title": "'Greasy spoon' kedgeree",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Greasy spoon kedgeree, Egg recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#haddock #rice #chorizo #pakistanibasar #eggs #fry #stock #fishstock #mushrooms #bacon #garlic \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Half- asleep this morning, my husband was muttering about a mixture of a spicy kedgeree and a greasy version of a traditional English breakfast, so I\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\nHalf- asleep this morning, my husband was muttering about a mixture of a spicy [[Kedgeree|kedgeree]] and a greasy version of a traditional English breakfast, so I came up with with this cheap and cheerful version.\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 3183\n|PortionCalories = 795\n|DatePublished=15th November 2013\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 40 minutes\n |PrepTime = 10 minutes\n |CookTime = 30 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:'Greasy spoon' kedgeree recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Wow Rosemary</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">That's a proper breakfast!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]] </span></span>\n}}\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 180g [[Haddock|haddock]] steaks\n| 1 litre [[Fish stock|fish stock]]\n| 2 tablespoons of [[Sunflower|sunflower]] or [[Rapeseed oil|rapeseed oil]], plus a bit extra\n| [[Garlic]] to taste, chopped\n| [[Indian green chillies]] to taste, chopped\n| 140g [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]], sliced\n| 1 heaped teaspoon [[Pakistani basar]]\n| 400g [[Basmati rice|basmati rice]]\n| 40g cooked [[Chorizo|chorizo]], thinly sliced and coarsely chopped\n| 100g chipolata [[Sausages|sausages]]\n| 180g smoked back [[Bacon|bacon]], rind removed, coarsely chopped\n| 4 [[free range eggs]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| [[Poach]] the [[Haddock|haddock]] in the [[Fish stock|fish stock]] for about 8 minutes.\n| Meanwhile, heat the [[Oil|oil]] in a pan, add the [[Garlic|garlic]], [[Chillies|chillies]] and [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]] and saut\u00e9 for a few minutes.\n| Add the [[Pakistani basar]] and cook for a further minute.\n| Stir in the [[Rice|rice]] and coat it in the [[Oil|oil]].\n| Remove the [[Haddock|haddock]] and pour the [[Stock|stock]] over the [[Rice|rice]].\n| Cover, and [[Simmer|simmer]] over a low heat for about 15 minutes or until the [[Rice|rice]] has absorbed the [[Stock|stock]].\n| Sir in the [[Chorizo|chorizo]] minute or two before the end of the cooking time.\n| While this is happening, [[Flake|flake]] the [[Haddock|haddock]] and keep warm.\n| [[Fry]] the [[Sausages|sausages]] and [[Bacon|bacon]] in a separate pan with some fresh oil and stir into the [[Rice|rice]] mixture, with the [[Haddock|haddock]] - keep over a low heat, covered.\n| [[Fry]] the [[Eggs|eggs]] until the white is just set, but the [[Yolk|yolk]], runny.\n| Chop the [[eggs]] roughly.\n| Serve the kedgeree immediately, topped with the fried [[eggs]]\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nIf you wish to add to the greasy spoon idea, serve with triangles of [[Fried|fried]] [[Bread|bread]], but I defy anyone to add [[Baked beans|baked beans]] or smear it with [[Ketchup|ketchup]]!\n===Variations===\nSmoked [[haddock]] can be used (and indeed, is traditional), but I didn't have any.  [[Pakistani basar]] can be difficult to obtain, so use a mixture of your favourite curry [[spices]] instead.\n===Chef's notes===\nI have no idea what this tastes like, but my husband says it is the best of the kedgerees I have made. :-)  Try to get the best quality [[chorizo]] you can.\n\nFollow the [[RSPCA Think Pig Checklist]] to make sure that your [[Pork|pork]] has come from pigs that have been reared to higher welfare standards.\n* http://bit.ly/rspcathinkpig\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Breakfast recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Chilli pepper recipes]]\n[[Category:Egg recipes]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Rice recipes]]\n[[Category:Sea fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]][[Category:Pan fried]][[Category:Poached]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#haddock #rice #chorizo #pakistanibasar #eggs #fry #stock #fishstock #mushrooms #bacon #garlic </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "'Roast' chicken (SV)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title='Roast' chicken, British sous vide recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#chicken #herbs #butter #spices #sear #miseenplace #salad #roasting #blowtorch #vacuumpack #spice \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This is my first experiment at 'roasting' a whole chicken at a time using a water bath\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1512\n|PortionCalories = 378\n|DatePublished=2nd February 2014\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime = 6 hours, 15 minutes\n|PrepTime = 15 minutes\n|CookTime = 6 hours\n|Image = [[Image:'Roast' chicken SV recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Nice one Julia</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I've now made this many times and I don't ever bother with the blowtorch - tastes the same without \ud83d\ude42</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis is my first experiment at '[[Roasting|roasting]]' a whole [[Chicken|chicken]] at a time using a water bath.  I have not cooked it whole as such, but cut it in half, for more even cooking.  The joy of using this method is that [[Basting|basting]] is not required.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 whole [[Chicken|chicken]], weighing about 1.3kg, [[How to spatchcock a chicken|spatchcocked]]\n| 50 ml [[Oil]] or [[Butter|butter]]\n| [[Herbs]], [[Spices|spices]], seasoning\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat the water bath to 71\u00b0 C (''160\u00b0 F'')\n\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| If desired, rub the [[Chicken|chicken]] in your choice of [[Herbs|herbs]] or [[Spice|spice]] mix.\n| [[Vacuum pack]] each [[Chicken|chicken]] half into sealing bags.\n| Cook in the water bath for at least 6 (maximum 8) hours.\n| Remove from the bath and pat dry.\n| Heat [[Oil|oil]] or [[Butter|butter]] over a high heat (less so if using [[Butter|butter]]) in a large sauteuse or [[Frying pan|frying pan]].\n| Place the [[Chicken|chicken]] halves in the pan and [[Sear|sear]] for 2 minutes on each side until golden [[Brown|brown]].\n| If you have not added any [[Herbs|herbs]] and [[Spices|spices]] to the sealing bags, you can add them to the pan for the last 30 seconds of cooking.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Potatoes|potatoes]] and [[Vegetables|vegetables]] or cool and accompany with [[Salad|salad]].\n===Chef's notes===\nYou can also use a [[blowtorch]] to sear the [[chicken]], in which case any [[spices]] or [[herbs]] are best added to the sealing bags at the beginning.\n{{SousVideSeeAlso}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Chicken roast sous vide]]\n[[Category:British recipes|Chicken roast sous vide]]\n[[Category:Main courses|Chicken roast sous vide]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes|Chicken roast sous vide]]\n[[Category:Poultry recipes|Chicken roast sous vide]]\n[[Category:Sous vide recipes|Chicken roast sous vide]]\n[[Category:Pan fried|Chicken roast sous vide]]\n[[Category:Sous vide cooking|Chicken roast sous vide]]\n[[Category:Molecular gastronomy recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#chicken #herbs #butter #spices #sear #miseenplace #salad #roasting #blowtorch #vacuumpack #spice </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "4 hour lamb stew",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=4 hour lamb stew - A Jamie Oliver recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#lamb #vegetables #bacon #whitewine #chorizo #oliveoil #parsnips #onions #potatoes #lambshanks #4hourlambstew \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This recipe idea came from a Jamie Oliver book, but as always, I can never find it when I want, so this is my recollection of the recipe\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2621\n|PortionCalories = 436\n|DatePublished=23rd June 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = A version using [[lamb shanks]] where the extra [[chorizo]] give it a little colour and piquancy. \n|Servings = Serves 6\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime = 4 hours, 15 minutes\n|PrepTime = 15 minutes\n|CookTime = 4 hours\n|Image = [[Image:Jamies 4 hour lamb lamb shanks.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Winter Warmer</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.7</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Lovely.  I make this in a slow cooker now.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n\nThis recipe idea came from a Jamie Oliver book, but as always, I can never find it when I want, so this is my recollection of the recipe.\n\nIt is a really simple dish to prepare, just throw everything, plus a bottle of [[White wine|white wine]], into the biggest casserole pot you have and leave it to cook for 4 hours.  You do need a big pot though!\n\nIf you enjoy your food spicy, try '''[[Lamb tangia]]''', it's very similar to this recipe and I think it's even nicer.\n\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1 leg of [[Lamb|lamb]]\n| [[Olive oil]] for [[Frying|frying]]\n| 6 rashers of [[Home smoked bacon|home smoked bacon]], chunky streaky [[Bacon|bacon]] or a small packet of [[Lardons|lardons]]\n| 4 [[Cloves|cloves]] of [[Garlic]], peeled and crushed\n| 3 [[Onions|onions]], peeled and cut into 4\n| 4 large [[Potatoes|potatoes]], peeled and cut into chunks\n| 5 [[Carrots|carrots]], peeled and cut in half, lengthwise\n| 2 [[Parsnips|parsnips]], peeled and cut in half, lengthways\n| 3 [[Celery|celery]] stick, cut into thick 'moons'\n| A few handfuls of [[Fresh herbs|fresh herbs]]\n| 2 [[Bay leaves|bay leaves]]\n| 1 bottle of [[Dry white wine|dry white wine]]\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Jamies 4 hour lamb ready to stew.jpg|Ready for the oven\nImage:Jamies 4 hour lamb ingredients.jpg|Ingredients for 4, using [[lamb shanks]] instead of a leg of lamb and [[chorizo]] instead of [[bacon]]\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Preheat the oven to 160\u00b0 C (325\u00b0 F - gas 3 - Moderately slow/Warm)\n| If you are using a glass casserole dish, do the [[Frying|frying]] in a separate pan, otherwise..\n| Add a few splashes of [[Olive oil|olive oil]] to a huge ovenproof pot or deep [[Roasting dish]] and [[Brown|brown]] the [[Lamb|lamb]] all over\n| Remove the [[Lamb|lamb]] for the next stage\n| [[Fry]] the [[Onions|onions]], [[Garlic|garlic]] and [[Bacon|bacon]] and [[Celery|celery]] for 4 minutes\n| Add a splash of [[White wine|white wine]] and [[Deglaze|deglaze]] the pan\n| Add your [[Lamb|lamb]] back (or move everything to your casserole dish)\n| Add the remaining [[Wine|wine]] and an equal amount of water and all of the remaining ingredients\n| Cover, with [[tin-foil]] if you are using a [[roasting tray]]\n| Roast for 4 to 5 hours - I find 4 hours sufficient although we don't use a particularly large cut of [[Meat|meat]]\n| Season the gravy to taste with [[Salt|salt]] and [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\n\nServe hot with crusty [[Bread|bread]] to soak up the delicious gravy\n\n===Variations===\nUse any [[Vegetables|vegetables]] you have knocking around at the time, just cut them (equally) on the large size, bearing in mind the time that it's cooking for.  We have lots of winter [[Squashes|squashes]] at the moment so I think I may use half a small [[Butternut squash|butternut squash]] instead of the [[Parsnips|parsnips]] - not my favourite [[Vegetables|vegetables]]!\n===Chef's notes===\nEnsure that you use a dry white wine.  I have made this with a medium/sweet wine and it was a little too sweet for my taste.\n==See also==\n\n* [[Slow roast recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Lamb]]\n[[Category:Lamb recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses|Lamb]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes|Lamb]]\n[[Category:Cooking with wine]]\n[[Category:Stews and casseroles]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n[[Category:Stewed, braised or pot roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#lamb #vegetables #bacon #whitewine #chorizo #oliveoil #parsnips #onions #potatoes #lambshanks #4hourlambstew </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Airfryed meatballs and bacon with tomatoes and spaghetti",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Airfryed meatballs and bacon with tomatoes and spaghetti\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#tomatosauce #airfryedmeatballsandbaconwithtomatoesandspaghetti #meatballs #bacon #bramblebeefarms #airfryer #panko #breadcrumbs #sweetcorn #tastesensationchilicheesemarinade #bakedbeans\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=A great airfrier recipe as you can use almost anything in this and it all cooks at the same time - its economical too! This was a use-up meal to clear out.\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=3rd December 2022\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  25 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime =  15 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 465\n|PortionCalories = 232 \n|Image = [[Image:Airfryed meatballs and bacon with tomatoes and spaghetti recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Delicious, quick and cheap!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Even though I say so myself \ud83d\ude00</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry]] </span></span>\n}}\nA great airfrier recipe as you can use almost anything in this and it all cooks at the same time - it's economical too!\n\nThis was a use-up meal to clear out odds and ends from the [[Freezer|freezer]]; it's so general that you could easily do this [[Sausages|sausages]], [[Burgers|burgers]],  almost any processed [[Meats|meats]].  You could even use [[Baked beans|baked beans]] as the [[Tomato sauce|tomato sauce]].\n\n* [[Treacle Cured Bacon from Russell's of Upwell's]]\n* [[Russell's Butchers of Upwell, Norfolk]]\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 2 x 40 oz (110g) Free Range Grass Fed Aberdeen Angus [[Meat balls|meat balls]] ([[Bramblebee Farms]])\n| 1 tablespoon [[Taste Sensation Chili Cheese marinade]] (optional) \n| 2 thick slices of treacly fatty back [[Bacon|bacon]] slices, chopped small (Russell's of Upwell)\n| 1 large [[Onion|onion]], finely chopped\n| A handful of [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]] - I used [[Panko]]; I like them crunchy\n| 1 large [[Cup|cup]] of [[Sun-dried tomatoes]] mixed with [[Tomato sauce for pizza]]\n| 110g [[Dried spaghetti|dried spaghetti]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| The 4oz [[Meatballs|meatballs]] are huge, so I cut each of them into 4.  This makes them 'normal' meatball size!\n| Chop the fatty back [[Bacon|bacon]] thinly\n| Sprinkle the chopped [[Onion|onion]] into the silicon [[Oven tray|oven tray]] - no [[Oil|oil]] is needed as they'll be plenty from the [[Bacon|bacon]] and [[Meatballs|meatballs]]\n| If you like you [[Meatballs|meatballs]] with a bite, roll them in 1 tablespoon of [[Taste Sensation Chili Cheese marinade]] or a spicy mix of your choosing\n| Sprinkle over a handful of [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]] - [[Panko]] is my favourite, but any will do. They soak up and excess [[Oils|oils]] and crisp up nicely\n| Pop the [[Silicone baking tray|silicone baking tray]] ion your [[Airfryer|airfryer]] and cook at 200\u00b0 C for 15 minutes - shaking the mixture up every 5 minutes if you get the chance.\n| Meanwhile [[Boil|boil]] the [[Spaghetti|spaghetti]] in lightly [[Salted|salted]] water for 10 minutes and [[Microwave|microwave]] your [[Tomato sauce|tomato sauce]] and the [[Peas|peas]] and [[Sweetcorn|sweetcorn]]\n| Drain the [[Spaghetti|spaghetti]] tip out the meatball mixture and pour over the [[Tomato sauce|tomato sauce]]\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Airfryed meatballs and bacon with tomatoes and spaghetti after 15 minutes in the air fryer.jpg|Meatballs, bacon and onions, perfectly cooked together after 15 minutes in the [[air fryer]] at 200\u00b0C\nImage:Airfryed meatballs and bacon with tomatoes and spaghetti spiced and ready to air fry.jpg|Roll the meatballs in Taste Sensation Chilli Cheese Marinade for an extra kick \nImage:One pound of Bramblebee Farm Angus Meatballs.jpg|[[Bramblebee Farms]] Grass-Fed Angus Meatballs, 4oz each!  I cut each one into four; four are plenty for one person\nImage:Russell's Treacly Bacon Slices.jpg|Lovely tracle cured back bacon\n</gallery>\n\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Peas|peas]] and [[Sweetcorn|sweetcorn]].\n\nFor a little bit of luxury, top with [[Grated|grated]] [[Cheddar cheese|cheddar cheese]]\n===Variations===\nUse bottled [[Bolognaise|bolognaise]] [[Sauce|sauce]], a tin of chopped [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]] or even [[Baked beans|baked beans]] for the [[Tomato sauce|tomato sauce]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Beef recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pasta recipes]]\n[[Category:Air fried recipes]]\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#tomatosauce #airfryedmeatballsandbaconwithtomatoesandspaghetti #meatballs #bacon #bramblebeefarms #airfryer #panko #breadcrumbs #sweetcorn #tastesensationchilicheesemarinade #bakedbeans</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

#airfriedrecipes #salted #recipes #seeds #vegetarianrecipes #veganrecipes\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=A great way to cook Butternut butternut squash, so quick and easy.\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=20th October 2021\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  1 hour, 11 minutes\n|PrepTime =  35 [[Butternut squash|butternut squash]], so quick and easy.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 [[Butternut squash|butternut squash]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| Pinch of [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Peel the [[Butternut squash|butternut squash]]\n| Cut in half and remove and discard the [[Seeds|seeds]]\n| Cut into slices\n| Rinse well and soak in [[Salted|salted]] water for 30 minutes if possible\n| Add the [[Olive oil|olive oil]] to your [[Air Fryer|air fryer]]\n| [[Air fry]] for about 35 minutes or until they start to [[Brown|brown]] slightly\n| Keep an eye on them as they 'go over' very quickly once they are done\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nFile:Air fried butternut squash soaking.jpg|Soaking in salted water\nFile:Air fried butternut squash ready to cook.jpg|Ready to cook\nFile:Chorizo and prawn curry recipe.jpg|Served with a [[Chorizo and prawn curry]]\n</gallery>\n\n===Serving suggestions===\nGreat with [[Chorizo and prawn curry]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Vegan title": "Air Fried Chip Shop Chips",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Air Fried Chip Shop Chips\n|titlemode=replace\n|description=These are the tastiest, healthiest chips that you can make at home. You only need a few tablespoons of Olive olive oil to cook chips for two people\n|keywords=#potatoes #chips #oliveoil #speedpeeler #airfryer #sophitopotatochipper #saladspinner #maltvinegar #salted #starch #unusualrecipes\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=15th January 2021\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  52 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  37 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 980\n|PortionCalories = 490\n|Image = [[Image:Markies chips air fryer.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Cheat!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.4</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">A smart idea, but not really a recipe.</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nThese are the tastiest, healthiest [[Chips|chips]]  that you can make at home.  You only need a few tablespoons of [[Olive oil|olive oil]] to cook chips for two people.\n\nYou need a few kitchen gadgets to make these, but it is well worth the effort. After trying many different products, I can safely say this collection of gadgets are '''the best'''! \n\n''By the way, I have absolutely no commercial affiliation with any of the products or companies mentioned''.\n\n* [[Speed peeler]]\n* [[Salad spinner]]\n* [[Sophito potato chipper]]\n* [[Tefal Actifry Genius]]\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 3 very large [[Potatoes|potatoes]]\n| 1 tablespoon of [[Table salt|table salt]] to soak them in\n| 2 tablespoons of [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n}}\n==== to serve====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]]\n| [[Malt vinegar]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Air Fryer|air fryer]] for 5 minutes at the 180\u00b0 C\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Peeler.jpg | A [[speed peeler]]\nImage:Kuhn Rikon Salad Spinner.jpg | Salad spinner for \u00a320 - [https://www.amazon.co.uk/dp/B0031U1NMA/ref=dp_prsubs_1 Amazon UK] \nImage:Potato chipper.jpg | The fabulous [[Sophito potato chipper]] - \u00a360 [https://www.amazon.co.uk/gp/product/B07ML62LVB/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_asin_title_o04_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1 Amazon UK]\nImage:Telfal Actifry Genius Air Fryer.jpg | The Tefal Actifry Genius - [https://www.amazon.co.uk/gp/product/B086B4819G/ref=ppx_od_dt_b_asin_title_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1 Amazon UK] <br />\u00a3159 (3rd jan 2021) - \u00a3226 only 2 weeks later? \ud83d\ude32\nImage:Markies steak pie and chips.jpg|[[Markies potatoes]] make the best chips\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Wash the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] well in cold water\n| Cut out any blemishes or bad marks\n| Using a [[Speed peeler|speed peeler]] and peel the [[Potatoes|potatoes]]\n| Using a [[Potato chipper|potato chipper]] if you have one, cut into [[Chips|chips]]\n| Wash the [[Starch|starch]] off the [[Chips|chips]] by placing in a [[Colander|colander]] under cold running water.\n| If you have time, they benefit from being soaked in well [[Salted|salted]] water before you cook them.\n| Certainly pop them in a bowl of [[Salted|salted]] water until you are ready to [[Fry|fry]] them - just like the [[Chip|chip]]-shop does.\n| Just before you r going to cook them, give the chipped [[Potatoes|potatoes]] a final rinse and [[Dry|dry]] them in a [[Tea-towel|tea-towel]].\n| A [[Salad spinner|salad spinner]] is a brilliant way to dry them thoroughly, though you may have to do this in a few batches - depending how greedy you both are!\n| Add no more than 2 tablespoons of [[Olive oil|olive oil]] to your [[Air Fryer|air fryer]] and tip [[Potatoes|potatoes]] in.\n| Around 35 to 37 minutes seems to cook them perfectly, though check them a little before this as some [[Potatoes|potatoes]] cook faster than others.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Malt vinegar|malt vinegar]] and [[Sea Salt|sea salt]].\n===Variations===\nif you are using a non-paddle air fryer such as the [[Pro Breeze Air Fryer]], add the potatoes to a Lock and Lock box with a few tables spoons of olive oil and shake them furiously to coa the chips evenly in oil.\n\nHalfway though cooking add a [[Spray|spray]] of [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and shake them up a little.  We've found this helps to really crisp them and make them evenly golden.\n===Chef's notes===\nWe have found that the paddle-type of [[Air Fryer|air fryer]], such as the Tefal Actifry makes the best [[Chips|chips]] - superior to the non-paddle type.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes]]\n[[Category:Air fried recipes]]\n[[Category:Cookery cheats]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#potatoes #chips #oliveoil #speedpeeler #airfryer #sophitopotatochipper #saladspinner #maltvinegar #salted #starch #unusualrecipes</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Air fried garlic French fries",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Air fried garlic French fries\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#airfriedgarlicfrenchfries #chips #friedgarlic #garlicpotatoes #airfryer #garlicfrenchfries #dry #garlicfies\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=Delicious garlic flavoured chips; A few potatoes, a bulb of garlic and some olive oil\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=1st September 2021\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment =\n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  40 minutes\n|PrepTime =  5 minutes\n|CookTime =  35 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 994\n|PortionCalories = 497\n|Image = [[Image:Air fried garlic French fries recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"><span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">So Simple, So Garlicky</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">This could not be easier - garlic perfection!</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\">[[User:Chef|Jerry]] </span></span>\n}}\n\n[[Garlic]] flavoured [[Chips|chips]]; lovely!  Saw this idea in a Gordon Ramsey Sunday Dinners TV program and as we always make our [[French fries]] in an [[Air Fryer|air fryer]], this was a no-brainer.\n\nA full bulb of [[Garlic|garlic]] sliced in half is plenty - wrap the other half in [[Cling Film|cling film]] for the next time!\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| Half a bulb of [[Garlic|garlic]] - sliced sideways to reveal all the [[Cloves|cloves]]\n| 4 medium sized [[Potatoes|potatoes]]\n| 2 tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| Pinch of [[Sea Salt|sea salt]]\n| Pinch of [[Ground black pepper|ground black pepper]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Peel the [[Potatoes|potatoes]]\n| Cut them into [[French fries]] - we use a [[Sopito Stainless Steel Potato Cutter]]\n| Rinse the [[Chips|chips]] well under running water\n| Leave them soaking in [[Salted|salted]] water until you are ready to cook them\n| [[Dry]] the [[Potato chips|potato chips]] in a [[Tea-towel|tea-towel]] or a [[Salad spinner|salad spinner]]\n| Cook them at your [[Air Fryer|air fryer]]'s hottest temperature [200\u00b0 C / 220\u00b0] for 35 minutes or until golden.\n| Shake the [[Cloves|cloves]] out of the 'shell' of the [[Garlic|garlic]] bulb. Discard the shell and keep the golden [[Garlic cloves|garlic cloves]] to serve with the [[Chips|chips]] - Yum!\n}}\n\n\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Air fried garlic French fries chips.jpg|Cooked to perfection - don't waste the lovely garlic cloves!\nImage:Air fried garlic French fries ready to cook.jpg|Ready to cook\nImage:Kuhn Rikon Salad Spinner.jpg|Use a salad spinner to dry the French fries\nImage:Potato chipper.jpg|This comes highly recommended - [[Sopito Stainless Steel Potato Cutter][\n</gallery>\n\n===Chef's notes===\nThis time of year, locally we are limited to [[New Potatoes|new potatoes]] but in season, Cara, [[Markies]], Agria, Mozart and Maris Piper make the best [[Chips|chips]]. &#127839;&#127839;&#127839;\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:French recipes]]\n[[Category:Italian recipes]]\n[[Category:North American recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes]]\n[[Category:Air fried recipes]]\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#airfriedgarlicfrenchfries #chips #friedgarlic #garlicpotatoes #airfryer #garlicfrenchfries #dry #garlicfies</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }

            }

                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Air Fried Panchphoran Aloo (Potatoes In Whole Spices)\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#potatoes #potatoesinwholespices #airfriedpanchphoranaloopotatoesinwholespices #nigella #seeds #airfryer #oliveoil #ghee #spice #vegetarianrecipes #clovesofgarlic\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=I saw Nigella doing a Pan-pan-fried version of this and thought it would be worth doing a similar recipe for an Air-air-fryer. I have chosen my own mix of..\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=4th December 2022\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  45 minutes\n|PrepTime =  5 minutes\n|CookTime =  40 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 763\n|PortionCalories = 190\n|Image = [[Image:Air Fried Panchphoran Aloo Potatoes In Whole Spices recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Fantastic!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Though I say so myself! \ud83d\ude01</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry]] </span></span>\n}}\nI saw [[Nigella]] doing a [[Pan-fried|pan-fried]] version of this and thought it would be worth doing a similar recipe for an [[Air-fryer|air-fryer]].  I have chosen my own mix of [[Spices|spices]]; all the [[Seeds|seeds]] are left whole for this.\n\nIf you don't have an [[airfryer]] this could just as easily be done as a pan-fried dish, probably reduce the size of the potato chunks and also reduce the cooking time slightly too.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 900g Cara [[Potatoes|potatoes]], peeled and cut into chunks, about half the size of a small [[Roast|roast]] [[Potato|potato]]\n| 3 [[Cloves of garlic|cloves of garlic]], peeled and sliced\n| 2 tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[ghee]]\n}}\n====spice mixture====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 1 thin [[Green Indian chilli|green indian chilli]], deseeded and chopped\n| Pinch of [[Sea Salt|sea salt]]\n| &#189; teaspoon [[Turmeric powder|turmeric powder]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Black mustard seeds|black mustard seeds]]\n| &#189; teaspoon white [[Cumin seeds|cumin seeds]]\n| &#189; teaspoon [[Black cumin seeds|black cumin seeds]]\n| &#189; teaspoon [[Nigella|nigella]] [[Seeds|seeds]]\n| &#189; teaspoon [[Fennel seeds|fennel seeds]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Coriander seeds|coriander seeds]]\n| &#189; teaspoon [[Fenugreek seeds|fenugreek seeds]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Add the [[Olive oil|olive oil]], [[Potatoes|potatoes]] and [[Garlic|garlic]] to your [[Air-fryer|air-fryer]]\n| ''This recipe is best suited to a paddle-type [[Air Fryer|air fryer]], otherwise you are going to have to keep mixing the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] very often''\n| Set the [[Air-fryer|air-fryer]] to the about 200\u00b0 C\n| Cook them for 20 minutes\n| After 20 minutes shake in all of the [[Spice|spice]] mixture and cook for a further 10 to 20 minutes until they are slightly crispy\n| Serve  immediately\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Air Fried Panchphoran Aloo Potatoes In Whole Spices.jpg|All of the spices!\nImage:Air Fried Panchphoran Aloo Potatoes In Whole Spices cooked.jpg|After 35 minutes in the [[air-fryer]]\n</gallery>\n\n===Serving suggestions===\nWe've served this with [[Sausages|sausages]], [[Eggs|eggs]] and [[Baked beans|baked beans]] as a sort of spicy [[Chip|chip]] substitute but these will accompany most dishes perfectly.\n===Recipe source===\n\n* Based on a recipe I saw [[Nigella]] Lawson doing on her TV program.\n===Variations===\nWe've used Car [[Potatoes|potatoes]] as  they are in season and very good for air-[[Frying|frying]]; use your favourite potatoes or what is available.  [[New Potatoes|new potatoes]] or waxy are not ideal for this dish.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Indian recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Chilli pepper recipes]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Air fried recipes]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#potatoes #potatoesinwholespices #airfriedpanchphoranaloopotatoesinwholespices #nigella #seeds #airfryer #oliveoil #ghee #spice #vegetarianrecipes #clovesofgarlic</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

Works rather well and takes one hour.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 400 g sweet [[Chestnuts|chestnuts]]\n| A good shake of [[salt]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Using a sharp pointed knife, stab a slit in each [[Chestnut|chestnut]], this stops them exploding and makes then a little easier to peel, once cooked.\n| Add a shake of [[salt]]\n| Pop then in the [[Air Fryer|air fryer]] for one hour\n| Allow to cook for 10 minutes, then peel and eat!\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Grain and bean recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Air fried recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#airfryer #airfriedroastedchestnuts #chestnut #chestnuts </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Air fried roast potatoes",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Actifry air fried roast potatoes recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#onion #roastpotatoes #oliveoil #airfriedroastpotatoes #airfry #bayleaves #potatoes #boiling #airfried #favouriterecipes #airfrier \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Tefal Actifry air fried Roast roast potatoes are the way to go, without question. \n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 273\n|PortionCalories = 136\n|DatePublished=7th March 2016\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  1 hour, 5 minutes\n|PrepTime =  5 minutes\n|CookTime =  1 hour\n|Image = [[Image:Air fried roast potatoes recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">The best roasties</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">The are the simplest, tastiest and healthiest roasties you can cook.  Melody, Markies or Marfona are the best potatoes for these, if you can get them.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Air fryer roast potatoes.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Potatoes, onion & bay leaf ready to [[air fry]]]]\n[[Air fried]] [[Roast potatoes|roast potatoes]] are the way to go, without question.  No par-[[Boiling|boiling]], just chuck them in the [[Air fryer|air fryer]] with some optional flavourings and a good tablespoon of [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and [[air fry]] for 1 hour.\n\nThis time I added a whole small peeled brown [[Onion|onion]] and a handful of [[Bay leaves|bay leaves]] to add extra flavours.  The [[onion]] can be eaten, the bay leaves should be discarded.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 350g [12 oz] maris piper [[Potatoes|potatoes]], peeled and cut into equal sized pieces\n| 1 generous tablespoon of [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 1 whole small peeled [[Brown|brown]] [[Onion|onion]], ''optional''\n| A handful of fresh [[Bay leaves|bay leaves]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Add the oil to the fryer\n| Pop the potatoes and optional ingredioents into the air fryer pan\n| Cook for at least 40 minutes, some potato varieties may take up to 1 hour\n}}\n===Chef's notes===\nAfter making these roast potatoes regularly for about 40 weeks, I've realised an extra trick to get them especially crispy. Always use large potatoes and cut them either in halves or into quarters. The tumbling action of the air-fryer tends to bump the corners and fluff them up.  Small whole potatoes tend to become 'polished' and don't 'fluff-up' at all.   They are still very crispy, but not as good as square-cut potatoes whole potatoes (pictured).\n\nAnother good way to get 'fluffy' roasties is to crush them slightly, halfway through the cooking process.\n\nA list of the best potato varieties for making [[roast potatoes]] can be '''[[:Category:Potato_recipes#ROAST_POTATOES|found here]]'''.\n\nNote to self: 45 minutes is probably an ideal time to aim for.\n\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Air fried recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#onion #roastpotatoes #oliveoil #airfriedroastpotatoes #airfry #bayleaves #potatoes #boiling #airfried #favouriterecipes #airfrier </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Air fried Singapore noodles with chicken, courgettes and mushrooms",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Air fried Singapore noodles with chicken, courgettes and mushrooms\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#vegetables #sesameoil #marinade #airfryer #chicken #airfryers #airfriedsingaporenoodleswithchickencourgettesandmushrooms #bean #oliveoil #noodles #lockandlockbox\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=This absolutely delicious version of Singapore noodles uses two Air air fryers although you could probably make this in one air fryer\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=2nd November 2021\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  2 hours, 40 minutes\n|PrepTime =  2 hours, 20 minutes\n|CookTime =  30 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 1334\n|PortionCalories = 667 \n|Image = [[Image:Air fried Singapore noodles with chicken, courgettes and mushrooms recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Fabulous!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.72</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">And I don't mid if it needs two air fryers either!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Sue_spins|Susie]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis absolutely delicious version of [[Singapore noodles]] uses two [[Air Fryers|air fryers]] although you could probably make this recipe in one air fryer or even in a large [[Wok|wok]].\n\nThe beauty of using the two [[Air Fryers|air fryers]] is that once the ingredients are prepared, there is almost nothing else to do during the cooking cycle.\n\nWe currently have an [[Tefal Actifry Genius]] air fryer, the rotating paddle type and also a [[Pro Breeze XL 5.5L Air Fryer]] which is like a small fan-assisted oven (5.5 litres).\n\nI have used the paddle [[Air Fryer|air fryer]] to '[[Stir-fry|stir-fry]]' the [[Vegetables|vegetables]] and the fan-[[Oven|oven]] [[Air fryer|air fryer]] to cook the [[Marinated|marinated]] [[Meat|meat]].  When everything is almost done, everything is added together in the large fan [[Air-fryer|air-fryer]], mix together and the [[Noodle|noodle]] and [[Bean sprouts|bean sprouts]] are added and cooked for the last few minutes.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n}}\n====Vegetable mix====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 1 tablespoon [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 125g sliced [[Button mushrooms|button mushrooms]]\n| 1 large [[Onion|onion]], peeled and sliced\n| 2 medium [[Sweet peppers|sweet peppers]], cored and chopped into strips\n| 1 large [[Courgette|courgette]] cut into slices\n| 2 tablespoons [[Sesame oil|sesame oil]]\n| 2 thumb-sized pieces of ginger, cut into thin slices - no need to peel the ginger!\n}}\n====Chicken and marinade====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 2 large [[Chicken breasts|chicken breasts]] cut into bite-sized pieces\n| 2 tablespoons [[Dark soy sauce|dark soy sauce]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Sesame oil|sesame oil]]\n| 2 tablespoons of [[Lime juice|lime juice]]\n| &#189; teaspoon [[Demerara sugar|demerara sugar]]\n| &#189; teaspoon [[Sea Salt|sea salt]]\n| Pinch of [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n| 1 heaped teaspoon of [[Curry powder|curry powder]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Turmeric|turmeric]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Chilli flakes|chilli flakes]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Coriander|coriander]] whole [[Seeds|seeds]]\n| A pinch of whole [[Fenugreek seeds|fenugreek seeds]]\n| A good pinch of [[5 spice powder]]\n| 4 [[Fat|fat]] [[Cloves of Garlic, peeled and crushed|cloves of garlic, peeled and crushed]]\n}}\n====Noodles and beanshoots====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 200g pre-cooked [[Egg noodles|egg noodles]]\n| 125g [[Bean|bean]] shoots\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Add the [[Chicken|chicken]]  and [[Marinade|marinade]] ingredients to a [[Lock and Lock box]], cover and shake really well to combine\n* Leave for a few hours to [[Marinade|marinade]], shaking now and then if you have the time\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Coat the rotary [[Air Fryer|air fryer]] with 1 tablespoon of [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| Add the remaining [[Vegetable|vegetable]] mix ingredients into the [[Air-fryer|air-fryer]] pan and drizzle with the [[Sesame oil|sesame oil]]\n| Cook on the highest temperature setting (usually for [[Chips|chips]]) for about 15 minutes\n| After the [[Vegetables|vegetables]] have cooked for about 10 minutes, leave them cooking while you add the [[Chicken|chicken]] [[Marinade|marinade]] to the [[Pro Breeze Air Fryer|pro breeze air fryer]] (the fan-[[Oven|oven]] type)\n| Cook for the marinaded chicken with the marinade for 10 minutes at 200\u00b0 C\n| By this time the [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]] and [[Onions|onions]] should have started to colour\n| Add the cooked [[Vegetables|vegetables]], [[Bean|bean]] shoots and [[Noodles|noodles]] to the [[Chicken|chicken]] mixture, stir well and cook for a further 5 minutes, stirring now and then\n| serve immediately\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Singapore_noodles_with_chicken_chicken_and_vegetables_with_noodles.jpg|Everything mixed together, ready to serve\nImage:Singapore_noodles_with_chicken_chicken_and_vegetables.jpg|The vegetables mixed in with the spicy chicken pieces\nImage:Singapore_noodles_with_chicken_marinading.jpg|The chicken after a few hours in the marinade\nImage:Singapore_noodles_with_chicken_vegetables_cooked.jpg|The vegetables after 15 minutes\nImage:Singapore_noodles_with_chicken_vegetables_in_air_fryer.jpg|The vegetables loaded into the Tefal air-fryer\nImage:Singapore_noodles_with_chicken_colourful_ingredients.jpg|Most of the very colourful ingredients\n</gallery>\n\n===Serving suggestions===\nA few quartered [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]] were a nice fresh [[Accompaniment|accompaniment]] to this dish\n===Variations===\nAny chopped [[Vegetables|vegetables]] work well in this, especially, oddly, [[Cucumbers|cucumbers]]!\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Chinese recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Chilli pepper recipes]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Poultry recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Air fried recipes]]\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#vegetables #sesameoil #marinade #airfryer #chicken #airfryers #singaporenoodles #bean #oliveoil #noodles #lockandlockbox</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }

title": "Air fried sweetcorn cobs",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "\n<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Air fried sweetcorn cobs recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#butter #airfryer #airfriedsweetcorncobs #sweetcorn #airfriedrecipes #roast #corn #airfry \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Using an Air Fryer is a ridiculously easy way to roast buttery Corn on the corn on the cob and get it perfect every time.\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=28th September 2016\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = An ideal accompaniment for Chile con carne\n|Servings = 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  21 minutes\n|PrepTime =  1 minute\n|CookTime =  20 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 149\n|PortionCalories = 74\n|Image = [[Image:Air fried sweetcorn cobs recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Simple is best</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.6</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">So easy and so healthy, and it's one of your 5 a day!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Air fried sweetcorn cobs.jpg|thumb|300px|right|1 teaspoon of butter and a pinch of salt is all that's needed.]]\nUsing an [[Air Fryer]] is a ridiculously easy way to [[Roast|roast]] buttery [[Corn on the cob|corn on the cob]] and get it perfect every time.  The [[Corn|corn]] cobs need to be cut in half to fit in the [[Air fryer|air fryer]], but this is also how they are often sold (in the UK).\n\nThe [[Tefal ActiFry AL806040 Air Fryer]] is still my favourite cooking tool.  It's so ugly it needs to be stored in the conservatory but it's still brought into use a couple of times a week.  It is also a ''must-have'' for the motorhome!\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 [[Sweetcorn|sweetcorn]] cob cut into two halves\n| Pinch of [[Salt|salt]]\n| 1 teaspoon of [[Butter|butter]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Pop the halved [[Sweetcorn|sweetcorn]] cobs in the airfryer with a teaspoon of [[Butter|butter]] and a pinch of [[Salt|salt]].\n| [[Air fry]] for 20 minutes.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with a little extra [[Butter|butter]]\n===Chef's notes===\nThe start photograph shown 1 tablespoon of [[Butter|butter]], but that was far too much.  A teaspoonful is all that's needed.  Any more just gets left in the [[Air Fryer|air fryer]] when the food is removed.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:North American recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Air fried recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#butter #airfryer #airfriedsweetcorncobs #sweetcorn #airfriedrecipes #roast #corn #airfry </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Aldi's Fiesta Chilli Con Carne with Cubed Steak",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Aldi's Fiesta Chilli Con Carne with Cubed Steak\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#pressurecooker #sweetcorn #kidneybeans #aldisfiestachilliconcarnewithcubedsteak #chilliconcarne #rice #chillipepperrecipes #garlicrecipes #steak #beefrecipes #sherry\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=A super tasty chilli con carne using bought sauce in a jar spiced up a little so it suits my taste\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=17th May 2023\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  2 hours, 5 minutes\n|PrepTime =  5 minutes\n|CookTime =  2 hours\n|TotalCalories = 617\n|PortionCalories = 154\n|Image = [[Image:Aldi's Fiesta Chilli Con Carne with Cubed Steak recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Tastes authentic</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">This is now my preferred way to make chilli!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jeremy]] </span></span>\n}}\nI wanted to jot down a reminder for myself because the [[Chili con carne|chili con carne]] I made was absolutely delicious and incredibly easy. It had an authentic flavour, and the [[Meat|meat]] turned out incredibly tender thanks to the extended cooking time achieved by using a [[Pressure cooker|pressure cooker]].\n\nThis is now a regular staple, together with [[How long to cook Oakhurst Aldi Peri Peri Chicken King Kebab|Aldi's Peri-Peri King Kebab]].  We now make this, eat half and freeze the remainder for another meal together. \n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 jar of Aldi's Fiesta [[Chilli con carne|chilli con carne]] (Hot)\n| 1 kg of [[Stewing steak|stewing steak]]; ours is from [[Russell's Butchers of Upwell, Norfolk]]\n| 1 400g can [[Kidney beans|kidney beans]]\n| 1 340g can [[Sweetcorn|sweetcorn]]\n| &#189; teaspoon very [[Hot chilli powder|hot chilli powder]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Taste Sensation fajita seasoning]] mix\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Drain the [[Kidney beans|kidney beans]] and rinse well\n| Drain and rinse the [[Sweetcorn|sweetcorn]]\n| Cut the [[Steak|steak]] into fairly small pieces as they tend to be on the large size\n| Pour the Fiesta [[Chilli con carne|chilli con carne]] [[Sauce|sauce]] into a large bowl that will fit into your [[Pressure cooker|pressure cooker]]\n| Rinse the jar with a little water or [[Sherry|sherry]] if you're feeling lush!\n| Add the remaining ingredients and mix well\n| Pressure cook on heigh for 2 hours (would be done in 1 hour, but 2 makes the meat super tender)\n| Allow to de-pressurise naturally\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Aldis Fiesta Chilli Con Carne with Cubed Steak ingredients.jpg|All of the ingredients\nImage:Aldis Fiesta Chilli Con Carne with Cubed Steak mixed and ready to cook.jpg|Mixed well and ready to pressure cook\n</gallery>\n===Serving suggestions===\nWe had this over two days; firstly with [[Taco shells|taco shells]] and then I had mine with [[Curly fries|curly fries]] and Anne had her second lot with [[Rice|rice]].\n===Chef's notes===\nThis was a superb [[Chilli|chilli]] with just the right heat.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Chilean recipes]]\n[[Category:Mexican recipes]]\n[[Category:Tex-Mex recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Beef recipes]]\n[[Category:Chilli pepper recipes]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pressure cooker recipes]]\n[[Category:Pressure cooked]]\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#pressurecooker #sweetcorn #kidneybeans #aldisfiestachilliconcarnewithcubedsteak #chilliconcarne #rice #chillipepperrecipes #garlicrecipes #steak #beefrecipes #sherry</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Allergy free and gluten free sausage farinata with red onions and rosemary",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Allergy free and gluten free sausage farinata with red onions and rosemary recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#onions #sausagemeat #oliveoil #allergyfreeandglutenfreesausagefarinatawithredonionsandrosemary #batter #rosemary #farinata #chickpeaflour #baking #miseenplace #browned \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Farinata is a rustic Italian flat bread from Liguria. Since it is always made with chickpea flour, it naturally gluten free. In this recipe\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 605\n|PortionCalories = 302\n|DatePublished=17th October 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = 2\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  1 hour, 40 minutes\n|PrepTime =  1 hour, 10 minutes\n|CookTime =  30 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Allergy free and gluten free sausage farinata with red onions and rosemary recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Didn't rise much for me?</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">3</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Looks as though it should really be like a Yorkshire pudding, but mine didn't rise at all. Help! </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>}}\n[[Image:Harrogate-pork-sausages.png|300px|thumb|right|[[Debbie and Andrew's Harrogate 97% Gluten Free Pork Sausages]]]]\nFarinata is a rustic Italian flat bread from Liguria. Since it is always made with chickpea flour, it naturally gluten free. In this recipe, [[debbie&andrew\u0092s sausages]] are added for extra flavour.\n\nFor a full Italianate experience, this should be called \"[[Farinata|farinata]] con salsiccia e cipolle rosse\".\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 100g of [[Chickpea flour|chickpea flour]]\n| 1&#8260;2 a teaspoon of [[Sea Salt|sea salt]]\n| 260mls water\n| 2 [[debbie&andrew\u0092s Harrogate 97% Pork sausages]] with the meat removed and broken into chunks\n| 1&#8260;2 [[Red onion|red onion]] thinly sliced\n| 2 tablespoons of [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 2 sprigs of fresh [[Rosemary|rosemary]] (or the equivalent [[Dried|dried]])\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6), [fan oven 180\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Mix the [[Chickpea flour|chickpea flour]] with the [[Salt|salt]] and water. Whisk well to form a smooth [[Batter|batter]] and leave at room temperature for 1-4 hours for the [[Chickpea|chickpea]] to soak.\n| 2 Preheat [[Oven|oven]] to 200&#9702;C (fan)\n| 3 Close to the end of the soaking time, cook the sliced [[Onions|onions]] and a teaspoon of\n| [[Oil|oil]] in a [[Frying pan|frying pan]] on a moderate heat until softened (approx 12 mins). Remove the [[Onions|onions]] from the pan and then [[Fry|fry]] the [[Sausage meat|sausage meat]] until [[Browned|browned]] all over - (approx 4 mins)\n| 4 Take a deep sided [[Baking|baking]] pan about 22cm x 22cm and pour in 2 tablespoons of [[Olive oil|olive oil]]. Place in the [[Oven|oven]] for 3 mins to prepare for cooking the [[Farinata|farinata]]. Carefully remove from the oven and pour the [[Batter|batter]] into the hot pan, then evenly scatter over the [[Sausage meat|sausage meat]], [[Onions|onions]] and [[Rosemary|rosemary]]. Return the tray back into the oven and cook for 15 minutes till [[Brown|brown]] on top and firm to touch\n| Remove from [[Oven|oven]], allow to cool then cut into slices and serve\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Italian recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Gluten free recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Debbie&andrew's sausage recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n{{Template:DebbieAndAndrew attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#onions #sausagemeat #oliveoil #allergyfreeandglutenfreesausagefarinatawithredonionsandrosemary #batter #rosemary #farinata #chickpeaflour #baking #miseenplace #browned </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Aloo Chop - very spicy mince on crispy mashed potato",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "\n<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Aloo Chop - very spicy mince on crispy mashed potato recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#mashedpotato #bramblebeefarm #parsley #potatoes #burger #vegetableoil #dried #potato #basilleaves #mash #lamb \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Crispy baked Mashed mashed potato with very spicy mince. This recipe is my variation on the classic Aloo Chop recipe that usually uses minced lamb. \n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=1st July 2018\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  2 hours, 15 minutes\n|PrepTime =  1 hour, 30 minutes\n|CookTime =  45 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 2839\n|PortionCalories = 709\n|Image = [[Image:Aloo Chop recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Wierd, but good!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.4</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Strange idea and even looks odd but it was really good.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nCrispy [[Baked|baked]] [[Mashed potato|mashed potato]] with very spicy [[Mince|mince]].\n\nThis recipe is my variation on the classic Aloo Chop recipe that usually uses [[Minced|minced]] [[Lamb|lamb]].\n\nIt stared as a way to use up the odd singe [[Bramblebee Farm|bramblebee farm]] Aberdeen Angus [[Burger|burger]],  and has developed into a family staple.\n\nI usually use a [[Bramblebee Farm]] [[Burger|burger]] and make the  weight up to 300g with other [[Meat|meat]] from the [[Freezer|freezer]].\n\nRather than mess around filling the [[Potato|potato]] balls as with the classic recipe, I just spread a layer of [[Mashed potato|mashed potato]] on an [[Oven tray|oven tray]], [[Bake|bake]] it until the potato is getting golden and crispy, then top with the [[Mince|mince]] add pop for a final 10 minutes to reheat the [[Meat|meat]].\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n}}\n==== for the crispy baked mashed potato====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 500g [[Potatoes|potatoes]]\n| 25g [[Butter|butter]]\n| Good pinch of [[Salt|salt]]\n| Good pinch [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| Pinch of freshly [[Grated|grated]] [[Nutmeg|nutmeg]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Dried|dried]] [[Parsley|parsley]]\n| 1 [[Egg|egg]], beaten\n| 1 teaspoon [[Vegetable oil|vegetable oil]]\n}}\n==== for the spicy mince====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 2 tablespoons [[Vegetable oil|vegetable oil]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Ghee|ghee]]\n| 2 large [[Onions|onions]], peeled and sliced\n| 2 inches of freshly [[Grated|grated]] [[Ginger|ginger]]\n| 8 large [[Garlic cloves|garlic cloves]], peeled and crusged\n| 2 [[Red chillies|red chillies]], deseeded and chopped\n| 2 [[Green chillies|green chillies]], deseeded and chopped\n| 450g [[Minced|minced]] [[Lamb|lamb]] (see variations)\n| 2 teaspoons [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]]\n| Handful of fresh [[Basil leaves|basil leaves]] (see variations)\n| 3 [[Green cardamom pods|green cardamom pods]], shells removed\n| 3 [[Brown|brown]] [[Cardamom pods|cardamom pods]], shells removed\n| 4 [[Clove buds|clove buds]]\n| A sliver of [[Cinnamon|cinnamon]] bark\n| 1 teaspoon [[Fenugreek seeds|fenugreek seeds]]\n| 2 tablespoons of [[Coriander seeds|coriander seeds]]\n| 2 tablespoons of sweet [[Paprika powder|paprika powder]]\n| 2 teaspoons of [[Turmeric powder|turmeric powder]]\n| 1 tablespoon of you r favourite [[Chilli sauce|chilli sauce]]\n| 5 tablespoons of [[Red wine|red wine]]\n| 2 tablespoons of [[sesame seeds]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Peel the [[Potatoes|potatoes]], [[Boil|boil]] for 25 minutes, drain, add [[Butter|butter]] and [[Salt|salt]]. [[Mash]]  and and allow to cool\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 220\u00b0 C (425\u00b0 F - gas 7), [fan oven 200\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Aloo-chop-ready to cook the meat.jpg|Meat added to the crispy mashed potatoes\nImage:Baked mash potato - nice and crispy.jpg|Crisped after 15 minutes in the oven\nImage:Aloo-mash.jpg|Raw mash, ready to cook - the extra portion is for my breakfast!\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n}}\n====for the baked mashed potatoes====\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Once the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] have cooled, sprinkle the [[Mash|mash]] with [[Parsley|parsley]] and [[Nutmeg|nutmeg]] and mix in the beaten [[Egg|egg]].  it will be quite liquid at this stage.\n| If it's too wet, add a tablespoon of [[Ground|ground]] [[Yellow cornmeal|yellow cornmeal]].\n| Grease an [[Oven tray|oven tray]] with 1 teaspoon of [[Vegetable oil|vegetable oil]]\n| Spread the [[Mashed potato|mashed potato]] in a thin layer over the tray\n| If you're not cooking immediately, place in a cool place until you are ready\n}}\n====for the spicy mince====\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Add all of the [[Dried|dried]] [[Spices|spices]] to a [[Coffee grinder|coffee grinder]] and grind to a powder \n| Add the [[Oil|oil]] and [[Ghee|ghee]] and cook the [[Onion|onion]] slices in a [[Wok|wok]] for 5 minutes\n| Add the [[Garlic|garlic]] and [[Ginger|ginger]] and [[Stir-fry|stir-fry]] for a further few minutes\n| Stir in the [[Meat|meat]] and [[Fry|fry]] for a few minutes\n| Add the fresh [[Chillies|chillies]], [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]], [[Basil leaves|basil leaves]] or [[Parsley|parsley]] and [[Chilli sauce|chilli sauce]] and mix really well.\n| The mixture does not need any more cooking at this stage and the [[Potato|potato]] mix and the [[Meat|meat]] can be prepared ahead of time if needed.\n}}\n====final assembly and cooking====\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Place the tray of [[Mashed potato|mashed potato]] in the [[Oven|oven]] while it preheats to 220\u00b0 C (425\u00b0 F - gas 7), [fan oven 200\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n| Once the [[Oven|oven]] had reached temperature, pop the tray in the middle of the oven and cook until it is crispy and has a golden colour - obout 15 minutes.\n| Spread the [[Meat|meat]] evenly over the [[Mash|mash]], sprinkle with [[sesame seeds]] and pop back in the [[Oven|oven]] for 15 minutes\n| Slice up and serve.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with cold [[Yoghurt|yoghurt]] and a [[Green vegetable|green vegetable]]\n===Variations===\n1 usually use 1 [[Bramblebee Farm]] 6 oz Aberdeen Angus [[Burger|burger]] & 300 g mixed [[Minced|minced]] / [[Pork|pork]] / [[Beef|beef]] / [[Lamb|lamb]]\n\nOut of season, I use another tablespoon of [[Dried|dried]] [[Parsley|parsley]], instead of the fresh [[Basil leaves|basil leaves]].\n===Chef's notes===\nWe usually pop the tray of [[Mashed potato|mashed potato]] in the [[Oven|oven]] while it gets to temperature and judge the remaining [[Mashed|mashed]] [[Potato|potato]] cooking time by eye.\n==See also==\n\n* [[Bramblebee Farm]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Indian recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Beef recipes]]\n[[Category:Chilli pepper recipes]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Lamb recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#mashedpotato #bramblebeefarm #parsley #potatoes #burger #vegetableoil #dried #potato #basilleaves #mash #lamb </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Annie batter",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Annie batter / Fanny Batter recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#flour #egg #batter #hand #yorkshirepuddingtray #vegetableoil #deliasmith #anniebatter #pigs #delia #plainflour \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=An aide-memoir for Annie so she can make perfect Yorkshire puddings for me (Fanny Batter!)\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 617\n|PortionCalories = 308\n|DatePublished=1st February 2016\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  57 minutes\n|PrepTime =  32 minutes\n|CookTime =  25 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Perfect Yorkshire puddings.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Thank you Darling!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">My dear Annie makes this for me at least once a week.  I Love Yorkies!</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Yorkshire pudding batter mixture.jpg|300px|thumb|right|]]\nThis is the recipe that Annie always uses for making [[Yorkshire puddings]].  It is copied from [[Delia Smith]]'s 'Complete Cookery Course' but with a few changes that over the years have proven to make a perfect [[Batter|batter]] with a good rise.\n\nIn [[Delia]]'s recipe she says it will serve 4 but I disagree, it serves 2 [[Pigs|pigs]] with a few leftover [[Popovers|popovers]].\n\nThe three main tricks to getting a well risen Yorkshire every time are:\n\n* Whisk by [[Hand|hand]], just enough to combine well. Do not use an electric whisk or go mad when hand beating\n\n* Allow the [[Batter|batter]] to reach room temperature by resting for 30 minutes first.  Do not rest in the [[Fridge|fridge]].  This will reduce the rise substantially.\n\n* [[Oil]] the [[Popover|popover]] or [[Yorkshire pudding tray]] and heat over a naked flame just before pouring the [[Batter|batter]] mixture into the tray, then put in the over immediately.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 75 g (3 oz) [[Plain flour|plain flour]]\n| 1 large [[Egg|egg]]\n| '''A total of 130 ml (5 fl oz) of liquid, comprised of:'''\n| 75 ml (3 fl oz) [[Milk|milk]] ''any type of milk is fine''\n| 55 ml (2 fl oz) water\n| Pinch of [[Sea Salt|sea salt]]\n| Pinch of [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 2 tablespoons [[Vegetable oil|vegetable oil]] to grease [[baking tray]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 220\u00b0 C (425\u00b0 F - gas 7), [fan oven 200\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Sift the [[Flour|flour]] into a large bowl\n| Add the [[Milk|milk]], water and [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]] to a jug\n| Make a depression in the middle of the [[Flour|flour]] and break the [[Egg|egg]] into it\n| Using a [[Hand|hand]] whisk, beat the [[Egg|egg]] into the [[Flour|flour]]\n| Once the [[Egg|egg]] and [[Flour|flour]] starts to combine, gradually mix in all of the liquids\n| [[Rest]] at '''room temperature''' for 30 minutes - do not refrigerate\n| Using a silicone [[Brush|brush]], distribute 2 tablespoons of [[Vegetable oil|vegetable oil]] into the [[Yorkshire pudding tray]] or [[Popover tray|popover tray]]\n| Carefully heat the tray on the [[Hob|hob]] top until the [[Oil|oil]] starts to sizzle\n| Pour the [[Batter|batter]] mixture evenly into the tray\n| Pop into the top of the [[Oven|oven]] and [[Bake|bake]] for 25 to 30 minutes\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Egg recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#flour #egg #batter #hand #yorkshirepuddingtray #vegetableoil #deliasmith #anniebatter #pigs #delia #plainflour </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Another Toady Hole\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#sausages #batter #bakingtray #sageleaves #anothertoadyhole #bake #sausage #plainflour #porksausages #eggs #meatrecipes\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=Weve tried many different recipes for Toad in the toad in the hole and this is our current favourite - especially as we now have our own free-range hens.\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=8th June 2023\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = 2\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  35 minutes\n|PrepTime =  5 minutes\n|CookTime =  30 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 796\n|PortionCalories = 398\n|Image = [[Image:Another Toady Hole recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Nice and eggy</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.6</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Some batter pudding can be rather weak - this is lovely and rich</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry]] </span></span>\n}}\nWe've tried many different recipes for [[Toad in the hole|toad in the hole]] and this is our current favourite - especially as we now have our own free-range [[Hens|hens]] again.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 285 ml [[MILK|milk]]\n| 115 g [[Plain flour|plain flour]]\n| 3 [[Eggs|eggs]]\n| Pinch of [[Salt|salt]]\n| Pinch of freshly grounds [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n| 6 [[Pork sausages|pork sausages]] from [[Russell's Butchers of Upwell, Norfolk]]\n| A handful of [[Sage leaves|sage leaves]], torn\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat you [[Oven|oven]] to maximum\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| [[Whisk]] the [[Batter|batter]] ingredients in a bowl until smooth and leave at room temperature\n| Wait for the [[Oven|oven]] to have been on for about 5 minutes so it's started to warm, but not yet at maximum heat\n| Spread 2 tablespoons of [[Olive oil|olive oil]] over a [[Baking tray|baking tray]] with a silicone [[Spatula|spatula]]\n| Slice each [[Sausage|sausage]] length-wise so any [[Fat|fat]] released is spread over the [[Baking tray|baking tray]]\n| Arrange the [[Sausages|sausages]], cut-side-down and sprinkle with torn [[Sage leaves|sage leaves]]\n| Pop the tray in the [[Oven|oven]] and leave to [[Bake|bake]] for about 5 minutes or until the [[Sausages|sausages]] start to [[Brown|brown]]\n| Pour the [[Batter|batter]] over the [[Sausages|sausages]]\n| Put the tray back in the [[Oven|oven]] on a middle shelf and [[Bake|bake]] for 20 minutes, don't open the oven during this period\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Toad-in-the-hole cooked.jpg|Perfectly cooked toad in the hole - crispy edges, soft middle\n</gallery>\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Baked beans|baked beans]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#sausages #batter #bakingtray #sageleaves #anothertoadyhole #bake #sausage #plainflour #porksausages #eggs #meatrecipes</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Apple and walnut salad with Somerset Camembert dressing",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Apple and walnut salad with Somerset Camembert dressing recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#cheese #salad #somersetcamembert #appleandwalnutsaladwithsomersetcamembertdressing #applejuice #apple #walnuts #starter #rocket #boiledorsimmered #snack \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This salad recipe would make an unusual starter or a light snack\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1580\n|PortionCalories = 790\n|DatePublished=24th October 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Apple and walnut salad, ready for the [[Somerset Camembert]]\n |Servings = Serves 2 as a light meal or 6 as a [[Starter|starter]]\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 10 minutes\n |PrepTime = 5 minutes\n |CookTime = 5 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Apple and walnut salad with Somerset Camembert dressing recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">I thought the dressing was nice</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I love Camembert cooked but I had never tried it as a salad dressing! </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]] </span></span>\n}}\n\nThis [[Salad|salad]] recipe would make an unusual [[Starter|starter]] or a light [[Snack|snack]].\n\nThis recipe reproduced by the kind permission of [[The Lubborn Creamery]], producers of [[Somerset Camembert]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 100g Shelled [[Walnuts|walnuts]]\n| 1 Medium [[Apple|apple]] - Cox or Worcester\n| Mixed [[Salad|salad]] leaves - [[Rocket|rocket]], red cos\n| 220g Ripe [[Somerset Camembert]]\n| 2 Rounded tablespoons [[cr\u00e8me fra\u00eeche]]\n| 3 tablespoons of Fresh [[Apple juice|apple juice]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Preheat [[Grill|grill]] to a medium heat and toast [[Walnuts|walnuts]] for\n| approximately 1 minute.\n| Slice the [[Apple|apple]], leaving the skin on, and put the slices in a small bowl and add 2 tablespoons of [[Apple juice|apple juice]], turn to coat the apple slices.\n| Next prepare the dressing.\n| Cut the [[Cheese|cheese]] in half and use a small, sharp knife to peel off the white coat.\n| Place the [[Cheese|cheese]] in a small saucepan. Add the [[cr\u00e8me fra\u00eeche]] and 1 tablespoon [[Apple juice|apple juice]].\n| Over a gentle heat [[Blend|blend]] the [[Cheese|cheese]] and [[cr\u00e8me fra\u00eeche]] together using a balloon whisk. It will take about 3-4 minutes, it is important that the [[Cheese|cheese]] is only melted and not cooked.\n| Arrange the [[Salad|salad]] leaves in a large bowl or on individual plates, followed by the [[Walnuts|walnuts]] and drained [[Apple|apple]] slices.\n| Lastly, pour on the [[Camembert]] dressing and serve.\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Salad recipes]]\n[[Category:Lubborn Creamery recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#cheese #salad #somersetcamembert #appleandwalnutsaladwithsomersetcamembertdressing #applejuice #apple #walnuts #starter #rocket #boiledorsimmered #snack </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
