title": "Apple crumble recipe",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Hot apple crumble fruit recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#cornflakes #applecrumblerecipe #apples #fruit #butter #almonds #breadcrumbs #brownsugar #fruitcrumble #porridgeoats #castersugar \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Another great recipe to use up apples when you have that once a year glut\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1696\n|PortionCalories = 212\n|DatePublished=29th July 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 8\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 40 minutes\n |PrepTime = 10 minutes\n |CookTime = 30 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Mango and ginger crumble recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Stow hall Gardens Apple Day</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Google Stow Hall Gardens, then visit on apple day - you could make tonnes of this then!</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nAnother great [[fruit crumble]] recipe to use up [[Apples|apples]] when you have that once a year glut.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 2 cooking [[Apples|apples]], peeled, cored and cut into slices\n| A handful of seasonal mixed [[fruit]] or [[sultanas]]\n| 1 tablespoon dark [[Brown sugar|brown sugar]] or [[Molasses|molasses]]\n| 100g softened [[Butter|butter]], [[Diced|diced]], plus a little extra for greasing\n| 140 g [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]]\n| 100 g [[cornflakes]]\n| 100 g [[Caster sugar|caster sugar]], plus &frac12; teaspoon for dusting\n| 25 g flaked [[Almonds|almonds]]\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the oven to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6)\n\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Grease a suitable [[Baking|baking]] dish with [[Butter|butter]]\n| Arrange the [[Apples|apples]] in layers\n| Sprinkle over the mixed [[Fruit|fruit]] and [[Brown sugar|brown sugar]]\n| Add the [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]] to a bowl and mix with the [[cornflakes]], scrunching them up as you go.  Add the [[Butter|butter]] and the [[Sugar|sugar]] and knead into the breadcrumbs with your fingers.\n| Spoon the crumble over the top of the [[Fruit|fruit]]\n| Sprinkle with the flaked [[Almonds|almonds]] and dust with the extra [[Sugar|sugar]]\n| [[Bake]] for 30 minutes or until golden\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe hot with [[Home-made custard|homemade custard]].\n\n===Variations===\nThe original recipe called for rolled [[porridge oats]], but I changed it to [[cornflakes]] as I remember my mum making crumble like this, many years ago.  This type of crumble does not hold together as well as a flour-type crumble, but it's all crunch and delicious.\n\nA made in heaven fruit combination is to add a handful of topped and tailed blackcurrents to the apples before cooking, marvellous!\n==See also==\n* [[Mango and ginger crumble]]\n* [[Apple crumble recipe]]\n* [[Apple crumble recipe (Mum's)]]\n* [[Traditional crumble topping|Traditional crumble topping]]\n{{Template:PeelingGinger}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#cornflakes #applecrumblerecipe #apples #fruit #butter #almonds #breadcrumbs #brownsugar #fruitcrumble #porridgeoats #castersugar </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Apple crumble recipe (Mum's)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Apple crumble, (Mum's) a fruit recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#butter #apples #apple #flour #muscovadosugar #jaggery #bake #wholemealflour #crumble #crumb #cookery \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Another recipe from Mum's scribbled cookery notes, this recipe was one of her favourites\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1616\n|PortionCalories = 269\n|DatePublished=29th July 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 6\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  45 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime =  35 minutes\n|Image = [[File:Mango and ginger crumble recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">I have to give this full marks!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Thanks Mum, great as always.</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry]] </span></span>\n}}\nAnother recipe from Mum's scribbled [[Cookery|cookery]] notes, this recipe was one of her favourites.  As she grew older and more reliant on others, this was a treat she always asked me to make for her.\n\n'''[[Apple|apple]] filling'''\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 675 g (1.5 lb) cooking [[Apples|apples]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]]\n| 3 tablespoons of water\n| 50g (2 oz) [[Muscovado sugar]] or [[Jaggery|jaggery]]\n| &#189; teaspoon powdered [[Mixed spice|mixed spice]]\n}}\n'''[[Crumble topping|crumble topping]]'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 75g (2.5 oz) [[Butter|butter]] \n| 50g (2 oz) [[Muscovado sugar]] or [[Jaggery|jaggery]]\n| 175 g (6 oz) [[Wholemeal flour|wholemeal flour]]\n}}\n\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6), [fan [[Oven|oven]] 180\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Peel, core and slice the [[Apples|apples]]\n| Add to a small pan together with the remaining filling ingredients and [[Simmer|simmer]] gently for 10 minutes.\n| Don't cook any longer as you don't want a [[Puree|puree]] for this recipe\n| Pour the mixture into a 1.2 l (2 pint) ovenproof dish and leave to cool\n}}\n'''[[Crumble|crumble]]'''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Add the [[Butter|butter]] and [[Flour|flour]] to a bowl and rub the [[Butter|butter]] into the [[Flour|flour]] until it becomes [[Crumb|crumb]]-like\n| Fold in the [[Sugar|sugar]]\n| Add the topping to the [[Apple|apple]] mixture and [[Bake|bake]] for 25 minutes\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe hot with [[Custard|custard]]\n==See also==\n* [[Mango and ginger crumble]]\n* [[Apple crumble recipe]]\n* [[Apple crumble recipe (Mum's)]]\n* [[Traditional crumble topping|Traditional crumble topping]]\n{{Template:PeelingGinger}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#butter #apples #apple #flour #muscovadosugar #jaggery #bake #wholemealflour #crumble #crumb #cookery </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }

Make this simple and delicious sweet.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1 pint (568 ml) [[apples]] peeled, cored and chopped\n| &#188; pint (142 ml) stiffly [[whipped cream]]\n| [[Sugar]] to taste\n| 1 tablespoon [[butter]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| [[Bake]] or stew the [[apples]]\n| ''Heat the [[butter]] in a pan, add the [[sugar]] and [[apple]] pulp, stew on a low heat until the apples are soft and mushy (20 minutes)''\n| Pass the pulp through a fine sieve, discarding any pips\n| Stir in the [[cream]]\n| ''Allow to cool''\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\n\nServe in a glass dish\n\n==See also==\n* [[Apple sauce]]\n* [[Dried apple slices]]\n* [[Apple crumble recipe]]\n* [[Freezing apples]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Stewed, braised or pot roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#apples #butter #stewedbraisedorpotroasted #applesauce #cream #applecrumblerecipe #driedappleslices #freezingapples #whippedcream #bake #apple </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Apple pie",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Apple pie, a fruit recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#apples #applepie #flour #castersugar #groundcinnamon #brownsugar #butter #pastry #piedish #brush #apple \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=The classic English dessert, ideal for using up your glut of home grown apples\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1985\n|PortionCalories = 248\n|DatePublished=27th October 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 8 - Makes 1 large pie\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 1 hour 15 minutes\n |PrepTime = 30 minutes\n |CookTime = 45 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Apple pie recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"><span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Bramley's rock!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Just the very best apples for a pie. \ud83e\udd67</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\">[[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]] </span></span>\n}}\nThe classic English [[Dessert|dessert]], ideal for using up your glut of home grown [[Apples|apples]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 680g (1&frac12;lb) Bramley [[Apples|apples]], peeled, cored and sliced\n| 255g (9oz) [[Homemade sweet shortcrust pastry]]\n| 75g (3oz) Soft [[Brown sugar|brown sugar]]\n| 25g (1oz) [[Butter|butter]], cubed\n| 1 tablespoon [[Plain flour|plain flour]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Caster sugar|caster sugar]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Ground cinnamon|ground cinnamon]]\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6)\n* Chill the pastry in the [[Fridge|fridge]] for 30 minutes\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Mix the [[Brown sugar|brown sugar]], [[Ground cinnamon|ground cinnamon]] and [[Flour|flour]] together into a bowl\n| Place a layer of [[Apple|apple]] slices in the base of a 900ml (1&frac12; pint) [[Pie dish|pie dish]] \n| Sprinkle over with some of the [[Sugar|sugar]], [[Cinnamon|cinnamon]] and [[Flour|flour]]\n| Repeat the layers until the dish is filled\n| Dab the [[Butter|butter]] over the [[Apples|apples]].\n| Roll out the [[Pastry|pastry]] until just larger than the [[Pie dish|pie dish]]\n| Cover the dish with the [[Pastry|pastry]]\n| Decorate with any pastry scraps and cut a few slits in the top\n| [[Brush]] with water and sprinkle with [[Caster sugar|caster sugar]].\n| [[Bake]] for 45 minutes\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe hot or cold, with [[Custard|custard]]\n===Variations===\n*Use a mix of Bramley [[Apples|apples]]  and Coxes apples\n*Add a tablespoon of chopped stem [[Ginger|ginger]]\n*Add 100 g of wild blackberries.  Don't bother with bland shop-bought  rubbish\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Pies tarts and flans]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#apples #applepie #flour #castersugar #groundcinnamon #brownsugar #butter #pastry #piedish #brush #apple </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Apple sauce",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Apple sauce, a fruit recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#applesauce #apples #sauce #apple #butter #lemonjuice #sauces #pork #vacuumpack #boiledorsimmered #vacuumpacked \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Perfect for pork and really quick and easy, especially if you happen to have an apple tree in your garden\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 472\n|PortionCalories = 21\n|DatePublished=27th October 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Perfect apple sauce\n|Servings = Serves 22 - Makes 1 jar of [[apple]] [[sauce]]\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime = 25 minutes\n|PrepTime = 10 minutes\n|CookTime = 15 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Apple sauce recipe1.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Made this again yesterday</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">This time with armfuls of windfalls from Stow Hall Gardens, my favourite place in all the world!</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nPerfect for [[pork]] and really quick and easy, especially if you happen to have an [[apple]] tree in your garden.  Some bottled [[sauces]] have a glutinous texture.  This is fresh and clean tasting.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 450g (1 lb) cooking [[apples]], about 3 large apples - Bramley cooking [[apples]] are the best for this [[sauce]]\n| 1 tablespoon Water\n| 2 teaspoons of [[lemon juice]]\n| 1 tablespoon sherry vinegar\n| 2 tablespoons of [[sugar]] (or to taste)\n| 25 g (1 oz) [[Butter]]\n| Pinch of [[sea salt]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Peel, core and quarter the [[apples]]\n| Add them to a pan, with all of the ingredients\n| Cover and heat the pan gently until the [[apples]] have softened, started to fluff up and most of the liquid has been reduced (about 15 minutes)\n| Mix well\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\n\nServe at room temperature\n\n===Freezing===\n\nThis is an ideal candidate for freezing. Make it when apples are plentiful and bag up and freeze in portion sizes to match your family.\n\nEven better if you can [[vacuum pack]] them first.\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Vacuum packed apple slices.jpg|[[vacuum packed]] apple slices ready for freezing\nImage:Apple sauce recipe 2.jpg|thumb|Stew for about 15 minutes\n</gallery>\n===Variations===\n\nI notice that my Phaidon Silver Spoon cookery book also suggest adding a tablespoon of grated [[horseradish root]] which I will have to try once mine has grown enough to harvest.\n\nOr try a [[Apple sauce#Other apple sauces|simple sauce!]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Dips and sauces]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Pickles and preserves]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#applesauce #apples #sauce #apple #butter #lemonjuice #sauces #pork #vacuumpack #boiledorsimmered #vacuumpacked </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }

title": "Apricot stuffed pork fillet",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Apricot stuffed pork fillet, a fruit recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#porkfillet #sherry #pork #apricotstuffedporkfillet #sageleaves #garlic #parsley #sauce #mushrooms #apricots #lemonjuice \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A different way to cook pork fillet, this version stuffed with dried apricots served in a creamy mushroom sauce\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n {{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1126\n|PortionCalories = 281\n|DatePublished=26th September 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Served with [[spaghetti]] and steamed [[broccoli]]\n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  1 hour, 5 minutes\n|PrepTime =  30 minutes\n|CookTime =  35 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Apricot stuffed pork fillet recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Genius idea!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">This is a perfect pairing, and served with spaghetti too.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nA different way to cook [[pork fillet]], this version stuffed with [[Dried apricots|dried apricots]] served in a creamy [[Mushroom|mushroom]] [[Sauce|sauce]].\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 whole [[Pork fillet|pork fillet]], about 500g (1 lb)\n| 50 g (2 oz) [[Dried apricots|dried apricots]] (chopped), soaked for 30 minutes in 3 tablespoons [[Sherry|sherry]] if you have the time.\n| 2 tablespoons freshly picked [[Parsley|parsley]], finely chopped.\n| 8 freshly picked [[Sage leaves|sage leaves]] plus a sprig for garnish.\n| 1 tablespoon [[Olive oil|olive oil]].\n| 1 small [[Onion|onion]], peeled and finely chopped.\n| 2 cloves of [[garlic]], peeled and crushed.\n| 300 ml (1/2 pint) [[Chicken|chicken]] stock or [[Vegetable Stock|vegetable stock]].\n| 125g (4 oz) [[Button mushrooms|button mushrooms]], thinly sliced.\n| 2 tablespoons [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]] or [[Lime juice|lime juice]].\n| 142 ml (5 fl oz) [[Soured cream|soured cream]].\n| 3 tablespoons of [[Sherry|sherry]] (or the [[Sherry|sherry]] that the [[Apricots|apricots]] were soaked in).\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]].\n\n}}\n\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| [[How to butterfly a chicken breast|Butterfly]] the pork fillet lengthways. ''Cut it open like a book''.\n| Flatten a little more using a [[Rolling pin|rolling pin]] or a [[Meat mallet|meat mallet]].\n| Season the inside with a little [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]].\n| Arrange the chopped [[Apricots|apricots]] and chopped [[Sage leaves|sage leaves]] along one side.\n| Sprinkle with the chopped [[Parsley|parsley]].\n| Close the ''book'' and secure with cocktail sticks or tie with fine string.\n| Heat the tablespoon of [[Olive oil|olive oil]] in a large [[Frying pan|frying pan]] over a medium heat. Sprinkle with a little [[Black pepper|black pepper]] and [[Brown|brown]] the [[Pork fillet|pork fillet]], turning regularly so it colours evenly.\n| Remove and keep warm.\n| Add the chopped [[Onions|onions]] and [[garlic]] and saut\u00e9 until softened but not coloured.\n| Add the [[Stock|stock]], [[Lime|lime]] or [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]] to the [[Onions|onions]], add the [[Meat|meat]] and cover and [[Simmer|simmer]] for 20 minutes.\n| Add the sliced [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]] and the [[Sherry|sherry]], stir well, cover and [[Simmer|simmer]] for another 15 minutes.\n| Remove the [[Pork|pork]] and discard the string or cocktail sticks, set to one side and keep warm.\n| Stir in the [[Soured cream|soured cream]] and warm through.  Don't allow it to [[Boil|boil]] or it will separate.\n| Slice the [[Pork fillet|pork fillet]] into medallions and arrange on serving plates.\n| Spoon the [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]] and [[Sauce|sauce]] over the [[Pork|pork]].\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Apricot_stuffed_pork_fillet_sewn_up.jpg|I found it more secure to tie with [[kitchen string]], using [[cocktail sticks]] to hold it in place while I tied the fillet.\nImage:Apricot_stuffed_pork_fillet_butterflied_and_stuffed.jpg|[[Butterflied]] and stuffing placed on one side\n</gallery>\n\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe on a bed of [[Plain rice|plain rice]] garnished with a few fresh [[Sage leaves|sage leaves]].\n===Variations===\nServe with [[pasta]], [[plain boiled rice]] or [[Boiled|boiled]] [[New Potatoes|new potatoes]].\n====The best knot to tie kitchen twine single-handedly====\nAfter much experimenting, I have discovered the best knot to tie kitchen twine on your own is the ''[[Surgeons' knot]]''.\n===Chef's notes===\nFollow the [[RSPCA Think Pig Checklist]] to make sure that your [[Pork|pork]] has come from pigs that have been reared to higher welfare standards.\n\n* http://bit.ly/rspcathinkpig\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Stewed, braised or pot roasted]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#porkfillet #sherry #pork #apricotstuffedporkfillet #sageleaves #garlic #parsley #sauce #mushrooms #apricots #lemonjuice </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Ash key pickle",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Ash key pickle, a British recipe Cooking Wiki\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#boil #ashkeypickle #veganrecipes #salads #herbs #historicrecipes #picklesandpreserves #pickle #pickled #vegetarianrecipes #vegetables \n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=Ash key or Ashen key pickle is an ancient pickle made from the seeds of Fraxinus excelsior European Ash or Common Ash\n|datePublished=2013-01-22\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n===Recipe review===\n</span>\n'''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Strange recipe</span>'''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">3.6</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Tried it, just for kicks.  Hmmm!</span> <span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> - [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n\n[[Image:Ash keys.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Leaves and seeds of Fraxinus excelsior]]  \n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}}\nAsh key or Ashen key pickle is an ancient pickle made from the seeds of ''Fraxinus excelsior'' [European Ash or Common Ash]\nAn odd recipe that probably needs very young ash keys to guarantee a tender [[Pickle|pickle]].\n\nThis recipe comes from John Evelyn's study of [[Vegetables|vegetables]], [[Herbs|herbs]] and [[Salads|salads]]: 'Acetaria, a Discourse of Sallets, 1699'\nYou can [http://www.gutenberg.org/etext/15517 download this book] from Project Gutenberg, the free on line book resource, it is also available in Kindle format from here.\n\n===Procedure===\n\n'''Gather them young, and [[Boil|boil]] them in three or four Waters to extract the Bitterness; and when they feel tender, prepare a Syrup of sharp [[White-wine vinegar]], [[Sugar]], and a little Water. Then [[Boil|boil]] them on a very quick Fire, and they will become of a green Colour, fit to be potted so soon as cold.'''\n\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Pickles and preserves]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Pickled]]\n{{RecipeSkip}}\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#boil #ashkeypickle #veganrecipes #salads #herbs #historicrecipes #picklesandpreserves #pickle #pickled #vegetarianrecipes #vegetables </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Asparagus and broccoli flan",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Asparagus and broccoli flan, a vegetarian recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#asparagusandbroccoliflan #parsley #creamcheese #asparagus #bake #fat #greaseproofpaper #blanche #salted #egg #bakingtray \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=I made a couple of these for my mum today, so she has a vegetarian alternative for Christmas dinner\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 3039\n|PortionCalories = 379\n|DatePublished=17th January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 8 - Makes two 9\" flans\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 1 hour\n |PrepTime = 10 minutes\n |CookTime = 50 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Asparagus and broccoli flan recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Seven years ago!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.6</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">It's a long time since I made this, or any flan to be honest.  Time to make amends!</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Remember the greaseproof.jpg|thumb|right|300px|Twice now, I've forgotten to put [[greaseproof paper]] under the baking beans.  Perhaps this picture will remind me next time!]]\nI made a couple of these for my mum today, so she has a vegetarian alternative for Christmas dinner.\n\nIt's just a slight variation of all of the flan recipes, but they looked so good I though I would add the recipe.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 500 g pack of [[Ready made shortcrust pastry|ready made shortcrust pastry]]\n| [[Olive oil]] for greasing\n| 4 [[Free range eggs|free range eggs]]\n| 8 tablespoons [[Milk|milk]]\n| &#190; of 1 small head of [[Broccoli|broccoli]], cut into small florets\n| 100g baby [[Asparagus|asparagus]] tips, [1 small pack]\n| 200 g of low-[[Fat|fat]] [[Cream cheese|cream cheese]] - mine was [[Chive|chive]] and [[Onion|onion]] flavoured but that's personal taste\n| A splash of [[Louisiana hot pepper sauce]]\n| A handful of freshly chopped [[Parsley|parsley]]\n| [[Freshly ground black pepper]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Preheat the oven to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - Gas 6)\n| On a floured board, roll out the pastry to fit your [[baking tray]]s\n| Lightly [[Oil|oil]] the trays to prevent the pastry sticking\n| Press the pastry well into the edges of the trays\n| Blind [[Bake|bake]] for 10 minutes\n| Add the [[Broccoli florets|broccoli florets]] to a pan of [[Boiling|boiling]] [[Salted|salted]] water and [[Blanche|blanche]] for about 4 minutes. Remove and drain well\n| Add the [[Eggs|eggs]], [[Milk|milk]], [[Pepper|pepper]], hot [[Sauce|sauce]] and [[Parsley|parsley]] to a large bowl and whisk until combined\n| Add the [[Cream cheese|cream cheese]] and whisk until really well mixed\n| Arrange the florets in the partially [[Baked|baked]] flans and pour in the [[Egg|egg]] mix\n| Arrange the [[Asparagus|asparagus]] tips over the top of the flan\n| [[Bake]] for 30 minutes\n}}\n===Chef's tip===\nBecause I use an electric whisk, I guess lots of air gets into the flans, so they often rise like souffl\u00e9s, to at least double the height of the tin.  bearing this in mind, ensure you leave enough  room above the flan when [[Baking|baking]]! \n{{Quiche - See also}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Egg recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Pies tarts and flans]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#asparagusandbroccoliflan #parsley #creamcheese #asparagus #bake #fat #greaseproofpaper #blanche #salted #egg #bakingtray </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }

title": "Aubergine no-meat meatballs",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Aubergine no-meat meatballs a British recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#oliveoil #aubergines #breadcrumbs #onion #balsamicvinegar #olives #auberginenomeatmeatballs #chilli #herbs #garlic #freshlygroundpepper \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=These little beauties are actually meat-free but they certainly look the part. And, they taste positively gorgeous\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 531\n|PortionCalories = 132\n|DatePublished=23rd May 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  35 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime =  25 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Aubergine nomeat meatballs recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Not a fan</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">3</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Meatballs should have meat in them!</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nThese little beauties are actually [[Meat|meat]]-free but they certainly look the part. And, they taste positively gorgeous. [[Aubergines]] [[Fried|fried]] up in a little [[Oil|oil]], mixed with chopped [[Olives|olives]], [[Chilli|chilli]] and [[Herbs|herbs]]. This dish is not just for vegetarians and vegans!\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| A few splashes of [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 2 [[Aubergines|aubergines]], cut into a small [[Dice|dice]]\n| 1 smallish [[Onion|onion]], finely chopped\n| 3 [[Garlic|garlic]] [[Cloves|cloves]], finely chopped\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]]\n| [[Freshly ground pepper]]\n| 1 [[Lemon|lemon]]\n| A handful of pitted [[Black olives|black olives]]\n| 1 [[Red chilli|red chilli]], finely chopped (or a pinch of [[Chilli powder|chilli powder]])\n| A large handful of fresh [[Basil|basil]] or 1 tablespoon chopped [[Rosemary leaves|rosemary leaves]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Balsamic vinegar|balsamic vinegar]]\n| 1 mug of [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Place a large [[Frying pan|frying pan]] over medium heat. Sizzle the [[Aubergine|aubergine]], [[Onion|onion]] and [[Garlic|garlic]] in a bit of [[Oil|oil]] till soft and starting to colour. Add more [[Oil|oil]], if need. Season well.\n| When it\u0092s almost done, add a squeeze of [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]] and grate over a good bit of [[Zest|zest]].\n| Tip it into a [[Food processor|food processor]] with the [[Olives|olives]], [[Chilli|chilli]], [[Balsamic vinegar|balsamic vinegar]] and [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]]. Whizz it up till everything comes together. Or just chop and mix everything up on a large cutting board.\n| Taste the mix. Add more [[Herbs|herbs]] or [[Spice|spice]] if needed. If it\u0092s a bit dry, add a splash of [[Olive oil|olive oil]]. If it\u0092s too wet, add more [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]]. Shape into balls. Two [[Aubergines|aubergines]] will give you about a dozen rounded tablespoon-sized balls.\n| Sizzle the balls in [[Olive oil|olive oil]] till golden all over and serve with a mound of sauced [[Spaghetti|spaghetti]], or just nibble them on their own.\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Abel and Cole veg box recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n{{Template:Abel and Cole veg box recipes attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#oliveoil #aubergines #breadcrumbs #onion #balsamicvinegar #olives #auberginenomeatmeatballs #chilli #herbs #garlic #freshlygroundpepper </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }

title": "Avocado and Capricorn goats' cheese salad",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Avocado and Capricorn goats' cheese salad a cheese recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#avocadoandcapricorngoatscheesesalad #tomatoes #parsley #grill #avocado #avocados #toasted #pinenuts #french #thelubborncreamery #bread \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Avocado and goats' cheese, an interesting combination and being suitable for vegetarians it's another recipe idea for our Gent nights\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1316\n|PortionCalories = 329\n|DatePublished=24th October 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 15 minutes\n |PrepTime = 10 minutes\n |CookTime = 5 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Avocado and Capricorn goats' cheese salad recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Yum</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.8</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">We love avocados</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Avocado]] and [[Goats' cheese|goats' cheese]], an interesting combination and being suitable for vegetarians it's another recipe idea for our [[Gent nights]].  It would make a good [[Starter|starter]] or with some crusty [[Bread|bread]] would probably make a good [[Main course|main course]].\n\nMany thanks to those nice people at [[The Lubborn Creamery]] who gave us permission to reproduce this recipe.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 12 small [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]], halved\n| 2 [[Cloves of garlic, crushed|cloves of garlic, crushed]].\n| 2 tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]].\n| 4 tablespoons [[French]] dressing.\n| 2 x 100g [[Capricorn Somerset Goats' cheese]], chopped\n| 2 tablespoons flat leaf [[Parsley|parsley]], chopped\n| 2 ripe [[Avocados|avocados]]\n| 25g [[Toasted|toasted]] [[Pine nuts|pine nuts]]\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the [[Grill|grill]] to high.\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Place the [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]] and [[Garlic|garlic]] on a [[Baking tray|baking tray]] and drizzle over the [[Oil|oil]].\n| [[Grill]] for 4-5 minutes, until just soft.\n| Place the [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]] in a bowl and mix together with the [[French]] dressing, [[Capricorn Somerset Goats' cheese]] and [[Parsley|parsley]].\n| Peel, stone and slice the [[Avocados|avocados]].\n| Fan the [[Avocado|avocado]] slices onto a serving plate and spoon the [[Tomato|tomato]] mixture onto the smaller end of the fan.\n| Sprinkle over some [[Toasted|toasted]] [[Pine nuts|pine nuts]].\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Salad recipes]]\n[[Category:Lubborn Creamery recipes]]\n[[Category:Grilled, griddled or barbecued]]\n\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#avocadoandcapricorngoatscheesesalad #tomatoes #parsley #grill #avocado #avocados #toasted #pinenuts #french #thelubborncreamery #bread </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Avocado and smoked mackerel salad",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Avocado and smoked mackerel salad a British recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#salad #tomatoes #lemonjuice #mackerel #sherryvinegar #nampla #avocadoandsmokedmackerelsalad #corianderleaves #onions #avocados #oliveoil \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Avocado pears, flakes of smoked mackerel and a zingy dressing make this salad idea for a summer's day meal\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1571\n|PortionCalories = 392\n|DatePublished=24th October 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime = 15 minutes\n|PrepTime = 15 minutes\n|CookTime = None\n|Image = [[Image:Avocado and smoked mackerel salad recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">I love the way you did this!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.7</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Twice as useful. \ud83d\ude3b</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\">[[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Avocado pears]], flakes of [[smoked]] [[mackerel]]  and a zingy dressing make this [[salad]] idea for a summers day meal\n\nAlthough this dish really should be served on one large dish, as we often want to use the remainder of the salad for another meal we serve the two separately.\n\n'''Avocado salad'''\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 2 ripe [[avocados]]\n| &#189; a [[cucumber]]\n| 2 large [[salad]] [[tomatoes]]\n| 2 [[spring onions]], [[chopped on the diagonal]]\n| 1 fresh green or [[red chili]]\n| &#189; tablespoon [[lemon juice]]\n| &#189; tablespoon [[sherry vinegar]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[nam pla]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[extra virgin olive oil]]\n| [[Salt]] and [[freshly ground black pepper]]\n}}\n'''Mackerel [[salad]]'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 15 g (1/2 oz) [[olive oil]]\n| 1 teaspoon whole [[mustard seeds]]\n| &#189; [[onion]], finely chopped\n| 225 g (8 oz) [[smoked]] [[mackerel]], flaked\n| 2 [[salad]] [[tomatoes]], chopped\n| Handful fresh [[coriander leaves]], chopped\n| 1 tablespoon [[lemon juice]]\n| Splash of [[sherry vinegar]]\n}}\n===Method===\n'''Avocado salad'''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Slice the [[avocados]] thinly\n| Peel and slice the [[cucumber]] thinly\n| Slice the [[tomatoes]]\n| Arrange all in a serving bowl\n| Deseed and chop the [[chili]]\n| Mix the [[lemon juice]], [[nam pla]], [[sherry vinegar]], [[sugar]] and [[chillies]] in a bowl and whisk together\n| Season with [[Pepper]]\n| Drizzle over the [[salad]]\n| Sprinkle the chopped spring onions over the top\n}}\n \n'''Mackerel salad'''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Gently [[fry]] the [[onions]] and [[mustard seeds]] in [[olive oil]] until the [[onions]] are translucent and soft.  Watch for [[popping]] [[mustard]] seeds!\n| Add the mackerel, [[tomatoes]] [[sherry vinegar]] and [[lemon juice]] and cook for 4 or 5 minutes to reduce the liquid\n| Take off the heat if the [[mackerel]] starts to break up\n| Add the [[coriander leaves]] and allow to wilt\n| Remove from heat and allow to cool\n| Remove the mixture with a slotted spoon and plate-up, leaving any excess liquid behind\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\n\nServe both dishes chilled\n\n===Chef's notes===\nDon't be tempted to add [[salt]] as processed [[mackerel]] can be quite salty already, as can [[nam pla]].\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Mackerel]]\n[[Category:Fish recipes|Mackerel]]\n[[Category:Sea fish recipes|Mackerel]]\n[[Category:Main courses|Mackerel]]\n[[Category:Salad recipes|Mackerel]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Uncooked]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#salad #tomatoes #lemonjuice #mackerel #sherryvinegar #nampla #avocadoandsmokedmackerelsalad #corianderleaves #onions #avocados #oliveoil </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Baby cauliflower cheese",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Baby cauliflower cheese a cheese recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#cauliflower #babycauliflowercheese #parmesan #boil #cayennepepper #grated #butter #sauce #parsley #garlic #bake \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=I normally find baby vegetables rather faddy, but when I spotted some sweet little cauliflowers, I decided to give them a try\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 662\n|PortionCalories = 165\n|DatePublished=17th January 2013\n|Author = JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = 4 as a [[Snack|snack]] or first course\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime =  45 minutes\n |PrepTime = 5 minutes\n |CookTime = 40 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Baby cauliflower cheese recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Dinky, sminky!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.7</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">A bit fancy, but rather nice and they do look great.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Baby cauliflowers.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Baby cauliflowers]]\nI normally find baby [[Vegetables|vegetables]] rather faddy, but when I spotted some sweet little [[Cauliflower|cauliflower]]s, I decided to give them a try.  I am the only person at home who really likes [[cauliflower]], so buying a large one can be rather wasteful and I loathe [[Frozen|frozen]] [[cauliflower]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 4 baby [[cauliflower]]s\n| [[Garlic]], to taste, crushed\n| 20g [[Butter|butter]]\n| 20g [[Plain flour|plain flour]]\n| 300ml warm [[Milk|milk]]\n| 30g mature [[Cheddar]] or [[Mah\u00f3n-Menorca]] [[Cheese|cheese]], [[Grated|grated]]\n| 15g [[Parmesan cheese]], finely [[Grated|grated]]\n| 2 teaspoons [[English mustard]]\n| A pinch of [[Cayenne pepper|cayenne pepper]]\n| Seasoning\n| [[Parsley]], finely chopped\n| 10g [[Parmesan]] for topping\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6).\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| [[Boil]] or [[Steam|steam]] the [[cauliflower]]s until they are almost cooked.\n| Drain, plunge into cold water for a few minutes, then drain thoroughly.\n| Meanwhile, melt the [[Butter|butter]] in a saucepan over a low heat.\n| Add the [[Garlic|garlic]] and allow to saut\u00e9 gently until golden - do not let it brown.\n| Stir in the [[Flour|flour]] and cook, stirring constantly, for 4 to 5 minutes.\n| Very slowly, add the [[Milk|milk]], a little at a time, whilst continuously stirring.\n| Continue cooking slowly until smooth and thickened (about 5 minutes) - do not allow the [[Sauce|sauce]] to [[Boil|boil]].\n| Add the [[Cheeses|cheeses]] and stir until they have melted\n| Add the [[Mustard|mustard]] and [[Cayenne pepper|cayenne pepper]], adjust seasoning and cook gently for a few more minutes.\n| Stir in the [[Parsley|parsley]] and remove from the heat.\n| Pour a little of the [[Sauce|sauce]] into the bottom of an [[Oven|oven]]-proof dish, arrange the cauliflowers over it, then pour the remaining sauce over them.\n| Sprinkle with the extra [[Parmesan]] and [[Bake|bake]] for 15 minutes.\n| Brown under a hot grill.\n}}\n===Variations===\nInstead of cooking in an [[Oven|oven]] dish, you can [[Bake|bake]] the cauliflowers in individual [[Ramekin dishes|ramekin dishes]].\n\nTry using a hard [[:Category:Swiss cheeses|Swiss cheese]] with the [[Parmesan]]\n==See also==\n* [[Cauliflower cheese]]\n* [[Broccoli and cauliflower cheese]]\n* [[Basic white sauce]]\n* [[Cheese sauce]]\n* [[Heston Blumenthal's perfect cauliflower cheese recipe]]\n* [[Mornay sauce]]\n* [http://www.bbc.co.uk/food/cauliflower_cheese BBC - cauliflower_cheese recipes]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n[[Category:Steamed]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#cauliflower #babycauliflowercheese #parmesan #boil #cayennepepper #grated #butter #sauce #parsley #garlic #bake </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Bacon, chestnut and cranberry stuffing",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Bacon, chestnut and cranberry stuffing, a British recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#stuffing #baconchestnutandcranberrystuffing #butter #bacon #port #breadcrumbs #cranberries #freeze #onion #egg #garlic \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This stuffing recipe is fairly involved, but worth making for special occasions such as Christmas dinner\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2224\n|PortionCalories = 222\n|DatePublished=17th January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n |Servings = Serves 10 - Makes 20 [[Stuffing|stuffing]] balls\n |Difficulty = 3\n |TotalTime =  2 hours 30 minutes\n |PrepTime = 1 hour 45 minutes\n |CookTime = 45 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Bacon, chestnut and cranberry stuffing.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Over the top!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">And all the better for it!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis [[Stuffing|stuffing]] recipe is fairly involved, but worth making for special occasions such as Christmas dinner.\n\nDon't use this to stuff the [[Turkey|turkey]], but serve as an [[Accompaniment|accompaniment]], either as balls or [[Baked|baked]] in one tray.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 100g [[Dried cranberries|dried cranberries]] \n| 50ml ruby [[Port|port]] \n| 1 small [[Onion|onion]], peeled and chopped \n| 2 rashers [[Bacon|bacon]] , chopped (rind removed and discarded)\n| 50g [[Butter|butter]] \n| 3 Cloves [[Garlic|garlic]], peeled and chopped\n| 450g [[sausagemeat]] \n| 140g dried [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]] *''see Chef's notes''\n| 2 tablespoons fresh [[Parsley|parsley]], chopped \n| &frac12; teaspoon fresh [[Thyme leaves|thyme leaves]], chopped \n| 140g cooked [[Chestnuts|chestnuts]] (about 200g / 20 raw chestnuts to allow for peeling and waste), peeled and chopped\n}}\n''' To bind'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 1 [[Egg|egg]], beaten\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Chop the [[cranberries]] and soak in the [[Port|port]] for at least 1 hour\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 190\u00b0 C (375\u00b0 F - gas 5), [fan oven 170\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Gently [[Fry|fry]] the [[Onion|onion]] [[Garlic|garlic]] and [[Bacon|bacon]] in the [[Butter|butter]] for about 6 to 8 minutes.\n| Allow to cool, then using your (clean) hands mix with the remaining ingredients.\n| Once well mixed, add the [[Egg|egg]] and mix in well.  This helps the [[Stuffing|stuffing]] to bind together properly.\n}}\n* either:\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Roll into 20 balls and [[Bake|bake]] alongside your [[Roast|roast]] - make them even nicer by rolling in melted [[Butter|butter]] first.\n| 35 minutes is all they need when cooked as balls.\n}}\n* or:\n{{RecipeMethod\n| [[Butter]] a small [[Oven|oven]] dish and pack the [[Stuffing|stuffing]] into the dish (about 5cm thick)\n| 40 to 45 minutes should be enough when coked in a tray\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Bacon, chestnut and cranberry stuffing recipe.jpg|[[Bacon]], [[Chestnut|chestnut]] and [[Cranberry|cranberry]] stuffing balls, ready to [[bake]] or [[freeze]]\nImage:Bacon, chestnut and cranberry stuffing ingredients.jpg|The ingredients for [[Bacon]], [[Chestnut|chestnut]] and [[Cranberry|cranberry]] [[Stuffing|stuffing]]\n</gallery>\n===Serving suggestions===\nThese also make nice nibbles served cold!\n===Chef's notes===\nMake them before the event and [[Freeze|freeze]] them (uncooked).\n\nDefrost properly on the day you want to use them.\n\n'''[[Breadcrumbs|Breadcrumbs]]:''' If you have a [[food-processor]] you can make fresh [[breadcrumbs]] really quickly.  Just tear up a few slices of good quality fresh bread, place in a [[food processor]] with a metal blade and pulse a few times until they look right.  I find that fresh bread is far better than stale bread for this.\n\n'''[[Roasting chestnuts|Roasting the chestnuts]]''': Cut a slit in the [[Chestnuts|chestnuts]] so they don't pop and [[Grill|grill]] for about 10 to 15 minutes, turning now and then. Allow to cool then peel and chop.\n===Variations===\n'''[[Port]]:''' If you don't have port to hand, use a combination of [[sherry]], [[wine]] or even a dash of [[rum]] or [[brandy]].\n\nUse a mixture of [[dried fruit]] with the [[cranberries]] - finely chopped [[apricots]] work well.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Poultry recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#stuffing #baconchestnutandcranberrystuffing #butter #bacon #port #breadcrumbs #cranberries #freeze #onion #egg #garlic </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Bacon steakburger and sausage bake with leek mash cambazola and tomatoes\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#potatoes #cheese #koshersalt #russells #oliveoil #souredcream #leeks #boiledorsimmered #blackpepper #greenvegetable #leek\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=A great meal for a winters evening, the sort of recipe you could add most things to.\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=13th February 2023\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  1 hour\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  45 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 3360\n|PortionCalories = 840\n|Image = [[Image:Bacon, steakburger and sausage bake with cambazola and leek and tomato mash recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Perfect</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.8</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">The leeks in the mash look great and taste fab!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry]] </span></span>\n}}\nA great meal for a winter's evening, the sort of recipe you could add most things to.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 2 large [[Potatoes|potatoes]], peeled and cut into quarters\n| 1 large [[Leek|leek]]\n| Good pinch of [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| Pinch of [[Kosher salt|kosher salt]]\n| 2 tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 2 [[Russell's]] steakburgers, chopped into cubes\n| 2 rashers of [[Russell's]] [[Treacly bacon|treacly bacon]], chopped into thin slices\n| [[Sausage meat]] squeezed from one [[Pork|pork]] [[Sausage|sausage]] and broken in to small pieces\n| 8 [[Cherry tomatoes|cherry tomatoes]], halved\n| 4 tablespoon [[Soured cream|soured cream]]\n| 80 g cambazloa [[Cheese|cheese]], cut into cubes\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 220\u00b0 C (425\u00b0 F - gas 7)\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Chop the [[Leeks|leeks]] into rounds and [[Fry|fry]] them until softened in [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| Meanwhile [[Boil|boil]] the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] for 15 minutes or until soft\n| [[Mash]] the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] together with the [[Soured cream|soured cream]]\n| Stir in the [[Leeks|leeks]] and season with [[Kosher salt|kosher salt]] and [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n| Spread thinly onto a backing dish and fluff with a fork\n| Distribute the [[Meat|meat]], [[Cheese|cheese]] and [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]] evenly over the [[Mashed potatoes|mashed potatoes]]\n| [[Bake]] for 35 minutes as 220\u00b0 C (425\u00b0 F - gas 7)\n| Serve immediately\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nBacon steakburger and sausage bake with cambazola and leek and tomato mash oven ready.jpg| Ready for the oven\nBacon steakburger and sausage bake with cambazola and leek and tomato mash baked.jpg| Thirty-five minutes later!\n</gallery>\n\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with a [[Green vegetable|green vegetable]]\n===Variations===\nUse any of your favourite [[Meats|meats]] for this fabulous dish!\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Beef recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Boiled title": "Baked basa fillets in a prawn and mushroom sauce",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Baked basa fillets in a prawn and mushroom sauce Italian recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#bakedbasafilletsinaprawnandmushroomsauce #mushroomsoup #prawns #sauce #butter #basafillets #basa #parsley #onion #pasta #drysherry \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Basa fillets baked in a prawn and mushroom sauce, Filetto di basa al forno con salsa di gamberetti\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1748\n|PortionCalories = 437\n|DatePublished=4th April 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Served with seasoned and lightly oiled [[courgettes]] that were then [[griddled]]\n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  50 minutes\n|PrepTime =  20 minutes\n|CookTime = 30 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Baked basa fillets in a prawn and mushroom sauce recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Brilliant Basa</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">This is a winner.  Anything in Lobster Bisque is good, especially basa.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Basa fillets]] [[Baked|baked]] in a [[Prawn|prawn]] and [[Mushroom|mushroom]] [[Sauce|sauce]], Filetto di basa al forno con salsa di gamberetti.  Using [[Mushroom soup|mushroom soup]] is a  clever [[Cheat|cheat]] that takes all of the hard work out of this recipe.\n\nThis dish will serve from 2 to 6 people using the same basic ingredients, just add more [[prawns]] and [[basa]], you'll just have more sauce if you're feeding 2 people with it.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 small [[Onion|onion]], peeled and finely chopped\n| 1 tablespoon [[Butter|butter]]\n| 225 g (8 oz) peeled cooked [[Prawns|prawns]]\n| 2 tablespoons of [[Dry sherry|dry sherry]]\n| 1 can of [[Mushroom soup|mushroom soup]]\n| 4 [[Basa fillets|basa fillets]]\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| Freshly chopped [[Parsley|parsley]] to garnish\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4), [fan [[Oven|oven]] 160\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Using a small pan or [[Wok|wok]],[[Saute|saute]] the [[Onions|onions]] in the [[Butter|butter]] over a gentle heat for 5 minutes.\n| Add the [[Sherry|sherry]] and [[Prawns|prawns]] for the last minute.\n| Mix in the [[Mushroom soup|mushroom soup]].\n| Pour a little of the [[Soup|soup]] mix into the bottom of an ovenproof dish, lay the fillets over the [[Sauce|sauce]] and cover with the remaining [[Sauce|sauce]].\n| Season and [[Bake|bake]] for 25 minutes.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[pasta]] or [[Plain boiled rice|plain boiled rice]] and garnish with [[Parsley|parsley]].\n===Variations===\nUse [[Cod|cod]], [[Basa|basa]], [[Sole|sole]] or any firm fleshed [[white fish]].\n\nI added a handful of chopped oyster mushrooms a the prawn stage to make this dish moor mushroomy!\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Italian recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Freshwater fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Sea fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Shellfish recipes]]\n[[Category:Cooking with wine]]\n[[Category:Student recipes]]\n[[Category:Cookery cheats]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#bakedbasafilletsinaprawnandmushroomsauce #mushroomsoup #prawns #sauce #butter #basafillets #basa #parsley #onion #pasta #drysherry </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Baked bean veggy-loaf",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Baked bean veggy-loaf recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#blackpepper #bakedbeanveggyloaf #freshherbs #bakedbeans #cheddarcheese #onion #bake #greaseproofpaper #egg #garlic #breadcrumbs \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A simple and easy vegetarian loaf that can be ready to eat in 45 minutes\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 784\n|PortionCalories = 196\n|DatePublished=5th May 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Baked-bean loaf, ready to bake\n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  45 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  30 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Bean-loaf-ready-to-bake.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Needs lots of cheese</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">3.4</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Find this a bit bland unless you add lots of cheese and chillies.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Baked bean veggyloaf chips and salad.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Spooned out with chips and cucumber salad]]\n\nA simple and easy [[Vegetarian|vegetarian]] loaf that can be ready to eat in 45 minutes.around 30 minutes.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 large 400g can of [[Baked beans|baked beans]]\n| 1 medium [[Onion|onion]], peeled and finely chopped\n| 1 [[Egg|egg]], beaten\n| 1 cup (50g / 2 oz) [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Mixed herbs|mixed herbs]] of chopped [[Fresh herbs|fresh herbs]] if available\n| 1 teaspoon [[Marmite]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Tomato puree|tomato puree]] or 2 tablespoons [[Tomato ketchup|tomato ketchup]]\n| 1 [[Clove|clove]] of [[Garlic, peeled and crushed|garlic, peeled and crushed]]\n| Pinch of [[Salt|salt]] and a good grind of [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4), [fan [[Oven|oven]] 160\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Mix all of the ingredients together.\n| Tip into a greased 450g (1 lb) loaf tin lined with [[Greaseproof paper|greaseproof paper]].\n| [[Bake]] for 30 minutes or firm to touch.\n| If you want to slice this, you'll need to let it cool first, or you can just spoon out the beany goodness!\n}}\n===Variations===\nUse a selection of fresh herbs.  We had run out of onions when I wanted to make this again, so I used more [[garlic]] and ''lots'' of chopped fresh [[chives]].\n\nSprinkle a handful of grated [[cheddar cheese]] and [[black pepper]] on the top, just before it goes in the oven.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Cookery cheats]]\n[[Category:Student recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#blackpepper #bakedbeanveggyloaf #freshherbs #bakedbeans #cheddarcheese #onion #bake #greaseproofpaper #egg #garlic #breadcrumbs </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Baked camembert and pepperoni squash cups\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#pepperoni #camembert #garlic #wintersquash #pillaurice #squash #camembertpepperonicups #hotcamembert #bakedsquashe #porkrecipes\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=Winter squash cups filled with garlic, camembert and pepperoni. Mini pizzas!\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=3rd October 2020\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Pizza squash cups served with [[pillau rice]]\n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  1 hour, 15 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  1 hour\n|TotalCalories = 490\n|PortionCalories = 245\n|Image = [[Image:Baked camembert and pepperoni squash cups recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Fabulous \ud83d\ude3b</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Tasty, easy; and no washing up - well not as much washing up!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry]]</span></span>\n}}\nThese [[Baked|baked]] [[Winter squash|winter squash]] cups filled with [[Garlic|garlic]] [[Camembert|camembert]] and [[Pepperoni|pepperoni]] are like little hot [[Pizzas|pizzas]]. We had them with [[Pillau rice|pillau rice]], a great match.\n\nYou could use any small [[Squash|squash]], especially butternut [[Squashes|squashes]] and if you [[Bake|bake]] them in individual dishes you can even eat them straight from the bowls.\n\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Squash_pizza_cups_baked.jpg|Baked and ready to serve\nImage:Squash_pizza_cups_ready_to_bake.jpg|Ready to bake for one hour\nImage:Winter_squash_filled_with_cheese.jpg|Press the [[garlic]] filled cheese into  the winter squash\nImage:winter_squash_lined_with_pepperoni.jpg|Line the halved [[squashes]] with [[pepperoni]] slices\nImage:Baked_camembert_garlic_filled_baked_camambert.jpg|[[Camembert]] quarters filled with [[garlic]] slices\n</gallery>\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 small [[Winter squash|winter squash]]\n| 125g of [[Camembert cheese]], ''half a box''\n| 3 [[Cloves of garlic|cloves of garlic]]\n| 30 small [[Pepperoni|pepperoni]] 'coins'\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6), [fan oven 180\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Halve the [[Winter squashes|winter squashes]] from top to bottom, not width-wise.  This way the [[Servings|servings]] are equal.\n| [[Scoop]] out the [[Seeds|seeds]] and discard.\n| Rinse the [[Squash|squash]] halves under running water and [[Dry|dry]] on a [[Paper towel|paper towel]].\n| Peel and thinly slice the [[Garlic cloves|garlic cloves]].\n| Quarter the [[Camembert|camembert]] and  push the [[Garlic|garlic]] slices into the [[Cheese|cheese]].\n| Line the 'cups' with a layer of [[Pepperoni|pepperoni]] 'coins'.\n| Press the [[Garlic|garlic]] [[Camembert|camembert]] into the 'cups'.\n| Cover with the remaining [[Pepperoni|pepperoni]].\n| Bake for one hour\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Pillau rice|pillau rice]].\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Chilli pepper recipes]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Squash recipes]]\n[[Category:Pizza recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#pepperoni #camembert #garlic #wintersquash #pillaurice #squash #bakedcamembert #recipes #bake #squashes #pizzacups</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Baked cod with a pesto and Parmesan crust",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Baked cod with a pesto and Parmesan crust recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#oliveoil #bakedcodwithapestoandparmesancrust #pesto #puylentils #grated #tomatoes #cod #breadcrumbs #sungold #garlic #breadcrumb \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Now that Atlantic cod has now been declared a sustainable species after many years of being on the 'danger' list, it's time to start cooking with it again\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1180\n|PortionCalories = 590\n|DatePublished=26th September 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  40 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  25 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Baked cod with a pesto and Parmesan crust recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Nice cheesy fish</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.7</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">A nice combination, especially with the lentils.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Baked cod with a pesto and Parmesan crust ready to bake.jpg|250px|thumb|right|Cod in a breadcrumb and pesto crust, ready to bake]]\nNow that [[Atlantic cod]] has now been declared a sustainable species after many years of being on the 'danger' list, it's time to start cooking with it again.\n\nThis recipe is a simple variation on a [[Cod with an Olive crust|very similar recipe]] using [[Tapenade|tapenade]] instead of [[pesto]].\n\nIt's a nice healthy recipe as it's baked rather than being fried. I'm serving it with [[Puy lentils|puy lentils]] in home-grown [[Leeks|leeks]] and [[Garlic|garlic]] with the last of this season's [[Sungold]] [[tomatoes]].\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 2 [[Cod|cod]] [[Steak|steak]]s of around 250g or once large 500g steak cut in two\n| 5 heaped tablespoons of [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]]\n| 5 tablespoons freshly [[Grated|grated]] [[Parmesan cheese|parmesan cheese]]\n| 80g [[Pesto|pesto]] - about 3 tablespoons\n| [[Olive oil]]\n| [[Freshly ground black pepper]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Check and remove any pin-[[bones]] from the [[Cod|cod]] fillets\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4), [fan oven 160\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Put the [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]] into a bowl and add the [[Grated|grated]] [[Parmesan]] and the [[Pesto|pesto]] together with a tablespoon of [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and a pinch of [[Black pepper|black pepper]] and mix well to combine.\n| Lightly [[Brush|brush]] or [[Spray|spray]] a [[Baking tray|baking tray]] with [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and lay the fillets on the tray skin side down.\n| Spread the top of each one fillet with the [[Breadcrumb|breadcrumb]] mixture.\n| [[Bake]] for 20 minutes and finish under the [[Grill|grill]] for a few minutes for a crispy topping watching it carefully to see it does not burn.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nI've served it with [[Puy lentils|puy lentils]] dressed with [[Leek|leek]] and [[Garlic|garlic]] [[Sauteed|sauteed]] in [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and  [[Sungold|sungold]] [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]]\n==See also==\n\n* http://www.fishonline.org/fish/cod-atlantic-cod-30\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Sea fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#oliveoil #bakedcodwithapestoandparmesancrust #pesto #puylentils #grated #tomatoes #cod #breadcrumbs #sungold #garlic #breadcrumb </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Baked cod with tomato and parmesan crust",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Baked cod with a tomato and parmesan crust recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#basa #cod #grated #bakingtray #breadcrumbs #parmesan #bakedcodwithtomatoandparmesancrust #tomatosauce #oliveoil #grill #peas \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Cod with a crunchy topping. No oil used so nice and healthy too\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1120\n|PortionCalories = 560\n|DatePublished=24th July 2017\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  40 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  25 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Baked cod with tomato and parmesan crust recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Healthy fish!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.7</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Looks like it's been deep fried(ish) but it's not - just a little olive oil.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nCod with a crunchy topping. No oil used so nice and healthy too\n\nI've actually used [[basa]] as it's half the price of cod, I prefer it to [[cod]].\n\nI already have batches of frozen [[tomato sauce for pizza]], which is what I've used in this recipe. You could use any bottled tomato sauce, it's just used as flavouring and to help the breadcrumbs stick to the fish.\n\nWe have a huge list of [[Tomato ketchup|tomato sauce recipes here]].  If none of those take your fancy, use good old Heinz tomato ketchup, it will be fine!\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 2 [[Cod|cod]] or [[basa]] fillets of around 250g or once large 500g steak cut in two\n| 5 heaped tablespoons of [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]]\n| 5 tablespoons freshly [[Grated|grated]] [[Parmesan cheese|parmesan cheese]]\n| 100g [[tomato sauce for pizza]] (or [[tomato sauce]] of your choice) - about 4 tablespoons\n| [[Olive oil to grease the [[baking tray]]]]\n| [[Freshly ground black pepper]] - no [[salt]] needed as [[Parmesan]] is already quite salty.\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Check and remove any pin-[[bones]] from the [[Cod|cod]] or [[basa]] fillets\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4), [fan oven 160\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Put the [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]] into a bowl and add the [[Grated|grated]] [[Parmesan]] and a pinch of [[Black pepper|black pepper]] and mix well to combine.\n| \n| Paint the fish fillets with a tablespoon of [[tomato sauce]] per side.\n| Arrange half of the breadcrumb mixture onto a large plate and press the fish down so the breadcrumbs stick. \n| Repeat with both fillets on both sides.\n| Lightly [[Brush|brush]] or [[Spray|spray]] a [[Baking tray|baking tray]] with [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and lay the fillets on the tray skin side down if your fillets have skin.\n| Sprinkle the remaining breadcrumbs over the top.\n| [[Bake]] for 20 minutes without turning over and finish under the [[Grill|grill]] for a few minutes if needed.\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Baked cod with tomato and parmesan crust ready to bake.jpg|Parmesan and Panko crust, ready to bake\nImage:Baked cod with tomato and parmesan preparation.jpg|My breadcrumbing station!\n</gallery>\n===Serving suggestions===\nThis went nicely with [[mashed potato]], [[peas]] and [[sweetcorn]].\n==See also==\n* http://www.fishonline.org/fish/cod-atlantic-cod-30\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Sea fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#basa #cod #grated #bakingtray #breadcrumbs #parmesan #bakedcodwithtomatoandparmesancrust #tomatosauce #oliveoil #grill #peas </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

They are usually [[baked]] together with other items such as [[kippers]], [[vegetables]], [[mushrooms]]. \n<GoogleBanner>recipe-pages</GoogleBanner>\nI don't currently have a specific recipe for baked [[eggs]] however, I though [[oven temperatures]] and times would be useful. \n\n===Oven temperatures and cooking times===\n* 177\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - Gas 4 - Moderate/Medium) :- Bake for 10 to 15 minutes in an exposed container\n* 204\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - Gas 6 - Moderately hot) :- Bake for 8 to 10 minutes in an exposed container\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Egg recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n{{RecipeSkip}}\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#bakedeggs #eggs #britishrecipes #oventemperatures #baking #eggrecipes #vegetables #baked #kippers #mushrooms #recipes </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Baked hake with crispy cashew and sweetcorn coating",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Baked hake with crispy cashew and sweetcorn coating - recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#fish #sweetcorn #bakedhakewithcrispycashewandsweetcorncoating #cashewnuts #plainflour #roasted #deepfry #masaharina #bake #eggs #chips \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=My favourite savoury nibbles are a mix of spicy cashew nuts and roasted sweet corn kernels, I used them to make a crispy coating for fish\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=20th November 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Served with fish shop chips\n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  30 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  15 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 2406\n|PortionCalories = 1203\n|Image = [[Image:Baked hake with crispy cashew and sweetcorn coating recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Not keen on hake</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">..but the coating made this rather nice.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry, aka Chef]] ([[User talk:Chef|talk]])</span></span>\n}}\nMy favourite savoury nibbles are a mix of spicy [[Cashew nuts|cashew nuts]] and [[Roasted|roasted]] [[Sweet corn|sweet corn]] kernels.  I just love the flavour the combination and the nice crunch they have - so I thought I should try and use this mixture to make a crisp coating for fresh [[Fish|fish]].  Rather than [[Deep fry|deep fry]] or even pan [[Fry|fry]] them, I thought I would [[Bake|bake]] them.\n\nThis worked really well and would be equally good on meaty steaks too.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| About half a [[Cup|cup]] of mixed [[Cashew nuts|cashew nuts]] and [[Roasted|roasted]] [[Sweet corn|sweet corn]] kernels\n| ''I used Natco Spicy cashew nuts & Natco roasted salted toasted corn - both available from Morrisons (UK)'' \n| A tablespoon of [[Masa Harina|masa harina]] to loosen the mixture when [[Grinding|grinding]] ([[Plain flour|plain flour]] would be fine)\n| 2 medium sized [[Hake|hake]] [[Fillet steaks|fillet steaks]]\n| 2 [[Eggs|eggs]], beaten\n| 3 tablespoons [[Plain flour|plain flour]] for dredging\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4), [fan oven 160\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Baked hake with crispy cashew and sweetcorn coating station.jpg|The coating station, 1 down, 1 to go\nImage:Crispy cashew and sweetcorn coating.jpg|My stash of munchies, with the amount used in the bowl\nImage:Natoco Spicy Cashew Nuts Natco Toasted Corn.jpg|Natco Roasted and salted toasted corn & Natco Spicy cashew nuts\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Add the [[Cashew nuts|cashew nuts]] and [[Sweet corn|sweet corn]] kernels to a [[Food processor|food processor]] with a metal blade\n| Grind the mixture to a coarse powder\n| You may find the mixture starts to clump together after a while - I guess this is because of the [[Oil|oil]] released from the [[Sweet corn|sweet corn]] kernels\n| If this does occur, just add a tablespoons of [[Masa Harina|masa harina]] (or [[Plain flour|plain flour]]) and blitz the mixture for a few seconds to separate the crumbs again\n| Prepare your 'coating station' by beating the [[Eggs|eggs]] and adding to a bowl\n| Pop the [[Flour|flour]] in saucer large enough to accommodate the fillets and finally the [[Ground nut|ground nut]] mixture in another saucer\n| Dredge the [[Fish|fish]] fillets in the [[Flour|flour]], [[Dip|dip]] in the beaten [[Egg|egg]] to coat and then press into the [[Nut|nut]] mixture ensuring the fish is well coated.\n| Carefully arrange the coated [[Fish|fish]] on a [[Grill tray|grill tray]] and [[Bake|bake]] for 15 minutes or until the coating turns golden\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Chips|chips]], [[Peas|peas]] and [[Garlic mayonnaise|garlic mayonnaise]].\n\nI much prefer proper [[Fish|fish]] shop [[Chips|chips]] to [[Oven|oven]] chips and don't [[Deep fry|deep fry]] at home so I've cheated by using chips bought a few hours earlier that were reheated in another [[Oven tray|oven tray]] while the fish baked.\n===Variations===\nTry this with any type of boneless [[Fish|fish]] fillet, [[Chicken|chicken]] fillets, [[Meat|meat]] steaks and even [[Burgers|burgers]].\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Sea fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#fish #sweetcorn #bakedhakewithcrispycashewandsweetcorncoating #cashewnuts #plainflour #roasted #deepfry #masaharina #bake #eggs #chips </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}
