- 1 level teaspoon [[salt]]\n| &frac14; level teaspoon [[pepper]]\n| 3-4 tablespoons stock in vegetable water\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Mix the [[mustard]] and [[vinegar]] together\n| Open the [[herrings]] out flat, cut each into three pieces and spread with the [[mustard]]\n| Arrange the tomatoes (skinned and sliced if fresh), [[herrings]] and [[onion]] in layers in an ovenproof dish\n| Sprinkle each layer with seasoning and pour over the stock\n| Bake in a very moderate oven (180\u00b0 C / 350\u00b0 F / Gas 4) for &#190; hour\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe hot\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Herring]]\n[[Category:Fish recipes|Herring]]\n[[Category:Sea fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses|Herring]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes|Herring]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#mustard #herrings #vinegar #onion #tomatoes </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Baked Leeks with Dragon Welsh Cheddar cheese sauce",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Baked Leeks with Dragon Welsh Cheddar cheese sauce recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#leeks #sauce #cheddar #bakedleekswithdragonwelshcheddarcheesesauce #baked #leek #parmaham #bread #southcaernarfoncreameries #recipesfromothersites #boiling \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=What better way to celebrate Welsh cuisine, Baked Leeks in a Dragon Welsh Cheddar cheese sauce?\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=24th September 2016\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  40 minutes\n|PrepTime =  20 minutes\n|CookTime =  20 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 2342\n|PortionCalories = 585\n|Image = [[Image:Baked Leeks with Dragon Welsh Cheddar cheese sauce recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Super leekey aroma!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Cooking this is like driving past the Nightlayer Leek Factory in Chatteris!</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nWhat better way to celebrate Welsh cuisine, [[Baked]] [[Leeks]] in a Dragon Welsh  [[Cheddar cheese]] [[Sauce|sauce]]?\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 8 medium small [[Leeks|leeks]] with most of the green parts removed\n| 8 slices of [[Parma ham]] or [[Serrano ham|serrano ham]]\n| 120g [[Dragon mature Welsh cheddar cheese]], grated\n| 300 ml cr\u00e8me fraiche\n| 1 heaped dessertspoon [[Wholegrain mustard|wholegrain mustard]]\n| Dash of [[Worcestershire sauce]]\n| [[Black pepper]] & [[Salt|salt]] to taste\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6), [fan oven 180\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Cook the [[Leeks|leeks]] in a pan of [[Boiling|boiling]] [[Salted|salted]] water for 5-6 mins until tender. Drain leeks thoroughly and allow to cool, pat dry with kitchen roll to ensure all excess liquid removed\n| Wrap a slice of [[Ham|ham]] around each [[Leek|leek]] and place seam down in a shallow [[Baking|baking]] dish\n| Place cr\u00e8me fraiche in mixing bowl and mix in Worcester [[Sauce|sauce]], [[Mustard|mustard]] and seasoning. Add 100g of [[Cheddar|cheddar]] and mix thoroughly.\n| Spoon over the [[Leeks|leeks]], sprinkle over remaining [[Cheddar|cheddar]] and [[Bake|bake]] for 20 mins until golden and bubbling.\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Dragon mature Welsh cheddar cheese.jpg|[http://www.dragonwales.co.uk/products/cheddar/mature/ Dragon mature Welsh cheddar cheese]\nImage:Dragon reduced fat mature Welsh cheddar cheese.jpg|[http://www.dragonwales.co.uk/products/cheddar/mature-reduced-fat/ Dragon reduced fat mature Welsh cheddar cheese]\n</gallery>\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe immediately with plenty of crusty [[Bread|bread]] to soak up [[Sauce|sauce]] and a crisp [[Green salad|green salad]]\n===Variations===\nFor a lower fat alternative, use [[Dragon reduced fat mature Welsh cheddar cheese]]\n{{Template:Dragon cheese attribution}}\n==See also==\n* [[South Caernarfon Creameries]]\n* [[Dragon mature Welsh cheddar cheese]]\n* [[Dragon reduced fat mature Welsh cheddar cheese]]\n\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Dragon cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#leeks #sauce #cheddar #bakedleekswithdragonwelshcheddarcheesesauce #baked #leek #parmaham #bread #southcaernarfoncreameries #recipesfromothersites #boiling </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Baked potatoes",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Baked potatoes, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#bakedpotatoes #butter #oliveoil #potatoes #chives #cream #miseenplace #papertowel #meattenderiser #potato \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Follow the strange method below and I will guarantee perfect jacket potatoes, every time. Crunchy, crisp skins with perfectly cooked centres\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 270\n|PortionCalories = 270\n|DatePublished=31st May 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = A really crispy baked potato<br />see how thick the skin is.\n|Servings = 1\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime = 4 hours 30 minutes\n|PrepTime = 3 hours\n|CookTime = 1 hour 30 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Jacket potato crisp skins.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Crisy, crispy skins</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">A lot of work for a jacket spud but totally worth it.  It's the only way to bake a spud.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nFollow the strange method below and I will guarantee perfect jacket potatoes, every time. Crunchy, crisp skins with perfectly cooked centres.\n* Use the right potatoes - see list at the bottom of the page\n* Prick them all over with a fork\n* Salt them for 2 hours or more\n* Wipe off any excess salt.\n* Pat them dry on a [[paper towel]].\n* Bake for 1 to 1.5 hours\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 4 large [[potatoes]], 275-350 g (10-12 oz ) each (see list of suitable varieties below)\n| 4 tablespoons [[Olive oil]]\n| 4 teaspoons [[Butter]]\n| Sea [[salt]]\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat the oven to 220\u00b0 C (425\u00b0 F) (Gas 7) \n\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:ITenderizer 56. Professional grade 56 blade meat tenderiser Tool.jpg|A [[meat tenderiser]] is the modern way to make all of the holes. Much more efficient than two forks!\nImage:Skins dehydrated after 3 hours.jpg|After 3 to 4 hours, all of the salt is quickly rinsed off with cold water. Now the skins are slightly dehydrated - note the water drained from them during this time\nImage:Coated with salt after first rubbing with a little olive oil.jpg|Coated with salt after first rubbing with a little olive oil\nImage:Stabbing the baked potatoes with two forks.jpg|Stabbing the baked potatoes with two forks\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Wash and thoroughly dry the potatoes\n| Prick all over with a fork so there are holes everywhere, this makes it easy for the water to drain and the skin to become crunchy.\n| Rub with a little [[olive oil]] and lots of sea [[salt]] to draw out the water and leave for 2 hours or more.\n| Preheat the [[oven]] to 220\u00b0 C  (425\u00b0 F) (Gas 7)\n| Rinse off most of the excess sea salt and pat dry before cooking.  It's job of drawing out moisture from the skin has been done.\n| Place on a rack in the centre of the oven until the skins are crisp (1 to 1.5 hours)\n| Make a cross in the top of the [[potato]], wrap with a cloth and squash it to break up the flesh inside\n}}\n===Servings===\n275-350 g (10-12 oz ) [[potatoes]] per person\n===Serving suggestions===\n\nServe immediately with sea [[salt]] and a knob of [[butter]]\n===Variations===\n\nServe with sour [[cream]] and chopped [[chives]]\n==The best potato varieties for baking are:==\n* Cara\n* [[Media:Estima potatoes.jpg|Estima]]\n* [[Media:Forty Fold potatoes.jpg|Forty Fold]]\n* [[Media:King Edward potatoes.jpg|King Edwards]]\n* [[Media:Marfona potatoes.jpg|Marfona]]\n* Maris Piper\n* Mozart\n* [[Media:Vivaldi.jpg|Vivaldi]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n[[Category:Student recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#bakedpotatoes #butter #oliveoil #potatoes #chives #cream #miseenplace #papertowel #meattenderiser #potato </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Baked ribbon pasta with stilton, mushrooms, mozzarella and walnuts",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Baked ribbon pasta with stilton, mushrooms, mozzarella and walnuts\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#pasta #mushrooms #butter #egg #walnut #parsley #sauce #mozzarella #bake #doublecream #stilton\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=A lovely stilton cheesy pasta dish with mushrooms, baked with melted mozzarella. A rather rich dish, but its nice to spoil yourself now and then.\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=20th November 2021\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  40 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime =  30 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 1420\n|PortionCalories = 710 \n|Image = [[Image:Baked ribbon pasta with stilton, mushrooms and mozzarella cheeses recipe served.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">An October treat!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Perfect for the local walnuts that are everywhere at the moment</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Chef]] </span></span>\n}}\nA lovely [[Stilton|stilton]] cheesy [[Pasta|pasta]] dish with [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]], [[Baked|baked]] with melted [[Mozzarella|mozzarella]].  A rather rich dish, but it's nice to spoil yourself now and then.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 225 g fresh [[Egg|egg]] ribbon [[Pasta|pasta]]\n| [[Freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 1 teaspoon of [[Taste Sensation fajita seasoning]]\n| 18 g [[Butter|butter]]\n| 1 teaspoon of [[olive oil]]\n| 3 [[Garlic cloves|garlic cloves]]. peeled and crushed\n| 225 g sliced [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]]\n| 50 g [[Stilton cheese|stilton cheese]]\n| 60 ml [[Double Cream|double cream]]\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] \n| 1 fresh [[Egg|egg]], lightly beaten\n| 125 g ball of [[Mozzarella cheese|mozzarella cheese]]\n| 4 [[Walnut|walnut]] kernels, broken into small pieces\n| Freshly chopped [[Parsley|parsley]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 180\u00b0 C\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Cook the the ribbon [[Pasta|pasta]] for about 4 minutes in lightly [[Salted|salted]] [[Boiling|boiling]] water until [[Al-dente|al-dente]]\n| While that's cooking melt the [[Butter|butter]] together with a teaspoon of [[olive oil]], the [[Black pepper|black pepper]], [[Taste Sensation fajita seasoning]] and [[Saute|saute]] the [[Garlic|garlic]] and [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]] for a few minutes until soft over a gentle heat so as not to burn the garlic\n| [[Crumble]] the [[Stilton|stilton]] over the [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]] and mix well\n| Add the [[Double Cream|double cream]] while stirring  and season to taste\n| Drain the [[Pasta|pasta]], reserving a the water if needed to thin the [[Sauce|sauce]].  See Chef's notes.\n| Mix the [[Pasta|pasta]] into the [[Mushroom|mushroom]] [[Sauce|sauce]] and stir in the beaten [[Egg|egg]]\n| Pour the mixture into a [[Butter|buttered]] ovenproof dish, top with the torn [[Mozzarella|mozzarella]] and cover with [[Tin foil|tin foil]] and [[Bake|bake]] for 15 minutes at 180\u00b0\n| Remove the [[Foil|foil]] and [[Bake|bake]] uncovered for a further 10 minutes until [[Browned|browned]]\n| Garnish with chopped [[Parsley|parsley]] and [[Walnut|walnut]] pieces\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Baked ribbon pasta with stilton, mushrooms and mozzarella cheeses baked.jpg|Baked, but a little dry\nImage:Baked ribbon pasta with stilton, mushrooms and mozzarella cheeses added.jpg|Mozzarella cheese topping added\nImage:Baked ribbon pasta with stilton, mushrooms and mozzarella cheeses ready to bake.jpg|Really should have used a smaller, deeper oven dish\nImage:Baked ribbon pasta with stilton, mushrooms pasta added.jpg|Creamy pasta and mushrooms\nImage:Baked ribbon pasta with stilton, mushrooms frying.jpg|Frying off the garlic and mushrooms\nImage:Baked ribbon pasta with stilton, mushrooms and mozzarella cheeses recipe ingredients.jpg|The ingredients for this lovely vegetarian dish\n</gallery>\n\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with a [[Green vegetable|green vegetable]]\n\n===Chef's notes===\nAfter making this, next time I would add a lot more of the pasta cooking liquid, probably 3 large serving spoon's worth.  After baking, even when covered with tin foil, it was quite dry.  I would also bake it in a smaller, deeper dish, so moisture is retained.  Very nice meal anyway and we will definitely be having this again.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Italian recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Egg recipes]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Pasta recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n[[Category:Taste Sensation recipes]]\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#pasta #mushrooms #butter #egg #walnut #parsley #sauce #mozzarella #bake #doublecream #stilton</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Baked squash filled with melted Camembert cheese",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Baked squash filled with melted Camembert cheese recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#cheese #squash #bakedsquashfilledwithmeltedcamembertcheese #bake #tacoshells #camembert #garlic #clovesofgarlic #tomatoes #baked #sherry \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=We just love Camembert baked in the oven, dipping veggies or crisps into the melted cheese - mmm!\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1443\n|PortionCalories = 721\n|DatePublished=1st November 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = My photography does not show how damned good this was!\n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  1 hour\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  45 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Baked squash filled with melted camembert cheese recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Phwoarr!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">The very idea!  Fabulous, though probably not very healthy if you took this regularly.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nWe just love [[Camembert]] [[Baked|baked]] in the [[Oven|oven]], dipping veggies or crisps into the melted [[Cheese|cheese]] - mmm!\n\nThis time I thought I would [[Bake|bake]] the [[Camembert]] inside the [[Squash|squash]], with plenty of [[Garlic|garlic]], obviously!\n\nI would normally suggest plain [[Tortilla chips|tortilla chips]] (''crisps'') to [[Dip|dip]] in the [[Cheese|cheese]], but every make I've tried recently is either ridiculously over-flavoured or just plain salty.  [[Taco shells]] have the same ingredients, but thankfully no added slat or flavours (yet!)\n\nI've pre-cooked the [[Squash|squash]] first as some [[Squashes|squashes]] take longer than others to soften and the dish would be pointless in a [[Rock|rock]] hard squash, over cooked squashes however, are fine.\n\nPre cooking the [[Squash|squash]] allows you to blot up any liquid released during cooking before you add the [[Cheese|cheese]].\n\nIf you know how long your [[Squash|squash]] will take to soften then you could [[Bake|bake]] it with the [[Cheese|cheese]] from the start.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 small [[Squash|squash]] ([[Butternut squash|butternut squash]] would be fine)\n| [[Garlic]] to taste, peelded and crushed or very thinly sliced - I used 3 [[Cloves|cloves]] to cook the [[Squash|squash]] and 3 to fill the [[Cheese|cheese]].\n| 2 teaspoons of [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| [[Salt]] & [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 1 whole [[Camembert cheese]] (I used a third of the wheel per person)\n| 2 tablespoons of [[shaved D\u017eiugas cheese]] (or [[Parmesan]])\n| 30ml of [[Sherry|sherry]]\n}}\n==== to serve====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 6 [[Taco shells]]\n| A few [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4), [fan oven 160\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Baked squash filled with melted camembert cheese cheese loaded.jpg|The cheese loaded, ready for the last 15 minutes\nImage:Baked squash filled with melted camembert cheese part-baked squash.jpg|The squash, partially baked\nImage:Baked squash filled with melted camembert cheese ingredients.jpg|The basic ingredients\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Halve the [[Squash|squash]] top to tail (through the stem), [[Scoop|scoop]] out the [[Seeds|seeds]] and discard.\n| Crush a few [[Cloves of garlic|cloves of garlic]] with a pinch of [[Salt|salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]], mix with a few teaspoons of [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and rub around the inside of the [[Squash|squash]].\n| [[Bake]] on an [[Oven tray|oven tray]] for 20 to 30 minutes or until it starts to soften.\n| Remove from the [[Oven|oven]] and use a [[Kitchen towel|kitchen towel]] to swab any excess liquid that may have formed during the cooking. \n| Cut the [[Camembert]] into thirds, and save the last third for another time. Crush another few [[Cloves of garlic|cloves of garlic]] and make a few random openings in the [[Cheese|cheese]] and  push the [[Crushed garlic|crushed garlic]] into the gaps.\n| Push the cheese into the squash, skin-side down.\n| Sprinkle with [[shavings of D\u017eiugas cheese]].\n| Pour a teaspoon of [[Sherry|sherry]] over each [[Cheese|cheese]] and [[Bake|bake]] for a further 15 minutes\n| If serving with [[Baked|baked]] [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]], drizzle each halve with [[Dark soy sauce|dark soy sauce]] and pop them into the [[Oven|oven]] with the [[Cheese|cheese]].\n| [[Microwave]] the [[Taco shells|taco shells]] for a few minutes to warm.\n| Serve!\n}}\n==See also==\n* [[Cheese fondue]] recipes\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:French recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Squash recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:D\u017eiugas cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#cheese #squash #bakedsquashfilledwithmeltedcamembertcheese #bake #tacoshells #camembert #garlic #clovesofgarlic #tomatoes #baked #sherry </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Balsamic vinegar gravy",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Balsamic vinegar gravy, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#balsamicvinegargravy #balsamicvinegar #vegetables #roast #boiling #roastingtray #gravybrowning #deglaze #sieve #garlic #bubble \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This recipe will work without a caramelised roasting tray, but it won't be as rich or as tasty. However, it does not have to be a meat roast\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 28\n|PortionCalories = 28\n|DatePublished=28th October 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Roast vegetables\n |Servings = Serves 4 - Makes 284 ml (1/2 pint) of [[Gravy|gravy]]\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 10 minutes\n |PrepTime = 5 minutes\n |CookTime = 5 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Roasted vegetables.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Glorious!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.8</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">A lot of work to make gravy but the effort is rewarded by the great taste.  A little goes a long way!</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis recipe will work without a caramelised [[roasting tray]], but it won't be as rich or as tasty.  However, it does not have to be a [[Meat|meat]] roast.  [[Roast]] vegetables work just as well.  The [[Vegetables|vegetables]] shown were [[Roasted|roasted]] with lots of [[Garlic|garlic]] and [[Cumin seeds|cumin seeds]] so the resulting gravy had a delicious and unique flavour.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| A [[baking tray]] with remnants of a [[Roast|roast]] \n| A piece of meat or a range of vegetables\n| A good glug of [[Balsamic vinegar|balsamic vinegar]] (about 6 tablespoons)\n| 1 tablespoon (or to taste) of good vegetable stock powder, such as [[Marigold Swiss bouillon powder]]\n| 284 ml [[Boiling|boiling]] water\n| 1 teaspoon [[gravy browning]] (optional)\n}}\n\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Add the [[Bouillon|bouillon]] powder or cube and the [[gravy browning]] to the [[Boiling|boiling]] water and mix well\n| Remove the [[Vegetables|vegetables]] (or [[Meat|meat]]) from the [[roasting tray]]\n| Place on the hob and turn to high\n| Splash a good glug of [[Balsamic vinegar|balsamic vinegar]] onto the tray and with a flat spatula, [[Deglaze|deglaze]] the tray, scraping all of the caramelised goodness from the base\n| Allow to [[Bubble|bubble]] away for 30 seconds\n| Pour in the [[Stock|stock]] mixture, stir well and heat until it thickens a little\n| Strain through a [[Sieve|sieve]] and serve immediately\n}}\n==See also==\n* Many other [[gravy recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Dips and sauces]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#balsamicvinegargravy #balsamicvinegar #vegetables #roast #boiling #roastingtray #gravybrowning #deglaze #sieve #garlic #bubble </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Balsamic vinegar salad dressing",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Balsamic vinegar salad dressing an Italian recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#balsamicvinegarsaladdressing #saladdressing #balsamicvinegar #muscovadosugar #sauce #boiledorsimmered #bubble #newpotatoes #images #salad \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=The origin of this salad dressing is from a meat recipe: Fillet steak salad with watercress, however, vegetarians\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 48\n|PortionCalories = 24\n|DatePublished=4th April 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Belazu Balsamic vinegar\n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  20 minutes\n|PrepTime =  3 minutes\n|CookTime =  17 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Belazu Balsamic vinegar.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Nice dressing</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Balsamic vinegar makes a great salad dressing but it doesn't have to be Belazu; title": "Bangers and mash pie (cheat)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Bangers and mash pie (cheat) a British recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#potatoes #sausages #gravy #butter #bake #boiling #diced #mash #springonions #pickle #branstonpickle \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A really simple meal that you can put together in no time - if you're lucky you'll probably already have the ingredients\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2319\n|PortionCalories = 579\n|DatePublished=22nd January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 50 minutes\n |PrepTime = 10 minutes\n |CookTime = 40 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Bangers and mash pie (cheat) recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Neat idea with the pickle</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Makes the ordinary, extraordinary</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nA really simple meal that you can put together in no time - if you're lucky you'll probably already have the ingredients.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 454g pack of thick [[Pork sausages|pork sausages]]\n| 850 g [[Potatoes|potatoes]], peeled and [[Diced|diced]]\n| 2 tablespoons [[Gravy|gravy]] granules\n| 3 tablespoons [[Branston pickle]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Butter|butter]]\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4)\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| [[Boil]] the diced [[Potatoes|potatoes]] for 15 minutes and drain well.\n| [[Grill]] the [[Sausages|sausages]] until [[Browned|browned]] all over, about 15 to 20 minutes minutes - cut each [[Sausage|sausage]] into 3 pieces.\n| Mix the 2 tablespoons of [[Gravy|gravy]] granules with 400 ml of [[Boiling|boiling]] water and mix well. Stir in the [[Pickle|pickle]].\n| Add the [[Sausages|sausages]] and [[Gravy|gravy]] to an oven proof dish.\n| [[Mash]] the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] with 1 tablespoon of [[Butter|butter]], season well and fork over the [[Sausages|sausages]].\n| [[Bake]] for 25 minutes then serve.\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Bangers and mash pie (cheat) ready to bake.jpg|Ready to bake\nImage:Bangers and mash pie (cheat) ready for the topping.jpg|ready for the topping\n</gallery>\n===Chef's notes===\nI can't resist meddling with a recipe, this is no exception.  As I had a few spare [[spring onions]] in the fridge, I chopped them up and added them to the mash and the gravy.  I also added a little [[squash mash]] to the mash and also sprinkled a little grated cheese over the top.  For 2 greedy people, I made half of the mash quantity but kept the other ingredients the same. \nA very nice recipe!\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Cookery cheats]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n[[Category:Student recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Grilled, griddled or barbecued]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#potatoes #sausages #gravy #butter #bake #boiling #diced #mash #springonions #pickle #branstonpickle </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Bangers and mustard mash Gluten Free recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#butter #potatoes #wholegrainmustard #sausages #mashing #spinach #bangersandmustardmashgf #salted #glutenfree #saucepan #boil \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Bangers and mash with a mustardy twist. This gluten free recipe comes to Cookipedia, courtesy of Debbie&andrews sausages\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2078\n|PortionCalories = 346\n|DatePublished=25th October 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 6\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  30 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime =  20 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Bangers and mustard mash GF recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Mustard Mash!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Wow, fabulous. Thanks Ken and Sue for re-inventing this for us!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Perfect-pork.png|300px|thumb|right|[[Debbie and Andrew's Perfect Pork sausages]]]]\n[[Bangers and mash]] with a mustardy twist.  This [[Gluten free|gluten free]] recipe comes to [[Cookipedia]], courtesy of [[Debbie&andrew's sausages|debbie&andrew's sausages]].  It's really tasty, dead simple and can be made in half an hour.  You can buy these [[Sausages|sausages]] from most good supermarkets.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 8 [[Potatoes|potatoes]], peeled and quartered\n| 2 packs [[Debbie and Andrew's Perfect Pork sausages]]\n| 1 tablespoon of [[Butter|butter]]\n| 5 ml [[Milk|milk]]\n| 1 tablespoon of [[Wholegrain mustard|wholegrain mustard]] - or to taste\n| [[Salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Place the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] in a [[Saucepan|saucepan]] of cold [[Salted|salted]] water and bring to the [[Boil|boil]].\n| Cook for 20 minutes until tender.\n| Meanwhile, in a large [[Frying pan|frying pan]] over a medium heat, cook the [[Sausages|sausages]] for 20 minutes or so until thoroughly cooked through and evenly [[Browned|browned]].\n| Remove from the pan and keep warm.\n| Drain the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] and [[Mash|mash]] with the [[Butter|butter]] and the [[Milk|milk]].\n| Continue [[Mashing|mashing]], or beat with an [[Electric mixer|electric mixer]], until smooth.\n| Stir in the [[Wholegrain mustard|wholegrain mustard]] then season with [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]].\n| Taste and add more [[Butter|butter]] or more [[Mustard|mustard]] to your liking.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe immediately with buttered [[Greens|greens]] or [[Spinach|spinach]].\n===See also===\n* [https://www.google.com/search?q=gluten+free+mustard&oq=gluten+free+mustard&aqs=chrome..69i57.6446j0j4&sourceid=chrome&es_sm=91&ie=UTF-8 Google search Gluten free mustard]\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Gluten free recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Debbie&andrew's sausage recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n{{Template:DebbieAndAndrew attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#butter #potatoes #wholegrainmustard #sausages #mashing #spinach #bangersandmustardmashgf #salted #glutenfree #saucepan #boil </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Barbecued pork chops with fresh herbs",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",

                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Barbecued pork chops with frash herbs\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#barbecue #russells #porksteaks #sageleaves #porkchops #butchers #tastesensation #marinade #grillpan #crackling #britishrecipes\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=Another aide-memoir now weve made such a suiccess of barbecuing these lovely big Pork pork chops from Russells butchers of Upwell. We sue the instant..\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n\n{{Template:PageAwaitingImage}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=20th June 2023\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime = 1 day, 1 hour, 20 minutes\n|PrepTime = 1 day\n|CookTime =  1 hour, 20 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 1870\n|PortionCalories = 930\n|Image = [[Image:Barbecued pork chops64.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Mmmm; nice...</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">\u2026extremely nice, and so easy!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry]] </span></span>\n}}\nAnother aide-memoir now we've made such a success of [[Barbecuing|barbecuing]] these lovely big [[Pork chops|pork chops]] from [[Russell's]] [[Butchers|butchers]] of Upwell.\n\nWe use the instant-light bags of charcoal and find them perfect. They are a little more expensive than pure charcoal but so much less hassle.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| Two large [[Pork chops|pork chops]] (steaks) from [[Russell's]] [[Butchers|butchers]] of Upwell (if you are lucky enough to live nearby!)\n| 1 can of Fanta\n| 2 tablespoon [[Taste Sensation]] [[Taste Sensation fajita seasoning]]\n| 1 large [[Onion|onion]]\n| A huge handful of [[Fennel leaves|fennel leaves]]\n| A huge sprig of [[Sage leaves|sage leaves]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Rub the [[Pork steaks|pork steaks]] with the [[Fajita seasoning|fajita seasoning]]\n* Place in a Large [[Lock and Lock box|lock and lock box]] and pour the tin of Fanta over the [[Meat|meat]]\n* Leave to [[Marinade|marinade]] for 24 hours, turning now and then if you get the chance\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Light all four corners of the instant light [[Barbecue|barbecue]] coals\n| Leave for 25 minutes or until the flames die down and the coals turn white\n| Raise a [[Grill|grill]] on tin cans or containers so the heat is not so intense\n| Chop the [[Onions|onions]] into rings and place on the [[Le Creuset]] [[Grill pan|grill pan]]\n| Lay the [[Fennel|fennel]] and [[Sage leaves|sage leaves]] to make a bed for the chops\n| Drain the chops and place on the [[Herbs|herbs]] so the rind hangs over the edge of the pan (if you like your [[Crackling|crackling]] &#128578;)\n| [[Barbecue]] for about an hour and a half turning now and then\n| BE CAREFULL - If you've not raised the [[Grill tray|grill tray]] as I did, you WILL burn the chops!!\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Barbecued pork chops61.jpg|Pork steaks laid on the herbs and raised up higher than normal so they do now burn or overcook\nImage:Barbecued pork chops59.jpg|A thick bed of herbs over the top on a large chopped onion, on a Le Creuset grill pan\nImage:Barbecued pork chops58.jpg|Coals white hot and ready with my raised grill\nImage:Pork Shoulder on a BBQ40.jpg|Light all four corners of the instant heat barbecue coals and leave for 25 minutes\n</gallery>\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with a [[Potato salad|potato salad]] and a [[Green salad|green salad]] with [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]]\n===Chef's notes===\nThis was just about the most perfect way to [[Barbecue|barbecue]] [[Pork steaks|pork steaks]]!\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Chilli pepper recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Barbecue recipes]]\n[[Category:Cookery cheats]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n[[Category:Grilled, griddled or barbecued]]\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#barbecue #russells #porksteaks #sageleaves #porkchops #butchers #tastesensation #marinade #grillpan #crackling #britishrecipes</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

chicken]]) but for less than \u00a34.50 Aldi do a prepared spatchcock chicken [[Garlic|garlic]] and [[Herbs|herbs]] or sweet [[Chili|chili]]]\n\nI made a holder for the [[Chicken|chicken]] from two [[Oven|oven]] trays held together with garden wire.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| One [[Spatchcock|spatchcock]] [[Chicken|chicken]]\n| 3 slices of fatty [[bacon]]\n| One bag of easy-light [[Barbecue|barbecue]] coals\n| Optional [[Habanero]] [[Chilli sauce|chilli sauce]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Place the [[Chicken|chicken]] between two [[Grill|grill]] trays and tie together with garden wire\n| This makes repeat turning of the [[Chicken|chicken]] very easy\n| Light the [[Barbecue|barbecue]] coals and wait until they are white-hot\n| Press the [[Foil|foil]] tray so it's only an inch high\n| Lay the fatty bacon strips on the flesh side of the bird to prevent burning\n| Place the tray on the coals and the [[Chicken|chicken]] on the tray - this stops the [[Fat|fat]] burning and holds the chicken away from the direct heat\n| [[Barbecue]] for 1 hour or until perfectly cooked\n| You can check the temperature of the breast [[Meat|meat]] with a [[Thermometer|thermometer]] to see if it's properly cooked [73\u00b0 165\u00b0F]\n| [[Rest for]] 10 minutes, then serve\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Aldi Ashfields ready minutes\n</gallery>\n===Chef's notes===\nOne bag of [[Big K Easy Light Barbecue Coals]] was enough for this recipe\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British title": "Barbecue flatbread",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Barbecue flatbread - a pitta for the bbq recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#dough #oliveoil #sausages #barbecueflatbread #yeast #pittabread #flatbreads #punch #baking #bread #brush \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A pitta bread style flatbread that can be cooked on a barbecue - perfect for sausages\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1274\n|PortionCalories = 320\n|DatePublished=22nd October 2015\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 6\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  1 hour, 25 minutes\n|PrepTime =  1 hour, 10 minutes\n|CookTime =  15 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Barbecue flatbread recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Or just use a pitta</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">2</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Though this recipe would be fine if you had gluten issues, I suppose.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nSometimes it's the details that count and a simple idea can make a fantastic [[BBQ]]! Andy Bates turns baker, whipping up this surprisingly easy no-fuss [[Flatbread|flatbread]] ([[pitta bread]]). Your guests will love the way it pops on the BBQ, and that you went the extra mile to make homemade simple and fresh [[Bread|bread]] for their [[Sausages|sausages]]!\n\nThis recipe is reproduced courtesy of [[Debbie&andrew's sausages|debbie&andrew's sausages]]\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 500g [[Strong white flour|strong white flour]] or Udi's [[Gluten free|gluten free]] [[All purpose flour|all purpose flour]] Mix \n| 10g [[Salt|salt]]\n| 25g [[Caster Sugar|caster sugar]]\n| 10g instant [[Yeast|yeast]]\n| 20ml [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 360ml tepid water\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Mix together the [[Flour|flour]], [[Salt|salt]], [[Sugar|sugar]] and [[Yeast|yeast]]. Add the [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and 270ml of the water. Mix the ingredients together. Gradually add the remaining water until all the flour has come away from the sides of the bowl and you have a soft [[Dough|dough]].\n| Place the [[Dough|dough]] on the worktop and [[Knead|knead]] for 5-10 minutes. The dough will be wet in the beginning but will form a smooth dough once kneaded. Place in an oiled bowl, cover and leave to double in size.\n| Remove the [[Cling Film|cling film]] and [[Punch|punch]] back the [[Dough|dough]] (feels good!). On a floured surface, tear off a piece of dough roughly the size of a golfball and roll into a circle about 5-10mm thick.\n| Just before [[Baking|baking]], [[Brush|brush]] the surface of the [[Breads|breads]] with [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and place on the [[Barbecue|barbecue]] for 3-4 minutes on each side. Nice, simple and fresh [[Flatbreads|flatbreads]], perfect with your favourite [[Sausages|sausages]].\n}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Lebanese recipes]]\n[[Category:North African recipes]]\n[[Category:Tunisian recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Gluten free recipes]]\n[[Category:Barbecue recipes]]\n[[Category:Debbie&andrew's sausage recipes]]\n[[Category:Grilled, griddled or barbecued]]\n{{Template:DebbieAndAndrew attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#dough #oliveoil #sausages #barbecueflatbread #yeast #pittabread #flatbreads #punch #baking #bread #brush </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Basic loaf - tang zhong method",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Basic loaf - tang zhong method a British recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#tangzhong #bake #knead #flour #prove #basicloaftangzhongmethod #dough #sparklingmineralwater #frenchbread #bread #thermomix \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This is a recipe for a basic white loaf using the tang zhong method\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1353\n|PortionCalories = 135\n|DatePublished=16th April 2013\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Servings: 10 - makes 1 large loaf\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  55 minutes + cooling and resting time\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  40 minutes + cooling and resting time\n|Image = [[Image:Basic loaf tang zhong method recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"><span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Best with Shipton Mill flour</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I had the best results with Shipton Mill flour when I tried this.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}}\n[[Image:The crumb2.jpg|thumb|300px|right|The crumb]]\nThis is a recipe for a [[Basic white loaf|basic white loaf]] using the [[Tang zhong|tangzhong]] method.  If you are making in a [[Bread machine|bread machine]], just use the [[French bread]] setting or the longest setting your machine has.\n\n{{RecipeIngredientsTM\n\n}}\n'''For the [[Tang zhong|tang zhong]]'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 30g [[Strong white bread flour|strong white bread flour]]\n| 150g [[Sparkling mineral water|sparkling mineral water]]\n}}\n'''For the [[Dough|dough]]'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 7g fast action [[Dried yeast|dried yeast]]\n| 480g [[Strong white bread flour|strong white bread flour]] (I used [[Shipton Mill]] Canadian [[Flour|flour]])\n| 200g water\n| 1 quantity [[Tang zhong|tang zhong]] as above (make up to 170g with water if it has evaporated too much)\n| 1\u00bc teaspoons [[Salt|salt]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Make the [[Tang zhong|tang zhong]] by mixing together the [[Flour|flour]] and water to make a smooth paste. Heat in a saucepan until it reaches exactly 65\u00b0C (149\u00b0F), and remove from the [[Hob|hob]], cover and leave to cool until it is down to room temperature.\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Mix and [[Knead|knead]] the ingredients according to your usual method.\n| Shape into a ball and leave in an oiled bowl, covered, until doubled in size (you can leave in the [[Fridge|fridge]] overnight if you wish, but bring up to room temperature before proceeding to the next stage).\n| Gently deflate the [[Dough|dough]] and repeat the previous step.\n| Deflate once more and shape as desired or place in a [[Banneton|banneton]] or loaf tin.\n| Cover and leave to [[Prove|prove]] until almost doubled.\n| Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6), [fan [[Oven|oven]] 180\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour].\n| [[Bake]] for 40 minutes adding a tray of [[Boiling|boiling]] water to the bottom of the [[Oven|oven]] to create [[Steam|steam]].\n| If [[Baking|baking]] in a tin, remove the [[Bread|bread]] after 30 minutes and [[Bake|bake]] on a shallow tray, upside down for 10 minutes.\n| Remove from the [[Oven|oven]] and allow to cool on a wire rack before slicing.\n}}\n===Recipe source===\n\n* Idea taken from various recipes by '''[http://lacocinadeloselfos.blogspot.co.uk La Cocina de los Elfos]'''\n===Chef's notes===\nIf mixing in a [[Thermomix]], mix ingredients '''30 seconds / Speed 4''', then '''2 minutes 30 seconds / [[Knead]]'''.  [[Prove]], shape and [[Bake|bake]] as above.\n\nUse menu 21 ''French dough'' (3 hours 35 minutes) on [[Panasonic SD-ZB2502 automatic breadmaker]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Oriental cuisine]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Breadmaker recipes]]\n[[Category:Thermomix recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#tangzhong #bake #knead #flour #prove #basicloaftangzhongmethod #dough #sparklingmineralwater #frenchbread #bread #thermomix </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Basic macaroni cheese",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Basic macaroni cheese a cheese recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#basicmacaronicheese #macaroni #pasta #grated #butter #cheddar #cheese #sauce #parmesancheese #salted #ovengrill \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=We have some more elaborate macaroni cheese recipes here. This is a simple version of Mac and cheese\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2879\n|PortionCalories = 719\n|DatePublished=20th December 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 30 minutes\n |PrepTime = 5 minutes\n |CookTime = 25 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Basic macaroni cheese recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n}}\n\nWe have some more elaborate [[Macaroni cheese|macaroni cheese recipes here]].  This is a simple version of Mac and cheese.  You could make it even simpler by omitting the [[parmesan cheese]] without spoiling the overall effect.\n \nOf course you can substitute your favourite [[Cheese|cheese]] in place of the [[Cheddar|cheddar]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 250g (9oz) [[Macaroni|macaroni]] [[Pasta|pasta]]\n| 40g (1&frac12; oz) [[Butter|butter]]\n| 40g (1&frac12; oz) [[Plain flour|plain flour]]\n| 600ml (1pint) [[Milk|milk]]\n| 250g (9oz) [[Grated|grated]] [[Cheddar cheese|cheddar cheese]]\n| 50g (2oz) freshly [[Grated|grated]] [[Parmesan cheese|parmesan cheese]]\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the [[Oven grill|oven grill]].\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Cook the [[Macaroni|macaroni]] in a large saucepan of lightly-[[Salted|salted]] [[Boiling|boiling]] water for 8 to 10 minutes or until [[al-dente]].\n| Drain well and set aside.\n| Melt the [[Butter|butter]] over a gentle heat in another [[Sauce|sauce]]pan that will be large enough to hold the [[Pasta|pasta]] and the sauce together.\n| Add the [[Flour|flour]] and mix well with a wooden spoon.\n| Cook this [[Roux|roux]] for a minute.\n| Little by little, whisk in the [[Milk|milk]]. \n| Cook for 10 minutes until thick and smooth.\n| Stir in most of the [[Cheddar|cheddar]], leaving a little to sprinkle on the top.\n| Gently cook for a further 5 minutes.\n| Mix the [[Macaroni|macaroni]] into the [[Sauce|sauce]] and mix well.\n| Pour the [[Macaroni cheese|macaroni cheese]] into an [[Oven|oven]]-proof dish, sprinkle with the remaining [[Cheese|cheese]] and [[Bake|bake]] under the hot [[Grill|grill]] until the cheese is melted, browned and bubbling.\n| Serve immediately.\n}}\n==See also==\n* [[Macaroni cheese|Other macaroni cheese recipes]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">A good starting point</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.7</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I like to use this as a starting point.  Try adding  chopped gammon and chillies, for instance.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n\n\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Macaroni cheese]]\n[[Category:British recipes|Macaroni cheese]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes|Macaroni cheese]]\n[[Category:Main courses|Macaroni cheese]]\n[[Category:Pasta recipes|Macaroni cheese]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes|Macaroni cheese]]\n[[Category:Student recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]][[Category:Grilled, griddled or barbecued]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#basicmacaronicheese #macaroni #pasta #grated #butter #cheddar #cheese #sauce #parmesancheese #salted #ovengrill </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Basic macaroni cheese (alt)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Basic macaroni cheese (alt) a cheese recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#macaroni #grated #pasta #cheese #parmesancheese #roux #butter #cheesesauce #cheddar #boiling #salted \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This Mac and cheese recipe is a variation on the Basic macaroni cheese recipe as suggested by Alastair Meikle. The difference is in the method; the\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2879\n|PortionCalories = 719\n|DatePublished=20th December 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 30 minutes\n |PrepTime = 5 minutes\n |CookTime = 25 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Basic macaroni cheese recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Winter warmer</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.63</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Simple food, easy to make, and delicious.</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:NonLoggedInUser|NonLoggedInUser]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis Mac and cheese recipe is a variation on the [[Basic macaroni cheese|Basic macaroni cheese recipe]] as suggested by Alastair Meikle.\n\nThe difference is in the method; the ingredients are the same.\n\nWe have some more elaborate [[Macaroni cheese|macaroni cheese recipes here]].  This is a simple version.  You could make it even simpler by omitting the [[parmesan cheese]] without spoiling the overall effect.\n \nOf course you can substitute your favourite [[Cheese|cheese]] in place of the [[Cheddar|cheddar]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 250g (9oz) [[Macaroni|macaroni]] [[Pasta|pasta]]\n| 40g (1&frac12; oz) [[Butter|butter]]\n| 40g (1&frac12; oz) [[Plain flour|plain flour]]\n| 600ml (1pint) [[Milk|milk]]\n| 250g (9oz) [[Grated|grated]] [[Cheddar cheese|cheddar cheese]]\n| 50g (2oz) freshly [[Grated|grated]] [[Parmesan cheese|parmesan cheese]]\n| Additional flavouring: Add [[tomato ketchup]] to taste\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the [[Oven]] - 190\u00b0C (375\u00b0F, Gas Mk.5).\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Cook the [[Macaroni|macaroni]] in a large saucepan of lightly-[[Salted|salted]] [[Boiling|boiling]] water for 8 to 10 minutes or until [[al-dente]].\n| Meanwhile make a [[roux]] by melting the [[Butter|butter]] over a gentle heat in another [[Sauce|sauce]]pan that will be large enough to hold the [[Pasta|pasta]] and the sauce together.\n| Add the [[Flour|flour]] and mix well with a wooden spoon.\n| Cook this [[Roux|roux]] for a minute.\n| Add the [[milk]], [[salt]], [[pepper]] and [[cheese]] and keep stirring until the flour 'explodes'.\n| Drain the [[macaroni]] and pour it into the [[cheese sauce]], stir well.\n| Serve. \n}}\n'''alternatively'''\n# Tip the mixture into an oven proof dish\n# Sprinkle grated cheese on top and bake until the cheese topping is crisp and brown.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Macaroni cheese]]\n[[Category:British recipes|Macaroni cheese]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes|Macaroni cheese]]\n[[Category:Main courses|Macaroni cheese]]\n[[Category:Pasta recipes|Macaroni cheese]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes|Macaroni cheese]]\n[[Category:Student recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]][[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#macaroni #grated #pasta #cheese #parmesancheese #roux #butter #cheesesauce #cheddar #boiling #salted </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Basic meatballs",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Basic meatballs a beef recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#bread #onion #oregano #olive #garlic #basicmeatballs #mint #dried #sauces #flour #egg \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=These are easy to make and can be utilised with many different flavoured sauces\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1985\n|PortionCalories = 496\n|DatePublished=20th January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Meatballs\n|Servings = Serves 4 to 6 people\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime = 30 minutes\n|PrepTime = 15 minutes\n|CookTime = 15 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Meatballs recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Perfect with spag. bol.</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.3</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">These meatballs and a bottle of spaghetti sauce make a perfect spaghetti bolognaise</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nThese are easy to make and can be utilised with many different flavoured [[Sauces|sauces]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 450 g (1 lb) lean [[Minced|minced]] [[Beef|beef]]\n| &#189; cup [[Grated|grated]] [[Onion|onion]]\n| 2 [[Cloves|cloves]] of [[Garlic|garlic]], peeled and crushed\n| &#188; a teaspoon [[Dried|dried]] [[Oregano|oregano]]\n| 1/8 of a teaspoon of [[Dried|dried]] [[Mint|mint]]\n| 2 slices white [[Bread|bread]], crusts removed - this can be stale bread\n| &#189; cup [[White wine|white wine]] or water\n| 1 [[Egg|egg]], beaten\n| Sea [[Salt|salt]] and freshly ground [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n| [[Flour]] for rolling\n| [[Olive]] [[Oil|oil]] for [[Frying|frying]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| With clean hands, mix the [[Mince|mince]], [[Onion|onion]], [[Garlic|garlic]], [[Salt|salt]], [[Pepper|pepper]], [[Oregano|oregano]], and [[Mint|mint]].\n| Moisten the [[Bread|bread]] in the [[Wine|wine]] or water.\n| Add [[Bread|bread]] and [[Egg|egg]] to [[Meat|meat]]. Knead well.\n| Shape into 2.5 cm (1\") balls, dust with [[Flour|flour]], and [[Saute|saute]] in hot [[Olive|olive]] [[Oil|oil]] until [[Browned|browned]] and cooked to your liking.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\n\nUse them to make [[New York-style stone baked pizza]], [[Meatball pizza]] or serve them with [[spaghetti]] and one of the following [[sauces]].\n* [[Balsamic vinegar gravy]]\n* [[Sofrito (Spanish tomato sauce)]]\n* [[Spicy tomato salsa]]\n* [[Tomato sauce for pizza]]\n* [[Roast garlic and sherry vinegar sauce]]\n===Variations===\n\nAdd 1/2 a teaspoon of [[chilli flakes]] for spicier meatballs.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Beef recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Cooking with wine]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#bread #onion #oregano #olive #garlic #basicmeatballs #mint #dried #sauces #flour #egg </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }

title": "Basic roast breast of goose",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Basic roast breast of goose a British recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#goose #basicroastbreastofgoose #roast #roasting #roastpotatoes #salad #blackpepper #vegetables #ground #stock #miseenplace \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=As the title suggests, this is a very basic recipe for roasting a goose breast. This will produce a slightly pink breast\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1840\n|PortionCalories = 920\n|DatePublished=17th January 2013\n|Author = JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = Serves 2 to 3\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 1 hour 20 minutes\n |PrepTime = 10 minutes\n |CookTime = 1 hour 10 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Basic roast breast of goose recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Tasty, very, very tasty</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.8</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Gorgeous, but SO very expensive.  Don't know how anyone can afford this nowadays.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Sliced (clumsily) for a salad.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Sliced (clumsily) for a [[salad]]]]\nAs the title suggests, this is a very basic recipe for [[Roasting|roasting]] a [[Goose|goose]] breast.  This will produce a ''slightly'' pink breast.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1 x 800g [[Goose|goose]] breast, bone in\n| Coarsely [[Ground|ground]] [[Salt|salt]] and [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 220\u00b0 C (425\u00b0 F - gas 7)\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Wash and dry the breast and place skin uppermost on a rack in a [[Roasting|roasting]] tin.\n| Season the skin with the [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]] and rub it in with your fingers.\n| [[Roast]] for 25 minutes.\n| Remove from the [[Oven|oven]] and prick a few holes in the skin, using a skewer.\n| Return to the [[Oven|oven]] and [[Roast|roast]] for a further 25 minutes.\n| Allow to rest for 20 minutes before carving.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe hot, with [[Roast potatoes|roast potatoes]] and [[Vegetables|vegetables]] or allow to go cold and serve with [[Salad|salad]]. \n===Chef's noted===\nKeep the [[goose]] [[fat]] for making [[roast potatoes]] and when carved, keep the bone for making [[stock]].\n==See also==\n* '''[[Meat cooking time calculator Metric|A comprehensive guide to roast meat cooking times]]''' - give the time you want to carve your roast and we'll give you a timed step by step roasting guide\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Goose breast]]\n[[Category:British recipes|Goose breast]]\n[[Category:Main courses|Goose breast]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes|Goose breast]]\n[[Category:Poultry recipes|Goose breast]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#goose #basicroastbreastofgoose #roast #roasting #roastpotatoes #salad #blackpepper #vegetables #ground #stock #miseenplace </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }

title": "Basic sausages",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Basic sausages, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#herbs #pork #basicsausages #fat #sausages #sausage #ground #garlic #breakfastsausage #dried #bake \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This is our first attempt at making sausages. It is not necessarily cheaper to make your own, but at least you know what has gone into them!\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 5293\n|PortionCalories = 330\n|DatePublished=20th October 2012\n|Author = JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = Serves 16 - Makes about 1.5kg of sausages\n |Difficulty = 3\n |TotalTime = 30 minutes\n |PrepTime = 30 minutes\n |CookTime = None\n|Image = [[Image:Basic sausages recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Proper sausages</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.8</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">And this great recipe is authored by a vegetarian!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Cumberland style.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Cumberland style]]\nThis is our first attempt at making [[Sausages|sausages]].  It is not necessarily cheaper to make your own, but at least you know what has gone into them!  This recipe is for a British style [[Breakfast sausage|breakfast sausage]], minus the chemicals and with much more [[Meat|meat]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1kg [[Shoulder of pork|shoulder of pork]], [[Minced|minced]]\n| 200g [[Pork fat|pork fat]], [[Minced|minced]]\n| 5g [[Black pepper|black pepper]], [[Ground|ground]]\n| 5g [[Sea Salt|sea salt]], [[Ground|ground]]\n| 1-2 tablespoons [[Dried|dried]] [[Herbs|herbs]]\n| 100g rusk\n| 150ml water\n| 2 metres [[Sheep|sheep]] casings\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Mix the [[Pork|pork]] and [[Fat|fat]] together - if [[Mincing|mincing]] your own, add bits of fat to the pork as you [[Mince|mince]].\n| In a large bowl, mix the [[Pepper|pepper]], [[Salt|salt]], [[Herbs|herbs]], rusk and water.\n| Add the [[Pork|pork]] and [[Fat|fat]] and mix thoroughly using your hands.\n| Stuff into the casings, using a [[Sausage|sausage]] stuffer, linking, if desired, as you go.\n| Keep in a container in the [[Fridge|fridge]] for 24 hours before consumption, or [[Freeze|freeze]] immediately.\n| If you are making a Cumberland style [[Sausage|sausage]], form into a coil as illustrated and [[Bake|bake]] in the [[Oven|oven]] at 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4), rather than [[Fry|fry]].\n}}\n===Variations===\nAdd any [[Herbs|herbs]] and/or [[Spices|spices]] to taste.  Try with finely chopped [[Spring onion|spring onion]] or [[Garlic|garlic]].\n===Chef's notes===\nGood hygene is essential!  Sterlise all of your [[Equipment|equipment]] and your work surface.  Plastic equipment can be sterlised in Milton, but metal items should be [[Boiled|boiled]] for at least 20 minutes.  We also wore shower caps on our heads and latex gloves.\n\nYou can link your [[Sausages|sausages]] after you have stuffed the casings, but I would recommend that to start with, you link as you go in case (like us) you overstuff and then cause the casing to burst whilst linking.\n\nFollow the [[RSPCA Think Pig Checklist]] to make sure that your [[Pork|pork]] has come from pigs that have been reared to higher welfare standards.\n* http://bit.ly/rspcathinkpig\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Sausages basic]]\n[[Category:British recipes|Sausages basic]]\n[[Category:Breakfast recipes|Sausages basic]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes|Sausages basic]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes|Sausages basic]]\n[[Category:Uncooked]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#herbs #pork #basicsausages #fat #sausages #sausage #ground #garlic #breakfastsausage #dried #bake </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Basic tomato soup",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Basic tomato soup recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#soup #tomatoes #diced #herbs #vegetables #cornflour #basictomatosoup #parsley #bacon #dripping #lard \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This is a simple recipe for a basic tomato soup as commonly eaten in the first half of the 20th century.\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1064\n|PortionCalories = 266\n|DatePublished=6th December 2015\n|Author = JuliaBalbilla\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = 4-6\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  2 hours, 10 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime =  2 hours\n|Image = [[Image:Basic tomato soup recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">The originals are the best</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.6</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">You cannot beat a recipe like this, I bet my mum made this same recipe, 70 years ago!</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\n<!--any extra images MUST be place between this comment and the /div tag below or the layout will be very broken-->\n\n\n\nThis is a simple recipe for a basic [[Tomato|tomato]] [[Soup|soup]] as commonly eaten in the first half of the 20th century.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 25g [[Butter|butter]], [[Dripping|dripping]] or [[Lard|lard]]\n| 1 [[Spanish]] [[Onion|onion]], peeled and [[Diced|coarsely diced]]\n| 1 medium [[Carrot|carrot]], scraped and [[Diced|diced]]\n| 2-3 stalks [[Celery|celery]], [[Diced|diced]] (include leaves if available)\n| 60g streaky [[Bacon|bacon]], [[Diced|diced]]\n| A pinch of [[Sugar|sugar]] or more (optional but will [[Help|help]] to caramelise the [[Vegetables|vegetables]] and reduce acidity)\n| 1 [[Bay leaf|bay leaf]]\n| 1 sprig of [[Thyme|thyme]]\n| 1 sprig of [[Parsley|parsley]]\n| 2 tins whole [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]] (see [[Chef's notes|Chef's notes]] below)\n| 900mls [[Chicken]], [[Ham|ham]] or [[Vegetable Stock|vegetable stock]] \n| 2 teaspoons [[Cornflour|cornflour]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Melt the [[Butter|butter]], [[Dripping|dripping]] or [[Lard|lard]] in a heavy bottomed pan over a low heat.\n| Add the [[Vegetables|vegetables]] and [[Bacon|bacon]] and [[Saute|saute]] until the [[Onions|onions]] are slightly softened.\n| Stir in the [[sugar]] and cook until the [[vegetables]] are beginning to [[Caramelised|caramelise]].\n| Let it take as long as it needs to do this.\n| Add the [[Herbs|herbs]], [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]] and [[Stock|stock]] and [[Simmer|simmer]], covered, for about 1-2 hours\n| Remove and discard the [[herbs]], rub the [[soup]] through a fine [[Sieve|sieve]] and return to the pan.\n| Take a little of the [[Stock|stock]] and mix with the [[Cornflour|cornflour]].\n| Return to the pan and bring to a gentle [[Boil|boil]].\n| Cook for a few minutes and season to taste.\n| Garnish with [[Croutons|croutons]] or a little chopped [[Parsley|parsley]].\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[White bread rolls|white bread rolls]]\n===Recipe source===\n\n* *'''''Radiation Cookery Book'''' (1935)\n* *'''''Ma Cuisine''''' - Auguste Escoffier (1934)\n===Variations===\nIf you have a good [[Blender|blender]], then you can [[Blend|blend]] the [[Soup|soup]] after removing the [[Herbs|herbs]], rather than passing through a [[Sieve|sieve]].\nYou can used [[milk]] to replace some of the stock, in which case do not add it until you have brought the [[soup]] to a boil after mixing in the [[cornflour]].  Re-heat by simmering only.\n===Chef's notes===\nYou can use fresh [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]] instead of tinned, providing they are tasty and ripe.  The flavourless, under-ripened ones commonly sold in British supermarkets are not suitable.  For my personal taste, I think a teaspoon of [[sugar]] is needed, but does depend on the acidity of your [[tomatoes]].\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Tomato soup basic]]\n[[Category:British recipes|Tomato soup basic]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes|Tomato soup basic]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites|Tomato soup basic]]\n[[Category:Soup and stock recipes|Tomato soup basic]]\n[[Category:Starters|Tomato soup basic]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes|Tomato soup basic]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes|Tomato soup basic]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered|Tomato soup basic]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#soup #tomatoes #diced #herbs #vegetables #cornflour #basictomatosoup #parsley #bacon #dripping #lard </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Basic white sauce",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Basic white sauce, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#butter #basicwhitesauce #cheesesauce #cream #shrimp #onions #mustardpowder #worcestershiresauce #doublecream #diced #cheese \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Also known as Bechamel sauce. This is your starting point for many sauces\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 276\n|PortionCalories = 69\n|DatePublished=31st January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4 - Makes &#189; pint (300 ml) sauce\n|Difficulty = 1\n|ImageComment = Bechamel sauce, with cheese, pouring over vegetables\n|TotalTime = 15 minutes\n|PrepTime = 5 minutes\n|CookTime = 10 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Broccoli and cauliflower cheese recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Base for cheese sauce</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Add 3 tablespoons of Taste Sensations Mature Cheese powder for the best cheese sauce.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n'''Also known as B\u00e9chamel sauce'''\n\nThis is your starting point for many sauces.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1 tablespoon [[butter]]\n| 1 tablespoon sifted plain flour\n| &#189; pint (300 ml) cold [[milk]] or half [[milk]], half stock\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Gently melt the [[butter]] in a pan.  Don't burn it\n| Add all of the sifted flour\n| Mix the flour and [[butter]] until it becomes a paste\n| Turn to a medium heat and gradually add all the [[milk]], whisking constantly\n| Ensure none of the sauce is stuck to the bottom of the pan\n| Whisk gently until the sauce starts to bubble\n| Reduce to a very low heat and cook for 5 minutes\n}}\n===Chef's tip===\n\nThe key to a perfect sauce is to keep whisking until all of the milk has been added and there are no lumps\n\n===Variations===\n\nThis white sauce is used as a base for many different sauces, including:\n* Mornay sauce ([[cheese]])\n* Nantua sauce ([[shrimp]], [[butter]] and [[cream]])\n* Cr\u00e8me sauce ([[double cream]])\n* Mustard sauce (prepared [[mustard]])\n* Soubise sauce (finely [[diced]] [[onions]] that have been sweated in [[butter]])\n* [[Cheese sauce]] ([[cheddar cheese]], [[mustard powder]], [[Worcestershire sauce]])\n\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|White sauce]]\n[[Category:Dips and sauces|White sauce]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#butter #basicwhitesauce #cheesesauce #cream #shrimp #onions #mustardpowder #worcestershiresauce #doublecream #diced #cheese </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

\n| 4 tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]] \n| 75g [[Butter]] \n| [[Salt]] and [[Pepper]]\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat [[Oven|oven]] to 200\u00b0C/400\u00b0F/Gas 6 \n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Cut each [[Potato|potato]] across its width in slices about 5mm apart but stopping about 1cm from the bottom so each potato is still joined at the base. \n| Break the [[Bay leaves|bay leaves]] in half and insert them into the slices, pick sprigs from the [[Rosemary|rosemary]] and again place into the slices. \n| Season with [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]. \n| Place the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] into a [[Roasting|roasting]] tin, sprinkle [[Olive oil|olive oil]] over the potatoes. \n| Pour enough cold water into the pan, just enough to cover the bottom of the pan. \n| Cut the [[Butter|butter]] into pieces and place around the [[Potatoes|potatoes]]. \n| Place pan into [[Oven|oven]] to [[Roast|roast]], [[Baste|baste]] regularly with the [[Butter|butter]] until the water evaporates and the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] are tender.\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Albert Bartlett recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main title": "Bean and cheese patties",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Bean and cheese pattie recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#oliveoil #grated #panko #carrots #garlic #parsley #beans #cheese #beanandcheesepatties #egg #mashed \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=It is best use giant white beans for this, especially if starting with dried ones. I used the Greek Fasolia Gigantes-Elefantes Kastorias...\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=12th January 2017\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  27 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  12 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 1014\n|PortionCalories = 253\n|Image = [[Image:Bean and cheese patties recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Vegalicious!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.6</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Thanks Julia - lovely \ud83e\uddc0!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>}}\n[[Image:Part of a roast.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Bean and cheese patties as part of a roast]]\nIt is best use giant white [[beans]] for this, especially if starting with dried ones.  I used the Greek [[Fassolia Gigantes-Elefantes Kastorias]], which are like large [[butter beans]] in appearance.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 250g (cooked weight) large [[White beans|white beans]], lightly [[Mashed|mashed]]\n| 50g [[Panko|panko]]\n| 160g [[Carrots|carrots]], coarsely [[Grated|grated]]\n| 100g hard [[Cheese|cheese]], [[Grated|grated]]\n| [[Parsley]] to taste, chopped\n| [[Olive oil]]\n| 90g [[Red onions|red onions]], finely chopped\n| [[Garlic]], to taste, [[Minced|minced]] with a little [[Salt|salt]]\n| 1 [[Egg|egg]], beaten\n| [[Salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| In a bowl, mix the [[Beans|beans]], [[Panko|panko]], [[Carrots|carrots]], [[Cheese|cheese]] and [[Parsley|parsley]]\n| Heat a little [[Olive oil|olive oil]] in a pan\n| Saut\u00e9 the [[Onions|onions]] until soft\n| Add the [[Garlic|garlic]] and cook for a minute or too - do not allow to burn\n| Add to the bowl and mix thoroughly\n| Stir in the beaten [[Egg|egg]] and the seasoning\n| Shape into 8 patties\n| Lay them on a tray and [[Refrigerate|refrigerate]] for an hour to firm up\n| Just before serving, heat some more [[Oil|oil]] in a large [[Frying pan|frying pan]] and cook on both side until [[Browned|browned]]\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nCan be served with [[Salad|salad]] as a [[Light lunch|light lunch]] or will go well as part of a [[Vegetarian|vegetarian]] [[Roast|roast]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Grain and bean recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#oliveoil #grated #panko #carrots #garlic #parsley #beans #cheese #beanandcheesepatties #egg #mashed </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Bean and potato pesto bake",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
