                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Bean and potato pesto bake recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#potatoes #pasta #greenbeans #beanandpotatopestobake #macaroni #pesto #boil #salted #tomatoes #bake #mozzarellacheese \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=My baked version of the Ligurian pasta dish, usually made with Trofie pasta, potatoes and Green green beans. Ive decided to add Mozzarella mozzarella..\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=13th July 2019\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  1 hour\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  45 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 1498\n|PortionCalories = 749 \n|Image = [[Image:Bean and potato pesto bake recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Vegalicious!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I love this \ud83d\udc9d\ud83d\udc9d\ud83d\udc9d</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry, aka Chef]])</span></span>}}\n[[Image:BeansPastaPestoReadyToBake.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Assembled, ready to bake]]\nMy [[Baked|baked]] version of the Ligurian [[Pasta|pasta]] dish, usually made with Trofie pasta, [[Potatoes|potatoes]] and [[Green beans|green beans]].\n\nI've decided to add [[Mozzarella cheese|mozzarella cheese]] and [[Bake|bake]] it to get a nice crispy finish.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 small jar of red [[Pesto|pesto]], about 120 g\n| 180 g [[Macaroni|macaroni]]\n| 100 g long [[Green beans|green beans]], trimmed\n| 200 g [[New Potatoes|new potatoes]], scrubbed and cubed\n| 200 g ball of [[Mozzarella cheese|mozzarella cheese]], drained and crumbled\n| 2 [[Salad|salad]] [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]], sliced\n| Splash of [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4), [fan oven 160\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| [[Boil]] the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] in [[Salted|salted]] water for 15 minutes\n| [[Boil]] the [[Pasta|pasta]] ([[Macaroni|macaroni]]) in well [[Salted|salted]] water for 10 minutes\n| [[Simmer]] the [[Green beans|green beans]] for 5 minutes\n| Mix the cooked [[Potatoes|potatoes]], [[Beans|beans]] and [[Pasta|pasta]] with the [[Pesto|pesto]] in a [[Casserole dish|casserole dish]]\n| Top with the sliced [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]] and the crumbled [[Mozzarella|mozzarella]] and sprinkle with [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n| [[Bake]] for 15 minutes and finish under a hot [[Grill|grill]] for the final 5 minutes\n| Serve immediately\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Italian recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Pasta recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#potatoes #pasta #greenbeans #beanandpotatopestobake #macaroni #pesto #boil #salted #tomatoes #bake #mozzarellacheese </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Beef and bean cottage pie",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Beef and bean cottage pie a beef recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#beefandbeancottagepie #kidneybeans #garlic #driedmixedherbs #carrots #bovril #potato #casseroledish #chilliflakes #potatoes #vegemite \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This is a mixture of Chilli con carne and Cottage pie. It is very quick and easy to produce, making it a balanced, inexpensive meal for students\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2266\n|PortionCalories = 566\n|DatePublished=20th January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 1 hour\n |PrepTime = 15 minutes\n |CookTime = 45 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Beef and bean cottage pie recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">An odd idea, but good.</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.6</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">A nice change from rice</span> \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\">[[User:Chef|Jerry]] </span></span>\n}}\n\nThis is a mixture of [[Chilli con carne]] and [[Cottage pie]].  It is very quick and easy to produce, making it a balanced, inexpensive meal for students\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 2 tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 2 medium or 1 large [[Onion|onion]], chopped\n| 300g [[Minced beef|minced beef]]\n| 200g [[Baked beans|baked beans]]\n| 200g [[Kidney beans|kidney beans]], drained\n| 1.5 teaspoons [[Marmite]], [[Vegemite]] or [[Bovril]]\n| 1-2 teaspoons [[Dried mixed herbs|dried mixed herbs]]\n| 1-2 tablespoons dired [[Chilli flakes|chilli flakes]]\n| 1kg [[Potatoes|potatoes]], peeled\n| 250g [[Carrots|carrots]], peeled\n| [[Garlic]], to taste, crushed\n| A little [[Milk|milk]] or a knob of [[butter]]\n| [[Salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Heat the [[Oil|oil]] over a high heat and saut\u00e9 the [[Onions|onions]] until golden [[Brown|brown]].\n| Add the [[Mince|mince]] and cook until [[Brown|brown]].\n| Stir in the [[Baked beans|baked beans]], [[Kidney beans|kidney beans]],  [[Marmite]], [[Vegemite]] or [[Bovril]], the [[Dried mixed herbs|dried mixed herbs]] and the [[Chilli flakes|chilli flakes]].\n| Transfer to a [[Casserole dish|casserole dish]].\n| Meanwhile, [[Boil|boil]] the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] and the [[Carrots|carrots]] until cooked - about 20 minutes.\n| Drain and [[Mash|mash]] together, adding the [[Milk|milk]] and the [[Garlic|garlic]].\n| Season to taste.\n| Spread out the [[Potato|potato]] over the [[Meat|meat]] and [[Bean|bean]] mixture in the [[Casserole dish|casserole dish]] and drag a fork through it to create a pretty pattern.\n| [[Bake]] at 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4), [fan [[Oven|oven]] 160\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour] for 20 minutes.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Peas|peas]] and / or [[Beans|beans]]\n===Variations===\nIf you don't like [[Chillies|chillies]] or [[Garlic|garlic]], just leave them out.  Use any type of tinned [[Beans|beans]] to replace the [[Kidney beans|kidney beans]].  Substitute the [[Carrot|carrot]] for [[Swede|swede]].  Grate some [[Parmesan]] or other hard [[Cheese|cheese]] over the top of the [[Potato|potato]] / carrot mixture before [[Baking|baking]]\n===See also===\n* {{ChiliConCarne}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Tex-Mex recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Beef recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pies tarts and flans]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#beefandbeancottagepie #kidneybeans #garlic #driedmixedherbs #carrots #bovril #potato #casseroledish #chilliflakes #potatoes #vegemite </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Beef short ribs (slow cooker recipe)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Slow cooked beef short ribs recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#beefshortribs #ribs #slowcooker #fat #oliveoil #bouquetgarni #argentineribs #flour #redwine #thyme #miseenplace \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This beef short ribs recipe is great for someone who is going to be out all day.  10 minutes of preparation and then 10 hours of slow cooking\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 4217\n|PortionCalories = 2108\n|DatePublished=18th January 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  10 hours, 10 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime =  10 hours\n|Image = [[Image:Beef short ribs slow cooker recipe recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Deep, textured and tasty</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">If you can get short ribs, give this a try!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nHaving discovered a great [[Supplier|supplier]] for my [[Beef short ribs|beef short ribs]] and making [[Barbecue beef short ribs]], I thought I would try other ways of cooking them.  As they make such a substantial meal, I just used 2 [[Ribs|ribs]] for 2 people.  This meant cutting the now [[Frozen|frozen]] 4 ribs (pictured) in half.  You need a clean [[hacksaw]] for this, it's no job for a knife!\n\nNormally I would [[Brown|brown]] the [[Meat|meat]] and [[Onions|onions]], but I thought I would try to make this a speed preparation that you could throw in the [[Slow cooker|slow cooker]] before going out for the day.  I'll cook it on low so all the collagen breaks down into lovely [[gravy]].\n\nIf you get a chance, it helps to skim any excess [[Fat|fat]] and give it a stir halfway through, however, it will be fine without.\n\n[[Beef short ribs]].jpg\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 600g [[Beef short ribs|beef short ribs]] - (2 ribs), half the quantity pictured\n| 1 teaspoon [[Mustard powder|mustard powder]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Fine yellow cornmeal|fine yellow cornmeal]] ([[Plain flour|plain flour]] would be fine)\n| pinch of [[Salt|salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 160 grams [[bacon lardons]]\n| 1 [[Oxo cube|oxo cube]], crumbled into 150 ml boiling water\n| 2 tablespoons of [[tomato puree]]\n| 6 [[Banana shallots|banana shallots]], peeled and cut into rings\n| 2 [[Cloves of garlic|cloves of garlic]], peeled, smashed and roughly chopped\n| 300 ml [[Red wine|red wine]]\n| A splash of [[Port|port]]\n| [[Juice]] and [[Zest|zest]] of a [[Lime|lime]]\n| A small [[Bouquet garni|bouquet garni]] (I used [[Thyme|thyme]], [[Sage|sage]], 2 [[Bay leaves|bay leaves]], [[Rosemary|rosemary]] and [[Parsley|parsley]])\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Switch the [[Slow cooker|slow cooker]] on to the low setting before you start to prepare.\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:IMG 4920.jpg|thumb|After 10 hours in the slow cooker\nImage:Beef_short_ribs.jpg|I used half the quantity pictured\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Mix the [[Mustard|mustard]], [[Yellow cornmeal|yellow cornmeal]] together and add to a plate\n| Rub 1 tablespoon of [[Olive oil|olive oil]] over the [[Ribs|ribs]]\n| Roll the [[Ribs|ribs]] in the [[Flour|flour]] to coat\n| Add the [[Ribs|ribs]] to the [[Slow cooker|slow cooker]] with any leftover [[Flour|flour]]. Place them meat-side down.\n| Add the remaining ingredients to the [[Slow cooker|slow cooker]]\n| Stir well\n| Cover with a layer of [[Tin-foil|tin-foil]]\n| Slow cook for 10 hours on low, skimming any [[Fat|fat]] halfway through if possible\n| After 10 hours, skim any [[Fat|fat]], remove the [[Bouquet garni|bouquet garni]] and serve\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Roast potatoes|roast potatoes]] and [[Green vegetables|green vegetables]]\n===Chef's notes===\nAsk your butcher for '[[beef short ribs]] from the plate', or [[Argentine ribs]]. You don't want back ribs as these are not the same.  I understand from talking to a butcher that this particular cut of [[beef]] is also known as 'Jacob's ladder'.\n\nI've found it difficult to obtain [[beef short ribs]] from anywhere but a specialist butchers and even then, they needed to be ordered in advance.  I was delighted to discover [[F. Conisbee specialist butchers]] had them in stock. 4 [[Argentine ribs]] for \u00a321.04.  Robert cut them in half again lengthwise with the bandsaw. One of these half-ribs per person is plenty!\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Beef recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Cooking with wine]]\n[[Category:Slow cooker recipes]]\n[[Category:Slow cooked]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#beefshortribs #ribs #slowcooker #fat #oliveoil #bouquetgarni #argentineribs #flour #redwine #thyme #miseenplace </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Beef stock",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Beef stock a beef recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#beef #stock #bones #onions #beefstock #litres #simmer #pints #leeks #miseenplace #boil \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Stocks are a fiddle to make and this, I'm afraid is no exception. However, if you want a restaurant quality beef stock, this is it\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 20640\n|PortionCalories = 1290\n|DatePublished=27th October 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Frozen stock\n |Servings = Serves 16 - Makes 3 [[Litres|litres]] of [[Beef|beef]] [[Stock|stock]]\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 4 hours 15 minutes\n |PrepTime = 15 minutes\n |CookTime = 4 hours\n |Image = [[Image:Chicken stock recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"><span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Better than OXO</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">But it does take longer to make!</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\">[[User:Chef|Jerry]] </span></span>\n}}\n\n[[Stock|Stock]]s are a fiddle to make and this, I'm afraid is no exception. However, if you want a restaurant quality [[Beef|beef]] stock, this is it.  Freeze in plastic [[Coffee|coffee]] cups and you won't have to use an [[Oxo cube]] for months!\n\nSee your butcher for the [[Beef|beef]] [[bones]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 3.7 kg (8 lb) [[Beef|beef]] [[bones]] (shin, leg or ribs)\n| 6 [[Litres|litres]] (10.5 [[Pints|pints]]) cold water\n| 1 tablespoon [[Sunflower oil|sunflower oil]]\n| 2 [[Carrots|carrots]], washed and sliced\n| 2 [[Leeks|leeks]], well washed and chopped\n| 2 [[Onions|onions]], halved, skin on\n| 2 sprigs of [[Thyme|thyme]]\n| 2 [[Bay leaves|bay leaves]]\n| 3 sprigs of [[Parsley|parsley]], with stalks\n| 20 [[Black peppercorns|black peppercorns]] \n| Good pinch of [[Salt|salt]]\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the oven to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6)\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| '''Dark [[Beef|beef]] [[Stock|stock]]'''\n| Place the [[bones]] in  a large [[roasting tray]] and roast for 40 minutes\n| '''Light [[Beef|beef]] [[Stock|stock]]'''\n| Omit the step above, then...\n| Place the [[bones]] in your biggest pan and cover with 6 [[Litres|litres]] (10.5 [[Pints|pints]]) of cold water and bring to the [[Boil|boil]]\n| Reduce the heat, cover, leaving the lid slightly ajar and [[Simmer|simmer]] for 1.5 hours, skimming any scum from the surface\n| In a [[Wok|wok]] or [[Frying pan|frying pan]], [[Sautee|sautee]] the [[Onions|onions]] until soft, about 4 minutes\n| Add the [[Onions|onions]] and the rest of the ingredients to the [[Beef|beef]] and [[Simmer|simmer]], lid ajar, for a further 2 hours - again, skimming any scum from the surface\n| Allow to cool slightly and strain without disturbing the ingredients or forcing them through the sieve(or you will cloud the [[Stock|stock]]\n| Allow to cool and refrigerate or freeze\n}}\n==See also==\nThe trick to making crystal-clear stock: [[Ice filtered consomm\u00e9]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Beef recipes]]\n[[Category:Soup and stock recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#beef #stock #bones #onions #beefstock #litres #simmer #pints #leeks #miseenplace #boil </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Beef Wellington",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Beef Wellington, | Beef recipes from The cook's Wiki\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#duxelles #beef #beefwellington #parmaham #mushrooms #pastry #brush #butter #thyme #clingfilm #shallots \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Beef Wellington is a not difficult to make at home, but is does take a little time.  Step by step, easy to follow directions with pictures\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}}\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2780\n|PortionCalories = 695\n|DatePublished=28th January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 3\n |TotalTime = 2 hours 30 minutes\n |PrepTime = 50 minutes\n |CookTime = 1 hour 40 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Beef Wellington recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Make this at least once a year!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Lovely details and such a special meal. Worth all the effort.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Beef Wellington sliced.jpg|thumb|250px|right|[[Beef]] Wellington sliced]]\n[[Image:Churchill-2.jpg|250px|thumb|right|The kitchen in [http://cwr.iwm.org.uk/ Churchill's underground bunker] where his favourite dish would have been cooked many times.]]\n[[Image:Churchill.jpg|250px|thumb|right|Churchill's favourite recipe]]\n'''[[Beef]] Wellington''' is a great Christmas alternative to [[Turkey|turkey]]. It was Winston Churchill's favourite dish (he knew what he liked!)\nUse a good [[Beef|beef]] fillet (preferably Aberdeen Angus), tell your butcher what you are going to use it for and get them to remove the chain muscle and the silverskin sinews and gristle from the outside of the fillet.\n\n'''[[Duxelles]]'''\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 250 g [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]] chopped very finely.\n| 2 [[Shallots|shallots]] peeled and chopped very finely\n| 2 cloves of [[Garlic]], peeled and crushed\n| 3 tablespoons [[Butter|butter]]\n| 50 ml [[Dry white wine|dry white wine]]\n| 1 sprig of [[Thyme|thyme]]\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n}}\n'''[[Beef]] Wellington'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| [[Olive oil]] for [[Frying|frying]]\n| 500g trimmed [[Beef|beef]] fillet (cut from the middle of the fillet)\n| 6 slices of [[Parma ham|parma ham]] or [[Prosciutto]]\n| Made-up [[English mustard recipe|English mustard]]\n| 375g packet of pre-rolled [[Puff pastry|puff pastry]] (you won't need it all).\n| 2 [[Egg yolks|egg yolks]]\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 220\u00b0 C (425\u00b0 F - gas 7), [fan oven 200\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n===Method===\n\n\n'''[[Duxelles]]'''\nDon't rush this, it's quite long-winded and will probably take around 30 minutes cooking.\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Gently saut\u00e9 [[Garlic|garlic]] and [[Shallots|shallots]] in the  the finely chopped [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]] in the [[Butter|butter]] for about 6 minutes until soft.\n| Add the chopped [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]] and the whole sprig of [[Thyme|thyme]] and gently cook for 10 minutes so most of the [[Mushroom|mushroom]] [[Liquor|liquor]] is cooked off.\n| Remove the sprig of [[thyme]]\n| Add the [[Wine|wine]], a splash of [[lemon juice]] and season to taste.\n| Cook gently until all of the liquid has gone.\n| The [[Duxelles|duxelles]] should stick together easily.\n| Remove from the heat and allow to cool.  Don't allow it to get too cold or it will be difficult to spread on the ham.\n}}\n'''[[Beef]] Wellington'''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Heat a [[Frying pan|frying pan]] and a few tablespoons of [[Olive oil|olive oil]] until almost [[Smoking|smoking]].\n| Add the [[Beef|beef]] and [[Brown|brown]] all surfaces, turning often.\n| Remove from the heat and allow to cool and then [[Brush|brush]] generously with the [[English mustard]] paste.\n| Cut a large sheet of [[Cling-film|cling-film]] and cover with the [[Parma ham|parma ham]] so it is large enough to roll around the [[Beef|beef]], overlapping at the edges.\n| Spread the [[Duxelles|duxelles]] over the [[Parma ham|parma ham]] as pictured.\n| Lay the fillet on the [[Duxelles|duxelles]] and use the [[Cling-film|cling-film]] to roll the [[Parma ham|parma ham]] around the the [[Beef|beef]] so it resembles a large [[Sausage|sausage]].\n| Twist the ends to seal and [[Refrigerate|refrigerate]] for 20 minutes so it holds its shape when un-wrapped.\n| Remove the [[puff-pastry]] from the fridge 25 minutes before you need it to prevent it cracking when un-rolled.\n| [[Brush|Brush]] the edges that will overlap with the [[Egg yolk|egg yolk]].\n| Remove the [[Cling-film|cling-film]] and wrap the [[Beef|beef]] in the [[Pastry|pastry]], pressing the edges together with the tines of a fork. Place join-side down on a non-stick baking tray and [[Brush|brush]] the [[Pastry|pastry]] with the remaining [[egg wash]].  Overlap the pastry just enough to join, trimming and discarding any excess.\n| Cut long diagonal slashes in the [[Pastry|pastry]] for decoration, being careful not to penetrate the pastry.\n| [[Bake]] for 35 to 40 minutes until the [[Pastry|pastry]] is nice and crispy.\n| Rest for 10 minutes before slicing and serving\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Potato wedges|potato wedges]] and a [[Green salad|green salad]].\n\nThe second half, on the second day, was reheated for 30 minutes(180\u00b0C - 350\u00b0 F) and served with [[chips]] and [[peas]].\n====[[Duxelles]] and Beef Wellington, step by step photographs====\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Duxelles ingredients.jpg|The basic ingredients for duxelles\nImage:Shallots and garlic suateed in butter.jpg|[[Shallots]] and [[Garlic|garlic]] [[saut\u00e9ed]] in [[butter]]\nImage:Mushrooms chopped.jpg|Mushrooms chopped in the [[food processor]]\nImage:Mushrooms go in dry.jpg|The [[mushrooms]] look very dry when they are first added\nImage:White wine added.jpg|Wet again once the [[white wine]]/[[sherry]] is added\nImage:Duxelles reduced, ready to cool.jpg|Duxelles completed, ready to cool\nImage:Fillet for beef Wellington.jpg|British prime fillet\nImage:Browning the fillet.jpg|Browned all over\nImage:Fillet steak brushed in mustard.jpg|Brushed generously in English mustard\nImage:IParma ham laid on cling film.jpg|[[Parma ham]] laid out on [[cling film]]\nImage:Duxelles.jpg|[[Parma ham]] brushed with [[duxelles]]\nImage:Rolled up in cling-film.jpg|[[Parma ham]], [[duxelles]], [[mustard]] and [[beef]] fillet, wrapped up in [[cling film]]\nImage:Roll the beef in the puff-pastry.jpg|Roll the beef in the puff-pastry\nImage:Trim excess & join the underside with a fork.jpg|Trim excess pastry & join the underside with a fork\nImage:Decorate with a sharp knife.jpg|Egg-wash & decorate with a sharp knife\nImage:Beef Wellington recipe.jpg|Beef Wellington\n</gallery>\n===Chef's notes===\nI never have [[White wine|white wine]] so use a little less [[Dry sherry|dry sherry]], watered down instead - no one has noticed yet!\n\nI've now made quite a few variations of this recipe, using [[bacon]] instead of [[ham]], including [[pat\u00e9]] in the [[duxelles]] and using different cuts of meat.  My conclusions: This doesn't work well you don't use [[fillet of beef]]. It's rich enough without adding [[pat\u00e9]].  If you use [[bacon]], it makes it too heavy and hard-going.\n\nIf you are making this for just 2 people, make the [[duxelles]] for 4, split the fillet in to two halves, wrap and bake one (to server two people), leave the other wrapped in [[clingfilm]] and bake that in a few days time for another lovely rich meal. That way you get two nice fresh crispy wellingtons rather than soggy leftovers.  You could also make a [[chicken wellington]] with the other half of the [[duxelles]].\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Beef recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#duxelles #beef #beefwellington #parmaham #mushrooms #pastry #brush #butter #thyme #clingfilm #shallots </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Beer battered fried fish",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->{{#seo:\n|title=Beer battered fried fish a British recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#fish #beerbatteredfriedfish #flour #batter #beer #hand #microwave #eggwhite #fried #canolaoil #groundnutoil \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=These Fried Fish are battered and deep-fat fried. You'll need thin fish filets that don't fall apart when cooked\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1510\n|PortionCalories = 755\n|DatePublished=31st December 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  27 minutes\n|PrepTime =  20 minutes\n|CookTime =  7 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Beer battered fried fish recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n======Best recipe review======\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Easy to make</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">...but Boy, you need lots of oil to fry this in!</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> - [[User:Chef|Jerry]]</span></span>\n}}\nThese [[Fried]] [[Fish]] are [[Battered|battered]] and deep-[[Fat|fat]] [[Fried|fried]]. You'll need thin [[Fish|fish]] filets that don't fall apart when cooked.\n\nIdeally serve with [[Chips|chips]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 2 Thin [[Fish|fish]] fillets (suggested: [[Cod|cod]] fillets, [[basa]] fillets, [[Catfish|catfish]] fillets, [[tilapia]], or [[Flounder|flounder]])\n| [[Oil]] with a high smoke point ([[Groundnut oil|groundnut oil]], [[Canola oil|canola oil]], [[Sunflower oil|sunflower oil]])\n| 1 [[Egg white]], whisked\n| 1 cup [[Plain flour|plain flour]] ([[All purpose flour|all purpose flour]])\n| \u00bd pint (236 ml, 1 cup) [[Beer|beer]] or [[Lager|lager]], or \u00bd pint (236 ml, 1 cup) cold water\n| &#189; teaspoon [[Baking powder|baking powder]]\n| extra [[Flour|flour]] to dust the [[Fish|fish]]\n}}\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Start heating the [[Oil|oil]]. This recipe is intended for fast cooking in very hot [[Oil|oil]].\n| Get the [[Batter|batter]] ingredients ready to mix.\n| [[Microwave]] the [[Fish|fish]], to ensure that the inside is hot. Flip the [[Fish|fish]] as you [[Microwave|microwave]] it. When done, the fish should be hot and should look half-cooked.\n| Mix the [[Flour|flour]], [[Egg white|egg white]], and [[Beer|beer]].\n| Pat a [[Fish|fish]] dry with a [[Paper towel|paper towel]], then lightly dust it with [[Flour|flour]] to ensure that it is really dry.\n| [[Dip]] the [[Fish|fish]], and your [[Hand|hand]], into the [[Batter|batter]]. Coat them well. The [[Batter|batter]] will [[Help|help]] protect your [[Hand|hand]] from splatter.\n| Hold the [[Fish|fish]] right above the [[Oil|oil]], then gently slide the [[Fish|fish]] into the [[Oil|oil]].\n| With tongs, nudge the [[Fish|fish]] as needed to keep it from sticking to the bottom. Turn the [[Fish|fish]] over as it cooks.\n| Remove the [[Fish|fish]] when it looks good, then serve it immediately.\n}}\n===Recipe source===\n* [http://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/Cookbook:Fried_Fish Wiki Cookbook]\n===See also===\n{{SeeAlso-chips}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Cooking with beer]]\n[[Category:Fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Freshwater fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Sea fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Deep fried]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#fish #beerbatteredfriedfish #flour #batter #beer #hand #microwave #eggwhite #fried #canolaoil #groundnutoil </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }

title": "Beer pickled belly of pork",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Beer pickled belly of pork, British recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#beerpickledbellyofpork #pickle #pints #porkbelly #garlicpowder #roasting #pulledpork #allspice #oliveoil #pork #refrigerate \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=The inspiration for this recipe comes from a combination of pulled pork (carnitas), slow roast herby pork belly and Jocasta Innes' beer pickle\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 4412\n|PortionCalories = 1103\n|DatePublished=27th October 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 7 days, 1 hour, 50 minutes\n |PrepTime = 7 days, 20 minutes\n |CookTime = 1 hour, 30 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Beer pickled belly of pork recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Need a smoker :(</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Nice recipe but you do have to have a smoker, which limits this for most people.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Beer pickled smoked belly of pork.jpg|thumb|300px|right|After 1 week and an hour in the smoker]]\nThe inspiration for this recipe comes from a combination of [[pulled pork]] (carnitas), [[Slow roast herby pork belly|slow roast herby pork belly]] and Jocasta Innes' beer pickle marinade.  I have use a mix of lager and mild as I have a plentiful supply from my barrels of home-brew!\n\nThe meat should marinate for 1 week before cooking, which could also be suitable for a preservative cure, however, in this recipe it is purely for the purpose of flavouring.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1.3 kg (3 lb) [[Belly of pork|belly of pork]]\n}}\n'''[[Pickle]]'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 2 [[Pints|pints]] home made [[Beer|beer]] ( I used a mixture of [[Lager|lager]] and [[Mild ale|mild ale]])\n| 2 [[Pints|pints]] water (or enough to completely cover the joint) \n| 1 tablespoon [[Allspice|allspice]]\n| 100g [[Sea Salt|sea salt]]\n| 4 tablespoons [[Black treacle|black treacle]]\n| 6 tablespoons [[Dark soy sauce|dark soy sauce]]\n| 2 tablespoons [[Chilli powder|chilli powder]] / curry powder\n| 2 tablespoons [[Garlic powder|garlic powder]]\n| 4 tablespoons [[Malt vinegar|malt vinegar]]\n}}\n'''[[Roasting]]'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 1 tablespoon of [[olive oil]]\n| Finely ground [[sea salt]]\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Slash the [[Pork belly|pork belly]] with a knife so there are deep cuts on both sides to ensure the [[Pickle|pickle]] can really flavour the [[Meat|meat]]\n* Mix the [[Pickle|pickle]] mixture together and place the [[Pork|pork]] in a non-metallic container ensuring the pork is totally immersed. [[Refrigerate]] for 1 week.\n* If you are luck enough to have a smoker, after 1 week, pat the joint dry and smoke for an hour or so before roasting.\n* 1 Week later: Preheat the oven to its highest setting - it will be turned down as soon as the meat goes in.\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Lay the joint on a rack, skin-side-up, over a [[roasting tray]] and rub the olive oil into the skin\n| Sprinkle with finely ground sea salt\n| Place into the oven and immediately reduce the heat to 220\u00b0 C (425\u00b0 F - gas 7) and roast for 20 minutes\n| Using a kitchen towel, pat off any excess fat that may be gathering on the top of the crackling\n| Reduce the heat to 165\u00b0 C (325\u00b0 F - gas 3) and roast for 1 hour or a little longer if needed, it does dry out easily so keep an eye on it.\n| Rest for 10 minutes, then cut into bite-sized chunks\n}}\n{{Template:See-also-pulled-pork}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Cooking with beer]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pickles and preserves]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#beerpickledbellyofpork #pickle #pints #porkbelly #garlicpowder #roasting #pulledpork #allspice #oliveoil #pork #refrigerate </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Beetroot, pork and apple hash",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Beetroot, pork and apple hash, your 5-a-day pork recipe!\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#oliveoil #beetrootporkandapplehash #ham #grated #purplesproutingbroccoli #saladspinner #sauteed #shredded #beetrootrosti #cookingapple #caramelised \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=I created this recipe in order to up our vegetable intake.  It went down very well and will be made again.  I might even try a vegtarian version!\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 690\n|PortionCalories = 345\n|DatePublished=9th April 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  30 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime =  20 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Beetroot, pork and apple hash recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Beetroot and apple!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Sounds like an Autumn treat!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Sue_spins|Susie]] </span></span>\n}}\nWe are trying to achieve the [[5 a day vegetable regime]] and to this end, I created this dish, loosely based on the [[Beetroot rosti|beetroot rosti]].  It was fabulous.  You could probably make a neater version by [[Frying|frying]] individual patties.  I was more concerned with getting it to the table and eating it so I cooked the whole thing as you would with [[Bubble and squeak|bubble and squeak]], patting it flat in the [[Frying pan|frying pan]] and constantly turning it over to ensure that it's cooked evenly.  Add a splash of [[Olive oil|olive oil]] to the pan if it appears to be [[Drying|drying]] out.  I wouldn't worry about the toasty burnt bits either as they are delicious in their own right.  A very successful experiment which went very well with [[Purple sprouting broccoli|purple sprouting broccoli]], [[Sauteed|sauteed]] in [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and a few crushed [[Cloves of garlic|cloves of garlic]].\n\nSwap out the [[Pork|pork]] for [[Feta cheese|feta cheese]] or [[Halloumi cheese|halloumi cheese]] and you have a [[Vegetarian|vegetarian]] version.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 3 cooked [[Beetroots|beetroots]], [[Grated|grated]] and squeezed dry (or spun in a [[Salad spinner|salad spinner]])\n| 1 [[Cooking apple|cooking apple]], peeled, cored and [[Grated|grated]]\n| 200 g cooked [[Gammon|gammon]] or [[Ham|ham]], [[Shredded|shredded]]\n| [[Freshly ground black pepper]] and a pinch of [[Salt|salt]]\n| [[Olive oil]]\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Beet pork apple almost done.jpg|Mixture well stirred and almost ready to serve\nImage:pork beetroot apple patted flat.jpg|Mixture patted flat in the frying pan\nImage:beets ready to make Rosti.jpg|Beets grated in a [[food processor]], drained in a [[salad spinner]]\n</gallery>\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Mix all of the ingredients together in a bowl\n| Heat a few tablespoons of [[Olive oil|olive oil]] in a heavy based [[Frying pan|frying pan]]\n| Fill the pan with the mixture and pat it flat\n| Cook on a medium heat for about 5 minutes\n| After 5 minutes, stir the mixture up with a [[Fish|fish]] slice and turn portions of the hash over to ensure its [[Toasted|toasted]] all over\n| Repeat for 10 minutes so the [[Apple|apple]], [[Beets|beets]] and [[Ham|ham]] are [[Caramelised|caramelised]]\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Purple sprouting broccoli|purple sprouting broccoli]] [[Sauteed|sauteed]] in [[Crushed garlic|crushed garlic]] and [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and [[New Potatoes|new potatoes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#oliveoil #beetrootporkandapplehash #ham #grated #purplesproutingbroccoli #saladspinner #sauteed #shredded #beetrootrosti #cookingapple #caramelised </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Beetroot and apple soup",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Beetroot and apple soup, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#beetroot #beetrootandapplesoup #yoghurt #onions #horseradish #garlic #chives #staranise #grated #vegetablestock #simmer \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=I love beetroot, so long as it isn't pickled in vinegar\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 545\n|PortionCalories = 136\n|DatePublished=21st November 2013\n|Author = JuliaBalbilla\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  2 hours\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  1 hour, 45 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Beetroot and apple soup recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"><span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">I thought this sounded odd!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.6</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">It's lovely, especially with horseradish cream - yum!</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\">[[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nI love [[Beetroot|beetroot]], so long as it isn't [[Pickled|pickled]] in [[Vinegar|vinegar]]\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 750g raw [[Beetroot|beetroot]], thoroughly washed, skin and [[Roots|roots]] intact\n| 2 medium [[Onions|onions]], roughly chopped\n| 1 bulb [[Garlic|garlic]], separated into [[Cloves|cloves]] and peeled\n| 2 tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 2 cooking [[Apples|apples]], peeled, quartered and cored\n| 1 &#189; [[Litres|litres]] water\n| 1 tablespoon [[Bron's Spanish vegetable stock concentrate (TM)|Bron's Spanish vegetable stock concentrate]]\n| 2 [[Star anise|star anise]]\n| [[Salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]\n| 2 teaspoons [[Horseradish|horseradish]], [[Grated|grated]]\n| 1 tablespoon natural [[Yoghurt|yogurt]] or [[Sour cream|sour cream]]\n| [[Chives]], snipped\n}}\n\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6), [fan [[Oven|oven]] 180\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n| Place the [[Beetroot|beetroot]] in 1cm of water in a [[Baking tray|baking tray]] and [[Bake|bake]] for at least 1 hour until tender - if using just one large [[Beetroot|beetroot]], it can take 3 hours\n| Remove from the [[Oven|oven]] and run under cold water for a couple of minutes until cool\n| Peel, chop and reserve\n| Heat the [[Oil|oil]] in a thick-bottomed pan over a low to medium heat.\n| Add the [[Onions|onions]] and [[Garlic|garlic]] and [[Sweat|sweat]] over a medium heat with the lid on until soft and slightly [[Caramelised|caramelised]].\n| Add the [[Apple|apple]] and [[Beetroot|beetroot]] and cook for 10 minutes.\n| Pour on the [[Stock|stock]], add thevstar [[Anise|anise]] and seasoning and [[Simmer|simmer]] for 20 minutes.\n| Remove the [[Star anise|star anise]], then blitz the [[Soup|soup]] for 2-3 minutes until velvety smooth.\n| Serve with snipped [[Chives|chives]] and a dollop of [[Yoghurt|yogurt]] mixed with the [[Horseradish|horseradish]]\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Rye|rye]] [[Bread|bread]]\n===Recipe source===\n\n* Lightly adapted from a recipe in '''[http://www.greatbritishlife.co.uk/home/beetroot_and_bramley_soup_with_horseradish_the_fast_diet_1_2291889 Great British Life]'''\n===Variations===\nAny [[Vegetable Stock|vegetable stock]] will be fine.\n==See also==\n* [[Beetroot recipes|Our favourite beetroot recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Soup and stock recipes]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#beetroot #beetrootandapplesoup #yoghurt #onions #horseradish #garlic #chives #staranise #grated #vegetablestock #simmer </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Beetroot and bitter salad leaf risotto dressed with goats' cheese",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Beetroot and bitter salad leaf risotto recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#beetroot #rice #stock #salad #grated #thymeleaves #onion #miseenplace #blackpepper #italian #oliveoil \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A brightly coloured rice risotto recipe served with rocket, spinach and watercress salad leaves and creamy tangy goat's' cheese\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 991\n|PortionCalories = 247\n|DatePublished=19th January 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime = 1 hour, 10 minutes\n|PrepTime = 25 minutes\n|CookTime = 45 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Beetroot and spinach risotto dressed with goats' cheese V recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">A good combination</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">3.9</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Especially with the cheese</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:NonLoggedInUser|NonLoggedInUser]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis [[risotto]] recipe is a variation of a recipe on a Sainsbury's card.\n\nAs with all risottos, adding the [[Stock|stock]] during the [[Rice|rice]] cooking stage will take your full attention, so this is not a heat it and leave it recipe.\n\nIt serves 4 with fairly small portions, but it is quite filling.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1.2 [[Litres|litres]] weak [[Vegetable Stock|vegetable stock]] (use 1 [[chicken stock]] cube or 1 level teaspoon of chicken [[Bouillon|bouillon]] powder.\n| 1 tablespoon [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| A big pinch of [[freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 1 medium [[Onion|onion]], peeled and very finely chopped\n| 1 [[Clove|clove]] of [[Garlic, peeled and crushed|garlic, peeled and crushed]]\n| 300 g pack of cooked [[Beetroot|beetroot]], dipped in [[Vinegar|vinegar]]\n| Freshly picked and chopped [[Thyme leaves|thyme leaves]] from a large sprig of [[Thyme|thyme]]\n| 250 g [[Italian]] [[Risotto rice|risotto rice]]\n| 100g roll of [[Goats' cheese|goats' cheese]], crumbled\n| 80 g mixed [[Bitter|bitter]] [[Salad|salad]] leaves, ([[Watercress|watercress]], [[Spinach|spinach]], [[Rocket|rocket]]), large stems discarded\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Roughly grate the [[Beetroot|beetroot]]\n* Blitz half of the [[Grated|grated]] [[Beetroot|beetroot]] to a pure\u00e9 in a [[food processor]] and keep the [[Grated|grated]] [[Beetroot|beetroot]] and the beetroot pure\u00e9 separate\n\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Make up the [[Stock|stock]] with [[Boiling|boiling]] water and keep it hot over a very low flame\n| Heat the [[Oil|oil]] in a large saucepan and add a big pinch of [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n| Saut\u00e9 the [[Onion|onion]] for 5 minutes, don't [[Brown|brown]] it.\n| Saut\u00e9 the [[Garlic|garlic]] for 1 minute\n| Stir in the [[Rice|rice]] and allow it to become coated by the [[Oil|oil]]\n| Mix in the [[Grated|grated]] [[Beetroot|beetroot]] and half of the [[Thyme leaves|thyme leaves]]\n| Allow the [[Beetroot|beetroot]] to warm through\n| Start adding the hot [[Stock|stock]] to the [[Rice|rice]], 1 ladleful at a time.  Wait until the previous ladle of [[Stock|stock]] has been completely absorbed before adding the next ladleful.  This will take 25 to 35 minutes.\n| Keep the [[Rice|rice]] [[Simmering|simmering]] during this stage\n| When you are down to the last ladle of [[Stock|stock]], add it with the [[Beetroot|beetroot]] pure\u00e9 and ensure most of the liquid is absorbed into the [[Rice|rice]]\n| Stir in the [[Salad|salad]] leaves and half of the [[Goats' cheese|goats' cheese]], let the leaves wilt and the [[Cheese|cheese]] melt into the [[Rice|rice]], giving it a nice creamy finish\n| Spoon onto serving plates and dress with the remaining [[Goats' cheese|goats' cheese]] and [[Salad|salad]] leaves\n}}\n===Beetroot recipes===\nWe have a great selection of beetroot recipes.   My favourite is the [[Beetroot rosti]].\n{{Beetroot recipes}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Italian recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Rice recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#beetroot #rice #stock #salad #grated #thymeleaves #onion #miseenplace #blackpepper #italian #oliveoil </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

meal\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 991\n|PortionCalories = 247\n|DatePublished=19th January 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  1 hour, 10 minutes\n|PrepTime =  25 minutes\n|CookTime =  45 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Beetroot and spinach risotto dressed with goats' cheese V [[User:TheJudge|The&nbsp;Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis [[Vegetarian|vegetarian]] [[Rice|rice]] recipe is a variation of a recipe on a Sainsbury's recipe card.\n\nAs with all risottos, adding the [[Stock|stock]] during the [[Rice|rice]] cooking stage will take your full attention, so this is not a heat it and leave it recipe.\n\nIt serves 4 with fairly small portions, but it is quite filling.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1.2 [[Litres|litres]] weak [[Vegetable Stock|vegetable stock]] (use 1 [[Vegetable stock|vegetable stock]] cube or 1 level teaspoon of [[Vegetable|vegetable]] [[Bouillon|bouillon]] powder.\n| 1 tablespoon [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| A big pinch of [[freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 1 medium [[Onion|onion]], peeled and very finely chopped\n| 1 [[Clove|clove]] of [[Garlic, peeled and crushed|garlic, peeled and crushed]]\n| 300 g pack of cooked [[Beetroot|beetroot]], dipped in [[Vinegar|vinegar]]\n| Freshly picked and chopped [[Thyme leaves|thyme leaves]] from a large sprig of [[Thyme|thyme]]\n| 250 g [[Italian]] [[Risotto rice|risotto rice]]\n| 100g roll of [[Goats' cheese|goats' cheese]], crumbled\n| 80 g mixed [[Bitter|bitter]] [[Salad|salad]] leaves, ([[Watercress|watercress]], [[Spinach|spinach]], [[Rocket|rocket]]), large stems discarded\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Roughly grate the [[Beetroot|beetroot]]\n* Blitz half of the [[Grated|grated]] [[Beetroot|beetroot]] to a pure\u00e9 in a [[food processor]] and keep the [[Grated|grated]] [[Beetroot|beetroot]] and the beetroot pure\u00e9 separate\n\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Make up the [[Stock|stock]] with [[Boiling|boiling]] water and keep it hot over a very low flame\n| Heat the [[Oil|oil]] in a large saucepan and add a big pinch of [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n| Saut\u00e9 the [[Onion|onion]] for 5 minutes, don't [[Brown|brown]] it.\n| Saut\u00e9 the [[Garlic|garlic]] for 1 minute\n| Stir in the [[Rice|rice]] and allow it to become coated by the [[Oil|oil]]\n| Mix in the [[Grated|grated]] [[Beetroot|beetroot]] and half of the [[Thyme leaves|thyme leaves]]\n| Allow the [[Beetroot|beetroot]] to warm through\n| Start adding the hot [[Stock|stock]] to the [[Rice|rice]], 1 ladleful at a time.  Wait until the previous ladle of [[Stock|stock]] has been completely absorbed before adding the next ladleful.  This will take 25 to 35 minutes.\n| Keep the [[Rice|rice]] [[Simmering|simmering]] during this stage\n| When you are down to the last ladle of [[Stock|stock]], add it with the [[Beetroot|beetroot]] pure\u00e9 and ensure most of the liquid is absorbed into the [[Rice|rice]]\n| Stir in the [[Salad|salad]] leaves and half of the [[Goats' cheese|goats' cheese]], let the leaves wilt and the [[Cheese|cheese]] melt into the [[Rice|rice]], giving it a nice creamy finish\n| Spoon onto serving plates and dress with the remaining [[Goats' cheese|goats' cheese]] and [[Salad|salad]] leaves\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Italian recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Rice recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#rice #beetroot #stock #grated #salad #onion #thymeleaves #vegetablestock #vegetarian #miseenplace #vegetable </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }

title": "Beetroot salad (cold)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Beetroot salad (cold), British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#juice #beetroot #allspice #cornflour #zest #muscovadosugar #vinegar #rest #fridge #recipesfromothersites #salad \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This interesting beetroot salad originates from Nik and Edwina's Cookbook\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 240\n|PortionCalories = 40\n|DatePublished=14th January 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = A great excuse to use this photo!<br />[https://www.flickr.com/photos/cmuffins/sets/ ''Canned muffins'']\n|Servings = 6\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime = 1 day, 15 minutes\n|PrepTime = 1 day, 10 minutes\n|CookTime =  5 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Shadowy beetroot.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Proper country fare</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.8</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">And a fabulous picture ftoo.</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n\nThis interesting [[Beetroot|beetroot]] [[Salad|salad]] originates from [[Nik and Edwina's Cookbook]].   This is the cold version, [[Beetroot salad (hot)|the hot version can be found here]]\n\nTo quote Nik:\n\n\"It's earthy and sweet and fragrant and spicy and fruity, we served it at our wedding feast, and it went down a storm\"\n\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 500g [[Beetroot|beetroot]], either freshly [[Boiled|boiled]], or from the supermarket (but make sure it'\u0092s not in [[Vinegar|vinegar]])\n| 4 oranges, Freshly squeezed. Use the [[Juice|juice]] and the [[zest]]\n| 1 \u0096to 2 teaspoons [[Allspice|allspice]]\n| 1 teaspoons [[Cornflour|cornflour]]\n| 1 tablespoon dark [[Brown|brown]] or [[Muscovado sugar|muscovado sugar]]\n}}\n\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Chop [[Beetroot|beetroot]] into skinny strips and arrange in a serving bowl\n| Reserve 2 tablespoons of [[Juice|juice]]. Heat the [[Rest|rest]] with the [[Zest|zest]], add 1 teaspoon of [[Allspice|allspice]] and the [[Sugar|sugar]]. Check for spiciness and add more [[Allspice|allspice]] if you like it that way\n| Mix the reserved [[Juice|juice]] with the [[Cornflour|cornflour]]. Add to [[Juice|juice]] in pan, heating gently, stirring constantly until the mixture has thickened a bit\n| Pour over the [[Beetroot|beetroot]] and chill overnight so the flavours become bosom buddies.\n| Take it out of the [[Fridge|fridge]] in plenty of time to be able to serve at room temperature\n}}\n==See also==\n* [[Beetroot salad (hot)]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Salad recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Nik and Edwina's Cookbook recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#juice #beetroot #allspice #cornflour #zest #muscovadosugar #vinegar #rest #fridge #recipesfromothersites #salad </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Beetroot salad (hot)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Beetroot salad (hot), British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#beetroot #juice #allspice #vinegar #cornflour #zest #unusualrecipes #salad #miseenplace #simmer #oranges \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This interesting hot beetroot salad originates from Nik and Edwina's Cookbook\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 567\n|PortionCalories = 94\n|DatePublished=14th January 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = A great excuse to use this photo!<br />[https://www.flickr.com/photos/cmuffins/sets/ ''Canned muffins'']\n|Servings = Serves 6\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  35 minutes\n|PrepTime =  30 minutes\n|CookTime =  5 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Shadowy beetroot.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Hot salad?</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Is there really such a thing?</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis interesting [[Beetroot|beetroot]] [[Salad|salad]] originates from [[Nik and Edwina's Cookbook]]. This is the hot version, [[Beetroot salad (cold)|the cold version can be found here]].\n\nTo quote Nik:\n\n\"It\u0092s earthy and sweet and fragrant and spicy and fruity, we served it at our wedding feast, and it went down a storm\"\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 500g [[Beetroot|beetroot]], either freshly [[Boiled|boiled]], or from the supermarket (but make sure it'\u0092s not in [[Vinegar|vinegar]])\n| 150ml [[White wine vinegar|white wine vinegar]]\n| 4 [[oranges]], Freshly squeezed. Use the juice and the zest\n| 1 teaspoon [[Allspice|allspice]]\n| 2 teaspoons [[Cornflour|cornflour]]\n| 225g dark [[Brown|brown]] or [[Muscovado sugar|muscovado sugar]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6), [fan [[Oven|oven]] 180\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Preheat [[Oven|oven]] to 200C. Chop [[Beetroot|beetroot]] into skinny strips and arrange in an [[Oven|oven]] proof dish\n| Mix [[Sugar|sugar]] and [[Vinegar|vinegar]] in saucepan. [[Simmer]] for 5 minutes\n| Reserve 2 tblspns of [[Juice|juice]]. Add the [[Rest|rest]] with the [[Zest|zest]] and the of [[Allspice|allspice]] to the pan\n| Mix the reserved [[Juice|juice]] with the [[Cornflour|cornflour]]. Add to [[Juice|juice]] in pan, heating gently, stirring constantly until the mixture has thickened a bit\n| Pour over the [[Beetroot|beetroot]] and place in [[Oven|oven]] for 8 minutes until warmed through. Serve\n}}\n==See also==\n* [[Beetroot salad (cold)]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Salad recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Nik and Edwina's Cookbook recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#beetroot #juice #allspice #vinegar #cornflour #zest #unusualrecipes #salad #miseenplace #simmer #oranges </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Beetroot spelt risotto (TM)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Beetroot spelt risotto - A Thermomix recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#butter #vinaigrette #beetroot #mustard #creamedhorseradish #sauce #juice #risotto #salad #drywhitewine #pickledbeetroot \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This unusual risotto is based on a recipe by Heston Blumenthal's 'Home' and has been adapted for making in a Thermomix\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 3827\n|PortionCalories = 956\n|DatePublished=11th September 2014\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|ImageComment = The new [[Thermomix]] TM5 (2014)\n|Servings = 4 as as first course or accompaniment, 2 as a main \n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  3 hours, 30 minutes\n|PrepTime =  1 hour, 50 minutes\n|CookTime =  1 hour, 40 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:The new (2014) Thermomix TM5.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Are you sure...</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">..that risotto is spelt like that? \ud83d\ude02\ud83d\ude02\ud83d\ude02</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Carla_Cancio-Bello,_J.D.,_on_behalf_of_Cuban_Cuisine_UK|Carla]] </span></span>\n}}\n\nThis unusual [[Risotto|risotto]] is based on a recipe by Heston Blumenthal in his book '''Heston Blumenthal at Home''' and has been adapted for making in a [[Thermomix]].  The [[Mustard|mustard]] [[Vinaigrette|vinaigrette]], [[Pickled beetroot|pickled beetroot]], acidulated [[Butter|butter]],  and [[Horseradish cream|horseradish cream]] can be made a day or two in advance and it is worth the effort as it is so delicious!\n\n{{RecipeIngredientsTM\n}}\n'''For the [[Mustard|mustard]] [[Vinaigrette|vinaigrette]] '''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 40g [[White wine vinegar|white wine vinegar]] \n| 40g [[Dijon Mustard|dijon mustard]] \n| 120g [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 2.4g [[Soy lecithin|soy lecithin]] (optional) \n| Seasoning \n}}\n'''For the acidulated [[Butter|butter]] '''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 50g [[Onions|onions]], peeled and roughly chopped\n| 90g [[Dry white wine|dry white wine]] \n| 150g [[White wine vinegar|white wine vinegar]] \n| 125g [[Unsalted butter|unsalted butter]], cubed \n}}\n'''For the [[Pickled beetroot|pickled beetroot]] '''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 200g [[Cider vinegar|cider vinegar]] \n| 1 teaspoon [[Caster Sugar|caster sugar]] \n| \u00bd teaspoon [[Salt|salt]] \n| 100g cooked [[Beetroot|beetroot]], cubed \n}}\n'''For the [[Creamed horseradish|creamed horseradish]] [[Sauce|sauce]]'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 40g fresh [[Horseradish|horseradish]], cut into chunks\n| 1 teaspoon water\n| 1 teaspoon [[Wine vinegar|wine vinegar]]\n| A dash of [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]]\n| 100g [[Double Cream|double cream]]\n| A pinch of [[Salt|salt]] \n}}\n'''For the [[Risotto|risotto]] '''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 200g [[Beetroot|beetroot]] [[Juice|juice]] \n| 30g [[Olive oil|olive oil]] \n| 200g pearled [[Spelt|spelt]] \n| 100g [[Dry white wine|dry white wine]] \n| 600ml/g warm [[Vegetable Stock|vegetable stock]] \n}}\n'''To finish '''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 60g [[Parmesan cheese]]\n| 50g acidulated [[Butter|butter]] (above) \n| Seasoning \n| 1 teaspoon [[Fennel seeds|fennel seeds]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Yoghurt|yogurt]] \n| [[Creamed horseradish]] [[Sauce|sauce]] (above) \n| [[Salad]] leaves\n| [[Mustard]] [[Vinaigrette|vinaigrette]] (above)\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n}}\n'''For the [[Mustard|mustard]] [[Vinaigrette|vinaigrette]] '''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Place all of the ingredients into the bowl, except for the seasoning 10 seconds / Speed 8\n| Season to taste and mix 3 seconds / Speed 5\n| Reserve in a sealed container in the [[Fridge|fridge]] until needed\n}}\n'''For the acidulated [[Butter|butter]] '''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Give the bowl a wipe with kitchen paper\n| Add the [[Onions|onions]], [[Wine|wine]] and [[Vinegar|vinegar]] 5 seconds / Speed 7\n| Scrap down the bowl\n| Cook at Speed 1 / Temp Varoma / MC Off until the liquid has reduced by about three quarters - this could take up to 15-20 minutes\n| During this time, scrap down the bowl a couple of times and check the liquid level - it will be impossible to be really precise because of the inclusion of the [[Onions|onions]]\n| Remove the bowl from the body of the [[Thermomix]] and allow to cool - alternatively, if you have too much time on your hands, you can just leave the bowl where it is and start the next stage once the temperature drops to 50\u00b0 C\n| Attach the [[Butterfly]] to the blade\n| Set for 4 minutes / Speed 3 / 50\u00b0 C\n| Gradually add the cubed [[Butter|butter]] through the hole in the lid (but keep the lid on between additions)\n| You will hear when the [[Butter|butter]] cubes have been emulsified when the whisking sounds less noisy - obviously the colder the butter, the longer it will take\n| If necessary emulsify for a minute or so longer\n| Leave to [[Rest for|rest for]] 20 minutes at room temperature\n| Push through a very fine [[Sieve|sieve]] agitating the solids with the spatula - you should left with a very small amount indeed of solid matter\n| Pour into a small bowl and [[Refrigerate|refrigerate]] until required\n}}\n'''For the [[Pickled beetroot|pickled beetroot]] '''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Whisk the [[Vinegar|vinegar]], [[Sugar|sugar]] and [[Salt|salt]] together by [[Hand|hand]] in a small bowl\n| Add the cubed [[Beetroot|beetroot]] and set aside in the [[Fridge|fridge]] for at least 30 minutes\n}}\n'''For the [[Creamed horseradish|creamed horseradish]] [[Sauce|sauce]]'''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Using a clean bowl, grate the [[Horseradish|horseradish]] with the water, [[Vinegar|vinegar]] and [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]] 12 seconds / Speed 6-8-10\n| Scrape down the bowl\n| Stir in the [[Cream|cream]] 6 seconds / Speed 4, adding [[Salt|salt]] to taste\n}}\n'''For the [[Risotto|risotto]]'''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Using a clean bowl, grate the [[Parmesan cheese]] and set aside\n| Add the [[Beetroot|beetroot]] [[Juice|juice]] 5-8 minutes / Speed Spoon / 100\u00b0 C / MC Off until reduce by half.  Keep an eye on this as beetroot contains natural [[Sugar|sugar]] and it may reduce more quickly than desired\n| Pour the [[Juice|juice]] into a jug and reserve\n| Wipe the bowl with [[Kitchen towel|kitchen towel]]\n| Add the [[Olive oil|olive oil]] to the bowl 4 minutes / Speed 1 / 100\u00b0 C\n| Add the pearled [[Spelt|spelt]] 5 minutes / Speed Spoon / 100\u00b0 C / Reverse blade - the spelt should have coloured slightly, but if not, cook for a little longer\n| Add the [[Dry white wine|dry white wine]] 5 minutes / Speed Spoon / Temp Varoma / Reverse blade or until the [[Wine|wine]] has reduced by three quarters - again this can be difficult to judge\n| Add 300g of the warm [[Stock|stock]] 10 minutes / Speed Spoon / Temp Varoma / Reverse blade until most of the stock has been absorbed\n| Add the remaining [[Stock|stock]] at the same Speed, Temp etc - you can do this 100g at a time ensuring that before each addition, the previous stock has been absorbed.  However, it is possible to add the whole 300g in one go\n| Add the [[Beetroot|beetroot]] [[Juice|juice]] and continue cooking for a further 5 minutes / Speed Spoon / Temp Varoma / Reverse blade\n}}\n'''To serve'''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Stir in the [[Grated|grated]] [[Parmesan]], [[Salt|salt]], acidulated [[Butter|butter]], [[Yoghurt|yogurt]] and the [[Fennel seeds|fennel seeds]] 20 seconds / Speed Spoon / Reverse blade and leave to [[Rest for|rest for]] a few minutes\n| Serve on plates or in bowls with a dollop of [[Creamed horseradish|creamed horseradish]] and a scattering of drained [[Beetroot|beetroot]]\n| Accompany with [[Salad|salad]] leave of your choice, dressed in the [[Mustard|mustard]] [[Vinaigrette|vinaigrette]]\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nThis [[Risotto|risotto]] also goes well as an [[Accompaniment|accompaniment]] to [[Fish|fish]] and [[Roasted|roasted]] [[Game|game]] birds, in which case leave out the [[Salad|salad]] leaves and [[Vinaigrette|vinaigrette]] if desired\n===Variations===\nUse [[Chicken stock|chicken stock]] instead of [[Vegetable|vegetable]] if preferred\n===Chef's notes===\nThe optional [[Soy lecithin|soy lecithin]] for the [[Vinaigrette|vinaigrette]] is to emulsify the other ingredients, ie the [[Sauce|sauce]] will not separate during storage\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Pickles and preserves]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Grain and bean recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Thermomix recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#butter #vinaigrette #beetroot #mustard #creamedhorseradish #sauce #juice #risotto #salad #drywhitewine #pickledbeetroot </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Black pudding",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Black pudding, a classic British recipe Cooking Wiki\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#blackpudding #suet #recipes #pig #sheep #historicrecipes #cattle #sweetpotato #boiledorsimmered #britishrecipes #timoleaguebrownpudding \n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=Black pudding or (less often) blood pudding is a British English term for sausage made by cooking blood with a filler until it is thick enough to\n|datePublished=2013-08-16\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n[[Image:Boudin.jpg|thumb|250px|right|Boudin noir(French black pudding) - before cooking]]\n[[Image:Black pudding.jpg|thumb|250px|right|A modern black pudding]]\n'''Black pudding''' or (less often) '''blood pudding''' is a British English term for [[sausage]] made by cooking blood with a filler until it is thick enough to congeal when cooled. It is also called blood sausage (first attested in 1868, perhaps influenced by German Blutwurst). \n\n[[Pig]] or [[cattle]] blood is most often used; [[sheep]] and [[goat]] blood are used to a lesser extent. Blood from [[poultry]], horses and other animals are used more rarely. Typical fillers include [[meat]], [[fat]], [[suet]], [[bread]], [[sweet potato]], [[barley]] and [[oatmeal]].\n===Black pudding - a recipe from 1600===\n\n\"Small otemeal mixed with blood, and liver ot either sheep, calf or swine, maketh that pudden...whose goodness it is in vain to boast because there is hardly to be found a man that doth not affect them.\"\n\n''English Housewife's Booke, 1600''\n\n''This was taken from the wonderful book: [[Food In England|''Food in England - Dorothy Hartley'']]''\n\n==See also==\n* [[Timoleague Brown pudding]]\n\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Offal recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n{{RecipeSkip}}\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#blackpudding #suet #recipes #pig #sheep #historicrecipes #cattle #sweetpotato #boiledorsimmered #britishrecipes #timoleaguebrownpudding </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Blue cheese and caramelized-onion squares",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Blue cheese and caramelized-onion squares a cheese recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#dough #onions #oliveoil #rosemary #flour #bakingpowder #bluecheeseandcaramelizedonionsquares #bluecheese #butter #unsaltedbutter #cheese \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Sweet caramelised onions and pungent blue cheese make a good pair in this simply elegant appetiser\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 3072\n|PortionCalories = 307\n|DatePublished=20th January 2013\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|ImageComment = [http://www.britishonions.co.uk/ www.britishonions.co.uk/]\n |Servings = Servings: 10 - Makes 42 squares\n |Difficulty = 3\n |TotalTime = 1 hour 20 minutes\n |PrepTime = 30 minutes\n |CookTime = 50 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:BritishOnions.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Shame</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">2</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">A picture says a thousand words \ud83d\ude2c</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nSweet caramelised [[Onions|onions]] and pungent [[Blue cheese|blue cheese]] make a good pair in this simply elegant [[Appetiser|appetiser]]\n\n\n'''Crust'''\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 2 cups (200g) all purpose (plain) [[Flour|flour]]\n| 2 teaspoons [[Baking powder|baking powder]]\n| &#190; teaspoon [[Salt|salt]]\n| &#190; cup (190ml) whole [[Milk|milk]]\n| &#188; (60ml) [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 2 tablespoons (1/4 stick) [[Unsalted butter|unsalted butter]], melted\n}}\n'''Topping'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 2 tablespoons (1/4 stick) [[Unsalted butter|unsalted butter]]\n| 2 tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 3 large [[Onions|onions]] (about 2 pounds), halved, thinly sliced\n| 1 tablespoon finely chopped fresh [[Rosemary|rosemary]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Sugar|sugar]]\n| &#189; teaspoon [[Salt|salt]]\n| 170g crumbled [[Blue cheese|blue cheese]] (1&#189; cups)\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat [[Oven|oven]] to 220\u00b0 C (425\u00b0 F - gas 7). \n===Method===\n'''The crust:'''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Mix [[Flour|flour]], [[Baking powder|baking powder]], and [[Salt|salt]] in medium bowl to blend. \n| Make well in center of dry ingredients. \n| Whisk [[Milk|milk]], [[Olive oil|olive oil]], and melted [[Butter|butter]] in liquid measuring cup to blend. \n| Slowly pour [[Milk|milk]] mixture into well in dry ingredients, stirring until just blended and smooth. \n| Roll out [[Dough|dough]] on lightly floured surface to 10x13-inch rectangle. \n| Transfer [[Dough|dough]] to rimmed [[Baking|baking]] sheet. \n| Re-form [[Dough|dough]] into 10x13-inch rectangle (dough will shrink when moved). \n| Pierce [[Dough|dough]] all over with fork. \n| Let [[Dough|dough]] rest while preparing topping.\n}}\n'''The topping:'''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Melt [[Butter|butter]] with [[Oil|oil]] in large [[Skillet|skillet]] over high heat. \n| Add [[Onions|onions]]. \n| Cook until [[Onions|onions]] are soft and beginning to [[Brown|brown]], stirring frequently, about 10 minutes. \n| Add [[Rosemary|rosemary]], [[Sugar|sugar]], and [[Salt|salt]]. \n| Season [[Onions|onions]] to taste with [[Pepper|pepper]]. \n| Reduce heat to medium. \n| Continue to cook until [[Onions|onions]] are soft and dark [[Brown|brown]], stirring frequently, about 20 minutes; cool.\n| Spread [[Onion|onion]] mixture evenly over [[Dough|dough]]. Sprinkle with [[Cheese|cheese]]. [[Bake]] until crust is golden and cheese is bubbling, about 20 minutes. \n| Let cool. \n| Cut into squares and serve.\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:British Onions recipes]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n{{Template:British Onions attribution}}\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#dough #onions #oliveoil #rosemary #flour #bakingpowder #bluecheeseandcaramelizedonionsquares #bluecheese #butter #unsaltedbutter #cheese </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }

title": "Blue cheese and walnut pizza",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Blue cheese and walnut pizza a cheese recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#pizzadough #pizzastone #grill #bluecheeseandwalnutpizza #bluecheese #fineyellowcornmeal #pizzapeel #walnuts #bake #pizzas #cheese \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=After making Quattro formaggi (four cheese) pizza, this was so good it deserves to a pizza of its own\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1517\n|PortionCalories = 758\n|DatePublished=12th April 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 2 with breakfast leftovers\n|ImageComment = Sitting on the pizza stone, ready to serve\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  1 hour, 14 minutes\n|PrepTime =  1 hour\n|CookTime =  14 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Blue cheese and walnut pizza recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n}}\n\nAfter making [[Quattro formaggi (four cheese) pizza]], this was so good it deserves to a pizza of its own.  Any [[blue cheese]] would work, I just happen to love St Agur, it is a little less salty than some and tastes creamy, even when melted.  Very nice.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| Olive oil\n| 1 portion of [[Pizza dough|pizza dough]] - makes 2 pizzas\n| 150 g [[Saint Agur Blue cheese]], crumbled\n| 6 tablespoons of crushed [[Walnuts|walnuts]]\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* If using a [[pizza stone]], preheat the [[pizza stone]] under a very hot [[grill]] for about 20 minutes.  Place it about 8cm (3\") from the heat source.\n\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Make 1 pizza per person.\n| Dust your work surface with [[Fine yellow cornmeal|fine yellow cornmeal]].\n| Divide the [[Pizza dough|pizza dough]] into two and roll out into two thin 25.5 cm (10 inch) [[Pizzas|pizzas]].\n| Prick the pizza all over with a fork. This prevents it puffing up too much and burning while it is cooking.\n| Place the [[Pizza dough|pizza dough]] on a [[Pizza peel|pizza peel]] that has been dusted with [[Fine yellow cornmeal|fine yellow cornmeal]].\n| Preheat the [[Pizza stone|pizza stone]] under a very hot [[Grill|grill]].\n| With a deft move, slide the [[Pizza dough|pizza dough]] from the [[Pizza peel|pizza peel]], on to the preheated [[Pizza stone|pizza stone]].\n| Cook for about 2 minutes on one side only, until lightly browned.\n| Remove from the oven.\n| Drizzle the top of the pizza with a little olive oil.\n| Arrange the walnuts over the pizza and top with the crumbled [[blue cheese]].\n| [[Bake]] the [[Pizza|pizza]] until the [[Cheese|cheese]] starts to melt and bubble-this only takes a few minutes under a very hot [[Grill|grill]].\n| Keep the fist pizza warm at the bottom of the oven whilst you make the second.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with homemade [[Cole-slaw|cole-slaw]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Tastes even better than it looks</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Blue cheese and walnuts go really well together, putting them on a pizza is just genius.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Italian recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Pizza recipes]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#pizzadough #pizzastone #grill #bluecheeseandwalnutpizza #bluecheese #fineyellowcornmeal #pizzapeel #walnuts #bake #pizzas #cheese </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
