title": "Blue cheese popcorn",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Blue cheese popcorn recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#popcorn #cheesepowder #corn #tastesensation #oliveoil #bluecheesepopcorn #popped #poppingcorn #tastesensationrecipes #glass #cheesepowders \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=When I first discovered the Taste Sensation range of Cheese powders, popcorn was one of the first uses that came to mind. Good thought it was too.\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=4th February 2020\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 1\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  6 minutes\n|PrepTime =  1 minute\n|CookTime =  5 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 180\n|PortionCalories = 180\n|Image = [[Image:Blue cheese popcorn recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Weird, but tasty</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.7</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">So easy to make using cheese powder.  Not sure if you could do it with actual blue cheese :D</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nWhen I first discovered the [[Taste Sensation]] range of [[Cheese powders]], [[Popcorn|popcorn]] was one of the first uses that came to mind.  Good thought it was too.   Makes a really quick and easy, cheesy popcorn.  I imagine it would be quite difficult to achieve this flavour of popcorn without [[Cheese powder|cheese powder]]!\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1 tablespoon [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| One closed handful of [[Popping corn|popping corn]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Taste Sensation]] Blue [[Cheese powder]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Add the [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and [[Popcorn|popcorn]] to a large lidded pop -ideally one with a [[Glass|glass]] lid so you can view the progress without filling the kitchen with popcorn.\n| Pop the lid on and turn the heat to as hot as it will go.\n| Once the [[Corn|corn]] starts to pop, leave it for 1 minute and turn the heat off.\n| There should be enough residual heat in the pot to pop the remaining [[Corn|corn]] without burning it too much.\n| Add a tablespoon of [[Taste Sensation]] Blue [[Cheese powder]] to a [[Lock and Lock box]] - add the [[Popped|popped]] [[Corn|corn]], close the lid and shake well to cover the [[Popcorn|popcorn]].\n| Enjoy!\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Danish recipes]]\n[[Category:French recipes]]\n[[Category:North American recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Taste Sensation recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Popcorn recipes]]\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#popcorn #cheesepowder #corn #tastesensation #oliveoil #bluecheesepopcorn #popped #poppingcorn #tastesensationrecipes #glass #cheesepowders </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Blue cheese venison burgers on crispy garlic new potatoes",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Blue cheese venison burgers on crispy garlic new potatoes recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#burgers #newpotatoes #venison #bluecheese #tomatoes #garlic #bluecheesevenisonburgersoncrispygarlicnewpotatoes #oliveoil #potatoes #cheddar #fat \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Venison burgers topped with blue cheese, oven baked on a bed of new potatoes mixed with lots of crushed garlic. As the burgers cook, the meat juices mingle with the garlic potatoes!\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1206\n|PortionCalories = 603\n|DatePublished=9th July 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  1 hour\n|PrepTime =  5 minutes\n|CookTime =  55 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Blue cheese venison burgers on crispy garlic new potatoes recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Different!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.8</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Not the normal way to serve burgers!</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry, aka Chef]])</span></span>\n}}\nArmed with a stack of [[Venison|venison]] [[Burgers|burgers]] from [[Preston family butchers - East Kent]], I thought I would see what I could knock up with what was lying around in the kitchen.\n\nThese came up winners.  The [[Burgers|burgers]] were topped with [[Blue cheese|blue cheese]] (or mature [[Cheddar|cheddar]]), cooked on a bed of crispy [[Garlic|garlic]] [[New Potatoes|new potatoes]], with a few [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]] on the side as a nod to healthy eating.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 4 x 100 g [[Venison|venison]] [[Burger|burger]] patties (or [[Meat|meat]] of your choice)\n| 450 g [[New Potatoes|new potatoes]]\n| 4 [[Fat|fat]] bulbs of [[Garlic, peeled and crushed|garlic, peeled and crushed]]\n| 2 tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 2 tablespoons of [[Blue cheese|blue cheese]] or mature [[Cheddar|cheddar]]\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| [[Tomatoes]] to garnish\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4), [fan oven 160\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Wash the [[New Potatoes|new potatoes]], don't peel them\n| Halve them and [[Steam|steam]] or [[Boil|boil]] for about 20 minutes until soft, but not disintegrating\n| Add 2 tablespoons of olive oil to be base of a small [[Oven tray|oven tray]]\n| Distribute half of the [[Crushed garlic|crushed garlic]] over the [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and season with [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]\n| Add the cooked [[New Potatoes|new potatoes]] on crush roughly with a fork\n| Sprinkle the remaining [[Garlic|garlic]] over the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] and season again.\n| Lay the [[Venison|venison]] [[Burgers|burgers]] over the crushed [[Potatoes|potatoes]] and [[Bake|bake]] for about 30 minutes at the top of the [[Oven|oven]], turning once after 15 minutes\n| After 30 minutes, top the [[Burgers|burgers]] with [[Blue cheese|blue cheese]] and [[Grill|grill]] until the [[Cheese|cheese]] is bubbling\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Blue cheese venison burgers bubbling.jpg|300px|thumb|right|Our chosen cheeses are bubbling\nImage:Blue cheese venison burgers grilling.jpg|300px|thumb|right|Ready for the cheese\n</gallery>\n\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with sliced [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Game recipes]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n[[Category:Steamed]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#burgers #newpotatoes #venison #bluecheese #tomatoes #garlic #bluecheesevenisonburgersoncrispygarlicnewpotatoes #oliveoil #potatoes #cheddar #fat </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Boiled bacon recipe",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Boiled bacon, a British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#bacon #gammonjoint #brusselssprouts #broadbeans #cauliflower #breadcrumbs #simmer #boiledbaconrecipe #boiledbacon #greenpeas #ground \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This is how boiled bacon would have been made in Mrs Beeton's day\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 3210\n|PortionCalories = 802\n|DatePublished=17th January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 1\n |ImageComment = Other publications - circa 1945\n |TotalTime = 3 hours 30 minutes\n |PrepTime = 2 hours\n |CookTime = 1 hour 30 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:BeetonsAd.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Beeton's Bacon</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.4</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">As with most of Mrs Beeton's recipes, they are simple, but very effective, this is no exception.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis is how [[Boiled bacon|boiled bacon]] would have been made in Mrs Beeton's day.  As with most of her recipes, there is a good deal of common sense and it is still relevant today.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1.1kg [[Gammon joint|gammon joint]] (2&frac12; lb)\n| Raspings (finely [[Ground|ground]] [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]])\n| Water\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| As [[Bacon|bacon]] is frequently excessively salty ,let it be soaked in warm water for an hour or two previous to dressing it up.\n| Then pare off the rusty parts and scrape the underside and rind as clean as possible.\n| Put it into a saucepan of cold water, let it come gradually to a [[Boil|boil]] and as the scum rises to the surface of the water, remove it.\n| Let it [[Simmer|simmer]] very gently until it is thoroughly done.\n| Remove and drain, remove the skin and sprinkle with a few raspings and garnish with tufts of [[Cauliflower|cauliflower]] or [[Brussels sprouts|brussels sprouts]].\n| When served alone, young and tender [[Broad beans|broad beans]] or [[Green peas|green peas]] are the usual accompaniments.\n}}\n===Chef's notes===\nTime: 1 lb of [[Bacon|bacon]], 45 minutes; 2 lbs, 1-1&frac12; hour.\n\n{{Template:ThinkPig}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#bacon #gammonjoint #brusselssprouts #broadbeans #cauliflower #breadcrumbs #simmer #boiledbaconrecipe #boiledbacon #greenpeas #ground </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

                ]

title": "Boiled carrots",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Boiled carrots, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#carrots #boiling #butter #boiledcarrots #boil #salted #boiledorsimmered \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Simple but tasty, baby carrots won't need boiling for as long as larger sliced carrots. Adjust the cooking time to suit your taste\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 220\n|PortionCalories = 55\n|DatePublished=24th October 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime = 10 minutes \n|PrepTime = 3 minutes\n|CookTime = 7 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Carrots.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">It's boiled carrots</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Not much else to say about this</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Carla_Cancio-Bello,_J.D.,_on_behalf_of_Cuban_Cuisine_UK|Carla]] </span></span>\n}}\nSimple but tasty, baby [[carrots]] won't need [[boiling]] for as long as larger sliced [[carrots]]. Adjust the cooking time to suit your taste\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 450 g (1 lb) [[Carrots]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[butter]]\n| &#189; teaspoon [[sea salt]]\n}}\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n| '''Young carrots'''\n| Scrub the [[carrots]]\n| Drop into [[boiling]] water [[salted]] water and [[boil]] for 7 to 10 minutes depending upon your desire for crunch\n| Place in a warm bowl and toss the [[carrots]] in the [[butter]]\n| Add a pinch of [[salt]] to taste\n|'''Larger, older [[carrots]]'''\n| Peel the [[carrots]], top and tail them\n| Slice into discs about 1 cm thick\n| Drop into [[boiling]] water [[salted]] water and [[boil]] for 9 to 12 minutes depending upon your desire for crunch\n| Place in a warm bowl and toss the [[carrots]] in the [[butter]]\n| Add a pinch of [[salt]] to taste\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Carrots]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments|Carrots]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes|Carrots]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes|Carrots]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#carrots #boiling #butter #boiledcarrots #boil #salted #boiledorsimmered </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

The recommended cooking times are unbelievable\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 92\n|PortionCalories = 46\n|DatePublished=25th October 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Other publications - circa 1945\n|Servings = 450 g (1 lb) serves 2 to 3\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime = 35 minutes\n|PrepTime = 5 minutes \n|CookTime = 30 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:BeetonsAd.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Are you mad, woman?</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">2</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Crazy, or very strange carrots!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:NonLoggedInUser|NonLoggedInUser]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis recipe is here for a bit of fun.  The recommended cooking times are unbelievable.    I'm surprised that there would be anything left after boiling for an hour and a half!  This would be how to make carrot puree.  Anyway, this is how it would have been done in her day!\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| To each 4 [[pints]] water allow 1 heaped teaspoon of [[salt]]\n| &#189; lb [[carrots]] per person\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Cut off the green tops, wash and scrape the [[carrots]], and remove any black specks.\n| If the [[carrots]] are very large, cut them in halves , divide them lengthwise into four pieces and put them into [[boiling]] water, [[salted]] in the above proportion;\n| Let them [[boil]]  until tender which may be ascertained by piercing the [[carrots]] with a fork, then drain well\n| Young [[carrots]] should be [[boiled]] whole\n}}\n===Time===\n# Young [[carrots]], about half an hour\n# Old ones from 1 hour to 1 and a half hours\n\n===Sufficient===\n# Allow 1lb for 2 or 3 persons\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Carrots]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments|Carrots]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes|Carrots]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes|Carrots]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes|Carrots]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#carrots #salted #boiledorsimmered #boil #boiling #pints </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Bombay Bavette with Coriander Chickpea Mash",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Bombay Bavette with Coriander Chickpea Mash recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#onions #chickpeas #coriander #garlic #rest #bombaybavettewithcorianderchickpeamash #spice #currypowder #limes #steak #unusualrecipes \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A meaty summer steak recipe with a strong Indian influence\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 4741\n|PortionCalories = 2370\n|DatePublished=16th August 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  30 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  15 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Bombay Bavette with Coriander Chickpea Mash recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Different!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Some nice ideas here, especially the mash.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nA simple and speedy taste of summer from [[Abel & Cole]], this recipe with an [[Indian]] influence.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 2 [[bavette steaks]] (Flank steak)\n| 1 tablespoon [[Curry powder|curry powder]]\n| A few glugs of [[Oil|oil]] ([[Olive|olive]], [[Coconut oil|coconut oil]] or [[Ghee|ghee]])\n| 1 large [[Onion|onion]], thinly sliced\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground pepper|freshly ground pepper]]\n| 2 x 400g tins of [[Chickpeas|chickpeas]]\n| 2 [[Garlic|garlic]] [[Cloves|cloves]], peeled\n| 2 [[Limes|limes]]\n| A large handful of fresh [[Coriander|coriander]], finely chopped\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Remove the steaks from their pack. Set on a plate. Scatter half the [[Curry|curry]] [[Spice|spice]] over. Massage in. Gloss with a little [[Oil|oil]]. Set aside.\n| Get a large [[Frying pan|frying pan]] hot. Add enough [[Oil|oil]] to create a 1cm pool of [[Oil|oil]]. Add your sliced [[Onions|onions]] and a pinch of [[Salt|salt]]. Sizzle over medium-high heat till golden and crisp. Place a fine [[Sieve|sieve]] over a [[Glass|glass]] bowl or pan. Drain the [[Onions|onions]]. (Use the oniony oil to make a [[Salad dressing|salad dressing]] another day.)\n| Place the [[Frying pan|frying pan]] back on the heat. Once hot, add your steaks, ensuring you mop up as much of the [[Spice|spice]] and [[Oil|oil]] as possible before pressing them into the pan. Cook over medium-high heat till golden and cooked to your liking, about 3 mins on each side for medium-rare.\n| Set your cooked steaks on a cutting board to [[Rest|rest]].\n| Tumble your [[Chickpeas|chickpeas]], the juices from their tins and the [[Garlic|garlic]] into a saucepan. Cook over medium heat for 5 mins, or till warmed through. Drain.\n| Add the [[Zest|zest]] and a good squeeze of [[Juice|juice]] from your [[Limes|limes]]. Crush the [[Chickpeas|chickpeas]] with a [[Potato masher|potato masher]] or fork till you have a rough [[Mash|mash]]. Swirl in the [[Rest|rest]] of your [[Curry powder|curry powder]] and the [[Coriander|coriander]]. Taste. Season as needed. 7. Thinly slice your [[Steak|steak]].\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe on a bed of [[Chickpea mash|chickpea mash]] with the crispy [[Onions|onions]] scattered over the top.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Indian recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Beef recipes]]\n[[Category:Chilli pepper recipes]]\n[[Category:Grain and bean recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Abel and Cole veg box recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n{{Template:Abel and Cole veg box recipes attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#onions #chickpeas #coriander #garlic #rest #bombaybavettewithcorianderchickpeamash #spice #currypowder #limes #steak #unusualrecipes </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

I can thoughrougly recommend taking a peek.  Most of the ideas are relatively  simple and the last few I've tried, and modified, have been fabulous.\n\nYou can use any [[Garlic|garlic]] [[Cheese|cheese]] and this would also work well with a [[Stilton cheese]], I feel!\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 4 large [[Chicken breasts|chicken breasts]]\n| 1 tablespoon of [[Taste Sensation Chili Cheese marinade]]\n| 1 [[Boursin cheese|boursin cheese]], '[[Garlic]] and Fine [[Herbs]]', 150g\n| 2 packs of [[Prosciutto]], about 12 slices\n| 3 tablespoon [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| [[Freshly ground black pepper]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 190\u00b0 C (375\u00b0 F - gas 5), [fan oven 170\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Carefully slice the [[Chicken breasts|chicken breasts]] to make a pocket in each one to fill with [[Cheese|cheese]]\n| Lightly dust the [[Chicken|chicken]] fillets with [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n| Roll the chicken breasts in the [[Taste Sensation Chili Cheese marinade]]\n| Fill each 'pocket' with a quarter of the [[Boursin cheese]]\n| Wrap each [[Chicken breast|chicken breast]] in 3 or 4 slices of [[Prosciutto]] and secure with a [[Cocktail stick|cocktail stick]]\n| Lightly [[Spray|spray]] a [[Roasting tray|roasting tray]] with [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and place the [[Chicken breasts|chicken breasts]], pocket-side upwards on the tray\n| Drizzle with [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and [[Roast|roast]] at 190\u00b0 C for 25 minutes\n| Serve with a [[Green vegetable|green vegetable]] and [[Roast potatoes|roast potatoes]]\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Aldi Parma Ham.jpg|Parma Ham (Aldi - \u00a31.99 150 g)\nImage:Aldi Boursin Garlic and Fine Herbs cheese.jpg|Aldi also sell Boursin!\nImage:Boursin chicken fillets wrapped in Prosciutto ingredients.jpg|The chicken rolled in [[Taste Sensation Chili Cheese marinade]]\nImage:Boursin chicken fillets wrapped in bacon in silicone tray.jpg|Ready to roast\nImage:Boursin chicken fillets wrapped in bacon.jpg|Roasted after 25 minutes\n</gallery>\n===Variations===\n[[Parma ham]] and [[Prosciutto]] can be quite expensive; thin sliced [[bacon|streaky bacon]] can be just as good and much cheaper.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Poultry recipes]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#chickenbreasts #oliveoil #parmaham #Prosciutto #ham #cheese #boursincheese #boursinchickenfilletswrappedinparmaham #garlic #chickenbreast #poultryrecipes #recipes #freshlygroundblackpepper</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

#redwine #slowcooker #boil \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A proper beef stew, Ox cheeks, pigs trotters, the lot!\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=21st April 2019\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 6\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  6 hours, 30 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  6 hours, 15 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 2886\n|PortionCalories = 481\n|Image = [[Image:Bramblebee Beef stew recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Thanks Paul!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">If you don't live in Upwell, Norfolk, you might be missing out here!</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n\nA proper [[Beef|beef]] [[Stew|stew]], one that you'll need a proper butcher for!\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 2 [[Ox|ox]] cheeks, cubed [about 1.6 kg combined weight]\n| 20g [[Plain flour]]\n| Good pinch of Himalayan pink [[Sea Salt|sea salt]]\n| Good pinch of [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 20 ml [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 2 large [[Red onions|red onions]], peeled and chopped\n| 4 [[Fat|fat]] [[Garlic cloves, peeled and crushed|garlic cloves, peeled and crushed]]\n| 1 large [[Carrot|carrot]], chopped\n| 200 ml [[Red wine]]\n| 750 ml [[Chicken stock|chicken stock]]\n| 1 [[Pig|pig]]'s [[Trotter|trotter]]\n| 1 sprig of [[Thyme|thyme]]\n| 2 [[Bay leaves|bay leaves]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Sherry vinegar|sherry vinegar]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Jaggery|jaggery]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Worcestershire sauce]]\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Bramblebee Beef stew in slow cooker.jpg|Into the slow cooker for 6 hours cooking\nImage:Bramblebee Beef stew Ox cheek fried off.jpg|Ox cheek fried off\nImage:Bramblebee Beef stew most ingredients.jpg|Most of the ingredients\nImage:Bramblebee Beef stew Ox cheek and pigs trotter.jpg|Pig's trotter and 2 ox cheeks, cubed\n</gallery>\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Mix the [[Flour|flour]], [[Salt|salt]] and [[Black pepper|black pepper]] together in a [[Lock&lock box|lock&lock box]], add the cubed [[Ox|ox]] cheek, close the lid and shake like mad to coat the [[Meat|meat]].\n| Heat a [[Wok|wok]] or [[Frying pan|frying pan]] and add the [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| [[Saute]] the [[Ox|ox]] cheeks until [[Browned|browned]]\n| Remove the [[Browned|browned]] cheeks and [[Fry|fry]] the [[Carrots|carrots]] and [[Onions|onions]] for five minutes\n| Add the [[Garlic|garlic]] and [[Stir-fry|stir-fry]] until it start to colour, then immediately add the [[red wine]], stir and bring to the [[Boil|boil]]\n| Add the [[Herbs|herbs]], [[Pig|pig]]'s [[Trotter|trotter]] and [[Chicken stock|chicken stock]]\n| Bring to the [[Boil|boil]] and then remove from the heat\n| Add this mixture to your [[Slow Cooker|slow cooker]] and cook for 6 hours\n| After 6 hours, discard the [[Pigs|pigs]] [[Trotter|trotter]], sieve the gravy from the meat, leaving the meat in the cooker. In a separate pan, heat and reduce the gravy by a third so it's nice, thick and sticky.\n| Stir in the [[Worcestershire sauce]], [[Sherry vinegar|sherry vinegar]], mix it back into the meat and serve.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Broccoli|broccoli]], [[Cauliflower|cauliflower]] and [[Roast potatoes|roast potatoes]]\n===Variations===\nIf you don't have a [[Slow Cooker|slow cooker]], use a [[Casserole dish|casserole dish]], covered, in an [[Oven|oven]] heated to 120\u00b0 C (250\u00b0 F - gas \u00bd), [fan oven [[100]]\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n===Chef's notes===\nI've use some fairly specialised ingredients as I have easy access to them.\n\nEverything in this recipe can be substituted and it will still be great, for example: [[Salt|salt]], [[Pepper|pepper]], [[Beef Stock|beef stock]], [[Oxo cube|oxo cube]], any [[Vinegar|vinegar]], [[White sugar|white sugar]], omit the [[Pig|pig]]'s [[Trotter|trotter]], use [[Beef|beef]] shin, [[Diced|diced]] [[Chuck steak|chuck steak]], [[Beef short ribs|beef short ribs]] or just [[Stewing steak|stewing steak]].\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Beef recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Slow cooker recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#bramblebeebeefstew #trotter #ox #pig #oliveoil #browned #sherryvinegar #beef #redwine #slowcooker #boil </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Bramblebee Farm Scotch eggs",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Bramblebee Farm Scotch eggs\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#bramblebeefarmscotcheggs #eggs #bramblebeefarm #breadcrumbs #poppyseeds #bakingtray #miseenplace #sausagemeat #baking #greaseproofpaper #sesameseeds \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Scotch eggs made from a tube of Lincolnshire sausage meat from Bramblebee Farm and six Upwell eggs, nothing more.\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=31st March 2018\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 5\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  55 minutes\n|PrepTime =  20 minutes\n|CookTime =  35 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 1650\n|PortionCalories = 330\n|Image = [[Image:Bramblebee Farm Scotch egg recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Beautiful!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">And I know because I've tried Bramblebee's sausage meat - from Old Spot piggies. \ud83d\udc37\ud83d\udc16\ud83e\udd69\ud83e\udd53</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\n===Best to make 5 Scotch Eggs, than 6!===\nAfter making these a few time, I think it is better to use more sausage meat per egg.  It's easier to 'stuff' the egg.\n\nThe [[Bramblebee farm]] Scotch eggs are really easy to make at home - if you can't get a tube of [[Bramblebee farm]] sausage meat, you can always remove the sausage meat from normal sausages.  You'll need about 180g of meat for each Scotch egg.\n\nOnly use small or medium sized [[eggs]] or you won't have enough sausage meat to cover the Scotch eggs.\n\nThese don't need to be coated with anything providing you cook them on [[greaseproof paper]].  Or you could sit them on a patch of [[breadcrumbs]] or a square of bread.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| A tube of [[Bramblebee Farm]] Lincolnshire sausage meat - ''about 975g''.\n| 5 small or medium [[Free range eggs|free range eggs]] - '''ensure the [[Eggs|eggs]] are at least 4 days old or you will be unable to peel them easily'''.\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Add the [[Eggs|eggs]] to a pan of warm water and bring to the [[Boil|boil]].  Once the water is boiling, time the eggs for exactly 5 minutes.  Remove the pan from the heat and allow to cool.\n* Peel the [[Hard-boiled eggs|hard-boiled eggs]] using a teaspoon.  Doing this under a trickle of water sometimes makes the task a little easier.\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4), [fan oven 160\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Bramblebee Farm Scotch egg ingredients.jpg|970g tube of Bramblebee Farm Lincolnshire sausage meat [\u00a33.50 - March 2018] & six local eggs\nImage:Hard boiled eggs on sausage meat patties.jpg|Press the sausage meat out into round-ish patties and place the eggs in the middle\nImage:Forming Bramblebee Farm Scotch eggs with your hands.jpg|Form the sausage meat with your hands\nImage:Forming the Bramblebee Farm Scotch eggs with your hands.jpg|Work the meat around the egg\nImage:Bramblebee Farm Scotch eggs - ready to cook.jpg|Ready to cook\nImage:Bramblebee Farm Scotch eggs - cooked.jpg|Cooked, don't worry if they split a little, they'll still taste great\n</gallery>\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| If you are going to add any flavourings to the [[Sausage meat|sausage meat]], do this now.\n| Divide the sausage meat into 5 equal portions and press each portion into a round 'burger-type' pattie, about 13 cm [5 inches] in diameter.\n| Place a [[Hard-boiled egg|hard-boiled egg]] in the centre of the pattie and work it into a ball, ensuring there is no ''seam''.\n| Place the [[Eggs|eggs]] on o non-stick [[Baking tray|baking tray]] or a [[Baking|baking]] tray covered with [[Grease-proof paper|grease-proof paper]].\n| [[Bake]] in the [[Oven|oven]] for 35 minutes, turning once if you get the chance.\n| Allow to cool and serve.\n}}\n===Variations===\nRoll in with [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]], [[Poppy seeds|poppy seeds]] or [[Sesame seeds|sesame seeds]] before cooking.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Beef recipes]]\n[[Category:Egg recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#bramblebeefarmscotcheggs #eggs #bramblebeefarm #breadcrumbs #poppyseeds #bakingtray #miseenplace #sausagemeat #baking #greaseproofpaper #sesameseeds </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Bramblebee Old Spot pulled pork",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Bramblebee Old Spot pulled pork\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#pork #roastingtray #marinade #bramblebeefarms #pittabreads #sageleaves #foil #salad #lemon #oliveoil #apple \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Another variation on my favourite way to cook pork, this time using Bramblebee Farms Old Spot pork.\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=4th April 2019\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Finely shredding the pork in the gravy\n|Servings = Serves 8\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  16 hours\n|PrepTime =  8 hours\n|CookTime =  8 hours\n|TotalCalories = 2783\n|PortionCalories = 348\n|Image = [[Image:Bramblebee Farms Old Spot shredded in gravy.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Wonderful!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Nothing better than pulled-pork! \ud83d\udc37\ud83d\udc37\ud83d\udc37</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nAnother variation on my favourite way to cook pork, this time using [[Bramblebee Farms]] Old Spot [[pork]].  Not wanting to compromise on the pulled pork I'm not making any attempt to use the rind as crackling.\n\nThis really is best if it can [[Marinate|marinate]] for 8 hours before the cooking.  Just make sure that you plan this one well ahead.\n\nThe trick to this recipe is cooking it on a low heat for 8 hours and making sure it does not dry out.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1.2 kg [[Bramblebee farms|bramblebee farms]] Old Spot [[Pork|pork]] joint, not rolled\n}}\n====for the marinade====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 300 ml [[Guinness]]\n| 1 whole bulb of garlic, that's about 8 cloves of garlic, peeled and crushed\n| 50 ml [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 30 ml [[Worcestershire sauce]]\n| [[Juice]] of 1 [[Lemon|lemon]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Black treacle|black treacle]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Curry paste|curry paste]]\n| 3 teaspoon sweet [[Paprika|paprika]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Smoked paprika|smoked paprika]]\n| 2 [[Bay leaves|bay leaves]], crumpled\n| Bunch of [[Sage leaves|sage leaves]], picked\n| A few pinches of fresh [[Thyme leaves|thyme leaves]] \n| Good pinch of [[Salt|salt]]\n| Good pinch of [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n}}\n====for ''the bed''====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 1 [[Red onion|red onion]], peeled and sliced\n| Skin of 1 [[Lemon|lemon]] torn into pieces\n| 1 peeled, cored and sliced bramley [[Apple|apple]]\n| Bunch of [[Sage leaves|sage leaves]], picked\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Cut a few slashes in the rind so the [[Marinade|marinade]] can penetrate the [[Meat|meat]] from both sides\n* Mix the [[Marinade|marinade]] ingredients together and stir well.\n* Add to a large [[Lock&lock box|lock&lock box]] together with the unrolled [[Pork|pork]], pop the lid on, shake really well and leave in the [[Fridge|fridge]] for 8 hours or mare, shaking and inverting now and again to get an even [[Marinade|marinade]].\n\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Bramblebee Farms Old Spot slow roast pork roughly shredded.jpg|Removed from the roasting tray and roughly shredded\nImage:Bramblebee Farms Old Spot slow roast pork after seven hours.jpg|After seven hours of slow roasting\nImage:Marinaded Bramblebee Farms Old Spot slow roast pork.jpg|Marinaded and ready to slow roast\nImage:Bed for Bramblebee Farms Old Spot slow roast pork.jpg|Onion slices, apple slices and herbs make a good bed for the pork\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 140\u00b0 C (257\u00b0 F - gas 1), [fan oven 120\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour] before you begin cooking\n| Place the ''bed'' items evenly in a large [[Roasting tray|roasting tray]]\n| Join 2 large sheets of [[Tin foil|tin foil]] to make an air-tight seal so they will cover the [[Roasting tray|roasting tray]] so the joint does not dry out\n| Lay the Old Spot [[Pork|pork]] joint on top of the ''bed'', rind-side up\n| Loosely cover the [[Roasting tray|roasting tray]], rolling the [[Foil|foil]] around the edges to the [[Steam|steam]] does not escape\n| [[Roast]] for 7 hours.  [[Baste]] at least three times, replacing the [[Foil|foil]] everytime\n| After the seven hours, remove the meat from the roasting tray and place on a cutting board, remove and discard the rind and any large pieces of fat.  Roughly shred the pork.\n| From the gravy, discard the lemon, most of the onion slices and any wood herbs.  Use a potato masher to mash the apple and any remaining onion.\n| Pop the pork back into the gravy and shred more finely with a pair of forks\n| Cover and return to the oven for the final hour, then serve with as much gravy as you need\n}}\n\n===Serving suggestions===\nThis works equally well as a hot meal with [[Roast potatoes|roast potatoes]] and [[Vegetables|vegetables]] as it does warm, with a [[Salad|salad]] and [[Pitta breads|pitta breads]].\n\nCover any leftovers with the [[Gravy|gravy]] and [[Refrigerate|refrigerate]] once cooled.  This keeps it moist.  Serve with a [[Salad|salad]] and [[Pitta breads|pitta breads]] the following day after skimming any excess [[Fat|fat]] and mixing well.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Cooking with beer]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Salad recipes]]\n[[Category:Slow cooked]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#pork #roastingtray #marinade #bramblebeefarms #pittabreads #sageleaves #foil #salad #lemon #oliveoil #apple </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Branston glazed sous-vide gammon steaks",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Branston glazed sous-vide gammon steaks\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#gammonsteaks #applesauce #branstonpickle #limejuice #britishrecipes #cauliflower #vacuumbag #sousvide #branstonglazedsousvidegammonsteaks #meatrecipes #vacuumseal\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=Tried this as an experiment last night and it was so very good, I had to put the recipe down so it can be easily repeated.\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=18th October 2020\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Conventionally cooked Branston glazed gammon\n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  6 hours 5 minutes\n|PrepTime =  5 minutes\n|CookTime =  6 hours\n|TotalCalories = 1086\n|PortionCalories = 543\n|Image = [[Image:Pickle coated gammon after.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Simply delicious</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">And deliciously simple.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nTried this as an experiment last night and it was so very good, I had to put the recipe down so it can be easily repeated.  To be fair, it's not really a glaze, more of a flavouring.  The gammon was sweet all the way through and not a bit salty.\n\nThe times and temperatures are fairly flexible providing the gammon reaches the safe temperature of 62 \u00b0C (145 \u00b0F): [[Safe minimum cooking temperatures]]\n\nThe the flavourings again are also flexible.  I chose [[Branston pickle|branston pickle]] and [[Apple sauce|apple sauce]] as they were to hand - and an excellent choice though I say so myself!\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 2 x 200g [[Gammon steaks|gammon steaks]]\n| 2 tablespoons [[Branston pickle|branston pickle]]\n| 2 tablespoons [[Apple sauce]]\n| Pinch of [[Taste Sensation Lime Juice Powder]] (or teaspoons [[Lime juice|lime juice]])\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Add the [[Gammon steaks|gammon steaks]], [[Branston pickle|branston pickle]], [[Apple sauce|apple sauce]] and [[Lime juice|lime juice]] to a [[Sous Vide|sous vide]] [[Vacuum bag|vacuum bag]]\n| [[Vacuum seal]] the bag and squish the flavourings around to coat the [[Gammon steaks|gammon steaks]]\n| Cook [[Sous-vide]] for 6 hours at 67\u00b0C [152.6\u00b0F]\n| You could use the liquid for a [[Sauce|sauce]], but we found the steaks had enough flavour already.\n| Discard the liquid and serve the [[Gammon steaks|gammon steaks]]\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Roast potatoes|roast potatoes]], [[Cauliflower|cauliflower]] and [[Carrots|carrots]] and a [[Cheese sauce|cheese sauce]] to pour over the [[Vegetables|vegetables]].\n===Variations===\nThis works equally well with the standard round 125g [[gammon steaks]].\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Sous vide recipes]]\n[[Category:Sous vide cooking]]\n{{Template:Sous Vide, Smoking and Curing UK}}\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#gammonsteaks #applesauce #branstonpickle #limejuice #britishrecipes #cauliflower #vacuumbag #sousvide #branstonglazedsousvidegammonsteaks #meatrecipes #vacuumseal</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }

title": "Branston pickle recipe",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Branston pickle recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#turnips #branstonpicklerecipe #scant #jaggery #worcestershiresauce #courgettes #gherkins #coffeegrinder #onions #cornflour #maltvinegar \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Branston Pickle is made from a variety of diced vegetables, including turnips, carrots, onions, cauliflower and gherkins pickled in a sauce made from\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 3512\n|PortionCalories = 26\n|DatePublished=6th June 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Just cooked and the vegetables still retain some colour\n |Servings = Servings: 133 - Makes enough to fill a 2 litre [[Pickle|pickle]] jar.\n |Difficulty = 3\n |TotalTime = 3 hours 20 minutes\n |PrepTime = 1 hour 20 minutes\n |CookTime = 2 hours\n |Image = [[Image:Branston pickle cooked.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Best pickle recipe ever.</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I promise you this tastes like the real thing and it stays great for years.  It even looks like Branston.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nBranston Pickle is made from a variety of diced vegetables, including turnips,carrots, onions, cauliflower and gherkins pickled in a sauce made from vinegar, tomato, apple and dates with spices such as mustard, coriander, garlic, cinnamon, pepper, cloves, nutmeg and cayenne pepper.\n\nIt is sweet and spicy with a chutney-like consistency, containing small chunks of vegetables in a thick brown sticky sauce. It is commonly served as part of a ploughman's lunch, a once common menu item in British pubs. It is also frequently combined with cheddar cheese in sandwiches, and most sandwich shops in the UK offer \"cheese and pickle\" as an option. It is available in the standard 'chunky' version, though there is also a 'sandwich' variety, where the vegetable chunks are smaller and easier to spread. In recent times, Premier Foods have also brought out a 'squeezy' variety in a plastic bottle. There was also a spicy type made for a short time, but this did not prove as popular and is now hard to find. \n\nThis is a [[Branston pickle]]-type recipe.  I have adjusted the ingredient list from the common 'Internet' recipe that seems to exist everywhere.  My version is below and I can vouch for its success.  I tend to add [[chillies]] to everything I eat, pickles being no exception. If you are like-minded, you will find the chillies don't make the pickle too hot, they just add just a little bite. However, if your aim is to make a fairly authentic version of Branston pickle, I would add a [[scant]] tablespoon of mustard powder instead.\n\nTo make preparation for this recipe easy, use the ''view a printable shopping list for this recipe'' link, top right, to create your shopping list.  Remember this can take more than 3 hours to prepare and cook, so set plenty of time aside first.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 250 g [[Carrots|carrots]], peeled\n| 3 small white [[turnips]], peeled \n| 10 big [[Cloves|cloves]] of [[Garlic]], peeled and crushed\n| 1 cup [[dried apricots]], chopped\n| 1 cup [[prunes]], chopped\n| 1 cup [[raisins]]\n| 1 medium [[Cauliflower|cauliflower]]\n| 2 large [[Onions|onions]], peeled\n| 2 [[Apples|apples]], peeled and cored\n| 2 [[Courgettes|courgettes]], unpeeled\n| 15 small cocktail [[Gherkins|gherkins]], see Chef's notes\n| 225 g dark [[muscovado sugar]], [[Brown sugar|brown sugar]] or [[Jaggery|jaggery]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Sea Salt|sea salt]]\n| 60 ml [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]]\n| 350 ml [[Cider vinegar|cider vinegar]]\n| 200 ml [[Malt vinegar]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Worcestershire sauce]]\n| 2 teaspoons black [[Mustard seeds|mustard seeds]]\n| 4 small dried [[Chile de \u00c1rbol]] powdered in a [[coffee grinder]] or 1 [[scant]] tablespoon of [[mustard powder]] (''see recipe notes'') \n| 1 heaped teaspoon [[Ground allspice|ground allspice]]\n| A big grind of [[black pepper]]\n| 1 to 2 tablespoons of [[caramel colouring]] - see [[Talk:Branston_pickle_recipe#Experiments_with_colouring|comments]] page\n| 1 tablespoon of [[arrowroot powder]] \n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Chop all of the ingredients into 2.5 mm (1/8\u201d) cubes.  This is a job for your [[Mandoline|mandoline]] if you have one. A good one will slice and [[Julienne|julienne]] in one go.  \n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Branston pickle start.jpg|A very full, very big pot, right at the start\nImage:Branston pickle ingredients.jpg|The basic ingredients\nImage:Branston original.jpg|Branston Original\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| In a '''very''' large pan, mix all of the ingredients apart from the colouring and the thickening.  Don't be concerned that there appears to be very little liquid at the start.  It doesn't take long for the mixture to amalgamate.\n| Bring to the [[Boil|boil]] then reduce to a [[Simmer|simmer]], partially covered, for about 1.5 to 2 hours or until the harder ingredients, like the [[turnips]], have softened to your liking.\n| Take a ladle or so of vinegar from the pan and add to a small bowl containing the arrowroot and mix to a paste, then return it to the pan.  Add the caramel colouring and mix well.  Stir and cook for 5 minutes more then remove from the heat and allow to cool properly.\n| Bottle in [[sterilised]] jars, leaving for a month to mature in a cool, dark place.\n}}\n\nFollowing [[Talk:Branston_pickle_recipe#Colour and drying out|comments from a visitor]] regarding the pickle drying out, it may be an idea to cut circles out of [[grease-proof paper]] to lay over the surface of the pickle before finally sealing the bottles.\n===Chef's notes===\nYou could use [[cornflour]] instead of the [[arrowroot]].  I used the latter only because I had some to hand.\n\nUse 1 teaspoon of chili powder if you don't have [[Chile de \u00c1rbol]].\n\nMix the colouring very well or you will get 'darker' areas in the pickle.\n\nI am not totally convinced that it is necessary to add ''pickled'' gherkins to a recipe that is to be pickled - however, it won't do any harm.  I added a full 340g jar of small pickled gherkins with vinegar to the most recent batch I made and it tasted perfect.  I'll leave it up to you to decide.\n[[Category:Ingredients]]\n[[Category:Condiments]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Dips and sauces]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Pickles and preserves]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Pickled]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#turnips #branstonpicklerecipe #scant #jaggery #worcestershiresauce #courgettes #gherkins #coffeegrinder #onions #cornflour #maltvinegar </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Breadcrumbed curry chicken breasts",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Breadcrumbed curry chicken breasts recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#breadcrumbs #breadcrumbedcurrychickenbreasts #chickenbreasts #greekyogurt #currypaste #chicken #marinade #yogurt #sauce #frozen #panko \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A small pot of yogurt, chicken breasts, breadcrumbs, curry paste and you have a perfect simple meal\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=17th February 2017\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  12 hours, 35 minutes\n|PrepTime =  12 hours\n|CookTime =  35 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 693\n|PortionCalories = 346\n|Image = [[Image:Breadcrumbed curry chicken breasts recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Crunchy chicken/</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.7</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Can't believe how easy this is to make!</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry, aka Chef]])</span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Breadcrumbed curry chicken breasts on a rack.jpg|thumb|300px|right|On a rack, ready to be baked]]\n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}}\n\nWe had half a pot of [[Greek yogurt]] going to waste in the [[Fridge|fridge]] so I thought of an idea to use it up.  Although it looks dry without a [[Sauce|sauce]], the [[Chicken|chicken]] was so juicy that it was fine without.\n\nIf you wanted to cook the [[Marinade|marinade]] to use as a [[Sauce|sauce]], make sure it is properly cooked as it has been in contact with raw [[Chicken|chicken]].  The best way would be to put it in a dish in the [[Oven|oven]] with the chicken.\n\nI use [[Cock Brand green curry paste]] - It's brilliant because it can be [[Frozen|frozen]] so it keeps forever.  Even better, you can still [[Scoop|scoop]] out a tablespoon of paste while it is still frozen.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 250g [[Greek yogurt]]\n| 1 heaped tablespoon [[Curry paste|curry paste]]\n| 2 [[chicken breasts]]\n| 8 tablespoons of [[Panko]] [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Add the [[Yogurt|yogurt]] to a [[Lock and Lock box]], stir in the [[Curry paste|curry paste]] and mix well add the [https://www.cookipedia.co.uk/cgi-bin/cc.pl?cftk=2#jump chicken breasts] and [[Marinate|marinate]] for 12 hours or more.\n* Shake to box every few hours if you have the chance.\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4), [fan oven 160\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| After 12 hours [[Marinading|marinating]], remove the [[Chicken breasts|chicken breasts]] and allow most of the [[Marinade|marinade]] to drip off.\n| Add the [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]] to a bowl and press the [[Chicken breasts|chicken breasts]] into the breadcrumbs to coat really well.\n| [[Bake]] on a [[Grill tray|grill tray]] in the middle of the [[Oven|oven]] [ 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4) ] for 30 to 35 minutes or until the [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]] are golden [[Brown|brown]].\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Rice|rice]], [[Peas|peas]] and [[Sweetcorn|sweetcorn]].\n===Chef's notes===\nAny [[Yogurt|yogurt]] would do, we just happened to have [[Greek yogurt]] in the fridge.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Indian recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Poultry recipes]]\n[[Category:Cookery cheats]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#breadcrumbs #breadcrumbedcurrychickenbreasts #chickenbreasts #greekyogurt #currypaste #chicken #marinade #yogurt #sauce #frozen #panko </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Breaded belly of pork fingers with creamy cabbage and red wine jus",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Breaded belly of pork fingers with creamy cabbage and red wine jus recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#pork #vegetables #stock #porkbellies #redwine #tomatoes #rapeseedoil #porkbelly #breadcrumbs #panko #cup \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Chef Brian Turner cooked this recipe for Michael Buerk on the BBC2 series; My Life on Plate. It looked interesting so I thought I would make my own\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 13006\n|PortionCalories = 1625\n|DatePublished=16th November 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 8\n|Difficulty = 3\n|TotalTime =  3 hours, 55 minutes\n|PrepTime =  8 hours, 25 minutes\n|CookTime =  3 hours, 30 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Breaded belly of pork fingers with creamy cabbage and red wine gravy recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Sounds fancy, tastes brilliant</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Quite a 'fussy' recipe, but taste it and you'll be glad of the effort you made.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nChef Brian Turner cooked this recipe for Michael Buerk on the BBC2 series; My Life on  Plate.  It looked interesting so I thought I would make my own version.\n\nIt was an astounding success and will become one of my [[:Category:Favourite recipes|favourite recipes]].\n\nBasically the [[Pork belly|pork belly]] is slow [[Roasted|roasted]] in [[Vegetables|vegetables]] and half a bottle of [[Red wine|red wine]].  Then the [[Pork|pork]] belly is pressed under weights, cut into strips, [[Breaded|breaded]] and [[Pan fried|pan fried]]. The whole process is quite a palava, though definitely worth the trouble.  Because of this I decided to buy 2 [[Pork bellies|pork bellies]] and slow cook them together.  At about \u00a35.00 each it seems to make financial sense as well as time saving.  The spare pork belly has been [[Vacuum packed|vacuum packed]] and will be used to make this recipe again in the very near future.\n\nAs far as the [[Vegetables|vegetables]] are concerned, they are to flavour the [[Meat|meat]] and to enrich the [[Stock|stock]], use whatever you have handy, there is no fixed rule for what to use. They will be discarded after cooking (and  fed to our [[Chickens|chickens]] in this case)  I often [[Freeze|freeze]] unused fresh vegetables; this is an idea recipe in which to use them up.\n\nThe [[Pork belly|pork belly]], [[Cabbage|cabbage]] and [[red wine]] jus can be all be cooked beforehand finally reheated while the [[Pork|pork]] is being [[Fried|fried]].\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n}}\n====to slow cook the pork belly====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| ''use whatever similar [[Vegetables|vegetables]] you have to [[Hand|hand]]''\n| 2 kg boneless [[Pork bellies|pork bellies]], skin removed\n| 1 [[Leek|leek]], chopped into rings\n| 4 [[Cloves of garlic|cloves of garlic]], unpeeled and smashed under a knife\n| 2 sticks of [[Celery|celery]], with leaves if possible, chopped into moons\n| 2 [[Carrots|carrots]], [[Split|split]] down the middle\n| 1 [[Parsnip|parsnip]], guess, [[Split|split]] down the middle\n| Half a [[Turnip|turnip]], cut into chunks\n| A handful of [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]], halved\n| A bunch of [[Fresh herbs|fresh herbs]], [[Thyme|thyme]] and [[Sage|sage]] are good with this\n| 300 ml [[Red wine|red wine]]\n| 400 ml of [[Chicken stock|chicken stock]]\n| Splash of [[Light soy sauce|light soy sauce]]\n| Pinch of [[Chilli powder|chilli powder]]\n| A pinch of [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n}}\n==== for the breaded pork fingers====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| Half a [[Cup|cup]] of [[Plain flour|plain flour]]\n| Half a teaspoon of [[Tex-Mex seasoning]] [or whatever you fancy to give them a little lift]\n| 2 large [[Eggs|eggs]], beaten\n| 1 [[Cup|cup]] of [[Panko]] [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]]\n| [[Rapeseed oil]] for shallow [[Frying|frying]]\n}}\n====for the creamy cabbage====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 1 small [[Savoy cabbage]]\n| 300 ml pot of [[Single Cream|single cream]]\n| Freshly chopped [[Parsley|parsley]]\n| [[Salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 160\u00b0 C (32\u00b0 F - gas 3), [fan oven 140\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| [[Sautee]] the [[Leeks|leeks]] (or [[Onions|onions]]), [[Celery|celery]] and [[Garlic|garlic]] in a little [[Olive oil|olive oil]] for a few minutes\n| Add the [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]] and [[Red wine|red wine]] and heat for 3 or 4 minutes\n| Place the chopped [[Vegetables|vegetables]] in the base of a [[Roasting tray|roasting tray]], large enough to accommodate both [[Pork bellies|pork bellies]]\n| Arrange the [[Fresh herbs|fresh herbs]] over the [[Vegetables|vegetables]] and sprinkle with [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]\n| Sit the [[Pork bellies|pork bellies]], on top of the [[Vegetables|vegetables]], fatty side to the top\n| Pour the [[Wine|wine]] mixture over the [[Pork bellies|pork bellies]]\n| Pour the [[Stock|stock]] around the side of the [[Pork|pork]]\n| Cover with just enough [[Tin foil|tin foil]] to stop the [[Pork|pork]] from [[Drying|drying]] out.  Don't completely cover as you want the [[Stock|stock]] to reduce while the pork cooks\n| Slow cook in the middle of the [[Oven|oven]] for about 3 hours\n| Remove the [[Pork|pork]] and allow to cool\n| Drain the [[Stock|stock]] for later and discard the [[Vegetables|vegetables]]\n| Press the [[Pork|pork]] under a heavy weight for a few hours at least.  I used a [[Granite pizza stone|granite pizza stone]].  Hardly any liquid comes from the pork but the [[Meat|meat]] is compressed a little more\n}}\n====cooking the breaded pork fingers====\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Cut each [[Pork belly|pork belly]] into four square 'fingers'\n| Beat the 2 [[Eggs|eggs]] into a bowl and season the [[Plain flour|plain flour]] with [[Tex-Mex seasoning]] or just [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]] and add to another bowl\n| Add the [[Panko]] [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]] to a final bowl\n| Heat the [[Rapeseed oil|rapeseed oil]] in a [[Frying pan|frying pan]], meanwhile [[Bread|bread]] the [[Pork|pork]] fingers\n| Press a [[Pork|pork]] finger into the seasoned [[Flour|flour]] so it is completely covered\n| Dredge the finger through the [[Egg wash|egg wash]] and then press each side into the [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]] - don't forget the ends. repeat for all the fingers\n| [[Shallow fry]] the [[Breaded|breaded]] [[Pork|pork]] in [[Rapeseed oil|rapeseed oil]]. Cook each side until it is golden [[Brown|brown]], then turn over onto an [[Uncooked|uncooked]] edge\n}}\n====red wine jus====\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Scrape and  discard any [[Fat|fat]] from the cooled [[Stock|stock]] and press through a [[Sieve|sieve]]\n| Heat the [[Stock|stock]] in a [[Saucepan|saucepan]] and reduce by about half.\n}}\n====creamy savoy cabbage====\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Separate the leaves, remove and discard the stems from the middle of each leaf, place the leaves together and chop into strips\n| Drop into [[Boiling|boiling]] [[Salted|salted]] water and allow to return to the [[Boil|boil]], then drain\n| Plunge into a bowl of cold water to retain the colour.  Cold water does the job just as well as iced water to my mind\n| Heat the [[Single Cream|single cream]] and a knob of [[Butter|butter]] in a pan and season. Add the [[Cabbage|cabbage]] and gently heat until warmed through.  I used half of the [[Cream|cream]] in the cabbage and half in the [[Mashed potatoes|mashed potatoes]].\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Breaded belly of pork fingers bubble and squeak and red wine gravy recipe.jpg|Also nice with [[bubble and squeak]] and grilled tomatoes\nImage:Savoy cabbage plunged into cold water.jpg|[[Savoy cabbage]] plunged into cold water\nImage:Vegetables laid in roasting tray.jpg|Vegetables in the roasting tray and cooking off [[onions]], [[tomatoes]] and [[red wine]]\nImage:Skinned pork bellies sitting on the veg.jpg|Pork bellies sitting on the vegetables, fat-side up\nImage:Tomatoes and wine on pork bellies.jpg|Tomato mixture poured over the pork\nImage:Just covered with tin foil.jpg|Just covered with tin foil\nImage:Pork after slow cooking.jpg|Pork after 3 hours of slow cooking\nImage:Pork bellies after 8 hours of pressing.jpg|After 8 hours of pressing\nImage:Squared off pork fingers for breading.jpg|Squared off pork fingers ready for breading\nImage:Breading process.jpg|The breading station!\nImage:Pan frying pork fingers.jpg|Pan frying, ready for assembly\n\n</gallery>\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with creamy [[Mashed potatoes|mashed potatoes]]\n===Recipe source===\n\n* Chef Brian Turned cooked a recipe similar to this for Michael Buerk on the BBC2 series; My Life on  Plate.\n===Variations===\nThe next day we used the remaining cabbage, potatoes, onions and a small cooking apple to make [[bubble and squeak]] as a replacement for the mashed potatoes.  Grilled tomatoes finished this dish off nicely.\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Cooking with wine]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n[[Category:Slow cooked]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#pork #vegetables #stock #porkbellies #redwine #tomatoes #rapeseedoil #porkbelly #breadcrumbs #panko #cup </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Breaded chicken slices",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Breaded chicken slices recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#breadcrumbs #egg #chicken #chickenbreast #dried #breadedchickenslices #frozen #oliveoil #bread #panko #browned \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This recipe idea was passed to me by Maureen Cooper. In America this is confusingly called chicken fried steak!\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=10th November 2016\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  20 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime =  10 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 481\n|PortionCalories = 240\n|Image = [[Image:Breaded chicken slices recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Phwoar!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">This looks like it came from a high-class takeaway!</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry, aka Chef]])</span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Pan frying chicken fried steak.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Pan frying one large chicken breast, thinly sliced]]\nThis recipe idea was passed to me by Maureen Cooper. It's an economical and fairly healthy way to use one [[Chicken breast|chicken breast]] to serve two (or more) people.\n\nIn America I believe this is confusingly as ''Chicken Fried Steak''!\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 large [[Chicken breast|chicken breast]] - if you can leave it partly [[Frozen|frozen]], it slices easily.\n| 1 [[Egg|egg]], beaten\n| 6 tablespoons of [[Panko]] [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]] - or make your own from leftover stale [[Bread|bread]]\n| 1 teaspoon of [[Dried|dried]] [[Rosemary|rosemary]]\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 2 tablespoons of [[Olive oil]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Add 2 tbs of [[Olive oil|olive oil]] to a large [[Frying pan|frying pan]] and place over a medium heat\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n|  \n| One large [[Chicken breast|chicken breast]], leave part [[Frozen|frozen]] so it slices easily and neatly.  Lay the [[Chicken|chicken]] breast on a chopping board and put flat of [[Hand|hand]] on the top and carefully slice in slices just under 1cm thick.\n| Beat the [[Egg|egg]] well and pour onto a small plate\n| Mix the [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]], [[Dried|dried]] [[Rosemary leaves|rosemary leaves]], [[Salt|salt]] and [[Black pepper|black pepper]] together and tip onto another small plate.\n| One by one, [[Dip|dip]] the slices in the [[Egg|egg]] mixture and then onto the [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]], pressing down so they stick well.\n| Pop the [[Breaded|breaded]] [[Chicken|chicken]] slices into the hot pan and [[Fry|fry]] for a few minutes a side.\n| Because the [[Chicken|chicken]] is sliced so thinly, the chicken is cooked once the [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]] are [[Browned|browned]].\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Chips|chips]] and [[Salad|salad]] or [[Mashed potato]] and [[Vegetables|vegetables]].\n\nMaureen especially likes the original Bisto [[Gravy|gravy]] on hers!\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Egg recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Poultry recipes]]\n[[Category:Cookery cheats]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#breadcrumbs #egg #chicken #chickenbreast #dried #breadedchickenslices #frozen #oliveoil #bread #panko #browned </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Bread and butter pudding",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Bread and butter pudding, Egg recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#breadandbutterpudding #butter #currants #grated #bread #candiedpeel #eggs #nutmeg #cream #whitebread #zest \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Another historic recipe for using up stale bread\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2253\n|PortionCalories = 563\n|DatePublished=29th July 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4 to 6\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 55 minutes\n |PrepTime = 15 minutes\n |CookTime = 40 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Bread and butter pudding recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">If you have to</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">3</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Not a fan of this I'm afraid.  Nasty stuff, made worse by custard!</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Bread and butter pudding ready to bake.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Bread and butter pudding, ready to bake]]\nAnother historic recipe for using up stale bread.  Unlike bread pudding, with which this is sometimes confused, this is better made with stale white bread.  This tangy version is quite a bit richer than the frugal original, probably [[Mrs Beeton's bread and butter pudding]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 50 g (2 oz) [[Butter|butter]]\n| 8 slices of stale [[White bread|white bread]] from a smallish loaf\n| 50 g (2 oz) [[Currants|currants]]\n| 10 g (1/2 oz) mixed [[candied peel]]\n| [[Grated|grated]] [[Zest|zest]] from half a [[Lemon|lemon]]\n| 3 large [[Eggs|eggs]], beaten\n| 60 ml (2.5 fl oz) [[Double cream|double cream]]\n| 275 ml (10 fl oz) full [[Cream|cream]] [[Milk|milk]]\n| 50 g (2 oz) [[Caster sugar|caster sugar]]\n| Freshly [[Grated|grated]] [[Nutmeg|nutmeg]]\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4)\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Lightly grease a backing tray with [[Butter|butter]].\n| Leaving the crusts on, [[Butter|butter]] each slice of brad and cut into eight pieces.arrange a layer of [[Bread|bread]] and sprinkle with half of the [[Currants|currants]] and [[Candied peel|candied peel]].\n| Arrange the remaining [[Bread|bread]] and sprinkle with the remaining [[Currants|currants]] and peel.\n| Add the double-[[Cream|cream]] ,[[Milk|milk]], [[Sugar|sugar]], [[Lemon zest|lemon zest]] and beaten [[Eggs|eggs]] to a bowl and whisk together well.\n| Pour this mixture over the layered [[Bread|bread]], sprinkle with a little freshly [[Grated|grated]] [[Nutmeg|nutmeg]] and [[Bake|bake]] for 40 minutes.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe warm\n==See also==\n* [[Bread and butter pudding (Mum's)]]\n* [[Bread and butter pudding]]\n* [[Old fashioned spicy bread pudding]] - ''very different, but it might be what you were searching for''\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Egg recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#breadandbutterpudding #butter #currants #grated #bread #candiedpeel #eggs #nutmeg #cream #whitebread #zest </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Bread and butter pudding (Mum's)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Bread and butter pudding (Mum's) a fruit recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#bread #custard #driedfruit #butter #miseenplace #freerangeeggs #groundcinnamon #breadandbutterpuddingmums #bake #eggs #fruit \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Another recipe from Mum's scribbled cookery notes, this recipe was one of Dad's favourites too\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1039\n|PortionCalories = 259\n|DatePublished=29th July 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  1 hour\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  45 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Bread and butter pudding Mum's recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">I like this much more now!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.7</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">As a kid we HAD to eat everything and that kind of puts you off everything.</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry]] </span></span>\n}}\nAnother recipe from Mum's scribbled [[Cookery|cookery]] notes, this recipe was one of Dad's favourites too.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 4 slices of [[Wholemeal|wholemeal]] [[Bread|bread]], preferably stale\n| 25 g (1 oz) [[Butter|butter]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Muscovado sugar]] \n| 426 ml (3/4 pint) [[Whole milk|whole milk]]\n| 50 g (2 oz) [[Dried fruit]] of choice ([[Sultanas|sultanas]], [[Raisins|raisins]], [[Currants|currants]], chopped [[Dried apricots|dried apricots]], [[Cherries#Maraschino Cherries|Maraschino Cherries]])\n| 2 [[Free range eggs|free range eggs]]\n| &#188; teaspoons freshly [[Ground cinnamon|ground cinnamon]]\n| &#188; teaspoon freshly [[Grated|grated]] [[Nutmeg|nutmeg]]\n\n}}\n\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4), [fan [[Oven|oven]] 160\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Spread all of the [[Butter|butter]] evenly on the [[Bread|bread]] and cut each piece into 4\n| Place half of the [[Bread|bread]], buttered side up into the base of a 900 ml (1.5 pint) [[Oven|oven]]-proof dish\n| Layer with half of the [[Dried fruit|dried fruit]] and sprinkle with half of the [[Sugar|sugar]]\n| Repeat with the remaining [[Bread|bread]], [[Fruit|fruit]] and [[Sugar|sugar]]\n| Whisk the [[Eggs|eggs]], [[Milk|milk]] and [[Spices|spices]] into a [[Custard|custard]] and pour over the layered [[Bread|bread]]\n| [[Bake]] for 45 minutes by which time the [[Custard|custard]] should be set\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe hot\n==See also==\n* [[Bread and butter pudding (Mum's)]]\n* [[Bread and butter pudding]]\n* [[Old fashioned spicy bread pudding]] - ''very different, but it might be what you were searching for''\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#bread #custard #driedfruit #butter #miseenplace #freerangeeggs #groundcinnamon #breadandbutterpuddingmums #bake #eggs #fruit </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

#bayleaves #grated #bayleaf \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A bread sauce recipe courtesy of British Onions\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 874\n|PortionCalories = 145\n|DatePublished=17th January 2013\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|ImageComment = Making bread sauce\n |Servings = Serves 6 to 8\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 50 minutes\n |PrepTime = 10 minutes\n |CookTime =  40 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Bread sauce recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Christmas Turkey sauce</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span leaves|bay leaves]]\n| 500ml [[Milk|milk]]\n| 125g white [[Bread crumbs|bread crumbs]]\n| 4 tablespoons of [[Creme fraiche|creme fraiche]] (optional)\n| Pinch of [[Grated|grated]] [[Nutmeg|nutmeg]]\n| Maldon [[Salt|salt]] and [[Freshly ground pepper|freshly ground pepper]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Stud the [[Onion|onion]] with the [[Cloves|cloves]]. \n| Place the [[Onion|onion]], [[Garlic|garlic]], [[Milk|milk]], and [[Bay leaf|bay leaf]] in a saucepan over a moderate heat and leave it to [[Simmer|simmer]] 15 minutes then remove it from the heat and leave it to infuse for 20 minutes. \n| Strain the [[Milk|milk]] and return it to the saucepan and bring it to a [[Simmer|simmer]]. \n| Stir in the [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]] and stir it softens. \n| Remove the [[Sauce|sauce]] from the pan and stir in the [[Creme fraiche|creme fraiche]] and [[Nutmeg|nutmeg]] and seasoning. \n| Serve warm in a [[Sauce|sauce]] boat.\n}}\n==See also==\n* [[Creamy bread sauce with garlic]]''\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:British Onions recipes]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n[[Category:Dips and sauces]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n{{Template:British Onions attribution}}\n\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#breadsauce #onion #garlic
