title": "Bread with no name",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Bread with no name, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#dough #banneton #breadwithnoname #thermomix #yeast #fridge #flour #bake #sparklingmineralwater #bread #dried \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This bread doesn't have a name but someone suggested 'Elizabeth II's Bonnet Bread'! To make it, you will need a 1kg banneton, lined with a hairnet\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1592\n|PortionCalories = 159\n|DatePublished=12th April 2013\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Servings: 10 - Makes 1 loaf\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  50 minutes + resting time\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes + resting time\n|CookTime =  40 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Bread with no name recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">I would call it round bread</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">..or Bun Bread?</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:NonLoggedInUser|NonLoggedInUser]] </span></span>\n}}\n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}}\n\nThis bread doesn't have a name but someone suggested 'Elizabeth II's Bonnet [[Bread]]'!  To make it, you will need a 1kg [[Banneton|banneton]], lined with a hairnet.\n\n{{RecipeIngredientsTM\n\n| 600g very strong Canadian [[White bread|white bread]] [[Flour|flour]]\n| 370g [[Sparkling mineral water|sparkling mineral water]]\n| 7g [[Dried|dried]] fast action [[Yeast|yeast]]\n| 1&frac14; teaspoons [[Salt|salt]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Mix the [[Flour|flour]] with the cold water ([[Thermomix]] 30 seconds)\n| Leave to autolyse for 2 hours\n| Incorporate the [[Yeast|yeast]] and the [[Salt|salt]] ([[Thermomix]] 30 seconds)\n| [[Knead]] according to your chosen method ([[Thermomix]] 2 minutes, 30 seconds)\n| Shape into a ball and put into a lightly oiled bowl\n| Cover with [[Cling film|cling film]] and leave in the [[Fridge|fridge]] overnight\n| In the morning, remove the [[Dough|dough]] from the [[Fridge|fridge]] and leave at room temperature until the [[Dough|dough]] has doubled\n| Again, shape into a ball and leave until doubled in size\n| Using 150g of the [[Dough|dough]], make a plaited circle and place in the bottom of the [[Banneton|banneton]]\n| Shape the rest of the [[Dough|dough]] and put in the [[Banneton|banneton]] on the plaited circle\n| Leave to rest until doubled in size.\n| Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 230\u00ba\n| When the [[Dough|dough]] is ready, transfer to a [[Baking sheet|baking sheet]], lower the [[Oven|oven]] temperature to 220\u00ba and [[Bake|bake]] for 40 minutes.\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Thermomix recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#dough #banneton #breadwithnoname #thermomix #yeast #fridge #flour #bake #sparklingmineralwater #bread #dried </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }

title": "Breakfast waffles",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Breakfast waffles, French recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#breakfastwaffles #batter #vegetableoil #eggwhites #bakingpowder #breakfast #eggyolks #flour #griddled #miseenplace #freerangeeggs \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=These basic breakfast waffles are simple and predictable to make\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 955\n|PortionCalories = 238\n|DatePublished=5th January 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  26 minutes\n|PrepTime =  8 minutes\n|CookTime =  18 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Breakfast waffles recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Nice, but not for breakfast!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Bacon and eggs is for breakfast!!!</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\">[[User:Chef|Jerry]] </span></span>\n}}\nThese basic [[Breakfast|breakfast]] [[Waffles|waffles]] are simple and predictable to make. The [[Batter|batter]] can be made in about 15 minutes, so they are suitable as a last-minute addition to a [[Breakfast|breakfast]]. They are made fluffy by beating the [[Egg whites|egg whites]] separately and folding them in as the last step.\n\nYou may find it easier to weight the liquids as 354ml of [[Milk|milk]] is roughly 354g, etc.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 3 [[free range eggs]], separated\n| 354 ml (1.5) cups [[Milk|milk]]\n| 225g (1/2 lb) ''approx. 1 &#190; cups' [[Plain flour|plain flour]]\n| 2 teaspoons [[Baking powder|baking powder]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Sugar|sugar]]\n| &#189; teaspoon [[Salt|salt]]\n| 60 ml (1/4 cup) [[Vegetable oil|vegetable oil]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Heat the waffle maker / waffle machine / waffle [[Iron|iron]]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Mix [[Egg yolks|egg yolks]] and [[Milk|milk]].\n| Add [[Flour|flour]], [[Baking powder|baking powder]], [[Sugar|sugar]], [[Salt|salt]] and mix well.\n| Add the [[Oil|oil]].\n| Beat the [[Egg whites|egg whites]] until stiff and then fold into the [[Batter|batter]].\n| Lightly [[Spray|spray]] the non-stick plates with [[Vegetable oil|vegetable oil]].\n| Pour about 1 cup of [[Batter|batter]] into the waffle maker and close the lid.\n| Close and cook until the lights indicate the waffle is cooked or until the waffle stops steaming - about 5 minutes.\n}}\n===Recipe source===\n\n* http://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/Cookbook:Breakfast_Waffles\n==See also==\n\n* {{SeeAlso-Waffles}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Belgian recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:French recipes]]\n[[Category:North American recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Breakfast recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Grilled, griddled or barbecued]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#breakfastwaffles #batter #vegetableoil #eggwhites #bakingpowder #breakfast #eggyolks #flour #griddled #miseenplace #freerangeeggs </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Brie fondue encounter",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Brie fondue encounter a cheese recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#brie #asparagus #briefondueencounter #dip #images #oliveoil #fondue #roastingtray #unusualrecipes #foil #freshlygroundpepper \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This starry dippity-dip-dip of a Brief Encounter, with Hollywoody asparagus, will make you so very happy\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2621\n|PortionCalories = 655\n|DatePublished=23rd May 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  25 minutes\n|PrepTime =  5 minutes\n|CookTime =  20 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Brie fondue encounter recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Gluttony!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Pure gluttony, and all the better for it!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis starry [[Dip|dip]]pity-[[Dip|dip]]-dip of a Brief Encounter, with Hollywoody [[Asparagus|asparagus]], will make you so very happy.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 150g Godminster [[Black pepper|black pepper]] [[Brie|brie]]\n| A bundle of [[Asparagus|asparagus]] (or swap for your favourite [[Fondue|fondue]] veg) ''see Serving suggestions''\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground pepper|freshly ground pepper]]\n| A little [[Olive oil|olive oil]] (optional)\n| 1 small warmed loaf of [[Bread|bread]] , to serve (optional)\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Heat the [[Oven|oven]] to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6), [fan [[Oven|oven]] 180\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Unwrap your [[Brie|brie]]. Line a little [[Roasting tray|roasting tray]] with [[Greaseproof paper|greaseproof paper]] or [[Foil|foil]]. Plonk your [[Brie|brie]] on top.\n| Pop in the [[Oven|oven]]. [[Roast]] 15-20 mins or till starting to colour a little on the top.\n| Get a large [[Frying pan|frying pan]] hot. Trim the woody ends from your [[Asparagus|asparagus]]. Rinse. Add them to the hot, [[Smoking|smoking]] pan while there i\u0092s still water clinging to them.\n| [[Griddle]] the [[Asparagus|asparagus]] (no [[Oil|oil]] needed) till just tender. Season with a little [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]. Gloss with a trickle of [[Oil|oil]], once cooked, if you like.\n| Remove the [[Brie|brie]] from the [[Oven|oven]]. Carefully cut the lid off. Remove. Scatter a little [[Pepper|pepper]] over, if you like. Use the asparagus as edible spoons.\n}}\n===Serve with===\n*Steamed Jersey Royals are brilliant dunked in (use a fork to save your fingers), as are griddled broccoli florets.\n==See also==\n\n* [[Cheese fondue recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:French recipes]]\n[[Category:Dips and sauces]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Abel and Cole veg box recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n{{Template:Abel and Cole veg box recipes attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#brie #asparagus #briefondueencounter #dip #images #oliveoil #fondue #roastingtray #unusualrecipes #foil #freshlygroundpepper </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "British onion soup with Welsh rarebit toasts",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=British onion soup with Welsh rarebit toasts recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#ale #britishonionsoupwithwelshrarebittoasts #cheese #grill #butter #mustard #onions #soup #worcestershiresauce #grilled #oliveoil \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This onion soup recipe is reproduced courtesy of British Onions\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 7205\n|PortionCalories = 1801\n|DatePublished=17th January 2013\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 1 hour 50 minutes\n |PrepTime = 20 minutes\n |CookTime = 1 hour 30 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:British onion soup with Welsh rarebit toasts recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Even better with some garlic!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.8</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">A handful of crushed garlic cloves makes this even nicer!</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\">[[User:Chef|Jerry]] </span></span>\n}}\n\nThis [[onion]] soup recipe is reproduced courtesy of British Onions.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1 tablespoon [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 2 tablespoons [[Butter|butter]]\n| 1 kg British [[Onions|onions]], finely sliced\n| A few sprigs of [[Thyme|thyme]]\n| 2 [[Bay leaves|bay leaves]]\n| 300ml dark [[Ale|ale]]\n| 1 litre [[Beef Stock|beef stock]], fresh if you can get it\n}}\n'''For the Welsh rarebit toasts'''\n* 100g mature [[Cheddar|cheddar]]\n* &frac12; teaspoon British [[Mustard|mustard]]\n* &frac12; [[Egg yolk|egg yolk]]\n* A couple of dashes of [[Worcestershire sauce]]\n* 1 tablespoon dark [[Ale|ale]]\n* [[Salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]\n* 8 slices of [[Sourdough|sourdough]] or white [[Baguette|baguette]]\n\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Heat the [[Oil|oil]] and [[Butter|butter]] in a large heavy bottomed pan. \n| Add the [[Onions|onions]] and cook on a really low heat, uncovered for 40 minutes or until the onions are sticky and caramelized. \n| Pour over the [[Ale|ale]] and reduce by half. \n| Add the [[Stock|stock]] and bring to the [[Boil|boil]]. \n| Cook for 30 minutes.\n| Heat the [[Grill|grill]] on high. \n| To make the Welsh rarebit toasts, mix together the [[Cheese|cheese]], [[Mustard|mustard]], [[Egg|egg]], [[Worcestershire sauce]], [[Ale|ale]] and [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]. \n| [[Grill]] the slices of [[Bread|bread]] on one side. \n| Sprinkle the [[Cheese|cheese]] mixture between each of the toasts on the un-[[Toasted|toasted]] side.\n| Pour the [[Soups|soups]] between 4 bowls. \n| Lay 2 of the rarebits on top of each of the bowls of [[Soup|soup]] then [[Grill|grill]] for 1-2 minutes or until the [[Cheese|cheese]] is melting. \n| Serve the [[Soup|soup]] immediately.\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Soup and stock recipes]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:British Onions recipes]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n[[Category:Grilled, griddled or barbecued]]\n{{Template:British Onions attribution}}\n\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#ale #britishonionsoupwithwelshrarebittoasts #cheese #grill #butter #mustard #onions #soup #worcestershiresauce #grilled #oliveoil </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }

title": "Broccoli, chilli, orange Soup",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Broccoli, chilli, orange Soup a gluten free recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#stock #potato #broccolichilliorangesoup #juice #onion #broccoli #chilli #garlic #oliveoil #orange #unusualrecipes \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A zingy way to warm up your greens\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 603\n|PortionCalories = 150\n|DatePublished=23rd May 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  35 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  20 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Broccoli, chilli, orange Soup recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Gorgeous!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Blooming love this!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:NonLoggedInUser|NonLoggedInUser]] </span></span>\n}}\nA zingy way to warm up your [[Greens|greens]]\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 500ml veg [[Stock|stock]]\n| 1 floury [[Potato|potato]], peeled and [[Diced|diced]]\n| A splash of [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 1 [[Onion|onion]], finely chopped\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground pepper|freshly ground pepper]]\n| 2 [[Garlic|garlic]] [[Cloves|cloves]], finely chopped\n| \u00bd [[Red chilli|red chilli]], finely chopped (more or less, to taste)\n| 1 [[Orange|orange]], [[Zest|zest]] and [[Juice|juice]]\n| 1 head of [[Broccoli|broccoli]], finely chopped\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Bring your [[Stock|stock]] to the [[Boil|boil]]. Add the [[Potato|potato]]. Lower heat to a rolling [[Simmer|simmer]]. Add a splash of [[Oil|oil]] to a hot [[Frying pan|frying pan]]. Add the [[Onion|onion]] in with a pinch of [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]. Lower heat.\n| Sizzle till tender. Mix in the [[Garlic|garlic]] and [[Chilli|chilli]]. Cook till softened. Add the [[Orange zest|orange zest]] and [[Juice|juice]]. Let the [[Juice|juice]] reduce down till it\u0092s almost a sticky glaze. Take off heat.\n| When the [[Potato|potato]]\u0092s cooked, add the [[Broccoli|broccoli]] to the pot. Cook till just tender.\n| Spoon a bit of [[Stock|stock]] into the orangey/[[Onion|onion]] pan to loosen the mix. Pop it in a [[Food processor|food processor]], along with the [[Broccoli|broccoli]], [[Potato|potato]] and most of the [[Stock|stock]]. Whizz till smooth. Add more stock as needed to reach desired consistency.\n| Taste. Add more [[Orange|orange]] or [[Chilli|chilli]], if you like.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nDelicious with a few [[Almonds|almonds]] [[Fried|fried]] in a little [[Olive oil|olive oil]] scattered on top.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Soup and stock recipes]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Gluten free recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Abel and Cole veg box recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n{{Template:Abel and Cole veg box recipes attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#stock #potato #broccolichilliorangesoup #juice #onion #broccoli #chilli #garlic #oliveoil #orange #unusualrecipes </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

If you were having this alone, then maybe\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| &#189; pint of [[Cheese sauce|cheese sauce]]\n| 300 g (11 oz) [[broccoli]] and [[cauliflower]], trimmed and cut to florets.  Most supermarkets sell these ready prepared, lazy and handy!\n| [[Nutmeg]] (optional)\n| Salt and [[freshly ground black pepper]] to taste\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Cut an x in the base of any thick stalks so they cook evenly\n| Add the [[broccoli]] and cauliflower to a large pan of boiling, lightly salted water and simmer hard for about 10 minutes, depending how you prefer your vegetables cooked\n| Meanwhile make the [[Cheese sauce|cheese sauce as shown here]]\n| Drain the broccoli and cauliflower and pour the [[cheese sauce]] over the vegetables, mixing well\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\n\nServe hot, sprinkled with [[nutmeg|grated nutmeg]] if liked\n\n===Variations===\n\nTop with a little extra [[cheese]] and brown under a [[grill]]\n==See also==\n* [[Baby cauliflower cheese]]\n* [[Basic white sauce]]\n* [[Cheese sauce]]\n* [[Heston Blumenthal's perfect cauliflower cheese recipe]]\n* [[Mornay sauce]]\n* [http://www.bbc.co.uk/food/cauliflower_cheese BBC - cauliflower_cheese recipes]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Cheese]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments|Cheese]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses|Cheese]]\n[[Category:Starters|Cheese]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes|Cheese]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes|Cheese]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Student recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#broccoliandcauliflowercheese #cheesesauce #nutmeg #broccoli #cauliflower #babycauliflowercheese #boiledorsimmered #cheese #grill #mornaysauce #basicwhitesauce </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Brown shrimp, peas and pasta",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Brown shrimp, peas and pasta a British recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#butter #garlic #brownshrimppeasandpasta #boiling #tagliatelle #pasta #lemonjuice #homemadepasta #lemon #pastamachine #unusualrecipes \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This Brown shrimp, peas and pasta recipe is surprisingly good\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2811\n|PortionCalories = 702\n|DatePublished=25th October 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = The hard to find, [[Prawns#Brown_shrimp|brown shrimp]]\n |Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 15 minutes\n |PrepTime = 5 minutes\n |CookTime = 10 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Brown shrimp.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Superb</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Just that I find it hard to buy these shrimp in the UK :(</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Sue_spins|Susie]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis recipe is surprisingly good.  The [[mint]] seems an odd herb to accompany [[seafood]] and [[Garlic|garlic]] but it worked really well.\n\nUse the small peeled [[Prawns#Brown_shrimp|Brown shrimp]] that are more often sold by specialist [[Suppliers|suppliers]], sea-front stalls and fishmongers than they are in supermarkets.  Well worth hunting out.\n  \nHome made [[Pasta|pasta]] is the best to go with this dish. Do try it, you don't even need a [[Pasta machine|pasta machine]].  Just roll it our flat and cut into rough strips with a knife.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 2 portions of [[Home made pasta]] or fresh pasta, rolled flat and cut into rough rustic strips\n| ''OR'' 300g [[Dried|dried]] [[Tagliatelle|tagliatelle]]\n| 300g small [[Prawns#Brown_shrimp|brown shrimp]]\n| 500 g [[Frozen peas|frozen peas]]\n| 4 cloves of [[Garlic]], peeled and crushed\n| 2 tablespoons finely chopped [[Mint leaves|mint leaves]]\n| [[Juice]] from 1 [[Lemon|lemon]]\n| 3 tablespoons of [[butter]] or a mixture of [[butter]] and [[olive oil]] for the more health conscious. \n| [[Salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Melt half of the [[Butter|butter]] in a pan, add the [[Garlic|garlic]] and gently saut\u00e9 until soft, don't allow it to burn or colour.\n| Add the [[Prawns#Brown_shrimp|shrimps]], half of the [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]] and season with [[Salt|salt]], [[Pepper|pepper]]. Stir well to mix and then remove from the heat.\n| Meanwhile cook the [[Peas|peas]] until tender, either by microwaving or [[Boiling|boiling]] - about 4 minutes\n| Cook the [[Tagliatelle|tagliatelle]] in salted [[Boiling|boiling]] water until [[Al dente|al dente]]\n| Drain the [[Pasta|pasta]] and add to the [[Prawns#Brown_shrimp|shrimps]], Stir in the remaining [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]], [[Butter|butter]] and peas. Mix well, season and serve.\n}}\n\n{{Template:YoutubePastaDough}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Pasta recipes]]\n[[Category:Shellfish recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#butter #garlic #brownshrimppeasandpasta #boiling #tagliatelle #pasta #lemonjuice #homemadepasta #lemon #pastamachine #unusualrecipes </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }

title": "Bubble and carrot squeak",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Bubble and carrot squeaky, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#potatoes #bubbleandcarrotsqueak #onions #eggrings #bubbleandsqueak #panfried #carrot #savoycabbage #rapeseedoil #juliennepeeler #salted \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Bubble and squeak (and carrots), an English dish made with the shallow-fried leftover vegetables.\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 480\n|PortionCalories = 240\n|DatePublished=16th November 2016\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Carrots and mustard seeds make a nice change\n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime = 1 hour\n|PrepTime = 10 minutes\n|CookTime = 35 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Bubble and carrot squeak recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Squeaky carrots?</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.6</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I had no idea they could squeak. :D</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis version of [[Bubble and squeak]] is Anne's favourite, odd for someone that won't normally eat her vegetables.  The special addition to this recipe are added carrots and mustard seeds.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 300g (10 oz) [[Potatoes|potatoes]], unpeeled (Nadine - Saxon - Wilja - Desiree - King Edward) \n| 10 [[savoy cabbage]] leaves\n| 1 medium carrot\n| 2 tablespoons [[Rapeseed oil]]\n| Pinch of [[freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 1 tablespoon of black mustard seeds\n| 1 [[Onion|onion]], peeled and chopped\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| [[Boil]] the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] in their skins, in lightly [[Salted|salted]] water for 25 minutes, drain, rub the skins off and chop into cubes\n| Using a [[Potato ricer|potato ricer]] or [[Mash|mash]]er, mash the [[Potatoes|potatoes]], season to taste with [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]\n| Remove the centre stems of the cabbage leaves and discard. Roll up the cabbage leaves and chop finely.\n| If you have a [[julienne peeler]], use that to turn your carrot into julienne strips. If not then grate roughly with a [[cheese grater]]\n| Add the cabbage and carrot to a small pan of boiling water. Bring the pan back to the boil and boil for 3 minutes.\n| At this stage, if you want to keep the bright green colour, plunge the cooked cabbage into cold water until you're ready to cook the squeak.\n| Heat 2 tablespoons of [[Oil|oil]] in a [[Frying pan|frying pan]] or [[wok]] and add a good pinch of black pepper\n| Gently fry the [[onions]] for 4 minutes\n| Leaving as much [[Oil|oil]] in the pan as you can, remove the [[Onions|onions]] and mix in with the [[Potato|potato]], [[carrot]] and [[Cabbage|cabbage]] mixture and sprinkle with [[mustard seeds]]\n| Add a little more oil to the onion frying pan. Spread the mixture evenly over the pan and turn up the heat. Fry for about 6 minutes, turning and mixing every minute so you get a nice crispy finish.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\n\nServe hot. If presentation is important, at the serving stage, use [[egg rings]] to mould the squeak into neat rounds - it;s much easier than trying to cook them in [[egg rings]] or [[silicone rings]].\n\n==See also==\n*[[Bubble and squeak]]\n*[[Squash, bubble and squeak|Squash, bubble and squeak recipe]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Student recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#potatoes #bubbleandcarrotsqueak #onions #eggrings #bubbleandsqueak #panfried #carrot #savoycabbage #rapeseedoil #juliennepeeler #salted </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Bubble and squeak",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Bubble and squeak, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#bubbleandsqueak #cabbage #potatoes #butter #potato #fry #vegetables #onion #fried #springonions #potatoricer \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Bubble and squeak (sometimes known as bubble or bubble and scrape) is a traditional English dish made with the shallow-fried leftover vegetables from\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1026\n|PortionCalories = 256\n|DatePublished=23rd October 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Bubble and squeak with chops and peas\n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime = 1 hour\n|PrepTime = 15 minutes\n|CookTime = 45 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Bubble and squeak recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Mum's was the best</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">In the post war austerity days of the 1960's, we had this at least once a week - Yummy.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n'''Bubble and squeak''' (sometimes known as '''bubble''' or '''bubble and scrape''') is a traditional English dish made with the shallow-[[Fried|fried]] leftover [[Vegetables|vegetables]] from a roast dinner. The chief ingredients are [[Potato|potato]] and [[Cabbage|cabbage]], but [[Carrots|carrots]], [[Peas|peas]], [[Brussels sprouts]], and other [[Vegetables|vegetables]] can be added.\n\nThe name probably comes from the sound the [[cabbage]] makes whilst this dish is being [[fried]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 450 g (1 lb) [[Potatoes|potatoes]], unpeeled (Nadine - Saxon - Wilja - Desiree - King Edward) \n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 70 g (2.5 oz) [[Butter|butter]]\n| 250 g (8 oz) [[Cabbage|cabbage]], [[Shredded|shredded]]\n| 3 tablespoons water\n| 3-4 tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 1 [[Onion|onion]], chopped\n| 2 [[Spring onions|spring onions]], chopped (optional)\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| [[Boil]] the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] in their skins, in lightly [[Salted|salted]] water for 25 minutes, drain, rub the skins off and chop into cubes\n| Using a [[Potato ricer|potato ricer]] or [[Mash|mash]]er, mash the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] with 55 g (2 oz) of the [[Butter|butter]], season to taste with [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]\n| Meanwhile, place the [[Cabbage|cabbage]], 3 tablespoons water and the remaining 15 g (1/2 oz) [[Butter|butter]] in a large heavy based pan, cover and gently cook for 10 minutes, or until tender\n| Mix the [[Mashed potato|mashed potato]] and [[Cabbage|cabbage]]\n| Heat half the [[Oil|oil]] in a [[Frying pan|frying pan]] and add the [[Onion|onion]] and [[Fry|fry]] gently until softened, about 4 minutes\n| Leaving as much [[Oil|oil]] in the pan as you can, remove the [[Onions|onions]] and mix in with the [[Potato|potato]] and [[Cabbage|cabbage]] mixture\n| If using [[Spring onions|spring onions]], mix them into the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] now\n| Make flat patties with the [[Potato|potato]] mix and [[Fry|fry]] for 15 minutes on one side\n| Add the remaining [[Oil|oil]], flip the patties over and [[Fry|fry]] for a further 10 minutes\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Bubble and squeak frying.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Bubble and scrape, frying\nImage:Bubble and scrape.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Mashed and mixed, ready to fry\n</gallery>\n\n===Serving suggestions===\n\nServe hot\n\n===Chef's note===\n\nYou can fry these as separate 'patties' or as pictured, as one large ''tortilla''.  If you're careful, you can flip it to cook both sides, I prefer just to stir it up now and then to ensure that you get lots of the lovely crispy caramelised surfaces.\n\n===Variations===\n\nUse left over [[Vegetables|vegetables]] instead of cooking afresh.\n\nUse [[Squash mash]] for the potatoes.\n\n==See also==\n\n[[Squash, bubble and squeak|Squash, bubble and squeak recipe]]\n[[Bubble and carrot squeak]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Student recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#bubbleandsqueak #cabbage #potatoes #butter #potato #fry #vegetables #onion #fried #springonions #potatoricer </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Butternut squash pisto",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Butternut squash pisto recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#butternutsquash #squash #pinenuts #cuminseeds #bayleaves #sieve #port #onions #nutmeg #butternutsquashpisto #oliveoil \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Pisto is the Spanish equivalent of ratatouille. This vegetarian pesto is made with butternut squash, always available at this festive time\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 810\n|PortionCalories = 202\n|DatePublished=3rd January 2015\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  1 hour, 15 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  1 hour\n|Image = [[Image:Butternut squash pisto.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Vegalicious!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Top marks Julia - A lovely vegetarian meal which we really enjoyed making.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nPisto is the [[Spanish]] equivalent of [[Ratatouille|ratatouille]].  This [[Vegetarian|vegetarian]] [[Pesto|pesto]] is made with [[Butternut squash|butternut squash]], always available at this festive time of year.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1.2 kg [[Butternut squash|butternut squash]], peeled and chopped into 2cm pieces - about 800g once prepared\n| 1 teaspoon of [[Old India Taco Seasoning]]\n| 6 tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| A good pinch of [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 3 medium [[Onions|onions]], peeled and chopped\n| 1 [[Red pepper|red pepper]], deseeded, halved and cut into rings\n| 2 [[Green Indian chillies|green indian chillies]], thinly sliced, deseeded if you wish\n| 1 large [[Sprig of rosemary|sprig of rosemary]], left whole\n| 4 freshly picked [[Bay leaves|bay leaves]]\n| 3 [[Cloves of garlic|cloves of garlic]], peeled and thinly sliced\n| 1 teaspoon [[Mexican oregano]]\n| A pinch of [[Cumin seeds|cumin seeds]]\n| A pinch of freshly [[Grated|grated]] [[Nutmeg|nutmeg]]\n| 180ml [[Passata|passata]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Port|port]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Sherry vinegar|sherry vinegar]]\n}}\n''' to garnish'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 2 tablespoons [[Pine nuts|pine nuts]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Pop the [[Butternut squash|butternut squash]] chunks into a [[Sieve|sieve]] and dust with the [[Old India Taco Seasoning]], set to one side.\n| Add the [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]] to a large [[Frying pan|frying pan]] or even a [[Wok|wok]].\n| Add the [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and gently saut\u00e9 the [[Onions|onions]] for 15 minutes.\n| Add the sliced [[Red pepper|red pepper]] and [[Fry|fry]] for 10 minutes.\n| Now to liven it up; add the sliced [[Chillies|chillies]], [[Cumin seeds|cumin seeds]], [[Bay leaves|bay leaves]], whole [[Sprig of rosemary|sprig of rosemary]] and finally the [[Garlic|garlic]] slices.  [[Stir-fry]] these for a few minutes.\n| Give the [[Sieve|sieve]] of [[Butternut squash|butternut squash]] a shake to remove any liquid that may have leached out and add the [[Squash|squash]] to the pan.\n| Very gently saut\u00e9 the [[Squash|squash]] for 20 minutes, turning regularly.\n| After 20 minutes add the [[Passata|passata]], [[Port|port]], [[Sherry vinegar|sherry vinegar]], [[Mexican oregano]], and a grate of [[Nutmeg|nutmeg]] and heat for the final 10 minutes.\n| Remove the stem of the [[rosemary]] sprig and serve.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe garnished with [[Toasted|toasted]] [[Pine nuts|pine nuts]]\n===Chef's notes===\nIf you don't have [[Old India Taco Seasoning]], a pinch of [[Salt|salt]] and &#189; teaspoon of unsmoked [[Paprika]] will work just as well.\n{{Template:Pisto recipes}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Mexican recipes]]\n[[Category:Spanish recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Squash recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#butternutsquash #squash #pinenuts #cuminseeds #bayleaves #sieve #port #onions #nutmeg #butternutsquashpisto #oliveoil </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Butterscotch",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Butterscotch, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#butterscotch #butter #creamoftartar #lemonjuice #sugarthermometer #boil #bakingtray #hardcrackstage #vanillaessence #softcrackstage #jam \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Butterscotch is a type of confectionery made by boiling sugar syrup, butter, cream, and vanilla\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1038\n|PortionCalories = 34\n|DatePublished=20th January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Servings: 30 - Make 450 g (1 lb of butterscotch)\n |Difficulty = 3\n |TotalTime = 50 minutes\n |PrepTime = 20 minutes\n |CookTime = 30 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Butterscotch recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n}}\n\nButterscotch is a type of confectionery made by boiling sugar syrup, butter, cream, and vanilla. The ingredients for butterscotch are similar to toffee; the major difference is that the sugar is boiled to the [[soft crack stage]] for butterscotch and the [[hard crack stage]] for toffee. Butterscotch sauce is often made into a syrup, which is used as a topping for ice cream (particularly sundaes).\n\nA [[Jam|jam]] making or [[sugar thermometer]] is required for this recipe.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 450 g (1 lb) of [[Granulated sugar|granulated sugar]]\n| 150 ml (1/4 pint) of water\n| 90 g (3 oz) [[Butter|butter]], preferably unsalted\n| 1 teaspoon [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]]\n| &#188; teaspoon [[Cream of tartar|cream of tartar]]\n| &#188; teaspoon [[vanilla essence]] or [[vanilla extract]]\n| A little [[Oil|oil]] for greasing\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Grease a shallow 28 cm x 18 cm (11\" x 7\") [[baking tray]]\n| Add the water and [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]] to a heavy-based pan and warm on a low heat\n| Add the [[Sugar|sugar]] and stir until it has completely dissolved.  Don't allow it to [[Boil|boil]]!\n| Mix in the [[Cream of tartar|cream of tartar]]\n| Heat to 115\u00b0 C (239\u00b0 F) then immediately remove from the heat\n| Add the [[Butter|butter]] and mix well\n| Return to the heat and heat to 138\u00b0 C (280\u00b0 F)\n| Remove from the heat and mix in the [[Vanilla|vanilla]] essence\n| Pour into the greased tray and leave to set.  Before the butterscotch cools completely, score it into bite-sized squares\n| When it is totally cold you can snap it into pieces\n| Store in an airtight container\n}}<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Yumm!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Just make certain that your fillings are in good nick. :D</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n\n\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#butterscotch #butter #creamoftartar #lemonjuice #sugarthermometer #boil #bakingtray #hardcrackstage #vanillaessence #softcrackstage #jam </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Buttery kedgeree",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Buttery kedgeree, Indian recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#butterykedgeree #butter #blackpepper #parsley #lemon #chives #currypaste #eggs #unusualrecipes #onions #measuringjug \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A wonderful mix of Asian and English flavours that originated amongst the British colonials in India. Then it was commonly eaten at breakfast time\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2080\n|PortionCalories = 520\n|DatePublished=15th August 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|ImageComment = Buttery kedgeree with [[asparagus]]\n|TotalTime = 50 minutes\n|PrepTime = 15 minutes\n|CookTime = 35 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Buttery kedgeree dish.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Anne's favourite</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I get Brownie points every time I make this for her.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Buttery kedgeree recipe.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Ingredients for buttery kedgeree]]\nA wonderful mix of Asian and English flavours that originated amongst the British colonials in India.  Then it was commonly eaten at breakfast time. It's a bit much for breakfast but it makes a superb evening meal. This recipe is based on Delia Smith's famous buttery kedgeree recipe.\n\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 225 ml [[basmati rice]]\n| 450 ml of the water that the fish was cooked in\n| 700g [[smoked haddock]], [[smoked basa]] or [[hoki]] fillets\n| 110g [[butter]]\n| 1 [[onion]], chopped finely\n| &#189; to &#190; teaspoon [[harissa paste]], [[curry powder]] or [[curry paste]] ( vindaloo paste gives a unique flavour for the hot-heads!)\n| 4 hard boiled [[eggs]], peeled and quartered\n| 4 tablespoons chopped [[parsley]]\n| Juice of 1 [[lime]] or [[lemon]]\n| Sea [[salt]] and freshly ground [[black pepper]]\n| 1 tablespoon chopped [[chives]] to garnish\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Rinse the rice in a sieve for 1 minute under cold running water to remove the excess starch and leave in a colander to drain\n| Put the fish fillets in a pan and cover with 570 ml cold water.  You can leave the skins on as they will fall off later anyway\n| Bring the fish to the boil and simmer for 8 minutes\n| Reserve 450ml of the haddock water in a [[measuring jug]]\n| Place the [[haddock]] in a covered bowl and keep warm\n| Using the same pan, melt 55g of the [[butter]] and soften the [[onions]] for 6 minutes.  Don't brown them\n| Mix in the [[curry paste]] and cook for a few seconds, stirring well\n| Stir in the rice and add the reserved haddock water\n| Once it reaches a simmer, give it a quick stir to lift any rice that has stuck to the base of the pan, cover with a layer of [[tin foil]] and then put on the pan lid so you have a really good seal\n| Simmer for 15 minutes then remove from the heat\n| Remove the skin from the fish and flake it into the rice using a fork\n| Add the hard boiled eggs, remaining [[butter]], [[parsley]], [[lemon]] juice and season with [[salt]] and [[black pepper]]\n| Cover the pan with tin foil, replace the lid and gently heat for 5 minutes.  Don't be tempted to stir it or lift the lid until then\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\n\nGarnish with chopped [[chives]] and serve immediately.\n\n===Chef's note===\n\nIf you and your partner both cook, this recipe, a glass of wine and some good music is a great way to spend some time together.\n\n==See also==\n\nA baked version with garlic and chili, [[Salmon kedgeree]] and [['Greasy spoon' kedgeree]] which speaks for itself.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Kedgeree]]\n[[Category:Breakfast recipes]]\n[[Category:Fish recipes|Kedgeree]]\n[[Category:Sea fish recipes|Kedgeree]]\n[[Category:Indian recipes|Kedgeree]]\n[[Category:Main courses|Kedgeree]]\n[[Category:Rice recipes|Kedgeree]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes|Kedgeree]]\n[[Category:British recipes|Kedgeree]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes|Kedgeree]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]][[Category:Poached]]\n\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#butterykedgeree #butter #blackpepper #parsley #lemon #chives #currypaste #eggs #unusualrecipes #onions #measuringjug </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Cabbage surprise",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Cabbage surprise\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#cabbage #leeks #potato #oliveoil #potatoes #smokedpaprika #dry #chickenstock #sauce #meatballs #cabbagesurprise\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=CV19 / Coronavirus lock-down period, in order to avoid trips to the supermarket use locally sourced food items\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=1st April 2020\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = A version with added bacon lardons\n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  1 hour, 50 minutes\n|PrepTime =  20 minutes\n|CookTime =  1 hour, 30 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 1425\n|PortionCalories = 712\n|Image = [[Image:Cabbage surprise recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">This is still tasty</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.1</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">..even after nearly a year in Lockdown!</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry, aka Chef]])</span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Taste Sensation Smokey BBQ & Apple sauce Mix.jpg|thumb|300px|right|My sample packet of [[Taste Sensation Smokey BBQ & Apple sauce Mix]]]]\n\nIn this CV19 / Coronavirus lock-down period, in order to avoid trips to the supermarket which risk public contact, we are attempting to use locally available produce and items we already have in the store cupboards and the [[Freezer|freezer]].  In our village we are fortunate to have a number of stalls selling locally grown fruit and vegetables, only a 5 minute cycle ride away.\n\nAlthough, as the name might imply, it started as a bit of a joke, but it was so good, I'm committing it to a recipe and making it again.\n\nI appreciate most people probably won't have exactly the same powdered flavourings that we have available from our fairly large [[Stock|stock]] of [[Taste Sensation]] products, but with a little ingenuity  you can do pretty well.  I've listed a few alternative suggestions in the variations section.\n\nI've also used a [[Food processor|food processor]], which makes life easier, but you can do just as well with a knife - that helps to kill time too!\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 [[Leek|leek]], trimmed, cleaned and thinly sliced\n| 1 small [[Cabbage|cabbage]] discard the old leaves and core and slice the remaining cabbage into slices\n| 1 large [[Potato|potato]], peeled and thinly sliced\n| 250g [[Pork|pork]] [[Sausage meat|sausage meat]]\n| 50g [[Taste Sensation Smokey BBQ & Apple sauce Mix]] mixed into 350ml warm water\n| 1 [[Chicken stock|chicken stock]] cube, mixed into 150 ml warm water\n| 2 tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| Pinch of [[Sea Salt|sea salt]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6), [fan oven 180\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Rinse and drain the [[Potato|potato]] slices in fresh cold water a few times to remove any excess [[Starch|starch]] and [[Dry|dry]] in a [[Salad spinner|salad spinner]] of [[Tea towel|tea towel]]\n| [[Brush]] a little [[Olive oil|olive oil]] around an [[Iron|iron]] or [[Glass|glass]] based [[Oven-proof casserole dish|oven-proof casserole dish]]\n| Distribute the [[Cabbage|cabbage]] slices over the base of the dish\n| cover with about half of the sliced [[Leeks|leeks]]\n| Add a layer of [[Potatoes|potatoes]] and cover those with more [[Leeks|leeks]]\n| Pour the [[Chicken stock|chicken stock]] over this and press down well\n| Form the [[Sausage meat|sausage meat]] into small [[Meatballs|meatballs]] and place those on the [[Leeks|leeks]]\n| Cover with the remaining [[Potato|potato]] slices, ensuring that all the [[Meatballs|meatballs]] are covered with the slices of potato, so the [[Meat|meat]] cannot burn or [[Dry|dry]] out\n| Pour the [[Taste Sensation Smokey BBQ & Apple sauce Mix]] all over this - it makes a really nice finish once the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] crisp up se ensure everything is covered\n| [[Spray]] a little [[Olive oil|olive oil]] over the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] to [[Help|help]] them crisp up\n| [[Bake]] for 1 hour 30 minutes at 200\u00b0 C - check every 30 minutes and cover with a metal [[Baking tray|baking tray]] if it looks as though it is starting to burn.\n| Voila - [[Cabbage]] surprise!\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nThis was superb on its own.\n===Variations===\nPop some peeled [[Apple|apple]] slices amongst the [[Cabbage|cabbage]] and sprinkle with some [[Sugar|sugar]] and [[Smoked paprika|smoked paprika]].\n\nMake up the [[Sauce|sauce]] mix with 3 tablespoons of bottled [[Barbecue sauce|barbecue sauce]] and a few tablespoons of [[Tomato sauce|tomato sauce]]\n\nMake the [[Sauce|sauce]] with a teaspoon of [[Chilli powder|chilli powder]], a teaspoon of [[Smoked paprika|smoked paprika]],a tablespoon of [[Paprika powder|paprika powder]] and two teaspoons of [[Honey|honey]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Taste Sensation recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#cabbage #leeks #potato #oliveoil #potatoes #smokedpaprika #dry #chickenstock #sauce #meatballs #cabbagesurprise</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Cajun Chicken Stir Fry",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Cajun Chicken Noodle Stir Fry\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#chicken #oliveoil #tastesensationcajunseasoning #vegetables #stirfry #chickenbreast #poultryrecipes #noodles #vegetablerecipes #chineserecipes #northamericanrecipes\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=Another experiment with Taste Sensation taste sensation seasonings. Cajun Chicken Noodle Stir Fry That sounds weird!\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=18th December 2019\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  3 hours, 17 minutes\n|PrepTime =  3 hours, 5 minutes\n|CookTime =  12 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 467\n|PortionCalories = 23\n|Image = [[Image:Cajun Chicken Stir Fry recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">This was good - I remember making it</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">And I can taste it from the photograph!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Taste Sensation Cajun Seasoning chicken pieces, air-fried.jpg|thumb|300px|right|After 10 minutes in the air fryer basket]]\n[[Image:Cajun Seasoning, Lime Juice, Olive oil mixed.jpg|thumb|300px|right|After shaking the sealed box for 10 seconds]]\n[[Image:Cajun Seasoning, Lime Juice, Olive oil.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Taste Sensation Cajun Seasoning, olive oil and lime juice]]\nAnother experiment with [[Taste Sensation Seasonings]].\nCajun Chicken Noodle Stir Fry! That sounds weird, but I bet it will be fine.  I marinaded the chicken slices in lime juice for an hour, then added the Cajun Seasoning and a tablespoon of olive oil to a Lock and Lock box, closed the lid and shook for ten seconds.  This leaves the chicken perfectly coated.  It could be stir fried on a wok but I'm going to air fry it in the basket so it can be cooked with no extra oil.\n\nI've used the remains of the Morrisons pre-packed [[Stir-fry|stir-fry]] ingredients from yesterday's [[Chilli and lime chicken stir fry]].\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 large [[Chicken breast|chicken breast]], cut into thin strips\n| 2 tablespoons of [[lime juice]]\n| 1 heaped tablespoon of [[Taste Sensation Cajun Seasoning]]\n| 3 tablespoon [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| Half a packet of [[Bean sprouts|bean sprouts]] [180 g]\n| Half a packet of fresh [[Egg noodles|egg noodles]] [205 g]\n| Half a packet of Sweet & Crunchy [[Stir fry|stir fry]] [300 g]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* If you get the chance, marinade the chicken pieces in lime juice for an hour before you add the Cajun Seasoning\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Pop the sliced [[Chicken|chicken]] in a [[Lock and Lock box|lock and lock box]] together with the [[Taste Sensation Cajun Seasoning]] and one of the tablespoons of [[Olive oil|olive oil]].  Shake like crazy to mix.  Leave to [[Marinade|marinade]] for a while longer if you can.\n| This is quicker and easier if you have two woks, if not cook the [[Chicken|chicken]] first and keep warm while you cook the [[Vegetables|vegetables]]\n| [[Stir fry]] the [[Chicken|chicken]] in a tablespoon of [[Olive oil|olive oil]], turning regularly until the chicken is properly cooked - about 5 minutes or longer if it's thickly sliced\n| [[Stir-fry]] the [[Vegetables|vegetables]] in a tablespoon of [[Olive oil|olive oil]] until they are wilted\n| Toss in the [[Beans|beans]] shoots and [[Noodles|noodles]] and [[Stir-fry|stir-fry]] until cooked - about 4 minutes\n| Mix in the cooked [[Chicken|chicken]] and serve immediately\n}}\n===Variations===\nYou can also cook the [[Chicken|chicken]] in an air-fryer basket for about 5 minutes, instead of pan-[[Frying|frying]]\n\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Chinese recipes]]\n[[Category:North American recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Chilli pepper recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Poultry recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Stir fried]]\n[[Category:Taste Sensation recipes]]\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#chicken #oliveoil #tastesensationcajunseasoning #vegetables #stirfry #chickenbreast #poultryrecipes #noodles #vegetablerecipes #chineserecipes #northamericanrecipes</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Cambozola mushroom burgers",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Cambozola mushroom burgers\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#cambozolamushroomburgers #mushroom #oliveoil #onion #garlic #mushrooms #onions #bake #tomatoes #beefburger #burger\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=A lovely easy recipe thats oddly different and very tasty. We use our local Russells steak burgers but any good quality \u00bc pounder burger will work..\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=25th September 2022\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  25 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime =  15 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 1852\n|PortionCalories = 926\n|Image = [[Image:Cambozola mushroom burgers recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Love Cambozola</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Especially as it doesn't melt too much, like some cheeses</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Cambozola mushroom burgers ready to cook.jpg|thumb|right|Two mushroom burgers ready to air-fry. One burger lifted on one to show the preparation.]]\nA lovely easy recipe that's oddly different and very tasty.\n\nWe use our local butcher, [[Russell's Butchers of Upwell, Norfolk|Russell's]] steak burgers, but any good quality &#188; pounder [[Burger|burger]] will work well.\n\nThe orange pepper happened to be a left over so we added that for a little extra colour.\n\nWe cooked these in our [[Air-fryer|air-fryer]], but a [[Conventional oven|conventional oven]] will do just as well.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] & [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 2 large [[Portobello mushrooms|portobello mushrooms]], stems removed\n| 1 medium [[Red onion|red onion]], finely chopped\n| 1 large [[Clove|clove]] of [[Garlic|garlic]], finely chopped\n| 1 teaspoon [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 2 50g slices of [[Cambozola cheese|cambozola cheese]]\n| 2 &#188; pounder [[Beef burgers|beef burgers]] or preferably 2 [[Russell's of Upwell steakburgers]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4), [fan oven 160\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Chop the [[Onions|onions]] and [[Garlic|garlic]] very finely\n| Season with [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]\n| Add the [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and mix well\n| Remove the stems of the [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]] to make a little more room\n| Spoon the [[Onion|onion]] mix into the [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]]\n| Top each [[Mushroom|mushroom]] with a slice of cambozola\n| Pop a [[Beef burger|beef burger]] on top of each [[Mushroom|mushroom]]\n| [[Oven]] [[Bake|bake]] for about 15 minutes at 180\u00b0 C\n| Leave to [[Rest for|rest for]] 5 minutes then serve\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\n</gallery>\n\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with curly fries, [[Onion|onion]] rings and [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]]\n===Variations===\nUse [[Stilton cheese|stilton cheese]] for a nice change\n===See also===\n* [[Russell's Butchers of Upwell, Norfolk]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Italian recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Beef recipes]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Air fried recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#cambozolamushroomburgers #mushroom #oliveoil #onion #garlic #mushrooms #onions #bake #tomatoes #beefburger #burger</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }

title": "Camembert sausage and mash",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Camembert sausage and mash\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#camembertsausageandmash #mash #camembertcheese #potatoes #onions #parsley #sausagemeat #garlic #sourcream #oliveoil #blackpepper\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=I had seen somewhere, a recipe with sausages and Camembert cheese. I invented this recipe using what was in the fridge at the time\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=22nd July 2020\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  1 hour\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  45 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 3342\n|PortionCalories = 1671\n|Image = [[Image:Camembert sausage and mash recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Looks a mess..</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">.. but it tasted fabulous.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nI had seen somewhere, a recipe with [[Sausages|sausages]] and [[Camembert cheese]].  I 'invented' this recipe using what was in the pantry at the time.  Here is my sausage and cheese bake.\n\nIt was a great success.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 2 large [[Potatoes|potatoes]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 1 large [[Onion|onion]]\n| 4 [[Cloves of garlic|cloves of garlic]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Dried|dried]] [[Parsley|parsley]]\n| 4 tablespoons of [[Sour cream|sour cream]]\n| Good pinch of [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 250 g [[Pork|pork]] [[Sausage meat|sausage meat]]\n| 2 small triangles of [[Camembert cheese]]\n| 8 [[Cherry tomatoes|cherry tomatoes]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 220\u00b0 C (425\u00b0 F - gas 7), [fan oven 200\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Peel the [[Potatoes|potatoes]], cut into smaller pieces and [[Boil|boil]] for 15 minutes or until soft\n| Meanwhile peel and slice the [[Onions|onions]] and [[Garlic|garlic]] and [[Fry|fry]] in the [[Olive oil|olive oil]], with the [[Black pepper|black pepper]] for about 10 minutes or until softened\n| Add the [[Sour cream|sour cream]] and [[Parsley|parsley]] to the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] and [[Mash|mash]] well\n| Mix the [[Fried|fried]] [[Onions|onions]] and [[Garlic|garlic]] into the [[Mash|mash]]\n| Lightly [[Oil|oil]] a [[Baking tray|baking tray]] and spread the [[Mash|mash]] thinly so that it can crisp slightly while cooking\n| Make thin '[[Burgers|burgers]]' with the [[Sausage meat|sausage meat]], lay over the mash and top with the [[Camembert cheese]]\n| Surround with sliced [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]] and cook in the [[Oven|oven]] for 35 to 45 minutes\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Camembert sausage and mash baked.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Baked\nImage:Camembert sausage and mash ready to bake.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Ready for the oven\n</gallery>\n\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with a nice [[Gravy|gravy]]\n\n===Variations===\nI added 2 tbs of [[Taste Sensation Mixed Sweet Red and Green Bell Pepper Granules]] to the mash for a bit of colour and extra flavour.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Taste Sensation recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#camembertsausageandmash #mash #camembertcheese #potatoes #onions #parsley #sausagemeat #garlic #sourcream #oliveoil #blackpepper</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Can-can chicken",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Can-can chicken, a fruit recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#cancanchicken #butter #chicken #lime #blackpeppercorns #szechuanpeppercorns #mortarandpestle #beer #tablesalt #herb #herbs \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=I've long believed that the success of beer can chicken was down to the cooking method rather than the beer itself\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 3595\n|PortionCalories = 599\n|DatePublished=7th November 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 6\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  2 hours\n|PrepTime =  30 minutes\n|CookTime =  1 hour, 30 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Can-can chicken recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Try this, try this, try this..</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">This is so simple and so good.  You don't even need beer in the tin. Water will do, drink the beer!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nI've long believed that the success of [[Beer can chicken|beer can chicken]] was down to the cooking method rather than the [[Beer|beer]] itself.  This recipe proves this, conclusively.  It's also ideal if you don't happen to be a [[Beer|beer]] drinker.  All you need is a clean empty tin-can label removed and well washed - the dishwasher is ideal. Use a ring-pull type can as there are less sharp edges to worry about.  I used a cat-food tin!\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 2 kg whole [[Chicken|chicken]] (4 lb)\n| 1 [[Lemon]], quartered\n| 1 [[Lime]], half quartered, the remainder sliced for a garnish\n| 1 small bulb of [[Garlic crushed|garlic crushed]]\n| 2 tablespoons [[Butter|butter]] at room temperature\n| A huge handful of [[Herbs|herbs]] of your choice\n| 1 teaspoon of [[Black peppercorns|black peppercorns]], roughly crushed in a [[Mortar and pestle|mortar and pestle]]\n| [[Table salt]]\n| 1 teaspoon of [[Szechuan peppercorns|Szechuan peppercorns]], roughly crushed in a [[Mortar and pestle|mortar and pestle]]\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6), [fan oven 180\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Tin-can chicken ready to roast.jpg|Tin-foil hat, ready to roast\nImage:Lemon, lime, herbs and a butter-rub.jpg|The clean empty can, citrus, herbs, water and a the herb-butter rub\nImage:Can-can chicken_ingredients.jpg|Can-can chicken, the ingredients\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| This is best made with a [[Grillpro Stainless Steel Chicken Roaster]] - it can be done without (see here).  Just be careful that it does not fall over\n| Add the crushed [[Peppercorns|peppercorns]] and [[Garlic|garlic]] to the warmed [[Butter|butter]], mix well and season with &#188; teaspoons of [[Salt|salt]]\n| Pack the clean empty tin can with the [[Herbs|herbs]], all of the quartered [[Lemons|lemons]] and half the [[Lime|lime]]\n| Half fill with cold water\n| Remove the [[Parsons nose|parsons nose]], if you remember!\n| Carefully sit the [[Chicken|chicken]] on the tin can\n| From the top of the [[Chicken|chicken]], push your fingers between the skin and the breasts to separate them and create pockets.  Pack most of the [[Herb|herb]] [[Butter|butter]] between the skin and the breast mat.  This gives it wonderful flavour and keeps it moist.\n| Rub the remaining [[Herb|herb]] [[Butter|butter]] over the skin and season with a little [[Table salt|table salt]].\n| Make a [[Tin-foil|tin-foil]] 'hat' to protect the bird from burning as it's likely to be quite close to the top of the [[Oven|oven]].\n| [[Roast]] for 1 hour 30 minutes, removing the [[Foil|foil]] for the final 30 minutes.\n| Leave to [[Rest for|rest for]] 15 minutes before serving - I usually turn the [[Oven|oven]] off and leave the door open.\n| Discard the can and its contents, carve and serve.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe the [https://www.cookipedia.co.uk/calories/chicken/bq/11#jump chicken] with [[Roast potatoes|roast potatoes]], [[Green vegetables|green vegetables]], gravy and slices of [[Lime|lime]].\n===Chef' notes===\nThis was fantastic - Crisp, juicy and loads of flavour.  It also saves you wasting a can of beer!\n===Variations===\nUse  whatever [[Fresh herbs|fresh herbs]] you can lay your hands on.  I used [[Bay leaves|bay leaves]], a huge bunch of [[Sage|sage]], [[Chives|chives]], [[Cutting celery|cutting celery]] and a little [[Thyme|thyme]] - it's surprising how much you can pack into a tin with the [[Lemons|lemons]].\n\nIf you don't have [[Szechuan peppercorns]] use a little more [[black peppercorns]] - I just find they make an interesting change.\n{{Template:Beercan chicken - See also}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:North American recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Poultry recipes]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#cancanchicken #butter #chicken #lime #blackpeppercorns #szechuanpeppercorns #mortarandpestle #beer #tablesalt #herb #herbs </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Capricorn, pea and mint tortilla",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Capricorn, pea and mint tortilla a cheese recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#springonions #capricornpeaandminttortilla #diced #mint #potatoes #grill #barbecued #salted #wedges #oliveoil #thelubborncreamery \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This excellent snack recipe comes courtesy of The Lubborn Creamery\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1424\n|PortionCalories = 237\n|DatePublished=20th January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 6\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime =  45 minutes\n |PrepTime = 10 minutes\n |CookTime = 35 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Capricorn, pea and mint tortilla recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Too minty for me, I'm afraid.</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">3</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">But I don't even like mint in garden peas.</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The&nbsp;Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis excellent [[Snack|snack]] recipe comes courtesy of [[The Lubborn Creamery]]\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 600g [[Potatoes|potatoes]], [[Diced|diced]]\n| 200g [[garden peas]], fresh or [[Frozen|frozen]]\n| 6 [[free range eggs]], beaten\n| 2 tablespoons freshly chopped [[Mint|mint]]\n| 1 x 100g [[Capricorn Somerset Goats cheese]], [[Diced|diced]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 1 bunch [[Spring onions|spring onions]], sliced\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| [[Boil]] the [[Diced|diced]] [[Potatoes|potatoes]] in [[Salted|salted]] water for 7-8 mins until tender, adding the [[Peas|peas]] for the last 2 mins.\n| Drain and mix with the [[Eggs|eggs]], [[Mint|mint]], seasoning and [[Capricorn Somerset Goats cheese]].\n| Heat the [[Oil|oil]] in a 20cm base non-stick [[Frying pan|frying pan]]. Add the [[Spring onions|spring onions]] and saut\u00e9 for 2 mins.\n| Pour in the [[Egg|egg]] mixture, mixing it into the [[Spring onions|spring onions]]. Cook over a low heat for 20-25 mins, until the egg is almost set.\n| Meanwhile, preheat the [[Grill|grill]] to a medium setting. Place the pan under grill (protecting the handle if it\u0092s not heatproof) and cook for 3-4 mins until set and golden on top.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe warm rather than hot, cut into [[Wedges|wedges]], with a mixed leaf [[Salad|salad]].\n{{Tortillas-See also}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Egg recipes]]\n[[Category:Lubborn Creamery recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n[[Category:Grilled, griddled or barbecued]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#springonions #capricornpeaandminttortilla #diced #mint #potatoes #grill #barbecued #salted #wedges #oliveoil #thelubborncreamery </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }

title": "Capricorn goats' cheese and thyme souffles",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Capricorn goats' cheese and thyme souffles recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#ramekins #butter #bake #capricorngoatscheeseandthymesouffles #sauce #nutmeg #boil #roastingtin #shallot #eggwhites #bayleaf \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A nice rich vegetarian starter to impress your friends with\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2189\n|PortionCalories = 547\n|DatePublished=20th January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 3\n |TotalTime = 1 hour 15 minutes\n |PrepTime = 15 minutes\n |CookTime = 1 hour\n |Image = [[Image:Capricorn goats' cheese and thyme souffles recipe.jpg|200px|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">A bit too faffy for me</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">3</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">The simple things are best</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:NonLoggedInUser|NonLoggedInUser]] </span></span>\n}}\nA nice rich [[Vegetarian|vegetarian]] [[Starter|starter]] to impress your friends with.\n\nMany thanks to those nice people at [[The Lubborn Creamery]] who gave us permission to reproduce this very well written recipe.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 275ml [[Milk|milk]]\n| 1 [[Bay leaf|bay leaf]]\n| 1 [[Shallot|shallot]], peeled and quartered\n| A few gratings of [[Nutmeg|nutmeg]]\n| 50g [[Butter|butter]]\n| 50g [[Plain flour|plain flour]]\n| 2 x 100g [[Capricorn Somerset Goats cheese]], [[Diced|diced]]\n| 3 teaspoon fresh [[Thyme leaves|thyme leaves]]\n| 3 [[free range eggs]], separated\n| 1 x 142ml carton [[Double cream|double cream]]\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 180C (350F, gas 4).\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Generously [[Butter|butter]] 6 x 150ml [[Ramekins|ramekins]] and place in a [[Roasting tin|roasting tin]].\n| Place the [[Milk|milk]] in a saucepan with the [[Bay leaf|bay leaf]], [[Shallot|shallot]], [[Nutmeg|nutmeg]] and seasoning. Bring to the [[Boil|boil]] then strain the flavoured milk into a jug.\n| In a clean pan, melt the [[Butter|butter]] then add the [[Flour|flour]] and cook for 2 mins, stirring, to cook out the rawness of the [[Flour|flour]].\n| Remove from the heat and gradually [[Blend|blend]] in the flavoured [[Milk|milk]] to make a thick [[Sauce|sauce]]. [[Simmer]] over a low heat for 2-3 mins then turn off the heat.\n| Stir in three-quarters of the [[Capricorn Somerset Goats cheese]], until it begins to melt, followed by 2 teaspoons [[Thyme|thyme]] and plenty of seasoning, then transfer to a large mixing bowl.\n| Add the [[Egg yolks|egg yolks]], one at a time, stirring until the [[Sauce|sauce]] is smooth.\n| Put the kettle on to [[Boil|boil]], then whisk the [[Egg whites|egg whites]] to the soft peak stage.\n| Mix a spoonful of [[Egg whites|egg whites]] into the [[Sauce|sauce]] base to slacken the mixture then carefully fold in the remainder.\n| Divide between the buttered [[Ramekins|ramekins]], then pour 1cm depth of [[Boiling|boiling]] water into the [[Roasting tin|roasting tin]] around the ramekins.\n| [[Bake]] the souffl\u00e9s for 20 mins until risen and golden.\n| Remove the [[Ramekins|ramekins]] from their hot water bath using a [[Fish|fish]] slice, and leave to cool on a wire rack. Run a small knife or spatula around the edge and turn the souffl\u00e9s out.\n| When ready to [[Bake|bake]], place them on a buttered [[Baking tray|baking tray]], puffy side up.\n| [[Bake]] for 15 mins in an [[Oven|oven]] preheated to 180C (350F, gas 4) then pour the [[Cream|cream]] over the top.\n| Scatter the reserved [[Capricorn Somerset Goats cheese]] and [[Thyme|thyme]] over the souffl\u00e9s and cook for a further 3-4 mins.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nTransfer to warmed plates and serve immediately with a [[Balsamic|balsamic]]-dressed [[Rocket|rocket]] [[Salad|salad]].\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Egg recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Lubborn Creamery recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#ramekins #butter #bake #capricorngoatscheeseandthymesouffles #sauce #nutmeg #boil #roastingtin #shallot #eggwhites #bayleaf </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

                "revisions": [
