                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Capricorn goats' cheese and walnut filo parcels recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#cranberrysauce #butter #capricorngoatscheeseandwalnutfiloparcels #walnuts #pastry #brushing #filopastry #bake #salad #drying #thelubborncreamery \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This delicious and impressive looking starter or light snack is also suitable for vegetarians\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1453\n|PortionCalories = 363\n|DatePublished=20th January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 25 minutes\n |PrepTime = 20 minutes\n |CookTime = 5 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Capricorn goats' cheese and walnut filo parcels recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Walnuts AND cheese</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Love this!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> those nice people at [[The Lubborn Creamery]] who gave us permission to reproduce this recipe.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 2 x 100g [[Capricorn Somerset Goats cheese]], cut in half horizontally\n| 8 teaspoons [[Cranberry sauce|cranberry sauce]]\n| 50g [[Walnuts|walnuts]], roughly chopped\n| 2 large sheets ready-made [[Filo pastry|filo pastry]]\n| 25g [[Butter|butter]], melted\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 200\u00baC / 400\u00baF / gas mark 6.\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Spread out the [[Pastry|pastry]], [[Brush|brush]] with melted [[Butter|butter]] (this will [[Help|help]] stop the pastry [[Drying|drying]] out) and cut into 15 cm / 6 in squares.\n| Layer one square on top of another to form a star shape and spread 2 teaspoons [[Cranberry sauce|cranberry sauce]] in the centre of each square.\n| Place a half [[Capricorn Somerset Goats cheese]] on top of the [[Cranberry sauce|cranberry sauce]] and sprinkle with the chopped [[Walnuts|walnuts]].\n| Draw up the [[Pastry|pastry]] corners and pinch to create an open 'basket', lightly [[Brushing|brushing]] the exposed pastry with melted [[Butter|butter]].\n| Place on a [[Baking|baking]] sheet and [[Bake|bake]] for 5 minutes.\n| Allow to cool a little and serve with a mixed leaf [[Salad|salad]].\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Lubborn #filopastry #bake #salad #drying #thelubborncreamery </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Capricorn mash with herby chicken breasts",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Capricorn mash with herby chicken breasts a cheese recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#chicken #potatoes #capricornmashwithherbychickenbreasts #mash #tomatoes #cheese #castersugar #herbs #tarragon #parsley #boil \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Both parts of this recipe appealed to me - cheesy mashed potato and herb flavoured chicken breasts\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1605\n|PortionCalories = 401\n|DatePublished=31st October 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 35 minutes\n |PrepTime = 15 minutes\n |CookTime = 20 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Capricorn mash with herby chicken breasts recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">The cheesy mash is nice</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">It's even niceer with a teaspoon of English mustard added as well</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nBoth parts of this recipe appealed to me - cheesy [[Mashed potato|mashed potato]] and [[Herb|herb]] flavoured [https://www.cookipedia.co.uk/cgi-bin/cc.pl?cftk=2#jump chicken breasts].\n\nMany thanks to those nice people at [[The Lubborn Creamery]] who gave us permission to reproduce this recipe.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 6 tablespoons freshly chopped [[Mixed herbs|mixed herbs]] (e.g. [[Chives|chives]], [[Parsley|parsley]], [[Tarragon|tarragon]])\n| 4 skinless [[Chicken|chicken]] breasts\n| 2 tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 4 stalks [[Cherry tomatoes|cherry tomatoes]] on the vine\n| &#189; teaspoon [[Caster sugar|caster sugar]]\n| 1kg floury [[Potatoes|potatoes]], peeled and cut into large chunks\n| 200ml [[Milk|milk]]\n| 2 x 100g [[Capricorn Somerset Goats' cheese]], roughly chopped\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6), [fan oven 180\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Spread the [[Herbs|herbs]] out on a plate, then drizzle 1 tablespoon [[Oil|oil]] over the [[Chicken|chicken]] breasts and season lightly. Roll in the [[Herbs|herbs]] to coat completely then place on a [[Baking tray|baking tray]].\n| Add the [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]] on the vine, drizzle the remaining [[Oil|oil]] over the tomatoes and sprinkle with the [[Caster sugar|caster sugar]].\n| [[Roast]] the [[Chicken|chicken]] and [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]] for 15-20 mins or until the juices of the chicken run clear when pierced. Rest the chicken for 5 mins before slicing.\n| Meanwhile, [[Boil|boil]] the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] in a large pan of lightly [[Salted|salted]] water until tender. Drain into a [[Colander|colander]].\n| Place the pan back on the heat and add the [[Milk|milk]] and [[Capricorn Somerset Goats' cheese]], stirring until most of the [[Cheese|cheese]] has melted.\n| [[Mash]] the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] into the molten [[Cheese|cheese]], adding seasoning to taste.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe the [[Mash|mash]] with the sliced [[Chicken|chicken]] breasts and [[Roasted tomatoes|roasted tomatoes]].\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes]]\n[[Category:Poultry recipes]]\n[[Category:Lubborn Creamery recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#chicken #potatoes #capricornmashwithherbychickenbreasts #mash #tomatoes #cheese #castersugar #herbs #tarragon #parsley #boil </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Caramelised Capricorn goats' cheese with soft fruit",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Caramelised Capricorn goats' cheese with soft fruit recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#caramelisedcapricorngoatscheesewithsoftfruit #vanilla #honey #strawberries #blueberries #raspberries #fruit #brownsugar #griddlepan #fridge #fruits \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This dessert recipe with an unusual mixture of fruit and goats' cheese is reproduced by kind permission from The Lubborn Creamery\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1028\n|PortionCalories = 257\n|DatePublished=10th April 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 40 minutes\n |PrepTime = 15 minutes\n |CookTime = 25 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Caramelised Capricorn goats' cheese with soft fruit recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Soft fruit, and cheese!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.7</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Yumm!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis dessert recipe with an unusual unusual mixture of [[Fruit|fruit]] and [[Goats' cheese|goats' cheese]] is reproduced by kind permission from [[The Lubborn Creamery]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 2 x 100g young [[Capricorn Somerset Goats cheese]]\n| 2 tablespoons clear [[Honey|honey]]\n| 75g soft [[Brown sugar|brown sugar]]\n| 125g [[Blueberries|blueberries]]\n| 50g [[Vanilla|vanilla]] [[Sugar|sugar]]\n| 400g [[Strawberries|strawberries]]\n| 50g [[Raspberries|raspberries]]\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Make the [[Vanilla|vanilla]] [[Sugar|sugar]] 4 days ahead\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Slice each [[Capricorn Somerset Goats cheese]] into 4 and coat each piece with the [[Honey|honey]] and then the [[Sugar|sugar]].\n| Heat a large non-stick [[Frying pan|frying pan]] (or [[Griddle pan|griddle pan]]) and over a gentle heat, [[Brown|brown]] the [[Capricorn Somerset Goats cheese]] for 1 - 2 minutes on each side.\n| Remove the [[Cheese|cheese]] slices from the pan and place on non-stick [[Baking paper|baking paper]]\n| Place in a [[Fridge|fridge]] for about 1 hour before serving.\n| Preheat [[Oven|oven]] to 180 C Gas mark 4.\n| Place the [[Blueberries|blueberries]] in a large shallow ovenproof dish.\n| Sprinkle over the [[Sugar|sugar]] and cook for 15 minutes.\n| Stir in [[Strawberries|strawberries]] and return dish to the [[Oven|oven]] for 5 minutes.\n| Remove dish from the [[Oven|oven]] and stir in the [[Raspberries|raspberries]].\n| Place 2 [[Caramelised|caramelised]] [[Capricorn Somerset Goats cheese]] slices on each plate and serve with the soft [[Fruits|fruits]].\n| (To make [[Vanilla|vanilla]] [[Sugar|sugar]], push a [[Vanilla pod|vanilla pod]] into a large jar of golden [[Caster sugar|caster sugar]]. Leave for at least four days before using)\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Lubborn Creamery recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#caramelisedcapricorngoatscheesewithsoftfruit #vanilla #honey #strawberries #blueberries #raspberries #fruit #brownsugar #griddlepan #fridge #fruits </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Caramelised onion tartlets with goats' cheese and thyme",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Caramelised onion tartlets with goats' cheese and thyme recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#pastry #egg #cayennepepper #butter #caramelisedoniontartletswithgoatscheeseandthyme #thyme #cheese #flour #parmesan #bake #mustardpowder \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A nice savoury tartlet that would be great for partys or make a wonderful addition to a tapa\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1943\n|PortionCalories = 161\n|DatePublished=20th December 2013\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = Servings: 12 - Makes 24 tartlets\n |Difficulty = 3\n |TotalTime = 2 hours\n |PrepTime = 1 hour\n |CookTime = 1 hour\n |Image = [[Image:Caramelised onion tartlets with goats' cheese and thyme recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Teeny, weeny tarts!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">2.45</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">\ud83d\ude02</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Sue_spins|Susie]] </span></span>\n}}\nA nice savoury tartlet that would be great for partys or make a wonderful addition to a [[tapa]].\n\n\n'''The [[Pastry|pastry]]:'''\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 6 oz (175 g) [[Plain flour|plain flour]]\n| 3 oz (75 g) [[Butter|butter]], at room temperature, cut into smallish lumps, plus a little extra for greasing\n| 1&frac12; oz (40 g) [[Parmesan]] ([[Parmigiano Reggiano]]), finely [[Grated|grated]]\n| &frac12; level teaspoon [[Mustard powder|mustard powder]]\n| [[Cayenne pepper]]\n| 1 large [[Egg|egg]], beaten\n}}\n'''The filling:'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 2 large [[Spanish]] [[Onions|onions]], peeled and finely chopped\n| 2 x 4 oz (110 g) Welsh [[Goats|goats]]' [[Cheese|cheese]] logs\n| 24 small sprigs fresh [[Thyme|thyme]], dipped in [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 1 oz (25 g) [[Butter|butter]]\n| 1 large [[Egg|egg]]\n| 4 fl oz (120 ml) [[Single cream|single cream]]\n| &frac14; level teaspoon [[Mustard powder|mustard powder]]\n| [[Cayenne pepper]]\n| [[Salt]] and freshly milled [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* You will also need a 3&frac14; inch (8 cm) [[Pastry|pastry]] cutter and two 12-hole patty tins with cups measuring 1&frac34; inches (4.5 cm) at the base, 2&frac12; inches (6 cm) at the top and &frac34; inch (2 cm) deep, well greased.\n===Method===\n\n\n'''First make up the [[Pastry|pastry]]. '''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Sift the [[Flour|flour]] into a large bowl, and then add the [[Butter|butter]]. \n| Take a knife and begin to cut it into the [[Flour|flour]] until it looks fairly evenly blended, and then add the [[Parmesan]], [[Mustard|mustard]] and a pinch of [[Cayenne pepper|cayenne pepper]], plus about 1&frac12; tablespoons cold water to make a smooth [[Dough|dough]], before discarding the knife and bringing it together with your fingertips. \n| Then place the [[Dough|dough]] in a plastic food bag and put it into the [[Fridge|fridge]] to rest for 30 minutes. \n| In the meantime, preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to gas mark 4, 350\u00b0F (180\u00b0C).\n| After that, roll it out as thinly as possible, use the cutter to stamp out 24 rounds and line the tins with them. (The [[Pastry|pastry]] will stand proud of the rim of the cups to allow for shrinkage.) \n| Then prick the bases and [[Brush|brush]] with the beaten [[Egg|egg]]. Now [[Bake|bake]] on the middle and top shelves of the [[Oven|oven]] (swapping them over halfway through to ensure even [[Browning|browning]]) for about 10 minutes, or until the [[Pastry|pastry]] is just cooked through, then cool them on a wire rack.\n}}\n'''For the filling.'''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Melt the [[Butter|butter]] in a large [[Frying pan|frying pan]] and cook the [[Onions|onions]] very gently, uncovered and stirring often, for about 30 minutes, or until they have turned a lovely golden [[Brown|brown]] [[Caramel|caramel]] colour. \n| Then leave to cool and set aside until needed.\n| Now whisk the [[Egg|egg]] with the [[Cream|cream]] and [[Mustard|mustard]] in a jug and add some seasoning. \n| Next, spoon a little of the [[Onion|onion]] mixture into each [[Pastry|pastry]] case, spread it out evenly and pour the [[Egg|egg]] mixture over. \n| Cut each [[Cheese|cheese]] log into 12 thin slices (wiping the knife between slices to cut more cleanly; the cheese is quite soft, so you may have to reshape a few slices into rounds). \n| Place a slice on the top of each tartlet, then top with a sprig of [[Thyme|thyme]] and a sprinkling of [[Cayenne pepper|cayenne pepper]]. \n| [[Bake]] for 20 minutes, or until puffy and golden, swapping the tins again halfway through cooking.\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:British Onions recipes]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Pies tarts and flans]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n{{Template:British Onions attribution}}\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#pastry #egg #cayennepepper #butter #caramelisedoniontartletswithgoatscheeseandthyme #thyme #cheese #flour #parmesan #bake #mustardpowder </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Caramel Apple Porkchops (GF)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Caramel Apple Pork Chops a gluten free recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#apples #brownsugar #nutmeg #pecans #sauce #caramelappleporkchopsgf #unsaltedbutter #vegetableoil #porkchops #greenbeans #cinnamon \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A delicious gluten free recipe that is ideal for a main course\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2720\n|PortionCalories = 680\n|DatePublished=20th February 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime = 45 minutes \n|PrepTime = 20 minutes\n|CookTime = 25 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Caramel Apple Porkchops GF recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Porkolicious!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">or maybe pecanolicious? \ud83d\ude43</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:NonLoggedInUser|NonLoggedInUser]] </span></span>\n}}\nA delicious [[Gluten|gluten]] free recipe that is ideal for a [[Main course|main course]]\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 4 (3/4 inch) thick [[Pork chops|pork chops]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Vegetable oil|vegetable oil]]\n| 2 tablespoons [[Brown sugar|brown sugar]]\n| [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]] to taste\n| 1/8 teaspoon [[Ground cinnamon|ground cinnamon]]\n| 1/8 teaspoon [[Ground|ground]] [[Nutmeg|nutmeg]]\n| 2 tablespoons [[Unsalted butter|unsalted butter]]\n| 2 [[Tart apples|tart apples]] - peeled, cored and sliced\n| 3 tablespoons [[Pecans|pecans]] (optional)\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4), [fan [[Oven|oven]] 160\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n* Place a medium sized oven proof tray in the [[Oven|oven]] to warm.\n\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Heat a large [[Frying pan|frying pan]] over medium-high heat.\n| [[Brush]] chops lightly with [[Oil|oil]] and place in hot pan.\n| Cook for 5 to 6 minutes, turning occasionally, or until done. Transfer to the warm dish, and keep warm in the preheated [[Oven|oven]].\n| In a small bowl, combine [[Brown sugar|brown sugar]], [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]], [[Cinnamon|cinnamon]] and [[Nutmeg|nutmeg]].\n| Add [[Butter|butter]] to the [[Frying pan|frying pan]], and stir in [[Brown sugar|brown sugar]] mixture and [[Apples|apples]].\n| Cover and cook until [[Apples|apples]] are just tender. Remove [[Apples|apples]] with a [[Slotted spoon|slotted spoon]] and arrange on top of chops.\n| Keep warm in the preheated [[Oven|oven]]. Continue cooking [[Sauce|sauce]] uncovered in [[frying pan]], until thickened slightly.\n| Spoon [[Sauce|sauce]] over [[Apples|apples]] and chops.\n| Sprinkle with [[Pecans|pecans]]\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with buttered [[Green beans|green beans]] and [[Mashed potatoes|mashed potatoes]]\n===Recipe source===\n\n* http://glutenfreerecipes.wikia.com/wiki/Caramel_Apple_Porkchops\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Gluten free recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#apples #brownsugar #nutmeg #pecans #sauce #caramelappleporkchopsgf #unsaltedbutter #vegetableoil #porkchops #greenbeans #cinnamon </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

The basic dressing I usually use is just Orange orange..\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=7th April 2020\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  10 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime = None\n|TotalCalories = 171\n|PortionCalories = 42\n|Image = [[Image:Carrot, onion and mint salad recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">This is now a household staple!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">We now make this at least once a week.</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Chef]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Mint carrot and onion salad ingredients.jpg|thumb|300px|right|The ingredients for Mint carrot and onion salad]]\nA very simple and very tasty [[Salad|salad]], we've think this goes very well with [[Home-made pizza|home-made pizza]].\n\nThe basic dressing I usually use is just [[Orange juice|orange juice]], homey and a splash of [[Olive oil|olive oil]].  This time I've used half a teaspoon of [[Dark soy sauce|dark soy sauce]], it adds a salty, rich flavours.  Play around with your favourite flavourings.\n\nThe quantities should serve four, but the tow of us can normally manage to eat it all!\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 medium white [[Onion|onion]], peeled and very finely chopped\n| 3 small to medium [[Carrots|carrots]], peeled and finely [[Grated|grated]]\n| Three [[Mint leaves|mint leaves]], deveined and finely chopped\n| A small bunch of [[Parsley|parsley]], chopped\n| 1 [[Scant|scant]] teaspoon of [[Honey|honey]]\n| 2 teaspoons of [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 2 teaspoons of [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]]\n| &#189; teaspoon of [[Dark soy sauce|dark soy sauce]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Mix the [[Carrots|carrots]], [[Onions|onions]] and [[Herbs|herbs]] together\n| [[Whisk]] the remaining ingredients together into a dressing - if the [[Honey|honey]] is quite set then [[Microwave|microwave]] for 10 seconds to soften\n| Mix the dressing in with the [[Salad|salad]] and chill in the [[Fridge|fridge]] if you have the time.\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Salad recipes]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n[[Category:Uncooked]]\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#carrotonionandmintsalad #salad #darksoysauce #honey #oliveoil #carrots #lemonjuice #onions #snacksandlightbites #recipes #fridge</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

of half a [[Lemon|lemon]]\n| 2cm [[Fresh ginger|fresh ginger]], peeled\n| 400g [[Carrots|carrots]], peeled and cut into 2-3 pieces\n| 50g [[Onion|onion]], peeled\n| 50g [[Butter|butter]]\n| Water\n| 4 teaspoons [[Bron's Spanish vegetable stock concentrate (TM)|Bron's Spanish vegetable stock concentrate]]\n| [[Salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]], to taste\n| 5g [[Coriander leaves|coriander leaves]]\n| 100g [[Milk|milk]]\n| Extra [[Coriander leaves|coriander leaves]], finely chopped, to garnish\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Grind the [[Lentils|lentils]] and [[Ginger|ginger]] '''Speed 10''' until fine.\n| Add the [[Carrots|carrots]], [[Onion|onion]] and [[Butter|butter]] a '''Few Seconds / Speed 4\u00bd'''.\n| Scrape down the inside of the bowl and repeat previous step if necessary.\n| Add the water, [[lemon juice]] and the [[Bron's Spanish vegetable stock concentrate (TM)|vegetable stock concentrate]] '''15 minutes / 100\u00b0C / Speed 2'''.\n| Season to taste.\n| Add the [[Coriander|coriander]] and [[Milk|milk]] '''1 minute / Speed 9''' or until smooth.\n| Adjust seasoning and serve, garnished with the chopped [[Coriander|coriander]].\n}}\n===Recipe source===\n\n* Lightly adapted from a recipe in '''Fast and Easy''' cooking, which is supplied with Thermomixes in the UK.\n===Chef's notes===\nIf you do not wish to make the [[Bron's Spanish vegetable stock concentrate (TM)|vegetable stock concentrate]] use sufficient stock cubes or [[Marigold Swiss bouillon powder]] to make 1 litre of stock.\n{{Template:PeelingGinger}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Soup and stock title": "Carrot cake (TM)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Carrot cake - A Thermomix recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#thermomix #carrots #cake #wholemealflour #unsaltedbutter #sourcream #cakerack #carrotcaketm #carrot #groundcinnamon #cookery \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A delicious carrot cake recipe made in the Thermomix\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2923\n|PortionCalories = 365\n|DatePublished=26th January 2014\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = 8-12\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  1 hour, 10 minutes\n|PrepTime =  5 minutes\n|CookTime =  1 hour, 5 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Carrot cake TM recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Looks lovely</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Much richer than I imagined</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Carla_Cancio-Bello,_J.D.,_on_behalf_of_Cuban_Cuisine_UK|Carla]] </span></span>\n}}\nA delicious [[Carrot|carrot]] [[Cake|cake]] recipe made in the [[Thermomix]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredientsTM\n\n| 300g [[Carrots|carrots]] (net weight after topping, tailing and peeling), cut into chunks\n| 3 large [[eggs]]\n| 320g light, soft [[Brown sugar|brown sugar]]\n| 50g [[Sour cream|sour cream]]\n| 80g organic, cold-pressed [[Rapeseed oil|rapeseed oil]]\n| 80g soft, [[Unsalted butter|unsalted butter]]\n| 250g plain, [[Wholemeal flour|wholemeal flour]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Bicarbonate of soda|bicarbonate of soda]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Grated|grated]] [[Nutmeg|nutmeg]]\n| 2 heaped teaspoons [[Ground cinnamon|ground cinnamon]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4), without fan.\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Place all of the ingredients into the bowl 40 seconds / Speed 6.\n| Pour the mixture into a lined and greased 20cm [[Cake|cake]] tin.\n| [[Bake]], without fan, for about 1 hour and 5 minutes, then test with a skewer.\n| Leave to cool in the tin.\n| Turn out onto a [[Cake rack|cake rack]] and serve.\n}}\n===Recipe source===\n\n* Lightly adapted from a recipe in ''Fast and Easy Cooking'', the [[Thermomix]] TM31 [[Cookery|cookery]] book.\n===Chef's notes===\nIf using organic [[Carrots|carrots]], there is no need to peel them.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Egg recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Thermomix recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#thermomix #carrots #cake #wholemealflour #unsaltedbutter #sourcream #cakerack #carrotcaketm #carrot #groundcinnamon #cookery </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }

title": "Cauliflower cheese",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Cauliflower cheese a cheese recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#cauliflowercheese #cheesesauce #cauliflower #nutmeg #cheese #basicwhitesauce #grill #boiledorsimmered #mornaysauce #tabascosauce \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=One of my favourite vegetable dishes that goes well with almost anything\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 572\n|PortionCalories = 286\n|DatePublished=17th January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Broccoli and cauliflower cheese\n |Servings = 2 people as a vegetable side-dish\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 15 minutes\n |PrepTime = 5 minutes\n |CookTime = 10 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Broccoli and cauliflower cheese recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"><span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Love this recipe</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Made with locally grown caulis, there's nothing like it.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\">[[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]] </span></span>\n}}\n\nOne of my favourite vegetable dishes that goes well with almost anything.  Whilst you could add extra cheese and grill to finish, as a vegetable accompaniment, I don't think it needs that.  If you were having this alone, then maybe\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| &#189; pint of [[Cheese sauce|cheese sauce]]\n| 300 g (11 oz) [[cauliflower]], trimmed and cut to florets.  Most supermarkets sell these ready prepared, lazy and handy!\n| Dash of [[Tabasco sauce]] (optional)\n| [[Nutmeg]] (optional)\n| Salt and [[freshly ground black pepper]] to taste\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Cut an x in the base of any thick stalks so they cook evenly\n| Add the [[cauliflower]] to a large pan of boiling, lightly salted water and simmer hard for about 10 minutes, depending how you prefer your vegetables cooked\n| Meanwhile make the [[Cheese sauce|cheese sauce as shown here]]\n| Drain the cauliflower and pour the [[cheese sauce]] over the vegetables, mixing well\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe hot, sprinkled with [[nutmeg|grated nutmeg]] if liked\n===Variations===\nTop with a little extra [[cheese]] and brown under a [[grill]]\n==See also==\n* [[Broccoli and cauliflower cheese]]\n* [[Baby cauliflower cheese]]\n* [[Basic white sauce]]\n* [[Cheese sauce]]\n* [[Heston Blumenthal's perfect cauliflower cheese recipe]]\n* [[Mornay sauce]]\n* [http://www.bbc.co.uk/food/cauliflower_cheese BBC - cauliflower_cheese recipes]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Cheese]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments|Cheese]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses|Cheese]]\n[[Category:Starters|Cheese]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes|Cheese]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes|Cheese]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Student recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#cauliflowercheese #cheesesauce #cauliflower #nutmeg #cheese #basicwhitesauce #grill #boiledorsimmered #mornaysauce #tabascosauce </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Caws pori (Welsh rarebit)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Caws pori (Welsh rarebit) a cheese recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#beer #caerphilly #welshcheese #bread #bitter #snack #salad #lightlunch #flour #worcestershiresauce #grated \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=24th January 2011, is National Welsh Rarebit Day, so here is the recipe\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1395\n|PortionCalories = 348\n|DatePublished=17th January 2013\n|Author = JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 25 minutes\n |PrepTime = 10 minutes\n |CookTime = 15 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Caws pori (Welsh rarebit) recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Never knew there was such a thing!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">(as Welsh Rarebit Day!)</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nToday, the 24th January 2011, is National Welsh Rarebit Day, so here is a recipe.  Tomorrow I shall be making this for my daughter's breakfast - yes, I know, a day late, but when I thought about it yesterday afternoon, there were no shops open for me to buy the [[Beer|beer]]!\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 225g strong [[Welsh cheese]], such as [[Black bomber cheese|Black bomber cheese]], [[Grated|grated]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Butter|butter]]\n| 2 teaspoons [[Worcestershire sauce]]\n| 1 teaspoon dry [[Mustard|mustard]]\n| 2 teaspoons [[Flour|flour]]\n| A pinch of [[White pepper|white pepper]]\n| 60ml [[Beer|beer]] \n| 4 large slices of [[Bread|bread]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| In a saucepan, mix the first 6 ingredients.\n| Stir in the [[Beer|beer]], but do not make it too wet.\n| Place the pan on a gentle heat, stirring until the [[Cheese|cheese]] has melted and has become a thickish paste.\n| Swivel the mixture around the pan, remove from heat and allow to cool a little.\n| Meanwhile, toast the [[Bread|bread]] on one side only.\n| Spread the mixture over the untoasted side and [[Brown|brown]] under a hot [[Grill|grill]].\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe either as a breakfast dish, a [[Snack|snack]] or as a [[Light lunch|light lunch]] with a side [[Salad|salad]].\n===Variations===\n[[Cheddar cheese]] is often suggested in recipe books as being the best for this dish, so do use it if you are unable to find a suitable hard [[Welsh cheese]].  \nAlso you can substitute [[Milk|milk]] for the [[Beer|beer]].\n===Chef's notes===\nDo not use [[Caerphilly]] (yummy though it is) as it is too crumbly and in any case most [[Caerphilly]] is now made in Somerset!  \nDo not use [[Lager|lager]] - you need [[Bitter|bitter]] really.  If you can find a Welsh one, then so much the better.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Welsh rarebit]]\n[[Category:British recipes|Welsh rarebit]]\n[[Category:Breakfast recipes|Welsh rarebit]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites|Welsh rarebit]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes|Welsh rarebit]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes|Welsh rarebit]]\n[[Category:Grilled, griddled or barbecued]]\n[[Category:Toasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#beer #caerphilly #welshcheese #bread #bitter #snack #salad #lightlunch #flour #worcestershiresauce #grated </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Celery soup (TM)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Celery soup a Thermomix recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#celery #sherryvinegar #soup #vegetablestock #thermomix #butter #potatoes #stock #onion #oliveoil #celeryseeds \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Celery soup is one of my favourites so had to cobble together a recipe for making it in a Thermomix. I feel that the sherry vinegar gives it\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1359\n|PortionCalories = 339\n|DatePublished=10th March 2015\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4-6\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  1 hour, 15 minutes\n|PrepTime =  5 minutes\n|CookTime =  1 hour, 10 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Celery soup TM recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Sherry vinegar - a great idea</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">3.96</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Thanks Julia</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Sue_spins|Susie]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Celery]] [[Soup|soup]] is one of my favourites so had to cobble together a recipe for making it in a [[Thermomix]].  I feel that the [[Sherry vinegar|sherry vinegar]] gives it extra depth without masking the taste of the celery\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1 [[Spanish]] [[Onion|onion]], quartered\n| 1 head [[Celery|celery]] (with leaves if possible), trimmed and cut into thirds\n| 40g [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 40g [[Butter|butter]]\n| [[Garlic]], to taste, peeled and [[Cloves|cloves]] cut in half\n| 1 teaspoon [[Celery seeds|celery seeds]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Sugar|sugar]]\n| [[Salt]] (see [[Chef's notes|chef's notes]] below)\n| 2-3 [[Potatoes|potatoes]], peeled and roughly chopped\n| 1kg [[Vegetable Stock|vegetable stock]] \n| 2-3 tablespoons [[Sherry vinegar|sherry vinegar]]\n| 250g [[Milk|milk]]\n| Seasoning, to taste\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Put the [[Onion|onion]], [[Celery|celery]] and [[Olive oil|olive oil]] into the bowl '''5 seconds / Speed 5'''\n| Scrape down the side of the bowl '''20 minutes / Temp Varoma / Speed 2 / Reverse Blade / MC Off'''\n| Scrape the bowl\n| Add the [[Butter|butter]], [[Celery seeds|celery seeds]], [[Sugar|sugar]] and [[Salt|salt]] (if using) '''20 minutes / 100\u00b0C / Speed 2 / Reverse Blade / MC Off'''\n| Add the [[Potatoes|potatoes]], [[Stock|stock]] and [[Sherry vinegar|sherry vinegar]] '''20-25 minutes / Temp Varoma / Speed 1 / MC''' On\n| Add the [[Milk|milk]] '''1 minute / increasing to Speed 10'''\n| Adjust seasoning\n| Reheat '''3 minutes / 100\u00b0C / Speed 1'''\n| Serve garnished with [[Celery leaves|celery leaves]] or [[Parsley|parsley]]\n}}\n===Variations===\nThe above recipe is for a smooth [[Soup|soup]].  [[Blend]] for a shorter time at Step 7 if you want to include some texture\n===Chef's notes===\nYou need to think about the type of [[Stock|stock]] you are using before adding any [[Salt|salt]], especially if you use a [[Thermomix]] made [[Vegetable Stock|vegetable stock]], you may find that [[Salting|salting]] is not necessary.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Soup and stock recipes]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Thermomix recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#celery #sherryvinegar #soup #vegetablestock #thermomix #butter #potatoes #stock #onion #oliveoil #celeryseeds </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Chargrilled peppers, leeks and garlic mushrooms",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Chargrilled peppers, leeks and garlic mushrooms\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#leek #chargrilledpeppersleeksandgarlicmushrooms #leeks #oliveoil #lecreuset #peppers #dry #blackpepper #unusualrecipes #dryfried #dryfry\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=The lovely recipe came about as a way to use up some leftovers. Dry-dry-frying the bell peppers is like barbecuing them\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=19th January 2022\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  15 minutes\n|PrepTime =  5 minutes\n|CookTime = 10 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 155\n|PortionCalories = 77\n|Image = [[Image:Chargrilled peppers, leeks and garlic mushrooms recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Nice side-dish</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Looks colourful too</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:NonLoggedInUser|NonLoggedInUser]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Chargrilled peppers, leeks and garlic mushrooms prepped.jpg|thumb|right|Peppers browned, leeks added]]\nThe lovely recipe came about as a way to use up some leftovers.\n\nThe effect of [[Dry-frying|dry-frying]] the [[Peppers|peppers]] in the [[Frying pan|frying pan]] is exactly the same as [[Barbecuing|barbecuing]] and gives a nice smoky flavour to the dish.\n\nThe [[Leeks|leeks]] are seasonal, here in Norfolk and keep their colour when cooked to the effect is a delicious and colourful recipe that is simple to make and inexpensive.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 [[Bell Pepper|bell pepper]] of any colour, deseeded and chopped\n| 1 large [[Leek|leek]], washed well and finely chopped\n| 2 tablespoon [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 10 [[Button mushrooms|button mushrooms]], sliced\n| 4 [[Cloves of Garlic, peeled and crushed|cloves of garlic, peeled and crushed]] (or to taste)\n| Good pinch of [[Salt|salt]], [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n| Pinch of [[Mixed herbs|mixed herbs]] or [[Fresh herbs|fresh herbs]] if in season\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Deseed the [[Pepper|pepper]], cut into strips and cut the strips into four pieces\n| Heat a good quality non-stick [[Frying pan|frying pan]] such as a [[Le Creuset]] on maximum\n| Do not add any [[Oil|oil]] at this stage\n| Add the [[Pepper|pepper]] strips to the pan and [[Dry-fry|dry-fry]], stirring often, until the skin is  blistered and blackened in places. This should take about 5 minutes and will also soften the pepper nicely.\n| Slice the [[Leek|leek]] lengthwise and wash any soil from between the leaves. Shake [[Dry|dry]] and slice finely\n| Add the [[Leeks|leeks]] to the pan and [[Dry fry|dry fry]] for a few minutes\n| Add the [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and stir in the [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]] and cook for about 5 minutes\n| Mix in the [[Crushed garlic|crushed garlic]], [[Herbs|herbs]] and seasoning and stir really well until combined nicely.\n| Serve immediately.\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\n</gallery>\n\n===Variations===\nIf you are using an [[Oven|oven]]-proof [[Frying pan|frying pan]] you can cover the pan once the dish is cooked and reheat in the oven if you're serving this with an oven cooked dish.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n[[Category:Dry fried]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#leek #chargrilledpeppersleeksandgarlicmushrooms #leeks #oliveoil #lecreuset #peppers #dry #blackpepper #unusualrecipes #dryfried #dryfry</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Cheat's apple wine",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Cheat's apple wine, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#yeast #wine #cheatsapplewine #degrees #applewine #drink #applejuice #litres #celsius #cookery #fermenting \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=I was re-arranging my cookery books last week and came across my old wine-making books from almost 30 years ago\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 8255\n|PortionCalories = 44\n|DatePublished=7th April 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Servings: 186 - Makes 28 litres\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 2 months\n |PrepTime = 2 months\n |CookTime = None\n |Image = [[Image:Cheat's apple wine recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Win, or cider?</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Sort of in-between</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Sue_spins|Susie]] </span></span>\n}}\nI was re-arranging my [[Cookery|cookery]] books last week and came across my old [[Wine|wine]]-making books from almost 30 years ago.  As we have a home-brewing shop in our nearest town I brought some new kit and today have started to make an [[Apple wine|apple wine]].\n\nThis is called Cheat's [[Apple wine|apple wine]] because I have used [[Apple juice|apple juice]], rather than starting from scratch with [[Apples|apples]].  This type of [[Wine|wine]] is ready to [[Drink|drink]] fairly soon after making so is ideal for someone who is impatient.\n\nSee [[#Chef's notes|Chef's notes]] below for [[Yeast|yeast]] and nutrient quantities.\n===[[Servings]]===\nAbout 30 bottles\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 5 [[Litres|litres]] [[Apple juice|apple juice]]\n| 6.5kg [[Sugar|sugar]]\n| General purpose [[Wine|wine]] [[Yeast|yeast]]\n| [[Yeast]] nutrient\n| Water, to make up to 23 [[Litres|litres]]\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Sterlise all [[Equipment|equipment]]\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Place all of the ingredients in a large [[Fermenting|fermenting]] bin with space for an airlock in the lid.\n| Stir and take a hydrometer reading if desired.\n| Cover with the lid and plug the airlock space with some cotton wool. \n| Agitate every day, using a sterlised plastic paddle and keep for a week at about 21 [[Degrees|degrees]] [[Celsius|celsius]].\n| Replace the cotton wool with and airlock which has been half-filled with water and keep at about 18 [[Degrees|degrees]] until the desired dryness has been achieved.\n| Rack into demijohns, leave for 2 months and rack again.\n| The [[Wine|wine]] should now be ready to [[Drink|drink]] and can be bottled.\n}}\n===Variations===\n30 bottles is a large quantity and you may prefer to use a 4.5 litre demijohn, which will yield about 6 bottles.\n===Chef's notes===\n[[Yeast]] and nutrients vary.  I used 4 tsps yeast and 5 tsps of nutrient, but you should follow the instructions given on you chosen packet or tub of nutrient and yeast.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Drink and beverage recipes]]\n[[Category:Cookery cheats]]\n[[Category:Uncooked]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#yeast #wine #cheatsapplewine #degrees #applewine #drink #applejuice #litres #celsius #cookery #fermenting </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Cheddar, Cambazola and treacly bacon puffs\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#pastry #cheese #puffpastry #bacon #cheddarcambazolaandtreaclybaconpuffs #greaseproofpaper #italiancheese #cured #treacle #maincourses #bake\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=Very similar to the Cheese and bacon puffs I made last week but with a hint of Cambazola, that lovely creamy blue Italian cheese. Two of these and a salad..\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=25th January 2023\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 6\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  40 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  25 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 3272\n|PortionCalories = 545 \n|Image = [[Image:Cheddar, Cambazola and treacly bacon puffs recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Light and puffy</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">and heavy with a lovely filling</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jeremy]] </span></span>\n}}\n\nVery similar to the [[Cheese and bacon puffs]] I made last week but with a hint of Cambazola, that lovely creamy blue [[Italian cheese]].\n\nTwo of these and a [[Salad|salad]] make a lovely evening meal!\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 6 rashers of [[Treacle cured bacon]]\n| 80g of Cambazloa [[Cheese|cheese]], divided into 6 portions\n| 120 g of [[Cheddar cheese]] divided into 6 portions\n| 1 pack of ready rolled [[Puff pastry|puff pastry]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat you [[Oven|oven]] to 200\u00b0 C\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Allow the [[Puff pastry|puff pastry]] roll to come to room temperature; it helps to stop the [[Pastry|pastry]] cracking\n| Roll out the [[Pastry|pastry]] and leave on it greaseproof packaging\n| Sprinkle wit [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| Cut the [[Pastry|pastry]] into 6 squares (12 cm x 12 cm (5\" x 5\")\n| Add a dob of Cambazola [[Blue cheese|blue cheese]] into the middle of each square\n| Lay a piece of [[Treacly bacon|treacly bacon]] diagonally over the Cambazloa [[Cheese|cheese]]\n| Place a slice of [[Cheddar]] over the [[Bacon|bacon]] on each puff\n| Pull all four corners together and twist together to join\n| Place on a [[Baking sheet|baking sheet]] covered with [[Greaseproof paper|greaseproof paper]]\n| [[Bake]] for 20 minutes at the top of the [[Oven|oven]] at 200\u00b0 C\n| They might need a little longer, sometimes they seem to take 25 minutes!\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Cheddar, Cambazola and treacly b1 Russells Bacon.jpg| After baking for 24 minutes\nImage:Cheddar, Cambazola and treacly b2 Russells Bacon.jpg| Ready for the oven\nCambazola and treacly bacon puffs with emmenthal.jpg| Cheddar popped on top of the bacon (with some extra Emmenthal!)\nImage:Cheddar, Cambazola and treacly b3 Russells Bacon.jpg| Traeacly bacon, done!\nImage:Cheddar, Cambazola and treacly b4 Russells Bacon.jpg| A dob of Cambazola on each square of puff pastry\n</gallery>\n}}\n\n===Chef's notes===\nI don't bother with [[Egg-wash|egg-wash]] any more, seems like a waste of an [[Egg|egg]] in these and I finds they hold together by twisting the [[Pastry|pastry]] than they do using [[Eggs|eggs]].\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:French recipes]]\n[[Category:Italian recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n<!-- footer title": "Cheddar shortcrust pastry",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->{{#seo:\n|title=Cheddar shortcrust pastry, British recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#cheddarshortcrustpastry #foodprocessor #pastry #cheddar #butter #flour #dough #freeze #plainflour #pies #sieve \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This is a lovely crisp pastry, perfect for meat pies or quiches and now I use nothing else now due to protests from my hubby!\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 4236\n|PortionCalories = 1059\n|DatePublished=5th April 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4 - makes about 600g\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  15 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime = None\n|Image = [[Image:Cheddar shortcrust pastry recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Makes great savouries</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">This makes such a difference to savoury pastries and is such a simple idea.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis is a lovely crisp [[Pastry|pastry]], perfect for [[Meat|meat]] [[Pies|pies]] or quiches and now I use nothing else now due to protests from my hubby!\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 500g [[Plain flour]]\n| 250g [[Butter]]\n| 125g Mature [[Cheddar]] (yellow)\n| 3-5tbsp cold water\n| extra [[Flour|flour]] for dusting\n\n}}\n</div>\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* [[Food processor]] with plastic blade required\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| [[Sieve]] [[Flour|flour]], cut [[Butter|butter]] into 1cm cubes and grate [[Cheddar|cheddar]].\n| Add everything to [[Food processor|food processor]] and pulse until mixed into chucky crumbs.\n| Add water one tablespoon at a time and pulse [[Food processor|food processor]] until ball of [[Dough|dough]] is formed.\n| Use immediately or [[Freeze|freeze]] for future use\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nThis makes 6 individual pie crusts and lids or\n2x quiche crusts or\n1x large pie crust and lid\n===Chef's notes===\nUsing a orange coloured [[Cheese|cheese]] will make the cheese noticeable in the [[Pastry|pastry]]\n{{Quiche - See also}}\n\n{{RecipeLine}}\n\n[[Category:Recipes|Pastry]]\n[[Category:British recipes|Pastry]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking|Pastry]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Uncooked]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#cheddarshortcrustpastry #foodprocessor #pastry #cheddar #butter #flour #dough #freeze #plainflour #pies #sieve </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]

title": "Cheese and bacon loaf",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Cheese and bacon loaf, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#breadmaker #cheeseandbaconloaf #strongbrownflour #unusualrecipes #pancetta #cheddarcheese #bacon #driedyeast #milkpowder #panasonicsd253 #poachedeggs \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This is really more of a reminder to anyone with a breadmaker to use it for more than just brown or white loaves\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2550\n|PortionCalories = 255\n|DatePublished=27th October 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Servings: 10 - Makes 1 large loaf\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime = 4 hours 5 minutes\n|PrepTime = 2 hours, 35 minutes \n|CookTime = 1 hour, 30 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Cheese and bacon loaf.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Not bad</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I would prefer to eat a cheese and bacon sandwich made with nice bread.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis is really more of a reminder to anyone with a [[Breadmaker|breadmaker]] to use it for more than just brown or white loaves. than a proper recipe.\n\nWe have a [[Panasonic SD253]] [[Breadmaker|breadmaker]] and it is wonderful.  We have used it twice a week for the last year or so to make white or wholemeal loaves.  However, we have only recently tried some of the other recipes that came with the breadmaker.  They are exceptional and well worth making.\n\nIf you have a Panasonic [[Breadmaker|breadmaker]], '''I urge you to try this recipe out!'''\n===Breadmaker settings===\n* For the Panasonic SD253 breadmaker and similar models, use the Basic bake (1), raisin setting.\n* For the [[Panasonic SD-ZB2502 automatic breadmaker]] use menu option 03, basic bake, raisin.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1 teaspoon [[Dried yeast|dried yeast]]\n| 500 g (1lb 2 oz) [[Strong brown flour|strong brown flour]]\n| 1 tablespoon of [[sugar]]\n| 1 tablespoon of  [[milk powder]]\n| 75 g (3 oz) [[Cheddar cheese]], grated\n| 350 ml water - or by weight instead of volume, 350 g water \n}}\n'''Place in the nut dispenser'''\n* 75 g (3 oz) [[home smoked bacon]], [[pancetta]] or cooked [[bacon]], chopped\n\n\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Add all of the ingredients apart from the bacon into the [[Breadmaker|breadmaker]]\n| Place the chopped bacon in the nut dispenser\n| Select BAKE RAISIN, LARGE program \n| Perfectly baked in 4 hours\n}}\n===Serving suggestion===\nServe with butter and steaming hot [[Poached eggs|poached eggs]]. \n===Chef's notes===\nThe timer cannot be used with this recipe\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Breadmaker recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#breadmaker #cheeseandbaconloaf #strongbrownflour #unusualrecipes #pancetta #cheddarcheese #bacon #driedyeast #milkpowder #panasonicsd253 #poachedeggs </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Cheese and bacon puffs",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Cheese and bacon puffs\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#cheeseandbaconpuffs #puffpastry #creamcheese #cheese #bacon #egg #blackpepper #treaclybacon #freshlygroundblackpepper #phillycheese #grated\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=This superb finger food needs only ready rolled puff pasty, bacon and cheese for a delicious snack\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=14th January 2023\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 6\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  30 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime =  20 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 3356\n|PortionCalories = 559\n|Image = [[Image:Cheese and bacon puffs recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Gorgous!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Discovered it was better at 200\u00b0 C than 180\u00b0 C, so I've altered the recipe</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis superb finger food needs only ready rolled puff pasty, [[Bacon|bacon]] and [[Cheese|cheese]] for a delicious [[Snack|snack]].\n\nThis type of recipe is really easy to customise by just adding a little of your  favourite flavours.  I love to add [[Cream cheese|cream cheese]] and [[Mustard|mustard]]; what's your favourite?\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 roll ready made [[Puff pastry|puff pastry]]\n| 3 tablespoon [[Philadelphia Original]] full [[Fat|fat]] [[Cream cheese|cream cheese]]\n| 1 heaped teaspoon [[Moutarde de Meaux]] ([[French]] [[Wholegrain mustard|wholegrain mustard]])\n| 6 rashers of [[Treacle Cured Bacon from Russell's of Upwell's]]\n| 100g gruy\u00e8re [[Cheese|cheese]], [[Grated|grated]]\n| 1 beaten [[Egg|egg]]\n| [[Freshly ground black pepper]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 200\u00b0 C - place near top of oven and use top heat only (if available)\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Philly Cheese and bacon puffs pizza stone.jpg| Cheese and bacon turnovers; Baked on a pizza stone\nImage:Philly Cheese and bacon puffs 00000026 Gouda.jpg| Cheese and bacon turnovers; Folded together, ready for the oven\nImage:Philly Cheese and bacon puffs 00000027 Gouda.jpg| Cheese and bacon turnovers; Grated [[gouda]]and [[black pepper]] added\nImage:Philly Cheese and bacon puffs 00000028 Gouda.jpg| Cheese and bacon turnovers; Topped with [[treacly bacon]]\nImage:Philly Cheese and bacon puffs 00000029 Gouda.jpg| Cheese and bacon turnovers with a dollop of mustardy [[Philly cheese]]\nImage:Philly Cheese and bacon puffs 00000030 Gouda.jpg| Cheese and bacon turnovers; The ingredients: [[Puff pastry]], [[Moutarde de Meaux]], [[Philly cheese]], [[Treacly bacon]], [[egg]] (wash) and [[black pepper]]\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Ensure the [[Puff pastry|puff pastry]] roll is properly [[Defrosted|defrosted]] if it has been [[Frozen|frozen]]\n| Unroll the [[Puff pastry|puff pastry]] onto the [[Greaseproof paper|greaseproof paper]] it is wrapped in\n| Cut the [[Puff pastry|puff pastry]] into 6 equal sized squares\n| Mix [[Pommery Mustard|pommery mustard]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]] into [[Philadelphia cream cheese]] ensuring the mixture is well combined\n| Add a dollop of mustardy [[Cream cheese|cream cheese]] into the centre of each square of [[Puff pastry|puff pastry]]\n| Lay a rasher of [[Bacon|bacon]] diagonally over each mound of [[Cream cheese|cream cheese]]\n| Scatter the [[Grated|grated]] [[Cheese|cheese]] over the [[Bacon|bacon]]\n| Although considered wisdom suggests using egg wash to join the pastry, my experiments show it's better to twist the dry pastry edges together to join them\n| Fold all four bare corners of the [[Pastry|pastry]] together and press together to seal\n| [[Brush]] the tops of the [[Pastry|pastry]] with the beaten [[Egg|egg]]\n| Slide the [[Pastries|pastries]] onto a greaseproof backing sheet or [[Pizza stone|pizza stone]] and [[Bake|bake]] for 20 '''''or''''' until golden [[Brown|brown]]\n| Move to as [[Cooling rack|cooling rack]] to cool, once [[Baked|baked]]\n}}\n===Chef's notes===\nThese keep perfectly well for 4 days if [[Refrigerated|refrigerated]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:French recipes]]\n[[Category:Swiss recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Breakfast recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Gluten free recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Pies tarts and flans]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#cheeseandbaconpuffs #puffpastry #creamcheese #cheese #bacon #egg #blackpepper #treaclybacon #freshlygroundblackpepper #phillycheese #grated</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]

title": "Cheese and bacon quiche",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Cheese and bacon quiche\n|titlemode=replace\n|description=With lovely Fresh fresh eggs from Thelma and Louise, making quiches is a must.\n|keywords=#pastry #greaseproofpaper #dehydrated #brie #eggs #freshlygroundblackpepper #parsley #bacon #cheddarcheese #bake #oliveoil #quiche\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=3rd July 2022\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  5 hours, 30 minutes\n|PrepTime =  4 hours, 20 minutes\n|CookTime =  1 hour, 10 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 3007\n|PortionCalories = 751\n|Image = [[Image:Cheese and bacon quiche recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Very continental</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Especially like the sun-dried tomatoes</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Cheese and bacon quiche baked.jpg|thumb|right|Baked in a Le Cruset oven dish]]\n\nWith lovely [[Fresh eggs|fresh eggs]] from [[Thelma and Louise]], [[Thelma and Louise|(our hens)]] making quiches is a must.  This one used bits and bobs we had lying about; it was fabulous.  Very juicy, which I think must have been the re-hydrated [[Taste Sensation Sun-dried Tomatoes Diced]] coupled with the fresh [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]].\n\nNormally, using a metal flan tin a percentage of the pasty is always left-over and wasted, this time I used the cast [[Iron|iron]] [[Le Creuset]]  rectangular [[Oven|oven]] dish.  The [[Pastry|pastry]] fitted perfectly, with no wastage.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 pack [[Ready rolled shortcrust pastry|ready rolled shortcrust pastry]]\n| 5 large [[Eggs|eggs]]\n| 3 tablespoons [[cr\u00e8me fra\u00eeche]]\n| Pinch of [[Dried|dried]] [[Parsley|parsley]]\n| A big pinch of [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 1 small [[Onion|onion]], peeled and chopped finely\n| 5 rashers of [[Bacon|bacon]], chopped into small pieces\n| 2 [[Cloves of garlic, crushed|cloves of garlic, crushed]]\n| 150 g [[Grated|grated]] [[Cheddar cheese]]\n| 50 g [[French]] [[Brie|brie]], chopped into small cubes\n| 3 tablespoons [[Taste Sensation Sun-dried Tomatoes Diced]]\n| 10 [[Cherry tomatoes|cherry tomatoes]], sliced\n| Good pinch of sweet [[Paprika powder|paprika powder]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Soak the [[Dehydrated|dehydrated]] [[Sun-dried tomatoes|sun-dried tomatoes]] in water for 3 hours\n* Drain in a [[Sieve|sieve]] before use.\n* Pre-heat you [[Oven|oven]] to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4), [fan oven 160\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Remove the pre-rolled [[Pastry|pastry]] from the [[Fridge|fridge]] and leave at room temperature for an hour to allow easy handling\n| Roll the [[Pastry|pastry]] into the [[Oven tray|oven tray]]\n| Cover with [[Greaseproof paper|greaseproof paper]]\n| Fill the paper with [[Baking beans|baking beans]] and [[Blind bake|blind bake]] for 15 minutes at 180\u00b0 C \n| Remove the [[Beans|beans]] and [[Greaseproof paper|greaseproof paper]] and prick the [[Pastry|pastry]] all over with a fork\n| Return to the [[Oven|oven]] and [[Bake|bake]] for a further 7 minutes to crisp up\n| Meanwhile [[Fry|fry]] the [[Onions|onions]] for 5 minutes in the [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]], adding the [[Crushed garlic|crushed garlic]] for the last few minutes\n| [[Stir fry]] the [[Bacon|bacon]] in this mixture until it is slightly [[Browned|browned]] and all of the  moisture is bubbled off from the bacon\n| [[Whisk]] the [[Eggs|eggs]], [[cr\u00e8me fra\u00eeche]] and [[Parsley|parsley]] together until smooth\n| Remove the [[Pastry|pastry]] from the [[Oven|oven]] and allow to cool for 10 minutes\n| Dot the [[Brie|brie]] evenly over the [[Pastry|pastry]] base\n| Pour in the [[Egg|egg]] mixture and evenly distribute the remaining main ingredients evenly over the mix, topping with half of the [[Cheddar cheese]] and a sprinkle of [[Paprika|paprika]]\n| [[Bake]] for 40 minutes at  160\u00b0 C - checking after 30 to ensure the [[Pastry|pastry]] does not burn\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\n</gallery>\n\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with a [[Green salad|green salad]]\n===Chef's notes===\nThe long preparation time is due to the time it takes to rehydrate the [[Sun-dried tomatoes|sun-dried tomatoes]].  Obviously with jarred sun-[[Dried|dried]] [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]] this step would not be necessary!\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:French recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Egg recipes]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Pies tarts and flans]]\n[[Category:Taste Sensation recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#pastry #greaseproofpaper #dehydrated #brie #eggs #freshlygroundblackpepper #parsley #bacon #cheddarcheese #bake #oliveoil #quiche</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Cheese and chilli popcorn\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#tastesensationchilicheesemarinade #popcorn #corn #spatterguard #snacksandlightbites #popped #recipes #popcornrecipes #britishrecipes #northamericanrecipes #unusualrecipes\n|description=Testing out my recent purchase of Taste Sensation Chili Cheese marinade ad I thought I would give it a go with popcorn. Wow! Fantastic flavours; its..\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=26th January 2021\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = |Spicy, sweet, salty and cheesy. Yum! \ud83c\udf7f\ud83c\udf7f\ud83c\udf7f\n|Servings = Serves 1\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  5 minutes\n|PrepTime =  1 minute\n|CookTime =  4 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 168\n|PortionCalories = 168\n|Image = [[Image:Taste Sensation Chili Cheese popcorn.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">This is a Winner!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">The perfect match of flavours, even if I say so myself.</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry, aka Chef]])</span></span>\n}}\nTesting out my recent purchase of [[Taste Sensation Chili Cheese marinade]] ad I thought I would give it a go with [[Popcorn|popcorn]].  Wow!\n\nFantastic flavours; it's quite hot, has a hint of saltiness with the [[Cheese|cheese]] and yet it's also quite sweet.  A winner.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 3 tablespoons [[Popping corn|popping corn]]\n| 12 tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Taste Sensation Chili Cheese marinade]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Heat the [[Oil|oil]] in a large heavy based pot for a minute or so\n| Drop the [[Popcorn|popcorn]] into the pot and shimmy the pot to coat the popcorn evenly with [[Oil|oil]]\n| Cover with a [[Spatter guard|spatter guard]] - this stops the [[Corn|corn]] and the [[Fat|fat]] from going everywhere and also allows the moisture to escape, which a pan lid would not\n| A [[Tea towel|tea towel]] works just as well, but take care it does not catch fire!\n| Once most of the [[Corn|corn]] has [[Popped|popped]], remove from the heat and shake into a [[Lock & Lock box]]\n| Add a tablespoon of [[Taste Sensation Chili Cheese marinade]] to the [[Lock & Lock box]], cover and shake like mad to cover the [[Popcorn|popcorn]].\n| Eat and enjoy!\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nPopcorn cooking.jpg| A [[spatter guard]] is perfect for popping corn\nImage:Taste Sensation Chili Cheese marinade.jpg|[https://tastesensationltd.com/product/chilli-cheese-marinade-flavouring Taste Sensation Chilli cheese marinade]\n</gallery>\n\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with a chilled [[Beer|beer]]!\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:North American recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Chilli pepper recipes]]\n[[Category:Popcorn recipes]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n[[Category:Taste Sensation recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#tastesensationchilicheesemarinade #popcorn #corn #spatterguard #snacksandlightbites #popped #recipes #popcornrecipes #britishrecipes #northamericanrecipes #unusualrecipes</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Cheese and ham savouries",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Cheese and ham savouries\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#puffpastry #maasdamcheese #pastry #cheeseandhamsavouries #ham #snacksandlightbites #maincourses #bake #cheeserecipes #maincourse #breadandbaking\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=A nice quick and easy savoury ham and cheese slice. A snack or main course.\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=13th December 2020\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = The curry-puff version!\n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  40 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime =  30 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 3176\n|PortionCalories = 934\n|Image = [[Image:Cheese and ham curry puff recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Just seen that y9ou also used curry powder in this</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.4</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I'll have to make this again now!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nA nice quick and easy [[Snack|snack]] which can work well as a [[Main course|main course]] too.\n\nA whole roll of ready-made [[Puff pastry|puff pastry]] makes 4 of these and there quite substantial.  I've used pre-sliced [[Maasdam cheese]] because I that was what was in the [[Fridge|fridge]] at the time - any of you favourite [[Cheeses|cheeses]] would work in this - even [[Blue cheese|blue cheese]]!\n\nI also added a teaspoon of [[Curry powder|curry powder]] to one of mine - Yum &#129322;!\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 roll of ready made [[Puff pastry|puff pastry]]\n| 6 slices of [[Maasdam cheese]], rolled and chopped\n| 4 medium sized slices of [[Ham|ham]], rolled and chopped\n| A few tablespoons of [[Milk|milk]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Pre-heat your [[Oven|oven]] to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4), [fan oven 160\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Quarter the [[Puff pastry|puff pastry]] into squares\n| Chop the [[Cheese|cheese]] and [[Ham|ham]] and divide into four piles\n| Add the mixture to the middle of the [[Pastry|pastry]]\n| If you want to add any extra flavourings, do this now\n| Roll up or 'pasty-fy' your savoury\n| Use a fork to seal the edge or squeeze the edges together to seal\n| [[Brush]] with a little [[Milk|milk]] so the [[Pastry|pastry]] turns golden when cooked\n| Pop onto a [[Baking tray|baking tray]] lined with [[Grease-proof paper|grease-proof paper]]\n| [[Bake]] for 30 minutes or until they 'look' nice.\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Cheese and ham savouries recipe.jpg|Just out of the oven\nImage:Cheese savouries ready to bake.jpg|Ready to bake - mine are the messy ones, Anne made the two neat ones!\nImage:Maasdam_cheese.jpg|Slices of cheese such as [[Maasdam cheese|Massdam]] are perfect\n</gallery>\n\n===Serving suggestions===\nEat hot or cold.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Pies tarts and flans]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#puffpastry #maasdamcheese #pastry #cheeseandhamsavouries #ham #snacksandlightbites #maincourses #bake #cheeserecipes #maincourse #breadandbaking</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Cheese and ham squash bombs",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Cheese and ham squash bombs a cheese recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#cheeseandhamsquashbombs #squashes #squash #ham #cheese #garlic #roast #scoop #fetacheese #oliveoil #lemon \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Another recipe inspired by Stefan Gates' The Extraordinary Cookbook\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1119\n|PortionCalories = 559\n|DatePublished=17th January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 2 to 4\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 1 hour 45 minutes\n |PrepTime = 15 minutes\n |CookTime = 1 hour 30 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Cheese and ham squash bombs recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Funky \ud83e\udd29</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">A natty idea!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nAnother recipe inspired by Stefan Gates' [[The Extraordinary Cookbook]].  \nStefan used hooligan squashes but I've used [[patti pan squashes]] because that's what's ready in the garden at the moment.  Any small squashes would do.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 2 small patti pan [[Squashes|squashes]]\n| 2 Cloves of [[Garlic|garlic]], skin on, smashed under the flat of a knife\n| A few sprigs of [[fresh thyme]]\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| [[Extra virgin olive oil]]\n}}\n'''the filling'''\n* 100g [[Feta cheese]]\n* 200g [[Cr\u00e8me fraiche]]\n* 100g cooked [[Ham|ham]] - chopped finely\n* The [[Juice|juice]] and [[Zest|zest]] from half a [[Lemon|lemon]]\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the oven to  200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6), [fan oven 180\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Cheese and ham squash bombs pair.jpg|Fresh out of the oven\nImage:Cheese and ham squash bombs ingredients.jpg|[[Cheese]] and [[Ham|ham]] [[Squash|squash]] bombs, the ingredients\nImage:Upside-down squash roasting.jpg|If they are an odd shape, roast them upside-down. Slice off the base instead of the top\n</gallery>\n\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Wash the [[Squashes|squashes]], slice off the tops and reserve then [[Scoop|scoop]] out the [[Seeds|seeds]] with a spoon and discard them.\n| Season the insides with [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]], add a smashed clove of [[Garlic|garlic]], a sprig of [[thyme]] and 1 teaspoon of [[Olive oil|olive oil]] to each [[Squash|squash]].\n| Replace the lid and shake well.\n| [[Roast]] for 1 hour\n| Meanwhile crush the [[Cheese|cheese]] and mix all of the filling ingredients together and season to taste.\n| After 1 hour, remove the [[Squashes|squashes]] from the oven and discard the garlic and [[thyme leaves]] & drain any excess liquid.\n| Add the filling, replace the tops and [[Roast|roast]] for a further 30 minutes\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe hot\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Squash recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#cheeseandhamsquashbombs #squashes #squash #ham #cheese #garlic #roast #scoop #fetacheese #oliveoil #lemon </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

                "revisions": [

                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
