                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Cheese and lentil wedges a cheese recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#butter #onion #tomatoes #cheeseandlentilwedges #saute #wok #grated #sandwich #driedmixedherbs #egg #wedges \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Going through my mum's cookery notes and found this favourite of hers\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1030\n|PortionCalories = 171\n|DatePublished=24th June 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = A [[Lentil lasagne (TM)|similar recipe]], using a [[Thermomix]] \n|Servings = Serves 6\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  50 minutes\n|PrepTime =  5 minutes\n|CookTime =  45 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Lentil lasagne TM recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Mum know best!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">This site would not exist if it were not for her. x</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef]] </span></span>\n}}\n\nGoing through my mum's cookery notes and found this favourite of hers.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 225 g (8 oz) [[Red lentils|red lentils]]\n| 450 ml (3/4 pint) water\n| 1 large [[Onion|onion]], peeled and sliced\n| 25 g (1 oz) [[Butter|butter]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Dried mixed herbs|dried mixed herbs]]\n| 100g (4 oz) [[Grated]] [[Cheddar cheese]]\n| 1 large [[Egg|egg]]\n| 25 g 91 oz) [[Breadcrumbs]]\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n}}\n'''garnish'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 2 [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]], sliced\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 190\u00b0 C (375\u00b0 F - gas 5), [fan [[Oven|oven]] 170\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Add the [[Lentils|lentils]] to the water and bring to the [[Boil|boil]].\n| Cook until all the water has been absorbed.\n| Add the [[Butter|butter]] to a [[Frying pan|frying pan]] or a [[Wok|wok]] and add a good grind of [[Black pepper|black pepper]].\n| [[Saute]] the [[Onion|onion]] for 6 minutes in the [[Butter|butter]] or until softened.\n| Mix all of the ingredients together and fill a 23 cm (9\") [[Sandwich|sandwich]] tin.  Press down to compact and top with the sliced [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]].\n| [[Bake]] in the middle of the [[Oven|oven]] for 30 minutes.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe, sliced into [[Wedges|wedges]].  This is good hot or cold.\n===Recipe source===\n\n* My mum!\n===Variations===\nUse [[Fresh herbs|fresh herbs]] if available.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Grain and bean recipes]]\n[[Category:Pies tarts and flans]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#butter #onion #tomatoes #cheeseandlentilwedges #saute #wok #grated #sandwich #driedmixedherbs #egg #wedges </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Cheese and mustard seed biscuits",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Cheese and mustard seed biscuits a cheese recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#cheese #cheeseandmustardseedbiscuits #grated #butter #flour #eggyolks #baking #blackbombercheese #mustardseed #plainflour #mustardseeds \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A variant on the traditional cheese straws\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 4319\n|PortionCalories = 359\n|DatePublished=27th October 2012\n|Author = JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = Serves 12 - Makes about 50 biscuits - they freeze well.\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 30 minutes\n |PrepTime = 15 minutes\n |CookTime = 15 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Cheese and mustard seed biscuits recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"><span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Its the mustard</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Mustard seeds really make the difference</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\">[[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]] </span></span>\n}}\n\nA variant on the traditional [[cheese]] straws.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 400g [[Plain flour|plain flour]]\n| A pinch of [[Salt|salt]]\n| 5 tbsps black [[Mustard seeds|mustard seeds]]\n| 120g [[Black bomber cheese|black bomber cheese]], [[Grated|grated]]\n| 120g [[Parmesan cheese]], [[Grated|grated]]\n| 230g [[Butter|butter]], cubed\n| 3 [[Egg yolks|egg yolks]]\n| Cold water to bind\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| [[Sieve]] the [[Flour|flour]] and [[Salt|salt]] into a bowl and add the [[Mustard seed|mustard seed]].\n| Add the [[Butter|butter]] into the [[Flour|flour]] along with the [[Cheese|cheese]], [[Egg yolks|egg yolks]] and water (if necessary).\n| Mix well until you have a smooth [[Dough|dough]].\n| Roll out into a rectangle on a lightly floured surface, until the thickness of a \u00a31 coin.\n| Cut with [[Pastry|pastry]] cutters and transfer to a greased [[Baking|baking]] sheet.\n| [[Bake]] for 15 minutes at 190\u00b0 C (375\u00b0 F - gas 5), [fan [[Oven|oven]] 170\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n| Cool on the [[Baking|baking]] sheet for 2-3 minutes to harden before transferring to a cooling tray.\n| The  biscuits will keep in an airtight container for up to 5 days.\n}}\n===Variations===\nUse any small seeds, eg [[celery]], [[nigella]], [[fennel]], [[caraway]].  I would recommend that you do include at least half [[Parmesan]] [[cheese]] and that the other half also be a strong [[cheese]], eg [[Old Winchester cheese]], [[Gruy\u00e8re]], strong [[Cheddar]].\n\nAdd 1 teaspoon of chilli powder for a little more bite.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#cheese #cheeseandmustardseedbiscuits #grated #butter #flour #eggyolks #baking #blackbombercheese #mustardseed #plainflour #mustardseeds </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }

title": "Cheese and olive sourdough",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Cheese and olive sourdough bread recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#cheeseandolivesourdough #sourdough #flour #parmesan #fridge #grated #onion #bread #ticklercheese #bake #vegetarian \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Whilst I am making this bread from a sourdough leaven, you can make a version with commercial yeast by using 10g\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2655\n|PortionCalories = 265\n|DatePublished=26th November 2012\n|Author = JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = Servings: 10 - 1 large loaf\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 4 hours\n |PrepTime = 3 hours 15 minutes\n |CookTime = 45 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Cheese and olive sourdough recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"><span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Nice combination.</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Thanks Julia - I really enjoyed making (and eating) this!</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\">[[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]] </span></span>\n}}\n\n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}}\n\nWhilst I am making this [[Bread|bread]] from a [[Sourdough|sourdough]] leaven, you can make a version with commercial [[Yeast|yeast]] by using 10g fresh or 5g [[Dried yeast|dried yeast]] in place of the leaven.  This will need to be started the day before you want to [[Bake|bake]] it.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 200g [[Sourdough|sourdough]] leaven\n| 500g [[Strong white bread flour|strong white bread flour]]\n| 325g [[Sparkling mineral water|sparkling mineral water]]\n| 30g [[Onion|onion]] powder\n| 1 teaspoon finely crushed [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] or Rose Pink Himalayan [[Rock salt|rock salt]]\n| 125g [[Parmesan]], [[Grated|grated]] (See '''Variations''' below)\n| 125g [[Tickler cheese|Tickler cheese]], [[Grated|grated]]\n| 75g (after stones have been removed) [[Black olives|black olives]], chopped\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* If your [[Sourdough|sourdough]] leaven has been in the [[Fridge|fridge]], remove it the day before you want to start making your [[Bread|bread]] and refresh it with 50g [[Flour|flour]] and 40g water. \n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Mix the [[Sourdough|sourdough]] leaven with 250g of the [[Flour|flour]] and all of the water and leave for several hours.\n| Add the remaining [[Flour|flour]] and the [[Onion|onion]] powder, [[Knead|knead]] according to your chosen method and shape into a ball.\n| Place in an oiled bowl, cover with [[Clingfilm|clingfilm]] and [[Refrigerate|refrigerate]] overnight.\n| Remove from the [[Fridge|fridge]] and leave at room temperature until it has almost doubled in size.\n| Gently deflate, shape into a ball and again, place in an oiled bowl, cover and leave to rise a second time.\n| When it has almost doubled in size, mix in the [[Salt|salt]], [[Cheeses|cheeses]] and the chopped [[Olives|olives]].\n| Shape and place in a 900g loaf tin and leave to prove until it has risen to the top of the tin.\n| Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to its highest temperature.\n| Slash if desired and [[Bake|bake]] for 30-40 minutes, reducing the temperature to 220\u00b0 C (425\u00b0 F - gas 7), [fan [[Oven|oven]] 200\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour].\n| After 30 minutes, remove from tin and place upside down on a baking tray.  Return to the oven for a further 10-15 minutes.\n| Allow to cool on a wire rack.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nGreat with salad.\n===Variations===\nUse any combination of hard, strong [[Cheese|cheese]] you like.  As there is no [[Vegetarian|vegetarian]] [[Parmesan]], use [[Bookhams not just a pasta cheese]] which is a vegetarian cheese made in a similar way to [[Parmesan]] and is available in branches of Waitrose.  [[Tickler cheese|Tickler]] is a vegetarian [[Cheddar]] type cheese available in most supermarkets.\n===Chef's notes===\nMake sure your tin is oiled well with [[oil|groundnut oil]] or line with [[Bake-O-Glide]]. \n==See also==\n* [[Rye sourdough starter]]\n* [[Spelt sourdough starter]]\n* [[Cheese and olive sourdough]]\n* [https://sites.google.com/site/nikandedwinascookbook/Home/bread/full-sourdough Sourdough recipe] from Nik and Edwina \n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#cheeseandolivesourdough #sourdough #flour #parmesan #fridge #grated #onion #bread #ticklercheese #bake #vegetarian </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Cheese and onion puff pies",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Cheese and onion puff pies a cheese recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#onions #pastry #cheeseandonionpuffpies #potatoes #onion #ham #brush #egg #potato #rosemary #cheese \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A rich cheese and onion meat pie recipe, courtesy of British Onions\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 4484\n|PortionCalories = 747\n|DatePublished=17th January 2013\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = Serves 6\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 1 hour 15 minutes\n |PrepTime = 20 minutes\n |CookTime = 55 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Cheese and onion puff pies recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Yum</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">A nice mix of cheeses</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The&nbsp;Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\n\nA rich [[cheese]] and [[onion]] meat pie recipe, courtesy of [[British Onions]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 3 Medium white [[Onions|onions]]\n| 2 Tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 2 Tablespoons fresh chopped [[Rosemary leaves|rosemary leaves]]\n| 450g/1lb [[Potatoes]], peeled, thinly sliced\n| 200g/7oz Full [[Fat|fat]] cr\u00e8me fraiche\n| 100g/4oz [[Gruyere]] or mature [[Cheddar cheese|cheddar cheese]], [[Grated|grated]]\n| 1 [[Clove|clove]] [[Garlic|garlic]], finely chopped\n| [[Salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 500g/1lb 2oz [[Puff pastry]], [[defrosted]] if [[Frozen|frozen]]\n| Little [[Flour|flour]] for dusting\n| 6 Slices [[Wafer|wafer]] thin [[Honey|honey]] [[Roast|roast]] [[Ham|ham]]\n| 1 [[Egg]], beaten\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Thinly slice 2 of the [[Onions|onions]] and reserve the third for later. \n| Heat 1 tablespoon of [[Oil|oil]] in a [[Frying pan|frying pan]], add the sliced [[Onions|onions]] and 1 tablespoon of the [[Rosemary|rosemary]] and [[Fry|fry]] gently for 10 minutes, stirring until just beginning to turn golden.\n| Meanwhile, bring a saucepan of water to the [[Boil|boil]], add the sliced [[Potatoes|potatoes]] and cook for 4-5 minutes until just tender. \n| Drain and return to the pan then leave to cool for 5 minutes.\n| Add the cr\u00e8me fraiche, [[Cheese|cheese]], [[Garlic|garlic]] and some [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]] to the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] and gently mix together then add the [[Onions|onions]] and mix once more, being careful not to break up the [[Potato|potato]] slices.\n| Cut the [[Pastry|pastry]] into 6, then roll one piece out on a lightly floured surface until a rough shaped 18cm/7inch square. \n| Lay one of the slices of [[Ham|ham]] on top then [[Pile|pile]] one sixth of the [[Potato|potato]] and [[Onion|onion]] mix on top.\n| [[Brush]] the edges of the [[Pastry|pastry]] with a little [[Egg|egg]] then gradually bring up the edges, pleating the [[Ham|ham]] and pastry up and over the filling to enclose completely, pinch the edges together in the centre and trim off the excess pastry. \n| Put the parcel on to an oiled [[Baking|baking]] sheet and repeat to make six parcels.\n| [[Brush]] the outside of the parcels with beaten [[Egg|egg]]. \n| Cut the remaining [[Onion|onion]] into 6 slices then put a slice on top of each [[Pastry|pastry]] parcel. \n| [[Brush]] with the remaining [[Oil|oil]] then sprinkle with the remaining [[Rosemary|rosemary]] and a little [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]].\n| [[Bake]] in a preheated [[Oven|oven]] set to 200\u00b0C/400\u00b0F/Gas 6 for 30-35 minutes until golden [[Brown|brown]] and the [[Pastry|pastry]] is cooked through.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe warm with a mixed leaf [[Salad|salad]].\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:British Onions recipes]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Pies tarts and flans]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n{{Template:British Onions attribution}}\n\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#onions #pastry #cheeseandonionpuffpies #potatoes #onion #ham #brush #egg #potato #rosemary #cheese </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Cheese and onion Yorkshire puddings",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Cheese and onion Yorkshire puddings\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#eggs #genius #yorkshirepudding #perfectyorkshirepuddings #delia #cheddarcheese #oliveeoil #lemonjuice #cheesepowder #onionpowder\n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This must be one of the most improbable, but brilliant recipes I've thought up in a long while\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 555\n|PortionCalories = 138\n|DatePublished=22nd January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime = 1 hour, 5 minutes\n|PrepTime = 45 minutes\n|CookTime = 20 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Cheese and onion Yorkshire puddings.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Sounds improbable</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">..but with Taste Sensation powders and potions, anything is possible!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry, aka Chef]])</span></span>\n}}\nThis must be one of the most improbable recipes I've thought up, but it's bloody brilliant! The Yorkshires are slightly more 'puddingy' than normal, but perfectly acceptable.  They have a lovely flavour - to easy to eat directly out of the pan \ud83d\ude1c.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1 large [[egg]]\n| 1 tablespoon of [[Olive oil]] to grease the baking tray\n| 75 ml [[milk]] (any type)\n| 55 ml water\n| 75 g [[plain flour]]\n| &frac12; cup of [[eggs]] (2 large eggs or 3 small eggs)\n| 2 tablespoons of [[Taste Sensation Well Matured Cheese Powder]]\n| 1 teaspoon of [[onion powder]] \n| A pinch of salt\n| A pinch of freshly ground [[black pepper]]\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the oven to 220\u00b0 C (425\u00b0 F - Gas 7)\n\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Brush the [[popover tray]] with the olive oil and preheat the oven\n| Place the tray in the middle of the oven until and leave until the oil is hot and almost smoking\n| A everything to a bowl and [[whisk]] well until all the ingredients are well combined\n| Leave the mixture to rest '''at room temperature'' for 30 minutes''' while the oven heats up\n| Spoon the batter mixture into the very hot tray\n| Bake for 20 minutes in the middle of the oven.\n}}\n===Chef's notes===\nWe have only used [[olive oil]] for cooking for the last 5 years and found that it's fine for recipes like this - much nicer than cheap [[vegetable oil]].\n==See also==\n* [[Popover]]\n* [[Toad in the hole]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Taste Sensation recipes]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#eggs #genius #yorkshirepudding #perfectyorkshirepuddings #delia #cheddarcheese #oliveeoil #lemonjuice #cheesepowder #onionpowder</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }

title": "Cheese and potato croquettes",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Cheese and potato croquettes a cheese recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#potatoes #breadcrumbs #cheeseandpotatocroquettes #cheese #egg #springonions #baking #sesameseeds #bake #chilipowder #flour \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=If what I'm hearing is true and you can't find these in the shops anymore, make your own, it's simple. Go posh and try with more exotic cheeses such as\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2135\n|PortionCalories = 533\n|DatePublished=31st January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Cheese and potato croquettes, ready to bake or freeze\n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 3\n|TotalTime = 2 hours 10 minutes\n|PrepTime = 35 minutes\n|CookTime = 1 hour 35 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Garlic and cornmeal potato nuggets to freeze.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"><span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Yummy</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I hadn't thought of freezing them - neat idea and tasty.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\">[[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nIf what I'm hearing is true and you can't find these in the shops anymore, make your own, it's simple.\n\nGo posh and try with more exotic [[cheeses]] such as Camembert or Roquefort.  With a sort [[cheese]] that won't grate easily, you may be better to mould potato mixture around the cheese rather than mix in with the [[potatoes]].\n\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 3 large [[baking]] [[potatoes]] (Desiree, Estima, Marfona or Vivaldi) if you can get them\n| 110 g (4 oz) [[Emmental]] or [[Cheddar cheese]], [[grated]]\n| 3 tablespoons [[butter]] or [[olive oil]]\n| 2 [[spring onions]], [[chopped on the diagonal]]\n| 2 [[egg]], beaten\n|  50 g (2 oz) [[plain flour]]\n| Bunch of [[parsley leaves]], chopped\n| [[Salt]] and [[freshly ground black pepper]]\n| Pinch if [[chili powder]] (optional)\n| 2 tablespoons [[sesame seeds]]\n| 50 g (2 oz) fresh [[breadcrumbs]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| [[Bake]] the [[potatoes]] at 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - Gas 4) for 1 hour or until cooked; allow to cool so they can be handled. Peel and [[mash]] with a [[potato masher]] or [[potato ricer]].\n| In a bowl, combine the [[cheese]], [[spring onions]], one of the [[eggs]], [[parsley]], [[salt]] and [[pepper]], [[chili powder]] if using, and [[potatoes]].\n| Squish up the mixture with your (clean) hands so it's well combined.\n| Pour the [[breadcrumbs]] onto a plate and mix in the [[sesame seeds]].\n| Mould the croquettes into shape, a bit bigger than golf-balls, then roll into sausage shapes\n| Dredge these in the [[flour]], then in the beaten [[egg]] mixture, then roll then in the [[breadcrumbs]]\n| Refrigerate for 30 minutes to set\n| Preheat the oven to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - Gas 4)\n| Place the croquettes on a non-stick [[baking]] tray and [[bake]] for 35 minutes or until golden brown.\n}}\n===Chef's tip===\n\nThe next time you cook [[jacket potatoes]], add a few extra and save them for making this dish.  They'll keep in the [[fridge]] for a few days.\n\n==See also==\n* [[Garlic and cornmeal potato nuggets]]\n* http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Croquette\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:French recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#potatoes #breadcrumbs #cheeseandpotatocroquettes #cheese #egg #springonions #baking #sesameseeds #bake #chilipowder #flour </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Cheese omelette",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Cheese omelette; a  recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#butter #cheeseomelette #eggs #blackpepper #garlic #panfried #chives #cream \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=As omelettes are so quick and easy to make, it's probably better to make an individual omelette for each person rather than make one huge omelette. Either..\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 478\n|PortionCalories = 478\n|DatePublished=17th January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 1\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 10 minutes\n |PrepTime = 5 minutes\n |CookTime = 5 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:RecipeCheese omelette.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Easy cheesey</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.8</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I love how easy this is to make and gruyere is just my favourite cheese.</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nAs omelettes are so quick and easy to make, it's probably better to make an individual omelette for each person rather than make one huge omelette.  Either way, I would not recommend making a single omelette for more that three people as it would not cook properly.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 2 large free-range [[eggs]]\n| 50 g ( 2 oz) gruyere cheese, grated\n| Salt and freshly ground [[black pepper]] to taste\n| Splash of [[cream]] or [[milk]] (optional)\n| 1 tablespoon [[butter]] or olive oil\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Break the [[eggs]] into a bowl with the salt, pepper, milk and cheese\n| Mix roughly with a knife. Don't whisk - it's nice to get some white and yolk only areas in the omelette\n| Add the [[butter]] to a small frying pan\n| When the [[butter]] is foaming add the mixture to the pan\n| Fry for 2 minutes on this side, pulling the solid edges to the centre with a fork\n| Flip over and fry for 1 minute on the other side\n| Slide on to a warm serving plate, folding the omelette - the last bit of cooking is done one the plate this way\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe immediately\n\n===Variations===\nExperiment with various cheeses, chopped herbs such as [[chives]] or parsley.\n\nRub the pan with half a [[Garlic|garlic]] clove prior to frying (discard the garlic).\n\nAdd a handful of microwaved mixed vegetables just before folding over.\n\n{{OmeletteRecipes}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Egg recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Student recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#butter #cheeseomelette #eggs #blackpepper #garlic #panfried #chives #cream </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Cheese sauce",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Cheese sauce; a  recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#butter #cheesesauce #cheddarcheese #boiledorsimmered #parmesancheese #cheese #chives #cream #flour #plainflour #basicwhitesauce \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=How to make a basic cheese sauce. Turn it into a Mornay sauce by simply changing the cheese varieties; eg: lly, half Gruy\u00e8re cheese and half parmesan..\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1089\n|PortionCalories = 544\n|DatePublished=17th January 2013\n|Author = JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = Serves 2 - Makes &#189; pint (300 ml) sauce\n|Difficulty = 1\n|ImageComment = Pouring over vegetables\n|TotalTime = 15 minutes\n|PrepTime = 5 minutes\n|CookTime = 10 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Broccoli and cauliflower cheese recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Naughty me!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.6</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I would eat this with everything, especially chips!</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nHow to make a basic [[cheese]] sauce.  Turn it into a '''Mornay sauce''' by simply changing the cheese varieties; eg: lly, half [[Gruy\u00e8re  cheese]] and half [[Parmesan cheese]] or variations of [[Gruy\u00e8re cheese]], Emmental cheese, or [[Cheddar cheese]].\n\nThe base sauce for these recipes is a [[Basic white sauce|basic white sauce]]\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1 tablespoon [[butter]]\n| 1 tablespoon sifted [[plain flour]]\n| &#189; pint (300 ml) cold milk or half milk, half stock\n}}\n\n'''For a normal cheese sauce:'''\n* 100 g (4oz) grated [[Cheddar cheese]]\n\n'''For Mornay sauce:'''\n* 50 g (2 oz) [[Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese]]\n* 50 g (2 oz) [[Gruy\u00e8re cheese]] \n\n\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Gently melt the [[butter]] in a pan.  Don't burn it\n| Add all of the sifted flour\n| Mix the [[flour]] and [[butter]] until it becomes a paste\n| Turn to a medium heat and gradually add all the milk, whisking constantly\n| Ensure none of the sauce is stuck to the bottom of the pan\n| Stir gently until the sauce starts to bubble\n| Sprinkle the cheese into the sauce and mix well\n| reduce to a very low heat and cook for 5 minutes\n}}\n===Chef's tip===\n\nThe key to a perfect sauce is to keep whisking until all of the [[milk]] has been added and there are no lumps\n\n===Variations===\n\nFor more exotic sauces, try different combinations of cheeses.  The recipe is the same, just change the cheese.  We have a few [[:Category:Dairy products|listed here]]\n\nA mixture of milk and [[cream]] makes a richer sauce\n\nChopped [[chives]] for a little colour and flavour\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Cheese]]\n[[Category:Dips and sauces|Cheese]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes|Cheese]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Student recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#butter #cheesesauce #cheddarcheese #boiledorsimmered #parmesancheese #cheese #chives #cream #flour #plainflour #basicwhitesauce </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

teaspoon [[Salt|salt]]\n| Pinch [[Cayenne|cayenne]]\n| 500g [[Milk|milk]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Grate the [[Cheese|cheese]] '''5 seconds / Speed 8'''.\n| Add the remaining ingredients and cook '''7 mins / Temp. 90\u00b0 / Speed 4'''.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Pasta|pasta]] or [[Vegetables|vegetables]].\n===Variations===\nAdd other spices as desired.\n===Chef's notes===\nThe [[Sauce|sauce]] will keep warm in a dish in the Varoma whilst you cook your [[Pasta|pasta]] or [[Vegetables|vegetables]] in the internal [[Steaming|steaming]] basket.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Dips and sauces]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Thermomix recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#pasta #vegetables #sauce #flour #cayenne #cheese #thermomixrecipes #mustardpowder #cheddarcheese #steaming #butter </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Cheese scones",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Cheese scones; a  recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#butter #cheesescones #scones #mustardpowder #buttermilk #flour #bakingtray #miseenplace #sage #foodprocessor #bake \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This recipe makes lovely savoury cheese scones which are best eaten warm with butter. They don't keep that well so freeze any excess. mise en place Preheat..\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1448\n|PortionCalories = 289\n|DatePublished=21st July 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 5 - Makes 8 to 10 cheese [[Scones|scones]]\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 30 minutes\n |PrepTime = 15 minutes\n |CookTime = 15 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Cheese scones recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"><span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Not difficult!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Nice with a cup of tea! \ud83c\udf75 </span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\">[[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]] </span></span>\n}}\n\nThis recipe makes lovely savoury cheese [[Scones|scones]] which are best eaten warm with [[Butter|butter]]. They don't keep that well so [[Freeze|freeze]] any excess.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 225g (8oz) [[Self raising flour|self raising flour]]\n| 55g (2oz) [[Butter|butter]] cut into small pieces\n| 25 g (1 oz) Cheddar cheese, coarsely grated and cut into small pieces\n| 1 egg yolk\n| 150ml [[Milk|milk]] or [[Buttermilk|buttermilk]]\n| 1/2 level teaspoon of [[chilli powder]]\n| 1/2 level teaspoon of [[mustard powder]]\n| 1/2 level teaspoon of [[Salt|salt]]\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 220\u00b0 C (425\u00b0 F - gas 7)\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Sift the [[Flour|flour]] into a mixing bowl, add the [[Salt|salt]], [[chilli]], [[mustard powder]] and [[Butter|butter]].\n| Rub the [[Butter|butter]] and into the [[Flour|flour]] then mix in the [[cheese]] and egg yolk.\n| Add enough [[Milk|milk]] or [[Buttermilk|buttermilk]], a little at a time, mixing to to make a soft [[Dough|dough]].\n| This can also be done in a [[Food processor|food processor]].\n| Tip out onto a floured worktop and knead lightly.\n| Roll out to 2 cm (&frac34;\") thick and them cut into rounds with a 5 cm (2\") [[Pastry|pastry]] cutter or hand-roll them into balls for a more rustic looking scone..\n| [[Brush]] the tops of the [[Scones|scones]] with a little [[Milk|milk]].\n| Place onto a lightly greased [[baking tray]] and [[Bake|bake]] for 12 to 15 minutes or until they have risen and turned golden.\n}}\n===Variations===\nTry different [[cheeses]] and adding some chopped fresh herbs such as [[sage]] or [[chives]].\n==See also==\n* [[Wholemeal cheese scones]] \n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#butter #cheesescones #scones #mustardpowder #buttermilk #flour #bakingtray #miseenplace #sage #foodprocessor #bake </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }

title": "Cheese shortcrust pastry",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Cheese shortcrust pastry\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#cheeseshortcrustpastry #foodprocessor #cheesepowder #bake #recipesfromothersites #butter #tastesensationwellmaturedcheesepowder #sausagerolls #plainflour #icingsugar #brush\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=This recipe requires a Food food processor. Buttery Homemade shortcrust pastry with just a tablespoon of cheese powder\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=10th April 2020\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = No prizes for presentation!!!\n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  1 hour, 15 minutes\n|PrepTime =  50 minutes\n|CookTime =  25 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 1630\n|PortionCalories = 407 \n|Image = [[Image:Cheese shortcrust pastry recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">It's not what it looks like, Jerry.</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">The important thing is what it tastes like - and it was lovely, thanks!</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis recipe requires a [[Food processor|food processor]].\n\nI tried a variation of our buttery [[homemade shortcrust pastry]] with just a tablespoon of Taste Sensation Well Matured Cheese Powder and it was spectacular.  Half went on two chicken pies, the other half on some home made sausage rolls.\n\nMost people would probably not have [[cheese powder]] in their kitchens, so about 100g of finely grated [[cheddar cheese]] would probably do as a substitute.  Try the [[cheese powder]] if you can, you will not be disappointed, I promise you!\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 250g [[Plain flour|plain flour]], sifted through a [[Sieve|sieve]]\n| &#188; teaspoon [[Sugar|sugar]] - [[Icing Sugar|icing sugar]] is best\n| 6 g [[Salt|salt]]\n| 1 heaped tablespoon of [[Taste Sensation Well Matured Cheese Powder]]\n| 100g [[Salted|salted]] [[Butter|butter]], cut into cubes\n| 75g iced water\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6), [fan oven 180\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Tip everything other than the water into a [[Food processor|food processor]] with a blade\n| Pulse briefly 6 times to combine the ingredients\n| Add the water while pulsing until the 'sound changes' and the mixture starts to form [[Rice|rice]]-like pieces\n| Check all of the ingredients have combined properly than [[Mould|mould]] the contents into a [[Dough|dough]]\n| Wrap the [[Pastry|pastry]] in [[Cling-film|cling-film]] and [[Refrigerate|refrigerate]] for at least 30 minutes to allow the [[Gluten|gluten]] to react and give the pastry a stretchy texture\n| Roll out and use as your recipe dictates - [[Brush|brush]] with [[Egg|egg]] or [[Milk|milk]] for a glaze if required\n| [[Bake]] for 20 to 25 minutes in the top half of the [[Oven|oven]]\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nWorked really well on a [[Chicken|chicken]] [[Pies|pies]] and [[Sausage rolls|sausage rolls]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Taste Sensation recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#cheeseshortcrustpastry #foodprocessor #cheesepowder #bake #recipesfromothersites #butter #tastesensationwellmaturedcheesepowder #sausagerolls #plainflour #icingsugar #brush</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Cheese squash bombs (V)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Cheese squash bombs vegetarian Cheese recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#squashes #garlic #cheese #roast #squash #cheesesquashbombsv #seeds #pattipansquashes #theextraordinarycookbook #fetacheese #freshthyme \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Stefan used hooligan squashes but I've used patti pan squashes because that's what's ready in the garden at the moment. Any small squashes would do\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 855\n|PortionCalories = 427\n|DatePublished=17th January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 2 to 4\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 1 hour 45 minutes\n |PrepTime = 15 minutes\n |CookTime = 1 hour 30 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Cheese and squash bombs v recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Good Old Stefan!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Nice with the white squash too!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:NonLoggedInUser|NonLoggedInUser]] </span></span>\n}}\nAnother recipe inspired by Stefan Gates' [[The Extraordinary Cookbook]].  \n\nStefan used hooligan squashes but I've used [[patti pan squashes]] because that's what's ready in the garden at the moment.  Any small squashes would do.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 2 small patti pan [[Squashes|squashes]]\n| 2 Cloves of [[Garlic|garlic]], skin on, smashed under the flat of a knife\n| A few sprigs of [[fresh thyme]]\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| [[Extra virgin olive oil]]\n}}\n'''the filling'''\n* 100g [[Feta cheese]]\n* 200g [[Cr\u00e8me fraiche]]\n* The [[Juice|juice]] and [[Zest|zest]] from half a [[Lemon|lemon]]\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the oven to  200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6), [fan oven 180\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Cheese and ham squash bombs pair.jpg|Fresh out of the oven\nImage:Cheese squash bombs v ingredients.jpg|[[Cheese]] [[Squash|squash]] bombs, the ingredients\nImage:Upside-down squash roasting.jpg|If they are an odd shape, roast them upside-down. Slice off the base instead of the top\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Wash the [[Squashes|squashes]], slice off the tops and reserve then [[Scoop|scoop]] out the [[Seeds|seeds]] with a spoon and discard them.\n| Season the insides with [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]], add a smashed clove of [[Garlic|garlic]], a sprig of [[thyme]] and 1 teaspoon of [[Olive oil|olive oil]] to each [[Squash|squash]].\n| Replace the lid and shake well.\n| [[Roast]] for 1 hour\n| Meanwhile crush the [[Cheese|cheese]] and mix all of the filling ingredients together and season to taste.\n| After 1 hour, remove the [[Squashes|squashes]] from the oven and discard the garlic and [[thyme leaves]] & drain any excess liquid.\n| Add the filling, replace the tops and [[Roast|roast]] for a further 30 minutes\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe hot\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Squash recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#squashes #garlic #cheese #roast #squash #cheesesquashbombsv #seeds #pattipansquashes #theextraordinarycookbook #fetacheese #freshthyme </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Cheese stuffed pancetta chicken breasts",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Cheese stuffed pancetta chicken breasts recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#chickenbreasts #cheesestuffedpancettachickenbreasts #herbesdeprovence #cheese #pancetta #oliveoil #greenbeans #onions #blackpepper #bakeoglide #cocktailstick \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A simple recipe using garlic and cheese to stuff chicken breasts, wrap them in pancetta or bacon to add a slaty tang\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1499\n|PortionCalories = 749\n|DatePublished=23rd May 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  45 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  30 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Cheese stuffed pancetta chicken breasts recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Cheesy Chicken!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Top job! Thanks Annie.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry, aka Chef]])</span></span>\n}}\nAnne made this for me as a surprise, and very good it was too.\n\nYou could make this with one large [https://www.cookipedia.co.uk/cgi-bin/cc.pl?cftk=2#jump chicken breast] each.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 4 small [[Chicken breasts|chicken breasts]]\n| 80 g sliced [[Pancetta|pancetta]]\n| 50 g strong [[Cheddar cheese|cheddar cheese]]\n| 2 [[Cloves of Garlic, peeled and crushed|cloves of garlic, peeled and crushed]]\n}}\n====sauce====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 400g [[Passata|passata]] (1 packet)\n| 1 small [[Onion|onion]], peeled and chopped\n| [[Freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 2 teaspoons [[Herbes de Provence|herbes de provence]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4), [fan oven 160\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Slice the [[Chicken breasts|chicken breasts]] to make pockets in them\n| Mix the [[Cheese|cheese]] with the [[Crushed garlic|crushed garlic]] and stuff the [[Chicken breasts|chicken breasts]] with this mixture\n| Wrap in [[Pancetta|pancetta]] and close with a [[Cocktail stick|cocktail stick]]\n| [[Bake]] for 30 minutes at  180\u00b0 C, checking after 15 minutes\n| Ideally place on a sheet of [[Bake O Glide|bake o glide]] as it's easier to use any of the [[Cheese|cheese]] that might leak out.  It just seems to stick to [[Tin-foil|tin-foil]] and be wasted.\n| Meanwhile, [[Saute|saute]] the [[Onions|onions]] for 5 minutes in [[Olive oil|olive oil]] that has had a pinch of [[Black pepper|black pepper]] added to it\n| Mix in the [[Herbes de Provence|herbes de provence]]\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe the [[Chicken breasts|chicken breasts]] and [[Tomato sauce|tomato sauce]] with [[Brown rice|brown rice]] and [[Green beans|green beans]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Mutton recipes]]\n[[Category:Poultry recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#chickenbreasts #cheesestuffedpancettachickenbreasts #herbesdeprovence #cheese #pancetta #oliveoil #greenbeans #onions #blackpepper #bakeoglide #cocktailstick </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Cheesy chick peas",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Cheesy chick peas a cheese recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#chickpeas #dried #boil #cheesychickpeas #paprikapowder #tomatoes #oliveoil #butter #simmer #herbs #blend \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This recipe comes from my mum's cookery notes, written long before cheesy-peas existed, or before the Fast Show, at least. Using dried chick peas, this\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1696\n|PortionCalories = 282\n|DatePublished=3rd July 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 6\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  13 hours, 15 minutes\n|PrepTime =  12 hours, 15 minutes\n|CookTime = 1 hour\n|Image = [[Image:Chickpeas.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Lol!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Cheesey peas!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]] </span></span>\n}}\n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}}\nThis recipe comes from my mum's [[Cookery|cookery]] notes, written long before cheesy-[[Peas|peas]] existed, or before the Fast Show, at least.\n\nUsing [[Dried|dried]] [[Chick peas|chick peas]], this recipe is very economical, though it does require preparing the day before you want to cook it.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 225 g (8 oz) [[Dried|dried]] [[Chick peas|chick peas]] or 2 x 400g cans of tinned [[Chick peas|chick peas]]\n| 25 g (1 oz) [[Butter|butter]] or [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 1 large [[Onion|onion]], peeled and sliced\n| 225 g (8 oz) raw [[Spinach leaves|spinach leaves]], chopped\n| 450 g (1 lb) fresh [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]], chopped into 8 pieces each\n| 1 teaspoon Unsmoked [[Paprika|paprika]]\n| 1 teaspoon freshly [[Ground cumin seeds|ground cumin seeds]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Dried oregano|dried oregano]]\n| &#189; teaspoon [[Chilli powder|chilli powder]]\n| 100 g (4 oz) mature [[Cheddar cheese|cheddar cheese]]\n| [[Salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]] to taste\n}}\n'''garnish'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 1 small pot [[Greek yogurt]]\n| A few pinches of unsmoked [[Paprika powder|paprika powder]]\n\n}}\n\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| add the presoaked [[Chick peas|chick peas]] to a large saucepan, cover with cold water and bring to the [[Boil|boil]] - skim any scum from the surface\n| Lower the heat and [[Simmer|simmer]] for 45 minutes or until tender to the pinch\n| Drain, reserving 200 ml (1/2 pint) of the cooking water for later.\n| Remove about half of the [[Chick peas|chick peas]], add to a [[Food processor|food processor]] with a metal blade and [[Blend|blend]] to a [[Puree|puree]], using as much of the reserved cooking [[Liquor|liquor]] as needed to make a smooth paste.\n| Meanwhile heat the [[Butter|butter]] or [[Olive oil|olive oil]] in a large pan and gently saut\u00e9 the [[Onions|onions]] for 8 minutes until transparent.\n| Add the [[Cumin powder|cumin powder]] and the remaining whole [[Chick peas|chick peas]] and cook for 2 minutes.\n| Add the chopped [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]], chopped [[Spinach|spinach]], [[Pureed|pureed]] [[Chick peas|chick peas]], [[Herbs|herbs]] and [[Spices|spices]] and seasoning.\n| Bring to the [[Boil|boil]] and [[Simmer|simmer]] for 5 minutes.\n| Remove from the heat and stir in the [[Grated|grated]] [[Cheese|cheese]].\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe immediately, topped with [[Yogurt|yogurt]], sprinkled with a pinch of [[Paprika powder|paprika powder]].\n===Recipe source===\n\n* My mum.\n===Chef's notes===\nYou can always rehydrate loads of [[Chick-peas|chick-peas]] and then [[Freeze|freeze]] them so you have an almost instant supply, rather than having to wait overnight.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#chickpeas #dried #boil #cheesychickpeas #paprikapowder #tomatoes #oliveoil #butter #simmer #herbs #blend </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }

title": "Cheesy cod bites in puff pastry parcels",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Cheesy cod bites in puff pastry parcels recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#puffpastry #fish #lemon #cheesycodbitesinpuffpastryparcels #dijonmustard #zest #grated #panko #pastry #cod #breadcrumbs \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Puff pastry parcels stuffed with cod fillets and D\u017eiugas cheese\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 4583\n|PortionCalories = 1145\n|DatePublished=1st November 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  1 hour, 10 minutes\n|PrepTime =  40 minutes\n|CookTime =  30 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Cheesy cod bites in puff pastry parcels recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Cheesy AND crunchy</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.7</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Neat idea and healthier than deep frying.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Puff pastry]] parcels stuffed with [[Cod|cod]] fillets and [[:Category:D\u017eiugas cheese recipes|D\u017eiugas cheese]].\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n}}\n====for the puff pastry parcels====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 800 g [[Cod fillet|cod fillet]] slices\n| 500g [[Puff pastry|puff pastry]]\n| 4 teaspoons [[Panko|panko]] [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]]\n| 4 [[Scant|scant]] teaspoons of [[Dijon Mustard|dijon mustard]]\n| 4 tablespoons of [[Grated|grated]] [[:Category:D\u017eiugas cheese recipes|D\u017eiugas cheese]]\n| Finely chopped fresh [[Dill|dill]] - [[Dried|dried]] dill will do at a push\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]], [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| [[Juice]] from half a [[Lemon|lemon]]\n| 1 [[Egg|egg]], beaten\n}}\n====for the sauce====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 200 ml [[Double Cream|double cream]]\n| 2 teaspoons of [[Dijon Mustard|dijon mustard]]\n| The [[Zest|zest]] from half a [[Lemon|lemon]]\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]], [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| A tablespoon of [[Capers|capers]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6), [fan oven 180\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Lay out your sheets of [[Puff pastry|puff pastry]] (or roll it out)\n| Pop the [[Fish|fish]] slices into a bowl, sprinkle with [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]] and season with [[Salt|salt]] and [[Black pepper|black pepper]].\n| Allow to [[Marinate|marinate]] for 30 minutes.\n| Sprinkle the insides of the [[Puff pastry|puff pastry]] with [[Panko]] [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]] and lay the [[Fish|fish]] fillets on top.\n| Coat with [[Mustard|mustard]] and then sprinkle with [[Grated|grated]] [[:Category:D\u017eiugas cheese recipes|D\u017eiugas cheese]].\n| Fold the [[Pastry|pastry]] up and pinch the edges to make a good seal.\n| Cut a slot in the top of the [[Pastry|pastry]] so [[Steam|steam]] can escape.\n| [[Brush]] with the beaten [[Egg|egg]].\n| [[Bake]] on a non-stick [[Baking tray|baking tray]] at 200\u00b0 C for 15 minutes then reduce the heat to 160\u00b0 C (325\u00b0 F - gas 3), [fan [[Oven|oven]] 140\u00b0 C] and bake for a further 15 minutes or until nicely [[Browned|browned]].\n}}\n====sauce====\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Add the [[Cream|cream]] to a small pan together with the [[Zest|zest]] from half a [[Lemon|lemon]], season with [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]] and gently [[Simmer|simmer]].\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe the [[Fish|fish]] pasties with the creamy [[Sauce|sauce]] and sprinkle with [[Capers|capers]].\n===Variations===\nFor a nice change (and an economical one) try using [[Basa fillets|basa fillets]] instead of [[Cod|cod]].\n\nIf you can't get [[D\u017eiugas cheese]], try Parmesan cheese, it's quite similar.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:French recipes]]\n[[Category:Italian recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Sea fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Pies tarts and flans]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:D\u017eiugas cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#puffpastry #fish #lemon #cheesycodbitesinpuffpastryparcels #dijonmustard #zest #grated #panko #pastry #cod #breadcrumbs </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }

title": "Cheesy monkfish jacket potatoes",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Cheesy monkfish jacket potatoes recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#cheesymonkfishjacketpotatoes #dill #potatoes #bake #monkfish #steamedmonkfishtail #frozen #grated #cheddarcheese #freezer #cheese \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=I wanted a nice recipe to use up a frozen monkfish tail we had in the freezer\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 853\n|PortionCalories = 426\n|DatePublished=30th December 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  1 hour, 20 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  1 hour, 5 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Cheesy monkfish jacket potatoes and sweetcorn.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">I can taste this already.</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">..and I've not even started to cook it yet.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nI wanted a nice recipe to use up a [[Frozen|frozen]] [[Monkfish|monkfish]] tail we had in the [[Freezer|freezer]].  This fitted the bill really nicely.\n\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 [[Monkfish|monkfish]] tail - [[Frozen|frozen]] is fine\n| 1 bunch of [[Dill|dill]] - optional\n| 2 [[Jacket potatoes|jacket potatoes]]\n| 75g [3 oz] good quality [[Cheddar cheese|cheddar cheese]], [[Grated|grated]]\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]]\n| [[Freshly ground black pepper]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* If the monkfish has been filleted, just chop into small pieces, if not, follow the steps [[Steamed monkfish tail|here]] to steam the monkfish.\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 220\u00b0 C (425\u00b0 F) (Gas 7)\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Cheesy monkfish jacket potatoes cheese.jpg|Topped with cheddar cheese\nImage:Cheesy monkfish jacket potatoes recipe.jpg|Packed with monkfish\nImage:Steamed monkfish tail recipe.jpg|[[Steamed monkfish tail]]\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| If you have the time it is really worthwhile taking the steps [[Baked potatoes|shown here]] to salt and dehydrate the skins to get really crispy skins on the baked potatoes.\n| Halve the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] and [[Bake|bake]] uncovered in the top half of the [[Oven|oven]] for 50 minutes\n| Mix the [[Grated|grated]] [[Cheddar cheese|cheddar cheese]], chopped [[dill]] and [[Black pepper|black pepper]] in a bowl\n| After 50 minutes, carefully remove the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] and [[Scoop|scoop]] out enough [[Potato|potato]] to make room for the filling\n| Fill with the cooked monkfish\n| Top the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] with the mixture and sprinkle with a little fresh [[Dill|dill]]\n| Pop back in the [[Oven|oven]] and [[Bake|bake]] for a further 10 to 15 minutes to [[Brown|brown]] the [[Cheese|cheese]]\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Peas|peas]] or [[Sweetcorn|sweetcorn]] and a knob of [[Butter|butter]]\n===Chef's notes===\nI've used [[Bake O Glide]] to rest the jackets on while they bake as it is easy to scrape up any cheese that oozes out.  [[Baking foil]] works almost as well.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Sea fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Steamed]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#cheesymonkfishjacketpotatoes #dill #potatoes #bake #monkfish #steamedmonkfishtail #frozen #grated #cheddarcheese #freezer #cheese </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]

title": "Cheesy oatcakes",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Cheesy oatcakes a cheese recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#cheesyoatcakes #dough #butter #oatflour #oats #mustardpowder #cheddar #plainoatcakes #foodprocessor #kneadingbread #paprika \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=I saw a picture of these on Flickr whilst looking for various oatcake images and they looked so delicious that they we had to have the recipe\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1607\n|PortionCalories = 401\n|DatePublished=22nd January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = These are the [[Cheesy oatcakes|cheesy version]]\n |Servings = Serves 4 - Makes 8 farls\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 30 minutes\n |PrepTime = 10 minutes\n |CookTime = 20 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Cheesey oatcakes recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n}}\n\nI saw a picture of these on Flickr whilst looking for various [[oatcake]] images and they looked so delicious that they we had to have the recipe. [http://www.flickr.com/photos/18154735@N00/ Dawn], who took the original picture and also listed the recipe, has kindly allowed us to use both.  The original source of the recipe was from a bag of [[Flour|flour]] from Arrowhead mills, Boulder, Colorado.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1 cup quick-cooking [[Oats|oats]]\n| 1 cup [[Oat flour|oat flour]] (see Chef's notes)\n| &frac14; teaspoon [[Sea Salt|sea salt]]\n| &frac14; teaspoon [[Mustard powder|mustard powder]]\n| 4 tablespoons softened [[Butter|butter]]\n| 1 cup mature [[Cheddar cheese]], [[Grated|grated]]\n| Up to &frac12; cup warm water\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the [[oven]] to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6), [fan oven 180\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Add the dry ingredients to a bowl and mix well\n| Fold in the softened [[Butter|butter]]\n| Mix in the [[Cheese|cheese]]\n| Add as much of the water as is needed and [[Kneading bread|knead]] into a pliable [[Dough|dough]]\n| Divide the [[Dough|dough]] in two and roll into two rounds, about 5 cm (&frac14;\u201d) thick\n| Score each round into 4 [[farls]] and bake on a lightly greased for 20 minutes\n}}\n===Variations===\n*Substitute [[Mustard powder|mustard powder]] with a mix of [[Paprika|paprika]] and [[Cayenne pepper|cayenne pepper]]\n*Substitute [[Parmesan cheese]] for [[Cheddar]]\n===Chef's notes===\nQuick-cooking [[Oats|oats]], quick oats, easy oats, quick oatmeal, quick-cooking oatmeal, are the same thing.\n\nIf you have a [[Food processor|food processor]] with a sharp steel blade, you can blitz [[Oatmeal|oatmeal]] into [[Oat flour|oat flour]] at home.\n==See also==\n* [[Plain oatcakes]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Loverly</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.8</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">All this from a Colorado bag of flour!</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Irish recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#cheesyoatcakes #dough #butter #oatflour #oats #mustardpowder #cheddar #plainoatcakes #foodprocessor #kneadingbread #paprika </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Cheesy smoked cod with mushrooms and pasta",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Cheesy smoked cod with mushrooms and pasta a cheese recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#pasta #passata #butter #fish #blackpepper #cod #macaroni #cheesysmokedcodwithmushroomsandpasta #boil #grated #bayleaves \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A quick and easy pasta dish using smoked cod or smoked haddock\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1972\n|PortionCalories = 493\n|DatePublished=10th May 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime = 30 minutes\n|PrepTime = 10 minutes\n|CookTime = 20 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Cheesy smoked cod and pasta recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Quick and gorgeous</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Cheese, pasta, fish. Need I say more?</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nA quick and easy [[Pasta|pasta]] dish using [[Smoked|smoked]] [[Cod|cod]] or [[Smoked haddock|smoked haddock]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 225 g [[macaroni]] or [[pasta]] of your choice\n| 225 g smoked [[cod]] or smoked [[haddock]] fillets\n| 450 ml [[Milk|milk]]\n| 2 [[Bay leaves|bay leaves]]\n| 25 g (2 tablespoons) [[Butter|butter]]\n| [[Freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 100 g of [[White mushrooms|white mushrooms]], thinly sliced\n| 25 g (1 oz) [[Plain flour|plain flour]]\n| 75 g (3 oz) [[Grated|grated]] [[Cheddar cheese|cheddar cheese]]\n| 300 ml [[passata]] \n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]]\n| Seasonal [[Fresh herbs|fresh herbs]] of your choice ([[Parsley|parsley]], snipped [[Chives|chives]], [[Basil|basil]], etc.)\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Cook the [[Pasta|pasta]] as directed on the packet.  9 to 11 minutes in [[Boiling|boiling]] [[Salted|salted]] water should be fine for [[Macaroni|macaroni]].\n| In the meantime, lay the [[Smoked fish|smoked fish]] over the [[Bay leaves|bay leaves]] in a [[Frying pan|frying pan]] and cover with [[Milk|milk]].\n| Bring to the [[Boil|boil]] and gently [[Poach|poach]] for 5 minutes or until the flesh flakes easily.\n| Drain and reserve the [[Milk|milk]].\n| Remove the [[Fish|fish]], discard the skin and any [[bones]] and [[Flake|flake]] the [[Fish|fish]] and set to one side.\n| Melt the [[Butter|butter]] in a saucepan and add a grind of [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n| [[Saute]] the [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]] in the [[Butter|butter]] for a few minutes then add the [[Flour|flour]], stir well and cook for another minute or so.\n| Lower the heat,and gradually add the [[Milk|milk]], stirring.\n| Bring back to the [[Boil|boil]], and cook for 3 minutes, stirring well.\n| Add the [[Grated|grated]] [[Cheese|cheese]] and a pinch of [[Salt|salt]] and the flaked [[Fish|fish]].  Heat for a few minutes more and then add the cooked [[Pasta|pasta]].\n| Heat the [[Passata|passata]] and season the [[Salt|salt]] and [[Black pepper|black pepper]] and a  [[Herbs|herbs]] of your choice.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with the hot [[Passata|passata]] poured around the edge of the plate\n\n{{Template:YoutubePastaDough}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Pasta recipes]]\n[[Category:Sea fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#pasta #passata #butter #fish #blackpepper #cod #macaroni #cheesysmokedcodwithmushroomsandpasta #boil #grated #bayleaves </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Chestnut flour shortbread",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Chestnut flour shortbread; a  recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#flour #chestnutflourshortbread #butter #chestnut #castersugar #riceflour #plainflour #bakingtray #bake #dough #sugars \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=I bought some chestnut flour. Someone suggested using to substitute some of the plain flour in shortbread\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 3566\n|PortionCalories = 713\n|DatePublished=27th October 2012\n|Author = JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = Serves 5 - Makes about 24-30 biscuits, depending on size\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 1 hour 30 minutes\n |PrepTime = 30 minutes\n |CookTime = 1 hour\n |Image = [[Image:Chestnut flour shortbread recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Strange, but nice</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.3</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Made this a few years ago, thanks Julia.  Can't find chestnut flour anymore.  Maybe I can make some next season using freshly roasted chestnuts?</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nA short time ago I bought some [[chestnut]] [[flour]], but wasn't sure what to do with it.  Someone suggested using to substitute some of the plain [[flour]] in shortbread, so this is what I have done.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 300g [[Butter|butter]]\n| 120g [[Caster sugar|caster sugar]]\n| 300g [[Plain flour|plain flour]]\n| 100g [[Chestnut|chestnut]] [[Flour|flour]]\n| 60g [[Rice flour|rice flour]] or [[Ground|ground]] [[Rice|rice]]\n| 10 g [[Sugar]] for rolling and sprinkling\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 140\u00b0 C (257\u00b0 F - gas 1), [fan oven 120\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| [[Cream]] the [[Butter|butter]] and [[Sugar|sugar]] together until smooth.\n| Add the [[Flour|flour]] and work into a [[Dough|dough]].\n| Roll out into a rectangle or a round on a sugared work surface until it is 1cm thick.\n| Place on a greased [[Baking tray|baking tray]] and cut into fingers or triangles.\n| Allow to chill in the [[Fridge|fridge]] for 20 minutes.\n| [[Bake]] for 50-60 minutes and when cooked, place on a wire rack.\n| Sprinkle with [[Sugar|sugar]] and allow to cool.\n}}\n===Variations===\nI sprinkled my biscuits with lavender [[sugar]]. Try various flavoured [[sugars]]. \n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Shortbread chestnut]]\n[[Category:British recipes|Shortbread chestnut]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking|Shortbread chestnut]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes|Shortbread chestnut]]\n\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#flour #chestnutflourshortbread #butter #chestnut #castersugar #riceflour #plainflour #bakingtray #bake #dough #sugars </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Chestnut stuffing for roast turkey (Mrs Beeton's)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Chestnut stuffing for roast turkey Mrs Beeton's British recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#chestnuts #butter #roast #miseenplace #potatomasher #vegetablestock #chestnutstuffingforroastturkeymrsbeetons #turkey #chicken #simmer #potatoricer \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A very traditional stuffing to serve with the Christmas turkey which would go as well with the roast Christmas chicken. I would be inclined to serve it\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1472\n|PortionCalories = 184\n|DatePublished=17th January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = A plate of sweet chestnuts\n |Servings = Serves 8\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 45 minutes\n |PrepTime = 15 minutes\n |CookTime = 30 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Chestnuts.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">A nice dip</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Well, dip, tapa, starter, accompaniment.</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Sweet chestnuts.jpg|thumb|300px|right|This is what they look like. Don't buy them, just pick them up from under the tree]]\nA very traditional stuffing to serve with the Christmas [[Turkey|turkey]] which would go as well with the [[Roast|roast]] Christmas [[Chicken|chicken]].\n\nI would be inclined to serve it as a side-dish, not as actual stuffing for the bird.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 900 g (2 lb) whole raw [[Chestnuts|chestnuts]]\n| 284 ml (1/2 pint) [[Vegetable Stock|vegetable stock]]\n| 25 g (1 oz) [[Butter|butter]]\n| A 'good pinch' of [[Sugar|sugar]]\n| [[Salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* [[Oven]] temperature: 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6), [fan oven 80\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Slit the chestnuts\n| [[Roast]] then in the [[oven]] for about 20 minutes\n| Allow to cool a little\n| Remove both the outer and inner skins, put the [[Chestnuts|chestnuts]] into a stewpan, add the [[Stock|stock]] (no more than will barely cover them) and [[Simmer|simmer]] them until they become tender\n| Rub through a fine [[Sieve|sieve]] or use a [[potato ricer]] or [[potato masher]].\n| Add the [[Butter|butter]], [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]] and use as required.\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Stuffing]]\n[[Category:British recipes|Stuffing]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes|Stuffing]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes|Stuffing]]\n[[Category:Poultry recipes|Stuffing]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#chestnuts #butter #roast #miseenplace #potatomasher #vegetablestock #chestnutstuffingforroastturkeymrsbeetons #turkey #chicken #simmer #potatoricer </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
