title": "Chicken, asparagus and broad bean suet crumble",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Chicken, asparagus and broad bean suet crumble recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#chicken #pie #oliveoil #chickenasparagusandbroadbeansuetcrumble #suet #asparagus #soup #blackpepper #pastry #fry #onions \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A seasonal savoury crumble recipe made with local seasonal ingredients\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=28th May 2019\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 3\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  3 hours, 30 minutes\n|PrepTime =  30 minutes\n|CookTime =  3 hours\n|TotalCalories = 1855\n|PortionCalories = 618 \n|Image = [[Image:Chicken asparagus and broad bean suet crumble recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Lovely jubbly</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Can't wait for asparagus season again...</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The&nbsp;Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nMade from produce purchased from the local gardens and [[Butchers|butchers]] around Upwell.  Covered this with a fabulous [[Suet|suet]] crust that was like a savoury [[Apple crumble|apple crumble]] crust!\n\nAs this will be for the two of us, I'm going to [[Freeze|freeze]] half of the filling and make another [[Pie|pie]], another day.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n}}\n====pie filling====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| A large pinch of [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n| 2 tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 2 tablespoons of [[Olive oil|olive oil]] from a bottle of [[Sun dried tomatoes|sun dried tomatoes]]\n| Two large [[Onions|onions]], finely chopped\n| 4 [[Cloves of garlic|cloves of garlic]], peeled and chopped\n| 2 [[Chicken|chicken]] [[Chicken breasts|chicken breasts]], chopped into bite-sized chunks\n| 1 can of [[Cream|cream]] of [[Chicken|chicken]] [[Soup|soup]]\n| A pinch of [[Turmeric|turmeric]]\n| A pinch of [[Salt|salt]]\n| A goodly pinch of whole [[Fennel seeds|fennel seeds]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Dried|dried]] [[Parsley|parsley]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Chicken stock|chicken stock]] mixed with 180 ml [[Boiling|boiling]]\n| A bag of [[Broad beans|broad beans]], podded, about a good handful\n| A bunch of [[Asparagus|asparagus]], speed peel tough stalks ends.\n| A large bunch of [[Sage leaves|sage leaves]]\n}}\n====Suet crust====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 110 g [[Suet|suet]]\n| 110 g [[Self-raising flour|self-raising flour]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Baking powder|baking powder]]\n| pinch of [[Sea Salt|sea salt]]\n| pinch of [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| Enough water just to bind the mixture together, don't try and make a 'wet' [[Pastry|pastry]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6), [fan oven 180\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour] so it is ready for the final 30 minutes of [[Baking|baking]]\n\n===Method===\n====filling====\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Heat the [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and add a pinch of [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n| Chop the [[Onions|onions]] and [[Fry|fry]] them in the [[Olive oil|olive oil]] until golden\n| Add the [[Garlic|garlic]] and [[Stir fry|stir fry]] for 3 minutes\n| Add the [[Chicken|chicken]] and [[Fry|fry]] for a few minutes, turning often\n| Add the [[Chicken|chicken]] [[Soup|soup]] a d the remaining ingredients, apart from the reserved [[Asparagus|asparagus]] tips, to a [[Slow Cooker|slow cooker]] set to low and slow cook for 2 hours, 30 minutes, stirring now and then\n}}\n====suet crust====\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Rub the [[Flour|flour]] into the [[Suet|suet]] until you can't feel the lumps in the suet\n| Add the [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]] and just enough water to bind the mixture so it can be squeezed into a ball without it falling apart again\n| Roll the [[Pastry|pastry]] out into a shape that will roughly cover your [[Pie|pie]] bowls\n| [[Bake]] for 30 minutes\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Chicken, asparagus and broad bean suet crumble ready to bake.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Ready to bake\nImage:Chicken, asparagus and broad bean suet crumble tips.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Add the asparagus tip when ready to bake\n</gallery>\n\n===Serving suggestions===\nWe served this with [[New Potatoes|new potatoes]], there was enough 'veg' in the [[Pie|pie]] filling to make a blanced meal\n===Recipe source===\n* Upwell, Norfolk!\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Poultry recipes]]\n[[Category:Slow cooker recipes]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n[[Category:Slow cooked]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#chicken #pie #oliveoil #chickenasparagusandbroadbeansuetcrumble #suet #asparagus #soup #blackpepper #pastry #fry #onions </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Chicken, pancetta and mushroom stew",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Chicken, pancetta and mushroom stew a British recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#chickenpancettaandmushroomstew #chicken #shallots #carrots #potatoes #oliveoil #broadbeans #herbs #garlic #pancetta #peppers \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This recipe is my husband's idea, and he did most of the work, but I could not resist meddling\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2695\n|PortionCalories = 1347\n|DatePublished=19th January 2013\n|Author = JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = 2-3\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 1 hour\n |PrepTime = 15 minutes\n |CookTime = 45 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Chicken, pancetta and mushroom stew recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Know what you mean Julia</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I can't watch someone cook without meddling myself!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:NonLoggedInUser|NonLoggedInUser]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis recipe is my husband's idea, and he did most of the work, but I could not resist meddling.  Ideal for using up [[Chicken|chicken]] left over from the day before and only uses one pot, so no need for endless washing up.  Plain, simple and easy!\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 2 tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 110g [[Shallots|shallots]], sliced - this is the net weight after peeling, topping and tailing\n| 200g [[Pancetta|pancetta]], cut into [[Lardons|lardons]]\n| [[Garlic]], as much as you like, roughly chopped\n| 250g [[Carrots|carrots]], peeled and coarsely chopped\n| 300g small [[Boiling|boiling]]/[[Salad|salad]] [[Potatoes|potatoes]], washed and left whole\n| 125g [[Button mushrooms|button mushrooms]], wiped and left whole\n| 75ml [[Dry white wine|dry white wine]]\n| 900ml hot [[Chicken stock|chicken stock]]\n| 170g [[Frozen|frozen]] [[Broad beans|broad beans]]\n| 150g [[Peppers|peppers]], sliced\n| 1 tablespoon [[Dried|dried]] [[Herbs|herbs]] of your choice\n| 325g cooked [[Chicken|chicken]], coarsely [[Shredded|shredded]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Heat the [[Olive oil|olive oil]] in a shallow [[Casserole|casserole]] or sauteuse and gently saut\u00e9 the [[Shallots|shallots]] and [[Pancetta|pancetta]], stirring from time to time.\n| When the [[Shallots|shallots]] are beginning to soften, stir in the [[Garlic|garlic]] and cook for about 2 minutes.\n| Add the [[Carrots|carrots]] and [[Potatoes|potatoes]] and saut\u00e9 for a further 2 minutes until coated with the [[Fat|fat]].\n| Stir in the [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]], and add the [[White wine|white wine]].\n| Allow to cook for 3 minutes and add the hot [[Stock|stock]].\n| Reduce the heat a little, cover and allow to [[Stew|stew]] for about 20-25 minutes.\n| Add the [[Broad beans|broad beans]], [[Peppers|peppers]], [[Herbs|herbs]] and the [[Chicken|chicken]], bring to the [[Boil|boil]] and [[Simmer|simmer]] for 10 minutes.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe hot with a hunk of [[Bread|bread]].\n===Variations===\nUse any left over fowl or [[Game|game]] birds and substitute the [[Wine|wine]] for [[Dry cider|dry cider]].  Any combination of [[Vegetables|vegetables]] will be fine so long as you take into consideration their various [[Cooking times|cooking times]].\n===Chef's notes===\nFollow the [[RSPCA Think Pig Checklist]] to make sure that your [[Pork|pork]] has come from pigs that have been reared to higher welfare standards.\n* http://bit.ly/rspcathinkpig\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Poultry recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Stews and casseroles]]\n[[Category:Stewed, braised or pot roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#chickenpancettaandmushroomstew #chicken #shallots #carrots #potatoes #oliveoil #broadbeans #herbs #garlic #pancetta #peppers </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Chicken and asparagus pie",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Chicken and asparagus pie, British recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#chicken #stock #onions #flour #asparagus #chickenandasparaguspie #olive #mushrooms #bacon #garlic #diced \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A really tasty and attractive dish, this one\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2837\n|PortionCalories = 709\n|DatePublished=12th November 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime = 1 hour\n|PrepTime = 20 minutes\n|CookTime = 40 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Chicken-Pie.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">As good as it looks</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">A great combination that makes great gravy.  I always burn my mouth pigging this!</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Pie for two.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Using the ingredients above, bake two separate 2 person pies on different days, each with half the filling and half a packet of [[Puff pastry|pre-rolled pastry]]]]\nA really tasty and attractive dish, this one.  If you can't be bothered to make [[Chicken|chicken]] [[Stock|stock]], rather than using a [[Stock cube|stock cube]]  you might be better off cheating and using a good quality tin of chicken & [[Asparagus|asparagus]] or chicken & [[Mushroom|mushroom]] soup.  I would omit the [[Flour|flour]] if you do it this way.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| A few home [[Smoked|smoked]] [[Bacon|bacon]] rashers, chopped - or just nice quality bacon.\n| 500 g ( 1lb 2 oz) [[Chicken|chicken]] breasts, [[Diced|diced]].\n| 1 [[Onion|onion]], peeled and chopped\n| 1 [[Clove|clove]] of [[Garlic|garlic]], peeled and crushed (optional)\n| [[Olive]] [[Oil|oil]] for [[Frying|frying]]\n| 2 tablespoons freshly chopped [[Parsley|parsley]]\n| 8 [[Asparagus|asparagus]] spears, chopped into 2.5 cm (1\") lengths\n| Handful of [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]], brushed clean and sliced\n| 284 ml (1/2 pint) [[Chicken|chicken]] [[Stock|stock]]\n| 2 tablespoons plain [[Flour|flour]]\n| Sea [[Salt|salt]] and freshly milled [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n| 225g/8oz ready rolled [[Puff pastry|puff pastry]]\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the oven to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - Gas 6 - Moderately hot)\n** If your electric oven has the options of upper, lower, both elements, use the lower element.\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Take the pack of pastry out of the fridge and allow to reach room temperature before using (step 8)\n| Heat a few tablespoons of [[Olive|olive]] [[Oil|oil]] in a pan or a [[Wok|wok]] and [[Fry|fry]] the [[Onions|onions]] (and [[Garlic|garlic]] if using) for 3 minutes\n| Season the [[Flour|flour]] with [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]] and toss the [[Chicken|chicken]] pieces in the flour. \n| Add the [[Chicken|chicken]] to the [[Onions|onions]] and [[Brown|brown]], turning often.\n| Arrange the [[Chicken|chicken]], [[Bacon|bacon]], [[Onions|onions]], [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]] and [[Asparagus|asparagus]] in an oven proof dish.\n| Pour the [[Chicken|chicken]] [[Stock|stock]] or soup over the ingredients.\n| Roll out the pastry so it is large enough to cover your dish.\n| [[Brush]] the edge of the dish with water to [[Help|help]] the pastry stick.\n| Trim away any excess and crimp the edge all the way round with the tines/prongs of a fork - I forgot to do this! A pastry wheel or crimper is also good for this eg [http://www.amazon.co.uk/Pastry-15-5cm-Polyamid-Guaranteed-quality/dp/B0030I1XW8/ref=sr_1_25?ie=UTF8&s=kitchen&qid=1280680434&sr=1-25 metal crimper] or [http://www.amazon.co.uk/Pastry-Cutter-Boxwood-Guaranteed-Quality/dp/B003NIGNLQ/ref=sr_1_34?ie=UTF8&s=kitchen&qid=1280680434&sr=1-34 wooden version]\n| Cut a 1cm (&frac12;\") hole in the top to allow [[Steam|steam]] to escape or even better, put in a [[pie funnel]].\n| [[Bake]] for 25 to 30 minutes in the middle of the oven until the pastry is golden [[Brown|brown]].\n| Check after 20 minutes and if the crust looks as though it might be starting to burn, lay a sheet of [[tin foil]] over the top.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\n\nServe with hot [[Jacket potatoes|jacket potatoes]].\n\n==See also==\n* {{See also - Jointing a chicken}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Poultry recipes]]\n[[Category:Pies tarts and flans]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#chicken #stock #onions #flour #asparagus #chickenandasparaguspie #olive #mushrooms #bacon #garlic #diced </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Chicken and ham pie",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Chicken and ham pie, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#chicken #butter #ham #piedish #stock #chickenandhampie #nutmeg #cream #flour #onions #squash \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A creamy, heartwarming meal that is made really easy by using pre-rolled puff pastry\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1664\n|PortionCalories = 416\n|DatePublished=12th November 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime = 1 hour 15 minutes\n|PrepTime = 15 minutes\n|CookTime = 1 hour\n|Image = [[Image:Chicken-Pie.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Winter Warmer!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">On cold and icy days like today, this is just the thing to warm your heart.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}} \n[[Image:Pie for two.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Using the ingredients above, bake two separate 2 person pies on different days, each with half the filling and half a packet of [[Puff pastry|pre-rolled pastry]]]]\nA creamy, heartwarming meal that is made really easy by using [[Pre-rolled puff pastry|pre-rolled puff pastry]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 500 g (1 lb 2 oz) [[Chicken|chicken]] breasts, skin removed\n| 100g cooked [[Ham|ham]]\n| 2 tablespoons plain [[Flour|flour]]\n| 1 large [[Leek|leek]], washed and sliced\n| 1 large [[Onion|onion]], peeled and sliced\n| &#188; teaspoon [[Grated|grated]] [[Nutmeg|nutmeg]]\n| 2 tablespoons melted [[Butter|butter]]\n| &#188; cup [[Chicken|chicken]] [[Stock|stock]]\n| &#188; cup single [[Cream|cream]]\n| Sea [[Salt|salt]] and freshly ground [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the oven to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - Gas 6 - Moderately hot)\n** If your electric oven has the options of upper, lower, both elements, use the lower element.\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Melt the [[Butter|butter]] in a small pan and use a little of it to grease a [[Pie dish|pie dish]].\n| Cube the [[Chicken|chicken]] into 1.5 cm (1/2\") cubes and cut the [[Ham|ham]] into similar sized strips\n| Season the [[Flour|flour]] with [[Salt|salt]], [[Pepper|pepper]] and [[Nutmeg|nutmeg]] and roll the [[Chicken|chicken]] in the seasoned flour so that it's well coated.\n| Arrange the [[Leeks|leeks]] and [[Onions|onions]] in the base of the [[Pie dish|pie dish]].\n| Cover with the [[Chicken|chicken]] and [[Ham|ham]] pieces.\n| Pour the remaining [[Butter|butter]] over the [[Chicken|chicken]] pieces.\n| Mix the [[Stock|stock]] and [[Cream|cream]] together and pour over the [[Chicken|chicken]].\n| Roll out the pastry and cover the [[Pie dish|pie dish]]. Cut a few slashes in the crust to let air out while it's cooking\n| [[Bake]] for 1 hour in the middle of the oven.\n| Check after 20 minutes and if the crust looks as though it might be starting to burn, lay a sheet of [[tin foil]] over the top.\n| Remove from the oven and allow to rest for 5 minutes before serving.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\n\nServe hot with [[Peas|peas]] and [[Squash|squash]] [[Mash|mash]].\n\n==See also==\n\n* {{See also - Jointing a chicken}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Poultry recipes]]\n[[Category:Pies tarts and flans]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#chicken #butter #ham #piedish #stock #chickenandhampie #nutmeg #cream #flour #onions #squash </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Chicken and mushroom pie",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Chicken and mushroom pie, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#chicken #piedish #butter #flour #cream #nutmeg #stock #chickenandmushroompie #garlic #tinfoil #bake \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A creamy, heart-warming meal that is made really easy by using pre-rolled puff pastry\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1444\n|PortionCalories = 361\n|DatePublished=12th November 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime = 1 hour 15 minutes\n|PrepTime = 15 minutes\n|CookTime = 1 hour\n|Image = [[Image:Chicken-Pie.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Tasty!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.8</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Not too fiddly, and has lovely gravy.</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry, aka Chef]])</span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Pie for two.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Using the ingredients above, bake two separate 2 person pies on different days, each with half the filling and half a packet of [[Puff pastry|pre-rolled pastry]]]]\nA creamy, heartwarming meal that is made really easy by using [[Pre-rolled puff pastry|pre-rolled puff pastry]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 500 g (1 lb 2 oz) [[Chicken|chicken]] breasts, skin removed\n| 150 g (5.5 oz) [[button mushrooms]], quartered \n| 2 tablespoons plain [[Flour|flour]]\n| 1 large [[Leek|leek]], washed and sliced\n| 1 clove garlic, peeled ad crushed\n| 1 large [[Onion|onion]], peeled and sliced\n| &#188; teaspoon [[Grated|grated]] [[Nutmeg|nutmeg]]\n| 2 tablespoons melted [[Butter|butter]]\n| &#188; cup [[Chicken|chicken]] [[Stock|stock]]\n| &#188; cup single [[Cream|cream]]\n| Handful of freshly chopped [[parsley]]\n| Sea [[Salt|salt]] and freshly ground [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the oven to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - Gas 6 - Moderately hot)\n** If your electric oven has the options of upper, lower, both elements, use the lower element.\n\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Melt the [[Butter|butter]] in a small pan and stir-fry the garlic for a minutes or so. Use little of it to grease a [[Pie dish|pie dish]].\n| Cube the [[Chicken|chicken]] 1.5 cm (1/2\") cubes\n| Season the [[Flour|flour]] with [[Salt|salt]], [[Pepper|pepper]] and [[Nutmeg|nutmeg]] and roll the [[Chicken|chicken]] in the seasoned flour so that it's well coated.\n| Arrange the [[Leeks|leeks]] and [[Onions|onions]] in the base of the [[Pie dish|pie dish]].\n| Cover with the [[Chicken|chicken]] and [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]].\n| Pour the remaining [[Butter|butter]] and [[Garlic|garlic]] over the [[Chicken|chicken]] pieces.\n| Mix the [[Stock|stock]] and [[Cream|cream]] together and pour over the [[Chicken|chicken]].\n| Roll out the pastry and cover the [[Pie dish|pie dish]], cut a few slashes in the crust to let air out while it's cooking\n| [[Bake]] for 1 hour in the middle of the oven.\n| Check after 20 minutes and if the crust looks as though it might be starting to burn, lay a sheet of [[tin foil]] over the top.\n| Remove from the oven and allow to rest for 5 minutes before serving.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\n\nServe hot with [[Peas|peas]] and [[Squash|squash]] [[Mash|mash]].\n\n==See also==\n* {{See also - Jointing a chicken}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Poultry recipes]]\n[[Category:Pies tarts and flans]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#chicken #piedish #butter #flour #cream #nutmeg #stock #chickenandmushroompie #garlic #tinfoil #bake </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }

title": "Chicken and raspberry pizza",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Chicken and raspberry pizza\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#pizza #raspberries #tomatoes #pizzadough #pizzastone #chicken #chickenandraspberrypizza #pizzas #chillioil #mozzarellacheese #cheese\n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A tangy pizza with mozzarella, chicken slices raspberries and basil.  An explosion of flavours!\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=31st July 2023\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  1 hour, 42 minutes\n|PrepTime =  1 hour, 30 minutes\n|CookTime =  12 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 1612\n|PortionCalories = 806 \n|Image = [[Image:Chicken and raspberry pizza.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Strange, but true</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">You won't believe the difference a few fresh raspberries make.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nAlmost the strangest pizza recipe yet!\n\nUsing processed sliced [[chicken]], [[mozzarella]], fresh [[tomatoes]] and [[raspberries]] turns a normal pizza into a very special one!\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 12 processed chicken slices\n| 24 fresh [[raspberries]]\n| A bunch of fresh basil, torn into pieces\n| 4 fresh [[tomatoes]], sliced\n| A good shake of [[chilli oil]]\n| 1 portion of [[Pizza dough]] (makes 2 [[Pizzas|pizzas]])\n| About 6 tablespoons of [[Tomato sauce for pizza]] or [[Passata|passata]]\n| 2 balls [[Mozzarella cheese|mozzarella cheese]] torn into small pieces(about 250g in total)\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Dust your work surface with [[Fine yellow cornmeal|fine yellow cornmeal]]\n| Divide the [[Pizza dough|pizza dough]] into two and roll out into two thin 25.5 cm (10 inch) [[Pizzas|pizzas]]\n| You can leave them in a [[Warm place|warm place]] for an hour or so to rise. I quite like them cooked immediately they are rolled out for a more crispy finish.\n| Prick the [[Pizza|pizza]] all over with a fork. This prevents it puffing up too much and burning while it is cooking\n| With a deft move, slide the [[Pizza|pizza]] from the [[Pizza peel|pizza peel]], on to the preheated [[Pizza stone|pizza stone]].\n| Cook on one side only for about 2 minutes or until lightly [[Browned|browned]].\n| Remove from the [[Oven|oven]] and spread the [[Tomato sauce|tomato sauce]] over the top of the [[pizza]]\n| Distribute a ball of torn [[Mozzarella cheese|mozzarella cheese]] over the tomato topping.\n| Arrange the [[chicken]] slices, [[basil]], [[tomatoes]] and [[raspberries]] over the pizza\n| Drizzle with [[chilli oil]], if liked.\n| Return to the [[Oven|oven]] and [[Bake|bake]] until the [[Cheese|cheese]] is nicely melted. This should take about 4 minutes under a [[Grill|grill]] on a [[Pizza stone|pizza stone]], if oven [[Baking|baking]], about 15 minutes in the middle of the oven.\n| Repeat for the second [[Pizza|pizza]].\n| Keep the first [[Pizza|pizza]] warm at the bottom of the [[Oven|oven]] whilst you make the second.\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Poultry recipes]]\n[[Category:Pizza recipes]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#pizza #raspberries #tomatoes #pizzadough #pizzastone #chicken #chickenandraspberrypizza #pizzas #chillioil #mozzarellacheese #cheese</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }

title": "Chicken and shallots in cream sherry and sherry vinegar",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Chicken and shallots in cream sherry and sherry vinegar\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#shallots #chickenandshallotsincreamsherryandsherryvinegar #chickenbreasts #butter #creamsherry #vinegar #freshlygroundblackpepper #parsley #chicken #oliveoil #sherryvinegar\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=A nice way to cook Chicken chicken breasts, in what seems like a lot of vinegar. Butter cream and shallots.\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=1st January 2023\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  35 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime =  25 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 1120\n|PortionCalories = 560\n|Image = [[Image:Chicken and shallots in cream sherry and sherry vinegar.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Delicious</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Could have done with more of the lovely sauce though!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:NonLoggedInUser|NonLoggedInUser]] </span></span>\n}}\nA nice way to cook [[Chicken breasts|chicken breasts]], in what seems like a lot of [[Vinegar|vinegar]].  However it works very well, especially with the [[Shallots|shallots]].\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 2 medium sized [[Chicken breasts|chicken breasts]], bone and skin removed\n| 6 [[Shallots|shallots]], peeled and finely chopped\n| [[Freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 25 g [[Butter|butter]]\n| A splash of [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 110 ml [[Cream Sherry]]\n| 80 ml [[Sherry vinegar]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Dried|dried]] [[Parsley|parsley]]\n| 3 tablespoon [[Double Cream|double cream]]\n| Pinch of [[Sea Salt|sea salt]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Flatten the [[Chicken breasts|chicken breasts]] by covering with [[Cling-film|cling-film]] and beating with a [[Rolling pin|rolling pin]] so they are of an even thickness\n| Heat the [[Butter|butter]] together with the [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]] in a heavy based [[Frying pan|frying pan]] and [[Brown|brown]] the [[Chicken breasts|chicken breasts]] on both sides - about 4 minutes\n| Reduce the heat to low, cover and cook for 15 minutes until properly cooked. Discard any condensed water, remove the chicken pieces and keep warm.\n| Add the [[Olive oil|olive oil]] to the same pan and gently saut\u00e9 the chopped [[Shallots|shallots]]\n| Pour the [[Vinegar|sherry vinegar]] and [[cream sherry]] over the cooked [[Shallots|shallots]], add the [[Parsley|parsley]], season with [[Salt|salt]] an [[Pepper|pepper]] and reduce by about half the amount\n| Allow the pan to cool a little so the cream does not seperate. Stir in the [[Double Cream|double cream]], mix well\n| Dish up the [[Chicken|chicken]] and pour the [[Shallot|shallot]] [[Sauce|sauce]] over the chicken\n}}\n\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nChicken and shallots in cream sherry and sherry vinegar double cream parsley butter reduction of sauce.jpg|Reduce the shallot sauce by about half\nChicken and shallots in cream sherry and sherry vinegar double cream parsley butter panfried browning.jpg|Brown the chicken breasts in lovely [[butter]]\nChicken and shallots in cream sherry and sherry vinegar basic ingredients.jpg|The basic ingredients for [[Chicken]] and [[shallots]] in [[cream sherry]] and [[sherry vinegar]]\n</gallery>\n\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Roast potatoes|roast potatoes]] and your choice of [[Vegetables|vegetables]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:French recipes]]\n[[Category:Italian recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Poultry recipes]]\n[[Category:Cooking with wine]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#shallots #chickenandshallotsincreamsherryandsherryvinegar #chickenbreasts #butter #creamsherry #vinegar #freshlygroundblackpepper #parsley #chicken #oliveoil #sherryvinegar</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Chicken casserole",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Chicken casserole, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#chickencasserole #chicken #garlic #vegetables #potatoes #carrots #chickenstock #leek #plainflour #fat #stewedbraisedorpotroasted \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This chicken casserole recipe is a complete balanced meal cooked in one pan\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 3133\n|PortionCalories = 783\n|DatePublished=19th January 2013\n|Author = JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 1 hour 15 minutes\n |PrepTime = 15 minutes\n |CookTime = 1 hour\n |Image = [[Image:Chicken casserole.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Nice one Rosemary</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Proper comfort food</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The&nbsp;Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\n\nThis chicken casserole recipe is a complete balanced meal cooked in one pan.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n|15g [[butter]]\n|1 tablespoon [[soya oil]]\n|8 [[chicken]] thighs (bone in)\n|3 medium [[carrots]], peeled and chopped\n|4 medium boiling [[potatoes]], eg [[Potatoes#Pictures of varieties of potatoes|Amorosa]], peeled and thickly sliced\n|1 large [[leek]], sliced\n|1 bulb of [[Garlic|garlic]], or more, to taste\n|2 tablespoons [[plain flour]]\n|600ml hot [[chicken stock]]\n|2 tablespoons or more of [[Tewkesbury mustard]]\n|4 handfuls of [[curly kale]], washed and roughly chopped\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n|Heat the butter and the oil in a [[Frying pan#Sauteuses|sauteuse]], uncovered, to a high heat.\n|Add the [[chicken]] thighs and fry on all sides until well [[browned]].\n|Remove from pan and reserve.\n|Add the [[carrots]] and [[potatoes]] to the pan.\n|Cook, uncovered, until slightly [[caramelised]] \u2013 a large pinch of [[sugar]] will help this process.\n|Remove the [[vegetables]] and reserve.\n|Add the [[leeks]] to the pan and cook for 5 minutes on a medium heat.\n|Add the [[Garlic|garlic]] and cook until it starts to colour, then remove from the pan.\n|Drain off the excess [[fat]], reheat and add the [[chicken]] and [[vegetables]].\n|Stir in the [[flour]] and cook slowly for about 4-5 minutes.\n|Slowly add the hot [[chicken stock]] and [[mustard]], stirring frequently, until the stock has slightly thickened.\n|Cover and cook for 30 minutes on a medium heat, adding the [[kale]] about 15 minutes before the end of the cooking time.\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Chicken]]\n[[Category:British recipes|Chicken]]\n[[Category:Main courses|Chicken]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes|Chicken]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes|Chicken]]\n[[Category:Poultry recipes|Chicken]]\n[[Category:Stews and casseroles|Chicken]]\n[[Category:Stewed, braised or pot roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#chickencasserole #chicken #garlic #vegetables #potatoes #carrots #chickenstock #leek #plainflour #fat #stewedbraisedorpotroasted </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Chicken hot-pot",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Chicken hot-pot, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#potatoes #chickenhotpot #chicken #mushrooms #parsley #miseenplace #cream #lecreuset #groundblackpepper #singlecream #butter \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A complete meal in a pot, chicken, potatoes, mushrooms in a delicious sauce. Dead easy to make\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 3617\n|PortionCalories = 904\n|DatePublished=19th January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Ok, this is Guinness hot-pot but you get the idea!\n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime = 2 hours\n|PrepTime = 20 minutes\n|CookTime = 1 hour 40 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Guinness stew - hot pot.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">The Guinness one looks better!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">And I love the crispy potatoes</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nA complete meal in a pot, chicken, [[potatoes]], [[mushrooms]] in a delicious sauce.  Dead easy to make.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 900g (2 lb) chicken pieces, skinned, preferably on the bone. [[Jointing a chicken|Why not try jointing your own chicken?]]\n| 110g (&#188; lb) [[button mushrooms]], sliced\n| 2 large [[onions]], sliced\n| 900g (2 lb) [[potatoes]], peeled and sliced 1 cm (&#189;\") thick\n| 426 ml (15 fl oz - &#190; pint) good quality [[chicken stock]]\n| 142 ml (5 fl oz - &#189; pint) [[single cream]]\n| 2 tablespoons fresh [[parsley]], chopped\n| 2 tablespoons [[butter]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[salt]], half the salt if the stock is salty or if you cheated and used a stock cube!\n| &#189; teaspoon freshly [[ground black pepper]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[sugar]]\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the oven to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - Gas 4)\n\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| If you have an enamel casserole such as a  [[Le Creuset]], then use that, otherwise, in a large pan, melt the butter and [[saut\u00e9]] the [[chicken]] pieces until they are golden on the outside\n| Place then in the bottom of the casserole dish\n| In a bowl, mix the [[parsley]], salt, pepper, sugar, thyme\n| Sprinkle a quarter of the mixture over the [[chicken]] pieces\n| Then repeatedly add the remaining onions, [[mushrooms]], potatoes and a sprinkle of herb mix  until they are used up.\n| Mix the [[cream]] into the stock and pour over the casserole\n| Bake, covered, for an hour and a half, covered, then increase the heat to 220\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - Gas 6) to brown the [[potatoes]]\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\n\nServe hot with a green vegetable\n\n===Variations===\n\nAdd a good grating of fresh [[Parmesan cheese]] at the browning stage. \n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Poultry recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes]]\n[[Category:Stews and casseroles]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Stewed, braised or pot roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#potatoes #chickenhotpot #chicken #mushrooms #parsley #miseenplace #cream #lecreuset #groundblackpepper #singlecream #butter </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Chicken in cream",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Chicken in cream\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#doublecream #parsley #chickenincream #tastesensationcajunseasoning #walnut #cauliflower #onions #britishrecipes #broadbeans #greenvegetables\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=A nice simple dish which is great to use up left-over Double double cream. \n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=22nd November 2021\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  50 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime =  40 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 732\n|PortionCalories = 366\n|Image = [[Image:Chicken_in_cream_recipe_with_parsley_walnuts_and_apricots.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Lots of flavours</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">..and nice with fresh local walnuts</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]] </span></span>\n}}\nA nice simple dish which is great to use up left-over [[Double Cream|double cream]].  It's the sort of dish you could add lots of various ingredients to suit your taste.\n\nChopped [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]], cooked [[Broad beans|broad beans]], [[Green beans|green beans]] or [[Cauliflower|cauliflower]] would also be good.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 tablespoon [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| Good pinch of [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Taste Sensation Spicy Mango Marinade Flavouring]]\n| 2 [[Chicken breasts|chicken breasts]], cut into cubes\n| 1 medium [[Onion|onion]], peeled and sliced\n| 3 [[Cloves of Garlic, peeled and crushed|cloves of garlic, peeled and crushed]]\n| 150 ml [[Double Cream|double cream]]\n|150 ml [[Greek yogurt]]\n| 2 tablespoons [[Dry sherry|dry sherry]]\n| 6 [[dried apricots]], chopped \n| Freshly chopped [[Parsley|parsley]] and [[Walnut|walnut]] pieces to garnish\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4), [fan oven 160\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Heat the [[Oil|oil]], with a pinch of [[Black pepper|black pepper]] in an [[Oven-proof casserole dish|oven-proof casserole dish]]  pan over a medium heat\n| [[Stir-fry]] the [[Onions|onions]] for 3 or 4 minutes\n| Add the [[Chicken|chicken]] pieces and [[Stir-fry|stir-fry]] until lightly [[Browned|browned]]\n| Stir in the [[Crushed garlic|crushed garlic]] and [[Taste Sensation Spicy Mango Marinade Flavouring]] and mix really well for a few minutes\n| Remove from the heat and [[Deglaze|deglaze]] the dish with the [[Sherry|sherry]].\n| Stir in the [[Double Cream|double cream]], [[Greek yogurt]], chopped [[apricots]], cover and [[Oven|oven]] [[Bake|bake]] at 180\u00b0 C for 30 minutes\n| Test the seasoning and serve, scattered with [[Parsley|parsley]] and [[Walnuts|walnuts]]\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Chicken_onions_garlic_double_cream_dutch_oven_baked.jpg|After baking for 30 minutes in the [[Dutch oven]]\nImage:Chicken_onions_garlic_double_cream_added.jpg|Double cream, yogurt and apricots added\nImage:Chicken_onions_garlic_frying_in_the_dutch_oven.jpg|Frying off the chicken, onions, garlic and Taste Sensation Spicy Mango Marinade Flavouring\n</gallery>\n\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Roast potatoes|roast potatoes]], [[Green vegetables|green vegetables]] and [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]]\n\n===Variations===\n[[Soured cream]] makes a nice sharp difference to this dish.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Poultry recipes]]\n[[Category:Cooking with wine]]\n[[Category:Taste Sensation recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#doublecream #parsley #chickenincream #tastesensationcajunseasoning #walnut #cauliflower #onions #britishrecipes #broadbeans #roasties #greenvegetables</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Chicken margherita melt",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Chicken margherita melt recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#chickenmargheritamelt #oliveoil #springonions #roastpotatoes #egg #mexicanoregano #seeds #chickenbreasts #mozzarella #basilleaves #tortillas \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Anne usually take the 'easy way out' when it comes to cooking and gets ready-meals. She loved this so much she asked me to reproduce it\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 954\n|PortionCalories = 477\n|DatePublished=24th October 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  2 hours, 20 minutes\n|PrepTime =  2 hours\n|CookTime =  20 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Chicken margherita melt recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">A sort of one-handed pizza</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">This looks great and tastes as good as any pizza.  And you can eat it with one hand!</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}}\n\nWhile I'm away, Anne, my partner usually take the 'easy way out' when it comes to cooking and gets ready-meals.  She was very taken with Morrison's [[Chicken]] margherita melt and asked if I could make it as she enjoyed it so much.\n\nThis is my attempt at reproducing a version of it.   The original ready meal came with [[Roast potatoes|roast potatoes]], but I think it would be nicer in flour or corn [[tortillas]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 2 [[Chicken breasts|chicken breasts]], skin removed\n| 2 tablespoons [[Balsamic vinegar|balsamic vinegar]]\n| 2 fat [[Cloves of Garlic, peeled and crushed|cloves of garlic, peeled and crushed]]\n| [[Salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| Half a teaspoon of [[Mexican oregano]] - Normal [[oregano]] is perfectly good, but not quite a strongly flavoured\n| 1 [[Egg|egg]], beaten\n| [[Flour]] for dredging - I love to use [[Masa Harina|masa harina]] or fine[[Yellow cornmeal|yellow cornmeal]] for this but [[plain flour]] is fine\n| 1 ball of [[Mozzarella cheese|mozzarella cheese]] thinly sliced\n}}\n'''[[Salsa|salsa]]'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 4 fresh [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]]\n| 1 [[Clove|clove]] of [[Garlic, peeled and crushed|garlic, peeled and crushed]]\n| Small bunch of [[Spring onions|spring onions]]\n| Freshly picked [[Basil leaves|basil leaves]]\n| 1 small [[Red chilli|red chilli]], sliced, [[Seeds|seeds]] removed if preferred\n| 1 small [[Green Indian chilli|green indian chilli]], sliced, [[Seeds|seeds]] removed if preferred\n| [[Zest]] and [[Juice|juice]] of 1 [[Lime|lime]]\n| 2 tablespoons of [[Olive oil]]\n| [[Salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Flatten the [[chicken breasts]] by bashing them with a rolling pin between a sheet of [[greaseproof paper]]; [[Flattening chicken breasts, aka Jamie Oliver chicken bashing|see here for more detailed steps and a neat tip]]\n* Add the flattened chicken breasts to a [[Lock & Lock box]] together with [[salt]], [[Freshly ground black pepper|pepper]], [[crushed garlic]], [[balsamic vinegar]] and the [[Mexican oregano]]\n* Clip on the lid, shake like mad to mix the marinade and coat the chicken\n* Refrigerate for a few hours if possible\n* Prepare your grill so you can melt the [[mozzarella]] when you are ready to serve\n* Warm a serving platter\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Chicken margherita melt.jpg|Laid out on a flour tortilla, with a little sour cream too!\nImage:Chicken margherita melt not Jamie Oliver.jpg|Serve yourself!  Not up to Jamie Oliver's presentation standards but it worked well for us.\nImage:Chicken margherita melt out of the grill.jpg|Direct from grilling\nImage:Chicken margherita melt ready to grill.jpg|Ready to grill\nImage:Chicken margherita melt pan fried.jpg|Pan fried for 9 minutes\n</gallery>\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Prepare 3 plates, one with your dredging flour, one with the beaten [[egg]] and the last with [[breadcrumbs]]\n| Heat a large [[frying pan]] over a medium heat and add a few tablespoons or [[olive oil]]\n| Dredge both sides of the marinaded chicken in a saucer of your flour to coat.  This helps the beaten egg to stick to the meat \n| Dip the floured chicken in the beaten egg and then pull it through the breadcrumbs and pop them into the hot frying pan\n| Cook for 4 minutes on each side or until the chicken is properly cooked and pop them onto a paper towel\n| Slice the cooked chicken into 2.5 cm (1\") thick strips and place on a baking tray.  I've used a [[silicone baking mat]] as it's easier to clean and does not stick\n| Place the [[mozzarella]] on top of the cooked [[chicken]]  and grill until it's nice and gooey  \n}}\n'''salsa and tortillas'''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Chop the [[tomatoes]] into eight slices\n| Slice the [[spring onions]] on the diagonal\n| Roughly tear the [[basil leaves]] into pieces to release their aromatics\n| Add these to a bowl together with the chopped [[chillies]], [[lime juice]] and [[zest]], [[olive oil]] and seasoning and mix well\n| Microwave the corn [[tortillas]] for 1 minute to warm them\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe the cheesey chicken from a hot platter and roll up the tortillas together with the salsa\n===Recipe source===\n* My variation on a Morrisons ready meal; Chicken Margherita melt\n===Variations===\nThis would be good with [[rice]], [[roast potatoes]], even as a filling for [[taco shells]].\n===Chef's notes===\nMy original choice was to serve this with pitta breads, that would probably have been a bit easier to eat and less messy than soft tortillas.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Italian recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Poultry recipes]]\n[[Category:Grilled, griddled or barbecued]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#chickenmargheritamelt #oliveoil #springonions #roastpotatoes #egg #mexicanoregano #seeds #chickenbreasts #mozzarella #basilleaves #tortillas </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Chicken satay",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Chicken satay recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#chicken #chickensatay #chickenthighs #sataysauce #corianderleaves #springonions #ginger #marinade #peanutbutter #cuminseeds #pineapple \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This is my version of Jamie Oliver's Chicken satay his recent book, Jamie Oliver's Comfort Food\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1892\n|PortionCalories = 473\n|DatePublished=4th November 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  12 hours, 40 minutes\n|PrepTime =  12 hours, 20 minutes\n|CookTime =  20 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Chicken satay recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Thanks Jamie!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.8</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Brilliant.  I love this!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}}\n\nThis is my version of Jamie Oliver's [[Chicken]] [[Satay]] from '''Jamie Oliver's Comfort Food''' ''August 2014'', ISBN 978-071815953\n\nI've really just changed some of the ingredients and omitted the unsalted shelled [[Peanuts|peanuts]] as the garnish as Anne does not like peanuts.  She loves [[Satay sauce|satay sauce]] though.  Odd, I know!\n\nAs with any [[Chicken|chicken]] dish, I [[Marinade|marinade]] the chicken pieces in a few tablespoons of [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]], half a teaspoon of fine [[Salt|salt]] and a splash of [[Olive oil|olive oil]].  This was a useful tip picked up on my first [[Indian cookery]] class, many moons ago.  I've also added a dash of [[Dark soy sauce|dark soy sauce]]. My [[Jaccard meat tenderiser]] has been brought into play on chicken for the first time.  We'll see if that makes any noticeable difference.\n\nI've used bone in [[Chicken thighs|chicken thighs]] as they were inexpensive.  These are not idea for skewering so I'll cook them in the [[Oven|oven]] and eat around the [[bones]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 8 [[Chicken thighs|chicken thighs]]\n| 2 tablespoons [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]]\n| \u00bd teaspoon fine [[Salt|salt]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Dark soy sauce|dark soy sauce]]\n| 1 teaspoon medium [[Curry powder|curry powder]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Turmeric powder|turmeric powder]]\n| 1 teaspoon sugar\n| \u00bd teaspoon white [[Cumin seeds|cumin seeds]]\n| \u00bd teaspoon [[Black cumin seeds|black cumin seeds]]\n| 2 [[Green Indian chillies|green indian chillies]]\n| 2 [[Red chillies|red chillies]]\n| 4 [[Fat|fat]] [[Cloves of Garlic, peeled and crushed|cloves of garlic, peeled and crushed]]\n| Thumb-sized piece of [[Ginger|ginger]], peeled and roughly chopped\n| Bunch of [[Spring onions|spring onions]]\n| Bunch of fresh [[Coriander|coriander]]\n| 6 tablespoons crunchy [[Peanut butter|peanut butter]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Tahini|tahini]]\n| 3 [[Limes|limes]]\n| 2 tablespoons of [[Light soy sauce|light soy sauce]]\n| [[Peanut oil]]\n| Small tin of [[Pineapple|pineapple]] rings\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Remove the skin from the [[Chicken thighs|chicken thighs]].  If you're lucky enough to own a [[Jaccard meat tenderiser]], press lots of holes into the [[Chicken|chicken]].  Add the chicken pieces  and [[Marinade|marinade]] for 6 hours of so in a cool place.\n* A few hours before you want to cook the [[Chicken|chicken]], cut some big slashes in them so there are large surface areas for the cover. Pop them in a [[Lock and Lock box]] with the half of the [[Satay sauce|satay sauce]]. Shake well and [[Refrigerate|refrigerate]] for a few hours.\n* 30 minutes before you're ready to cook, preheat the [[Oven|oven]] and a [[Griddle pan|griddle pan]] to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6), [fan oven 180\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| De-seed one of each of the [[green chillies]] and one of the [[Red chillies|red chillies]] and peel and roughly chop the [[Garlic|garlic]] and [[ginger]].\n| In a dry pan, heat the [[Cumin seeds|cumin seeds]] until they pop.  Grind them in a [[Coffee grinder|coffee grinder]] or [[Pestle and mortar|pestle and mortar]], pop them back into the pan with the [[Curry powder|curry powder]] and [[Turmeric|turmeric]] for 30 seconds to release the aromas.\n| Reserve a handful of [[Coriander leaves|coriander leaves]] for garnish and pop the [[Rest|rest]] in a [[Blender|blender]] together with two chopped [[Chillies|chillies]], [[Ginger|ginger]], [[Garlic|garlic]] and [[Blend|blend]] to a paste.\n| Add the [[Peanut butter|peanut butter]] and [[Tahini|tahini]], [[Zest|zest]] and [[Juice|juice]] of 2 [[Limes|limes]], 2 tablespoons of [[Soy sauce|soy sauce]], 1 teaspoon of sugar and the green parts of the [[Spring onions|spring onions]].\n| Blend and test for seasoning. Adjust the consistency by adding a little [[Chicken stock|chicken stock]] or water if needed.\n| Reserve half of the [[Satay sauce|satay sauce]] to serve as a garnish, cut a few slashes in the [[Chicken thighs|chicken thighs]], pop them in a [[Lock and Lock box]] with the remaining [[Sauce|sauce]] and [[Marinade|marinade]] in a cool place for a few hours.\n| [[Spray]] the [[Chicken|chicken]] pieces with a little [[Oil|oil]], carefully oil the hot [[Griddle pan|griddle pan]] and cook in the [[Oven|oven]] for 20 minutes, turning after 10 minutes.\n| Chop the remaining [[Chillies|chillies]], the white parts of the [[Spring onions|spring onions]] and the [[Coriander leaves|coriander leaves]] to use as a garnish.\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Chicken satay conventional.jpg|300px|thumb|right|Served in a more conventional manner, with a vegetable stir-fry and noodles ([[vegetable chow mein]])\nImage:Chicken satay sspread.jpg|300px|thumb|right|Really should have been with paratha or naan breads but pittas worked pretty well\n</gallery>\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with the remaining [[Satay sauce|satay sauce]], [[Lime wedges|lime wedges]], [[pineapple]] rings, [[Coriander leaves|coriander leaves]] and [[Pitta breads|pitta breads]] or more conventionally with [[vegetable chow-mein]] (stir fried vegetables and noodles).\n===Variations===\nUse boneless [[Chicken thighs|chicken thighs]], chop them into 4 before [[Marinating|marinating]] and cook them on [[Skewers|skewers]]\n===Chef's notes===\nBe aware of food hygiene when preparing this dish as you will be handling raw [[Chicken|chicken]] multiple times and preparing items that will be [[Uncooked|uncooked]] and used as garnishes.\n{{Template:PeelingGinger}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Chinese recipes]]\n[[Category:Mauritian recipes]]\n[[Category:Oriental cuisine]]\n[[Category:Thai recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Poultry recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Grilled, griddled or barbecued]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#chicken #chickensatay #chickenthighs #sataysauce #corianderleaves #springonions #ginger #marinade #peanutbutter #cuminseeds #pineapple </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Chicken stock concentrate (TM)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Chicken stock concentrate - A Thermomix recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#chicken #vegetables #dried #whitewine #courgette #stockcubes #thermomix #onion #coarseseasalt #thermomixrecipes #carrot \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=One of the great things about owning a Thermomix is its ability to make stock concentrates which can be kept in the fridge in a jar or plastic\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1313\n|PortionCalories = 218\n|DatePublished=13th November 2013\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Servings: 6 - Makes about 750ml\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  30 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime =  20 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Chicken stock concentrate TM recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Lovely stock</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Lasts for ages if frozen</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:NonLoggedInUser|NonLoggedInUser]] </span></span>\n}}\nOne of the great things about owning a [[Thermomix]] is its ability to make [[Stock|stock]] concentrates which can be kept in the [[Fridge|fridge]] in a jar or plastic container.  It works out so much cheaper than commercial [[Stock cubes|stock cubes]] and contains no nasty chemicals.\n\n{{RecipeIngredientsTM\n\n| 375g raw [[Chicken|chicken]], roughly chopped\n| 430g [[Vegetables|vegetables]] (I used 2 [[Celery|celery]] stalks, \u00bd large [[Carrot|carrot]], 1 medium [[Onion|onion]], 1 bulb [[Garlic|garlic]] and \u00bd small [[Courgette|courgette]]) chopped into large pieces\n| 2-3 teaspoons [[Dried|dried]] [[Herbes de Provence|herbes de provence]]\n| 200g [[Coarse sea salt|coarse sea salt]]\n| 65g [[White wine|white wine]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Put the [[Chicken|chicken]] in the bowl '''Speed 5-7-9 / 10 seconds'''\n| Add the [[Vegetables|vegetables]] '''Speed 6 / 10-15 seconds'''\n| Add the [[Dried|dried]] [[Herbs|herbs]], [[Salt|salt]] and [[Wine|wine]] '''Speed 2 / Temp. Varoma / 20 minutes''' using internal [[Steaming|steaming]] basket on the top, rather than the MC.\n| When the cooking time is over and the mixture has cooled somewhat, replace the MC '''Speed 10 / 1 minute'''.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nUse 1 teaspoon of the concentrate to 500ml of water.\n===Chef's notes===\nIt will taste very salty in its concentrated form, but once diluted in water it will be fine.\n==See also==\n\n* [[Bron's Spanish vegetable stock concentrate (TM)]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Soup and stock recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Poultry recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Cooking with wine]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n[[Category:Thermomix recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#chicken #vegetables #dried #whitewine #courgette #stockcubes #thermomix #onion #coarseseasalt #thermomixrecipes #carrot </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Chicken tikka (cheat)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Chicken tikka (cheat), Indian recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#chicken #marinade #yogurt #currypaste #chickentikka #lemonjuice #dip #greensalad #naturalyogurt #barbecue #marinading \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This is a really simple way to make chicken tikka, (tandoori chicken)\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}}\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1037\n|PortionCalories = 259\n|DatePublished=24th October 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = 4 with rice other dishes\n|ImageComment = Chicken tikka, [[green salad]], [[naan bread]] & [[yogurt]]\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  2 days, 40 minutes\n|PrepTime =  2 days, 10 minutes\n|CookTime = 30 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Chicken tikka (cheat) recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Lovely</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.3</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">As good as any restaurant!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:NonLoggedInUser|NonLoggedInUser]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis is a really simple way to make [[Chicken tikka|chicken tikka]], (''tandoori chicken''). All you need are [[Chicken|chicken]] pieces, a pot of [[Yogurt|yogurt]] and a jar of ready made ''[[Curry paste|curry paste]]''.  I've used vindaloo paste but you could use whatever you fancy.\n\nThe long you can leave the chicken pieces [[Marinading|marinading]], the better it will be.  I try to leave it a few days if I have managed to think that far ahead.\n\nThis will be cooked in an oven but could just as easily be cooked under a [[Grill|grill]], or on a [[barbecue]] grid or hot-plate.\n\nWe have a more authentic [[Chicken tikka|chicken tikka]] recipe here if you want to make it from scratch.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 4 [[Chicken|chicken]] legs and 4 [[chicken]] thighs (or similar selection)\n| 500g pot of [[Natural yogurt|natural yogurt]]\n| 3 tablespoons of your favourite [[Curry paste|curry paste]]\n| [[Lemon juice]] (optional)\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] (optional)\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Chicken tikka (cheat)_resting.jpg|Rest for 4 minutes then serve\nImage:Chicken tikka (cheat)_ready_to_cook.jpg|After 2 days its ready to cook\nImage:Chicken tikka (cheat)_yogurt_curry_paste.jpg|Add the curry paste to the yogurt\nImage:Chicken tikka (cheat)_cut slashes.jpg|Cut deep slashes into the chicken pieces\nImage:Chicken tikka (cheat)_ingredients.jpg|Chicken tikka, the simplest of ingredients\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| I like to remove the skin and trim any [[Fat|fat]].  The [[Marinade|marinade]] gets better penetration without the skin on and it's also a little healthier.\n| Cut 3 or 4 deep slashes down to the bone on each piece.  This ensures really good coverage of the [[Marinade|marinade]].\n| Optionally you can [[Marinade|marinade]] the [[Chicken|chicken]] pieces in [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]] and a good pinch of [[Salt|salt]] for a few hours before adding the [[Yogurt|yogurt]] [[Marinade|marinade]].  This [[Tenderise|tenderises]] the chicken.\n| Mix 2 to 3 tablespoons of your favourite [[Curry paste|curry paste]] into about two thirds of the [[Yogurt|yogurt]].  You don't need any more yogurt for this recipe so it leaves a little spare to make a [[Dip|dip]] or dressing to go with the [[Chicken|chicken]] pieces.\n| Add the [[Chicken|chicken]] pieces and the [[Marinade|marinade]] to a [[Lock and Lock]] style box.  replace the lid and shake like mad.\n| [[Refrigerate]] for a few days if possible shaking it now and then.\n| When you are ready to cook them, preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 220\u00b0 C (425\u00b0 F - gas 7), [fan oven 200\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n| Cook on a grid over a foil-lined oven tray at the top of the [[Oven|oven]] for about 25 to 30 minutes, turning once. Check the chicken is properly cooked, rest for 4 or 5 minutes then serve.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Plain rice|plain rice]], a simple [[Green salad|green salad]] and the remaining [[Yogurt|yogurt]] as a [[Dip|dip]].\n===Variations===\nStart with this [[Cheat|cheat]] recipe and tailor it to your liking by adding extra [[Garlic|garlic]], [[Chillies|chillies]], [[Ginger|ginger]], [[Herbs|herbs]] and [[Spices|spices]].  I'm sure that you get the idea.\n==See also==\n* [[Chicken tikka]]\n* [[Chicken tikka masala]]\n* {{See also - Jointing a chicken}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Indian recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Poultry recipes]]\n[[Category:Barbecue recipes]]\n[[Category:Cookery cheats]]\n[[Category:Student recipes]]\n[[Category:Marinaded]][[Category:Grilled, griddled or barbecued]][[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#chicken #marinade #yogurt #currypaste #chickentikka #lemonjuice #dip #greensalad #naturalyogurt #barbecue #marinading </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Chicken tikka kebabs",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Chicken tikka kebabs\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#marinade #chicken #kebabs #massamancurry #sweetpeppers #chickentikkakebabs #grill #mushrooms #rice #limejuice #olives\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=Delicious home-made spicy hot chicken kebabs\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}}\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=29th November 2021\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  5 hours, 35 minutes\n|PrepTime =  5 hours, 20 minutes\n|CookTime =  15 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 412\n|PortionCalories = 206 \n|Image = [[Image:Chicken tikka kebabs recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Yum!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.9</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Bloody, Yum!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:NonLoggedInUser|NonLoggedInUser]] </span></span>\n}}\nDelicious home-made spicy hot chicken kebabs.  These take a while to prepare but are most definitely worth the effort.  Whatever else you put on the kebab sticks is up to your personal taste.\n\nWe've chosen [[Sweet peppers|sweet peppers]] and [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]].\n\nAs I've recently bought a selection of Mae Ploy [[Curry|curry]] pastes, I've used the Mae Ploy [[Massaman curry]] paste in this recipe.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n}}\n====kebabs====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| One massive [[Chicken breast|chicken breast]] fillet\n| Two [[Sweet peppers|sweet peppers]], any colour\n| 24 [[Button mushrooms|button mushrooms]]\n}}\n====marinade====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 4 [[Cloves of Garlic, peeled and crushed|cloves of garlic, peeled and crushed]]\n| 250g [[Greek yogurt]]\n| 2 teaspoons Mae Play [[Massaman curry]] paste\n| 1 teaspoon soft [[Brown sugar|brown sugar]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Lime juice|lime juice]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n}}\n====marinade====\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Mix all of the [[Marinade|marinade]] ingredients together in a [[Lock & Lock box]] and stir really well to ensure they are properly mixed\n| Cut the [[Chicken|chicken]] into bite-sized pieces and add to the [[Marinade|marinade]]\n| Cover and shake hard so the [[Chicken|chicken]] is evenly coated\n| Leave to [[Marinade|marinade]] for about 5 hours, shaking now and then if you can\n}}\n====kebabs====\n{{RecipeMethod\n| While you assemble the [[Kebabs|kebabs]], preheat you [[Grill|grill]] to maximum\n| Deseed the [[Peppers|peppers]] and cut into squares so they 'fit' the [[Kebabs|kebabs]]\n| Slide the [[Chicken|chicken]], [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]] and [[Pepper|pepper]] slices onto your [[Kebab|kebab]] sticks - metal [[Skewers|skewers]] work well for us\n| Arrange over a [[Foil|foil]]-lined [[Oven tray|oven tray]] and coat with any spare [[Marinade|marinade]]\n| [[Grill]] for 15 minutes, turning once\n| [[Rest for]] 5 minutes before serving\n}}\n\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Vegetable|vegetable]] [[Rice|rice]] or [[Pittas|pittas]] and a [[Salad|salad]]\n===Variations===\n[[Cherry tomatoes]], slices of [[Fruit|fruit]] and slices of [[Red onion|red onion]] and [[Olives|olives]] go well on these [[Kebabs|kebabs]].\n===Chef's notes===\nThese would be perfect for a [[Barbecue|barbecue]] too, though not for us as it's snowing at the moment!\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Greek recipes]]\n[[Category:Indian recipes]]\n[[Category:Middle Eastern recipes]]\n[[Category:North African recipes]]\n[[Category:Thai recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Marinades dressings and butters]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Chilli pepper recipes]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Poultry recipes]]\n[[Category:Barbecue recipes]]\n[[Category:Grilled, griddled or barbecued]]\n[[Category:Marinaded]]\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#marinade #chicken #kebabs #massamancurry #sweetpeppers #chickentikkakebabs #grill #mushrooms #rice #limejuice #olives</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }

title": "Chicken Wellington",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Chicken Wellington, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#chickenwellington #chicken #bacon #chickenbreast #pastry #puffpastry #onions #hasselbackpotatoes #oliveoil #yolk #brushing \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=After the success of my beef wellington, I thought I would 'invent' a chicken version\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 3256\n|PortionCalories = 1628\n|DatePublished=21st January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 2 to 4 (see below)\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 1 hour 25 minutes\n |PrepTime = 45 minutes\n |CookTime = 40 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Chicken Wellington recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Much cheaper than Beef Wellington.</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">..and just as good.  Cranberry sauce sounds a great idea.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nI thought I would 'invent' this after the success of my recent [[Beef Wellington]].  Disappointingly, after I had assembled them and check teh internets ''(sic)'', I discover that I am not the first to make this :-)\n\nIt's very much an experiment, made from what was available when the shops were shut. One of the things I may change is to use [[Belazu chilli jelly]], instead of [[Cranberry jelly|cranberry jelly]] - or maybe that can be another recipe.\n\nThis version uses [[p\u00e2t\u00e9]] rather than [[duxelles]].  It was an absolute success and more versions will certainly follow.\n\nFrom the ingredients you would think that it would serve just two people as the chicken breasts were quite small and the bacon very thin.  However we both agreed that as they were they could easily have serve 4 people, especially if served with extra vegetables.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1 medium [[Onion|onion]], peeled and finely chopped\n| 3 Cloves [[Garlic|garlic]], peeled and thinly sliced\n| 2 tablespoons of  [[Olive oil]]\n| [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 170 g coarse [[Pork|pork]] and [[Mushroom|mushroom]] p\u00e2t\u00e9\n| 6 rashers [[Bacon|bacon]]\n| 2 large [https://www.cookipedia.co.uk/calories/chicken/bq/2#jump chicken breasts]\n| 375g Jus Rol, ready rolled [[Puff pastry|puff pastry]]\n| 2 [[Egg yolks|egg yolks]] for [[Brushing|brushing]] the [[Pastry|pastry]].\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 220\u00b0 C (425\u00b0 F - gas 7), [fan oven 200\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n===Method===\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Chicken Wellington ready to bake.jpg|[[Chicken]] Wellingtons, ready to bake\nImage:Chicken Wellington rolled in cling-film.jpg|Roll in cling-film and chill\nImage:Chicken Wellington bacon spread with pate.jpg|Bacon spread with and pate\nImage:Chicken Wellington Pate, onions and garlic, ready to spread.jpg|Pate, onions and garlic, ready to spread\nImage:Chicken Wellington ingredients.jpg|[[Chicken]] Wellington, the ingredients\n</gallery>\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Add the [[Olive oil|olive oil]] to a small pan and give it a good grind of [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n| Very gently [[Fry|fry]] the [[Garlic|garlic]] and [[Onions|onions]] for 10 minutes in the [[Oil|oil]] until soft\n| Add the p\u00e2t\u00e9, heat and stir until it breaks down and mingles with the [[Onions|onions]]. remove from the heat and allow to cool a little.\n| Lay 3 rashers of [[Bacon|bacon]] out on a large sheet of [[Cling-film|cling-film]] and spread half of the [[Pate|pate]] over the bacon\n| With a sharp knife, make a pocket in the [[Chicken breast|chicken breast]] and add a tablespoon of [[Cranberry|cranberry]] jelly\n| Lay the [[Chicken breast|chicken breast]] on the [[Bacon|bacon]] and with the [[Help|help]] of the [[Cling-film|cling-film]], roll up into a parcel and 'twizzle' the ends to seal.\n| Repeat for the other [[Chicken breast|chicken breast]].\n| Chill in the [[Refrigerator|refrigerator]] for 30 minutes, at the same time, remove the [[Puff-pastry|puff-pastry]] and allow it to reach room temperature.\n| After 30 minutes, remove the [[Cling-film|cling-film]] and wrap each [[Chicken|chicken]]/[[Bacon|bacon]] parcel in [[Puff pastry|puff pastry]]. There will be enough for two in 1 pack of ready-rolled [[Pastry|pastry]].\n| You can either make the Wellington properly by [[Brushing|brushing]] the [[Pastry|pastry]] joins with [[Egg|egg]]-[[Yolk|yolk]] and pressing together with the tines of a fork, or [[Cheat|cheat]] as I have by twisting the joins like a [[Calzone pizza]] or a [[Cornish pasty]].\n| [[Brush]] the surface of the Wellingtons with [[Egg|egg]]-[[Yolk|yolk]] so they colour when [[Baked|baked]].\n| Chill the Wellingtons in the [[Fridge|fridge]] while the [[Oven|oven]] warms up, then [[Bake|bake]] for 35 to 40 minutes - Check the [[Chicken|chicken]] is properly cooked then serve.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Hasselback potatoes]] and [[Peas|peas]]\n===Chef's notes===\nI was a little concerned that the [[chicken]] would not be cooked in the 20 to 30 minutes that it normally takes to cook [[puff pastry]].  In the event we cooked them in the oven with the [[hasselback potatoes]], which took almost an hour.  The chicken was very moist, probably due to the [[cranberry sauce]] and pate, yet the pastry was perfect - super crunchy!\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Poultry recipes]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#chickenwellington #chicken #bacon #chickenbreast #pastry #puffpastry #onions #hasselbackpotatoes #oliveoil #yolk #brushing </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Chili and lime spiced butternut squash",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
