                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Chili and lime spiced butternut squash\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#chiliandlimespicedbutternutsquash #oliveoil #bakingtray #tastesensationrecipes #miseenplace #vegetable #butternutsquash #bake #squash #airfryer \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A really simple and quick way to jazz up this underrated vegetable.\n|og:image=https://www.cookipedia.co.uk/wiki/images/thumb/5/52/Chili_and_lime_spiced_butternut_squash_recipe.jpg/450px-Chili_and_lime_spiced_butternut_squash_recipe.jpg\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=15th December 2019\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  43 minutes\n|PrepTime =  3 minutes\n|CookTime =  40 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 90\n|PortionCalories = 45\n|Image = [[Image:Chili and lime spiced butternut squash recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Livens up squashes and gourds</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.1</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I tried this with courgettes and it was just as good, but it did not need to be cooked for so long.  20 minutes was enough for them.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nA really simple and quick way to jazz up this underrated [[Vegetable|vegetable]].\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 [[Butternut squash|butternut squash]], peeled and chopped into bite-sized pieces\n| 2 tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Taste Sensation Chilli and Lime seasoning]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6), [fan oven 180\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Pop all of the ingredients into a [[Lock and Lock box]]\n| Fit the lid and shake like crazy to coat the pieces of [[Squash|squash]]\n| Tip them out onto a [[Baking tray|baking tray]] and [[Bake|bake]] for 40 minutes at 200\u00b0 C\n}}\n===Variations===\nThese could just as easily be cooked in an [[Air Fryer]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n[[Category:Taste Sensation recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#chiliandlimespicedbutternutsquash #oliveoil #bakingtray #tastesensationrecipes #miseenplace #vegetable #butternutsquash #bake #squash #airfryer </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Chilli and lime chicken stir fry",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Chilli and lime chicken stir fry recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#chicken #oliveoil #vegetables #stirfry #beansprouts #chilliandlimechickenstirfry #refrigerator #noodles #drysherry #tastesensationrecipes #date \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Another experiment with Taste Sensation taste sensation seasonings. I used their excellent Chilli and lime seasoning recently..\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=18th December 2019\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  3 hours, 17 minutes\n|PrepTime =  3 hours, 5 minutes\n|CookTime =  12 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 467\n|PortionCalories = 233 \n|Image = [[Image:Chilli and lime chicken stir fry recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Any stir-fry is good..</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.7</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">..add chilli and lime and you'll have to fight me for it.  You'll probably win too as I'm old and fat!</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Morrisons stir fry selection.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Half quantities of Morrisons stir fry selection (for two people)]]\nAnother experiment with [[Taste Sensation Seasonings|taste sensation seasonings]].  I used their excellent [[Chilli and Lime Seasoning]] recently in [[Chili and lime spiced butternut squash]].  This time I thought I would try a [[Stir-fry|stir-fry]].\n\nI've used Morrisons pre-packed [[Stir-fry|stir-fry]] ingredients as they are the easiest way to get a decent variety of [[Vegetables|vegetables]].  Half quantities of these packs are perfect for a two-person [[Stir fry|stir fry]].  Just check the quality of the [[Bean sprouts|bean sprouts]] as they can be rather close to sell-by (or bin-by) [[Date|date]].\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 large [[Chicken breast|chicken breast]], cut into thin strips\n| 1 heaped tablespoon of [[Taste Sensation Chilli and Lime Seasoning]]\n| 3 tablespoons of [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| Half a packet of [[Bean sprouts|bean sprouts]] [180 g]\n| Half a packet of fresh [[Egg noodles|egg noodles]] [205 g]\n| Half a packet of Sweet & Crunchy [[Stir fry|stir fry]] [300 g]\n| Splash of [[Dark soy sauce|dark soy sauce]] - optional\n| Splash of [[Dry sherry|dry sherry]] - optional\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* If you get the chance, leave the [[Chicken|chicken]] pieces, dusted with the [[Taste Sensation Chilli and Lime Seasoning]] in the [[refrigerator]] for a few hours beforehand to enhance the flavour.\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Pop the sliced [[Chicken|chicken]] in a [[Lock and Lock box|lock and lock box]] together with the [[Taste Sensation Chilli and Lime Seasoning]] and one of the tablespoons of [[Olive oil|olive oil]].  Shake like crazy to mix.  Leave to [[Marinade|marinade]] for a while if you get the chance.\n| This is quicker and easier if you have two woks, if not cook the [[Chicken|chicken]] first and keep warm while you cook the [[Vegetables|vegetables]]\n| [[Stir fry]] the [[Chicken|chicken]] in a tablespoon of [[Olive oil|olive oil]], turning regularly until the chicken is properly cooked - about 5 minutes or longer if it's thickly sliced\n| [[Stir-fry]] the [[Vegetables|vegetables]] in a tablespoon of [[Olive oil|olive oil]] until they are wilted\n| Toss in the [[Beans|beans]] shoots and [[Noodles|noodles]] and [[Stir-fry|stir-fry]] until cooked - about 4 minutes\n| If using, add a splash of [[Sherry|sherry]] and [[Soy sauce|soy sauce]] and mix well\n| Mix in the cooked [[Chicken|chicken]] and serve immediately\n}}\n===Variations===\nYou can also cook the [[Chicken|chicken]] in an air-fryer basket for about 5 minutes, instead of pan-[[Frying|frying]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Chinese recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Chilli pepper recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Poultry recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Stir fried]]\n[[Category:Taste Sensation recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#chicken #oliveoil #vegetables #stirfry #beansprouts #chilliandlimechickenstirfry #refrigerator #noodles #drysherry #tastesensationrecipes #date </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Chilli coconut chicken with a bean and pasta salad",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Chilli coconut chicken with a bean and pasta salad\n|titlemode=replace\n|description=Taste Sensation chilli coconut marinade sous vide chicken with a pasta salad\n|keywords=#chickenbreast #marinade #tastesensationchillicoconutmarinade #salad #bean #chicken #pasta #chillicoconutchickenwithabeanandpastasalad #carrots #tastesensation #vacuumseal\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=6th February 2021\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  18 hours\n|PrepTime =  12 hours\n|CookTime =  6 hours\n|TotalCalories = 682\n|PortionCalories = 341\n|Image = [[Image:Chilli coconut chicken with a bean and pasta salad recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Better than any curry</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">A stunning array of flavours; and pasta!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nI had a sample of [[Taste Sensation]]'s [[Taste Sensation chilli coconut marinade]] and it tasted so great, I thought I would find an excuse to make a nice healthy [[Salad|salad]].\n\nI've cooked the [[Chicken breast|chicken breast]] [[Sous-vide|sous-vide]] as I find it the best way to keep the [[Chicken|chicken]] moist.  If you don't have a [[Sous-vide bath|sous-vide bath]], I would use pre-cooked chicken left-overs or even supermarket pre-sliced chicken. Add them to a [[Lock and Lock box]] together with the [[Marinade|marinade]] powder and shake the box well to coat the chicken evenly.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n}}\n====for the spicy coconut chicken====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 1 large [[Chicken breast|chicken breast]], skin removed\n| 2 tablespoons [[Taste Sensation chilli coconut marinade]]\n}}\n====for the pasta salad====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 2 medium [[Carrots|carrots]], scraped or peeled and finely [[Grated|grated]]\n| 1 white [[Onion|onion]], peeled and finely sliced\n| 2 tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[balsamic vinegar]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Honey|honey]]\n| Pinch of [[Sea Salt|sea salt]]\n}}\n====for the pasta bean salad====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 56g [2 oz] [[Dried pasta|dried pasta]] of your choosing\n| 1 can of Morrisons [[Bean|bean]] [[Salad|salad]], drained and rinsed\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Place the [[Chicken breast|chicken breast]] in a [[Sous-vide|sous-vide]] bag together with 2 tbs of [[Taste Sensation chilli coconut marinade]]\n* [[Vacuum seal]] and leave in a cool place to [[Marinade|marinade]] for 12 hours\n\n===Method===\n====coconut chicken====\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Cook the [[Marinated|marinated]] [[Chicken breast|chicken breast]] [[Sous-vide|sous-vide]] for about 6 hours at 63\u00b0 C [145\u00b0 F]\n| Remove from the [[Sous-vide|sous-vide]] bag, reserving the cooking juices and leave to cool\n}}\n====bean salad====\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Cook the [[Pasta|pasta]] as directed, drain and allow to cool a little\n| Mix the cooked [[Pasta|pasta]] together with the canned [[Bean|bean]] [[Salad|salad]]\n| Pour over the reserved cooking juices and mix well\n}}\n====carrot and onion salad====\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Grate the [[Carrots|carrots]]\n| Slice the [[Onions|onions]]\n| Mix the dressing ingredients together and  pour over the [[Carrot and onion salad|carrot and onion salad]]\n| Serve!\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Pasta and bean salad.jpg| Pasta and bean salad\nImage:Coconut chili chicken sous vide sliced.jpg|Coconut chilli chicken, sliced\nImage:Coconut chili chicken sous vide cooked.jpg|Coconut chilli chicken after 6 hours sous-vide cooking\nImage:Coconut chili chicken sous vide marinade.jpg|Coconut chilli chicken after 12 hours marinading\n</gallery>\n\n===Chef's notes===\nThis recipe is probably quite difficult to replicate without a [[Sous-vide|sous-vide]] [[Cooker|cooker]] but you could probably [[Marinade|marinade]] and [[Steam|steam]] the [[Chicken|chicken]] in a small dish to keep the cooking juices.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pasta recipes]]\n[[Category:Salad recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Pasta salad recipes]]\n[[Category:Sous vide recipes]]\n[[Category:Sous vide cooking]]\n{{Template:Sous Vide, Smoking and Curing UK}}\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#chickenbreast #marinade #tastesensationchillicoconutmarinade #salad #bean #chicken #pasta #chillicoconutchickenwithabeanandpastasalad #carrots #tastesensation #vacuumseal</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Chilli Dog Frito Pie",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Chilli Dog Frito Pie\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#onions #hotdogs #chillisauce #tomatoes #oliveoil #mixedherbs #cheddarcheese #chillidogfritopie #chilli #tortillachips #tortilla \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=We often make this in our Motorhome, it's a great posh picnic recipe.\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=29th May 2017\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  35 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime =  25 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 4418\n|PortionCalories = 1104\n|Image = [[Image:Chilli Dog Frito Pie recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Looks a bloody mess!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.8</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Though I bet it tastes good!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nWe often make this in our Motorhome, it's a nice and simple recipe to make and is great food to pick at.  Ideal for parties.\n\nAlthough I planned to use [[Chilli|chilli]] dogs, as Anne wanted normal [[Hot dogs|hot dogs]], we used those and I added the [[chilli sauce]] afterwards.\n\nThis is the kind of recipe you can throw in what you fancy - just make sure it's not too wet or you'll get soggy [[tortilla chips]].\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 large pack lightly [[Salted|salted]] [[Tortilla chips|tortilla chips]]\n| 1 560g can of [[Hot dogs|hot dogs]] (large)\n| Splash of [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| Pinch of [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 2 small white [[Onions|onions]], peeled an finely chopped\n| 4 fresh [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]]\n| 180g mature [[Cheddar cheese]]\n| Pinch of [[Mixed herbs|mixed herbs]]\n| [[Chilli sauce]] to serve\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4), [fan oven 160\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Add a splash of [[Olive oil|olive oil]] to a large [[Baking tray|baking tray]]\n| Sprinkle with [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n| Finely chop the [[Onions|onions]] and arrange half in the base of the tray\n| Chop half of the [[Hot dogs|hot dogs]] into small pieces and scatter over the [[Onions|onions]]\n| Roughly chop half of the [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]] and add to the [[Onions|onions]] & [[Hot dogs|hot dogs]]\n| Tip the [[Tortilla|tortilla]] [[Chip|chip]] into the tray and top with the remaining chopped [[Hot dogs|hot dogs]], [[Onions|onions]] and [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]]\n| Sprinkle with a good pinch of [[Mixed herbs|mixed herbs]] (and [[Chilli sauce|chilli sauce]] if using)\n| Cover with [[Grated|grated]] [[Cheddar cheese]]\n| [[Bake]] in the [[Oven|oven]] for about 20 minutes until the [[Cheese|cheese]] is bubbling and the dogs are cooked.\n}}\n===Variations===\nUse canned [[Chilli|chilli]] dogs instead of [[Frankfurters|frankfurters]]\n\n<YouTube>https://youtu.be/QV0O2LQlccg</YouTube>\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:North American recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Chilli pepper recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#onions #hotdogs #chillisauce #tomatoes #oliveoil #mixedherbs #cheddarcheese #chillidogfritopie #chilli #tortillachips #tortilla </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }

minutes\n|PrepTime =  5 minutes\n|CookTime =  15 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 760\n|PortionCalories = 3040\n|Image = [[Image:Chilli Jack burger recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">A cheeseburger</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span [[Burger|burger]] made with [[Dragon Monterey Jack cheese]], produced in Wales by [[South Caernarfon Creameries]].\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 500g [[Beef mince]]\n| 2 tablespoons Sweet [[Chilli sauce|chilli sauce]]\n| 1 medium sized [[Egg|egg]] beaten\n| 1 [[Red chilli|red chilli]] finely chopped (optional for extra heat)\n| 4 x 28g slices [[Dragon Monterey Jack cheese]]\n| 4 x [[Burger]] buns [[Split|split]] in half horizontally\n| 4 large [[Gherkins|gherkins]] thinly sliced\n| A Light dusting of [[Plain flour|plain flour]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Mix the [[Mince|mince]] with the chopped [[Chilli|chilli]] and 1 tablespoon of [[Chilli sauce|chilli sauce]]\n| Add beaten [[Egg|egg]] and mix thoroughly, form into 4 evenly sized [[Burgers|burgers]] and dust with [[Plain flour|plain flour]]\n| [[Grill]] or [[BBQ|bbq]] [[Burgers|burgers]] for 6-10 minutes until cooked through\n| Place a slice on [[Monterey Jack]] on each [[Burger|burger]] and [[Grill|grill]] until melted and bubbling\n| Spread one slice of bun with [[Chilli sauce|chilli sauce]] and arrange [[Gherkins|gherkins]] slices on base of bun, place the [[Burger|burger]] inside bun and serve immediately\n}}\n===Recipe source===\n\n* Many thanks to [[South Caernarfon Creameries]] for giving [[Cookipedia]] permission to use this recipe.\n==See also==\n\n* [[Dragon Monterey Jack cheese]]\n* [[South Caernarfon Creameries]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:North American recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Spicy title": "Chilli peppers in a blanket",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Chilli peppers in a blanket recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#chillipeppersinablanket #roast #bacon #corianderleaves #sweetpotatoes #mascarponecheese #chilli #chili #chicken #sweetcorn #cocktailstick \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=These are the best post-pub snack in the universe. They're a great accompaniment to roast chicken, roast sweet potatoes and sweetcorn\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 4361\n|PortionCalories = 1090\n|DatePublished=8th September 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  40 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  25 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Chilli peppers in a blanket recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Genius!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Just perfect for home-grown chillies.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nThese are the best post-pub [[Snack|snack]] in the universe. They're so easy and good.  They're also good with [[Roast|roast]] [[Chicken|chicken]], [[Roast|roast]] [[Sweet potatoes|sweet potatoes]] and [[Sweetcorn|sweetcorn]].\n\nIf you're not a [[chili]] fan, try this with [[Bell_peppers#Sweet_banana_pepper|sweet banana peppers]] instead.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 4 to 6 decent sized [[Chilli peppers|chilli peppers]]\n| 200g [[Cream cheese|cream cheese]]\n| 1 teaspoon freshly chopped [[Coriander leaves|coriander leaves]]\n| 8 to 12 rashers of [[Smoked|smoked]] streaky [[Bacon|bacon]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Heat the [[Oven|oven]] to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6), [fan [[Oven|oven]] 180\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Halve the [[Peppers|peppers]] lengthwise.  Cut through the stem and try to keep it intact\n| [[Scoop]] out the [[Seeds|seeds]] and membrane and discard them\n| Fold the [[Coriander leaves|coriander leaves]] into the [[Cheese|cheese]]\n| Wrap the [[Bacon|bacon]] around the [[Chilli|chilli]] a couple of times.  Secure with a [[Cocktail stick|cocktail stick]]\n| Place on a [[Baking tray|baking tray]] and [[Roast|roast]] until the [[Bacon|bacon]] is properly cooked\n}}\n===Variations===\nTry this with [[goats cheese]] or [[mascarpone cheese]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Tex-Mex recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Chilli pepper recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Abel and Cole veg box recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n{{Template:Abel and Cole veg box recipes attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#chillipeppersinablanket #roast #bacon #corianderleaves #sweetpotatoes #mascarponecheese #chilli #chili #chicken #sweetcorn #cocktailstick </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Chilli salsa dip",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",

                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Spicy chilli salsa dip recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#chillisalsadip #bbq #tomatoes #springonions #limewedges #smokedpaprika #redonion #salsa #redchillies #chillies #sausages \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A perfect spicy dip for alls meats, especially sausages!\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 245\n|PortionCalories = 40\n|DatePublished=22nd October 2015\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 6\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  15 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime =  5 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Chilli salsa dip recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Not difficult to make.</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Needs more garlic though!</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Caramelised-red-onion-sausages.png|300px|thumb|right|[[Debbie & Andrew's Caramelised Red Onion Pork Sausages]] - perfect for this salsa dip]]\nAndy [[BBQ]]s some key ingredients to add a smoky twist to a [[Mexican]] classic. Chunky, tangy and bursting with flavour, get your guests doing the [[Sausage|sausage]] [[Salsa|salsa]] this summer with this BBQ must-have! Perfect with the sweetness of our [[Caramelised]] [[Red onion|red onion]] [[Sausages]].\n\nThis recipe is reproduced courtesy of [[Debbie&andrew's sausages|debbie&andrew's sausages]]\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 4 ripe [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]]\n| 2 [[Red chillies|red chillies]]\n| 4 [[Spring onions|spring onions]]\n| 1 [[Clove|clove]] [[Garlic, peeled and crushed|garlic, peeled and crushed]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Tomato puree|tomato puree]]\n| Pinch of [[Smoked paprika|smoked paprika]]\n| [[Juice]] of 1 to 2 [[Limes|limes]]\n| Pinch of golden [[Caster Sugar|caster sugar]]\n| Small bunch [[Coriander|coriander]], roughly chopped\n| [[Lime wedges]], to serve\n| [[Salt]] and [[Freshly ground pepper|freshly ground pepper]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Pop your [[Chillies|chillies]], [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]] and [[Spring onions|spring onions]] on the [[BBQ]] for 2-3 minutes for caramelisation and charcoal notes.\n| Chop them as finely as you can and mix well with the remaining ingredients. Stunningly simple!\n}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Latin American recipes]]\n[[Category:Mexican recipes]]\n[[Category:Tex-Mex recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Dips and sauces]]\n[[Category:Marinades dressings and butters]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Chilli pepper recipes]]\n[[Category:Gluten free recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Debbie&andrew's sausage recipes]]\n[[Category:Grilled, griddled or barbecued]]\n[[Category:Uncooked]]\n{{Template:DebbieAndAndrew attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#chillisalsadip #bbq #tomatoes #springonions #limewedges #smokedpaprika #redonion #salsa #redchillies #chillies #sausages </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Chilli vodka",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Chilli vodka recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#chillivodka #vodka #spirits #hand #chillies #lemonjuice #cuminseeds #spices #driedchillies #tomatojuice #tabasco \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=In general I am not keen on spirits but I do like the occasional Bloody Mary. Vodka doesnt have much of a taste, so it is nice to have some to hand\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1000\n|PortionCalories = 1000\n|DatePublished=17th October 2015\n|Author = JuliaBalbilla\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = 500ml\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  5 minutes\n|PrepTime =  5 minutes\n|CookTime = None\n|Image = [[Image:Chilli vodka recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Not for me.</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">3</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Don't see the point of vodka, and even less; the reason to waste nice chillies on it!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Chilli vodka ingredients.jpg|300px|thumb|right|Chilli vodka - the ingredients]]\nIn general I am not keen on [[Spirits|spirits]] but I do like the occasional Bloody Mary.  [[Vodka]] doesn't have much of a taste, so it is nice to have some to [[Hand|hand]] which is already spiced and therefore there is no need to add [[Tabasco]].\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 500ml [[Vodka|vodka]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Fenugreek seeds|fenugreek seeds]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Cumin seeds|cumin seeds]]\n| 1 [[Cinnamon stick|cinnamon stick]]\n| [[Dried chillies]] to taste - I used 5 small ones.  Remember you need to be able to get them back out of the bottle!\n| 3 cardamon pods slightly bruised\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Put all of the [[Spices|spices]] into a clean, sterlised bottle.\n| Top up with [[Vodka|vodka]], leaving a gap at the top to allow room for shaking.\n| Shake the bottle from time to time and it should be ready in two months, or a little less.\n| It will keep for up to one year.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nMake a Bloody Mary with [[Tomato juice|tomato juice]], a little [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]] and [[Celery salt|celery salt]]\n===Chef's notes===\nIt is better to use too many [[chillies]] than too few.  If it ends up too spicy, you can always add more [[Vodka|vodka]] to tone it down a bit\n===Recipe source===\n\n* Based on a recipe by Nigella Lawson\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Drink and beverage recipes]]\n[[Category:Alcoholic beverages]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Chilli pepper recipes]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n[[Category:Uncooked]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#chillivodka #vodka #spirits #hand #chillies #lemonjuice #cuminseeds #spices #driedchillies #tomatojuice #tabasco </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }

cooker]] so the beef breaks down into that lovely tender stringy pieces.\n\nSpicy but not hot.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 450 g [[Stewing steak|stewing steak]] from [[Russell's Butchers of Upwell, anise|star anise]]\n| 2 tablespoon [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Add everything to a large [[Lock and Lock box]], shake really well to mix and leave to [[Marinade|marinade]] for a few hours, or overnight\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Place the marinaded mixture in a bowl that will fit in your [[Pressure cooker|pressure cooker]]\n| ''I have [[modified a cheap saucepan so that it fits inside a pressure cooker]] and is easier to remove than a [[Pyrex bowl]]''\n| Cook in the [[Pressure cooker|pressure cooker]] at high pressure for 1 hour 30 minutes - ''see Chef's notes''.\n| Depressurise normally, this will take about 15 minutes\n| Serve!\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Chinese beef stew marinade mixture.jpg|The saucepan so that it fits inside a pressure cooker|saucepan inside the pressure cooker]]\n===Chef' notes===\nNext time I would cook for only 30 minutes, then depressurise normally.\n</gallery>\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Chinese recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Beef title": "Chinese chicken fried rice",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->{{#seo:\n|title=Chinese chicken fried rice, Chinese recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#rice #chinesechickenfriedrice #chinese #sesameoil #mushrooms #shiitakemushrooms #boiling #springonions #chickenstock #chicken #5spicepowder \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=It's easy to make this Chinese takeaway favourite at home and it will only take 20 minutes of your time!\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1117\n|PortionCalories = 558\n|DatePublished=31st March 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  20 minutes\n|PrepTime =  5 minutes\n|CookTime =  15 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Chinese chicken fried rice recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Fabulous!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">If you think this looks good, you want to taste it!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nIt's easy to make this [[Chinese]] takeaway favourite at home and it will only take 20 minutes of your time!\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 teaspoon [[Sesame oil|sesame oil]]\n| 350 g [[Chicken|chicken]] fillets, cut into thin strips\n| 3 [[Cloves of Garlic, peeled and crushed|cloves of garlic, peeled and crushed]]\n| 2 [[Sweet peppers|sweet peppers]] of any colour, deseeded and thinly sliced\n| 1 teaspoon [[Chinese]] [[5 spice powder]]\n| 2 tablespoons of [[Dark soy sauce|dark soy sauce]]\n| 6 [[Spring onions|spring onions]], trimmed and sliced\n| A few [[mushrooms]], sliced\n| 140 g [[Basmati rice|basmati rice]]\n| 100 ml of [[Chicken stock|chicken stock]] made from &#189; a [[Stock cube|stock cube]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Rinse the [[Rice|rice]] in a [[Sieve|sieve]] under cold running water and allow to drain.\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Cook the [[Rice|rice]] in plenty of [[Boiling|boiling]] water for  the [[Rice|rice]] in plenty of [[Boiling|boiling]] water for 12 to 15 minutes.  Drain and set aside.\n| Heat the [[Sesame oil|sesame oil]] in a large [[Wok|wok]] over a high heat and [[Stir-fry|stir-fry]] until golden [[Brown|brown]], stirring often.\n| Add the [[Peppers|peppers]], [[Garlic|garlic]], [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]] and [[5 spice powder]] and [[Stir-fry|stir-fry]] for 5 minutes.\n| Check that the [[Chicken|chicken]] is properly cooked, add the [[Spring onions|spring onions]], [[Soy sauce|soy sauce]], cooked drained [[Rice|rice]] and the [[Chicken stock|chicken stock]]. \n| Heat for a few minutes, stirring now and then.\n| Serve immediately.\n}}\n===Variations===\nFor a more authentic recipe, use [[shiitake mushrooms]].  You can buy [[Dried|dried]] [[shiitake mushrooms]] from most [[Chinese wholesalers]].  These keep for years and you can just rehydrate what you need, when you need it.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Chinese recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Poultry recipes]]\n[[Category:Stir fried]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#rice #chinesechickenfriedrice #chinese #sesameoil #mushrooms #shiitakemushrooms #boiling #springonions #chickenstock #chicken #5spicepowder </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Chinese style pickled cauliflower",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Chinese style pickled cauliflower recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#cauliflower #blackvinegar #chinesestylepickledcauliflower #pickle #saladspinner #vinegar #spices #teatowel #sterilise #seewoo #frozen \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=An experimental recipe for pickled cauliflower using just Chinkiang black (rice) vinegar\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 125\n|PortionCalories = 11\n|DatePublished=12th May 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Servings: 12 - Makes almost a litre of pickled cauliflower\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime = 1 day\n|PrepTime = 1 day\n|CookTime = None\n|Image = [[Image:Chinese style pickled cauliflower recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Can't find Balck Vinegar?</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">2.55</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Tried everywhere and can't find anything like the price you paid.</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\n{{Template:WorkInProgress}}\nWe were gifted an absolutely massive [[Cauliflower|cauliflower]] recently, most of which was [[Vacuum packed|vacuum packed]] and [[Frozen|frozen]] for later use.  I decided to make a [[Pickle|pickle]] with what was left.\n\nMost of the flavour of a [[Pickle|pickle]] is from the [[Vinegar|vinegar]] plus any additional [[Spices|spices]].  I absolutely love the flavour of Chinkiang [[Black vinegar|black vinegar]], it's so nice you could almost [[Drink|drink]] it.  As I want to retain the flavour of the Chinkiang black rice vinegar and not sully it with any other flavours, I'm using just the vinegar and the [[Cauliflower|cauliflower]].\n\nTo hold all of the pieces of [[cauliflower]] under the vinegar and prevent them from going mouldy, I used an odd piece of sterilised plastic to cover them.  If you are going to do this only use plastic as most metals will corrode in the vinegar.  Some commercial pickles actually come with a plastic disc that performs this function that you might be able to reuse.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 500 g of small [[Cauliflower|cauliflower]] florets trimmed from a cauliflower\n| 2 tablespoons fine [[Salt|salt]]\n| 3 550 ml bottles of Chinkiang [[Black vinegar|black vinegar]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Add the [[Cauliflower|cauliflower]] florets to a bowl and just cover with cold water\n| Leave in a cool place for 24 hours.\n| RInse the florets in cold water and dry, ideally using a [[Salad spinner|salad spinner]]\n| Lay the florets out on a [[Tea towel|tea towel]], ideally in the sun or in a [[Warm place|warm place]] for a few hours\n| [[Sterilise]] a [[Kilner jar]], add the [[Cauliflower|cauliflower]] florets and cover with Chinkiang [[Black vinegar|black vinegar]]\n| Leave for 1 month to mature\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Chinkiang black vinegar.jpg|300px|thumb|right|Chinkiang black vinegar (\u00a31.43 per 550ml [[See Woo]] May 2015)\nImage:Very large cauliflower.jpg|300px|thumb|right|A very large cauliflower!\n</gallery>\n\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Chinese recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Pickles and preserves]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n[[Category:Pickled]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#cauliflower #blackvinegar #chinesestylepickledcauliflower #pickle #saladspinner #vinegar #spices #teatowel #sterilise #seewoo #frozen </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Chip shop cod roe made at home",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Chip shop cod roe made at home recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#codroe #roe #souredcream #chipshopcodroemadeathome #egg #dill #fishcakes #parsley #frying #breadcrumbs #cod \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Fresh cod roe is a seasonal January to March - UK and difficult to buy fresh outside of this period. However, if like me youre a fan of chip shop\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 551\n|PortionCalories = 275\n|DatePublished=7th July 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  20 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime =  10 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Chip shop cod roe made at home recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Tasteier and healthier than the real thing</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\">\n\n<span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I much prefer this to the greasy chip-shop version.  It can be difficult to buy the big cans or roe, but they are out there if you search for them.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\">[[User:TheJudge|The Judge]]</span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Large can of Princes Cod Roe.jpg|300px|thumb|right|I've bought 600g cans of Princes Pressed Cod Roe from Iceland and Bookers (wholesalers)]]\nFresh [[Cod roe|cod roe]] is a seasonal [January to March - UK] and difficult to buy fresh outside of this period.  However, if like me you're a fan of chip shop style [[Cod|cod]] [[Roe|roe]] then you're in luck as almost all [[Fried|fried]] cod roe served in [[Fish|fish]] and chip shops is canned, and very reasonably priced too.\n\nFor greater economy, buy the 600 g can instead of the 200 g tin, cut the roe into 100g slices and [[Freeze|freeze]] the remaining segments for later use.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 200g can Princes [[Pressed cod roe|pressed cod roe]]\n| 2 tablespoons [[Plain flour|plain flour]]\n| 1 [[Egg|egg]], beaten with 1 tablespoon cold water\n| 75g [[Panko]] or dried [[breadcrumbs]] (flavoured with lemon and black pepper, if possible)\n| [[Olive oil]], for [[Frying|frying]]\n| 2 tablespoons of fresh [[Soured cream|soured cream]]\n| Chopped fresh [[Dill|dill]] or [[Parsley|parsley]] (optional)\n| [[Salad]] leaves, to serve\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Carefully remove the [[Cod roe|cod roe]] from the can, in one piece. Slice through the middle horizontally to make two 100 g rounds.\n| Put the [[Flour|flour]] onto a plate and coat each [[Cod roe|cod roe]] round lightly with it, then [[Dip|dip]] into the beaten [[Egg|egg]], making sure they are coated around the sides. Finally, dip into the [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]] to coat completely.\n|  Heat the [[Vegetable oil|vegetable oil]] in a [[Frying pan|frying pan]] and cook the [[Roe|roe]] [[Fish cakes|fish cakes]] for 3 to 4 minutes on each side, turning them over carefully with a [[Fish slice|fish slice]]. Drain on [[Kitchen paper|kitchen paper]].\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe the [[Fish cakes|fish cakes]] with [[Soured cream|soured cream]] and chopped fresh [[Dill|dill]] or [[Parsley|parsley]],  accompanied by a [[Green salad|green salad]].\n===Recipe source===\n\n* http://www.princes.co.uk/recipes/princes-[[Cod|cod]]-[[Roe|roe]]-fishcakes\n===Variations===\nIf you have access to a [[Smoker|smoker]], these are really good if the [[Cod roe|cod roe]] is [[Smoked|smoked]] for an hour or so before [[Frying|frying]].\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Sea fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#codroe #roe #souredcream #chipshopcodroemadeathome #egg #dill #fishcakes #parsley #frying #breadcrumbs #cod </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }

Then serve it with [[Chips|chips]] from your favourite chip shop.\n\nIf you have a willing victim (''partner'') then you can probably get them collected directly from the chip shop and serve them straight to the plate.\n\nIf not then we find keeping them wrapped in a warm [[Oven|oven]], then refresh by heating in an [[Air Fryer]] for 10 minutes or by [[Stir-frying|stir-frying]] in a very hot [[Wok|wok]] for a minute or two.\n\nHowever you cook homemade [[Chips|chips]], you can;t beat chips from a good [[Fish|fish]] and chip shop.\n\n===Ingredients===\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1 large bag of chips from the chip shop\n| A pinch of [[salt]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Add the chips to the air-fryer\n| Add a pinch of [[salt]]\n| Shake well to distribute evenly\n| Cook for 5 to 10 minutes\n}}\n\n\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Cookery cheats]]\n[[Category:Deep fried]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#chips #filletsteak #airfryer #wok #unusualrecipes #sausages #chipshopfridayagreatrecipeidea #fish </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Chocolate and marshmallow wedges a British recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#chocolate #butter #marshmallows #chocolateandmarshmallowwedges #orangejuice #cocoapowder #eggyolks #strained #fridge #clingfilm #vanillaextract \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A chocolate cake marbled with pink and white marshmallows\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}}\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 3174\n|PortionCalories = 317\n|DatePublished=6th April 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Servings: 10 - 1 x 20cm cake\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  30 minutes\n|PrepTime =  25 minutes\n|CookTime =  5 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Chocolate and marshmallow wedges recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Very sweet</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Can't eatr too much of this in one sitting!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nA [[Chocolate|chocolate]] [[Cake|cake]] marbled with pink and white [[Marshmallows|marshmallows]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 350g Green & Black's dark [[Chocolate|chocolate]], broken into small pieces\n| 250g [[Butter|butter]]\n| 1&frac12; tablespoons water\n| 1&frac12; tablespoons [[Caster Sugar|caster sugar]]\n| 1&frac12; teaspoons [[Vanilla extract|vanilla extract]]\n| 1&frac12; tablespoons [[Orange juice|orange juice]]\n| 3 medium [[Egg yolks|egg yolks]], whisked lightly and [[Strained|strained]]\n| 125g digestive biscuits, one half crushed and one half roughly chopped\n| 175g pink and white [[Marshmallows|marshmallows]], cut into halves and quarters\n| 1 tablespoon [[Cocoa powder|cocoa powder]] mixed with 1 tablespoon [[Chocolate|chocolate]] powder\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Melt the [[Chocolate|chocolate]] with the [[Butter|butter]], water and [[Sugar|sugar]] in a mixing bowl set over a pan of hot water taken of the heat.\n| Stir until smooth, then remove the bowl from the heat and leave to cool a little.\n| Lightly whisk in the [[Vanilla|vanilla]] and [[Orange juice|orange juice]], followed by the [[Egg yolks|egg yolks]].\n| Mix the digestive biscuits with the [[Chocolate|chocolate]] mixture, followed by the [[Marshmallows|marshmallows]].\n| Pour into a lightly [[Butter|butter]] 20cm round tin, lined with [[Greaseproof paper|greaseproof paper]].\n| If necessary, press the mixture down and level off with a palette knife.\n| Cover with [[Cling film|cling film]] and [[Refrigerate|refrigerate]] overnight.\n| Turn out onto a plate and dust the top with the [[Cocoa powder|cocoa powder]] mixture.\n| Cut into [[Wedges|wedges]] while still chilled and keep in the [[Fridge|fridge]] until required.\n}}\n===Recipe source===\n\n* From '''Simple Home Baking''' by ''Carol Pastor''\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Uncooked]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#chocolate #butter #marshmallows #chocolateandmarshmallowwedges #orangejuice #cocoapowder #eggyolks #strained #fridge #clingfilm #vanillaextract </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Chorizo, puy lentils and herby roast squash",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Chorizo, puy lentils and herby roast squash a British recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#squash #oliveoil #chorizopuylentilsandherbyroastsquash #parsley #garlic #lentils #onions #thymeleaves #spray #herbs #chorizosausage \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This is a variation on a recipe found on a supermarket recipe card, modified to match what was knocking about at the time - very nice it was too\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1188\n|PortionCalories = 594\n|DatePublished=17th January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = 2 to 3 people\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 45 minutes\n |PrepTime = 15 minutes\n |CookTime = 30 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Chorizo, puy lentils and herby roast squash recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Delicous</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Don't know about supermarket card - this was Michelin star stuff!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Sue_spins|Susie]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis is a variation on a recipe found on a supermarket recipe card, modified to match what was knocking about at the time - very nice it was too.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1 small [[Squash|squash]], peeled and cut into bite-sized pieces - any small [[squash]] or [[Pumpkin|pumpkin]] would be fine.\n| &#189; tablespoon fresh [[Rosemary leaves|rosemary leaves]], chopped\n| Pinch of fresh [[Thyme leaves|thyme leaves]]\n| 1 tablespoon freshly chopped [[Parsley|parsley]]\n| [[Olive oil]]\n| 250 g [[Puy lentils|puy lentils]], rinsed\n| 1 [[Onion|onion]], peeled and chopped\n| 3 Cloves of [[Garlic|garlic]], peeled and crushed\n| 1 sliced [[Red pepper|red pepper]], de-seeded, pith removed\n| 150 g [[Chorizo sausage|chorizo sausage]], skin peeled and the [[Sausage|sausage]] cut into bite-sized chunks\n| 1 tablespoon [[Dijon Mustard|dijon mustard]]\n| 100 ml [[Single cream|single cream]]\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6), [fan oven 180\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Toss the [[Squash|squash]] chunks in a little [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and arrange on a [[Roasting tray|roasting tray]]. Sprinkle with the [[Rosemary|rosemary]] and [[Thyme leaves|thyme leaves]]. Alternatively, use an [[Oil|oil]] [[Spray|spray]].\n| [[Bake]] for 20 to 30 minutes until softened.\n| [[Boil]] the [[Lentils|lentils]] for 15 to 20 minutes or until tender.\n| Heat a few tablespoons of [[Olive oil|olive oil]] in a [[Wok|wok]] or [[Frying pan|frying pan]] and gently saut\u00e9 the [[Onions|onions]], [[Garlic|garlic]], [[Peppers|peppers]] and [[Chorizo|chorizo]] chunks for 5 minutes.\n| Mix the [[Mustard|mustard]] in with the [[Cream|cream]] and pour into the pan and heat to a [[Simmer|simmer]].\n| Add the [[Lentils|lentils]] and [[Squash|squash]], season with [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]], dress with the [[Parsley|parsley]] and serve immediately.\n}}\n===Variations===\nUse any seasonal [[Herbs|herbs]] to flavour the [[Roasting|roasting]] [[Squash|squash]].\n\nUse an [[Roast butternut squash (Air fryer recipe)|Air fryer to roast the butternut squash]].\n\nAs an alternative, sliced [[Meats|meats]] would be nice, but you probably want to add those at the last minute rather than [[Fry|fry]] the with the [[Onions|onions]].\n===Chef's notes===\nFollow the [[RSPCA Think Pig Checklist]] to make sure that your [[Pork|pork]] has come from pigs that have been reared to higher welfare standards.\n* http://bit.ly/rspcathinkpig\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Grain and bean recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n[[Category:Squash recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#squash #oliveoil #chorizopuylentilsandherbyroastsquash #parsley #garlic #lentils #onions #thymeleaves #spray #herbs #chorizosausage </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Chorizo and mozzarella stuffed peppers",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Chorizo and mozzarella stuffed peppers\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#peppers #stuffing #chorizoandmozzarellastuffedpeppers #mozzarella #chorizo #bake #diced #chives #chive #cheese #chips\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=Baked sweet peppers stuffed with chorizo, mozzarella, herbs and breadcrumbs\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=24th October 2021\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  3 hours, 40 minutes\n|PrepTime =  2 hours, 20 minutes\n|CookTime =  1 hour, 20 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 433\n|PortionCalories = 108\n|Image = [[Image:Chorizo and mozzarella stuffed peppers recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">What an odd combination!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.2</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">It works, I have to say  that!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:NonLoggedInUser|NonLoggedInUser]] </span></span>\n}}\nWe had lots of [[Peppers|peppers]] left over from a large bag of 'wonky peppers' and as we always have [[Frozen|frozen]] [[Diced|diced]] [[Chorizo|chorizo]] and frozen [[Mozzarella|mozzarella]]; I thought I would make stuffed peppers.  I used [[Panko]] [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]] and [[Fresh herbs|fresh herbs]], but a few tablespoons of [[Stuffing|stuffing]] would work just as well.\n\nBe careful how much you make up as there's not much room in small [[Peppers|peppers]], large ones would be better on reflection.\n\nWe've done this for two people, but I imagine we will eat all of the cheesy, meaty stuffing but we won't eat all of the [[Peppers|peppers]], our [[Chickens|chickens]] can have what we don't eat!\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 4 [[Sweet peppers|sweet peppers]] sliced in half, lengthways\n| Try to retain some of the [[Pepper|pepper]] around the stalk area or you [[Stuffing|stuffing]] will leak out\n| 400g pack of Morrison's [[Diced|diced]] [[Chorizo|chorizo]]\n| 1 [[Mozzarella|mozzarella]] ball, torn into shreds\n| 50g [[Grated|grated]] or sliced [[Gruyere|gruyere]], or [[Cheese|cheese]] of your choosing\n| A huge good handful of freshly chopped [[Herbs|herbs]]; [[Parsley|parsley]], [[Thyme|thyme]], [[Sage|sage]], [[Chives|chives]], [[Chive|chive]] flowers\n| A tablespoon of [[Cornmeal|cornmeal]] to absorb some of the [[Fat|fat]]\n| A pinch of [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 220\u00b0 C (425\u00b0 F - gas 7)\n* Squeezed and drain the mozzarella in a [[Sieve|sieve]] for an hour or two.  If you don't do this, the mixture will be too wet.\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Mix all of the [[Stuffing|stuffing]] ingredients together in a large bowl, mixing really well\n| [[Spray]] the base of your [[Baking tray|baking tray]] with [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| Stuff the halved [[Peppers|peppers]] with the mixture\n| Place the [[Peppers|peppers]] on the greased tray\n| Cover with [[Tin-foil|tin-foil]] and [[Bake|bake]] for 1 hour\n| Remove the [[Tin-foil|tin-foil]] and [[Bake|bake]] for a further 20 minutes\n| I initially cooked these at a lower temperature and they were a little undercooked so I added some [[Marmite]] stock for the last hour and increased the heat to 220 for the final hour\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Chorizo and mozzarella stuffed peppers cooked.jpg|Cooked; after a little marmite stock was added for the last hour to steam and assist final cooking\nImage:MorrisonsDicedChorizo.jpg|Morrisons's Diced Chorizo [https://groceries.store.morrisons.com/products/104514145/details buy here]\n</gallery>\n\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Garlic|garlic]] flavoured  [[Air fried|air fried]] [[Chips|chips]]\n===Variations===\nJust one half per person would make a nice [[Accompaniment|accompaniment]] to any meal.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Chilli pepper recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#peppers #stuffing #chorizoandmozzarellastuffedpeppers #mozzarella #chorizo #bake #diced #chives #chive #cheese #chips</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }

                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Chorizo and prawn curry\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#kingprawns #defrosted #peas #airfriedbutternutsquash #chorizoandprawncurry #slowcooker #coconutmilk #chorizo #frozen #meatrecipes #frozenpeas\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=This is really an aide-m\u00e9moire to myself; I made this recently and it was excellent\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=20th October 2021\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Served with [[air fried butternut squash]] and naan breads\n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  3 hours, 5 minutes\n|PrepTime =  5 minutes\n|CookTime =  3 hours\n|TotalCalories = 2946\n|PortionCalories = 1473\n|Image = [[Image:Chorizo and prawn curry recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Your looks disgusting</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">My attempt at this looked much better and tasted like a bought curry \ud83d\udc73</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis is really an aide-m\u00e9moire to myself; I made this recently and it was excellent.\n\nI already make [[Curry Sauce 6 litres|curry sauce]] to an almost industrial scale and freeze the sauces in two-person quantities.  A few simple additions have brought this simple curry top another level.\n\nWe always have [[Frozen|frozen]] [[Chorizo|chorizo]], [[Peas|peas]] and [[King prawns|king prawns]], so this is such an easy recipe.\n\nI generally do this in the [[Slow Cooker|slow cooker]] as it's so easy that way - just [[Chuck|chuck]] everything in and stir it now and then.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 portion of [[Curry sauce|curry sauce]] - [[Defrosted|defrosted]]\n| 1 pack of [[Chorizo|chorizo]] slices or diced chorizo pieces\n| &#189; can of [[Coconut Milk|coconut milk]]\n| 1 [[Cup|cup]] of [[Frozen peas|frozen peas]], [[Defrosted|defrosted]]\n| 1 small [[Onion|onion]], finely chopped\n| 12 [[King prawns|king prawns]], [[Defrosted|defrosted]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Add everything except for the [[Peas|peas]] and the [[King prawns|king prawns]] to your [[Slow Cooker|slow cooker]]\n| Cook on high for 2 to 3 hours\n| Stir now and then if you are able\n| Add the [[King prawns|king prawns]] and [[Peas|peas]] for the last 10 minutes of cooking\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nMorrisonsSlicedChorizo.jpg|Morrisons's Chorizo Slices [https://groceries.store.morrisons.com/products/104527771/details buy here]\nMorrisonsDicedChorizo.jpg|Morrisons's Diced Chorizo [https://groceries.store.morrisons.com/products/104514145/details buy here]\n</gallery>\n\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with naan breads and a vegetable - [[air fried butternut squash]] was good with this.\n===Chef's notes===\nAs we make this recipe regularly. we [[Freeze|freeze]] the remaining &#189; can of [[Coconut Milk|coconut milk]] for the next time - it freezes really well in a plastic bag.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Indian recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Sea fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Shellfish recipes]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n[[Category:Slow cooked]]\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#kingprawns #defrosted #peas #airfriedbutternutsquash #chorizoandprawncurry #slowcooker #coconutmilk #chorizo #frozen #meatrecipes #frozenpeas</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Chorizo meatballs in tomato sauce with bubble and squeak and asparagus",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Chorizo meatballs in tomato sauce with bubble and squeak and asparagus\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#oliveoil #chorizomeatballsintomatosaucewithbubbleandsqueakandasparagus #onions #potatoes #cabbage #asparagus #passata #sauce #bubbleandsqueak #mixedherbs #simmer \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This was a fantastic meal and so economical - 6 sausages made meatballs for four people!\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=10th April 2017\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  1 hour\n|PrepTime =  25 minutes\n|CookTime =  35 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 6060\n|PortionCalories = 3030\n|Image = [[Image:Chorizo meatballs in tomato sauce with bubble and squeak and asparagus recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Arty-farty!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.6</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Nice picture, though I say so myself \ud83d\ude01</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry, aka Chef]])</span></span>\n}}\nThis was a fantastic meal and so economical - 6 [[Sausages|sausages]] made [[Meatballs|meatballs]] for four people!\n\nWe also had the luxury of catching our home grown [[Asparagus|asparagus]] tips before   they went to [[Seed|seed]].\n\nThis is a great recipe to use as an inspiration for an idea of your own.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 2 tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]] \n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 1 500g packet of [[Passata|passata]] - a can of chopped [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]] would work\n| 2 white [[Onions|onions]], peeled and chopped\n| 4 [[Cloves of garlic|cloves of garlic]], peeled and chopped\n| A handful of freshly chopped [[Herbs|herbs]] or half a teaspoon of [[Dried mixed herbs|dried mixed herbs]]\n| 18 meatballs [[Meatballs from sausages|meatballs made from sausages]]\n| 2 portions of [[Bubble and squeak|bubble and squeak]] made from 3 large [[Potatoes|potatoes]] and a quarter of a white [[Cabbage|cabbage]]\n| 4 [[Asparagus spears|asparagus spears]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 190\u00b0 C (375\u00b0 F - gas 5), [fan oven 170\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Make up the  [[Bubble and squeak|bubble and squeak]] from cooked [[Potatoes|potatoes]] and white [[Cabbage|cabbage]] and shape into circles with an [[Egg|egg]] ring or by [[Hand|hand]]. I also added a tablespoon of mustard seeds and a little onion as well.\n| Place on a greased [[Baking tray|baking tray]] or [[Silicone baking mat|silicone baking mat]] and [[Bake|bake]] for 35 minutes - a dribble of [[Olive oil|olive oil]] on the top helps to [[Brown|brown]] the top.\n| Add 2 tablespoons of [[Olive oil|olive oil]] to a [[Frying pan|frying pan]] together with a good pinch of [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n| [[Saute]] the [[Onions|onions]] for 4 minutes then add the chopped [[Garlic|garlic]] and cook for a further 3 minutes, add the [[Passata|passata]], [[Mixed herbs|mixed herbs]] and optionally, a splash of [[Red wine|red wine]].\n| If the meatballs are made from raw sausages, add them now, if they are already cooked, pop them in the sauce for the last ten minutes. \n| [[Simmer]] for 30 minutes on a low heat, stirring now and then.  This will reduce the [[Sauce|sauce]] a little\n| [[Steam]] the [[Asparagus|asparagus]] for 5 minutes and serve\n}}\n===Variations===\nOur [[Tomato sauce for pizza]] would also make a great [[Sauce|sauce]] for this recipe.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#oliveoil #chorizomeatballsintomatosaucewithbubbleandsqueakandasparagus #onions #potatoes #cabbage #asparagus #passata #sauce #bubbleandsqueak #mixedherbs #simmer </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Christmas beer can turkey",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Christmas beer can turkey recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#turkey #christmasbeercanturkey #foil #smeg_opera_cooker #frozen #ovens #unusualrecipes #steam #fat #defrosted \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=We used our Grillpro Stainless Steel Chicken Roaster to cook this year's Christmas turkey (with a Tex-Mex rub)\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 13440\n|PortionCalories = 1680\n|DatePublished=13th November 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = A 5.6 kg beer can turkey\n |Servings = Serves 8\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 3 hours 45 minutes\n |PrepTime = 15 minutes\n |CookTime = 3 hours 30 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Beer can turkey recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">A memorable Christmas special</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Had this every Christmas for 7 years.  Unfortunately our new oven is not big enough to do this anymore.  Shame :(</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nWe used our [[Grillpro Stainless Steel Chicken Roaster]] to cook this year's Christmas [[Turkey|turkey]] (with a [[Tex-Mex]] rub).  This is really just a personal aide-memoir, so we can create the same delicious meal again next year!\n\nFor the [[Tex-Mex]] rub and [[Beer-can chicken|beer-can chicken]] recipe, follow the [[Beer-can chicken|original]].\n\nWe had a 5.6 kg Bernard Matthews ([[Frozen|frozen]]) [[Turkey|turkey]].  Fully [[defrosted]].\n\nWe used the small oven of our [[Smeg_Opera_cooker|Smeg Opera cooker]], the contraptions that supper the oven shelves were removed to make available space wider.\n\nRemove any giblets, cut off and discard the [[Parson's nose]].\n\nIt was cooked for 3 hours, 10 minutes at 190\u00b0 C (375\u00b0 F - gas 5) then rested for 30 minutes in the same [[Oven|oven]], with the heat switched off.  Bottom heat *only* was finally used as the [[Ovens|ovens]] top heating element was too close to the top of the bird.\n\nThe [[Grillpro Stainless Steel Chicken Roaster]] was placed in a tray that was kept 1/2 filled with water to prevent burning of the [[Fat|fat]] that dripped and the top of the bird had a 'hat' of [[Tin-foil|tin-foil]].\n\nThe [[Oven|oven]] needed opening every 20 minutes of so, just to release the excess [[Steam|steam]].\n\nThe [[turkey]] was sublime.  We did not have to carve the [[Turkey|turkey]], honestly, I just placed it very heavily on the chopping board and it fell apart, yet the skin was still crispy as you can see. Even my, almost lifetime vegetarian mother was tempted into a lapse.\n===Big bird===\nThis year we had an even larger bird, 6.5kg.  At first it looked as though it would never fir in the oven, however after it was fully de-frosted and a little more of the protruding neck bone was removed, it fitted in - just.  Surprisingly it only needed an extra 20 minutes over a bird 1 kg lighter.  It was sublime.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 5.6 kg whole turkey - fully de-frosted\n| 1 [[Grillpro Stainless Steel Chicken Roaster]]\n| [[Tin foil]]\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Beer can turkey crusader.jpg|The caped crusader (2011)\nImage:Beer can turkey garlic.jpg|The garlic element (2011)\nImage:Beer can turkey stuffing.jpg|Beer, stuffing and there's the rub (2011)\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Cooked for 3 hours, 10 minutes at 190\u00b0 C (375\u00b0 F - gas 5)\n| Baste regularly to ensure a crispy skin\n}}\n===Cooking times===\n'''5.6 kg whole [[turkey]] - fully de-frosted'''\n* Wing tips wrapped in [[tin-foil]]\n* A sheet of [[foil]] placed loosely over the top of the bird.\n* Cooked for 3 hours, 10 minutes at 190\u00b0 C (375\u00b0 F - gas 5)\n* Bottom element only to prevent top burning.\n* Rested for 30 minutes (or more) in the same [[Oven|oven]], with the heat switched off.\n'''6.5 kg turkey - fully de-frosted'''\n* Wing tips wrapped in [[tin-foil]]\n* A sheet of [[foil]] placed loosely over the top of the bird.\n* Cooked for 3 hours, 30 minutes at 190\u00b0 C (375\u00b0 F - gas 5)\n* Bottom element only to prevent top burning.\n* Rested for 30 minutes (or more) in the same [[Oven|oven]], with the heat switched off.\n===Cooking without the GrillPro gizmo===\nI've cooked chickens many many times without the gadget without any problems, you just need a method to ensure the bird does not fall over as the flesh cooks and starts to fall away from the bird.  Sitting it upright in a large pan has worked for me before now.\n{{Template:Beercan chicken - See also}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]][[Category:British recipes]][[Category:Main courses]][[Category:Poultry recipes]][[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#turkey #christmasbeercanturkey #foil #smeg_opera_cooker #frozen #ovens #unusualrecipes #steam #fat #defrosted </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Christmas pudding",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Christmas pudding, a fruit recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#christmaspudding #brandy #cherries #stout #fruit #boil #mixedspice #butter #sultanas #bakingpowder #cranberries \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This recipe is based on that of a pudding made in 1714 for George I when he celebrated his first Christmas as King of England\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}}\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 3753\n|PortionCalories = 375\n|DatePublished=2nd April 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = After the first boiling\n |Servings = Servings: 10 - Makes 1 x 2lb pudding\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 1 day, 8 hours, 20 minutes\n |PrepTime = 1 day 20 minutes\n |CookTime = 8 hours\n |Image = [[Image:After first boiling.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Complicated</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">But nicer than buying one!</span> \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\">[[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\n\nThis recipe is based on that of a pudding made in 1714 for George I when he celebrated his first Christmas as King of England.  I used a 5 inch spherical pudding tin to cook it in.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 80g [[Plain flour|plain flour]], sieved with:\n| 0.75 teaspoon [[Baking powder|baking powder]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Mixed spice|mixed spice]]\n| 0.75 teaspoon [[Salt|salt]]\n\nthen:\n\n| 80g [[Ground almonds|ground almonds]]\n| 80g [[Muscovado]] [[Sugar|sugar]]\n| 80g [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]]\n| 120g [[Shredded|shredded]] [[Beef|beef]] or [[Vegetable|vegetable]] [[Suet|suet]]\n| &frac12; [[Nutmeg|nutmeg]], [[Grated|grated]]\n| 130g [[Prunes|prunes]], stoned and chopped\n| 40g dried [[Dates|dates]], stoned and chopped\n| 80g [[Raisins|raisins]]\n| 80g [[Sultanas|sultanas]]\n| 80g [[Currants|currants]]\n| 80g mixed peel\n| 40g glac\u00e9 [[Cherries|cherries]], chopped and rolled in a little [[Flour|flour]] or 40g dried [[cranberries]]\n| 2 [[Eggs|eggs]], thoroughly beaten\n| 100ml [[Stout|stout]]\n| 85ml [[Brandy|brandy]]\n| [[Zest]] of a small [[Lemon|lemon]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Mix the dry ingredients,  [[Fruit|fruit]] and liquids separately, then mix all three together.\n| Leave to stand overnight in a cool place.\n| Add the mixture to a pudding basin, cover with [[Greaseproof paper|greaseproof paper]] and then [[Muslin|muslin]].\n| [[Boil]] in a saucepan on a metal ring for 6 hours, ensuring that the water level is about half way up the side of the basin.\n| On Christmas Day, [[Boil|boil]] for a further 2 hours.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Brandy|brandy]]/[[Rum|rum]] [[Butter|butter]] or [[Sauce|sauce]].\n===Chef's notes===\n*I like to soak the dried [[fruit]] (except for the [[cherries]]) overnight in the [[brandy]] and [[stout]] first.\n*It is easier to chop the glac\u00e9 [[cherries]] with scissors, rather than a knife.\n*Every so often, pierce the pudding with a skewer and feed it with more [[Brandy|brandy]].\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Christmas pudding]]\n[[Category:British recipes|Christmas pudding]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes|Christmas pudding]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts|Christmas pudding]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes|Christmas pudding]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#christmaspudding #brandy #cherries #stout #fruit #boil #mixedspice #butter #sultanas #bakingpowder #cranberries </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

Purple Majesty potatoes are available from branches of '''[http://www.sainsburys.co.uk/sol/index.jsp Sainsbury's].'''\n\n{{FindAlbertBartlett}}\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| &frac12; pack of Purple Majesty [[Potatoes|potatoes]] (about 600g)\n| 800g chopped [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]] (2 cans)\n| 2 tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 2 [[Litres|litres]] /3&frac12; [[Pints|pints]] [[Vegetable Stock|vegetable stock]]\n| 1 Large [[Onion|onion]], peeled and [[Diced|diced]]\n| 2 [[Cloves garlic, peeled and crushed|cloves garlic, peeled and crushed]]\n| 4 [[Carrots|carrots]], peeled and sliced\n| 1 [[Red pepper|red pepper]], washed and [[Diced|diced]]\n| 400g [[Cannellini beans|cannellini beans]], rinsed and drained\n| 1 tablespoon [[Worcestershire sauce|worcestershire sauce]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Sugar|sugar]]\n| 175g / 6oz [[Spinach leaves|spinach leaves]]\n| [[Freshly ground black pepper]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Prepare the Purple Majesty [[Potatoes|potatoes]] by washing and cutting into 1 inch cubes.\n| In a large, non-stick, lidded saucepan, heat the [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and add the [[Diced|diced]] [[Onion|onion]] and [[Garlic|garlic]] and saut\u00e9 over a medium heat for about 5 minutes until starting to soften.\n| Next add the [[Diced|diced]] [[Potato|potato]] and sliced [[Red pepper|red pepper]] and cook with the [[Onions|onions]] and [[Garlic|garlic]] for a further 5 minutes adding a splash of water if too dry.\n| Now add the [[Vegetable Stock|vegetable stock]], tinned [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]], sliced [[Carrot|carrot]], [[Red pepper|red pepper]], drained cannelloni [[Beans|beans]], [[Worcestershire sauce]] and teaspoon of [[Sugar|sugar]].  \n| Cover and cook over a medium heat for 15-20 minutes until the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] are soft but still hold their shape.\n| Finally add lots of [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]], stir through the [[Spinach leaves|spinach leaves]].  \n| They will cook immediately and serve!\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Albert Bartlett recipes]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n[[Category:British
