title": "Cider bread",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Cider bread, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#yeast #dough #ferment #ciderbread #ryeflour #fridge #bake #knead #cheese #bread #breadmaker \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This is based on a recipe in Richard Bertinet's Dough\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}}\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 4404\n|PortionCalories = 440\n|DatePublished=22nd October 2012\n|Author = JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = Servings: 10 - 2 large or 4 small loaves\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime = 3 hours 30 minutes\n|PrepTime = 2 hours 30 minutes\n|CookTime = 1 hour\n|Image = [[Image:Cider bread recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"><span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">A unique recipe</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">And a fabulous picture Julia!</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\">[[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis is based on a recipe in Richard Bertinet's '''[[Dough]]'''\n(ISBN 9781856267625).\n\n'''For the [[Ferment|ferment]]'''\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 5g fresh [[Yeast|yeast]]\n| 175g [[Sparkling mineral water|sparkling mineral water]]\n| 200g [[Strong white bread flour|strong white bread flour]]\n| 50g [[Rye flour|rye flour]]\n| 5g [[Salt|salt]]\n}}\n'''For the [[Dough|dough]]'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 10g fresh [[Yeast|yeast]]\n| 450g [[Dry cider|dry cider]]\n| 150g water\n| 750g [[Strong white bread flour|strong white bread flour]] (I use very strong Canadian flour)\n| 250g [[Rye flour|rye flour]]\n| 20g [[Salt|salt]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Mix the ingredients for the [[Ferment|ferment]], having dissolved the [[Yeast|yeast]] in the water and place in a covered bowl in the [[Fridge|fridge]] overnight.\n| In the morning, remove the [[Ferment|ferment]] from the [[Fridge|fridge]] and bring to room temperature.\n| Dissolve the [[Yeast|yeast]] in the water and mix with the remaining ingredients.\n| [[Knead]] the [[Dough|dough]] in your preferred manner.\n| Shape into a ball and leave in an oiled bowl, covered with [[Clingfilm|clingfilm]] for about an hour.\n| Remove from the bowl, re-shape the [[Dough|dough]] into another ball and return to the bowl for another hour.\n| Divide the [[Dough|dough]] into 2 or 4 and shape as desired.\n| Allow to prove, covered, until ''almost'' doubled in size.\n| Make cuts if desired.\n| [[Bake]] at 230\u00b0 C (450\u00b0 F - gas 8) for 45 minutes, reducing the heat to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6) after 10 minutes.\n| Once [[Baked|baked]], allow to cool on a wire rack.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Cheese|cheese]] and [[Pickles|pickles]].\n===Variations===\nYou can use [[Dried yeast|dried yeast]] if preferred, but reduce the quantity by half of that given for fresh [[Yeast|yeast]].  The mixing, [[Kneading|kneading]] and rising can be done with the aid of a [[Breadmaker|breadmaker]] or [[Food processor|food processor]].\n===Chef's notes===\nMy oven is rather tempermental so check your [[bread]] towards the end of the cooking time.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]][[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#yeast #dough #ferment #ciderbread #ryeflour #fridge #bake #knead #cheese #bread #breadmaker </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }

title": "Classic liver and bacon with onion gravy",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Classic liver and bacon with onion gravy a British recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#liver #plainflour #onions #classicliverandbaconwithoniongravy #bacon #gravybrowning #oliveoil #butter #port #gravy #calves \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This is the classic way to serve liver and bacon\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1273\n|PortionCalories = 636\n|DatePublished=27th August 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  30 minutes\n|PrepTime =  5 minutes\n|CookTime =  25 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Classic liver and bacon with onion gravy recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Just like Mum used to make</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">This is a love it or hate it recipe.  I love it as it reminds me of proper home cooking by my Mum!</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis is the classic way to serve [[Liver and bacon|liver and bacon]].  Quick, easy and very tasty.\n\nA few quick tips: Cook the [[Onions|onions]] really slowly, about 30 minutes to get nice and [[Caramelised|caramelised]].  Cut the [[Liver|liver]] into thin strips and cook it quickly, don't overcook it or it will be like shoe leather.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 150 g of [[Liver|liver]] per person - lambs, [[Calves|calves]] or [[Pigs liver|pigs liver]].\n| [[Olive oil]] for [[Frying|frying]]\n| [[Plain flour]] for coating the [[Liver|liver]]\n| 6 rashers of [[Bacon|bacon]]\n| 2 large [[Onions|onions]]\n| A few [[Cloves of garlic|cloves of garlic]], peeled and sliced - optional\n| 50 g [[Butter|butter]]\n| 245 ml [[Vegetable Stock|vegetable stock]]\n| [[Gravy browning]]\n| 1 tablespoon of [[Plain flour|plain flour]]\n| Splash of [[Port|port]]\n| [[Salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Onions garlic butter gravy.jpg|Gravy with browning added\nImage:Onions garlic cooked.jpg|..after 20 minutes..\nImage:Onions garlic butter.jpg|Onions, garlic, butter and pepper\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Add the [[Butter|butter]] to a pan or [[Wok|wok]] and add a good grind of [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n| Add the [[Onions|onions]] and optional [[Garlic|garlic]] and saut\u00e9 on a low heat for 20 minutes stirring now and then.\n| Add 1 tablespoon of [[Plain flour|plain flour]] and stir in the [[Stock|stock]]\n| Heat and stir until it thickens.  If you wish, add a little [[Gravy browning|gravy browning]] (or [[Soy sauce|soy sauce]]) to colour the [[Gravy|gravy]].\n| Add a splash of [[Port|port]] or [[Sherry|sherry]] and season to taste.\n| [[Grill]] the [[Bacon|bacon]] util it is crispy.\n| Dredge the [[Liver|liver]] strips in a little seasoned [[Flour|flour]] and pan [[Fry|fry]] the liver in a little [[Olive oil|olive oil]] for a minute or so on each side.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Mashed potatoes|mashed potatoes]] and [[peas]] or [[baked beans]]\n===Variations===\nWe have a large variation of [[Gravy|gravy]] recipes and [[Mashed potato|mashed potato]] recipes if you want to try something different.\n==See also==\n* http://www.guardian.co.uk/lifeandstyle/2010/oct/17/nigel-slater-classic-liver-and-bacon-recipe\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Offal recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#liver #plainflour #onions #classicliverandbaconwithoniongravy #bacon #gravybrowning #oliveoil #butter #port #gravy #calves </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Classic scones",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Classic scones, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#butter #classicscones #scones #buttermilk #flour #pastry #foodprocessor #cream #miseenplace #dough #castersugar \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This recipe makes light textured scones which are best eaten warm with butter or cream. They don't keep that well so freeze any excess\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1312\n|PortionCalories = 131\n|DatePublished=4th October 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Servings: 10 - Makes 10 classic [[Scones|scones]]\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 30 minutes\n |PrepTime = 15 minutes\n |CookTime = 15 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Classic scones recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"><span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Lovely when warm..</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">..and served with British butter!</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\">[[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis recipe makes light textured [[Scones|scones]] which are best eaten warm with [[Butter|butter]] or [[Cream|cream]].  They don't keep that well so [[Freeze|freeze]] any excess.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 225g (8oz) [[Self raising flour|self raising flour]]\n| 55g (2oz) [[Butter|butter]] cut into small pieces\n| 25g (1oz) [[Caster sugar|caster sugar]]\n| 150ml (5fl) oz [[Milk|milk]] or [[Buttermilk|buttermilk]]\n| pinch of [[Salt|salt]]\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 220\u00b0 C (425\u00b0 F - gas 7)\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Sift the [[Flour|flour]] into a mixing bowl, add the [[Salt|salt]], [[Butter|butter]] and [[Sugar|sugar]]\n| Rub the [[Butter|butter]] into the [[Flour|flour]] then add the [[Milk|milk]] or [[Buttermilk|buttermilk]] and mix to make a soft [[Dough|dough]].\n| This can also be done in a [[Food processor|food processor]].\n| Tip out onto a floured worktop and [[Kneading bread|knead]] lightly.\n| Roll out to 2 cm (&frac34;\") thick and them cut into rounds with a 5 cm (2\") [[Pastry|pastry]] cutter.\n| [[Brush]] the tops of the [[Scones|scones]] with a little [[Milk|milk]].\n| Place onto a lightly greased [[baking tray]] and [[Bake|bake]] for 12 to 15 minutes or until they have risen and turned golden.\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#butter #classicscones #scones #buttermilk #flour #pastry #foodprocessor #cream #miseenplace #dough #castersugar </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Coconut ice (uncooked)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Coconut ice recipe (uncooked)\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#foodcolouring #condensedmilk #icingsugar #coconut #split #foil #coconuticeuncooked #baking #knead #airtightcontainer #peppermint \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Traditionally, coconut ice is cooked, but here is an easy recipe for an uncooked version.\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=28th January 2017\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 10\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  15 minutes (plus setting overnight)\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes (plus setting overnight)\n|CookTime = None\n|TotalCalories = 1679\n|PortionCalories = 167 \n|Image = [[Image:Coconut ice uncooked recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Nice one</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Even nicer without food colouring</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:NonLoggedInUser|NonLoggedInUser]] </span></span>\n}}\nTraditionally, [[Coconut|coconut]] ice is cooked, but here is an easy recipe for an [[Uncooked|uncooked]] version which is more common these days\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 397g sweetened [[Condensed milk|condensed milk]]\n| 400g [[Icing Sugar|icing sugar]], sifted\n| 320g [[Dessicated coconut|dessicated coconut]]\n| Pink [[Food colouring|food colouring]], optional\n| A few drops [[Vanilla extract|vanilla extract]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Using a wooden spoon, mix together the [[Condensed milk|condensed milk]] and [[Icing Sugar|icing sugar]] in a large bowl. It will get very stiff. Work the [[Coconut|coconut]] into the mix until it's well combined - use your hands, if you like.\n| [[Split]] the mix into two and [[Knead|knead]] a very small amount of [[Food colouring|food colouring]] into one half.\n| Line a 20cm x 25cm receptacle with [[Baking|baking]] [[Parchment|parchment]]\n| Spoon the white half of the mixture into the tin and level. \n| Press pink half on top of the white mixture.\n| Wrap tin in loosely in [[Clingfilm|clingfilm]] or [[Foil|foil]] and leave to set overnight before cutting into squares. \n| These will keep for up to a month at least, if stored in an [[Airtight container|airtight container]].\n}}\n===Variations===\nPlay around with different flavours and colours eg [[Peppermint|peppermint]] / green or [[Lemon|lemon]] / yellow\n===Coconut shredder working in a 10 second video=== \n<YouTube>https://youtu.be/-0Ha0o0Xy5Q</YouTube>\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Uncooked]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#foodcolouring #condensedmilk #icingsugar #coconut #split #foil #coconuticeuncooked #baking #knead #airtightcontainer #peppermint </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }

title": "Cod with mustard and caper vinaigrette (SV)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Cod with mustard and caper vinaigrette a sous vide recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#fish #potatoes #vinaigrette #cod #shallot #gherkin #blowtorch #shallots #groundnutoil #fry #whitewinevinegar \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A simple sous vide recipe\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1974\n|PortionCalories = 493\n|DatePublished=13th November 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  2 hours, 10 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime =  2 hours\n|Image = [[Image:Cod with mustard and caper vinaigrette SV recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">It was ok</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">3</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">A bit of a fiddle for not much result</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Carla_Cancio-Bello,_J.D.,_on_behalf_of_Cuban_Cuisine_UK|Carla]] </span></span>\n}}\nA simple sous vide recipe.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n}}\n'''For the [[Vinaigrette|vinaigrette]]'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 20g [[Shallots|shallots]], peeled and finely sliced\n| 2 teaspoons [[Wholegrain mustard|wholegrain mustard]]\n| 1 teaspoon clear [[Honey|honey]]\n| 2 teaspoons [[Capers|capers]], drained and chopped\n| 1 [[Gherkin|gherkin]], finely sliced\n| 3 tablespoons [[Grapeseed oil|grapeseed oil]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[White wine vinegar|white wine vinegar]]\n| Seasoning\n}}\n'''For the [[Cod|cod]]'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 60g [[Salt|salt]]\n| 1.5 litres cold water\n| 1kg waxy [[Potatoes|potatoes]], peeled and cubed into 1cm pieces\n| 4 [[Cod|cod]] fillets, skin removed\n| 60g [[Unsalted butter|unsalted butter]]\n| Extra [[Salt|salt]]\n| [[Groundnut oil]]\n\n}}\n\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n}}\n'''To make the [[Vinaigrette|vinaigrette]]'''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Place a small saucepan of water over a medium heat\n| Bring to the [[Boil|boil]] and [[Blanch|blanch]] the [[Shallot|shallot]] for 20 seconds\n| Drain and tip into a bowl of iced water.\n| Drain again and pat dry.\n| Combine the remaining ingredients in a bowl.\n| Season and whisk thoroughly.\n| Add the [[Shallot|shallot]] and keep in the [[Fridge|fridge]] until required - it will keep for up to 1 week.\n}}\n'''For the [[Cod|cod]]'''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Preheat the water bath to 84\u00b0C (''183.2\u00b0F)''.\n| Place the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] into a sous vide bag and seal.\n| Add to the bath and cook for 1\u00bd hours.\n| Reduce the temperature to 50\u00b0C, leaving the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] in the bath.\n| Meanwhile put the [[Salt|salt]] and water into a bowl to make a [[Brine|brine]].\n| Add the [[Fish|fish]] fillets and leave for 20 minutes.\n| Rinse, drain and pat dry.\n| Vacuum and seal the [[Fish|fish]] in individual sous vide bags with 15g [[Butter|butter]] in each.\n| Add the [[Fish|fish]] to the water bath and cook for 20 minutes.\n| When the cooking time is up, remove the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] from the bag and dress them with the [[Vinaigrette|vinaigrette]].\n| Heat a film of [[Oil|oil]] in a [[Frying pan|frying pan]] to medium high.\n| Remove the [[Fish|fish]] from the bags and pat dry.\n| Season with [[Salt|salt]].\n| [[Fry]] just one side of each fillet in the pan for 30 seconds until golden.\n| Remove from the pan and serve coloured side up on top of the [[Potatoes|potatoes]].\n}}\n===Recipe source===\n\n* Adapted from a recipe in Heston Blumenthal's ''Heston Blumenthal at Home''\n===Variations===\nAny flaky [[white fish]] will be fine.\n===Chef's notes===\nI used a [[blowtorch]] on the [[fish]] to finish, but I feel that in this instance, pan frying would give a better appearance.\n{{SousVideSeeAlso}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Marinades dressings and butters]]\n[[Category:Fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes]]\n[[Category:Sea fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Sous vide recipes]]\n[[Category:Sous vide cooking]]\n[[Category:Molecular gastronomy recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#fish #potatoes #vinaigrette #cod #shallot #gherkin #blowtorch #shallots #groundnutoil #fry #whitewinevinegar </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Cold pork with mustard",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Cold pork with mustard, Chinese recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#mustard #coldporkwithmustard #foodprocessor #jaggery #springonions #porkloin #lightsoysauce #drysherry #fridge #tinfoil #beansprouts \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A good way of preparing pork for a salad or picnic. It some lovely has Chinese flavours that work very well with mustard\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 3126\n|PortionCalories = 781\n|DatePublished=31st January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|ImageComment = Pork - bronzed and tasty\n|TotalTime = 2 hours 10 minutes\n|PrepTime = 10 minutes + overnight marinade\n|CookTime = 2 hours\n|Image = [[Image:Chinese pork bronzed.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Heavenly Match!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I don't need to say anymore.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Chinese pork marinade.jpg|thumb|right|300px|In the marinade]]\nA good way of preparing pork for a salad or picnic.  It some lovely has Chinese flavours that work very well with mustard\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1 kg (2lb) boned roasting pork ([[Pork loin|loin]] is good)\n| 250 ml (8 fl oz) [[light soy sauce]]\n| 120 ml (4 fl oz) rice wine or [[dry sherry]]\n| 100g (4 oz) brown [[sugar]] or [[jaggery]]\n| 3 large [[spring onions]] (scallions)\n| 1 teaspoon sea [[salt]]\n| 2 tablespoons [[mustard]] powder\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| In a large bowl, or even in a [[food processor]], mix all ingredients together except for the [[mustard]] and pour over the pork\n| Leave to marinate for 12 hours or more, basting and turning often.\n| Line a large [[roasting tin]] with [[tin foil]] and place the pork on a rack in the tray\n| Roast in a preheated oven at 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F)  for 10 minutes and then reduce the heat to 160\u00b0 C (325\u00b0 F) and cook for a further 1 &#190; hours\n| Remove and leave to cool, then chill in the [[fridge]]\n| Mix the [[mustard]] with enough water to make a creamy paste to serve with the pork\n| Slice the pork thinly, arrange on a platter and serve\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\n\nServe chilled with a salad or cold tossed [[beansprouts]]\n===Chef's tip===\n{{Template:ThinkPig}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Pork]]\n[[Category:Oriental cuisine|Pork]]\n[[Category:Chinese recipes|Pork]]\n[[Category:Main courses|Pork]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes|Pork]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes|Pork]]\n[[Category:Salad recipes|Pork]]\n[[Category:Starters|Pork]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Cooking with wine]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#mustard #coldporkwithmustard #foodprocessor #jaggery #springonions #porkloin #lightsoysauce #drysherry #fridge #tinfoil #beansprouts </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Concentrated tomato paste (TM)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Concentrated tomato paste - A Thermomix recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#oliveoil #tomatoes #seeds #tomato #fridge #chinois #sieve #thermomixrecipes \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This has been translated from a Spanish Thermomix recipe by Ernest Capell Navau\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 193\n|PortionCalories = 38\n|DatePublished=20th October 2012\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = Servings: 5 - Makes about 100ml\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 45 minutes\n |PrepTime = 5 minutes\n |CookTime = 40 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Concentrated tomato paste recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Great for our tomato glut</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">And I can use my Thermy \ud83d\ude00</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis has been translated from a Spanish Thermomix recipe by Ernest Capell Navau which can be found at '''[http://www.clubcocinafacil.com/salsas-guarniciones/TOMATE-CONCENTRADO_2293.html ClubCocinaFacil]'''.\n\n{{RecipeIngredientsTM\n| 1kg ripe [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]]\n| 15g [[Sugar|sugar]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Wash the [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]], and cut into quarters or halves depending on size. \n| Place in the '''TM Speed 5-7-10''' progressively for '''15 seconds'''.\n| Rub through a [[Chinois|chinois]] or fine meshed [[Sieve|sieve]] to remove the skin and [[Seeds|seeds]].\n| Return to the TM, with the [[Sugar|sugar]] and [[Olive oil|olive oil]] '''Temp. Varoma / Speed 2 / 40 minutes'''.\n| Allow to cool and keep in the [[Fridge|fridge]] in an [[Air-tight container|airtight container]].\n}}\n===Chef's notes===\nIf you wish to achieve a darker colour, transfer to a small saucepan and reduce for a further 2-3 minutes.  When a recipe calls for [[Tomato|tomato]] pur\u00e9e use 1 part paste to 1 part water.\n\nThe original suggests around 20g [[Sugar|sugar]], but I feel that would make it far too sweet.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Spanish recipes]]\n[[Category:Dips and sauces]]\n[[Category:Marinades dressings and butters]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Thermomix recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#oliveoil #tomatoes #seeds #tomato #fridge #chinois #sieve #thermomixrecipes </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Condensed milk 1 (TM)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Condensed milk a Thermomix recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#fat #thermomix #condensedmilk #refrigerate #boiledorsimmered #desserts #powderedmilk #frozen #granulatedsugar \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=I seem to have a problem with shop bought condensed milk. The problem is not with the product itself\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 459\n|PortionCalories = 459\n|DatePublished=8th February 2016\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = 1\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  10 minutes\n|PrepTime =  3 minutes\n|CookTime =  7 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:The new (2014) Thermomix TM5.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Good bit of research here Julia!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Would not of thought of looking in Polish grocers (or online)</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]] </span></span>\n}}\nI seem to have a problem with shop bought [[Condensed milk|condensed milk]].  The problem isn't with the product itself, but the lengths I have to go to to use it.  My local shop sometimes stocks it, but not always available when wanted.  If I do manage to get it, I often can't open the tin either because I cannot find the tin opener or cannot seem to operate the wretched thing.  The least stressful answer of course is to make your own which is so quick and easy in the [[Thermomix]].\n\nThis particular recipe uses [[Powdered milk|powdered milk]], which should be full-[[Fat|fat]].  Annoyingly, most powdered [[Milk|milk]] in British supermarkets tend to be half-fat or fat-free which will not work so well.  However, you will be able to get it in Polish grocers where it is usually sold in bags.\n{{RecipeIngredientsTM\n| 400g [[Granulated sugar|granulated sugar]] - golden granulated will give a slightly darker colour\n| 220g powdered full-[[Fat|fat]] [[Milk|milk]]\n| A small pinch of [[Salt|salt]]\n| 250g water\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Put all of the ingredients into the bowl in the order given above\n| '''7 minutes / 90\u00b0C / Speed 4'''\n| Scrape the inside of the bowl '''10 seconds / Speed 8'''\n| Immediately transfer to a clean jar or [[Lock & Lock box]]\n| Cover loosely and leave to cool\n| [[Refrigerate]] and use within 2 weeks\n| Alternatively, it can be [[Frozen|frozen]]\n}}\n===Servings===\nServings: 50 - Makes about 800g, the equivalent of 2 standard tins\n===Serving suggestions===\nUse in [[Desserts|desserts]] according to your recipe\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Dips and sauces]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Gluten free recipes]]\n[[Category:Thermomix recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#fat #thermomix #condensedmilk #refrigerate #boiledorsimmered #desserts #powderedmilk #frozen #granulatedsugar </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Cooking dumplings in a slow cooker",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Cooking dumplings in a slow cooker\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#slowcooker #shreddedsuet #dough #cookingdumplingsinaslowcooker #dumplings #soup #beefrecipes #recipes #stew #atora #dry\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=Can you cook dumplings in a Slow slow cooker? Yes, of course you can...\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=22nd February 2023\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  1 hour, 5 minutes\n|PrepTime =  5 minutes\n|CookTime =  1 hour\n|TotalCalories = 1159\n|PortionCalories = 289\n|Image = [[Image:Cooking dumplings in a slow cooker recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">The Lazy-Boy's way</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Good, but nice if they were crispy too</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:NonLoggedInUser|NonLoggedInUser]] </span></span>\n}}\nCan you cook [[Dumplings|dumplings]] in a [[Slow Cooker|slow cooker]]?  Yes, of course you can - it's really easy.\n\nThey'll need to be cooked in a [[Soup|soup]] or [[Stew|stew]]; cook the stew in the [[Slow Cooker|slow cooker]] as you would normally and just add the [[Dumplings|dumplings]] to the stew for the last hours and cook with the lid on.\n\nThey are very nice but they won't be crispy - you'll need to finish then off under the grill if you want crunchy dumplings.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 75 g [[Shredded suet|shredded suet]] ([[Atora]], etc)\n| 150 g [[Self-raising flour|self-raising flour]]\n| &#189; [[Dried mixed herbs|dried mixed herbs]] (optional)\n| 75 g water\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Allow the [[Shredded suet|shredded suet]] to get to room temperature\n| Add the [[Dry|dry]] ingredients to a bowl large enough  to get both you hands in\n| Rub the [[Suet|suet]] into the [[Flour|flour]] with your fingertips\n| [[Kneading]] the [[Dough|dough]] into a soft but not sticky texture, use as much of the water as is needed. You shouldn't need more than 75 g\n| Shape the [[Dough|dough]] into 8 or 9 balls, slightly smaller than a golf ball\n| Add them to you [[Slow Cooker|slow cooker]] when your recipe has about an hour of cooking left\n| Cook in the [[Slow Cooker|slow cooker]] with the lid on for one hour\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Dumplings ready to cook in the slow cooker for one hour.jpg| Ready to cook in the slow cooker for one hour\nImage:Slow cooker dumplings rolled out.jpg| Hand-shaped dumplings, about golf ball size\n</gallery>\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Beef recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n[[Category:Slow cooked]]\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#slowcooker #shreddedsuet #dough #cookingdumplingsinaslowcooker #dumplings #soup #beefrecipes #recipes #stew #atora #dry</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Cooking gammon in a pressure cooker",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=How do you cook gammon in a pressure cooker\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#pressurecooker #gammon #grapefruit #oranges #gammonjoint #cookinggammoninapressurecooker #pressurecookerrecipes #porkrecipes #recipes #meatrecipes #citrusfruits\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=How long to cook gammon in a Pressure pressure cooker. 1 hour!\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=8th March 2022\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 6\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  1 hour, 25 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime =  1 hour, 15 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 4315\n|PortionCalories = 719\n|Image = [[Image:Cooking gammon in a pressure cooker recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Perfection!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">This is now the only way to cook gammon.  Tasty, juicy and simple!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry]] </span></span>\n}}\nHow long does it take to cook [[Gammon|gammon]] in a [[Pressure cooker|pressure cooker]]?\n\nI see lots of differing [[Information|information]] for this; most of it far too complicated.  If you want tasty flavourful [[Gammon|gammon]] that can be 'carved' by pushing a spoon on to it, then the answer is simple: 1 hour at full pressure and allow the [[Pressure cooker|pressure cooker]] to depressurise naturally.\n\nThis simple formula works for most [[Gammon|gammon]] joints between 1kg & 1.8kg; the standard size for rolled gammon.\n\nIf your joint is smaller, cook it for 45 minutes.  That's the answer!\n\nTo add a little extra flavour I've used some [[Citrus fruits|citrus fruits]] and [[Herbs|herbs]].  It was delicious, moist and extremely tasty!\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1.6 kg rolled [[Gammon joint|gammon joint]], rind removed\n| 2 [[Oranges|oranges]]\n| 1 [[Grapefruit|grapefruit]]\n| Big bunch of [[Sage|sage]]\n| Sprig of [[Thyme|thyme]]\n| Good pinch of [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Put the [[Fresh herbs|fresh herbs]] into the [[Cooker|cooker]].\n| Put the pot stand in the [[Pressure cooker|pressure cooker]] and fill with a couple of inches of hot water, so the inner pot is just above the water level.\n| Cut the [[Grapefruit|grapefruit]] into enough slices to line the base of the inner pot.\n| Remove all of the plastic wrapping from the [[Gammon joint|gammon joint]], if applicable.\n| Sit the joint on top of the [[Grapefruit|grapefruit]] slices.\n| Cut the [[Oranges|oranges]] into halves and surround the [[Gammon|gammon]] with them.\n| Sprinkle everything with a good amount of [[Black pepper|black pepper]].\n| Close the [[Pressure cooker|pressure cooker]], bring to full pressure and cook for one hour.\n| Allow to depressurise naturally.\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Bunch_of_herbs_in_pressure_cooker.jpg|Put a big bunch of herbs in the base of the pressure cooker\nImage:Gammon_joint_on_grapefruit_slices.jpg|Sit the gammon joint on slices of grapefruit\nImage:Cooking gammon in a pressure cooker recipe.jpg|Surround the gammon joint with citrus fruit\nImage:Gammon_joint_pressure_cooked_in_one_hour.jpg|Pressure cooked ham cooking for one hour\nImage:The_gammon_falls_apart_after_cooking.jpg|The joint of gammon just falls apart; perfectly cooked\nImage:Pressure_cooked_gammon.jpg|Perfectly cooked in 1 hour, tender and juicy and carved with a spoon!\n</gallery>\n\n===Serving suggestions===\nGreat as a '[[Roast|roast]]' dinner, and fantastic served cold, as a [[Salad|salad]].\n===Variations===\nI noticed that black pepper sprinkled over the gammon joint at the start of cooking remained until the very end.  On that basis, it would be pefectly possible to roll the ham joint in flavourings before cooking which would give you a lovely flavoured outside.  Will try this soon!\n===Chef's notes===\nNote to self: With this amount of water, electric hob setting 9 is fine to bring to pressure without burning the contents. [[Hob]] setting 5 keeps the [[Pressure cooker|pressure cooker]] on full pressure without any [[Steam|steam]] escaping.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Danish recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Pressure cooker recipes]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#pressurecooker #gammon #grapefruit #oranges #gammonjoint #cookinggammoninapressurecooker #pressurecookerrecipes #porkrecipes #recipes #meatrecipes #citrusfruits</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Cooking globe artichokes in a pressure cooker",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",

                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Cooking globe artichokes in a pressure cooker recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#pressurecooker #cookingglobeartichokesinapressurecooker #dips #globeartichokes #garlicmayonnaise #steamer #artichoke #bitter #boiling #unusualrecipes #garlic \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=How to prepare globe artichokes, how long to steam them, what to serve them with and how to eat them\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 300\n|PortionCalories = 150\n|DatePublished=9th April 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Quartered hearts, ready to eat\n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  15 minutes\n|PrepTime =  5 minutes\n|CookTime =  10 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Quartered artichokes.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Yeah, it works!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Not sure why I would bother though. :D</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nThe easiest way to cook [[Globe artichokes|globe artichokes]] is in a [[Pressure cooker|pressure cooker]].  However, not everyone has a [[Pressure cooker|pressure cooker]], so the next best thing is to [[Steam|steam]] them.  It will take twice as long but the results will be the same.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 2 [[Globe artichokes|globe artichokes]]\n| A selection of [[Dips|dips]] to serve, eg:\n| ''[[garlic mayonnaise]]''\n| ''[[Lemon butter for fish|lemon butter]]''\n| ''[[Balsamic vinegar and olive oil dip]]''\n| ''[[Sour cream and chive dip]]''\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Cooking globe artichokes in a pressure cooker recipe.jpg|Remove the hairy centre and you're down to the heart of the choke\nImage:Trim a third of the choke and discard.jpg|Trim a third of the choke and discard\nImage:Globe artichokes peeled.jpg|Peel the stem and trim to 2.5 cm\nImage:Two globe artichokes ready to prepare.jpg|Globe artichokes ready to prepare\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Some suggest trimming the spike from each 'leaf' or 'petal', however, on mine there is not much of a spike and that feels rather unnecessary as there is no culinary benefit in doing this\n| Using a [[Speed peeler|speed peeler]], remove the skin from the stem as it can make the choke [[Bitter|bitter]]\n| Trim the stem to about 2.5 cm (1 \")\n| Remove the top third of the [[Artichoke|artichoke]] and discard\n| Add a squeeze of [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]] over the cut area\n| Fill the [[Pressure cooker|pressure cooker]] to just under the trivet with [[Boiling|boiling]] water\n| Smash a [[Clove|clove]] of unpeeled [[Garlic|garlic]] under the flat of a knife and add to the water\n| If you have the squeezed [[Lemons|lemons]] add these together with the [[Artichokes|artichokes]] to the [[Steamer|steamer]] basket and sit on the trivet\n| Cook for 7 minutes on high pressure and let the [[Cooker|cooker]] depressurise naturally\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe warm or cold with a selection of [[dips]].\n\nYou'll need a large bowl for all of the discarded nibbles.\n\nPull each 'leaf' out, dip and pare the buttery part of the leaf with your teeth and then discard it.\n\nWhen you have nibbled all of the leaves, remove the hairy centre and you are at the heart of the choke. You can scoop this out with a spoon or quarter the 'cup', dip and nibble the quarters.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:French recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#pressurecooker #cookingglobeartichokesinapressurecooker #dips #globeartichokes #garlicmayonnaise #steamer #artichoke #bitter #boiling #unusualrecipes #garlic </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]

title": "Cooking pork shoulder on a barbecue",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Cooking pork shoulder on a barbecue\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#BBQ #barbecue #BBQporkshould #hotlouisianabarbecuemarinade #porkrecipes #barbecuerecipes #bbqpork #instantheatcoals #barbecuedpork #porkjointbarbecue #porkjointbbq #crackling\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=Cooking a large 1kg+ Pork pork shoulder joint on our coal fired barbecue was easy with a bag of instant heat BBQ coals\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=14th June 2023\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 6\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  4 hours, 30 minutes\n|PrepTime =  30 minutes\n|CookTime =  4 hours\n|TotalCalories = 2739\n|PortionCalories = 456 \n|Image = [[Image:Cooking pork shoulder on a barbecue recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">It works, it works!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Just waiting for some more decent weather so I can make this again!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jeremy]] </span></span>\n}}\nI though I would make an attempt at cooking a large 1kg+ [[Pork shoulder|pork shoulder]] joint on our coal fired [[Barbecue|barbecue]] using instant heat bags of barbecue coals.\n\nThe venture was very successful, although next time I will cook the [[Pork shoulder|pork shoulder]] even longer by adding some normal coals before the instant heat coals run out.\n\nA bag of instant heat [[Barbecue|barbecue]] coals last for about two and a half hours before they 'burn out'\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1kg [[Pork shoulder|pork shoulder]], skin on and scored with a hobby [[Knife|knife]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Honey|honey]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Taste Sensation Hot Louisiana Barbecue Marinade Flavouring]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Lime juice|lime juice]]\n| Good pinch of [[Sea Salt|sea salt]]\n| Good pinch of [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 1 bag instant light [[BBQ]] coals\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Remove any butchers twine and unroll the joint\n* Place the joint in a Lock & Lock box, skin-side down\n* Mix the marinade ingredients together and pour over the meat\n* Leave for 5 or 6 hours end ensure the meat is well covered\n* Reserve any spare marinade\n* Light all four corners of the [[Barbecue|barbecue]] coals bag\n* Leave burning for 20 minutes until the flames die down and the coals are white-hot\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Arrange the white hot coals so they  are in a single layer under  the meat\n| Place a second rack about 10cm (4\") above the normal rack so the [[Meat|meat]] is well above the coals\n| Close the venys  on your BBQ to ensure a slow burn\n| Place the pork shoulder on the second rack, skin-side down\n| Cook for 1 hour, then turn the meat over and baste with any remaining marinade\n| Keep turning and basting for as long as the coals are hot\n| We left our first attmept for 3 hours as the BBQ still had plenty of residual heat\n| Remove and serve\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Pork Shoulder on a BBQ47.jpg|Still tender and juicy even after three hours on the BBQ\nImage:Pork Shoulder on a BBQ45.jpg|Rotate and turn the joint regularly to get an even cook \nImage:Pork Shoulder on a BBQ44.jpg|The crackling was lovely\nImage:Pork Shoulder on a BBQ43.jpg|Close the vents on you barbecue so it does not burn too quickly\nImage:Pork Shoulder on a BBQ42.jpg|My rather successful method to raise the joint well above the hot coals\nImage:Pork Shoulder on a BBQ40.jpg|Instant heat BBQ coals make this a very easy way to barbecue\n</gallery>\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:North American recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Barbecue recipes]]\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#BBQ #barbecue #BBQporkshould #hotlouisianabarbecuemarinade #porkrecipes #barbecuerecipes #bbqpork #instantheatcoals #barbecuedpork #porkjointbarbecue #porkjointbbq #crackling</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }

No washing up; well not much. title": "Corned beef fritters",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Corned beef fritters a beef recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#cornedbeeffritters #guinness #bitter #batter #tabascosauce #electricmixer #branstonpickle #bakedbeans #fry #egg #refrigerator \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=These corned beef fritters are really easy to make and even easier if you have an electric mixer\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1547\n|PortionCalories = 386\n|DatePublished=1st April 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|ImageComment = Corned beef fritters with [[home made Branston pickle]]\n|TotalTime = 22 minutes\n|PrepTime = 10 minutes\n|CookTime = 12 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Corned beef fritters recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Breakfast for me!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">The perfect breakfast dish (with Daddies sauce).  But not everyday or my waistline would suffer.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nThese corned beef fritters are really easy to make and even easier if you have an [[electric mixer]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1 tin [[Spam]], cut into 10 mm (1/2\" slices) or thinner\n| [[Oil]] for [[Frying|frying]]\n}}\n\n'''[[Batter]] mix'''\n* 60 g [[Self-raising flour|self-raising flour]]\n* 1 [[Egg|egg]], beaten\n* Splash of [[Guinness]], [[Bitter|bitter]] or if you must, [[Milk|milk]] and water mixed (about 35 to 40 ml of liquid is required)\n* Splash of [[Louisiana hot pepper sauce]] or [[Tabasco sauce]] (to taste)\n* Pinch of [[Salt|salt]]\n* A little plain flour to dust before battering.\n\n\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Add all of the dry [[batter]] ingredients to a bowl, then whisking well, add just enough fluid ([[Guinness]], [[Bitter|bitter]], or the [[Milk|milk]]/water mix) to make a thick batter. Add the egg and mix it in extremely well.\n| Rest the batter in the [[refrigerator]] for 20 minutes if you can\n| Dip each piece of spam in a saucer of plain flour and knock off any excess (this helps the batter mix to stick)\n| Dip each piece of spam in the batter \n| Heat a shallow [[Frying pan|frying pan]] with a little [[Oil|oil]]. When it has just started to smoke, reduce the heat a little and [[Fry|fry]] the fritters a few at a time for 3 minutes a side\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\n\nServe hot with [[Baked beans|baked beans]], [[Chips|chips]] and [[Branston pickle]] or [[OK Sauce]]\n=== Tip ===\n\nTo make it easier to dip the pieces of spam in the batter, use a fork and spear the slice about 1 cm from its end. Have the bowl of batter as close to the frying pan as possible, then dip the Spam and transfer into the hot oil immediately. Slide the fritter off the fork with a knife or other metal implement. '''Do not use your fingers at any point - severe burns can occur!!'''\n\nAlternatively, if you're handy with a pair of chopsticks, you can grip the end of the Spam with them and do the dipping and transferring that way. For me, the only disadvantage of this method is that there is always a 'naked' uncovered bit on the fritter. Forking it is the only way!!!\n\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Cooking with beer]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Beef recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:North American recipes]]\n[[Category:Student recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#cornedbeeffritters #guinness #bitter #batter #tabascosauce #electricmixer #branstonpickle #bakedbeans #fry #egg #refrigerator </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Corned beef hash with eggs",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Corned beef hash with eggs a beef recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#cornedbeefhashwitheggs #fry #nutmeg #butter #eggs #parsley #oliveoil #sweetbellpepper #potato #peppers #boiledpotatoes \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A delicious dish that works as a brunch, snack or a full blown meal\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1975\n|PortionCalories = 493\n|DatePublished=12th December 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime = 45 minutes\n|PrepTime =  25 minutes\n|CookTime =  20 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Corned beef hash with eggs recipe 1.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Classic comfort food</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Nice and easy and really tasty.  A good way to use up left-overs.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Corned beef hash with eggs recipe 2.jpg|thumb|300px|right|OK, It says 4, but we're pigs!]]\nA delicious dish that works as a brunch, snack or a full blown meal.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 2 tablespoons [[Olive oil]]\n| 2 tablespoons [[Butter|butter]]\n| 1 [[Onion|onion]], peeled and finely chopped\n| 1 [[sweet bell pepper]], any colour, deseeded and chopped\n| 2 large [[Boiled potatoes|boiled potatoes]], cubed\n| 350 g (12 oz) can of [[corned beef]]\n| &#188; teaspoon grated [[nutmeg]]\n| &#188; teaspoons [[Paprika powder|paprika powder]]\n| 4 [[free-range eggs]]\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| Chopped [[Parsley|parsley]] to garnish\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Mix the [[Butter|butter]] and [[Oil|oil]] together in a large [[Frying pan|frying pan]] and [[Fry|fry]] the [[Onions|onions]] and [[peppers]] for 5 minutes\n| Cube the corned [[Beef|beef]] and add to a bowl together with the [[Potato|potato]] cubes, [[Paprika|paprika]], ground [[Nutmeg|nutmeg]] and season with [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]\n| Add the mixture to the [[Frying pan|frying pan]] and press down so you have a flat tortilla\n| [[Fry]] for about 5 minutes, shimmying the pan so it can crisp-up without sticking\n| Flip it or turn it over with a spatula and [[Fry|fry]] the other side for 4 minutes\n| With a tablespoon, make 4 depressions in the mixture and break the [[Eggs|eggs]] into the wells you have made\n| Cover the pan and [[Poach|poach]] the [[Eggs|eggs]] until the whites are set, about 4 minutes\n| Garnish with [[Parsley|parsley]] and serve hot\n}}\n==See also==\n* [[Crispy baked potatoes stuffed with corn beef hash]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Beef recipes]]\n[[Category:Egg recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Breakfast recipes]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n[[Category:Poached]]\n[[Category:pan fried]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#cornedbeefhashwitheggs #fry #nutmeg #butter #eggs #parsley #oliveoil #sweetbellpepper #potato #peppers #boiledpotatoes </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Coronation chicken",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Coronation chicken, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#sauce #coronationchicken #wine #whippedcream #cream #chicken #currypowder #lemonjuice #apricot #lemon #bayleaf \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This recipe is the original one which was served to Queen Elizabeth II on her Coronation day\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 3337\n|PortionCalories = 556\n|DatePublished=3rd November 2012\n|Author = JuliaBalbilla\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 6 to 8\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime = 1 hour 25 minutes\n|PrepTime = 15 minutes\n|CookTime = 1 hour 10 minutes \n|Image = [[Image:Coronation chicken recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"><span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Yet another great opportunity to use the Hostess Trolley</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">This recipe needs to be served correctly! \ud83d\ude0a</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\">[[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\n\nThis recipe is the original one which was served to Queen Elizabeth II on her Coronation day.  It was created especially for the occasion by Rosemary Hume and Constance Spry and I have converted the quantities into metric\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 2 young [[Roasting|roasting]] [[Chickens|chickens]], [[Parson's nose|parson's nose removed]].\n| Water and a little [[Wine|wine]] to cover\n| [[Bouquet garni]]\n| [[Salt]]\n| 3-4 [[Peppercorns|peppercorns]]\n}}\n'''For the [[Cream|cream]] of [[Curry|curry]] [[Sauce|sauce]]'''\n* 1 tablespoon [[vegetable oil]]\n* 60g [[Onion|onion]], finely chopped\n* 2 teaspoons [[Curry powder|curry powder]]\n* 1 teaspoon [[Tomato|tomato]] pur\u00e9e\n* 125ml [[Red wine|red wine]]\n* 90ml water\n* 1 [[Bay leaf|bay leaf]]\n* [[Salt]], [[Sugar|sugar]], a touch of [[Pepper|pepper]]\n* A slice or two of [[Lemon|lemon]] and a squeeze of [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]], possibly more\n* 2 tablespoons [[Apricot|apricot]] pur\u00e9e\n* 420ml [[Mayonnaise|mayonnaise]]\n* 3 tablespoons lightly [[Whipped cream|whipped cream]]\n* A little extra [[Whipped cream|whipped cream]]\n\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| [[Poach]] the [[Chickens|chickens]], with the [[Carrot|carrot]], bouquet, [[Salt|salt]] and [[Peppercorns|peppercorns]], in water and a little [[Wine|wine]], enough barely to cover, for about 40 minutes or until tender.\n| Allow to cool in the liquid.\n| Joint the birds, remove the bone with care.\n}}\n'''For the [[Cream|cream]] of [[Curry|curry]] [[Sauce|sauce]].'''\n# Heat the [[Oil|oil]], add [[Onion|onion]], cook gently 3-4 minutes, add [[Curry powder|curry powder]].\n# Cook again 1-2 minutes.\n# Add pur\u00e9e, [[Wine|wine]], water, and [[Bay leaf|bay leaf]].\n# Bring to [[Boil|boil]], add [[Salt|salt]], [[Sugar|sugar]] to taste, [[Pepper|pepper]], and the [[Lemon|lemon]] and [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]].\n# [[Simmer]] with the pan uncovered 5-10 minutes.\n# Strain and cool.\n# Add by [[Degrees|degrees]] to the [[Mayonnaise|mayonnaise]] with the [[Apricot|apricot]] pur\u00e9e to taste.\n# Adjust seasoning, adding a little more [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]] if necessary.\n# Finish with the [[Whipped cream|whipped cream]].\n# Take a small amount of [[Sauce|sauce]] (enough to coat the [[Chicken|chicken]]) and mix with a little extra [[Cream|cream]] and seasoning.\n'''To finish'''\n# Mix the [[Chicken|chicken]] and the [[Sauce|sauce]] together, arrange on a dish, coat with the extra sauce.\n===Serving suggestions===\nFor convenience in serving on the occasion mentioned, the [[Chicken|chicken]] was arranged at one end of an oblong dish, and a [[Rice|rice]] [[Salad|salad]] was arranged at the other.  The rice salad which accompanied the chicken was of carefully cooked rice, cooked [[Peas|peas]]. [[Diced|diced]] raw [[Cucumber|cucumber]], and finely chopped [[Mixed herbs|mixed herbs]], all mixed in a well-seasoned [[French]] dressing.\n===Recipe source===\n* Taken from '''''The Constance Spry Cookery Book''''' by Constance Spry and Rosemary Hume, 1956\n===Variations===\nWhen I made this, I substituted the [[Apricot|apricot]] pur\u00e9e with two handfuls of [[Sultanas|sultanas]].  \n\nAlthough this was originally intended to be a very mild dish, you can make it as spicy as you like, by increasing the quantity of [[Curry powder|curry powder]] or by using a hotter [[Spice|spice]] mix instead.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Chicken coronation]]\n[[Category:British recipes|Chicken coronation]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes|Chicken coronation]]\n[[Category:Main courses|Chicken coronation]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes|Chicken coronation]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes|Chicken coronation]]\n[[Category:Poultry recipes|Chicken coronation]]\n[[Category:Cooking with wine|Chicken coronation]]\n[[Category:Poached]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#sauce #coronationchicken #wine #whippedcream #cream #chicken #currypowder #lemonjuice #apricot #lemon #bayleaf </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Coronation salmon with mango and almonds",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Coronation salmon with mango and almonds a fruit recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#coronationsalmonwithmangoandalmonds #coriander #yogurt #mangochutney #mayonnaise #springonions #salmon #mango #almonds #lemonjuice #salmonfillets \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A small change on the classic chicken version makes this creamy, spicy, cold dish a winner. As it's served cold, it's ideal for preparing in advance\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2954\n|PortionCalories = 738\n|DatePublished=25th October 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime = 1 hour\n|PrepTime = 50 minutes\n|CookTime = 10 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Coronation salmon with mango and almonds recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Fit for a Queen</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">See what I did there? :D</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nA small change on the classic [[chicken]] version makes this creamy, spicy, cold dish a winner.  As it's served cold, it's ideal for preparing in advance.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1 tablespoon [[vegetable oil]]\n| 4 [[salmon fillets]] 500g (1 lb 2 oz) total weight\n| 200 g (7 oz) [[mayonnaise]]\n| 150g (5 oz) natural [[yogurt]]\n| 1&frac12; tablespoon Patek's mild Korma Curry Paste\n| 2 tablespoons [[mango chutney]]\n| 4 [[spring onions]], [[chopped on the diagonal]]\n| 1 [[mango]], peeled and sliced and cut into chunks\n}}\n\n1 small handful of Sultanas\n* 1 small bunch [[coriander]], chopped, a few leaves reserved for garnish\n* Juice of 1 [[lemon]]\n* 25g (1 oz) flaked [[almonds]]\n\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| [[Fry]] the [[salmon]] in the [[oil]] for 6 minutes, turning once\n| Cover the pan and leave for 5 minutes\n| Remove and allow to completely cool\n| In a bowl, add the [[mayonnaise]], [[curry paste]], [[yogurt]] and mix until smooth\n| Fold in the [[mango chutney]], [[spring onions]], [[mango]] pieces, [[coriander]], sultanas and [[lemon juice]] \n| Season to taste\n| Once the [[salmon]] is cold, remove the skin and flake into bite-sized pieces\n| Mix the flakes into the [[sauce]], add the [[almond]] flakes and garnish with with the reserved [[coriander]]\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\n\nServe cold with [[basmati rice]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Salmon]]\n[[Category:Fish recipes|Salmon]]\n[[Category:Main courses|Salmon]]\n[[Category:Salad recipes|Salmon]]\n[[Category:Freshwater fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Sea fish recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#coronationsalmonwithmangoandalmonds #coriander #yogurt #mangochutney #mayonnaise #springonions #salmon #mango #almonds #lemonjuice #salmonfillets </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Cotswold vegetables with cider and garlic sauce",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Cotswold vegetables with cider and garlic sauce British recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#cotswoldvegetableswithciderandgarlicsauce #vegetables #rapeseedoil #garlic #sauce #flour #vegetablestock #cider #boil #onions #vegetable \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This vegetarian dish has been made mainly from ingredients produced in the Cotswolds - the garlic was Spanish and therefore the only non-local\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1782\n|PortionCalories = 445\n|DatePublished=31st October 2012\n|Author = JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = 4 or 8 as an [[accompaniment]]\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 30 minutes<br />Not incl. roasting the garlic\n |PrepTime = 10 minutes\n |CookTime = 20 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Cotswold vegetables with cider and garlic sauce recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"><span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Wow Julia - that's purple!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.8</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Purple headed!</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\">[[User:Chef|Jerry]] </span></span>\n}}\n\nThis [[Vegetarian dish|vegetarian dish]] has been made mainly from ingredients produced in the Cotswolds - the [[Garlic|garlic]] was [[Spanish]] and therefore the only non-local ingredient.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 2 medium [[Onions|onions]], finely chopped\n| 2 tablespoons [[Rapeseed oil|rapeseed oil]]\n| 4 bulbs [[Garlic|garlic]], [[Roasted|roasted]] and flesh squeezed from skin\n| 2 medium [[Carrots|carrots]], [[Diced|diced]]\n| 1 small head of [[Broccoli|broccoli]], broken into florets\n| 1 small purple [[Cauliflower|cauliflower]], broken into florets\n| 8 leaves of cavolo nero (black leaf [[Kale|kale]]), coarsely [[Shredded|shredded]]\n| 560 ml [[Dry cider|dry cider]]\n| 2 further teaspoons [[Rapeseed oil|rapeseed oil]]\n| 2 teaspoons [[Flour|flour]] \n| 280 ml [[Vegetable Stock|vegetable stock]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Using a large saucepan, gently [[Fry|fry]] the [[Onions|onions]] in the [[Oil|oil]] until soft and transparent.\n| Add the [[Vegetables|vegetables]] and cook for a few minutes, stirring constantly.\n| Add enough water to cover, bring to the [[Boil|boil]], and [[Simmer|simmer]] until the [[Vegetable|vegetable]] are cooked.\n| Meanwhile, [[Boil|boil]] the [[Cider|cider]] until it has reduced by half and then add the [[Vegetable Stock|vegetable stock]].\n| Just before the [[Vegetables|vegetables]] are ready, heat the 2 teaspoons [[Rapeseed oil|rapeseed oil]] in a saucepan and stir in the [[Flour|flour]].\n| Allow to cook for a couple of minutes.\n| Gently stir in the [[Cider|cider]] and the [[Stock|stock]] and add the squeezed [[Garlic|garlic]], cooking until the [[Sauce|sauce]] has thickened.\n| Strain the [[Vegetables|vegetables]] and serve with the [[Sauce|sauce]] and a knob of [[Butter|butter]].\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Boiled|boiled]] or [[Mashed potatoes|mashed potatoes]]\n===Variations===\nUse any [[Vegetables|vegetables]] that are in season, including at least one root and one leafy [[Vegetable|vegetable]].  \n\nYou can sprinkle a mixture of [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]], [[Butter|butter]] and finely [[Grated|grated]] [[Cheese|cheese]] on the top and [[Grill|grill]] until [[Brown|brown]].\n\nAnother alternative is to make it as a [[Stew|stew]] with [[Herb|herb]] [[Dumplings|dumplings]].\n===Chef's notes===\nThe rapeseed oil I use is '''[http://www.r-oil.co.uk/ R-Oil]''', which is produced in Lower Swell in the Cotswolds and the dry cider was from Hayles Fruit Farm, near Winchcombe.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Cotswold vegetables with cider and garlic sauce]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments|Cotswold vegetables with cider and garlic sauce]]\n[[Category:Cooking with beer|Cotswold vegetables with cider and garlic sauce]]\n[[Category:British recipes|Cotswold vegetables with cider and garlic sauce]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses|Cotswold vegetables with cider and garlic sauce]]\n[[Category:Stews and casseroles|Cotswold vegetables with cider and garlic sauce]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes|Cotswold vegetables with cider and garlic sauce]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes|Cotswold vegetables with cider and garlic sauce]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#cotswoldvegetableswithciderandgarlicsauce #vegetables #rapeseedoil #garlic #sauce #flour #vegetablestock #cider #boil #onions #vegetable </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Cottage loaf",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Cottage loaf, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#dough #yeast #bread #cottageloaf #flour #baking #clingfilm #knockback #wholemeal #batter #refrigerate \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This recipe is based on one by Elizabeth David in English Bread and Yeast Cookery but I have made it using an overnight sponge\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}}\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1194\n|PortionCalories = 119\n|DatePublished=27th October 2012\n|Author = JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = Servings: 10 - Makes 1 loaf\n |Difficulty = 3\n |TotalTime = 14 hours, 10 minutes\n |PrepTime = 13 hours 30 minutes\n |CookTime = 40 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Cottage loaf recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"><span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">A stunning loaf, Julia</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Looks amazing and tastes fantastic.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\">[[User:Chef|Jerry]] </span></span>\n}}\n\nThis recipe is based on one by Elizabeth David in '''English [[Bread]] and [[Yeast]] [[Cookery]]''' (ISBN 1906502870) but I have made it using an overnight sponge method.  Yes, you will need to start this the evening before!  \n\nAlso please read Chef's Notes below, before attempting to make this [[Bread|bread]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 225ml sparkling water at room temperature\n| 7g fresh [[Yeast|yeast]]\n| 340g [[Strong white bread flour|strong white bread flour]]\n| 110g strong [[Wholemeal|wholemeal]] [[Bread|bread]] [[Flour|flour]]\n| 5g [[Salt|salt]] \n}}\n===Method===\n\n'''The sponge'''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Place the water in a jug and add the [[Yeast|yeast]].\n| Weigh out half quantities of each of the [[Flours|flours]] (170g white and 55g wholemeal) and place in a large bowl.\n| Once the [[Yeast|yeast]] has dissolved, empty the jug into the bowl with the [[Flour|flour]].  Do not add [[Salt|salt]] at this stage!\n| Beat into a thick [[Batter|batter]], preferably using your [[Hand|hand]], but a whisk would be fine.\n| Cover with [[Clingfilm|clingfilm]] and keep at room temperature overnight.  \n}}\n'''The [[Dough|dough]]'''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Mix the remaining [[Flour|flour]] and the [[Salt|salt]] into the sponge to form a fairly stiff, but not too stiff, [[Dough|dough]].\n| Allow to rest, covered for 10 minutes\n| Knead for about 15 minutes or until the [[Dough|dough]] quickly springs back when poked.\n| Form into a ball, place in a lightly oiled bowl, cover with [[Clingfilm|clingfilm]] and allow to prove for about an hour.\n| Knock back and repeat steps 3 and 4.\n}}\n'''Shaping'''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| [[Knock back]] the [[Dough|dough]], weigh it, and break off a piece which is rather under a third of the weight of the whole.\n| Roll each piece into a ball, turning the folds underneath .\n| Leave each piece to rise separately, covering each one with a large upturned bowl, for 45 minutes.  It is better to allow the larger piece to rise on the [[Baking|baking]] tin or stone on which it will be [[Baked|baked]].\n| Carefully flatten the top of the bottom piece and using a sharp knife or [[Grignette|grignette]], cut a 4cm cross in the middle.\n| Flatten the bottom of the topknot and moisten the bottom with some water.\n| Place in the centre of the larger piece of [[Dough|dough]].\n| Using the handle of a wooden spoon, make a hole through the centre of the topknot down into the body of the bottom piece.\n| If you wish to slash the bread, do so at this stage.\n| Cover with a [[Tea towel|tea towel]] and leave to prove for a further 10 minutes.\n}}\n'''[[Baking]]'''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Carefully put the [[Bread|bread]] onto the lowest rack in the [[Oven|oven]] and switch it on now, setting it at 230\u00b0 C (450\u00b0 F - gas 8), [fan oven 210\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour].\n| [[Bake]] for about 30 minutes, then reduce the heat to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6), [fan [[Oven|oven]] 180\u00b0C] for the remaining 10 minutes.\n| Remove from [[Oven|oven]] and allow to cool on a wire rack.\n}}\n===Chef's notes===\nMaking a sponge first encourages the [[Yeast|yeast]] to act vigorously without the hindrance of [[Salt|salt]], which is why the salt is only added at the [[Dough|dough]] stage.\n\nIf you find the sponge [[Fermenting|fermenting]] too rapidly, [[Refrigerate|refrigerate]] whilst you are in bed and first thing in the morning, put it back in the kitchen for a while to come back to room temperature.\n\nThe process of using the end of a wooden spoon to make a hole in the [[Bread|bread]], is known as 'bashing' and is done to join the top and bottom halves of the loaf.\n\nThe reason the [[Oven|oven]] is not switched on until the loaf is in it is that it will have a chance to expand further and recover from its 'bashing'.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]][[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#dough #yeast #bread #cottageloaf #flour #baking #clingfilm #knockback #wholemeal #batter #refrigerate </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Cottage pie",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Cottage pie a beef recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#beef #cottagepie #carrots #tomatoes #squashmash #herbs #cheese #olive #tomato #miseenplace #bake \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Comfort food for a cold winter's evening\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2904\n|PortionCalories = 726\n|DatePublished=20th January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime = 1 hour, 25 minutes\n|PrepTime = 10 minutes\n|CookTime = 1 hour 15 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Classic shepherds pie recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">This is nice</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.32</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Especially on a cold day</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]] </span></span>\n}}\nComfort food for a cold winter's evening.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1 kg [[Squash mash]] (or of course, plain old [[mashed potatos]])\n| 2 tablespoons [[Olive|olive]] oil\n| 1 large [[Onion|onion]], peeled and chopped\n| 2 medium [[Carrots|carrots]], grated\n| 560 g (1&frac14;) lb lean [[Beef|beef]] mince\n| 400 g (14oz) tin [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]]\n| 285 ml (10 fl oz) [[Beef|beef]] stock or from a stock cube\n| 1 [[Bay|bay]] leaf\n| 1 leaves only from 1 sprig of [[Thyme|thyme]]\n| 2 tablespoons of  [[Tomato pur\u00e9e]]\n| [[Salt|salt]] and freshly ground [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the [[oven]] to 190\u00b0 C (375\u00b0  F - Gas 5)\n\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Add the oil to a large pan and fry the [[Onions|onions]] and [[Carrots|carrots]] until the onions are soft - about 4 minutes\n| Add the [[Beef|beef]] mince and fry for a further 4 minutes\n| Add the stock, [[Herbs|herbs]] and [[Tomato|tomato]] puree\n| Bring to the [[Boil|boil]] then reduce heat\n| Simmer for 30 minutes\n| Pour the meat into a casserole dish, top with the [[squash mash]] and [[Bake|bake]] for 30 minutes\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\n\nServe hot with garden [[peas]].\n\n===Variations===\n\nAdd a little grated [[cheese]] and sliced [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]] to the top and crisp under the grill to finish. \n\n==See also==\n* [[Shepherds' pie recipes|other shepherds' pie recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Beef recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pies tarts and flans]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#beef #cottagepie #carrots #tomatoes #squashmash #herbs #cheese #olive #tomato #miseenplace #bake </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
