title": "Courgette 'spaghetti'",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Courgette 'spaghetti' recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#courgette #courgettes #spaghetti #onions #oliveoil #onion #tomatoes #pasta #tomatosauce #stirfry #sieve \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This recipe is based upon Courgette and garlic 'pasta'. Both recipes are an ideal way to use up courgettes. \n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 552\n|PortionCalories = 276\n|DatePublished=29th August 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  20 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime =  10 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Courgette spaghetti recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Simples!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Super simples, even!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Sue_spins|Susie]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Zucchini spaghetti in garlic.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Stir-frying the 'pasta' with leeks and garlic]]\n===[[TL;DR]]===\nA recipe for making [[Pasta|pasta]] from a couple of [[Courgettes|courgettes]]!\n\nThis recipe is based upon [[Courgette]] and [[Garlic|garlic]] '[[Pasta|pasta]]'.  Both recipes are an ideal way to use up [[Courgettes|courgettes]].  They are best when about 15 cm (6 in). At this size they still have a lovely shine - once the surface turns matt they should really be treated as [[Marrows|marrows]].\n\nTo shred the [[Courgette|courgette]] ([[Zucchini|zucchini]]) into '[[Spaghetti|spaghetti]]' I found the [[Oxo Good Grips Julienne peeler]] to be the quickest and simplest way.  With the strips of courgette this thin, they can be cooked in a few minutes.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 medium [[Onion|onion]], peeled and sliced\n| 3 [[Fat|fat]] [[Cloves of Garlic, peeled and crushed|cloves of garlic, peeled and crushed]]\n| 4 tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| big pinch of [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 3 or 4 small [[Courgettes|courgettes]], trimmed (topped and tailed)\n| 1 tablespoon fine [[Salt|salt]]\n| 100g [[Jarlsberg]] cheese or your strong cheese of choice\n| 6 tablespoon of good [[Tomato sauce|tomato sauce]] (I've used some of my [[Tomato sauce for pizza]])\n| [[Salt]] to taste\n| Freshly picked [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]] to garnish ([[Sungold|sungold]])\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Shred the [[Courgettes|courgettes]] into [[Spaghetti|spaghetti]] with the [[Oxo Good Grips Julienne peeler]]\n| To reduce the water content of the [[Courgette|courgette]], add the strips to a [[Sieve|sieve]] with 1 tablespoon fine [[Salt|salt]] and leave to drain while the [[Onions|onions]] cook. \n| Add the [[Olive oil|olive oil]] to a pan or a [[Wok|wok]] together with a big pinch of [[Salt|salt]] and [[Stir fry|stir fry]] the leeds for 3 or 4 minutes\n| Add the [[Crushed garlic|crushed garlic]] and [[Saute|saute]] for no more than a minute, stirring often.\n| Rinse the [[Salted|salted]] [[Courgette|courgette]] [[Spaghetti|spaghetti]] under cold running water and dry in a [[Salad spinner|salad spinner]]\n| Toss the [[Courgette|courgette]] strips into the [[Onions|onions]] and mix well\n| [[Stir fry]] for 3 or 4 minutes - if you like your [[Courgettes|courgettes]] really well cooked, pop a lid on the pan as that helps to [[Steam|steam]] them\n| Heat the [[Tomato sauce|tomato sauce]] and spread on the base of the serving plates -  a few seconds in the [[Microwave|microwave]] is an ideal way to do this\n| MIx the [[Grated|grated]] [[Cheese|cheese]] into the cooked '[[Spaghetti|spaghetti]]' toss really well and serve immediately so the cheese melts on the place\n| Garnish with [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]] and serve\n}}\n===Variations===\nI used a small [[Leek|leek]] instead of an [[Onion|onion]] as we have plenty at this time of year so it's nice to use as much of our garden produce as we can!\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:North American recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Pasta recipes]]\n[[Category:Squash recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n[[Category:Stir fried]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#courgette #courgettes #spaghetti #onions #oliveoil #onion #tomatoes #pasta #tomatosauce #stirfry #sieve </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Courgette and garlic 'pasta'",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Courgette (zucchini) and garlic 'pasta' recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#courgettes #mandoline #cheese #tomatosauce #oliveoil #redonion #parmesancheese #courgette #speedpeeler #freshherbs #stirfry \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Use the seasons glut of courgettes (zucchini) to make a pasta substitute.  It tastes like pasta and is gluten free!\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 263\n|PortionCalories = 131\n|DatePublished=18th August 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  18 minutes\n|PrepTime =  8 minutes\n|CookTime =  10 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Courgette and garlic pasta recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Spiral pasta, that isn't!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Very healthy for you though.</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nAnother great way to use your home-grown [[Courgettes|courgettes]].  Using a [[Mandoline|mandoline]] [[Peeler|peeler]], shave the courgettes into ribbons of [[Pasta|pasta]].  You could use a [[Food processor|food processor]] but the result would not be so aesthetically pleasing.\n\nI've included this in our pasta category, even though it contains no pasta.  It could possible be a gluten free pasta?\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 2 or 3 [[Courgettes|courgettes]], depending upon the size\n| 3 tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| A good pinch of [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 1 [[chile de arbol]]\n| 1 medium sized [[Red onion|red onion]], peeled and very finely chopped\n| 3 [[Cloves of Garlic, peeled and crushed|cloves of garlic, peeled and crushed]]\n| 30 g of [[Parmesan cheese|parmesan cheese]], [[Grated|grated]]\n| 80 g strong [[Cheese|cheese]] of your choice cut into shaving with a [[Speed peeler|speed peeler]]. I've used a nice [[Gruyere|gruyere]]\n| 6 tablespoon of good [[Tomato sauce|tomato sauce]] (I've used some of my [[Tomato sauce for pizza]])\n| A good pinch of [[Fresh herbs|fresh herbs]] to garnish\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Using a [[Speed peeler|speed peeler]] or [[Mandoline|mandoline]], shave the [[Courgettes|courgettes]] into ribbons\n| Add a good pinch of [[Black pepper|black pepper]] and the (whole) chili to the [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and heat in a large [[Frying pan|frying pan]] or [[Wok|wok]].\n| Add the chopped [[Red onion|red onion]] and [[Saute|saute]] for 3 or 4 minutes\n| Stir in the [[Crushed garlic|crushed garlic]] and before it gets a chance to colour, add the [[Courgette|courgette]] ribbons\n| [[Stir fry]] the [[Courgettes|courgettes]], turning often, until they are done to your liking\n| Discard the whole chili and add the shaving of strong [[Cheese|cheese]] to the pan stir well and serve immediately before the cheese melts too much\n| Place the warm [[Tomato sauce|tomato sauce]] on the plates and spoon the [[Courgette|courgette]] mixture over the top\n| Dress with [[Fresh herbs|fresh herbs]] and a good sprinkle of [[Parmesan cheese|parmesan cheese]]\n}}\n===Chef's notes===\nIf you don't have any decent tomato sauce to hand, take a little from a bottle of shop-bought bolognese sauce or similar and freeze the remainder in small portions for future use with similar recipes. \n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Italian recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Gluten free recipes]]\n[[Category:Pasta recipes]]\n[[Category:Squash recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n[[Category:Stir fried]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#courgettes #mandoline #cheese #tomatosauce #oliveoil #redonion #parmesancheese #courgette #speedpeeler #freshherbs #stirfry </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Courgette and Halloumi Falafels",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Courgette and Halloumi Falafels recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#courgette #breadcrumbs #courgetteandhalloumifalafels #grated #salad #chillipowder #egg #lemon #mint #tahini #halloumi \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=These are delicious warm as a starter or as a side with a vegetarian dip and a salad\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 744\n|PortionCalories = 186\n|DatePublished=16th August 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  30 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  15 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Courgette and Halloumi Falafels recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Vegalicious!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Anything with haloumi in it is a winner in my books - a lovely vegetarian dish.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nDelicious warm as a [[Starter|starter]] or a side with [[Abel & Cole's]] [[Spicy Tomato Dip]], or stuff in a [[Pita|pita]] with [[Salad|salad]] and a [[Tahini|tahini]] dressing.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 200g [[Courgette|courgette]], coarsely [[Grated|grated]]\n| 150g [[Halloumi|halloumi]], coarsely [[Grated|grated]]\n| 100g [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]]\n| A large handful fresh [[Mint|mint]], finely chopped\n| 1 [[Lemon|lemon]]\n| A pinch of [[Chilli powder|chilli powder]] or finely chopped fresh [[Chilli|chilli]]\n| 1 [[Egg|egg]], beaten\n| [[Olive]] or [[Sunflower oil|sunflower oil]] for shallow [[Frying|frying]]\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground pepper|freshly ground pepper]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Pop the [[Courgette|courgette]] in a [[Sieve|sieve]] with a pinch of [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]. Give it a squeeze with your hands to remove some of the water from it.\n| Toss the [[Courgette|courgette]] in a bowl and mix with the [[Halloumi|halloumi]], [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]], [[Mint|mint]], [[Zest|zest]] of the [[Lemon|lemon]] and a squeeze of [[Juice|juice]], [[Chilli powder|chilli powder]] and the beaten [[Egg|egg]].\n| The mix should come together to form little falafels. If it's too wet, toss a few more [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]] in. If it's too dry, add a little more [[Grated|grated]] [[Courgette|courgette]].\n| The falafels will [[Fry|fry]] better if you chill the mix first but you can [[Fry|fry]] them straight away, too. Just get a large [[Frying pan|frying pan]] hot, add enough [[Olive oil|olive oil]] to generously coat the pan and cook on all sides till golden.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe in a [[Pita|pita]] with [[Salad|salad]] and a [[Tahini|tahini]] dressing.\n{{SeeAlso-HalloumiRecipes}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Greek recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Chilli pepper recipes]]\n[[Category:Grain and bean recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Abel and Cole veg box recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n{{Template:Abel and Cole veg box recipes attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#courgette #breadcrumbs #courgetteandhalloumifalafels #grated #salad #chillipowder #egg #lemon #mint #tahini #halloumi </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }

title": "Courgette gratin",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Courgette gratin a cheese recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#courgettes #onions #oliveoil #courgettegratin #garlic #cheese #grated #parsley #blackpepper #jarlsbergcheese #scrambledeggs \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A great recipe for your home grown courgettes, though this time of year in the UK (February), they'll have to come from the supermarket. This is\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 910\n|PortionCalories = 227\n|DatePublished=19th February 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime = 1 hour, 10 minutes\n|PrepTime = 40 minutes\n|CookTime = 30 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Courgette gratin recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"><span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">A courgette omelette!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Nice as a hand-held snack!</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\">[[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nA great recipe for your home grown [[Courgettes|courgettes]], though this time of year in the UK (February), they'll have to come from the supermarket.\n\nThis is another great recipe for your [[Ghent night]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1kg (2lb) firm [[Courgettes|courgettes]], skin on, washed and cut into thin rounds or [[Julienned|julienned]].\n| Fine [[Table salt|table salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 4 tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 2 large [[Onions|onions]], peeled and chopped\n| 4 [[Garlic cloves, peeled and crushed|garlic cloves, peeled and crushed]]\n| 3 [[Free range eggs|free range eggs]] plus 1 free-range [[Egg yolk|egg yolk]]\n| 75g of your favourite hard [[Cheese|cheese]]\n| 5 tablespoons cooked [[White rice|white rice]], I prefer [[Basmati rice|basmati rice]] for this as it has a nice flavour\n| 2 tablespoons of freshly chopped [[Parsley|parsley]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Add the [[Courgettes|courgettes]] to a [[Colander|colander]] and shake a few tsp of [[Salt|salt]] evenly over them to extract some of the excess liquid which will spoil the gratin.\n* Leave for 30 minutes then rinse well and, let them drain for few minutes, then gently squeeze any more excess liquid from them. I managed nearly a pint of drained liquid from 1 kg of [[courgettes]]!\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4), [fan [[Oven|oven]] 160\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Heat 1 tablespoon of [[Olive oil|olive oil]] in a [[Wok|wok]] or [[Frying pan|frying pan]]\n| Add a good grind of [[Black pepper|black pepper]] and then saut\u00e9 the onions for 5 minutes until softened, don't [[Brown|brown]] them. Stir in the [[Crushed garlic|crushed garlic]] of the last minute just to cook the roughness from it\n| Reserve the [[Onions|onions]] and [[Garlic|garlic]] to a large mixing bowl and add 2 tablespoons of [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and when nice and hot, saut\u00e9 the [[Courgettes|courgettes]] until softened, about 12 minutes\n| Add all of the [[Eggs|eggs]] to a the mixing bowl holding the [[Onions|onions]] and [[Garlic|garlic]] and beat with a fork\n| Mix in the cooked [[Rice|rice]] into the [[Courgettes|courgettes]] to absorb the [[Oil|oil]], and add to the [[Egg|egg]] mixture together with 50 g of the [[Grated|grated]] [[Cheese|cheese]], [[Onions|onions]] and [[Garlic|garlic]]\n| If the courgettes are very hot, leave them for 15 minutes to cook or you might end up with un-pourable [[scrambled eggs]] when you mix them in.\n| Season with a little [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n| Pour the mixture into a shallow gratin dish and sprinkle with the remaining [[Grated|grated]] [[Cheese|cheese]] and drizzle the last tablespoon of [[Olive oil|olive oil]] over the top\n| [[Bake]] in the middle of the [[Oven|oven]] for 30 minutes\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nAllow to cool a little so it can be served warm and serve, sprinkled with freshly chopped [[Parsley|parsley]].\n===Chef's notes===\nEven after rinsing the courgettes well, there is still a tiny hint of salt in this dish so you won't want to add any extra salt as seasoning.\n\nYou can also use a mixture of, [[Grated|grated]]: ( eg: [[Parmesan cheese]], [[Jarlsberg cheese]], mature [[Cheddar cheese]], [[Gruy\u00e8re cheese]])\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Egg recipes]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Salad recipes]]\n[[Category:Pies tarts and flans]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#courgettes #onions #oliveoil #courgettegratin #garlic #cheese #grated #parsley #blackpepper #jarlsbergcheese #scrambledeggs </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Courgette pasta with almond pesto and rocket",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Courgette pasta with almond pesto and rocket Italian recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#courgettes #lemon #basil #courgettepastawithalmondpestoandrocket #almonds #chilli #juice #zest #pasta #pesto #oliveoil \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A delicious side or starter, ideal for vegetarians, vegans or anyone who wants to make an interesting meal using courgettes as pasta\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 200\n|PortionCalories = 50\n|DatePublished=8th June 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  20 minutes\n|PrepTime =  20 minutes\n|CookTime = None\n|Image = [[Image:Courgette pasta with almond pesto and rocket recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Vegalicious \ud83e\udd17</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">No wonder it's only 50 calories a serving!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nA delicious side or [[Starter|starter]], ideal for vegetarians, vegans or anyone who wants to make an interesting meal using [[Courgettes|courgettes]] as [[Pasta|pasta]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 2 [[Courgettes|courgettes]] - select the straightest ones you can find\n| 1 [[Lemon|lemon]], [[Juice|juice]] and [[Zest|zest]]\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground pepper|freshly ground pepper]]\n| 20 g [[Almonds|almonds]]\n| 2 large handfuls of fresh [[Basil|basil]]\n| A pinch of red or yellow [[Chilli|chilli]], finely chopped (more or less, to taste)\n| A good few glugs of [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 2 large handfuls of fresh [[Rocket|rocket]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Trim the woody tops off the [[Courgettes|courgettes]]. Using a large, sharp knife, cut the [[Courgette|courgette]] lengthwise into long, thin panels. Cut each panel into thin [[Pasta|pasta]]-like ribbons.\n| Toss in a bowl with a pinch of [[Salt|salt]], the [[Zest|zest]] from the [[Lemon|lemon]] and a good squeeze of [[Juice|juice]].\n| Place the [[Almonds|almonds]], [[Basil|basil]], [[Chilli|chilli]] and a good pinch of [[Salt|salt]] in a [[Food processor|food processor]] (or you can pound in a [[Pestle and mortar|pestle and mortar]]). Pulse or pound until it starts to come together. Add a good squeeze of [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]] and then trickle in enough [[Oil|oil]] until to bring everything together nicely. Taste. Adjust seasoning or balance of [[Basil|basil]], [[Nuts|nuts]], [[Lemon|lemon]] and [[Oil|oil]].\n| Dollop a good spoonful or two of the [[Pesto|pesto]] in with your [[Courgettes|courgettes]]. Gently mix it with your hands, until the [[Courgettes|courgettes]] have a nice [[Pesto|pesto]] coating. Toss the [[Rocket leaves|rocket leaves]] in. Gently mix through. Finish with a drizzle of [[Olive oil|olive oil]], a squeeze of [[Lemon|lemon]], a few fresh [[Basil leaves|basil leaves]] and some chopped [[Almonds|almonds]]. Eat straight away or tote along to a picnic.\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Italian recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Abel and Cole veg box recipes]]\n[[Category:Uncooked]]\n{{Template:Abel and Cole veg box recipes attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#courgettes #lemon #basil #courgettepastawithalmondpestoandrocket #almonds #chilli #juice #zest #pasta #pesto #oliveoil </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Crab, prawns, dill with pasta in a creamy sauce",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Crab, prawns, dill with pasta in a creamy sauce\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#sauce #freshpasta #butter #pasta #tomatoes #dill #crabmeat #crabprawnsdillwithpastainacreamysauce #prawns #blackpepper #salted \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Make this really simple, quick and delicious recipe - it is great if you can make your own pasta. If not then use about 200g of ready-made Fresh fresh pasta...\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=26th April 2017\n|Author=Chef|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  15 minutes\n|PrepTime =  5 minutes\n|CookTime =  10 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 2227\n|PortionCalories = 1113\n|Image = [[Image:Crab, prawns, dill with pasta in a creamy sauce recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Delicous!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">\u2026and very easy to make.</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The&nbsp;Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:home-made fresh pasta.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Homemade [[Fresh pasta]]]]\nMake this really simple, quick and delicious meal - it's great if you can make your own [[Pasta|pasta]].  If not then use about 200g of ready-made [[Fresh pasta|fresh pasta]]. All supermarkets now stock fresh pasta, usually in the chiller.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 200g of  [[Fresh pasta]] - homemade, rolled out and cut into rustic strips\n| 1 medium [[Onion|onion]], finely chopped\n| 1 teaspoon [[Butter|butter]]\n| A pinch of [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n| A big bunch of fresh [[Dill|dill]]\n| 300ml tub of cr\u00e8me fra\u00eeche\n| 114g fresh premium claw [[Crabmeat|crabmeat]]\n| 75g cold water [[Prawns|prawns]] (about half a small packet)\n| 3 fresh [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]], quartered\n}}\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Heat 1 teaspoon of [[Butter|butter]] in a pan and add a pinch of [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n| Peel and finely chop a medium and gently saut\u00e9 in the [[Butter|butter]] for 5 minutes\n| Cook the past for 4.5 minutes in fast [[Boiling|boiling]] [[Salted|salted]] water\n| Drain, reserving a little of the water to loosen the [[Sauce|sauce]] if needed\n| Stir the cr\u00e8me fra\u00eeche into the [[Onions|onions]] and lower the heat \n| Mix in the [[Crabmeat|crabmeat]], then the [[Prawns|prawns]]\n| Add the [[Pasta|pasta]] and loosen the [[Sauce|sauce]] with a little water if needed\n| Stir in the chopped [[Dill|dill]] and gently reheat the [[Sauce|sauce]] for a minute or so\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with chopped [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n<YouTube>https://youtu.be/DOaTJan1_Y8</YouTube>\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Italian recipes]]\n[[Category:Fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Pasta recipes]]\n[[Category:Shellfish recipes]]\n[[Category:Cookery cheats]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#sauce #freshpasta #butter #pasta #tomatoes #dill #crabmeat #crabprawnsdillwithpastainacreamysauce #prawns #blackpepper #salted </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }

title": "Crabmeat pasta with fennel and chillies",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Crabmeat pasta with fennel and chillies recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#crabmeat #pasta #sweetcorn #parsley #crab #crabmeatpastawithfennelandchillies #driedpasta #lemon #fennel #dill #freshpasta \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This was one of the nicest pasta dishes that I've ever made. I'm sure it would be even better made with fresh crab\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 747\n|PortionCalories = 373\n|DatePublished=13th December 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  40 minutes\n|PrepTime =  30 minutes\n|CookTime =  10 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Crabmeat pasta with fennel and chillies recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Fennel chilli kick!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.7</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I thought these flavours would override the crabmeat but they were really rather good.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis is my version of Jamie Oliver's [[Crab]] Linguine, adapted for two people using [[Home made pasta|home made pasta]] cut into rustic strips rather that linguine. I've dressed it with fresh [[Parsley|parsley]] and [[Grilled|grilled]] [[Sweetcorn|sweetcorn]] as I can't wait for another chance to play with my Rothenberger MAPP blowtorch!\n\nI've used 2 packets of premium claw [[Crabmeat|crabmeat]] from Morrisons, about \u00a33.75 per carton ''Dec 2014''.\n\nThis was one of the nicest [[pasta]] dishes that I've ever made.  I'm sure it would be even better made with fresh [[crab]].  The [[sweet corn]] was absolutely essential for the balance of this dish, it's sweetness of setting the lemony tang.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 portion of [[Home made pasta|home made pasta]], cut into rustic strips, or 180 g [[Dried pasta|dried pasta]] of your choosing.\n| 2 x 114 g packs of Premium Claw [[Crabmeat]]\n| 1 fresh [[Lemons|lemons]]\n| Half a bulb of [[Fennel|fennel]]\n| 1 small [[Red chilli|red chilli]]\n| 1 [[Indian]] [[Green chilli|green chilli]]\n| 1 teaspoon of freshly chopped [[parsley]]\n| 4 tablespoons of [[Extra virgin Olive oil|extra virgin olive oil]]\n}}\n'''to garnish'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 1 fresh [[Sweet corn|sweet corn]] cob\n| Freshly chopped [[dill]]\n| A few nice [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* If you're using [[Fresh pasta|fresh pasta]], don't forget that you are best leaving it in the [[Fridge|fridge]] for an hour or so before you roll it out.  For this recipe I'm assuming that you have your [[Pasta|pasta]] already sorted!\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Add the [[Crabmeat|crabmeat]] to a bowl and add a pinch of [[Black pepper|black pepper]], a good pinch of chopped [[Parsley|parsley]] and any of the green [[Fennel tops|fennel tops]] if there are any.\n| Cut the base of the [[Fennel|fennel]] and trim any grotty bits.\n| Grate the [[Fennel bulb|fennel bulb]] into the [[Crab|crab]].  I've used my new [[Jamie Oliver acid etched coarse grater]].  If you have one, mind your fingers.  It does a blinding job but it is dreadfully sharp!\n| Using a small microplane [[Grater|grater]], add the [[Zest|zest]] of the [[Lemon|lemon]] to the [[Crab meat|crab meat]].\n| Deseed the both of the [[Chillies|chillies]] and chop finely. Add half to the [[Crab meat|crab meat]] and keep the remainder for dressing the dish.\n| Stir up the [[Olive oil|olive oil]] with the [[Juice|juice]] of the zested [[Lemon|lemon]] and mix this together with the chopped [[parsley]], into the [[Crab meat|crab meat]].\n| Gently heat the [[Crab meat|crab meat]] in a separate pan and cook your [[Pasta|pasta]] in a large pan of [[Boiling|boiling]] water. 3 minutes for [[Fresh pasta|fresh pasta]], 7 minutes + for [[Dried pasta|dried pasta]].\n| While the [[Pasta|pasta]] is cooking, [[Microwave|microwave]] the [[Sweet corn|sweet corn]] for a few minutes and toast it with your blowtorch if you have one. See here for more.\n| Drain the [[Pasta|pasta]], keeping back a ladle of the cooking [[Liquor|liquor]].\n| Mix the [[Pasta|pasta]] into the [[Crabmeat|crabmeat]], adding an eggcup full of the pasta water to thin the [[Sauce|sauce]] if needed.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe, scattered with the blackened [[Sweetcorn|sweetcorn]], chopped [[dill]] and the chopped [[Chillies|chillies]].\n\n{{Template:YoutubePastaDough}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Italian recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Chilli pepper recipes]]\n[[Category:Fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Pasta recipes]]\n[[Category:Sea fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Shellfish recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#crabmeat #pasta #sweetcorn #parsley #crab #crabmeatpastawithfennelandchillies #driedpasta #lemon #fennel #dill #freshpasta </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Crab and brown shrimp pizza",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Crab and brown shrimp pizza recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#pizza #crabmeat #grill #chilioil #pizzadough #pizzas #seafood #mozzarella #passata #brownshrimp #crabandbrownshrimppizza \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Being a seafood lover I thought that crabmeat would be nice on a pizza. When Anne came in with the ingredients, she surprised me with a pack of peeled\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1371\n|PortionCalories = 685\n|DatePublished=19th February 2016\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  1 hour, 12 minutes\n|PrepTime =  1 hour\n|CookTime =  12 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Crab and brown shrimp pizza recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">One of the best pizzas, ever!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">This was glorious, and so seefoody!</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nBeing a [[Seafood|seafood]] lover I thought that [[Crabmeat|crabmeat]] would be nice on a [[Pizza|pizza]].  When Anne came in with the ingredients, she surprised me with a pack of peeled [[Brown shrimps|brown shrimps]] so I combined the two and made a fabulous pizza.\n\nThe only downside was the amount of liquid in the [[Crabmeat|crabmeat]], added to increase the nett weight rather than for any culinary reason.  It made the [[Pizza|pizza]] a little wet.  Next time I make this I will spin the crabmeat in a [[Salad spinner|salad spinner]] to reduce the amount of liquid.  If you don't have a [[Salad|salad]] spinner just sit the crabmeat in a [[Sieve|sieve]] for 30 minutes.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 portion of [[Pizza dough]] (makes 2 [[Pizzas|pizzas]])\n| About 6 tablespoons of [[Tomato sauce for pizza]] or [[Passata|passata]]\n| 1 small [[Onion|onion]], very finely chopped\n| 90g peeled [[Brown shrimp|brown shrimp]] (1 small pack)\n| 100g white & [[Brown|brown]] [[Crab meat|crab meat]] (1 small pot)\n| 2 balls [[Mozzarella cheese|mozzarella cheese]] torn into small pieces(about 250g in total)\n| [[Chili oil]] to taste\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat the [[Grill|grill]] to high - with a [[Pizza stone|pizza stone]] if you have one\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Pizza mozzarella Brown shrimp and crabmeat added.jpg|Mozarella added...\nImage:Pizza Brown shrimp and crabmeat added.jpg|Base part-baked and brown shrimp and crabmeat added\nImage:Brown shrimp and crabmeat pizza.jpg|The uncooked base with the crabmeat and brown shrimp\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Divide the [[Pizza dough|pizza dough]] into two and roll out into two [[Pizzas|pizzas]]\n| Make each [[Pizza|pizza]] individually and place the first one in the [[Oven|oven]] to keep warm whilst the second pizza completes\n| [[Grill]] the [[Pizza|pizza]] for about 2 to 3 minutes per side with no toppings added\n| Removed the part-[[Baked|baked]] [[Pizza|pizza]] and spread with [[Tomato sauce for pizza]] or [[Passata|passata]]\n| Sprinkle with the finely chopped [[Onions|onions]]\n| Add the peeled [[Brown shrimp|brown shrimp]] and cover with the [[Crabmeat|crabmeat]]\n| Arrange the torn [[Mozzarella|mozzarella]] over the [[Seafood|seafood]]. Try to cover as much of the seafood as possible so it does not get too crisped\n| Season with [[Salt|salt]] and [[Black pepper|black pepper]] and drizzle with [[Chili oil|chili oil]] if liked\n| [[Bake]] for about 3 or 4 minutes under the hot [[Grill|grill]] until the [[Mozzarella|mozzarella]] just starts to [[Brown|brown]]\n| Serve immediately\n}}\n==See also==\n\n* [https://www.sainsburys.co.uk/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/gb/groceries/fisherman-brown-shrimp-90g?langId=44&storeId=10151 Brown shrimp (Sainsbury's)]\n* [https://www.sainsburys.co.uk/shop/gb/groceries/sainsburys-white---[[Brown|brown]]-[[Crab|crab]]-[[Meat|meat]]--taste-the-difference-100g Mixed crabmeat (Sainsbury's)]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Shellfish recipes]]\n[[Category:Pizza recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#pizza #crabmeat #grill #chilioil #pizzadough #pizzas #seafood #mozzarella #passata #brownshrimp #crabandbrownshrimppizza </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }

title": "Crab cakes",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Crab cakes, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#crabcakes #crab #breadcrumbs #cakes #flour #butter #egg #bread #englishmustard #mayonnaise #worcestershiresauce \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=You can buy ready prepared crab meat which is much easier to use and judge the weight\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1763\n|PortionCalories = 440\n|DatePublished=9th June 2013\n|Author = JuliaBalbilla\n|ImageComment = Crab cake with tomato sauce\n |Servings = Serves 4 - Makes 6 [[Crab|crab]] [[Cakes|cakes]]\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 1 hour 25 minutes\n |PrepTime = 1 hour 15 minutes\n |CookTime = 10 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Crab cakes recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Expensive, but glorious</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">We try to treat ourselves to this whenever we visit Cromer.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nYou can buy ready prepared [[Crab|crab]] [[Meat|meat]] which is much easier to use and judge the weight.  However, if you want to fiddle about getting the [[Meat|meat]] out of claws etc, then that is fine!\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 225 g white [[Crab|crab]] [[Meat|meat]]\n| 225 g [[Brown|brown]] [[Crab|crab]] [[Meat|meat]]\n| Breadcrumbs from 3 or more thick slices of stale wholemeal [[Bread|bread]], crusts removed.\n| 2 heaped tablespoons [[Mayonnaise|mayonnaise]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Worcestershire sauce]]\n| 2 heaped teaspoons hot [[English mustard]] or 2 teaspoons of [[mustard powder]], mixed with a little water.\n| [[Flour]] or [[cornmeal]]\n| 2 beaten [[Eggs|eggs]]\n| 12 rounded tablespoons [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]]\n| 4 tablespoons [[Sunflower oil|sunflower oil]]\n| 50 g [[Butter|butter]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Mix the [[Crab|crab]], wholemeal [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]], [[Mayonnaise|mayonnaise]], [[Worcestershire sauce]] and [[English mustard]] thoroughly in a bowl.\n| Divide the mixture into 6 and form into rounds of about 2 cm thick (see Chef's notes below).\n| Put some [[Flour|flour]] on a plate, pour the [[Egg|egg]] onto another plate and the [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]] onto a third plate.\n| Dust the [[Crab|crab]] [[Cakes|cakes]] firstly in [[Flour|flour]], then coat in the beaten [[Egg|egg]] and finally in the [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]].\n| Leave to rest in the [[Freezer|freezer]] for an hour or so.\n| Heat the [[Oil|oil]] and [[Butter|butter]] in a [[Frying pan|frying pan]] to a medium heat and cook the [[Crab|crab]] [[Cakes|cakes]] for about 4 minutes on each side.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Tomato sauce|tomato sauce]] and/or [[Salad|salad]].\n===Chef's notes===\nThe consistency of the [[Crab|crab]] [[Cakes|cakes]] should be fairly firm, which is why the [[Bread|bread]] quantity is not specific.  You need to get the mixture so that you can easily shape them without them falling apart.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Crab cakes]]\n[[Category:British recipes|Crab cakes]]\n[[Category:Fish recipes|Crab cakes]]\n[[Category:Main courses|Crab cakes]]\n[[Category:Shellfish recipes|Crab cakes]]\n[[Category:Starters|Crab cakes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#crabcakes #crab #breadcrumbs #cakes #flour #butter #egg #bread #englishmustard #mayonnaise #worcestershiresauce </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Crab cakes (TM)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Crab cakes - A Thermomix recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#garlic #crabcakes #breadcrumbs #eggs #crab #chilli #coriander #flour #onion #oliveoil #ginger \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A recipe for crab cakes made in a Thermomix\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1254\n|PortionCalories = 418\n|DatePublished=17th February 2014\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = 3 as a starter or part of a main course\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  1 hour, 35 minutes\n|PrepTime =  1 hour, 20 minutes, including resting time\n|CookTime =  15 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Crab cakes TM recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Delicips</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">But fresh crab is SO expensive nowdays</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:NonLoggedInUser|NonLoggedInUser]] </span></span>\n}}\nA recipe for [[Crab cakes|crab cakes]] made in a [[Thermomix]]\n\n{{RecipeIngredientsTM\n\n| 16 tablespoons [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]]\n| 4cm [[Root ginger|root ginger]], peeled and coarsely chopped\n| 3-4 long, [[Green Indian chillies|green indian chillies]], stalks removed\n| 1 small [[Onion|onion]] halved\n| [[Garlic]], to taste, peeled\n| 4 tablespoons roughly chopped fresh [[Coriander|coriander]]\n| 4 large [[Eggs|eggs]]\n| 450g [[Crab|crab]] [[Meat|meat]] (from claws)\n| [[Plain flour]]\n| [[Olive oil]]\n}}\n\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Grind [[Bread|bread]] into crumbs '''4 seconds / Speed 7'''\n| Remove and reserve\n| Add the [[Ginger|ginger]], [[Chillies|chillies]], [[Onion|onion]], [[Garlic|garlic]] and [[Coriander|coriander]] and 2 of the [[Eggs|eggs]] '''5 seconds / Speed 5'''\n| Scrape down side of bowl\n| Stir in the [[Crab|crab]] [[Meat|meat]] and 8 tablespoons of the [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]] '''10 seconds / Speed 3 / Reverse blade'''\n| Divide the mixture into 6 or 9 and shape into [[Cakes|cakes]]\n| Chill on a tray in the [[Fridge|fridge]] for 30 minutes to 1 hour to firm up\n| Beat the remaining 2 [[Eggs|eggs]]\n| Put the remaining [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]] and the [[Flour|flour]] on separate plates\n| Lightly coat each [[Crab|crab]] [[Cake|cake]] in the [[Flour|flour]], then the [[Egg|egg]] and finally the [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]]\n| Heat the [[Oil|oil]] in a [[Frying pan|frying pan]] and [[Brown|brown]] the [[Crab cakes|crab cakes]] for a minute or 2 each side\n| [[Oil]] the varoma tray, add the [[Crab cakes|crab cakes]] and [[Steam|steam]] '''10 minutes / Temp Varoma /Speed 1''' (preheat first)\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Chilli|chilli]] [[Jam|jam]] and [[Lettuce|lettuce]] dressed in a warm mixture of [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and fried [[Garlic|garlic]].  You can use the [[oil]] in which you fried the [[Crab cakes|crab cakes]] to fry the [[garlic]] and use as the dressing.  They would also go well with [[Batatas harras (Lebanese spiced potatoes)|batatas harras]]\n===Recipe source===\n\n* Lightly adapted and converted for Thermomix from a recipe by [http://www.bbc.co.uk/food/recipes/crab_cakes_80855 Angela Hartnett]\n===Chef's notes===\nHusband suggested adding some [[horseradish]] to the mixture plus extra [[chilli]], [[garlic]] and [[ginger]].  Also he prefers [[spring onions]] as listed in the original recipe.\n{{Template:PeelingGinger}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Chilli pepper recipes]]\n[[Category:Fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Sea fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Shellfish recipes]]\n[[Category:Thermomix recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n[[Category:Steamed]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#garlic #crabcakes #breadcrumbs #eggs #crab #chilli #coriander #flour #onion #oliveoil #ginger </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Cranberry and red onion relish",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Cranberry and red onion relish a fruit recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#cranberryandredonionrelish #butter #cranberries #redwinevinegar #orange #onionrelish #juice #grated #refrigerator #muslin #simmer \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Another onion relish recipe, this one courtesy of British Onions\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2063\n|PortionCalories = 1031\n|DatePublished=20th January 2013\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = 2 small jars of onion relish\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 40 minutes\n |PrepTime = 5 minutes\n |CookTime = 35 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Cranberry and red onion relish recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">I love a different pickle</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Makes such a change from Branson!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n\nAnother [[Onion relish|onion relish recipe]], this one courtesy of British Onions.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 2 tablespoons [[Butter|butter]]\n| 2 [[Red onions|red onions]] peeled and sliced\n| [[Grated]] rind and [[Juice|juice]] of 1 large [[Orange|orange]]\n| 2 cups (200g) fresh or [[Frozen|frozen]] [[Cranberries|cranberries]]\n| 4 tablespoons [[Sugar|sugar]]\n| 4 tablespoons [[Red wine vinegar|red wine vinegar]]\n| 4 tablespoons [[Red wine|red wine]]\n| &#189; teaspoon [[Allspice|allspice]]\n| Pinch of [[Ground cinnamon|ground cinnamon]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Melt the [[Butter|butter]] in medium saucepan and [[Fry|fry]] the [[Onions|onions]] gently until softened, about 8 - 10 minutes.\n| Add the [[Orange|orange]] rind and [[Juice|juice]], and cook gently for 5 minutes.\n| Add the [[Cranberries|cranberries]] to the saucepan with the [[Sugar|sugar]], [[Wine vinegar|wine vinegar]], [[Red wine vinegar|red wine vinegar]] and [[Spices|spices]].\n| Heat until just [[Boiling|boiling]] and then reduce the heat.\n| [[Simmer]] until syrupy, about 15 minutes.\n| Pot the relish in [[Sterilized|\ufffdsterilised\ufffd]] small glass jars.\n| Place a circle of [[Greaseproof paper|greaseproof paper]] over the surface of each one, and then seal and label the jars.\n| Decorate the lids with fabric or [[Butter|butter]] [[Muslin|muslin]] and tie with string or ribbon.\n| Make this relish 2 - 3 weeks before Christmas if you like.\n| Remember to store it in the [[Refrigerator|refrigerator]] after opening and use within 2 weeks.\n}}\n==See also==\n* Other [[Onion relish]] recipes\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:British Onions recipes]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Cooking with wine]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n{{Template:British Onions attribution}}\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#cranberryandredonionrelish #butter #cranberries #redwinevinegar #orange #onionrelish #juice #grated #refrigerator #muslin #simmer </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Creamy bread sauce with garlic",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Creamy bread sauce with garlic; a  recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#butter #onion #nutmeg #cream #blackpepper #garlic #bayleaves #creamybreadsaucewithgarlic #groundcloves #fridge #boiledorsimmered \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This creamy bread sauce recipe can be made well in advance and frozen for later use. Chef's tip This can be made a week in advance and kept in the fridge...\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1254\n|PortionCalories = 156\n|DatePublished=17th January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Creamy garlic bread sauce\n|Servings = Serves 8\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime = 2 hours 45 minutes\n|PrepTime = 2 hours 15 minutes (or more)\n|CookTime = 30 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Creamy garlic bread sauce recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"><span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Great with turkey</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">..or chicken! \ud83d\udc14 </span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\">[[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]] </span></span>\n}}\n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}}\n\nThis creamy bread sauce recipe can be made well in advance and frozen for later use.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1 large [[onion]], coarsely chopped\n| 1 bulb [[Garlic|garlic]], coarsely chopped\n| 8 whole [[cloves]]\n| 2 [[bay leaves]], torn\n| 568ml fresh whole [[milk]]\n| 50g [[butter]], plus knob of [[butter]] to finish\n| Freshly ground [[black pepper]]\n| 200g day old white bread, crusts removed\n| &frac12; teaspoon freshly grated [[nutmeg]]\n| 4 tablespoons double [[cream]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Tear the bay leaves in half\n| Place the chopped [[onion]], [[Garlic|garlic]], [[ground cloves]], [[bay leaves]] in a small pan and add the [[milk]] and [[butter]]\n| Season with [[black pepper]]\n| Bring to the boil, then reduce the heat and allow to simmer until the [[onion]] has softened (about 20 minutes)\n| Remove from heat and leave to infuse for 2 hours or chill overnight\n| Strain the liquid\n| Roughly tear the bread into small pieces and stir into the [[milk]]\n| Add the [[nutmeg]] and blend\n| Heat and simmer for 3-4 minutes\n| Stir in the [[cream]] and serve warm with a knob of [[butter]] to prevent a skin from forming\n}}\n===Chef's tip===\n\nThis can be made a week in advance and kept in the [[fridge]].\n\nIt will keep for up to 3 months in an airtight container in the freezer.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Bread]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments|Bread]]\n[[Category:British recipes|Bread]]\n[[Category:Dips and sauces|Bread]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes|Bread]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#butter #onion #nutmeg #cream #blackpepper #garlic #bayleaves #creamybreadsaucewithgarlic #groundcloves #fridge #boiledorsimmered </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Creamy chicken casserole with potato dumplings",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Creamy chicken casserole with potato dumplings British recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#creamychickencasserolewithpotatodumplings #chicken #dumplings #tarragon #herbs #garlic #mustardpowder #singlecream #stew #onion #miseenplace \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Chewy dumplings and creamy chicken with the strange, but wonderful flavour of tarragon make this an ideal winter stew\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 3058\n|PortionCalories = 764\n|DatePublished=19th January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 1 hour 15 minutes\n |PrepTime = 15 minutes\n |CookTime = 1 hour\n |Image = [[Image:Creamy chicken casserole with potato dumplings recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Best dumplings!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I had never made potato dumplings until now - they make a really nice change.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nChewy [[Dumplings|dumplings]] and creamy [[Chicken|chicken]] with the strange, but wonderful flavour of [[Tarragon|tarragon]] make this an ideal winter [[Stew|stew]].\n\n'''[[Chicken]] [[Stew|stew]]'''\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1 large [[Onion|onion]], peeled and chopped\n| 3 [[Cloves|cloves]] of [[Garlic]], peeled and crushed or to taste\n| 300 ml (1/2 pint) [[Vegetable stock|vegetable stock]]\n| 120 ml (4 fl oz) [[White wine|white wine]] or [[Dry sherry|dry sherry]]\n| 4 large [[Chicken|chicken]] breasts, skin removed\n| 300 ml [[Single cream|single cream]]\n| 1 tablespoon fresh [[Tarragon|tarragon]], chopped\n| Pinch of [[mustard powder]], to taste\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n}}\n'''[[Dumplings]]'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 225 g (8 oz) floury [[Potatoes|potatoes]] (Desiree, King Edward), peeled, [[Boiled|boiled]] and [[Mashed|mashed]]\n| 115 g (6 oz) [[Suet|suet]]\n| 115 g (4 oz) [[Self-raising flour|self-raising flour]]\n| Up to 50 ml (50 g) (2 fl oz) water, you'll need less or none at all if the potatoes are 'wet'.\n| 2 tablespoons fresh mixed [[Herbs|herbs]], chopped\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 190\u00b0 C (375\u00b0 F - gas 5)\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Creamy chicken casserole with potato dumplings after.jpg|thumb|300px|right|After the oven\nImage:Creamy chicken casserole with potato dumplings before.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Before the oven\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Cut the chicken breasts into bite-sized pieces\n| Add the [[Stock|stock]], [[Onion|onion]], [[Garlic|garlic]], [[mustard powder]] [[Wine|wine]] and [[Chicken|chicken]] pieces to a large oven proof casserole dish, bring to the boil, reduce the heat, cover and [[Simmer|simmer]] for 15 minutes\n| Add the [[Tarragon|tarragon]] and [[Cream|cream]] and heat gently for 5 minutes, stirring well. Season to taste \n| In a bowl, mix the [[Dumpling|dumpling]] ingredients into a soft [[Dough|dough]]. If you're lazy like me, lob it all into a [[food-processor]] and blitz it.  Add the water a little at a time until the mixture binds together.  I've made these dumplings when they have had the consistency of thick [[double cream]] and they still cook out ok.\n| With lightly floured hands, roll into 6 balls\n| Lay the [[Dumplings|dumplings]] onto the [[Chicken casserole|chicken casserole]]\n| [[Bake]] uncovered for 30 minutes\n| Finish for 5 minutes under a [[grill]] to crisp the dumplings - keep you eye on them though, they burn easily.\n}}\n===Variations===\nIf you don't have [[Fresh herbs|fresh herbs]], use half the amount of [[Dried|dried]] [[Herbs|herbs]] instead.\n===Chef's notes===\nTake a tip from Delia Smith, use [[cr\u00e8me fraiche]] instead of [[single cream]] as it is far less likely to [[split]] when heated.\n==See also==\n* {{See also - Jointing a chicken}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Chicken]]\n[[Category:British recipes|Chicken]]\n[[Category:Main courses|Chicken]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes|Chicken]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes|Chicken]]\n[[Category:Poultry recipes|Chicken]]\n[[Category:Stews and casseroles|Chicken]]\n[[Category:Cooking with wine|Chicken]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n[[Category:Stewed, braised or pot roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#creamychickencasserolewithpotatodumplings #chicken #dumplings #tarragon #herbs #garlic #mustardpowder #singlecream #stew #onion #miseenplace </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",

                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Creamy coleslaw, a fruit recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#creamycoleslaw #foodprocessor #yogurt #apple #greekyogurt #raisins #driedapricots #fats #vegetables #sultanas #cabbage \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This is very cheap and easy to make and it's pretty healthy too\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 624\n|PortionCalories = 78\n|DatePublished=24th October 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 8 - Make 850 g coleslaw\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime = 40 minutes, includes chill time\n|PrepTime = 40 minutes\n|CookTime = None\n|Image = [[Image:Coleslaw recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"><span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Wow - just wow!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">So nice, so easy and SO MUCH OF IT!!!</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\">[[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis is very cheap and easy to make and it's pretty healthy too. title": "Creamy seafood in lettuce wraps",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Healthy creamy seafood in lettuce wraps recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#mackerel #creamyseafoodinlettucewraps #iceberglettuce #lettuce #seafood #zest #peeledprawns #tapa #bones #smoked #lemon \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=The idea for this recipe came from a seafood sauce made by The Barefoot Contessa, however, her sauce used double cream!  This is healthier\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 913\n|PortionCalories = 456\n|DatePublished=12th October 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2 as a main course or 4 as a starter\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  5 minutes\n|PrepTime =  5 minutes\n|CookTime = None\n|Image = [[Image:Creamy seafood in lettuce wraps recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Dinner Part Starter..</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">.. or what!!! \ud83d\udc96</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nThe idea for this recipe came from a [[Seafood|seafood]] [[Sauce|sauce]] made by The Barefoot Contessa, however, her sauce used [[Double Cream|double cream]]!  I wanted this to be healthy.  Using [[Lettuce|lettuce]] leaves for the wrap makes for a lovely fresh crunchy taste and texture.\n\nWe had this as a main meal, but it would be great as a 'serve yourself' [[tapa]] or [[starter]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 180 g [[Smoked|smoked]] [[Mackerel|mackerel]] fillets\n| 150 g [[Greek yogurt|greek yogurt]]\n| 150 g cooked [[Peeled prawns|peeled prawns]]\n| [[Juice]] and [[Zest|zest]] from half a [[Lemon|lemon]]\n| 1 small [[Iceberg lettuce|iceberg lettuce]]\n| [[Freshly ground black pepper]]\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Creamy seafood lettuce wraps, the ingredients.jpg|300px|thumb|right|The ingredients - I forgot to photograph the lemon and eventually only needed half of the prawns shown here\nImage:Chop the celery finely.jpg|300px|thumb|right|Slice the celery lengthwise in both directions before chopping so you get a very fine dice\n</gallery>\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Add the [[Yogurt|yogurt]] to a bowl\n| Give it a grind of [[Black pepper|black pepper]] and add the [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]] and [[Zest|zest]] and mix well\n| Remove the skin from the [[Mackerel|mackerel]] and [[Flake|flake]] into bite-size pieces, checking for [[bones]] as you go\n| Stir in the [[Prawns|prawns]] and [[Mackerel|mackerel]]\n| Break the [[Iceberg lettuce|iceberg lettuce]] into 'cups'\n| Add a tablespoon of the creamy [[Seafood|seafood]] to each [[Lettuce|lettuce]] leaf, roll it up and eat\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Sea fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Shellfish recipes]]\n[[Category:Uncooked]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#mackerel #creamyseafoodinlettucewraps #iceberglettuce #lettuce #seafood #zest #peeledprawns #tapa #bones #smoked #lemon </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Creamy tarragon chicken in pumpkin cups",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Creamy tarragon chicken in pumpkin cups recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#pumpkin #chicken #squash #soup #blackpepper #seeds #saute #oliveoil #creamytarragonchickeninpumpkincups #scoop #slowcooker \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This recipe is an excuse to use up our collection of home-grown pumpkins and squashes. I've cheated a little with the filling as I didnt have too much\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1811\n|PortionCalories = 905\n|DatePublished=8th November 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  3 hours, 10 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime =  3 hours\n|Image = [[Image:Creamy tarragon chicken in pumpkin cups recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Best thing is...</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">...no washing up! \ud83e\udd2d</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis recipe is an excuse to use up our collection of home-grown [[Pumpkins|pumpkins]] and [[Squashes|squashes]].\n\nI've cheated a little with the 'filling' as I didn't have too much spare time and I've also used the [[Slow cooker|slow cooker]] to cook the filling for the same reason. It would be fine by just heating the [[Soup|soup]], and mixing in the [[Chicken|chicken]], providing it is properly cooked.  [[Slow cooking]] for a few hours just allows the flavours to properly mingle, providing you have the time. \n\nYou could possibly cook the [[Chicken|chicken]] filling in the [[Squash|squash]] or [[Pumpkin|pumpkin]], but there is always the risk of the body of the squash collapsing and dumping the filling all over your [[Oven|oven]] - this way is far safer!  It's also easier to check that the pumpkin is properly cooked.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 100g [[Bacon lardons|bacon lardons]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| Pinch of [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n| 1 small [[Onion|onion]], peeled, halved and chopped\n| 4 [[Cloves of Garlic, peeled and crushed|cloves of garlic, peeled and crushed]]\n| A pinch of [[Tex-Mex seasoning]] (optional)\n| 2 small [[Chicken breasts|chicken breasts]], chopped into bite-sized pieces\n| 1 can of [[Cream of mushroom soup|cream of mushroom soup]]\n| Splash of [[Dry sherry|dry sherry]] (optional)\n| 1 teaspoon [[Dried tarragon|dried tarragon]]\n| 1 medium sized [[Pumpkin|pumpkin]] or [[Squash|squash]] (think how it would make 2 small bowls if it were cut in two)\n| 2 tablespoons of Dzuigas [[Cheese|cheese]], finely [[Grated|grated]] (optional)\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4), [fan oven 160\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Pumpkins scooped out and ready to bake.jpg|thumb|right|300px|Pumpkins scooped out and ready to bake\nImage:Tarragon chicken filling.jpg|thumb|right|300px|Sauteed chicken filling\n</gallery>\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Add the [[Olive oil|olive oil]], [[Black pepper|black pepper]] and [[Lardons|lardons]] to a [[Frying pan|frying pan]] or [[Wok|wok]] and [[Saute|saute]] gently for 5 minutes\n| Add the [[Onions|onions]] and chopped [[Chicken|chicken]] and [[Saute|saute]] for a further 5 minutes, add the [[Garlic|garlic]] for the last few minutes, mixing well\n| Open the [[Soup|soup]] and pour into your [[Slow cooker|slow cooker]], rinse the tin out with a splash of [[Sherry|sherry]] if you have some\n| Add the [[Chicken|chicken]] mix to the [[Soup|soup]] and slow cook for a few hours\n| Meanwhile, carefully cut the [[Squash|squash]] or [[Pumpkin|pumpkin]] in half, through the stem.  [[Scoop]] out and discard the [[Seeds|seeds]]\n| [[Bake]] in the [[Oven|oven]] at  , [[Scoop|scoop]] the [[Seeds|seeds]] and bak in the oven at 180\u00b0 C for about an hour - the timing will vary depending upon the type of [[Squash|squash]]\n| If it looks as if the 'soup' might need thickening, stir in a tablespoon of [[yellow cornmeal]] and mix well during the last 15 minutes of cooking.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe the [[Tarragon|tarragon]] [[Chicken|chicken]] directly in the [[Pumpkin|pumpkin]] bowls, each sprinkled with a tablespoon of [[D\u017eiugas cheese]]. \n===Variations===\nUse any form of [[Squash|squash]] or [[Pumpkin|pumpkin]]; [[Butternut squash|butternut squash]] would be great, but you would need a large one to serve as a bowl.\n\nA good [[Parmesan cheese]] would be a fair substitute for [[D\u017eiugas cheese]].\n===Chef's notes===\nThis was absolutely delicious and will be made again and again!\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:North American recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Poultry recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Cookery cheats]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n[[Category:Slow cooked]]\n[[Category:D\u017eiugas cheese recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#pumpkin #chicken #squash #soup #blackpepper #seeds #saute #oliveoil #creamytarragonchickeninpumpkincups #scoop #slowcooker </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Cream cheese spritz cookies",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Cream cheese spritz cookies recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#creamcheese #vanillaextract #cookies #eggyolk #bake #butter #oxo #fridge #cup #bakingtray #groundcinnamon \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=I put this recipe here incase anyone has lost user manual for their Oxo good grips cookie press\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 4726\n|PortionCalories = 196\n|DatePublished=18th October 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = These are the cookie shapes that come with the Oxo cookie press.\n|Servings = Serves 24\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  30 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  15 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Oxo Good Grips Disc set included with cookie press.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">The recipe works well</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">3</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I much prefer savoury cookies.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Chef]] </span></span>\n}}\nI've put this recipe here in case anyone has lost user manual for their [[Oxo Good Grips Cookie Press|Oxo good grips cookie press]].\n\nThis is a an [[Oxo]] tested recipe.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 230 g (2 sticks) [[Unsalted butter|unsalted butter]] direct from the [[Fridge|fridge]]\n| 85 g (2 oz) [[Philadelphia Original]] [[Cream cheese|cream cheese]], softened\n| 200g (1 [[Cup|cup]]) [[Castor sugar|castor sugar]]\n| 1 [[Egg yolk|egg yolk]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Vanilla extract|vanilla extract]]\n| 315 g (2.5 cups) [[Plain flour|plain flour]] ([[All-purpose flour|all-purpose flour]])\n| &#188; teaspoon fine [[Salt|salt]]\n| &#189; teaspoon [[Ground cinnamon|ground cinnamon]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4), [fan oven 160\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| In a large mixing bowl, [[Cream|cream]] together cubed [[Butter|butter]] and [[Cream cheese|cream cheese]]\n| Add [[Sugar|sugar]] and the [[Egg yolk|egg yolk]], beating until light and fluffy\n| Mix in the [[Vanilla extract|vanilla extract]]\n| Fit your chosen cookie press disk into the [[Oxo Good Grips Cookie Press|Oxo good grips cookie press]].\n| Press [[Cookies|cookies]] out onto an ungreased [[Baking sheet|baking sheet]]\n| [[Bake]] for 12 to 15 minutes in the centre of the [[Oven|oven]] or until the [[Cookies|cookies]] have turned golden [[Brown|brown]]\n| Turn the [[Baking tray|baking tray]] round after 6 minutes\n}}\n===Recipe source===\n\n* [[Oxo Good Grips Cookie Press|Oxo good grips cookie press]] user manual\n===Chef's notes ===\nThis recipe makes 24 mini cookies\n==See also==\n\n* See [[Oxo Good Grips Cookie Press]] page for spare user manual and more info.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:North American recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#creamcheese #vanillaextract #cookies #eggyolk #bake #butter #oxo #fridge #cup #bakingtray #groundcinnamon </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Crema Inglesa (TM)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Crema Inglesa - A Thermomix recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#custard #sauce #pastries #caramel #creams #thermomixrecipes #vanilla #icingsugar #coffee #eggyolks #chocolate \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This is a translation of a recipe in Salsas y Alinos con Thermomix (Susaeta Ediciones) and is very similar to custard\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 381\n|PortionCalories = 95\n|DatePublished=12th April 2013\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|ImageComment = Crema Inglesa\n |Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 13 minutes\n |PrepTime = 5 minutes\n |CookTime = 8 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Crema Inglesajpg.jpeg|250px|Crema Inglesa|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">English Cream</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">\u2026or custard \ud83d\ude09</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:NonLoggedInUser|NonLoggedInUser]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis is a translation of a recipe in '''Salsas y Ali\u00f1os con Thermomix (Susaeta Ediciones)''' and is very similar to [[Custard|custard]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredientsTM\n| 300g [[Milk|milk]]\n| 3 [[Egg yolks|egg yolks]]\n| 75g [[Icing sugar|icing sugar]]\n| A few drops of [[Vanilla|vanilla]] essence\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Add the ingredients to the TM and cook '''8 minutes / 90\u00b0 / Speed 4'''.\n| The result should be a light [[Sauce|sauce]], but a little creamy.\n| Pour it into a bowl and keep stirring with a wooden spoon until it has completely cooled, to avoid it forming a skin.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nThis is similar to the [[Custard|custard]] used in [[Pastries|pastries]] but is much lighter and less dense.  It has many uses:  use it to decorate dishes and also a basis for ice [[Creams|creams]] and mousses. \n===Variations===\nIt can be made with different flavours by adding [[Chocolate|chocolate]], [[Caramel|caramel]], [[Coffee|coffee]] etc to the [[Milk|milk]].  \n===Chef's Notes===\nTo save stirring the sauce for ages, just cover it with cling-film to prevent skin formation.\n\n===See also===\n*[[Cr\u00e8me Anglaise]] to make this recipe using conventional methods\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Spanish recipes]]\n[[Category:Dips and sauces]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Thermomix recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#custard #sauce #pastries #caramel #creams #thermomixrecipes #vanilla #icingsugar #coffee #eggyolks #chocolate </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

                ]
