title": "Crispy baked potatoes stuffed with corn beef hash",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Crispy baked potatoes stuffed with corn beef hash Beef recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#oliveoil #cornedbeef #potato #crispybakedpotatoesstuffedwithcornbeefhash #cornedbeefhash #tomatoes #bakedpotatoes #onions #potatoes #fry #worcestershiresauce \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This is not the Jamie Oliver 30 minutes version. This takes a lot longer, however, if you have the time it is well worth the wait\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1658\n|PortionCalories = 829\n|DatePublished=14th December 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2 pigs!\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  4 hours, 20 minutes\n|PrepTime =  3 hours\n|CookTime =  1 hour, 20 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Crispy baked potatoes stuffed with corn beef hash recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Food of the eighties</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.7</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Corned beef is food of a time, and for me it's the eighties.  Nice idea though.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}}\n\nThis is not the Jamie Oliver 30 minutes version.  This takes a lot longer, however, if you have the time it is well worth the wait.  Most of the time is spent waiting, not doing so it's still an easy meal.\n\nYou don't have to [[Baked potatoes|salt the potatoes]] first, its just that this step removed moisture from the skins to make them extra crispy. The [[Salt|salt]] is washed off so does not make them the least bit salty.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 2 large [[Baking|baking]] [[Potatoes|potatoes]]\n| 1 x 340 g tin of [[Corned beef|corned beef]]\n| 2 tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 1 [[Red onion|red onion]], peeled and thinly sliced\n| 2 [[Cloves of Garlic, peeled and crushed|cloves of garlic, peeled and crushed]], optional\n| 1 tablespoon [[Worcestershire sauce]]\n}}\n''' to serve'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| [[Olive oil]]\n| 6 medium [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]]\n| 2 large [[Free range eggs|free range eggs]]\n| [[Salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Salt the Jacket potatoes [[Baked potatoes|as show here]]\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 220\u00b0 C (425\u00b0 F - gas 7), [fan oven 200\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\n[[Image:Skins dehydrated after 3 hours.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Salt the potatoes for 2 or 3 hours then rinse the salt off with cold water. Now the skins are slightly dehydrated - note the water drained from them during this time]]\n[[Image:Tomaotes ready to roast.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Tomatoes, coated with season oil, ready to roast]]\n</gallery>\n\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| ''Ideally for really crispy potatoes, cook them for 1 hour 20 minutes - the 3 hours preparation time includes [[Baked potatoes|salting the potatoes]]''\n| Splash a little [[Olive oil|olive oil]] in a [[Baking tray|baking tray]] and season with [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]].\n| Prick the [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]] a few times to stop them splitting. Add them to the tray and toss them in the seasoned [[Oil|oil]].  We will add these to the [[Oven|oven]] for the final 20 minutes of cooking.\n| If you have [[Baked potatoes|salted the potatoes first]], wash the salt off and pat them dry.\n| Place them on a [[Grill tray|grill tray]] at the top part of a preheated [[Oven|oven]].\n| [[Bake]] for 1 hour.\n| Heat a few tablespoon of [[Olive oil|olive oil]] in a [[Frying pan|frying pan]] or a [[Wok|wok]], season with [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]] and [[Fry|fry]] the [[Onions|onions]] for 7 minutes adding the [[Garlic|garlic]] during the final few minutes.\n| Roughly chop the [[Corned beef|corned beef]] and add to the [[Onions|onions]] and [[Stir-fry|stir-fry]] for a few minutes.\n| Meanwhile, carefully remove the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] from the [[Oven|oven]] and cut into halves. [[Scoop]] out the cooked [[Potato|potato]] and add to the [[Corned beef|corned beef]] with a good splash of [[Worcestershire sauce]].\n| If the hash is not ready, return the [[Potato|potato]] skins to the top of the [[Oven|oven]] to keep them crispy. At the same time, add the tray of [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]] to the bottom of the oven.\n| Turn the heat up under the [[Corned beef|corned beef]] and let it crisp for a few minutes, scraping the bottom of the pan to prevent it  sticking.\n| Fill the [[Potato|potato]] skins with the [[Corned beef hash|corned beef hash]] and return to the top of the [[Oven|oven]] for 15 minutes.\n| When the 15 minutes is up, [[Fry|fry]] the [[Eggs|eggs]].\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe the [[Egg|egg]] on top of the [[Crispy jacket potatoes|crispy jacket potatoes]] filled with [[Corned beef hash|corned beef hash]] with a side order of [[Roasted tomatoes|roasted tomatoes]] and a dollop of [[HP sauce]] - what could be better?.\n===Variations===\nI like quite a 'runny' hash so I added a little [[Stock|stock]], during the last few minutes of the [[Corned beef hash|corned beef hash]] [[Frying|frying]] stage.\n==See also==\n* [[Corned beef hash with eggs]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Australian recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:North American recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Beef recipes]]\n[[Category:Egg recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#oliveoil #cornedbeef #potato #crispybakedpotatoesstuffedwithcornbeefhash #cornedbeefhash #tomatoes #bakedpotatoes #onions #potatoes #fry #worcestershiresauce </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Crispy Capricorn potato fritters with bacon",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Crispy Capricorn potato fritters with bacon an egg recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#batter #grated #crispycapricornpotatofritterswithbacon #chives #oliveoil #eggs #onion #potatoes #fry #plainflour #bacon \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=I think that this light snack recipe from The Lubborn Creamery would make an excellent breakfast, though it's probably a little optimistic to expect\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1125\n|PortionCalories = 281\n|DatePublished=20th January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 25 minutes\n |PrepTime = 15 minutes\n |CookTime = 10 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Crispy Capricorn potato fritters with bacon recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Tasty and crispy</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">These are nicer than cheesey-chips!</span> \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\">[[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\n\nI think that this light [[Snack|snack]] recipe from [[The Lubborn Creamery]] would make an excellent breakfast, though it's probably a little optimistic to expect it to stretch to 4 people!\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 2 medium [[Eggs|eggs]], beaten\n| 25g (1oz) [[Plain flour|plain flour]]\n| 2 tablespoons snipped fresh [[Chives|chives]]\n| 750g floury [[Potatoes|potatoes]], peeled and coarsely [[Grated|grated]]\n| 1 small [[Onion|onion]], [[Grated|grated]]\n| 1 x 100g [[Capricorn Somerset Goats cheese]], finely [[Diced|diced]]\n| [[Olive oil|olive oil]] to [[Fry|fry]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Mix the [[Eggs|eggs]] and [[Flour|flour]] together in a bowl to form a thick [[Batter|batter]]. Stir in the [[Chives|chives]] and plenty of seasoning.\n| Squeeze the excess liquid out of the [[Grated|grated]] [[Potatoes|potatoes]] and [[Onion|onion]] then spread them out on a clean [[Tea-towel|tea-towel]] and pat dry.\n| Stir into the [[Batter|batter]], mixing well, then add the [[Capricorn Somerset Goats cheese]].\n| Heat a little [[Olive oil|olive oil]] in a [[Frying pan|frying pan]] and add 6 tablespoons of [[Batter|batter]], pressing down each one to flatten it out. Cook for 2 &frac12;-3 mins each side until golden.\n| Keep warm while you cook the remaining [[Batter|batter]], adding extra [[Oil|oil]] as needed.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with crispy [[Bacon|bacon]] and [[Grilled|grilled]] [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]].\n===Chef's notes===\nFollow the [[RSPCA Think Pig Checklist]] to make sure that your [[Pork|pork]] has come from pigs that have been reared to higher welfare standards.\n==See also==\n{{FritterRecipes}}\n* http://bit.ly/rspcathinkpig\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Breakfast recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Egg recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Lubborn Creamery recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#batter #grated #crispycapricornpotatofritterswithbacon #chives #oliveoil #eggs #onion #potatoes #fry #plainflour #bacon </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Crispy duck and hoisin pizza",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Crispy duck and hoisin pizza recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#pizza #duck #pizzastone #crispyduckandhoisinpizza #grill #oliveoil #pizzas #pizzadough #shredded #bake #provolone \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Another excuse to play with my homemade sous vide cooker and combine the results in a pizza. I used half of a boneless aromatic crispy duck for the main topping\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2432\n|PortionCalories = 1216\n|DatePublished=2nd May 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  1 hour, 30 minutes\n|PrepTime =  1 hour, 15 minutes\n|CookTime =  15 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Crispy duck and hoisin pizza recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Fab idea!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.6</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Don't think I've ever seen this before but it was really good.</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nAnother excuse to play with my [[homemade sous vide cooker]] and combine the results in a [[Pizza|pizza]].\n\nI used half of a boneless aromatic [[Crispy duck|crispy duck]], bought from [[See Woo]], our brilliant local [[Chinese wholesalers]].  A couple of cooked [[Duck|duck]] breasts would work just as well on this [[Pizza|pizza]].\n\nI [[Vacuum packed|vacuum packed]] the half [[Duck|duck]] in 2 tablespoons of [[Peking duck|peking duck]] [[Sauce]] ([[Hoisin sauce]] is very similar) and cooked [[Sous vide|sous vide]] for 8 hours at 60\u00b0C and [[Shredded|shredded]] it ready for the [[Pizza topping|pizza topping]].  The duck would be perfectly cooked after 3 hours at 57\u00b0C, but I wanted to achieve the 'overcooked and falling apart' finish that you can't get with cooking for shorter times.  As it is vacuum sealed, it stays nice and moist and the quick heat from the grill give the duck a nice crispy finish.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 portion [[Pizza dough|pizza dough]] - Makes 2 [[Pizzas|pizzas]]\n| 150g of selected [[Cheeses|cheeses]], [[Grated|grated]].\n| 4 tablespoons of [[Tomato sauce for pizza]]\n| 4 medium [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]], sliced\n| 300 g  peking crispy [[Duck|duck]], [[Shredded|shredded]]\n| A large bunch of fresh [[Chives|chives]], chopped\n| [[Olive oil]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat the [[Grill|grill]] (if using a [[Pizza stone|pizza stone]])\n* If using the [[Oven|oven]], preheat it to 220\u00b0 C (425\u00b0 F - gas 7)\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Dust your work surface with [[Fine yellow cornmeal|fine yellow cornmeal]]\n| Divide the [[Pizza dough|pizza dough]] into two and roll out into two thin 25.5 cm (10 inch) [[Pizzas|pizzas]]\n| You can leave them in a [[Warm place|warm place]] for an hour or so to rise. I quite like them cooked immediately they are rolled out for a more crispy finish.\n| Prick the [[Pizza|pizza]] all over with a fork. This prevents it puffing up too much and burning while it is cooking\n| With a deft move, slide the [[Pizza|pizza]] from the [[Pizza peel|pizza peel]], on to the preheated [[Pizza stone|pizza stone]].\n| Cook on one side only for about 2 minutes or until lightly [[Browned|browned]].\n| Remove from the [[Oven|oven]] and spread the [[Pizza|pizza]] with 2 tablespoons of [[Tomato sauce for pizza|tomato sauce for pizza]].\n| Sprinkle the cheese over the tomato sauce and top with the shredded duck.  Don't put the cheese on top of the duck if you want it to be crispy.\n| Season with [[Salt|salt]], [[Pepper|pepper]] and finish with a drizzle of [[Olive oil|olive oil]].\n| Return to the [[Oven|oven]] and [[Bake|bake]] until the [[Cheese|cheese]] is nicely melted. This should take about 4 minutes under a [[Grill|grill]] on a [[Pizza stone|pizza stone]], if oven [[Baking|baking]], about 15 minutes in the middle of the oven.\n| Repeat for the second [[Pizza|pizza]].\n| Keep the first [[Pizza|pizza]] warm at the bottom of the [[Oven|oven]] whilst you make the second.\n| Sprinkle with chopped chives and serve\n}}\n===See also===\n*[[Sous vide duck pizza]]\n*[[Sous vide hoisin duck pizza]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Chinese recipes]]\n[[Category:Italian recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Chilli pepper recipes]]\n[[Category:Pizza recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Grilled, griddled or barbecued]]\n[[Category:Sous vide cooking]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#pizza #duck #pizzastone #crispyduckandhoisinpizza #grill #oliveoil #pizzas #pizzadough #shredded #bake #provolone </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Crispy duck parcels",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Crispy duck parcels recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#duck #noodles #pile #hoisinsauce #lime #crispyduckparcels #sauce #lettuce #honey #cucumber #soysauce \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Abel & Cole's healthy twist on the classic Chinese restaurant dish, crispy duck pancakes\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 706\n|PortionCalories = 176\n|DatePublished=8th September 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  1 hour, 15 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  1 hour\n|Image = [[Image:Crispy duck parcels recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Nicer than Chinese pancakes</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Lovely idea - one of may favourite dishes, and healthier this way. \ud83e\udd6c\ud83e\udd6c\ud83e\udd6c</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nA healthy, [[Abel & Cole]] twist to the classic [[Chinese]] [[Crispy duck pancakes|crispy duck pancakes]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 2 [[Duck|duck]] legs\n| 1 [[Red chilli|red chilli]], chopped\n| 10 g [[Fresh ginger|fresh ginger]], chopped or [[Grated|grated]]\n| A splash of [[Soy sauce|soy sauce]]\n| 20 g drizzle of [[Honey|honey]]\n| 100 g [[Spring onions|spring onions]]\n| 1 300 g  [[Cucumber|cucumber]]\n| 8 large [[Lettuce|lettuce]] leaves\n| 50 ml [[Hoisin sauce|hoisin sauce]]\n| Fresh [[Coriander leaves|coriander leaves]] (optional)\n| Fresh [[Lime|lime]] (optional)\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Heat the [[Oven|oven]] to 160\u00b0 C (325\u00b0 F - gas 3), [fan [[Oven|oven]] 140\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Pop [[Duck|duck]] in a [[Roasting dish|roasting dish]]. Add [[Chilli|chilli]], [[Ginger|ginger]], [[Soy sauce|soy sauce]] and [[Honey|honey]]. Massage into [[Duck|duck]].\n| [[Roast]] for 45 mins. Then, crank the [[Oven|oven]] up to 190\u00b0 C (375\u00b0 F - gas 5), [fan [[Oven|oven]] 170\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour] to [[Help|help]] crisp the skin; cook for 15 mins, till [[Duck|duck]] is crisp, golden and cooked through - test by piercing a [[Fat|fat]] part of the leg - if the juices run clear, it's done.\n| [[Rest for]] 15 mins.\n| Slice [[Onions|onions]] and [[Cucumbers|cucumbers]] into wispy wands. Wash your [[Lettuce|lettuce]] leaves.\n| Shred the cooled [[Duck|duck]]. Spoon some [[Sauce|sauce]] over it. Fold through.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nTo eat: [[Pile|pile]] a mound of saucy [[Duck|duck]] onto a leaf. Top with [[Cucumber|cucumber]] and [[Spring onion|spring onion]]. Add extra [[Sauce|sauce]], [[Coriander|coriander]] and [[Lime|lime]], if you like.\n===Variations===\n[[Vegan]] option: Swap the [[Duck|duck]] for [[Brown rice|brown rice]] [[Noodles|noodles]]. Toss warm, cooked [[Noodles|noodles]] with a glug of [[Hoisin sauce|hoisin sauce]]. [[Pile]] into leaves with garnishes, as above.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Chinese recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Poultry recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Abel and Cole veg box recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n{{Template:Abel and Cole veg box recipes attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#duck #noodles #pile #hoisinsauce #lime #crispyduckparcels #sauce #lettuce #honey #cucumber #soysauce </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }

title": "Crisp Cheese and Chili Snaps",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Crisp Cheese and Chili Snaps - savoury biscuit recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#butter #crispcheeseandchilisnaps #cheese #chilipowder #foodprocessor #plainflour #dough #squeezycheesecookies #miseenplace #cheddarcheese #grated \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=These are very,very good. I've eaten too many while they were still hot and soft so I'll suffer later!\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1882\n|PortionCalories = 188\n|DatePublished=16th October 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Servings: 10\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  59 minutes\n|PrepTime =  45 minutes\n|CookTime =  14 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Cheese and chili cookies.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Fantastic</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">These are brilliant - I had forgotten how good they were.  Off to make some more before I forget again!</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n===Crisp Cheese and Chili Snaps===\nWell I seem to remember my mum saying the art of a good cook is to be able to recover from a failure - well Mum, this is what I've made from my first (failed) attempt at making [[Squeezy cheese cookies]].\n\nThese are very good, though I've eaten too many while they were still hot and soft so I'll suffer later!\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 150 g [5 oz - 1.5 cups] [[Plain flour|plain flour]]\n| &#188; teaspoon [[Chili powder|chili powder]]\n| &#188; teaspoon [[Smoked paprika powder|smoked paprika powder]]\n| &#189; teaspoon [[Sea Salt|sea salt]]\n| 60 g [2.5 oz] [[Butter|butter]] cut into small cubes\n| 225 g [8 oz] strong [[Cheddar cheese]], roughly [[Grated|grated]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 190\u00b0 C (375\u00b0 F - gas 5), [fan oven 170\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n* Ensure the [[Cheese|cheese]] and [[Butter|butter]] are at room temperature\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Squeezy cheese cookie dough - wrapped in cling-film.jpg|Wrapped in cling-film\nImage:Squeezy cheese cookie dough - kneaded.jpg|Kneaded into a dough\nImage:Squeezy cheese cookie dough - small balls.jpg|Blended into small balls\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Add the dry ingredients to a [[Food processor|food processor]] with a metal blade and pulse until combined.\n| Add the [[Butter|butter]] and [[Cheese|cheese]] and mix until it separates into small balls.  Don't over mix.\n| Tip into a bowl and knead with your hands to combine into a pliable dough.\n| Wrap the [[Dough|dough]] in [[Cling-film|cling-film]] and allow to [[Rest for|rest for]] 30 minutes at room temperature.\n| You can refrigerate at this stage and bake the cheese cookies later.  If you do this, allow the dough to get back to room temperature.\n| Roll the dough out to form a tube and cut into fairly thin slices, about 2 mm is good, this way they are lovely and crisp once you allow them to cool.\n| Lay the slices on a non-greased baking tray \n| [[Bake]] in the middle of the [[Oven|oven]] for 12 to 14 minutes or until the edges begin to [[Brown|brown]]\n| Remove from the baking tray with a metal [[spatula]] and leave to cool on a rack.\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Chilli pepper recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#butter #crispcheeseandchilisnaps #cheese #chilipowder #foodprocessor #plainflour #dough #squeezycheesecookies #miseenplace #cheddarcheese #grated </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Croutons recipe",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Croutons recipe French, from Cookipedia.Co.Uk\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#croutonsrecipe #bread #butter #fry #garlic #croutons #tablesalt #soups #brownbread #whitebread #ciabatta \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A simple accompaniment to soups and salads. Ideally from un-sliced white bread, though brown bread makes an interesting change\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 586\n|PortionCalories = 146\n|DatePublished=27th October 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 10 minutes\n |PrepTime = 2 minutes\n |CookTime = 8 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Croutons recipe recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"><span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">I'll never buy ready made again.</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">These re so simple to make. A no-brainer - make your own! </span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\">[[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]] </span></span>\n}}\nA simple [[Accompaniment|accompaniment]] to [[Soups|soups]] and [[Salads|salads]].  Ideally from un-sliced [[White bread|white bread]], though [[Brown bread|brown bread]] makes an interesting change.  They are probably better made with stale [[Bread|bread]].\n\nThey can be made in an [[Oven|oven]], but I find a heavy based [[Frying|frying]]-pan to be just as good, and a little quicker.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| About 175 g (6 oz) of stale [[Bread|bread]] - crusts removed\n| 2 to 3 tablespoons of [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Butter|butter]]\n| Fine [[Table salt|table salt]]\n| 1 clove of [[Garlic|garlic]], peeled and [[Grated|grated]] (optional)\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Remove the crusts and cut the [[Bread|bread]] into cubes\n| Heat the [[Oil|oil]] and [[Butter|butter]] in the pan until frothing\n| Add the [[Garlic|garlic]] if using and [[Fry|fry]] for 25 seconds\n| Toss in the [[Croutons|croutons]] and jiggle the pan so the [[Oil|oil]] is evenly distributed and [[Fry|fry]] until golden [[Brown|brown]]\n| Sprinkle with a little [[Salt|salt]] and serve.\n| They will keep if stored in an airtight container, but they are so quick and simple to make it's probably easier to make them as you need them.\n}}\n===Variations===\nIf , like me you prefer you [[Croutons|croutons]] drier, just use half the [[Oil|oil]] and [[Butter|butter]].  They are just as nice.\n\nShould you want to cook them in the oven, preheat to 180\u00b0C (gas mark 4 / 350\u00b0F), using a bowl, toss them in just oil, spread out on a baking sheet and bake for about 10 minutes.  They could also be done under a grill, but watch them closely or they will burn!\n===Chef's notes===\nAs a rough guide, 1 bread roll makes enough croutons for 2 people; [[ciabatta]] rolls make really nice croutons.\n\n{{Template:Croutons recipes}}\n\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:French recipes]]\n[[Category:Salad recipes]]\n[[Category:Soup and stock recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#croutonsrecipe #bread #butter #fry #garlic #croutons #tablesalt #soups #brownbread #whitebread #ciabatta </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }

title": "Crumble topping recipe",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Crumble topping, a British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#crumbletoppingrecipe #fruit #plainflour #foodprocessor #butter #brownsugar #gingerpowder #flour #breadcrumbs #applecrumblerecipe #rolledoats \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This recipe is for a basic crumble topping commonly used to cover cooked fruit\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2244\n|PortionCalories = 374\n|DatePublished=29th July 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 6 - Good covering for about 1 lb of [[Apples|apples]]\n |ImageComment = Crumble only, nothing underneath!\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 40 minutes\n |PrepTime = 5 minutes\n |CookTime = 35 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Crumble topping recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Super on rhubarb</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.7</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I much prefer home-made crumble, it can be made less sweet (for my taste) and it's easy to add your own spices and flavours.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis recipe is for a basic fruit crumble topping commonly used to cover cooked [[Fruit|fruit]].  I have created this recipe separately as Mum wanted me to make her some crumble on its own!\n\nAs a basic rule use 4 parts flour, to 2 parts butter and 2 parts sugar, using less sugar as taste demands.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 285g (10&frac12; oz) [[Plain flour|plain flour]]\n| 150g (5oz) [[Butter|butter]] (preferably unsalted) at room temperature, cut into small cubes.  \n|* [[Stork margarine]] is also good for this recipe.\n| 150g (5oz)  unrefined [[Brown sugar|brown sugar]], [[Muscovado]] etc.\n| Pinch of [[Cinnamon|cinnamon]] powder or [[Ginger powder|ginger powder]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4)\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n|By hand\n| Sift the [[Plain flour|plain flour]] into a large bowl and sprinkle with [[Sugar|sugar]], [[Salt|salt]] and spices if using.\n| With 'light-hands', gradually rub the [[Butter|butter]] into the [[Flour|flour]] a few cubes at a time until the mixture resembles [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]]\n| Don't over-work it or it will become a useless [[Dough|dough]].\n| With a [[food processor]]\n| Add the flour and butter to a [[food processor]] with a plastic blade attachment\n| Pulse the mixture in very short bursts, regularly opening and scraping any residue from the edge of the bowl if as it forms\n| Once it resembles breadcrumbs sprinkle in the [[sugar]] and pulse until combined.\n| Don't run it continuously or you will end up with pastry\n| Break up any lumps with your fingers before sprinkling and baking.\n| Normally you would spoon this mixture over the [[Fruit|fruit]], if, unusually, you are making it on its own, sprinkle over a lightly buttered 24 cm (9\") [[Oven|oven]]-proof dish\n| [[Bake]] in the [[Oven|oven]] for 35 to 40 minutes - keep your eye on it for the last 10 minutes, the transition time between done and burnt is short!\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Crumble topping recipe breadcrumbs.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Rubbed into 'breadcrumbs'\nImage:Crumble topping ingredients.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Crumble topping - basic ingredients\n</gallery>\n===Variations===\nDepending upon your taste, use less sugar. This recipe is fairly sweet for my taste. \n\nFor a nice change, add a little [[Rolled oats|rolled oats]] for [[Cornflakes|cornflakes]] to the mixture before [[Baking|baking]].\n==See also==\n* [[Mango and ginger crumble]]\n* [[Apple crumble recipe]]\n* [[Apple crumble recipe (Mum's)]]\n* [[Crumble topping recipe|Traditional crumble topping]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Pies tarts and flans]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#crumbletoppingrecipe #fruit #plainflour #foodprocessor #butter #brownsugar #gingerpowder #flour #breadcrumbs #applecrumblerecipe #rolledoats </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Crunchy garlic salad",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Crunchy garlic salad recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#salad #garlic #crunchygarlicsalad #yoghurt #parsley #oliveoil #lemonjuice #bitter #crunchysalad #frying #fat \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Using lots of yoghurt and garlic is a really nice simple way to jazz up a salad. Frying off the garlic before adding it to the salad prevents the garlic..\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=17th November 2017\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  10 minutes\n|PrepTime =  6 minutes\n|CookTime =  4 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 510\n|PortionCalories = 127\n|Image = [[Image:Crunchy garlic salad recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Love raw onions!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.9</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Red are milder than white, but still spicy and crunchy. </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nUsing lots of [[Yoghurt|yoghurt]] and [[Garlic|garlic]] is a really nice simple way to jazz up a [[Salad|salad]].\n\n[[Frying]] off the [[Garlic|garlic]] before adding it to the [[Salad|salad]] prevents the garlic flavour from being too harsh and gives the dressing a nutty taste.\n\nBe adventurous, try adding any of your favourite [[Vegetables|vegetables]] to this [[Salad|salad]] recipe.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 250 g low [[Fat|fat]] Greek-style [[Yoghurt|yoghurt]]\n| 220 g pack of [[Crunchy salad|crunchy salad]]\n| 3 [[Cloves of garlic|cloves of garlic]]\n| 2 tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| pinch of [[Salt|salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 2 tablespoons [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]]\n| Pinch of [[Sugar|sugar]]\n| 1 teaspoon freshly chopped [[Parsley|parsley]]\n| 1 small [[Red onion|red onion]], finely sliced\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Crush the [[Garlic|garlic]] and gently [[Fry|fry]] in the [[Olive oil|olive oil]] over a low heat.\n| The moment the [[Garlic|garlic]] begins to colour, remove the pan from the heat.  Don't allow the garlic to burn or it will be horrid and [[Bitter|bitter]].\n| Allow the [[Garlic|garlic]] to cool then pour into a bowl and whisk in the [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]], [[Salt|salt]], [[Pepper|pepper]] and [[Sugar|sugar]].\n| Add the [[Yoghurt|yoghurt]] and mix really well.\n| [[Refrigerate]] and allow the flavours to amalgamate if time allows.\n| Mix the [[Salad|salad]] in with the [[Yoghurt|yoghurt]] so it resembles a [[Cole-slaw|cole-slaw]] and serve.\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Crunchy garlic salad the basic ingredients.jpg|thumb|300px|right|The basic ingredients\nImage:Crunchy garlic salad the pre mix.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Ready to mix in the garlic oil\n</gallery>\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe dressed with chopped [[Parsley|parsley]] and sliced [[Onion|onion]] rings.\n\n===Chef's notes===\nThis delicious [[salad]] lasted the pair of us two days in the end.  Make up the [[yogurt]] dressing in one go, use half the [[salad]] and refrigerate the remaining salad and mix them together when you want to use it.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:French recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Marinades dressings and butters]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Salad recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#salad #garlic #crunchygarlicsalad #yoghurt #parsley #oliveoil #lemonjuice #bitter #crunchysalad #frying #fat </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Crunchy lettuce salad with pineapple salsa",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Iceberg lettuce salad with pineapple salsa recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#pineapple #redpeppers #salsa #lettuce #roast #duck #juice #ginger #redonion #onions #pineapplesalsa \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A fragrant crunchy and spicy salad with a sweet twist\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 190\n|PortionCalories = 95\n|DatePublished=7th December 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  45 minutes\n|PrepTime =  45 minutes\n|CookTime = None\n|Image = [[Image:Crunchy lettuce salad with pineapple salsa recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Great flavours</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">It was even nicer the second time (using fresh pineapple\ud83c\udf4d\ud83c\udf4d\ud83c\udf4d)</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nI made a [[Pineapple salsa|pineapple salsa]] to go with [[Roast|roast]] [[Duck|duck]] legs and it was so good that we made it the next day and added it to [[Lettuce|lettuce]] and [[Red peppers|red peppers]] to make a fragrant, [[Crunchy salad|crunchy salad]].\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 small tin of [[Pineapple|pineapple]] rings (4 rings)\n| 1 small [[Red onion|red onion]], peeled and cut into thin rings\n| 2 small fresh [[Chillies|chillies]], deseeded and chopped into rings\n| 1 teaspoon [[Fresh ginger|fresh ginger]] - ([[Frozen ginger paste]] is the most economical way to use [[Ginger|ginger]] and still have the zing)\n| 1 level teaspoon [[Muscovado sugar|muscovado sugar]]\n| 20 ml [[Lime juice|lime juice]]\n| 20 ml [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| Pinch of [[Sea Salt|sea salt]]\n| Half an [[Iceberg lettuce]], chopped\n| Half a [[Roasted red pepper|roasted red pepper]], deseeded and chopped\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Drain the canned [[Pineapple|pineapple]] rings and cut into segments - reserve a little of the [[Juice|juice]]\n| Leave the [[Onions|onions]] to dress the [[Salsa|salsa]] at the end\n| Mix the remaining items together and the flavours to combine\n| Taste and add a little of the [[Pineapple|pineapple]] [[Juice|juice]] if needed\n| Add the [[Lettuce|lettuce]], [[Red peppers|red peppers]] and [[Onion|onion]] rings to a bowl and toss in the [[Salsa|salsa]]\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nGreat with [[Roast|roast]] [[Duck|duck]].\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Chilli pepper recipes]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Uncooked]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#pineapple #redpeppers #salsa #lettuce #roast #duck #juice #ginger #redonion #onions #pineapplesalsa </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Cumberland sauce",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Cumberland sauce, a fruit recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#lemon #redcurrantjelly #lingonberry #orange #zest #cumberlandsauce #sauce #duck #port #ham #gingerpowder \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This sauce, invented, it is said, by the 3rd Duke of Cumberland (or Crown Prince Ernst August II of Hanover, 3rd Duke of Cumberland and Teviotdale\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 338\n|PortionCalories = 42\n|DatePublished=17th January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = The inventor!\n|Servings = Serves 8\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime = 45 minutes, incl. cooling time\n|PrepTime = 35 minutes\n|CookTime = 10 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:The 3rd Duke of Cumberland.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"><span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Love the narrative of this \ud83c\udfa9</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.6</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Any food created by someone who looks like this, has to be good!</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\">[[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis [[sauce]], invented, it is said, by the 3rd Duke of Cumberland (or Crown Prince Ernst August II of Hanover, 3rd Duke of Cumberland and Teviotdale, if you want the fully Monty!) is fantastic with [[duck]], [[pork]], gammon, [[ham]], [[chicken]] and most game. It can be improved by substituting [[redcurrant jelly]] with [[lingonberry]] preserve if you can obtain it.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1 [[Lemon]]\n| 1 [[Orange]]\n| 4 heaped tablespoons [[redcurrant jelly]]\n| 4 tablespoons [[port]]\n| 1 heaped teaspoon [[mustard powder]]\n| 1 heaped teaspoon ground [[ginger]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| [[Zest]] the [[orange]] and [[lemon]] using a [[mandoline]] or a [[speed peeler]] and then chopping the zest into smaller pieces, or use a [[lemon zester]], which I never find as quick\n| [[Blanch]] the [[zest]] in freshly [[boiled]] water for 5 minutes to lose any bitterness then drain well\n| Add the redcurrant jelly or [[lingonberry]] preserve to a pan with the port, heat and stir to melt the jelly\n| In a bowl, add the [[mustard]], [[ginger powder]] and juice of half a [[lemon]] and whisk up well\n| Add the [[redcurrant jelly]] and the juice of an [[orange]] and whisk again\n| Mix in the [[zest]]\n}}\n===Chef's tip===\n\nServe at room temperature\n\n===Variations===\n\nSubstitute the redcurrant jelly with [[lingonberry]] preserve.\n\nUse a [[lime]] instead of a [[lemon]].\n\nUse a [[Seville orange]] when in season.\n\n===Chef's tip===\n\nDon't try to thicken this [[sauce]] as it is supposed to be quite thin.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Dips and sauces]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Blanched]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#lemon #redcurrantjelly #lingonberry #orange #zest #cumberlandsauce #sauce #duck #port #ham #gingerpowder </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Cumberland sausages with Puy lentils",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Cumberland sausages with Puy lentils; a  recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#lentils #sausages #stock #parsley #pancetta #muscovadosugar #simmer #boil #shallots #sherryvinegar #blackpepper \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A nice mixture of pork sausages and lentils. Great for a winter day meal. This is my variation of a recipe from featured in Sevenoaks Magazine. \n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1070\n|PortionCalories = 535\n|DatePublished=12th February 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  50 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  35 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Cumberland sausages with Puy lentils recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"><span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Sausagey snack!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">A clever way to use lentils.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\">[[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]] </span></span>\n}}\n\nA nice mixture of [[Pork sausages|pork sausages]] and [[Lentils|lentils]].  Great for a winter day meal.\n\nThis is my variation of a recipe from featured in ''Sevenoaks Magazine''.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 125 g [[Puy lentils]] (any small [[Lentils|lentils]] will work with this recipe)\n| 125 g [[Shallots|shallots]], peeled and quartered - soak in [[Boiling|boiling]] water for 3 minutes for easy peeling)\n| 1 tablespoon [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| Good pinch of [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n| 2 teaspoons [[Muscovado sugar|muscovado sugar]]\n| 2 teaspoons [[English mustard]]\n| 2 tablespoons [[Sherry vinegar|sherry vinegar]] ([[Red wine vinegar|red wine vinegar]] will be fine)\n| 75 ml [[Vegetable Stock|vegetable stock]]\n| 4 Cumberland [[Sausages|sausages]]\n| 8 rashers [[Pancetta|pancetta]] or thin-cut [[Bacon|bacon]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Runny honey|runny honey]] (or [[Microwave|microwave]] set [[Honey|honey]] for a few seconds)\n| 3 tablespoons chopped fresh [[Parsley|parsley]]\n}}\n\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Pop the [[Lentils|lentils]] in a pan and just cover with cold water\n| bring to the [[Boil|boil]], reduce the heat and [[Simmer|simmer]] for 10 minutes\n| Heat a [[Wok|wok]] or [[Frying pan|frying pan]] and add the [[Oil|oil]] and [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n| [[Fry]] the [[Shallots|shallots]] for 5 minutes stirring now and then\n| Sprinkle with the [[Muscovado sugar|muscovado sugar]] and saut\u00e9 gently for another 5 minutes to caramelise, toss them regularly while they cook\n| Drain the [[Lentils|lentils]] and add to a clean pan together with the [[Stock|stock]], [[Mustard|mustard]] and [[Sherry vinegar|sherry vinegar]]\n| Bring to the [[Boil|boil]], reduce the heat and [[Simmer|simmer]] for 15 minutes of until the [[Lentils|lentils]] are tender and the [[Stock|stock]] has reduced. Add extra [[Stock|stock]] if they dry out before they are tender\n| While the [[Lentils|lentils]] are cooking wrap each [[Sausage|sausage]] in a rasher of [[Pancetta|pancetta]]\n| [[Grill]] the [[Sausages|sausages]] under a medium / hot [[Grill|grill]] for 10 minutes or until the [[Sausages|sausages]] are properly cooked and the [[Pancetta|pancetta]] is crispy\n| Mix half of the [[Parsley|parsley]] into the [[Lentils|lentils]], mix well, season to taste and serve and serve\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nSit the [[Sausages|sausages]] on a bed of [[Lentils|lentils]], sprinkled with the remaining [[Parsley|parsley]]\n\n===Variations===\nTry this with [[Toulouse sausages]]\n\nAny small (fast cooking) lentils will work with this dish\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:French recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#lentils #sausages #stock #parsley #pancetta #muscovadosugar #simmer #boil #shallots #sherryvinegar #blackpepper </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }

title": "Cumberland sausage Scotch egg - with a pastry coat",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Cumberland sausage Scotch egg - with a pastry coat recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#pastry #eggs #egg #glutenfree #sausage #bake #baking #piccalilli #flour #onions #cereal \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This is like a Scotch egg but with a pastry covering instead of breadcrumbs using Debbie&andrews debbie&andrews sausages\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 192\n|PortionCalories = 24\n|DatePublished=24th October 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 8 - Makes 8 Scotch egg pasties\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  1 hour, 5 minutes\n|PrepTime =  40 minutes\n|CookTime =  25 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Cumberland sausage Scotch egg with a pastry coat recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">A Welsh Egg, maybe? \ud83e\udd13</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Nice, but I think the pastry is too much - one or the other.</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Perfect-cumberland-sausages.png|300px|thumb|right|[[Debbie and Andrew's Perfect Cumberland Pork Sausages]]]]\nThis is like a [[Scotch]] [[Egg|egg]] but with a [[Pastry|pastry]] covering instead of [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]], and because we are using [[Debbie&andrew's sausages|debbie&andrew's sausages]] they will be full of flavour, unlike the shop bought Scotch eggs.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 pack [[Debbie and Andrew's Perfect Cumberland Pork Sausages]]\n| 9 medium [[Eggs|eggs]] (it's important they're not large)\n| 6 [[Spring onions|spring onions]], finely sliced\n| 2 x 500g blocks [[Frozen|frozen]] [[Shortcrust pastry|shortcrust pastry]], [[Defrosted|defrosted]] (for a [[Gluten free|gluten free]] option, try Udi's [[Pastry]] Mix)\n| [[Plain flour|plain flour]], for dusting (for a [[Gluten free|gluten free]] option, try [[Udi's all purpose flour mix]])\n| [[Brown sauce|brown sauce]] or [[Piccalilli|piccalilli]], to serve\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6), [fan oven 180\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Bring a pan of water to the [[Boil|boil]], introduce 8 of the [[Eggs|eggs]] in their shells and leave in [[Simmering|simmering]] water for 6 mins. Drain, then cool under cold water and peel carefully.\n| Meanwhile, squeeze the [[Sausage|sausage]] mixture of the skins and mix it together with the [[Onions|onions]] using your hands.\n| Roll out a block of [[Pastry|pastry]] until large enough to cut 3 x 18cm circles (use a good sized [[Cereal|cereal]] bowl or a side plate as a template). Re-roll the trimmings; you should get 4 further circles from each. Prepare 2 [[Baking|baking]] sheets by dusting with a little [[Flour|flour]].\n| Using slightly wet hands, [[Squash|squash]] out an eighth of the [[Sausage|sausage]] mix over each of the rounds of [[Pastry|pastry]], going almost right to the edges. Slightly wet the edges of the pastry. Sit a peeled [[Egg|egg]] in the middle of the sausage, grind over a little [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]], then pull the sides up over the egg and seal. Crimp the edges and put onto the [[Baking sheet|baking sheet]].\n| [[Bake]] for 25 to 30 minutes until the [[Pastry|pastry]] is golden [[Brown|brown]].\n}}\n===See also===\n* [[Udi's Gluten Free Products|Udi's Gluten Free baking products]]\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Egg recipes]]\n[[Category:Gluten free recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Debbie&andrew's sausage recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n{{Template:DebbieAndAndrew attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#pastry #eggs #egg #glutenfree #sausage #bake #baking #piccalilli #flour #onions #cereal </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Curried carrot soup",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Curried carrot soup, Indian recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#curriedcarrotsoup #garlic #carrots #vegetables #seeds #parsley #vegetablestock #soup #nigella #onions #cumin \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A lovely warming soup for autumn and winter. Note that the carrots and onions are net weight, ie after peeling\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1647\n|PortionCalories = 411\n|DatePublished=18th January 2013\n|Author = JuliaBalbilla\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  1 hour, 45 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  1 hour, 30 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Curried carrot soup recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"><span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Wierd food, very wierd</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">But bloody marvellous - the strange things are often the best!</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\">[[User:Chef|Jerry]] </span></span>\n}}\nA lovely warming [[Soup|soup]] for autumn and winter.  Note that the [[Carrots|carrots]] and [[Onions|onions]] are net weight, ie after peeling.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 175g [[Unsalted butter|unsalted butter]]\n| 220g [[Onions|onions]], chopped\n| 2 bulbs [[Garlic|garlic]], peeled and [[Cloves|cloves]] cut in half if large \n| 500g [[Carrots|carrots]], peeled and chopped into small pieces\n| A pinch each of [[Sugar|sugar]] and [[Salt|salt]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Cumin seeds|cumin seeds]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Nigella|nigella seeds]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Jalfrezi masala|jalfrezi masala]]\n| 800ml [[Vegetable Stock|vegetable stock]]\n| 1 tablespoon chopped [[Green chillies|green chillies]] or a sprig of [[parsley]], to serve\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Melt the [[Butter|butter]] in a saucepan over a low-medium heat.\n| Add the [[Onion|onion]], [[Garlic|garlic]] and [[Carrots|carrots]], and [[Stew|stew]] gently for about 30 minutes until they are soft, but not [[Browned|browned]].\n| Add a pinch of [[Sugar|sugar]] and [[Salt|salt]] and continue cooking until the [[Vegetables|vegetables]] are beginning to caramelise.\n| Meanwhile toast the [[Cumin|cumin]] and [[Nigella|nigella]] [[Seeds|seeds]] in a [[Dry frying|dry frying]] pan until fragrant. \n| Add the [[Toasted|toasted]] [[Seeds|seeds]] and jalfrezi masala to the [[Vegetables|vegetables]] and cook a further 2-3 minutes.\n| Add the [[Vegetable Stock|vegetable stock]] and water and bring to the [[Boil|boil]]. \n| Reduce to a [[Simmer|simmer]] and cook for 30 minutes.\n| [[Blend]] the [[Soup|soup]] in a [[Blender|blender]] until smooth. \n| Season to taste and serve, sprinkled with the chopped [[Chillies|chillies]] or the [[parsley]] sprig.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with a nice hunk of [[Bread|bread]].\n===Recipe source===\n\n* Based on a recipe by '''[http://www.bbc.co.uk/food/recipes/curried_carrot_soup_29946 Michael Caines]'''\n===Variations===\nInstead of stock, use water to which has been added 2 tsps [[Marigold Swiss Bouillon Powder]] or [[Bron's Spanish vegetable stock concentrate (TM)|Bron's Spanish vegetable stock concentrate]] \nUse chopped [[Coriander|coriander]] to garnish if preferred.  Adjust [[Garlic|garlic]] quantity to taste.  Use [[Chicken stock|chicken stock]] if preferred and use any [[Spice|spice]] mix you like.\n===Chef's notes===\nIf it is too thick, add a little more [[stock]] or water.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Carrot soup]]\n[[Category:British recipes|Carrot soup]]\n[[Category:Indian recipes|Carrot soup]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites|Carrot soup]]\n[[Category:Soup and stock recipes|Carrot soup]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes|Carrot soup]]\n[[Category:Starters|Carrot soup]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes|Carrot soup]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes|Carrot soup]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes|Carrot soup]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered|Carrot soup]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#curriedcarrotsoup #garlic #carrots #vegetables #seeds #parsley #vegetablestock #soup #nigella #onions #cumin </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Curried fish pie (TM)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Curried fish pie - A Thermomix recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#fish #potatoes #butter #steaming #potato #nutmeg #currypowder #mashedpotato #bake #cream #thermomix \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This recipe for Thermomix is finished off in the oven\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2273\n|PortionCalories = 568\n|DatePublished=18th January 2013\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = Serves 4 to 6\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 1 hour 15 minutes\n |PrepTime = 15 minutes\n |CookTime = 1 hour\n |Image = [[Image:Curried fish pie recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Fish pie and broccoli</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Perfection, and it rhymes! \ud83d\ude43</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:The fish mixture.jpg|thumb|300px|right|The fish mixture]]\nThis recipe for [[Thermomix]] is finished off in the [[Oven|oven]].\n\n'''For the pie'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsTM\n| 340g [[Milk|milk]]\n| 160g water\n| 500g mixed [[Fish|fish]], cut into chunks - use firm fish such as [[Cod|cod]], [[Haddock|haddock]], [[Monkfish|monkfish]], [[Pollack|pollack]] or [[Salmon|salmon]]\n| [[Juice]] of &frac12; a [[Lemon|lemon]] (optional)\n| 60g [[Butter|butter]] or [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 40g [[Plain flour|plain flour]]\n| 2 teaspoons of [[Marigold Swiss Bouillon Powder]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Curry powder|curry powder]], [[Garam masala|garam masala]] or [[Pakistani basar]] etc\n| 50g baby [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]]\n}}\n'''For the [[Mashed potato|mashed potato]]'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 750g floury [[Potatoes|potatoes]], peeled and cut into 2cm pieces\n| 500g water (if you had more than 400g if [[Fish|fish]] liquid left over from above, you can include this as a part of the water quantity)\n| &frac12; to 1tsp [[Salt|salt]]\n| 40g [[Butter|butter]]\n| 100g of the [[Steaming|steaming]] water\n| &frac12; teaspoons [[Marigold Swiss Bouillon Powder]]\n| 100g [[Milk|milk]] or [[Cream|cream]]\n| &frac12; teaspoons [[Nutmeg|nutmeg]], [[Grated|grated]]\n| Seasoning, to taste\n| A little extra [[Butter|butter]] for dotting\n}}\n===Method===\n\n'''For the pie'''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Put the [[Milk|milk]] and water into the TM bowl and insert the internal [[Steaming|steaming]] basket.\n| Add the [[Fish|fish]] to the basket, with the [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]] (if using) squeezed over it.\n| Cook '''10 minutes / 100\u00b0 / Speed 4'''.\n| Tip out the [[Fish|fish]] liquid and reserve.\n| Set the [[Fish|fish]] aside.\n| Weigh 400g of the [[Fish|fish]] liquid back into the TM bowl, using extra [[Milk|milk]] if necessary to make it up to 400g.\n| Add the [[Butter|butter]] or [[Oil|oil]], [[Flour|flour]], [[Bouillon|bouillon]] powder and the [[Curry powder|curry powder]].\n| Cook '''4 minutes / 100\u00b0 / Speed 4'''.\n| Taste and season if necessary.\n| Return the [[Fish|fish]] to the [[Sauce|sauce]] and add the [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]].\n| Mix '''10 seconds / Speed Spoon / Reverse Blade'''.\n| Transfer into an ovenproof dish, cover and reserve.\n}}\n'''For the [[Mashed potato|mashed potato]]'''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Having washed the TM bowl (no need to wash the basket at this stage), weigh in the water, add the [[Salt|salt]] and insert the basket.\n| Weigh the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] into the basket.\n| Cook '''15 minutes / Temp. Varoma / Speed Spoon'''.\n| Check the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] have been properly cooked and is necessary, cook a few minutes more until tender.\n| Drain the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] and reserve the [[Steaming|steaming]] water.\n| Insert the '''Butterfly Whisk''' and add the butter, [[Steaming|steaming]] water, the [[Stock|stock]] powder, [[Milk|milk]] or [[Cream|cream]], [[Nutmeg|nutmeg]] and seasoning with the [[Potatoes|potatoes]].\n| Mix '''2-10 seconds / Speed 4''' depending on the desired consistency - I find that 4 seconds is about right.\n| Spread the [[Potato|potato]] over the [[Fish|fish]] mixture and make a ridge pattern with a fork.\n| Dot some small pieces of [[Butter|butter]] over the [[Potato|potato]].\n| [[Bake]] at 220\u00b0 C (425\u00b0 F - gas 7), [fan [[Oven|oven]] 200\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour] for 30-40 minutes until golden [[Brown|brown]].\n| '''AGA [[Ovens|ovens]]''':  [[Bake]] 30 minutes on rack set on lowest set of runners in the [[Roasting]] [[Oven]].\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Steamed|steamed]] [[Peas|peas]] or [[Broccoli|broccoli]].\n===Recipe source===\n* Lightly adapted from '''Fast and Easy Cooking''', the [[Thermomix]] UK recipe book.\n===Variations===\nYou can also use [[Prawns|prawns]] or [[scallops]] in place of the some of the [[Fish|fish]].  You can cover with [[Puff pastry|puff pastry]] instead of [[Potato|potato]] if preferred.  Add some [[Garlic|garlic]] and/or [[onion]] - this will need be [[saut\u00e9ed]] in the TM bowl '''before''' [[steaming]] the [[fish]].\n===Chef's notes===\nUsually I find that the [[potatoes]] need cooking for 20 minutes.  It is best to allow the [[fish]] mixture to cool (covered), before adding the [[potato]] or it will sink too much into the [[fish]] [[sauce]].\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes]]\n[[Category:Sea fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Thermomix recipes]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#fish #potatoes #butter #steaming #potato #nutmeg #currypowder #mashedpotato #bake #cream #thermomix </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Curried lamb shanks (slow cooker recipe)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Curried lamb shanks: A slow cooker recipe from Cookipedia\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#onions #lambshanks #slowcooker #currypowder #gravy #beefstock #muscovadosugar #guinness #manhattan #oliveoil #chili \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=I was thumbing through some old cookbooks, this recipe jumped out at me from my 1986 \"The Manhattan Chili Co. Southwest American Cookbook\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1095\n|PortionCalories = 547\n|DatePublished=6th April 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = The rescued version of this dish, served as a normal roast dinner!\n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  5 hours, 30 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  5 hours, 15 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Chilied lamb shanks recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Superb</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I wish I could have tried the New York version too.</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The&nbsp;Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nOnly this morning we mentioned that we hadn't had [[Lamb shanks|lamb shanks]] for a while, then this afternoon as I was thumbing through some old cookbooks, this recipe jumped out at me from my 1986 \"The [[Manhattan]] [[Chili]] Co. Southwest American Cookbook.  I have amended it to use a [[slow cooker]] and for once, used commercial [[curry powder]] rather than a homemade blend.\n\n===Update===\nThe ingredients shown below have been much reduced from the original recipe because, to my taste, it was almost bitter.  To rescue the meal, I discarded all of the original gravy and served it with potatoes, carrots, peas and a normal [[onion gravy]].  It still had a little of the curry bite so was not a complete disaster. The lamb shanks were perfectly cooked and delicious.\n\nIf you do make this, taste the gravy and adjust the seasoning before the extended cooking period.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 100 ml [[olive oil]]\n| 2 [[Lamb shanks|lamb shanks]]\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] & [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 2 [[Onions|onions]], peeled and sliced\n| 1 bulb of [[Garlic, peeled and crushed|garlic, peeled and crushed]]\n| 2 teaspoons of [[curry powder]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Cumin seeds|cumin seeds]], lightly [[Toasted|toasted]] and finely [[Ground|ground]]\n| 1 teaspoon of [[Dried|dried]] [[Mexican oregano]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[muscovado sugar]]\n| 1 tin peeled [[Plum tomatoes|plum tomatoes]]\n| 330 ml [[Guinness]] (1 bottle)\n| 100 ml [[Beef Stock|beef stock]]\n| ''optional'' - 2 teaspoons [[Exotic chilli powders|mild chilli powder]] (''guajillo'')\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Curried lamb shanks.jpg|300px|thumb|right|After 4 hours slow cooking\nImage:Manhattan Chili Co - Goodbye.jpg|thumb|300px|right|The Manhattan Chili Co is now closed.\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| In a large flameproof [[Casserole|casserole]] or [[Dutch Oven|dutch oven]], heat 100 ml of [[olive oil]], when hot add a good pinch of [[Black pepper|black pepper]] and  [[Brown|brown]] the [[Lamb shank|lamb shank]] really well on all sides, this should take around 15 minutes.\n| Sprinkle the [[Lamb shanks|lamb shanks]] with a pinch of [[Salt|salt]] and pop them in the [[slow cooker]].  Discard the used [[Oil|oil]].\n| Return the pan to a low heat, add the remaining [[Oil|oil]] and the [[Garlic|garlic]] and the [[Onions|onions]], cover and saut\u00e9 for 15 minutes stirring now and then.\n| Add the [[Chillies|chillies]], [[Chilli powder|chilli powder]], [[Oregano|oregano]] and [[Cumin|cumin]] and [[Stir-fry|stir-fry]] uncovered for 5 minutes.\n| Chop the [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]] with a sharp knife while they are still in the can.\n| Add them to the [[Onions|onions]] together with the [[Guinness]], [[Beef Stock|beef stock]], 1/2 a teaspoon of [[Sea Salt|sea salt]],[[muscovado sugar]] and stir well.\n| Add everything to the slow cooker, set to medium and cook for 5 hours, covered.\n| After 5 hours, remove the lamb shanks and keep warm\n| Test the gravy for seasoning, if you need it hotter, spice it up with your favourite [[chili sauce]].\n| Pour the cooking [[Liquor|liquor]] through a [[Sieve|sieve]] and press out all of the juices, discard the solids.\n| Add the [[Strained|strained]] [[Gravy|gravy]] to the [[Casserole|casserole]] over a high heat and to bring it to the [[Boil|boil]].  For the next 15 minutes, reduce this by one third by stirring, [[Boiling|boiling]] and skimming.\n| Serve the lamb shanks with the hot [[Gravy|gravy]].\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Rice|rice]] and freshly [[Grilled|grilled]] [[Sweetcorn|sweet corn]].\n===Recipe source===\n* The [[Manhattan]] [[Chili]] Co. Southwest American Cookbook\n* The Manhattan Chili Co. has now closed, see image above. Feb 2016. The url was www.manhattanchili.com.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:North American recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Cooking with beer]]\n[[Category:Chilli pepper recipes]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Lamb recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Slow cooker recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#onions #lambshanks #slowcooker #currypowder #gravy #beefstock #muscovadosugar #guinness #manhattan #oliveoil #chili </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Curried lentil and vegetable soup",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Curried lentil and vegetable soup a British recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#curriedlentilandvegetablesoup #vegetables #brusselssprouts #onions #lentils #swede #garlic #carrots #spice #diced #soup \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This substantial soup has been adapted from Mrs Maureen Kirkland's recipe for Rumpy-pumpy soup which appears in The Hairy Bikers' book, Mum's Know\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1919\n|PortionCalories = 479\n|DatePublished=17th January 2013\n|Author = JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 45 minutes\n |PrepTime = 15 minutes\n |CookTime = 30 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Curried lentil and vegetable soup recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n===Recipe review===\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Nice as a starter</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Heart-warming food</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> - [[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]] </span></span>\n}}\n\nThis substantial [[Soup|soup]] has been adapted from Mrs Maureen Kirkland's recipe for ''Rumpy-pumpy soup'' which appears in The Hairy Bikers' book, '''Mum's Know Best''' (ISBN 0297860267).  Maureen's original recipe was created as a way to get her children to eat [[Vegetables|vegetables]] in disguise, but my adaptation is slightly more gutsy.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 2 tablespoons [[Peanut|peanut]] or other [[Oil|oil]]\n| 1 large Spanish [[Onions|onion]], peeled and [[Diced|diced]]\n| 4 bulbs [[Garlic|garlic]], peeled and [[Diced|diced]]\n| 300 g [[Carrots|carrots]], scraped and sliced\n| 220 g [[Swede|swede]], peeled and cubed\n| 550 g [[Potatoes|potatoes]]\n| A pinch of sugar\n| 150 g orange [[Lentils|lentils]]\n| 1&frac12; teaspoons [[curry spice mix]] 1\n| 4 teaspoons [[curry spice mix]] 2\n| 1.4 [[Litres|litres]] [[Beef Stock|beef stock]]\n| 350 g [[Brussels sprouts|Brussels sprouts]], trimmed and cleaned\n| Seasoning\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Heat the [[Oil|oil]] over a high heat in a large pan.\n| Add the [[Onions|onions]], [[Garlic|garlic]], [[Carrots|carrots]], [[Swede|swede]] and [[Potatoes|potatoes]], reduce the heat to low and stir.\n| Cover, and allow to [[Stew|stew]] until the [[Onions|onions]] are soft.  Add the sugar and cook until parts of the vegetables are slightly brown.\n| Stir in the [[Lentils|lentils]] and [[Spice|spice]] mixes and cook for about a minute.\n| Add the [[Stock|stock]] and [[Brussels sprouts]], bring to the [[Boil|boil]] and allow to [[Simmer|simmer]] until all the [[Vegetables|vegetables]] are cooked.\n| Season to taste.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nThis can be served as a first course, or it would make an excellent lunch if served with some homemade [[Bread|bread]] and [[Salad|salad]].\n===Variations===\nUse different [[Vegetables|vegetables]], according to season and vary the type of [[Spice|spice]] mix by using [[Jerk seasoning|jerk seasoning]].  Froxen  [[Tex-Mex]] spice mix etc.  Frozen [[Brussels sprouts]] are fine, but add them about 10 minutes before the end of the stimated cooking time.  The [[soup]] can be left as it is or can be liquidised.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Curried lentil and vegetable soup]]\n[[Category:British recipes|Curried lentil and vegetable soup]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes|Curried lentil and vegetable soup]]\n[[Category:Grain and bean recipes|Curried lentil and vegetable soup]]\n[[Category:Main courses|Curried lentil and vegetable soup]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes|Curried lentil and vegetable soup]]\n[[Category:Soup and stock recipes|Curried lentil and vegetable soup]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes|Curried lentil and vegetable soup]]\n[[Category:Starters|Curried lentil and vegetable soup]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes|Curried lentil and vegetable soup]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#curriedlentilandvegetablesoup #vegetables #brusselssprouts #onions #lentils #swede #garlic #carrots #spice #diced #soup </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Curried lentil and vegetable soup a vegetarian recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#vegetables #onions #brusselssprouts #soup #curryspicemix #lentils #garlic #spice #diced #potatoes #swede \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This substantial soup has been adapted from Mrs Maureen Kirkland's recipe for Rumpy-pumpy soup which appears in The Hairy Bikers' book\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1919\n|PortionCalories = 479\n|DatePublished=17th January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 45 minutes\n |PrepTime = 15 minutes\n |CookTime = 30 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Curried lentil and vegetable soup recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">A bit thick</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">3</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">or it was for me anyway</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}} \nThis substantial [[Soup|soup]] has been adapted from Mrs Maureen Kirkland's recipe for ''Rumpy-pumpy soup'' which appears in The Hairy Bikers' book, '''Mum's Know Best''' (ISBN 0297860267).  Maureen's original recipe was created as a way to get her children to eat [[Vegetables|vegetables]], but my adaptation is more gutsy.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 2 tablespoons [[Peanut|peanut]] or other [[Oil|oil]]\n| 1 large Spanish [[Onions|onion]], peeled and [[Diced|diced]]\n| 4 bulbs [[Garlic|garlic]], peeled and [[Diced|diced]]\n| 300 g [[Carrots|carrots]], scraped and sliced\n| 220 g [[Swede|swede]], peeled and cubed\n| 550 g [[Potatoes|potatoes]]\n| A pinch of sugar\n| 150 g [[Orange|orange]] [[Lentils|lentils]]\n| 1&frac12; teaspoons [[curry spice mix]] 1\n| 4 teaspoons [[curry spice mix]] 2\n| 1.4 [[Litres|litres]] [[Vegetable Stock|vegetable stock]]\n| 350 g [[Brussels sprouts|Brussels sprouts]], trimmed and cleaned\n| Seasoning\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Heat the [[Oil|oil]] over a high heat in a large pan.\n| Add the [[Onions|onions]], [[Garlic|garlic]], [[Carrots|carrots]], [[Swede|swede]] and [[Potatoes|potatoes]], reduce the heat to low and stir.\n| Cover, and allow to [[Stew|stew]] until the [[Onions|onions]] are soft.  Add the sugar and cook until parts of the vegetables are slightly brown.\n| Stir in the [[Lentils|lentils]] and [[Spice|spice]] mixes and cook for about a minute.\n| Add the [[Stock|stock]] and [[Brussels sprouts|brussels sprouts]], bring to the [[Boil|boil]] and allow to [[Simmer|simmer]] until all the [[Vegetables|vegetables]] are cooked.\n| Season to taste.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nThis can be served as a first course, or it would make an excellent lunch if served with some homemade [[Bread|bread]] and [[Salad|salad]].\n===Variations===\nUse different [[Vegetables|vegetables]], according to season and vary the type of [[Spice|spice]] mix by using [[Jerk seasoning|jerk seasoning]].  Froxen  [[Tex-Mex]] spice mix etc.  Frozen [[Brussels sprouts]] are fine, but add them about 10 minutes before the end of the stimated cooking time.  The [[soup]] can be left as it is or can be liquidised.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Curried lentil and vegetable soup]]\n[[Category:British recipes|Curried lentil and vegetable soup]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes|Curried lentil and vegetable soup]]\n[[Category:Grain and bean recipes|Curried lentil and vegetable soup]]\n[[Category:Main courses|Curried lentil and vegetable soup]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes|Curried lentil and vegetable soup]]\n[[Category:Soup and stock recipes|Curried lentil and vegetable soup]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes|Curried lentil and vegetable soup]]\n[[Category:Starters|Curried lentil and vegetable soup]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes|Curried lentil and vegetable soup]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes|Curried lentil and vegetable soup]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#vegetables #onions #brusselssprouts #soup #curryspicemix #lentils #garlic #spice #diced #potatoes #swede </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

You could cook them in the [[Curry|curry]] as it is being slow cooked if you wished.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 portion of [[Curry sauce|curry sauce]]\n| 1 can peeled chopped [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]]\n| Half a can of [[Coconut Milk]]\n| 360g of [[Oxford sausages]] (about 5 large ones)\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Cook the [[Sausages|sausages]] for 15 minutes at 180\u00b0 C in your [[Air Fryer]] - I used a silicone tray as it makes less mess.\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Place the [[Curry sauce|curry sauce]], chopped [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]] and\n}}\n\n===Serving suggestions===\nWent well with [[Rice|rice]], [[pittas]] and a [[broccoli]]\n===Chef's notes===\n[[Freeze]] the other half of the [[Coconut Milk|coconut milk]] to use in the same recipe at a later date.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Indian recipes]]\n[[Category:Thai recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Beef recipes]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Air fried recipes]]\n[[Category:Slow cooked]]\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#sausages #veal #cornmeal #egg #pork #sausage #grated #burgers #oxfordsausages #mince #eggrecipes</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
