title": "Curry sauce",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Curry sauce\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#currysauce #dried #tomatoes #onions #coconutmilk #fish #kidneybeans #fry #paprikapowder #garammasala #slowcooker \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=The result of 20 years curry sauce experiments, at last, Perfection!\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=5th November 2018\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Curry sauce, served with roasted butternut squash and pitta bread\n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  5 hours, 15 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  5 hours\n|TotalCalories = 3298\n|PortionCalories = 824\n|Image = [[Image:Curry sauce recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Perfection</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I now make this in large batches and freeze it in plastic coffee cups, one cup per person. So easy!</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n===Note to self===\nDon't forget there is now the industrial version - tried and tested, [[Curry Sauce 6 litres|makes 6 litres of curry sauce, ready to freeze]].\n----\nI have now made this curry sauce recipe around twenty times and I think it is now perfect. It is our 'go to' recipe for curries.  Give it a try!\n\nThe recipe below makes about 1500 grams of curry sauce which we split into three 500 gram portions and vacuum seal and freeze for later use. A 500g portion is ideal for two people once meat or fish is added.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 tablespoon of [[ghee]]\n| 2  tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| big pinch of [[Ground black pepper|ground black pepper]]\n| 2 medium [[Onions|onions]], peeled and sliced\n| 5 [[Cloves of garlic|cloves of garlic]], peeled and thinly sliced\n| 1 can of [[Coconut milk|coconut milk]]\n| 2 cans of chopped [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]]\n| 1 teaspoon of [[malt vinegar]] - '''no more!'''\n| 1 can of drained mixed beans or [[Kidney beans|kidney beans]]\n| 2 heaped teaspoons of Hot Madras [[Curry powder|curry powder]]\n| 1 heaped teaspoon of [[Hot chilli powder|hot chilli powder]]\n| 1 heaped teaspoon of [[Turmeric powder|turmeric powder]]\n| 1 heaped teaspoon of [[paprika powder]]\n| 1 teaspoon of whole [[Fenugreek seeds|fenugreek seeds]]\n| 1 tablespoon of [[Muscovado sugar|muscovado sugar]]\n| 3 teaspoons of [[Dried|dried]] [[Parsley|parsley]]\n| 1 teaspoon of [[Vegetable Stock|vegetable stock]] powder\n| 2 pinches of [[garam masala]]\n| &#189; teaspoon of [[Sea Salt|sea salt]]\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Indian_Curry_Sauce_3_Vac-sealed_bags.jpg|This recipe makes just about 3 x 500g [2 person] bags, ideal for freezing\nImage:Indian_Curry_Sauce_After_Cooking.jpg|Curry sauce after slow-cooking for 5 hours\nImage:Indian_Curry_Sauce_Before_Cooking.jpg|Curry sauce, ready to cook\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Mix all of the [[Dried|dried]] ingredients together so they can be added in one go\n| In a [[Wok|wok]], [[Fry|fry]] the [[Onions|onions]] for 5 minutes over a medium heat\n| Add the sliced [[Garlic|garlic]] and [[Stir fry|stir fry]] for a minute or so\n| Stir in all of the [[Dried|dried]] ingredients and mix well\n| Immediately add the vinegar, tinned [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]], [[Coconut milk|coconut milk]] and [[Kidney beans|kidney beans]]\n| Mix well and add to the [[Slow Cooker|slow cooker]] on a low setting\n| Slow cook for 5 hours\n| Blend to a fine sauce using a [[stick blender]].\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\n500g [[lamb neck fillet]] cut into cubes and slow cooked; low setting, for 5+ hours, makes the best lamb curry.\n\nWe served this with [[Roasted|roasted]] [[Butternut squash|butternut squash]], [[Baked|baked]] for 90 minutes at 200\u00b0 C\n===Variations===\nThis works as a [[Vegetarian|vegetarian]] [[Curry|curry]] [[Sauce|sauce]] but would work equally well with [[Meat|meat]] or [[Fish|fish]].\n\nI would be inclined to add any [[Meat|meat]] at the start of the slow-cooking process, but I would add [[Fish|fish]] or [[Prawns|prawns]] just for the final hour, to prevent over cooking.\n\n===Quantities for freezing===\nWe [[vacuum seal]] the curry sauce in packets of around 500g which are good for two people once meat or vegetables are added.  If you were making double quantities of this recipe you can make six 420g bags of curry sauce for the freezer.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Indian recipes]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Chilli pepper recipes]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Slow cooker recipes]]\n[[Category:Stewed, braised or pot roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#currysauce #dried #tomatoes #onions #coconutmilk #fish #kidneybeans #fry #paprikapowder #garammasala #slowcooker </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

#paprikapowder #garammasala #slowcooker #cateringquantity #industrial \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This is the catering version of my famous curry sauce\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=26th May 2020\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Just some of the ingredients!\n|Servings = Serves 24\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  7 hours, 30 minutes\n|PrepTime =  30 minutes\n|CookTime =  7 hours\n|TotalCalories = 3298\n|PortionCalories = 138\n|Image = [[Image:Curry sauce catering size recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Perfection!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">We must eat a lot of curry - I make this every 3 months!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry]]</span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Indian_Industrial_Curry_Sauce_Before_Cooking.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Catering Sized Curry sauce, ready to cook]]\nThis is the catering version of my [[curry sauce]] recipe that has been perfected over many, many years.\n\nIt's basically three times the quantity of the original recipe with a few extra ingredients.\n\nThis should make around 6 litres of curry sauce.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 3 tablespoons of [[ghee]]\n| 6  tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 1 teaspoon of of [[Ground black pepper|ground black pepper]]\n| 8 medium [[Onions|onions]], peeled and sliced\n| 21 [[Cloves of garlic|cloves of garlic]], peeled and thinly sliced\n| 1 can of [[Coconut milk|coconut milk]]\n| 1 packet of [[coconut block]], oily residue discarded\n| 1 catering can of chopped [[tomatoes]] [2.55 kg]\n| 1 400g can of [[chickpeas]], drained\n| 1 tablespoon of [[malt vinegar]]\n| 6 heaped teaspoons of Hot Madras [[Curry powder|curry powder]]\n| 4 heaped teaspoons of extra hot [[Chilli powder]]\n| 3 heaped teaspoons of [[Turmeric powder|turmeric powder]]\n| 3 heaped teaspoons of [[paprika powder]]\n| 3 teaspoons of whole [[Fenugreek seeds|fenugreek seeds]]\n| 3 tablespoons of [[Jaggery]]\n| 9 teaspoons of [[Dried|dried]] [[Parsley|parsley]]\n| 3 teaspoons [[Taste Sensation Lime Juice Powder]]\n| 1 [[Vegetable Stock|vegetable stock]] cube\n| 1 teaspoon [[garam masala]]\n| 2 teaspoons [[Sea Salt|sea salt]]\n| 250 ml boiling water\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Mix all of the [[Dried|dried]] ingredients together so they can be added in one go.\n| Using the 'StoveTop' option of the [[slow cooker]] fry the chopped [[onions]] in the [[olive oil]], [[ghee]] and [[black pepper]].\nIn a [[Wok|wok]], [[Fry|fry]] the [[Onions|onions]] for 5 minutes over a medium heat.\n| Add the sliced [[Garlic|garlic]] and [[Stir fry|stir fry]] for a minute or so.\n| Stir in all of the [[Dried|dried]] ingredients and mix well.\n| Immediately add the vinegar, tinned [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]] and [[Coconut]] products.\n| Mix well and add to the [[Slow Cooker|slow cooker]] on a low setting.\n| Slow cook for 5 to 7 hours, add extra water if needed.\n| Blend to a fine sauce using a [[stick blender]].\n}}\n\n===Quantities for freezing===\nWe [[vacuum seal]] the curry sauce in packets of around 500g which are good for two people once meat or vegetables are added.  If you were making double quantities of this recipe you can make six 420g bags of curry sauce for the freezer.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Indian recipes]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Chilli pepper recipes]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Slow cooker recipes]]\n[[Category:Stewed, braised or pot roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#currysauce #dried #tomatoes #onions #coconutmilk #fish #kidneybeans #fry #paprikapowder #garammasala #slowcooker #cateringquantity #industrial</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

A must for mince pies and jam roly poly\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 675\n|PortionCalories = 168\n|DatePublished=20th January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4 - Make 1 pint of custard\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime = 20 minutes\n|PrepTime = 5 minutes\n|CookTime = 15 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Custard recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Worth the effort</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.8</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">The flavour added by using a vanilla pod is amazing. A must for [[mince pies]] and [[jam roly poly]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 570 ml (1 pint) of [[milk]]\n| 55 ml (2 fl oz) [[single cream]]\n| 1 [[vanilla pod]] or &frac12; teaspoons [[vanilla extract]]\n| 4 [[egg yolks]]\n| 30 g (1 oz) [[caster sugar]]\n| 2 teaspoons [[cornflour]]\n| [[Grated]] [[nutmeg]] (optional)\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Heat the [[milk]], [[cream]] and [[vanilla pod]] to a slow [[simmer]]\n| In a separate large bowl, vigorously whisk the [[egg yolks]], [[sugar]] and [[cornflour]] (and [[vanilla extract]] if used)\n| Pour the [[milk]] into the [[egg]] mixture, whisking all the while\n| Return the mixture to the pan and stir until thickened.  Check that it does not stick to the bottom of the pan\n| Pour into a serving jug\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\n\nServe immediately whilst still hot with a small grating of fresh [[nutmeg]] if liked\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#custard #vanillapod #vanillaextract #eggyolks #nutmeg #cornflour #grated #jamrolypoly #mincepies #castersugar #egg </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

I'll leave it to you to decide which is best.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 450 g (1 lb) cooking [[Apples|apples]]\n| 50 g (2 oz) [[Walnuts|walnuts]]\n| 100 g (4 oz) stoned [[Dates|dates]]\n| 100 g (4 oz) [[Wholemeal flour|wholemeal flour]] (see notes)\n| 100 g (4 oz) [[muscovado sugar]] or [[Jaggery|jaggery]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Honey|honey]]\n| 25g (1 oz) [[Butter|butter]], melted\n| 1 [[Free range egg|free range egg]]\n| Pinch of [[Salt|salt]]\n\n}}\n\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6), [fan [[Oven|oven]] 180\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Peel, core and [[Dice|dice]] the [[Apples|apples]]\n| Chop the [[Dates|dates]] and crush the [[Walnuts|walnuts]]\n| Add all the ingredients to a mixing bowl and mix until combined well\n| Spread the mixture into a lightly greased 20 cm (8\") square shallow [[Baking tray|baking tray]]\n| Bake for 30 minutes or until golden brown\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nCut into squares and server warm with [[Soured cream|soured cream]]\n\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#dateandapplesquares #walnuts #apples #dates #miseenplace #butter #cookery #bakingtray #wholemealflour #freerangeegg #unusualrecipes </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

It works well as a packed lunch, so we usually make double the amount.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n}}\n====salad====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 2 [[Wholemeal|wholemeal]] [[Tortillas|tortillas]] \n| 4 [[Spring onions|spring onions]], whites parts only, finely chopped \n| 2 [[Avocados|avocados]], peeled and cut into chunks \n| \u00bd [[Cucumber|cucumber]], peeled, de-seeded and cut into thick slices \n| 400g can black (turtle) [[Beans|beans]], drained and rinsed \n| 100g [[Feta cheese|feta cheese]], crumbled \n| 8 [[Mint leaves|mint leaves]], torn \n}}\n====dressing====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 4 tablespoons of [[Olive oil|olive oil]] (or [[Avocado oil|avocado oil]]) \n| [[Juice]] of 1 [[Lime|lime]] \n| A pinch of [[sugar]] or a 8g of [[Agave syrup|agave syrup]]\n| 1 tablespoon chopped [[Dill|dill]] \n| 1 tablespoon chopped [[Mint|mint]] \n| 1 teaspoon finely chopped [[Coriander|coriander]] stalks \n| 1 [[Red chilli|red chilli]], deseeded and finely chopped \n| 1 teaspoon [[Chipotle|chipotle]] [[Sauce|sauce]] (or [[Smoked paprika|smoked paprika]]) \n| [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| First of all, blitz together the dressing ingredients together, and adjust the [[Chipotle|chipotle]] and sweet/sour balance to taste \n| Mix the [[Spring onions|spring onions]], [[Avocado|avocado]], [[Black beans|black beans]] and [[Cucumber|cucumber]] with the dressing in a large bowl. \n| Cut the [[Tortillas|tortillas]] into 1cm strips. [[Dry fry]] in a pan until [[Browned|browned]] on all sides. \n| Divide the [[Salad|salad]] mixture between 4 plates, and top with the [[Feta|feta]] and [[Tortillas|tortillas]]\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:North American recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Grain and bean recipes]]\n[[Category:Salad recipes]]\n[[Category:Nik and Edwina's Cookbook recipes]]\n[[Category:Uncooked]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#tortillas #springonions #cucumber #chipotle #deconstructedtortillasalad #agavesyrup #browned #beans #avocadooil #dryfry #wholemeal </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Devilled kidneys",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Devilled kidneys, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#devilledkidneys #parsley #tomatopuree #flour #mustardpowder #chilipowder #worcestershiresauce #redwine #butter #frying #sauce \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A classic Victorian breakfast dish that's also good for a light lunch. Bring it back into fashion, it's brilliant!\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 754\n|PortionCalories = 188\n|DatePublished=20th January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime = 25 minutes\n|PrepTime = 10 minutes\n|CookTime = 15 minutes \n|Image = [[Image:Devilled kidneysII.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"><span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">I just LOVE this recipe!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Fabulous.  I'm sure it can be hotter, but it's nice and warming.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\">[[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nA classic Victorian breakfast dish that's also good for a light lunch.  Bring it back into fashion, it's brilliant!\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 8 Lamb's kidneys; washed & [[dried]], skinned, cored and roughly chopped\n| 1 tablespoon [[plain flour]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[mustard powder]]\n| Pinch of  [[chili powder]] (or to taste)\n| [[Sea salt]] and [[freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[red wine]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[tomato puree]]\n| 2 tablespoons water\n| 1 teaspoon [[Worcestershire sauce]]\n| 50 g (2 oz) [[butter]]\n| 4 Slices of hot buttered wholemeal toast\n| Chopped [[parsley]] to garnish\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Mix the [[tomato puree]], [[red wine]], [[Worcestershire sauce]] and water together\n| Add the [[chili powder]], [[mustard powder]], [[salt]] and [[pepper]] to the [[flour]] and mix well\n| Roll the chopped kidney in the seasoned [[flour]] to coat well\n| Heat the [[butter]] in a [[frying]] pan and when sizzling, add the kidneys and cook for about 5 minutes, stirring often\n| Add the [[sauce]] to the cooked kidneys, simmer, stirring well.  It's ready to serve once the sauce has reduced and thickened a little.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\n\nServe on hot buttered toast, garnished with chopped [[parsley]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Kidneys]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes|Kidneys]]\n[[Category:Lamb recipes|Kidneys]]\n[[Category:Main courses|Kidneys]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes|Kidneys]]\n[[Category:Offal recipes|Kidneys]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes|Kidneys]]\n[[Category:Starters|Kidneys]]\n[[Category:British recipes|Kidneys]]\n[[Category:Cooking with wine]]\n[[Category:Breakfast recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#devilledkidneys #parsley #tomatopuree #flour #mustardpowder #chilipowder #worcestershiresauce #redwine #butter #frying #sauce </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }

                "revisions": [

                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Dragon Cheddar cheese, tomato and chicken papparedelle recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#pasta #chicken #oliveoil #grated #tomatoes #southcaernarfoncreameries #thymeleaves #cheese #dragoncheddarcheesetomatoandchickenpapparedelle #vegetarian #bake \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A great cheese, chicken and pasta recipe from South Caernarfon Creameries, the award winning Welsh cheese makers.\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=16th September 2016\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 6\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  45 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime =  35 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 3142\n|PortionCalories = 523\n|Image = [[Image:Dragon Cheddar cheese, tomato and chicken papparedelle recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Cheese and chicken</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I love the idea of this</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nA great [[Cheese|cheese]], [[Chicken|chicken]] and [[Pasta|pasta]] recipe from [[South Caernarfon Creameries]], the award winning [[Welsh cheese]] makers.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 500g [1lb] pappardelle or [[Tagliatelle|tagliatelle]] [[Pasta|pasta]]\n| 2 tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 2 [[Cloves|cloves]] [[Garlic|garlic]]\n| 8 [[Plum tomatoes|plum tomatoes]]\n| 2 [[Chicken breasts|chicken breasts]] thinly sliced (for [[Vegetarian|vegetarian]] version omit [[Chicken|chicken]] and add some [[Roasted peppers|roasted peppers]])\n| 1 tablespoon [[Thyme leaves|thyme leaves]]\n| 200g [7oz] Dragon Mature [[Cheddar cheese]], [[Grated|grated]]\n| [[Freshly ground black pepper]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Set your [[Oven|oven]]  to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4), [fan oven 160\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Cut [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]] in half and arrange on a [[Baking sheet|baking sheet]]. Drizzle with 1 tablespoon of [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and sprinkle with the [[Thyme leaves|thyme leaves]]. [[Bake]] for 20 minutes.\n| [[Stir fry]] [[Chicken|chicken]] in 1 tablespoon [[Olive oil|olive oil]] until cooked through\n| Cook [[Pasta|pasta]] in [[Boiling|boiling]] [[Salted|salted]] water until [[Al dente|al dente]] (follow packet instructions)\n| Drain [[Pasta|pasta]], place in a [[Baking|baking]] dish. Stir through [[Chicken|chicken]] and arrange [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]] on top.\n| Sprinkle over [[Grated|grated]] [[Cheese|cheese]] and place under a hot [[Grill|grill]] to melt cheese.\n| Season with [[Black pepper|black pepper]] and serve with a [[Green salad|green salad]].\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Dragon mature Welsh cheddar cheese.jpg|thumb|300px|right|[http://www.dragonwales.co.uk/products/cheddar/mature/ Dragon mature Welsh cheddar cheese]\nImage:Dragon reduced fat mature Welsh cheddar cheese.jpg|thumb|300px|right|[http://www.dragonwales.co.uk/products/cheddar/mature-reduced-fat/ Dragon reduced fat mature Welsh cheddar cheese]\n</gallery>\n===Variations===\nFor a reduced fat version, use [[Dragon reduced fat mature Welsh cheddar cheese]]\n\n{{Template:Dragon cheese attribution}}\n\n==See also==\n* [[Dragon mature Welsh cheddar cheese]]\n* [[Dragon reduced fat mature Welsh cheddar cheese]]\n* [[South Caernarfon Creameries]]\n\n{{Template:YoutubePastaDough}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Pasta recipes]]\n[[Category:Poultry recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Grilled, griddled or barbecued]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n[[Category:Dragon cheese recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#pasta #chicken #oliveoil #grated #tomatoes #southcaernarfoncreameries #thymeleaves #cheese #dragoncheddarcheesetomatoandchickenpapparedelle #vegetarian #bake </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Dragon Cheddar cheese and leek pate",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Dragon Cheddar cheese and leek pate recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#dragoncheddarcheeseandleekpate #leek #worcestershiresauce #cheese #foodprocessor #southcaernarfoncreameries #leeks #pate #puree #butter #blackpepper \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=An unusual recipe for a cheese pate with leeks using Dragon mature Welsh cheddar cheese from South Caernarfon Creameries.\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=18th September 2016\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 6\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  2 hours, 15 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  2 hours\n|TotalCalories = 829\n|PortionCalories = 138\n|Image = [[Image:Dragon Cheddar cheese and leek pate recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Cheese pate?</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.9</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">That is a new one on me!</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nAn unusual recipe for a [[Cheese|cheese]] [[Pate|pate]] with [[Leeks|leeks]] using [[Dragon mature Welsh cheddar cheese]] from [[South Caernarfon Creameries]].\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 15g [[Unsalted butter|unsalted butter]]\n| 1 large [[Leek|leek]], trimmed and finely chopped\n| 3 tablespoons half-[[Fat|fat]] cr\u00e8me fraiche or [[Single Cream|single cream]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Wholegrain mustard|wholegrain mustard]]\n| Dash of [[Worcestershire sauce]]\n| [[Ground black pepper]]\n| 140g [[Dragon mature Welsh cheddar cheese]] or block chopped in a [[Food processor|food processor]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Melt the [[Butter|butter]] in a [[Frying pan|frying pan]] until bubbling, add [[Leek|leek]] and saut\u00e9 until [[Leeks|leeks]] are tender and cooked through\n| Add the cr\u00e8me fraiche, [[Mustard|mustard]], [[Worcestershire sauce]] and some [[Black pepper|black pepper]]. Stir well and cook uncovered to reduce liquid slightly.\n| Transfer the mixture to a [[Blender|blender]] or [[Food processor|food processor]], add the [[Cheese|cheese]] and [[Puree|puree]] in short bursts until smooth.\n| Pour into a shallow serving dish and chill for at least 2 hours.\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Dragon mature Welsh cheddar cheese.jpg|thumb|300px|right|[http://www.dragonwales.co.uk/products/cheddar/mature/ Dragon mature Welsh cheddar cheese]\nImage:Dragon reduced fat mature Welsh cheddar cheese.jpg|thumb|300px|right|[http://www.dragonwales.co.uk/products/cheddar/mature-reduced-fat/ Dragon reduced fat mature Welsh cheddar cheese]\n</gallery>\n===Serving suggestions===\nSprinkle with fresh chopped [[Chives|chives]] and serve with [[Dragon Cheddar cheese and leek pate]] or crusty [[Bread|bread]].\n===Variations===\nUse [[Dragon reduced fat mature Welsh cheddar cheese]] if you are watching your calories!\n{{Template:Dragon cheese attribution}}\n==See also==\n* [[Dragon mature Welsh cheddar cheese]]\n* [[Dragon reduced fat mature Welsh cheddar cheese]]\n* [[South Caernarfon Creameries]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Dips and sauces]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n[[Category:Dragon cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#dragoncheddarcheeseandleekpate #leek #worcestershiresauce #cheese #foodprocessor #southcaernarfoncreameries #leeks #pate #puree #butter #blackpepper </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

read-rolled [[Puff pastry|puff pastry]] into a delicious [[Snack|snack]] or [[Aperitif|aperitif]].\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 320g ready rolled [[Puff pastry|puff pastry]]\n| 190g jar of green [[Pesto|pesto]]\n| 2 [[Red peppers|red peppers]] deseeded and sliced\n| 100g [[Dragon mature Welsh cheddar cheese]], [[Grated|grated]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Olive oil]]\n| Fresh [[Basil leaves|basil leaves]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 220\u00b0 C (425\u00b0 F - gas 7), [fan oven 200\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Toss [[Peppers|peppers]] in [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and [[Roast|roast]] for 10 minutes on a [[Baking sheet|baking sheet]] (also great with [[Courgettes|courgettes]] and [[Red onions|red onions]])\n| Cut [[Pastry|pastry]] into 4 squares and place on a [[Baking sheet|baking sheet]] that has been dampened with cold water\n| Spread each [[Pastry|pastry]] square with [[Pesto|pesto]]\n| Arrange [[Roasted peppers|roasted peppers]] over the top and sprinkle with [[Cheddar|cheddar]]\n| [[Bake]] for 12-14 minutes until [[Pastry|pastry]] is risen and topping is lightly [[Browned|browned]]\n}}\n\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Dragon mature Welsh cheddar cheese.jpg|thumb|300px|right|[http://www.dragonwales.co.uk/products/cheddar/mature/ Dragon mature Welsh cheddar cheese]\nImage:Dragon reduced fat mature Welsh cheddar title": "Dragon Welsh cheddar cheese and butternut squash soup",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Dragon Welsh cheddar cheese and butternut squash soup recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#soup #chives #dragonwelshcheddarcheeseandbutternutsquashsoup #butternutsquash #saucepan #squash #boil #butter #onion #southcaernarfoncreameries #cheese \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Butternut squash makes a superb soup and the addition of Dragon mature Welsh cheddar cheese adds a lovely tangy cheesy note\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=25th September 2016\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  35 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime =  25 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 1625\n|PortionCalories = 406\n|Image = [[Image:Dragon Welsh cheddar cheese and butternut squash soup recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Nice and Cheesy</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.7</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I've also made this using 3 heaped tablespoons of Mature Cheese Powder.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Butternut squash]] makes a superb [[Soup|soup]] and the addition of [[Dragon mature Welsh cheddar cheese]] from [[South Caernarfon Creameries]] adds a lovely tangy cheesy note.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1kg [[Butternut squash|butternut squash]], peeled and cut into chunks\n| 1 white [[Onion|onion]] finely chopped\n| 450ml [[Chicken|chicken]] or [[Vegetable Stock|vegetable stock]]\n| 200ml [[Single Cream|single cream]] or [[Milk|milk]]\n| 100g [[Grated|grated]] Dragon mature [[Cheddar cheese|cheddar cheese]]\n| 50g [[Butter|butter]]\n| 2 teaspoons [[Brown sugar|brown sugar]]\n| Pinch [[Cayenne pepper|cayenne pepper]]\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] & [[Freshly ground pepper|freshly ground pepper]] to taste\n| 1 tablespoon chopped [[Chives|chives]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| In a large [[Saucepan|saucepan]], [[Fry|fry]] the [[Onion|onion]] in [[Butter|butter]] for 1-2 minutes, add [[Squash|squash]] and stir for 1 minute\n| Add [[Stock|stock]] and [[Sugar|sugar]] then bring to a [[Boil|boil]], reduce heat to medium and [[Simmer|simmer]] until [[Squash|squash]] is soft and cooked through (approx. 15 mins)\n| Remove from the heat and allow to cool. Using a [[Blender|blender]], pur\u00e9e until smooth\n| Return the [[Soup|soup]] to the [[Saucepan|saucepan]] and place over medium low heat. Stir in the [[Cream|cream]], [[Cheddar|cheddar]] and seasoning\n| Stir the [[Soup|soup]] until heated through but do not [[Boil|boil]]. Sprinkle with chopped [[Chives|chives]] and serve hot\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Dragon mature Welsh cheddar cheese.jpg|thumb|300px|right|[http://www.dragonwales.co.uk/products/cheddar/mature/ Dragon mature Welsh cheddar cheese]\nImage:Dragon reduced fat mature Welsh cheddar cheese.jpg|thumb|300px|right|[http://www.dragonwales.co.uk/products/cheddar/mature-reduced-fat/ Dragon reduced fat mature Welsh cheddar cheese]\n</gallery>\n===Serving suggestions===\nDelicious with extra [[Cheese|cheese]] sprinkled over and a chunk of granary or [[Walnut|walnut]] [[Bread|bread]]\n===Variations===\nFor a lower fat alternative, use Dragon reduced fat mature Welsh cheddar cheese\n{{Template:Dragon cheese attribution}}\n==See also==\n* [[South Caernarfon Creameries]]\n* [[Dragon mature Welsh cheddar cheese]]\n* [[Dragon reduced fat mature Welsh cheddar cheese]]\n* [[Butternut squash soup|A selection of butternut squash soup recipes on Cookipedia]]\n\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Soup and stock recipes]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Dragon cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#soup #chives #dragonwelshcheddarcheeseandbutternutsquashsoup #butternutsquash #saucepan #squash #boil #butter #onion #southcaernarfoncreameries #cheese </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Dragon Welsh cheddar cheese and tomato scones",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Dragon Welsh cheddar cheese and tomato scones recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#southcaernarfoncreameries #butter #dragonwelshcheddarcheeseandtomatoscones #bakingpowder #egg #flour #cheddar #scones #herbs #tomato #blackpepper \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This cheese and tomato scone recipe comes courtesy of South Caernarfon Creameries, the addition of tomatoes makes an unusual and interesting change\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=25th September 2016\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 12\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  30 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  15 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 1755\n|PortionCalories = 146\n|Image = [[Image:Dragon Welsh cheddar cheese and tomato scones recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Nice and cheesy</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.6</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I can't stop eating these - they only last one day. \ud83d\ude44</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry, aka Chef]])</span></span>\n}}\nThis [[Cheese|cheese]] and [[Tomato|tomato]] scone recipe comes courtesy of [[South Caernarfon Creameries]], the addition of [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]] makes an unusual and interesting change.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 250g [[Self-raising flour|self-raising flour]]\n| 1 level teaspoon [[Baking powder|baking powder]]\n| 50g Dragon [[Salted|salted]] [[Butter|butter]]\n| 1 [[Egg|egg]] beaten & 100ml [[Milk|milk]] mixed together\n| 100g [[Dragon mature Welsh cheddar cheese]]\n| 2 tablespoons of chopped [[Sun-dried tomatoes|sun-dried tomatoes]] in [[Oil|oil]] (drained weight)\n| 1 teaspoon [[Mixed herbs|mixed herbs]]\n| [[Freshly ground black pepper]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 220\u00b0 C (425\u00b0 F - gas 7), [fan oven 200\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| [[Sieve]] the [[Flour|flour]] with [[Baking powder|baking powder]] into a large mixing bowl, rub in the [[Butter|butter]] until mixture resembles [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]]\n| Sprinkle in [[Herbs|herbs]] and [[Black pepper|black pepper]], stir through [[Sun dried tomatoes|sun dried tomatoes]] and [[Cheddar|cheddar]]\n| Gradually add [[Egg|egg]] & [[Milk|milk]] mixture until you have a [[Dough|dough]], if this seem too wet do not add all liquid\n| Turn onto floured surface and [[Knead|knead]] until smooth\n| Flatten out to approx. 3cm deep and using a round cutter stamp out [[Scones|scones]]\n| [[Bake]] on a tray lightly dusted with [[Flour|flour]] for 12-15 minutes until golden [[Brown|brown]] and cooked through\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Dragon mature Welsh cheddar cheese.jpg|thumb|300px|right|[http://www.dragonwales.co.uk/products/cheddar/mature/ Dragon mature Welsh cheddar cheese]\nImage:Dragon reduced fat mature Welsh cheddar cheese.jpg|thumb|300px|right|[http://www.dragonwales.co.uk/products/cheddar/mature-reduced-fat/ Dragon reduced fat mature Welsh cheddar cheese]\n</gallery>\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe warm and spread with [[Dragon Cheddar cheese and leek pate]] or just with butter.\n===Variations===\nUse [[Dragon reduced fat mature Welsh cheddar cheese]] if you are watching your calories!\n{{Template:Dragon cheese attribution}}\n==See also==\n* [[Dragon mature Welsh cheddar cheese]]\n* [[Dragon reduced fat mature Welsh cheddar cheese]]\n* [[South Caernarfon Creameries]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n[[Category:Dragon cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#southcaernarfoncreameries #butter #dragonwelshcheddarcheeseandtomatoscones #bakingpowder #egg #flour #cheddar #scones #herbs #tomato #blackpepper </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

mature Welsh cheddar cheese, produced by South Caernarfon Creameries.\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=18th September 2016\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 8\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  20 minutes\n|PrepTime =  5 minutes\n|CookTime =  15 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 1267\n|PortionCalories = 158\n|Image = [[Image:Dragon Welsh cheddar cheese pancakes recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Nicer than with syrup!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Mush prefer a savoury pancake. cheese, produced by [[South Caernarfon Creameries]].\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 200g [[Plain flour|plain flour]]\n| 2 teaspoons [[Baking powder|baking powder]]\n| 2 teaspoons [[Granulated sugar|granulated sugar]]\n| \u00bc teaspoon [[Salt|salt]]\n| 300ml [[Milk|milk]]\n| 1 large [[Egg|egg]]\n| 75g [[Grated|grated]] [[Dragon mature Welsh cheddar cheese]]\n| [[Butter]] or [[Olive oil|olive oil]] for [[Frying|frying]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Combine the [[Flour|flour]], [[Baking powder|baking powder]], [[Sugar|sugar]] and [[Salt|salt]] in a bowl, then add the [[Butter|butter]].\n| Pour the [[Batter|batter]] into the pan in even circles. Cook until bubbles form then flip and cook for 2-3 minutes.\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Dragon mature Welsh cheddar cheese.jpg|thumb|300px|right|[http://www.dragonwales.co.uk/products/cheddar/mature/ Dragon mature Welsh cheddar cheese]\nImage:Dragon reduced fat mature Welsh cheddar cheese.jpg|thumb|300px|right|[http://www.dragonwales.co.uk/products/cheddar/mature-reduced-fat/ Dragon reduced fat mature Welsh cheddar cheese]\n</gallery>\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with a little extra [[Grated|grated]] [[Dragon mature Welsh cheddar cheese]] for an extra cheesey [[Pancake|pancake]]!\n===Variations===\nUse [[Dragon reduced fat mature Welsh cheddar cheese]] if you are watching your calories!\n\n{{Template:Dragon cheese attribution}}\n==See also==\n* [[Dragon mature Welsh cheddar cheese]]\n* [[Dragon reduced fat mature Welsh cheddar cheese]]\n* [[South Caernarfon Creameries]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Breakfast recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Egg recipes]]\n[[Category:Dragon cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#grated #bakingpowder #egg #southcaernarfoncreameries #dragonwelshcheddarcheesepancakes #butter #granulatedsugar #oliveoil #cheese #recipesfromothersites #plainflour </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

gas 6), [fan oven 180\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Place [[Pork|pork]] steaks into a lightly oiled [[Baking|baking]] dish and [[Bake|bake]] for 15 minutes\n| Mix together the [[Mustard|mustard]], [[Cheddar|cheddar]] and cr\u00e8me fra\u00eeche or [[Soured cream|soured cream]], add seasonings and mix thoroughly\n| Spread the [[Cheese|cheese]] mixture over the steaks and [[Bake|bake]] again until the topping is golden and bubbling and the [[Meat|meat]] is cooked through\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Dragon mature Welsh cheddar cheese.jpg|thumb|300px|right|[http://www.dragonwales.co.uk/products/cheddar/mature/ Dragon mature Welsh cheddar cheese]\nImage:Dragon reduced fat mature Welsh cheddar cheese.jpg|thumb|300px|right|[http://www.dragonwales.co.uk/products/cheddar/mature-reduced-fat/ Dragon reduced fat mature Welsh cheddar cheese]\n</gallery>\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Green beans|green beans]] and [[New Potatoes|new potatoes]]\n===Variations===\nFor a lower fat alternative, use [[Dragon reduced fat mature Welsh cheddar cheese]]\n{{Template:Dragon cheese attribution}}\n==See also==\n* [[South Caernarfon Creameries]]\n* [[Dragon mature Welsh cheddar cheese]]\n* [[Dragon reduced fat mature Welsh cheddar cheese]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Dragon cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#dragonwelshrarebitporksteaks #pork #souredcream #cheddar #southcaernarfoncreameries #bake #miseenplace #recipesfromothersites #grated #wholegrainmustard #newpotatoes </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Drappit eggs with herbs",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Drappit eggs with herbs, Egg recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#nutmeg #spinach #garammasala #drappiteggswithherbs #tablespoons #parsley #butter #poached #egg #vinegar #tomatoes \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A Scottish dish from the 1700's, probably from a Scot based in India\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1207\n|PortionCalories = 201\n|DatePublished=23rd January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Free range eggs\n|Servings = Serves 6\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime = 55 minutes\n|PrepTime = 30 minutes\n|CookTime = 25 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Eggs.jpg|right|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"><span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Eggs and herbs</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">That's what these are - see!</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\">[[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nA Scottish dish from the 1700's, probably from a Scot based in India.  ''Drappit eggs'' are  poached eggs, they are ''drapped'' into the water and in this context, herbs are any green vegetable.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1 lb (450g) [[spinach]], washed\n| 1 head iceberg [[lettuce]], washed and broken into leaves\n| Salt and [[freshly ground black pepper]] to taste\n| 3 [[tablespoons]] butter\n| 2 [[tablespoons]] fresh chervil, chopped\n| 8 sprigs [[parsley]], chopped\n| &#189; teaspoon ground [[white pepper]]\n| &#189; teaspoon [[sea salt]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[nutmeg]], grated\n| &#188; teaspoon [[garam masala]]\n| 4 fl oz (112 ml) [[single cream]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[malt vinegar]]\n| 6 [[free range eggs]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Place an oven proof dish in a preheated oven, 275\u00b0 F (140\u00b0 C - Gas 1 - Low)\n| For 3 minutes, in a sieve over a pan of boiling water, wilt the [[spinach]] and lettuce.  Drain and chop finely\n| In a large pan, melt the [[butter]], add the [[parsley]], [[chervil]] and the greens.  Add the [[nutmeg]] and [[garam masala]] and season with salt and pepper.\n| Pour in the [[cream]] and stir well.  Place the mixture in the preheated dish and keep warm in the oven.\n| Boil a pan of water, add the [[vinegar]] and [[poach]] the [[eggs]] until firm.\n| Make 6 ''nests'' in the greens and place an [[egg]] in each.\n| Brown under a grill for a few minutes\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\n\nServe hot with grilled [[tomatoes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Eggs]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments|Eggs]]\n[[Category:Egg recipes|Eggs]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes|Eggs]]\n[[Category:Indian recipes|Eggs]]\n[[Category:Main courses|Eggs]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes|Eggs]]\n[[Category:Starters|Eggs]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites|Eggs]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Poached]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#nutmeg #spinach #garammasala #drappiteggswithherbs #tablespoons #parsley #butter #poached #egg #vinegar #tomatoes </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Drop scones",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Drop scones; a  recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#dropscones #goldensyrup #cream #eggs #chilli #fruit #butter #clottedcream #bubble #herbs #unusualrecipes \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=These are also known as griddle or girdle scones or Scotch pancakes. \n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2094\n|PortionCalories = 87\n|DatePublished=20th October 2012\n|Author = JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = 24 scones\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 40 minutes\n |PrepTime = 10 minutes\n |CookTime = 30 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Drop scones recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Scotch pancakes?</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.1</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Lovely.  These taste like Scotch pancakes that my Mum used to buiy, some 50 years ago.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nThese are also known as  [[Griddle|'''griddle''']] or '''girdle scones''' or '''Scotch pancakes'''.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 450 g [[Self-raising flour|self-raising flour]]\n| 85 g [[Sugar|sugar]]\n| &frac12; teaspoon [[Salt|salt]]\n| 2 tablespoons [[Golden syrup|golden syrup]], warmed\n| 290 ml [[Milk|milk]]\n| 2 [[Eggs|eggs]], beaten\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Mix all of the dry ingredients with the [[Golden syrup|golden syrup]] in a bowl.\n| Beat the [[Milk|milk]] with the [[Eggs|eggs]] and add to the bowl.\n| Whisk until it has the consistency of thick [[Cream|cream]].\n| Heat a lightly greased [[Frying pan|frying pan]] or [[Griddle|griddle]] and drop tablespoons of the mixture into it.  Make sure that there is plenty of space between each one.  Depending on the size of your pan, you should be able to do at least 3 at a time.\n| Flip them over when they start to [[Bubble|bubble]] and the underneath is golden [[Brown|brown]].\n| When the other side is cooked, place them in a clean [[Tea towel|tea towel]] whilst you do the rest.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe hot with [[Butter|butter]] or [[Clotted cream|clotted cream]] and [[Jam|jam]] or [[Honey|honey]].  Alternatively, if you are feeling cheffy, you could turn these into a pudding by making a stack of three or four scones with various fillings such as [[Fruit|fruit]], chopped [[Nuts|nuts]] and thick [[Cream|cream]]. \n===Variations===\nIt is possible to make savoury versions.  Leave out the [[Sugar|sugar]] (but keep the [[Golden syrup|golden syrup]]!) and add flavourings of your choice.  I have made versions with [[Garlic|garlic]], [[Chilli|chilli]] and [[Herbs|herbs]].\n===Chef's notes===\nIf you do not wish to eat them straight away, keep them in an airtight container such as a [[Lock&Lock boxes|Lock&Lock box]] and reheat in a warm [[Oven|oven]] as required.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Drop scones]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking|Drop scones]]\n[[Category:British recipes|Drop scones]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes|Drop scones]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts|Drop scones]][[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#dropscones #goldensyrup #cream #eggs #chilli #fruit #butter #clottedcream #bubble #herbs #unusualrecipes </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Duck, leek and chorizo cassoulet",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Duck, leek and chorizo cassoulet\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#onions #slowcooker #fat #russellsofupwellduck #duck #duckfat #bacon #chorizo #sherryvinegar #budweiser\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=Another variation of this French classic using produce from Russell's' Butchers of Upwell.\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=21st December 2022\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  5 hours, 15 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  5 hours\n|TotalCalories = 1720\n|PortionCalories = 860\n|Image = [[Image:Duck, leek and chorizo cassoulet.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Very nice</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Almost like you get in Bordeaux!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The&nbsp;Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Duck, leek and chorizo cassoulet slow cooked.jpg|thumb|right|After 1 hour in the slow cooker - \ud83d\ude0b]]\nMy own variation on this French classic.  A very economical meal, one duck leg, half a chorizo sausage and one large leek and butter beans are the basics for this recipe.\n\nThis recipe is cooked in the [[Slow-cooker|slow-cooker]]; just starting off in a cast [[Iron|iron]] [[Frying pan|frying pan]] to [[Brown|brown]] the [[Duck|duck]], [[chorizo]] and [[leeks]].\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 large [[Duck|duck]] leg, skin on, from Russell's of Upwell if you're lucky enough to live in Norfolk!\n| Half a link of chorizo sausage.\n| 3 rashers of Russel's treacly [[Bacon|bacon]] - (fatty back bacon [[Cured|cured]] in [[Black treacle|black treacle]])\n| 1 large [[leek]], washed and chopped into rings\n| 3 [[Fat|fat]] [[Cloves of Garlic, peeled and crushed|cloves of garlic, peeled and crushed]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Sherry vinegar|sherry vinegar]]\n| 3 [[Thin Indian green chillies|thin indian green chillies]], left whole\n| 1 400g can of chopped [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]]\n| 1 400g can of [[Butter beans|butter beans]]\n| 1 bottle of [[Budweiser]] beer (300 ml)\n| 1 crumbled chicken stock cube\n| Big pinch of [[Taste Sensation Italian seasoning]]\n| Pinch of [[Sea Salt|sea salt]]\n| &#189; teaspoon of [[Mixed herbs|mixed herbs]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Remove the skin from the chorizo by peeling it off\n| Chop the chorizo into rings\n| Using no [[Fat|fat]] at all, [[Fry|fry]] the [[Duck|duck]] leg for 10 minutes in a heavy based pan to [[Brown|brown]] and release the [[Duck fat|duck fat]] from the skin\n| Chop the [[Bacon|bacon]] rashers into bite-sized pieces and [[Fry|fry]] them together with the [[chorizo slices]] for 3 or 4 minutes to colour them\n| Leaving the [[Fat|fat]] in the pan, remove all the [[Meat|meat]] and place in the [[Slow Cooker|slow cooker]] while you cook the [[leeks]]\n| [[Sautee]] the [[leeks]] for 5 minutes until until well [[Browned|browned]]\n| Add the [[Garlic|garlic]] and [[Stir-fry|stir-fry]] for a minute or so\n| Tip the contents of the pan into the [[Slow Cooker|slow cooker]] and [[Deglaze|deglaze]] the pan with the [[Sherry vinegar|sherry vinegar]]\n| Mix all of the [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]], drained [[Beans|beans]], [[Chillies|chillies]], [[Herbs|herbs]] and seasoning together and stir well to combine\n| Add all of this to the [[Slow Cooker|slow cooker]] together with the [[Budwesier]] mixed with the stock cube and slow cook on high for 2 hours\n| After 2 hours, stir well, remove and discard the whole [[Chillies|chillies]], turn the [[Slow-cooker|slow-cooker]] down to low and cook for the remaining two hours.\n| Remove the duck leg from the slow cooker, shred the meat from the leg and serve directly onto the plates and pour over the beans and sausage mixture.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with plain boiled potatoes\n===Recipe source===\n* Based on an idea bought to me by produce sold by the [[Butchers|butchers]] I can see from here!\n===Chef's notes===\nAlmost anything you love can be added to this, the [[Duck fat|duck fat]] and the [[Beans|beans]] are the mainstay of this recipe to my mind, but anything you have top [[Hand|hand]] will be fabulous in this hearty [[Soup|soup]]-cum-[[Stew|stew]] recipe\n==See also==\n* [https://www.facebook.com/people/Russells-Family-Butchers/100063462076744/?paipv=0&eav=AfY1bdaLsrKyd7lZwxlS3oVF2YMWaPhrzCHWXKcQ3R8QqU018A93uyL5jG6NTEpPsC8&_rdr Russell's of Upwell (Facebook page)]\n* [[Cassoulet|Other good cassoulet recipes]]\n\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:French recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Soup and stock recipes]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Chilli pepper recipes]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Slow cooker recipes]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n[[Category:Slow cooked]]\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#onions #slowcooker #fat #russellsofupwellduck #chorizo #duck #duckfat #bacon #sausages #sherryvinegar #chickenstock #fry</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Duck legs, a sous vide recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#duck #sousvidecooking #mustard #garlicpowder #groundblackpepper #searing #mashedpotatoes #vegetables #miseenplace #refrigerate #sear \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This is a straightforward and easy recipe for cooking duck legs sous vide in a water bath\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 836\n|PortionCalories = 209\n|DatePublished=13th November 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  8 - 10 hours, 20 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  8 - 10 hours, 5 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Duck legs SV recipe.jpg|Searing the [[duck]] legs at the end|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Keeps them lovely and moist</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">You really cannot overcook duck legs this way.</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:NonLoggedInUser|NonLoggedInUser]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis is a straightforward and easy recipe for cooking [[Duck|duck]] legs sous vide in a [[Sous vide cooking|water bath]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 4 Barbary [[Duck|duck]] legs\n| 4 teaspoons [[Ground black pepper|ground black pepper]]\n| 4 teaspoons [[Garlic powder|garlic powder]]\n| 2 heaped teaspoons [[Ground|ground]] [[Mustard|mustard]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat the [[Sous vide cooking|water bath]] to 82\u00b0C (''179.6\u00b0F'')\n\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Mix together the [[Pepper|pepper]], [[Garlic powder|garlic powder]] and [[Mustard|mustard]].\n| Rub all over the [[Duck|duck]] legs.\n| Place the legs into separate pouches.\n| [[Vacuum pack]], seal and cook in the [[Sous vide cooking|water bath]] for 8-10 hours.\n| If they are not to be served immediately, plunge the pouches in iced water, leave to cool and [[Refrigerate|refrigerate]], then follow the instructions below re [[Searing|searing]].\n| If serving immediately, remove the [[Duck|duck]] from the pouches and [[Sear|sear]] each side in a very hot [[Frying pan|frying pan]] until both sides are crisp (about 1-2 minutes each side).\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Mashed potatoes|mashed potatoes]] and [[Vegetables|vegetables]].\n===Variations===\nAny type of [[Duck|duck]] legs will be fine.  I just happened to have Barbary ones.\n{{SousVideSeeAlso}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Poultry recipes]]\n[[Category:Sous vide recipes]]\n[[Category:Sous vide cooking]]\n[[Category:Molecular gastronomy recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#duck #sousvidecooking #mustard #garlicpowder #groundblackpepper #searing #mashedpotatoes #vegetables #miseenplace #refrigerate #sear </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }

title": "Dumplings",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Dumplings, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#dumplings #cheese #selfraisingflour #bicarbonateofsoda #boiledorsimmered #dough #cheddarcheese #shredded #grated #suet #stock \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=These crispy suet dumplings are easy to make and a great addition for stews and casseroles.\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 816\n|PortionCalories = 204\n|DatePublished=31st January 2013\n|Author = JuliaBalbilla\n|ImageComment = Suet Dumplings - (boiled)\n |Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 40 minutes\n |PrepTime = 10 minutes\n |CookTime = 30 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Suet Dumplings recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Naughty, but nice</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">These were fantastic, great with a beef stew.  Easy to make too!</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Suet Dumplings baked.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Suet Dumplings - (baked)]]\nThese crispy suet dumplings are easy to make and a great addition for stews and casseroles.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 110 g (4 oz) [[self raising flour]]\n| 50 g (2 oz) [[shredded]] [[Suet]]\n| 2 tablespoons fresh [[parsley]], chopped\n| 1 tablespoon finely chopped [[onion]]\n| Cold water to mix \n| &#188; teaspoon [[dried]] mixed [[herbs]]\n| [[Salt]] and [[freshly ground black pepper]] to taste\n| A good pinch of [[bicarbonate of soda]] (not essential, but good if you have it)\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Add the ingredients to a bowl, gently rub the flour into the suet with your fingers.  When you can no longer feel the suet with your fingers, gradually add a few tablespoons of cold water and mix to form a soft but not sticky [[dough]].\n| Adjust the consistency of the dough by adding extra flour or water if required.\n| Divide into 6 to 8 and form into balls\n| Drop then into a stew or casserole about 20 to 30 minutes before the end of cooking\n| Alternatively, [[boil]] in water or [[stock]] for 20 to 30 minutes\n}}\n===Method: Crispy suet dumplings===\n# Preheat the oven to 200\u00b0 C (400 \u00b0F - gas 6)\n# Follow steps above\n# Gently float on top of a stew or casserole\n# Baste with a little of the gravy\n# Bake (uncovered) at the top of the oven for 30 minutes or so - the dumplings should be cooked and crispy on the top\n===Serving suggestions===\nDumpling are really nice, crisped under a grill once they have cooked. Especially [[cheese]] dumplings\n===Variations===\nAdd 2 tablespoons of [[grated]] [[Cheddar cheese]] to make [[cheese]] dumplings\n===Extend the shelf life of shredded suet===\nSuet, once opened, has a very limited shelf life and will go rancid.  Once opened, if you do not need to use the whole packet, freeze the remainder; once properly defrosted it is a good a fresh suet, and it lasts for years in the freezer.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Dumplings]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments|Dumplings]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes|Dumplings]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Student recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#dumplings #cheese #selfraisingflour #bicarbonateofsoda #boiledorsimmered #dough #cheddarcheese #shredded #grated #suet #stock </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Duxelles recipe",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Duxelles recipe Beef, from Cookipedia.Co.Uk\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#mushrooms #shallots #butter #thyme #garlic #beefwellington #duxellesrecipe #whitewine #lemonjuice #liquor #sherry \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Duxelles is a finely chopped mixture of mushrooms , onions or shallots and herbs, sauteed in butter, and reduced to a paste (sometimes cream is used\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 602\n|PortionCalories = 301\n|DatePublished=20th January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Duxelles on prosciutto in preparation for [[beef Wellington]]\n |Servings = Serves 2\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 45 minutes\n |PrepTime = 15 minutes\n |CookTime = 30 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Duxelles.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">A Beef Wellington essential</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">You can't make Beef Wellington with this; and it's pretty good on its own too.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n'''Duxelles''' is a finely chopped mixture of [[mushrooms]] , [[onions]] or [[shallots]] and [[herbs]], [[saut\u00e9ed]] in [[butter]], and reduced to a paste (sometimes cream is used as well). It is a basic preparation used in stuffings and [[sauces]] (notably, [[beef Wellington]]), or as a garnish. Duxelles can also be filled into a pocket of raw pastry and baked as a savoury tart (similar to a hand-held pie).\n\n'''Duxelles''' is made with any cultivated or wild mushroom, depending on the recipe. Duxelles made with wild [[porcini mushrooms]] will be much stronger flavoured than that made with [[white mushrooms]] or [[brown mushrooms]]. Fresh mushrooms are usually used, however reconstituted dried varieties are used as well. If you want a stronger flavour, use a mixture of both.\n\n'''Duxelles''' is a useful way to freeze and store [[mushrooms]] that would not normally be reusable after [[freezing]].\n\nDuxelles is said to have been created by the 17th-century French chef Fran\u00e7ois Pierre La Varenne (1615\u20131678) and to have been named after his employer, Nicolas Chalon du Bl\u00e9, marquis d'Uxelles, mar\u00e9chal de France.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 250 g [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]] chopped very finely. A mixture of [[chestnut mushrooms]], [[shiitake mushrooms]] and [[wild mushrooms]] works well.\n| 2 [[Shallots|shallots]] peeled and chopped very finely\n| 2 cloves of [[Garlic]], peeled and crushed\n| 4 tablespoons [[Butter|butter]]\n| 50 ml [[Dry white wine|dry white wine]]\n| Splash of [[lemon juice]]\n| 1 sprig of [[Thyme|thyme]]\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\nDon't rush this, it's quite long-winded and will probably take around 30 minutes cooking.\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Gently saut\u00e9 [[Garlic|garlic]] and [[Shallots|shallots]] in the  the finely chopped [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]] in the [[Butter|butter]] for about 6 minutes until soft.\n| Add the chopped [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]] and the whole sprig of [[Thyme|thyme]] and gently cook for 10 minutes so most of the [[Mushroom|mushroom]] [[Liquor|liquor]] is cooked off.\n| remove the sprig of [[thyme]]\n| Add the [[Wine|wine]], a splash of [[lemon juice]] and season to taste.\n| Cook gently until all of the liquid has gone.\n| The [[Duxelles|duxelles]] should stick together easily.\n| Remove from the heat and allow to cool.\n| Use in your recipe, spread on [[bread]] or [[crackers]] or [[freeze]] for later use.\n}}\n====Duxelles, step by step photographs====\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Duxelles ingredients.jpg|The basic ingredients for duxelles\nImage:Shallots and garlic suateed in butter.jpg|[[Shallots]] and [[Garlic|garlic]] [[saut\u00e9ed]] in [[butter]]\nImage:Mushrooms chopped.jpg|Mushrooms chopped in the [[food processor]]\nImage:Mushrooms go in dry.jpg|The [[mushrooms]] look very dry when they are first added\nImage:White wine added.jpg|Wet again once the [[white wine]]/[[sherry]] is added\nImage:Duxelles reduced, ready to cool.jpg|Duxelles completed, ready to cool\n</gallery>\n===Chef's notes===\nI never have [[White wine|white wine]] so use a little less [[Dry sherry|dry sherry]], watered down instead - no one has noticed yet!\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Beef recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Ingredients]]\n[[Category:Prepared foods]]\n[[Category:Fungi]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#mushrooms #shallots #butter #thyme #garlic #beefwellington #duxellesrecipe #whitewine #lemonjuice #liquor #sherry </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Easy Meaty Sausage, Sage and Onion Stuffing",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Easy Meaty Sausage, Sage and Onion Stuffing recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#breadcrumbs #butter #easymeatysausagesageandonionstuffing #onion #chicken #sage #miseenplace #sageleaves #stuffing #sausages #gluten \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A really meaty stuffing made with debbie&andrews sausages is ideal for seasonal specials like Christmas dinner\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 250\n|PortionCalories = 25\n|DatePublished=25th October 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 10\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  40 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime =  30 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Easy Meaty Sausage, Sage and Onion Stuffing recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Good stuffing recipe</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Thank you!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:NonLoggedInUser|NonLoggedInUser]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Harrogate-pork-sausages.png|300px|thumb|right|[[Debbie and Andrew's Harrogate 97% Gluten Free Pork Sausages]]]]\nA really meaty [[Stuffing|stuffing]] made with debbie&andrew's 97% [[Pork sausages|pork sausages]], ideal for seasonal specials like Christmas dinner, or anytime you want to go that little bit further.\n\nThis recipe is also suitable for coeliacs as it it made with [[Gluten free|gluten free]] ingredients.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| A knob of [[Butter|butter]] to grease\n| 3tbsp fresh [[Gluten|gluten]]-free [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]]\n| 1 [[Onion|onion]], finely chopped\n| 2tbsp fresh [[Sage leaves|sage leaves]], finely chopped\n| 1 pack [[Debbie and Andrew's Harrogate 97% Gluten Free Pork Sausages]]\n| 1 [[free range egg]]\n| [[Salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 190\u00b0 C (375\u00b0 F - gas 5), [fan oven 170\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Grease an ovenproof dish with [[Butter|butter]].\n| Combine the [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]] with the [[Onion|onion]] and [[Sage|sage]] in a large mixing bowl, then stir in a little [[Boiling|boiling]] water and mix thoroughly.\n| Remove the [[Sausages|sausages]] from their skins and use your hands to mix the [[Sausagemeat|sausagemeat]] and [[Egg|egg]] into the [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]].\n| Season well with [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]] and place in the prepared [[Oven|oven]]proof dish. [[Bake]] in the preheated oven for 30 minutes until crispy on top.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Roast|roast]] [[Chicken|chicken]] or of course - with [[Turkey|turkey]]!\n==See also==\n\n* [[Udi\u0092s Gluten Free Products]]\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:North American recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Gluten free recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Debbie&andrew's sausage recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n{{Template:DebbieAndAndrew attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#breadcrumbs #butter #easymeatysausagesageandonionstuffing #onion #chicken #sage #miseenplace #sageleaves #stuffing #sausages #gluten </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Easy sausage and bean cassoulet",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "\n<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Easy sausage and bean cassoulet recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#toulousesausages #cremefraiche #steamedbroccoli #tomatopuree #blackpepper #easysausageandbeancassoulet #french #simmer #port #oliveoil #saute \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Use this recipe as a starting point for your imagination! We had a small ciabatta loaf, pack of Toulouse sausages\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 6613\n|PortionCalories = 1653\n|DatePublished=12th January 2016\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = OK, it might look like cat sick but it was glorious!\n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  55 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime =  45 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Easy sausage and bean cassoulet recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Much better than it looks</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.8</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Tasted fabulous, looks rubbish!</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry, aka Chef]])</span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Mogettes a la paysan.jpg|300px|thumb|right|One of the many variants of bottled white French beans]]\nUse this recipe as a starting point for your imagination!\n\nWe had a small [[Ciabatta|ciabatta]] loaf, pack of [[Toulouse sausages]] from [[Gourmet sausage maker - Bexley]] and a large bottle of [[French]] [[Flageolet beans|flageolet beans]] from our summer holiday.  The [[Rest|rest]] of the ingredients were  odds and ends.\n\nI find the [[French]] bottled [[mogettes]] \u00e0 la paysanne to be a little cloying so I tried to adjust this with the [[Creme fraiche|creme fraiche]].  Serving with the [[Steamed broccoli|steamed broccoli]] was almost like a palate cleaner. The result was excellent and will be made again.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 medium [[Onion|onion]], peeled and chopped\n| 4 [[Cloves of Garlic, peeled and crushed|cloves of garlic, peeled and crushed]]\n| A good pinch of [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n| 2 tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 6 [[Toulouse sausages]], cut in half\n| 850 ml jar of [[mogettes \u00e0 la paysanne]] - not sure if you would find these in the UK but they are very common in mid-France\n| 2 tablespoons of [[Tomato puree|tomato puree]]\n| 2 teaspoons of [[Old India Taco Seasoning]] or [[Tex-Mex seasoning]]\n| 2 tablespoons of ruby [[Port|port]]\n| 5 tablespoons of [[Creme fraiche|creme fraiche]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Add the [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and [[Black pepper|black pepper]] to a [[Dutch Oven|dutch oven]], when hot add the chopped [[Onions|onions]] and the halved [[Toulouse sausages]] and [[Saute|saute]] for 4 minutes\n| Stir in the [[Crushed garlic|crushed garlic]] and [[Saute|saute]] for a minute or so\n| Tip in the mogettes and the [[Taco seasoning]] and [[Tomato puree|tomato puree]] and mix well\n| Bring to a [[Simmer|simmer]], reduce the heat to very low and simmer for about 40 minutes. As you can get quite a lot of [[Steam|steam]] from this you can adjust the consistency to your liking by [[Simmering|simmering]] covered or with the lid half on.\n| When there is about 5 minutes left to go, begin [[Steaming|steaming]] the [[Broccoli|broccoli]].\n| Stir in the [[Port|port]] and [[Creme fraiche|creme fraiche]] and mix well.  Bring back to a [[Simmer|simmer]] and remove from the heat. Ensure the mixture does not [[Boil|boil]]\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Steamed broccoli|steamed broccoli]] and sliced [[Ciabatta bread|ciabatta bread]]\n===Variations===\nOdd [[Vegetables|vegetables]] can be mixed in too.  I found a spare [[Tomato|tomato]] chopped it up and added it to the mix\n\n===See also ===\n* [[Cassoulet recipes]]\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:French recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Chilli pepper recipes]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n[[Category:Steamed]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#toulousesausages #cremefraiche #steamedbroccoli #tomatopuree #blackpepper #easysausageandbeancassoulet #french #simmer #port #oliveoil #saute </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Eggy bread",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Eggy bread, Egg recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#eggybread #garlicoliveoil #marmite #eggs #tabascosauce #panfried #blackpepper #freerangeeggs #tabasco \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=We always called this egg-bread or eggy-bread, but that was when we were 5 years old!\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 384\n|PortionCalories = 384\n|DatePublished=23rd October 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Eggy bread in the pan\n|Servings = 1 person for a good breakfast\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime = 11 minutes\n|PrepTime = 5 minutes\n|CookTime = 6 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Eggy bread recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">The Best Breakfast!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Especually if it has Marmite in the sandwich.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Eggy bread recipe2.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Eggs soaked up]]\nWe always called this egg-bread or eggy-bread, but that was when we were 5 years old!  I think it's also called French toast, though I'm not certain about that.\n\nIt's one of the very few occasions where processed bread is better than home baked bread.  The soft processed bread tends to soak up the egg mixture better.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 2 slices of sliced brown wholemeal bread\n| 2 [[free range eggs]]\n| 3 tablespoons [[milk]]\n| A dash of [[Tabasco sauce]]\n| [[Freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 2 tablespoons [[garlic olive oil]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| In a large shallow dish, break the two [[eggs]]\n| Add the [[milk]], [[Tabasco]], [[black pepper]] and whisk until well mixed\n| Place the bread in the mixture and leave for a minute\n| Turn the bread over and leave until the mixture has soaked into the bread\n| Heat a large frying pan and add the [[garlic olive oil]]\n| Fry for 3 minutes a side\n| Make a sandwich with the optional [[Marmite]] in the middle\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nI love mine with a squeeze of [[marmite]]!\nServe hot with fresh orange juice\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Egg recipes]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Breakfast recipes]]\n[[Category:Student recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#eggybread #garlicoliveoil #marmite #eggs #tabascosauce #panfried #blackpepper #freerangeeggs #tabasco </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
