title": "Egg and bacon flan",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Egg and bacon flan, Egg recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#eggandbaconflan #mascarponecheese #bacon #greenpepper #homesmokedbacon #greaseproofpaper #eggs #blindbaking #tomato #tomatoes #ham \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Another recipe that has come about as a result of my newfound craze, making quiches\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1901\n|PortionCalories = 950\n|DatePublished=31st January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 2 as a main or 4 as a starter\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime = 1 hour\n|PrepTime = 10 minutes\n|CookTime = 50 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Egg and bacon flan.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Love this!!!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Homemade quiches are the dog's!  So easy to add all of your favourite ingredients; normally lots of chillies. :D</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Remember the greaseproof.jpg|thumb|right|300px|Twice now, I've forgotten to put [[greaseproof paper]] under the baking beans.  Perhaps this picture will remind me next time!]]\nAnother recipe that has come about as a result of my recent craze, making quiches.  This time I thought I would use some of our Home smoked bacon and fresh eggs from our hens.\n\nI'm using Jus Rol ready made shortcrust pastry and find that 1 500g pack is too much pastry for a (shallow) 10\" [[Push-out flan dish]], so this time I used about half - which means I can make another one tomorrow!\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 250 g (9 oz) from block of ready-made [[shortcrust pastry]]\n| 2 [[free range eggs]], beaten\n| 45 ml (4 tablespoons) of [[milk]]\n| 3 tablespoons of [[mascarpone cheese]]\n| 5 rashers of cooked [[bacon]], [[home smoked bacon]] or [[ham]], chopped into tiny pieces.\n| [[freshly ground black pepper]]\n| Slices of [[tomato]] or [[red pepper]] or [[green pepper]] or a mixture of all to garnish\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Allow the pastry to get to room temperature before rolling it out.\n\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Preheated the oven to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - Gas 6)\n| Roll the pastry and use it to line a greased 20 cm (8\") [[push-out flan dish]]\n| [[Blind baking|Bake blind]] at 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - Gas 6) for 10 minutes\n| Beat the [[eggs]], [[milk]], [[mascarpone cheese]] and season to taste with [[pepper]] -  [[salt]] won't be needed with the bacon\n| Stir in the bacon pieces\n| Pour the egg and bacon mixture into the blind-baked flan case\n| Decorate with whatever you have to hand, I used half of a [[green pepper]], sliced, but use whatever you have to hand, [[tomatoes]] look and taste are good.\n| Reduce the heat of the oven to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - Gas 4)\n| [[Bake]] for a further 40 minutes\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\n\nServe hot or cold\n===Notes===\nOur [[bacon]] is smoked and dried for 4 months so can be eaten without cooking rather like ham. If you're using normal bacon I would cook it first.\n\n{{Quiche - See also}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Egg recipes]]\n[[Category:Pies tarts and flans]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#eggandbaconflan #mascarponecheese #bacon #greenpepper #homesmokedbacon #greaseproofpaper #eggs #blindbaking #tomato #tomatoes #ham </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Eight hour smoky pulled pork in Guinness",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Eight hour smoky pulled pork in Guinness an Irish recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#eighthoursmokypulledporkinguinness #roastingtray #pittabread #porkshoulder #marinade #coleslaw #muscovadosugar #marinading #bayleaves #juice #garlic \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This version of pulled pork is loosely based on the 'Eight hour smokey pulled pork shoulder' recipe from The Fabulous Baker Brothers\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 6128\n|PortionCalories = 1021\n|DatePublished=28th July 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 6 \n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  20 hours, 15 minutes\n|PrepTime =  12 hours 15 minutes\n|CookTime =  8 hours\n|Image = [[Image:Eight hour smoky Guinness pulled pork recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Worthy of the wait</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Fabulous, if you have the time and the patience.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}}\nThis version of [[Pulled pork|pulled pork]] is loosely based on the 'Eight hour smokey pulled pork shoulder' recipe from The Fabulous Baker Brothers. #<small>see [[Talk:Eight hour smoky pulled pork in Guinness|talk page]]</small>\n\n[[Marinading]] the [[Pork shoulder|pork shoulder]] overnight makes a huge difference so you need to plan ahead when making this.\n\nServe with [[Coleslaw]], pickles and [[Pitta bread|pitta bread]].  It's also great in sandwiches\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 2.2kg [[Pork shoulder]] joint\n| 100 ml [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 100 ml [[Worcestershire sauce]]\n| 30g [[Smoked paprika|smoked paprika]] or a mixture of normal and [[Smoked|smoked]] [[Paprika|paprika]]\n| 1 bunch of [[Thyme|thyme]]\n| A few [[Bay leaves|bay leaves]]\n| 300 ml of Guinness original (small bottle)\n| 1 bulb of [[Garlic]], peeled and crushed\n| [[Juice]] and [[Zest|zest]] from 1 [[Lemon|lemon]]\n| A tablespoon of [[Muscovado sugar|muscovado sugar]]\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n*Cut a criss-cross of slashes in the skin with a very sharp knife such as a Stanley knife.  The skin won't go crispy but it helps to keep the [[Meat|meat]] moist and the slashes let the [[Marinade|marinade]] through. I normally leave the lemon skins in while it marinades and also whilst it cooks.\n*Place the joint in a large tray, pour the [[Marinade|marinade]] over and [[Refrigerate|refrigerate]] overnight, '[[Basting|basting]]' now and then.\n*Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to maximum heat\n*Mix all of the ingredients together and\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Cover the [[Roasting tray|roasting tray]] with [[Tin-foil|tin-foil]], sealing the edges.  Ensure that the roasting tray is very well sealed or the joint is likely to dry out after 8 hours cooking. #<small>see [[Talk:Eight hour smoky pulled pork in Guinness|talk page]]</small>\n| Place in the [[Oven|oven]] and immediately turn the heat down to 140\u00b0 C (257\u00b0 F - gas 1)\n| Cook for 8 hours\n| Decant the joint to another [[Roasting tray|roasting tray]], shred whatever [[Meat|meat]] you are going to consume immediately, store the remaining [[Meat|meat]] in a [[Lock and Lock]] style box and refrigerate for later use. This way it will stays moist and fresh.\n| Using a [[Fat strainer|fat strainer]] separate most of the excess fat from the cooking juices and discard. Add the cooking juices back to the roasting tray and heat up over the hob. Mix in the [[Shredded|shredded]] [[Meat|meat]], stir well to mix then transfer to a serving dish.\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Eight hour smoky Guinness pulled pork_overnight.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Ready to refrigerate overnight\nImage:Eight hour smoky Guinness pulled pork_ingredients.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Eight hour smoky Guinness pulled pork, the ingredients\n</gallery>\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Pitta bread|pitta bread]], [[Pickles|pickles]] and [[Cole slaw|cole slaw]].\n===Chef's notes===\nA can of drained [[kidney beans]] or virtually any pulses added at the start of the cooking process make this recipe stretch even firther.\n{{Template:See-also-pulled-pork}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Irish recipes]]\n[[Category:North American recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#eighthoursmokypulledporkinguinness #roastingtray #pittabread #porkshoulder #marinade #coleslaw #muscovadosugar #marinading #bayleaves #juice #garlic </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "English milk loaf",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=English milk loaf, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#dough #englishmilkloaf #yeast #bake #flour #bread #milkpowder #groundnut #conventionaloven #breadmakers #fat \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This is the ridged, cylindrical loaf that I remember as a child back in the 60s and 70s\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1785\n|PortionCalories = 178\n|DatePublished=13th November 2013\n|Author = JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = Servings: 10 - Makes 1 loaf\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime = 2 hours 50 minutes\n|PrepTime = 2 hours 15 minutes\n|CookTime = 35 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:English milk loaf recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Love those slices</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Need to get me one of those tins!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Carla_Cancio-Bello,_J.D.,_on_behalf_of_Cuban_Cuisine_UK|Carla]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:English milk loaf slices.jpg|thumb|300px|right|English [[milk]] loaf slices]]\nThis is the ridged, cylindrical loaf that I remember as a child back in the 60s and 70s.  \n\nYou can use a breadmaker for the dough but to get its authentic shape you will need a [[:Category:Bread and baking#Loaf pans:|milk loaf tin]].  The ingredients are listed in the order in which you should add them to a Panasonic [[breadmaker]] and set to French [[bread]] dough setting. For the [[Panasonic SD-ZB2502 automatic breadmaker]] use menu option 21, French dough. For other makes, refer to your manufacturer's instructions and set to the longest dough programme, then continue from stage 4.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 7g easy [[Bake|bake]] [[Yeast|yeast]]\n| 450g strong [[Plain flour|plain flour]]\n| 1 tablespoon full-[[Fat|fat]] dried [[Milk powder|milk powder]]\n| 2 tablespoons [[Sunflower oil|sunflower oil]]\n\n| &frac12; teaspoon [[Salt|salt]]\n| 270ml warm [[Milk|milk]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Mix the [[Flour|flour]], [[Salt|salt]], [[Yeast|yeast]] and [[Milk powder|milk powder]] in a bowl.\n| Add the [[Milk|milk]] and [[Oil|oil]] and mix to a soft [[Dough|dough]], adding a little more [[Flour|flour]] if it is too wet.\n| Knead for 10 minutes until it becomes smooth, springy and silky.\n| Lightly, but thoroughly grease the [[Milk|milk]] loaf pan with an [[Oil|oil]] such as [[Groundnut|groundnut]] which is low in monounsaturates.\n| Shape the [[Dough|dough]] into a cylinder the same length of the tin.\n| Place the [[Dough|dough]] into the bottom of the tin, engage the tabs and clip the tin together.\n| Set the tin aside in a [[warm place]] to allow the [[Bread|bread]] to rise - watch the [[Dough|dough]] through the small vision hole at the top.\n| Heat the [[Oven|oven]] to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6).\n| As soon as the [[Dough|dough]] can be seen rising towards the hole, [[Bake|bake]] for 30 minutes ([[Fan-assisted oven|fan-assisted oven]]) or 35 minutes ([[Conventional oven|conventional oven]]).\n| Allow the tin to cool for 2-3 minutes before unclipping and turn out onto a [[Cooling rack|cooling rack]].\n}}\n===Chef's notes===\nYou can make this with fresh [[yeast]] if you wish, in which case allow 15g and dissolve it in the milk before use.  This method is not suitable for [[breadmakers]].  For this recipe I used French bread flour from [[Wessexmill.co.uk|Wessex Mills]] but you can play around with various flours.\n==See also==\n* [[Milk loaf recipe]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Breadmaker recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#dough #englishmilkloaf #yeast #bake #flour #bread #milkpowder #groundnut #conventionaloven #breadmakers #fat </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "English milk loaf (TM)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=English milk loaf - A Thermomix recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#dough #thermomix #flour #bread #englishmilkloaf #yeast #driedyeast #coolingrack #warmplace #milkpowder #amazon \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This recipe for the classic English milk loaf is made in a Thermomix, then baked in the oven\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1603\n|PortionCalories = 160\n|DatePublished=13th November 2013\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Servings: 10 - 1 loaf\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime = 4 hours 45 minutes \n|PrepTime = 4 hours 10 minutes\n|CookTime = 35 minutes \n|Image = [[Image:English milk loaf recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Love the special tin</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Where can you buy that?</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Carla_Cancio-Bello,_J.D.,_on_behalf_of_Cuban_Cuisine_UK|Carla]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:English milk loaf slices.jpg|thumb|300px|right|English [[milk]] loaf slices]]\nThis recipe for the classic English milk loaf is made in a [[Thermomix]], then [[Baked|baked]] in the [[Oven|oven]]. \n\nTo give this its traditional shape, you will need a Mermaid [[Milk]] Loaf Tin which in the UK can be obtained through [[Amazon]] and other specialist kitchenware shops.  For those of you in Australia, I found some on E-bay (Australia), but unfortunately they don\u0092t seem to be available in Canada or the USA.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 7g [[Dried yeast|dried yeast]] or 15g fresh\n| 270g [[Milk|milk]]\n| 450g strong [[Bread|bread]] [[Flour|flour]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Dried|dried]] full-[[Fat|fat]] [[Milk powder|milk powder]]\n\n| 2 tablespoons [[Oil|oil]]\n| &frac12; teaspoon [[Salt|salt]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Put the [[Yeast|yeast]] in the bowl with the [[Milk|milk]] '''3 minutes / 37\u00b0 / Speed 1'''\n| Add the remaining ingredients in the order given '''15 seconds / Speed 4'''\n| Then '''2&frac12; minutes / Speed [[Knead]]'''\n| Leave in the bowl until the [[Dough|dough]] is pushing up the MC then '''10 seconds / Speed 4'''\n| Leave to rise again as before (optional)\n| Tip the [[Dough|dough]] out onto a lightly floured surface\n| Lightly, but thoroughly grease the [[Milk|milk]] loaf pan with an [[Oil|oil]] such as [[Groundnut|groundnut]] which is low in monounsaturates and shake over a light dusting of [[Flour|flour]]. \n| Shape the [[Dough|dough]] into a cylinder the same length of the tin. \n| Place the [[Dough|dough]] into the bottom of the tin, engage the tabs and clip the tin together. \n| Set the tin aside in a [[warm place]] to allow the [[Bread|bread]] to rise - watch the [[Dough|dough]] through the small vision hole at the top. \n| Heat the [[Oven|oven]] to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6). \n| As soon as the [[Dough|dough]] can be seen rising towards the hole, [[Bake|bake]] for 30 minutes ([[Fan-assisted oven|fan-assisted oven]]) or 35 minutes ([[Conventional oven|conventional oven]]). \n| Allow the tin to cool for 2-3 minutes before unclipping and turn out onto a [[Cooling rack|cooling rack]].\n}}\n===Recipe source===\n* Adapted for [[Thermomix]] from the recipe supplied with the tin.  You don\u0092t get one now, probably because it was appalling (the quantities were wrong and too small to allow the [[Dough|dough]] to rise to the top of the tin.)\n==See also==\n* [[Milk loaf recipe]]\n* [[English milk loaf]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Breadmaker recipes]]\n[[Category:Thermomix recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#dough #thermomix #flour #bread #englishmilkloaf #yeast #driedyeast #coolingrack #warmplace #milkpowder #amazon </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }

title": "Eton mess",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Eton mess, a fruit recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#etonmess #strawberries #castersugar #foodprocessor #bananas #eggwhites #doublecream #cream #icingsugar #meringue #miseenplace \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Eton mess is an English dessert consisting of a mixture of strawberries, pieces of meringue and cream, which is traditionally served at Eton College's\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 3170\n|PortionCalories = 528\n|DatePublished=20th January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 6\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime = 3 hours 15 minutes\n|PrepTime = 15 minutes plus 2 hours cooling\n|CookTime = 1 hour\n|Image = [[Image:Eton mess recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">What Ho!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.8</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Capital stuff, 'Old Bean'!</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nEton mess is an English [[Dessert|dessert]] consisting of a mixture of [[Strawberries|strawberries]], pieces of [[meringue]] and [[Cream|cream]], which is traditionally served at Eton College's annual prize giving celebration picnic on the 4th of June (actually celebrated on the last Wednesday in May). One anecdotal story is that the dessert was invented when a Labrador accidentally sat on a picnic basket in the back of a car on the way to a picnic.\n\nEton mess was served in the 1930s in the school's \"sock shop\" (tuck shop), and was originally made with either [[Strawberries|strawberries]] or [[Bananas|bananas]] mixed with [[Ice cream|ice cream]] or cream. Meringue was a later addition.\n\nThe trick to making successful meringues seems to be turning the oven heat down, immediately they go into the oven and then killing the heat after an hour and not touching them until the oven is completely cold.  It's something I learned from following Delia Smith and it has served me in good stead ever since.  Having said that though, in this recipe it's not so important as you can hide your mistakes under the mess!\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 175 g (6 oz) golden [[Caster sugar|caster sugar]]\n| 3 large [[Free range eggs|free range eggs]], discard the yolks, only the whites are required\n| 450 g (1 lb) fresh [[Strawberries|strawberries]], stems removed\n| 2 tablespoons of unrefined [[Icing sugar|icing sugar]]\n| 570 ml (1 pint) [[Double cream|double cream]]\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the oven to 150\u00b0 C (300\u00b0 F - gas 2)\n\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| This recipe is easier to create using an electric hand-whisk or [[Food processor|food processor]] and the meringues may be best made the day before\n| Measure the [[Caster sugar|caster sugar]] and place on a plate\n| Place the [[Egg whites|egg whites]] in a clean bowl and whisk until the peaks are firm\n| Add the golden [[Caster sugar|caster sugar]] a tablespoon at a time, not adding more until the previous tablespoon has been combined into the [[Egg whites|egg whites]]\n| Line a [[baking tray]] with [[grease-proof paper]] and using a tablespoon as a measure, dollop the mixture in rows on to the baking tray\n| Put the tray on a middle shelf and immediately turn the heat down to 140\u00b0 C (275\u00b0 F -  gas 1)\n| Leave them in the oven to [[Bake|bake]] for 1 hour\n| After one hour, turn the heat off, but leave them in the oven until it is completely cold\n| Once you are ready to continue, break up the meringues and layer into a large serving bowl\n| Chop half of the [[Strawberries|strawberries]], add the [[Icing sugar|icing sugar]] and blend to a puree in a [[Food processor|food processor]].  If you are fussy you may want to pass the puree through a fine sieve to remove the pips\n| Chop the remaining [[Strawberries|strawberries]] and fold into the [[Double cream|double cream]]\n| Pour the [[Cream|cream]] & [[Strawberries|strawberries]] over the meringues and make a proper mess by adding the puree!\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\n\nServe immediately or everything goes soggy, very quickly\n\n===Variations===\n\nUse fresh [[Raspberries|raspberries]] or [[Bananas|bananas]] instead of the strawberries\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Student recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#etonmess #strawberries #castersugar #foodprocessor #bananas #eggwhites #doublecream #cream #icingsugar #meringue #miseenplace </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Everyday white loaf",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Everyday white loaf, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#flour #dough #everydaywhiteloaf #yeast #mixer #breadmaker #clingfilm #knockback #thermomix #crumble #panasonicsd253breadmaker \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This recipe is based on one that I made at bread school day course at the Miele Experience\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1331\n|PortionCalories = 133\n|DatePublished=27th September 2012\n|Author = JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = Servings: 10 - 1 large loaf\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 4 hours 10 minutes\n |PrepTime = 3 hours 35 minutes\n |CookTime = 35 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Everyday white loaf recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"><span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Lovely loafJulia!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I can see how light this is going to be</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\">[[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis recipe is based on one that I made at bread school day course at the '''[http://www.miele.co.uk/events/simply-cooking/Default.aspx M\u00edele Experience Centre]'''.\n\nWe have a [[Everyday white loaf (TM)|separate recipe]] for making this in a [[Thermomix]].\n\nSee '''Variations''' below for instructions on how to partially make this in a food [[Mixer|mixer]] and [[Breadmaker|breadmaker]]\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 15g fresh [[Yeast|yeast]]\n| 300ml (approx) sparkling water, at room temperature (see Chef's notes below)\n| 500g [[Strong white bread flour|strong white bread flour]]\n| &frac34; teaspoon [[Salt|salt]]\n| 15g [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| [[Crumble]] and dissolve the [[Yeast|yeast]] in half of the water.\n| [[Sieve]] the [[Flour|flour]] and [[Salt|salt]] into a mixing bowl.\n| Cut the [[Butter|butter]] into the [[Flour|flour]] and thoroughly rub it in.\n| When the [[Yeast|yeast]] has dissolved mix it in with the [[Flour|flour]] and add the rest of the water as needed to form a moist [[Dough|dough]] - it is better for the dough to be a little bit too wet than too dry.\n| Leave to rest for 10 minutes.\n| Lightly [[Flour|flour]] a work surface and your hands and [[Kneading bread|knead]] the [[Dough|dough]] for about 10 minutes until smooth and elastic.  Don't worry about the dough sticking to your hands as it will become less moist as you work it.\n| Shape into a ball, place in an oiled bowl and cover with [[Clingfilm|clingfilm]].\n| Leave until the [[Dough|dough]] has almost doubled in size (about an hour).\n| Gently [[Knock back|knock back]] with your finger tips and repeat steps 7 and 8, but the [[Proving|proving]] should only take about 45 minutes.\n| Gently [[Knock back|knock back]] again, face downards into a rectangle, one side being the same length as the tin.\n| Roll the [[Dough|dough]] towards you as tightly as you can.\n| Flatten and stretch the ends and tuck them underneath so that they meet up in the middle.\n| Place into a 900g / 2lb loaf tin, cover with [[Clingfilm|clingfilm]] and prove until the [[Dough|dough]] reaches the top of the tin.\n| Make some diagonal slashes across the top or one long one across the lenghth and [[Bake|bake]] at 220\u00b0 C (425\u00b0 F - gas 7), [fan [[Oven|oven]] 200\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour] for 30-35 minutes until golden.\n| Cool completely on a wire rack.\n}}\n===Variations===\nThe first 4 stages can be done in a food [[Mixer|mixer]].  \n\nStages 1-9 can be done in a [[Breadmaker|breadmaker]] on the longest [[Dough|dough]] setting. [[Panasonic SD253 breadmaker]], this is French dough, for the [[Panasonic SD-ZB2502 automatic breadmaker]], use menu option 21, French dough.\n===Chef's notes===\nThe amount of water you need can depend on the heat and humidity of your kitchen.  It can also depend on the [[Flour|flour]] you are using.  I used very strong Canadian [[Bread|bread]] [[Flour|flour]], which like [[Wholemeal|wholemeal]], needs much more water than ordinary bread flour.  \n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes|White]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking|White]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes|White]]\n[[Category:Breadmaker recipes|White]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#flour #dough #everydaywhiteloaf #yeast #mixer #breadmaker #clingfilm #knockback #thermomix #crumble #panasonicsd253breadmaker </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Everyday white loaf (TM)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Everyday white loaf - A Thermomix recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#dough #clingfilm #flour #yeast #bread #thermomix #knockback #wholemeal #everydaywhiteloaf #thermomixrecipeswhite #oliveoil \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This Thermomix recipe is based on one that I made at bread school day course at the Miele Experience\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1331\n|PortionCalories = 133\n|DatePublished=20th September 2012\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = Servings: 10 - 1 large loaf\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 4 hours 10 minutes\n |PrepTime = 3 hours 35 minutes\n |CookTime = 35 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Everyday white loaf recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Bread of the people</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Made in my Thermy!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis recipe is based on one that I made at bread school day course at the '''[http://www.miele.co.uk/events/simply-cooking/Default.aspx M\u00edele Experience Centre]''' and has been adapted for making in a [[Thermomix]].  There is also a recipe for making this using the [[Everyday white loaf|conventional method]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredientsTM\n| 15g fresh [[Yeast|yeast]]\n| 300g (approx) sparkling water, at room temperature (see Chef's notes below)\n| 500g [[Strong white bread flour|strong white bread flour]]\n| &frac34; teaspoon [[Salt|salt]]\n| 15g [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Add the [[Yeast|yeast]] and water to the TM bowl.\n| Mix for '''2 minutes / Temp. 37\u00b0 / Speed 1'''.\n| Add the remaining ingredients in the order given above.\n| '''3 minutes / Knead'''\n| Leave in the TM bowl until the dough has rested and is touching the lid.\n| '''12 seconds / Knead'''\n| Tip the TM bowl upside down on a lightly floured surface .  \n| Loosen the blades by undoing the blade unit at the base.  The weight of the blades will help the dough to drop out of the bowl onto the surface.  \n| Pull any remaining bits of dough off the blades and out of the bowl.\n| Shape into a ball, place in an oiled bowl and cover with [[Clingfilm|clingfilm]].\n| Leave until the [[Dough|dough]] has almost doubled in size (about an hour).\n| Gently [[Knock back|knock back]], face downards into a rectangle, one side being the same length as the tin.\n| Roll the [[Dough|dough]] towards you as tightly as you can.\n| Flatten and stretch the ends and tuck them underneath so that they meet up in the middle.\n| Place into a 900g / 2lb loaf tin, cover with [[Clingfilm|clingfilm]] and prove until the [[Dough|dough]] reaches the top of the tin.\n| Make some diagonal slashes across the top or one long one across the lenghth and [[Bake|bake]] at 220\u00b0 C (425\u00b0 F - gas 7), [fan [[Oven|oven]] 200\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour] for 30-35 minutes until golden.\n| Cool completely on a wire rack.\n}}\n===Chef's notes===\nThe amount of water you need can depend on the heat and humidity of your kitchen.  It can also depend on the [[Flour|flour]] you are using.  I used very strong Canadian [[Bread|bread]] [[Flour|flour]], which like [[Wholemeal|wholemeal]], needs much more water than ordinary bread flour.  \n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|White]]\n[[Category:British recipes|White]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking|White]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes|White]]\n[[Category:Thermomix recipes|White]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#dough #clingfilm #flour #yeast #bread #thermomix #knockback #wholemeal #everydaywhiteloaf #thermomixrecipeswhite #oliveoil </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]

title": "Falafel wraps with Taste Sensation dips",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Falafel wraps with Taste Sensation dips\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#tastesensation #meatballs #rocket #dips #oliveoil #tomatoes #vegetarian #lemonjuice #tortilla #greekyogurt #yogurt \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=IKEAs Meat Free vegetarian meatballs in wraps with rocket and dips\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=22nd February 2020\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  1 hour, 25 minutes\n|PrepTime =  1 hour, 10 minutes\n|CookTime =  15 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 1770\n|PortionCalories = 885 \n|Image = [[Image:Falafel wraps with Taste Sensation dips recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Taste Sensation-tastic!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Just love their spices.  I could eat them straight of of the bag - and often do.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nI accidentally bought IKEA's '[[Meat]] Free' vegetarian [[Meatballs|meatballs]]. I would now buy them in preference to the actual meatballs.  They are lovely; a sort of herby [[Falafel|falafel]].  Having worked that one out, I thought this would be a good opportunity to try some of my new [[Taste Sensation|Taste Sensation]] powders as they make great [[Dips|dips]] when added to [[Yogurt|yogurt]].  The [[Rocket|rocket]] just completes these wraps.  They were fab!\n\nWhen I've made the [[Yogurt|yogurt]] [[Dips|dips]] with [[Taste Sensation]] powders, I've found they mix in better if left for a while, though if you're pushed for time, just make sure you mix them well instead.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 20 Ikea [[Vegetarian]] '[[Meat]]-Free' [[Meatballs|meatballs]], ''read '[[Falafel]]'''\n| 6 white [[Tortilla|tortilla]] wraps\n| 70 g bag of [[Rocket|rocket]]\n| 6 [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]]\n| Splash of [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| Splash of [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]]\n}}\n====for four dips====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 400 g [[Greek yogurt|Greek yogurt]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Taste Sensation Tomato powder]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Taste Sensation]] [[Lime juice|lime juice]] powder\n| 1 teaspoon [[Taste Sensation]] Sweet [[Chilli]] [[Marinade]] flavouring\n| 1 teaspoon [[Taste Sensation Piri Piri seasoning]]\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:FalafelsreadyToWrap.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Falafel / veggie meatballs; ready to wrap\nImage:TasteSensation yogurt dips.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Assorted [[Taste Sensation yogurt dips]]\n</gallery>\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Mix up the [[Dips|dips]] and leave for 1 hour, then stir again before use.\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n}}\n====the dips====\n{{RecipeMethod\n| For each of the [[Dips|dips]], add a teaspoon of the flavouring powders to three tablespoons of [[Greek yogurt]] and mix well.  Leave to stand for one hour if you have the time.\n}}\n====the wraps====\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Add IKEA's [[Meat|meat]]-free [[Meatballs|meatballs]] to a [[Lock and Lock box]], add a splash of [[Olive oil|olive oil]], pop the lid on and shake well.  I find this gives them a nice crispy coat.\n| Pop them in the [[Air Fryer]] for 15 minutes\n| [[Microwave]] the [[Tortilla|tortilla]] wraps for 20 seconds to warm them slightly\n| Tip the [[Rocket|rocket]] into a bowl and make a simple [[Salad dressing|salad dressing]] with 1 tablespoon [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and a shake of [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]]\n| Chop the [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]]\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nSmear the [[Tortillas|tortillas]] with a [[Dip|dip]] or [[Dips of your choice|dips of your choice]], add [[Rocket|rocket]], [[falafels]] and [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]], roll them up and eat them - carefully!\n===Chef's notes===\nIf you don't have an [[Air-fryer]] you can [[Oven|oven]] [[Bake|bake]] the [[Vegetarian|vegetarian]] [[Meatballs|meatballs]] for 15 minutes at 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4), fan oven 160\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour or pan fry in a little [[Olive oil|olive oil]] for 10 minutes,.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Lebanese recipes]]\n[[Category:Middle Eastern recipes]]\n[[Category:Swedish recipes]]\n[[Category:Dips and sauces]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Salad recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Air fried recipes]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n[[Category:Taste Sensation recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#tastesensation #meatballs #rocket #dips #oliveoil #tomatoes #vegetarian #lemonjuice #tortilla #greekyogurt #yogurt </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }

title": "Favourite ingredients soup (TM)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Favourite ingredients soup - A Thermomix recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#cauliflower #chillies #cheese #garlic #bouillon #chilli #beaufort #thermomixrecipes #soup #fridge #oliveoil \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This warming soup is made out of 4 of my favourite ingredients, namely cauliflower, cheese, garlic and chillies\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 973\n|PortionCalories = 243\n|DatePublished=20th October 2012\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = Serves 4 to 6\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 50 minutes\n |PrepTime = 5 minutes\n |CookTime = 45 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Favourite ingredients soup recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">How did I guess what would be in this Julia?</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">\ud83d\ude01\ud83d\ude01\ud83d\ude01</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:NonLoggedInUser|NonLoggedInUser]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis warming [[Soup|soup]] is made out of 4 of my favourite ingredients, namely [[Cauliflower|cauliflower]], [[Cheese|cheese]], [[Garlic|garlic]] and [[Chillies|chillies]].  This recipe is designed to be made in a [[Thermomix]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredientsTM\n| 380g [[Cauliflower|cauliflower]], broken into florets\n| 1 bulb [[Garlic|garlic]], peeled\n| 5 small [[Chillies|chillies]], de-stalked, with [[Seeds|seeds]] left in\n| 40g [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 150g strong, hard [[Cheese|cheese]], cut into chunks\n| 300g-400g [[Milk|milk]]\n| Up to 2 teaspoons [[Vegetable|vegetable]] [[Bouillon|bouillon]] powder\n| Seasoning, if necessary\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Add 500g cold water into the TM jug and place the [[Steaming|steaming]] basket containing the [[Cauliflower|cauliflower]], inside.\n| [[Steam]] for '''30 minutes / 100\u00b0 / Speed 1'''.\n| Remove from TM and reserve.\n| Add the [[Garlic|garlic]], [[Chillies|chillies]] and [[Oil|oil]] to the jug  and saut\u00e9 '''10 minutes / Temp. Varoma / Speed 1'''.\n| Add the reserved [[Cauliflower|cauliflower]] and the [[Cheese|cheese]] and mix '''10 seconds / Speed 5''' to chop the cheese.\n| Add the [[Milk|milk]] and [[Bouillon|bouillon]] powder and cook for '''6 minutes / 90\u00b0 / Speed 4'''.\n| Check seasoning and serve immediately.\n}}\n===Variations===\nSubstitute the [[Cauliflower|cauliflower]] with [[Broccoli|broccoli]].\n===Chef's notes===\nAdjust the quantities of [[Chillies|chillies]] and [[Garlic|garlic]] to your own taste.  I like strong flavours so some people may find the above quantities excessive.  It also depends on the type of [[Chilli|chilli]] as to its heat.  I used 'Superchilli' which is slightly on the spiteful side.\n\nThis recipe is ideal for using up any odd bits of [[Cheese|cheese]] in your [[Fridge|fridge]] and I added a mixture of [[Meldon cheese|Meldon]] (Devon) and [[Lake District Cheddar cheese|Lake District Mature]] (Cumbria).  [[Parmesan]], [[Beaufort]] or a vintage [[Cheddar]] would be ideal.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Soup and stock recipes]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Thermomix recipes]]\n\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#cauliflower #chillies #cheese #garlic #bouillon #chilli #beaufort #thermomixrecipes #soup #fridge #oliveoil </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }

This recipe uses Dragon mature Welsh cheddar cheese from south..\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=18th September 2016\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 8\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  1 hour, 25 minutes\n|PrepTime =  25 minutes\n|CookTime =  1 hour\n|TotalCalories = 3036\n|PortionCalories = 397\n|Image = [[Image:Festive fruity apple and Dragon cheddar cheese loaf recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Thanks Covid</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.8</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Might be our Christmas dinner this year \u2639\ufe0f.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nAn unusual [[Apple|apple]] and [[Cheese|cheese]] loaf that is perfect for Christmas and other festive occasions. This recipe uses [[Dragon mature Welsh cheddar cheese]] from [[South Caernarfon Creameries]].\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 2 cooking [[Apples|apples]] peeled, cored and [[Grated|grated]]\n| 90g [[Raisins|raisins]]\n| 8 large pitted [[Dates|dates]] finely chopped\n| 50g chopped [[Walnuts|walnuts]]\n| 125g [[Butter|butter]]\n| 100g soft [[Brown sugar|brown sugar]]\n| 225g [[Self-raising flour|self-raising flour]]\n| \u00bc teaspoon [[Ground cinnamon|ground cinnamon]]\n| 75g Vintage or Mature [[Cheddar|cheddar]] [[Grated|grated]]\n| 2 large [[Eggs|eggs]] lightly beaten\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4), [fan oven 160\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Grease and line a large loaf tin and set [[Oven|oven]] to 180/350/gas 4\n| Beat [[Butter|butter]] and [[Sugar|sugar]] together until light and creamy\n| [[Sieve]] [[Flour|flour]] with [[Cinnamon|cinnamon]] and place in bowl, add [[Eggs|eggs]] and beat until smooth\n| Add [[Apple|apple]], [[Walnuts|walnuts]], [[Raisins|raisins]] and [[Cheddar|cheddar]], mix in thoroughly\n| Place mixture in loaf tin and smooth over surface, [[Bake|bake]] in [[Oven|oven]] for approx. 1 hour or until cooked through and golden [[Brown|brown]] on top\n| Allow to cool for 15 minutes before turning onto wire rack\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Dragon mature Welsh cheddar cheese.jpg|thumb|300px|right|[http://www.dragonwales.co.uk/products/cheddar/mature/ Dragon mature Welsh cheddar cheese]\nImage:Dragon reduced fat mature Welsh cheddar cheese.jpg|thumb|300px|right|[http://www.dragonwales.co.uk/products/cheddar/mature-reduced-fat/ Dragon reduced fat mature Welsh cheddar cheese]\n</gallery>\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe slices lightly buttered for delicious treat\n===Variations===\nUse [[Dragon reduced fat mature Welsh cheddar cheese]] if you are watching your calories!\n===Chef's notes===\nWill keep for up to a week in an airtight [[Lock & Lock]]-type box.\n\n{{Template:Dragon cheese attribution}}\n\n==See also==\n* [[Dragon mature Welsh cheddar cheese]]\n* [[Dragon reduced fat mature Welsh cheddar cheese]]\n* [[South Caernarfon Creameries]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and title": "Fish pie (SV)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Fish pie, a sous vide recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#potatoes #fish #parsleysauce #butter #prawns #salmon #thermomix #smokedhaddock #vegetables #kingprawns #salad \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=The fish and potatoes are cooked sous-vide and finished in the oven. It contains parsley sauce which can be made conventionally or in a Thermomix\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1619\n|PortionCalories = 404\n|DatePublished=13th November 2013\n|Author = JuliaBalbilla\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  2 hours, 45 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  2 hours, 30 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Fish pie (SV) recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Looks stunning</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I especially love the spiral veg.</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The&nbsp;Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nThe [[Fish|fish]] and [[Potatoes|potatoes]] are cooked sous-vide and finished in the [[Oven|oven]].  It contains [[Parsley sauce|parsley sauce]] which can be made conventionally or in a [[Thermomix]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1kg [[Potatoes|potatoes]], peeled and cut into 25mm slices\n| 20 g [[Butter]]\n| 250g firm [[white fish]], such as [[Hake|hake]], [[Pollack|pollack]], [[Monkfish|monkfish]] or [[Basa|basa]]\n| 300g [[Salmon|salmon]] or [[Smoked haddock|smoked haddock]]\n| 200g [[King prawns|king prawns]], peeled\n| 1 quantity [[Parsley sauce (TM)|Thermomix parsley sauce]] or [[Parsley sauce|conventional parsley sauce]]\n}}\n\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat the water bath to 84\u00b0C (''183.2\u00b0F'')\n\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Put the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] in a vacuum packing pouch and smear [[Butter|butter]] over them.\n| Vacuum and seal.\n| Place in the water bath and cook leave for 1-2 hours or up to a maximum of 4.\n| Cool the water to 62\u00b0C (''143.6\u00b0F'') by removing some of the water and adding ice cubes or cold water, leaving the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] in the bath.\n| In the meantime, [[Vacuum pack|vacuum pack]] the [[Fish|fish]] in separate pouches and add to the water bath once it has reached 62\u00b0C (''143.6\u00b0F'').\n| After 30 minutes, remove the [[Prawns|prawns]], after a further 5-10 minutes remove the which [[Fish|fish]] and finally the [[Salmon|salmon]] after a further 10 minutes.\n| Also remove the [[Potatoes|potatoes]].\n| Place the pouches in s sink or bowls of iced water so that they can cool as soon as possible.\n| In the meantime, make the parsley sauce using the [[Parsley sauce|conventional method]] or with a [[Thermomix]].\n| Once the [[Fish|fish]] and [[Potatoes|potatoes]] are cool, remove them from the pouches.\n| Chop the [[Fish|fish]] into chunks and mix with the [[Prawns|prawns]].\n| Place in a [[Baking|baking]] dish and pour over the [[Parsley sauce|parsley sauce]].\n| [[Mash]] the [[Potatoes|potatoes]], adding extra [[Butter|butter]] and a little [[Milk|milk]] if desired.\n| Spread it over the [[Fish|fish]] mixture, dot with [[Butter|butter]] and [[Bake|bake]] at 200\u00b0C (''392\u00b0F'') for 30-40 minutes.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Salad|salad]] or [[Vegetables|vegetables]]\n{{SousVideSeeAlso}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Sea fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Shellfish recipes]]\n[[Category:Sous vide recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Sous vide cooking]]\n[[Category:Molecular gastronomy recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#potatoes #fish #parsleysauce #butter #prawns #salmon #thermomix #smokedhaddock #vegetables #kingprawns #salad </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Fish turnovers (MoF)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Fish turnovers (MoF), British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#parsley #potato #margarine #fish #lemonjuice #fat #plainflour #panfried #kneadingbread #sauce #mashedpotato \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A recipe for Fish turnovers. Post war cookery advice from the UK Ministry of Food\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1037\n|PortionCalories = 259\n|DatePublished=20th January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Ministry of Food Cookery calendar - 1951\n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime = 20 minutes\n|PrepTime = 10 minutes\n|CookTime = 10 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Ministry of Food Cookery calendar - 1951.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Cheap and cheerful</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">That's what most foods were just after the war.</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Sue_spins|Susie]] </span></span>\n}}\n\"Housekeeping's most important secret nowadays is to know how to make best use of the foods available.  Here are some practical suggestions for improving your inside knowledge without undue expense.\"  '''Ministry of food Cookery Calendar - April..May 1951'''\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1 lb [[mashed potato]]\n| &#189; oz [[margarine]], melted\n| 2 oz [[plain flour]]\n| [[salt]] and [[pepper]] to taste\n| 1 lb fillet of [[fish]]\n| Chopped [[parsley]]\n| [[Lemon juice]]\n| [[Fat]] for [[frying]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Mix the [[potato]], [[margarine]] and [[flour]] together , season to taste and [[Kneading bread|knead]] well.  Divide into eight portions and roll each into a round\n| Wash the [[fish]] and cut into small pieces, place an  equal portion into each [[potato]] round and add seasoning to taste, 1 level teaspoons [[parsley]] and &#189; teaspoon [[lemon juice]]\n| Damp the edges of the rounds, fold over and press the edges well together\n| [[Fry]] in a little hot [[fat]] for 10 minutes and until brown on both sides\n| Serve hot with [[parsley]] [[sauce]] and [[spinach]]\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Freshwater fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Sea fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#parsley #potato #margarine #fish #lemonjuice #fat #plainflour #panfried #kneadingbread #sauce #mashedpotato </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Fish with tomato sauce (TM)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Fish with tomato sauce - A Thermomix recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#tomatoes #oliveoil #sauce #garlic #celery #potato #frenchbeans #fishstock #fish #thermomixrecipes #whitefish \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This easy recipe is made in a Thermomix\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 787\n|PortionCalories = 393\n|DatePublished=20th October 2012\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = Serves 2\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 45 minutes\n |PrepTime = 10 minutes\n |CookTime = 35 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Fish and tomato sauce recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Fish stew made in my Thermie</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Love how easy this is</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:NonLoggedInUser|NonLoggedInUser]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis easy recipe is made in a [[Thermomix]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredientsTM\n| 25g [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 50g  [[Garlic|garlic]], peeled\n| 1 stick [[Celery|celery]], cut into chunks\n| 200g [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]], cut in half\n| &frac12; [[Fish stock|fish stock]] cube\n| A little water, if necessary\n| 350g [[white fish]] fillets, each cut unto 2 or 3 pieces\n| 85g [[French beans]], as many as desired\n| Seasoning\n| Extra [[Olive oil|olive oil]] for drizzling\n| 350g [[Potato|potato]], chopped (slightly larger than an [[Oxo cube]])\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Put the [[Oil|oil]] in the jug to heat for '''7 minutes / Temp Varoma / Speed 1'''. \n| Meanwhile, peel the [[Garlic|garlic]] and when the [[Oil|oil]] has heated add the garlic and [[Celery|celery]] to the jug without stopping the machine and increase to '''Speed 5''' for a few seconds until chopped. \n| Reduce to '''Speed 1''' and allow to saut\u00e9 for about '''7 minutes'''.\n| Add the [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]] and [[Fish stock|fish stock]] cube and blitz for '''5 seconds / Speed 5'''.\n| Add some water if too thick - this depends on the ripeness of the [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]] \n| Place the [[Fish|fish]] and the [[French beans]] in Varoma tray, season and drizzle with a little [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| Add the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] to the Varoma bowl.\n| Cook for '''20 minutes / Temp. Varoma / Speed 1'''.\n| Plate up the [[Fish|fish]], [[Beans|beans]] and [[Potato|potato]] and pour over the [[Sauce|sauce]].\n}}\n===Chef's notes===\nThe [[Sauce|sauce]] in the photograph looks quite thin.  This is because I over estimated the amount of water, plus the [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]] were rather ripe.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Sea fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Thermomix recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#tomatoes #oliveoil #sauce #garlic #celery #potato #frenchbeans #fishstock #fish #thermomixrecipes #whitefish </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }

title": "Flageolet bean salad",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Flageolet bean salad, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#beans #flageoletbeansalad #flageoletbeans #oliveoil #parsley #lemon #unusualrecipes #dried #cookery #simmer #chickpeas \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Another recipe from my Mum's sheaf of cookery notes. This went very nicely with some sliced ham\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 214\n|PortionCalories = 107\n|DatePublished=11th August 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime = 1 day, 2 hours, 20 minutes\n|PrepTime = 1 day, 20 minutes\n|CookTime = 2 hours\n|Image = [[Image:Flageolet bean salad recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">A great accompaniment</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">We make this once a week - great with pizzas and pies.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nAnother recipe from my Mum's sheaf of [[Cookery|cookery]] notes.  This went very nicely with some sliced ham.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 225 g (8 oz) [[Dried|dried]] [[Flageolet beans|flageolet beans]]\n| 1 whole [[Lemon|lemon]]\n\n| 4 tablespoons [[Olive oil]]\n| 2 [[Garlic cloves, peeled and crushed|garlic cloves, peeled and crushed]]\n| 3 tablespoons of freshly chopped [[Parsley|parsley]]\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Soak the [[Beans|beans]] overnight in cold unsalted water\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Add the [[beans]] to plenty of cold water\n| Bring to the [[Boil|boil]], reduce and [[Simmer|simmer]] viperously for 1 hour or until tender but not mushy\n| Drain and allow to cool a little\n| Mix the remaining ingredients together and pour over the drained [[Beans|beans]]\n| Cover and [[Marinade|marinade]] for 2 hours or more\n| Season to taste and serve\n}}\n===Recipe source===\n\n* My Mum!\n===Variations===\nIt would have been nice garnished with a few slices of raw onion.\n\nUse 2 x 400g cans of well rinsed and drained [[flageolet beans]] instead of dried beans.  Any [[beans]] or [[chick peas]] would work well in this recipe.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Grain and bean recipes]]\n[[Category:Salad recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#beans #flageoletbeansalad #flageoletbeans #oliveoil #parsley #lemon #unusualrecipes #dried #cookery #simmer #chickpeas </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

cloves, peeled and crushed|garlic cloves, peeled and crushed]]\n| 3 tablespoons of freshly chopped [[Parsley|parsley]]\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Soak the [[Beans|beans]] overnight in cold unsalted water\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Add the beans to plenty of cold water\n| Bring to the [[Boil|boil]], reduce and [[Simmer|simmer]] viperously for 1 hour or until tender but not mushy\n| Drain and allow to cool a little\n| Mix the remaining ingredients together and pour over the drained title": "Folded breakfast pizza",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Folded breakfast pizza\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#pizza #bakedbeans #pizza #bakedbeanpizza #breakfastpizza #baconandbeans #pizzas #pizzastone #russelsofupwell\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=An egg, sausage, bacon and baked beans calzone pizza. Perfect Heinz beans folded pizza\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=6th March 2023\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  1 hour, 45 minutes\n|PrepTime =  1 hour, 15 minutes\n|CookTime =  30 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 2129\n|PortionCalories = 1064\n|Image = [[Image:Folded breakfast pizza recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">A fabulous pizza</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I couldn't eat one for breakfast though \ud83d\ude32</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Sue_spins|Susie]] </span></span>\n}}\nAn [[Egg|egg]], [[Sausage|sausage]], [[Bacon|bacon]] and [[baked beans]] folded [[Calzone pizza|calzone pizza]].\n\nThis recipe makes 2 nice big [[Pizzas|pizzas]], perfect for two hungry people! I don't think I could eat this for [[Breakfast|breakfast]] though, but it makes a wonderful evening meal!\n\nIt's worth draining the excess sauce from the [[Beans|baked beans]] and removing the extra water from the [[Mozzarella|mozzarella]] or your [[Pizza|pizza]] might be a bit soggy.\n\nYou can make your own [[Pizza dough|pizza dough]] or buy ready made [[Pizza|pizza]] [[Dough|dough]], the rest is easy.  There's a page [[Calzone folding|here on how to crimp the folded pizza]] if you're unsure how to do it.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 portion [[Pizza dough|pizza dough]]\n| 2 slices of [[Treacle Cured Bacon from Russell's of Upwell]]\n| 2 [[Pork sausages|pork sausages]]\n| 2 large [[Eggs|eggs]]\n| 1 can of Heinz [[Beans|beans]] (415 g)\n| 1 ball [[Mozzarella cheese|mozzarella cheese]]\n| 100 g [[Grated|grated]] [[Cheddar cheese|cheddar cheese]]\n| 50 g [[Grated|grated]] [[Gruyere cheese|gruyere cheese]] (optional) \n| [[Cornmeal]] for dusting; use [[Plain flour|plain flour]] at a push\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Tip the [[Beans|beans]] out into a [[Sieve|sieve]] or [[Colander|colander]] and leave it for an hour to allow most of the [[Sauce|sauce]] to drain. Discard the drained sauce.\n* Squeeze as much of the water as you can from the [[Mozzarella|mozzarella]] and tear into small pieces.\n* Leave it in a [[Sieve|sieve]] to drain while the [[Beans|beans]] do the same.\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 210\u00b0 C (410\u00b0 F - gas 6)\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Slice the [[Sausages|sausages]] lengthwise - this helps them cook properly\n| Chop the [[Bacon|bacon]] into small bite-size pieces\n| Grate the [[Cheddar]] or mixture of hard [[Cheese|cheeses]]\n| We find it easier to divide the fillings onto separate dishes prior to 'building' the two [[Pizzas|pizzas]] - up to you!\n| Divide the [[Pizza dough|pizza dough]] into two portions and roll out on a worksurface liberally  dusted with [[Cornmeal|cornmeal]] to stop it sticking\n| If you're using a [[Pizza stone|pizza stone]], build the [[Pizzas|pizzas]] on a really well dusted [[Baking tray|baking tray]] or you'll never get them off your work surface\n| When filling the [[Pizza|pizza]] try to keep the filling to one half of the [[Pizza dough|pizza dough]]\n| Also make sure you leave a decent 'edge' unfilled or you will have a job crimping it\n| Sprinkle the [[Mozzarella|mozzarella]] and [[Cheddar|cheddar]], etc. over one half the base of each [[Pizza|pizza]]\n| Pour the [[Baked beans|baked beans]] over the [[Cheese|cheese]]\n| Cover with the chopped [[Bacon|bacon]] and place the slices [[Sausages|sausages]] over the [[Beans|beans]] and [[Cheese|cheese]]\n| Top with a raw [[Egg|egg]]\n| Fold the [[Pizza|pizza]] over and [[Calzone folding|crimp the edges]] to make sure none of the lovely filling escapes while cooking\n| Make a couple of holes in the top of each [[Pizza|pizza]]\n| [[Bake]] for 30 minutes at  210\u00b0 C (410\u00b0)\n| Remove it from the [[Oven|oven]] and leave to [[Rest for|rest for]] 10 minutes if you can wait! This way you can make sure the [[Sausage|sausage]] is properly cooked\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Folded breakfast calzone pizza on a pizza stone.jpg|Two baked bean breakfast pizzas baked on the pizza stone after 30 minutes\nImage:Baked bean calzone pizza ready to bake on a pizza stone.jpg|Ready to bake for 30 minutes at 210\u00b0 C - 410\u00b0 F\nImage:Baked bean sausage bacon egg pizza ready to fold.jpg|Ready to fold and crimp - cross your fingers!\nImage:The ingredients for a baked bean and breafast pizza.jpg|All of the ingredients for a breakfast calzone pizza\n</gallery>\n===Recipe source===\n* I got the idea from this from a daytime tv [[Air-fryer|air-fryer]] advert and thought that using a [[Pizza stone|pizza stone]] I can do a better job of this than they did in an air-fryer\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Italian recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Pizza recipes]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#pizza #bakedbeans #pizza #bakedbeanpizza #breakfastpizza #baconandbeans #pizzas #pizzastone #russelsofupwell</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Four allia soup",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Four allia soup a cheese recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#fouralliasoup #oliveoil #garlic #cider #cheese #flour #springonions #foil #onions #butter #fat \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This is a recipe based on French onion soup, but uses four types of the 'Allium' family and has cider as the alcoholic liquid rather than wine and/or\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2661\n|PortionCalories = 665\n|DatePublished=17th January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Four Allia soup\n |Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 2 hours 30 minutes\n |PrepTime = 15 minutes\n |CookTime = 2 hours 15 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Four Allia soup recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">\ud83e\uddc5\ud83e\uddc5\ud83e\uddc5\ud83e\uddc5 = \ud83c\udf75</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Very French!</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Garlic ready for roasting.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Garlic ready for roasting]]\nThis is a recipe based on French [[Onion|onion]] [[Soup|soup]], but uses four types of the 'Allium' family and has [[Cider|cider]] as the alcoholic liquid rather than [[Wine|wine]] and/or [[Brandy|brandy]].  Also I have used a good [[Cheese|cheese]] to sprinkle on top.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 4 bulbs [[Garlic|garlic]], whole\n| [[Olive oil]]\n| 2 large [[Onions|onions]], coarsely sliced\n| 1 tablespoon [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 40g [[Butter|butter]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Salt|salt]]\n| &#189; teaspoon of [[Sugar|sugar]]\n| Bunch of [[Spring onions|spring onions]], finely chopped\n| 1 extremely [[Fat|fat]] [[Leek|leek]] or 2 medium ones, sliced thickly and washed thoroughly\n| 40g [[flour]]\n| 1.85 litres boiling [[vegetable stock]]\n| 150 ml dry [[cider]]\n| 225g [[Single Gloucester cheese]], grated\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the oven to 180 C/350 F/Gas 4.\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Keeping the bulbs intact, slice off the tops so that the flesh of each [[Clove|clove]] is exposed, and place in [[Foil|foil]] and put into a [[Baking|baking]] dish.\n| Sprinkle with [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and loosely enclose in the [[Foil|foil]].\n| [[Bake]] for about an hour on a low shelf of the oven.\n| In the meantime, place the [[Onions|onions]] in a large pan on a lowish heat, with the tablespoon [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and the [[Butter|butter]].\n| Cover and allow to [[Stew|stew]] for 15 minutes.\n| Add the [[Salt|salt]] and [[Sugar|sugar]], and allow to caramelise slightly.\n| Add the [[spring onions]] and the [[leeks]] and cook very gently, uncovered for about 30 minutes.\n| Meanwhile, squeeze the [[Garlic|garlic]] cloves from their skins into a bowl.\n| Stir in the [[flour]] and cook for 3 minutes.\n| Add the [[Garlic|garlic]], [[stock]] and the [[cider]] and simmer for a further 40 minutes.\n| Serve in bowls with the [[cheese]] sprinkled on the top.\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Four allia soup]]\n[[Category:Cooking with beer]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes|Four allia soup]]\n[[Category:British recipes|Four allia soup]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Soup and stock recipes|Four allia soup]]\n[[Category:Starters|Four allia soup]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes|Four allia soup]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes|Four allia soup]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#fouralliasoup #oliveoil #garlic #cider #cheese #flour #springonions #foil #onions #butter #fat </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Four and twenty blackbirds",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Four and twenty blackbirds, an historic british recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#fourandtwentyblackbirds #unusualrecipes #britishrecipes \n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=: Sing a song of sixpence, : a pocket full of rye.: Four and twenty blackbirds, : baked in a pie.: When the pie was opened, : the birds began to sing\n|datePublished=2013-01-22\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n: Sing a song of sixpence, \n\n: a pocket full of rye.\n\n: Four and twenty blackbirds, \n\n: baked in a pie.\n\n: When the pie was opened, \n\n: the birds began to sing.\n\n: Wasn't that a dainty dish \n\n: to set before the king?\n\n: The king was in his counting house, \n\n: counting out his money.\n\n: The queen was in the parlour, \n\n: eating bread and honey.\n\n: The maid was in the garden, \n\n: hanging out the clothes,\n\n: When down came a blackbird \n\n: and pecked off her nose!\n\nAccording to the Oxford Dictionary of Nursery Rhymes, an Italian cookbook from 1549 (translated into English in 1598) actually contains a recipe \"to make pies so that birds may be alive in them and flie out when it is cut up.\" The ODNR also cites a 1723 cook who describes this as an earlier practice, the idea being that the birds cause \"a diverting Hurley-Burley amongst the Guests.\"\n\nWe have managed to collect a few [[:Category:historic recipes|historic recipes for you here]].\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Blackbirds]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes|Blackbirds]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n{{BottomBanner}}\n{{RecipeSkip}}\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#fourandtwentyblackbirds #unusualrecipes #britishrecipes </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }

title": "Freezing apples",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Freezing apples; a  recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#apples #freezingapples #freezer #frozen #freezing #freeze #miseenplace #bakingtray #driedappleslices \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Not a recipe, just a useful idea for using the glut of apples you seem to get in the Autumn\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 182\n|PortionCalories = 182\n|DatePublished=27th September 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Fast frozen, bagged sealed and ready for the freezer\n |Servings = 1\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 15 minutes\n |PrepTime = 15 minutes\n |CookTime = None\n|Image = [[Image:Freezing apples bagged.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Thanks Debs</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">A great tip.  We use this all the time now.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nNot a recipe, just a useful idea for using the glut of [[Apples|apples]] you seem to get in the Autumn.\n\nI have made [[Dried apple slices|dried apple slices]] as a way to use lots of apples but to be honest, you can only eat so many of them.\n\n[[Freezing]] them was an idea my neighbour came up with and it seems rather good as in most cases, [[Frozen|frozen]] [[Apples|apples]] would still be fine for cooking.\n\nWhilst there is a lot of fiddling about; peeling and trimming, the benefit is that you probably have organic [[Apples|apples]] if they have come from your garden.  \n\nI was staggered to learn from a Kentish orchard owner that [[Apples|apples]] are sprayed once a week until they are picked!  That really can't be great for you.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 2 kg [[Apples]]\n| Juice of 1 [[lemon]]\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n*Wash, peel and trim the [[Apples|apples]] removing any bruised, marked or bad parts.\n*Keeping them in water as you process them appears to stop then turning too [[Brown|brown]]\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Cut them into quarters and place in a bowl and add the [[lemon juice]]\n| Mix well then place them on a [[Baking tray|baking tray]].\n| [[Freeze]] them in the fast freeze section of your [[Freezer|freezer]] if it has such a thing.\n| The next day, remove them from the tray and in small amounts, bag and seal them in [[Freezer|freezer]] bags.\n| Stored in the freezer they should keep for 6 to 10 months, especially if the bags are properly sealed.\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Freezing apples trimmed.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Peeled, cored trimmed and quartered, ready to speed-freeze\nImage:How to freeze cooking apples.jpg|thumb|300px|right|[[Apples|Apples]], good, bad and ugly\n</gallery>\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Pickles and preserves]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n[[Category:Uncooked]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#apples #freezingapples #freezer #frozen #freezing #freeze #miseenplace #bakingtray #driedappleslices </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Freezing horseradish",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Freezing horseradish\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#roots #horseradish #freezing #freezinghorseradish #horseradishroot #veganrecipes #unusualrecipes #oils #dipsandsauces #horseradishsauce\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=An experiment in freezing raw horseradish roots for later use\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=19th October 2020\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Raw horseradish roots, vacuum sealed, ready to freeze\n|Servings = Serves 10\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  3 hours, 25 minutes\n|PrepTime =  3 hours, 25 minutes\n|CookTime = None\n|TotalCalories = 250\n|PortionCalories = 25\n|Image = [[Image:Freezing horseradish recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Simples</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">..as some of the best things are. Don;t make it any harder than you need.</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]])</span></span>\n}}\nInitially I was uncertain if this idea would work - it works perfectly and I'm now a convert.  This is the way to store horseradish!\n\nI have had superb success in [[Freezing|freezing]] [[Ginger|ginger]] and [[Garlic|garlic]] for later use in small amounts so as I thought I would experiment with [[Horseradish|horseradish]] to see if it be treated in the same way.\n\nI've chosen not to grate it before [[Freezing|freezing]] at a I don't want to lose any of the essential [[Oils|oils]].  After leaving it frozen for a week, to finish this experiment I made a [[horseradish dip]] by grating an inch of the root with a few tablespoons of [[Greek yogurt]] and a teaspoon of [[lime juice]]. It was superb, not too harsh and just lovely for dipping [[Twice fried, air fried potato chips]].\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Horseradish Roots To Vacuum Seal.jpg|Raw horseradish roots ready to vacuum seal\nImage:Cleaned and dried horseradish root pieces.jpg|Cleaned and dried horseradish root pieces\n</gallery>\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| Dig up 2 medium [[Horseradish|horseradish]] plants\n| The yield from 1 medium-sized [[Horseradish|horseradish]] plant is about 250g once trimmed and cleaned\n| 500 g [[Horseradish root|horseradish root]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Soak the [[Roots|roots]] in a bucket for a few hours so you can remove the loose earth easily.\n| Trim the leaves from the [[Roots|roots]] and discard them.\n| In a ventilated place, use a sharp [[Knife|knife]] to trim root hairs and small [[Roots|roots]] from the main roots.\n| Scrub the [[Roots|roots]] clean and use a sharp [[Knife|knife]] to  scrape the roots, rather as you would clean an old [[Carrot|carrot]].\n| Cut the [[Roots|roots]] into thumb sized pieces.\n| [[Dry]] the pieces of [[Horseradish|horseradish]] [[Roots|roots]] in a [[Salad spinner|salad spinner]].\n| [[Vacuum seal]] the [[Roots|roots]] in dated bags and [[Freeze|freeze]] for later use.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\n[[Defrost]] at a later [[Date|date]] to make [[Horseradish sauce|horseradish sauce]] or [[horseradish dip]].\n{{Template:HorseradishSeeAlso}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Dips and sauces]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n[[Category:Frozen]]\n[[Category:Uncooked]]\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#roots #horseradish #freezing #freezinghorseradish #horseradishroot #veganrecipes #unusualrecipes #oils #dipsandsauces #horseradishsauce</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
