It is vegilicious\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=6th February 2021\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  5 minutes\n|PrepTime =  5 minutes\n|CookTime = None\n|TotalCalories = 194\n|PortionCalories = 97\n|Image = [[Image:Fresh carrot and onion salad recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Lovely, even in the Winter</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">So easy, so nice!</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nWe love this recipe; and probably have this two or three times a week.\n\nIf you have a [[Food-processor|food-processor]], it only takes a few minutes to prepare.  Do try it, it's fantastic! &#129367;&#129365;\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 3 small [[Carrots|carrots]]\n| 1 medium white [[Onion|onion]]\n| 2 tablespoons of [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 1tbs [[Cider vinegar|cider vinegar]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Honey|honey]]\n| Pinch of pink [[Sea Salt|sea salt]]\n| Pinch of [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Top, tail and peel the [[Carrots|carrots]]\n| Remove the skin from the [[Onion|onion]]\n| Finely slice the [[Onion|onion]]\n| Grate the [[Carrot|carrot]] on the finest setting\n}}\n====dressing====\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Mix all of the dressing ingredients together, ensuring the [[Honey|honey]] is properly dissolved\n| Pour over the [[Salad|salad]] and mix well\n| Chill, if required, and serve\n}}\n===Variations===\nFresh [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]] and a little [[Zest|zest]] of [[Lemon|lemon]] makes a good substitute for the [[Cider vinegar|cider vinegar]].\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Salad recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Uncooked]]\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#onion #vegilicious #freshcarrotandonionsalad #cidervinegar #honey #carrots #snacksandlightbites #starters #vegetablerecipes #salad #britishrecipes #freshlygroundblackpepper</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Fresh peas with ham and garlic",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Fresh peas with ham and garlic a British recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#peas #freshpeaswithhamandgarlic #garlic #bacon #frozenpeas #ham #broadbeans #boil #blackpepper #frozen #oliveoil \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Peas, ham and garlic are three flavours that really go well together\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 335\n|PortionCalories = 167\n|DatePublished=31st October 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 2\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 6 minutes \n |PrepTime = 3 minutes\n |CookTime = 3 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Fresh peas with ham and garlic recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Nice with beans too</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I like to do the same with tinned cannelloni beans</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The&nbsp;Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\n\n[[Peas]], [[Ham|ham]] and [[Garlic|garlic]] are three flavours that really go well together.  This simple recipe combines all three as a great [[Side dish|side dish]], add a little [[Pasta|pasta]] and you have a superb supper.\n\nIt is ideally made using fresh [[Peas|peas]] but is equally good with [[Frozen|frozen]] baby peas.  I would not use minted peas for this, though that's a personal preference.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| A dash of [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 2 Cloves of [[Garlic|garlic]], peeled and finely sliced\n| 175 g (6 oz) fresh or [[Frozen peas|frozen peas]]\n| 4 slices or [[Parma ham|parma ham]], [[Home smoked bacon|Home smoked bacon]] or good quality dry-[[Cured|cured]] [[Bacon|bacon]]\n| A grind of [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* If using [[Frozen peas|frozen peas]] or large fresh [[Peas|peas]], cook as you would do normally, either [[Microwave|microwave]] or [[Boil|boil]] for a few minutes. Drain well.\n* Omit this stage if you are using fresh baby [[Peas|peas]].\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Slice the [[Bacon|bacon]] into bite-sized strips\n| Heat the [[Oil|oil]] in a small pan and add the [[Garlic|garlic]] slices\n| As soon as it starts to colour, add the [[Ham|ham]] or [[Bacon|bacon]]\n| [[Stir fry]] for a few minutes, until the [[Meat|meat]] takes a little colour\n| Add the [[Peas|peas]] and continue to heat whilst jiggling the pan\n| Serve immediately\n}}\n===Variations===\nThis would work well with baby [[Broad beans|broad beans]] too\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Stir fried]][[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#peas #freshpeaswithhamandgarlic #garlic #bacon #frozenpeas #ham #broadbeans #boil #blackpepper #frozen #oliveoil </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

Not the nasty Deep deep fried stuff but lovely bacon flavoured toast - cooked in an Air air fryer. To save on..\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=29th November 2022\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 1\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  15 minutes\n|PrepTime =  \n|CookTime =  15 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 210\n|PortionCalories = 210\n|Image = [[Image:Bacon fried bread cooked in an air fryer.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Superb fried bread</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Tasty, not greasy!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry]] </span></span>\n}}\nA great way to make delicious '[[Fried|fried]] [[Bread|bread]]'.\n\nNot the nasty [[Deep fried|deep fried]] stuff but lovely [[Bacon|bacon]] flavoured toast - cooked in an [[Air Fryer|air fryer]].\n\nTo save on cleaning the air fryer, use a [[silicone baking tray]].  That can be washed separately and the air frier just needs a quick rinse; popping it back in the warm air fryer will dry it nicely to save it rusting.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| One thick slice of proper [[Bread|bread]]\n| One thick slice of fatty back [[Bacon|bacon]] - Treacly bacon from Russell's of Upwell is perfect.\n}}\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Place the bacon on the slice of toast in a dry [[silicone baking tray]], no extra oil needed\n| Cook in the [[Air Fryer|air fryer]] for up to 15 minutes at 200\u00b0 C\n| Turn the toasty [[Bread|bread]] and [[Bacon|bacon]] a few times if you can\n| That's it, gorgeous toasty [[Fried|fried]] [[Bread|bread]], with a slice of [[Bacon|bacon]] to go with it.\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Two silicone baking tins for air fryers.jpg|Two silicone trays for less than \u00a310 - [https://www.amazon.co.uk/gp/product/B08JHZ7YKZ/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_search_asin_title?ie=UTF8&psc=1 Amazon UK November 2022]\nImage:Cooking sausages in an airfryer recipe.jpg|thumb|right|A Pyrex bowl also works and saves on washing-up\n</gallery>\n===Chef's notes===\nAs this was my breakfast I added a single piece of [[Goddard's air fried chicken pieces|Goddard's air fried chicken]] because I could. ''It also cooks in the same time''.\n\n===See also===\n* [[Russell's Butchers of Upwell, Norfolk]]\n* [[Treacle Cured Bacon from Russell's of Upwell's]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Air fried recipes]]\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#bread #bacon #airfryer #siliconebakingtray #fried #goddardsairfriedchickenpieces #snacksandlightbites #accompaniments #airfriedrecipes #deepfried #porkrecipes</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Fruity sausage and coconut curry",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Fruity sausage and coconut curry recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#currypowder #fruitysausageandcoconutcurry #sultanas #onion #apple #coconutcream #chillipowder #sausages #sunfloweroil #curry #miseenplace \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A fruity sausage curry which has a lovely coconut flavour from using coconut milk\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 995\n|PortionCalories = 165\n|DatePublished=25th October 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 6\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  1 hour, 5 minutes\n|PrepTime =  20 minutes\n|CookTime =  45 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Fruity sausage and coconut curry recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Simple sausage curry</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Very simple, very sausagey!</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Butchers-classic-cumberland-sausages.png|300px|thumb|right|[[Debbie and Andrew's Butcher's Classic Cumberland Sausages]]]]\nA fruity [[Sausage|sausage]] [[Curry|curry]] which has a lovely [[Coconut|coconut]] flavour from using [[Coconut milk|coconut milk]].  This recipe comes to [[Cookipedia]] courtesy of [[Debbie&andrew's sausages|debbie&andrew's sausages]].\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 2 packs [[Debbie and Andrew's Butcher's Classic Cumberland Sausages]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Sunflower oil|sunflower oil]]\n| 1 [[Onion|onion]], chopped\n| 2 [[Cloves garlic, crushed|cloves garlic, crushed]]\n| 1 [[Apple|apple]], cored and chopped\n| 2 teaspoons [[Curry powder|curry powder]]\n| A pinch [[Chilli powder|chilli powder]]\n| 75g [[Sultanas|sultanas]]\n| 1 [[Chicken stock|chicken stock]] cube\n| 1 x 400ml tin [[Coconut cream|coconut cream]]\n| 350ml water\n| [[Salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]] to taste\n| 1 tablespoon dark [[Brown|brown]] soft [[Sugar|sugar]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6), [fan oven 180\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| [[Bake]] your [[Sausages|sausages]] in a lightly oiled [[Baking tray|baking tray]] in the preheated [[Oven|oven]] for 20 minutes, shaking the pan once or twice during that time. Remove and put to one side.\n| Heat the [[Oil|oil]] in a large [[Saucepan|saucepan]] over a medium heat. Cook the [[Onion|onion]] and [[Garlic|garlic]] until fragrant.\n| Stir in the [[Apple|apple]], [[Curry powder|curry powder]], [[Chilli powder|chilli powder]] and [[Sultanas|sultanas]]. Cook for 2 minutes.\n| Now [[Crumble|crumble]] over the [[Stock cube|stock cube]], add the [[Coconut cream|coconut cream]] and water and season with [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]. Stir well.\n| Add the cooked [[Sausages|sausages]] to the pan and [[Simmer|simmer]], covered, for 20 minutes, stirring occasionally.\n| Just before serving, stir in the [[Sugar|sugar]].\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Plain boiled rice|plain boiled rice]] and maybe a [[poppadum]] or two.\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Indian recipes]]\n[[Category:Oriental cuisine]]\n[[Category:Thai recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Debbie&andrew's sausage recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n{{Template:DebbieAndAndrew attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#currypowder #fruitysausageandcoconutcurry #sultanas #onion #apple #coconutcream #chillipowder #sausages #sunfloweroil #curry #miseenplace </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Fruity sausage and lentil hotpot (GF)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Fruity sausage lentil hotpot a gluten free recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#casserole #bayleaves #celery #sausages #onions #stock #carrots #recipesfromothersites #puylentils #cookipedia #fruitysausageandlentilhotpotgf \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A one pot sausage and vegetable hotpot with a fruity finish. This recipe is gluten free\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1050\n|PortionCalories = 175\n|DatePublished=24th October 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 6\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  2 hours, 20 minutes\n|PrepTime =  20 minutes\n|CookTime =  2 hours\n|Image = [[Image:Fruity sausage and lentil hotpot GF recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Fruity-tooty</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">In a hot-pot - yum!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]] </span></span>\n}}\nA one pot [[Sausage|sausage]] and [[Vegetable|vegetable]] hotpot with a fruity finish.  This recipe is [[Gluten free|gluten free]] and is brought to [[Cookipedia]] courtesy of debbieandanndrew's [[Sausages|sausages]].\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 2tbsp [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 2 [[Onions|onions]], peeled and sliced\n| 2 [[Carrots|carrots]], peeled and sliced\n| 2 sticks [[Celery|celery]], sliced\n| 2 [[Bay leaves|bay leaves]]\n| 1tsp fresh [[Thyme leaves|thyme leaves]]\n| 1 pack debbie&andrew's Perfect Cumberland [[Pork sausages|pork sausages]]\n| 500ml [[Chicken stock|chicken stock]]\n| 150g [[Puy lentils|puy lentils]]\n| 200g [[Dried apricots|dried apricots]]\n| [[Salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 140\u00b0 C (257\u00b0 F - gas 1), [fan oven 120\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Heat 1 tablespoon of [[Oil|oil]] in a large [[Casserole|casserole]] over a medium heat. Add the [[Onions|onions]], [[Carrots|carrots]], [[Celery|celery]], [[Bay leaves|bay leaves]] and [[Thyme|thyme]] and [[Sweat|sweat]] for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally.\n| In a large [[Frying pan|frying pan]], heat the second tablespoon of [[Oil|oil]] and then [[Brown|brown]] the [[Sausages|sausages]] all over for 10 minutes or so.\n| Add the [[Browned|browned]] sausages to the [[Casserole|casserole]].\n| Pour a little [[Stock|stock]] in to the [[Frying pan|frying pan]] and heat for a few minutes to soak up all the [[Meat|meat]] juices, then add this liquid to the [[Casserole|casserole]].\n| Now add the [[Lentils|lentils]], [[Apricots|apricots]] and the [[Rest|rest]] of the [[Stock|stock]].\n| Make sure the liquid covers the ingredients. If not, just add a little water until it does.\n| Cook uncovered in the preheated [[Oven|oven]] for 1 and \u00bd hours, stirring once or twice in that time.\n| Remove the [[Bay leaves|bay leaves]], season to taste.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with a simple [[Green salad|green salad]] and chunks of fresh [[Udi's Gluten Free Products|gluten free bread]].\n===See also===\n* [[Udi's Gluten Free Products|Udi's gluten free bread and baking products]]\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Gluten free recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Stews and casseroles]]\n[[Category:Debbie&andrew's sausage recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Stewed, braised or pot roasted]]\n{{Template:DebbieAndAndrew attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#casserole #bayleaves #celery #sausages #onions #stock #carrots #recipesfromothersites #puylentils #cookipedia #fruitysausageandlentilhotpotgf </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Fruit crumble (TM)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Fruit crumble a Thermomix recpe recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#fruit #crumble #cinnamon #unsaltedbutter #demerarasugar #apples #dough #dice #strained #custard #confit \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This Thermomix method of making a fruit crumble is very simple and ensures that the crumble topping is not too stodgy\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2483\n|PortionCalories = 310\n|DatePublished=27th May 2015\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 8\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  45 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime = 25 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Fruit crumble TM recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Make it with rhubarb</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">..just as it should be!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Sue_spins|Susie]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis method of making a [[Fruit|fruit]] [[Crumble|crumble]] is very simple and ensures that the [[Crumble topping|crumble topping]] is not too stodgy.\n{{RecipeIngredientsTM\n}}\n====For the crumble topping====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 100g [[Plain flour|plain flour]]\n| 50g [[Ground almonds|ground almonds]]\n| 125g chilled, [[Unsalted butter|unsalted butter]], cut into cubes\n| 70g [[Demerara sugar|demerara sugar]]\n}}\n====For the fruit compote====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 750g [[Fruit|fruit]] - [[Dice]] larger fruit ([[Apples|apples]], [[Pears|pears]], [[Peaches|peaches]] etc) into 2cm cubes.\n| 60g [[Unsalted butter|unsalted butter]]\n| 60g [[Demerara sugar|demerara sugar]]\n| [[Cinnamon]], to taste\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Pre-heat the [[Oven|oven]] to 190C/170C fan/gas 5\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Put the ingredients for the [[Crumble|crumble]] mixture into the bowl '''Turbo three times'''\n| Spread the mixture on a [[Baking tray|baking tray]] and [[Bake|bake]] for 15 minutes or until golden.  Do not allow to burn.\n| Meanwhile, without washing the bowl, start the [[Fruit|fruit]] compote by melting the [[Butter|butter]] and [[Sugar|sugar]] '''7 minutes / 90C / Speed Spoon'''.\n| Add any hard [[Fruit|fruit]], eg [[Apples|apples]] '''3 minutes / 100C / Speed Spoon / Reverse blade / MC Off'''\n| Add any soft [[Fruit|fruit]], eg [[Berries|berries]] and the [[Cinnamon|cinnamon]] and cook for a further '''3 minutes / 100C / Speed Spoon / Reverse blade / MC Off'''\n| Switch off the machine and leave for another 2-3 minutes\n| Pour the [[Fruit|fruit]] into an oven proof serving bowl (or individual pudding bowls), sprinkle with the [[Crumble|crumble]] and gently heat at  190C/170C fan/gas 5 for about 5 minutes\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with hot [[Custard|custard]] or [[Ice cream|ice cream]]\n===Recipe source===\n* Based on a recipe by Raymond Blanc\n===Chef's notes===\nIf the [[crumble]] mixture is over-blended are more like [[dough]], spread it out over the baking tray as above, but periodically remove from the oven and bash into crumbs until you get the right texture\n\nThe fruit can be fresh, [[Frozen|frozen]] and [[Defrosted|defrosted]] or [[Confit|confit]] / jarred and [[Strained|strained]]), stalks, cores, stones etc removed and peeled if necessary.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Thermomix recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#fruit #crumble #cinnamon #unsaltedbutter #demerarasugar #apples #dough #dice #strained #custard #confit </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Game casserole with dumplings (slow cooker recipe)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Game casserole with dumplings slow cooker / crockpot recipe Game\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#slowcooker #game #dumplings #fry #carrots #stock #garlic #casserole #leeks #mushrooms #venison \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Use any combination of game for this slow cooker recipe. I made it with bits of venison, pheasant, pigeon, duck and partridge. Crockpot recipe\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 4087\n|PortionCalories = 1021\n|DatePublished=8th July 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 8 hours 45 minutes\n |PrepTime = 15 minutes\n |CookTime = 8 hours 30 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Game casserole with dumplings recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Gamekeeper's stew</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Nigel (the Stow Bardolph gamekeeper) would love this!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Sue_spins|Susie]] </span></span>\n}} \nUse any combination of [[Game|game]] for this [[Slow cooker|slow cooker]] recipe.  I made it with bits of [[Venison|venison]], [[Pheasant|pheasant]], [[Pigeon|pigeon]], [[Duck|duck]] and [[Partridge|partridge]].  If you buy any [[Game|game]] and have just a little too much for the recipe you are making, just put the excess in a bag in the [[Freezer|freezer]] and soon you will have enough to make a mixed game meal\n\n'''For the [[Casserole|casserole]]'''\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 2 tablespoons [[Oil|oil]] or [[Goose fat|goose fat]]\n| 750g mixed [[Game|game]], cut into chunks\n| 1 large [[Red onion|red onion]], chopped\n| [[Garlic]] to taste, chopped (use lots of it!)\n| 2 tablespoons [[Plain flour|plain flour]]\n| 300ml robust [[Red wine|red wine]]\n| 300ml [[Game|game]] or [[Beef Stock|beef stock]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Tomato|tomato]] pur\u00e9e\n| 2 [[Bay leaves|bay leaves]]\n| 150g [[Carrots|carrots]], sliced lengthways\n| 250g [[Leeks|leeks]], thinly sliced\n| Seasoning\n}}\n'''For the [[Dumplings|dumplings]]'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 150g [[Self-raising flour|self-raising flour]]\n| 75g [[Suet|suet]]\n| 3 tablespoons mixed [[Fresh herbs|fresh herbs]], or 1 tablespoon [[Dried|dried]] [[Herbs|herbs]]\n| 75ml-100ml water\n| Seasoning\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat your [[Slow cooker|slow cooker]], if necessary, according to the manufacturer's instructions.\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Heat the [[Oil|oil]] or [[Fat|fat]] in a pan to a high temperature.\n| Add the [[Game|game]] pieces and [[Fry|fry]] on all sides until they start to [[Brown|brown]], then place them in the [[Slow cooker|slow cooker]].\n| Add the [[Onions|onions]] to the pan and [[Fry|fry]] for a few minutes until soft, stir in the [[Garlic|garlic]] and cook for a further minute of two.\n| Transfer to the [[Slow cooker|slow cooker]].\n| [[Stew]] the [[Flour|flour]] in the [[Frying pan|frying pan]] for 1 minute and slowly stir in the [[Wine|wine]], [[Stock|stock]] and [[Tomato puree|tomato puree]] ensuring that you are not left with any lumps.\n| Add to the [[Slow cooker|slow cooker]] and cook on low for about 7 hours.\n| Stir the [[Casserole|casserole]], add the [[Carrots|carrots]] and cook on high for 45 minutes.\n| Meanwhile, mix together the [[Dumpling|dumpling]] ingredients, adding enough water to make a soft, but not sticky [[Dough|dough]].\n| Shape into 8 balls.\n| Stir in the [[Leeks|leeks]] and add the [[Dumplings|dumplings]] to the [[Slow cooker|slow cooker]].  At this stage, you may feel you need to add more [[stock]], wine or water.\n| Cook for a further 30-45 minutes until the [[Dumplings|dumplings]] are light and fluffy.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with a hunk of [[Bread|bread]].\n===Variations===\nTry this with [[Beef|beef]], or with [[Pork|pork]] and [[Cider|cider]].  Add [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]] or other [[Vegetables|vegetables]] of your choice.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Game recipes]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Cooking with wine]]\n[[Category:Slow cooker recipes]]\n[[Category:Stews and casseroles]]\n[[Category:Slow cooked]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#slowcooker #game #dumplings #fry #carrots #stock #garlic #casserole #leeks #mushrooms #venison </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }

title": "Gammon and vegetable pasta in mustard sauce (TM)",
                "revisions": [
                    {

                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Gammon and vegetable pasta in mustard sauce  British recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#gammon #pasta #sauce #flour #garlic #bouillon #mustard #onion #oliveoil #vegetables #peas \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=I invented this recipe for the Thermomix as a way of using up some cold, boiled gammon\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1623\n|PortionCalories = 405\n|DatePublished=20th October 2012\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 55 minutes\n |PrepTime = 10 minutes\n |CookTime = 45 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Gammon and vegetable pasta in mustard sauce recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Not a bad invention, Julia.</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.1</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Especially considering that you're a vegetarian!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]] </span></span>\n}}\nI invented this recipe for the [[Thermomix]] as a way of using up some cold, [[Boiled|boiled]] [[Gammon|gammon]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredientsTM\n| 1 [[Onion|onion]], cut into quarters\n| 1 bulb [[Garlic|garlic]], peeled\n| 50g [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| Pinch [[Sugar|sugar]]\n| 500g [[Milk|milk]]\n| 40g [[Flour|flour]]\n| 5 tablespoons [[Ground|ground]] [[Mustard|mustard]]\n| 1.5 teaspoons [[Vegetable|vegetable]] [[Bouillon|bouillon]] powder\n| 200g [[Pasta|pasta]] shapes, preferably ones which take about 13 minutes to cook in a saucepan\n| 1 large or 2 small [[Red peppers|red peppers]], cut into strips\n| 100g Cooked [[Gammon|gammon]], cut into slices.\n| 50g [[garden peas]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Drop the [[Onion|onion]] on running blades at '''Speed 5'''.\n| Add the [[Garlic|garlic]], [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and [[Sugar|sugar]]. \n| Saut\u00e9 '''15 minutes / Temp. Varoma / Speed 1'''.\n| Add the [[Milk|milk]], [[Flour|flour]], [[Mustard|mustard]] and [[Bouillon|bouillon]] powder.\n| Cook '''7 mins / Temp. 90\u00b0 / Speed 4'''.\n| Blitz '''10 secs / Speed 8'''.\n| Transfer to a receptacle that will fit the Varoma bowl and cover with the lid.\n| Give the TM bowl a quick rinse and fill with 1000g water.\n| Bring to [[Boil|boil]] '''11 minutes / Temp. 100\u00b0 / Speed 1'''.\n| Meanwhile add the [[Peppers|peppers]] to the internal [[Steaming|steaming]] basket.\n| Add enough [[Gammon|gammon]] and [[Peas|peas]] to almost fill the basket.\n| Add the [[pasta]] to the TM bowl.\n| Place the Varoma bowl containing the [[Sauce|sauce]] on top of the TM lid.\n| Cook '''15 minutes  / Temp. 100\u00b0 / Speed Spoon / Reverse Blade'''.\n| Mix the [[Pasta|pasta]], [[Gammon|gammon]] and [[Vegetables|vegetables]] with the [[Sauce|sauce]] and serve.\n| If the [[Sauce|sauce]] is a little too thick, add some of the [[Pasta|pasta]] water to thin it down.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Salad|salad]].\n{{GammonRecipes}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pasta recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Thermomix recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#gammon #pasta #sauce #flour #garlic #bouillon #mustard #onion #oliveoil #vegetables #peas </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Garlic and crayfish pizza",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Garlic and crayfish pizza, | Easy pizza recipes from the cook's Wiki\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#garlicandcrayfishpizza #pizza #oliveoil #crayfishtails #pizzastone #pizzadough #dough #grill #fineyellowcornmeal #pecorinocheese #miseenplace \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Crayfish are well suited to pizzas as they have a robust flavour and cope well with the extreme heat\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1560\n|PortionCalories = 390\n|DatePublished=23rd November 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4 - Makes 2 pizzas\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  1 hour, 25 minutes\n|PrepTime =  1 hour, 10 minutes\n|CookTime =  15 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Garlic and crayfish pizza recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Crayfish and Pizza - Perfection</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">One of my favourite pizzas.  Best made with home-made dough too.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Garlic and crayfish pizza_ingredients.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Garlic and crayfish pizza, ready to bake]]\nA delicious excuse for pizza gluttony, again.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 portion of [[Pizza dough|pizza dough]]\n| 5 [[Fat|fat]] [[Cloves of Garlic, peeled and crushed|cloves of garlic, peeled and crushed]]\n| 5 tablespoons of [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 180g prepared [[Crayfish tails|crayfish tails]] [crawfish tails]\n| 2 x 150 g balls of [[Mozzarella cheese|mozzarella cheese]]\n| 30 g [[Pecorino cheese|pecorino cheese]] or [[Parmesan cheese|parmesan cheese]]\n| [[Freshly ground black pepper]]\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Make the [[Pizza dough|pizza dough]] as instructed\n* If using a [[Pizza stone|pizza stone]], preheat the [[Pizza stone|pizza stone]] under a very hot [[Grill|grill]] for about 20 minutes. Place it about 8cm (3\") from the heat source.\n\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Make 1 [[Pizza|pizza]] per person\n| Crush the [[Garlic|garlic]] and add it to the [[Crayfish tails|crayfish tails]] together with 4 tablespoons of [[Olive oil|olive oil]].  Mix well and let the flavours mingle while the [[Dough|dough]] is pepared.\n| Dust the work surface with [[Fine yellow cornmeal|fine yellow cornmeal]]\n| Stretch or roll the [[Dough|dough]] into two thin rounds\n| Sprinkle the stone with [[Fine yellow cornmeal|fine yellow cornmeal]]\n| Pre-cook the empty [[Pizza|pizza]] base on one side only for about 3 minutes or until it is lightly [[Browned|browned]]\n| Remove from the [[Oven|oven]], flip and add the topping.\n| Lightly [[Oil|oil]] one side of the [[Pizza|pizza]] and [[Grill|grill]], oiled side down, flip and repeat, about 2 minutes per side\n| Tear the [[Mozzarella|mozzarella]] into pieces and scatter over the [[Pizza|pizza]].\n| Add the [[Crayfish tails|crayfish tails]], garlic and [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and a grind of [[Black pepper|black pepper]].\n| Top with the [[Grated|grated]] [[Pecorino|pecorino]] or [[Parmesan|parmesan]] and top with a drizzle of [[Olive oil|olive oil]].\n| [[Bake]] for 3 or 4 minutes or until the [[Cheese|cheese]] browns a little - watch it carefully as it can burn easily.\n| Keep the fist [[Pizza|pizza]] warm at the bottom of the [[Oven|oven]] whilst you make the second.\n| Serve hot\n}}\n===Variations===\nI chopped up a small [[Roasted red pepper|roasted red pepper]] and added to this as I had one spare.\n\nSplit a [[green Indian chilli]] down the middle and saut\u00e9 it with the onions and garlic and leave it with the prawns while they marinade.  Remove and discard before making the pizza.\n\nLeave the prawn , onions and garlic to [[marinade]] for a few hours if you have the time.\n==See also==\n{{Template:Crayfish recipes}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:North American recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Freshwater fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Shellfish recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#garlicandcrayfishpizza #pizza #oliveoil #crayfishtails #pizzastone #pizzadough #dough #grill #fineyellowcornmeal #pecorinocheese #miseenplace </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Garlic and herb Jerusalem (f)artichokes",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Garlic and herb Jerusalem (f)artichokes a British recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#bayleaves #garlic #jerusalemartichokes #artichokes #sherryvinegar #oliveoil #sweetpotato #panfried #bay #saute #blackpepper \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Gerard's Herbal (1621) had a view on Jerusalem artichokes: \"which way soever they be dressed and eaten, they stir and cause a filthy loathsome\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 370\n|PortionCalories = 92\n|DatePublished=20th January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Garlic and herb Jerusalem artichokes - worm fodder!\n |Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 45 minutes\n |PrepTime = 10 minutes\n |CookTime = 35 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Garlic and herb Jerusalem artichokes recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Not a fan \ud83d\ude42</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">2</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">\ud83e\udd22\ud83e\udd22\ud83e\udd22</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n\nGerard's Herbal (1621) had a view on [[Jerusalem artichokes]]: \"which way soever they be dressed and eaten, they stir and cause a filthy loathsome stinking wind within the body, thereby causing the belly to be pained and tormented, and are a meat more fit for swine than men.\"\n\nAnyway, lets not let that get in our way.  Anitra has, by daughter-proxy, given us a huge pile of [[Jerusalem artichokes]] that I am determined to use.  This shall be the first attempt.\n===Update===\nGerard had something here.  Pretty non-descript, this, even with all the [[Garlic|garlic]] and [[bay leaves]].  Sweet tasting, rather similar to [[parsnip]] or [[sweet potato]], neither of which are my favourites.  These are also quite a fiddle to prepare and there is a fair deal of waste too.  I would feed these to worms. \n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 600 g (1lb 2 oz) [[Jerusalem artichokes]] (peeled weight)\n| A few glugs of [[Olive oil|olive oil]], flavoured with a few good grinds of [[black pepper]].\n| 4 Cloves of [[Garlic|garlic]], peeled and sliced thinly\n| 6 [[Bay leaves|bay leaves]] - you can use less, but if you have a [[Bay|bay]] tree to [[Hand|hand]], why not?  Let's go for big flavour here.\n| 2 tablespoons [[Sherry vinegar|sherry vinegar]]\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Peel the [[Artichokes|artichokes]] and cut into even side pieces, about the size of halved ping-pong balls\n| Heat a [[Wok|wok]] or [[Frying pan|frying pan]] with a few glugs of [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and [[Saute|saute]] over a fairly high heat until they have golden edges\n| Lower the heat a little, add the [[Garlic|garlic]] and [[Fry|fry]] it off a little\n| [[Deglaze]] the pan with the [[Sherry vinegar|sherry vinegar]], add the [[Bay leaves|bay leaves]], seasoning, cover and cook for 25 to 30 minutes\n| Remove the cover and the [[Bay leaves|bay leaves]], turn up the heat and crisp up the [[Artichokes|artichokes]] for 3 or 4 minutes\n| Season and serve immediately\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#bayleaves #garlic #jerusalemartichokes #artichokes #sherryvinegar #oliveoil #sweetpotato #panfried #bay #saute #blackpepper </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Garlic and thyme pork tenderloin (SV)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Garlic and thyme pork tenderloin sous vide recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#thyme #garlicpowder #pork #vegetables #freshthyme #porktenderloin #oregano #sear #mash #marjoram #snack \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description= A simple recipe using one of the best pork cuts, cooked sous vide\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 451\n|PortionCalories = 112\n|DatePublished=27th December 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment =Pork tenderloin fillet\n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime = Up to 8 hours, 15 minutes\n|PrepTime = 15 minutes\n|CookTime = Up to 8 hours\n|Image = [[Image:Sous vide TexMex pork tenderloin fillet recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Perfect</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">As good as a Michelin 5 star meal</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Carla_Cancio-Bello,_J.D.,_on_behalf_of_Cuban_Cuisine_UK|Carla]] </span></span>\n}}\nA simple recipe using one of the best [[Pork|pork]] cuts, cooked sous vide.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 piece of [[Pork tenderloin|pork tenderloin]] (fillet) weighing about 650g\n| 1 tablespoon [[Garlic powder|garlic powder]]\n| 1.5 tsps. [[Dried|dried]] or 1-2 tablespoons [[Fresh thyme|fresh thyme]]\n| [[Freshly ground pepper]]\n| [[Salt]] (see Chef's notes below)\n| [[Oil]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat the water bath to 56.5\u00b0C (''149\u00b0F'') for medium rare or 60\u00b0C (''140\u00b0F'') for medium\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Pat dry the [[Pork|pork]].\n| Smear with the [[Garlic powder|garlic powder]]. [[Thyme|thyme]] and [[Pepper|pepper]].  Sprinkle with [[Salt|salt]] if desired at this stage (see Chef's notes below).\n| Place in a suitable vacuum packing bag and seal.\n| Put into the bath and cook for a minimum of 2 hours and a maximum of 8 hours.\n| Remove from the bag and drain.\n| In the meantime, preheat [[Oil|oil]] in a [[Frying pan|frying pan]] as hot as you can.\n| Season with [[Salt|salt]] if you have not previously done so.\n| [[Sear]] the [[Meat|meat]] for a minute each side until [[Browned|browned]].\n| Pat dry, [[Rest for|rest for]] a few minutes, the cut into slices.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nAs part of a [[Main course|main course]], serve with [[Roast potatoes|roast potatoes]] or [[Mash|mash]], [[Vegetables|vegetables]] and [[Onion gravy|onion gravy]].  Alternatively serve hot or cold as a [[Snack|snack]] or [[Tapa|tapa]] with [[Salad|salad]] and/or a [[Salsa|salsa]]\n===Variations===\nUse [[Oregano|oregano]] or [[Marjoram|marjoram]] instead of the [[Thyme|thyme]]\n===Chef's notes===\nSeason with [[Salt|salt]] by all means, BUT if a) you are not starting the cooking process straight away or b)  cooking for a long period or c) using the cook-chill method, it would be better to salt just before [[Searing|searing]].  Contact between [[Meat|meat]] and salt for a longer length of time may cause the meat to be dry.\n{{SousVideSeeAlso}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Pork tenderloin garlic thyme]]\n[[Category:British recipes|Pork tenderloin garlic thyme]]\n[[Category:Main courses|Pork tenderloin garlic thyme]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites|Pork tenderloin garlic thyme]]\n[[Category:Starters|Pork tenderloin garlic thyme]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes|Pork tenderloin garlic thyme]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes|Pork tenderloin garlic thyme]]\n[[Category:Molecular gastronomy recipes|Pork tenderloin garlic thyme]]\n[[Category:Sous vide recipes|Pork tenderloin garlic thyme]]\n[[Category:Sous vide cooking|Pork tenderloin garlic thyme]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#thyme #garlicpowder #pork #vegetables #freshthyme #porktenderloin #oregano #sear #mash #marjoram #snack </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }

title": "Garlic chicken with tomato and basil",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Garlic chicken with tomato and basil a British recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#chicken #marinade #garlicchickenwithtomatoandbasil #lemon #juice #basting #fridge #microwave #marinating #clingfilm #peas \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A simple and very tasty chicken dish\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 375\n|PortionCalories = 187\n|DatePublished=23rd October 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 2\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 1 hour 30 minutes\n |PrepTime = 1 hour 10 minutes\n |CookTime = 20 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Garlic chicken with tomato and basil.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Looks burnt</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">But it wasn't - just very caramelised. \ud83d\ude0e </span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Garlic chicken marinade.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Ready to marinate]]\nA simple and very tasty chicken dish.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 2 skinless & boneless [[Chicken|chicken]] breasts\n| [[Juice]] of one [[Lemon|lemon]] (see method)\n| A good 3 tablespoons of [[Extra virgin olive oil|extra virgin olive oil]]\n| 5 [[Clove|cloves]] [[Garlic crushed|garlic crushed]]\n| [[Salt]] & [[Pepper|pepper]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n\n'''Prepare [[Chicken|chicken]]'''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Slash [[Chicken|chicken]] breasts across about 5 times. Make the cuts fairly deep because you want the [[Marinade|marinade]] to really penetrate.\n| Place in a shallow bowl\n}}\n'''[[Marinade]]'''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| First [[Microwave|microwave]] the whole [[Lemon|lemon]] for about 15 seconds. This will enable you to extract the maximum amount of [[Juice|juice]]\n| Cut the [[Lemon|lemon]] in half and squeeze the [[Juice|juice]] out into a small mixing bowl removing any pips\n| Add the [[Oil|oil]] and the Crushed [[Garlic|garlic]] and season generously\n| Mix well and pour over the [[Chicken|chicken]] breasts\n| Cover with [[Clingfilm|clingfilm]] and place in the [[Fridge|fridge]]\n| After half an hour turn the [[Chicken|chicken]] over in the [[Marinade|marinade]], re-cover and put back in the [[Fridge|fridge]].\n| Turn [[Chicken|chicken]] over after half an hour (the chicken needs at least 1 hour of [[Marinating|marinating]])\n| Heat a smallish [[Frying pan|frying pan]] over a medium heat and when hot put the [[Chicken|chicken]] in the pan cut-side-up together with half of the [[Marinade|marinade]]\n| Cook for 10 minutes [[Basting|basting]] regularly with the [[Marinade|marinade]]\n| Check the underside of the [[Chicken|chicken]] after about 10 minutes. If nicely [[Brown|brown]], turn it over and put in the rest of the [[Marinade|marinade]].\n| Give this side 10 minutes, again [[Basting|basting]] regularly.\n| The [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]] will evaporate leaving a nice [[Brown|brown]] sticky residue on the [[Meat|meat]]. The [[Oil|oil]] will separate.\n| Give the [[Meat|meat]] a little cut in the middle and check that it's not pink. \n| Stir in 3 tablespoons of [[oven dried tomatoes]] and a big handful of chopped [[basil]] leaves.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe immediately with [[Croquette potatoes|croquette potatoes]] and [[Peas|peas]] with the juices and [[Oil|oil]] from the pan poured over\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Poultry recipes]]\n[[Category:Student recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#chicken #marinade #garlicchickenwithtomatoandbasil #lemon #juice #basting #fridge #microwave #marinating #clingfilm #peas </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Garlic infused sourdough bread",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Garlic infused sourdough bread\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#garlic #dough #flour #bread #garlicinfusedsourdoughbread #starter #clingfilm #knead #garlicpowder #thermomix #sourdoughstarter \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=The making of this sourdough bread is a lengthy process only make it when you have sufficient other bread to last you.\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=5th May 2017\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 6\n|Difficulty = 3\n|TotalTime =  1 hour, 10 minutes plus hours of resting time!\n|PrepTime =  \n|CookTime =  1 hour, 10 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 1774\n|PortionCalories = 295\n|Image = [[Image:Garlic infused sourdough bread recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">A recipe from a garlic *superfan*</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.7</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Knowing Rosemary's [aka Julia] passion for garlic, this is another of her methods to get her 'fix'.  Thank you Rosemary, you have passed your love of the bulb to me and Anne too. </span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Garlic infused sourdough bread2.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Garlic infused sourdough bread]]\nThe making of this [[Bread|bread]] is quite a lengthy process, so only make it when you have sufficient other bread to last you.  The timings are also a bit vague because it's a case of doing things when the [[Starter|starter]] and [[Dough|dough]] look 'ready'. \n\nIt uses a [[Rye sourdough starter|rye sourdough starter]] and strong white Canadian [[Bread|bread]] [[Flour|flour]] and has a hydration rate of about 76%.  As this is a wet [[Dough|dough]], you will need a [[Mixer|mixer]] of some kind\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 50 g [[Garlic|garlic]], peeled weight\n| 500 g bottled or chlorine free water \n| 170 g 100% organic [[Rye|rye]] [[Starter|starter]]\n| 65 g strong white Canadian [[Bread|bread]] [[Flour|flour]]\n| 65 g tepid [[Garlic|garlic]] water from the above\n| 400 g strong white Canadian [[Bread|bread]] [[Flour|flour]]\n| 250 g tepid [[Garlic|garlic]] water from above\n| 10 g [[Salt|salt]]\n| A further 20g [[Garlic|garlic]] water from above\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n}}\n====Garlic Water====\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Place the [[Garlic|garlic]] and water in a [[Saucepan|saucepan]], bring to the [[Boil|boil]] and boil gently, covered, for 30 minutes.  \n| Strain the [[Garlic|garlic]] and use to [[Chuck|chuck]] into something else.\n| Allow the water to cool until it is about 35\u00b0C.\n}}\n====The Starter====\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Mix the [[Starter|starter]] with the 65g of cooled [[Garlic|garlic]] water and 65g of the [[White flour|white flour]].\n| Place in a bowl, cover with [[Clingfilm|clingfilm]] and make an hole in the top to encourage air-borne bacteria.\n| Leave until it is nice and bubbly.  The length of time this takes, does depend on the temperature at which it's kept - it will be quicker in a warm airing cupboard than at room temperature.  It is up to you how you do this, but obviously don't use the airing cupboard unless you are going to be around to keep and eye on it. I tend to leave mine at room temperature overnight.\n}}\n====Autolysis====\n{{RecipeMethod\n| A couple of hours before you think your [[Starter|starter]] might be nice and bubbly, mix the 400g Canadian [[Flour|flour]] with the 250g [[Garlic|garlic]] water.\n| Leave for about 2 hours.\n| Meanwhile, dissolve the [[Salt|salt]] in 20g hot [[Garlic|garlic]] water\n}}\n====To make the final dough====\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Mix the [[Salt|salt]] mixture with the autolysed [[Flour|flour]].\n| Add the bubbly [[Sourdough starter|sourdough starter]] and mix thoroughly.\n| Now you can either [[Knead|knead]] the [[Dough|dough]] using a dough hook or the knead setting on a [[Thermomix]], or if preferred omit the [[Kneading|kneading]] altogether and use the stretch and fold method, repeating every 30 minutes or so.\n| I tend to give it a bit of a [[Knead|knead]], then place in a oiled bowl, followed by a couple of stretches and folds.\n| Whatever you do, don't knock the [[Dough|dough]] back - just handle it gently.\n| Keep covered.\n| When the [[Dough|dough]] has roughly doubled in size, shape as desired.\n| As it is a wet [[Dough|dough]] you may find that it will need some support eg loaf / cake tin or [[Banneton|banneton]], unless you are skilled at handling wet dough (which I am not).\n| Try not to deflate the [[Dough|dough]] too much whilst shaping.\n| Cover with [[Clingfilm|clingfilm]] and leave to [[Prove|prove]].\n| [[Bake]] at 230\u00b0 C (450\u00b0 F - gas 8), [fan [[Oven|oven]] 210\u00b0 C] for about 40 minutes and allow to cool on a rack.\n}}\n===Variations===\nYou can add some [[Garlic powder|garlic powder]] to the [[Dough|dough]], but don't over do it as the powder caramelises and can make the [[Bread|bread]] look burnt, even though it isn't\n===Chef's notes===\nStarter: I used the [http://forkingfoodie.blogspot.co.uk/2015/03/simple-four-day-sourdough-starter-that.html Forking Foodie's Simple Four Day Sourdough Starter].  Remove it from the [[Fridge|fridge]] at least 12 hours beforehand and feed it.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Bread]]\n[[Category:British recipes|Bread]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Breakfast recipes|Bread]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes|Bread]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes|Bread]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes|Bread]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted|Bread]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#garlic #dough #flour #bread #garlicinfusedsourdoughbread #starter #clingfilm #knead #garlicpowder #thermomix #sourdoughstarter </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Garlic yogurt dip",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Garlic yogurt dip\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#garlicyogurtdip #parsley #dried #vegetables #chips #dip #garlic #blackpepperspecialmix #recipes #groundblackpepper #chefsnotes\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=Just an aide-memoir for me. We make this all the time, but one day Ill forget the exact quantities, so these notes will save me! A lovely dip for chips..\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=17th December 2022\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  2 hours\n|PrepTime =  2 hours\n|CookTime = None\n|TotalCalories = 132\n|PortionCalories = 66\n|Image = [[Image:Garlic yogurt dip - ready to stand for 2 hours.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">We love this</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Anne has asked me to make this for her 3 times this week!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry]] </span></span>\n}}\nJust an aide-memoir for me. We make this all the time, but one day I'll forget the exact quantities, so these notes will save me!\n\nA lovely [[Dip|dip]] for [[Chips|chips]] and [[Vegetables|vegetables]] - this makes the perfect amount for two people.  It's quite [[Garlic|garlic]]y but you'll probably know how much garlic is ''too much'' for you!\n\nIt only takes a few minutes to prepare, but is improved if left for a few hours for the flavours to minge, especially if you're out of season and using [[Dried|dried]] [[Parsley|parsley]].\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 3 [[Cloves of Garlic, peeled and crushed|cloves of garlic, peeled and crushed]]\n| Pinch of [[Black pepper|black pepper]] - see [[Chef's notes]]\n| Pinch of pink seas [[Salt|salt]]\n| 6 good tablespoons of full-frat [[Greek yogurt]] (160 g)\n| &#189; teaspoon [[Dried|dried]] [[Parsley|parsley]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Add [[Garlic|garlic]], [[Ground black pepper|ground black pepper]] and [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] to a bowl\n| Mix well with the back of a spoon\n| Stir in the [[Yogurt|yogurt]] and optional [[Dried|dried]] [[Parsley|parsley]]\n| Mix well and leave to stand for a few hours if you have the time\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Garlic yogurt dip - ready to stand for 2 hours.jpg|Garlic dip, ready to stand for a few hours so the flavours can develop\nImage:Garlic yogurt dip - dried parsley added.jpg|A sprinkle of dried parsley will be re-hydrated in an hour or so\nImage:Garlic yogurt dip - spice ingredients.jpg|Garlic dip, the basic ingredients\n</gallery>\n\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe as a [[Dip|dip]] for [[Chips|chips]] and [[Vegetables|vegetables]]\n===Chef's notes===\nI pre-grind my ''special-mix'' [[black pepper]] and store in a covered bowl so it's easy to add a pinch, rather than having to grind it fresh each time. My special mix is 65% black peppercorns and 35% Szechuan peppercorns.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:French recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Dips and sauces]]\n[[Category:Marinades dressings and butters]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:uncooked]]\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#garlicyogurtdip #parsley #dried #vegetables #chips #dip #garlic #blackpepperspecialmix #recipes #groundblackpepper #chefsnotes</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Ginger beer",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Ginger beer, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#gingerbeer #ginger #beer #yeast #lemon #castorsugar #carbonated #softdrink #ale #boiling #fermented \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Ginger Beer is a type of carbonated soft drink\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n''see also: [[Ginger ale]]''\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 334\n|PortionCalories = 13\n|DatePublished=2nd January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = This locally produced ginger-beer container has been on our fireplace for 28 years!\n |Servings = Servings: 25 - 1 gallon of [[Ginger|ginger]] [[Beer|beer]]\n |Difficulty = 3\n |TotalTime = 5 days until it is ready for drinking\n |PrepTime = 30 minutes\n |CookTime = None\n|Image = [[Image:Old-fashioned ginger beer recipe recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Tangy Tango</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.9</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">My lips are tingling already - I LOVE ginger beer!</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Ginger]] [[Beer|beer]] is a type of [[Carbonated|carbonated]] [[Soft drink|soft drink]] or occasionally, [[Alcoholic beverage|alcoholic beverage]] flavoured primarily with ginger, lemon and [[Sugar|sugar]]. It originated in England in the mid 1700s, and it reached its peak of popularity in the early 1900s. The original recipe requires only ginger, sugar, and water, to which is added a gelatinous substance called \"ginger beer plant\" (see below).\n \n[[Fermentation]] over a few days turns the mixture into ginger beer. [[Lemon]] may be added. A simple version of this recipe can be made at home today in which the following is bottled in a 2 litre bottle: [[Grated|grated]] [[Fresh ginger|fresh ginger]], sugar, a small amount of baker's [[Yeast|yeast]], and (optionally) [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]]. \n\nIt is sealed at room temperature for a day or two before refrigerating.\n\nInstead of using the ginger [[Beer|beer]] plant, some other form of live culture may be used to produce [[Fermented|fermented]] ginger beer. This is often baker's or [[Brewer's yeast|brewer's yeast]], but can also be a culture of [[Lactic acid|lactic acid]] bacteria, [[Kefir|kefir]] [[Grains|grains]], or tibicos. [[Ginger]] beer is fizzy due to carbon dioxide. \n\nThe [[Alcohol|alcohol]] content when produced by the traditional process can be high, up to 11%, although it is possible to [[Ferment|ferment]] ginger beer in such a way as to produce little alcohol. Ginger beer may be mixed with beer (usually a British [[Ale|ale]] of some sort) to make one type of shandy, and with Gosling's Black Seal [[Rum|rum]] to make a drink, originally from Bermuda, called a Dark 'N' Stormy. The soda version of ginger beer is the main ingredient in the Moscow Mule cocktail.\n\nThe [[Beverage|beverage]] produced industrially today is often not brewed ([[Fermented|fermented]]). Such ginger [[Beer|beer]] is [[Carbonated|carbonated]] with pressurised carbon dioxide, does not contain [[Alcohol|alcohol]], and is sold as a [[Soft drink|soft drink]]. [[Ginger]] beer is similar to ginger [[Ale|ale]] except that it has a significantly stronger ginger taste, often being described as ginger ale with a kick to it. \n\nIts other distinctive properties include its traditional cloudy appearance, its predominately [[Citrus|citrus]] sour taste base and its spicy ginger bite.\n\nThis recipe is taken from \"Modern practical cooking\" - circa 1900\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1 gallon [[Boiling|boiling]] water\n| 14 oz loaf [[Sugar|sugar]]\n| 1 [[Lemon|lemon]]\n| &frac34; oz lump of [[Ginger|ginger]], bruised\n| &frac12; oz solid [[Yeast|yeast]]\n| 2 teaspoonfuls of [[Castor sugar|castor sugar]]\n| 1 teaspoonful of [[Cream of tartar|cream of tartar]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Wipe the [[Lemon|lemon]] and peel very thinly\n| put the rind in a large jar or pan, and add the lump [[Sugar|sugar]], [[Ginger|ginger]] and [[Cream of tartar|cream of tartar]]\n| Pour [[Boiling|boiling]] water over these ingredients, and stir together. Leave until lukewarm.\n| Mix the [[Yeast|yeast]] and [[Castor sugar|castor sugar]] together until they become liquid, then stir into the other ingredients with the [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]].\n| Partly cover\n| Leave in a warm place for 12 hours\n| Remove the scum, strain the [[Ginger|ginger]] [[Beer|beer]] and bottle\n| Cork the bottles very securely and tie the corks with wire\n| Leave for about 4 to 5 days\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nPour into a glass, being careful to leave the sediment behind\n===Modernising this recipe.===\nI would be inclined to use [[Jaggery|jaggery]] in place of 'lump [[Sugar|sugar]]', or just use [[Brown sugar|brown sugar]] or [[Castor sugar|castor sugar]].\n\nUse a little more than 1/2 a teaspoon of brewers [[Yeast|yeast]] instead of solid [[yeast]].\n\nStore the bottles in a cool place and take very great care when handling or opening.  Even I can remember my Grandfather's legendary tales of ginger beer bottles exploding in the night and setting up a chain reaction.\n{{Template:PeelingGinger}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Uncooked]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#gingerbeer #ginger #beer #yeast #lemon #castorsugar #carbonated #softdrink #ale #boiling #fermented </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Ginger limeade",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Ginger limeade; a  recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#limes #freshginger #gingerlimeade #wedges #foodprocessor #stevia #sausages #juice #recipesfromothersites #glass #cup \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Andy Bates shares the secret of his ultimate refreshing summer thirst-quencher. Using fresh ginger and a LOT of limes\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 257\n|PortionCalories = 32\n|DatePublished=22nd October 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Servings: 8 - Makes just over 1 litre of limeade\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  3 hours, 5 minutes\n|PrepTime =  3 hours, 5 minutes\n|CookTime = None\n|Image = [[Image:Ginger limeade recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Fresh ginger makes this special</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.8</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">It just lifts this drink to another level.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nAndy Bates shares the secret of his ultimate refreshing summer thirst-quencher. Using [[Fresh ginger|fresh ginger]] and a LOT of [[Limes|limes]], this sweet and sassy mocktail will keep your guests hydrated and coming back for more [[Glass|glass]] after zingy glass! Andy's tip - leave the syrup to develop overnight. Best served with Perfect Cumberland [[Sausages]].\n\nThis recipe is reproduced courtesy of [[Debbie&andrew's sausages|debbie&andrew's sausages]].\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 6 cups cold water\n| 100g golden [[Caster Sugar|caster sugar]] (or [[Stevia|stevia]] if you prefer)\n| 3 tablespoons chopped peeled [[Fresh ginger|fresh ginger]]\n| Bunch of [[Mint leaves|mint leaves]] \n| [[Juice]] of 7 [[Limes|limes]]\n| [[Zest]] of 5 [[Limes|limes]]\n| 3 [[Limes|limes]], cut into [[Wedges|wedges]] to garnish\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| In a [[Food processor|food processor]], mix half a [[Cup|cup]] of water and all other ingredients (except for the [[Lime wedges|lime wedges]]). Chill for at least 3 hours, or even better, overnight. Fill up with remaining water in a jug and serve chilled with [[Wedges|wedges]]. Voila!\n}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Drink and beverage recipes]]\n[[Category:Non-alcoholic beverages]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n[[Category:Debbie&andrew's sausage recipes]]\n[[Category:Uncooked]]\n{{Template:DebbieAndAndrew attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#limes #freshginger #gingerlimeade #wedges #foodprocessor #stevia #sausages #juice #recipesfromothersites #glass #cup </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]

title": "Glazed carrots",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Glazed carrots, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#carrots #glazedcarrots #lemonjuice #butter #salted #boil #boiling #castersugar #boiledorsimmered #mortarandpestle #cuminseeds \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Carrots, cooked or raw lend great colour to any dish, the glaze, which is a simple process, lifts a dish even more. For a bit of fun, see how they were\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 296\n|PortionCalories = 74\n|DatePublished=1st December 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Glazed carrots with boiled potatoes\n|Servings = 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime = 13 minutes\n|PrepTime = 3 minutes\n|CookTime = 10 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Boiled glazed carrots.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"><span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Bright and beautiful</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.2</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Tasty too!</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\">[[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]] </span></span>\n}}\n\nCarrots, cooked or raw lend great colour to any dish, the glaze, which is a simple process, lifts a dish even more.\n\nFor a bit of fun, [[Boiled carrots (Mrs Beeton's)|see how they were done in Mrs Beeton's day!]]\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 450 g (1 lb) [[carrots]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[butter]]\n| &#189; teaspoon [[caster sugar]]\n| 2 teaspoons of [[lemon juice]]\n| A pinch of [[Sea salt]]\n| [[Freshly ground black pepper]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| '''Baby [[carrots]]'''\n| Scrub the [[carrots]]\n| Drop into [[boiling]] water [[salted]] water and [[boil]] for 7 to 10 minutes depending upon your desire for crunch\n| Drain the [[carrots]] and return to the now dry pan and heat to evaporate any excess moisture\n| Add the [[butter]] and [[sugar]], [[lemon juice]] and a pinch of salt and toss the pan constantly until the [[carrots]] are glazed\n| Season to taste with [[freshly ground black pepper]]\n}}\n\n# '''Larger, older [[carrots]]'''\n# Peel the [[carrots]], top and tail them\n# Slice into discs about 1 cm thick\n# Drop into [[boiling]] water [[salted]] water and [[boil]] for 9 to 12 minutes depending upon your desire for crunch\n# Drain the [[carrots]] and return to the now dry pan and heat to evaporate any excess moisture\n# Add the [[butter]] and [[sugar]], [[lemon juice]] and a pinch of salt and toss the pan constantly until the [[carrots]] are glazed\n#  Season to taste with [[freshly ground black pepper]]\n===Servings===\n450 g (1 lb) carrots for 3 to 4 people \n\n===Variations===\nBruise a teaspoon of [[cumin seeds]] in a [[mortar and pestle]] and sprinkle over the [[carrots]] as they are served.\n\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Carrots]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments|Carrots]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes|Carrots]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes|Carrots]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#carrots #glazedcarrots #lemonjuice #butter #salted #boil #boiling #castersugar #boiledorsimmered #mortarandpestle #cuminseeds </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }

title": "Gluten free, beer battered toad in the hole",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Gluten free, beer battered toad in the hole recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#batter #beer #glutenfreebeerbatteredtoadinthehole #eggs #sausage #hob #onion #wedges #thyme #oliveoil #glutenfree \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Tasty Toad in the toad in the hole made with a boozy batter. This gluten free recipe is from Debbie&andrews sausages\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 532\n|PortionCalories = 133\n|DatePublished=25th October 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  1 hour, 10 minutes\n|PrepTime =  25 minutes\n|CookTime =  45 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Gluten free, beer battered toad in the hole recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Tasty toady!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Today!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:NonLoggedInUser|NonLoggedInUser]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Perfect-cumberland-sausages.png|300px|thumb|right|[[Debbie and Andrew's Perfect Cumberland Pork Sausages]]]]\nTasty [[Toad in the hole|toad in the hole]] made with a boozy [[Batter|batter]].\n\nThis [[Gluten free|gluten free]] recipe come to [[Cookipedia]] courtesy of [[Debbie&andrew's sausages|debbie&andrew's sausages]].\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n}}\n====For the 'toad':====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 5tbsp [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 1 pack [[Debbie and Andrew's Perfect Cumberland Pork Sausages]]\n| 2 [[Red onions|red onions]], peeled and cut into [[Wedges|wedges]]\n| 1 small bunch of [[Fresh thyme|fresh thyme]], leaves stripped\n}}\n====For the 'hole':====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 225g plain flour (for a Gluten Free alternative, try [[Udi's Gluten Free Products|Udi's All Purpose Flour Mix]])\n| \u00bd teaspoon [[Salt|salt]]\n| A pinch of [[Pepper|pepper]]\n| 4 [[Eggs|eggs]], beaten\n| 150ml [[Milk|milk]]\n| 150ml [[Beer|beer]] ([[Bitter|bitter]] or [[Lager|lager]])\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 220\u00b0 C (425\u00b0 F - gas 7), [fan oven 200\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| To make the [[Batter|batter]], sift the [[Flour|flour]], [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]] into a large bowl and make a well in the centre. Mix the [[Eggs|eggs]], [[Milk|milk]] and [[Beer|beer]] together in another bowl, then pour into the well.\n| Mix in gently with a wooden spoon, then stir to a smooth lump free [[Batter|batter]] and set aside.\n| Heat 2 tablespoons of [[Oil|oil]] in a shallow [[Roasting tin|roasting tin]] on the [[Hob|hob]].\n| Add the [[Sausages|sausages]] and cook for 5 minutes to [[Brown|brown]] evenly, then add the [[Onions|onions]] and cook for 2 minutes more.\n| Stir through the [[Thyme|thyme]], then remove everything from the tin and set aside on a plate.\n| Add the remaining [[Oil|oil]] to the empty tin and place in the [[Oven|oven]] for 5 minutes to heat up.\n| Remove from the [[Oven|oven]] and very carefully scatter the [[Sausage|sausage]] and [[Onion|onion]] mixture back into the tin. Shake to distribute evenly in the hot [[Oil|oil]], then pour over the rested [[Batter|batter]].\n| Put back in the [[Oven|oven]] and [[Bake|bake]] for 45 minutes.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with seasonal [[Vegetables|vegetables]] and [[Onion gravy|onion gravy]] if you like.\n==See also==\n\n* [[Udi's Gluten Free Products]]\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Cooking with beer]]\n[[Category:Gluten free recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Debbie&andrew's sausage recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n{{Template:DebbieAndAndrew attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#batter #beer #glutenfreebeerbatteredtoadinthehole #eggs #sausage #hob #onion #wedges #thyme #oliveoil #glutenfree </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Gluten free Full English Breakfast",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Gluten free Full English Breakfast recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#bacon #butter #mushrooms #sausages #glutenfree #sausage #tomatoes #oliveoil #grill #eggs #glutenfreefullenglishbreakfast \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=You want the Full English, and you want it gluten free - here is your answer: tasty gluten free Perfect Pork sausages, bacon, egg, sausages\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 744\n|PortionCalories = 372\n|DatePublished=24th October 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  55 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime =  45 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Gluten free Full English Breakfast recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">The Full English</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">It's just a breakfast, with funny sausages!</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Perfect-pork.png|300px|thumb|right|[[Debbie and Andrew's Perfect Pork sausages]]]]\nYou want the Full English, and you want it [[Gluten free|gluten free]] - here is your answer: tasty [[Gluten|gluten]] free [[Perfect Pork sausages]], [[Bacon|bacon]], [[Egg|egg]], [[Sausages|sausages]] and toast - Yum!\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 4 [[Debbie and Andrew's Perfect Pork sausages]]\n| 4 large [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]]\n| 2 [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]] - halved\n| 4 rashers [[Bacon|bacon]]\n| 4 [[Eggs|eggs]] - beaten\n| 2 slices toast (for a [[Gluten free|gluten free]] option, try [[Udi's White Sandwich Bread]])\n| 15g [[Butter|butter]]\n| A drizzle of [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| [[Salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]] to season\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4), [fan oven 160\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Put the [[Sausages|sausages]] in a [[Roasting tin|roasting tin]], drizzle with [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and place in the [[Oven|oven]] for 25 minutes to [[Roast|roast]]. Shake the pan once or twice in that time. Turn the oven off but leave the pan of sausages in the oven.\n| Place the [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]] and [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]] under the [[Grill|grill]] and cook for about 10 minutes. Remove and add to the [[Sausage|sausage]] pan in the cooling [[Oven|oven]].\n| Now [[Grill|grill]] the [[Bacon|bacon]] for 5 minutes, turning halfway. Add to the [[Sausage|sausage]] pan in the [[Oven|oven]].\n| Place a non-stick [[Saucepan|saucepan]] over a low heat. Melt 1 knob of [[Butter|butter]] in the pan, add the [[Eggs|eggs]], season to taste and stir to scramble. Remove the eggs from the heat.\n| Toast your [[Bread|bread]] and - while its [[Toasting|toasting]] - take the tray out of the [[Oven|oven]] and arrange 2 [[Sausages|sausages]], 2 [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]], 2 [[Tomato|tomato]] halves and 2 rashers of [[Bacon|bacon]] on each plate. [[Butter]] your toast - 1 slice each - and top with [[Scrambled egg|scrambled egg]]. And don't forget the [[Teapot|teapot]] too!\n}}\n===See also===\n* [[Udis Gluten Free Products|Udi's Gluten Free Bread and Baking Products]]\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Breakfast recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Egg recipes]]\n[[Category:Gluten free recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Debbie&andrew's sausage recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Grilled, griddled or barbecued]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n{{Template:DebbieAndAndrew attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#bacon #butter #mushrooms #sausages #glutenfree #sausage #tomatoes #oliveoil #grill #eggs #glutenfreefullenglishbreakfast </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
