                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Gluten Free hot dogs recipe from debbie and andrews sausages\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#onions #fry #caramelised #butter #porksausages #redonion #tomatosauce #sausages #oliveoil #grill #hotdogs \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Gluten free hot dogs made with debbie&andrews sausages made from the very best cuts of pork\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1072\n|PortionCalories = 268\n|DatePublished=16th October 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  25 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime =  15 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Gluten Free hot dogs recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Shurely these are just normal hot dogs?</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Just use any gluten fee sausage!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:NonLoggedInUser|NonLoggedInUser]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Caramelised-red-onion-sausages.png|300px|thumb|right|[[Debbie & Andrew's Caramelised Red Onion Pork Sausages]]]]\n[[Image:Perfect-pork.png|300px|thumb|right|[[Debbie and Andrew's Perfect Pork sausages]]]]\n[[Gluten free|Gluten free]] [[Hot dogs|hot dogs]] made with [[debbie&andrews sausages]] which are made from the very best [[Cuts of pork|cuts of pork]] which come British Red Tractor assured farms. perfect for picnics and barbecues - even good for bonfire night!\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 pack of debbie&andrew\u0092s Harrogate 97% [[Pork]] or [[Caramelised]] [[Red onion|red onion]] [[Pork sausages|pork sausages]]\n| 1 pack of [[Udi\u0092s gluten free Classic Finger Rolls]]\n| 2 [[Brown|brown]] [[Onions|onions]] - peeled and sliced\n| A knob of [[Butter|butter]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| In a non stick large [[Frying pan|frying pan]], drizzle some [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and [[Fry|fry]] off [[Onions|onions]] over a medium/high heat until golden and sticky, this should take around 12 minutes. Set aside in a bowl.\n| In the same non stick large [[Frying pan|frying pan]], [[Fry|fry]] off debbie&andrew\u0092s [[Caramelised]] [[Red onion|red onion]] [[Pork sausages|pork sausages]] over a medium/high heat until golden [[Brown|brown]], about 10 minutes.\n| With a [[Bread|bread]] knife, slice your buns directly down the centre without cutting the whole way through. Toast under the [[Grill|grill]], then [[Butter|butter]]. Place your [[Sausages|sausages]] inside and cover in [[Onions|onions]] and your favourite [[Sauce|sauce]].\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with your favourite [[tomato sauce]] or [[Ketchup|ketchup]]\n\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Gluten free recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Barbecue recipes]]\n[[Category:Debbie&andrew's sausage recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n{{Template:DebbieAndAndrew attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#onions #fry #caramelised #butter #porksausages #redonion #tomatosauce #sausages #oliveoil #grill #hotdogs </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Gluten free sausage and Cheddar cheese pin wheels (GF)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",

                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Sausage and cheddar cheese pinwheels, a savoury recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#glutenfree #thyme #creamcheese #porksausages #redonion #pastry #cheddar #diced #grated #caramelised #bakingtray \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Sausage and cheddar cheese pinwheels - a sausage savoury from debbie& andrew's sausages\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 8518\n|PortionCalories = 608\n|DatePublished=22nd October 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 14\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  35 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  20 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Gluten free sausage and Cheddar cheese pinwheels recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Pip, pip, pip!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">For it was him - meow!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Caramelised-red-onion-sausages.png|300px|thumb|right|[[Debbie & Andrew's Caramelised Red Onion Pork Sausages]]]]\nThis delicious [[Gluten free|gluten free]] savoury recipe is is reproduced courtesy of [[Debbie&andrew's sausages|debbie&andrew's sausages]].  Try it with this [[Chilli salsa dip]].\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 pack debbie&andrew's [[Caramelised]] [[Red onion|red onion]] [[Pork sausages|pork sausages]], [[Diced|diced]] small \n| 250g [[Cream cheese|cream cheese]] \n| 4 [[Spring onions|spring onions]], sliced thinly\n| 100g mature [[Cheddar|cheddar]], [[Grated|grated]]\n| 1 sheet of [[Gluten free|gluten free]] [[Puff pastry|puff pastry]] \n| 2 tablespoons [[Thyme|thyme]], chopped \n| 1 [[Egg|egg]], beaten \n| [[Gluten free]] [[Flour|flour]] for dusting\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4), [fan oven 160\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Line a flat [[Baking tray|baking tray]] with [[Parchment|parchment]].\n| In a bowl, mix the [[Cream cheese|cream cheese]], [[Red onion|red onion]], [[Grated|grated]] [[Cheddar|cheddar]], 1 tablespoon of chopped [[Thyme|thyme]] and [[Diced|diced]] debbie&andrew's [[Caramelised]] Red [[Onion]] [[Pork sausages|pork sausages]] until well combined and easily spreadable. Season with [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]].\n| Dust your bench with [[Flour|flour]] and lay down the puff pasty sheet. Evenly spread your [[Cream cheese|cream cheese]] mixture all over your [[Pastry|pastry]] sheet.\n| Roll up your [[Pastry|pastry]] sheet length ways. Once completely rolled and secure, using a sharp clean knife, cut pinwheels that are 1 inch thick.\n| Place cut side down on the lined [[Baking tray|baking tray]], and using your beaten [[Egg|egg]], [[Brush|brush]] the sides and top of pinwheels to completely coat. Sprinkle with your leftover chopped [[Thyme|thyme]] and [[Bake|bake]] for 15-20 minutes or until golden.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe hot.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Gluten free recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Debbie&andrew's sausage recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n{{Template:DebbieAndAndrew attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#glutenfree #thyme #creamcheese #porksausages #redonion #pastry #cheddar #diced #grated #caramelised #bakingtray </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Gluten free sausage and egg muffins",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Gluten free sausage and egg muffins recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#sausage #muffins #glutenfree #butter #egg #glutenfreesausageandeggmuffins #sausages #bakingtray #oliveoil #muffin #recipesfromothersites \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=These sausage and egg muffins are far tastier than their well known namesake because they contain award winning sausages\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 576\n|PortionCalories = 192\n|DatePublished=22nd October 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 3\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  40 minutes\n|PrepTime =  5 minutes\n|CookTime =  35 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Gluten free sausage and egg muffins recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Still prefer a Mac Muffin</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">\ud83e\udd61\ud83e\udd61\ud83e\udd61</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Harrogate-pork-sausages.png|300px|thumb|right|[[Debbie and Andrew's Harrogate 97% Gluten Free Pork Sausages]]]]\nThese [[Sausage|sausage]] and [[Egg|egg]] [[Muffins|muffins]] are far tastier than their well known namesake because they contain award winning [[:Category:Debbie&andrew's sausage recipes|debbie and andrew's sausages]], they are also [[Gluten free|gluten free]].\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 pack [[Debbie and Andrew's Harrogate 97% Gluten Free Pork Sausages]]\n| 6 [[free range eggs]]\n| 3 [[English muffins]] (if you can't find [[Gluten free|gluten free]], try Gluten Free Rolls like [[Udis Gluten Free Products|these from Udi's]])\n| 15g [[Butter]] to spread\n| A little [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| [[Salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 190\u00b0 C (375\u00b0 F - gas 5), [fan oven 170\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Drizzle a little [[Oil|oil]] into a [[Baking tray|baking tray]] and place the [[Sausages|sausages]] in the tray. [[Roast]] in the preheated [[Oven|oven]] for 25 minutes, shaking the tin once or twice in that time.\n| Remove the tray from the [[Oven|oven]] and drain the [[Sausages|sausages]] on [[Kitchen paper|kitchen paper]]. When they have cooled a little, cut each in half lengthways and drain on kitchen paper again.\n| In a large [[Frying pan|frying pan]], [[Fry|fry]] the 6 [[Eggs|eggs]] (to taste) in a little hot [[Oil|oil]]. Season with [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]] and put to one side.\n| Meanwhile, half and toast your [[Muffins|muffins]] (in your [[Toaster|toaster]] if they fit, under the [[Grill|grill]] if not). Spread all 6 halves generously with [[Butter|butter]].\n| Place the [[Muffin|muffin]] halves on plates - 2 to each plate. Top each half with two [[Sausage|sausage]] halves, then top each with an [[Egg|egg]].\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nSeason with more [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]] and serve.\n===See also===\n* [[Udi's Gluten Free Products]]\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:North American recipes]]\n[[Category:Breakfast recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Egg recipes]]\n[[Category:Gluten free recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Debbie&andrew's sausage recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n{{Template:DebbieAndAndrew attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#sausage #muffins #glutenfree #butter #egg #glutenfreesausageandeggmuffins #sausages #bakingtray #oliveoil #muffin #recipesfromothersites </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }

title": "Gluten free sausage and spinach pasta bake",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Gluten free sausage and spinach pasta bake recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#pasta #grated #glutenfree #spinach #sausage #tomato #boil #butter #whitesauce #glutenfreesausageandspinachpastabake #nutmeg \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This gluten free sausage, spinach and pasta bake comes to Cookipedia courtesy of debbie&andrews sausages\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 3467\n|PortionCalories = 577\n|DatePublished=23rd October 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 6\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  1 hour, 10 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  55 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Gluten free sausage and spinach pasta bake recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Different!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I do like the idea of spinach in this.  Healthy too.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Perfect-pork.png|300px|thumb|right|[[Debbie and Andrew's Perfect Pork sausages]]]]\nThis [[Gluten free|gluten free]] [[Sausage|sausage]], [[Spinach|spinach]] and [[Pasta|pasta]] [[Bake|bake]] comes to [[Cookipedia]] courtesy of [[debbie&andrew's sausages]]. This makes a great easy meal for six people.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 pack [[Debbie and Andrew's Perfect Pork sausages]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 1 [[Onion|onion]], [[Diced|diced]]\n| 1 [[Carrot|carrot]], [[Grated|grated]]\n| 150ml [[Red wine|red wine]]\n| 300ml [[Chicken stock|chicken stock]]\n| 3 tablespoons [[Tomato|tomato]] pur\u00e9e\n}}\n====for the pasta layer:====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 50g [[Butter|butter]]\n| 50g [[Plain flour|plain flour]] (for a [[Gluten free|gluten free]] alternative, try Udi's [[All purpose flour|all purpose flour]] Mix)\n| 600ml [[Milk|milk]]\n| 1tsp freshly [[Grated|grated]] [[Nutmeg|nutmeg]]\n| 500g penne [[Pasta|pasta]] (or a [[Gluten free|gluten free]] alternative)\n| 200g fresh [[Spinach|spinach]]\n| 140g [[Cheddar cheese|cheddar cheese]], [[Grated|grated]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 190\u00b0 C (375\u00b0 F - gas 5), [fan oven 170\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Slit the [[Sausages|sausages]] and remove the [[Meat|meat]] from the skins. Chop or [[Dice|dice]] the [[Sausage meat|sausage meat]] into small bite-size pieces.\n| Now heat the [[Oil|oil]] in a non stick pan, add the [[Onion|onion]] and [[Fry|fry]] for 5 minutes until soft and golden. Stir in the [[Sausage meat|sausage meat]] and fry for another 5 minutes. Finally add the [[Carrot|carrot]], [[Wine|wine]], [[Stock|stock]] and [[Tomato|tomato]] pur\u00e9e and season well with [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]. Bring to the [[Boil|boil]] then [[Simmer|simmer]] for 10 minutes and set aside.\n| Melt the [[Butter|butter]] in another pan. Add the [[Flour|flour]] and stir to make a [[Roux|roux]]. Slowly add the [[Milk|milk]], whisking all the time, until the [[White sauce|white sauce]] is thick and smooth. Add the [[Nutmeg|nutmeg]] and more seasoning then stir and put to one side.\n| Bring a large pan of [[Salted|salted]] water to the [[Boil|boil]]. Add the [[Pasta|pasta]], stir well, bring back to the boil then cook for 10 minutes until [[Al dente|al dente]]. Remove from the heat, stir in the [[Spinach|spinach]] and leave for 2 minutes until the spinach wilts. Drain the pasta and spinach well and put to one side.\n| In a shallow ovenproof dish, layer the three mixtures - [[Pasta|pasta]] first, then [[Sausage|sausage]] mix, then [[White sauce|white sauce]]. Make sure your top layer is white [[Sauce|sauce]] and sprinkle with [[Cheese|cheese]].\n| [[Bake]] in the preheated [[Oven|oven]] for 20 minutes until golden [[Brown|brown]] and bubbling on top. Serve immediately.\n}}\n===See also===\n* [[Udis Gluten Free Products|Udi's Gluten Free Products for gluten free baking products]]\n* [http://www.healthysupplies.co.uk/gluten-free-pasta.html?gclid=COSSior32MgCFaYSwwodvOsFHA Gluten free pasta from www.healthysupplies.co.uk]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Italian recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Gluten free recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pasta recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Cooking with wine]]\n[[Category:Stews and casseroles]]\n[[Category:Debbie&andrew's sausage recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n{{Template:DebbieAndAndrew attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#pasta #grated #glutenfree #spinach #sausage #tomato #boil #butter #whitesauce #glutenfreesausageandspinachpastabake #nutmeg </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Gluten free sausage and thyme quiche",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Gluten free sausage and thyme quiche recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#sausages #glutenfreesausageandthymequiche #cheese #thyme #bake #sausage #glutenfree #grated #singlecream #egg #cream \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This delicious gluten free sausage and thyme quiche recipe is easy to make and can be completed made in one hour\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 847\n|PortionCalories = 211\n|DatePublished=23rd October 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  1 hour\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime =  50 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Gluten free sausage and thyme quiche recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Quicky Quiche</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">If you're in a hurry, this is the quiche recipe for you!</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Perfect-cumberland-sausages.png|300px|thumb|right|[[Debbie and Andrew's Perfect Cumberland Pork Sausages]]]]\nThis delicious [[Gluten free|gluten free]] [[Sausage|sausage]] and [[Thyme|thyme]] quiche recipe is easy to make and can be completed made in one hour.\n\nIt has been brought to [[Cookipedia]] courtesy of debbie&andrew's [[Sausages|sausages]].\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 readymade [[Shortcrust pastry|shortcrust pastry]] case (for a [[Gluten free|gluten free]] alternative try Udi's [[Pastry]] Mix)\n| 1 pack [[Debbie and Andrew's Perfect Cumberland Pork Sausages]], each [[Sausage|sausage]] cut in half\n| 2 [[free range eggs]]\n| 75ml [[Single Cream|single cream]]\n| 75ml cr\u00e8me fraiche\n| 100g [[Cheddar cheese|cheddar cheese]], [[Grated|grated]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Fresh thyme|fresh thyme]] chopped\n| [[Salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]] to taste\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6), [fan oven 180\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| [[Bake]] your [[Sausages|sausages]] in a lightly oiled [[Baking tray|baking tray]] in the preheated [[Oven|oven]] for 20 minutes, shaking the pan once or twice during that time.\n| Put to one side to cool, then slice in half lengthways to make 12 fingers.\n| Place the cooked halved [[Sausages|sausages]] in a fan shape in the flan case.\n| In a large bowl mix the [[Eggs|eggs]] with the [[Single Cream|single cream]] and cr\u00e8me fraiche.\n| Whisk, season with [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]] and add the [[Thyme|thyme]] and [[Grated|grated]] [[Cheese|cheese]]. Stir well.\n| Pour the [[Cheese|cheese]], [[Egg|egg]] and [[Cream|cream]] mixture over the [[Sausages|sausages]] and [[Bake|bake]] in the preheated [[Oven|oven]] for 30 minutes.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nSlice and serve with a simple [[Green salad|green salad]].\n==See also==\n\n* [[Udis Gluten Free Products|Udi's gluten free bread and baking supplies]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Gluten free recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Pies tarts and flans]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n[[Category:Debbie&andrew's sausage recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n{{Template:DebbieAndAndrew attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#sausages #glutenfreesausageandthymequiche #cheese #thyme #bake #sausage #glutenfree #grated #singlecream #egg #cream </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Gluten free sausage cassoulet",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Gluten free sausage cassoulet recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#glutenfree #glutenfreesausagecassoulet #oliveoil #diced #sausages #breadcrumbs #cannellinibeans #lardons #celery #honey #sweetpotato \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This warming gluten free sausage cassoulet is easy to make and can be completed in less than one hour\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2364\n|PortionCalories = 591\n|DatePublished=23rd October 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  55 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  40 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Gluten free sausage cassoulet recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Not bad</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Pretty tasty. I think a lot of sausages nowadays are gluten free also.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Harrogate-pork-sausages.png|300px|thumb|right|[[Debbie and Andrew's Harrogate 97% Gluten Free Pork Sausages]]]]\nThis warming [[Gluten free|gluten free]] [[Sausage|sausage]] [[Cassoulet|cassoulet]] is easy to make and can be completed in less than one hour.  It is brought to [[Cookipedia]] courtesy of debbiesandandrews [[Sausages|sausages]].\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 Pack of [[Debbie and Andrew's Harrogate 97% Gluten Free Pork Sausages]]\n| 2tbs [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 200g [[Smoked|smoked]] [[Lardons|lardons]]\n| 1 [[Brown|brown]] [[Onion|onion]], [[Diced|diced]]\n| 2 [[Carrots|carrots]], [[Diced|diced]]\n| 2 [[Celery|celery]] sticks, [[Diced|diced]]\n| 1 [[Sweet potato|sweet potato]], cubed\n| 2 [[Cloves garlic, minced|cloves garlic, minced]]\n| 10 [[Sage leaves|sage leaves]] - roughly chopped\n| &#189; bottle of [[Red wine|red wine]]\n| 400g can [[Cannellini beans|cannellini beans]] - drained and rinsed\n| 400g can of chopped [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]]\n| 2tbs [[Honey|honey]]\n| 50g [[Gluten free|gluten free]] [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Use a large, stove-top and [[Oven|oven]] friendly dish. On a medium/high heat, [[Fry|fry]] off the [[Lardons|lardons]], [[Onion|onion]], [[Carrot|carrot]], [[Sweet potato|sweet potato]], [[Celery|celery]] and [[Sage|sage]] in the [[Olive oil|olive oil]] until golden [[Brown|brown]] - about 10 minutes. Add the [[Garlic|garlic]] and [[Red wine|red wine]] and cook out for 5 minutes until reduced by half.\n| Add your [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]], [[Cannellini beans|cannellini beans]], [[Honey|honey]] and season with [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]] to taste.\n| Place the debbie&andrew's [[Harrogate 97% Pork Sausages]] carefully on top being careful not to fully submerge as you want the [[Sausages|sausages]] to get a lovely golden [[Brown|brown]] colour.\n| Sprinkle with [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]], drizzle with a little extra [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and lay a few extra whole [[Sage leaves|sage leaves]] on the top.\n| Place in the [[Oven|oven]] and [[Bake|bake]] for 40 minutes.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe hot with crusty [[Gluten free|gluten free]] [[Bread|bread]].\n===See also===\n* [[Udi's Gluten Free Products|Udi\u0092s Gluten Free Products for gluten free bread]]\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:French recipes]]\n[[Category:Gluten free recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Stews and casseroles]]\n[[Category:Debbie&andrew's sausage recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Stewed, braised or pot roasted]]\n{{Template:DebbieAndAndrew attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n[[Category:Cooking with wine]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#glutenfree #glutenfreesausagecassoulet #oliveoil #diced #sausages #breadcrumbs #cannellinibeans #lardons #celery #honey #sweetpotato </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }

title": "Gluten Free sausage kebabs with quinoa salad (GF)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Gluten Free sausage kebabs with quinoa salad recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#quinoa #oliveoil #hazelnuts #butternutsquash #skewers #zest #glutenfree #onion #mint #courgettes #garlic \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=The following recipe is debbie&andrew's special recipe to celebrate being at the Cheshire County Show in 2105\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 567\n|PortionCalories = 141\n|DatePublished=17th October 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  1 hour\n|PrepTime =  20 minutes\n|CookTime =  40 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Gluten Free sausage kebabs GF recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Lovely kebabs</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">3</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">You can keep the quinoa though.</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Carla_Cancio-Bello,_J.D.,_on_behalf_of_Cuban_Cuisine_UK|Carla]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Caramelised-red-onion-sausages.png|300px|thumb|right|[[Debbie & Andrew's Caramelised Red Onion Pork Sausages]]]]\nThe following recipe is [[debbie&andrew's]] special recipe to celebrate being at the Cheshire County Show in 2105.\n\nIt is a [[Gluten free|gluten free]] recipe which is suitable for Coeliacs, but which everyone will find delicious. It just shows that [[Sausages|sausages]] are for more than just sarnies!\n\nThis recipe also has an accompanying [[Salad|salad]] which is also [[Gluten free|gluten free]]\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n}}\n====for the salad====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 1&#8260;2 a [[Butternut squash|butternut squash]], roughly chopped, deseeded 50g [[Hazelnuts|hazelnuts]], roughly chopped\n| 250g [[Quinoa|quinoa]]\n| [[Zest]] and [[Juice|juice]] 1 [[Lemon|lemon]]\n| 1 bunch of [[Mint|mint]], roughly chopped\n| 1 bunch of [[Parsley|parsley]], roughly chopped\n| 2 [[Courgettes|courgettes]], thickly sliced\n| 4 [[Garlic|garlic]] [[Cloves|cloves]], leave skin on\n| [[Olive oil]]\n}}\n====for the kebabs====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 1 pack of [[Debbie & Andrew's Caramelised Red Onion Pork Sausages|debbie&andrew's Caramelised red onion sausages]], chopped into large chunks\n| 1&#8260;2 a [[Butternut squash|butternut squash]], thickly cubed, [[Boiled|boiled]] and drained (skin on) 1 [[Red onion|red onion]], thickly sliced\n| 1 green and 1 [[Red pepper|red pepper]], halved and deseeded and cut into big chunks\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6), [fan oven 180\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Tip the [[Pepper|pepper]], [[Squash|squash]] & [[Courgettes|courgettes]] into a [[Baking tray|baking tray]]. Smother with [[Salt|salt]], [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and [[Paprika|paprika]]. [[Roast]] for 20 minutes\n| Take out of [[Oven|oven]] and tip [[Onion|onion]], [[Garlic|garlic]] and [[Hazelnuts|hazelnuts]] into a [[Roasting dish|roasting dish]]. Toss and [[Roast|roast]] for 20 mins, then cool 4 - Prepare [[Quinoa|quinoa]] according to the pack instructions\n| In a bowl, mix [[Zest|zest]], [[Juice|juice]] and 100ml [[Oil|oil]]. Squeeze the [[Roasted garlic|roasted garlic]] pulp from skins into the bowl, [[Mash|mash]] well and fold in the [[Mint|mint]] and [[Parsley|parsley]]. Pour over the veg, then toss with the [[Quinoa|quinoa]] and [[Hazelnuts|hazelnuts]], season with [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]. Set aside\n| Thread the [[Debbie & Andrew's Caramelised Red Onion Pork Sausages|debbie&andrew's Caramelised red onion sausages]] onto 4 [[Skewers|skewers]] with the cooked [[Butternut squash|butternut squash]] cubes, [[Pepper|pepper]] and [[Onion|onion]]. [[Fry]] in a non stick pan in a little [[Olive oil|olive oil]] over a high heat until skewers are lovely and golden\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe the [[Skewers|skewers]] over the [[Quinoa|quinoa]] [[Salad|salad]] and serve hot\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Gluten free recipes]]\n[[Category: Grain and bean recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Salad recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Debbie&andrew's sausage recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n{{Template:DebbieAndAndrew attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#quinoa #oliveoil #hazelnuts #butternutsquash #skewers #zest #glutenfree #onion #mint #courgettes #garlic </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }

title": "Gluten free sausage plait",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Gluten free sausage plait recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#sausagemeat #pastry #egg #butter #onion #bakingtray #sausage #sunfloweroil #glutenfree #brush #glutenfreesausageplait \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Fancy baking can be gluten free with this sausage plait recipe from Debbie and andrews sausages\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2951\n|PortionCalories = 491\n|DatePublished=22nd October 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 6\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  1 hour, 5 minutes\n|PrepTime =  20 minutes\n|CookTime =  45 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Gluten free sausage plait recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Or use any sausages!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">2.5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Nothing very special about those sausages, use any brand.</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]]</span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Harrogate-pork-sausages.png|300px|thumb|right|[[Debbie and Andrew's Harrogate 97% Gluten Free Pork Sausages]]]]\n</div>\n\nFancy [[Baking|baking]] can be [[Gluten free|gluten free]] with this [[Sausage|sausage]] plait recipe from [[Debbie&andrew's sausages|debbie&andrew's sausages]].\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 2 packs [[Debbie and Andrew's Harrogate 97% Gluten Free Pork Sausages]]\n| A knob of [[Butter|butter]] to grease\n| 1 tablespoon [[Sunflower oil|sunflower oil]]\n| 1 [[Red onion|red onion]], peeled and [[Diced|diced]]\n| 2 teaspoons [[Dried thyme|dried thyme]]\n| [[Salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]\n| 1 x 500g block ready made [[Gluten free|gluten free]] [[Puff pastry|puff pastry]]\n| 2 [[Hard-boiled eggs|hard-boiled eggs]], sliced\n| 1 [[Egg|egg]], beaten\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6), [fan oven 180\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Remove all the [[Sausages|sausages]] from their skins. Grease a [[Baking tray|baking tray]] with a little [[Butter|butter]].\n| Heat the [[Sunflower oil|sunflower oil]] in a large [[Frying pan|frying pan]] until hot. Add the [[Onion|onion]] and cook until soft. Transfer to a bowl.\n| Add the [[Sausage meat|sausage meat]], [[Thyme|thyme]] and [[Black pepper|black pepper]] to the cooked [[Onion|onion]] and mix and season well.\n| Roll the [[Puff pastry|puff pastry]] out on a floured surface to a rectangle. Arrange the sliced [[Eggs|eggs]] in a long line down the middle of the [[Pastry|pastry]]. Top with the [[Sausage meat|sausage meat]] mixture.\n| Now, using a sharp knife, cut 2.5cm strips, on the angle, from the edge of the [[Sausage meat|sausage meat]] to the outer edge of the [[Pastry|pastry]]. [[Brush]] the strips with beaten [[Egg|egg]].\n| Starting at the top of the [[Pastry|pastry]], take the top left strip of pastry and lay it over the [[Sausage meat|sausage meat]]. Then, take the top right strip and lay it over the [[Sausage|sausage]] [[Meat|meat]]. Repeat to make the plait pattern. Tuck the ends of the pastry into the plait and [[Brush|brush]] the whole thing with beaten [[Egg|egg]].\n| Transfer the plait to the prepared [[Baking tray|baking tray]] and [[Bake|bake]] in middle of the preheated [[Oven|oven]] for 20 minutes. Turn the oven temperature down to 140\u00baC /275\u00baF /Gas Mark 1 and bake for another 20 minutes.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe hot with seasonal [[Vegetables|vegetables]] or cold with relish or [[Chutney|chutney]] for the perfect picnic!\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Gluten free recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Pies tarts and flans]]\n[[Category:Debbie&andrew's sausage recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n{{Template:DebbieAndAndrew attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#sausagemeat #pastry #egg #butter #onion #bakingtray #sausage #sunfloweroil #glutenfree #brush #glutenfreesausageplait </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Gluten free sausage rolls gluten free recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#pastry #sausages #bakingtray #sausage #recipesfromothersites #bake #glutenfreesausagerollsgf #miseenplace #flour #sausagerolls #glutenfree \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Make these gluten free sausage rolls using award winning sausages from Debbie&andrews sausages\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 120\n|PortionCalories = 15\n|DatePublished=22nd October 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 8\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  35 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime =  25 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Gluten free sausage rolls GF recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Nothing special</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">3</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I prefer our local butcher's sausages to these expensive brands.</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Carla_Cancio-Bello,_J.D.,_on_behalf_of_Cuban_Cuisine_UK|Carla]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Harrogate-pork-sausages.png|300px|thumb|right|[[Debbie and Andrew's Harrogate 97% Gluten Free Pork Sausages]]]]\nMake these [[Gluten free|gluten free]] [[Sausage rolls|sausage rolls]] using award winning [[Sausages|sausages]] from [[Debbie&andrew's sausage recipes|debbie&andrews sausages]].\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 pack [[Debbie and Andrew's Harrogate 97% Gluten Free Pork Sausages]]\n| 1 x 500g block [https://www.google.com/search?q=gluten+free+puff+pastry+ready+made&oq=gluten+free+puff+pastry+ready+made&aqs=chrome..69i57.11587j0j7&sourceid=chrome&es_sm=91&ie=UTF-8 ready made gluten free puff pastry]\n| &#8232;A little [[Oil|oil]] to grease\n| A little [[Flour|flour]] to dust\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4), [fan oven 160\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Lightly grease a [[Baking tray|baking tray]] with [[Oil|oil]].\n| Remove the skins from the [[Sausages|sausages]] but try to keep their [[Sausage|sausage]] shape as best you can! Place them on the greased [[Baking tray|baking tray]] and [[Bake|bake]] the skinned sausages for 10 minutes just to part cook them.\n| Meanwhile cut the [[Pastry|pastry]] block into 8 and roll out each piece on a lightly floured work surface.\n| Wrap each [[Sausage|sausage]] in a piece of [[Pastry|pastry]], pinch to seal and then trim the pastry ends off if you wish. Put back in the [[Oven|oven]] for 15 minutes, then allow to cool on a rack before serving.\n}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Gluten free recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Debbie&andrew's sausage recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n{{Template:DebbieAndAndrew attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#pastry #sausages #bakingtray #sausage #recipesfromothersites #bake #glutenfreesausagerollsgf #miseenplace #flour #sausagerolls #glutenfree </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Gluten Free sausage sandwich (GF)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Gluten Free sausage sandwiches, a recipe from debbie and andrews sausages\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#onions #porksausages #redonion #butter #caramelised #fry #ketchup #sausages #bread #pork #sauce \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Gluten free sausage sandwiches made with debbie&andrews sausages which are made from the very best cuts of pork\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1072\n|PortionCalories = 268\n|DatePublished=17th October 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  25 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime =  15 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Gluten Free hot dogs sausage sandwich recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Shurely these are just normal sausage sandwiches?</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Just use any gluten fee sausage!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:NonLoggedInUser|NonLoggedInUser]] </span></span>}}\n[[Image:Perfect-pork.png|300px|thumb|right|[[Debbie and Andrew's Perfect Pork sausages]]]]\n[[Image:Caramelised-red-onion-sausages.png|300px|thumb|right|[[Debbie & Andrew's Caramelised Red Onion Pork Sausages]]]]\n[[Gluten free|Gluten free]] sausage sandwiches made with [[debbie&andrews sausages]] which are made from the very best [[Cuts of pork|cuts of pork]] which come British Red Tractor assured farms. perfect for picnics and barbecues - great food for a bonfire night!\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 pack of debbie&andrew\u0092s Harrogate 97% [[Pork]] or [[Caramelised]] [[Red onion|red onion]] [[Pork sausages|pork sausages]]\n| 1 pack of [[Udi\u0092s gluten free Classic Finger Rolls]]\n| 2 [[Brown|brown]] [[Onions|onions]] - peeled and sliced\n| A knob of [[Butter|butter]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| In a non stick large [[Frying pan|frying pan]], drizzle some [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and [[Fry|fry]] off [[Onions|onions]] over a medium/high heat until golden and sticky, this should take around 12 minutes. Set aside in a bowl.\n| In the same non stick large [[Frying pan|frying pan]], [[Fry|fry]] off debbie&andrew\u0092s [[Caramelised]] [[Red onion|red onion]] [[Pork sausages|pork sausages]] over a medium/high heat until golden [[Brown|brown]], about 10 minutes.\n| With a [[Bread|bread]] knife, slice your buns directly down the centre without cutting the whole way through. Toast under the [[Grill|grill]], then [[Butter|butter]]. Place your [[Sausages|sausages]] inside and cover in [[Onions|onions]] and your favourite [[Sauce|sauce]].\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with your favourite [[tomato sauce]] or [[Ketchup|ketchup]]\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Gluten free recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Barbecue recipes]]\n[[Category:Debbie&andrew's sausage recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n{{Template:DebbieAndAndrew attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#onions #porksausages #redonion #butter #caramelised #fry #ketchup #sausages #bread #pork #sauce </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Gluten Free Sicilian sausage pasta",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Gluten Free Sicilian sausage pasta recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#oliveoil #sausage #diced #glutenfreesiciliansausagepasta #glutenfree #pasta #tomatoes #onion #butter #redwine #garlic \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This Gluten free Sicilian sausage pasta recipe is brought to Cookipedia by Debbie&andrews\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 3092\n|PortionCalories = 773\n|DatePublished=23rd October 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  1 hour\n|PrepTime =  30 minutes\n|CookTime =  30 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Gluten Free Sicilian sausage pasta recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Coeliac's special!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.6</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">A quick and easy recipe too.</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Harrogate-pork-sausages.png|300px|thumb|right|[[Debbie and Andrew's Harrogate 97% Gluten Free Pork Sausages]]]]\nThis [[Gluten free]] Sicilian [[Sausage|sausage]] [[Pasta|pasta]] recipe is brought to [[Cookipedia]] by [[Debbie&andrews sausages|debbie&andrews sausages]].\n\nYou can find [[Gluten free|gluten free]] casarecce [[Pasta|pasta]] quite easily, just [https://www.google.com/search?q=casarecce+pasta&oq=casarecce+pasta&aqs=chrome..69i57.942j0j7&sourceid=chrome&es_sm=91&ie=UTF-8#q=gluten+free+casarecce+pasta Google for it by clicking here].\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 pack of |[[Debbie and Andrew's Harrogate 97% Gluten Free Pork Sausages]]\n| 1 x 500g pack gluten-free casarecce pasta\n| 500g vine [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]]\n| 1 bunch of [[Basil|basil]]\n| Handful of pitted [[Kalamata|kalamata]] [[Olives|olives]]\n| 1 ball of [[buratta cheese]]\n| 2 [[Cloves|cloves]] [[Garlic|garlic]], [[Diced|diced]]\n| 1 [[Onion|onion]], [[Diced|diced]]\n| &#188; bottle [[Red wine|red wine]]\n| 100g [[Parmesan|parmesan]], [[Grated|grated]]\n| [[Olive oil]]\n| Knob [[Butter|butter]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4), [fan oven 160\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Preheat [[Oven|oven]] to 180\u00b0C. Put the vine [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]] in a [[Roasting dish|roasting dish]] and smother with [[Olive oil|olive oil]]. Be generous. [[Roast]] for 20 minutes until tomatoes are soft.\n| In a large [[Saucepan|saucepan]] over a medium/high heat, melt a knob of [[Butter|butter]] and a tablespoon of [[Olive oil|olive oil]] until sizzling. Add your debbie&andrew's Harrogate 97% [[Pork]] [[Sausage meat|sausage meat]] by peeling off the skin and pushing out the lovely [[Meat|meat]] inside. Add [[Diced|diced]] [[Onion|onion]] and break up the [[Sausage|sausage]] meat like you would with [[Mince|mince]]. Cook for around 10 minutes until lovely and golden.\n| Add the [[Garlic|garlic]] and [[Red wine|red wine]] and cook out for 2 minutes.\n| Take your [[Roasted tomatoes|roasted tomatoes]] out of the [[Oven|oven]] and add to your [[Sausage|sausage]] [[Sauce|sauce]] (get rid of vines). Add your [[Olives|olives]] and [[Simmer|simmer]] until lovely and thick, season with [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]].\n| Bring a pan of [[Salted|salted]] water to the [[Boil|boil]] and cook the casarecce according to the packet instructions. Drain, reserving a cupful of cooking water, and add to the [[Sauce|sauce]] with a little of the water to loosen.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nDrizzle over a good glug of [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and serve with buratta and a scattering of [[Basil leaves|basil leaves]].\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Italian recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Gluten free recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pasta recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Cooking with wine]]\n[[Category:Debbie&andrew's sausage recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n{{Template:DebbieAndAndrew attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#oliveoil #sausage #diced #glutenfreesiciliansausagepasta #glutenfree #pasta #tomatoes #onion #butter #redwine #garlic </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }

title": "Gluten free Victoria Sandwich (GF)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Gluten free Victoria Sandwich a gluten free recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#flour #cake #castersugar #cream #butter #sandwich #vanilla #margarine #gluten #cakes #chocolate \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This is an all-time family favourite and well worth the bit of effort\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2712\n|PortionCalories = 271\n|DatePublished=27th September 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings =Servings: 10 -  Make 1 gluten free Victoria Sandwich \n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  40 minutes\n|PrepTime = 20 minutes\n|CookTime =  20 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Gluten_free_angel_cake_(GF)_recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Vic. cake</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">3</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">That's what Mum called it!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The&nbsp;Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Gluten_free_angel_cake_(GF)_ready_to_fill.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Gluten free Victoria Sandwich cake, ready to fill]]\nThis is an all-time family favourite and well worth the bit of effort.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 170 g/6oz [[Wellfoods Ltd|Wellfoods]] Gluten Free [[Flour]] Alternative\n| 2 teaspoons of [[Baking powder|baking powder]], (Check its [[Gluten]] Free), sifted into the [[Flour|flour]].\n| 170 g/6oz [[Vanilla]] [[Sugar]], (or 1 teaspoon of [[vanilla essence]] added to [[Caster sugar|caster sugar]])\n| 170 g/6oz Soft [[Margarine]]\n| 3 Large [[Free range eggs|free range eggs]], lightly beaten\n}}\n'''filling'''\n* 180 g Filling of your choice, for example, [[Strawberry]] [[Jam|jam]]. (Beaten slightly to soften)\n* 1 Teaspoon of [[Caster sugar|caster sugar]] for dusting.\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 190\u00b0 C (375\u00b0 F - gas 5), [fan oven 170\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n* Grease and baseline 2 x 7\" (18cm) [[Sandwich|sandwich]] tins.\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| [[Cream]] the [[Margarine|margarine]] and [[Sugar|sugar]] together until soft, fluffy and pale in colour.\n| Add the one third of the [[Egg|egg]], and a spoon of [[Flour|flour]], beat in with each addition.\n| Add final spoon of [[Flour|flour]] and carefully fold into the mixture.\n| Divide mixture between the tins, check the weight on scale.\n| Level the tops with a knife, making a slight hollow in the centre of each.\n| [[Bake]] in the centre of the [[Oven|oven]] for about 20 minutes until golden and slightly shrinking away from the edges of the tins and when lightly pressed with a finger, should spring back into shape.\n| Remove from the [[Oven|oven]], cool slightly, and then turn out onto a wire [[Cooling rack|cooling rack]]. \n| The sponge is delicate\u0085so handle with care. \n| When completely cold, peel off the [[Greaseproof paper|greaseproof paper]] and [[Sandwich|sandwich]] together with the filling of your choice. Dust with [[Caster sugar|caster sugar]].\n| Variations:\n| Finish the [[Cake|cake]] when cool by filling with [[Butter|butter]] [[Cream|cream]] and decorate with [[Walnut|walnut]] pieces.\n| This basic recipe could be divided into 15 or so bun cases, or iced to form a birthday [[Cake|cake]].\n}}\n===Recipe source===\n* [[User:Janet Woodward|Janet Woodward]]\n===Variations===\nSubstitute one tablespoon of [[Cocoa|cocoa]] (check as usual for suitability) for one of [[Flour|flour]]; add a tablespoon of hot water to enrich the cocoa. Fold into mixture carefully or make a marble effect. \n\nFill with [[Vanilla|vanilla]] [[Butter|butter]] [[Cream|cream]] and finish with a melted [[Chocolate|chocolate]] topping.\n<br />Or<br /> \nAdd two tablespoons [[Coffee|coffee]] granules in 1 tablespoon almost [[Boiling|boiling]] water. Stir well.\n\nWhen cool, add it to the [[Cake|cake]] mix with the last of the [[Flour|flour]].\n===Chef's notes===\nUnfilled, the [[Cake|cake]] freezes well. Wrap the two [[Cakes|cakes]] separately in [[Cling film|cling film]]. \n[[Freezer]] storage for 3 months. Defrost at room temperature for an hour.\n\nThis basic recipe could be divided into 15 or so bun cases, or iced to form a birthday [[Cake|cake]]. \n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:Egg recipes]]\n[[Category:Gluten free recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#flour #cake #castersugar #cream #butter #sandwich #vanilla #margarine #gluten #cakes #chocolate </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Gooseberry fool (Mrs Beeton's)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Gooseberry fool (Mrs Beeton's) a fruit recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#gooseberries #butter #whippedcream #unusualrecipes #bake #cream \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Not sure what to do your glut of gooseberries? Make this simple and delicious sweet\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 633\n|PortionCalories = 158\n|DatePublished=12th April 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Gooseberry fool. (Not Mrs Beeton's!)\n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime = 45 minutes plus cooling time\n|PrepTime = 15 minutes\n|CookTime = 30 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Gooseberry fool (Mrs Beeton's) recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Looks lovely</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Nice and sharp</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The&nbsp;Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nNot sure what to do your glut of gooseberries?  Make this simple and delicious sweet.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1 pint (568 ml) [[gooseberries]] (topped and tailed)\n| &#188; pint (142 ml) stiffly [[whipped cream]]\n| [[Sugar]] to taste\n| 1 tablespoon [[butter]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| [[Bake]] or stew the [[gooseberries]]\n| ''Heat the [[butter]] in a pan, add the [[sugar]] and gooseberries, stew on a low heat until the gooseberries are soft and mushy (30 minutes)''\n| Pass the pulp through a fine sieve, discarding the pips and skin\n| Stir in the [[cream]]\n| ''Allow to cool''\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#gooseberries #butter #whippedcream #unusualrecipes #bake #cream </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Goose fat roasted belly pork",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Goose fat roasted belly pork a British recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#pork #onions #goosefat #goosefatroastedbellypork #garlic #peppercorns #basting #liquor #roasting #thyme #whitewinegravy \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A tasty, but rather unhealthy change from turkey for Christmas lunch\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 7546\n|PortionCalories = 1257\n|DatePublished=7th November 2012\n|Author = JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = Serves 6\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 3 hours 30 minutes\n |PrepTime = 30 minutes\n |CookTime = 3 hours \n |Image = [[Image:Goose fat roasted belly pork recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"><span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Crunchy crackling</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Hope you're still enjoying the memory of this, Mike wherever you are now. :(</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\">[[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nA tasty, but rather unhealthy change from turkey for Christmas lunch.  This is a treat for my husband who for the best part of the year restricts his consumption of [[saturated fat]].  The recipe is vaguely based on a healthier '''[http://www.bbcgoodfood.com/recipes/9098/sticky-slowroast-belly-of-pork James Martin recipe]'''.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1.4 kg [[Belly pork|belly pork]], boned and scored\n| 2 teaspoons [[Goose fat|goose fat]]\n| 2 teaspoons green [[Peppercorns|peppercorns]], crushed\n| [[Sea Salt|Coarse sea salt]]\n| 1 teaspoon dried [[thyme]]\n| 3 large [[Onions|onions]], sliced\n| [[Garlic]] to taste, separated, but not peeled\n| 2 tablespoons of extra [[Goose fat|goose fat]]\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 180C/fan 160C/gas 4.\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Place the [[Pork|pork]], skin-side up, on a rack in a [[Roasting|roasting]] tin. \n| Smear with 2 teaspoons [[Goose fat|goose fat]], then lightly press on the crushed [[Peppercorns|peppercorns]], a sprinkling of [[Coarse sea salt|coarse sea salt]] and [[thyme]]. \n| Put in the [[Oven|oven]], then cook for 1 hour. \n| Remove from the [[Oven|oven]] and [[Baste|baste]] with the juices. Continue to cook for a further 1&frac12; hours, [[Basting|basting]] every 30 minutes.\n| Put the sliced [[Onions|onions]] and [[Garlic|garlic]] in the [[Roasting|roasting]] tin underneath the [[Pork|pork]]. \n| [[Brush]] 2-3 tablespoons of [[Goose fat|goose fat]] over the [[Pork|pork]], then increase the [[Oven|oven]] to 200C/fan 180C/ gas 6. \n| Cook for a further 30-40 mins, [[Basting|basting]] occasionally. Once cooked and tender (this can be easily tested by piercing the flesh with a knife), remove [[Pork|pork]] from the [[Oven|oven]], then leave to rest for 10-15 mins.\n| While the [[Pork|pork]] is resting, heat the tin on the stove with the [[Onions|onions]], adding 2 tablespoons of water. This will lift any residue from the pan, creating a moist cooking [[Liquor|liquor]]. Season the onions with [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]], then divide between 6 plates. \n| Carve [[Pork|pork]] into 6 portions, then serve on top of the [[Onions|onions]] and pour over the cooking [[Liquor|liquor]].  Squeeze the [[Garlic|garlic]] over the top.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Roast potatoes|roast potatoes]], [[Vegetables|vegetables]] and [[white wine gravy]].\n===Chef's notes===\nIf making in smaller quantities you will need to reduce the cooking times in proportion to the weight of the [[pork]].\n{{Template:ThinkPig}}\n==See also==\n* '''[[Meat cooking time calculator Metric|A comprehensive guide to roast meat cooking times]]''' - give the time you want to carve your roast and we'll give you a timed step by step roasting guide\n* [[Slow roast recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Pork belly]]\n[[Category:British recipes|Pork belly]]\n[[Category:Main courses|Pork belly]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes|Pork belly]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes|Pork belly]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes|Pork belly]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#pork #onions #goosefat #goosefatroastedbellypork #garlic #peppercorns #basting #liquor #roasting #thyme #whitewinegravy </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

''see variations''\n| 1 heaped tablespoon of [[Taste Sensation Chilli and Lime Seasoning]]\n| 300 ml water\n| 2 tablespoons of [[Lime juice|lime juice]]\n| 3 whole [[Star anise|star anise]] 'flowers' - not just 3 petals!\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Add all the ingredients to your [[Slow Cooker|slow cooker]]\n| Set to low and slow cook for 8 hours\n| Add extra water if it starts to dry out\n| Be careful not to break up the [[Star anise|star anise]] while stirring!\n| Remove the [[Star anise|star anise]] before serving\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nWe're having this with [[Couscous|couscous]]\n===Variations===\nI used a small pot of my home made [[Pizza topping|pizza topping]] instead of the [[Tomato puree|tomato puree]].  Similar to the [[Puree|puree]], just slightly spicier.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Chilean recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Chilli pepper recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Slow cooker recipes]]\n[[Category:Slow cooked]]\n[[Category:Taste Sensation recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#staranise #tomatopuree #pizzatopping #darkchocolate #puree #slowcooker #greenandblackschocolatechilliporkribs #limejuice #tastesensationseasonings #couscous #porkspareribs </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Green smoothie (TM)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Green smoothie - A Thermomix recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#sweetfreedom #cabbage #watercress #fridge #dried #egg #lettuce #glass #palmsugar #swisschard #juice \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This healthy recipe is delicious although it may sound strange\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 593\n|PortionCalories = 296\n|DatePublished=30th August 2012\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = Serves 2\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 10 minutes\n |PrepTime = 10 minutes\n |CookTime = None\n |Image = [[Image:Green smoothie (TM) recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Hmmm!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.7</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Oddly nice!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis healthy recipe is delicious although it may sound strange.\n\n{{RecipeIngredientsTM\n| 1 large [[Apple|apple]], quartered, stem discarded\n| 2 ripe [[Bananas|bananas]], peeled\n| 35g fresh [[Watercress|watercress]] (see variations below)\n| 1 fresh [[Lime|lime]] - [[Juice|juice]] of the whole lime plus &frac14; of the squeezed lime including skin and pith\n| 150g [[Kefir|kefir]] or natural live organic [[Yoghurt|yogurt]] (kefir has more probiotics)\n| 30g [[Hemp seeds|hemp seeds]] or [[Linseeds|linseeds]] or [[Chia|chia]] [[Seeds|seeds]] or 1 raw organic free-range [[Egg|egg]] or 30 to 50 g [[Nuts|nuts]] of choice\n| 25g agave syrup or [[Sweet Freedom]] or 15 g [[Honey|honey]] or 15 g [[Palm sugar|palm sugar]] (optional)\n| &frac12; sheet [[Dried|dried]] [[Nori|nori]] or 1 tablespoon dried [[Seaweed|seaweed]] pieces - an excellent source of minerals (optional)\n| 150g ice cubes\n| &#8539; teaspoon [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] or pink Himalayan [[Salt|salt]] - an excellent source of minerals \n| 500g water, divided 300 g and 200 g\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Add or weigh in all ingredients except the last 200 g water. \n| [[Blend]] 2&frac12; minutes/Speed 10.\n| Add remaining 200 g water and mix 10 seconds/Speed 4. Add more water if you prefer.\n}}\n===Recipe source===\n* ''My [[Thermomix]]'' newsletter for January 2012\n===Variations===\nSubstitute any of the following for the [[Watercress|watercress]]:  \n*[[Rocket|rocket]]\n*[[Flat-leaf parsley|flat-leaf parsley]]  \n*[[Spinach|spinach]]  \n*[[Swiss chard|swiss chard]]\n*[[Lettuce|lettuce]]  \n*[[Kale|kale]]  \n*green outer [[Cabbage|cabbage]] leaves\n*wild [[Greens|greens]], e.g. [[Dandelion leaves|dandelion leaves]] or fresh [[Nettle|nettle]] tops \n*a mixture of any of the above \nI find that it is particularly good with a stick of [[celery]] and a couple of [[cabbage]] leaves.\n===Chef's notes===\n[[Drink]] immediately for best nutritional benefits, or keep in the [[Fridge|fridge]] for up to 24 hours in a clean [[Glass|glass]] bottle/jar with a lid or stopper.  If using [[Sweet Freedom]], I find that 15g is enough.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Drink and beverage recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Thermomix recipes]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n[[Category:Uncooked]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#sweetfreedom #cabbage #watercress #fridge #dried #egg #lettuce #glass #palmsugar #swisschard #juice </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Green tea salmon and coconut rice",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Green tea salmon and coconut rice recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#salmon #darksoysauce #marinade #salmonfillets #coconutrice #greentea #preservedlemon #ground #greenteasalmonandcoconutrice #oliveoil #mezzaluna \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This is my take on Jamie Oliver's green tea salmon with coconut rice (from his Jamie's 15 minute meals series).  I'm to accompany this with broccoli\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 3536\n|PortionCalories = 1768\n|DatePublished=30th October 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  1 hour, 25 minutes\n|PrepTime =  1 hour, 10 minutes\n|CookTime =  15 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Green tea salmon and coconut rice recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">A lot of faff..</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">..but a lot of taste, so it was worth it!</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis is my take on Jamie Oliver's [[Green tea]] [[Salmon|salmon]] with [[Coconut rice|coconut rice]] (from his Jamie's 15 minute meals series).  Jamie accompanied his with [[Miso|miso]] [[Greens|greens]], but I'm just going for nice plain [[Broccoli|broccoli]].  I've spiced up the rub for the salmon a little and as I'm not constrained for time I'll [[Marinade|marinade]] mine in [[Dark soy sauce|dark soy sauce]] beforehand.\n\nUsing tea leaves as a herb sound to odd the first time you hear it, but in most cases, herbs are just leaves.  These are sun-dried herby (tea) leaves.be an odd\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 2 small [[Salmon fillets|salmon fillets]] with the skin on\n| 3 tablespoons [[Dark soy sauce|dark soy sauce]]\n| 1 heaped teaspoon of [[Green tea|green tea]] - I used monkey picked oolong\n| 2 teaspoons of [[Coriander seeds|coriander seeds]], freshly [[Ground|ground]]\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Olive oil]] \n}}\n'''[[Coconut rice|coconut rice]]'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 150g [[Basmati rice|basmati rice]]\n| 400g tin of [[Coconut milk|coconut milk]]\n| 1 [[Preserved lemon|preserved lemon]] cut in half\n}}\n'''garnish'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 1 chopped [[Chilli|chilli]]\n| [[Lime]] quarters\n| Finely chopped [[parsley]] or [[coriander]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Descale the [[Salmon fillets|salmon fillets]] by running a knife at 90 \u00b0 against the '[[Grain|grain]]' of the scales or by using a [[Fish|fish]] descaler\n* Rinse the [[Salmon|salmon]] in cold water to wash off the scales and pat dry\n* [[Marinade]] in [[Dark soy sauce|dark soy sauce]] for 1 hour in a cool place\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Green tea salmon skin removed.jpg|Skin removed ready to fry for a minute to crisp up\nImage:Green tea salmon frying.jpg|Saute the fillets, skin side down\nImage:Green tea salmon ingredients.jpg|The dry rub ingredients\nImage:Descaling a salmon fillet with a knife.jpg|Descaling the salmon fillet with a knife\nImage:Using a Mezzaluna to chop the salmon skin.jpg|Using a [[Mezzaluna]] to chop the salmon skin\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n}}\n'''[[Coconut rice|coconut rice]]'''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| ''aim for twice the amount of liquid to [[Rice|rice]] (by volume)''\n| Mix the [[Coconut milk|coconut milk]] with 200 ml of water and stir well.\n| Measure 300 ml from this mixture - [[Freeze|freeze]] the remains for next time as you will be making this again!\n| Rinse the [[Basmati rice|basmati rice]] for a few minutes under cold running water\n| Add 300 ml of the coconut mixture, the [[Rice|rice]] and the [[Preserved lemon|preserved lemon]] to the pan, bring to the [[Boil|boil]], reduce to a [[Simmer|simmer]], cover and cook for 10 minutes without stirring\n| After 10 minutes, remove from the heat and discard the [[Preserved lemon|preserved lemon]]\n}}\n'''[[Green tea|green tea]] [[Salmon|salmon]]'''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Heat a [[Frying pan|frying pan]] with 1 teaspoon of [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| My green [[Tea leaves|tea leaves]] were monkey picked oolong which are quite large so I added them to the whole [[Coriander seeds|coriander seeds]], [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]] and [[Ground|ground]] them to a powder in my [[Coffee grinder|coffee grinder]]\n| Sprinkle the [[Ground|ground]] powder onto a plate\n| Remove the [[Salmon|salmon]] from the [[Soy|soy]] [[Marinade|marinade]] and discard the marinade\n| Dredge the [[Salmon|salmon]] through the rub and ensure it is evenly coated, skin included\n| Lay the [[Salmon fillets|salmon fillets]], skin side down and [[Saute|saute]] for 5 minutes, jiggle the [[Salmon|salmon]] after a few minutes to ensure it does not stick, but don't be tempted to turn it over yet\n| After 5 minutes, [[Saute|saute]] the [[Salmon|salmon]] on the other three sides for about a minute each side\n| Carefully remove the [[Salmon fillets|salmon fillets]] from the pan and place skin side up on a chopping board\n| Using a sharp knife, peel the skin from the fillets\n| Place the skin back into the pan, soft side down for 1 minute so it can crisp up. Press it into the pas so it makes good contact with the heat.\n| Pat the skin with a paper towel to remove any excess oil\n| Cut the skin into 2.5 cm slices to arrange over the dish like crisps when served.  A [[Mezzaluna]] is a great tool to use for this.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Broccoli|broccoli]]\n===Recipe source===\n* My variation on [http://hotcooking.co.uk/recipes/70/jamie-oliver-15-minute-meals-green-tea-salmon Jamie Oliver's Green tea salmon]\n===Variations===\nMy favourite [[marinade]] for this dish is now 3 tablespoons of [[dark soy sauce]], 1 tablespoon of [[Chinkiang rice vinegar]] (''Black rice vinegar'') and a small splash of [[olive oil]].\nYou can use a fresh [[Lemon|lemon]] for the rice if you don't have [[Preserved lemons|preserved lemons]]\n===Chef's notes===\nThis was so good that we had this three times in one week!\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Oriental cuisine]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Freshwater fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Sea fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#salmon #darksoysauce #marinade #salmonfillets #coconutrice #greentea #preservedlemon #ground #greenteasalmonandcoconutrice #oliveoil #mezzaluna </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Griddle pan waffles",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Griddle pan waffles, Egg recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#butter #griddlepanwaffles #buttermilk #banana #freerangeeggs #hand #fetacheese #avocado #wafflemaker #chocolatesauce #pancake \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Sam Hardacre one of The Marketing Lab's array of Geek Brains, brought this rather clever idea to my attention\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1894\n|PortionCalories = 473\n|DatePublished=3rd January 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Sam has cleverly used a small pan to neatly constrain the waffle\n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  35 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  20 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Griddle pan waffles recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Thanks Sam!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Hi Sam (& Louisa).  You are now, but a very distant memory, but your griddle-pan waffles will live on in perpetuity. --JP</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry]] </span></span>\n}}\n[https://www.facebook.com/samhardacre Sam Hardacre] one of [http://themarketinglab.co.uk/ The Marketing Lab's] array of Geek Brains, brought this rather clever idea to my attention and also provided the picture, thanks Sam.\n\nIt does not require a [[Waffle maker]] and can made with a normal stove-top griddle pan.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 2 [[Free range eggs|free range eggs]]\n| 300 ml [[Buttermilk|buttermilk]] or [[Semi-skimmed milk|semi-skimmed milk]]\n| See this [[buttermilk]] link for how to make your own buttermilk from regular [[milk]]\n| 225 g (8 oz) [[Self-raising flour|self-raising flour]]\n| &#188; teaspoons [[Table salt|table salt]]\n| 100g [[Butter|butter]] , softened in the [[Microwave|microwave]] for a few seconds\n| 1tsp extra [[Butter|butter]] for cooking\n| Optional for sweet waffles: \n| &#189; tsp. [[Vanilla extract|vanilla extract]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Sugar|sugar]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Pre heat the [[Oven|oven]] to 160\u00b0 C (325\u00b0 F - gas 3) if you are making lots so they can be kept warm\n* Get the [[Griddle pan|griddle pan]] nice and hot before [[Hand|hand]] as some cast [[Iron|iron]] pans can take a while to get hot.\n\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Whisk the [[Milk|milk]] and [[Eggs|eggs]] in a large bowl\n| Using a fine [[Sieve|sieve]], sift the [[Flour|flour]], [[Salt|salt]] and [[Baking powder|baking powder]] into the [[Egg|egg]]-mix.\n| Fold the softened [[Butter|butter]] into the mixture. Mix this just enough to combine the ingredients.  Jamie Oliver advises not to over-mix at this stage or the waffles will not puff up.\n| Add the extra teaspoons of [[Butter|butter]] to the pan and [[Brush|brush]] or swill to coat evenly.\n| Immediately pour the mixture into the pan over a medium heat  and carefully tip it to spread and cover the whole of the pan as you would with a [[Pancake|pancake]]\n| Cook for 8 to 10 minutes on this side, or until golden, then  then flip the waffle and cook for another 8 to 10 minutes on this side\n| If you are making lots then keep them warm in the [[Oven|oven]], but don't stack them of they will [[Sweat|sweat]]\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nCrispy [[Bacon|bacon]], sliced [[Avocado|avocado]] and [[Cheddar cheese|cheddar cheese]]\n\n[[Red onion]], [[Black olives|black olives]], and [[Feta cheese]]\n\n[[Butter]], [[Banana|banana]], [[Brown sugar|brown sugar]], and [[Cinnamon|cinnamon]]\n\n[[Maple syrup]]\n\n[[Honey]]\n\n[[Chocolate sauce]] and squirty [[Cream|cream]]\n===Recipe source===\n\n* http://www.jamieoliver.com/recipes/eggs-recipes/griddle-pan-waffles\n==See also==\n{{SeeAlso-Waffles}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Australian recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:French recipes]]\n[[Category:North American recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Egg recipes]]\n[[Category:Grilled, griddled or barbecued]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#butter #griddlepanwaffles #buttermilk #banana #freerangeeggs #hand #fetacheese #avocado #wafflemaker #chocolatesauce #pancake </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}
