title": "Grilled corn on the cob",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Grilled corn on the cob recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#sweetcorn #microwaved #microwave #griddlepan #butter #corn #toasting #miseenplace #grilledcornonthecob \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A lovely way to cook whole corn on the cob (sweetcorn). Toasting the sweetcorn adds a lovely flavour  which I've done by using a blowtorch\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 113\n|PortionCalories = 113\n|DatePublished=5th December 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 1\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  9 minutes\n|PrepTime =  5 minutes\n|CookTime =  4 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Blow-torch toasting sweetcorn.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Simple things are best!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.8</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">This is so easy and turns a simple vegetable into a special treat.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Stripping corn from the cob.jpg|300px|thumb|right|Stripping sweetcorn from the cob with a knife]]\nA lovely way to cook whole [[Corn on the cob|corn on the cob]] ([[Sweetcorn|sweetcorn]]).\n\n[[Toasting]] the [[Sweet corn|sweet corn]] adds a lovely flavour  which I've done by using a blowtorch.  This can be achieved using a very hot [[Frying pan|frying pan]] too.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 fresh [[Corn on the cob|corn on the cob]]\n| A knob of [[butter]]\n| A pinch of [[sea salt]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* If using a [[Frying pan|frying pan]] or [[Griddle pan|griddle pan]], pre heat this while the [[Sweet corn|sweet corn]] is being prepared.\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| If the [[Sweetcorn|sweetcorn]] cob has a leaves and silk ( is the name for the pistillate flowers), remove them first.\n| Soak for 4 minutes in cold water.\n| [[Microwave]] for 2 minutes\n| If using a hot pan to finish them, pat them dry, once the pan is very hot, add them to the pan, without any [[Oil|oil]] and toast them for 4 minutes turning regularly with tongs.\n| If using a blowtorch, place the [[Corn|corn]] cob in a dry [[frying pan]] and toast the kernels while turning the cob with tongs.  This only takes 20 seconds and is very easy to overdo it with a good blowtorch.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Butter|butter]] and a pinch of salt.\n===Chef's notes===\nTo strip the kernels from the cob, hold with a [[Tea-towel|tea-towel]] if it's very hot and cut downwards with a knife.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Cookery cheats]]\n[[Category:Grilled, griddled or barbecued]]\n[[Category:Microwaved]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#sweetcorn #microwaved #microwave #griddlepan #butter #corn #toasting #miseenplace #grilledcornonthecob </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Grilled figs with Capricorn cheese, honey and walnuts recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#grill #honey #figs #walnuts #grilledfigswithcapricorncheesehoneyandwalnuts #bakingtray #fig #almond #diced #miseenplace #unusualrecipes \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This unusual dessert recipe is reproduced by the kind permission of The Lubborn Creamery\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1334\n|PortionCalories = 333\n|DatePublished=20th January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 15 minutes\n |PrepTime = 10 minutes\n |CookTime = 5 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Grilled figs with Carpricorn, honey and walnuts recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Figs and cheese</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Nice mixture</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis unusual [[Dessert|dessert]] recipe is reproduced by the kind permission of [[The Lubborn Creamery]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 40g (1 &frac12;oz) [[Walnut|walnut]] halves\n| 8 fresh [[Figs|figs]]\n| 1 x 100g [[Capricorn Somerset Goats' cheese]], [[Diced|diced]]\n| 18 teaspoon Greek [[Honey|honey]] to drizzle\n| crisp [[Almond|almond]] biscuits to serve\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the [[Grill|grill]] to a moderate setting\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Spread the [[Walnuts|walnuts]] out on a [[Baking tray|baking tray]] and toast under the [[Grill|grill]] for 1-2 mins, watching closely so that they don't burn. Remove and break up into smaller pieces.\n| Cut a cross in each [[Fig|fig]], keeping them attached at the base, then squeeze so that each one opens up like a flower.\n| Divide the [[Capricorn Somerset Goats' cheese]] between the [[Figs|figs]] and place on the [[Baking tray|baking tray]]. Place under the [[Grill|grill]] and cook for 2-3 mins or until the [[Cheese|cheese]] is bubbling and golden.\n| Transfer to serving plates, scatter with [[Walnuts|walnuts]] and drizzle each [[Fig|fig]] with a teaspoon of Greek [[Honey|honey]].\n| Serve immediately, accompanied by crisp [[Almond|almond]] biscuits\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Lubborn Creamery recipes]]\n[[Category:Grilled, griddled or barbecued]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#grill #honey #figs #walnuts #grilledfigswithcapricorncheesehoneyandwalnuts #bakingtray #fig #almond #diced #miseenplace #unusualrecipes </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Grilled mackerel, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#grilledmackerel #mackerel #horseradishcream #oliveoil #grapefruitsalsa #zest #lime #griddled #barbecued #citrus #grilled \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=As mackerel is quite an oily fish, it's nice to have clean citrus flavours to cut the oil\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 493\n|PortionCalories = 123\n|DatePublished=12th April 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime = 20 minutes\n|PrepTime = 5 minutes\n|CookTime = 15 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Grilled mackerel recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Nice on a pizza</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Had mackerel pizza yesterday - yummy</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> - [[User:PSmith]] </span></span>\n}}\n\nAs mackerel is quite an [[oil]]y [[fish]], it's nice to have clean [[citrus]] flavours to cut the oil.  This would be nice with a dollop of [[horseradish cream]] and a [[grapefruit salsa]].\n\nYour fishmonger will fillet mackerel if you ask.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 2 fresh [[mackerel]] fillets\n| [[Olive oil]]\n| [[Zest]] and juice of a [[lime]]\n| [[Freshly ground black pepper]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| With a sharp knife, slash the skin at regular intervals, not cutting all the way through\n| Season each side with [[salt]], [[pepper]] and [[lime]] [[zest]] and juice and then drizzle with a little [[olive oil]]\n| Grill for 5 minutes per side then set aside to rest for 5 minutes\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\n\nServe hot or cold with a dollop of [[horseradish cream]] and [[grapefruit salsa]]\n\n===Chef's notes===\nDon't be tempted to add [[salt]] as processed [[mackerel]] can be quite salty already.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Mackerel]]\n[[Category:Fish recipes|Mackerel]]\n[[Category:Sea fish recipes|Mackerel]]\n[[Category:Main courses|Mackerel]]\n[[Category:Starters|Mackerel]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Student recipes]]\n[[Category:Grilled, griddled or barbecued]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#grilledmackerel #mackerel #horseradishcream #oliveoil #grapefruitsalsa #zest #lime #griddled #barbecued #citrus #grilled </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

oil]]. \n| [[Grill]] over high heat on a bar grill or a [[griddle pan]] brushed with a little olive oil. \n| When well marked set aside and keep warm. \n| To make the dressing place all the ingredients in a [[Blender|blender]] and blitz until smooth. \n| Strain through a [[Sieve|sieve]] and drizzle over the [[Lettuce|lettuce]]. title": "Grilled sausage and halloumi salad with avocados",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Grilled sausage and halloumi salad with avocado recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#grill #cheese #rocket #halloumicheese #avocado #barbecue #antipasti #sausages #salad #redwinevinegar #honey \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Halloumi cheese is brilliant fun have a go with this gluten free recipe. It grills without melting and it squeaks when you eat it!\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1124\n|PortionCalories = 187\n|DatePublished=24th October 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 6\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  40 minutes\n|PrepTime =  20 minutes\n|CookTime =  20 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Grilled sausage and halloumi salad with avocados recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Halluminicious!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Fab. salad. Period!</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Harrogate-pork-sausages.png|300px|thumb|right|[[Debbie and Andrew's Harrogate 97% Gluten Free Pork Sausages]]]]\n[[Halloumi cheese]] is brilliant fun - if you've never tried it before, have a go with  this recipe.  It is a [[Cheese|cheese]] that you can [[Grill|grill]] without it melting - it also squeaks when you eat it.  In this recipe it is paired with debbie&andrew's [[Harrogate 97% Pork Sausages|harrogate 97% pork sausages]], [[Avocados|avocados]] and a [[Rocket|rocket]] [[Salad|salad]].  As well as being great fun, this recipe is also [[Gluten free|gluten free]]!\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 pack [[Debbie and Andrew's Harrogate 97% Gluten Free Pork Sausages]]\n| 225g block [[Halloumi cheese|halloumi cheese]]\n| 100g bag [[Rocket|rocket]]\n| 200g jar mixed [[Antipasti|antipasti]] in [[Olive oil|olive oil]], drained\n| 1 ripe [[Avocado|avocado]], peeled, stone removed, and sliced\n| 1 tablespoon [[Red wine vinegar|red wine vinegar]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Honey|honey]]\n| [[Salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Grill|grill]] to its hottest setting.\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Place the [[Sausages|sausages]] on the [[Grill|grill]] and cook evenly, turning often, for around 15 to 20 minutes.\n| Slice the [[Halloumi|halloumi]] into 0.5cm slices and add to the [[Barbecue|barbecue]] after around 10 minutes. The [[Cheese|cheese]] will need 5 minutes or so to [[Grill|grill]].\n| In a large serving bowl toss the [[Rocket|rocket]] with the drained [[Antipasti|antipasti]], then add the [[Avocado|avocado]] and [[Red wine vinegar|red wine vinegar]] and drizzle with a little [[Honey|honey]]. Toss well and check for [[Oil|oil]] and [[Vinegar|vinegar]] - add more of one or other to taste. Season with [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]].\n| Now slice the cooked [[Sausages|sausages]] and [[Cheese|cheese]] into slivers on the angle and add to the top of the [[Salad|salad]] before serving.\n}}\n===Variations===\nThis recipe is also ideal for the [[Barbecue|barbecue]].\n{{SeeAlso-HalloumiRecipes}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Greek recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Gluten free recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Salad recipes]]\n[[Category:Barbecue recipes]]\n[[Category:Debbie&andrew's sausage recipes]]\n[[Category:Grilled, griddled or barbecued]]\n{{Template:DebbieAndAndrew attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#grill #cheese #rocket #halloumicheese #avocado #barbecue #antipasti #sausages #salad #redwinevinegar #honey </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Guinness lamb shanks with dark sticky gravy",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Guinness lamb shanks with dark sticky gravy a British recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#lambshanks #guinness #oliveoil #guinnesslambshankswithdarkstickygravy #springonions #rosemary #mintleaves #worcestershiresauce #mintoil #onions #squashmash \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Another cooker-top slow cooked lamb recipe. This one from Jamie Oliver's new book: \"Jamie's Great Britain\" uses lamb shanks\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2320\n|PortionCalories = 580\n|DatePublished=6th May 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 3\n |TotalTime = 3 hours 30 minutes\n |PrepTime = 15 minutes\n |CookTime = 3 hours 15 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Guinness lamb shanks with dark sticky gravy recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Tricky, but tasty</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.8</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">A bit of a faff to make, but nothing good is easy, they say!</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nAnother cooker-top slow cooked [[Lamb|lamb]] recipe. This one from Jamie Oliver's new book: \"Jamie's Great Britain\" uses [[Lamb shanks|lamb shanks]]. After 3 hours cooking they just disintegrate and soak up the sticky sweet gravy - wonderful!\n\nI've adapted the recipe for 4 people and like to serve it with [[Squash mash|squash mash]], [[Spring onions|spring onions]] and [[Jamie's mint oil]].\n\nJamie comes up trumps again with this book, a big [[Coffee|coffee]] table hardback, full of neat twists on standard recipes.  It's a bit pricey at \u00a330, but you can probably find a copy for less than a tenner if you shop around: \n*\"Jamie's Great Britain\" - Jamie Oliver: ISBN 978-0718156817\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| [[Olive oil]] for saut\u00e9ing \n| [[Sea Salt|Sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 3 [[Red onions|red onions]], peeled and chopped\n| 70g of dried mixed fruit ([[Raisins|raisins]], [[Sultanas|sultanas]] & [[Dried apricots|dried apricots]])\n| 2 heaped tablespoons of chunky [[Marmalade|marmalade]]\n| 1 tablespoon of Heinz [[Tomato sauce|tomato sauce]]\n| 1.5 tablespoons [[Worcestershire sauce]]\n| 200 ml [[Guinness]], [[Porter|porter]] or [[Brown ale|brown ale]]\n| 4 [[Lamb shanks|lamb shanks]]\n| 4 sprigs of fresh [[Rosemary|rosemary]] (see ingredients photo)\n| 500 ml [[Chicken stock|chicken stock]]\n}}\n''' to garnish'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| A Large [[Sprig of mint|sprig of mint]] leaves\n| 5 tablespoons of [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 3 large [[Spring onions|spring onions]]\n| 5 tablespoons [[Cider vinegar]]\n| A handful of [[Mint leaves|mint leaves]], picked from the stems\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Guinness lamb shanks with dark sticky gravy ingredients.jpg|[[Guinness]] [[Lamb shanks|lamb shanks]] with dark sticky [[Gravy|gravy]]; the basic ingredients\nImage:Jamie Oliver's spring onion and cider vinegar dressing.jpg|[[Jamie Oliver's spring onion and cider vinegar dressing]]\nImage:Jamie Oliver's mint oil dressing.jpg|[[Jamie Oliver's mint oil dressing]]\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n'''[[Mint oil]]'''\n''Make this now so it has time to infuse''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Add the chopped picked [[Mint leaves|mint leaves]] to a [[Mortar and pestle|mortar and pestle]] with a good pinch of [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and crush well\n| Mix with 5 tablespoons of [[Olive oil|olive oil]], set to one side\n}}\n'''[[Guinness]] [[Lamb shanks|lamb shanks]] in sweet gravy'''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| A a slug of [[Olive oil|olive oil]] to a large metal pan, add a good grind of [[Black pepper|black pepper]], heat the [[Oil|oil]] and add the [[Onions|onions]] and a pinch of [[Salt|salt]].\n| Saut\u00e9 for 5 or 6 minutes until they have take some colour.\n| Lower the heat a little and stir in the stock, [[Guinness]], [[Dried fruit|dried fruit]], [[Marmalade|marmalade]], tomato sauce and [[Worcestershire sauce]] - leave a little Guinness to de-glaze the [[Frying pan|frying pan]] later. \n| Mix well and keep it [[Simmering|simmering]] while you [[Brown|brown]] off the [[Lamb shanks|lamb shanks]]\n| [[Brown]] the [[Lamb shanks|lamb shanks]], two at a time in a large [[Frying pan|frying pan]]. Use a little little [[Olive oil|olive oil]] to start them off.\n| Keep turning them until they have take some colour and add the [[Browned|browned]] shanks to the [[Onions|onions]] when they are done.\n| Add a little more [[Oil|oil]] and saut\u00e9 the [[Rosemary|rosemary]] sprigs, being careful not to burn them.\n| Add the whole [[Rosemary|rosemary]] sprigs to the [[Casserole dish|casserole dish]], de-glaze the pan with the last drop of [[Guinness]] and pour it all into the [[Casserole|casserole]].\n| Place a lid on the [[Casserole dish|casserole dish]] and simmer quite vigorously for about 3 hours. Turn the shanks about halfway through, being careful not to let them break up.\n| Carefully remove the cooked shanks and keep warm.\n| Remove the [[rosemary sprigs]] and discard.\n| Whizz the gravy mixture into a smooth sauce using a [[food processor]] or a [[stick blender]].\n| Return to the heat and reduce the gravy by about half.  This might take up to 15 minutes but it's better to reduce and concentrate the flavour rather than by adding a [[thickening agent]].\n}}\n'''Mashed potatoes'''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Allow up to 40 minutes to cook your [[Mashed potatoes]]\n}}\n'''Spring onion dressing'''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Finely chop 3 [[Spring onions|spring onions]], mix with a pinch of [[Salt|salt]] and up to 5 tablespoons [[Cider vinegar|cider vinegar]]\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe on a bed of [[Squash mash|squash mash]], sprinkled with the [[Spring onion|spring onion]] dressing and [[mint oil]], dressed with a sprinkling of [[Mint leaves|mint leaves]].\n===Variations===\nYou can find a variety of [[mashed potato recipes|mashed potato recipes here]], or try [[celeriac mash]] for a change.\n===Chef's notes===\nThe original recipe used 1 litre of stock and 200 ml Guinness (for 6), even so I would think that was too much.  I used a total of 850 ml and that was really more than was needed - it took a vigorous 15 minute reduction to get it any where close to sticky.  \n\nMaking it again, as long as the casserole was not too large, I would sit the shanks thick-side down, add the [[ale]] and then top-up with enough stock to the cover the start of the bone.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Lamb recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Stewed, braised or pot roasted]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#lambshanks #guinness #oliveoil #guinnesslambshankswithdarkstickygravy #springonions #rosemary #mintleaves #worcestershiresauce #mintoil #onions #squashmash </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

It's different.</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.3</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Not bad at all. [[Vegetarian|vegetarian]] option.\n\nWe always have [[Halloumi|halloumi]] in the [[Fridge|fridge]] and easy access to fresh [[Vegetables|vegetables]]  from the numerous local markets so this was easy to make, especially as we always have [[Curry sauce|curry sauce]] in the [[Freezer|freezer]].\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 portion of home made [[Curry sauce|curry sauce]]\n| 250 g packet of [[Halloumi cheese|halloumi cheese]], cut into 10 cm cubes\n| Half a [[Cauliflower|cauliflower]], cut into florets\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| [[Boil]] the [[Cauliflower|cauliflower]] in unsalted water for 5 minutes and drain\n| Heat the [[Curry sauce|curry sauce]] in a pan and [[Simmer|simmer]] gently for 5 minutes\n| add the drained [[Cauliflower|cauliflower]] and the cubed [[Halloumi|halloumi]] to the [[Curry sauce|curry sauce]] and [[Simmer|simmer]] for a further 5 minutes\n| Serve immediately\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Boiled|boiled]] [[Broccoli|broccoli]], [[Wild rice|wild rice]] and [[Pitta breads|pitta breads]]\n===Chef's notes===\nThis recipe does require making the [[Curry sauce|curry sauce]] first, although you could always title": "Halloumi and pepperoni vegetable bake",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Halloumi and pepperoni vegetable bake\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#halloumiandpepperonivegetablebake #spices #bake #pepperoni #sageleaves #butternutsquash #fried #currypowder #vegetariandish #halloumicheese #miseenplace \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Oven roast/baked vegetables with herbs, cheese and salami\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=10th April 2019\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Lovely with roast potatoes\n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  50 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  35 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 1671\n|PortionCalories = 835 \n|Image = [[Image:Halloumi and pepperoni vegetable bake.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">What a vegetable bake!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Lovely \ud83d\ude0b\ud83d\ude0b\ud83d\ude0b</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nOf course you can omit the [[Salami|salami]] and make this a totally [[Vegetarian dish|vegetarian dish]], but fo rme, the crispy, meaty bite of [[Pepperoni|pepperoni]] makes this [[Vegetable|vegetable]] [[Bake|bake]] so yummy.\n\nUse whatever [[Vegetables|vegetables]] you have, either fresh or left-over. Pick what you fancy, not what I list here.  As long as you bear in mind that the thickness of the vegetables determine how they cook, you can use whatever veg. you please.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 250g [[Halloumi cheese]] cut into 3 cm cubes\n| 40g [[Pepperoni|pepperoni]] slices or medallions\n| 60 ml [[Olive oil|olive oil]] (the remnants from a bottle of [[Sun-dried tomatoes|sun-dried tomatoes]] makes a fabulous substitute for [[Olive|olive]] [[Oil|oil]])\n| 2 [[Red onions|red onions]], peeled, quartered or sliced\n| 6 [[Cloves of garlic|cloves of garlic]], peeled and smashed or sliced, or chopped\n| 1 [[Courgette|courgette]], sliced\n| 1 medium [[Carrot|carrot]], peeled and cut into fingers\n| Half of a [[Butternut squash|butternut squash]], peeled, deseeded and sliced\n| 8 whole [[Cherry tomatoes|cherry tomatoes]]\n| Half of a [[Sweet Pepper|sweet pepper]] of your choice - think colours here!\n| 3 pinches of [[Curry powder|curry powder]]\n| Half a teaspoon of whole [[Coriander seeds|coriander seeds]]\n| Half a teaspoon of whole [[Fenugreek seeds|fenugreek seeds]]\n| Half a teaspoon of [[Chilli flakes|chilli flakes]]\n| Pinch of [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| Pinch of [[Sea Salt|sea salt]]\n| Four [[Bay leaves|bay leaves]]\n| Bunch of [[Sage leaves|sage leaves]]\n| Bunch of [[Fresh thyme|fresh thyme]]\n| [[Sprig of rosemary]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 220\u00b0 C (425\u00b0 F - gas 7), [fan oven 200\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Halloumi and pepperoni vegetable bake ready to go.jpg|thumb|300px|right|ready to bake\nImage:Halloumi and pepperoni vegetable bake ingredients.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Most of the basic ingredients\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Add the dry [[Spices|spices]] to a large [[Baking tray|baking tray]] and jiggle well to distribute evenly\n| Add the remaining ingredients and mix very well so tat everything is evenly mixed\n| [[Bake]] for 35 minutes at the top of the [[Oven|oven]], stirring and mixing well every 10 minutes or so\n| Depending upon the types of vegetables you use, they may leech out large amounts of water which tends to steam the vegetables rather than roast them. If this happens, just drain and discard any excess every time you turn them \n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with air-[[Fried|fried]] [[Roast potatoes|roast potatoes]]\n===Chef's notes===\nIf you don't have the whole [[Spices|spices]] or the [[Fresh herbs|fresh herbs]], don;t worry, use what you have have available.  [[Dried]] [[Herbs|herbs]] work well in this recipe too.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Chilli pepper recipes]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Squash recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#halloumiandpepperonivegetablebake #spices #bake #pepperoni #sageleaves #butternutsquash #fried #currypowder #vegetariandish #halloumicheese #miseenplace </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }

title": "Ham, tomato and pasta scramble",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Ham, tomato and pasta scramble an Italian recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#tomatoes #hamtomatoandpastascramble #pasta #grated #cheat #herbs #garlic #ham #fry #spaghetti #onions \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A quick and easy recipe that is idea for students or anyone who is short on time and cooking equipment\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1613\n|PortionCalories = 403\n|DatePublished=6th May 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  20 minutes\n|PrepTime =  5 minutes\n|CookTime =  15 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Ham, tomato and pasta scramble recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Lovely</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">..and I'm retired, not a student!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:NonLoggedInUser|NonLoggedInUser]] </span></span>\n}}\nA quick and easy recipe that is idea for students or anyone who is short on time and cooking [[Equipment|equipment]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 2 [[Cloves of Garlic, peeled and crushed|cloves of garlic, peeled and crushed]]\n| 1 [[Onion|onion]], peeled and finely chopped\n| 2 tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 125 g pack of cooked sliced [[Ham|ham]], chopped finely\n| 1 tablespoon [[Tomato puree|tomato puree]]\n| &#188; teaspoon [[Caster Sugar|caster sugar]], or [[Cheat|cheat]]: crush normal [[Sugar|sugar]] between 2 tablespoons\n| &#189; teaspoon [[Dried oregano|dried oregano]]\n| 1 400g can of chopped [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]]\n| 225 g (8 oz) [[Spaghetti|spaghetti]]\n| [[Sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]] to taste\n| 1 ball of [[Mozzarella cheese|mozzarella cheese]], [[Grated|grated]] or finely sliced and chopped\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| [[Boil]] a [[Kettle|kettle]] full of water for your [[Pasta|pasta]]\n| Add the [[Olive oil|olive oil]] to a [[Frying pan|frying pan]] and give it a good twist of [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n| Gently [[Fry|fry]] the [[Onions|onions]] for 4 minutes, stirring now and then\n| Add the [[Garlic|garlic]] and [[Fry|fry]] for another few minutes, don't let it burn\n| Add the [[Ham|ham]] and '[[Stir-fry|stir-fry]]' it for a minute so it can absorb the flavour of the [[Garlic|garlic]] and [[Onions|onions]]\n| Meanwhile, cook the [[Spaghetti|spaghetti]] for 8 to 10 minutes in lightly [[Salted|salted]] [[Boiling|boiling]] water\n| Drain and return to the [[Pasta|pasta]] saucepan\n| Pour the [[Sauce|sauce]] over the cooked [[Pasta|pasta]] and mix really well\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with the [[Grated|grated]] [[Mozzarella|mozzarella]] sprinkled on top.\n\nA few fresh [[tomatoes]] dotted about look and taste nice and could be part of your [[5 a day]].\n===Variations===\nUse any [[Herbs|herbs]] of your choice, as a general rule you can usually use double the amount of [[Fresh herbs|fresh herbs]] compared to  [[Dried|dried]] [[Herbs|herbs]].\n\nSpoil yourself, add a little [[Grated|grated]] [[Parmesan cheese|parmesan cheese]] as well\n===Chef's notes===\n[[Cheat]] on the chopped [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]], use normal canned [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]]  and while they are still in the can, use a sharp knife to chop them up.\n\n{{Template:YoutubePastaDough}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Italian recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pasta recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Cookery cheats]]\n[[Category:Student recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#tomatoes #hamtomatoandpastascramble #pasta #grated #cheat #herbs #garlic #ham #fry #spaghetti #onions </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

they are also easy to clean.\n| '''Serve once the fries have cooked for 37 minutes'''\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Potato chipper.jpg|[https://www.amazon.co.uk/gp/product/B07ML62LVB/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_asin_title_o04_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1Sopito Stainless Steel Potato Cutter] \u00a359.99 - title": "Ham leek and cheese gratin",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Ham leek and cheese gratin recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#leeks #cheesesauce #microwave #ham #boil #cheddarcheese #hamleekandcheesegratin #butter #cheese #breadcrumbs #blackpepper \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This recipe is a simple way of combining leeks, cheese and ham into a gorgeous meal\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1634\n|PortionCalories = 817\n|DatePublished=30th September 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  15 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime = None\n|Image = [[Image:Ham leek and cheese gratin recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">A bit burnt, hey?</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">You need to watch this a bit closer!</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry, aka Chef]])</span></span>\n}}\nI always seem to let our [[Leeks|leeks]] run to [[Seed|seed]], by which time they are unusable.  This year I'm making an effort to use them profusely.  I've even deliberately run out of [[Onions|onions]] and just put a sign in the [[Onion|onion]] bowl: \"USE LEEKS!\"\n\nThis recipe is a simple way of combining [[Leeks|leeks]], [[Cheese|cheese]] and [[Ham|ham]] into a gorgeous meal.\n\nThis was very tasty but one problem was the whole leeks.  Although it looks nice, once soft they are very difficult to cut - in future I will slice them thinly and probably not par-boil first. 20 seconds in the [[microwave]] would be enough.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 4 medium to small [[Leeks|leeks]], liberally trimmed, peeled and cleaned\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| Pinch of fresh [[Thyme leaves|thyme leaves]]\n| 150g cooked [[Ham|ham]] - the thinner the better, thick ham does not roll well!\n| 100g [[Cheddar cheese]] for the [[Cheese sauce|cheese sauce]]\n| &#190; pint of [[Milk|milk]] [354 ml]\n| 2 tablespoons [[Butter|butter]]\n| 2 tablespoons [[Plain flour|plain flour]]\n| 4 tablespoons [[Panko|panko]] [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]]\n| 25g [[Cheddar cheese]] to top\n| 25g crumbled [[Blue cheese|blue cheese]] (optional)\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4), [fan oven 160\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Leeks and ham sauce added.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Adding the final topping\nImage:Leeks and ham ready for cheese sauce.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Leeks rolled in ham, ready for the sauce\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Ensure the [[Leeks|leeks]] are properly cleaned\n| I've used small gratin dishes so had to halve them but you can leave them whole\n| [[Boil]] the [[Leeks|leeks]] in lightly [[Salted|salted]] water for about 8 minutes or until softened - they can also be microwaved, see below.\n| Drain well.\n| Meanwhile, to make the [[Cheese sauce|cheese sauce]], melt the [[Butter|butter]] with a pinch of [[Black pepper|black pepper]] and stir in the [[Flour|flour]] once melted.\n| Whisk the [[Milk|milk]] in and bring to a [[Simmer|simmer]], don't [[Boil|boil]]. Once [[Simmering|simmering]], whisk well, add 100 g of the [[Cheddar]] and once melted, remove from the heat.\n| Roll the [[Leeks|leeks]] in the cooked [[Ham|ham]] and lay in a lightly oiled gratin dish or shallow [[Casserole|casserole]].\n| Pour the [[Cheese sauce|cheese sauce]] over the [[Leeks|leeks]].\n| If you have the time, chilling the mixture in the gratin dishes (as pictured), solidifies the cheese sauce making it easier to add the topping, which has a tendency to sink into the hot sauce.\n| Mix the [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]] and any [[Cheese|cheese]] you are using for the topping in a bowl and [[Crumble|crumble]] well, maybe add a pinch of [[Black pepper|black pepper]].\n| Pour this mixture over the top and [[Bake|bake]] uncovered at the top of the [[Oven|oven]] at 180\u00b0 C\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nA few [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]] is all this dish needs to finish it off.\n===Variations===\nYou could include a little [[Pasta|pasta]] to stretch this dish even further.\n===Chef's notes===\nThe [[Leeks|leeks]] can be softened in the [[Microwave|microwave]], the advantage of this over [[Boiling|boiling]] is that they keep their color.\n\nLay them on a plate and [[Microwave|microwave]] on full power for 2 minutes.full power.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Italian recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#leeks #cheesesauce #microwave #ham #boil #cheddarcheese #hamleekandcheesegratin #butter #cheese #breadcrumbs #blackpepper </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Hard boiled eggs with prawns, Egg recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#butter #eggs #parsley #boiledorsimmered #prawns #anchovyfillets \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A simple way to make hardboiled eggs a little more interesting\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1588\n|PortionCalories = 397\n|DatePublished=31st January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Free range eggs\n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime = 20 minutes\n|PrepTime = 10 minutes\n|CookTime = 10 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Eggs.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"><span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">A heavenly mixture</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.8</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Fishy eggs, or eggy fish?</span> \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\">[[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nA simple way to make hard boiled eggs a little more interesting.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 4 Free range [[eggs]]\n| 4 [[anchovy fillets]], chopped finely \n| 25g (1oz) softened [[butter]]\n| 8 Cooked peeled [[prawns]]\n| [[Parsley]] to garnish\n| Salt & [[pepper]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Hard-boil the [[eggs]] for 8 minutes in boiling water, refresh in cold water then peel and slice in half lengthways\n| Remove the yolks, place in a bowl and mash with a fork\n| Finely chop 2 of the walnuts\n| Add the chopped anchovies and [[butter]] to the egg yolks. Mix well\n| Season mixture with salt and [[pepper]]\n| Fill the egg white halves with the mixture, dress with a prawn on each\n| garnish with chopped [[parsley]] and serve\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Eggs]]\n[[Category:Egg recipes|Prawns]]\n[[Category:Fish recipes|Eggs]]\n[[Category:Shellfish recipes|Eggs]]\n[[Category:Starters|Eggs]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#butter #eggs #parsley #boiledorsimmered #prawns #anchovyfillets </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Harissa pork spare ribs",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Harissa pork spare ribs\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#ribs #harissaporkspareribs #scant #freeze #wine #spices #fat #tomatopuree #harissaseasoning #sweetcorn #roast \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Another excuse to play with Taste Sensations spice mixes. This time Taste Sensation Harissa Seasoning.\n|og:image=https://www.cookipedia.co.uk/wiki/images/thumb/7/72/Harissa_pork_spare_ribs_recipe.jpg/450px-Harissa_pork_spare_ribs_recipe.jpg\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=23rd December 2019\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime = 1 day, 6 hours\n|PrepTime = 1 day\n|CookTime =  6 hours\n|TotalCalories = 3125\n|PortionCalories = 1562\n|Image = [[Image:Harissa pork spare ribs recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Just right!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Lovely spicy flavour, complex, but not too hot.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nAnother excuse to play with [[Taste Sensation]]'s [[Spice|spice]] mixes.  This time [[Taste Sensation harissa seasoning]].\n\nI've used a [[Spicy pork spare ribs|similar recipe]] as the basis for this, but used only the [[harissa seasoning]], rather than a selection of [[Spices|spices]] as I wanted to really taste their seasoning in this.\n\nOur butcher has been very generous with the [[Ribs|ribs]] too. More of a loin cut than ribs.  We've used about 900g of the ribs for two greedy people as a main.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 900g [[Pork spare ribs|pork spare ribs]] - separated\n| 3 [[Fat|fat]] [[Cloves of garlic|cloves of garlic]] - or lots of miserable little ones\n| 250 ml [[Red wine|red wine]] -  we [[Freeze|freeze]] any leftover red [[Wine|wine]], great for recipes like this.\n| 2 tablespoons [[Sherry vinegar|sherry vinegar]]\n| 2 tablespoons [[Tomato puree|tomato puree]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Honey|honey]]\n| 2 [[Scant|scant]] tablespoons of [[Taste Sensation harissa seasoning]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 140\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4), [fan oven 160\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Taste Sensation harissa marinade.jpg|The marinade, mixed shaking the Lock and Lock box!\nImage:Taste Sensation harissa ribs ingredients.jpg|The basic ingredients - remember to cut up the ribs!\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Separate the [[Ribs|ribs]] (or [[Meat|meat]]) into manageable chunks, or get your butcher to do this.\n| Add everything to a [[Lock & Lock box]], close the lid and shake like crazy for a minute or so.\n| Leave to [[Marinade|marinade]] for 24 hours in a cool place\n| When ready to cook, shake up again and then tip everything out onto a deep [[Baking tray|baking tray]], cover with a tray or tin-foil and [[Roast|roast]] at the top of the [[Oven|oven]] for about 4 hours stirring up occasionally.\n| About 15 minutes before you are ready to serve, turn the heat up to 220\u00b0, uncover and cook until all the juices have turned dark and sticky and coated the ribs.\n| Serve\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nThis went very nicely with [[peas]], [[sweetcorn]], [[carrots]] and a simple, non-spicy gravy. \n===Recipe source===\n\n* Inspired by [[Taste Sensation Seasonings]]!\n\n===Chefs notes===\nBecause Christmas dinner got in the way of devouring these, they actually spent 3 days marinating in the fridge. And were no better or worse for that, so don't be concerned about how long you marinade them for, providing it is in a cool place.\n\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Cooking with wine]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Taste Sensation recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#ribs #harissaporkspareribs #scant #freeze #wine #spices #fat #tomatopuree #harissaseasoning #sweetcorn #roast </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Herby carrot, squash and orange bake",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Herby carrot, squash and tangerine bake\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#seeds #carrots #oliveoil #dumplingsquash #herbycarrotsquashandorangebake #scant #herbs #squash #wintersquash #tangerines #snacksandlightbites\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=We bought some lovely fruit and veg. from our local vegetable stall and I knocked this recipe up to use them.\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=1st November 2020\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Lovely served with a roast dinner\n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  40 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime =  30 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 313\n|PortionCalories = 156\n|Image = [[Image:Herby carrot, squash and orange bake recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Delish!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">You cannot beat local fresh veg.</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nWe bought some lovely [[Fruit|fruit]] and veg. from our local [[Vegetable|vegetable]] stall and I knocked this recipe up to use them.  It was fabulous, easy to make and  even easier to modify to suit your particular tastes.\n\nThe squash was the colourful [[winter squash]] (dumpling squash) and as this was a side dish for two people, half the squash was enough for both of us. The  tangerines were tiny, packed full of flavour with thin skins and very little pith.  The carrots had been picked that day, complete with leaves.\n\nChoose whatever [[Herbs|herbs]] you enjoy and just sprinkle them over the [[Vegetables|vegetables]] before [[Roasting|roasting]].\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| Half a small colourful [[Winter squash|winter squash]] (dumpling squash)\n| 3 [[Carrots|carrots]]\n| 3 [[Tangerines|tangerines]]\n| 1 [[Scant|scant]] teaspoons of [[Dill|dill]] [[Seeds|seeds]]\n| 1 [[Scant|scant]] teaspoon of [[Caraway seeds|caraway seeds]]\n| 10 [[Szechuan peppercorns]], crushed in a [[Pestle and mortar|pestle and mortar]]\n| Pinch of [[Sea Salt|sea salt]]\n| 1 tsb [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 220\u00b0 C (425\u00b0 F - gas 7), [fan oven 200\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| [[Scoop]] the [[Seeds|seeds]] from the [[Squash|squash]] and peel it and cut into small slices.\n| Peel or scrape the [[Carrots|carrots]], cut into halves or quarters lengthwise and then into pieces so they are the same size as the [[Squash|squash]] pieces.\n| Remove the peel from the [[Tangerines|tangerines]] and separate the segments and leave un-peeled; we're going to use them whole.\n| Tip everything into a [[Roasting tray|roasting tray]] and spay or [[Brush|brush]] them with about a tablespoon of [[Olive oil|olive oil]].\n| Sprinkle the [[Seeds|seeds]] and seasonings over the top, shake the tray well and [[Roast|roast]] for about 30 minutes or until the [[Carrots|carrots]] are done to your liking - everything else should be done nicely if the carrots are cooked as you like them.\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Vegetables and tangerines roasted.jpg|Roasted and ready to serve after 30 minutes\nImage:Carrot squash tangerines and herbs, ready to roast.jpg|Oil, sprinkled with herbs and ready to roast\nImage:Preparing summer squash.jpg|Half of this type of squash, perfect!\n</gallery>\n===Variations===\nUse any [[Herbs|herbs]] or [[Spices|spices]] that you like - [[Chilli flakes|chilli flakes]] and [[Fennel|fennel]] would be nice with this too.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#seeds #carrots #oliveoil #dumplingsquash #herbycarrotsquashandorangebake #scant #herbs #squash #wintersquash #tangerines #snacksandlightbites</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Herring pie (MoF)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Herring pie (MoF), a fruit recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#potato #apple #onion #lemon #herrings #nutmeg #citricacid \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=From the Ministry of Food leaflet \"All about Herrings\" - reprinted in 1948! I had no idea what lemon substitute might have been, but editor Roses2at\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2235\n|PortionCalories = 558\n|DatePublished=20th January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = All about Herrings - 1948\n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime = 45 minutes\n|PrepTime = 15 minutes\n|CookTime = 30 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:All_about_Herrings.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">lol!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">3</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I love these old recipes!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:NonLoggedInUser|NonLoggedInUser]] </span></span>\n}}\nFrom the Ministry of Food leaflet \"All about Herrings\" - reprinted in 1948!\n\nI had no idea what lemon substitute might have been, but editor [[User:Roses2at|Roses2at]] has done a little research and has come up with either apple peel or [[citric acid]] - see the [[Talk:Herring_pie_(MoF)|comments]] page for more details.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 8 oz grated raw [[potato]]\n| 8 oz grated raw [[apple]]\n| 3 oz chopped [[onion]]\n| &frac14; level teaspoon [[nutmeg]]\n| 2 level teaspoons [[salt]]\n| Pinch of [[pepper]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[lemon]] substitute\n| 4 [[herrings]], cleaned and boned\n| 6 oz [shortcrust] pastry\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Arrange half the [[potato]], [[apple]] and [[onion]] in a pie dish\n| Sprinkle on the [[nutmeg]], seasoning and [[lemon]] substitute\n| Lay the [[herrings]] on the top\n| Cover with the remainder of the [[potato]], [[apple]] and [[onion]] mixture\n| Roll out the pastry\n| Cover the dish with it, and bake in a hot oven (220\u00b0 C / 425\u00b0 F / Gas 7) for 30 minutes\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Sea fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes|Herring]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#potato #apple #onion #lemon #herrings #nutmeg #citricacid </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

\"All about Herrings\" - reprinted in 1948!\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 332\n|PortionCalories = 55\n|DatePublished=24th October 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = All about Herrings - 1948\n|Servings = Serves 6 - Makes one jar\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime = 5 minutes\n|PrepTime = 5 minutes\n|CookTime = None\n|Image = [[Image:All_about_Herrings.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Love the leaflet</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">My mum had these too.</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:NonLoggedInUser|NonLoggedInUser]] </span></span>\n}}\nFrom the Ministry of Food leaflet \"All about Herrings\" - reprinted in 1948!\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 6 oz cooked, flaked [[herring]]\n| &#189;                 "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Heston Blumenthal's perfect cauliflower cheese recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#hestonblumenthalsperfectcauliflowercheese #cauliflower #cheese #grated #whitewine #steamed #stock #vinegar #chickenstock #groundnutoil #truffleoil \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This is Heston's perfect cauliflower cheese recipe as seen on Channel 4's \"How to cook like Heston\"It is quite elaborate but definitely worth the\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1714\n|PortionCalories = 428\n|DatePublished=2nd February 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 3\n|TotalTime = 1 hour\n|PrepTime = 40 minutes \n|CookTime = 20 minutes \n|Image = [[Image:Heston's cauliflower cheese (TM).jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Lots of taste</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">..but it should be with that much cheese!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Sue_spins|Susie]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Heston Blumenthal's perfect cauliflower cheese_ingredients.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Heston Blumenthal's perfect cauliflower cheese, the ingredients]]\nThis is Heston's perfect cauliflower [[Cheese|cheese]] recipe as seen on Channel 4's \"How to cook like Heston\"\n\nIt is quite elaborate but definitely worth the effort.  Cooking the [[Cauliflower|cauliflower]] in three separate ways, [[Vinaigrette|vinaigrette]], [[Deep fried|deep fried]] and boiled, gives an extra contrast to this dish.\n\nThe cheese sauce is sublime, but the cleverest idea is soaking some of the cauliflower in a vinaigrette.  It adds a fantastic random taste\n\n'''for the [[Cauliflower|cauliflower]]'''\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 50g [[Caster sugar|caster sugar]]\n| 100ml [[White wine vinegar|white wine vinegar]]\n| 1 large [[Cauliflower|cauliflower]], broken into florets and separated into thirds\n| [[Groundnut oil]]\n}}\n'''for the [[Cheese sauce|cheese sauce]]'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 500ml [[Chicken stock|chicken stock]], reduced to 200ml and kept warm\n| 300ml [[White wine|white wine]], reduced to 30ml\n| 120g [[Grated|grated]] gruy\u00e8re [[Cheese|cheese]]\n| 20g [[Cornflour|cornflour]]\n| 20g soft [[Cheese|cheese]]\n| Knob of [[Butter|butter]]\n| Drops of [[Truffle oil|truffle oil]]\n| 25g extra [[Grated|grated]] Gruy\u00e8re [[Cheese|cheese]] or [[Cheddar cheese|cheddar cheese]] for gratinating\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Reduce the [[White wine|white wine]] from 500 ml to 30 ml, or [[Cheat|cheat]] and use [[Dry sherry|dry sherry]]!\n* Reduce the [[Chicken stock|chicken stock]] from 500 ml to 200 ml\n* Preheat the [[Grill|grill]] to maximum once the [[Cauliflower|cauliflower]] has been cooked\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Using a small pan, stir the [[Sugar|sugar]] into the [[Vinegar|vinegar]] and  bring to the [[Boil|boil]]\n| Put a third of the [[Cauliflower|cauliflower]] florets  into a bowl, pour the [[Vinegar|vinegar]] mix over the florets and [[Refrigerate|refrigerate]] for at least half an hour\n| Fill another small pan &#190; full with [[Groundnut oil|groundnut oil]] and heat over a medium high heat.  When the [[Oil|oil]] reaches 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F) add the second third of the florets and [[Fry|fry]] for about 3 minutes until golden.\n| [[Blanch]] the remaining third of the florets in [[Boiling|boiling]] [[Salted|salted]] water until soft, about 4 minutes. These could also be [[Steamed|steamed]]\n| Add the reduced [[Stock|stock]] and [[Wine|wine]] to a pan over a medium heat\n| Mix in the [[Grated|grated]] Gruy\u00e8re and cornflower and mix well until the [[Cheese|cheese]] is incorporated into the [[Stock|stock]]\n| Remove the pan from the heat and add a few drops or [[Truffle oil|truffle oil]]\n| Place in an [[Oven|oven]]-proof serving dish, sprinkle with the extra [[Grated|grated]] [[Cheddar|cheddar]] and [[Brown|brown]] under the [[Grill|grill]]\n}}\n===Chef's notes===\nAnne does not like raw [[cauliflower]] so I [[steamed]] it prior to adding it to the vinaigrette.\n===Variations===\nA grating of [[nutmeg]] prior to grilling does not go amiss.\n==See also==\n* [[Heston Blumenthal's perfect cauliflower cheese]] - Normal recipe\n* [[Heston Blumenthal's perfect cauliflower cheese (TM)]] - recipe for a [[Thermomix]]\n* [[Heston Blumenthal's perfect cheese sauce]] - Just the cheese sauce\n* http://www.channel4.com/4food/recipes/chefs/heston-blumenthal/cauliflower-cheese-recipe\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Deep fried]][[Category:Boiled or simmered]][[Category:Grilled, griddled or barbecued]]\n\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#hestonblumenthalsperfectcauliflowercheese #cauliflower #cheese #grated #whitewine #steamed #stock #vinegar #chickenstock #groundnutoil #truffleoil </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Heston Blumenthal's perfect cauliflower cheese (TM)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Heston Blumenthal's perfect Thermomix cauliflower cheese recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#cauliflower #garlic #cheese #grated #butter #wine #creamcheese #grill #vegetablestock #cornflour #deepfry \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=I love cauliflower cheese and this Thermomix recipe is probably the best I have ever made\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1719\n|PortionCalories = 429\n|DatePublished=27th October 2012\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime = 13 hours\n|PrepTime = 12 hours 25 minutes\n|CookTime = 35 minutes \n|Image = [[Image:Heston's cauliflower cheese (TM).jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Heavenly</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Thank you Heston!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The&nbsp;Judge]] </span></span>\n}}{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}}\nI love [[Cauliflower cheese|cauliflower cheese]] and this one is probably the best I have ever made.\n\n{{RecipeIngredientsTM\n| 50g white [[Caster sugar|caster sugar]]\n| 100g [[White wine vinegar|white wine vinegar]]\n| 2 small [[Cauliflower|cauliflowers]], broken into florets and divided into three\n| [[Groundnut oil]]\n| 500g [[Vegetable Stock|vegetable stock]]\n| 300g water\n| 1 bulb [[Garlic|garlic]], peeled\n| 300g [[White wine|white wine]], reduced to 30ml ('''10-15 minutes / Temp. Varoma / Speed 1''')\n| 120g Gruy\u00e8re [[Cheese|cheese]], [[Grated|grated]]\n| 20g [[Cornflour|cornflour]]\n| 30g [[Cream cheese|cream cheese]]\n| Knob of [[Butter|butter]]\n| 25g extra [[Grated|grated]] Gruy\u00e8re or [[Cheddar]] for the topping\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Add the [[Sugar|sugar]] and [[Vinegar|vinegar]] to the bowl and set the TM to 100\u00b0.\n* Once it has reached this temperature, pour the mixture over one third of the [[Cauliflower|cauliflower]].\n* Allow to cool somewhat and leave in the [[Fridge|fridge]] overnight.\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| The next day, grate the [[Cheese|cheese]] for cooking and topping separately in the TM and coat the cooking [[Cheese|cheese]] in the [[Cornflour|cornflour]] (I used [[Gruyere]] for cooking and a mixture of that and mature [[Cheddar]] for the topping) and set aside.\n| Put one third of the [[Cauliflower|cauliflower]] into the internal [[Steaming|steaming]] basket with the [[Vegetable Stock|vegetable stock]] and water '''16 minutes / Temp. Varoma / Speed 1.'''\n| Meanwhile, [[Deep fry|deep fry]] the remaining third of the [[Cauliflower|cauliflower]] at 180\u00ba C until golden [[Brown|brown]].\n| Drain the [[Cauliflower|cauliflower]] on kitchen paper and [[Deep fry|deep fry]] the [[Garlic|garlic]] until golden [[Brown|brown]], but make sure it doesn't burn.\n| Remove the [[Steamed|steamed]] [[Cauliflower|cauliflower]] (keep the liquid), mix with the others and place in a [[Baking|baking]] dish or [[Casserole|casserole]].\n| Reduce the [[Stock|stock]] / water mix to 200ml '''18 minutes / Temp. Varoma / Speed 1''' and leave in the bowl.\n| Preheat the [[Grill|grill]] to high. \n| Add the [[Wine|wine]], cornfloured [[Cheese|cheese]], [[butter]] and the [[Fried|fried]] [[Garlic|garlic]] to the TM bowl with the [[Butter|butter]] '''5 minutes/ 90\u00ba / Speed 4'''.\n| Add the [[Cream cheese|cream cheese]] and cook at the same setting for a further 1 minute.\n| Process '''15 seconds / Speed 5-10 progressively''', so that the [[Garlic|garlic]] is well pulverised. \n| Mix the [[Sauce|sauce]] with the [[Cauliflower|cauliflower]], sprinkle over the [[Grated|grated]] chase and [[Grill|grill]] for several minutes.\n}}\n===Recipe source===\n* Lightly adapted and converted for Thermomix from a '''[http://www.channel4.com/4food/recipes/chefs/heston-blumenthal/cauliflower-cheese-recipe Heston Blumenthal recipe]'''\n===Chef's notes===\nThe timings for the reduction of the [[Wine|wine]] and [[Stock|stock]] may vary as it will depend on the temperature of your kitchen and the ingredients.\n==See also==\n* [[Heston Blumenthal's perfect cauliflower cheese]] - Normal recipe\n* [[Heston Blumenthal's perfect cauliflower cheese (TM)]] - recipe for a [[Thermomix]]\n* [[Heston Blumenthal's perfect cheese sauce]] - Just the cheese sauce\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Thermomix recipes]]\n[[Category:Deep fried]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#cauliflower #garlic #cheese #grated #butter #wine #creamcheese #grill #vegetablestock #cornflour #deepfry </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Heston Blumenthal's perfect cheese sauce",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Heston Blumenthal's perfect cheese sauce a cheese recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#hestonblumenthalsperfectcheesesauce #cheese #whitewine #stock #truffleoil #chickenstock #grated #cornflour #pasta #cheesesauce #drysherry \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This is Heston's the cheese sauce used with Heston Blumenthal's perfect cauliflower cheese\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1471\n|PortionCalories = 367\n|DatePublished=2nd February 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = [[Used with 3 variations of cauliflower]]\n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime = 25 minutes\n|PrepTime = 15 minutes \n|CookTime = 10 minutes \n|Image = [[Image:Heston's cauliflower cheese (TM).jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Very rich, quite complex</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">but definitely worth the effort</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Sue_spins|Susie]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Perfect cheese sauce ingredients.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Heston Blumenthal's perfect cheese sauce, the ingredients]]\nThis is Heston's the cheese sauce used with [[Heston Blumenthal's perfect cauliflower cheese]].  It is just as good with [[pasta]], any vegetables and anywhere a rich cheese sauce is needed.\n\n'''for the [[Cheese sauce|cheese sauce]]'''\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 500ml [[Chicken stock|chicken stock]], reduced to 200ml and kept warm\n| 300ml [[White wine|white wine]], reduced to 30ml\n| 120g [[Grated|grated]] gruy\u00e8re [[Cheese|cheese]]\n| 20g [[Cornflour|cornflour]]\n| 20g soft [[Cheese|cheese]]\n| Knob of [[Butter|butter]]\n| Drops of [[Truffle oil|truffle oil]]\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Reduce the [[White wine|white wine]] from 500 ml to 30 ml, or [[Cheat|cheat]] and use [[Dry sherry|dry sherry]]!\n* Reduce the [[Chicken stock|chicken stock]] from 500 ml to 200 ml\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Add the reduced [[Stock|stock]] and [[Wine|wine]] to a pan over a medium heat\n| Mix in the [[Grated|grated]] Gruy\u00e8re and cornflower and mix well until the [[Cheese|cheese]] is incorporated into the [[Stock|stock]]\n| Remove the pan from the heat and add a few drops or [[Truffle oil|truffle oil]]\n| Use as required\n}}\n==See also==\n\n* [[Heston Blumenthal's perfect cauliflower cheese]] - Normal recipe\n* [[Heston Blumenthal's perfect cauliflower cheese (TM)]] - recipe for a [[Thermomix]]\n* http://www.channel4.com/4food/recipes/chefs/heston-blumenthal/cauliflower-cheese-recipe\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#hestonblumenthalsperfectcheesesauce #cheese #whitewine #stock #truffleoil #chickenstock #grated #cornflour #pasta #cheesesauce #drysherry </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Hippy mutton pie",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Hippy mutton pie, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#mutton #potatoes #stock #hempseedoil #oliveoil #potato #hippymuttonpie #carrots #eggyolk #onion #butter \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This is my take on shepherds' pie which I am topping with Purple Majesty potatoes\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 3120\n|PortionCalories = 780\n|DatePublished=27th October 2012\n|Author = JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 1 hour 35 minutes plus mash cooling time\n |PrepTime = 20 minutes\n |CookTime = 1 hour 15 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Hippy mutton pie recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Lol!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Very 70's, Julia!</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n\nThis is my take on shepherds' pie which I am topping with Purple Majesty [[Potatoes|potatoes]].  My wife wears a lot of purple and she is a bit hippy-ish, hence the name.   Do not be alarmed however, at the use of [[Hemp seed oil|hemp seed oil]].  Although it comes from the [[Seeds|seeds]] of ''Cannabis sativa'', the [[Oil|oil]] does not contain the psychoactive contents of the plant.  Looks weird, but tastes delicious!\n\n'''For the [[Mutton|mutton]]'''\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| [[Olive oil]]\n| 500g [[Shoulder|shoulder]] of [[Mutton|mutton]], trimmed of [[Fat|fat]] and cut into smallish chunks\n| [[Hemp seed oil]]\n| 150g [[Celery|celery]], hacked rustically\n| 150g [[Carrots|carrots]], peeled and hacked rustically\n| 1 medium [[Green pepper|green pepper]], hacked rustically\n| 1 medium [[Yellow pepper|yellow pepper]], hacked rustically\n| 1 medium [[Onion|onion]], chopped\n| 1 [[Red onion|red onion]], chopped\n| 1 bulb [[Garlic, crushed|garlic, crushed]]\n| 400ml [[Meat stock|meat stock]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Tomato|tomato]] pur\u00e9e\n| 30ml [[Worcestershire sauce|worcestershire sauce]]\n| Seasoning\n| 3 heaped teaspoons [[Cornflour|cornflour]]\n}}\n'''For the [[Potato|potato]] topping'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 1kg Purple Majesty [[Potatoes|potatoes]]\n| 60ml hot [[Milk|milk]]\n| 40g [[Butter|butter]]\n| 30ml [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 1 [[Egg yolk|egg yolk]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Heat a little [[Olive oil|olive oil]] in a saucepan to [[Smoking|smoking]] point.\n| Add the [[Mutton|mutton]] and cook until the juices have evaporated and the [[Meat|meat]] has begun to caramelise.\n| Transfer the [[Mutton|mutton]] into a deep [[Oven|oven]]-proof dish.\n| Using the same pan, heat a little [[Hemp seed oil|hemp seed oil]] and reduce the heat to medium.\n| Add the [[Celery|celery]] and [[Carrots|carrots]] and cook until they are beginning to colour and soften.\n| Stir in the [[Onion|onion]] and [[Peppers|peppers]], adding more [[Hemp seed oil|hemp seed oil]] if necessary, and cook for about until they, too, are soft, stirring from time to time\n| Add the [[Garlic|garlic]] and [[Fry|fry]] for 2-3 minutes - do not allow it to burn.\n| Mix the [[Vegetables|vegetables]] with the [[Mutton|mutton]] and season to taste.\n| Still using the same saucepan, heat the [[Stock|stock]], tomatoe pur\u00e9e and [[Worcestershire sauce]].\n| Put the [[Cornflour|cornflour]] in a mug or jug and add some hot [[Stock|stock]] to it, a little at a time, stirring until you have a thick, smooth paste.\n| Add  a little more [[Stock|stock]] to it, stir, and pour into the saucepan with the rest of the stock.\n| Tip the [[Mutton|mutton]] and [[Vegetable|vegetable]] into the [[Stock|stock]], reduce the heat and [[Simmer|simmer]], partially covered, for 10-15, stirring occasionally.\n| The [[Stock|stock]] should be fairly thick.\n| Pour back into the [[Oven|oven]]-proof dish and allow to cool completely.\n| Meanwhile, [[Boil|boil]] the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] in unsalted water until the are cooked - about 20 minutes.\n| Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 140\u00b0 C (257\u00b0 F - gas 1)\n| Drain the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] in a [[Colander|colander]], place the colander on a metal tray and put in the [[Oven|oven]] to dry out for about 15-20 minutes.\n| [[Mash]] or rice the [[Potatoes|potatoes]], gradually incorporating the hot [[Milk|milk]], [[Butter|butter]], [[Oil|oil]] and [[Egg yolk|egg yolk]].\n| Allow to cool competely.\n| Using a palette knife, spread the [[Potato|potato]] mixture over the [[Mutton|mutton]],\n| Run a fork, which has been dipped in [[Milk|milk]], over the top of the [[Potato|potato]] to make a pattern.\n| [[Bake]] at 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6) for 10 minutes, reduce the heat to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4) and bake for a further 30 minutes.\n}}\n===Variations===\nOf course, you can use whatever [[Mashing|mashing]] [[Potatoes|potatoes]], [[Vegetables|vegetables]] and [[Oil|oil]] you like.  \nThe [[Garlic|garlic]] quantity may seem large, but it will not be overpowering.  I would have added more, but I couldn't be bothered to peel more than one bulb.\n\nUse [[lamb]] or [[beef]] instead of [[mutton]].\n\nSubstitute some of the [[stock]] with red [[wine]].\n===Chef's notes===\nPurple Majesty [[potatoes]] are available from branches of '''[http://www.sainsburys.co.uk/sol/index.jsp Sainsbury's].'''\n\nHemp seed oil is available in large branches of the main supermarkets or direct from '''[http://www.goodwebsite.co.uk/index.php Good Website]'''\n==See also==\n* [[Shepherds' pie recipes|Other shepherds' pie recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Mutton recipes]]\n[[Category:Pies tarts and flans]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#mutton #potatoes #stock #hempseedoil #oliveoil #potato #hippymuttonpie #carrots #eggyolk #onion #butter </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Home-made beef gravy",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Home-made beef gravy a beef recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#stock #onion #homemadebeefgravy #gravybrowning #blackpeppercorns #gravyrecipes #plainflour #boiledorsimmered #dripping #carrot #offal \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Tasty and easy to make homemade gravy\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 139\n|PortionCalories = 34\n|DatePublished=17th January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4 - Makes 1 pint of beef gravy\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 1 hour 20 minutes\n |PrepTime = 10 minutes\n |CookTime = 1 hour 10 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Home-made beef gravy recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Bisto - Bah!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">This is way better than any shop-bought gravy</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]])</span></span>\n}}\nTasty and easy to make homemade gravy.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| [[Beef]] trimmings, including [[Offal|offal]] such as [[Kidney|kidney]], [[Liver|liver]], heart, etc.\n| 1 [[Onion|onion]], cut in half, one half chopped finely\n| 8 [[Black peppercorns|black peppercorns]]\n| Handful of [[Parsley leaves|parsley leaves]] and stems\n| 1 teaspoon of [[Beef dripping|beef dripping]] or [[Butter|butter]]\n| 1 tablespoon of [[Plain flour|plain flour]]\n| [[Gravy browning]] (optional)\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] to taste\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Place the [[Meat|meat]] trimmings, half of the [[Onion|onion]], the [[Peppercorns|peppercorns]], [[Parsley|parsley]] and a pint of water\n| Bring to the [[Boil|boil]], reduce the heat and [[Simmer|simmer]], covered, for 1 hour\n| Remove from the heat and strain the [[Stock|stock]] into a separate bowl\n| In the same pan, melt the [[Dripping|dripping]] and [[Fry|fry]] the chopped half of the [[Onion|onion]] until it is nicely [[Browned|browned]] \n| Stir in the [[Flour|flour]] and mix well\n| Little by little add the [[Stock|stock]], stirring as you go\n| Add a little [[gravy browning]] if needed\n| Season to taste and serve immediately\n}}\n===Variations===\nUse other seasonal [[Herbs|herbs]] as available.  Odd [[Vegetables|vegetables]] such as [[Carrot|carrot]] or [[Parsnips|parsnips]] can be added to the [[Stock|stock]].\n===Chef's note===\nCheat if you are short of time, use stock from a stock-cube and then continue from step 4.  that way you can pretend to everyone that you made it.\n==See also==\n* Many other [[gravy recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Beef recipes]]\n[[Category:Dips and sauces]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Offal recipes]]\n[[Category:Soup and stock recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#stock #onion #homemadebeefgravy #gravybrowning #blackpeppercorns #gravyrecipes #plainflour #boiledorsimmered #dripping #carrot #offal </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
