title": "How long to cook Oakhurst Aldi Peri Peri Chicken King Kebab",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=How long to cook Oakhurst Aldi Peri Peri Chicken King Kebab\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#aldireadymeals #aldi #AldiKingkebab #periperi #fajita #burntkebab #overcooeked #chicken #airfryer #oakhurst #hotchicken #perfectlycooked #howtocook\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=Aldi fab Chicken King Kebabs are burnt if you cook them as they suggest - this is how I cook them perfectly\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=6th April 2023\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Half of the King Kebab, with chips \ud83d\ude0b\n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  47 minutes\n|PrepTime =  2 minutes\n|CookTime =  45 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 602\n|PortionCalories = 301\n|Image = [[Image:How long to cook Oakhust Aldi Peri Peri Chicken King Kebab recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">This doesn't look that great...</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">..but it tastes unbelievable!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jeremy]] </span></span>\n}}\nI love Aldi's [[Chicken]] King [[Kebabs]] - especially the [[Peri peri|peri peri]] one, although the [[Fajita|fajita]] is just as delicious. I've found the temperatures and cooking times that they suggest are far too high; cook the King Kebab their way and and you end up with it burnt to a crisp.\n\nI use an [[Air Fryer|air fryer]] to cook these as it's more economical and quicker to cook them this way (no waiting for the [[Oven|oven]] to get to temperature).\n\nThis is really an aide-memoir for me so it is always perfectly cooked.\n\nThe portion sizes on the packaging suggest this serves four people.  it does not, it serves two [[Pigs|pigs]]! #portionControl\n\nIf you're paranoid about the [[Chicken|chicken]] being undercooked, check it with a [[Meat thermometer|meat thermometer]]. (if it's 74 \u00b0C (165 \u00b0F) or more, it's properly cooked.\n\n''[[Safe minimum cooking temperatures]]'' for all [[Meats|meats]] can be found here\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| One box of Aldi's [[Chicken]] King [[Kebab]] (produced by Oakhurst [[Butchers|butchers]])\n| Two portions of Stott's [[Chips|chips]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Allow the package to [[Defrost|defrost]] completely - leave it in the [[Fridge|fridge]] for 24 hours from [[Frozen|frozen]], it will be properly [[Defrosted|defrosted]] in that time\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Once the [[Chicken]] King [[Kebab]] is properly [[Defrosted|defrosted]], remove the two wooden [[Skewers|skewers]] and discard\n| Place the [[Kebab|kebab]] in a [[Silicone baking tray]]\n| Break the [[Kebab|kebab]] up and distribute it evenly over the surface of the [[Baking tray|baking tray]]\n| Place the [[Silicone baking tray]] in your [[Air Fryer|air fryer]]\n| [[Air fry]] for 45 minutes at  180 \u00b0C - Turning the heat up to 200\u00b0C for the final 10 minutes\n| '''Move the chicken pieces around every 10 to 15 minutes''' so they are evenly cooked and coated with the peri peri sauce\n| ''It will be perfectly cooked, and not burnt''\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Oakhurst Aldi Peri Peri Chicken King Kebab.jpg|This is the glorious Oakhurst Aldi Peri Peri Chicken King Kebab\nImage:Half of the Oakhurst Aldi Peri Peri Chicken King Kebab ready to air fry.jpg|King Kebab, defrosted and spread over a silicone baking tray, ready to [[air fry]]\nImage:Aldi Peri Peri Chicken King Kebab after 45 minutes.jpg|Perfectly cooked after only 45 minutes in the [[air fryer]] at 180 \u00b0C<br>Imagine what it would be like after an 70 minutes at 200\u00b0C \n</gallery>\n===Chef's notes===\nI'm not sure why the cooking times shown on the packet are so long and so hot - I usually cook small [[Chicken|chicken]] pieces for  15 minutes or so at 180 \u00b0C, so 45 at the same temperature should be fine.\n\n'''Aldi suggest:'''\n\n* King [[Kebab]] [[Peri peri|peri peri]] from [[Frozen|frozen]]: Fan 200\u00b0C for 1 hour 35 minutes\n\n* King [[Kebab]] [[Peri peri|peri peri]] from [[Frozen|frozen]]: Electric 220\u00b0C for 1 hour 35 minutes\n\n* King [[Kebab]] [[Peri peri|peri peri]] from [[Frozen|frozen]]: Gas 7 for 1 hour 35 minutes\n\n* King [[Kebab]] [[Peri peri|peri peri]] from [[Defrosted|defrosted]] (chilled): Fan 200\u00b0C for 60 to 70 minutes\n\n* King [[Kebab]] [[Peri peri|peri peri]] from [[Defrosted|defrosted]] (chilled): Electric 200\u00b0C for 60 to 70 minutes\n\n* King [[Kebab]] [[Peri peri|peri peri]] from [[Defrosted|defrosted]] (chilled): Gas 7 for 60 to 70 minutes\n\n* King [[Kebab]] [[Fajita|fajita]] from [[Frozen|frozen]]: Fan 200\u00b0C for 1 hour 35 minutes\n\n* King [[Kebab]] [[Fajita|fajita]] from [[Frozen|frozen]]: Electric 220\u00b0C for 1 hour 35 minutes\n\n* King [[Kebab]] [[Fajita|fajita]] from [[Frozen|frozen]]: Gas 7 for 1 hour 35 minutes\n\n* King [[Kebab]] [[Fajita|fajita]] from [[Defrosted|defrosted]] (chilled): Fan 200\u00b0C for 60 to 70 minutes\n\n* King [[Kebab]] [[Fajita|fajita]] from [[Defrosted|defrosted]] (chilled): Electric 200\u00b0C for 60 to 70 minutes\n\n* King [[Kebab]] [[Fajita|fajita]] from [[Defrosted|defrosted]] (chilled): Gas 7 for 60 to 70 minutes\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Chilli pepper recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Poultry recipes]]\n[[Category:Air fried recipes]]\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#aldireadymeals #aldi #AldiKingkebab #periperi #fajita #burntkebab #overcooeked #chicken #airfryer #oakhurst #hotchicken #perfectlycooked #howtocook</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "How to activate Allinsons Dried Active Yeast",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=How to activate Allinsons Dried Active Yeast\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#driedactiveyeast #whisk #britishrecipes #allinsonsdriedactiveyeast #breadmakerrecipes #breadandbaking #breadmaker #warmplace #recipes #yeast #allinsondriedactiveyeast\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=The official method from Allinsons as to how to activate Allinsons Dried Active Yeast for use in a breadmaker \n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=19th March 2020\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = [[Allinson Dried Active Yeast]]<br />'''NOT SUITABLE''' for Breadmakers\n|Servings = 1\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  15 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime = None\n|TotalCalories = 16\n|PortionCalories = 16\n|Image = [[Image:NOT SUITABLE for Breadmakers.jpg|200px|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Poorly labelled Allinson</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.4</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Not sure why but the labelling on this product used to make very clear that it was not suitable for breadmakers, now it just about whispers it.  Not Good Guys! </span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nI thought I had a problematic batch of [[yeast]] so I returned it to Allinson (The Silver Spoon Company) as faulty.  They tested it and even baked a loaf of bread with it.  it transpires that [[Allinsons Dried Active Yeast]] is unsuitable for breadmakers and needs to be ''activated'' first.  These instructions are verbatim from Allinson - Jane Johnson; Customer Quality Co-ordinator. \n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 teaspoon [[Sugar|sugar]]\n| 150 ml warm water (1 part [[Boiling|boiling]], 2 parts cold)\n| 15 g Allinson's [[Dried active yeast|dried active yeast]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Dissolve the [[Sugar|sugar]] in warm water\n| Sprinkle in the [[Dried active yeast|dried active yeast]] and [[Whisk|whisk]] thoroughly.\n| Leave in a [[Warm place|warm place]] until the surface is covered in froth. This usually takes 15 minutes.\n| [[Whisk]] again and use immediately.\n| Liquid used to activate '''should not''' be used in addition to the amount of liquid in the recipe.\n}}\n===Chef's notes===\nLike me, you were probably not aware that this was necessary as I had been using this yeast in our [[breadmaker]] for years and years.  However, the loaves are much better after following this procedure.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Breadmaker recipes]]\n[[Category:Uncooked]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#driedactiveyeast #whisk #britishrecipes #allinsonsdriedactiveyeast #breadmakerrecipes #breadandbaking #breadmaker #warmplace #recipes #yeast #allinsondriedactiveyeast</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "How to cook beetroot",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=How to cook beetroot Cooking Wiki\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#pressurecooker #howtocookbeetroot #beetrootrosti #veganrecipes #pressurecookers #saladspinner #steaming #vegetablerecipes #vegetarianrecipes #roastingtray #tinfoil \n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=There are many ways to cook freshly picked beetroot: Boiling in a pan, Boiling in a pressure cooker, steaming and roasting, wrapped in tin-\n|datePublished=2014-04-08\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n\nThere are many ways to cook freshly picked beetroot: Boiling in a pan, Boiling in a [[pressure cooker]], [[steaming]] and [[roasting]], wrapped in [[tin-foil]].  I prefer the [[pressure cooker]] method, it's quickest and the most economical way.  With modern [[pressure cookers]] I use the smallest gas ring on the lowest setting , it makes no noise or steam and only takes an hour.\n\nPrepare them with a quick rinse, being careful not to break the skin and then trim the leaves leaving about 2.5 cm (1 inch) and leave the roots intact.  We will remove both of those when they are cooked.  This prevents them from bleeding badly while they are cooking.\n\n===Cooking beetroots in a pressure cooker===\n\nTrim the beets as above, fill the cooker to just below the trivet stand and place the beetroots in the steamer basket and sit on the trivet.  Bring to high pressure and cook for about 50 minutes and allow to de-pressurise naturally. The beets are cooked when the root  is soft enough to penetrate with a skewer and the skin moves easily when rubbed with your fingers.\n\nWhen the beets are cooked, trim the roots and stems completely and rub the skins off with your fingers, using rubber gloves if you don't want purple fingers.\n===Cooking beetroots by boiling in a pan===\n\nTrim the beets as above, place in a lidded pan, just covered with boiling water, cover and boil for an 1 hour 30 minutes (depending upon size) or until the beetroot is soft enough to penetrate with a skewer and the skin moves easily when rubbed with your fingers.\n\nWhen the beets are cooked, trim the roots and stems completely and rub the skins off with your fingers, using rubber gloves if you don't want purple fingers.\n<gallery widths=250px perrow=5>\nImage:Beetroots cooked and trimmed.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Cooked skinned and trimmed\nImage:Trimmed beets ready to cook.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Leaves trimmed, roots left alone, ready to boil, steam or roast\n</gallery>\n===Cooking beetroots by steaming in a pan===\n\nTrim the beets as above, place in a steamer with the pan filled with about 5 cm (2 inches) of boiling water, cover and steam for an 1 hour 30 minutes (depending upon size) or until the beetroot is soft enough to penetrate with a skewer and the skin moves easily when rubbed with your fingers.\n\nWhen the beets are cooked, trim the roots and stems completely and rub the skins off with your fingers, using rubber gloves if you don't want purple fingers.\n===Cooking beetroots in the oven===\n\nBeetroots can be roasted or steamed in the over.\n\n=====Roasting beets in the oven=====\n\n:'''150\u00b0 C (300\u00b0 F - gas 2), [fan oven 130\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]'''\n\nTrim the beets as above, wrap them in [[tin foil]], place the foil parcels in a [[roasting tray]] and roast in the middle of the oven at 150\u00b0 C (300\u00b0 F - gas 2), [fan oven 130\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour] for 2 to 3 hours. The beets are cooked when the root  is soft enough to penetrate with a skewer and the skin moves easily when rubbed with your fingers.\n\nWhen the beets are cooked, trim the roots and stems completely and rub the skins off with your fingers, using rubber gloves if you don't want purple fingers.\n\n=====Steaming beets in the oven=====\n\n:'''150\u00b0 C (300\u00b0 F - gas 2), [fan oven 130\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]'''\n\nTrim the beets as above, place them in a lidded casserole dish filled with 5 cm (2 inches) of boiling water and steam in the middle of the oven at 150\u00b0 C (300\u00b0 F - gas 2), [fan oven 130\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour] for 2 to 3 hours. The beets are cooked when the root  is soft enough to penetrate with a skewer and the skin moves easily when rubbed with your fingers.\n\nWhen the beets are cooked, trim the roots and stems completely and rub the skins off with your fingers, using rubber gloves if you don't want purple fingers.\n\n===Beetroot recipes===\nWe have a great selection of beetroot recipes.   My favourite is the [[Beetroot rosti]].\n{{Beetroot recipes}}\n\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Pressure cooker recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n{{RecipeSkip}}\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#pressurecooker #howtocookbeetroot #beetrootrosti #veganrecipes #pressurecookers #saladspinner #steaming #vegetablerecipes #vegetarianrecipes #roastingtray #tinfoil </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "How to make poppadum crisps",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=How to make poppadum crisps\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#poppadumcrisps #poppadomcrisps #indiancrisps #veganrecipes #poppadumrecipes #microwaved\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=Using uncooked poppodums, it is easy to make your own poppadum crisps without frying.\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=27th September 2021\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = They even look inviting!\n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  2 minutes\n|PrepTime =  1 minute\n|CookTime =  1 minute\n|TotalCalories = 210\n|PortionCalories = 105\n|Image = [[Image:Poppadum crisps recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Genius!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I now prefer these to the deep fried version!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:NonLoggedInUser|NonLoggedInUser]] </span></span>\n}}\nUsing [[Uncooked|uncooked]] [[Poppadum|poppadum]]s, it is easy to make your own poppadum crisps without any oil at all.  Very healthy.\n\nYou can buy [[Uncooked|uncooked]] poppadums from supermarkets and any store that sells [[Indian]] ingredients; you can also buy them online from [[Amazon]], but check and compare prices, some sellers can charge 10 times as much as other [[Suppliers|suppliers]], so be careful!\n\nThese don't stay fresh once cooked so only make as much as you can eat at one time.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 5 [[Uncooked|uncooked]] poppadums and scrunch them into crisp-sized pieces\n| Search Google for '[[Uncooked|uncooked]] [[Poppadoms|poppadoms]]' if you can't obtain them easily\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Take about 5 raw [[Uncooked|uncooked]] poppadums and scrunch them into crisp-sized pieces.\n| Place them in a plastic bowl without a lid.\n| [[Microwave]] on full power for one minute.\n| Allow to cool and harden, this will only take a minute or two.\n| Eat!\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Khanum Poppadoms.jpg|Raw uncooked poppadoms\nImage:How to make poppadum crisps recipe.jpg|After microwaving for one minute at full power\nImage:TasteSensation yogurt dips.jpg|[[Taste Sensation yogurt dips|These dips]] are ideal for poppodum crisps\n</gallery>\n\n===Serving suggestions===\nTake a teaspoon of your favourite [[Taste Sensation]] spice mix and stir them into 5 tablespoons of [[Greek yogurt|greek yogurt]] to make a yummy [[Dip|dip]] for these lovely crisps.\n\n===Chef's note===\n* Amazon UK sell [https://www.amazon.co.uk/gp/product/B08GGBN41Z/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_asin_title_o01_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1 Country Range Poppadoms] which I have found to be the nicest and least expensive of their offerings.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Indian recipes]]\n[[Category:Dips and sauces]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Gluten free recipes]]\n[[Category:Microwaved]]\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#poppadumcrisps #poppadomcrisps #indiancrisps #veganrecipes #poppadumrecipes #microwaved</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "HP sauce (TM)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=HP sauce - A Thermomix recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#thermomix #hpsauce #worcestershiresauce #lemon #boiledorsimmered #blackpepper #fridge #onion #sterilisedjars #tabasco #vinegar \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This is the nearest I have tasted to commercial HP sauce\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 317\n|PortionCalories = 4\n|DatePublished=11th December 2012\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|ImageComment = The new [[Thermomix]] TM5 (2014)\n|Servings = 75\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  1 hour, 5 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime =  55 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:The new (2014) Thermomix TM5.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Saucy!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Not bad, either.</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The&nbsp;Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis is the nearest I have tasted to commercial [[HP sauce]] that i can make in my Thermie.\n\n{{RecipeIngredientsTM\n\n| 750g [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]], quartered\n| 130g [[Muscovado sugar|muscovado sugar]]\n| 100g red [[Onion|onion]], cut into chunks\n| 1 [[Lemon|lemon]], sliced\n| 60g white [[Vinegar|vinegar]]\n| 20g [[Salt|salt]]\n| &frac12; to 1 teaspoon [[Allspice|allspice]],\n| 1 teaspoon [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n| 20g [[Worcestershire sauce]],\n| &frac12; teaspoon [[Tabasco]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Place all the ingredients into bowl '''30 seconds / Speed 8''' and scrape sides.\n| Set to '''10 minutes / Temp. Varoma / Speed 2'''.  \n| Then '''15 minutes / 100\u00b0 / Speed 2'''.\n| Then '''25 minutes / 100\u00b0 / Speed 3'''.\n| Then cook for a further '''5 minutes / 100\u00b0 / Speed 4'''.\n| Allow to cool slightly then blitz '''1 minute / Speed 8'''.\n| Store in [[Sterilised jars|sterilised jars]] or in [[Lock and Lock boxes|Lock&Lock]] containers in the [[Fridge|fridge]].\n}}\n\n===Servings===\nServings: 70 - About 750 ml\n===Recipe source===\n\n* Lightly adapted from a recipe by '''[http://www.forumthermomix.com/index.php?topic=7661.0 nola276]'''\n===Chef's notes===\nI would watch the [[Thermomix]] for a short while at the beginning as the mixture may come through the sides of the MC and splash.  Alternatively you could reduce in the ingredient quantities slightly.\n\nThis recipe makes about 750ml of brown sauce.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Dips and sauces]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Thermomix recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#thermomix #hpsauce #worcestershiresauce #lemon #boiledorsimmered #blackpepper #fridge #onion #sterilisedjars #tabasco #vinegar </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Iced carrot cake",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Iced carrot cake, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#cake #orange #carrot #carrots #walnuts #icedcarrotcake #butter #grated #cherries #driedfruit #eggs \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Another recipe from Mum's scribbled cookery notes, this one for an carrot cake with orange icing\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2342\n|PortionCalories = 234\n|DatePublished=19th July 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Servings: 10 - Makes one cake\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime = 1 hour, 25 minutes\n|PrepTime = 1 hour \n|CookTime = 25 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Iced carrot cake recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Wartime food?</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I wonder if this recipe came about because of wartime rationing?</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nAnother recipe from Mum's scribbled [[Cookery|cookery]] notes, this one for an [[Carrot|carrot]] [[Cake|cake]] with [[Orange|orange]] icing.  In her hey-day she would have used a [[Hand|hand]] whisk, it's probably easier and quicker to use an electric whisk.  I also use a [[Food processor|food processor]] to grate [[Carrots|carrots]] but that's because I like playing with kitchen toys!\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n}}\n'''[[Carrot|carrot]] [[Cake|cake]]'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 175g (6 oz) [[Carrots]]\n| 100g (4 oz) [[Wholemeal]] [[Self-raising flour|self-raising flour]]\n| 2 large [[Free range eggs|free range eggs]]\n| 100g (4 oz) [[muscovado sugar]] or [[Jaggery|jaggery]]\n| 75 ml (3 fl oz) [[Vegetable oil]]\n| 50 g (2 oz) [[Desiccated coconut]]\n| 50 g (2 oz) [[Dried fruit]] of choice ([[Sultanas|sultanas]], [[Raisins|raisins]], [[Currants|currants]], chopped [[Dried apricots|dried apricots]], maraschino [[Cherries|cherries]])\n| 1 teaspoon freshly [[Ground cinnamon|ground cinnamon]] or [[Cinnamon|cinnamon]] powder\n| &#189; teaspoon freshly [[Grated|grated]] [[Nutmeg|nutmeg]]\n}}\n'''[[Orange|orange]] icing'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 40g (1.5 oz) [[Butter]]\n| 75g (3 oz) [[Sugar|sugar]]\n| [[Grated]] [[Zest|zest]] from the rind from half an [[Orange|orange]]\n}}\n'''optional garnish'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 25g (1 oz) chopped [[Walnuts|walnuts]]\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 190\u00b0 C (375\u00b0 F - gas 5), [fan [[Oven|oven]] 170\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n}}\n'''[[Carrot|carrot]] [[Cake|cake]]'''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Grease the base of an 18 cm (7\") square [[Cake|cake]] tin\n| Peel and grate the [[Carrots|carrots]] using a fine [[Grater|grater]]\n| Whisk the [[Eggs|eggs]] and [[Sugar|sugar]] together until nice and thick\n| Slowly drizzle all of the [[Oil|oil]] in while still whisking\n| Sprinkle and gently fold in the remaining ingerdients\n| Mix well and pour into the [[Cake|cake]] tin\n| Use a spatula to create a flat surface\n| [[Bake]] in the middle of the [[Oven|oven]] for 20 to 25 minutes or until the [[Cake|cake]] is golden [[Brown|brown]] and firm to the touch\n| Remove from the tin and cool on a wire rack\n| Spread with [[Orange|orange]] icing and sprinkle with the chopped [[Walnuts|walnuts]] if using\n}}\n'''[[Orange|orange]] icing'''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Beat the [[Butter|butter]] in a warm bowl until softened\n| Whisk in the [[Sugar|sugar]] and [[Orange zest|orange zest]] until combined\n| Spread over the [[Carrot|carrot]] [[Cake|cake]] and sprinkle with the chopped [[Walnuts|walnuts]]\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#cake #orange #carrot #carrots #walnuts #icedcarrotcake #butter #grated #cherries #driedfruit #eggs </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Iced cream (original recipe)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=An historic iced cream recipe Cooking Wiki\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#strawberries #sweetsanddesserts #fruitrecipes #raspberries #frozen #cherries #historicrecipes #icecream #currants #britishrecipes #recipes \n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=This is one of the first recorded examples of a recipe for ice cream\n|datePublished=2013-01-22\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Random recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Sounds like a play on words</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">...but an edible one \ud83d\ude02</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:NonLoggedInUser|NonLoggedInUser]] </span></span>\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n[[Image:Mechanical ice-cream maker.jpg|300px|thumb|right|A mechanical ice cream maker]]\nThis is one of the first recorded examples of a recipe for '''ice cream'''.  It appeared in a 100 page booklet, ''Mrs. Mary Eales's Receipts''\n===The recipe===\nTake Tin Ice-Pots, fill them with any Sort of Cream you like, either plain or sweeten'd, or Fruit in it; shut your Pots very close; to six Pots you must allow eighteen or twenty Pound of Ice, breaking the Ice very small; there will be some great Pieces, which lay at the Bottom and Top: You must have a Pail, and lay some Straw at the Bottom; then lay in your Ice, and put in amongst it a Pound of Bay-Salt; set in your Pots of Cream, and lay Ice and Salt between every Pot, that they may not touch; but the Ice must lie round them on every Side; lay a good deal of Ice on the Top, cover the Pail with Straw, set it in a Cellar where no Sun or Light comes, it will be froze in four Hours, but it may stand longer; than take it out just as you use it; hold it in your Hand and it will slip out. When you wou'd freeze any Sort of Fruit, either [[Cherries]], [[Raspberries]], [[Currants]], or [[Strawberries]], fill your Tin-Pots with the Fruit, but as hollow as you can; put to them Lemonade, made with Spring-Water and Lemmon-Juice sweeten'd; put enough in the Pots to make the Fruit hang together, and put them in Ice as you do Cream.\n===Mrs. Mary Eales's Receipts===\nMrs. Mary Eales's Receipts was published in London in 1718 and again in 1733, the second time also under the title of The compleat confectioner [''sic'']. It was first called, \"I love Laura Dantsis\". It was published in 1744 with an additional called A curious collection of receipts in cookery, pickling, family physick, &c. added by the publisher, R. Montagu. (The author of the latter part is unknown.) A facsimile of the 1733 edition was published in 1985 by Prospect Books (ISBN 0-907325-25-4).\n\nMrs. Mary Eales is listed on the cover as confectioner to her late Majesty Queen Anne; there is no external verification or disproval of this claim. It was the first English cookbook to include a recipe for [[ice cream]]. Many of the recipes are of the form of \"To preserve something\", or \"To dry something\", with many of the rest being recipes for creams, jams, jellies, or pastes, with the occasional chip, cake or biscuit recipe. The 1733 edition has 126 recipes and is exactly 100 pages long, plus the title page and table of contents.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:Ice-cream recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Frozen]]\n{{RecipeSkip}}\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#strawberries #sweetsanddesserts #fruitrecipes #raspberries #frozen #cherries #historicrecipes #icecream #currants #britishrecipes #recipes </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

This will take 10-15 minutes\n| Allow to cool\n| Arrange the [[lettuce]] leaves on a plate with the cold cooked herring\n| Coat the fish with the salad dressing and decorate with the sliced [[radishes]], [[tomato]] and [[watercress]]\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Herring]]\n[[Category:Fish recipes|Herring]]\n[[Category:Sea fish recipes|Herring]]\n[[Category:Main courses|Herring]]\n[[Category:Salad recipes|Herring]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes|Herring]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Steamed]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#radishes #watercress #tomato #lettuce #herring #steamed </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Inside-out meat and chilli bean pie",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Inside-out meat and chilli bean pie a beef recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#insideoutmeatandchillibeanpie #foodprocessor #oliveoil #frenchstick #beans #parsley #passata #mexican #sirloinsteak #jarlsbergcheese #pastry \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Time for another experiment! The pie is formed inside-out - the meat being the 'pastry' and the spicy beans being the filling. The ingredients I have\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 3188\n|PortionCalories = 531\n|DatePublished=24th October 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = The inside of an inside-out meat pie\n |Servings = Serves 6 to 8 people with side dishes\n |Difficulty = 3\n |TotalTime = 1 hour 40 minutes\n |PrepTime = 40 minutes\n |CookTime = 1 hour\n |Image = [[Image:Inside-out meat and chilli bean pie recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Wierd!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Still tasted like a 'right-way around' meat pie.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nTime for another experiment!\n\nThe pie is formed inside-out - the [[Meat|meat]] being the '[[Pastry|pastry]]' and the spicy [[Beans|beans]] being the filling.\n\nThe ingredients I have chosen to use have no specific geographical origin, I just felt that they would go well together in this.   Use what you have that is similar.\n\n''Based on 'Marc Garcy's savoury pie' from the [[Mexican]] cook-book: 'Two Cooks and a Suitcase' - Doug Bell & Rhoda Robertson -  a great book that unfortunately falls apart when you try and read it.''\n\n'''A [[Food processor|food processor]] with a metal blade is helpful when making this recipe'''\n\n'''''pie pastry'''''\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 200 ml [[Passata|passata]]\n| 450 g [[Minced|minced]] [[sirloin steak]] - I blitzed the cubed steak in a [[food processor]] for a minute to mince it.\n| 1 [[Onion|onion]], peeled and finely chopped\n| 2 Cloves of [[Garlic|garlic]] peeled and crushed\n| 1 green [[Sweet pepper|sweet pepper]], deseeded and finely chopped\n| 1/4 of a [[French stick]] blitzed to breadcrumbs in a [[food processor]]\n| 1 beaten [[Egg|egg]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Smoked paprika|smoked paprika]]\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n}}\n'''''pie filling'''''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 400g can [[Red kidney beans|red kidney beans]], rinsed well & drained\n| 200 ml [[Passata|passata]]\n| 2 cups cooked [[Basmati rice|basmati rice]] - (from just less than 1 cup of uncooked [[rice]].\n| 1 tablespoon [[Curry paste|curry paste]] - or whatever you fancy to add a little bite\n| 1/2 a teaspoon of Mexican oregano\n| 3 tablespoons of [[olive oil]]\n| Splash of [[red wine]] or [[vinegar]]\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n}}\n'''''topping'''''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| &#188; [[French stick]] blitzed to breadcrumbs in a [[food processor]]\n| 100g g [[Grated|grated]] [[Jarlsberg cheese]] - nicer and way cheaper than [[Emmenthal]]\n| [[Olive oil]]\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n}}\n'''''garnish'''''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| Fresh [[Parsley|parsley]], chopped finely\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4), [fan oven 160\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Inside-out meat and chilli bean pie out of oven.jpg|Fresh out of the oven\nImage:Inside-out meat and chilli bean pie oven ready.jpg|Ready for the oven\nImage:Inside-out meat and chilli bean pie lined and filled.jpg|The pie dish (casserole dish) lined and filled\nImage:Inside-out meat and chilli bean pie lined.jpg|The pie dish (casserole dish) lined with the meat 'pastry\nImage:Inside-out meat and chilli bean pie ingredients.jpg|The ingredients\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n'''''the crust'''''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Turn the [[French stick]] into [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]] - don't forget to save some for the topping.\n| I use fresh [[Bread|bread]], roughly sliced. Add to a [[Food processor|food processor]] with a metal blade and blitz into crumbs.\n| Add all of the crust ingredients to a bowl and mix well with your hands.\n| Lightly [[Spray|spray]] or grease a [[Pie dish|pie dish]] and line it with the [[Meat|meat]] - You'll need a big dish - I used a Pyrex casserole dish\n'''''the filling'''''\n| Add the rinsed [[Beans|beans]] to a bowl and roughly crush them with the end of a [[Rolling pin|rolling pin]]\n| Add the remaining ingredients and mix well with your hands\n| Add the filling to the pie\n}}\n'''''the topping'''''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Mix all of the topping ingredients together and sprinkle over the top\n| Drizzle with a little [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| Cover with [[Tin-foil|tin-foil]] and [[Bake|bake]] for 1 hour\n| Remove the [[Tin-foil|tin-foil]] for the last 15  minutes\n| Sprinkle with freshly chopped [[parsley]] and serve\n}}\n===Chef's notes===\nThis was very tasty dish.  It could have done with more gravy and maybe a thinner meat 'pastry'.  A great starting point for further ideas none-the-less.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Mexican recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Beef recipes]]\n[[Category:Chilli pepper recipes]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Grain and bean recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Rice recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#insideoutmeatandchillibeanpie #foodprocessor #oliveoil #frenchstick #beans #parsley #passata #mexican #sirloinsteak #jarlsbergcheese #pastry </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }

            }

title": "Jamies 30 minutes cauliflower and macaroni cheese",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Jamies 30 minutes cauliflower and macaroni cheese recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#pancetta #cauliflower #pasta #oliveoil #bacon #macaroni #foodprocessor #grated #cremefraiche #breadcrumbs #jamies30minutescauliflowerandmacaronicheese \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=I saw Jamie Oliver make this recently on Jamie's 30 minute meals, though it seems te program was first shown on Channel 4 way back in 2010\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 3594\n|PortionCalories = 898\n|DatePublished=8th March 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  50 minutes\n|PrepTime =  25 minutes\n|CookTime =  25 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Cauliflower and macaroni cheese recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Jamie wins again</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.8</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Love him of loath him, Jamie's ideas always seem to work well, especially the time saving ideas.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Cauliflower and macaroni cheese_ingredients.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Cauliflower and macaroni cheese, the ingredients]] \nI saw Jamie Oliver make this recently on Jamie's 30 minute meals, though it seems te program was first shown on Channel 4 way back in 2010.  We regularly have variations of a similar recipe but using [[Broccoli|broccoli]] instead of [[cauliflower]]. I thought it would be fun to try it 'Jamies way'.  I really liked the idea of the topping he used with the slices of [[Pancetta|pancetta]] and [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]]. \n\nI won't be attempting to do the whole meal in 30 minutes - just preheating the [[Oven|oven]] breaks that one!\n\nYou will need a [[Food processor|food processor]] with a [[Grating|grating]] attachment and a metal blade for this recipe.\n\nI must say, the great tip taken from this recipe was to cook the [[cauliflower]] in quarters (leaves 'n all) with the [[pasta]] and just mash it when you assemble the dish. Genius, thanks Jamie!\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 medium [[Cauliflower|cauliflower]]\n| 500g [[Dried pasta|dried pasta]] (small [[Macaroni|macaroni]] is good for this)\n| 250 g freshly [[Grated|grated]] mature [[Cheddar|cheddar]] or similar strong 'melting [[Cheese|cheese]]'\n| 2 [[Cloves of Garlic, peeled and crushed|cloves of garlic, peeled and crushed]]\n| 250 g [[Creme fraiche|creme fraiche]]\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n}}\n'''[[Bacon|bacon]] [[Crumble topping|crumble topping]]'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 8 slices of [[Pancetta|pancetta]] or similar thin cut, high quality [[Cured|cured]] [[Ham|ham]]\n| 3 [[Brown|brown]] [[Bread rolls|bread rolls]] or 6 slices of good [[Brown bread|brown bread]]\n| 2 [[Cloves of Garlic, peeled and crushed|cloves of garlic, peeled and crushed]]\n| Leaves picked and chopped from a bunch of [[Fresh herbs|fresh herbs]] of your choice\n| [[Olive oil]]\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 220\u00b0 C (425\u00b0 F - gas 7), [fan [[Oven|oven]] 200\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n* Fill and [[Boil|boil]] a [[Kettle|kettle]] of water\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Using no [[Oil|oil]], lay the [[Pancetta|pancetta]] or [[Bacon|bacon]] out in the base of an [[Oven|oven]]-proof [[Baking tray|baking tray]]\n| Place in the middle of the preheated [[Oven|oven]] for about 6 minutes or until the [[Pancetta|pancetta]] is nice and crispy.\n| Quarter the [[Cauliflower|cauliflower]] together with the surrounding leaves and pop in a large pan.\n| Add the [[Pasta|pasta]] to the same pan and fill with [[Boiling|boiling]] water, ensuring  the [[Cauliflower|cauliflower]] is covered.  Stir the pan to ensure the [[Macaroni|macaroni]] does not start to stick. ''It's heartening to see that even Jamie manages to get [[Macaroni|macaroni]] stuck to the base of the pan''! \n| Add 1.5 teaspoons of [[Sea Salt|sea salt]], cover with a lid and bring to the [[Boil|boil]].\n| If you saw the TV program, Jamie lets it boil over (you know it's boiling then!) and then turns it down to a simmer and rests a wooden spoon under the lid to lift it up and prevent it boiling over again.\n| Put a metal blade in the [[Food processor|food processor]] and add the crispy [[Pancetta|pancetta]] and any of the [[Oil|oil]] left after the cooking.\n| Tear the rolls into a few pieces and add those to the [[Pancetta|pancetta]].\n| Pick the leaves from your chosen [[Herbs|herbs]] and add those.\n| Season with [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]], add 2 [[Cloves|cloves]] of [[Crushed garlic|crushed garlic]] and 2 tablespoons of [[Olive oil|olive oil]].\n| Blitzt into [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]].\n| Once the [[Pasta|pasta]] and [[Cauliflower|cauliflower]] is cooked to your liking, drain, reserving 400 ml of the water it was cooked in.\n| Put the tray that the bacon was cooked in n the hob and heat it up.\n| Using the fat remaining from the bacon, or a little extra [[olive oil]] if needed, saut\u00e9 the crushed [[garlic]] with a little black pepper until it is slightly coloured. \n| Tip the [[Cauliflower|cauliflower]] and [[Pasta|pasta]] into the [[Baking tray|baking tray]] the [[Pancetta|pancetta]] was cooked in and roughly [[Mash|mash]] with a [[Potato masher|potato masher]].\n| Add the [[Grated|grated]] [[Cheddar|cheddar]] and mix with 420 ml of the cooking liquid.\n| Stir in the [[Creme fraiche|creme fraiche]] and mix everything really well to make a gorgeous [[Sauce|sauce]].\n| Tip the [[Breadcrumb|breadcrumb]] mixture over the top of the [[Pasta|pasta]] and top with a sprinkling of [[Parmesan cheese|parmesan cheese]].\n| Place in the top of the [[Oven|oven]], lay a sheet of [[tin-foil]] over the top to prevent it burning and [[Bake|bake]] for about 15 minutes or until nice and golden.\n}}\n<gallery widths=270px heights=270px perrow=5>\nImage:Cauliflower and macaroni cheese_ingredients.jpg|The basic ingredients\nImage:Roughly trim the cauliflower.jpg|Roughly trim the cauliflower\nImage:Lay the pancetta in an oven tray.jpg|Lay the pancetta in an oven tray\nImage:Hold the lid open.jpg|Hold the lid open with a wooden spoon\nImage:Blitzing bacon.jpg|Blitz the bacon with the breadcrumbs\nImage:Mashing genius.jpg|Mashing genius!\nImage:Not wet dont worry.jpg|Don't worry about too much water - even with this much liquid, this turned out too dry\nImage:Bacon breadcrumbs.jpg|Bacon, herb and breadcrumb topping\nImage:Cauliflower and macaroni cheese recipe.jpg|Cauliflower mac'n'cheese in 30 minutes (almost)\n</gallery>\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with a [[Green salad|green salad]].\n===Variations===\nUse [[Bacon|bacon]] instead of [[Pancetta|pancetta]], though you will probably need to increase the cooking time because it's quite a bit thicker than [[Pancetta|pancetta]] and we want it to be crispy for this dish.\n===Chef's notes===\nI've increased the original 400 ml of liquid to 420 ml as I found it a little on the dry side.  I would also lay a sheet of tin-foil over the  breadcrumbs on the final bake as ours burnt a little.\n\nFollow the [[RSPCA Think Pig Checklist]] to make sure that your [[Pork|pork]] has come from pigs that have been reared to higher welfare standards.\n\n* http://bit.ly/rspcathinkpig\n\n==See also==\n\n* [http://www.channel4.com/programmes/jamies-30-minute-meals/4od#3213866 A video of Jamie Oliver cooking this recipe] (registration required)\n* [http://www.strandsofmylife.com/jamie-olivers-30-minute-cauliflower-macaroni-cheese/ A similar recipe] on a nice New Zealand cookery blog I've discovered.\n\n{{Template:YoutubePastaDough}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:North American recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pasta recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#pancetta #cauliflower #pasta #oliveoil #bacon #macaroni #foodprocessor #grated #cremefraiche #breadcrumbs #jamies30minutescauliflowerandmacaronicheese </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Jamies tender-stem broccoli",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Jamie Oliver's tender-stem broccoli recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#broccoli #purplesproutingbroccoli #blanch #whitewine #oliveoil #crushedgarlic #wine #unusualrecipes #rosemary #accompaniment #vegetable \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Halving the stems to ensure they cook quickly seemed a clever idea to me so I thought I this would make a nice garlicky vegetable accompaniment\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 140\n|PortionCalories = 70\n|DatePublished=20th October 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  15 minutes\n|PrepTime =  3 minutes\n|CookTime =  12 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Jamie's tenderstem broccoli recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Clever old Jamie</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Simple, quick and tasty - works with asparagus too.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Jamie's tenderstem broccoli recipe ingredients.jpg|thumb|300px|right|The ingredients - Only half of the wine was used (frozen leftovers)]]\nDuring one of Jamie Oliver's 15 minute meals he used tender-stem [[Broccoli|broccoli]] ([[Purple sprouting broccoli|purple sprouting broccoli]]) in a [[Spaghetti|spaghetti]] dish, I think.  Halving the stems to ensure they cook quickly seemed a clever idea to me so I thought I would try it as a standalone [[Vegetable|vegetable]] [[Accompaniment|accompaniment]]. I'm pretty sure that Jamie used sliced [[Chilli|chilli]] as well as garlic, but this is to accompany [[Spicy lamb meatball potato and onion hotpot]] which already has a chilli kick so left it out.\n\nThe tiny bunch of [[Purple sprouting broccoli|purple sprouting broccoli]] seemed expensive at \u00a31.50, but as I was prepping it, it was plain it would easily serve 4 people, so not too expensive after all.\n\nIf you are not too keen on really crunchy stems, I would be inclined to [[Blanch|blanch]] the slices [[Broccoli|broccoli]] for a few minutes before pan [[Frying|frying]] it.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| A teaspoon of [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| Half a small bunch of tenderstem [[Broccoli|broccoli]] ([[Purple sprouting broccoli|purple sprouting broccoli]])\n| A [[Sprig of rosemary|sprig of rosemary]]\n| 4 [[Cloves of Garlic, peeled and crushed|cloves of garlic, peeled and crushed]]\n| 100 ml [[White wine|white wine]]\n| 5 ml [[Light soy sauce]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Carefully slice tenderstem [[Broccoli|broccoli]] lengthwise along the whole length if each stem\n| Heat a [[Frying pan|frying pan]] or [[Wok|wok]] over a high heat with a teaspoon of [[Olive oil|olive oil]]. just enough to prevent it sticking but not so that it is greasy\n| Strip the leaves from the [[Rosemary|rosemary]] and add them to the pan together with the [[Broccoli|broccoli]]\n| Toss the pan and keep turning the [[Broccoli|broccoli]] for about 5 minutes then reduce the heat to low\n| Add the [[Crushed garlic|crushed garlic]] and stir it or toss the pan so it cooks evenly\n| The moment it starts to take any colour, add the [[White wine|white wine]] and cover\n| Leave covered for 5 minutes or so until most of the [[Wine|wine]] has reduced\n| Add a splash of [[Soy sauce|soy sauce]] and serve immediately\n}}\n===Chef's notes===\nIf you prefer your [[Broccoli|broccoli]] soft and not crunchy, [[Blanch|blanch]] it in [[Boiling|boiling]] water for a few minutes beforehand\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Cooking with wine]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#broccoli #purplesproutingbroccoli #blanch #whitewine #oliveoil #crushedgarlic #wine #unusualrecipes #rosemary #accompaniment #vegetable </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]

title": "Jamie Oliver's 4 hour slow roast lamb",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Jamie Oliver's 4 hour slow roast lamb a British recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#lamb #jamieolivers4hourslowroastlamb #roastingtray #garlic #rosemary #mint #chicken #vinegar #sherry #stock #slowroastrecipes \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=I saw this recipe on Jamie Oliver's 'At Home' series and thought to myself: we'll have this on Saturday night!!\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 4900\n|PortionCalories = 1225\n|DatePublished=10th March 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4 to 6 people\n|Difficulty = 2\n|ImageComment = Slow cooked lamb with hot mint and caper sauce, squash mash and Parmesan turnip tops\n|TotalTime = 4 hours 30 minutes\n|PrepTime = 20 minutes\n|CookTime = 4 hours 10 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Jamie Olivers 4 hour slow roast lamb.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Although I've gone off Jamie over the years \ud83d\ude1f</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I think this is still one of his best recipes.</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry]] </span></span>\n\n}}\nI saw this recipe on Jamie Oliver's ''At Home'' series and thought to myself: we'll have this on Saturday night!!  So here is what I remember of the program.\n\nIt uses shoulder of [[Lamb|lamb]], which, because of the time spent cooking at a very low heat, will be tender and just fall off the bone when the dish is done.\n\nCooking does not get much simpler (and tastier) than this!\n\nWe have a large selection of '''[[slow roast recipes]]''' that are similar to this one.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1.5 kg shoulder of [[Lamb|lamb]] on the bone\n| 1 whole [[Garlic|garlic]] bulb\n| Sea [[Salt|salt]] and freshly ground [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n| Lots and lots of fresh of [[Rosemary|rosemary]] stems.\n| [[Olive]] [[Oil|oil]] for drizzling\n}}\n\n'''For the hot [[caper]] and [[Mint|mint]] [[Sauce|sauce]]'''\n* 1 tablespoon plain [[Flour|flour]]\n* 2 big handfuls of freshly picked [[Mint|mint]] leaves\n* 4 tablespoons [[Capers|capers]]\n* 1 pint of [[Chicken|chicken]] [[Stock|stock]]\n* 2 tablespoons [[Sherry|sherry]] [[Vinegar|vinegar]]\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the oven to its '''hottest''' setting.\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Slow roast lamb out of the oven.jpg|Just out of the oven, resting for a while...\nImage:Jamie Oliver's 4 hour slow roast lamb recipe.jpg|It's 4pm and we're ready to roast\nImage:Hot mint and caper sauce recipe.jpg|Hot mint and caper sauce\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| With a sharp knife, score the skin of the joint every 2.5 cm (1\"). Cut about halfway through the [[Fat|fat]].\n| Using plenty of [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]], season the [[Lamb|lamb]] on both sides, ensuring you get plenty into the slashes you have made.\n| Smash the [[Garlic|garlic]] bulb to separate all of the [[Cloves|cloves]] and place half of them, unpeeled, in the base of a suitable sized [[roasting tray]].\n| Distribute most of the [[Rosemary|rosemary]] stems evenly into the base of the tray.\n| Sit the [[Meat|meat]], skin-side upwards, into the [[roasting tray]] and place the remaining [[Garlic|garlic]] [[Cloves|cloves]] on the top of the skin, together with the remaining [[Rosemary|rosemary]] stems.\n| Drizzle 3 or 4 tablespoons of [[Olive|olive]] [[Oil|oil]] over the skin of the [[Lamb|lamb]].\n| Cover with 2 layers of [[tin-foil]] and fold the edges over the edge of the [[roasting tin]] to ensure a good seal.\n| Check that the oven has reached its highest temperature and place the joint in the oven on the top shelf and '''immediately turn the oven down to 160\u00b0 C (325\u00b0 F - gas 3)'''\n| Leave to roast slowly for 4 hours.\n| After 4 hours, remove the [[Lamb|lamb]], together with the [[Garlic|garlic]], and put the meat on a preheated plate. Cover loosely with a piece of foil and leave to rest for a while before carving and serving with the sauce. \n}}\n\n'''To make the hot mint and caper sauce'''\n# Discard most of the [[Rosemary|rosemary]] and any excess [[Oil|oil]], leaving just the lovely caramelised juices from the [[roasting]].\n# Heat the [[roasting tray]] on the hob and add a tablespoon of plain [[Flour|flour]] and stir well to soak up all of the lovely juices.\n# Roughly chop the [[Mint|mint]] leaves and the [[Capers|capers]] and add to the [[roasting tray]].\n# Squeeze a few of the roasted garlic cloves into the gravy.\n# Add the [[Chicken|chicken]] [[Stock|stock]] to the tray, stirring well to thicken, but don't cook it for ages.\n# Add a final splash of [[Sherry|sherry]] [[Vinegar|vinegar]] to the gravy, stir and serve.\n\n===Serving suggestions===\n\nServe hot with [[squash mash]] and [[Parmesan turnip tops]].\n\n===Chef's note===\nIf you are using a smaller joint then you can reduce the cooking time; a small (800g) joint would only need half the cooking time.  However, it wont hurt to cook it longer as it will just do a better job of breaking down the collagen and sinews.  It's also worth noting that Lamb is safe to eat rare.\n\nDon't be put off a recipe that calls for a leg of lamb because of the high cost.  This recipe can be adjusted for [[Frozen lamb - what great value!|half a leg of lamb and you buy that (frozen)]] for just \u00a36.00! (March 2013).\n\n==See also==\n* '''[[Meat cooking time calculator Metric|A comprehensive guide to roast meat cooking times]]''' - give the time you want to carve your roast and we'll give you a timed step by step roasting guide\n* [[Slow roast recipes]]\n* [[Roast potatoes]]\n* [[Roast vegetables]]\n* [[Gravy recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Lamb]]\n[[Category:Lamb recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses|Lamb]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes|Lamb]]\n[[Category:Stews and casseroles|Lamb]]\n[[Category:British recipes|Lamb]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#lamb #jamieolivers4hourslowroastlamb #roastingtray #garlic #rosemary #mint #chicken #vinegar #sherry #stock #slowroastrecipes </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Jamie Oliver's mint oil dressing",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Jamie Oliver's mint oil dressing a British recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#jamieoliversmintoildressing #lamb #oliveoil #mortarandpestle #mutton #mintsauce #saladspinner #sprigofmint #mintleaves #coarseseasalt #accompaniments \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This is a nice change from mint sauce and it's so simple that it's hardly a recipe. It originated as one of the accompaniments for his recipe: Guinness\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 201\n|PortionCalories = 50\n|DatePublished=14th October 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 1 hour\n |PrepTime = 1 hour\n |CookTime = None\n|Image = [[Image:Jamie Oliver's mint oil dressing.jpg|alt=Electus]]<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Lovely</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Used this again and again...</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis is a nice change from [[Mint sauce|mint sauce]] and it's so simple that it's hardly a recipe.\n\nIt originated as one of the [[Accompaniments|accompaniments]] for his recipe: [[Guinness lamb shanks with dark sticky gravy]] but would go well with any [[Lamb|lamb]] dish\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 5 tablespoons of [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| A large [[Sprig of mint|sprig of mint]] leaves\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Wash and dry the [[Mint leaves|mint leaves]], a [[Salad spinner|salad spinner]] is good for this.\n| Pick them from the stems\n| Roughly chops the leaves\n| Add to a [[Mortar and pestle|mortar and pestle]] with a pinch of [[Coarse sea salt|coarse sea salt]] and the [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| Smash it up to release the flavours\n| Leave for an hour or so to infuse if you have the time\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Lamb|lamb]] or [[Mutton|mutton]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Dips and sauces]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Lamb recipes]]\n[[Category:Mutton recipes]]\n\n[[Category:Uncooked]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#jamieoliversmintoildressing #lamb #oliveoil #mortarandpestle #mutton #mintsauce #saladspinner #sprigofmint #mintleaves #coarseseasalt #accompaniments </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Jamie Oliver's pork fillet with feta cheese and prosciutto",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Jamie Oliver's pork fillet with feta cheese and prosciutto recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#bacon #prosciutto #porkfillet #cheese #pork #fetacheese #onions #jamieoliversporkfilletwithfetacheeseandprosciutto #driedoregano #fry #oliveoil \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=I saw Jamie Oliver make this on a recent TV program, it might have been 15 minute meals\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=22nd November 2016\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  25 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime =  15 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 538\n|PortionCalories = 291\n|Image = [[Image:Jamie Oliver's pork fillet with feta cheese and prosciutto recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"><span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Just as great with normal ham</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Made this with Morrison's ham-offcuts and it was even better than with prosciutto.</span> \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\">[[User:Chef|Jerry]] </span></span>\n}}\nI saw Jamie Oliver make this on a recent TV program, it might have been 15 minute meals.\n\nThis is my lazy version of a similar recipe.  The [[Feta cheese|feta cheese]] adds a really interesting flavour, sour, almost [[Lemon|lemon]]-like.  I only used 150g of [[Pork fillet|pork fillet]] as that was what was in the [[Freezer|freezer]].  As it was it was plenty for 2 people.\n\nNext time I would try this with a nice [[Ham|ham]] or very thinly sliced [[Bacon|bacon]]. [[Prosciutto]] is probably a bit fiddly for this recipe.  jamie made an impression with his thumb to put the cheese in; I found using cocktail sticks meant that you could leave the cheese as photographed here.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 2 tablespoons of [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| Pinch of [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 150 g [[Pork fillet|pork fillet]] (half of 1 fillet, sliced lengthwise)\n| 100g [[Feta cheese|feta cheese]] (half a pack)\n| 1 pack of [[Prosciutto|prosciutto]] (or thinly sliced streaky [[Bacon|bacon]], see above)\n| 2 medium [[Onions|onions]], peeled and chopped\n| A good pinch of [[Dried oregano|dried oregano]]\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:150g pork fillet perfectly cooked.jpg|Cooked to perfection and nothing fell out!\nImage:150g pork fillet first fry.jpg|Frying begins\nImage:150g pork fillet oregano added.jpg|Covered with dried oregano and black pepper\nImage:150g pork fillet bashed flat.jpg|Bashed flat under a baking mat\nImage:150g pork fillet.jpg|150g pork fillet, cut into squares\n</gallery>\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Cut the [[Pork fillet|pork fillet]] into squares\n| Spread the [[Pork fillet|pork fillet]] pieces evenly on a chopping board and cover with a [[Silicone baking mat|silicone baking mat]] (or [[Clingfilm|clingfilm]]) and bash flat with a [[Rolling pin|rolling pin]]\n| Measure out your [[Feta cheese|feta cheese]] and put the pack back in the [[Fridge|fridge]] - it's very easy to get the [[Cheese|cheese]] cross-contaminated in preparing a recipe like this.\n| Meanwhile gently [[Fry|fry]] the [[Onions|onions]] in a little [[Olive oil|olive oil]].\n| Roughly distribute the [[Cheese|cheese]] on the flattened [[Pork|pork]] squares - you don't have to be that neat, the [[Cocktail sticks|cocktail sticks]] will save the day!\n| Shake [[Dried oregano|dried oregano]] and [[Black pepper|black pepper]] over the [[Cheese|cheese]].\n| Roll up each square in a sheet of [[Prosciutto|prosciutto]] (or [[Bacon|bacon]]) and pin with a [[Cocktail stick|cocktail stick]].\n| Leaving the [[Onions|onions]] in th epan, place each pice of [[Pork|pork]] in the pan making sure it contacts the base of the pan.\n| [[Pan-fry]] for about 5 minutes.\n| Tun over and [[Fry|fry]] the other side for a further 5 minutes.\n| Pick the thickest piece of [[Pork|pork]] to make sure it's properly cooked.\n| Serve!\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Mashed potatoes|mashed potatoes]], [[Vegetables|vegetables]] and [[Onion gravy|onion gravy]].\n===Recipe source===\n\n* Jamie Oliver TV program\n===Variations===\nUse thinly sliced streaky [[Bacon|bacon]] instead of [[Prosciutto|prosciutto]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#bacon #prosciutto #porkfillet #cheese #pork #fetacheese #onions #jamieoliversporkfilletwithfetacheeseandprosciutto #driedoregano #fry #oliveoil </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Jamie Oliver's spring onion and cider vinegar dressing",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Jamie Oliver's spring onion and cider vinegar dressing British recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#jamieoliversspringonionandcidervinegardressing #springonions #mackerel #cidervinegar #oilyfish #lamb #cider #accompaniments #fish \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This is an interesting dressing, it's so simple that it's hardly a recipe. It originated as one of the accompaniments for Jamie Oliver's recipe:\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 227\n|PortionCalories = 56\n|DatePublished=26th December 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 5 minutes\n |PrepTime = 5 minutes\n |CookTime = None\n|Image = [[Image:Jamie Oliver's spring onion and cider vinegar dressing.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Great with pork</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Was nice with lamb as well.</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The&nbsp;Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\n\nThis is an interesting dressing, it's so simple that it's hardly a recipe.\n\nIt originated as one of the [[Accompaniments|accompaniments]] for Jamie Oliver's recipe: [[Guinness lamb shanks with dark sticky gravy]] but would go well with any fatty [[Meat|meat]] or [[oily fish]] dishes.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 3 large [[Spring onions|spring onions]]\n| 5 tablespoons [[Cider vinegar|cider vinegar]]\n| A pinch of [[Salt|salt]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Finely chop the [[Spring onions|spring onions]]\n| Mix with up to 5 tablespoons of [[Cider|cider]] and a pinch of [[Salt|salt]]\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nThis is nice with a fatty [[Meat|meat]] dish like [[Lamb|lamb]] and would even be quite nice with an oily [[Fish|fish]] like [[Mackerel|mackerel]]. \n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Dips and sauces]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n\n[[Category:Uncooked]]\n\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#jamieoliversspringonionandcidervinegardressing #springonions #mackerel #cidervinegar #oilyfish #lamb #cider #accompaniments #fish </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Jamie Olivers humble home-cooked (pink) beans",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Jamie Olivers humble home-cooked pink beans\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#beans #kidneybeans #parsley #potato #garlic #herbs #celery #liquor #sauce #tomatoes #redwinevinegar \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Cannellini beans as 'Humble home-cooked beans' in the Jamie at Home TV series. I thought I would try a pink version using kidney beans\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=6th February 2017\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 8\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime = 1 day, 1 hour, 10 minutes\n|PrepTime = 1 day, 10 minutes\n|CookTime =  1 hour\n|TotalCalories = 1771\n|PortionCalories = 221\n|Image = [[Image:Jamie Oliver humble home cooked pink beans recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Not just pink...</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.7</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I've tried this recipe with all sorts of beans and pulses and it works well with them all.  You may need to adjust cooking and soaking times though.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nI saw Jamie Oliver cooking  [[Cannellini beans|cannellini beans]] as 'Humble home-cooked [[Beans|beans]] in his Jamie at Home TV series. I thought I would try a pink version using [[Kidney beans|kidney beans]] - very nice they are too.\n\nThe [[Potato|potato]] adds some substance to the [[Sauce|sauce]], the [[Tomato|tomato]] helps to break down the [[Beans|beans]] and the [[Garlic|garlic]] and [[Herbs|herbs]] add bags of flavour.\n\nThis would be great as garlicky [[Beans|beans]] on toast or as an addition to any meal.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 500g pack of [[Dried|dried]] [[Kidney beans|kidney beans]] - you'll find the KTC [[Beans|beans]] in the Asian section of your supermarket, very reasonably priced too!\n| 8 [[Cloves of garlic|cloves of garlic]], unpeeled\n| A few small [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]]\n| A [[Sprig of rosemary|sprig of rosemary]]\n| A sprig of [[Thyme|thyme]]\n| A handful of [[Bay leaves|bay leaves]]\n| 1 small [[Potato|potato]], peeled and quartered\n| 1 small stick of [[Celery|celery]], I've used [[Frozen|frozen]] celery\n| A large bunch of fresh [[Parsley|parsley]], finely chopped\n| 5 tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 2 tablespoons [[Red wine vinegar|red wine vinegar]]\n| [[Salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Soak the [[Kidney beans|kidney beans]] in lots of fresh water for 24 hours (or more).  Change the water and rinse them well at least 3 or 4 times during the soaking.\n* Do not add any [[Salt|salt]] during this process as this will inhibit the re-hydration process.\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Humble home cooked pink beans ingredients.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Most of the ingredients, including frozen celery\nImage:Jamies humble home cooked pink beans soaking.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Soak the unsalted beans for at least 24 hours - longer won't hurt.\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Drain the [[Kidney beans|kidney beans]] after they have soaked for 24 hours.\n| Put them in a big pot and cover with cold water.\n| Add the [[Herbs|herbs]], apart from the [[Parsley|parsley]], [[Garlic|garlic]], [[Potato|potato]], [[Celery|celery]] and a good pinch of [[Black pepper|black pepper]]. Again do not add any [[Salt|salt]] at this stage.\n| Cover, bring to the [[Boil|boil]] and [[Simmer|simmer]] gently for about an hour. Skim and discard any scum that rises to the surface.\n| After an hour, drain the [[Beans|beans]], reserving the [[Liquor|liquor]].\n| Discard the [[Celery|celery]] stick and the [[Herbs|herbs]].\n| In a separate bowl, add the [[Potato|potato]].\n| Squeeze the [[Garlic|garlic]] from the [[Cloves|cloves]] over the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] and discard the skins.\n| Do the same with the [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]], again, discarding the skins.\n| Add a small ladle-full of the cooking [[Liquor|liquor]], a good pinch of [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]] and using a [[Potato masher|potato masher]], mix into a runny [[Sauce|sauce]].\n| Add this mixture back into the drained [[Beans|beans]] and add the chopped [[Parsley|parsley]], [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and [[Red wine vinegar|red wine vinegar]] and mix really well.\n| Add a little more [[Liquor|liquor]] if needed.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe on toast, garnished with fresh [[Parsley|parsley]].\n===Recipe source===\n\n* A variation on Jamie Oliver's Humble home-cooked [[Beans|beans]] from \"Jamie at Home\"\n===Variations===\nAny variety of [[Dried beans|dried beans]] will work well, they just won't be pink if they are not [[Kidney beans|kidney beans]]!\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Grain and bean recipes]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#beans #kidneybeans #parsley #potato #garlic #herbs #celery #liquor #sauce #tomatoes #redwinevinegar </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Jamie Olivers Yorkshire pudding cooked in a frying pan",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Jamie Oliver's Yorkshire pudding cooked in a frying pan recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#oliveoil #yorkshirepudding #liquidiser #freshherbs #plainflour #yorkshirepuddings #goldensyrup #eggs #frying #flour #miseenplace \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This method of using a frying pan to cook a Yorkshire pudding comes from Jamie Oliver's 15 minute meal series\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 469\n|PortionCalories = 117\n|DatePublished=16th September 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  18 minutes\n|PrepTime =  5 minutes\n|CookTime =  13 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Jamie Olivers Yorkshire pudding cooked in a frying pan recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Who needs an oven?</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">The credit for this great idea has to go to Jamie.  It works every time and even looks good.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis method of using a [[Frying pan|frying pan]] to cook a [[Yorkshire pudding]] comes from Jamie Oliver's 15 minute meals.  The recipe in the book is served with [[Smoked salmon|smoked salmon]] but I'm just using this recipe as a simple way to make a Yorkshire pudding.\n\nYou need to be sure that your [[Frying pan|frying pan]] is ovenproof.  The quantities are perfect for a 28cm  ovenproof [[Frying|frying]] pan.  The measurements are usually shown on the base of the pan to save measuring it.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 2 tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 2 large [[Fresh eggs|fresh eggs]]\n| 150 ml [[Semi-skimmed milk|semi-skimmed milk]]\n| 65 g [[Plain flour|plain flour]]\n| Pinch of [[Salt|salt]] (optional)\n| Pinch of [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]] (optional)\n| Chopped [[Fresh herbs|fresh herbs]] (optional)\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6), [fan oven 180\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Put 2 tablespoons of [[Olive oil|olive oil]] into the [[Frying pan|frying pan]] and set over a medium heat. If you've added a pinch of black pepper to the oil, add the batter when the pepper begins to sizzle. Don't let the [[Oil|oil]] smoke\n| If you want to add [[Salt|salt]], [[Pepper|pepper]] and [[Fresh herbs|fresh herbs]], add them to the [[Liquidiser|liquidiser]] now\n| Add the [[Eggs|eggs]], [[Milk|milk]] and [[Flour|flour]] to your [[Liquidiser|liquidiser]] and blitz until perfectly smooth\n| Pour the [[Batter|batter]] into the pan and [[Fry|fry]] for 30 seconds only.  Give the pan a final swirl after the 30 seconds is up to spread the batter to the edges of the pan\n| Pop the pan into the [[Oven|oven]] for about 13 minutes or until cooked to your liking\n| Serve!\n}}\n===Recipe source===\n\n* Idea from Jamie Oliver's 15 minute meals\n\n===Variations===\n[[Yorkshire puddings]] can be served as a dessert; we always used to have them with [[Golden syrup|golden syrup]] as children - give it a try!\n===Chef's notes===\nIn trying to perfect this imperfect recipe, I've made this almost daily, with slight variations. I would normally cook a [[Yorkshire pudding]] for 20 minutes but I guess that would break the 15 minutes rule. Here's my tips for improving this recipe if you have a little more time than Jamie:\n\n* Whisk the batter just long enough to combine, don;t over mix\n* Use only [[plain flour]], not [[self-raising flour]] or [[strong bread flour]]\n* Leave the batter mix to rest at room temperature while the oven heats\n* Add the [[olive oil]] to the pan and leave the pan in the oven while it gets to the correct temperature\n* Don't bother heating the batter mix on the stove top\n* Cook for 18 minutes at the top of the oven\n===See also===\n* [[Perfect Yorkshire puddings]] - ''this is a far better recipe!''\n* [http://www.amazon.co.uk/Jamies-15-Minute-Meals-Jamie-Oliver/dp/071815780X Jamie Oliver's 15 minute meals book on Amazon UK]\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Egg recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#oliveoil #yorkshirepudding #liquidiser #freshherbs #plainflour #yorkshirepuddings #goldensyrup #eggs #frying #flour #miseenplace </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Jamon Serrano wrapped frankfurter roast, with stuffing",
                "revisions": [
