                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Jamon Serrano wrapped frankfurter roast, with stuffing recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#stuffing #serranoham #boiling #beef #gravy #frankfurters #broccoli #roast #jamonserranowrappedfrankfurterroastwithstuffing #potatoes #roastpotatoes \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Most UK supermarkets now sell Serrano Hams for a very reasonable \u00a330. This strange sounding recipe is one way I found to use it.\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=29th December 2016\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  45 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  30 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 3011\n|PortionCalories = 1505\n|Image = [[Image:Jamon Serrano wrapped frankfurter roast, with stuffing recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Love this ham</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Works well with frankfurters too, amazingly!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:NonLoggedInUser|NonLoggedInUser]] </span></span>\n}}\nIf you cannot get [[Jam\u00f3n serrano|Serrano Ham]], any nice looking packaged ham slices would work well in this recipe.\n\nThis strange sounding recipe is one way I found to use it.  I have a [[Bacon slicer|bacon slicer]] so the [[Ham|ham]] can be sliced thinly.  This combination sounds mad but it was really good - almost a [[Roast|roast]] dinner!\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 can of [[Frankfurters|frankfurters]]\n| 6 large slices of [[Serrano ham]]\n| 170g portion of [[Sage and onion stuffing|sage and onion stuffing]] mix\n| 280 ml [[Beef|beef]] [[Gravy|gravy]]\n| 6 medium sized [[Potatoes|potatoes]] ([[Maris Piper]]'s are ideal for [[Roasting|roasting]])\n| 8 [[Broccoli|broccoli]] florets\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6), [fan oven 180\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| If you have an [[Air Fryer]], make [[Air fried roast potatoes]], if not make normal [[Roast potatoes|roast potatoes]].\n| Make up the [[Stuffing|stuffing]] mix as directed on your packet - [170g of stuffing mix to 350ml [[Boiling|boiling]] water in my case - mix and leave for 5 minutes to absorb the water]\n| Lightly [[Oil|oil]] a small [[Baking tray|baking tray]] and spread the [[Stuffing|stuffing]] over the base\n| Drain the [[Frankfurters|frankfurters]] and wrap each one in a sheet of [[Serrano ham]], press each wrapped  [[Frankfurter|frankfurter]] into the bed of [[Stuffing|stuffing]].\n| [[Bake]] for 26 minutes or until the [[Stuffing|stuffing]] is crispy and golden.\n| Make up the [[Gravy|gravy]] (4 teaspoons of [[Beef|beef]] [[Gravy granules|gravy granules]] to 280 ml [[Boiling|boiling]] water)\n| [[Boil]] the [[Broccoli|broccoli]] for 4 to 5 minutes in [[Salted|salted]] [[Boiling|boiling]] water\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Roasted frankfurters with ham and stuffing.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Bed the Franks down into the stuffing\nImage:Air fried roast potatoes cooking.jpg|thumb|300px|right|The best roast potatoes ever, roasting away in the corner\n</gallery>\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Cranberry sauce|cranberry sauce]] for the wierdest [[Roast|roast]] dinner ever.\n===Recipe source===\n\n* An excuse to use up lots of [[Serrano ham]], and a bit of fun.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Air fried recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:German recipes]]\n[[Category:Spanish recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#stuffing #serranoham #boiling #beef #gravy #frankfurters #broccoli #roast #jamonserranowrappedfrankfurterroastwithstuffing #potatoes #roastpotatoes </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Jam roly-poly",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Jam roly-poly, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#brush #castersugar #egg #jamrolypoly #suet #dough #custard #dumplings #raspberry #homemadecustard #kneadingbread \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=With a name like that it just has to be British!! Usually served with English homemade custard!\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2160\n|PortionCalories = 432\n|DatePublished=31st January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 5\n|Difficulty = 2\n|ImageComment = Atora suet logo\n|TotalTime = 1 hour\n|PrepTime = 15 minutes\n|CookTime = 45 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Atora suet.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n}}\n\nWith a name like that it just has to be British!! Usually served with English homemade [[custard]]!\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 250 g (8 oz) [[self-raising flour]]\n| 125 g (4 oz)  [[shredded suet]] - eg: [[Suet|Atora]]\n| 8 tablespoons water\n| 4 tablespoons [[raspberry]] [[jam]]\n| 1 [[egg]], beaten\n| [[Caster sugar]] for dusting\n| [[Milk]] for brushing\n| Pinch of table [[salt]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Preheat the oven to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6 - Moderately hot)\n| In a sieve, sift the [[flour]] into a bowl with the pinch of table [[salt]]\n| Add the water and [[suet]] and [[Kneading bread|knead]] to make a soft, dryish [[dough]] - not sticky\n| Tip the [[dough]] onto a floured surface and roll into a rectangle, about 20 cm x 30 cm (8\" x 12\")\n| Warm the jam for a few seconds in the microwave or over a bowl of hot water so it can be brushed easily\n| [[Brush]] the jam onto the pastry., leaving a 1 cm (1/2\") gap all around the edges\n| [[Brush]] the border with [[milk]]\n| With the short side nearest you, loosely roll up, away from you\n| Lightly pinch the edges to seal\n| Sit the roly-poly (long sealed edge) on a greased baking sheet\n| [[Brush]] with the beaten [[egg]] and sprinkle with [[caster sugar]]\n| [[Bake]] in the oven for 35 to 40 minutes. It should be golden brown when done\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\n\nSprinkle with a little [[caster sugar]] and serve hot with [[homemade custard]]\n===Shelf life===\nI have found that packet suet has a limited shelf life once opened. I thought I was unable to make decent [[dumplings]] until I threw out what turned out to be rancid suet and made them with a fresh packet!\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Too heavy for my tum.</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.3</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">This was fine when I was 12 but now it's just too stodgy for my liking - sorry</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#brush #castersugar #egg #jamrolypoly #suet #dough #custard #dumplings #raspberry #homemadecustard #kneadingbread </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Jazz apple granita",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Jazz apple granita, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#granita #jazzapplegranita #limejuice #freezer #whitewine #jazzapple #brandy #juice #frozen #puree #applebrandy \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A granita made with white wine, apples and lime juice\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 822\n|PortionCalories = 102\n|DatePublished=2nd January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 8\n |Difficulty = 3\n |TotalTime = 8 hours 30 minutes incl freezing time\n |PrepTime = 6 hours, 30 minutes\n |CookTime = None\n |Image = [[Image:Jazz apple granita recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">  <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Apple ice-cream</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Or apple-ice, if that makes more sense?</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\">[[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]] </span></span>}}\nA [[granita]] made with [[white wine]], [[apples]] and [[lime juice]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 300ml (1/2 pint) [[White wine|white wine]] \u2013 eg Riesling or Chardonnay\n| [[Juice]] of 2 [[Limes|limes]] (8 teaspoons juice) \n| 6 Jazz [[Jazz apple|apples]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Sugar|sugar]]\n| 4-6 tablespoons [[Apple brandy|apple brandy]] ([[Calvados]])\n}}\n\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Put the [[Wine|wine]], 300ml (1/2pint) water and the [[Lime juice|lime juice]] in a pan.\n| Peel, core and [[Dice|dice]] the [[Jazz apple|apples]] and mix them in with the [[Sugar|sugar]]. Bring to the [[Boil|boil]] then reduce the heat and [[Simmer|simmer]], covered for about 15 minutes until the apples are soft enough to [[Squash|squash]].\n| Transfer the mixture to a [[Food processor|food processor]] and whiz to make a runny [[Puree|puree]]. Add the [[Brandy|brandy]], whiz again then pour the puree into a plastic tub. Cool at room temperature then cover and put in the [[Freezer|freezer]] for 2-3 hours until nearly solid. \n| Break the iced mixture into chunks and chop into flaky pieces. [[Freeze]] again for another 3 hours or longer.\n}}\n \n===Serving suggestions===\nLet the [[Granita|granita]] soften for about 5 minutes before spooning shavings of it into chilled cocktail or [[shot glasses]], dishes or plates.  Serve with [[Spicy Jazz Apple Crisps]] \n===Chef's notes===\nThe [[Granita|granita]] will keep in the [[Freezer|freezer]] for 3 months.\n\n{{Soft ice cream}}\n\n===Recipe source===\n\n* http://www.jazzapples.co.uk/\n\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Ice-cream recipes]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Cooking with wine]]\n[[Category:Frozen]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#granita #jazzapplegranita #limejuice #freezer #whitewine #jazzapple #brandy #juice #frozen #puree #applebrandy </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

#jewelledcheddarandapplefestivewreathsalad #turkey #cranberries #walnut #pomegranate #balsamicvinegar #driedcranberries #nuts \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A rather stunning and definitely September 2016\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 6\n|Difficulty = 3\n|TotalTime =  20 minutes\n|PrepTime =  20 minutes\n|CookTime = None\n|TotalCalories = 152\n|PortionCalories = 913\n|Image = [[Image:Jewelled Cheddar and apple festive wreath salad recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span unusual wreath-shaped [[Salad|salad]] recipe from [[South Caernarfon Creameries]], the award-winning [[Welsh cheese]] makers.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 large bag of [[Salad|salad]] leaves\n| 1 crisp eating [[Apple|apple]], cored and cut into thin slices and tossed in [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]]\n| 1 large [[Pomegranate|pomegranate]] deseeded\n| 50g [[Dried cranberries|dried cranberries]]\n| 1 heaped tablespoon [[Pumpkin seeds|pumpkin seeds]] or chopped [[Nuts|nuts]]\n| 120g crumbled [[Dragon mature Welsh cheddar cheese]]\n}}\n====dressing====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 3 tablespoons [[Extra slices on the [[Salad|salad]] leaves\n| Sprinkle over the [[Cheese|cheese]] and [[Walnut|walnut]] halves, top with [[Pomegranate seeds|pomegranate seeds]] and [[Cranberries|cranberries]]\n| Mix together the [[Salad dressing|salad dressing]] and drizzle over the [[Salad|salad]]. Season to taste\n| Serve immediately\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Dragon mature Welsh cheddar cheese.jpg|thumb|300px|right|[http://www.dragonwales.co.uk/products/cheddar/mature/ Dragon mature Welsh cheddar cheese]\nImage:Dragon reduced fat mature Welsh cheddar cheese.jpg|thumb|300px|right|[http://www.dragonwales.co.uk/products/cheddar/mature-reduced-fat/ Dragon reduced fat mature Welsh cheddar cheese]\n</gallery>\n===Serving suggestions===\nPerfect with cold [[Ham|ham]] or left-over [[Turkey|turkey]]\n===Variations===\nFor a lower-calorie version, try [[Dragon reduced fat mature Welsh cheddar cheese]].\n\n{{Template:Dragon cheese attribution}}\n==See also==\n* [[Dragon mature Welsh cheddar cheese]]\n* [[Dragon reduced fat mature Welsh cheddar cheese]]\n* [[South Caernarfon Creameries]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Salad recipes]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n[[Category:Uncooked]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n[[Category:Dragon cheese recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#salad #apple #southcaernarfoncreameries #jewelledcheddarandapplefestivewreathsalad #turkey #cranberries #walnut #pomegranate #balsamicvinegar #driedcranberries #nuts </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",

                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Gluten free Kale and sausage soup recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#simmer #chickpeas #onion #carrots #grill #redpepper #butter #sweat #curlykale #soup #stock \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A heartwarming winter sausage and vegetable soup that is also gluten free\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 3654\n|PortionCalories = 913\n|DatePublished=22nd October 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  50 minutes\n|PrepTime =  20 minutes\n|CookTime =  30 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Kale and sausage soup GF recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Any GF sausages are as good</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">And probably cheaper \ud83d\ude00</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Perfect-cumberland-sausages.png|300px|thumb|right|[[Debbie and Andrew's Perfect Cumberland Pork Sausages]]]]\nA heartwarming winter [[Soup|soup]] that is also [[Gluten free|gluten free]].\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 pack [[Debbie and Andrew's Perfect Cumberland Pork Sausages]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Vegetable oil|vegetable oil]]\n| 1 [[Onion|onion]], peeled and chopped\n| 2 [[Cloves garlic, crushed|cloves garlic, crushed]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Ground cinnamon|ground cinnamon]]\n| Half a teaspoon of [[Ground allspice|ground allspice]]\n| 2 [[Carrots|carrots]], peeled and sliced\n| 1 [[Red pepper|red pepper]], deseeded and chopped\n| 1 litre [[Chicken stock|chicken stock]]\n| 125g fresh [[Curly kale|curly kale]], stems discarded and leaves roughly chopped\n| 2 x 400g cans [[Chickpeas|chickpeas]], drained and rinsed\n| [[Salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Grill|grill]]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| [[Grill]] the [[Sausages|sausages]] for 20 minutes or so, until cooked through. Turn often to ensure even colouring. When cool enough to handle, cut into thick slices and put to one side.\n| Now heat the [[Oil|oil]] in a large [[Saucepan|saucepan]] over a medium heat, add the [[Onion|onion]] and [[Sweat|sweat]] until soft and golden. Stir in the [[Garlic|garlic]], [[Cinnamon|cinnamon]] and [[Allspice|allspice]].\n| Add the [[Carrots|carrots]] and [[Red pepper|red pepper]] to the pan, then stir in the [[Stock|stock]]. Bring to the [[Boil|boil]], then reduce the heat and [[Simmer|simmer]] for 10 minutes, partially covered.\n| Add the [[Kale|kale]] to the pan and [[Simmer|simmer]] for a further 10 minutes until all the [[Vegetables|vegetables]] are tender.\n| Stir in the [[Chickpeas|chickpeas]] and [[Sausage|sausage]] slices, warm through, then serve with [[Bread|bread]] and [[Butter|butter]].\n}}\n==See also==\n\n* [[Udi's Gluten Free Products]] for gluten free bread and baking.\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Soup and stock recipes]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Gluten free recipes]]\n[[Category:Grain and bean recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Debbie&andrew's sausage recipes]]\n[[Category:Grilled, griddled or barbecued]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n{{Template:DebbieAndAndrew attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#simmer #chickpeas #onion #carrots #grill #redpepper #butter #sweat #curlykale #soup #stock </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Kid's party sausage kebabs with potato salad",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Kids party sausage kebabs with potato salad recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#kebabs #skewers #barbecue #barbecuesauce #newpotatoes #saladcream #butter #dill #bacon #sausages #sausage \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Looking for food for a kids barbecue party? This sausage recipe is ideal; why not get them to help building their own kebabs?\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1346\n|PortionCalories = 336\n|DatePublished=24th October 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  45 minutes\n|PrepTime =  30 minutes\n|CookTime =  15 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Kid's party sausage kebabs with potato salad recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Kids, and a barbecue?</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">2.5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I can see that going well. \ud83d\ude33</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Carla_Cancio-Bello,_J.D.,_on_behalf_of_Cuban_Cuisine_UK|Carla]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Perfect-pork.png|300px|thumb|right|[[Debbie and Andrew's Perfect Pork sausages]]]]\nLooking for food for a kids [[Barbecue|barbecue]] party?  This [[Sausage|sausage]] recipe is ideal; why not get them to [[Help|help]] building their own [[Kebabs|kebabs]]?\n\nThis easy recipe comes to [[Cookipedia]] courtesy of [[Debbie&andrew's sausages|debbie&andrew's sausages]].\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 600g [[New Potatoes|new potatoes]]\n| 2 packs [[Debbie and Andrew's Perfect Pork sausages]] cut in half\n| 2 [[Red onions|red onions]], peeled and cut into chunks\n| 2 [[Red peppers|red peppers]], seeds removed and cut into chunks\n| 12 rashers of streaky [[Bacon|bacon]], cut in half\n| 25 ml [[Barbecue sauce]]\n| 2 tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Butter|butter]]\n| [[Salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Salad cream|salad cream]]\n| 1 handful fresh [[Dill|dill]], chopped\n| 12 wooden [[Skewers|skewers]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Soak your wooden [[Skewers|skewers]] in water for 20 minutes then drain and put to one side\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| .Halve all the [[Sausages|sausages]] and put those to one side too. Preheat your [[Barbecue|barbecue]] to a medium heat.\n| Bring a pan of [[Salted|salted]] water to the [[Boil|boil]] and cook the [[New Potatoes|new potatoes]] for 15 minutes until tender.\n| Thread the [[Sausages|sausages]], [[Onion|onion]], [[Pepper|pepper]] and [[Bacon|bacon]] onto the [[Skewers|skewers]] and then [[Brush|brush]] with [[Barbecue sauce|barbecue sauce]].\n| Cook the [[Kebabs|kebabs]] on your [[Barbecue|barbecue]] for 10 minutes, turning occasionally.\n| When the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] are cooked, drain and roughly crush with a fork. Stir in [[Butter|butter]], [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]], [[Salad cream|salad cream]] and [[Dill|dill]].\n| Serve the [[Kebabs|kebabs]] at once with a spoon of [[Potato salad|potato salad]] on the side and more [[Barbecue sauce|barbecue sauce]] if you wish.\n}}\n===Chef's notes===\nYou could of course cook the [[Kebabs|kebabs]] on a normal [[Oven grill|oven grill]].\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Greek recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Salad recipes]]\n[[Category:Debbie&andrew's sausage recipes]]\n[[Category:Grilled, griddled or barbecued]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n{{Template:DebbieAndAndrew attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#kebabs #skewers #barbecue #barbecuesauce #newpotatoes #saladcream #butter #dill #bacon #sausages #sausage </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Kidneys turbigo",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Kidneys turbigo, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#kidneysturbigo #kidneys #sausages #butter #sherry #onions #shallots #sherryvinegar #mushrooms #tomatopuree #bayleaf \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=I remember my mum used to cook kidney turbigo when we were small children and I even remember it being spicy\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1809\n|PortionCalories = 301\n|DatePublished=19th January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 6\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime = 1 hour 10 minutes\n|PrepTime = 15 minutes\n|CookTime = 55 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Kidneys turbigo recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">My first ever 'curry'</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.7</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Back in the 60's, this was the first 'curry' I ever remember tasting! Thanks Mum!  x</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Kidneys turbigo ingredients.jpg|thumb|300px|right|The ingredients]]\nI remember my mum used to cook [[kidney]] turbigo when we were small children and I even remember it being spicy.  This is as close to her recipe that I have been able to get to the recipe she used to make.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 12 [[Shallots|shallots]]\n| 50 g (2 oz) [[Butter|butter]]\n| Olive oil for frying\n| 6 lambs [[Kidneys|kidneys]], washed, skinned, cored and cut into small chunks\n| 1 pack of thin chipolata sausages (about 340 g)\n| 150 g fresh [[button mushrooms]], quartered\n| 2 teaspoons [[Plain flour|plain flour]] \n| 1 teaspoon [[Tomato puree|tomato puree]]\n| 1 tablespoons of [[Sherry|sherry]]\n| 1 tablespoon of [[Sherry vinegar|sherry vinegar]]\n| 284 ml (1/2 pint) [[Beef stock|beef stock]]\n| Good splash of [[Louisiana hot pepper sauce]] or [[Tabasco sauce]]\n| 1 [[Bay leaf|bay leaf]]\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 2 tablespoons freshly chopped [[Parsley|parsley]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| [[Blanch]] the [[Shallots|shallots]] in [[Boiling|boiling]] [[Salted|salted]] water for 2 minutes, drain and peel - it's easier after they have been blanched. Set aside.\n| Heat a splash of [[olive oil]] in a pan and [[saut\u00e9]] the [[Kidneys|kidneys]] and [[sausages]] on a fairly high heat until [[Browned|browned]] all over. Lift out the kidneys and sausages with a slotted spoon and set aside. I prefer to discard the juice and fat at this stage.\n| Give the pan a wipe round, add 50 g of [[butter]] and add the [[Onions|onions]] and [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]]. [[Saut\u00e9]] for 5 minutes, stirring often.\n| Leaving the [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]] and [[Onions|onions]] in the pan, remove it from the heat and stir in the [[Flour|flour]].\n| Deglaze the pan with the [[Sherry|sherry]] and the [[Sherry vinegar|sherry vinegar]], add [[Tomato puree|tomato puree]], [[Stock|stock]] and [[Bay leaf|bay leaf]], 1 tablespoon of the [[parsley]] and season to taste with [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]\n| Cut the [[sausages]] in half or smaller pieces if you wish.\n| Return to the heat, bring to the [[Boil|boil]] and return the [[Kidneys|kidneys]] and [[Sausages|sausages]], reduce the heat, cover and [[Simmer|simmer]] for 40 minutes.\n| Discard the bay leaf and serve immediately, sprinkled with the remaining parsley.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nThe classic accompaniment for this dish is fried [[croutons]], but I prefer it with [[Peas|peas]] and [[Mashed potatoes|mashed potatoes]].  Plain [[Tortilla chips|tortilla chips]] would be a nice [[Side dish|side dish]] for this.\n===Variations===\nA few rashers of [[home smoked bacon]] added with the sausages would go well with this. \n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Lamb recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Offal recipes]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Stews and casseroles]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Stewed, braised or pot roasted]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#kidneysturbigo #kidneys #sausages #butter #sherry #onions #shallots #sherryvinegar #mushrooms #tomatopuree #bayleaf </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

Use to dust parsnips and carrots before roasting them. Also good in bean stews and\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 12\n|PortionCalories = 12\n|DatePublished=25th October 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Spices with a smile!\n |Servings = Servings: 1 - Makes a small jar of kitchen [[Pepper|pepper]]\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 10 minutes\n |PrepTime = 10 minutes\n |CookTime = None\n |Image = [[Image:Spices with a smile.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Surprisingly good</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">It packs quite a punch too!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:NonLoggedInUser|NonLoggedInUser]] </span></span>\n}}\nYou may see this mentioned in some historic recipe books.  Use to dust [[Parsnips|parsnips]] and [[Carrots|carrots]] before [[Roasting|roasting]] them.  \n\nAlso good in [[Bean|bean]] [[Stews and casseroles|stews and casseroles]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1 tablespoon [[Black peppercorns|black peppercorns]]\n| 2 whole [[nutmegs]]\n| 3 teaspoons [[Ginger powder|ginger powder]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Anise|anise]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Coriander seeds|coriander seeds]]\n| 2 tablespoons [[Clove buds|clove buds]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Cover the nutmegs with a strong [[Tea|tea]]-towel and smash with a [[Rolling pin|rolling pin]]\n| Add all the [[Spices|spices]] and the [[Nutmeg|nutmeg]] shards to a [[Coffee grinder|coffee grinder]] and reduce to a powder\n| Store in an airtight container for up to 4 months\n}}\n===Chef's notes===\nIf you cannot get [[Anise|anise]], use an equivalent amount of anise-like [[Spices|spices]] such as [[Fennel|fennel]], star-anise, [[Aniseed myrtle|aniseed myrtle]], etc.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Marinades dressings and butters]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Uncooked]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#spices #anise #kitchenpepper #coffeegrinder #parsnips #stewsandcasseroles #aniseedmyrtle #fennel #gingerpowder #nutmeg #rollingpin </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Kohlrabi coleslaw",

                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Kohlrabi coleslaw recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#grated #carrots #parsley #redonions #kohlrabi #mayonnaise #kohlrabicoleslaw #pumpkinseeds #bread #uncookedcoleslawkohlrabi #cheese \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Kohlrabi is a much underused vegetable in the UK and so when I spotted one in a Polish grocery shop, I decided to use it as an alternative to cabbage\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 255\n|PortionCalories = 31\n|DatePublished=11th May 2015\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 8\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  10 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime = None\n|Image = [[Image:Kohlrabi coleslaw recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Different!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Nice use for kohlrabi, an underused vegetable</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry, aka Chef]])</span></span>\n}}\n[[Kohlrabi]] is a much underused [[Vegetable|vegetable]] in the UK and so when I spotted one in a Polish grocery shop, I decided to use it as an alternative to [[Cabbage|cabbage]] in [[Coleslaw|coleslaw]]\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 300g [[Carrots|carrots]], coarsely [[Grated|grated]]\n| 300g [[Kohlrabi|kohlrabi]], coarsely [[Grated|grated]]\n| 150g [[Red onions|red onions]], coarsely [[Grated|grated]]\n| 25g [[Pumpkin seeds]] (optional)\n| [[Italian]] [[Parsley|parsley]] (finely chopped), to taste\n| [[Mayonnaise]], to taste\n| Seasoning\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Mix the [[Grated|grated]] [[Vegetables|vegetables]] in a bowl\n| Add [[Mayonnaise|mayonnaise]] to taste and then the [[Pumpkin seeds|pumpkins seeds]], if using\n| Stir in the [[Parsley|parsley]], ensuring you have sufficient to add plenty of colour\n| Season to taste\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe chilled with other [[Salads|salads]] or with [[Bread|bread]] and [[Cheese|cheese]]\n===Variations===\nAdd other [[Seeds|seeds]] of your choice.\n===Chef's notes===\nI used a mixture of [[Carrots|carrots]], yellow, purple, pale [[Orange|orange]] and normal orange.  Purple ones tend to also contain orange, so [[Red onions|red onions]] add a bit more colour.  Keep [[Refrigerated|refrigerated]] before serving.  I grated the vegetables with a 6mm grater, but they can also be sliced.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Coleslaw kohlrabi]]\n[[Category:British recipes|Coleslaw kohlrabi]]\n[[Category:German recipes|Coleslaw kohlrabi]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments|Coleslaw kohlrabi]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites|Coleslaw kohlrabi]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes|Coleslaw kohlrabi]]\n[[Category:Salad recipes|Coleslaw kohlrabi]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes|Coleslaw kohlrabi]]\n[[Category:Student recipes|Coleslaw kohlrabi]]\n[[Category:Uncooked|Coleslaw kohlrabi]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#grated #carrots #parsley #redonions #kohlrabi #mayonnaise #kohlrabicoleslaw #pumpkinseeds #bread #uncookedcoleslawkohlrabi #cheese </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Lamb and beetroot casserole",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Lamb and beetroot casserole a British recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#lambandbeetrootcasserole #carawayseeds #lamb #onions #simmer #diced #parsley #beetroot #tomatopuree #oliveoil #vegetablestock \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A colourful main course stew. Ideal for cold winter evenings\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 3257\n|PortionCalories = 814\n|DatePublished=21st January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 2 hours 30 minutes\n |PrepTime = 15 minutes\n |CookTime = 2 hours 15 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Lamb and beetroot stew.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Great for the beetroot season</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.7</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I'm always wondering how to use up our beetroot glut.  This is a fine idea.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nA colourful main course stew.  Ideal for cold winter evenings.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 3 tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 800 g boned [[Lamb|lamb]] shoulder, roughly [[Diced|diced]]\n| 2 medium [[Onions|onions]], peeled and finely chopped\n| 700 g fresh [[Beetroot|beetroot]], peeled and roughly [[Diced|diced]]\n| 1.5 tablespoons [[Tomato puree|tomato puree]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Caraway seeds|caraway seeds]]\n| 1 litre of [[Vegetable stock|vegetable stock]] or water\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n}}\n''' To garnish'''\n* Big handful of [[Parsley|parsley]], chopped\n* 150 ml [[Greek yogurt]]\n\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Heat the [[Oil|oil]] in a lidded casserole or [[Dutch oven]]\n| [[Brown]] the [[Lamb|lamb]] pieces all over\n| Remove and reserve the [[Meat|meat]], retaining as much of the [[Oil|oil]] as you can\n| Add the [[Onions|onions]], lower the heat a little and saut\u00e9 until translucent, about 8 minutes.\n| Put the [[Meat|meat]] back in the pot, add the [[Tomato puree|tomato puree]], [[Beetroot|beetroot]], [[Stock|stock]], [[Caraway seeds|caraway seeds]], [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]] and mix well\n| Cover and gently [[Simmer|simmer]] for 1.5 hours.\n| If the gravy is still very liquid then remove the lid and [[Simmer|simmer]] for another 30 minutes\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Lamb and beetroot casserole - cooked.jpg|thumb|right|300px|Cooked and reduced\nImage:Lamb and beetroot casserole ready for the oven.jpg|thumb|right|300px|Ready for the oven\n</gallery>\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with crusty [[Bread|bread]], garnished with [[Parsley|parsley]] and a dollop of [[Yogurt|yogurt]]\n==See also==\n* [[Beetroot recipes|Our favourite beetroot recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Lamb recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#lambandbeetrootcasserole #carawayseeds #lamb #onions #simmer #diced #parsley #beetroot #tomatopuree #oliveoil #vegetablestock </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Lamb Bangers and Sweet Potato Mash",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Lamb Bangers and Sweet Potato Mash a British recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#mash #sweetpotatoes #onions #potatoes #simmer #butter #balsamic #boil #groundcumin #sausages #lambbangersandsweetpotatomash \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A nice variation on bangers and mash\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1851\n|PortionCalories = 462\n|DatePublished=21st January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Sweet potato and squash mash\n |Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 50 minutes\n |PrepTime = 15 minutes\n |CookTime = 35 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Sweet potato and squash mash.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Where's the bangers?</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I see only orange mash.</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Sue_spins|Susie]] </span></span>\n}}\n\nA nice variation on [[Bangers|bangers]] and [[Mash|mash]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 500g [[Sweet potatoes|sweet potatoes]], peeled and cut into even-sized chunks \n| 300g floury [[Potatoes|potatoes]], peeled and cut into even-sized chunks \n| &frac14; teaspoon [[Ground cumin|ground cumin]] \n| 50g [[Butter|butter]] \n| 1 tablespoon [[Olive oil|olive oil]] \n| 8 [[Lamb|lamb]] [[Sausages|sausages]] \n| 1 jar [[Belazu]] [[Balsamic]] [[Onions|onions]] in [[Balsamic vinegar|balsamic vinegar]] \n| 1 tablespoon [[Redcurrant jelly|redcurrant jelly]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Place the [[Sweet potatoes|sweet potatoes]] and floury [[Potatoes|potatoes]] in a large saucepan and cover with water. \n| Bring to the [[Boil|boil]] and [[Simmer|simmer]], covered, for 15-20mins, until fully cooked and tender. \n| Drain and return to the pan. \n| [[Mash]] the potatoes and stir in the [[Ground cumin|ground cumin]] and [[Butter|butter]] until smooth. \n| Season with [[Salt|salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]] and keep warm.\n| Meanwhile, heat the [[Oil|oil]] in a large [[Frying pan|frying pan]] over a medium heat, and cook the [[Sausages|sausages]] for 5 mins on each side. Add the [[Onions|onions]] with their [[Balsamic|balsamic]] liquor and bring to the [[Boil|boil]]. Lower the heat and [[Simmer|simmer]] for 5 mins until the sausages are cooked and [[Sauce|sauce]] reduced. \n| Stir in the [[Redcurrant jelly|redcurrant jelly]] and season to taste. \n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\n* Serve with the [[Sweet potato|sweet potato]] [[Mash|mash]] and some [[Blanched|blanched]] [[Spinach|spinach]].\n(''Essentials magazine'')\n===Variations===\nIf like me, you're not so keen on [[Sweet potatoes|sweet potatoes]], try using any variety of [[Squash|squash]] instead.  The [[Cooking times|cooking times]] will be similar.\n\n{{Template:Belazu attribution}}\n\n===Belazu products used in this recipe===\n* [http://www.mybelazu.com/details/balsamic-onions.html Belazu Balsamic onions]\n\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Belazu recipes]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Lamb recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#mash #sweetpotatoes #onions #potatoes #simmer #butter #balsamic #boil #groundcumin #sausages #lambbangersandsweetpotatomash </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }

title": "Lamb fillet kebabs",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Lamb fillet kebabs, Greek recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#lambfilletkebabs #oliveoil #salad #grill #pittabreads #chilipowder #lemonjuice #brush #barbecue #redonion #lamb \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=So simple to make, this is hardly a recipe\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1688\n|PortionCalories = 844\n|DatePublished=27th July 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  6 hours, 20 minutes\n|PrepTime =  6 hours, 10 minutes\n|CookTime =  10 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Lamb fillet kebabs recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">And the best lamb fillet?</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">It comes from Russell' The Butchers, in Upwell. The best there is - I can even hear them in the mornings! Baaaa!</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nSo simple to make, this is hardly a recipe.  I think these are much nicer if they are given time to [[Marinade|marinade]], but you could cook them immediately if you were pushed for time.\n\nI've used [[Tex-Mex mix]] as the spicy base for these, but any mix of [[Spices|spices]] would be fine.  If using [[Chili powder|chili powder]], just use a level teaspoon or they might be too hot.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 [[Lamb tenderloin|lamb tenderloin]] fillet\n| 2 tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 2 tablespoons of [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]]\n| 2 teaspoons [[Tex-Mex mix]] or 1 [[Scant|scant]] teaspoon [[Chili powder|chili powder]] and a pinch of [[Mixed herbs|mixed herbs]]\n| Pinch of [[Salt|salt]]\n| [[Freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 1 small [[Red onion|red onion]], halved\n| 2 halved [[Sweet peppers|sweet peppers]] (different colours) - use the remains in your [[Salad|salad]]\n}}\n'''to serve'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 180g Mixed [[Salad|salad]]\n| 4 [[Pitta breads]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat the [[Grill|grill]] or [[Barbecue|barbecue]]\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Lamb fillet kebabs, grilled.jpg|Lamb fillet kebabs, grilled\nImage:Lamb fillet kebabs, ready to grill.jpg|Lamb fillet kebabs, ready to grill\nImage:Lamb fillet medallions, marinading.jpg|Lamb fillet medallions, marinading\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Chop the tenderloin fillets into about 16 medallions\n| Place them in a [[Lock and Lock box]] together with the [[Olive oil|olive oil]], [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]], [[Tex-Mex mix]], [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]\n| Shake viperously for a minute\n| Place in the [[Fridge|fridge]] for 6 hours or so\n| Make up the [[Skewers|skewers]] using the marinaded [[Lamb|lamb]], [[Onion|onion]] and [[Bell peppers|bell peppers]]\n| [[Brush]] with a little extra [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and [[Grill|grill]] for about 10 minutes under a hot [[Grill|grill]] or [[Barbecue|barbecue]].\n| Turn once during cooking and [[Brush|brush]] with [[Olive oil|olive oil]] once more\n| [[Rest for]] 5 minutes before serving\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Pitta breads|pitta breads]] and a mixed [[Salad|salad]]\n===See also===\n* [[Russell's Butchers of Upwell, Norfolk]]\n\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Greek recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Grilled, griddled or barbecued]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#lambfilletkebabs #oliveoil #salad #grill #pittabreads #chilipowder #lemonjuice #brush #barbecue #redonion #lamb </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }

title": "Lamb hot pot",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Lamb hot pot, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#lambhotpot #butter #diced #vegetables #rosemary #garlic #stock #potatoes #celery #carrots #stewedbraisedorpotroasted \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Lamb hot pot recipe British potato recipes from The cook's Wiki\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 4670\n|PortionCalories = 1167\n|DatePublished=22nd January 2013\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 1 hour 35 minutes\n |PrepTime = 20 minutes\n |CookTime = 1 hour 15 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Lamb hot pot recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"><span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Perfumed heaven</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">The garlic and rosemary make this!</span> \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\">[[User:Chef|Jerry]] </span></span>\n}}\nClassic lamb recipe.\n{{FindAlbertBartlett}}\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 2 [[Carrots]] finely [[Diced|diced]] \n| 2 [[Celery]] Sticks finely [[Diced|diced]] \n| 2 [[Onions]] finely [[Diced|diced]] \n| 1 clove of [[Garlic|garlic]] crushed \n| 2 sprigs of [[Rosemary]] \n| 75g [[Butter]] \n| 4 Large Chump Chops \n| 150ml [[White wine|white wine]] \n| 650ml Good [[Lamb]] or [[Beef Stock|beef stock]] \n| 8 Rooster [[Potatoes]] thinly sliced \n| [[Salt]] & [[Pepper]]\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat [[Oven|oven]] to 180\u00b0C / Gas Mark 4.\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Lightly cook the [[Vegetables|vegetables]], [[Garlic|garlic]] and [[Rosemary|rosemary]] in 50g of [[Butter|butter]], remove from pan and keep to one side.  \n| Melt the remaining [[Butter|butter]] in the pan and [[Brown|brown]] the chops on each side, remove from pan. \n| Add the [[Wine|wine]], [[Boil|boil]] and reduce until almost dry add the [[Stock|stock]] and bring to the boil. \n| Place the chops into a shallow [[Braising|braising]] dish, cover with the [[Vegetables|vegetables]] and season with [[Salt|salt]] & [[Pepper|pepper]]. \n| Lay the sliced [[Potatoes|potatoes]] overlapping onto the chops, pour over the hot [[Stock|stock]], place into [[Oven|oven]] and cook for 1 hour [[Basting|basting]] the potatoes every 15 minutes.\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Albert Bartlett recipes]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Lamb recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes]]\n[[Category:Stews and casseroles]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Stewed, braised or pot roasted]]\n{{Template:Albert Bartlett attribution}}\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#lambhotpot #butter #diced #vegetables #rosemary #garlic #stock #potatoes #celery #carrots #stewedbraisedorpotroasted </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }

title": "Lamb shanks in porter with dark sticky gravy",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Lamb shanks in porter with dark sticky gravy | Cookipedia recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#lambshanks #porter #oliveoil #mintleaves #springonions #rosemary #onions #worcestershiresauce #lambshanksinporterwithdarkstickygravy #mintoil #casseroledish \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Another cooker-top slow cooked lamb recipe. This one from Jamie Oliver's new book: &quot;Jamie's Great Britain&quot; uses lamb shanks. After hours cooking they just fall apart!\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2576\n|PortionCalories = 644\n|DatePublished=21st January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 4 hours\n |PrepTime = 20 minutes\n |CookTime = 3 hours 40 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Guinness lamb shanks with dark sticky gravy recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Superb</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">This was as good as it looks!</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nAnother cooker-top slow cooked [[Lamb|lamb]] recipe. This one from Jamie Oliver's new book: \"Jamie's Great Britain\" uses [[Lamb shanks|lamb shanks]]. After 3 hours cooking they just disintegrate and soak up the sticky sweet gravy - wonderful!\n\nI've adapted the recipe for 4 people and like to serve it with [[Squash mash|squash mash]], [[Spring onions|spring onions]] and [[Jamie's mint oil]].\n\nJamie comes up trumps again with this book, a big [[Coffee|coffee]] table hardback, full of neat twists on standard recipes.  It's a bit pricey at \u00a330, but you can probably find a copy for less than a tenner if you shop around: \n*\"Jamie's Great Britain\" - Jamie Oliver: ISBN 978-0718156817\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| [[Olive oil]] for saut\u00e9ing \n| [[Sea Salt|Sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 3 [[Red onions|red onions]], peeled and chopped\n| A large handful of dried mixed fruit ([[Raisins|raisins]], [[Sultanas|sultanas]] & [[Dried apricots|dried apricots]])\n| 2 heaped tablespoons of chunky [[Marmalade|marmalade]]\n| 1 tablespoon of Heinz [[Tomato sauce|tomato sauce]]\n| 1.5 tablespoons [[Worcestershire sauce]]\n| 200 ml [[Porter]], [[Guinness]] or [[Brown ale|brown ale]]\n| 4 [[Lamb shanks|lamb shanks]]\n| 4 sprigs of fresh [[Rosemary|rosemary]] (see ingredients photo)\n| 500 ml [[Chicken stock|chicken stock]]\n}}\n''' to serve'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| Any of [[mashed potato recipes|these mashed potato recipes]]\n}}\n''' to garnish'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| A Large [[Sprig of mint|sprig of mint]] leaves\n| 5 tablespoons of [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 3 large [[Spring onions|spring onions]]\n| 5 tablespoons [[Cider vinegar]]\n| A handful of [[Mint leaves|mint leaves]], picked from the stems\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Guinness lamb shanks with dark sticky gravy ingredients.jpg|[[Porter]] [[Lamb shanks|lamb shanks]] with dark sticky [[Gravy|gravy]]; the basic ingredients\nImage:Jamie Oliver's spring onion and cider vinegar dressing.jpg|[[Jamie Oliver's spring onion and cider vinegar dressing]]\nImage:Jamie Oliver's mint oil dressing.jpg|[[Jamie Oliver's mint oil dressing]]\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n'''[[Mint oil]]'''\n''Make this now so it has time to infuse''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Add the chopped picked [[Mint leaves|mint leaves]] to a [[Mortar and pestle|mortar and pestle]] with a good pinch of [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and crush well\n| Mix with 5 tablespoons of [[Olive oil|olive oil]], set to one side\n'''[[Porter]] [[Lamb shanks|lamb shanks]] in sweet gravy'''\n| A a slug of [[Olive oil|olive oil]] to a large metal pan, add a good grind of [[Black pepper|black pepper]], heat the [[Oil|oil]] and add the [[Onions|onions]] and a pinch of [[Salt|salt]].\n| Saut\u00e9 for 5 or 6 minutes until they have take some colour.\n| Lower the heat a little and stir in the [[Porter]], [[Dried fruit|dried fruit]], [[Marmalade|marmalade]], tomato sauce and [[Worcestershire sauce]] - leave a little Porter to de-glaze the [[Frying pan|frying pan]] later. \n| Mix well and keep it [[Simmering|simmering]] while you [[Brown|brown]] off the [[Lamb shanks|lamb shanks]]\n| [[Brown]] the [[Lamb shanks|lamb shanks]], two at a time in a large [[Frying pan|frying pan]]. Use a little little [[Olive oil|olive oil]] to start them off.\n| Keep turning them until they have take some colour and add the [[Browned|browned]] shanks to the [[Onions|onions]] when they are done.\n| Add a little more [[Oil|oil]] and saut\u00e9 the [[Rosemary|rosemary]] sprigs, being careful not to burn them.\n| Add the whole [[Rosemary|rosemary]] sprigs to the [[Casserole dish|casserole dish]], de-glaze the pan with the last drop of [[Porter]] and pour it all into the [[Casserole|casserole]].\n| Place a lid on the [[Casserole dish|casserole dish]] and simmer quite vigorously for about 3 hours. Turn the shanks about halfway through, being careful not to let them break up.\n| Carefully remove the cooked shanks and keep warm.\n| Remove the [[rosemary sprigs]] and discard.\n| Whizz the gravy mixture into a smooth sauce using a [[food processor]] or a [[stick blender]].\n| return to the heat and reduce the gravy by about half.  This might take up to 15 minutes but it's better to reduce and concentrate the flavour rather than ny adding a [[thickening agent]].\n}}\n'''Mashed potatoes'''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Allow up to 40 minutes to cook your [[Mashed potatoes]]\n}}\n'''Spring onion dressing'''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Finely chop 3 [[Spring onions|spring onions]], mix with a pinch of [[Salt|salt]] and up to 5 tablespoons [[Cider vinegar|cider vinegar]]\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe on a bed of [[Squash mash|squash mash]], sprinkled with the [[Spring onion|spring onion]] dressing and [[mint oil]], dressed with a sprinkling of [[Mint leaves|mint leaves]].\n===Variations===\nServe with [[celeriac mash]].\n===Chef's notes===\nThe original recipe used 1 litre of stock and 200 ml Porter (for 6), even so I would think that was too much.  I used a total of 850 ml and that was really more than was needed - it took a vigorous 15 minute reduction to get it any where close to sticky.  \n\nMaking it again, as long as the casserole was not too large, I would sit the shanks thick-side down, add the [[ale]] and then top-up with enough stock to the cover the start of the bone.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Lamb recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Stewed, braised or pot roasted]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#lambshanks #porter #oliveoil #mintleaves #springonions #rosemary #onions #worcestershiresauce #lambshanksinporterwithdarkstickygravy #mintoil #casseroledish </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",

                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Lamb stock; a  recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#fat #lamb #bones #lambstock #stock #pints #boil #simmer #bayleaf #boiledorsimmered #roast \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=stocks are a fiddle to make and this, I'm afraid is no exception. However, if you want a recipe for restaurant quality lamb stock, this is it. Freeze in..\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}}\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2799\n|PortionCalories = 699\n|DatePublished=21st January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Frozen stock\n|Servings = Serves 4 - Makes 2 [[Pints|pints]] of [[Lamb|lamb]] [[Stock|stock]]\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime = 5 hours incl. cooling time\n|PrepTime = 1 hour, 20 minutes\n|CookTime = 3 hours 40 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Chicken stock recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"><span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Freezing...Clever idea!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.7</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Makes it easy to re-use stock</span> \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\">[[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Stock|Stock]]s are a fiddle to make and this, I'm afraid is no exception. However, if you want a recipe for restaurant quality [[Lamb|lamb]] stock, this is it.  Freeze in plastic or paper vending-type coffee cups and you won't have to use an [[stock cubes]] for months!\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 900 g (2 lb) [[Lamb|lamb]] [[bones]] and [[Meat|meat]] trimmings with any excess [[Fat|fat]] removed. This calls for a trip to your friendly [[local butcher]]!\n| Half an an [[Onion|onion]], peeled and chopped\n| 1 [[Carrot|carrot]], peeled and chopped\n| 1 stick of [[Celery|celery]], with leaves, chopped\n| 4 [[Button mushrooms|button mushrooms]], brushed clean and halved\n| 2.25 [[Litres|litres]] (4 [[Pints|pints]]) of cold water\n| 1 sprig of [[Thyme|thyme]]\n| 1 [[Sprig of mint|sprig of mint]]\n| 2 Cloves of [[Garlic|garlic]], with skins, smashed\n| 1 [[Bay leaf|bay leaf]]\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the [[oven]] to  204\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - Gas 6)\n\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Place the [[bones]] in  a large [[Roasting tray]] and [[roast]] for 40 minutes\n| Drain any [[Fat|fat]] and reserve\n| Add the [[bones]] and the remaining ingredients to the largest pan you have, bring to the [[Boil|boil]], reduce the heat and [[Simmer|simmer]] uncovered for 3 hours, skimming any scum or surface [[Fat|fat]] as it appears\n| Allow to cool slightly and strain being careful not to disturb the ingredients or force them through the sieve\n| Allow to cool properly and remove the remaining surface [[Fat|fat]]\n| Refrigerate or freeze in plastic coffee cups until required\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Lamb recipes]]\n[[Category:Soup and stock recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#fat #lamb #bones #lambstock #stock #pints #boil #simmer #bayleaf #boiledorsimmered #roast </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }

title": "Lancashire Hot-Pot",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Lancashire Hot-Pot, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#potatoes #lancashirehotpot #kidneys #onions #mutton #vegetables #stock #butter #rootvegetables #lamb #herbs \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A meat and potato casserole. This recipe is from The Main Cookery Book (edition unknown, but c.1939). It was first published in 1929\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2311\n|PortionCalories = 577\n|DatePublished=19th January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 2 hours 15 minutes\n |PrepTime = 15 minutes\n |CookTime = 2 hours\n |Image = [[Image:Lancashire hot-pot recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"><span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Can't beat the origianls</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.8</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">The original, and the best.</span> \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\">[[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nA [[Meat|meat]] and [[Potato|potato]] casserole.  This recipe is from ''The Main Cookery Book'' (edition unknown, but ''c''.1939).  It was first published in 1929.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1 lb [450 g] neck of [[mutton]]\n| 2 [[Onions|onions]]\n| 2 [[Sheep|sheep]]'s [[Kidneys|kidneys]]\n| &frac12; pint [280 ml] warm water [or [[stock]]]\n| 2 lb [900 g] [[Potatoes|potatoes]]\n| Seasoning\n| &frac12; oz [15 g] melted [[butter]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Skin and core the [[Kidneys|kidneys]], and cut the [[Meats|meats]] into small neat pieces.\n| Wash, peel and slice the [[Potatoes|potatoes]], and slice the [[Onions|onions]].\n| Line the casserole with a layer of these [[Vegetables|vegetables]].\n| Season well and fill the casserole with layers of [[Meat|meat]], [[Vegetables|vegetables]] and seasonings.\n| Pour on the water [or stock].\n| Have a layer of [[potatoes]] on top, brush over with a little melted butter, cover with a \"lid\" of buttered paper, or the lid of the casserole, and cook for half-an-hour at fairly hot [220 C/425 F/Gas 7], then for 1&frac12; hours in a slow oven [150 C/300 F/Gas 2].\n| Remove the lid, and continue cooking for a further half hour to [[Brown|brown]] the top layer.\n}}\n===Variations===\nThis is a very traditional and basic recipe.  Nowadays other [[Root vegetables|root vegetables]] and [[Herbs|herbs]] are included and neck of [[Lamb|lamb]] takes the place of [[Mutton|mutton]].\n==See also==\n* [http://www.deliaonline.com/recipes/main-ingredient/lamb/traditional-lancashire-hotpot.html Delia Smith hot pot reicpe]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Lancashire]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes|Lancashire]]\n[[Category:Lamb recipes|Lancashire]]\n[[Category:Main courses|Lancashire]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes|Lancashire]]\n[[Category:Mutton recipes|Lancashire]]\n[[Category:Offal recipes|Lancashire]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes|Lancashire]]\n[[Category:Stews and casseroles|Lancashire]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Stewed, braised or pot roasted]]\n\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#potatoes #lancashirehotpot #kidneys #onions #mutton #vegetables #stock #butter #rootvegetables #lamb #herbs </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]

title": "Large sandwich loaf",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Large sandwich loaf, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#largesandwichloaf #dough #butter #bread #flour #groundnutoil #knead #fridge #driedyeast #baked #yeast \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This loaf is baked in a 1.8kg (4lb) loaf tin and these are produced by Alan Silverwood. Grease the tin well with groundnut oil\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 3011\n|PortionCalories = 301\n|DatePublished=27th October 2012\n|Author = JuliaBalbilla\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Servings: 10 - 1 large loaf\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  13 hours, 10 minutes\n|PrepTime =  12 hours 20 minutes\n|CookTime =  50 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Large sandwich loaf recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Big Bread!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">This would feed a big family for days</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:The crumb.jpg|thumb|300px|right|The crumb]]\nThis loaf is [[Baked|baked]] in a 1.8kg (4lb) loaf tin and these are produced by Alan Silverwood.  Grease the tin well with [[Groundnut oil|groundnut oil]].  Start making this the evening before you want to eat the [[Bread|bread]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1kg [[Strong white bread flour|strong white bread flour]]\n| 650ml cold water\n| 50g [[butter]]\n| 7g [[Dried yeast|dried yeast]]\n| 2 teaspoons [[Salt|salt]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Mix the [[Flour|flour]] and water and leave to autolyse for 30 minutes.\n| Incorporate the [[butter]], [[Yeast|yeast]] and [[Salt|salt]] and then [[Knead|knead]] according to your chosen method.\n| Shape into a ball, place in a bowl, cover and [[Refrigerate|refrigerate]] overnight.\n| The next morning, remove from the [[Fridge|fridge]] and wait until the [[Dough|dough]] has risen sufficiently.\n| Divide the [[Dough|dough]] into 4 equal pieces and shape into balls.\n| Place the balls, side by side, in the greased loaf tin, cover, and leave to rise until almost double in size.\n| Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 230\u00b0 C (450\u00b0 F - gas 8), [fan oven 210\u00b0 C].\n| Shake some [[Flour|flour]] over the top.\n| Place the [[Bread|bread]] in the [[Oven|oven]] and reduce the temperature to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6), [fan oven 180\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour].\n| [[Bake]] for about 50 minutes.\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]][[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#largesandwichloaf #dough #butter #bread #flour #groundnutoil #knead #fridge #driedyeast #baked #yeast </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }

title": "Layered rolls (TM)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Layered rolls - A Thermomix recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#dough #flour #yeast #clingfilm #bread #breadmaker #thermomix #mixer #bake #sieve #kneadingbread \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=These rolls are very easy to make and the idea has been taken from Richard Berthinet's Dough\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}}\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1329\n|PortionCalories = 132\n|DatePublished=12th April 2013\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|ImageComment = Layered rolls\n |Servings = 10-12 rolls\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 27 hours, 20 minutes\n |PrepTime = 27 hours\n |CookTime = 20 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Layered rolls recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Pretty, pretty!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Lots of work though</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:NonLoggedInUser|NonLoggedInUser]] </span></span>\n}}\n\nThese rolls are very easy to make and the idea has been taken from Richard Berthinet's '''[[Dough]]''' (ISBN 9781856267625).  I have started by making an overnight sponge, to encourage [[Yeast|yeast]] activity, but you can omit that stage if you like and mix in all the ingredients at the same time.\n\nSee 'Variations' below for instructions on partially making these rolls in a [[Breadmaker|breadmaker]], food [[Mixer|mixer]] and [[Thermomix]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredientsTM\n| 10g fresh [[Yeast|yeast]]\n| 350g [[Sparkling mineral water|sparkling mineral water]]\n| 500g strong [[Bread|bread]] [[Flour|flour]] - you may need to use more water if using very strong bread [[Flour|flour]]\n| 10g [[Salt|salt]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| The night before you want to [[Bake|bake]] the [[Bread|bread]], dissolve the [[Yeast|yeast]] in the water,\n| [[Sieve]] 250g [[Flour|flour]] into a large bowl and stir in the water and dissolved [[Yeast|yeast]].  Do NOT add the [[Salt|salt]] at this stage as its will interfere with yeast activity.\n| Mix thoroughly.\n| Cover with [[Clingfilm|clingfilm]] and leave at room temperature overnight.\n| If it becomes very active, [[Refrigerate|refrigerate]] and bring to room temperature in the morning.\n| The next day, [[Sieve|sieve]] the remaining 250g [[Flour|flour]] with the [[Salt|salt]] and add to the bowl.\n| Mix thoroughly and leave to rest for 20 minutes.  The [[Dough|dough]] should be fairly sticky, so add more water if necessary.\n| Knead, using your desired method until you have an elastic [[Dough|dough]].\n| Shape into a ball and leave it to rest for an hour in an oiled bowl, covered with [[Clingfilm|clingfilm]], until the [[Dough|dough]] has almost doubled in size.\n| Lightly [[Flour|flour]] a work surface and gently deflate the [[Dough|dough]].\n| Knead briefly and repeat the two previous steps.\n| Gently spread the [[Dough|dough]] on a floured work surface and roll out until it is about 5mm thick.\n| Using a plain 6cm [[Pastry|pastry]] cutter cut out circles of [[Dough|dough]] and place them on a [[Baking tray|baking tray]].\n| Lightly dampen the circles with water.\n| Cut out the equivalent number of circles again and place on top of the others.\n| Dampen the top circles and go through the same process a 3rd time.\n| Cover with a damp cloth and leave to prove for up to 45 minutes.\n| [[Bake]] at 230\u00b0 C (450\u00b0 F - gas 8), [fan [[Oven|oven]] 210\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour] for 15-20 minutes. \n| Allow to cool on a wire rack.\n}}\n===Variations===\n* Stages 1-11 can be done in a food [[Mixer|mixer]].\n* Stages 6-11 can be done in a [[Breadmaker|breadmaker]] on the longest [[Dough|dough]] setting.\n*Stages 1-11 can also be done in a [[Thermomix]]. Add the sponge ingredients all together, having dissolved the [[Yeast|yeast]]. Mix for 6-20 seconds at Speed 3 until the [[Dough|dough]] has formed into a ball that begins to clean the sides of the bowl. Add the remaining [[Flour|flour]] and the [[Salt|salt]] the next day and [[Kneading bread|knead]] for 90 seconds at the kneading setting. Tip the TM bowl upside down on a lightly floured surface . Loosen the blades by undoing the blade unit at the base. The weight of the blades will [[Help|help]] the dough to drop out of the bowl onto the surface. Pull any remaining bits of dough off the blades and out of the bowl. Continue from step 12. \n===Chef's notes===\nYou will find that the rolls slant somewhat during rising but that is part of their charm!  The more they slant, the longer they may need baking.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Breadmaker recipes]]\n[[Category:Thermomix recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#dough #flour #yeast #clingfilm #bread #breadmaker #thermomix #mixer #bake #sieve #kneadingbread </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Lazy Hollandaise-y Asparagus",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Lazy Hollandaise-y Asparagus a gluten free recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#eggs #butter #boil #lazyhollandaiseyasparagus #pancetta #parmaham #hollandaise #prosciutto #ham #ovengrill #duck \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Pigs in a blanket. Delish, but so is this seasonal twist. And, hollandaise without whisking - genius!\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1084\n|PortionCalories = 271\n|DatePublished=18th May 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  25 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime =  15 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Lazy Hollandaisey Asparagus recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Wicked idea!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Green egg dip \ud83e\udd6c\ud83c\udf73 \ud83e\udd6c\ud83e\udd5a \ud83e\udd6c\ud83e\udd5a\ud83c\udf73</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Pigs]] in a blanket. Delish, but so is this seasonal twist. And, [[Hollandaise|hollandaise]] without whisking - genius!\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 [[duck|duck egg]] or 2 chicken [[eggs]] per person\n| 6 [[Asparagus spears|asparagus spears]]\n| 100g pack of [[Pancetta|pancetta]], [[Prosciutto|prosciutto]] or [[Parma ham|parma ham]]\n| A knob of [[Butter|butter]]\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n| A drop of [[White wine vinegar|white wine vinegar]] (optional)\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Get your [[Eggs|eggs]] so they can warm to room temp. Crank your [[Oven grill|oven grill]] up to high.\n| Snap or slice the woody ends off the [[Asparagus|asparagus]]. Wrap each spear with a slice of [[Pancetta|pancetta]] or a halved (lengthwise) strip of [[Prosciutto|prosciutto]] or [[Parma ham|parma ham]].\n| Get a pot of water on the [[Boil|boil]] for the [[Eggs|eggs]].\n| Pop the wrapped spears on a hot [[Grill pan|grill pan]] and under the [[Grill|grill]]. Place your [[Eggs|eggs]] in the [[Sauce|sauce]] pan. Set the timer for 7 mins. Let the [[Egg|egg]] water gently [[Bubble|bubble]] away - don't let it [[Boil|boil]] too softly or too rapidly.\n| Turn your spears a couple of times, until the [[Ham|ham]] is crisped up and the tips are tender. Remove from [[Oven|oven]]. Brust the tips with [[Butter|butter]].\n| Slice the tops off the [[Eggs|eggs]]. Dunk a nugget of [[Butter|butter]] into each melting [[Yolk|yolk]]. Season. Add a drop of [[Vinegar|vinegar]] to give a lazy [[Hollandaise|hollandaise]]-y effect. Dunk.\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:French recipes]]\n[[Category:Breakfast recipes]]\n[[Category:Egg recipes]]\n[[Category:Gluten free recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Cookery cheats]]\n[[Category:Abel and Cole veg box recipes]]\n[[Category:Grilled, griddled or barbecued]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n{{Template:Abel and Cole veg box recipes attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#eggs #butter #boil #lazyhollandaiseyasparagus #pancetta #parmaham #hollandaise #prosciutto #ham #ovengrill #duck </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Leek, potato, cheese and bacon bake",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Leek, potato, cheese and bacon bake\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#grated #cheesepowder #pancetta #potatoes #bacon #cheddarcheese #potato #cheesesauce #parsley #leeks #cajunseasoning\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=While were in this coronavirus lockdown, Im attempting to rustle up an easy meal using produce available from local farmers stalls and common store..\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=24th March 2020\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  1 hour 15 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime = 1 hour\n|TotalCalories = 1207\n|PortionCalories = 301\n|Image = [[Image:Leek, potato, cheese and bacon bake recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Love this!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.6</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Proper comfort food.</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]] </span></span>\n}}\nWhile we're in this coronavirus lockdown, I'm attempting to rustle up an easy meal using produce available from local farmer's stalls and common store cupboard items.\n\nThe only item that you might not have is the [[Cheese powder|cheese powder]].  In which case, just use 100g of [[Grated|grated]] [[Cheddar|cheddar]].\n\nI've used a [[Food processor|food processor]] to thinly slice the [[Leeks|leeks]] and [[Potatoes|potatoes]], but they could just as easily be sliced by [[Hand|hand]].\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 2 large potatoes, peeled and thinly sliced - I've used [[Media:Cara potatoes.jpg|Cara potatoes]]\n| 1 large [[Leek|leek]], cleaned, trimmed and thinly sliced.\n| 2 [[Cloves of Garlic, peeled and crushed|cloves of garlic, peeled and crushed]]\n| 1 heaped teaspoon of [[Taste Sensation Cajun Seasoning|taste sensation cajun seasoning]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Dried|dried]] [[Parsley|parsley]]\n| 3 tablespoons [[Taste Sensation Matured Blue Cheese powder]]\n| 2 tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 2 tablespoons [[Plain flour|plain flour]]\n| 400 ml [[Milk|milk]]\n| 30 g [[Cheddar cheese|cheddar cheese]] [[Grated|grated]]\n| 100g cubed [[Pancetta|pancetta]] (basically [[Bacon|bacon]]!)\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Leek and potato pie ready to bake.jpg|Ready to bake\nImage:Leek and potato pie baked.jpg|The bake, baked!\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Rinse the [[Potato|potato]] slices in cold water to remove excess [[Starch|starch]]\n| [[Boil]] the [[Potato|potato]] slices in lots of water for about 7 minuets.  Leave a little bite in the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] so they keep their shape.\n| Pop the sliced [[Leeks|leeks]] in a bowl and sprinkle with the [[Cajun Seasoning|cajun seasoning]] [[Crushed garlic|crushed garlic]] and mix well.\n| Mix the [[Cheese powder|cheese powder]] into the [[Milk|milk]] and add the [[Dried|dried]] [[Parsley|parsley]]\n| Heat the [[Oil|oil]] and once it's hot, stir in the [[Flour|flour]] to make a [[Roux|roux]] (paste).\n| Gently [[Whisk|whisk]] the [[Milk|milk]] and [[Cheese powder|cheese powder]] into the four and [[Oil|oil]] until they are combined.  If using [[Grated|grated]] [[Cheese|cheese]], make the [[White sauce|white sauce]] with milk alone and then add the grated cheese.\n| Heat the [[Milk|milk]] until it is [[Simmering|simmering]] and mix well while it thickens.\n| I made my [[Cheese sauce|cheese sauce]] in a Le Cruset [[Baking|baking]] dish, but you could make in a pan and pour it into the baking dish afterwards.\n| Add the [[Leek|leek]] mixture and sliced [[Potatoes|potatoes]] in layers, pressing down to ensure even covering with the [[Cheese sauce|cheese sauce]].\n| Top with the [[Pancetta|pancetta]] cubes and a little [[Grated|grated]] [[Cheese|cheese]].\n| [[Bake]] for 1 hour, covered for the first 30 minutes, remove the cover for the final 30 minutes so the [[Pancetta|pancetta]] crisps.\n}}\n===Variations===\nJust omit the [[Bacon|bacon]] for a [[Vegetarian|vegetarian]] option.\n===Chef's notes===\nIf you don't have [[Cheese powder|cheese powder]], just use 100g of [[Grated|grated]] [[Cheddar cheese|cheddar cheese]].\nIf you don't have [[Taste Sensation Cajun Seasoning|taste sensation cajun seasoning]], half a teaspoon of [[Chilli powder|chilli powder]] and a pinch of [[Black pepper|black pepper]] would add a little bite if you don't have the [[Cajun Seasoning|cajun seasoning]].\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Irish recipes]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes]]\n[[Category:Pies tarts and flans]]\n[[Category:Taste Sensation recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#grated #cheesepowder #pancetta #potatoes #bacon #cheddarcheese #potato #cheesesauce #parsley #leeks #cajunseasoning</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}
