title": "Leek and cheese envelope (MoF)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Leek and cheese envelope (MoF) a cheese recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#leeks #flour #sauce #cheese #bake #cheddarcheese #boiling #grated #brush #fat #leek \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=UK Minisrty of Food: \"Housekeeping's most important secret nowadays is to know how to make best use of the foods available\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1040\n|PortionCalories = 260\n|DatePublished=20th January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Ministry of Food Cookery calendar - 1951\n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime = 45 minutes\n|PrepTime = 5 minutes\n|CookTime = 40 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Ministry of Food Cookery calendar - 1951.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">A wonderful recipe</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">As good now as it was 70 years ago</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Carla_Cancio-Bello,_J.D.,_on_behalf_of_Cuban_Cuisine_UK|Carla]] </span></span>\n}}\n\"Housekeeping's most important secret nowadays is to know how to make best use of the foods available.  Here are some practical suggestions for improving your inside knowledge without undue expense.\"  '''Ministry of food Cookery Calendar - April..May 1951'''\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1 lb [[leeks]]\n| 3 oz [[Cheddar cheese]], [[grated]]\n| [[Rough puff pastry]] using 3 oz [[flour]], 3 oz [[fat]] \n| ''[[Sauce]]''\n| 1 oz [[margarine]]\n| 1 oz [[flour]]\n| &frac14; pint [[milk]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Cut the [[leeks]] in half lenghtwise, then in half again and wash very thoroughly.\n| Cook in [[boiling]] [[salted]] water for 10 minutes. Drain well.\n| Make the [[sauce]], add the [[leeks]] and all but 1 tablespoon of the [[cheese]]; set aside to cool.\n| Roll out the pastry into a 10\" square and spread the [[leek]] mixture over the centre\n| Damp the edges of the pastry and close together to form an envelope\n| [[Brush]] the top with [[milk]], sprinkle with the remaining [[cheese]] and [[bake]] in a hot oven (220\u00b0  C - 425\u00b0 F - Gas 7) for 25-30 minutes\n}}\n==See also==\n* [[Cheese sauce]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Pies tarts and flans]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#leeks #flour #sauce #cheese #bake #cheddarcheese #boiling #grated #brush #fat #leek </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Left-over turkey curry",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Left-over turkey curry, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#curry #leftoverturkeycurry #currypaste #turkey #chillisauce #boiledrice #driedfruit #greenchillies #onions #coconutmilk #chillipowder \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=The key to this very simple recipe is to use a good curry paste. All supermarkets sell many brands of curry paste and they are all good\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 3271\n|PortionCalories = 1635\n|DatePublished=21st January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 2\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 30 minutes\n |PrepTime = 10 minutes\n |CookTime = 20 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Left-over turkey curry recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Boxing Day Treat</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">When you're sick of roast turkey this is what to do with it!</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nThe key to this very simple recipe is to use a good [[Curry paste|curry paste]].  All supermarkets sell many brands of curry paste and they are all good.  Look out for Thai green curry paste or Thai red curry paste.  My favourite is Cok Brand [[Curry]] Paste but I've only seen it in [[Oriental stores]].\n[[Image:Left-over turkey curry ingredients.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Left-over [[Turkey|turkey]] [[Curry|curry]] - the ingredients]]\n\nThe resulting [[Curry|curry]] is just warmly spicy, but not hot.  Use this as the base curry and as chopped fresh [[Green chillies|green chillies]] or [[Chilli sauce|chilli sauce]] to add the actual heat.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1.5 tablespoons [[Oil|oil]] or [[Butter|butter]] for [[Frying|frying]]. Margerine or butter spreads don't really work very well.\n| 1 large [[Onion|onion]], peeled and chopped\n| 1 tablespoon [[Curry paste|curry paste]]\n| 400 ml [[Coconut milk|coconut milk]]\n| Enough leftover cooked [[Turkey|turkey]] for two people\n| 1 handful of [[Dried fruit|dried fruit]] such as [[Raisins|raisins]], [[Sultanas|sultanas]], [[Apricots|apricots]] etc. (optional)\n| Chopped fresh [[Green chillies|green chillies]] or [[Chilli sauce|chilli sauce]] (optional)\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Heat the [[Oil|oil]] in a [[Frying pan|frying pan]], saucepan or [[Wok|wok]]. Not too hot, don't let it start to smoke.\n| [[Fry]] the chopped [[Onions|onions]] for 5 or 6 minutes util they turn golden [[Brown|brown]].\n| Stir in the [[Curry paste|curry paste]] so it coats the [[Onions|onions]].\n| Turn down the heat and pour in the [[Coconut milk|coconut milk]] and stir well.\n| Add the cooked [[Turkey|turkey]] and the [[Dried fruit|dried fruit]] (optional) and gently [[Simmer|simmer]] for about 10 minutes while the [[Boiled rice|boiled rice]] is cooked.\n| You can serve the [[Curry|curry]] immediately or leave it for an hour or so and just reheat when you want to serve it.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Boiled rice|boiled rice]] and chopped fresh [[Chillies|chillies]] or [[Chilli sauce|chilli sauce]].\n===Variations===\nIf everyone wants a hot [[Curry|curry]], stir in [[Chilli powder|chilli powder]] to taste (about 1 to 2 teaspoons) with the [[Curry paste|curry paste]].\n\nIf you need to bulk this out to stretch to four people, add a can of [[kidney beans]] or similar.  If you need a little more liquid, add a slug of [[beer]] or [[lager]].\n===Chef's notes===\nMany curry pastes are water-based so do not keep well in the fridge, however, they freeze very well and often the contents can be spooned out while the paste is still 'frozen'.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Chilli pepper recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Student recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n[[Category:Thai recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#curry #leftoverturkeycurry #currypaste #turkey #chillisauce #boiledrice #driedfruit #greenchillies #onions #coconutmilk #chillipowder </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Lemon, garden peas and Capricorn goats' cheese risotto",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Lemon, garden peas and Capricorn goats' cheese risotto recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#lemongardenpeasandcapricorngoatscheeserisotto #butter #rice #onion #diced #goatscheese #doublecream #vegetarian #vegetablestock #thelubborncreamery #whitewine \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=The Lubborn Creamery has kindly given us permission to reproduce this lovely rich and creamy vegetarian risotto recipe\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1200\n|PortionCalories = 600\n|DatePublished=24th October 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 2\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 1 hour 15 minutes\n |PrepTime = 15 minutes\n |CookTime = 1 hour\n |Image = [[Image:Lemon, garden peas and Capricorn goats' cheese risotto recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Different!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Never usually add cheese to rice - this made a nice change.</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Sue_spins|Susie]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[The Lubborn Creamery]] has kindly given us permission to reproduce this lovely rich and creamy [[Vegetarian|vegetarian]] [[Risotto|risotto]] recipe.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1 x100g Capricorn\u00ae [[Goats cheese|goats cheese]]\n| 150g [[Risotto rice|risotto rice]]\n| 250ml [[Vegetable Stock|vegetable stock]]\n| 75ml [[White wine|white wine]]\n| 25ml [[Double cream|double cream]]\n| &frac12;  small [[Onion|onion]], [[Diced|diced]]\n| &frac12;  [[Leek|leek]], [[Diced|diced]]\n| 100g cooked [[Garden peas|garden peas]]\n| &frac12;  fresh [[Lemon|lemon]], juiced and zested\n| 40g [[Butter|butter]]\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]]\n| [[Freshly ground black pepper]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Melt the [[Butter|butter]] over a low heat in a thick bottom pan.\n| Add the [[Onion|onion]] and cook until translucent and soft.\n| Add the [[Rice|rice]] and cook for a few minutes, again until translucent.\n| Pour in the [[Wine|wine]] and reduce the liquid by half, then add the [[Stock|stock]] a little at a time.\n| [[Crumble]] in the Capricorn\u00ae [[Goats cheese|goats cheese]] and pour in the [[Cream|cream]], stir well.\n| Season with [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]. Cook for a further 40 mins, then stir in the [[Peas|peas]] and [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]] and [[Zest|zest]].\n| Check the [[Rice|rice]] is cooked and the [[Sauce|sauce]] is loose and creamy.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nPlace into two bowls and serve.\n===Chef's notes===\nFor a lighter alternative, use cr\u00e8me fra\u00eeche instead of [[Double cream|double cream]] and a low-[[Fat|fat]] spread instead of [[Butter|butter]].\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Rice recipes]]\n[[Category:Cooking with wine]]\n[[Category:Lubborn Creamery recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#lemongardenpeasandcapricorngoatscheeserisotto #butter #rice #onion #diced #goatscheese #doublecream #vegetarian #vegetablestock #thelubborncreamery #whitewine </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Lemon and bay leaf chicken with new potatoes",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->{{#seo:\n|title=Lemon and bay leaf chicken with new potatoes British recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#newpotatoes #chicken #lemonandbayleafchickenwithnewpotatoes #garlic #lemon #greensalad #oliveoil #whitewine #bellpeppers #redonion #bayleaf \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A complete family meal for \u00a32.90 per serving. April 2010\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1298\n|PortionCalories = 324\n|DatePublished=21st January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Served with a green salad\n |Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 1 hour 10 minutes\n |PrepTime = 10 minutes\n |CookTime = 1 hour\n |Image = [[Image:Lemon and bay leaf chicken with new potatoes recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Superfood</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">...super-salad!</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nA complete family meal for \u00a32.90 per serving. [April 2010]\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 2 [[Bell peppers|bell peppers]] of any colour, deseeded and sliced\n| 500 g [[New Potatoes|new potatoes]], quartered\n| 1 [[Red onion|red onion]], peeled and finely sliced\n| 3 cloves of [[Garlic|garlic]], peeled, smashed and chopped\n| 1 tp [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 4 large [[Chicken|chicken]] breasts, skin removed\n| 4 fresh [[Bay leaves|bay leaves]]\n| 1 [[Lemon|lemon]], sliced\n| 100 ml [[Dry white wine|dry white wine]] or [[Chicken stock|chicken stock]], or a mix of both.\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| [[Green salad]] to serve\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 220\u00b0 C (425\u00b0 F - gas 7), [fan oven 200\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Lemon and bay leaf chicken cooked.jpg|Fully cooked\nImage:Lemon and bay leaf chicken prepared.jpg|Prepared [[chicken]] breasts\nImage:Lemon and bay leaf chicken potatoes pre-roast.jpg|Prior to roasting\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| [[Spray]] or lightly grease a [[Roasting tray|roasting tray]] with a little [[Olive oil|olive oil]], scatter the [[Peppers|peppers]], [[New Potatoes|new potatoes]] and [[Onions|onions]] and [[Garlic|garlic]] and drizzle with [[Olive|olive]] [[Oil|oil]] and season.\n| Toss the contents to mix well and [[Roast|roast]] for 20 minutes.\n| Reduce the heat to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6), [fan [[Oven|oven]] 180\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n| Cut a deep slit in each [[Chicken breast|chicken breast]] and fill with a [[Bay leaf|bay leaf]] between two slices of [[Lemon|lemon]], drizzle with the  [[White wine|white wine]] or [[Stock|stock]] and return to the [[Oven|oven]] for 25 to 30 minutes, [[Basting|basting]] now and then until the [[Chicken|chicken]] is properly cooked.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nOn its own or maybe with a small [[Green salad|green salad]]\n===Recipe source===\n* Based on a Waitrose recipe card - April 2010\n===Chef's notes===\nThe alert amongst you will notice these are not [[new potatoes]] but what was in the kitchen at the time.  Cut large potatoes into   fairly small even-sized pieces so they cook at the same rate.\n\nIf you have free access to fresh bay leaves, use them!  Scatter a handful into the vegetable mix at the start.  The same for any left over lemon pieces, squeeze the lemon juice over the vegetables and scatter the pieces over the vegetables.  They can be discarded at before serving but they add a little more aroma and flavour to the dish.\n\nNot being a white-[[Wine|wine]] drinker, but having [[Sherry|sherry]] for cooking, if [[White wine|white wine]] is called for I often mix [[Dry sherry|dry sherry]] with a little water instead.\n==See also==\n* {{See also - Jointing a chicken}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes]]\n[[Category:Poultry recipes]]\n[[Category:Cooking with wine]]\n[[Category:Stewed, braised or pot roasted]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#newpotatoes #chicken #lemonandbayleafchickenwithnewpotatoes #garlic #lemon #greensalad #oliveoil #whitewine #bellpeppers #redonion #bayleaf </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Lemon and parsley sauce",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Lemon and parsley sauce, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#lemonandparsleysauce #lemon #butter #parsley #parsleyleaves #zest #boiledorsimmered #blackpepper #fish #juice #fishdishes \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=An extremely quick and delicious accompaniment for fish dishes\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 376\n|PortionCalories = 188\n|DatePublished=12th April 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 2\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 5 minutes \n |PrepTime = 2 minutes\n |CookTime = 3 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Lemon and parsley sauce.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">So simple</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">This could not be easier to make.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nAn extremely quick and delicious [[Accompaniment|accompaniment]] for [[Fish dishes|fish dishes]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 50g [[Butter|butter]]\n| 1 [[Lemon|lemon]]\n| Bunch of fresh [[Parsley leaves|parsley leaves]], finely chopped\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Melt the [[Butter|butter]] in a small pan\n| Add a twist or two of [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n| Stir in the [[Juice|juice]] and [[Zest|zest]] of 1 [[Lemon|lemon]]\n| Season to taste\n| Sprinkle in the chopped [[Parsley|parsley]]\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nPour over the [[Fish|fish]] and serve\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Dips and sauces]]\n[[Category:Fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#lemonandparsleysauce #lemon #butter #parsley #parsleyleaves #zest #boiledorsimmered #blackpepper #fish #juice #fishdishes </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Lemon chicken spaghetti",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",

                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Lemon chicken spaghetti recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#spaghetti #parsley #blackpepper #cremefraiche #zest #chicken #oliveoil #onions #lemonchickenspaghetti #garlic #driedspaghetti \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A different way to make a simple evening meal with spaghetti and chicken.\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 3148\n|PortionCalories = 787\n|DatePublished=7th January 2016\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  35 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime =  25 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Lemon chicken spaghetti recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Love the picture</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">It's just given me an idea for tomorrow's dinner.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry, aka Chef]])</span></span>\n}}\nA different way to make a simple evening meal with [[Spaghetti|spaghetti]] and [[Chicken|chicken]].\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 2 [[Onions|onions]], peeled and chopped\n| 4 [[Cloves of Garlic, peeled and crushed|cloves of garlic, peeled and crushed]]\n| 2 tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| Pinch of [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n| 700 g boneless [[Chicken breasts|chicken breasts]] cut into bite-sized pieces\n| [[Juice]] from half a [[Lemon|lemon]] plus a little [[Zest|zest]]\n| 2 tablespoons fresh [[Parsley|parsley]], chopped\n| Pinch of [[Sea Salt|sea salt]]\n| 5 [[Spring onions, chopped|spring onions, chopped]]\n| 4 tablespoons [[Creme fraiche|creme fraiche]] \n| 400 g [[Dried spaghetti|dried spaghetti]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Add the [[Olive oil|olive oil]] to a pan or [[Wok|wok]] together with a pinch of [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n| [[Sautee]] the [[Onions|onions]] for 3 or 4 minutes over a medium heat, then add the [[Garlic|garlic]] for a minute or two, stirring so it does not catch\n| Add the [[Chicken|chicken]], [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]] and [[Zest|zest]] and cook over a low heat for 15 to 20 minutes until the chicken is properly cooked\n| Meanwhile cook the [[Spaghetti|spaghetti]] in [[Salted|salted]] [[Boiling|boiling]] water for 7 to 10 minutes\n| Stir in the [[Creme fraiche|creme fraiche]] and [[Spring onions|spring onions]] and season to taste\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nYou can serve the [[Sauce|sauce]] over the [[Spaghetti|spaghetti]] or mix it in, whatever takes your fancy.\n\nA few [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]] make a refreshing [[Accompaniment|accompaniment]] to this recipe.\n===Variations===\nWe done this twice now, the second time with [[Fresh thyme|fresh thyme]] instead of [[Parsley|parsley]].  About a teaspoonful of freshly picked leaves was very nice.\n\n{{Template:YoutubePastaDough}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Italian recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pasta recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#spaghetti #parsley #blackpepper #cremefraiche #zest #chicken #oliveoil #onions #lemonchickenspaghetti #garlic #driedspaghetti </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Lemon curd (TM)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Lemon curd - A Thermomix recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#lemoncurd #eggs #unsaltedbutter #refrigerate #lemoncurdrecipe #pumpkinlemoncurd #lemon #cakes #boiledorsimmered #pies #tarts \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=I loathe shop-bought lemon curd and hadn't eaten it for years, until I made this recipe, which is delicious\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 599\n|PortionCalories = 30\n|DatePublished=24th February 2014\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = 20\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  10 minutes\n|PrepTime =  5 minutes\n|CookTime =  5 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Lemon curd (TM).jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Thermy curd</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Lovely, thanks Julia</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nI loathe shop-bought [[Lemon curd|lemon curd]] and hadn't eaten it for years, until I made this recipe, which is delicious.\n\n{{RecipeIngredientsTM\n\n| 75g [[Sugar|sugar]]\n| The rind of 1 large, unwaxed [[Lemon|lemon]], thinly peeled\n| 40g [[lemon juice]] from the above\n| 2 large [[Eggs|eggs]]\n| 50g [[Unsalted butter|unsalted butter]]\n}}\n\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Put the [[Sugar|sugar]] and the rind into the bowl '''20 seconds / Speed 10'''\n| Add the remaining ingredients '''10 seconds / Speed 6'''\n| Scrape down the inside of the bowl '''5 minutes / 80\u00b0C / Speed 4''' - you may wish the mixture to be thicker or runnier, in which case adjust the cooking time by a minute or two.\n| Transfer to a bowl and allow to cool before use.\n| If you want to keep it, tip into sterlised jars or [[Lock&Lock]] tubs and [[Refrigerate|refrigerate]].\n}}\n===Recipe source===\n\n* Summarised from '''Fast and Easy Cooking''', the book which comes with Thermomixes sold in the UK.\n===Servings===\nThis recipe makes 250 ml\n===Variations===\nUse as a filling for [[Tarts|tarts]], [[Cakes|cakes]] and [[Pies|pies]] or spread on toast.\n\n==See also==\n* [[Lemon curd]] - information page\n* [[Lemon curd recipe]]\n* [[Pumpkin lemon curd]]\n* [[Lemon curd recipe (Mum's)]]\n* [[Orange curd recipe (Mum's)]]\n\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Breakfast recipes]]\n[[Category:Dips and sauces]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Egg recipes]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Pickles and preserves]]\n[[Category:Thermomix recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#lemoncurd #eggs #unsaltedbutter #refrigerate #lemoncurdrecipe #pumpkinlemoncurd #lemon #cakes #boiledorsimmered #pies #tarts </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Lemon curd recipe",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Lemon curd recipe Fruit, from Cookipedia.Co.Uk\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#butter #zest #lemoncurdrecipe #lemonjuice #lemoncurd #eggs #sauce #lemonzest #lemons #lemonrinds #lemonmeringuepie \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A custard-like dessert sauce made with eggs, lemon juice and zest, sugar, and butter\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 982\n|PortionCalories = 98\n|DatePublished=29th July 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Lemon curd\n |Servings = Serves 10 - Makes 1 x 12 oz jar of [[Lemon curd|lemon curd]]\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 25 minutes\n |PrepTime = 15 minutes\n |CookTime = 10 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Lemon curd (TM).jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"><span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Strange, but lovely</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I had never thought of making this, fun, and tasty \ud83c\udf4b\ud83c\udf4b\ud83c\udf4b</span> \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\">[[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}}\n\nA [[Custard|custard]]-like [[Dessert|dessert]] [[Sauce|sauce]] made with [[Eggs|eggs]], [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]] and [[Zest|zest]], [[Sugar|sugar]], and [[Butter|butter]]. [[Lemon curd]] makes an ideal dessert spread for scones and [[Breads|breads]] as well as the filling for [[Lemon meringue pie]] .\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| &#189; cup (120ml) [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]]\n| 2 tablespoons freshly [[Grated|grated]] [[Lemon zest|lemon zest]]\n| &#8531; cup (80g) [[Sugar|sugar]]\n| 3 [[free range eggs]]\n| 90g [[Unsalted butter|unsalted butter]]\n| Pinch of [[Salt|salt]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Grate the [[Lemon rinds|lemon rinds]] to produce two tablespoons of [[Zest|zest]]. Grate only the yellow zest, avoid the inner white pith which is bitter.\n| Extract the [[Juice|juice]] from the [[Lemons|lemons]] to produce &#189; cup (120ml) of juice.\n| Cut the [[Butter|butter]] into small chunks.\n| Put [[Eggs|eggs]], [[Zest|zest]], [[Sugar|sugar]], and [[Salt|salt]] into cooled [[Sauce|sauce]] pan.\n| Whisk ingredients in pan till frothy and light in colour (a minute or two).\n| Add [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]] and whisk 30 seconds.\n| Add [[Butter|butter]] chunks.\n| Set pan on stove burner, turn on heat to medium-to-low, and start whisking contents so they don't coagulate or stick to bottom of.\n| Whisk constantly till [[Butter|butter]] melts and mixture thickens, then whisk another two minutes, but do not let mixture [[Boil|boil]] - it should be quite steamy (185\u00b0F, 85\u00b0C).\n| Optional: Remove [[Zest|zest]] with the [[Strainer|strainer]] over a mixing bowl and pouring the mixture through. Then work the mixture through the strainer with the spatula to strain out the zest and any [[Egg|egg]] lumps; rake mixture off bottom of strainer into bowl.\n| Pour mixture from bowl into jar to within &#188; inch (0.75cm) from top, taking care not to get mixture on rim, then seal jar with lid.\n| [[Refrigerate]] to thicken the product further.\n}}\n===Chef's notes===\nKeeps for several months if refrigerated.\n==See also==\n* [[Lemon curd]] - information page\n* [[Lemon curd recipe]]\n* [[Pumpkin lemon curd]]\n* [[Lemon curd recipe (Mum's)]]\n* [[Orange curd recipe (Mum's)]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Dips and sauces]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Pickles and preserves]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#butter #zest #lemoncurdrecipe #lemonjuice #lemoncurd #eggs #sauce #lemonzest #lemons #lemonrinds #lemonmeringuepie </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Lemon curd recipe (Mum's)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",

                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Lemon curd, (Mum's) an egg recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#cookery #simmering #freerangeeggs #pumpkinlemoncurd #lemoncurd #boiledorsimmered #butter #juice #zest #lemoncurdrecipe #grated \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Another recipe from Mum's scribbled cookery notes, seeing the recipe now, I'm amazed to see how simple it was for her to make such a great staple\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1069\n|PortionCalories = 178\n|DatePublished=29th July 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 6 - Makes 2 small pots\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  30 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  15 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Lemon curd recipe Mum's recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Thanks Mum!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">This recipe has been made many times over. x Jem</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry]] </span></span>\n}}\nAnother recipe from Mum's scribbled [[Cookery|cookery]] notes, seeing the recipe now, I'm amazed to see how simple it was for her to make such a great staple.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 2 large [[Free range eggs|free range eggs]]\n| 100g (4 oz) [[Butter|butter]]\n| [[Grated]] [[Zest|zest]] and [[Juice|juice]] of 2 large [[Lemons|lemons]]\n| 225 g (8 oz) [[Brown sugar|brown sugar]]\n\n}}\n\n\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Beat the [[Eggs|eggs]] and add to the top pan of a [[Bain-marie|bain-marie]] ([[Double-boiler|double-boiler]]), with the remaining ingredients.  A bowl over a pan of [[Simmering|simmering]] water will do if you don't have a [[Bain-marie|bain-marie]]\n| Stir until the [[Sugar|sugar]] has dissolved.\n| Continue gently heating and stirring as the [[Curd|curd]] thickens.  Its ready when it is thick enough to coat the back of a wooden spoon.\n| Pour into hot, [[Sterilised|sterilised]] [[Jam|jam]] jars and seal properly.\n}}\n==See also==\n* [[Lemon curd]] - information page\n* [[Lemon curd recipe]]\n* [[Pumpkin lemon curd]]\n* [[Lemon curd recipe (Mum's)]]\n* [[Orange curd recipe (Mum's)]]\n* [[Lemon curd (TM)]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Dips and sauces]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Egg recipes]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#cookery #simmering #freerangeeggs #pumpkinlemoncurd #lemoncurd #boiledorsimmered #butter #juice #zest #lemoncurdrecipe #grated </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Lemon meringue pie",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Lemon meringue pie, Egg recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#meringue #cornflour #butter #lemonmeringuepie #pastry #bake #baking #strained #juice #yolks #egg \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=The classic British dessert, this version includes the recipe for the filling. You could cheat of course, and use lemon curd and pre-rolled pastry\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2598\n|PortionCalories = 433\n|DatePublished=22nd October 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 6 to 8\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 1 hour, 15 minutes\n |PrepTime = 15 minutes\n |CookTime = 1 hour\n |Image = [[Image:Lemon meringue pie recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"><span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">I remember this!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">It's just like Mum used to  make for us, fifty years ago.</span> \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\">[[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nThe classic British [[Dessert|dessert]], this version includes the recipe for the filling.  You could cheat of course, and use [[Lemon curd|lemon curd]] and pre-rolled pastry.\n\n\n'''[[Pastry|pastry]]'''\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 175g [[Plain flour|plain flour]]\n| 100g [[Butter|butter]], straight from the [[Fridge|fridge]] and cut into small pieces\n| 1 tablespoon [[Icing sugar|icing sugar]]\n| 1 [[Egg yolk|egg yolk]] [reserve white for [[Meringue|meringue]]]\n}}\n'''filling'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| level tablespoons [[Cornflour|cornflour]]\n| 100g golden [[Caster sugar|caster sugar]]\n| [[Zest|zest]] from 2 large [[Lemons|lemons]]\n| [[Strained|strained]] [[Juice|juice]] from 2 large [[Lemons|lemons]]\n| [[Strained|strained]] [[Juice|juice]] from 1 [[Orange|orange]]\n| 85g [[Butter|butter]], cut into small pieces\n| 1 whole [[Egg|egg]] and 3 [[Yolks|yolks]] [reserve whites for the [[Meringue|meringue]]]\n}}\n'''[[Meringue|meringue]]'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 4 [[Egg whites|egg whites]] at room temperature\n| 200g golden [[Caster sugar|caster sugar]]\n| 2 level teaspoons [[Cornflour|cornflour]]\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6)\n===Method===\n\n\n'''[[Pastry|pastry]]'''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Add the [[Flour|flour]], [[Butter|butter]], [[Sugar|sugar]] and [[Egg yolk|egg yolk]] to a [[Food processor|food processor]] with a plastic blade and pulse the mixture until it binds together.  Don't over-work it.\n| Roll out to fit a 23 cm fluted non-stick [[Baking|baking]] tin, ideally with a loose bottom for easy release.\n| Prick the base with a fork and chill for at least 30 minutes.\n| Blind [[Bake|bake]] the case for about 20 minutes or until golden.\n}}\n'''filling'''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Mix the [[Lemon zest|lemon zest]], [[Cornflour|cornflour]] and [[Sugar|sugar]] in a medium pan and gradually add the [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]].\n| Separately, mix the [[Orange juice|orange juice]] with enough water to make 200 ml.  Add this to the pan. Cook this over a medium heat until it thickens, stirring all the while.\n| Remove from the heat and stir in the [[Butter|butter]]\n| Beat the 3 [[Yolks|yolks]] and whole [[Egg|egg]] together and add to pan.\n| Return to a medium heat and stir constantly until the mixture bubbles and thickens.\n| Remove from the heat and set aside.\n}}\n'''[[Meringue|meringue]]'''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Add the whites to a large bowl and whisk to soft peaks with an electric [[Mixer|mixer]].\n| Try not to overwork the [[Meringue|meringue]] from now on.\n| Mix the [[Sugar|sugar]] with the [[Cornflour|cornflour]] and add a spoonful at a time, lightly whisking between each addition.\n}}\n'''[[Baking|baking]] the pie'''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Reheat the filling if needed and pour into the [[Pastry|pastry]] case.\n| Top with the [[Meringue|meringue]] mixture by adding a spoonful at a time. Start around the edges and work into the centre to prevent the meringue from sinking into the filling.\n| Give the pie a final jiggle before you [[Bake|bake]] in the centre of the [[Oven|oven]] for 18 to 20 minutes or until the peaks colour slightly.\n| Remove from the [[Oven|oven]] and rest for 30 minutes before removing from the [[baking tray]].\n| It's best to leave for another 30 minutes before slicing.\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Egg recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Pies tarts and flans]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]][[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#meringue #cornflour #butter #lemonmeringuepie #pastry #bake #baking #strained #juice #yolks #egg </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Lemon sauces",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Lemon sauces\n|titlemode=replace\n|description=Lemon Sauce recipes. Variation on lemon or lime sauce recipes.\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n===Lemon Sauce recipes===\nThis page may be useful if you are looking to make a variation on lemon or lime sauces.\n\nIf you cannot find the sauce you want here, you will definitely find it in our [[:Category:Dips and sauces|dips and sauces recipe category]]\n \nHere are a number of recipes that contain lemon sauce:\n* [[Allioli a la Catalana]] - The traditional hand-made allioli ([[Garlic mayonnaise]])\n* [[Avocado sauce]] - A simple [[avocado]] puree / sauce is a great accompaniment to dry [[meat]] or coarse white [[fish]]\n* [[Beurre blanc sauce]] - A rich, hot [[butter]] sauce made with a reduction of [[vinegar]] or white wine\n* [[Cuban guava barbecue sauce]] - This traditional spicy Cuban [[Barbecue sauce|barbecue sauce]] can be used as a [[Marinade|marinade]] or as an [[Accompaniment|accompaniment]]\n* [[Cumberland sauce]] - This [[sauce]], invented, it is said, by the 3rd Duke of Cumberland is great with rich and spicy meats\n* [[Hollandaise sauce]] - An emulsion of [[butter]] and [[lemon]] juice using [[egg]] yolks as the emulsifying agent\n* [[Kachumbari]] - This is a chilled, spicy sauce from Kenya\n* [[Lemon and parsley sauce]] - An extremely quick and delicious accompaniment for fish dishes\n* [[Lemon butter for fish]] - A simple lemony [[butter]] sauce that is perfect for delicate white [[fish]] and for dipping [[globe artichokes]]\n* [[Mary Rose sauce]] - The classic [[prawn cocktail]] sauce\n* [[Piri piri sauce]] - This condiment is great dripped on [[grilled]] [[meat]] and [[poultry]]\n* [[Salsa de aj\u00ed picante]] - A [[hot pepper]] sauce from Ecuador\n* [[Sauce velout\u00e9]] - One of the classic 5 mother sauces of French cuisine\n* [[Sauce vierge]] - A [[Sauce|sauce]] for [[Fish|fish]] and sometimes [[Pasta|pasta]], which can be served warm or cold\n* [[Quick tartare sauce]] - A tartare sauce recipe for those with not much time on their hands!\n===Recipes using lemon sauces===\n\nThe following recipes are not actually for [[lemon]] sauce, but sauce recipes that contain sauces using lemons.\n* [[Champi\u00f1ones al Ajillo (Mushrooms in Garlic Sauce)]] - Mushrooms in garlic \"sauce\" - not exactly a sauce as we know it in the UK, but delicious all the same\n* [[Creamy seafood in lettuce wraps]] - The idea for this recipe came from a seafood sauce made by The Barefoot Contessa.  My variation won't turn you into a fattie!\n* [[Deep fried chicken in lemon sauce]] - A delicious Chinese-style lemon sauce used to coat fried chicken or fish\n* [[Paling in 't groen (Eel in green sauce)]] - An [[eel]] recipe from Belgium, in a rather unappetising sounding 'green sauce' \n* [[Pebre chileno (Chilean hot pepper sauce) (V)]] - This is a spicy salsa from Chile\n* [[Potted smoked mackerel with Capricorn goats' cheese and chives]] - Get your hit of omega 3 oils with this creamy fishy starter recipe\n* [[Prawn cocktail with quails' eggs and Mary Rose sauce]] - Another wonderful recipe idea, kindly reproduced with Robin's permission\n* [[Salat malfoof]] - A garlicky coleslaw type recipe from the Lebanon\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#lemonsauce #saucewithlemons #cornflour #limejuice #lemonzest #lemonrecipe</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Dips and sauces]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Lentil lasagne (TM)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Lentil lasagne - A Thermomix recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#butter #cheese #lentils #lasagne #puylentils #nutmeg #onion #sauce #garlic #vegetablestock #groundcoriander \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Lentils often sound boring, but used this way they are delicious especially if made with earthy Puy lentils (Lentilles vertes du Puy)\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1777\n|PortionCalories = 444\n|DatePublished=26th September 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  2 hours, 5 minutes\n|PrepTime =  20 minutes\n|CookTime =  1 hour, 45 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Lentil lasagne TM recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Prawn and crab is nicer</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">3.4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">\ud83d\ude03</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Lentil lasagne2.jpg|thumb|300px|right|The interior]]\nLentils often sound boring, but used this way they are delicious especially if made with earthy [[Puy lentils]] (Lentilles vertes du Puy)\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 350g [[Puy lentils]]\n| 125g [[Parmigiano-Reggiano|Parmesan]] or [[Grana Padano]] cheese (for a vegetarian alternative, use Bookham's [[Twineham Grange cheese]])\n| 30g [[Butter|butter]]\n| 2 tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 1 large [[Onion|onion]], thickly sliced\n| [[Garlic]] to taste, thickly sliced\n| 2 teaspoons [[Ground coriander|ground coriander]]\n| 600g [[Vegetable Stock|vegetable stock]]\n| Seasoning\n| 40g [[Plain flour|plain flour]]\n| 40g [[Butter|butter]]\n| [[Freshly ground white pepper]]\n| Freshly [[Ground|ground]] [[Nutmeg|nutmeg]] - use plenty\n| 600g [[Milk|milk]]\n| [[Lasagne]] sheets (use the ones that don't require cooking first)\n| Extra [[Butter|butter]] for dotting (optional)\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Wash the [[Lentils|lentils]] and put them in a jug covered with [[Boiling|boiling]] water.\n| Meanwhile cut the [[Cheese|cheese]] into chunks, add to the bowl '''6 seconds / Speed 10''''''Bold text'''\n| Remove from the bowl and reserve\n| Add the [[Butter|butter]], [[Oil|oil]], [[Onion|onion]] and [[Garlic|garlic]] to the TM bowl '''25 minutes / Speed 1 / Temp Varoma / Reverse blade / MC off''', but increase to '''Speed 2 for the last 10 minutes'''\n| Drain the [[Lentils|lentils]] and add to the bowl '''2 minutes / Speed 2 / 100\u00b0 C / Reverse blade / MC off'''\n| Add the [[Coriander|coriander]] and [[Vegetable Stock|vegetable stock]] '''25 minutes / Speed 2 / 100\u00b0 C  / Reverse blade / MC off''' - much of the liquid should have been absorbed.  If not, increase the cooking time, but watch it because you don't want the mixture to be totally absorbed\n| Season to taste, but bear in mind that the [[Cheese|cheese]] will be salty\n| Remove from the bowl and reserve\n| Rinse the bowl so that any traces of the [[Lentils|lentils]] mixture have disappeared (no need for a thorough wash)\n| Add the [[Butter|butter]], [[Flour|flour]], [[Pepper|pepper]], [[Nutmeg|nutmeg]] and [[Milk|milk]] to the rinsed out bowl '''7 minutes / Speed 4 / 90\u00b0 C / MC on'''\n| In the meantime, preheat the [[Oven|oven]] 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6), [fan oven 180\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n}}\n'''To prepare for the [[Oven|oven]] '''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Take a [[Lasagne|lasagne]] or [[Baking|baking]] dish and pour half of the [[Lentil|lentil]] mixture into the bottom - spread it out fairly evenly\n| Cover with [[Lasagne|lasagne]] sheets\n| Pour half of the [[Sauce|sauce]] over the sheets, then top with half of the [[Grated|grated]] [[Cheese|cheese]]\n| Add the remaining [[Lentils|lentils]], [[Lasagne|lasagne]] sheets, [[Sauce|sauce]] and [[Cheese|cheese]] as just described\n| Dot the top layer of [[Cheese|cheese]] with [[Butter|butter]] if desired.\n| [[Bake]] for about 45 minutes\n}}\n===Recipe source===\n\n* Adapted and converted for [[Thermomix]] from a recipe by Rose Elliot\n===Chef's notes===\nThe timing for cooking the [[Lentils|lentils]] is approximate and you may find that you will need a little less [[Stock|stock]] or a shorter cooking time.  [[Puy lentils]] are cooked in 20-25 minutes if [[Boiled|boiled]], so try not to overcook them, especially as they have had a short soaking beforehand.  Just don't let the mixture get too dry and bear in mind that the liquid will continue to evaporate whilst making the [[Basic white sauce|b\u00e9chamel sauce]].\n{{LasagneRecipes}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Italian recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Grain and bean recipes]]\n[[Category:Pasta recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#butter #cheese #lentils #lasagne #puylentils #nutmeg #onion #sauce #garlic #vegetablestock #groundcoriander </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Lentil soup",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Lentil soup, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#lentilsoup #lentils #chiliflakes #onion #garlic #bayleaf #carrots #oliveoil #vegetablestock #diced #boiledorsimmered \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Thick and warming, this soup is great comfort food on a winter evening, serve with warm crusty bread\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1422\n|PortionCalories = 355\n|DatePublished=31st October 2012\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime = 45 minutes\n|PrepTime = 10 minutes\n|CookTime = 35 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Lentil soup recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"><span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">A hearty meal</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">And vegan too \ud83d\udc96</span> \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\">[[User:Chef|Jerry]] </span></span>\n}}\nThick and warming, this soup is great comfort food on a winter evening, serve with warm crusty bread.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1.5 tablespoons of [[olive oil]]\n| 1 [[onion]], peeled and chopped\n| 2 [[Carrots|carrots]], scrubbed and [[diced]]\n| 2 cloves of [[Garlic|garlic]], peeled and crushed\n| 225 g (1/2 lb) of dry red [[lentils]]\n| 6 cups of [[vegetable stock]] or water\n| 1 [[Bay leaf|bay leaf]]\n| [[Sea salt]] and [[freshly ground black pepper]]\n| A squeeze of lemon juice\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n|Pick over the lentils and remove any stones.  Rinse well.\n|Heat the olive oil, with a twist of pepper, in a large pan over medium heat.  Once oil is hot, add the onion and carrots.  [[Saut\u00e9]]  for a few minutes, until the vegetables have started to soften, then add the garlic, stir-fry until the garlic takes some colour.\n|Add the lentils, bay leaf, and stock to the pot.  Simmer over low-medium heat for 25-35 minutes, until lentils are softened.\n}}\n===Serving suggestion===\n\nAdd a squeeze of fresh lemon juice just before serving, serve hot with crusty bread.\n\n===Variations===\n\nSprinkle with [[chili flakes]] for a spicier soup. \n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Grain and bean recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:North African recipes]]\n[[Category:Soup and stock recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Student recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#lentilsoup #lentils #chiliflakes #onion #garlic #bayleaf #carrots #oliveoil #vegetablestock #diced #boiledorsimmered </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

                ]

title": "Lettuce soup (TM)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Lettuce soup - A Thermomix recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#potatoes #mint #garlic #parsley #butter #cream #lettuce #thermomixrecipes #springonions #yoghurt #stock \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This Thermomix recipe has been adapted from a recipe in Fast and Easy Cooking, the book which comes with the UK Thermomix\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 835\n|PortionCalories = 208\n|DatePublished=20th October 2012\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 35 minutes\n |PrepTime = 10 minutes\n |CookTime = 25 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Lettuce soup recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Strange\u2026</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">2.5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">\u2026but true.</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:NonLoggedInUser|NonLoggedInUser]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis Thermomix recipe has been adapted from a recipe in '''[http://www.ukthermomix.com/recindex.php Fast and Easy Cooking]''', the book which comes with UK Thermomixes.  It can easily be adapted for cooking on the hob.\n\n{{RecipeIngredientsTM\n| 4 [[Spring onions|spring onions]], cut into 2cm lengths\n| [[Garlic]] to taste, peeled\n| 30g [[Butter|butter]]\n| 500g [[Vegetable Stock|vegetable stock]]\n| 250g [[Potatoes|potatoes]], peeled and cut into 1cm cubes\n| 8-10 outside leaves of a large [[Lettuce|lettuce]], roughly torn (I used Iceberg)\n| 100g [[Cream|cream]] or [[Yoghurt|yogurt]]\n| Seasoning\n| [[Mint]] or [[Parsley|parsley]] to garnish\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Place the [[Spring onion|spring onion]] and the [[Garlic|garlic]] in The TM bowl and chop '''4 seconds / Speed 4&frac12;'''.\n| Scrape doen the sides and lid of the TM bowl and lid.\n| Add the [[Butter|butter]] and saut\u00e9 '''10 minutes /100\u00b0C/ Speed 1 / MC Off'''. \n| Add the [[Stock|stock]] and the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] and cook '''15-17 minutes / 100\u00b0 C / Speed 1''', making sure that the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] are properly cooked.\n| Add the [[Lettuce|lettuce]], [[Cream|cream]] seasoning and pur\u00e9e '''1 minute / 90\u00b0C / Speed 8''' until smooth.\n| If the temperature has dropped below 90\u00b0C, heat through on '''Speed 1''' until that temperature has been achieved.\n| Serve garnished with the [[Mint|mint]] or [[Parsley|parsley]].\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Soup and stock recipes]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Thermomix recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#potatoes #mint #garlic #parsley #butter #cream #lettuce #thermomixrecipes #springonions #yoghurt #stock </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }

2455\n|PortionCalories = 613\n|DatePublished=21st January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Liver and onions with salad\n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime = 30 minutes\n|PrepTime = oz dry white wine or [[sherry]] \n| Salt & freshly ground [[black pepper]]\n| Finely chopped [[chives]] to garnish\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Season a little flour with [[black pepper]] and coat the liver\n| Heat 25g of [[butter]] and 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a frying pan\n| Add the liver and cook for 2 minutes a side\n| Season with a little [[salt]]\n| Reserve the liver to a plate and keep warm\n| Add the shallots to the pan and cook over a gentle heat for about 10 minutes\n| [[Deglazing|Deglaze]] the pan with the wine and continue cooking until the liquid has reduced by half\n| Add the remaining 15g of [[butter]], stir and remove from heat\n| Pour the sauce over the liver, garnish with the chopped [[chives]] and serve\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Offal recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Cooking with title": "Liver in garlic butter",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "\n<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Liver in garlic butter recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#liver #breadcrumbs #garlic #flour #butter #thymeleaves #eggwash #liveringarlicbutter #sieve #panfried #salad \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Another nice way to cook liver with as much garlic as you like!\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=15th May 2019\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  2 hours, 10 minutes\n|PrepTime =  2 hours\n|CookTime =  10 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 1365\n|PortionCalories = 682\n|Image = [[Image:Liver in garlic butter recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Wow!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Just Wow.  What a mix of flavours\ud83e\udd17</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry, aka Chef]])</span></span>\n}}\nAnother nice way to cook [[Liver|liver]] with as much [[Garlic|garlic]] as you like!\n\nAs a habit, I like to soak [[Liver|liver]] in [[Milk|milk]] before cooking.  You can omit that step if you wish, other than imparting more [[Garlic|garlic]] flavour, it probably doesn't make too much difference.\n[[Image:Liver coated, ready to fry.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Breadcrumbed liver, ready to fry]]\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 3 tablespoons [[Butter|butter]]\n| Pinch of [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 6 [[Cloves of Garlic, peeled and crushed|cloves of garlic, peeled and crushed]]\n| 200 ml [[Milk|milk]]\n| 200g [[Lambs|lambs]] [[Liver|liver]], deveined and thinly sliced\n| 1 tablespoon picked [[Thyme leaves|thyme leaves]]\n| 2 [[Eggs|eggs]], beaten\n| 2 tablespoons of [[Plain flour|plain flour]]\n| 25g [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Add the [[Milk|milk]], half of the [[Crushed garlic|crushed garlic]] and the sliced [[Liver|liver]] to a [[Lock and Lock box]], cover, shake well and leave for an hour or two, shaking now and then.\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Drain the [[Milk|milk]] from the [[Liver|liver]] using a [[Sieve|sieve]] so you retain the [[Garlic|garlic]]!\n| Beat the [[Thyme leaves|thyme leaves]] into the [[Egg|egg]]\n| Arrange the [[Flour|flour]], [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]], [[Egg wash|egg wash]] on plates, and a spare plate for the coated [[Liver|liver]]\n| Coat the [[Liver|liver]] in [[Flour|flour]], [[Dip|dip]] in the [[Egg wash|egg wash]] and roll in the [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]]\n| Heat the [[Butter|butter]] in a [[Frying pan|frying pan]] and add the [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n| Add the remaining [[Garlic|garlic]] to the pan and [[Fry|fry]] for one minutes\n| Add all of the [[Liver|liver]] to the pan and cook for 5 minutes, turning once\n| Remove from the pan and [[Rest for|rest for]] 5 minutes\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with a light [[Salad|salad]] and [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]].  We had some leftover roasties too.  Yum!\n===Variations===\nWe make [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]] from the [[Bread|bread]] we [[Bake|bake]] everyday which makes this look rather 'gnarly'.  Normal breadcrumbs are fine.\n===Chef's notes===\nAdd the [[Flour|flour]] to a [[Lock and Lock box]] with the drained [[Liver|liver]], cover and shake well.  This is quick, easy and the best way to evenly flour the liver.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Italian recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Lamb recipes]]\n[[Category:Salad recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#liver #breadcrumbs #garlic #flour #butter #thymeleaves #eggwash #liveringarlicbutter #sieve #panfried #salad </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Loaf inglese al latte - in italiano",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Loaf inglese al latte - in italiano a British recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#loafingleseallatteinitaliano \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Questo e' il loaf increspato e cilindrico che ricordo da bambina negli anni '60 e\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2224\n|PortionCalories = 222\n|DatePublished=13th November 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = 10\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  2 hours, 50 minutes\n|PrepTime =  2 hours, 15 minutes\n|CookTime =  35 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:English milk loaf recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Round bread!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">..but not Pagnotta.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry, aka Chef]])</span></span>\n}}\nQuesto e' il loaf increspato e cilindrico che ricordo da bambina negli anni '60 e '70.\n[[Image:English milk loaf slices.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Loaf inglese al latte]]\n\u00c8 possibile utilizzare una macchina per il pane per l'impasto, ma per ottenere la sua forma autentica avrete bisogno di uno stampo per il 'loaf' (pagnotta) inglese. Gli ingredienti sono elencati nell'ordine in cui li si dovrebbe aggiungere ad una macchina per il pane Panasonic e impostato sul programma per la pasta del pane francese. Per le altre marche, fare riferimento alle istruzioni del produttore e impostare il programma pi\u00f9 lungo, quindi continuare dalla fase 4.\n===Ingredienti===\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 7g di lievito\n| 450g farina\n| 1 cucchiaio di latte in polvere\n| 2 cucchiai di olio di girasole\n| &frac12; cucchiaino di sale\n| 270 ml latte caldo\n\n}}\n\n===Preparazione===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Mescolare la farina, il sale, il lievito e il latte in polvere in una ciotola.\n| Aggiungere il latte e l'olio e mescolare per ottenere un impasto morbido, aggiungere la farina, aggiungetene un po' di pi\u00f9 se \u00e8 troppo bagnato.\n| Impastare per 10 minuti fino a che non diventa liscia, elastica e morbida.\n| Leggermente, ma accuratamente ungere lo stampo per il loaf con olio. L'olio d'arachide e' particolarmente adatto perche' ha un basso contenuto di acidi grassi monoinsaturi.\n| Date alla pasta la forma di un cilindro della stessa lunghezza dello stampo.\n| Mettere l'impasto sul fondo dello stampo, inserire le linguette e chiudete lo stampo.\n| Lasciate riposare in un luogo caldo per consentire al pane di lievitare - guarda l'impasto attraverso il buco nel coperchio dello stampo.\n| Riscaldare il forno a 200 \u00b0C (400 \u00b0F - gas 6).\n| Appena il pane e' lievitato e si riesce a vedere dal buco nel coperchio, infornate e cuocete per 30 minuti (se il forno e'\n| ventilato) o 35 minuti (con un forno convenzionale).\n| Lasciate raffreddare lo stampo per 2-3 minuti prima togliere il coperchio. Togliete il pane e lasciatelo raffreddare su una griglia.\n}}\n===Note===\nSi pu\u00f2 fare questo loaf anche con lievito di birra fresco, se lo si desidera, in questo caso usatene 15g e fatelo sciogliere nel latte prima dell'uso. In questo caso non e' possibile usare una machcina per il pane. Per questa ricetta ho usato la farina francese per il pane della marca 'Wessex Mills' ma si pu\u00f2 provare con farine diverse.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Breadmaker recipes]][[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#loafingleseallatteinitaliano </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Lobster thermidor",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Lobster thermidor, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#lobsterthermidor #lemon #shallot #zest #grated #butter #parsley #lobster #doublecream #parmesancheese #brandy \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Try this dish out - it is superb and well worth the trouble it takes. If like me you're a little squeamish about boiling live lobsters, buy one that is\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1138\n|PortionCalories = 569\n|DatePublished=21st January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime = 40 minutes\n|PrepTime = 20 minutes\n|CookTime = 20 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Lobster thermidor recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Superb</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I remember being served this in a pub in Polzeth, way back in my surfing days - just sublime.  This tasted as good.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nTry this dish out - it is superb and well worth the trouble it takes.\n\nIf like me you're a little squeamish about [[boiling]] live [[lobsters]], buy one that is ready cooked. Large supermarkets sell them now, as do good fishmongers.\n\nI got lucky when I went to buy the (cooked) lobster from Tesco's as they were reduced, so I got the lobster for \u00a37.49, which meant lobster thermidor for two cost less than a tenner! (''August 2008'')\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1 whole [[Lobster]], cooked\n| 25 g ( 1 oz) [[butter]]\n| 1 [[shallot]] or small [[onion]], finely chopped\n| 284ml (1/2 pint) very good quality [[Fish stock|fish stock]] - &#189; a tin of good [[lobster bisque soup]] is an excellent substitute, if not better\n| 50 ml (2 fl oz) [[white wine]]\n| 100 ml (4 fl oz) [[double cream]]\n| 2 tablespoons fresh [[parsley]], chopped\n| &#189; teaspoon [[English mustard]] powder\n| Juice from half a [[lemon]]\n| Pinch of chopped [[lemon]] [[zest]]\n| Splash of [[brandy]]\n| [[Sea salt]] and [[freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 25 g (1 oz) [[Parmesan cheese]], freshly [[grated]]\n| [[Lemon]] quarters to garnish\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:How to make Lobster thermidor.jpg|Stock - reduced\nImage:Cooking Lobster thermidor.jpg|Before the sauce\nImage:How to prepare Lobster thermidor.jpg|\u00a37.50 !\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Twist off the claws and smash open with a hammer to remove the [[meat]]. Reserve.\n| Lay the lobster on its back and split in half from head to toe.\n| Scoop out the [[meat]] from the head and body and reserve\n| Chop the [[meat]] into small pieces, mix up a bit and arrange back in the shell\n| Heat the [[butter]] in a pan, [[sweat]] the chopped [[shallot]] until translucent - about 5 minutes on a low heat\n| Add the [[stock]], [[wine]], [[brandy]] and bring to the [[boil]]. Reduce until it is half of its original volume, less if using soup. Add the [[mustard]], [[lemon juice]], [[zest]] and [[double cream]] \n| Season with [[salt]] and [[pepper]] and mix in half of the chopped [[parsley]]\n| Preheat the grill\n| Spoon the [[sauce]] over the [[lobster]] meat\n| Sprinkle the [[grated]] [[Parmesan cheese]] over the  top and add a twist of [[pepper]]\n| Heat under the grill for about 4 minutes - just enough make the [[cheese]] bubble\n| Sprinkle the remaining parsley over the top \n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\n\nServe immediately with lemon quarters as a garnish\n\nI served this with [[lemon rice]] which worked really well as an accompaniment.\n\nEqually good accompaniments would be [[new potatoes]] and a [[green salad]], or a [[tomato and onion salad]] to cut through the richness of the sauce, and then some [[Basic French loaf|crusty French bread]] to soak up all the juices.\n\n==See also==\n{{Template:Lobster recipes}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Shellfish recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Cooking with wine]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n[[Category:Grilled, griddled or barbecued]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\nHector Acosta: All I just want to add is this: This is MY FAVOURITE DISH EVER!!!\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#lobsterthermidor #lemon #shallot #zest #grated #butter #parsley #lobster #doublecream #parmesancheese #brandy </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "London broil",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=London broil recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#londonbroil #barbecue #grain #flanksteak #grill #northamerican #marination #thricecookedchips #juice #images #restfor \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=London broil is a North American beef dish made by grilling marinated flank steak, then cutting it against the grain into thin strips\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1808\n|PortionCalories = 452\n|DatePublished=18th August 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  12 hours, 10 minutes\n|PrepTime =  12 hours\n|CookTime =  10 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:London_broilII.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Looks fab.</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Tastes fab too.  I marinate mine for 24 hours or more though.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}}\nLondon [[Broil|broil]] is a [[North American]] [[Beef|beef]] dish made by [[Grilling|grilling]] [[Marinated|marinated]] [[Flank steak|flank steak]], then cutting it against the [[Grain|grain]] into thin strips.\n\nThe name generally refers to the [[Marination|marination]] method rather than the [[Cut of beef|cut of beef]].\n\nThis recipe can also be cooked on a [[Barbecue|barbecue]].\n\nPlease ensure that you [[Rest|rest]] the [[Meat|meat]] for at least 10 minutes before serving.  It won't go cold and this method ensures a tender [[Steak|steak]] that is not too bloody.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 900g (2 lb) [[Flank steak]]\n| [[Juice]] and [[Zest|zest]] from 1 [[Lemon|lemon]] (or [[Lime|lime]])\n| 5 tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 4 [[Fat|fat]] [[Cloves of Garlic, peeled and crushed|cloves of garlic, peeled and crushed]]\n| 4 tablespoons [[Balsamic vinegar|balsamic vinegar]]\n| 3 tablespoons [[Dijon Mustard|dijon mustard]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Worcestershire sauce]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Light soy sauce|light soy sauce]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Chilli powder|chilli powder]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Dried oregano|dried oregano]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Dried thyme|dried thyme]]\n| Splash of good [[Chilli sauce|chilli sauce]] (to taste)\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Place all of the ingredients in a shallow [[Lock & Lock]] style box.\n| Shake vigorously for a minute.\n| [[Refrigerate]] for 12 hours, shaking and turning now and then.\n| Prepare a very hot [[Grill|grill]], [[Barbecue|barbecue]] or [[Griddle pan|griddle pan]]\n| [[Grill]] for 3 to 4 minutes per side (or to your liking)\n| Allow the cooked [[Meat|meat]] joint to [[Rest for|rest for]] 10 minutes in a [[Warm place|warm place]].\n| Slicing the [[Meat|meat]] against (across) the [[Grain|grain]] will give you the most tender cuts of [[Meat|meat]].\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Horseradish cream|horseradish cream]], [[Thrice cooked chips|thrice cooked chips]] and a [[Green salad|green salad]].\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:North American recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Marinades dressings and butters]]\n[[Category:Beef recipes]]\n[[Category:Chilli pepper recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Barbecue recipes]]\n[[Category:Grilled, griddled or barbecued]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#londonbroil #barbecue #grain #flanksteak #grill #northamerican #marination #thricecookedchips #juice #images #restfor </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }

title": "Macaroni cheese (TM)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Macaroni cheese a Thermomix recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#cheese #pasta #sodiumcitrate #bakingsheet #panko #cheddar #fat #tapiocaflour #bake #crumble #refrigerate \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This recipe is for a delicious macaroni cheese made in a Thermomix. It is more time consuming than most, but is well worth the effort\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 4385\n|PortionCalories = 1461\n|DatePublished=23rd June 2015\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = 3-4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  2 hours (plus cooling time)\n|PrepTime =  30 minutes (plus cooling time)\n|CookTime =  1 hour, 30 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Macaroni cheese TM recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Looks lovely Julia</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.6</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Very fancy-pants!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis recipe is for a delicious [[Macaroni cheese|macaroni cheese]] made in a [[Thermomix]].  It is more time consuming than most, but is well worth the effort and the first two stages can be made in advance.\n{{RecipeIngredientsTM\n}}\n====For the cheese topping====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 120g [[Cheddar]] and / or mature [[Swiss cheese]], cut into chunks\n| 30g water\n| 1.25g [[Sodium citrate|sodium citrate]]\n| 50g [[Tapioca flour|tapioca flour]] ([[Starch|starch]])\n| 50g [[Panko|panko]]\n}}\n====For the macaroni====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 1.5kg water\n| \u00bd teaspoons [[Salt|salt]]\n| 200g [[Macaroni|macaroni]] or other short [[Pasta|pasta]] tubes\n| A little flavourless [[Oil|oil]]\n}}\n====For the cheese sauce====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 270g mixed extra mature [[Cheddar]] and [[Parmesan]], cut into chunks\n| 185g full [[Fat|fat]] [[Milk|milk]]\n| 13g [[Sodium citrate|sodium citrate]]\n| 80g full [[Fat|fat]] [[Cream cheese|cream cheese]]\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Pre-heat the [[Oven|oven]] to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4), [fan oven 160\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Put the [[Cheese|cheese]] into the bowl 5 seconds / Speed 5\n| Remove from the bowl and divide into 100g and 20g.  Reserve.\n| Add the water to the bowl with the [[Sodium citrate|sodium citrate]] '''2 minutes 30 seconds / 98\u00b0 C / Speed 2'''\n| Add the [[Cheese|cheese]], a little at a time '''3-4 minutes / 98\u00b0 C / Speed 2'''.  Make sure that each addition of cheese is melted and smooth before adding the next.\n| Add the [[Tapioca flour|tapioca flour]], a third at a time '''5 minutes / 98\u00b0 C / Speed 2'''.\n| Empty onto a sheet of [[Bake-O-Glide]] or silicone mat whilst still warm.\n| Soread out the mixture until thin and even.\n| Place the sheet onto a [[Baking tray|baking tray]] and [[Bake|bake]] until completely dry and golden [[Brown|brown]] for about 25-40 minutes.\n| Allow to cool and break into pieces.\n| Place in the bowl and blitz '''10 Seconds / Speed 10''' (or use a [[Spice|spice]] grinder)\n| Add the remaining [[Cheese|cheese]] and the [[Panko|panko]] and mix '''6 Seconds / Speed 3'''\n| Refigerate in an [[Airtight container|airtight container]] until needed.\n| The [[Cheese|cheese]] topping will keep for 2-3 days.\n}}\n====For the macaroni====\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Chill a metal [[Baking sheet|baking sheet]] in the [[Freezer|freezer]] for a minimum of 30 minutes.\n| [[Boil]] the water in the TM jug and add [[Salt|salt]] '''11 minutes / 98\u00b0C / Speed 2''' then add [[Pasta|pasta]]. \n| Cook '''3 minutes / 98\u00b0C / Speed Spoon / Reverse Blade''', turning down to 90\u00b0C if it bubbles up onto TM lid.\n| Drain (do not rinse) and spread on the [[Baking sheet|baking sheet]] in a single layer.\n| Leave the [[Pasta|pasta]] to cool for 5 minutes, then transfer to a bowl.\n| Lightly dress in the [[Oil|oil]], cover and [[Refrigerate|refrigerate]] until ready for use.\n}}\n====For the cheese sauce====\n{{RecipeMethod\n| In a dry bowl, grate the hard [[Cheese|cheese]] '''7 seconds / Speed 5'''.\n| Remove and reserve. \n| Put the [[Milk|milk]] and [[Sodium citrate|sodium citrate]] into the bowl '''3 minutes 30 seconds / 98\u00b0 C / Speed 2'''.\n| Keeping the '''same speed and temperature''', gradually add the hard and [[Cream cheeses|cream cheeses]] and mix until they have melted and the mixture is smooth - about 4 minutes.\n| Leave to cool very slighty.\n}}\n====To assemble and bake====\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Pre-heat the [[Oven|oven]] to 220\u00b0 C (425\u00b0 F - gas 7), [fan oven 200\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n| Mix the [[Cheese sauce|cheese sauce]] with the [[Pasta|pasta]] and tip into a [[Casserole dish|casserole dish]].\n| Sprinkle the [[Cheese|cheese]] [[Crumble|crumble]] mixture over the top.\n| [[Bake]] for about 15 minutes covered then remove the lid and bake for a further 10 minutes or until the top is golden [[Brown|brown]].\n| Serve whilst still hot.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nThis is very filling, so best served with just [[Salad|salad]].\n===Recipe source===\n\n* Adapted and converted for Thermomix from a recipe in ''' ''[http://www.amazon.co.uk/Modernist-Cuisine-Home-Nathan-Myhrvold/dp/0982761015/ref=sr_1_1?s=books&ie=UTF8&qid=1435037010&sr=1-1&keywords=Modernist Modernist Cuisine at Home]'' '''\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:North American recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Pasta recipes]]\n[[Category:Molecular gastronomy recipes]]\n[[Category:Thermomix recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#cheese #pasta #sodiumcitrate #bakingsheet #panko #cheddar #fat #tapiocaflour #bake #crumble #refrigerate </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}
