title": "Macaroni pie (Scottish)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Macaroni pie, an authentic Scottish recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#hotwatercrustpastry #westindianmacaronipie #basicmacaronicheese #boiledorsimmered #britishrecipes #unusualrecipes #pastarecipes #macaronicheese #maincourses #blindbaked #eggrecipes\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=A Scottish macaroni pie, as opposed to a West Indian macaroni pie is a pie case made from hot water crust pastry, that is filled with macaroni cheese\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2200\n|PortionCalories = 1100\n|DatePublished=6th July 2014\n|Author=Chef\n |Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 3\n |TotalTime = 1 hour 45 minutes\n |PrepTime = 30 minutes\n |CookTime = 1 hour 15 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Macaroni pies.jpg|300px|alt=Electus]]\n <span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Random recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Contents were lovely</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">3</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Pastry was a bit too greasy for me</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry]] </span></span>\n}}\nA '''Scottish macaroni pie''', as opposed to a [[West Indian macaroni pie]] is a pie case made from [[Hot water crust pastry|hot water crust pastry]], that is filled with [[macaroni cheese]] (mac and cheese) and then baked.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| two portions of [[hot water crust pastry]]\n| half a portion of [[basic macaroni cheese]]\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4), [fan [[Oven|oven]] 160\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Divide the pastry into 8 pieces\n| Reserve about a sixth of each piece for a lid, roll this out flat\n| Mould each of the pieces into cases, using your fingers\n| Fill with the macaroni cheese mix and cover with the lid\n| Sprinkle a little extra cheese on top and bake for 15 minutes at 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - Gas 4).\n}}\n\n===Recipe for Scottish macaroni pie===\nI have been struggling for a while to obtain a recipe for a Scottish macaroni pie, without much luck.  Bearing in mind that I have never tasted one, the following may be a close approximation.\n\nI made two portions of [[hot water crust pastry]], hand moulded it into 8  '''not''' 12 pie cases, [[blind baked]] these for 20 minutes at 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - Gas 4), made half a portion of [[basic macaroni cheese]] and used it to fill the pie cases.  Sprinkled a little extra cheese on the top and baked these for 15 minutes at 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - Gas 4).\n<GoogleBanner>recipe-pages</GoogleBanner>\nI have to say that I found the hot water crust pastry unbelievably greasy and not very nice at all.  I will repeat the experiment using shortcrust pastry, which may not be authentic but will probably be nicer.\n===Visitor's tip for making hot-water crust pastry===\nYou want to make the pie crust with as cold water as possible. The dough should also be worked together as quickly as possible, not to generate to much heat.\n\nLeave to rest in the fridge for 30 min before rolling it out.  --Siri-Ann \n===See also===\n\n* [[West Indian macaroni pie]]\n* [[Hot water crust pastry]]\n* [[Melton Mowbray style pork pies|Melton Mowbray style pork pie]]\n[[Category:Ingredients]]\n[[Category:Prepared foods]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Pasta recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Egg recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n{{RecipeSkip}}\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#hotwatercrustpastry #westindianmacaronipie #basicmacaronicheese #boiledorsimmered #britishrecipes #unusualrecipes #pastarecipes #macaronicheese #maincourses #blindbaked #eggrecipes </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Macaroni with four cheeses",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Macaroni with four cheeses a cheese recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#grated #macaroniwithfourcheeses #cheese #sauce #grill #butter #chiliflakes #boiling #emmental #emmentalcheese #macaroni \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Macaroni cheese (Mac and cheese), simple yet tasty - especially when made with four cheeses, though there is nothing to stop you replacing these just\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2912\n|PortionCalories = 728\n|DatePublished=20th December 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 30 minutes\n |PrepTime = 10 minutes\n |CookTime = 20 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Macaroni with four cheeses recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Macaroni is good with one cheese</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">It's supercalifragilisticexpialidocious with four cheeses </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Sue_spins|Susie]] </span></span>\n}}\nMacaroni [[Cheese|cheese]] (Mac and cheese), simple yet tasty - especially when made with four [[Cheeses|cheeses]], though there is nothing to stop you replacing these just one cheese.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 250 g (9 oz) [[Dried|dried]] macaroni\n| 40 g (1&frac12; oz) [[Butter|butter]]\n| 40 g (1&frac12; oz) [[Plain flour|plain flour]]\n| 600 ml /(1pint) [[Milk|milk]]\n| 110 g (4 oz) [[Grated|grated]] [[Gruy\u00e8re cheese]]\n| 110 g (4 oz) [[Grated|grated]] [[Emmental cheese]]\n| 1 teaspoon of [[Chili flakes|chili flakes]] (optional)\n| 50 g (2oz) [[Grated|grated]] [[Cheddar cheese]]\n| 50 g (2oz) [[Grated|grated]] [[Parmesan cheese]]\n| [[Freshly ground black pepper]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Cook the macaroni in a large saucepan of [[Boiling|boiling]] [[Salted|salted]] water for 8-10 minutes; drain well and set to one side.\n| Melt the [[Butter|butter]] over a medium heat in a pan slightly and add the [[Flour|flour]], stir to form a [[Roux|roux]], cooking for a few minutes.\n| Whisk in the [[Milk|milk]], a little at a time. Cook for 10-15 minutes until you have a thick, smooth [[Sauce|sauce]].\n| Meanwhile, preheat the [[Grill|grill]].\n| Remove the [[Sauce|sauce]] from the heat and add the [[Gruy\u00e8re]] and [[Emmental]] and stir well until the [[Cheese|cheese]] has melted and combined into the sauce.\n| Season with [[Black pepper|black pepper]].\n| Sprinkle the [[Chili flakes|chili flakes]] into the [[Cheese sauce|cheese sauce]], if using, and mix well.\n| Tip the macaroni into the [[Sauce|sauce]] and mix well. Pour the mixture into a deep ovenproof dish.\n| Sprinkle the [[Parmesan]] and [[Cheddar]] over the top and place under the [[Grill|grill]] until the [[Cheese|cheese]] has melted and some of the [[macaroni]] has crisped up a little.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe immediately.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Pasta recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]][[Category:Grilled, griddled or barbecued]]\n\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#grated #macaroniwithfourcheeses #cheese #sauce #grill #butter #chiliflakes #boiling #emmental #emmentalcheese #macaroni </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Macaroni with three cheeses",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Macaroni with three cheeses a cheese recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#macaroniwiththreecheeses #macaroni #cheeses #cheese #butter #nutmeg #sauce #cheddar #blender #wellsalpine #celery \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=I'm not sure to which category this mac and cheese recipe belongs, but it uses two East Anglian cheeses and one from Galicia in Spain\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2616\n|PortionCalories = 654\n|DatePublished=20th December 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = A picture from a similar recipe, Macaroni with four cheeses\n |Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 30 minutes\n |PrepTime = 10 minutes\n |CookTime = 20 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Macaroni with four cheeses recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"><span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Mac and cheese</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.67</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">..with extra cheese, and extra cheese - what's not to like?</span> \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\">[[User:Chef|Jerry]] </span></span>\n}}\nI'm not sure to which category this mac and cheese recipe belongs, but it uses two East Anglian [[Cheeses|cheeses]] and one from Galicia in Spain.  It also has the benefit of [[Roast garlic|roast garlic]] mixed in with it.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 20 ml [[Butter|butter]] or [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 2 tablespoons [[Plain flour|plain flour]]\n| 300 ml semi-skimmed [[Milk|milk]]\n| Large pinch [[Rock salt|rock salt]]\n| Freshly [[Grated|grated]] [[Nutmeg|nutmeg]] and [[Black pepper|black pepper]], to taste\n| 40 g [[Wells Alpine cheese]], chopped into small pieces\n| 40 g Vintage [[Lincolnshire Poacher cheese]], chopped into small pieces\n| 80 g [[Tetilla Cheese|tetilla cheese]], chopped into small pieces\n| 2 bulbs [[Roasted garlic|roasted garlic]], squeezed\n| 400g (14 oz) [[Macaroni|macaroni]] - dry weight\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the oven to 220\u00b0C (425\u00b0F - Gas Mk 7) \n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Melt the [[Butter|butter]] over a medium heat.\n| Add the [[Flour|flour]], little by little, stirring constantly in a figure of 8 until thick and smooth - a balloon whisk is good for this.\n| Reduce heat to low and cook for a few minutes, stirring occasionally.  Do not allow to [[Brown|brown]].\n| Remove from heat and add the [[Milk|milk]] slowly - again stirring constantly in a figure of 8 until thick and smooth.\n| Stir in the [[Salt|salt]], [[Nutmeg|nutmeg]] and [[Pepper|pepper]].\n| Add the [[Cheeses|cheeses]] and allow them to melt, still over a low heat and stir from time to time and add the squeezed [[Garlic|garlic]].\n| Bring some water to the [[Boil|boil]] and cook the [[Macaroni|macaroni]] for the time indicated on the packet.\n| Meanwhile, using a stick [[Blender|blender]] or [[Food processor|food processor]], blitz the [[Sauce|sauce]] until it is smooth.\n| Drain the [[Macaroni|macaroni]] and place in an [[Oven|oven]]-proof dish and pour the [[Sauce|sauce]] over it.\n| Sprinkle with extra [[Cheese|cheese]]\n| Bake in the oven for 15 to 20 minutes until the [[cheese]] has melted and the macaroni has crisped a little.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nOn its own or with [[Salad|salad]].  Even eat it cold for breakfast :-)\n===Variations===\nThe [[Cheeses|cheeses]] can be substituted as none of them are that easy to get.  For [[Wells Alpine]], you can use [[Gruy\u00e8re]]; for [[Lincolnshire Poacher]], a good, strong [[Cheddar]] would be excellent.  Tetilla is more difficult to substitute as it is quite a unique [[Cheese|cheese]].  You need something with a soft texture, but not of the [[Brie]] type.  The nearest I can think of in texture, but not flavour, is [[Havarti]]. \nThis is a VERY rich version of [[Macaroni cheese|macaroni cheese]] and it is not advisable to eat this too late in the evening!  It can be thinned down with [[Vegetable stock|vegetable stock]] if you prefer it to be lighter or if you want it to be even richer, you can chuck in some [[Dry sherry|dry sherry]], [[Wine|wine]] or [[Cider|cider]].\n===Chef's notes===\nJust experiment with this recipe by adding whatever you like, such as [[Celery|celery]] [[Seeds|seeds]], [[Chillies|chillies]], [[Paprika|paprika]] \n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Macaroni with three cheeses]]\n[[Category:Cooking with beer|Macaroni]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes|Macaroni with three cheeses]]\n[[Category:British recipes|Macaroni with three cheeses]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses|Macaroni with three cheeses]]\n[[Category:Pasta recipes|Macaroni with three cheeses]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites|Macaroni with three cheeses]]\n[[Category:Starters|Macaroni with three cheeses]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes|Macaroni with three cheeses]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]][[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#macaroniwiththreecheeses #macaroni #cheeses #cheese #butter #nutmeg #sauce #cheddar #blender #wellsalpine #celery </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Make this sausage pizza recipe with your kids\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#pizza #grated #dairy #sausage #mozzarella #glutenfree #miseenplace #pizzas #pizzadough #sauce #bakingtray \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Have fun with the children and start them on the road to cooking with this simple sausage pizza recipe that you can all make together\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 600\n|PortionCalories = 100\n|DatePublished=24th October 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 6\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  50 minutes\n|PrepTime =  20 minutes\n|CookTime =  30 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Make this sausage pizza with your kids recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Kiddies pizza</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.6</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">The kids loved making this, and loved eating it even more!</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nHave fun with the children and start them on the road to cooking with this simple [[Sausage|sausage]] [[Pizza|pizza]] recipe that you can all make together.  Even as an adult, I think pizza is a great meal to make with other people, especially if you like to personalise it to your own taste.\n[[Image:Perfect-pork.png|300px|thumb|right|[[Debbie and Andrew's Perfect Pork sausages]]]]\n\nTry our [[Pizza dough|pizza dough]] recipe and our [[tomato sauce for pizza]] recipe if you fancy making everything yourself.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 pack [[Debbie and Andrew's Perfect Pork sausages]]\n| 2 large ready-made pizza bases or for a [[Gluten free|gluten free]] alternative, try Udi's [[Pizza]] Base Mix\n| 75g [[Grated|grated]] [[Cheddar cheese|cheddar cheese]] or a [[Dairy|dairy]] free option\n| 100g [[Grated|grated]] [[Mozzarella|mozzarella cheese]] or a [[Dairy|dairy]] free option\n| 50ml of tomato pizza sauce - or [[Tomato sauce for pizza|make it yourself!]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6), [fan oven 180\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| [[Bake]] your [[Sausages|sausages]] in a lightly oiled [[Baking tray|baking tray]] in the preheated [[Oven|oven]] for 20 minutes, shaking the pan once or twice during that time.\n| Put to one side to cool, then slice thinly.\n| Spread the [[Sauce|sauce]] over the [[Pizza|pizza]] bases. Add the sliced [[Sausage|sausage]] and sprinkle with the [[Cheddar|cheddar]] and [[Mozzarella|mozzarella]].\n| Place the [[Pizzas|pizzas]] in the [[Oven|oven]] and cook for 10 to 15 minutes or until the base is crisp and the topping is golden.\n| Slice and serve!\n}}\n===Variations===\nAdd sliced [[Peppers|peppers]], [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]], slices of [[Onion|onion]] or [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]].\n==See also==\n* [[Udi's Gluten Free Products|Udi's Gluten Free Baking Products]]\n* [[Pizza dough|Cookipedia's pizza dough recipe]]\n* [[:Category:Pizza recipes|Cookipedia's pizza recipe section]]\n* [[Tomato sauce for pizza|Cookipedia's tomato sauce for pizza]]\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Italian recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Gluten free recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Pizza recipes]]\n[[Category:Debbie&andrew's sausage recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n{{Template:DebbieAndAndrew attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#pizza #grated #dairy #sausage #mozzarella #glutenfree #miseenplace #pizzas #pizzadough #sauce #bakingtray </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Making crispy croutons for salads",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Making crispy croutons for salads and soups recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#croutons #oliveoil #makingcrispycroutonsforsalads #bread #bake #salad #ciabatta #mixedherbs #miseenplace #france #spray \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Croutons are a great way to liven up any salad and are really easy to make at home. This recipe uses the oven. Baking them produces an excellent crouton\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 266\n|PortionCalories = 33\n|DatePublished=12th July 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 8\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  25 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  10 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Making crispy croutons for salads recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Use stale bread</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Great for using up left-over bread and rolls.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Croutons]] are a great way to liven up any [[Salad|salad]] and are really easy to make at home.  They can be made on the [[Croutons recipe|hob, in a frying pan]], but I've found the best results are achieved if you make them in the [[Oven|oven]] as they get a nice even crisp and you don't have to fiddle about with them too much.\n\nThe [[Croutons|croutons]] will stay nice and crispy for at least a month if kept in a [[Lock and Lock]] style box once they have been allowed to cool down.\n\n[[French]] [[Baguettes|baguettes]] make the best [[Croutons|croutons]], but I've yet to find a decent [[Baguette|baguette]] outside [[France]].  [[Ciabatta bread]] or rolls have a similar texture and give very good results.\n\nTwo [[Ciabatta|ciabatta]] rolls make enough to garnish a [[Salad|salad]] for eight people.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 2 [[Ciabatta|ciabatta]] rolls\n| A good splash of [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| A shake of [[Mixed herbs|mixed herbs]]\n| Fine [[Sea Salt|sea salt]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 190\u00b0 C (375\u00b0 F - gas 5).  In this instance, the fan oven temperature can be the same.  Just watch them carefully!\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Salad croutons.jpg|Croutons after baking to 10 minutes\nImage:Croutons oiled, seasoned and ready for the oven.jpg|Oiled, seasoned and ready for baking\nImage:Ciabatta bread cut into croutons.jpg|Two rolls make enough croutons to serve eight people\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Cut the [[Bread|bread]] into similar sized cubes\n| Spread the [[Croutons|croutons]] out on the [[Oven tray|oven tray]]\n| [[Spray]] or sprinkle a few tablespoons f [[Olive oil|olive oil]] over the [[Croutons|croutons]]\n| Season with [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and a shake of [[Mixed herbs|mixed herbs]]\n| Use a silicone [[Brush|brush]] to ensure the [[Croutons|croutons]] are evenly coated with the [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and distribute them evenly on the tray\n| [[Bake]] for 5 minutes in the top of the [[Oven|oven]]\n| After 5 minutes turn them and [[Bake|bake]] the [[Croutons|croutons]] for a further 5 minutes.  Check them often as they can burn easily.\n| Remove from the [[Oven|oven]] and leave to cool on the tray\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nUse the [[Croutons|croutons]] to garnish [[Soups|soups]] or [[Salads|salads]].\n\nThese apparently make a great [[Snacks|snack]] - the pile gets smaller and smaller every time someone walks through the kitchen!\n===Variations===\nUse flavoured [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n\nAdd a few sprigs of [[Fresh herbs|fresh herbs]] to the tray to flavour the [[Croutons|croutons]]\n\n[[Herb]] [[Bread|bread]], [[Cheese|cheese]] [[Breads|breads]] make an interesting change\n\n{{Template:Croutons recipes}}\n\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:French recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Salad recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#croutons #oliveoil #makingcrispycroutonsforsalads #bread #bake #salad #ciabatta #mixedherbs #miseenplace #france #spray </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }

title": "Malteser fudge (TM)",

                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Malteser fudge - a Thermomix recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#chocolate #fudge #condensedmilk #cream #boiledorsimmered #cake #miseenplace #clingfilm #fridge #sweets \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A sweet pudding made in a Thermomix using Maltesers to create the fudge\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 3546\n|PortionCalories = 591\n|DatePublished=8th March 2015\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 6 to 8 people\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  15 minutes\n|PrepTime =  5 minutes\n|CookTime =  10 minutes\n|Image = [[File:Maltesers-Wrapper-Small.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">No thanks!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">2</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Too sweet, too expensive!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]] </span></span>\n}}\nHad no idea how expensive Maltesers are now!!  Try to buy them in large bags or boxes if you can.\n\n{{RecipeIngredientsTM\n| 220g Maltesers\n| 395g sweetened [[Condensed milk|condensed milk]]\n| 200g [[Milk|milk]] [[Chocolate|chocolate]], broken into pieces\n| 200g plain [[Chocolate|chocolate]], broken into pieces\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Line a deepish 20 cm / 8 inch round or 18 cm / 7 inch round [[Cake|cake]] tin\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Put the Maltesers over the base in a single layer \n| Tip the [[Chocolate|chocolate]] into the bowl '''5 sec / speed 8'''.\n| Add the [[Condensed milk|condensed milk]] '''10 mins / 100C / Speed 3'''.\n| As soon as the [[Fudge|fudge]] is finished, quickly pour over the Maltesers\n| Gently smooth the [[Fudge|fudge]] over the top and then shake the tin\n| Cover the [[Fudge|fudge]] with [[Cling film|cling film]] and leave in the [[Fridge|fridge]] to set\n| Cut into squares or slices\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nThis might be nice with a little whipped [[cream]]. \n===Recipe source===\n\n* Lightly adapted from a recipe on the [http://www.recipecommunity.com.au/desserts-sweets-recipes/chocolate-malteser-fudge/202758 Thermomix Australia Recipe Community site]\n===Variations===\nUse Smarties, M&Ms or other [[Chocolate|chocolate]] based [[Sweets|sweets]] instead of Maltesers\n===Chef's notes===\nMore of a pudding than a confectionery.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Australian recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Thermomix recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#chocolate #fudge #condensedmilk #cream #boiledorsimmered #cake #miseenplace #clingfilm #fridge #sweets </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Marie Rose Sauce (TM)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Marie Rose Sauce - A Thermomix recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#eggyolks #orange #tomatoketchup #mustard #sauces #juice #mayonnaise #oliveoil #brandy #salads #seafood \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This Marie Rose Sauce recipe is a translation of a recipe in Salsas y Alinos con Thermomix (Susaeta Ediciones)\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 179\n|PortionCalories = 29\n|DatePublished=31st August 2012\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|ImageComment = The new [[Thermomix]] TM5 (2014)\n |Servings = Servings: 6 - Makes 500 ml\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 10 minutes\n |PrepTime = 10 minutes\n |CookTime = None\n|Image = [[Image:The new (2014) Thermomix TM5.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Nice with the orange</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I don't usually make this with oranges, but it made a nice change.</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The&nbsp;Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis is a translation of a recipe in '''Salsas y Ali\u00f1os con Thermomix (Susaeta Ediciones)'''\n\n{{RecipeIngredientsTM\n| 2 very fresh [[Egg yolks|egg yolks]]\n| 1 [[Orange|orange]]\n| 100g [[Tomato ketchup|tomato ketchup]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Brandy|brandy]]\n| 450g [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Mustard|mustard]]\n| A dash of [[Tabasco]]\n| [[Salt]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Squeeze the [[Juice|juice]] from the [[Orange|orange]] and pour it into the TM with all the other ingredients except for the [[Oil|oil]].\n| Mix '''4 seconds / Speed 5'''.\n| Keeping the motor running at '''Speed 5''' and with the MC in position, pour the [[Oil|oil]] onto the lid allowing it to fall, little by little, into the TM, until the [[Sauce|sauce]] has emulsified.\n| Check the texture, and if it is not thick enough, add a little more [[Oil|oil]].\n| You can add a little more [[Ketchup|ketchup]] if it is too pale.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nThis is one of those [[Sauces|sauces]] derived from [[Mayonnaise|mayonnaise]].  It is perfect with [[Fish|fish]], [[Seafood|seafood]], [[Salads|salads]] and white [[Meat|meat]].  \n===Variations===\nA variation is made with [[Milk|milk]], where you substitute the [[Egg yolks|egg yolks]] for 200g milk and reduce the [[Oil|oil]] by half.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Spanish recipes]]\n[[Category:Dips and sauces]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Egg recipes]]\n[[Category:Cooking with wine]]\n[[Category:Thermomix recipes]]\n\n[[Category:Uncooked]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#eggyolks #orange #tomatoketchup #mustard #sauces #juice #mayonnaise #oliveoil #brandy #salads #seafood </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]

It's quick, simple and easy to make. More than can be said for icing a cake!\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 3244\n|PortionCalories = 324\n|DatePublished=25th October 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Servings: 10 - Enough for 1 large cake\n|Difficulty = 2\n|ImageComment = Marzipan Christmas cake\n|TotalTime = 15 minutes\n|PrepTime = 15 minutes \n|CookTime = None\n|Image = [[Image:Marzipan.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"><span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Almondy!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">..and a must for Christmas cakes</span> \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\">[[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis version is [[marzipan]] made with [[eggs]] that needs no cooking. title": "Mashed potato (TM)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Mashed potato - A Thermomix recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#potatoes #butter #potato #mashedpotatoes #thermomixrecipes #nutmeg #stock #thermomix #breadmaking #vegan #steaming \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This is for making mashed potatoes in a Thermomix is based on a recipe in Fast and Easy Cooking, the Thermomix UK recipe book\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1057\n|PortionCalories = 264\n|DatePublished=12th April 2013\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 28 minutes\n |PrepTime = 10 minutes\n |CookTime = 18 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Mashed potato (TM) recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Thermie Mash</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Simples!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The&nbsp;Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis is for making [[Mashed potatoes|mashed potatoes]] in a [[Thermomix]] is based on a recipe in '''Fast and Easy Cooking''', the Thermomix UK recipe book.\n\n{{RecipeIngredientsTM\n| 500g [[Boiled|boiled]] hot water, weighed in TM bowl\n| 1kg [[Potatoes|potatoes]], peeled and cut into 2cm cubes\n| 40g [[Butter|butter]] or [[Olive oil|olive oil]] (if [[Vegan|vegan]])\n| [[Salt]], [[Pepper|pepper]] and [[Grated|grated]] [[Nutmeg|nutmeg]], to taste\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Place the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] in the internal '''[[Steaming]] Basket''' and cook over the water in the bowl for '''18 minutes / Temp. Varoma / Speed Spoon'''.\n| Check the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] for done-ness and if needed, cook for a few minutes more until fully cooked.\n| Drain the [[Potatoes|potatoes]].\n| Empty the bowl of water and insert the '''Butterfly Whisk'''.\n| Add the [[Butter|butter]] or [[Oil|oil]] and seasonings.\n| Mix for '''4 - 10 seconds / Speed 4''', depending on desired consistency.\n}}\n===Chef's notes===\nYou can use the [[Potato|potato]] water for [[Stock|stock]] or for [[Bread making|bread making]].\n\nTimings will vary according to quantity and type of [[Potato|potato]] used.  I would personally recommend King Edward.  The [[mashed potato]] illustrated was mixed for 10 seconds and looks very gluey, so if you want something rather less pur\u00e9ed I should start with 4 seconds and keep checking until it has achieved your preferred consistency.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Thermomix recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#potatoes #butter #potato #mashedpotatoes #thermomixrecipes #nutmeg #stock #thermomix #breadmaking #vegan #steaming </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",

                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Mashed potato, a British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#potatoes #butter #potatomasher #mashedpotatorecipe #carrots #potatoricer #chives #butternutsquash #thermomix #boiledorsimmered #blackpepper \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Floury potatoes such as Desiree, King Edward or Maris Piper mash very well\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1200\n|PortionCalories = 300\n|DatePublished=21st January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Mashed potatoes\n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime = 30 minutes\n|PrepTime = 5 minutes\n|CookTime = 25 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Mashed potatoes recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"><span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Mustard mash potatoes</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">What a brilliant idea, I have never thought of that!</span> \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\">[[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nFloury potatoes such as Desir\u00e9e, King Edward or Maris Piper mash very well.  Instead of a [[potato masher]], you can use a [[Potato ricer|potato ricer]] to make really smooth mashed potatoes.  We also have a [[Mashed potato (TM)|recipe]] for making mashed [[potatoes]] in a [[Thermomix]]\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 900 g) (2 lb) Desir\u00e9e or King Edward [[potatoes]]\n| 2 oz (50 g) [[butter]]\n| 4 tablespoons [[milk]]\n| 2 level tablespoons [[cr\u00e8me fra\u00eeche]]\n| [[Salt]] and freshly milled [[black pepper]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Peel the [[potatoes]] and cut into 5cm (2\") square pieces\n| Place the [[potatoes]] in boiling water and boil until soft (about 25 minutes)\n| When the [[potatoes]] are cooked, remove and drain\n| Add the cr\u00e8me fra\u00eeche, [[butter]] and [[milk]]\n| Using a [[potato masher]], mash to the desired consistency\n| Season with [[salt]] and [[pepper]]\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\n\nServe hot, sprinkled with chopped [[chives]]\n===Variations===\n* Make them with 50/50 [[carrots]]\n* Make then with 50/50 [[butternut squash]]\n* Freeze the special mixes above in portion sized freezer bags so you have special mash, easily to hand\n\n==Which [[potatoes]] make the best mashed potatoes==\n* Nadine\n* Saxon\n* Wilja \n===Variations===\nStir two teaspoons of ready made English mustard into the mashed potatoes and mix well just before serving: [[Mustard mash]], that's what that'll be!\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Squash recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#potatoes #butter #potatomasher #mashedpotatorecipe #carrots #potatoricer #chives #butternutsquash #thermomix #boiledorsimmered #blackpepper </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Matilda's chicken shoe, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#chicken #matildaschickenshoe #bacon #mushrooms #salad #smoked #meatmallet #choppedspringonions #chickenbreast #springonions #meats \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Stuffed chicken breasts, which look like an old-fashioned shoe\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1164\n|PortionCalories = 291\n|DatePublished=21st January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Matilda's Chicken Shoe\n |Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 1 hour 10 minutes\n |PrepTime = 45 minutes\n |CookTime = 25 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Finishedshoe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">I wonder how you're doing now, Maltilda?</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I remember the day you made this!  Seems like a lifetime ago now.</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry]] </span></span>\n}}\nStuffed [[Chicken|chicken]] breasts, which look like an old-fashioned shoe.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 4 plump boneless [[Chicken breast|chicken breast]] fillets\n| 8 medium [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]] \n| 4 [[Spring onions|spring onions]]\n| 8 rashers [[Smoked|smoked]] rindless back [[Bacon|bacon]]\n| [[Salt]]\n| [[Pepper]]\n| Cocktail sticks, soaked in water for 45 minutes\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Justgointooven.jpg|Ready for the oven\nImage:Wrappedinpolythene.jpg|Wrapped in cling-film\nImage:Bacononbreast.jpg|Bacon on the chicken\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Slit the [[Chicken|chicken]] breasts down the middle so that they fold out and look relatively symmetrical but do not cut them in half\n| Carefully put the [[Chicken|chicken]] in a plastic [[Freezer|freezer]] bag and bang them out with a [[meat mallet]].\n| Take the [[Chicken|chicken]] out of the bag and cover them with 2 slices of [[Bacon|bacon]] per breast\n| Sprinkle finely [[Chopped spring onions|chopped spring onions]] and [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]] over the [[Meats|meats]], but not too thickly.\n| Season with a little [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]].\n| Fold the [[Chicken|chicken]] back up like a sandwich and use cocktail sticks to keep them together. Just poke them through tightly.\n| Wrap in [[cling-film]] and let them settle for half an hour in the [[Fridge|fridge]].\n| Put in the oven for 25 mins at 180 C/350 F/Gas 6 on bottom shelf of oven.\n| Take out the cocktail sticks and enjoy.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Salad|salad]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Chicken shoe]]\n[[Category:British recipes|Chicken shoe]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes|Chicken shoe]]\n[[Category:Poultry recipes|Chicken shoe]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites|Chicken shoe]]\n[[Category:Starters|Chicken shoe]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#chicken #matildaschickenshoe #bacon #mushrooms #salad #smoked #meatmallet #choppedspringonions #chickenbreast #springonions #meats </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Meatballs from sausages",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Meatballs from sausages, a recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#sausages #oliveoil #onion #sausagemeat #meatballs #yellowcornmeal #fry #meatballsfromsausages #pizza #herbs #basil \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Make up to 35 lovely meatballs from just six sausages - fabulous for pizzas or meatballs and spaghetti\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=11th February 2017\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = 35 meatballs from 6 sausages!\n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  25 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  10 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 2421\n|PortionCalories = 605\n|Image = [[Image:Meatballs from sausages recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">40 meatballs!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I did even better than you: 40 meatballs from 6 sausages.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nWe bought some lovely Italian-style [[Sausages|sausages]] from [[Gourmet sausage maker - Bexley]] ([[Hall Place Farmers' Market, Bexley, Kent]]), but this time, instead of using them as sausages we would extract the [[Sausagemeat|sausagemeat]] from the sausages and make [[Meatballs|meatballs]].\n\nWe'll use half of them to make a [[Pizza|pizza]] each and the remainder can be [[Frozen|frozen]] to be used later in a nice [[Tomato sauce|tomato sauce]] with some [[Spaghetti|spaghetti]].\n\nI've added fresh [[Basil|basil]] as it will works very well with the [[Italian sausages]].  Use whatever fresh or dried [[Herbs|herbs]] you feel would suit your particular [[Sausages|sausages]].\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 6 meaty [[Italian]]-style [[Sausages|sausages]]\n| Pinch of [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 4 tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 1 small white [[Onion|onion]], very finely chopped\n| Bunch of fresh [[Basil leaves|basil leaves]], finely chopped\n| 2 tablespoons of [[Yellow cornmeal|yellow cornmeal]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| With a sharp knife, carefully cut the [[Sausages|sausages]] lengthwise and [[Scoop|scoop]] the [[Sausagemeat|sausagemeat]] from the skins, which you can discard.\n| Peel and very finely chop the white [[Onion|onion]].\n| Finely chop the fresh [[Basil|basil]].\n| Mix the chopped [[Onion|onion]], [[Herbs|herbs]] and [[Sausagemeat|sausagemeat]] together in a bowl and scrunch it together in your hands, squeezing it  through your fingers to mix really well.\n| Using a teaspoon as a rough measure, roll the mixture into quite small balls - I managed 35 small [[Meatballs|meatballs]] from 6 [[Sausages|sausages]]!\n| Toss the [[Meatballs|meatballs]] in [[Yellow cornmeal|yellow cornmeal]].\n| Add a pinch of [[Black pepper|black pepper]] to the [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and gently [[Fry|fry]] for about 5 minutes, turning once.\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Six fat Italian-style sausages meatball ingredients.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Ingredients for the meatballs\nImage:Six fat Italian-style sausages.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Six fat Italian-style sausages\n</gallery>\n===Serving suggestions===\nIdeal for adding to [[Pizzas|pizzas]] or to serve in a [[Tomato sauce|tomato sauce]] with [[Pasta|pasta]].\n===Chef's notes===\nI'm deliberately using more [[Olive oil|olive oil]] than I really needed to [[Fry|fry]] the [[Sausages|sausages]] in because I want any remaining [[Oil|oil]] from the [[Frying|frying]] to drizzle over the [[Pizza|pizza]] before [[Baking|baking]] it.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Italian recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Pizza recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#sausages #oliveoil #onion #sausagemeat #meatballs #yellowcornmeal #fry #meatballsfromsausages #pizza #herbs #basil </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Melton Mowbray style pork pies",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Melton Mowbray style pork pies a British recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#meltonmowbraystyleporkpies #flour #eggyolk #lard #pork #dough #anchovyessence #plainflour #muffintrays #groundallspice #boil \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This recipe makes about 6 single portion Melton Mowbray style pork pies using hot water crust pastry and best quality ingredients.\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 3119\n|PortionCalories = 519\n|DatePublished=31st January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 6 - Enough pastry for 6 small [[pork]] pies\n|Difficulty = 3\n|TotalTime = 1 hour 35 minutes\n|PrepTime = 35 minutes\n|CookTime = 1 hour\n|Image = [[Image:Hand raised pork pie with hot water crust pastry recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Love the jelly</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.8</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Such fabulous pies from such an unassuming place.  I stayed there years ago, it's the kind of place where nothing ever happens - however, they invented a great pie!</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis recipe makes about 6 single portion Melton Mowbray style pork pies using hot water crust pastry and best quality ingredients.\n\nRaised pies are easier to make whilst the pastry is warm.\n\n'''Hot water pastry'''\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 225 g (8 oz) strong [[plain flour]]\n| Pinch of crushed [[sea salt]]\n| 25 ml (1 fl oz) [[milk]]\n| 25 ml (1 fl oz) water\n| 75 g (3 oz) [[lard]] or [[shortening]]\n| 1 large [[egg yolk]], whisked, for glazing and sealing\n}}\n'''Pork pie filling'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 350 g (12 oz) [[pork]] shoulder, including a little fat\n| 110 g (4 oz) unsmoked back [[bacon]] rashers, rind removed\n| 1.5 teaspoons chopped fresh [[sage]]\n| &frac12; teaspoon [[anchovy essence]] or 1 teaspoon finely chopped [[anchovies]]\n| &frac14; teaspoon [[ground allspice]]\n| &frac14; teaspoon [[ground mace]]\n| [[Sea salt]] and [[freshly ground black pepper]] \n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the oven to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - Gas 4)\n===Method===\n\n'''Prepare the filling'''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Add all of the ingredients to a [[food processor]] and chop to a coarse mix using the pulse button a few times.  Don't over do it or you will end up with meat paste\n}}\n'''Hot water crust pastry''' \n{{RecipeMethod\n| Sift the [[salt]] and [[flour]] into a bowl\n| Mix the water and [[milk]] into a small pan gently heat\n| Cut the [[lard]] into small pieces and drop into the [[milk]]/water mix\n| Once the [[lard]] has completely melted, raise the heat and bring to the [[boil]] and then immediately remove from the heat\n| Pour into the [[flour]] and using a wooden spoon, mix well\n| Dust a chopping board with a little extra [[flour]] and [[Kneading bread|knead]] the [[dough]] for a minute or two\n| Use 2/3rds of the [[dough]] for the pies and 1/3 for the lids\n| Divide 2/3rd into 6 and roll into balls, using your hands, mould each ball into a pie shape\n| Divide the filling into six portions and fill the pies\n| Using a pastry [[brush]], paint a little of the [[egg yolk]] around the rim of each pie\n| Divide the remaining 1/3rd into six pieces, roll into balls and then roll each ball flat to make the pie lids\n| Crimp the lids to the pies with the tines of a fork and glaze the pies with any remaining [[egg yolk]]\n| Make a little [[steam]] slash in the top of each pie and [[bake]] on a tray for about 50 to 55 minutes\n| Allow to cool on a wire rack\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\n\nServe warm or cold\n\n===Chef's notes===\n\nHaving made these, I would suggest that this quantity is better suited to 4 slightly larger pies.  Although unconventional, to prevent them collapsing, I would bake them in [[muffin trays]].\n\n===Authenticity===\n\nPlease note: True Melton Mowbray Pork Pies do not and never have contained cured pork (''bacon'').\n\n{{Template:ThinkPig}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Pies tarts and flans]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#meltonmowbraystyleporkpies #flour #eggyolk #lard #pork #dough #anchovyessence #plainflour #muffintrays #groundallspice #boil </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Memphis BBQ pulled duck tacos",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Memphis BBQ pulled duck tacos recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#duck #memphisbbqpulledducktacos #barbecuesauce #tacotrays #tacos #tacoshells #springonions #sourcream #sauce #fat #cherries \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Crispy tacos filled with Gressingham pulled duck and salad, serve with sour cream and black cherries\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1008\n|PortionCalories = 504\n|DatePublished=30th November 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  45 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime =  35 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Memphis BBQ pulled duck tacos recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Nice, but...</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">What an expensive way to buy duck! \ud83e\udd2d</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis recipe is more an assembly list than a recipe.  I spotted the [[Gressingham Memphis Barbecue Pulled Duck]] in Morrisons and thought it would make a good [[Taco|taco]] filling. \n\nThe [[Duck|duck]] was very good and I'll be getting more today.  Do note though that the duck is notreally pulled duck, it's duck legs with a sauce that need to be ''pulled'' once they've been cooked.  \n\nThe Old El Paso [[Tacos|tacos]] however, ''really'' let this recipe down.  They are so thin now that they break apart as you touch them. Any because they are so miserably thin, they don't even have the crunch purported on the packet.  Another cynical attempt at increasing profits I guess.\n\nIf you don't want to use the flimsy El Paso [[Tacos]], try to hunt down the cheaper and far nice Discovery [[Taco trays|taco trays]], or forget tacos altogether and use [[Corn|corn]] or [[Flour tortillas|flour tortillas]] instead.\n\nThe [[Duck|duck]] feels like it might serve 4 but is actually contains 2 duck legs, a [[Foil|foil]] tray and a sachet of [[Sauce|sauce]], plenty for 2 people, not enough for four.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 pack [[Gressingham Memphis BBQ Pulled Duck]] (2 duck legs in with [[Barbecue sauce|barbecue sauce]])\n| 1 Pack Discovery [[Taco trays|taco trays]] or if you must ,1 Pack El Paso [[Taco shells]] (see notes above)\n| 6 [[Spring onions|spring onions]]\n| 12 [[Baby tomatoes|baby tomatoes]]\n| Half a green [[Sweet Pepper|sweet pepper]]\n| 10 [[Black cherries|black cherries]]\n| 150 ml pot of [[Sour cream|sour cream]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4), [fan oven 160\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Memphis BBQ pulled duck tacos ingredients.jpg|thumb|right|300px|The basic ingredients\nImage:Gressingham Memphis Barbecue Pulled Duck.jpg|thumb|right|300px|[[Gressingham Memphis Barbecue Pulled Duck]] (whole duck legs with sauce)\n</gallery>\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Remove the [[Duck|duck]] legs from the plastic wrapping and place in the tray provided, make sure you include all the lovely [[Fat|fat]] too!\n| Leave the [[Sauce|sauce]] sachet to one side for now\n| [[Roast]] the [[Duck|duck]] legs at 180\u00b0 C for 25 minutes, uncovered, in the tray provided\n| After 25 minutes, drain and discard some of the cooking juices (see [[Chef's notes]] below).\n| Add the contents of the Memphis [[Barbecue sauce|barbecue sauce]] to the duck's legs and mix well\n| [[Bake]] for a further 10 minutes\n| When there is 5 minutes remaining pop the [[Taco trays|taco trays]] or fragile El Paso [[Taco shells|taco shells]] into the [[Oven|oven]] to warm up\n| Meanwhile: chop the [[Spring onions|spring onions]] ([[Scallions|scallions]])\n| Halve the [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]]\n| Halve the [[Cherries|cherries]] and remove the stones\n| Chop the [[Green pepper|green pepper]]\n| Using two forks, shred the [[Duck|duck]] legs with two forks\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe the pulled [[Duck|duck]], [[Vegetables|vegetables]] and [[Tacos|tacos]] and [[Sour cream|sour cream]] in separate dishes so diners can assemble the tacos at the table\n===Variations===\nUse whatever filling ingredients that take your fancy, some other suggestions, sliced red onions, avocado, pickled chillies, crispy lettuce, pineapple chunks.\n===Chef's notes===\nThe [[Gressingham BBQ Pulled Duck]] (legs) are already pre-cooked. If you are using [[Fresh duck|fresh duck]] legs, they will will probably take about the same time, but the [[Oven|oven]] could do with being 1 little warmed (190\u00b0 C - 200\u00b0 C) and they will benefit from resting for 15 minutes once removed from the oven.\n\nThe cooking instructions on the [[Gressingham Pulled Duck]] suggests discarding all of the cooking juices after 25 minutes of [[Roasting|roasting]]. I would definitely suggest otherwise.  Next time I will mix them in with the [[Barbecue sauce|barbecue sauce]], and not waste them.\n\nI allowed the juices to solidify overnight and it was almost all lovely tasty jelly, hardly any [[Fat|fat]] - made a great [[Sandwich|sandwich]] filling and reminded me of jelly and [[Dripping|dripping]] of old.\n{{Tortillas-See also}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:North American recipes]]\n[[Category:Tex-Mex recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Barbecue recipes]]\n[[Category:Poultry recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#duck #memphisbbqpulledducktacos #barbecuesauce #tacotrays #tacos #tacoshells #springonions #sourcream #sauce #fat #cherries </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Meringue recipe",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Meringue recipe British, from Cookipedia.Co.Uk\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#castersugar #meringuerecipe #eggwhites #bakingtray #doublecream #bake #freerangeeggs #miseenplace #icingsugar #foodprocessor \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=The trick to making successful meringues seems to be turning the oven heat down, immediately they go into the oven and then killing the heat after an\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 3022\n|PortionCalories = 503\n|DatePublished=12th April 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Meringues\n|Servings = Serves 6 - Makes enough meringues to serve 6, though you probably want to balance all that sugar with some fruit or ice-cream!\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime = 1 hour 30 minutes plus oven cooling time\n|PrepTime = 15 minutes\n|CookTime = 1 hour 15 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Meringue recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Easy peasey</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">These were easier to make than I thought they would be</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n\nThe trick to making successful meringues seems to be turning the oven heat down, immediately they go into the oven and then killing the heat after an hour and not touching them until the oven is completely cold.  It's something I learned from following Delia Smith and it has served me in good stead ever since.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 175 g (6 oz) golden [[Caster sugar|caster sugar]]\n| 3 [[egg whites]] from 3 large [[Free range eggs|free range eggs]]\n| 2 tablespoons of unrefined [[Icing sugar|icing sugar]]\n| 570 ml (1 pint) [[Double cream|double cream]]\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the oven to 150\u00b0 C (300\u00b0 F - gas 2)\n\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| This recipe is easier to create using an electric hand-whisk or [[Food processor|food processor]] and the meringues may be best made the day before\n| Measure the [[Caster sugar|caster sugar]] and place on a plate\n| Place the [[Egg whites|egg whites]] in a clean bowl and whisk until the peaks are firm\n| Add the golden [[Caster sugar|caster sugar]] a tablespoon at a time, not adding more until the previous tablespoon has been combined into the [[Egg whites|egg whites]]\n| Line a [[baking tray]] with [[grease-proof paper]] and using a tablespoon as a measure, dollop the mixture in rows on to the baking tray\n| Put the tray on a middle shelf and immediately turn the heat down to 140\u00b0 C (275\u00b0 F -  gas 1)\n| Leave them in the oven to [[Bake|bake]] for 1 hour\n| After one hour, turn the heat off, but leave them in the oven until it is completely cold\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Stewed, braised or pot roasted]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#castersugar #meringuerecipe #eggwhites #bakingtray #doublecream #bake #freerangeeggs #miseenplace #icingsugar #foodprocessor </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

Keep in an airtight jar.\n}}\n===Chef's notes===\nI used Bramley [[Apples|apples]] and Wilkins of Tiptree 'Tawny' [[Orange]] Thick Cut [[Marmalade|marmalade]].\n{{Template:PeelingGinger}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Mincemeat (2)]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking|Mincemeat (2)]]\n[[Category:British recipes|Mincemeat (2)]]\n[[Category:Pies tarts and flans|Mincemeat (2)]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts|Mincemeat (2)]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes|Mincemeat (2)]]\n[[Category:Cooking with wine|Mincemeat (2)]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Uncooked]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#apples #orange #marmalade #muscovado #currants #raisins #lime #brandy #sultanas #beef #cinnamon </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Mince and tatties",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Mince and tatties, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#minceandtatties #lentils #mushrooms #leeks #potatoes #sweetcorn #butter #onions #oliveoil #beefmince #vegetable \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Minced beef in a vaguely Scottish way with mashed potato and vegetable accompaniment\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1619\n|PortionCalories = 404\n|DatePublished=1st November 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Mince and tatties, steaming hot!\n |Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 40 minutes\n |PrepTime = 10 minutes\n |CookTime = 30 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Mince and tatties recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Suitably Scottish fare.</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.2</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Realistically tasty too.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nMinced [[beef]] in a vaguely Scottish way with [[mashed potato]] and [[vegetable]] accompaniment.\n[[Image:Mince and tatties ingredients.jpg|thumb|300px|right|The basic ingredients]]\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 250g fresh lean [[beef mince]].\n| 300g [[potato]].\n| 150g tinned [[sweetcorn]] in water.\n| 150g [[lentils]].\n| 120g [[mushrooms]].\n| 150g [[leeks]].\n| 2 [[onions]].\n| knob of [[butter]].\n| [[salt]].\n| [[pepper]].\n| splash [[olive oil]].\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Finely chop the [[onions]].\n* Slice [[mushrooms]].\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n|Boil [[potatoes]] in unsalted water 15 minutes.\n|Steam [[leeks]] above [[potatoes]].\n|Boil [[lentils]] in separate saucepan - small lentils only take about 10 minutes.\n|Heat the [[olive oil]] in a large saucepan.\n|Add [[onion]] and stir until beginning to caramelise.\n|Add the mince and stir the mince until all the pinkness has changed to brown.\n|Add the [[mushrooms]], [[sweetcorn]] and boiled [[lentils]].\n|Season to taste.\n|Stir well until the mixture is good and hot.\n|Season and mash the [[potatoes]] with [[butter]], [[milk]] and seasoning.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe directly onto warmed plates.\n===Variations===\nPeas substitute for sweetcorn.\n\nButter substitute for olive oil.\n\nProven\u00e7al herb coarse salt if required.\n\nTurnip or swede or carrots for the leeks.\n===Chef's notes===\nIt is deliberate that the mince is added to the saucepan before the mushrooms because I have found that by adding the fungi too early they tend to disappear in the mixture and deprive the tongue of that texture.\n\nSome cooks add water to the cooking mince but in my opinion that makes it too moist.\n\nAny mashed potato not eaten at the time may be held over and fried crisp & brown with bacon and egg for the next day's breakfast!\n\nNote minimum salt used in all my recipes and never in boiling/steaming vegetables.\n\nNot an expert chef, merely a survival cook developing simple foods to my taste.\n\n''[[User:Alastair|Alastair]] has not specify where the [[leeks]] are used, but as there were already lots of onions in the mince, I though they would go rather well in the mash - which they did.  Especially when leftovers were re-fried as a sort of bubble-and-squeak.''\n\n''I would also recommend a big dollop of brown sauce to complete this meal, though I don't know how Scottish that is!'' --[[User:Chef|Chef]] 18:22, 27 September 2011 (BST)\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Steamed]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#minceandtatties #lentils #mushrooms #leeks #potatoes #sweetcorn #butter #onions #oliveoil #beefmince #vegetable </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Mince pies (1)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Mince pies (1), British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#egg #brush #castersugar #mincemeat #puffpastry #baking #bake #miseenplace #custard #jarofmincemeat \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This is a slight variation in that it uses puff pastry insted of shortcrust which I think makes them slightly lighter. It's also cockney rhyming slang\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 4332\n|PortionCalories = 361\n|DatePublished=20th January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Homemade mincemeat, containing, apples, beef, sugar, raisins, suet, molasses, vinegar and spices\n|Servings = Serves 12 - Makes 24 mince pies\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime = 35 minutes\n|PrepTime = 15 minutes\n|CookTime = 20 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Mincemeat.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Puffy pies!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.7</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Nice and light too</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:NonLoggedInUser|NonLoggedInUser]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis is a slight variation in that it uses puff pastry instead of shortcrust which I think makes them slightly lighter.\n\nIt's also cockney rhyming slang and tasty dessert - can you think of any others?\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1 Packet [[pre-rolled puff pastry]]\n| 450 g (1 lb) [[jar of mincemeat]]\n| 55 g (2 oz) [[caster sugar]]\n| 1 whole [[egg]]\n| 60 ml (2 fl oz) milk\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the oven to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - Gas 6 - Moderately hot)\n\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Beat the [[egg]] and add a tiny pinch of [[salt]]\n| Using a pastry cutter, stamp out 24 x 7.5 cm (3\") circles of [[puff pastry]] for the bases\n| Push the circles into 2 molded [[baking]] trays\n| Fill each base with 2 teaspoons of [[mincemeat]] and [[brush]] the edges with a little [[milk]]\n| Using a pastry cutter, stamp out 24 x 6 cm (2.5\") circles of pastry for the lids\n| Put the lids on the bases and ensure they are sealed\n| [[Brush]] the [[egg]] mixture over the tops of the pies and sprinkle with a little [[caster sugar]]\n| [[Bake]] for 20 minutes and allow to cool on a raised grid to prevent them sweating\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\n\nServe hot with [[custard]]\n==See also==\n* [[Mincemeat]]\n* [[Mincemeat (2)]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#egg #brush #castersugar #mincemeat #puffpastry #baking #bake #miseenplace #custard #jarofmincemeat </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Mini bangers and mash - party food",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Mini bangers and mash - party food recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#mash #butter #potato #mustard #bangersandmash #ramekins #roast #diced #tomatoketchup #kitchenpaper #ketchup \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=These mini bowls of Bangers and bangers and mash make brilliant party food for kids and adults alike\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1574\n|PortionCalories = 131\n|DatePublished=23rd October 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 12\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  40 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime =  30 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Mini bangers and mash party food recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Party pretties</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Nice for little fingers!</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nThese mini bowls of [[Bangers and mash|bangers and mash]] make brilliant [[Party food|party food]] for kids and adults alike. As party food it will easily serve 12 people.  This recipe is brought to [[Cookipedia]] courtesy of [[Debbie&andrew's sausages|debbie&andrew's sausages]].\n[[Image:Perfect-cumberland-sausages.png|300px|thumb|right|[[Debbie and Andrew's Perfect Cumberland Pork Sausages]]]]\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 2 packs [[Debbie and Andrew's Perfect Cumberland Pork Sausages]]\n| 6 [[Potatoes|potatoes]], peeled and [[Diced|diced]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Butter|butter]]\n| A splash of [[Milk|milk]]\n| [[Salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]\n| [[Tomato ketchup]] and [[Mustard|mustard]] to serve\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6), [fan oven 180\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Place the [[Sausages|sausages]] in a [[Roasting tin|roasting tin]].\n| [[Roast]] in the preheated [[Oven|oven]] for 20 minutes, then give the tin a good shake and roast for another 10. Remove from the tin and drain on [[Kitchen paper|kitchen paper]].\n| Meanwhile, place the [[Potato|potato]] pieces in a pan of cold [[Salted|salted]] water and bring to the [[Boil|boil]]. Cook for 10 minutes until tender, then drain and [[Mash|mash]] with the [[Butter|butter]] and [[Milk|milk]] and plenty of [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]].\n| To assemble your mini [[Bangers and mash|bangers and mash]], place a good spoon of [[Mash|mash]] inside 12 [[Ramekins|ramekins]] (or similar). Place a [[Sausage|sausage]] standing up inside the mash, then dot the surrounding [[Potato|potato]] once with [[Ketchup|ketchup]] and once with [[Mustard|mustard]].\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with teaspoons as a finger food, canap\u00e9 or small [[Starter|starter]].\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Student recipes]]\n[[Category:Debbie&andrew's sausage recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n{{Template:DebbieAndAndrew attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#mash #butter #potato #mustard #bangersandmash #ramekins #roast #diced #tomatoketchup #kitchenpaper #ketchup </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }

title": "Minty, lemony spring greens, spuds and pancetta",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Minty, lemony spring greens, spuds and pancetta Gluten free recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#oliveoil #onion #mintylemonyspringgreensspudsandpancetta #mint #pancetta #garlic #springgreens #vinegar #barbecue #boiling #lemon \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=With a barbecue, or perch a poached egg on top and call it supper\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 861\n|PortionCalories = 215\n|DatePublished=17th May 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  15 hours, 20 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 hours, 20 minutes\n|CookTime = None\n|Image = [[Image:Minty, lemony spring greens, spuds and pancetta recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Nice lunchtime nibble</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Great for summer afternoons</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nWith a [[Barbecue|barbecue]], or [[Perch|perch]] a [[Poached egg|poached egg]] on top and call it supper.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 500g [[New Potatoes|new potatoes]], cut into 3-4cm chunks\n| 140g [[Spring greens|spring greens]], [[Spinach|spinach]] or [[Chard|chard]], after stems removed, sliced into thin ribbons*\n| [[Olive oil]]\n| 70g [[Pancetta|pancetta]] or smoky [[Bacon|bacon]], snipped into little squares\n| \u00bd [[Onion|onion]] (red, if you have one), finely sliced\n| 2 [[Garlic|garlic]] [[Cloves|cloves]], roughly chopped\n| Lots of [[Freshly ground pepper|freshly ground pepper]]\n| 1 [[Lemon|lemon]]\n| A dash of [[Cider|cider]] or [[Red wine vinegar|red wine vinegar]]\n| A handful of fresh [[Mint|mint]], finely chopped, plus a bit to garnish\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| In [[Salted|salted]] water, with a splash of [[Oil|oil]], [[Boil|boil]] your small pieces of [[Potatoes|potatoes]] till tender. Test by piercing though the centre of one with a small knife.\n| Fold your [[Greens|greens]] through the [[Boiling|boiling]] water and cook, with the [[Spuds|spuds]], for a min. Drain. Let them [[Rest for|rest for]] a min to [[Steam|steam]] off any remaining moisture. Dust with a pinch of [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]. Splash a bit of [[Olive oil|olive oil]] over to gloss.\n| [[Fry]] the [[Pancetta|pancetta]] till crisp and golden. Remove from the pan. Add the [[Onion|onion]], [[Garlic|garlic]] and a splash of [[Olive oil|olive oil]], if needed. Sizzle till softened.\n| Dress the veg with [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]] and [[Zest|zest]]. Add the [[Onion|onion]] and [[Garlic|garlic]]. Toss with the chopped [[Mint|mint]]. Taste. Add a drop of [[Vinegar|vinegar]], to give it a bit more oomph. Scatter over the [[Pancetta|pancetta]]. Finish with the fresh [[Mint|mint]]. Devour.\n}}\n===Variations===\nIf you don't have [[Spring greens|spring greens]] to [[Hand|hand]], you can swap them out for florets of [[Pan-fried|pan fried]] or [[Roasted|roasted]] [[Cauliflower|cauliflower]], or use fresh [[Rocket|rocket]] or [[Watercress|watercress]].\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Gluten free recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Abel and Cole veg box recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n{{Template:Abel and Cole veg box recipes attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#oliveoil #onion #mintylemonyspringgreensspudsandpancetta #mint #pancetta #garlic #springgreens #vinegar #barbecue #boiling #lemon </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

#mintleaves #olives #roastpotatoes \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Mint and lamb go really well together, as does orange and lamb, so I thought I would try them both together in the same 2\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  35 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime =  25 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 1245\n|PortionCalories = 622\n|Image = [[Image:Mint and orange lamb steaks recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Love the loaf tin</span>''\n\n<span ingredients]]\n[[Mint]] and [[Lamb|lamb]] go really well together, as does [[Orange|orange]] and lamb, so I thought I would try them both together in the same recipe.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 3 tablespoons of the [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| [[Freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 1 x 300g [[lamb fillet]], cut in half lengthwise\n| 1 medium sized [[Red onion|red onion]], peeled and chopped\n| 100g bottled [[Red pepper|red pepper]] drained and roughly chopped.\n| 50g [[Black olives|black olives]], pitted\n| 1 [[Orange|orange]], zested and peeled then chopped into bite-sized segments\n| A splash of [[lemon juice]]\n| A handful of [[Mint leaves|mint leaves]], chopped\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Add a good pinch of [[Black pepper|black pepper]] to a [[Wok|wok]] or large [[Frying pan|frying pan]], add 3 tablespoons of [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| Add the chopped [[Red onion|red onion]] and the [[Lamb|lamb]] steaks and [[Brown|brown]] the [[lamb fillets]], turning often.\n| Once the steaks are [[Browned|browned]] the [[Onions|onions]] should have also taken some of the colour\n| Turn the pan down and add the [[Chopped red peppers|chopped red peppers]] and [[Olives|olives]]\n| Add the chopped [[Orange|orange]] segments and [[Orange zest|orange zest]], together with a splash of [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]]\n| Stir well and [[Simmer|simmer]] gently for about 5 minutes\n| Stir in the chopped [[Mint|mint]] and [[Simmer|simmer]] for a further 5 minutes\n| Taste for seasoning and serve\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Roast potatoes|roast potatoes]] and minted [[Peas|peas]]\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Lamb Mint sauce can also is a good marinade for lamb chops, leg steaks or roasting joints - mix a few spoons with some fresh\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 80\n|PortionCalories = 20\n|DatePublished=12th April 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4 people\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime = 3 minutes\n|PrepTime = 3 minutes\n|CookTime = None\n|Image = [[Image:Mint sauce.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n======Best recipe review======\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Lovely</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">So much nicer than the nasty stuff they sell in the shops</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> - 10 minutes.\n# Add [[salt]] and [[vinegar]] to taste.\n\n===Variations===\n\nExperiment with [[sherry vinegar]], [[malt vinegar]], [[cider vinegar]] and different [[mint]] types for some interesting variations.\n\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Dips and sauces]]\n[[Category:Marinades dressings and butters]]\n[[Category:Pickles and preserves]]\n[[Category:Ingredients]]\n[[Category:Condiments]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n{{CategoryLineIngredients}}\n[[Category:Uncooked]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#mintsauce #mint #castersugar #cidervinegar #blackpepper #oliveoil #vinegar #maltvinegar #applejuice #sherryvinegar #whitewinevinegar </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Mixed herbs and pine nut stuffing",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
