                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Mixed herbs and pine nut stuffing a British recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#mixedherbsandpinenutstuffing #parsley #pinenuts #garlic #zest #butter #breadcrumbs #onion #lemon #rosemary #panfried \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A good stuffing recipe for chicken or turkey\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1558\n|PortionCalories = 389\n|DatePublished=6th April 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 30 minutes\n |PrepTime = 10 minutes\n |CookTime = 20 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Mixed herbs and pine nut stuffing recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Pine nut make this</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Such a distinct flavour and texture</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\">[[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]] </span></span>\n}}\nA good stuffing recipe for chicken or turkey.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 200g (7oz) white [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]]\n| 125g (4&frac12;oz) [[Butter|butter]]\n| 2 Cloves of [[Garlic|garlic]] (or to taste), peeled and crushed\n| 1 [[Onion|onion]], peeled and finely chopped\n| 1 sprig of [[Rosemary|rosemary]], chopped leaves only\n| 1 sprig of [[Thyme|thyme]], chopped leaves only\n| 6 fresh [[Sage leaves|sage leaves]], chopped\n| The [[Zest|zest]] from 1 [[Lemon|lemon]]\n| 50g (2oz) [[Pine nuts|pine nuts]]\n| 3 tablespoons of fresh [[Parsley|parsley]], chopped\n| 1 teaspoon [[Sea Salt|sea salt]]\n| [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Melt [[Butter|butter]] in a [[Frying pan|frying pan]] and saut\u00e9 [[Onion|onion]] and [[Garlic|garlic]] for five minutes or until softened - don't allow the garlic to burn.\n| Mix in the [[Herbs|herbs]] for one minute then add [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]] and mix well.\n| Add the [[Zest|zest]], [[Pine nuts|pine nuts]].  Season and cook over medium heat for about seven minutes until crumbs start to [[Brown|brown]] and crisp.\n| Remove from the heat, stir in the [[Parsley|parsley]] and serve.\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Stuffing]]\n[[Category:British recipes|Stuffing]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments|Stuffing]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes|Stuffing]]\n[[Category:Poultry recipes|Stuffing]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#mixedherbsandpinenutstuffing #parsley #pinenuts #garlic #zest #butter #breadcrumbs #onion #lemon #rosemary #panfried </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Mock bananas",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Mock bananas, A British Wartime recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#parsnips #mockbananas #unusualrecipes #banana #bananas \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This is more of a story than a recipe. I was talking to my Mum about the historic recipes section and she mentioned this\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 102\n|PortionCalories = 25\n|DatePublished=21st January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = My Mum, 1947!\n |Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 35 minutes\n |PrepTime = 20 minutes\n |CookTime = 15 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Mum.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Yuck!!!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">1</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I cannot think of anything more vile.  Period!</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis is more of a story than a recipe...\n\nI was talking to my Mum about the historic recipes section and she mentioned this.\n\n\u201cAfter the war, when I worked at Unilever House as a secretary, sometimes, as a treat, Mum used to make me [[banana]] sandwiches.  \n\nWe had no [[bananas]] after the war, so they were made with sliced [[parsnips]] flavoured with banana essence!\u201d\n\nI found the recipe below in [http://www.amazon.com/Well-Eat-Again-Marguerite-Patten/dp/0600325245 ''We'll Eat Again'': Marguerite Patten]\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 3 [[Parsnips]]\n| Banana essence or extract\n| Sugar to taste\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Choose young [[parsnips]] if possible for they are more tender and have a sweeter taste. Peel the [[parsnips]], do not slice. \n| Either cook in a small amount of unsalted water until tender or put into a steamer, cover and cook over boiling water.\n| If boiling the [[parsnips]], then dry well on kitchen paper. If steaming the parsnips, simply remove from the steamer and dry.\n| Slice the cooked parsnips and put into a bowl and mash, add a few drops only of banana essence or extract. The easiest way to obtain a small amount of essence or extract is to dip a skewer into the bottle and then hold this over the bowl so the drops fall.\n| Continue adding banana flavouring until you get the right taste. Add [[sugar]] to taste then mash until smooth.\n}}\n\nUse as a sandwich filling or as a pudding with yogurt or custard.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Bananas]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes|Bananas]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts|Bananas]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#parsnips #mockbananas #unusualrecipes #banana #bananas </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Mock Goose (bullocks heart)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Mock Goose, an historic British recipe Cooking Wiki\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#onions #britishrecipes #sage #meatrecipes #poultryrecipes #recipes #historicrecipes #offalrecipes #boiledorsimmered #beefrecipes #forcemeat \n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=Mock goose (from a bullocks heart)\n|datePublished=2013-01-22\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n'''Mock goose (from a bullock's heart)'''. In the  beef eating north poor folk sometimes cooked bullock's heart instead of a goose for Christmas.\n\nA few days before wanted, wash the heart well and set it to simmer overnight with a good dash of vinegar in the water and a few peppercorns.\n\nIf necessary, let it simmer two of three nights, 'till it is really tender, leaving to to grow cold in the broth, and on Christmas Eve skim off the fat from the broth , take up the heart, stuff it with forcemeat made of breadcrumbs, the fat from the stock, a heavy seasoning of [[sage]] and [[onions]] chopped (the onions should have been cooked whole in the broth). Pepper and salt.\n\nMoisten the [[forcemeat]] with the broth, or an egg, and stuff the heart and sew it up.  Flour thickly, tie some rashers of bacon across the 'breast', and roast, basting as if you were cooking a goose.\n\nAdorn the mock goose with a ring of sausages and some roast potatoes, and serve with apple sauce.  In texture and flavour it much resembles a goose.\n\n''This was taken from the wonderful book: [[Food In England|''Food in England - Dorothy Hartley'']]\n\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Beef recipes]]\n[[Category:Offal recipes]]\n[[Category:Poultry recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n{{RecipeSkip}}\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#onions #britishrecipes #sage #meatrecipes #poultryrecipes #recipes #historicrecipes #offalrecipes #boiledorsimmered #beefrecipes #forcemeat </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Molly's Marmite dog biscuits",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Home made Marmite dog biscuits\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#eggs #MarmiteDog #dogtreat #marmitedogbiscuits #dogbiscuit #flour #Marmitedoggybiscuits #dogfoodrecipe #homemadedogtreats\n|description=Marmite dog treats that are easy to make at home\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=25th January 2021\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 5\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  1 hour\n|PrepTime =  30 minutes\n|CookTime = 30 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 216\n|PortionCalories = 43\n|Image = [[Image:Molly's Marmite dog biscuits recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Thanks Mollie \ud83d\udc36</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">R.I.P - wherever you are now...</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Molly the dog biscuit taste tester.jpg|thumb|250px|right|Molly, the home-made Marmite dog biscuit tester]]\nThe home-made [[Marmite]] dog-treats have been tested and approved by Molly, Janet's owner. &#128521;\n\nThey are really easy home made dog treats. If you can add ingredients to a bowl and mix them and turn an [[Oven|oven]] on, then you can make these.\n\nYou can cut them into [[Biscuit|biscuit]] shapes with a [[Knife|knife]] or use a [https://www.amazon.co.uk/s?k=doggy+biscuit+mould&ref=nb_sb_noss_2 dog biscuit cutter].\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 8 oz of [[Rolled oats|rolled oats]] [225g - cups]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Marmite]] (or [[Vegemite]] if you are Antipodean)\n| 1 [[Free range egg|free range egg]]\n| 2 fl oz [60 ml - &#188; [[Cup|cup]]] of warm water\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 160\u00b0 C (325\u00b0 F - gas 3), [fan oven 140\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Stir the [[Marmite]] into the warm water\n| Beat the [[Egg|egg]]\n| Pop everything into a large bowl and mix really well until all the [[Oats|oats]] are evenly covered\n| Leave for 15 minutes so the [[Oats|oats]] absorb all of the liquid - the consistency should be like a hard [[Dough|dough]]\n| Give the mixture a final [[Knead|knead]] and add a little more water if it is too stiff\n| Roll out to your desired thickness and cut into shapes with a [[Knife|knife]] or press out using a dog [[Biscuit|biscuit]] cutter\n| [[Bake]] for about 25 to 30 minutes at 160\u00b0 C (325\u00b0 F - gas 3), [fan [[Oven|oven]] 140\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n| Cool on a wire rack\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nStore in an [[Airtight container|airtight container]] and use within 6 days or [[Freeze|freeze]] once cooled\n===See also ===\n* [[Molly's home-made peanut butter doggy biscuits]] - the peanut butter flavoured home made dog-biscuit\n* [[Cat food gravy recipe]] - a recipe I made for our poorly, toothless Siamese cat. \n* A quick search on Amazon finds hundreds of different reasonably priced dog biscuit cutters: [https://www.amazon.co.uk/s?k=doggy+biscuit+mould&ref=nb_sb_noss_2 Amazon UK search for doggy biscuit cutters]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Egg recipes]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#eggs #MarmiteDog #dogtreat #marmitedogbiscuits #dogbiscuit #flour #Marmitedoggybiscuits #dogfoodrecipe #homemadedogtreats</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Mrs Beeton's bread and butter pudding",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Mrs Beeton's bread and butter pudding an egg recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#butter #eggs #bread #piedish #currants #lemonpeel #mrsbeetonsbreadandbutterpudding #vanilla #pints #breadpudding #candiedpeel \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Mrs Beeton's version of the famous bread and butter pudding\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1705\n|PortionCalories = 284\n|DatePublished=4th October 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Other publications - circa 1945\n |Servings = Serves 6 or 7 people\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 55 minutes\n |PrepTime = 15 minutes\n |CookTime = 40 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:BeetonsAd.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">No need to change this recipe</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">This is exactly how Mum made this.</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry]] </span></span>\n}}\nMrs Beeton's version of the famous bread and butter pudding.  Not to be confused with [[Bread pudding|bread pudding]], which is quite different.\n\nIf you want a much [[Bread and butter pudding|richer, tangy version, we have one here]]\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 9 Thin Slices Of [[Bread]] and [[Butter]] \n| 900ml (1&frac12; [[Pints|pints]]) [[Milk]] \n| 110g (4oz) [[Currants]] \n| 4 medium [[Eggs]] \n| [[Sugar]], to taste\n| [[Vanilla essence]], [[Grated]] [[Lemon peel|lemon peel]] or [[Nutmeg]], to flavour\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4) - (Moderate)\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Cut nine slices of [[Bread|bread]] thinly and [[Butter|butter]] them. \n| Place into a [[Pie dish|pie dish]] with [[Currants|currants]] between each layer and on the top. \n| Sweeten and flavour the [[Milk|milk]], either by infusing with a little [[Lemon peel|lemon peel]], or by adding a few drops of [[Vanilla|vanilla]] essence. \n| Whisk the [[Eggs|eggs]] and stir into the [[Milk|milk]]. \n| Strain this over the [[Bread|bread]] and [[Butter|butter]]. \n| [[Bake]] in a moderate [[Oven|oven]] for 1 hour, or rather longer. \n| This pudding may be very much enriched by adding [[Cream|cream]], [[Candied peel|candied peel]], or more [[Eggs|eggs]]. \n| It should not be turned out, but served in the [[Pie dish|pie dish]] and is better for being made about 2 hours before it is [[Baked|baked]].\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Egg recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#butter #eggs #bread #piedish #currants #lemonpeel #mrsbeetonsbreadandbutterpudding #vanilla #pints #breadpudding #candiedpeel </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Mulligatawny soup",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Mulligatawny soup, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#coconut #almonds #rice #boil #turmeric #chickenstock #mulligatawnysoup #spices #vegetables #soup #carrots \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A curried Anglo-Indian soup. Mulligatawny means 'pepper water'\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 733\n|PortionCalories = 183\n|DatePublished=24th October 2012\n|Author = JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 1 hour\n |PrepTime = 15 minutes\n |CookTime = 45 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Mulligatawny soup recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Curry Soup!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">\ud83d\udc73\ud83d\udc73\ud83d\udc73</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n\nA curried Anglo-Indian [[Soup|soup]].  Mulligatawny means '[[Pepper|pepper]] water'.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 2 tablespoons [[Basmati rice|basmati rice]]\n| 300ml water\n| 1 [[Clove|clove]]\n| A pinch of [[Turmeric|turmeric]]\n| [[Salt]]\n| &frac12; teaspoon [[Cumin seeds|cumin seeds]]\n| 6 [[White peppercorns|white peppercorns]]\n| 3 or more [[Dried|dried]] [[Bird's Eye chillies|bird's eye chillies]]\n| 6 [[Cardamom pods|cardamom pods]]\n| 30g whole [[Almonds|almonds]], skins intact\n| 30g fresh [[Coconut|coconut]]\n| 900ml [[Chicken stock|chicken stock]]\n| 350g mixed, [[Diced|diced]] [[Vegetables|vegetables]], such as [[Carrots|carrots]], [[Parsnips|parsnips]], [[Celery|celery]] or [[Onions|onions]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| [[Boil]] the [[Rice|rice]] in the water with the [[Clove|clove]], [[Turmeric|turmeric]] and a little [[Salt|salt]], until just cooked.\n| Grind the [[Spices|spices]], [[Almonds|almonds]] and [[Coconut|coconut]] '''*'''(see Chef's notes below) and [[Dry-fry|dry-fry]] them in a deep pan over a low heat for a couple of minutes, stirring constantly.\n| Add the [[Chicken stock|chicken stock]] and [[Vegetables|vegetables]], then bring to the [[Boil|boil]].\n| [[Simmer]], half-covered for 30-40 minutes.\n| Stir in the [[Rice|rice]] (with any remaining water) and adjust seasoning if necessary.\n}}\n===Variations===\nFor a thicker [[Soup|soup]], add cooked [[Chicken|chicken]] towards the end and/or use more [[Rice|rice]].\n===Chef's notes===\nSee [[User:Chef| Chef's]] instructions for preparing a [[coconut]] - works brilliantly!  '''*'''For this recipe, get down to the skin and simply peel it.   Chop the flesh and blend separately from the spices.  [[Coconut]] flesh is oily and will impede the quick grinding of the [[spices]] and [[almonds]]. \n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Soup and stock recipes]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Chilli pepper recipes]]\n[[Category:Rice recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#coconut #almonds #rice #boil #turmeric #chickenstock #mulligatawnysoup #spices #vegetables #soup #carrots </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Mushrooms in a cucumber sauce",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Mushrooms in a cucumber sauce recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#butter #mushrooms #cucumber #mushroomsinacucumbersauce #dill #dried #blackpepper #boil #londonbroil #saute #roux \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=The first thing to say about this recipe is that it tastes much better than it looks!  It's also a great recipe for using up cucumbers if you grow them at home\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 525\n|PortionCalories = 131\n|DatePublished=25th August 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  25 minutes\n|PrepTime =  5 minutes\n|CookTime =  20 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Mushrooms in a cucumber sauce with pork chops and mashed potatoes.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Looks are not everything!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Lol! \ud83d\ude02</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry, aka Chef]])</span></span>\n}}\nThe first thing to say about this recipe is that it tastes much better than it looks!  It's also a great recipe for using up [[cucumbers]] if you grow them at home, as we do.  \n\nThis went really nicely with [[mashed potatoes]] and [[barbecued]] [[pork chops]] that had been treated to a [[London broil]] marinade.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| A good grind of [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n| 50g [2 oz] [[Butter|butter]]\n| 110 g [4 oz] of oyster [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]], wiped clean and chopped\n| 1 tablespoon [15 ml] [[Plain flour|plain flour]]\n| Half a [[Cucumber|cucumber]], de-seeded, peeled and cubed\n| 150 ml [1/4 pint] hot [[Vegetable Stock|vegetable stock]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Dried|dried]] [[Dill|dill]]\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] to taste\n| Freshly chopped [[Parsley|parsley]] to garnish\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Add a good grind of [[Black pepper|black pepper]] to a small saucepan\n| Melt half of the [[Butter|butter]]\n| [[Saute]] the [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]] in the [[Butter|butter]] for 4 minutes, turning often\n| Remove with a [[Slotted spoon|slotted spoon]] and keep warm\n| Melt the remaining [[Butter|butter]]\n| Cook the [[Cucumber|cucumber]] cubes until they visibly 'wilt', about 5 minutes, stirring now and then\n| Make a [[Roux|roux]] by sprinkling  the [[Flour|flour]] over the buttery [[Cucumber|cucumber]] and mix well so all the [[Fat|fat]] is absorbed\n| Add the [[Dried|dried]] [[Dill|dill]] and hot [[Stock|stock]] and [[Blend|blend]] into a [[Sauce|sauce]]\n| Bring to the [[Boil|boil]] and then reduce and [[Simmer|simmer]] for 10 minutes\n| Stir in the [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]]\n| Serve\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe over barbecued meat or vegetables.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Dips and sauces]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#butter #mushrooms #cucumber #mushroomsinacucumbersauce #dill #dried #blackpepper #boil #londonbroil #saute #roux </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Mushrooms in a cucumber sauce (V)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Mushrooms in a cucumber sauce a vegetarian recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#butter #mushrooms #cucumber #dill #sauce #dried #blackpepper #vegetables #simmer #images #flour \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A delicious vegetarian sauce, using fresh cucumbers and mushrooms\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 525\n|PortionCalories = 131\n|DatePublished=23rd August 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  25 minutes\n|PrepTime =  5 minutes\n|CookTime =  20 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Mushrooms in a cucumber sauce recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Looks are not everything!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Lol! \ud83d\ude02</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry, aka Chef]])</span></span>\n}}\nThe first thing to say about this recipe is that it tastes much better than it looks!  It's also a great recipe for using up [[cucumbers]] if you grow them at home, as we do.  \n\nThis is an interesting [[Vegetarian|vegetarian]] [[Mushroom|mushroom]] [[Sauce|sauce]] that is nice poured over [[Vegetables|vegetables]] and especially [[hard-boiled eggs]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| A good grind of [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n| 50g [2 oz] [[Butter|butter]]\n| 110 g [4 oz] of oyster [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]], wiped clean and sliced\n| 1 tablespoon [15 ml] [[Plain flour|plain flour]]\n| Half a [[Cucumber|cucumber]], de-seeded, peeled and cubed\n| 150 ml [1/4 pint] hot [[Vegetable Stock|vegetable stock]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Dried|dried]] [[Dill|dill]]\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] to taste\n| Freshly chopped [[Parsley|parsley]] to garnish\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Add a good grind of [[Black pepper|black pepper]] to a small saucepan\n| Melt half of the [[Butter|butter]]\n| [[Saute]] the [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]] in the [[Butter|butter]] for 4 minutes, turning often\n| Remove with a [[Slotted spoon|slotted spoon]] and keep warm\n| Melt the remaining [[Butter|butter]]\n| Cook the [[Cucumber|cucumber]] cubes until they visibly 'wilt', about 5 minutes, stirring now and then\n| Make a [[Roux|roux]] by sprinkling  the [[Flour|flour]] over the buttery [[Cucumber|cucumber]] and mix well so all the [[Fat|fat]] is absorbed\n| Add the [[Dried|dried]] [[Dill|dill]] and hot [[Stock|stock]] and [[Blend|blend]] into a [[Sauce|sauce]]\n| Bring to the [[Boil|boil]] and then reduce and [[Simmer|simmer]] for 10 minutes\n| Stir in the [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]]\n| Serve\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe over vegetables or for a main course, [[Hard boiled eggs|hard boiled eggs]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Dips and sauces]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#butter #mushrooms #cucumber #dill #sauce #dried #blackpepper #vegetables #simmer #images #flour </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Mushrooms with smokey bacon",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",

                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Mushrooms with smokey bacon a British recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#mushrooms #mace #oliveoil #nutmeg #mushroomswithsmokeybacon #fry #garlic #parsley #homesmokedbacon #simmer #buttonmushrooms \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A great combination and another use for your home smoked bacon\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 513\n|PortionCalories = 128\n|DatePublished=20th January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Saut\u00e9ed mushrooms in red wine\n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime = 20 minutes\n|PrepTime = 5 minutes\n|CookTime = 15 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Sauteed mushrooms and red wine.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">I can smell that from here</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">..and that's just from the picture!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:NonLoggedInUser|NonLoggedInUser]] </span></span>\n}}\n\nA great combination and another use for your [[home smoked bacon]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 400g (14 oz) [[button mushrooms]]\n| 4 tablespoons [[olive oil]]\n| &#189; teaspoon ground [[mace]] or [[grated]] [[nutmeg]]\n| [[Freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 4 rashers of [[home smoked bacon]], chopped into strips\n| 3 [[cloves]] of [[Garlic]]\n| 1 glass of good [[red wine]]\n| 3 tablespoons chopped [[parsley]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| [[Brush]] the [[mushrooms]] clean, don't wash [[mushrooms]].\n| Heat the [[olive oil]] in a heavy pan and [[fry]] the [[mushrooms]] until they have taken a little colour and start to [[sweat]].\n| Season with [[pepper]] and [[mace]] or [[nutmeg]]\n| Add the [[bacon]] and [[Garlic|garlic]] and [[fry]] for 3 minutes, stirring often\n| [[Deglaze]] the pan with the [[wine]], reduce the heat and [[simmer]] for 5 minutes - the aim is to reduce the wine to just a little [[sauce]]\n| Stir in the [[parsley]], remove from the heat and serve immediately\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\n\nServe hot\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Cooking with wine]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#mushrooms #mace #oliveoil #nutmeg #mushroomswithsmokeybacon #fry #garlic #parsley #homesmokedbacon #simmer #buttonmushrooms </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Mushroom and garlic soup",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Mushroom and garlic soup, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#mushrooms #soup #vegetablestock #foodprocessor #mushroomandgarlicsoup #onions #mushroom #fat #butter #simmer #oliveoil \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=While everyone else seems to be cooking Christmas dinner, we're making \ud83c\udf44 mushroom soup thanks to Kentdown Mushroom Farm\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1598\n|PortionCalories = 199\n|DatePublished=24th December 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Mushroom soup, even fully blended, it has plenty of texture.\n|Servings = Serves 8\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  1 hour, 20 minutes\n|PrepTime =  45 minutes\n|CookTime =  35 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Mushroom and garlic soup recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">\ud83c\udf44\ud83c\udf44\ud83c\udf44 + \ud83e\uddc4 = \ud83c\udf72</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Winter warming goodness in a bowl.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nWhile everyone else seems to be cooking Christmas dinner, we're making [[Mushroom soup|mushroom soup]] on an industrial scale thanks to  Kentdown [[Mushroom]] Farm who, via a friend of ours, provided a few kilograms of free [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]] - [[Soup|soup]] it is then.\n\nMost of the recipes seem to use [[Cream|cream]], but this [[Soup|soup]] turned out to be fantastically rich and creamy and only used full cream [[Milk|milk]] and [[Vegetable Stock|vegetable stock]].\n\nWe made two batches with slightly different ingredients, this was the best one.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 2 medium [[Onions|onions]], peeled and finely chopped\n| 2 [[Fat|fat]] [[Cloves of Garlic, peeled and crushed|cloves of garlic, peeled and crushed]]\n| 60 g [[Butter|butter]]\n| 3 tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| Big pinch of [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 675 g of field [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]], washed and sliced in a [[Food processor|food processor]]\n| 1 litre [[Vegetable Stock|vegetable stock]]\n| 500 ml full [[Fat|fat]] [[Milk|milk]]\n| 75 g of [[Plain flour|plain flour]] (about 50g per litre of liquid)\n| 1 tablespoon [[Dried|dried]] [[Parsley|parsley]]\n| We've used no [[Salt|salt]] as we have used commercial [[Vegetable|vegetable]] bullion, which is already quite salty.\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Mushrooms cooking down.jpg|Batches of mushrooms cooking down\nImage:Mushrooms sliced for soup making.jpg|Mushrooms, cleaned and sliced in the food processor|alt=mushrooms for soup\nImage:2 kg of unwashed mushrooms for soup.jpg|2 kg of unwashed mushrooms|alt=unwashed mushrooms for soup\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Heat the [[Butter|butter]], [[Olive oil|olive oil]] in a large pan and add a big pinch of [[Black pepper|black pepper]].\n| Turn the heat down quite low and gently saut\u00e9 the [[Onions|onions]] for 15 minutes - adding the [[Crushed garlic|crushed garlic]] for the last 5 minutes.  Meanwhile...\n| Wash the [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]] -  best practice suggests [[Brushing|brushing]] mushrooms, that might be fine for a handful, but we had 2 kilograms to clean! The water in the bucket we used to wash the mushrooms was very black and mucky afterwards.\n| Lay them out on [[Tea|tea]]-towels to dry a little before slicing them finely in a [[Food processor|food processor]].\n| Add the [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]] to the cooked [[Onions|onions]], stir well and [[Simmer|simmer]] for 10 minutes.\n| If you are going to keep some of the sliced [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]] back to add after blending for a chunkier [[Soup|soup]], reserve a ladle-full of them at this stage.\n| Temporarily remove from the heat and sprinkle all of the [[Flour|flour]] over the [[Mushroom|mushroom]] mixture, stirring all the while to make a [[Roux|roux]].\n| Add the [[Milk|milk]] and [[Vegetable Stock|vegetable stock]] and mix well.\n| Bring to the [[Boil|boil]], lower the heat, cover and [[Simmer|simmer]] for 10 minutes stirring now and then.\n| Allow to cool for 5 minutes and then in small batches, carefully [[Blend|blend]] in a [[Food processor|food processor]].\n| Add any reserved [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]] back at this stage, reheat  and serve immediately with crusty [[Bread|bread]] and a sprinkle of [[Fresh herbs|fresh herbs]].\n}}\n===Recipe source===\n\n* A composite of ideas taken from four cookbooks including The New Covent Garden Soup Company's \"Book of Soups\", ISBN 075220503X and Debra Mayhew's \"The Soup Bible\", ISBN 0760790450\n===Variations===\nOn one batch we reserved a ladle of sliced [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]] and added them back after the blending, the other was fully blended.  Both had a lovely texture, worlds apart from tinned [[Soup|soup]].\n===Chef's notes===\nThis freezes very well.  Ladle the cold soup into plastic bags on a large tray and carefully freeze the whole tray, sealing the bags up once fully frozen.\n==See also==\n\n* Kentdown Mushroom Farm, Scudders Hill, Fawkham, Longfield, Kent, DA3 8PA. Tel: 01474 703 164 - 01474 703191\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Soup and stock recipes]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#mushrooms #soup #vegetablestock #foodprocessor #mushroomandgarlicsoup #onions #mushroom #fat #butter #simmer #oliveoil </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Mushroom ketchup - homemade (TM)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Mushroom ketchup - homemade Thermomix Recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#onion #cidervinegar #mushrooms #garlic #spices #ginger #sauce #nutmeg #boiledorsimmered #tomatoketchup #balsamicvinegar \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Making your own bottled sauces is so easy with the Thermomix and this mushroom ketchup is just one example. The mushroom flavour is very subtle and it is quite similar to Brown sauce. \nMethod Recipe source Recipe by JuliaBalbilla\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=17th August 2016\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = 70\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  1 hour, 10 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime =  1 hour\n|TotalCalories = 796\n|PortionCalories = 11\n|Image = [[Image:Mushroom ketchup homemade TM recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Never thought of trying this!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.3</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">..I always make tomato sauce in my Thermy though - just never thought to make this!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The&nbsp;Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nMaking your own bottled [[Sauces|sauces]] is so easy with the [[Thermomix]] and this [[Mushroom ketchup|mushroom ketchup]] is just one example.\n{{RecipeIngredientsTM\n| 1 kg [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]], quartered if large [[Portobello|portobello]] type (any type will do but open-cap makes a darker [[Sauce|sauce]])\n| 2 tablespoons [[Salt|salt]]\n| 1 large [[Onion|onion]], quartered\n| 3 large [[Cloves|cloves]] [[Garlic|garlic]]\n| 5 cm piece ginger root, sliced across into discs\n| 4 [[Bay leaves|bay leaves]], crumbled\n| &#189; [[Nutmeg|nutmeg]], [[Grated|grated]]\n| &#189; teaspoon [[Ground allspice|ground allspice]]\n| &#189; teaspoon [[Ground black pepper|ground black pepper]]\n| 250 gm [[Cider vinegar|cider vinegar]] (I used 200g [[Cider vinegar|cider vinegar]] and 50g [[Balsamic vinegar|balsamic vinegar]])\n| 50 gm soft dark [[Muscovado sugar|muscovado sugar]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Chop [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]] in two or three batches '''Speed 4 / 5 seconds'''\n| Transfer to a bowl and mix with the [[Salt|salt]] then cover and leave for about 24 hours at room temperature, mixing occasionally.\n| Add [[Onion|onion]], [[Garlic|garlic]], [[Ginger|ginger]] and [[Spices|spices]] to the bowl and chop '''Speed 5 / 5 seconds''' then scrape down.\n| Add all of the salty [[Mushroom|mushroom]] mixture (do not rinse)\n| Add the [[Vinegar|vinegar]] and [[Sugar|sugar]] and cook '''Speed 2 /  100\u00b0C / 60 minutes / MC off''' and basket inverted on the lid to allow the mix to reduce.\n| Process '''Speed 10 / 2 minutes''' until very smooth - it should be gloopy, like [[Tomato ketchup|tomato ketchup]].\n| Transfer to warmed [[Sterilised jars|sterilised jars]]/bottles and seal (you could also use ziploc bags and [[Freeze|freeze]] once cooled).\n}}\n===Recipe source===\n\n* Recipe by Rogizoja from [http://www.forumthermomix.com/index.php?PHPSESSID=9gqt3cds5vevc2ii1boecvg9l3&topic=14759.0 Forum Thermomix]\n\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Dips and sauces]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Thermomix recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#onion #cidervinegar #mushrooms #garlic #spices #ginger #sauce #nutmeg #boiledorsimmered #tomatoketchup #balsamicvinegar </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Mushroom soup",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Mushroom soup, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#mushroomsoup #driedmushrooms #garlic #mushrooms #shallots #vegetablestock #leeks #butter #bread #cream #stock \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This vegetarian mushroom soup recipe from the Chilli Lime Deli's newsletter is by kind permission of owner, John Caffrey\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1516\n|PortionCalories = 379\n|DatePublished=17th January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 1 hour 15 minutes\n |PrepTime = 30 minutes \n |CookTime = 45 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Mushroom soup recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">That was creamy!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Lovely.  Thanks John.</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The&nbsp;Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\n\nThis recipe is reproduced from the Chilli Lime Deli's newsletter, with the kind permission of owner, John Caffrey.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 25 g [[Dried mushrooms|dried mushrooms]]\n| 250 ml warm water\n| 30ml [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Butter|butter]]\n| 2 [[Leeks|leeks]] finely chopped\n| 2 [[Shallots|shallots]] finely chopped\n| 1 [[Clove|clove]] [[Garlic|garlic]] finely chopped\n| 8oz of fresh [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]] chopped\n| 1.2 [[Litres|litres]] [[Vegetable stock|vegetable stock]]\n| &frac12; tablespoons [[Dried thyme|dried thyme]]\n| 150ml [[Double cream|double cream]]\n| [[Salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Rehydrate the [[Dried mushrooms|dried mushrooms]] and keep the liquor for later.\n| Heat the [[Oil|oil]] and [[Butter|butter]] in a large saucepan until it starts to foam. Add the [[Leeks|leeks]], [[Garlic|garlic]] and [[Shallots|shallots]], and cook gently until soft but not coloured.\n| Add the fresh [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]] and cook until they start to soften. Add the [[Stock|stock]] and the soaking liquor, [[Dried mushrooms|dried mushrooms]], [[Thyme|thyme]] and [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]. Cook gently for about 30mins, stir occasionally.\n| Pour about &frac34; of the [[Soup|soup]] into a [[Blender|blender]] and blend until smooth, return back to the pan, add the [[Cream|cream]], warm through.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with crusty [[Bread|bread]]\n===Variations===\nUse [[Beef stock|beef stock]] instead of [[Vegetable stock|vegetable stock]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Soup and stock recipes]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#mushroomsoup #driedmushrooms #garlic #mushrooms #shallots #vegetablestock #leeks #butter #bread #cream #stock </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Mushroom soup (V)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Mushroom soup a British vegetarian recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#driedmushrooms #garlic #mushrooms #shallots #butter #leeks #bread #doublecream #cream #vegetablestock #thyme \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This soup recipe is reproduced from the Chilli Lime Deli's newsletter, with the kind permission of owner, John Caffrey\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1516\n|PortionCalories = 379\n|DatePublished=17th January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 1 hour 15 minutes\n |PrepTime = 30 minutes \n |CookTime = 45 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Mushroom soup recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Nice soup, John.</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.6</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">The double cream makes all the difference for me.</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Carla_Cancio-Bello,_J.D.,_on_behalf_of_Cuban_Cuisine_UK|Carla]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis recipe is reproduced from the Chilli Lime Deli's newsletter, with the kind permission of owner, John Caffrey.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 25 g [[Dried mushrooms|dried mushrooms]]\n| 250 ml warm water\n| 30ml [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Butter|butter]]\n| 2 [[Leeks|leeks]] finely chopped\n| 2 [[Shallots|shallots]] finely chopped\n| 1 [[Clove|clove]] [[Garlic|garlic]] finely chopped\n| 8oz of fresh [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]] chopped\n| 1.2 [[Litres|litres]] [[Vegetable stock|vegetable stock]]\n| &frac12; tablespoons [[Dried thyme|dried thyme]]\n| 150ml [[Double cream|double cream]]\n| [[Salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Rehydrate the [[Dried mushrooms|dried mushrooms]] and keep the liquor for later.\n| Heat the [[Oil|oil]] and [[Butter|butter]] in a large saucepan until it starts to foam. Add the [[Leeks|leeks]], [[Garlic|garlic]] and [[Shallots|shallots]], and cook gently until soft but not coloured.\n| Add the fresh [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]] and cook until they start to soften. Add the [[Stock|stock]] and the soaking liquor, [[Dried mushrooms|dried mushrooms]], [[Thyme|thyme]] and [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]. Cook gently for about 30mins, stir occasionally.\n| Pour about &frac34; of the [[Soup|soup]] into a [[Blender|blender]] and blend until smooth, return back to the pan, add the [[Cream|cream]], warm through.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with crusty [[Bread|bread]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Soup and stock recipes]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#driedmushrooms #garlic #mushrooms #shallots #butter #leeks #bread #doublecream #cream #vegetablestock #thyme </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Mushroom stroganoff with green beans and wild rice",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Mushroom stroganoff with green beans and wild rice vegetarian recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#wildrice #cremefraiche #mushroomstroganoffwithgreenbeansandwildrice #stock #fry #paprikapowder #lemon #mushrooms #vegetablestock #greenbeans #vegetarian \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=An economical and deliciously creamy mushroom vegetarian main course that qualifies as another Gent night contender\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1035\n|PortionCalories = 517\n|DatePublished=19th March 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  1 hour, 5 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  50 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Mushroom stroganoff with green beans and wild rice recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">A Happy Meal \ud83d\ude0a</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Creamy and with wild rice - Yum!</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nAn economical and deliciously creamy [[Mushroom|mushroom]] [[Vegetarian|vegetarian]] [[Main course|main course]] that qualifies as another [[Gent night]] contender.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 tablespoon [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| [[Freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 1 large [[Onion|onion]], peeled and finely chopped\n| 2 [[Cloves of Garlic, peeled and crushed|cloves of garlic, peeled and crushed]]\n| 250 g closed cup [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]], brushed clean and sliced\n| 1 teaspoon [[Paprika powder|paprika powder]]\n| &#189; teaspoon made-up [[English mustard]]\n| 150 ml [[Vegetable Stock|vegetable stock]], a [[Stock cube|stock cube]] is fine for this\n| 100g [[Wild rice|wild rice]], rinsed under running water and drained\n| 150 ml [[Creme fraiche|creme fraiche]]\n| 1 teaspoon of [[Dry sherry|dry sherry]]\n| Half a [[Lemon|lemon]] cut into [[Wedges|wedges]]\n| A handful of [[Green beans|green beans]], trimmed and halved\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Cook the [[Wild rice|wild rice]] as instructed on the packet. Note that [[Wild rice|wild rice]] can take as long as 50 minutes to cook properly so you may need to adjust the stroganoff cooking time appropriately\n| Heat the [[Oil|oil]] in a [[Wok|wok]] or saucepan and give a good grind of [[Black pepper|black pepper]], add the [[Onions|onions]] and gently [[Fry|fry]] for about 5 minutes or until translucent.\n| Add the [[Crushed garlic|crushed garlic]] and [[Fry|fry]] for another 2 minutes.\n| Add the sliced [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]] and [[Saute|saute]] for 6 minutes, turning now and then.\n| Add the [[Mustard|mustard]] and [[Paprika powder|paprika powder]] and mix well, then pour over the [[Stock|stock]]. Ensure the [[Stock|stock]] is well mixed and [[Simmer|simmer]] for about 5 minutes.\n| Meanwhile cook the [[Beans|beans]] for about 6 minutes in [[Boiling|boiling]] water.\n| Add the [[Creme fraiche|creme fraiche]] together with the [[Juice|juice]] from &#188; of the [[Lemon|lemon]] and stir well.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with the [[Wild rice|wild rice]] and [[Green beans|green beans]]\n===Recipe source===\n\n* Based on a recipe seen on bbc.co.uk/food\n===Variations===\nUse [[Sour cream|sour cream]] instead of [[Creme fraiche|creme fraiche]]\n===Chef's notes===\nDon't add any extra salt without tasting first as [[Vegetable Stock|vegetable stock]] from a cube tends to be rather salty.\n\nIf you want to thicken the sauce, mix a little of the [[Stock|stock]] with a level teaspoon of [[Cornflour|cornflour]] and stir back in at stage 5 and mix well.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Italian recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Rice recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#wildrice #cremefraiche #mushroomstroganoffwithgreenbeansandwildrice #stock #fry #paprikapowder #lemon #mushrooms #vegetablestock #greenbeans #vegetarian </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

As you can see, it looks fab. That was a new one to me, so I asked him for the secret!\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 portion of [[Mashed potato recipe|mashed potates]] for two people\n| 2 teaspoons of ready-made [[Mustard|mustard]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| While mixing the [[Butter|butter]] and [[Milk|milk]] (or [[Cream|cream]]) into the [[Potatoes|potatoes]], add two teaspoons of [[Mustard|mustard]].\n| Mash until well mixed.\n| Serve with [[Sausages|sausages]], [[Vegetables|vegetables]] and [[Gravy|gravy]].\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Ken doing what he does best.jpg|Ken doing what he does best!\n</gallery>\n\n===Recipe source===\n\n* Our neighbour Ken - happy fishing mate!\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Irish recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes]]\n[[Category:Cookery cheats]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#mustardmash #mustard #potatoes #cream #gravy #britishrecipes #recipes #cookerycheats #bangersandmash #irishrecipes #butter</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Mustard roasted loin of pork with melting rooster potatoes",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Mustard roasted loin of pork with melting rooster potatoess recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#potatoes #mustardroastedloinofporkwithmeltingroosterpotatoes #butter #fat #roastingtray #boil #boiledorsimmered #fridge #potato #roast #mustard \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A warming dish for winter\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 5894\n|PortionCalories = 1473\n|DatePublished=24th October 2012\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 1 hour 40 minutes\n |PrepTime = 40 minutes\n |CookTime = 1 hour\n |Image = [[Image:Mustard roasted loin of pork with melting rooster potatoes recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Tried this with Cara potatoes</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">They got nice and buttery-crispy</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]] </span></span>\n}}\nA warming dish for winter.\n\n{{FindAlbertBartlett}}\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 900g [[Pork loin|pork loin]] with Skin Removed \n| 2 Tablespoons [[Dijon Mustard]] \n| 12 Baby Rooster [[Potatoes]] \n| 75g [[Butter]] Softened \n| [[Salt]] & [[Pepper]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Trim any excess [[Fat|fat]] from the loin leaving about 5mm. \n| Score the [[Fat|fat]] with the tip of a small knife, rub the [[Mustard|mustard]] into the fat, season with [[Salt|salt]] & [[Pepper|pepper]], place in the [[Fridge|fridge]] for 30 minutes. \n| Preheat [[Oven|oven]] to 200\u00b0C / Gas Mark 6. \n| Spread the [[Butter|butter]] over the bottom of a [[Braising|braising]] dish just large enough to take all the [[Potatoes|potatoes]]. \n| Trim 1cm off the end of each [[Potato|potato]] and place them flat side down into the dish, they should all fit snugly. \n| Pour cold water into the dish until the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] are just covered, bring the water to the [[Boil|boil]] and place into the [[Oven|oven]]. \n| Place the [[Pork|pork]] onto a [[Roasting tray]] and place into the [[Oven|oven]]. [[Roast]] the pork for 45 to 50 minutes, and rest for a further 15. The water should have reduced to dry and the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] should be tender. \n| If the water has not reduced remove from the [[Oven|oven]] and finish cooking on the gas, until the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] are golden [[Brown|brown]].\n}}\n===Chef's notes===\n{{Template:ThinkPig}}\n==See also==\n* '''[[Meat cooking time calculator Metric|A comprehensive guide to roast meat cooking times]]''' - give the time you want to carve your roast and we'll give you a timed step by step roasting guide\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Albert Bartlett recipes]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n{{Template:Albert Bartlett attribution}}\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#potatoes #mustardroastedloinofporkwithmeltingroosterpotatoes #butter #fat #roastingtray #boil #boiledorsimmered #fridge #potato #roast #mustard </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Nacho chicken salad",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Nacho chicken salad; a  recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#salad #tomatoes #roast #oliveoil #redwinevinegar #coriander #chicken #chives #zest #redonion #lime \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Take your Sunday leftovers to mexico with this quick and easy salad. \n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1595\n|PortionCalories = 797\n|DatePublished=17th May 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  20 minutes\n|PrepTime =  20 minutes\n|CookTime = None\n|Image = [[Image:Nacho chicken salad recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">I love Nachos</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Even better when they're served with spicy chicken!</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nTake your Sunday leftovers to [[Mexico]] with this quick and easy [[Salad|salad]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 6 large [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]] or 500g [[Cherry tomatoes|cherry tomatoes]]\n| 1 [[Red onion|red onion]]\n| A few glugs of [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| A handful fresh [[Coriander|coriander]], finely chopped\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground pepper|freshly ground pepper]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Caster Sugar|caster sugar]], plus an extra pinch\n| 100g cr\u00e8me fra\u00eeche\n| 4 tablespoons finely chopped [[Chives|chives]], plus a pinch to garnish\n| 1 head of [[Lettuce|lettuce]], [[Shredded|shredded]]\n| 2 [[Red peppers|red peppers]]\n| 1 [[Avocado|avocado]], sliced and peeled\n| A few slices or shreds of leftover [[Roast|roast]] [[Chicken|chicken]] *''see variations, below''\n| 2 [[Limes|limes]]\n| 2 tablespoons of [[Red wine vinegar|red wine vinegar]]\n| 2 handfuls of [[Tortilla chips|tortilla chips]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Finely [[Dice|dice]] half of your [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]] and \u00bd of your [[Red onion|red onion]] to make a little [[Salsa|salsa]]. Mix in a bowl with a pinch of [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]. Finely chop half of your [[Coriander|coriander]]. Stir through. Taste. Mix in a pinch of [[Sugar|sugar]], if needed.\n| In a separate dish, mix your cr\u00e8me fra\u00eeche and [[Chives|chives]]. Season to taste. Garnish with any spare [[Chives|chives]].\n| Heat a clean, [[Dry frying|dry frying]] pan. Add your [[Peppers|peppers]] on a high heat. Turn them every min or so for five mins or till charred. Use tongs to hold the [[Pepper|pepper]], slice into rings. (''see [[Roasted red peppers|roasted red peppers]]'')\n| Finely shred your [[Lettuce|lettuce]] onto a plate.\n| Cut remaining [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]] in [[Wedges|wedges]] or halves (if using [[Cherry|cherry]] toms). Thinly slice your [[Onion|onion]], pop in a [[Sieve|sieve]] and pour [[Boiling|boiling]] water over to soften it.Scatter the [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]], [[Onions|onions]], charred [[Pepper|pepper]] slices and [[Avocado|avocado]] over your leaves. Gently mix. Top with slices of cold [[Roast|roast]] [[Chicken|chicken]] and the remaining [[Coriander|coriander]]. \n| Mix the [[Juice|juice]] and [[Zest|zest]] of one of your [[Limes|limes]] in a little bowl or [[Jam|jam]] jar with the [[Red wine vinegar|red wine vinegar]], 2 tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]], 1 teaspoon [[Sugar|sugar]] and a pinch of [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]. Whisk. Drizzle over your [[Salad|salad]].\n| Cut your [[Lime|lime]] into [[Wedges|wedges]]. Serve alongside the [[Salad|salad]] with the [[Salsa|salsa]], creamy [[Chive dip|chive dip]] and a handful of [[Tortilla chips|tortilla chips]]. Crush another handful of [[Chips|chips]] over your [[Salad|salad]] like [[Croutons|croutons]].\n| For a simple dressing mix the [[Juice|juice]] and [[Zest|zest]] of 1 [[Lime|lime]] with the [[Sugar|sugar]], [[Red wine vinegar|red wine vinegar]] and [[Olive oil|olive oil]]. Drizzle over the [[Salad|salad]].\n}}\n===Variations===\nNo leftover [[Roast|roast]] [[Chicken|chicken]]? [[Roast]] [[Chicken thighs|chicken thighs]] in a 220\u00b0C/Gas 7 [[Oven|oven]] for 35 mins, or till golden, crispy-skinned and cooked through.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Mexican recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Salad recipes]]\n[[Category:Abel and Cole veg box recipes]]\n[[Category:Uncooked]]\n{{Template:Abel and Cole veg box recipes attribution}}\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#salad #tomatoes #roast #oliveoil #redwinevinegar #coriander #chicken #chives #zest #redonion #lime </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "No pasta lasagne",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",

                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=No pasta lasagne a cheese recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#courgettes #nopastalasagne #bubble #basil #parmesan #pinenuts #mozzarella #oliveoil #tomatosauce #pastasauce #images \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Having a low-carb day, or just fancy a change from pasta? Then courgettes to your rescue for you my friend\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1159\n|PortionCalories = 289\n|DatePublished=18th May 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  45 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  30 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:No pasta lasagne recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Cut the carbs!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.6</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Originally I thought what's the point of this, until I tried to keep the carbohydrates down!</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nHaving a low-carb day, or just fancy a change from [[Pasta|pasta]]? Then [[Courgettes|courgettes]] to your rescue for you my friend. This fresh, organic Mediterranean style recipe is yummy and healthy. Hurrah.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 jar of [[Tomato|tomato]] [[Pasta sauce|pasta sauce]], or make your own, ''see Chef's notes''\n| 2-3 [[Courgettes|courgettes]]\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground pepper|freshly ground pepper]]\n| A [[Lemon|lemon]]\n| 100g [[Parmesan|parmesan]]\n| A few handfuls of fresh [[Basil|basil]]\n| 2 balls of fresh [[Mozzarella|mozzarella]]\n| A handful of [[Pine Nuts|pine nuts]] (optional)\n| [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Heat your [[Oven|oven]] to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4), [fan [[Oven|oven]] 160\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Dollop a few spoonfuls of [[Sauce|sauce]] in the bottom of a [[Lasagne|lasagne]] dish. Top with overlapping ribbons of [[Courgette|courgette]] (use your veg [[Peeler|peeler]]).\n| Sprinkle with [[Salt|salt]], [[Pepper|pepper]], [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]] and [[Zest|zest]]. Scatter with [[Grated|grated]] [[Parmesan|parmesan]] and [[Basil|basil]] and torn [[Mozzarella|mozzarella]]. Repeat. Repeat again, but skip the [[Courgettes|courgettes]].\n| Top with [[Pine nuts|pine nuts]]. Season. [[Bake]] in a 180\u00b0C/Gas 4 [[Oven|oven]] until golden, 20-30 mins.\n}}\n===Chef's notes===\nMake your own [[Tomato sauce|tomato sauce]]: [[Fry]] finely [[Diced|diced]] [[Onion|onion]] in [[Olive oil|olive oil]] till tender. Add two or three chopped [[Garlic|garlic]] [[Cloves|cloves]]. Season. Sizzle for a mo. Add a tin of [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]], [[Bubble|bubble]] it for a few mins. Add a glug of [[Balsamic vinegar|balsamic vinegar]]. [[Bubble]] again. Fold in [[Fresh herbs|fresh herbs]]\n==See also==\n\n* [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Vd3yG_HGl60 Abel & Cole 'how to' video for this recipe]\n{{LasagneRecipes}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Italian recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Pasta recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Cookery cheats]]\n[[Category:Gluten free recipes]]\n[[Category:Abel and Cole veg box recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n{{Template:Abel and Cole veg box recipes attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#courgettes #nopastalasagne #bubble #basil #parmesan #pinenuts #mozzarella #oliveoil #tomatosauce #pastasauce #images </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

Most of the large farms in the north made their own relish to eat with [[beef]]\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| &frac34; oz of [[cayenne pepper]]\n| 2 tablespoons of [[soy sauce]]\n| 3 cloves of [[Garlic|garlic]]\n| A tablespoons of [[anchovies]] (these came in barrels and the scraping of the barrel was used)\n| A few [[cloves]]\n| 3 or 4 [[shallots]]\n| 1 teaspoon of [[sugar]]\n| A quart of [[vinegar]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Pound all dry things with the [[dry sugar]]\n| Chop and add the [[onions]], etc.\n| Put into a leadless glazed demijohn  with the [[vinegar]], and cork lightly.\n| This jar was then left at the foot of the stairs for a month, and everyone passing up and down to chapel (twice a day) had to give it a shake.\n}}\n\n===Servings===\nServings: 32 - Makes 2 pint one jars\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Dips and sauces]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Uncooked]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#nunssauce #vinegar #beef #onions #anchovies #shallots #drysugar #cayennepepper #unusualrecipes #garlic #soysauce </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Nut brittle based on Rick Stein's TV recipe",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Nut brittle based on Rick Steins TV recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#nuts #cup #greaseproofpaper #butter #almonds #nutbrittlerickstein #nut #snacksandlightbites #bakingtray #sweetsanddesserts #refrigerate\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=My take on Ricks tv recipe I saw recently - I am only interested in the nut brittle!\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=14th December 2020\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = The improved nut brittle - perfect!\n|Servings = 50\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  25 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime =  15 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 1976\n|PortionCalories = 39\n|Image = [[Image:New_improve_nut_brittle.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Was not hot enough the first time</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.8</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">So it was more like caramel toffee, which was even nicer, just rather messy to eat.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry, aka Chef]])</span></span>\n}}\nWatching a Rick Stein TV program, he made a panna cotta with green [[Pistachio nut|pistachio nut]] brittle [[Dessert|dessert]].  I have lots of lovely [[Nuts|nuts]] from RealFoodSource bought from [[Amazon]] recently so I thought I would make something similar. I'm only interested in the [[Nut|nut]] brittle and I'm going to use [[Brazil nuts]], [[Cashew nuts]] and [[Almonds|almonds]].  I've blitzed &#190; of the nuts and left the remaining nuts whole.\n\nGo easy when consuming this as it contains a massive amount of [[Sugar|sugar]]!\n\nSee '''Chef's notes''' below for ''improvements'' I've made to Rick's recipe.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 2 tablespoons of [[Butter|butter]]\n| &#189; a [[Cup|cup]] of [[Granulated sugar|granulated sugar]]\n| &#189; a [[Cup|cup]] of [[Muscovado sugar|muscovado sugar]]\n| 100 ml water\n| 1 teaspoon [[Sea Salt|sea salt]]\n| 1 [[Cup|cup]] of mixed [[Nuts|nuts]] of your choice - some broken, some whole.\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Line a [[Baking tray|baking tray]] with [[Greaseproof paper|greaseproof paper]] - check that it will fit in the [[Fridge|fridge]]! \n| Add the [[Butter|butter]], [[Sugar|sugar]] and water to a heavy based pan and heat over a medium flame\n| Carefully stir until everything has combined\n| [[Boil]] for about 10 minutes until it reaches 'hard-crack' stage\n| Threads should be formed as you pull a spoon away and the threads should break easily when cooled\n| If you have a [[Jam|jam]] [[Thermometer|thermometer]] your looking for about 146\u00b0-155 \u00b0 C (295\u00b0-310\u00b0 F).\n| Do not let the [[Sugar|sugar]] burn or it will be brittle\n| Stir in the [[Nuts|nuts]], mix well and quickly pour the mixture onto the [[Greaseproof paper|greaseproof paper]] and spread out with a [[Spatula|spatula]].\n| [[Refrigerate]] for around 30 minutes, then break up the brittle into bite-sized pieces.\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nNut brittle based on Rick Stein's TV recipe.jpg|The original, rather soft version\n</gallery>\n===Chef's notes===\nAfter finding that this was far too sweet for me, and rather too soft, I made some improvements:\n* I tipped everything into a big [[saucepan]].\n* Added a further 2 cups of mixed nuts.\n* Heated for 10 minutes, stirring all the time.\n* Even after this, the nuts actually tasted soft, not what I wanted.\n* I put the oven on a very low grill [120\u00b0] and tipped the sticky nut mixture onto an unlined oven tray.\n* Grill/baked the nut mixture for about 15 minutes.\n* Allow to cool completely\n* Smash the toffee mixture into smaller pieces and store in a [[Lock and Lock box]]\n* '''They are now perfect''' (for my taste)\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Student recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#nuts #cup #greaseproofpaper #butter #almonds #nutbrittlebasedonricksteinstvrecipe #nut #snacksandlightbites #bakingtray #sweetsanddesserts #refrigerate</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Oatmeal cookies",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Oatmeal cookies, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#oatmealcookies #bakingtray #vanilla #butter #eggyolks #miseenplace #plainflour #oats #bake #dough #coconuticecream \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Buttery, crunchy on the outside, soft in the middle and a wonderful accompaniment for homemade ice-cream. These are quick and simple to make\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2813\n|PortionCalories = 351\n|DatePublished=15th October 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Servings: 8 - Makes about 25 cookies\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 30 minutes\n |PrepTime = 15 minutes\n |CookTime = 15 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Oatmeal cookies recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Changed my mind</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I don't normally like cookies, but these were all right</span> \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\">[[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nButtery, crunchy on the outside, soft in the middle and a wonderful accompaniment for homemade [[Ice-cream|ice-cream]].  These are quick and simple to make.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 225 g (8 oz) [[Butter|butter]], softened\n| 225 g (8 oz) [[Sugar|sugar]]\n| 2 [[Egg yolks|egg yolks]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Vanilla|vanilla]] essence\n| 110 g (4oz) [[Oats|oats]]\n| 225 g (8oz) [[Plain flour|plain flour]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Bicarbonate of soda|bicarbonate of soda]]\n| &frac12; teaspoon [[Salt|salt]]\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 160\u00b0 C (325\u00b0 F - gas 3)\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Line a [[baking tray]] with [[Grease-proof paper|grease-proof paper]]\n| If you want to be a purist, whisk the [[Egg yolks|egg yolks]] and [[Vanilla|vanilla]] together, beat the [[Butter|butter]] and [[Sugar|sugar]] then fold in the dry ingredients and mix until you have a '[[Dough|dough]]' that stands-up on its own.\n| Or, being a lazy sod like me, sling it all in a [[Food processor|food processor]] and blitz it.\n| Roll the cookies into balls and place on the [[baking tray]] with enough room for them to spread out.\n| [[Bake]] for 14 minutes\n| Remove and cool on a rack\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Coconut ice cream|coconut ice cream]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Grain and bean recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#oatmealcookies #bakingtray #vanilla #butter #eggyolks #miseenplace #plainflour #oats #bake #dough #coconuticecream </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }

title": "Old-fashioned rice pudding",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Old-fashioned rice pudding, British recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#rice #oldfashionedricepudding #nutmeg #evaporatedmilk #butter #grain #grated #honey #miseenplace #fat #jam \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=You either love or loathe this; it's the original, thick skinned, spicy flavoured, creamy rice pudding\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 935\n|PortionCalories = 233\n|DatePublished=21st January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime = 1 hour 35 minutes\n|PrepTime = 5 minutes\n|CookTime = 1 hour 30 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Original rice pudding recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n}}\n\nYou either love or loathe this; it's the original, thick skinned, spicy flavoured, creamy [[Rice|rice]] pudding.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 110g (4 oz) short-[[Grain|grain]] [[Rice|rice]] (pudding rice)\n| 568 ml (1 pint) full-[[Fat|fat]] [[Milk|milk]]\n| 410g tin of [[Evaporated milk|evaporated milk]] (14.5 oz)\n| 40g (1.5 oz) [[Sugar|sugar]], [[Jaggery|jaggery]] or [[Honey|honey]]\n| 1 whole [[Nutmeg|nutmeg]], [[Grated|grated]]\n| 25g [[Butter|butter]]\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the oven to 150\u00b0 C (300 \u00b0F - gas 2)\n\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Evenly distribute the [[Rice|rice]] and  [[Sugar|sugar]] in a suitable oven proof serving dish\n| Mix the [[Evaporated milk|evaporated milk]] and the [[Milk|milk]] together and pour over the [[Rice|rice]]\n| Grate the [[Nutmeg|nutmeg]] over the surface and dot with shavings of [[Butter|butter]]\n| Place in the oven for 30 minutes\n| After 30 minutes, remove and stir well\n| Cook for a further hour without stirring\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\n\nServe hot with spoonfuls of [[Strawberry|strawberry]] [[Jam|jam]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Thick-skinned</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">3.5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Not for me.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#rice #oldfashionedricepudding #nutmeg #evaporatedmilk #butter #grain #grated #honey #miseenplace #fat #jam </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
