title": "Old fashioned spicy bread pudding",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Old fashioned spicy bread pudding an egg recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#grated #zest #oldfashionedspicybreadpudding #spirit #brownbread #nutmeg #muscovadosugar #butter #mixedspice #bread #demerarasugar \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Not to be confused with bread and butter pudding, this spicy version was often frugal way to use up stale bread\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2001\n|PortionCalories = 333\n|DatePublished=29th July 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 6\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 2 hours 15 minutes\n |PrepTime = 1 hour\n |CookTime = 1 hour 15 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Old fashioned spicy bread pudding recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n}}\n\nNot to be confused with [[bread and butter pudding]], this spicy version was often frugal way to use up stale bread. Now it's a good excuse to let bread go stale on purpose.\n\nI prefer this made with [[Brown bread|brown bread]], the way my mum used to make it.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 225 g (8 oz) [[Brown bread|brown bread]] or [[White bread|white bread]] with the crusts cut off\n| 2 teaspoons of [[Mixed spice|mixed spice]]\n| 50 g (2 oz) chopped [[Candied peel|candied peel]]\n| 110 g (4 oz) [[Sultanas|sultanas]]\n| 25 g (1 oz) [[Currants|currants]]\n| 25 g (1 oz) [[Raisins|raisins]]\n| 3 tablespoons of [[Brandy|brandy]], [[Whisky|whisky]] or other [[Spirit|spirit]] of your choosing\n| 275 ml (10 fl oz) full [[Fat|fat]] [[Milk|milk]]\n| 50 g (2 oz) of melted [[Butter|butter]]\n| A little [[Olive oil|olive oil]] for greasing\n| 1 large beaten [[Egg|egg]]\n| 75 g (3 oz) [[muscovado sugar]]\n| [[Grated]] [[Zest|zest]] of 1 [[Lemon|lemon]]\n| [[Grated]] [[Zest|zest]] of &frac12; an [[Orange|orange]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Demerara sugar|demerara sugar]]\n| Freshly [[Grated|grated]] [[Nutmeg|nutmeg]]\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4)\n* Place the [[Dried fruit|dried fruit]] and your chosen [[Spirit|spirit]] in a bowl and leave for an hour to infuse the flavours.\n* Break the [[Bread|bread]] into 1cm (1/2\") pieces a add to a large bowl and leave for 30 minutes to soak.\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| In a separate bowl, mix the beaten [[Egg|egg]], [[muscovado sugar]], melted [[Butter|butter]] and [[Mixed spice|mixed spice]] and beat well to combine.\n| Pour this into the [[Milk|milk]] and [[Bread|bread]] mixture.\n| Beat this mixture really well with a fork so there are no lumps.\n| Fold the marinaded [[Fruits|fruits]], [[Spirit|spirit]] and [[Fruit|fruit]] [[Zest|zest]] into this mixture.\n| Spoon this mixture into a [[Baking|baking]] dish and spread it out evenly.\n| Sprinkle the top with a little freshly [[Grated|grated]] [[Nutmeg|nutmeg]] and the [[Demerara sugar|demerara sugar]].\n| [[Bake]] in the middle of the [[Oven|oven]] for 1 hour, 15 minutes.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with hot [[Custard|custard]], consume and then find a comfy chair to sleep it off in.\n===Variations===\nTry other [[Dried|dried]] [[Fruits|fruits]], [[Apricots|apricots]], [[Cherries|cherries]] etc.\n==See also==\n''Bread and butter pudding is very different, but it might be what you were searching for''\n* [[Bread and butter pudding (Mum's)]]\n* [[Bread and butter pudding]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Wartime fare</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">My Dad loved this, I think it reminded him of good times during the war.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Egg recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#grated #zest #oldfashionedspicybreadpudding #spirit #brownbread #nutmeg #muscovadosugar #butter #mixedspice #bread #demerarasugar </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]

title": "Olive oil powder",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Olive oil powder recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#oliveoil #oliveoilpowder #tapiocamaltodextrin #sieve #maltodextrin #fridge #salad #moleculargastronomy #zorbit #fat #starchy \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=An easy introduction to molecular gastronomy. Powders made from oil have a magic of their own\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 370\n|PortionCalories = 61\n|DatePublished=12th September 2014\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Servings: 6 - About 150ml\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  10 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime = None\n|Image = [[Image:Olive oil powder recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">The Fat Duck</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">...would probably have had this on the menu!</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nAn easy introduction to [[Molecular gastronomy|molecular gastronomy]], powders made from [[Oil|oil]] have a magic of their own.  You must ensure that you measure the two ingredients by '''volume''' and not by weight.  In general the [[Maltodextrin|maltodextrin]] should be twice the volume of the [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 50ml [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 100ml [[Tapioca maltodextrin]] (also sold as [[Zorbit]] or [[El Bull\u00ed Texturas Malto]])\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Simply mix the [[Tapioca maltodextrin]] gradually with the [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| Pass through a [[Sieve|sieve]] \n| If a more powdery texture is desired, pass through a [[Sieve|sieve]] once more, using a finer mesh\n| Store in a container in the [[Fridge|fridge]] until required\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nSprinkle over [[Salad|salad]] leaves or any [[Ingredient|ingredient]] that would normally be dressed in, or drizzled with [[Olive oil|olive oil]].  For the best effect make sure that the surface of the ingredients is as dry as possible\n===Variations===\nYou can use almost any [[Oil|oil]] you like instead of [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n===Chef's notes===\nWhilst it is plainly obvious that the addition of a sufficient quantity of [[Starchy|starchy]] powder to [[Oil|oil]] would necessarily create an oil powder, the magic happens when the powder is put into the mouth.  When you do this, the powder reverts back to the flavour and texture of pure oil.  This is because [[Tapioca maltodextrin]], whilst not [[Fat|fat]] soluble, ''is'' water soluble, which is why you should only sprinkle it on ingredients which have been patted dry.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Molecular gastronomy recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Spanish recipes]]\n[[Category:Marinades dressings and butters]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Uncooked]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#oliveoil #oliveoilpowder #tapiocamaltodextrin #sieve #maltodextrin #fridge #salad #moleculargastronomy #zorbit #fat #starchy </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=One pan sausage hash, a gluten free sausage recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#worcestershiresauce #onion #butter #eggs #sausages #sausagemeat #potato #glutenfree #sodium #cookipedia #fat \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A one pan gluten free sausage hash recipe that can be made in 25 minutes and will serve 6 people\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 709\n|PortionCalories = 118\n|DatePublished=23rd October 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 6\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  25 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  10 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:One pan sausage hash gluten free recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Bish, bosh, bash; Sausage hash</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">3.9</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Debbie and Andrew win again.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry, aka Chef]])</span></span>\nA one pan [[Gluten free|gluten free]] [[Sausage|sausage]] hash recipe that can be made in 25 minutes and will serve 6  people.\n\n}}\n[[Image:Harrogate-pork-sausages.png|300px|thumb|right|[[Debbie and Andrew's Harrogate 97% Gluten Free Pork Sausages]]]]\nThis recipe is brought ot [[Cookipedia]] courtesy of [[Debbie&andrew's sausages|debbie&andrew's sausages]]\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 2tbsp [[Sunflower oil|sunflower oil]]\n| 50g [[Butter|butter]] \n| 1 pack [[Debbie and Andrew's Harrogate 97% Gluten Free Pork Sausages]]\n| 1 [[Onion|onion]], peeled and sliced\n| 1 small [[Potato|potato]], unpeeled\n| [[Worcestershire sauce|worcestershire sauce]], to taste\n| 2 large [[Eggs|eggs]]\n| [[Salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Heat the [[Oil|oil]] in a large non stick [[Frying pan|frying pan]] and remove the [[Sausages|sausages]] from their skins.\n| Add the [[Butter|butter]] and skinned [[Sausages|sausages]] to the pan and [[Brown|brown]] evenly for a few minutes. Break up the [[Sausage meat|sausage meat]] as much as you can with your wooden spoon. Add the [[Onion|onion]] to the pan and stir.\n| Now grate the [[Potato|potato]] into a [[Sieve|sieve]] and squeeze it as hard as you can over the sink to remove the water. Sprinkle the [[Grated|grated]] potato over the [[Sausagemeat|sausagemeat]] and [[Onion|onion]] mix. Stir again to cook evenly and drizzle with [[Worcestershire sauce|worcestershire sauce]] (to taste).\n| After 5 minutes or so, crack the [[Eggs|eggs]] into the pan and cook to your taste. Season and serve straight from the pan with plenty of warm [[Bread|bread]] and [[Butter|butter]] or piles of freshly made toast.\n}}\n===Chef's notes===\nLea & Perrins\u00ae [[Worcestershire sauce|worcestershire sauce]] is [[Cholesterol|cholesterol]] free, [[Fat|fat]] free, [[Preservative|preservative]] free, [[Gluten free|gluten free]] and has 80% less [[Sodium|sodium]] than [[Soy sauce|soy sauce]].\n===See also===\n* [[Udi's Gluten Free Products|Udi's Gluten free bread and baking]]\n* [http://www.leaperrins.com/Products/The%20Original%20Worcestershire%20Sauce Leaperrins.com]\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Gluten free recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Debbie&andrew's sausage recipes]]\n[[Category:Stewed, braised or pot roasted]]\n{{Template:DebbieAndAndrew attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#worcestershiresauce #onion #butter #eggs #sausages #sausagemeat #potato #glutenfree #sodium #cookipedia #fat </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

Varoma / Reverse Blade / Speed 1\n| Add the [[Onion|onion]] slices 15 minutes / Temp. Varoma / Reverse Blade / Speed Spoon / MC OFF\n| Add the [[Potatoes|potatoes]], seasoning, water and the [[Stock|stock]] concentrate 20 minutes / 90\u00b0 / Reverse Blade / Speed Spoon\n| Add the [[Cheese|cheese]] and the [[Cream|cream]] Speed 5-10 progressively until smooth\n| Reheat to 90\u00b0 and serve, sprinkled with the snipped [[Chives|chives]]\n}}\n===Recipe source===\n* Inspired by a '''[http://www.rte.ie/lifestyle/food/recipes/2011/0923/423-leek-potato-and-blue-cheese-soup/ Rachel Allen recipe]'''\n===Variations===\nYou can use ordinary [[Vegetable Stock|vegetable stock]] if you prefer.  If using a mild [[Blue cheese|blue cheese]], you may wish to increase the quantity to 150g.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Soup and stock recipes]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Thermomix recipes]]\n\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#bluecheese #chives #potatoes #vegetablestock #fridge #spanish #cheese #stock #sourcream #onion #onions </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Onion and cheese soda bread",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Onion and cheese soda bread a cheese recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#onionandcheesesodabread #dough #onions #onion #sundriedtomatoes #bicarbonateofsoda #flour #yogurt #oliveoil #plainflour #onionrelish \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A savoury onion bread from British Onions\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2824\n|PortionCalories = 470\n|DatePublished=4th October 2012\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = Serves 6\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 35 minutes\n |PrepTime = 15 minutes\n |CookTime = 20 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Onion and cheese soda bread recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">It's heavy</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">And cheesy</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]] </span></span>\n}}\n\nA savoury [[onion]] bread from [[British Onions]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1 Large [[Onion]], sliced\n| 1 tablespoon [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 450g/1lb [[Plain flour|plain flour]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Bicarbonate of soda]]\n| 150g/6oz [[Gruyere cheese|gruyere cheese]], [[Grated|grated]]\n| 884ml/10floz [[Yogurt]]\n| 3 tablespoons Water\n| 2 tablespoons [[Sundried tomatoes|sundried tomatoes]], chopped\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 220C/425F/Gas No 7\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Heat the [[Oil]] in a [[Frying pan|frying pan]] & gently [[Fry|fry]] the [[Onions|onions]] until translucent, about 10 minutes.\n| Mix the [[Flour|flour]], [[Bicarbonate of soda|bicarbonate of soda]] in a bowl; add 125g/5oz [[Cheese|cheese]], [[Onions|onions]] & [[Sundried tomatoes|sundried tomatoes]]. \n| Mix the [[Yogurt|yogurt]] & water together, stir into the [[Flour|flour]]. \n| Mix with a spoon until it comes together to form a soft [[Dough|dough]].\n| Turn onto a floured surface, [[Kneading bread|knead]] until if form smooth [[Dough|dough]] & shape into a 20cm round. \n| Place onto a [[Baking|baking]] sheet & mark out 6 [[Wedges|wedges]] with a knife. [[Bake]] for 20 minutes until golden [[Brown|brown]].\n| Serve warm with [[Grilled|grilled]] [[Bacon|bacon]], [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]] & [[Onion relish|onion relish]].\n}}\n===Chef's notes===\nWork quickly as the rising effect of the bicarbonate will be lost unless you bake the rolls immediately after shaping.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:British Onions recipes]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n{{Template:British Onions attribution}}\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#onionandcheesesodabread #dough #onions #onion #sundriedtomatoes #bicarbonateofsoda #flour #yogurt #oliveoil #plainflour #onionrelish </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }

                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Onion gravy (1), British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#onions #oliveoil #butter #gravy #dried #whitewine #thyme #gravybrowning #balsamicvinegar #bitter #boiledorsimmered \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This is a smashing accompaniment to good sausages and mashed potatoes\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 379\n|PortionCalories = 47\n|DatePublished=17th January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 8 - ''it will [[Freeze|freeze]]''\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 40 minutes\n |PrepTime = 5 minutes\n |CookTime = 35 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Onion gravy recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Nice made with leeks too</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I used one large leek, chopped finely in my Molineux</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Sue_spins|Susie]] </span></span>}}\nThis is a smashing [[Accompaniment|accompaniment]] to good [[Sausages|sausages]] and [[Mashed potatoes|mashed potatoes]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 2 large [[Onions|onions]], peeled and finely sliced ([[Red onions|red onions]] are nice in this)\n| 1 Clove of [[Garlic|garlic]], peeled and crushed\n| 1 tablespoon [[Butter|butter]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 250 ml [[Vegetable Stock|vegetable stock]] (Marigold is good here)\n| 1 tablespoon [[Plain flour|plain flour]]\n| A good splash or either: [[Red wine]], [[White wine|white wine]], [[Bitter|bitter]], [[Lager|lager]], [[Stout|stout]] or [[Guinness]]\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| [[Louisiana Hot Pepper Sauce|Louisiana hot pepper sauce]] (optional)\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Gently [[Fry|fry]] the [[Onions|onions]] in a mixture of [[Butter|butter]] and [[Olive oil|olive oil]], to which a good grind of [[Black pepper|black pepper]] has been added.\n| This should take about 20 minutes, cook over a very gentle heat and don't rush it. Slow [[Frying|frying]] caramelises the [[Onions|onions]] and gives a good colour.\n| Once the [[Onions|onions]] have taken lots of colour, sprinkle the [[Flour|flour]] over them and stir well to absorb the flavoured [[Fat|fat]].\n| Add a good splash of your chosen [[Wine|wine]] or [[Beer|beer]] and mix well.\n| Add the [[Stock|stock]], [[Pepper|pepper]] [[Sauce|sauce]] and any optional flavouring, mix in the stock and [[Simmer|simmer]] for 10 to 15 minutes.\n| Season to taste and serve.\n}}\n===Variations===\nExperiment with the following additions, though not in the same [[Gravy|gravy]]:\n*A tablespoon of  [[Brown sugar|brown sugar]]\n* [[Balsamic vinegar]]\n*[[Dried]] [[Chillies|chillies]]\n*[[Garlic olive oil]]\n*Fresh or [[Dried|dried]] [[Herbs|herbs]] ([[Thyme|thyme]] is good)\n*[[Soy sauce]]\n*[[Szechuan peppercorns]]\n*Wholegrain [[Mustard|mustard]]\n*[[Worcestershire sauce]]\nA tiny splash of [[Gravy browning|gravy browning]] can be added for a darker [[Gravy|gravy]]\n==See also==\n* Many other [[gravy recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Cooking with beer]]\n[[Category:Dips and sauces]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Cooking with wine]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#onions #oliveoil #butter #gravy #dried #whitewine #thyme #gravybrowning #balsamicvinegar #bitter #boiledorsimmered </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Onion Gravy (2)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Onion Gravy - an alternative recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#soysauce #onion #flour #bayleaf #boiledorsimmered #vegetablestock #herbs #boil #sage #sauce #dried \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A nice easy onion gravy recipe - great with a sunday roast\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n* see also: ''[[Onion gravy]]''\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 341\n|PortionCalories = 85\n|DatePublished=17th January 2013\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|ImageComment = Ready to serve\n |Servings = Serves 4 - Make half a pint of gravy\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 25 minutes\n |PrepTime = 5 minutes\n |CookTime = 20 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Onion Gravy (2) before soy recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Nice made with leeks too</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I used one large leek, chopped finely in my Molineux</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Sue_spins|Susie]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Onion Gravy (2) after soy recipe.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Before the [[soy sauce]] was added]]\nA nice easy onion gravy recipe - great with a sunday roast.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 285ml (&frac12; pint) [[Vegetable Stock]] or Water\n| 1 Large [[Onion]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Oil]]\n| 1 tablespoon Heaped [[Flour]]\n| 1 [[Bay leaf|bay leaf]]\n| Pinch [[Dried]] [[Sage]]\n| [[Soy sauce|Dark soy sauce]] or  [[Soy sauce|light soy sauce]], either is ok; light soy will be saltier, dark soy, richer\n| [[Salt]] and [[Pepper]], to taste\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Peel and chop the [[Onion|onion]].\n| Heat the [[Oil|oil]] in a heavy based saucepan and add the [[Onion|onion]], saut\u00e9 gently until golden [[Brown|brown]].\n| Add the [[Flour|flour]] and [[Herbs|herbs]], cook for 3-4 minutes, ensuring that the [[Flour|flour]] does not burn.\n| Gradually add the [[Stock|stock]] (or water), stirring constantly to prevent lumps.\n| Bring to the [[Boil|boil]] and [[Simmer|simmer]] for 10 minutes.\n| Add the [[Soy sauce|soy sauce]] and then season to taste, not the other way around.\n| Remove the [[Bay leaf|bay leaf]], serve as is or blend into a smooth [[Sauce|sauce]].\n}}\n==See also==\n* Many other [[gravy recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:British Onions recipes]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n[[Category:Dips and sauces]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n{{Template:British Onions attribution}}\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#soysauce #onion #flour #bayleaf #boiledorsimmered #vegetablestock #herbs #boil #sage #sauce #dried </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Onion powder",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Onion powder, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#onionpowder #onions #spice #fooddehydrators #onion #foodprocessor #thermomix #cookingsousvide #dehydrated #soups #stews \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=I have never been able to buy onion powder in the UK and have had to rely on a friend who regularly visits Barbados to bring me some American powder\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 801\n|PortionCalories = 28\n|DatePublished=13th November 2013\n|Author = JuliaBalbilla\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Servings: 28\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  7 hours, 10 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime =  7 hours\n|Image = [[Image:Onion powder recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Worth it!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">This alone was worth getting the dehydrator for!</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nI have never been able to buy [[Onion|onion]] powder in the UK and have had to rely on a friend who regularly visits Barbados to bring me some American powder that she can get there.  However you can easily make your own at home.  If you do not have a [[Food dehydrators|dehydrator]], you can dry them in the [[Oven|oven]] on its lowest setting in which case they will dry quicker (although their nutritional value will be reduced).\n[[Image:Dehydrated onion rings.jpg|300px|thumb|right|Dehydrated onion rings]]\n\nThe time given below for dehydrating is approximate as it does depend on the temperature and humidity of your kitchen.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 2 kg of  fresh [[Onions|onions]], cut into 4 mm slices.\n| Pinch of [[salt]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Add a pinch of salt to the onion slices\n| Dehydrate the [[Onions|onions]] for 7 hours at 60\u00b0C for 2 hours, then 50\u00b0C for the remaining 6 hours.\n| Grind the [[Onions|onions]] using a [[Food processor|food processor]] or [[Thermomix]], until you have a powder of the desired consistency.\n| Keep in jar or [[Lock & Lock box]].\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nUse in [[Soups|soups]] and [[Stews|stews]] or as part of a [[Spice|spice]] mix or rub.  Also use when [[Cooking sous vide|cooking sous vide]] as raw [[Onions|onions]] can take on a metallic taste.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Marinades dressings and butters]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Dehydrated]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#onionpowder #onions #spice #fooddehydrators #onion #foodprocessor #thermomix #cookingsousvide #dehydrated #soups #stews </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

teaspoon [[Salt]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Black peppercorns]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Put all the ingredients into a deep pan with 100ml/ 4 floz of water.\n| Bring to the [[Boil|boil]], and then reduce to [[Simmer|simmer]].\n| Cover & cook for 30 to 40 minutes until the [[Onions|onions]] are soft.\n| Remove the lid and bring to the [[Boil|boil]] stirring until it thickens.\n| Store in [[Sterilised jars|sterilised jars]].\n}}\n==See also==\n* Other [[Onion relish]] recipes\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Pickles and preserves]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:British Onions recipes]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n[[Category:Pickled]]\n{{Template:British Onions attribution}}\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#boil #onions #onionrelish #blackpeppercorns #redwinevinegar #sterilisedjars #brownsugar #simmer #pickled </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",

#unsaltedbutter #bakingtray #clingfilm #dough #citrusfruits #shortbread #rest #oranges \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A variation of the traditional shortbread\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=18th March 2017\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = 10\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime = 55 minutes, plus 1 hour resting and overnight \n|PrepTime = 15 minutes, plus 1 hour resting and overnight \n|CookTime = 40 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 5422\n|PortionCalories = 542\n|Image = [[Image:Orange fool.jpg|300px|Orange and almond tangerines.</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">They're smaller and a bit more [[Plain flour|plain flour]]\n| Finely [[Grated|grated]] rind of 3 [[Oranges|oranges]]\n| 115g [[Ground almonds|ground almonds]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Mix all of the ingredients until you have a [[Dough|dough]]\n| Wrap in [[Clingfilm|clingfilm]] and chill overnight\n| Roll out to 1cm thick and cut into shapes of your choice\n| Transfer to a [[Baking tray|baking tray]] and leave to [[Rest|rest]] in the [[Fridge|fridge]] for 1 hour\n| [[Bake]] in a preheated [[Oven|oven]] at 140\u00b0 C (275\u00b0 F - gas 1), [fan oven 120\u00b0 C] for 40 minutes until golden\n| Cool on a rack, then store in a [[Airtight container|airtight container]]\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nGoes nicely with [[Orange fool]] or can just be eaten with a cup of tea or coffee\n===Recipe Gastronomic Adventures (with Motorbike and Sidecar)]''' by Jennifer Paterson & Clarissa Dickson Wright\n===Variations===\nYou can use other [[Citrus fruits|citrus fruits]] if you like\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or title": "Orange curd (Mum's)",
                "revisions": [

                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Orange curd (Mum's), Egg recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#juice #zest #grated #unusualrecipes #brownsugar #lemon #butter #jam #simmering #eggs #freerangeeggs \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Another recipe from Mum's scribbled cookery notes, seeing the recipe now\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1079\n|PortionCalories = 53\n|DatePublished=29th July 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Servings: 20 - Makes 2 small pots\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  30 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  15 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Orange curd recipe Mum's recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Back to wartime recipes</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.7</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Can't beat the old recipes!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The&nbsp;Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nAnother recipe from Mum's scribbled [[Cookery|cookery]] notes, seeing the recipe now, I'm amazed to see how simple it was for her to make such a great staple.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 2 large [[Free range eggs|free range eggs]]\n| 100g (4 oz) [[Butter|butter]]\n| [[Grated]] [[Zest|zest]] and [[Juice|juice]] of 2 large [[Oranges|oranges]]\n| [[Grated]] [[Zest|zest]] and [[Juice|juice]] of half a [[lemon]]\n| 225 g (8 oz) [[Brown sugar|brown sugar]]\n\n}}\n\n\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Beat the [[Eggs|eggs]] and add to the top pan of a [[Bain-marie|bain-marie]] ([[Double-boiler|double-boiler]]), with the remaining ingredients.  A bowl over a pan of [[Simmering|simmering]] water will do if you don't have a [[Bain-marie|bain-marie]]\n| Stir until the [[Sugar|sugar]] has dissolved.\n| Continue gently heating and stirring as the [[Curd|curd]] thickens.  Its ready when it is thick enough to coat the back of a wooden spoon.\n| Pour into hot, [[Sterilised|sterilised]] [[Jam|jam]] jars and seal properly.\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Dips and sauces]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Egg recipes]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#juice #zest #grated #unusualrecipes #brownsugar #lemon #butter #jam #simmering #eggs #freerangeeggs </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

                ]
            }
        }

A bowl over a pan of [[Simmering|simmering]] water will do if you don't have a [[Bain-marie|bain-marie]]\n| Stir until the [[Sugar|sugar]] has dissolved.\n| Continue gently heating and stirring as the [[Curd|curd]] thickens. title": "Orange fool",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Orange fool recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#zest #orangefool #eggs #orangejuice #grated #orange #citrusfruit #doublecream #boiledorsimmered #cream #doubleboiler \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A recipe from The Cookery Book of Lady Clarke of Tillypronie. Lady Clarke collected recipes from her hostesses when visiting friends\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=17th March 2017\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 6\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  20 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime =  10 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 1699\n|PortionCalories = 283\n|Image = [[Image:Orange fool recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">No fool like an orange fool</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.8</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Lovely and sharp.  Thanks Julia.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nA recipe from ''The Cookery Book of Lady Clark of Tillypronie''.  Lady Clark (1851-1897) collected recipes from her hostesses when visiting friends, and then tested them in her own kitchen.  In 1909 her husband arranged for the recipes to be published in book form.  This is a [[custard]] based fool.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 570ml [[Double Cream|double cream]]\n| 3 [[Eggs|egg]] [[yolks]]\n| The [[Juice|juice]] of 6 [[Oranges|oranges]]\n| [[Caster Sugar|caster sugar]], to taste - I used 4 tbsps for a mixed [[citrus]] fool, but I would halve it if just using [[orange juice]]\n| The [[Grated|grated]] [[Zest|zest]] of 1 [[Orange|orange]] (use a [[Seville orange]] if in season)\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Beat the [[Eggs|eggs]] into the [[Cream|cream]]\n| Add the [[Orange juice|orange juice]] and the [[Zest|zest]]\n| Add the [[Sugar|sugar]] and gently cook in a [[Double boiler|double boiler]], or a bowl over a [[Saucepan|saucepan]] of water\n| Once the mixture has thickened, remove from the heat and pour into dishes or [[Glasses|glasses]]\n| Leave to cool before serving\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Orange and almond shortbread]]\n===Variations===\nUse other [[Citrus fruit|citrus fruit]] if you like, or a mixture\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Egg recipes]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#zest #orangefool #eggs #orangejuice #grated #orange #citrusfruit #doublecream #boiledorsimmered #cream #doubleboiler </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Orange jelly",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Vegan orange jelly agar-agar recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#agar #orangejuice #boil #orangejelly #orange #bakingtray #boiledorsimmered #vegan #fridge #juice \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This is a simple recipe for homemade vegan jelly produced from orange (or any other) juice and agar-agar\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 162\n|PortionCalories = 27\n|DatePublished=10th August 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 6 - Makes about 350ml\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  25 minutes\n|PrepTime =  20 minutes\n|CookTime =  5 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Orange jolly.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Worked with lemon</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">As suggested, I tried with 300 ml of lemon juice from Morrisons and it worked perfectly.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n{{Template:WorkInProgress}}\nThis is a simple recipe for home made [[Vegan|vegan]] jelly produced from [[Orange|orange]] (or any other) [[Juice|juice]] and [[Agar|agar]]-[[Agar|agar]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 360ml [[orange juice]]\n| 4g [[Agar|agar]]-[[Agar|agar]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Mix the [[Orange juice|orange juice]] and [[Agar|agar]]-[[Agar|agar]] in a small saucepan and bring to the [[Boil|boil]].\n| [[Boil]] for 2 minutes, stirring from time to time to dissolve the [[Agar|agar]]-[[Agar|agar]].\n| Remove from the heat and leave for 5 minutes.\n| Pour into a lined rectangular [[Baking tray|baking tray]] and leave to set in the [[Fridge|fridge]] for 10 minutes.\n| Using a palette knife, remove the jelly from the tray and cut into rectangles.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nUse the rectangles as a base for sweet and savoury canap\u00e9s.\n===Chef's notes===\nIf you want to make a deeper jelly, it will need longer than 10 minutes to set.\n===Variations===\nTry this recipe with a variety of different fruit juices.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#agar #orangejuice #boil #orangejelly #orange #bakingtray #boiledorsimmered #vegan #fridge #juice </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Orange Milk Ice Cream",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Orange Milk Ice Cream recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#freezer #orange #freeze #icecreammaker #icecream #glucose #litres #orangemilkicecream #fat #grated #frozen \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=As the name suggests, this ice cream is made using milk - full fat and condensed, rather than cream and eggs\n|og:image=--og_image--\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1651\n|PortionCalories = 91\n|DatePublished=31st May 2016\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Servings: 18 - Makes about 1.5 litres\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime = 5 hours \n|PrepTime = 4 hours 20 minutes \n|CookTime = 40 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Orange Milk Ice Cream recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Super creamy</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.7</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Rich and refreshing - great for a garden party</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nAs the name suggests, this [[Ice cream|ice cream]] is made using [[Milk|milk]] - full [[Fat|fat]] and condensed, rather than [[Cream|cream]] and [[Eggs|eggs]].  Remember that if your [[Ice cream maker|ice cream maker]] doesn't have a built in [[Freezer|freezer]], you will need to [[Freeze|freeze]] your bowl for at least 12 hours before use.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 3 [[Litres|litres]] full [[Fat|fat]] [[Milk|milk]]\n| 2 teaspoons finely [[Grated|grated]] [[Orange|orange]] rind\n| 180g condensed milk ([[Thermomix]] owners can [[Condensed milk 1 (TM)|make their own]])\n| 15g liquid [[Glucose|glucose]]\n| [[Orange]] extract, to taste (I use Sainsbury's Taste the Difference Valencian Orange Extract)\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Place a bowl of cold water into the [[Freezer|freezer]] for about an hour - the bowl should be large enough to hold the bowl in which you will be mixing the ingredients\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Bring the [[Milk|milk]] to the [[Boil|boil]] with the [[Orange|orange]] rind in a [[Saucepan|saucepan]] and keep on the heat until you are left with about 1.1 [[Litres|litres]].\n| Meanwhile, mix the [[Condensed milk|condensed milk]] and the [[Glucose|glucose]] in a bowl.\n| Once the [[Milk|milk]] has reduced, stir it into the bowl.\n| Cool the mixture as quickly as possible, by putting the bowl inside the one that you have placed in the [[Freezer|freezer]].\n| Mix in the [[Orange|orange]] extract, a little at a time until it is to your taste.  However, remember that once [[Frozen|frozen]], the orange taste will be less pronounced.\n| Once the mixture is cooled, put it in the [[Fridge|fridge]] to chill further.  This is optional, but preferable if your [[Ice cream maker|ice cream maker]] is one without a built [[Freezer|freezer]], ie where you need to [[Freeze|freeze]] the bowl before use.\n| Pour the mixture into your [[Ice cream maker|ice cream maker]] and churn according to the manufacturer's instructions - it should still be slightly soft.\n| Transfer to a container and [[Freeze|freeze]] until required.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nRemove from the [[Freezer|freezer]] a short while before serving, so that it is able to be scopped out.  Will go nicely with other [[Citrus|citrus]] [[Desserts|desserts]] or with [[Chocolate|chocolate]] and [[Strawberries|strawberries]]\n===Recipe source===\n\n* Adapted from a recipe for [[Milk]] [[Ice cream|ice cream]] in '''Gordon Ramsay *** Chef''' ISBN 1849491909\n===Variations===\nPlay about with different flavourings using various extracts and [[Fruits|fruits]]\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Ice-cream recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Frozen]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#freezer #orange #freeze #icecreammaker #icecream #glucose #litres #orangemilkicecream #fat #grated #frozen </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Organic Rooster and Leek Pie",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Organic Rooster and Leek Pie a British recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#organicroosterandleekpie #puffpastry #leeks #pastry #parsley #egg #potatoes #onion #potato #butter #brush \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Organic Rooster and Leek Pie British potato recipes\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 3258\n|PortionCalories = 543\n|DatePublished=20th January 2013\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = Serves 6\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 1 hour 25 minutes\n |PrepTime = 40 minutes\n |CookTime = 45 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Organic Rooster and Leek Pie recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Roosters are nice</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I think this is nicer with Cara potatoes</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry]] </span></span>\n}}\n\n{{FindAlbertBartlett}}\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 750g Organic Rooster [[Potatoes]]\n| 300g [[Leeks]], well washed\n| 1 [[Onion]]\n| 50g [[Butter]]\n| 300g [[Puff pastry|puff pastry]]\n| 4 tablespoons of Flat leaved [[Parsley]], chopped\n| 1 [[free range egg]]\n| 100ml [[Double cream|double cream]], [[Boiled|boiled]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Peel then slice [[Potatoes|potatoes]] on a [[Mandolin|mandolin]].  \n| Finely slice the [[Onions|onions]] and [[Leeks|leeks]].\n| Melt the [[Butter|butter]] in a pan, add the [[Onion|onion]] and [[Sweat|sweat]] these for 2-3 minutes without [[Browning|browning]].  \n| Add the [[Leeks|leeks]] and cook together until softened.  \n| Add the sliced [[Potato|potato]] and cook for 5-6 minutes.  \n| Season and leave to cool.\n| Roll out two thirds of the [[Puff pastry|puff pastry]] and line a 20cm dish.  \n| Roll out the remaining [[Pastry|pastry]] to make a lid and rest in the [[Fridge|fridge]] for 30 minutes. \n| Mix the [[Parsley|parsley]] with the cooled [[Potato|potato]] and [[Leek|leek]] mixture, spoon into the [[Pastry|pastry]] case, [[Brush|brush]] the edges with beaten [[Egg|egg]] and cover with [[Puff pastry|puff pastry]].\n| Press the edges together, make a small hole in the centre and [[Brush|brush]] the top with the rest of the beaten [[Egg|egg]].\n| [[Bake]] for 45 minutes - 1 hour at 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4), covering if it browns too much.  \n| Once cooked, leave to rest for &frac12; hour before pouring the [[Boiled|boiled]] [[Cream|cream]] into the pie through the hole in the centre.  \n| Leave to cool and serve at room temperature.\n}}\n\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Albert Bartlett recipes]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Pies tarts and flans]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n{{Template:Albert Bartlett attribution}}\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#organicroosterandleekpie #puffpastry #leeks #pastry #parsley #egg #potatoes #onion #potato #butter #brush </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }

            }

title": "Our best breadmaker bread recipe",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Our best breadmaker bread recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#breadmaker #howtoactivateallinsonsdriedactiveyeast #yeast #vegetableoil #bake #bread #breadmaking #ascorbicacid #easybakeyeast #strongwhiteflour #grainandbeanrecipes\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=This is a breadmaker recipe I have developed over 10 years of using breadmakers - it's light and airy and tastes fantastic.\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=20th March 2020\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 10\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  6 hours, 8 minutes\n|PrepTime =  4 hours, 38 minutes\n|CookTime =  1 hour, 30 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 1638\n|PortionCalories = 163 \n|Image = [[Image:Filmed on Mill Rigg.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Make This!!!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">The best breadmaker recipe we've found.  You bread maker must have a 'French bake' setting for this to work.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nWe have been using [[Breadmakers|breadmakers]] for about ten years now, I think we're on our third now.  We now [[Bake|bake]] [[Bread|bread]] every two days and we have come up with a recipe that never fails to make a light airy loaf.\n\nWe add a little bit of [[Wholemeal flour|wholemeal flour]], just for a little interest, but not enough to make a heavy loaf.\n\nWe've made this in a variety of [[Panasonic Breadmakers]] which all have a 'French bake' setting.  This is an extended rise and gives a very light airy loaf.  You cannot make an extra large loaf with this setting as it rises too much.  it would probably work on a normal setting if your breadmaker does not have 'French bake'.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 teaspoon Allinson's Easy [[Bake]] [[Yeast]] - See [[Chef's notes|chef's notes]] below for other types of yeast.\n| 200g [[Strong white flour|strong white flour]]\n| 200g [[Strong brown flour|strong brown flour]]\n| 2 pinches of [[Ascorbic acid|ascorbic acid]]\n| 1 teaspoon of [[Sugar|sugar]]\n| 1 teaspoon of [[Salt|salt]]\n| 20g [[Vegetable oil|vegetable oil]]\n| 280g water\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Although the instructions say to put the [[Yeast|yeast]] in the separate compartment, we always tip everything together in the [[Breadmaker|breadmaker]] bin.  It's up to you.\n| If you are not using a fast [[Easy Bake Yeast]] , then '''activate it first''' - [[How to activate Allinsons Dried Active Yeast|'''instructions are here''']].\n| Set the breadmaker to 'French Bake'  setting (#8 on the [[Panasonic SD-ZB2502]])\n| Your loaf should be ready after 6 hours.  Put a timer on so you don;t forget it as it will collapse if you leave it in the [[Breadmaker|breadmaker]] for an extended period after if has completed the [[Baking|baking]] cycle.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nCategory:Favourite recipes\n===Chef's notes===\nIf you do buy [[Allinsons Dried Active Yeast]] and want to use it in a [[breadmaker]] you need to '''activate it first''' - [[How to activate Allinsons Dried Active Yeast|'''instructions are here''']].\n\nWe ''always'' use [[olive oil]] in our [[breadmaking]] as we don't keep standard [[vegetable oil]] anymore.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:French recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Grain and bean recipes]]\n[[Category:Breadmaker recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#breadmaker #howtoactivateallinsonsdriedactiveyeast #yeast #vegetableoil #bake #bread #breadmaking #ascorbicacid #easybakeyeast #strongwhiteflour #grainandbeanrecipes</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]

title": "Oven-dried tomatoes",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Oven-dried tomatoes, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#tomatoes #ovendriedtomatoes #oliveoil #garlic #pestleandmortar #sweets #salad #oils #spices #fennelseeds #sweetpeppers \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=If you don't have hot Mediterranean sun to dry your tomatoes, try this method instead:It's really tasty way to use up a glut of tomatoes, especially\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 588\n|PortionCalories = 58\n|DatePublished=28th February 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Oven-dried tomatoes - done\n |Servings = Servings: 10 - Makes 1 small jar\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 6 hours, 15 minutes\n |PrepTime = 15 minutes\n |CookTime = 6 hours\n |Image = [[Image:Sun-dried tomatoes at home 1.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">I did this with our tomato glut</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">What a great idea for using up the masses of tomatoes that get left over at the end of the season</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nIf you don't have hot Mediterranean sun to dry your tomatoes, try this method instead:\n\nIt's really tasty way to use up a glut of [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]], especially the split and 'spoilt' ones.  This year, our Sungold tomatoes were not the same as they usually are, they had tough, flavourless skins and were pretty nasty, truth be told.  I tried this experiment on the remaining harvest and from a preliminary taste while they are still cooking, I wish I had more of them!\n\nThis makes a brilliant [[pizza]] topping.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 30 [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]], washed and halved (top to bottom). Cut larger ones into smaller pieces so they are all a similar size.\n| 5 [[Cloves|cloves]] of [[Garlic]], peeled and crushed\n| 2 teaspoons [[Fennel seeds|fennel seeds]], crushed in a [[Pestle and mortar|pestle and mortar]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Demerara sugar|demerara sugar]]\n| 2 teaspoons [[Sea Salt|sea salt]]\n| [[Freshly ground black pepper]]\n| Plenty of [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 100\u00b0 C (225\u00b0 F - gas &frac14;)\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Sun-dried tomatoes at home 2.jpg|Oven-dried tomatoes -  ready for the oven\nImage:Sun-dried tomatoes at home 3.jpg|Sungold tomatoes - the colourful ingredients\nImage:Sun-dried peppers and tomatoes.jpg|A version with hot and sweet peppers and tomatoes\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Lightly [[Oil|oil]] an [[Oven|oven]] tray\n| Distribute the halved [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]], skin-side down\n| Put the [[Garlic|garlic]], 3 tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]], [[Sugar|sugar]], [[Fennel|fennel]] and half of the [[Salt|salt]] in a bowl and ensure that is well mixed.\n| Spoon the mixture over the [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]]\n| Season with [[Pepper|pepper]] and the remaining [[Salt|salt]] and drizzle well with [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| [[Roast]] for 6 hours or until there is just a tiny amount of liquid left. Keep your eye on them because once all of the liquid evaporates,, they burn really quickly. Once properly roasted they will be like little [[Toffee|toffee]] taste bombs.  If you don't eat them all immediately, store them in a [[Lock and lock|lock and lock]] box in the [[Fridge|fridge]]\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nEat like [[Sweets|sweets]] or scatter over a [[Salad|salad]]\n===Chef's notes===\nI used [[Basil|basil]] flavoured [[Olive oil]], just because I had some spare, use any flavoured [[Oils|oils]] and experiment with different [[Herbs|herbs]] and [[Spices|spices]].\n===Variations===\nI recently tried a variation using home grown [[sweet peppers]], home grown [[chili peppers]] and [[tomatoes]].  I roasted them and left them a little wetter than I normally would then blitzed them in a [[food processor]] with a metal blade.  The resulting [[pur\u00e9e]] is now in the fridge, ready for the next batch of [[pizza making]]!\n\n==See also==\n* [[Sun-dried tomato recipe]]\n* [http://yardday.com/gardening/eating-growing-tomatoes-benefits The benefits of growing and eating tomatoes - ''Yardday.com'']\n\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Pickles and preserves]]\n[[Category:Salad recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#tomatoes #ovendriedtomatoes #oliveoil #garlic #pestleandmortar #sweets #salad #oils #spices #fennelseeds #sweetpeppers </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Oven roasted rooster potatoes with garlic and rosemary",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Oven roasted rooster potatoes with garlic and rosemary recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#potatoes #ovenroastedroosterpotatoeswithgarlicandrosemary #butter #oliveoil #lemonjuice #garlic #rosemary #roasting #fry #boil #salted \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Oven roasted rooster potatoes with garlic and rosemary British potato recipes\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 870\n|PortionCalories = 217\n|DatePublished=31st October 2012\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 1 hour 5 minutes\n |PrepTime = 5 minutes\n |CookTime = 1 hour\n |Image = [[Image:Oven roasted rooster potatoes with garlic and rosemary recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Air fry this!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">This is better when cooked in an air fryer as the rotation fluffs up the potatoes.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n{{FindAlbertBartlett}}\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 450g Rooster potatoes peeled and cut into quarters \n| 8 tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]] \n| 50g Soft [[Butter]] \n| 2 [[Clove buds]] \n| 5 [[cloves of garlic]]. peeled and crushed \n| 2 [[Rosemary#Sprigs_of_rosemary|Sprigs of rosemary leaves]] Chopped \n| [[Plain flour|plain flour]] for dusting \n| [[Salt]] & [[Pepper]] \n| [[lemon juice]]\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Pre Heat [[Oven]] To 200\u00b0C/400\u00b0F or Gas mark 6.\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Combine the Crushed [[Garlic|garlic]], chopped [[Rosemary|rosemary]], [[Butter|butter]] & [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]].\n| Part [[Boil|boil]] the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] in [[Salted|salted]] water till two thirds cooked. \n| Drain & leave to cool.\n| Lightly dust the cooked [[Potatoes|potatoes]] with the [[Flour|flour]] so they are evenly coated.\n| Heat a [[Roasting|roasting]] tin with the [[Olive oil|olive oil]], add the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] then place in the [[Oven|oven]] for approx. 45 minutes until tender.\n| Remove the tin, then add the [[Garlic|garlic]], [[Rosemary|rosemary]] and [[Butter|butter]], and gently [[Fry|fry]] for 1 minute until [[Potatoes|potatoes]] are coated.\n}}\n\n==See also==\n* '''[[Meat cooking time calculator Metric|A comprehensive guide to roast meat cooking times]]''' - give the time you want to carve your roast and we'll give you a timed step by step roasting guide\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Albert Bartlett recipes]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n{{Template:Albert Bartlett attribution}}\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#potatoes #ovenroastedroosterpotatoeswithgarlicandrosemary #butter #oliveoil #lemonjuice #garlic #rosemary #roasting #fry #boil #salted </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }

title": "Overnight Slow Roast Pork Joint",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Overnight Slow Roast Pork Joint\n|titlemode=replace\n|description=The idea for this recipe came from Jamie Olivers Cook With Jamie - My Guide to Making You a Better Cook.\n|keywords=#oliveoil #gravy #onions #pork #chickenstock #vegetables #fennelseeds #overnightslowroastporkjoint #garlic #hob #mash\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n<div class=\"right_imgs\" style=\"float: right;\">\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=10th December 2021\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = 8\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  9 hours, 25 minutes\n|PrepTime =  25 minutes\n|CookTime =  9 hours\n|TotalCalories = 6394\n|PortionCalories = 799 \n|Image = [[Image:Overnight Slow Roast Pork Joint recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Gorgeous</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I thought the best version was in the enchiladas</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:NonLoggedInUser|NonLoggedInUser]] </span></span>\n}}\n</div>\n\nThe idea for this recipe came from Jamie Oliver's \"Cook With Jamie - ''My Guide to Making You a Better Cook''\" [https://www.amazon.co.uk/Cook-Jamie-Guide-Making-Better/dp/0141019700 ISBN 0-718-14771-5 Amazon].  His recipe is fine but the quantities are far too large as that would serve 12 people!  I've reduced the quantities so the recipe should serve about 6 people and the ingredients are more easily available and affordable.\n\nThe original recipe used a bulb of fennel which was not available from any of our local suppliers, so as we try to only source local products, I picked some apples from our neighbour's tree and used those instead \ud83d\ude09. \n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 tablespoon whole [[Fennel seeds|fennel seeds]]\n| &#189; teaspoon [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 2 teaspoons of pink [[Sea Salt|sea salt]]\n| 3 [[apples]], cored and roughly cut up, no need to peel\n| 2 large [[Carrots|carrots]], peeled and sliced\n| 2 large [[Onions|onions]], peeled and sliced\n| 1 whole bulb of [[Garlic|garlic]], separated into [[Cloves|cloves]] which are then peeled and  crushed under a [[Knife|knife]]\n| Bunch of fresh [[Thyme leaves|thyme leaves]]\n| 10 fresh [[Sage leaves|sage leaves]]\n| 2.2 kg boneless [[Pork shoulder|pork shoulder]], rolled and tied\n| 4 tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| half a bottle of [[White wine|white wine]]\n| &#189; pint of [[Chicken stock|chicken stock]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Pre heat your [[Oven|oven]] to the highest setting - remember this is only for the first 15 minutes roasting.\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Grind the [[Fennel seeds|fennel seeds]] and [[Salt|salt]] together in a [[Spice|spice]] mill or [[Coffee grinder|coffee grinder]] and set to one side.\n| Add a good glug of [[Olive oil|olive oil]] to the base of a large [[Roasting tray|roasting tray]] and layer all of the [[Onions|onions]], [[Garlic|garlic]], [[Herbs|herbs]], [[Spices|spices]] and sliced [[Vegetables|vegetables]] in the tray.\n| Carefully cut slashes in the [[Pork|pork]] skin using a [[Stanley knife]].  Massage the skin with a tablespoon or so of [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and then rub the [[Fennel|fennel]]-[[Salt|salt]] into the cuts.\n| Sit the [[Pork|pork]] on top of the [[Vegetables|vegetables]] and pop into your [[Oven|oven]] set to its highest setting for just 15 minutes.  Don't forget to time this, you'll destroy a great pork joint if you don't turn it down in time!\n| After 15 minutes, cover the joint with [[Tin-foil|tin-foil]], pour the half of the bottle of wine over the vegetables, reduce the heat to 120\u00b0 C (250\u00b0 F - gas \u00bd) and cook for 4 hours\n| After 4 hours, slice the skin and most of the fat from the joint and discard\n| Cut the pork joint in half, lengthwise, turn over and cover with the vegetables to keep the meat moist, re-cover with tin-foil and slow-cook for a futher 4 hours at 120\u00b0 C\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:UPLOAD Overnight roast pork shoulder7.JPG|Cut in half and covered with the vegetables to keep moist\nImage:Overnight roast pork shoulder vegetables.JPG|Vegetables prepared with lots of garlic!\nImage:UPLOAD Overnight roast pork shoulder garlic added.JPG|Vegetables seasoned, ready for the pork shoulder\nImage:Overnight roast pork shoulder oven ready.JPG|Pork shoulder added, ready for the oven\nImage:Cook_with_Jamie-My_Guide_to_Making_you_a_better_cook.jpg|The book that inspired this cut-down version of Jamie's fabulous slow-roast pork recipe\nImage:UPLOAD_2021_12_14_0053.JPG|[[Pulled pork enchiladas]] ready to bake for 30 minutes\nImage:UPLOAD_2021_12_14_0067.JPG|[[Pulled pork enchiladas]] after baking\nImage:UPLOAD_2021_12_14_0082.JPG|[[Pulled pork enchiladas]], served with [[Garlic chilli courgettes]]\n</gallery>\n\n===Serving suggestions===\nWe served this in multiple ways; first portions with roast potatoes, vegetables and gravy, second portion, after a little spicing up, as [[pulled pork]] in taco shells with sour cream and salad, and the final portions as [[Pulled Pork Enchiladas]].\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#oliveoil #gravy #onions #pork #chickenstock #vegetables #fennelseeds #overnightslowroastporkjoint #garlic #hob #mash</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Ox-brain fritters",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Ox-brain fritters a beef recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#oxbrainfritters #flour #egg #fat #breadcrumbs #dip #stew #frying #unusualrecipes #fry #brush \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This recipe is from an undated book, 'Modern practical cookery'. It looks to be circa 1900 and is very similar in content to Mrs Beeton's Cookbook\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1075\n|PortionCalories = 179\n|DatePublished=21st January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Modern practical cookery, circa 1900\n |Servings = Serves 6\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 1 hour 20 minutes\n |PrepTime = 1 hour\n |CookTime = 20 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Modern practical cookery.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"><span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">No, no, no!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">3</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Not for me I'm afraid.</span> \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\">[[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis recipe is from an undated book, 'Modern practical cookery'.  It looks to be circa 1900 and is very similar in content to Mrs Beeton's Cookbook.  I just had to add this recipe, though I don't think I'll be trying it out.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1 Ox brain\n| 1 [[Egg|egg]]\n| [[Breadcrumbs]]\n| A little [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]\n| Deep [[Fat|fat]] for [[Frying|frying]]\n| 1 oz of [[Flour|flour]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Soak the brain, in cold water for an hour and remove the membrane\n| [[Stew]] the brain, in enough water to cover it, for 10 minutes, then strain it\n| When cold, slice it thinly and [[Dip|dip]] into [[Flour|flour]] seasoned with [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]\n| [[Brush]] the slices with [[Egg|egg]] and coat with [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]]\n| [[Fry]] them for three minutes in smoking hot [[Fat|fat]] and drain on paper\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe fritters on lace papers.\n==See also==\n{{FritterRecipes}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Beef recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Offal recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#oxbrainfritters #flour #egg #fat #breadcrumbs #dip #stew #frying #unusualrecipes #fry #brush </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Ox-tail soup",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Ox-tail soup a beef recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#diced #stock #tomatoes #oxtailsoup #fat #turnips #carrots #fry #leek #guinness #soup \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A traditional British winter soup, sadly more commonly seen in tins nowadays than made in the home\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 5302\n|PortionCalories = 1325\n|DatePublished=17th January 2013\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = Serves 4-8\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 2 hours\n |PrepTime = 15 minutes\n |CookTime = 1 hour 45 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Ox-tail soup recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"><span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">The classic soup</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.8</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">The smell of this reminds me of winter afternoons for some reason.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\">[[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]] </span></span>\n}}\n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}}\n\nA traditional British winter [[Soup|soup]], sadly more commonly seen in tins nowadays than made in the home.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 600 g [[Ox-tail|ox-tail]], cut into 8 pieces (your butcher should do this for you)\n| 2 [[Red onions|red onions]], finely [[Diced|diced]]\n| 3 [[Carrots|carrots]], scraped and finely [[Diced|diced]]\n| 1 [[Leek|leek]], finely [[Diced|diced]]\n| 3 [[Celery|celery]] stick, finely [[Diced|diced]]\n| 1 medium, or 2 small [[Turnips|turnips]], finely [[Diced|diced]]\n| [[Garlic]], to taste, fined [[Diced|diced]] (I used 3 bulbs)\n| 4 [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Dried thyme|dried thyme]]\n| 2 large [[Bay leaf|bay leaves]]\n| 275ml [[Guinness]]\n| 1.75 [[Litres|litres]] [[Beef Stock|beef stock]]\n| Seasoning\n| [[Parsley]], chopped (to garnish)\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| In a deep [[Stock|stock]] pot, [[Fry|fry]] the [[Oxtail|oxtail]] pieces on all sides until [[Browned|browned]] and a lot of the [[Fat|fat]] has melted - do not add additional fat if possible. You may need to do this in 2 batches.\n| Remove from the pan and reserve, leaving 1 tablespoon [[Fat|fat]] in the pan.\n| Add the [[Onions|onions]], [[Carrots|carrots]], [[Leek|leek]], [[Celery|celery]], [[Turnips|turnips]] and [[Garlic|garlic]] and [[Fry|fry]] until the [[Onion|onion]] is soft.\n| Add the [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]] and [[Herbs|herbs]] cook for a further 5 minutes.\n| Return the [[Ox-tail|ox-tail]] to the pan with the [[Guinness]] and [[Stock|stock]].\n| Bring to the [[Boil|boil]], reduce the heat and [[Simmer|simmer]] (covered) for about 1&frac12; hours, stirring occasionally, until the [[Meat|meat]] is cooked.\n| Remove the [[Ox-tail|ox-tail]] from the pan and reserve.\n| Remove the bay leaves and pur\u00e9e the [[Soup|soup]] or rub through a [[Sieve|sieve]].\n| Pick what [[Meat|meat]] there is from the [[Ox-tail|ox-tail]] and add it to the pan.\n| Reheat and adjust seasoning.\n| Serve, sprinkled with the chopped [[Parsley|parsley]].\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Croutons|croutons]] or [[Country bread|country bread]].\n===Variations===\nIf good, ripe, fresh [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]] are availables, these can replace the tinned tomatoes, but peel them first.\n===Chef's notes===\nYou will need a large [[Stock|stock]] pot for this - about 6 or 7 litre capacity.  [[Ox-tail]] is quire fatty, so if you can, leave the soup overnight in the fridge and skim the [[fat]] off the next day.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Soup and stock recipes]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Beef recipes]]\n[[Category:Cooking with beer]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Offal recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n[[category:Pan fried]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#diced #stock #tomatoes #oxtailsoup #fat #turnips #carrots #fry #leek #guinness #soup </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Oxford sausages",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Oxford sausages\n|titlemode=replace\n|description=A nice traditional homemade sausage that is highly flavoured and is skinless\n|keywords=#sausages #veal #cornmeal #egg #pork #sausage #grated #burgers #oxfordsausages #mince #eggrecipes\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=29th October 2021\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = An Oxford sausage egg McMuffin\n|Servings = 6\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  40 minutes\n|PrepTime = 20 minutes\n|CookTime = 20 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 6215\n|PortionCalories = 1035\n|Image = [[Image:Oxford sausage egg McMuffin.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">What a great breakfast muffin!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Better than one you can buy, and no threat of McLitter!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:NonLoggedInUser|NonLoggedInUser]] </span></span>\n}}\nA nice traditional homemade [[Sausage|sausage]] that is quite highly flavoured and has the advantage for the home chef that it does not need a skin.  I've made mine from minced beef rather than veal.\n\nThis recipe makes 18 sausages which will easily serve six people.\n\nFrom Wikipedia: \"Oxford [[Sausages|sausages]] are a distinctive variety of [[Pork|pork]] and [[Veal|veal]] [[Sausage|sausage]] commonly associated with, and thought to have been developed in, the English city of Oxford. Traditionally, Oxford sausages are noted for the addition of veal, in contrast to many traditional British sausages which contain only pork, and their high level of [[Spice|spice]] seasoning. References to the \"Oxford\" style of sausage [[Date|date]] back to at least the early 18th century, but it was more widely popularised owing to inclusion in Mrs Beeton's Book of Household Management, first published in 1861\"\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 450g lean boneless [[Pork shoulder|pork shoulder]], [[Minced|minced]]\n| 450g [[Minced beef|minced beef]] (or [[Veal|veal]])\n| 350g [[Shredded suet|shredded suet]]\n| 225g [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]]\n| [[Grated]] rind of &#189; a [[Lemon|lemon]]\n| &#189; teaspoon [[Grated|grated]] [[Nutmeg|nutmeg]]\n| 1 tablespoon of chopped fresh [[Mixed herbs|mixed herbs]] or 1 teaspoon [[Dried mixed herbs|dried mixed herbs]]\n| 1 teaspoon freshly chopped [[Sage leaves|sage leaves]]\n| Pinch of [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]\n| 1 [[Egg|egg]], beaten\n| [[Cornmeal]] for coating\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| [[Mince]] the [[Pork|pork]] and [[Beef|beef]] (or [[Veal|veal]]) - a [[Food processor|food processor]] with a metal blade makes short work of this!\n| Add everything but the beaten [[Egg|egg]] and the [[Cornmeal|cornmeal]] to a large bowl and mix well with your hands\n| Add the beaten [[Egg|egg]] and mix everything together\n| Shape the mixture into [[Sausages|sausages]] or [[Burgers|burgers]]\n| Coat lightly with [[Cornmeal|cornmeal]]\n| [[Grill]] or [[Fry|fry]] until evenly [[Browned|browned]]\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Air fried Oxford sausages.jpg|Air fried Oxford sausages\nImage:Oxford sausages mixed and divided.jpg|About 1kg in total, mixed and divided into three good sized portions\nImage:Herbs and spices for Oxford sausages.jpg|Herbs and spices for [[Oxford sausages]]. [[Chives]], [[parsley]], [[sage]], [[thyme]], [[nutmeg]], [[salt]] and [[black pepper]]. As you can see, I like a herby sausage. I eventually halved the amount of [[salt]] pictured\nImage:BeetonsAd.jpg|thumb|250px|right|Mrs Beeton's other publications - circa 1945\n</gallery>\n\n===Serving suggestions===\nI'm going to use some of these in our lovely [[Curry sauce|curry sauce]] with [[Rice|rice]] and [[Broccoli|broccoli]]\n===Variations===\nBecause these are skinless [[Sausages|sausages]] they can easily be made into [[Burgers|burgers]].\n===Chef's notes===\nThese cook well in an [[Air Fryer|air fryer]] - 180\u00b0 C for anout 15 minutes, resting for 5 minutes after cooking\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Beef recipes]]\n[[Category:Egg recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Veal recipes]]\n[[Category:Air fried recipes]]\n[[Category:Grilled, griddled or barbecued]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#sausages #veal #cornmeal #egg #pork #sausage #grated #burgers #oxfordsausages #mince #eggrecipes</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
