title": "Oxtail stew in Guinness",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Oxtail stew in Guinness a beef recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#oxtailstewinguinness #oxtail #oliveoil #soffritto #tomato #bones #guinness #flour #garlic #oxtailstew #blender \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Although this slow-cooked oxtail stew takes 5 and a half hours to cook, it only takes 15 minutes to prepare, is economical and results in flavoursome\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 14538\n|PortionCalories = 2423\n|DatePublished=19th January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 6\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 5 hours 45 minutes\n |PrepTime = 15 minutes\n |CookTime = 5 hours 30 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Oxtail stew in Guinness recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Treacly and tasty</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.8</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I don't like Guinness, but it's great in this recipe - like adding molasses!</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nAlthough this slow-cooked [[Oxtail stew|oxtail stew]] takes 5 and a half hours to cook, it only takes 15 minutes to prepare, is economical and results in flavoursome [[Meat|meat]] that melts in your mouth.  This dish can be a little greasy, so be sure to trim off all of the excess fat.\n\nThis makes two different meals if you save the leftovers and make oxtail soup with them.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 3 tablespoons [[Plain flour|plain flour]]\n| 2 kg [[Oxtail|oxtail]], trimmed of any excess [[Fat|fat]]\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| [[Olive oil]]\n| 800g [[Soffritto|soffritto]]\n| 4 Cloves of [[Garlic|garlic]], peeled and crushed\n| 2 X 440 ml cans of [[Guinness]] original \n| 250 ml [[Beef Stock|beef stock]]\n| 4 tablespoons [[Tomato|tomato]] pur\u00e9e\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 150\u00b0 C (300\u00b0 F - gas 2)\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Oxtail stew in Guinness oven ready.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Ready for 5.5 hours stewing\nImage:Oxtails, browning.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Brown the oxtails\nImage:Coat with seasond flour (cheat).jpg|thumb|300px|right|Add seasoned flour & meat, close lid and shake\nImage:Oxtail stew in Guinness ingredients.jpg|thumb|300px|right|The ingredients (900g carrots & swedes)\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Season the [[Flour|flour]] well with [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]\n| In batches (by using a plastic bag or a [[Lock & Lock]]-type box) add the seasoned [[Flour|flour]] and the trimmed [[Oxtail|oxtail]] and shake well to coat\n| Heat a few tablespoons of [[Olive oil|olive oil]] in a flame-proof [[Casserole|casserole]] and [[Fry|fry]] the [[Oxtail|oxtail]] in batches for 2 minutes a side or until nicely [[Browned|browned]].  Set aside and repeat until all of the [[Meat|meat]] is done, using more [[Olive|olive]] [[Oil|oil]] if needed.\n| Add a little more [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and saut\u00e9 the [[Garlic|garlic]] and [[Soffritto|soffritto]] for 4 minutes, stirring regularly.\n| Add the [[Oxtail|oxtail]] back into the [[Casserole dish|casserole dish]] together with the [[Guinness]], [[Stock|stock]] and [[Tomato|tomato]] pur\u00e9e.\n| Stir well, bring to the [[Boil|boil]] and then carefully transfer to the [[Oven|oven]].\n| Cook for 5 &#189; hours, stirring occasionally.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nEither; [[Jacket potatoes]], [[spaghetti]] or [[pasta]], [[mashed potatoes]] or simply, nice crusty bread.\n===Chef's notes===\n''My'' soffritto: I used 2 x 450g packets of chopped [[carrots]] and [[swedes]], 4 sticks of [[celery]] plus finely chopped [[cutting celery]] leaves (I like celery) and 4 medium onions, all trimmed, peeled and chopped.  What, and which vegetables is not madly critical, use what you most prefer.  Use the leaves from the celery if they are available, if not, some parsley would be fine. I also stirred in the unused seasoned flour at the beginning.\n===Oxtail soup from the leftovers===\nEasy oxtail soup from the leftovers. Refrigerate the leftovers and the next day, skim the fat from the surface.  Remove the [[bones]] and add the leftovers to a [[food processor]]. With clean hands, pull all of the meat from the [[bones]] and add that the the [[blender]]. Pulse it a few times to blend the mixture and add extra water if needed to thin (I used 250 ml). Cook 100g of broken spaghetti, add that to the soup and reheat for perfect oxtail soup.  Serve with crusty bread.\n==See also==\n* [[Slow roast recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Beef recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Cooking with beer]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Offal recipes]]\n[[Category:Stews and casseroles]]\n[[Category:Stewed, braised or pot roasted]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#oxtailstewinguinness #oxtail #oliveoil #soffritto #tomato #bones #guinness #flour #garlic #oxtailstew #blender </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Ox head",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Ox head a beef recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#oxhead #bones #unusualrecipes \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This recipe for cooking an ox head comes from the marvelous book: :Cookbook: Food In England. I only add it for a bit of fun because I can't image that\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}}\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2192\n|PortionCalories = 274\n|DatePublished=21st January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Food in England - Dorothy Hartley\n |Servings = 8\n |Difficulty = 3\n |TotalTime = 28 hours\n |PrepTime = 24 hours\n |CookTime = 4 hours\n |Image = [[Image:Food In England.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"><span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Those were the days...</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">..my friend, we thought they'd never end.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n==Ox head==\n\nThis recipe for cooking an ox head comes from the marvelous book: [[:Cookbook: Food In England]]\n\nI only add it for a bit of fun because I can't image that you would be able to obtain a complete ox head very easily.\n\nOur local Sainsbury's doesn't stock them.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1 ox head\n| A few [[peppercorns]]\n| A bunch of fresh [[herbs]]\n}}\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n|Get this prepared by the butcher, who will send it to you split in two.\n| Lay it in strong salty water overnight and rinse under a briskly running tap til thoroughly clear. The tongue should be salted separately.\n|Put the head into a pan with water to cover, a few peppercorns, salt ,a bunch of herbs , and vegetable trimmings.\n| Simmer till the [[bones]] and meat all fall to pieces, then drain into a basin.\n| Take out every scrap of bone and gristle and chop the meat  finely, sprinkling with powdered herbs and pepper.\n| Press into a mould set with a weight on top, and turn out when cold.\n| Garnish with parsley and serve with pickles and roast potatoes.\n| The broth, strained and boiled with oatmeal, onions, or a strongly flavoured vegetable such as celery, makes a meaty soup.\n}}\n\n''Note'':  Be sure you put the  remnants, [[bones]], vegetables, etc., out for the fowls to pick clean.  There is enough miscellaneous picking on an ox-head to keep an industrious hen busy for hours\n\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Beef recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Offal recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#oxhead #bones #unusualrecipes </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Ozzy [dog]'s Cole-slaw dressing\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#cup #sultanas #recipes #carrots #onion #whisk #lemonjuice #blackpepper #fridge #starters #buttermilk\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=This recipe is not named after a famous chef, but after a very famous dog - the wonderful Ozzy, who owns our friends: Adrienne and Martin.\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=17th January 2021\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 10\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  20 minutes\n|PrepTime =  20 minutes\n|CookTime = None\n|TotalCalories = 1372\n|PortionCalories = 137\n|Image = [[Image:Ozzy's Coleslaw dressing recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Thanks Oz.</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">It was lovely jubbly!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis recipe is not named after a famous chef, but after a very famous dog - the wonderful Ozzy, who owns our friends: Adrienne and Martin. &#128521;\n\n''In all fairness, the real credit should go to Martin who sent me this family favourite in exchange for our [[Carrot and onion salad|carrot and onion salad]]''.\n\n'''Tip:''' A [[food processor]] is your friend here.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n}}\n====dressing====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 1/3 [[Cup|cup]] [[Sugar|sugar]]  [83 ml]\n| &#189; teaspoon [[Salt|salt]]\n| &#188; teaspoons [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n| &#188; [[Cup|cup]] [[Milk|milk]] [62 ml]\n| &#189; [[Cup|cup]] [[Mayonnaise|mayonnaise]] [125 ml]\n| &#188; [[Cup|cup]] [[Buttermilk|buttermilk]] [62 ml]\n| 1.5 tablespoons [[White wine vinegar|white wine vinegar]]\n| 2.5 tablespoons [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]]\n}}\n====slaw====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| Half a [[White cabbage|white cabbage]] - finely sliced\n| 2 medium [[Carrots|carrots]] - peeled and [[Grated|grated]]\n| 1 large white [[Onion|onion]], peeled and finely sliced\n}}\n====optional extras (''not authorised by Ozzy'')====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| A tablespoon or so of [[black mustard seeds]]\n| A tablespoon of toasted [[poppy seeds]] \n| 1 [[Apple|apple]] peeled and sliced\n| A handful of [[Sultanas|sultanas]], [[Raisins|raisins]] or [[Currants|currants]]\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nLovely Ozzy.jpg | The lovely Ozzy\nOzzy on the beach.jpg | Ozzy on the beach\nOzzys Slaw served with turkey and pitta-breads.jpg|Ozzy's slaw was delicious, served with [[Sous-vide chili cheese turkey crown]] and [[home-made pitta bread]]\nOzzy with Annie.jpg|Ozzy by Annies feet\nOzzy by the decking.jpg|Ozzy by the decking.jpg\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Add all of the dressing ingredients to a large bowl and [[Whisk|whisk]] together\n| Stir in the slaw ingredients mix well\n| Chill in the [[Fridge|fridge]] until ready to serve\n}}\n===Recipe source===\n\n* Ozzy!\n===Variations===\nUse [[Red cabbage|red cabbage]] for a lovely pink slaw.\n\n[[Red onions]] are milder\n\nA handful of [[Mustard seeds|mustard seeds]] adds a little bite\n==See also==\n\n* [[Coleslaw]] recipes\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Dips and sauces]]\n[[Category:Marinades dressings and butters]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Salad recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Uncooked]]\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#cup #sultanas #recipes #carrots #onion #whisk #lemonjuice #blackpepper #fridge #starters #buttermilk</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Paleo sausage muffin with smashed avocado",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Paleo friendly sausage muffin with smashed avocado recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#oliveoil #eggs #egg #sausagemeat #sausages #muffin #sausage #avocado #recipesfromothersites #cookipedia #lime \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Paleo Polly brings this Paleo friendly recipe to Cookipedia courtesy of Debbie and Andrews sausages\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 478\n|PortionCalories = 478\n|DatePublished=23rd October 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 1\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  20 minutes\n|PrepTime =  5 minutes\n|CookTime =  15 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Paleo Sausage Muffin Herbs.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Pollie's muffin stack!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.7</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Sounds like a joke, but tasted like a dream when I made it.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nPaleo Polly brings this Paleo friendly recipe to [[Cookipedia]] courtesy of Debbie and Andrew's [[Sausages|sausages]], you know, the sausages with the red and green Hunter wellies on the packet.\n[[Image:Harrogate-pork-sausages.png|300px|thumb|right|[[Debbie and Andrew's Harrogate 97% Gluten Free Pork Sausages]]]]\n\nOn a weekend, [http://paleopolly.com/about/ Paleo Polly] loves nothing more than indulging in a hearty [[Breakfast|breakfast]]. This recipe is a completely stripped down, wholesome paleo version of a [[Sausage|sausage]] [[Muffin|muffin]]! It has all the flavour, but without any processed nasties!\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| [[Olive oil]]\n| 2 [[Debbie and Andrew's Harrogate 97% Gluten Free Pork Sausages]], de-skinned\n| 2 large [[Eggs|eggs]]\n| [[Salt]]\n| [[Black pepper]]\n| 1 [[Avocado|avocado]], [[Mashed|mashed]] with the [[Juice|juice]] of 1 [[Lime|lime]]\n| 100ml of water\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Take two stainless steel 8cm cutters, and grease using [[Olive oil|olive oil]].\n| In a mixing bowl, de-skin the [[Sausages|sausages]], season and mix.\n| On a plate, take the cutter and fill with the [[Sausage meat|sausage meat]].\n| Take a [[Frying pan|frying pan]], add [[Olive oil|olive oil]], and cook the [[Sausage|sausage]] patty on a medium heat for around 4 minutes.\n| Flip over, cook on the other side for 4 mins - place the cutter around the [[Meat|meat]] again to retain the shape.\n| Wash and clean the cutter.\n| Take the [[Eggs|eggs]] and crack into a bowl. Pierce the [[Egg yolks|egg yolks]] with a fork.\n| In a non stick [[Frying pan|frying pan]], heat some [[Olive oil|olive oil]]. Add the cutter to the pan. Once the [[Olive|olive]] [[Oil|oil]] is hot, pour in the [[Egg|egg]].\n| Repeat this with the second [[Egg|egg]]. Season with [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]].\n| Once the [[Eggs|eggs]] are cooking add the water to the pan, reduce the heat and cover. Allow the eggs to [[Steam|steam]] for a couple of minutes.\n| Remove from the pan. Assemble the [[Muffin|muffin]] by layering the [[Sausage meat|sausage meat]] on top of the [[Egg|egg]]. Top with [[Avocado|avocado]], and add the eggy lid.\n| You can add [http://paleopolly.com/2014/12/15/paleo-bacon-sandwich-with-ketchup/ Paleo Polly\u0092s paleo ketchup] for tomato sauce fans!\n}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:North American recipes]]\n[[Category:Breakfast recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Egg recipes]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Gluten free recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Debbie&andrew's sausage recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n[[Category:Paleolithic diet recipes]]\n{{Template:DebbieAndAndrew attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#oliveoil #eggs #egg #sausagemeat #sausages #muffin #sausage #avocado #recipesfromothersites #cookipedia #lime </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]

title": "Pancakes",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Pancakes, Egg recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#pancakes #flour #butter #batter #frying #eggs #castersugar #freerangeeggs #dripping #fat #lemonjuice \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=The traditional English pancake recipe. As served on Shrove Tuesday or Pancake day in the UK and Australia\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1017\n|PortionCalories = 508\n|DatePublished=14th February 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 2\n|ImageComment = A stack of pancakes\n|TotalTime = 25 minutes\n|PrepTime = 10 minutes\n|CookTime = 15 minutes \n|Image = [[Image:Pancakes recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Nom, nom, nom!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">These are best with freshly squeezed lemon juice and the barest sprinkle of icing sugar.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nThe traditional English pancake recipe. As served on Shrove Tuesday or Pancake day in the UK and Australia.  Better known in the USA as Mardi Gras or Fat Tuesday. Historically, pancakes were made on Shrove Tuesday so that the last of the fatty and rich foods could be used up before Lent.  This recipe makes 8 pancakes.\n\n===Swedish pancakes===\n\nThe recipe for traditional Swedish pancakes is the same as below, except that they might be served with a local preserve such as [[lingonberry]] jam.  They are traditionally follow [[\u00c4rtsoppa (Swedish pea soup)]] on a Thursday if what I read is to be believed.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 200 ml (7fl oz) [[milk]] mixed with 75 ml (3fl oz) cold water\n| 2 [[free range eggs]]\n| 110 g (4 oz) [[plain flour]], sifted\n| 50 g (2 oz) [[butter]]\n| pinch of table [[salt]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Sift the [[salt]] and [[flour]] into a large mixing bowl. Hold the sieve high so the [[flour]] gets combined with lots of air\n| Make a well in the centre of the [[flour]] and break the [[eggs]] into it.\n| With a spatula mix the [[eggs]] and [[flour]] together\n| Ideally with an electric hand mixer, gradually add the milk and water mix whilst whisking. Your goal is a smooth [[batter]] with no lumps or stray bits of [[flour]]\n| There is no need to leave the mixture to stand, make the pancakes straight away\n| Heat the [[butter]] in a heavy [[frying]] pan, swill it around so the pan is well oiled but not [[dripping]] in [[fat]].  Pour the remaining [[butter]] into a plate to use for the remaining pancakes\n| Use 2 tablespoons of [[batter]] mixture per pancake, dolloped in the middle of the pan and instantly swirl the pan around to distribute the [[batter]] around the whole of the pan\n| Cook for about 30 seconds on the first side and about 15 seconds on the other side\n| Dab a little more [[butter]] on the [[frying]] pan before every fresh pancake\n| Stack them up on a plate, separated with sheets of grease proof paper and keep them warm in a very low oven\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\n* Serve with a squeeze of [[lemon juice]] and sprinkled with [[caster sugar]]\n* Try a little pineapple or strawberry jam or a little bit of [[honey]].\n\n==See also==\n* [[Breton buckwheat pancake recipe]]\n* [[Cr\u00eape recipe]]\n* [[Potato pancakes]]\n* [[Crispy duck pancake recipe]]\n* [[Crispy potato pancakes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Egg recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n[[Category:Swedish recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#pancakes #flour #butter #batter #frying #eggs #castersugar #freerangeeggs #dripping #fat #lemonjuice </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

= [[Image:Pan fried Capricorn goats' cheese with watercress pesto recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span thanks to those nice people at [[The Lubborn Creamery]] who gave us permission to reproduce this recipe\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 2 x100g [[Capricorn Somerset Goats' cheese]]\n| 25g [[Flour|flour]]\n| 50g [[Watercress|watercress]]\n| 25g ready-made [[Pesto|pesto]]\n| [[Rapeseed oil]]\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]]\n| [[Freshly ground black pepper]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Halve each of the [[Capricorn Somerset Goats' cheese]] by slicing lengthways.\n| Season the [[Flour|flour]] with [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]], and use to coat the [[Capricorn Somerset Goats' cheese]] slices.\n| [[Capricorn Somerset Goats' cheese]] and place on kitchen paper to soak up excess [[Oil|oil]].\n| Put the [[Watercress|watercress]] on two plates and place the [[Capricorn Somerset Goats' cheese]] on top, two slices on each plate.\n| Spoon the [[Pesto|pesto]] onto the [[Capricorn Somerset Goats' cheese]] and serve.\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British fried]]\n\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#panfriedcapricorngoatscheesewithwatercresspesto #flour #rapeseedoil #pesto #watercress #fry #snack #panfried #vegetarian #cheese title": "Paprika salmon - Air Fryer recipe",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Paprika salmon - Air Fryer recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#airfryer #lemon #salmon #smokedpaprika #lemonjuice #seafishrecipes #britishrecipes #paprika #spice #lemonzest #grater\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=This recipe is shamelessly purloined from my ProBreeze Air air fryer\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=11th January 2021\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Second attempt, server with [[special fried rice]] and oranges\n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  13 minutes\n|PrepTime =  7 minutes\n|CookTime =  8 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 507\n|PortionCalories = 253\n|Image = [[Image:Paprika salmon Air Fryer fried rice.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Salmon and oranges!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Visually these are a great match.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry, aka Chef]])</span></span>\n}}\nThis recipe is shamelessly purloined from my ProBreeze [[Air Fryer|air fryer]] and slightly modified to suit my taste.\n\nThe ProBreeze [[Air Fryer]] is a non-paddle air-frier - basically a hot basket, so this recipe would be fine in a fan [[Oven|oven]] too.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 2 x 120 g [[Salmon fillets|salmon fillets]]\n| 2 teaspoons of [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| &#189; [[Lemon|lemon]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Smoked paprika|smoked paprika]]\n| Pink [[Sea Salt|sea salt]]\n| [[Freshly ground black pepper]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat you [[Air Fryer|air fryer]] to 180\u00b0 C\n* If using a [[Conventional oven|conventional oven]], use the temperatures below and allow 15 minutes for a conventional [[Oven|oven]] to reach temperature\n* 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6), [fan [[Oven|oven]] 180\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Using a microplane [[Grater|grater]], remove and reserve the [[Zest|zest]] from half the [[Lemon|lemon]]\n| Cut the remaining half of the [[Lemon|lemon]] into very thin slices\n| Spray the salmon pieces with a little olive oil\n| Add the [[Smoked paprika|smoked paprika]], [[Lemon zest|lemon zest]], [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]] to another plate\n| Press the [[Salmon|salmon]] pieces into the [[Spice|spice]] mix to cover all sides\n| Add the [[Salmon|salmon]] pieces to the basket and cook for eight minutes\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Air fried salmon using frozen wild salmon.jpg|Using Tesco's frozen Wild Salmon and too much paprika\nImage:Paprika salmon Air Fryer recipe.jpg|The first attempt - too much paprika \ud83d\ude06!\n</gallery>\n\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with a [[Salad|salad]] or [[Vegetables|vegetables]] of your choosing.\n===Recipe source===\n'''Pro'''Breeze [[Air Fryer]] recipe booklet\n[https://probreeze.com/product-category/air-fryers/ www.probreeze.com/product-category/air-fryers/]\n===Variations===\nI've used [[Smoked paprika|smoked paprika]] instead of plain [[Paprika|paprika]] - use what you fancy.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Freshwater fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Sea fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Air fried recipes]]\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#airfryer #lemon #salmon #smokedpaprika #lemonjuice #seafishrecipes #britishrecipes #paprika #spice #lemonzest #grater</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

                "revisions": [

                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Parsley and thyme stuffing, British recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#breadcrumbs #parsleyandthymestuffing #onion #egg #poultry #oliveoil #roastingtray #thymeleaves #freshherbs #stuffing #parsley \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This stuffing recipe is good for meat or poultry and should be made with fresh herbs\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 232\n|PortionCalories = 58\n|DatePublished=21st January 2013\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = Serves 4 people\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 45 minutes\n |PrepTime = 15 minutes\n |CookTime = 30 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Parsley and thyme stuffing recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Reminds me of a song!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.7</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Nice, especially as balls.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis [[Stuffing|stuffing]] recipe is good for [[Meat|meat]] or [[Poultry|poultry]] and should be made with [[Fresh herbs|fresh herbs]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1 [[Onion|onion]], peeled and finely chopped \n| 1 tablespoon [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 2 teaspoons fresh [[Parsley|parsley]], chopped\n| 2 teaspoons of fresh [[Thyme leaves|thyme leaves]], pulled from the stem and chopped\n| 85g (3oz) fresh [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]]\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 1 [[Egg|egg]], beaten\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Heat the [[Oil|oil]] in a small [[Frying pan|frying pan]] and gently saut\u00e9 the [[Onion|onion]] until soft and translucent - don't [[Brown|brown]] the onion.\n| Add the [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]], [[Onions|onions]] and [[Herbs|herbs]] to a bowl, season well and mix well with your hands.\n| Fold in the beaten [[Egg|egg]] and combine with the [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]].\n| Either use to stuff your [[Meat|meat]] or [[Poultry|poultry]] or roll into balls and cook in the [[roasting tray]] with the [[Meat|meat]] for the last 30 minutes or spread into a lightly greased [[Oven|oven]]-proof dish and cook for about 30 minutes at 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6)\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Poultry recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#breadcrumbs #parsleyandthymestuffing #onion #egg #poultry #oliveoil #roastingtray #thymeleaves #freshherbs #stuffing #parsley </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Peanut butter cookies",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Peanut butter cookies\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#peanutbutter #peanutbuttercookies #cookies #egg #spices #coolingrack #recipes #sweets #tacoseasoning #unusualrecipes #bakingsheet\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=My version of a Saturday Times peanut cookie recipe\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=22nd April 2022\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = 16\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  25 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  10 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 1582\n|PortionCalories = 98\n|Image = [[Image:Peanut butter cookies recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Very pleased with these</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">\u2026 and the chili ones are the best!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry]] </span></span>\n}}\nI first saw this in a Saturday Times recipe section; I'm a lover of [[Peanut butter|peanut butter]], but not a fan of [[Sweets|sweets]] so I have modified this to match my personal taste.\n\n''The original recipe used 200g of [[Granulated sugar|granulated sugar]] and no [[Salt|salt]] or other [[Spices|spices]].''\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 250g [[Peanut butter|peanut butter]], depending if you want bit in the [[Cookies|cookies]], or not.\n| 75g [[Demerara sugar|demerara sugar]]\n| 1 large [[Egg|egg]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 180\u00b0 C\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Add the [[Peanut butter|peanut butter]], [[Sugar|sugar]] and the [[Egg|egg]] to your [[Mixer|mixer]], fitted with a metal blade\n| [[Blend]] until it's a smooth paste\n| [[Scoop]] up a large tablespoon of the mixture and roll in to a ball\n| Place on a non-stick [[Baking sheet|baking sheet]] and flatten with the back of a fork ensuring they are well spaced apart\n| These quantities make 16 cookies\n| [[Bake]] for 10 to 12 minutes until they look crispy\n| Leave on a [[Cooling rack|cooling rack]] until completely cooled\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Peanut butter cookie mixture.jpg|The cookie mixture after 20 seconds in the blender\nImage:Peanut butter cookie and crispy prawn chili mixture.jpg|A very good tablespoon of Tean's Crispy Prawn Chili added to the mixture\nImage:Peanut butter cookies just baked.jpg|Peanut butter cookies, just baked, fresh from the oven\n</gallery>\n\n===Recipe source===\n* Based on a recipe seen in the Saturday Times; 16th April 2022\n===Variations===\nI made half of the mixture as the recipe, the remaining half I mixed with a heaped tablespoon of [[Sambal Udang Bercili Ranggup - Crispy Prawn Chilli]]; the chilli version is superb and what I would make in future!\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Egg recipes]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#peanutbutter #peanutbuttercookies #cookies #egg #spices #coolingrack #recipes #sweets #tacoseasoning #unusualrecipes #bakingsheet</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Pease pudding",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Pease pudding; a  recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#peasepudding #splitpeas #onion #butter #bouquetgarni #whitewinevinegar #sieve #boiledorsimmered #bacon #egg #simmer \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Pease pudding nursery rhyme :Pease pudding hot, :Pease pudding cold, :Pease pudding in the pot, nine days old. :Some like it hot, :Some like it cold...\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}} \n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2096\n|PortionCalories = 262\n|DatePublished=17th January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Geordie hummus<br />''James Marwood; pic & humour''\n|Servings = Serves 8\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime = 1 day, 2 hours, 30 minutes\n|PrepTime = 1 day\n|CookTime = 2 hours 30 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Geordie hummus.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">A MUST with gammmon</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Counteracts the saltiness of cured pork - very moorish!</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n===Pease pudding nursery rhyme===\n\n:Pease pudding hot,\n:Pease pudding cold,\n:Pease pudding in the pot, nine days old.\n:Some like it hot,\n:Some like it cold,\n:Some like it in the pot,\n:Nine days old.\n\nThis historic recipe if great with [[gammon]], [[ham]] or [[boiled]] [[bacon]] - it's even good spread on bread.\n\nYou need to plan ahead for this recipe as the [[split peas]] need to soak for 24 hours\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 475 g (1 lb) [[split peas]]\n| 1 [[onion]], quartered\n| [[Bouquet garni]]\n| 50 g (2 oz) [[butter]]\n| 1 large [[egg]]\n| Salt and [[freshly ground black pepper]] to taste\n| [[White wine vinegar]] (unconventional and very optional)\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Soak the [[split peas]] in fresh water for 24 hours\n| Rinse and drain\n| Add the presoaked [[split peas]] to a large pan of [[boiling]] water containing the [[onion]], [[bouquet garni]], [[salt]] and [[pepper]] and return to the boil\n| [[Simmer]] for 2 &frac12; hours, checking and adding water if required. Take it from me, it's easy to boil this one dry - and it stinks when you do!\n| Drain the cooked [[split peas]]\n| Blend in a [[food processor]] or press through a [[sieve]] or a [[potato ricer]]\n| Beat in the egg and [[butter]] and season well\n| I use a glug of [[white wine vinegar]] to thin this down if needed, but I have strange tastes\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\n\nCut into sensibly proportioned cubes, wrap tightly in [[tin foil]] and [[freeze]]\n\nWhen required, [[defrost]] naturally and microwave for 3 minutes or so.\n===Variations===\nGeordie hummus joke aside, yesterday I turned our pease pudding into [[hummus]] - fantastic it was too.  I crushed  4 cloves of garlic and sauteed them in 4 tablespoons of olive oil until they just started to colour and then stirred the mixture into the pease pudding.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Dips and sauces]]\n[[Category:Grain and bean recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#peasepudding #splitpeas #onion #butter #bouquetgarni #whitewinevinegar #sieve #boiledorsimmered #bacon #egg #simmer </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }

title": "Pea and ham soup",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Pea and ham soup, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#soup #stock #boil #hamhock #peaandhamsoup #fat #shallots #peas #butter #blender #cheesecloth \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This recipe is based on one by Heston Blumenthal which was published in The Sunday Times in 2007\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2918\n|PortionCalories = 486\n|DatePublished=17th January 2013\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = Serves 6\n |Difficulty = 3\n |TotalTime = 14 hours 50 minutes\n |PrepTime = 12 hours 20 minutes\n |CookTime = 2 hours 30 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Pea and ham soup recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Winter Warmer</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.8</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Nice on a cold day!</span> \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\">[[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\n \n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}}\n\nThis recipe is based on one by Heston Blumenthal which was published in '''The Sunday Times''' in 2007.  I would never be able to improve upon any recipe created by the inimitable Heston, but my husband likes strong oniony and garlicky flavours and the smokiness of Spanish panceta, hence this adaptation.\n\n\n'''For the [[Stock|stock]] - note the [[Vegetable|vegetable]] weights are net, ie after they have been trimmed and peeled'''\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 200g medium [[Onions|onions]], cut in half\n| 200g [[Carrots|carrots]], cut into chunks\n| 150g [[Celery|celery]], cut into chunks\n| 250g [[Leeks|leeks]], cut into chunks\n| 2 bulbs [[Garlic, crushed|garlic, crushed]]\n| 1 large, or 2 small [[Bay leaves|bay leaves]]\n| 2 teaspoons of [[Dried thyme|dried thyme]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[White peppercorns|white peppercorns]]\n| 1 teaspoon whole [[Cloves|cloves]]\n| 1 [[Ham hock|ham hock]], weighing about 1.25kg\n| 2 [[Litres|litres]] water\n}}\n'''For the [[Soup|soup]]'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 50g [[Butter|butter]]\n| 200g [[Shallots|shallots]], sliced\n| 75g [[Pancetta#Panceta ib\u00e9rica de bellota|panceta ib\u00e9rica de bellota]], chopped\n| 1 bulb [[Garlic, crushed|garlic, crushed]]\n| 700g [[Frozen peas|frozen peas]], [[defrosted]]\n| [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n}}\n'''To garnish'''\n* 75g [[Pancetta#Panceta ib\u00e9rica de bellota|panceta ib\u00e9rica de bellota]], cut into 1cm [[Dice|dice]]\n\n===Method===\n\n\n'''To make the [[Stock|stock]]'''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Add all the ingredients for the [[Stock|stock]] in a large, heavy-based pan and bring to the [[Boil|boil]] over a medium heat. \n| Skim any scum from the surface, reduce the heat and [[Simmer|simmer]] gently, uncovered, for 2 hours until the [[Hock|hock]] is cooked. \n| Remove from the heat and leave to cool, then strain the [[Stock|stock]] through a fine [[Sieve|sieve]] or [[Cheesecloth|cheesecloth]], reserving the [[Ham hock|ham hock]].\n| It is advisable to store the [[stock]] in the fridge, and preferably overnight to allow any [[fat]] to harden.  It will then be easier to remove.\n}}\n'''To make the [[Soup|soup]]'''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Heat the [[Butter|butter]] in the same pan, add the [[Shallots|shallots]], [[Pancetta#Panceta ib\u00e9rica de bellota|panceta]] and [[Garlic|garlic]], then [[Sweat|sweat]] for 10-15 minutes until the shallots are tender. \n| Add the [[Stock|stock]], bring to the [[Boil|boil]] and skim.\n| Add 500g of the [[Peas|peas]] and return to the [[Boil|boil]], then pur\u00e9e with a stick [[Blender|blender]]. \n| Bring back to the [[Boil|boil]] and adjust seasoning. \n| If the [[Soup|soup]] is too thick, add a little water until the desired consistency is achieved.\n| When the [[Ham hock|ham hock]] has cooled, remove the [[Meat|meat]] in flakes and add to the [[Soup|soup]].\n| Shortly before serving, heat the [[Soup|soup]], with the remaining 200g [[peas]] and [[Fry|fry]] the [[Pancetta#Panceta ib\u00e9rico de bellota|panceta]] over a high heat until crisp. \n| Serve the [[Soup|soup]] in bowls, sprinkling the crisp [[Pancetta#Panceta ib\u00e9rica de bellota|panceta]] over the soup and drizzle with a little of the [[Pancetta#Panceta ib\u00e9rica de bellota|panceta]] [[Fat|fat]] from the pan.\n}}\n===Chef's notes===\n[[Pancetta#Panceta ib\u00e9rica de bellota|Panceta]] is salty so do not add any [[salt]] and warn your diners to taste before adding any.\n===Chef's notes===\n{{Template:ThinkPig}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Soup and stock recipes]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#soup #stock #boil #hamhock #peaandhamsoup #fat #shallots #peas #butter #blender #cheesecloth </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Pecorino cheese stuffed chorizo burgers | Cookipedia recipes\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#pecorinostuffedchorizoburgers #breadcrumbs #cheese #chorizosausage #foodprocessor #egg #bread #burgers #chorizo #beefmince #mince \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=The inspiration for this recipe came from Triple D (Diners, drive-ins and dives).  What a blinding idea!\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2987\n|PortionCalories = 746\n|DatePublished=21st January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Topped with [[yogurt]] mixed with [[horseradish cream]] \n|Servings = Serves 4 - Makes 4 1/2 pounder burgers\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  1 hour, 15 minutes\n|PrepTime =  1 hour\n|CookTime =  15 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Pecorino stuffed chorizo burgers recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Horseradish Cream</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Made with yogurt - wow!</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nThe inspiration for this recipe came from an episode of Triple D; [http://www.foodnetwork.com/diners-drive-ins-and-dives/index.html Diners, Drive-ins and Dives], my favourite cooking program.\n[[Image:Pecorino stuffed chorizo burgers_ingredients.jpg|thumb|300px|right|That's all she wrote...]]\n\nIts basically a [[Burger|burger]] made from a mix of [[Beef mince|beef mince]] and [[Minced|minced]] [[Chorizo sausage|chorizo sausage]] stuffed with nice [[Italian cheese]].\n\nThis was a fantastic and will be made again and again!\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 200g [[Chorizo sausage|chorizo sausage]]\n| 500 g [[Beef mince|beef mince]] ([[Ground beef|ground beef]])\n| 100 g [[Pecorino Romano|pecorino romano]], freshly [[Grated|grated]]\n| &#189; teaspoon [[Salt|salt]]\n| &#189; teaspoon [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| &#189; teaspoon [[Mexican oregano]]\n| [[Fresh herbs]]\n| 2 large slices of [[Bread|bread]] or a cup of [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]]\n| 4 tablespoons [[Milk|milk]]\n| 1 large [[Egg|egg]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Blitz the [[Bread|bread]] slices to crumbs in a [[Food processor|food processor]] with a metal blade.\n| Soak the [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]] in the [[Milk|milk]] for about 15 minutes and then squeeze out any excess [[Milk|milk]].\n| Skin the [[Chorizo|chorizo]] and blitz to a [[Mince|mince]] in a [[Food processor|food processor]] with a metal blade.\n| To the [[Chorizo|chorizo]] [[Mince|mince]] in the [[Mixer|mixer]], add the [[Herbs|herbs]] and [[Spices|spices]], [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]], the [[Egg|egg]] and the mince.\n| Blitz until combined but be careful not ro turn it into [[Pate|pate]]!\n| Divide the [[Burgers|burgers]] and the [[Cheese|cheese]] into four.\n| Using you hands, press out into large [[Burgers|burgers]] and fill with the [[Cheese|cheese]] and fold up to seal.  [[Mould]] into flat burgers.\n| Refrigerate for 30 minutes if you have the time, this seems to help firm them up and bind them together.\n| [[Grill]] for 15 minutes on a tray, not a rack, turning once. ''I think it's nice to let them cook in their own chorizo flavoured oil.''\n| [[Rest for]] a 5 minutes before serving to allow the [[Meat|meat]] to relax and the [[Cheese|cheese]] to melt properly.\n}}\n<gallery widths=270px heights=270px perrow=5>\nImage:Pecorino stuffed chorizo burgers ingredients.jpg|A few simple ingredients\nImage:Chorizo, herbs, beef mince.jpg.jpg|Minced chorizo and herbs with ground beef\nImage:Chorizo, herbs, beef mince, breadcrumbs, egg.jpg.jpg|Breadcrumbs and egg agged\nImage:Chorizo burger mince, pecorino cheese.jpg|Chorizo mince with 100g of [[pecorino cheese]]\nImage:Moulding the pattie,stage one.jpg|Filling the burger with cheese\nImage:Moulding the patttie, stage two.jpg|Folding\nImage:Mouilding the pattie, stage three.jpg|Closing the gaps\nImage:Four half-pound burgers.jpg|Four half-pounders\nImage:Pecorino stuffed chorizo burgers recipe.jpg|The best burger I've ever tasted!\n</gallery>\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Chips|chips]], in a bun with [[Salad|salad]] leaves and sliced [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]].\n===Variations===\nI've used [[Oregano|oregano]] as the base flavour but use a little of what you fancy; [[Garlic|garlic]], [[Horseradish|horseradish]], [[Chillies|chillies]], [[Sage|sage]], [[Thyme|thyme]] would all make good alternatives.\n===Chef's notes===\nFollow the [[RSPCA Think Pig Checklist]] to make sure that your [[Pork|pork]] has come from pigs that have been reared to higher welfare standards.\n\n* http://bit.ly/rspcathinkpig\n\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Italian recipes]]\n[[Category:North American recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Beef recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n[[Category:Grilled, griddled or barbecued]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#pecorinostuffedchorizoburgers #breadcrumbs #cheese #chorizosausage #foodprocessor #egg #bread #burgers #chorizo #beefmince #mince </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }

title": "Peppered mackerel and red pepper pizza",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Peppered mackerel and red pepper pizza recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#pizza #grill #mackerel #mozzarella #pizzas #passata #chilioil #pizzadough #pepperedmackerelandredpepperpizza #seafood #blackpepper \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Smoked peppered mackerel pizza is very different from normal pizza fare. Great if you love seafood.\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1226\n|PortionCalories = 613\n|DatePublished=5th March 2016\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  1 hour, 12 minutes\n|PrepTime =  1 hour\n|CookTime =  12 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Peppered mackerel and red pepper pizza recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Fishy pizza</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.7</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">A strange combination but it worked very well.  The kind of pizza you would probably find in Sicily.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nAbout time we had another seafood pizza.  This time I thought I would try [https://groceries.morrisons.com/webshop/product/Morrisons-Fishmonger-Peppered-Smoked-Scottish-Mackerel-Fillets/209931011?from=search&tags=%7C105651&param=mackerel&parentContainer=SEARCHmackerel_SHELFVIEW smoked peppered mackerel].  It's available from most supermarkets, a 250g pack usually contains 4 peppered mackerel fillets, plenty enough for 2 pizzas.  I used 2 jarred [[red peppers]] in oil to add a little colour and flavour.\n[[Image:Morrisons smoked peppered mackerel.jpg|thumb|300px|right|[https://groceries.morrisons.com/webshop/product/Morrisons-Fishmonger-Peppered-Smoked-Scottish-Mackerel-Fillets/209931011?from=search&tags=%7C105651&param=mackerel&parentContainer=SEARCHmackerel_SHELFVIEW Morrisons smoked peppered mackerel fillets]]]\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 portion of [[Pizza dough]] (makes 2 [[Pizzas|pizzas]])\n| About 6 tablespoon of [[Tomato sauce for pizza]] or [[Passata|passata]]\n| 1 260g pack of smoked peppered [[mackerel]]\n| 2 large red peppers in olive oil, sliced lengthwise\n| 2 balls [[Mozzarella cheese|mozzarella cheese]] torn into small pieces(about 250g in total)\n| [[Chili oil]] to taste\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat the [[Grill|grill]] to high - with a [[Pizza stone|pizza stone]] if you have one\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Divide the [[Pizza dough|pizza dough]] into two and roll out into two [[Pizzas|pizzas]]\n| Make each [[Pizza|pizza]] individually and place the first one in the [[Oven|oven]] to keep warm whilst the second pizza completes\n| [[Grill]] the [[Pizza|pizza]] for about 2 to 3 minutes per side with no toppings added\n| Removed the part-[[Baked|baked]] [[Pizza|pizza]] and spread with [[Tomato sauce for pizza]] or [[Passata|passata]]\n| Remove the skin from the [[mackerel]] fillets and tear into bite-sized pieces and distribute over the pizza\n| Do the same with the red pepper strips\n| Arrange the torn [[Mozzarella|mozzarella]] over the [[Seafood|seafood]]. Try to cover as much of the seafood as possible so it does not get too crisped\n| Season with [[Salt|salt]] and [[Black pepper|black pepper]] and drizzle with [[Chili oil|chili oil]] if liked\n| [[Bake]] for about 3 or 4 minutes under the hot [[Grill|grill]] until the [[Mozzarella|mozzarella]] just starts to [[Brown|brown]]\n| Serve immediately\n}}\n==See also==\n* [https://groceries.morrisons.com/webshop/product/Morrisons-Fishmonger-Peppered-Smoked-Scottish-Mackerel-Fillets/209931011?from=search&tags=%7C105651&param=mackerel&parentContainer=SEARCHmackerel_SHELFVIEW smoked peppered mackerel]\n\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Pizza recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#pizza #grill #mackerel #mozzarella #pizzas #passata #chilioil #pizzadough #pepperedmackerelandredpepperpizza #seafood #blackpepper </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Perfect Yorkshire puddings",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Perfect Yorkshire puddings, British recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#eggs #plainflour #wholemilk #perfectyorkshirepuddings #blacktreacle #jam #miseenplace #bakingtray #roastbeef #vegetableoil #lemonjuice \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=These are great with roast dinners, especially roast beef and can also be made as a puddings and served with golden syrup, black treacle, jam, lemon\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 618\n|PortionCalories = 103\n|DatePublished=22nd January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 6 - Using 1/2 a cup as a measure makes about 12 Yorkshire puddings\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime = 1 hour, 5 minutes\n|PrepTime = 45 minutes\n|CookTime = 20 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Perfect Yorkshire puddings.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Perfect Yorkies</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.8</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I love these so much that I even have them with honey and golden syrup!</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nThese are great with roast dinners, especially [[roast beef]] and can also be made as a puddings and served with [[golden syrup]],  [[black treacle]], [[jam]], [[lemon juice]] and [[sugar]], etc...\n\nThe original recipe on this page was a variation of [[Delia Smith's Yorkshire pudding recipe]] from her Illustrated Cookbook.  However, over the years we have had a few failures and I would heartily now recommend this recipe instead.  \n\nThis recipe is far simpler and has never failed for me.  I believe this recipe originates from Brian Turner, the famous Yorkshire chef.\n\n''Use the history button above if you wish to view the previous recipe.''\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| Vegetable oil\n| &frac12; cup of [[whole milk]] (125 ml or 125 g or 4.6 oz) - ''[[Milk|Skimmed]] or [[semi-skimmed milk]] does not work as well''.\n| 3 tablespoons of water\n| &frac12; cup of [[plain flour]] (75g or 2.6 oz)\n| &frac12; cup of [[eggs]] (2 large eggs or 3 small eggs)\n| A pinch of salt\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the oven to 220\u00b0 C (425\u00b0 F - Gas 7)\n\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Select your measure and use it to measure out equal quantities of [[whole milk]], [[plain flour]] and [[eggs]] - 1 cup takes about 5 medium eggs.\n| Tip the flour, eggs, milk and water into a bowl and add a generous pinch of salt.\n| Whisk by hand until all of the lumps are beaten out of the flour and no more.  Don't over-beat the batter - it is not necessary.\n| Leave the mixture to rest '''at room temperature'' for 30 minutes''' if you have the time.\n| Generously grease a metal [[baking tray]] (about 28 cm x 18 cm - 11\" x 7\") with the [[vegetable oil]] -  [[brushing]] works well here.\n| Place the tray in the middle of the oven until and leave until the oil is hot and almost smoking\n| Pour the batter mixture into the very hot tray\n| Bake for 20 minutes in the middle of the oven.\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Yorkshire pudding batter mixture.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Yorkshire pudding mixture ready for the oven\nImage:Yorkshire pudding batter measures.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Plain flour, whole milk & eggs in equal quantities. (''whole cup measures used here'')\n</gallery>\n===Chef's notes===\n\nThis recipe always rises well and creates perfectly formed puddings, but they do tend to be rather 'puddingy' (almost sponge-like), probably because of the amount of eggs in comparison with [[Delia Smith's Yorkshire pudding recipe]].\n==See also==\n* [[Popover]]\n* [[Toad in the hole]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#eggs #plainflour #wholemilk #perfectyorkshirepuddings #blacktreacle #jam #miseenplace #bakingtray #roastbeef #vegetableoil #lemonjuice </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Philadelphia extra light fruit scones",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Philadelphia extra light fruit scones; a  recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#scones #philadelphiaextralightfruitscones #brush #dough #jam #bakingsheet #flour #castersugar #spice #blackcurrant #grated \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=You can make these delicious fruity scones from scratch in 35 minutes. Just mind you don't eat them all at once\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1987\n|PortionCalories = 248\n|DatePublished=27th April 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Servings: 8 - Makes 8 scones\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  35 minutes\n|PrepTime =  20 minutes\n|CookTime =  15 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Philadelphia extra light fruit scones recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n======Best recipe review======\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Not bad</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Not a great fan of Philly cheese, but these are quite good.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> - [[User:Chef|Jerry]]</span></span>\n}}\nYou can make these delicious fruity [[Scones|scones]] from scratch in 35 minutes.  Just mind you don't eat them all at once!\n\n{{PhiladelphiaPermission}}\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 50g [[Butter|butter]] or [[Margarine|margarine]]\n| 250g [[Self raising flour|self raising flour]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Baking powder|baking powder]]\n| 1 medium [[Cooking apple|cooking apple]], peeled, cored & [[Grated|grated]]\n| 25g [[Caster Sugar|caster sugar]]\n| 50g [[Philadelphia Extra Light]]\n| 5 tablespoons skimmed [[Milk|milk]]\n| 100g Philadelphia Extra Light\n| 2.5 tablespoons [[Fruit|fruit]] [[Jam|jam]] (e.g. [[Blackcurrant|blackcurrant]])\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* 220\u00b0 C (425\u00b0 F - gas 7), [fan [[Oven|oven]] 200\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Rub the [[Fat|fat]] into the [[Flour|flour]] until it resembles [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]]. Add remaining dry ingredients and mix well.\n| Mix 1 tablespoon of the [[Milk|milk]] with the Philly to form a runny paste and stir into the mixture.\n| Add enough of the remaining [[Milk|milk]] to form a stiff [[Dough|dough]] (saving some to [[Brush|brush]] the top of the [[Scones|scones]]).\n| On a floured table and roll out the [[Dough|dough]] to 2cm thick.\n| Cut into [[Scones|scones]] with a round cutter and place on a greased [[Baking sheet|baking sheet]].\n| [[Brush]] the tops with a little [[Milk|milk]] and [[Bake|bake]] at 220\u00ba C, Gas Mark 7 for 10 - 15 minutes or until golden.\n| Cool on a wire rack and fill with the Philly and [[Jam|jam]].\n}}\n===Recipe source===\n\n* [http://www.philadelphia.co.uk/philadelphia3/page?siteid=philadelphia3-prd&locale=uken1&PagecRef=609&rid=1237 The Philadelphia recipe website]\n===Variations===\nFor a little winter [[Spice|spice]] add [[Ground cinnamon|ground cinnamon]] into the scone mixture.\n\n==See also==\n{{OtherRecipes Philadelphia Extra Light}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Philadelphia recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n[[Category:Cookery cheats]]\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#scones #philadelphiaextralightfruitscones #brush #dough #jam #bakingsheet #flour #castersugar #spice #blackcurrant #grated </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Pickled beetroot recipe",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Pickled beetroot, a British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#beetroot #vinegar #pickledbeetrootrecipe #kilner #boil #miseenplace #blackpeppercorns #cookipedia #sterilised #pickled #driedchillies \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This recipe is the original Mrs Beeton's recipe that has been adapted to use specific quantities and to suit Cookipedia's standard layout\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1221\n|PortionCalories = 10\n|DatePublished=24th December 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Pickled beetroots\n |Servings = Servings: 120 - Will fill about 2 x 2 litre [[Kilner]] jars\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 1 hour, 40 minutes\n |PrepTime = 10 minutes\n |CookTime = 1 hour 30 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Pickled beetroots recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Perfect with cod and chips</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">The acidic tang and peculiar flavour of the beetroot make this a must for Fridays fish supper.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}} \nThis recipe is the original Mrs Beeton's recipe that has been adapted to use specific quantities and to suit [[Cookipedia]]'s standard layout.  Whilst some recipes and available ingredients improve with age, you really can't beat this 1860's classic.\n[[Image:Pickled beetroot recipe - small scale ingredients.jpg|thumb|300px|right|The ingredients for 1 litre of pickled beets]]\n\nThis recipe makes quite a large quantity, '''[[Pickled beetroot recipe (1 litre qty)|see here for a recipe using smaller quantities]]''', more suited to those who want to try the recipe out.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 2 kg medium-sized [[Beetroots|beetroots]]\n| 2 [[Litres|litres]] clear (white) [[Pickling|pickling]] [[Vinegar|vinegar]]\n| 25 g whole [[Allspice berries|allspice berries]]\n| 25 g [[Black peppercorns|black peppercorns]]\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Wash the [[Beetroot|beetroot]] free of any dirt but do not scrub hard and be careful not to nick the skins (or they will leach colour).\n* Trim the leaves and the tap-root.\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Bring a large pan of water to a [[Boil|boil]], add the [[Beetroot|beetroot]] and [[Simmer|simmer]]  for 90 minutes.\n| Drain the [[Beetroot|beetroot]] and set aside to cool. \n| Once cool enough to handle, rub the skins off and trim as needed.\n| Cut into slices about 12mm thick.\n| Pack the slices into [[Sterilised|sterilised]] [[Kilner]]-type jars.\n| Meanwhile, add the [[Vinegar|vinegar]] and the [[Spices|spices]] to a large pan and in a well-ventilated room, bring to a [[Boil|boil]] and continue to boil for 10 minutes.\n| Remove from the heat and allow to cool.\n| You can strain the spices through a linen cloth or leave them in.  I enjoy my pickles quite spicy so tend to leave them in, especially if I have added extra [[dried chillies]]!\n| Pour the [[Vinegar|vinegar]] over the [[Beetroot|beetroot]], ensuring that it is totally covered.\n| Seal the jars securely, mark them with the date and set aside in a cool, dark, cupboard and allow to mature for a few weeks before use.\n}}\n===Chef's notes===\nIf you need to ensure that you have enough jars, [[Vinegar|vinegar]] and [[Beetroot|beetroot]], pack the sliced beetroot into your jars, cover with water, then measure the water used to calculate how much [[Vinegar|vinegar]] etc. you'll need.\n\nPat the beetroot slices dry again, before pickling.\n==See also==\n* [[Beetroot recipes|Our favourite beetroot recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Pickles and preserves]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Pickled]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#beetroot #vinegar #pickledbeetrootrecipe #kilner #boil #miseenplace #blackpeppercorns #cookipedia #sterilised #pickled #driedchillies </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Pickled beetroot recipe (1 litre qty)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Pickled beetroot, (1 litre qty) a British recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#beetroot #kilnerjar #boil #vinegar #miseenplace #sterilise #pickled #simmer #pickles #spices \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=I have adapted the original Mrs Beeton's original pickled beetroot recipe for a less industrial quantity than hers\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 215\n|PortionCalories = 215\n|DatePublished=24th December 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Pickled beetroots\n |Servings = 1\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 1 hour, 40 minutes\n |PrepTime = 10 minutes\n |CookTime = 1 hour 30 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Pickled beetroots recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">It's so true</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">The simple things are best - and this is real simples!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry]] </span></span>\n}}\nI have adapted the [[original Mrs Beeton's original pickled beetroot recipe]] for a less industrial quantity than hers.  This recipe also uses ''off the (supermarket) shelf ingredients''.  You don't even need a [[Kilner jar]], the jar that contains the Sarson's pickling vinegar can be sterilised by a hot wash in the dishwasher and used to store the pickled beetroot.  You'll even have some spare spicy vinegar left over for your fish and chips.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1 x 500 g bunch of beetroots (about 5 to 7 medium sized beetroots\n| 1 x 1.14 litre jar of Sarson's clear white pickling vinegar\n|* The vinegar purports to be already ''spiced'', but I like to add a little zip to my [[pickles]], hence the pickling spices..\n| 1 x 26g packet of Schwartz `Pickling Spice' '''pictured''\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Wash the [[Beetroot|beetroot]] free of any dirt but do not scrub hard and be careful not to nick the skins (or they will leach colour).\n* Trim the leaves, leaving a few mm of the stem and remove the tap-root without cutting the skin of the beetroot.\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Bring a large pan of water to a [[Boil|boil]], add the [[Beetroot|beetroot]] and [[Simmer|simmer]]  for 90 minutes.\n| Drain the [[Beetroot|beetroot]] and set aside to cool. \n| Once cool enough to handle, rub the skins off and properly trim the stems and roots.\n| Cut into slices about 12mm thick.\n| [[Sterilise]] the Pickling vinegar jar (or a  1 litre [[Kilner jar]] - A hot wash in the dishwasher should suffice for home use.\n| Pack the slices into the jar.\n| Meanwhile, add the all of the [[Vinegar|vinegar]] and all of the the [[Spices|spices]] to a large pan, and in a well-ventilated room, bring to a [[Boil|boil]] and continue to boil for 10 minutes.\n| Remove from the heat and allow to cool completely.\n| You can strain the spices through a clean cloth or leave them in.  I enjoy my pickles quite spicy so tend to leave them in.\n| Pour the [[Vinegar|vinegar]] over the [[Beetroot|beetroot]], ensuring that it is totally covered.\n| Seal the jars securely and set aside in a cool, dark, cupboard and allow to mature for a few weeks before use.\n| Strain any remaining vinegar through a clean cloth and bottle to use as a spicy condiment.\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Beetroots, trimmed and ready to boil.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Beetroots, trimmed prior to boiling for 90 minutes\nImage:Pickled beetroot recipe - small scale ingredients.jpg|thumb|300px|right|The ingredients for 1 litre of pickled beets, available from any supermarket\n</gallery>\n===Servings===\nServings: 60 - Will fill a 1 litre jar with pickled beetroot\n==See also==\n* [[Beetroot recipes|Our favourite beetroot recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Pickles and preserves]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Pickled]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#beetroot #kilnerjar #boil #vinegar #miseenplace #sterilise #pickled #simmer #pickles #spices </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Pickled carrots, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#pickledcarrots #vinegar #sterilised #whitesugar #pickles #carrots #julienned #spices #dill #pickled #whitewinevinegar \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Nice and easy to make and no need to make huge quantities\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 343\n|PortionCalories = 172\n|DatePublished=5th January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = A jar of pickled carrots\n|Servings = Servings: 35 - Makes one jar\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime = 30 minutes\n|PrepTime = 30 minutes\n|CookTime = None\n|Image = [[Image:Pickled carrots recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Maybe in wartime?</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Not sure why you would need to pickle carrots nowadays.  I think they are one vegetable that is better fresh.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nNice and easy to make and no need to make huge quantities.  \n\nNot really sure how long this would last though I would guess 3 months providing the jar is properly [[Sterilised|sterilised]]\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 8 [[Carrots|carrots]], peeled and [[Julienned|julienned]]\n| [[White wine vinegar]] and water mixed 50/50 to cover\n| 1 tablespoon [[White sugar|white sugar]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Sea Salt|sea salt]]\n| 1 tablespoon whole [[Coriander seeds|coriander seeds]]\n| 1 teaspoon dried [[dill]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[chilli flakes]]\n| Grind of [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Add the [[Vinegar|vinegar]] and water mixture, [[White sugar|white sugar]], [[Salt|salt]], [[Pepper|pepper]] to a suitable pan. Bring the mixture to a [[Boil|boil]]. Remove from heat and allow to cool slightly.\n| Place the [[Carrots|carrots]] in a [[Sterilised|sterile]] jar\n| Cover with the [[Vinegar|vinegar]] solution\n| Seal the containers, refrigerate and marinate for at least a week to allow the flavours to permeate.\n}}\n===Variations===\n\nTry a different mix of [[Vinegars|vinegars]] - I always think if the [[Vinegar|vinegar]] blend tastes nice, then so will the [[Pickles|pickles]].\n\nAdd your favourite [[Spices|spices]] to the [[Pickles|pickles]].\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Carrots]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments|Carrots]]\n[[Category:Pickles and preserves|Carrots]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes|Carrots]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes|Carrots]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Uncooked]]\n[[Category:Pickled]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#pickledcarrots #vinegar #sterilised #whitesugar #pickles #carrots #julienned #spices #dill #pickled #whitewinevinegar </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Pickled eggs",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Pickled eggs, Egg recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#pickledeggs #eggs #vinegar #turmericpowder #blackpeppercorns #chickens #onion #whitewinevinegar #boil #turmericroot #garlic \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=We have our own chickens and enjoy pickled eggs, so this recipe is a no-brainer for us. The beauty of making these yourself is that you can spice them\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2811\n|PortionCalories = 117\n|DatePublished=24th December 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Various flavoured pickled eggs\n|Servings = Serves 24. Enough to fill a 2 litre preserving jar\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime = 45 minutes\n|PrepTime = 15 minutes\n|CookTime = 30 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Pickled eggs recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Great if you have your own hens</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">This is a no-brainer if you keep your own birds. Yummy eggs, just don't eat too many at once!</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nWe have our own [[chickens]] and enjoy [[pickled]] [[eggs]], so this recipe is a no-brainer for us.\n\nThe beauty of making these yourself is that you can spice them up with your favourite ingredients.  Your imagination is the only limit.\n\nTry making up your own blend of [[vinegar]] using various vinegar types, make the tester up in very small amounts, tasting as you go, so when you have a good blend you will have the ratios to get the final amount the same as your tester.\n\nJust ensure the [[eggs]] you are using are at least 3 days old or you will not be able to peel them easily\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 24 medium [[boiled eggs]], shelled\n| 500 ml [[cider vinegar]]\n| 500 ml [[white wine vinegar]]\n| 1 [[onion]], peeled and sliced down from the top\n| 1/2 a teaspoon of [[mixed spice powder]]\n| 3 [[chipotle chillies]]\n| 4 cloves [[Garlic|garlic]], peeled and halved\n| 2 heaped teaspoons [[black treacle]] or [[molasses]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[sea salt]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[black peppercorns]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[turmeric powder]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| [[Boil]] all of the ingredients except the [[eggs]], for 10 minutes\n| Allow to cool completely\n| Drop the [[eggs]] into a 2.5 kg (5 lb) sterilised jar and pour in the [[vinegar]] mixture\n| If you don't have enough vinegar (unlikely) then make up the difference with cold water\n| Close and shake well\n| Leave for a month to mature, turning often to mix\n}}\n===Chef's note===\n\n[[Turmeric powder]] is fine but it does make the vinegar cloud badly every time you move the jar and also leaves a sludge in the bottom.  The same amount of [[turmeric root]] would be better if you can get hold of it.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Egg recipes]]\n[[Category:Pickles and preserves]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Pickled]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#pickledeggs #eggs #vinegar #turmericpowder #blackpeppercorns #chickens #onion #whitewinevinegar #boil #turmericroot #garlic </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
