title": "Pickled red cabbage (Mrs Beeton's)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Pickled red cabbage (Mrs Beeton's) a British recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#vinegar #colander #ginger #spices #pints #spicypickledcabbage #pickle #boil #blackpeppercorns #cabbage #redcabbage \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This is from Mrs Beeton's Cookery Book. This copy was a present for my partner's mother, dated 1952\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}} \n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 367\n|PortionCalories = 11\n|DatePublished=24th December 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Other publications - circa 1945\n |Servings = Servings: 100 - Make 1 large jar\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 1 day, 1 hour\n |PrepTime = 1 day, 1 hour\n |CookTime = None\n|Image = [[Image:BeetonsAd.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Beeton's are the best</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">You cannot beat her recipes - tried and tested!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:NonLoggedInUser|NonLoggedInUser]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis is from Mrs Beeton's Cookery Book. This copy was a present for my partner's mother,  dated 1954\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 650g red cabbage (1 large red cabbage)\n| [[Salt]]\n| Water\n| 2 [[Pints|pints]] of [[Vinegar|vinegar]] 1.13 [[Litres|litres]]) - to each 2 quart (2 pints) add 1 tablespoon [[Ginger|ginger]], well bruised\n| 1oz (25 g) whole [[Black peppercorns|black peppercorns]]\n| A little cayene, if liked\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Take off the outside decayed leaves of a nice [[Red cabbage|red cabbage]], cut it into quarters, remove the stalks, and cut it across in very thin slices.\n| Lay these on a dish, and cover them plentifully with [[Salt|salt]], then cover with another dish.\n| Leave for 24 hours; turn into a [[Colander|colander]] to drain, and if necessary, wipe lightly with a clean, soft cloth. Put them in a jar; [[Boil|boil]] up the [[Vinegar|vinegar]] with the [[Spices|spices]], and when cold, pour it over the [[Cabbage|cabbage]]. | It will be fit for use in a week or two, but if kept for a very long time, the cabbage is liable to get soft and discoloured. To be really nice and crisp, and of a good red colour, it should be eaten almost immediately after it is made. A little bruised cochineal [[Boiled|boiled]] with the vinegar adds greatly to the appearance of this [[Pickle|pickle]]. Tie down with bladder, and keep in a dry place.\n}}\n\nSeasonable in July and August, but the pickle will be much more crisp if the frost has just touched the leaves.\n==See also==\n* [[Spicy pickled cabbage]] (my ''modern-day'' version of Mrs B's recipe)\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Pickles and preserves]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Pickled]]\n[[Category:Uncooked]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#vinegar #colander #ginger #spices #pints #spicypickledcabbage #pickle #boil #blackpeppercorns #cabbage #redcabbage </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Pickled walnuts",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Pickled walnuts recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#pickledwalnutrecipe #picklednuts #picklesandpreserves #preparedfoods #walnuts #beef #maltvinegar #storecupboarditems #historicrecipes\n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=How to make pickled walnuts from shelled walnuts\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=23rd September 2020\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Pickled walnuts\n|Servings = 25\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime = 2 days, 2 hours\n|PrepTime = 2 days, 2 hours\n|CookTime = None\n|TotalCalories = 1022\n|PortionCalories = 40\n|Image = [[Image:Pickled Walnut recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Absolute perfetion.</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Unfortunately, these are but a memory until next season, which in March, is months away.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nI've been searching for a [[Pickled walnut|pickled walnut]] recipe for a long while, but can only find a recipe for [[Pickling|pickling]] whole green [[Walnuts|walnuts]].  The only information I can find, unhelpfully seems to be cloned all over the Internet.\n\nThis is my original attempt at pickling walnuts that have the shells removed.\n\n35 large [[walnuts]], once shelled are enough to fill one 500 ml [[Kilner jar]]. 350 ml of sherry vinegar will cover the nuts.\n\nHopefully the procedures and measurements will be useful to anyone else attempting this.\n===Preparing the walnut kernels for pickling===\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:RemoveBrineWalnutsSaladSpinner.jpg|You can use a [[salad spinner]] to remove excess brine.\nImage:PickledWalnutsinBrine.jpg|Soaking in the brine for 2 days\nImage:Removethepapershellwalnut.jpg|Be sure to remove the papery layer from the centre of the kernel\n</gallery>\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 35 large [[Walnuts|walnuts]], shells removed \n| 50 g [[Salt|salt]]\n| 500 ml [[Boiling|boiling]] water\n| 350 ml [[Sherry vinegar|sherry vinegar]]\n| 10 [[Peppercorns|peppercorns]]\n| 5 [[Juniper berries|juniper berries]]\n| 2 tablespoons [[Muscovado sugar|muscovado sugar]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n'''2 days before the [[Pickling|pickling]] is to start'''\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Remove the shells from the [[Walnuts|walnuts]], discard any damaged or shrunken kernels.\n| Break the kernels in half [into two cotlydons] to allow the [[Vinegar|vinegar]] to penetrate the kernel properly.\n| Carefully pick though the shelled kernels and remove any pieces of shell, especially the thin piece that divides each [[Nut|nut]].\n| [[Boil]] about 500ml of water and mix in 50g of [[Salt|salt]] and stir well.\n| Soak the kernels in this brine liquid for 2 days, in a cool place.\n| A quick taste test after this and the walnuts had a salty 'edge' but not too salty for my taste\n}}\n'''[[Pickling]] day''':\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Discard the salt-water and rinse the [[walnut]] kernels in a [[sieve]] under cold running water.\n| Rinse and repeat until the water runs clear.\n| Remove excess brine with a [[salad spinner]] if you have one and pat dry with a [[tea-towel]].\n| Add the [[sherry vinegar]], [[juniper berries]], [[peppercorns]] and [[muscovado sugar]] to a pan and bring it almost to the [[Boil|boil]], then turn off the heat and leave it to go completely cold\n| remove the [[Pickles|pickles]] from the [[Salt|salt]] water and pat dry on a clean [[Tea|tea]]-towel \n| [[Sterilise]] the [[Pickling|pickling]] jar and pack the [[walnuts]] into the 500ml [[Kilner jar]]\n| Pour the [[Vinegar|vinegar]], with the [[Spices|spices]] over the walnuts\n| Seal and store in a cool, dark place for 2 months to mature.\n}}\n=====Walnut weights=====\n35 large walnuts weigh 350 grams in their shells\n35 large walnuts weigh 175 grams once the shells are removed.\n===Variations===\nI tried a few different variations as there were plenty of walnuts available locally.  When they are ready I will let you know which worked, and which did not!\n\n=====Walnuts in red wine vinegar=====\n* 350 ml red wine vinegar\n* 1/2 a teaspoon of sea salt\n* 1 teaspoon jaggery\n* 1 teaspoon black peppercorns\n=====Walnuts in cider vinegar=====\n* 350 ml cider vinegar\n* 1/2 a teaspoon of sea salt\n* 1 teaspoon jaggery\n* 2 tablespoons dark soy sauce\n\n==Commercial pickled walnuts==\n[[Image:Jar of pickled walnuts.jpg|300px|thumb|right|Jar of pickled walnuts]]\n'''Pickled walnuts''' are a traditional English pickle made by pickling [[walnuts]] in [[malt vinegar]].  They are commonly served with cold meats and [[cheeses]] such as [[Stilton]].  There use in the United Kingdom dates back to before 1800, however there is some evidence that walnuts were pickled in the Persian area some 8000 years ago.\n\nCharles Dickens mention pickled walnuts in ''The Pickwick Papers'':\n\n<blockquote>However, there he lay, and I have heard my uncle say, many a time, that the man said who picked him up that he was smiling as merrily as if he had tumbled out for a treat, and that after they had bled him, the first faint glimmerings of returning animation, were his jumping up in bed, bursting out into a loud laugh, kissing the young woman who held the basin, and demanding a mutton chop and a pickled walnut. He was very fond of pickled walnuts, gentlemen. He said he always found that, taken without vinegar, they relished the beer.</blockquote>\n\nThey are also an ingredient in [[Wow-wow sauce]], historically served with [[beef]].\n\n{{RecipeLine}}\n{{CategoryLineIngredients}}\n[[Category:Ingredients]]\n[[Category:Prepared foods]]\n[[Category:Store cupboard items]]\n[[Category:Pickles and preserves]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Pickles and preserves]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Pickled]]\n\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#pickledwalnutrecipe #picklednuts #picklesandpreserves #preparedfoods #walnuts #beef #maltvinegar #storecupboarditems #historicrecipes </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}
Retrieved from "https://www.cookipedia.co.uk/recipes_wiki/Special:ApiHelp"


 

title": "Pickling vinegar",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Homemade pickling vinegar recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#vinegar #vinegars #pickles #maltvinegar #papertowel #picklesandpreserves #pickling #spices #sieve #jaggery #demerara\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=A recipe for the most perfect pickling vinegar\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=25th September 2020\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = 6\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  15 minutes\n|PrepTime =  5 minutes\n|CookTime =  10 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 96\n|PortionCalories = 19\n|Image = [[Image:My Pickling spices.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Perfect for onions</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">This mix was perfect with my pickled shallots.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry, aka Chef]]</span></span>\n}}\nAs Autumn approaches again, I've been making lots of different [[Pickles|pickles]] and have been experimenting with the [[Pickling|pickling]] [[Vinegar|vinegar]] as I've found the commercial pickling [[Vinegars|vinegars]] rather harsh and uninteresting.\n[[Image:MaltVinegarIsCheap.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Malt Vinegar in bulk is not expensive!<br />5 litres for \u00a33.25]]\n\nI've come to the rather simple and obvious conclusion that if the [[Pickling|pickling]] [[Vinegar|vinegar]] does not taste very nice, the [[Pickles|pickles]] probably won't either!\n\nUsing [[Malt vinegar|malt vinegar]] as the base makes sense as it is relatively economical and it will do the 'donkey work' with the [[Pickle|pickle]].  Blending other [[Vinegars|vinegars]] and [[Spices|spices]] enhances the flavour of the finished [[Vinegar|vinegar]] and the addition of [[Sugar|sugar]] removes the harshness.\n\n[[Jaggery]] or other 'dark' [[Sugars|sugars]] such as [[Demerara|demerara]] and [[Muscovado|muscovado]] also adds a more interesting flavour than pure [[White sugar|white sugar]].  [[Honey]] would also be a good addition if you have a plentiful source available.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 300 ml [[Malt vinegar|malt vinegar]]\n| 30 ml [[Balsamic vinegar|balsamic vinegar]]\n| 20 ml Shaoxing cooking [[Wine|wine]] - basically an exotic [[Vinegar|vinegar]]\n| 2 tablespoons [[Jaggery|jaggery]] - a small ''block''\n| 1 teaspoon [[Juniper berries|juniper berries]]\n| 6 [[Clove buds|clove buds]]\n| 1 tablespoon mixed green and black [[Cardomom pods|cardomom pods]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Szechuan peppercorns]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Black peppercorns|black peppercorns]]\n| 3 [[Dried|dried]] [[Red chillies|red chillies]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Add all of the ingredients to a suitable pan.\n| Bring to the [[Boil|boil]].\n| [[Simmer]] for 5 minutes.\n| Leave to cool completely.\n| Filter through a [[Paper towel|paper towel]] over a [[Sieve|sieve]], if you have added any ingredients that might cloud the [[Vinegar|vinegar]].\n| Use as required in you recipe, or just as a [[Condiment|condiment]].\n}}\n===Servings===\n350 ml of pickling vinegar\n===Variations===\nThis mixture suits my taste and also matches what I have available in my kitchen.  Experiment with a variety of [[Vinegars|vinegars]] and [[Spices|spices]]- make small batches and taste test them as you go.  You will easily find a [[Vinegar|vinegar]] that suits your taste.\n===Chef's notes===\nIf you discover you've not made enough flavoured pickling vinegar to cover your pickles, just top the mixture up with normal malt vinegar.\n\nI've found some of these [[Vinegar|vinegar]] mixes so good that once the [[Pickles|pickles]] have been eaten, they are too good to discard, so I filter them again using a [[Paper towel|paper towel]] over a [[Sieve|sieve]] and re-use them as exotic [[Vinegars|vinegars]] for [[Salad dressings|salad dressings]] etc.\n===See also===\nOur [[:[[Category:Pickles and preserves]]|full range of pickle and preserve recipes]].\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Marinades dressings and butters]]\n[[Category:Pickles and preserves]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Pickled]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#vinegar #vinegars #pickles #maltvinegar #papertowel #picklesandpreserves #pickling #spices #sieve #jaggery #demerara</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Pig's feet and ears (Mrs Beeton's)",
                "revisions": [

                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Pig's feet and ears (Mrs Beeton's) a British recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#stock #butter #simmer #onion #mace #flour #lemon #boiledorsimmered #sauce #boil \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=These recipes make me giggle!\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}}\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 774\n|PortionCalories = 129\n|DatePublished=21st January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Other publications - circa 1945\n |Servings = Serves 6\n |Difficulty = 3\n |TotalTime = 3 hours 30 minutes\n |PrepTime = 30 minutes\n |CookTime = 3 hours \n |Image = [[Image:BeetonsAd.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">I prefer my ears crispy - Lol!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">3</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">This is so funny, though I guess once this would have been a deadly  serious  recipe.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nThese recipes make me giggle!\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 4 pig's feet\n| 2 pig's ears\n| A slice of [[onion]]\n| A small blade of [[mace]]\n| A thin strip of [[lemon]] rind\n| White [[stock]] or [[milk]]\n| '''For the [[sauce]]'''\n| 50 g (2 oz) [[butter]]\n| 40 g (1.5 oz) [[flour]]\n| 426 ml (3/4 pint) of white [[stock]]\n| [[Salt]] and [[pepper]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Wash the feet and ears, cover them with white [[stock]] or [[milk]], add the [[onion]], [[mace]], [[lemon]] rind and [[salt]] and [[pepper]] to taste\n| [[Simmer]] until tender, then cut the feet into neat pieces, and the ears into thin strips\n| Heat the [[butter]] in a stewpan, add the [[flour]], stir and cook slowly for about 5 minutes, then add the [[stock]] or liquor in which the feet and ears were cooked\n| [[Boil]] up, season to taste, [[simmer]] gently for 10 minutes, then put in the prepared feet and ears, and when thoroughly hot, serve\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Pork]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes|Pork]]\n[[Category:Main courses|Pork]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#stock #butter #simmer #onion #mace #flour #lemon #boiledorsimmered #sauce #boil </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Pig's head, boiled (Mrs Beeton's)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Pig's head, boiled (Mrs Beeton's) a British recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#saltpeter #peasepudding #unusualrecipes #simmer #boil \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This is from Mrs Beetons Cookery Book\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2192\n|PortionCalories = 274\n|DatePublished=12th April 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 8\n|Difficulty = 3\n|ImageComment = [[How to cook a pig's head|Step by step pictures here]]\n|TotalTime = 6 days, 3 hours, 30 minutes\n|PrepTime = 6 days\n|CookTime = 3 hours 30 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Briefly.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Oink, oink!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Love the picture - do nothing by halves \ud83d\ude2c</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:NonLoggedInUser|NonLoggedInUser]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:BeetonsAd.jpg|thumb|250px|right|Other publications - circa 1945]]\nThis is from Mrs Beeton's Cookery Book.  This copy was a gift, dated 1950\n\nI tried in vain but could not find a use for the left over hair, eyes, snout and brains!\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1 Pig's head\n| 1 lb common [[salt]]\n| 1 oz [[saltpeter]]\n| [[Pease pudding]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Scald and cleanse the head thoroughly, removing the hair, eyes, snout and brains\n| Soak in strong [[salt]] and water for about 24 hours, changing the water 2 or 3 times, then drain and dry well\n| Mix the [[salt]] and [[saltpeter]] together, run it well into every part of the head, repeat this process daily for 5 to 6 days\n| Drain the head from brine, place in a stew pan containing sufficient warm water to cover it, bring to the [[boil]] and skim well\n| [[Simmer]] gently for 3 &frac12; hours\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\n\nServe with [[pease pudding]]\n===Warning===\n\nPlease research the risks of using [[saltpeter]] if you ever attempt this recipe!\n\n==See also==\n\n'''* How to prepare and cook a pig's head; [[How to cook a pig's head|a step by step pictorial guide]].'''\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#saltpeter #peasepudding #unusualrecipes #simmer #boil </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Pigeon pie (Mrs Beeton's)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Pigeon pie (Mrs Beeton's), Egg recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#stock #egg #ham #pigeon #bacon #bake #rumpsteak #beef #brush #unusualrecipes #eggs \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Pigeons are hard to come by nowadays, but if you know someone who shoots, then you may be in luck\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 4240\n|PortionCalories = 706\n|DatePublished=20th January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Other publications - circa 1945\n|Servings = Serves 6\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime = 1 hour 20 minutes\n|PrepTime = 20 minutes\n|CookTime = 1 hour\n|Image = [[Image:BeetonsAd.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">This is lovely, almost as rich as liver</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">If it's good enough for Mrs Beeton, it's good enough for me.</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Carla_Cancio-Bello,_J.D.,_on_behalf_of_Cuban_Cuisine_UK|Carla]] </span></span>}}\nPigeons are hard to come by nowadays, but if you know someone who shoots, then you may be in luck.  They are at their best from March to September.\n\nThis tried and trusted recipe is from Mrs Beeton's Cookery Book, circa 1945.\n\nThe only change I would make to the recipe below is to use [[pre-rolled puff pastry]], and maybe omit the pigeons feet!.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 2 pigeons\n| 340 g (3/4 lb) [[rump steak]]\n| 75 g (3 oz) [[ham]] or lean [[bacon]]\n| 284 ml (1/2 pint) good [[stock]]\n| 1 hard-[[boiled]] [[egg]]\n| 1 [[egg]] yolk\n| 500g [[Puff-pastry]] - puff-paste in Beaton-speak.\n| [[Salt]] and [[pepper]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Cut each [[pigeon]] into 4 pieces\n| Cut the [[beef]] into small thin slices, the [[ham]] into strips and the [[eggs]] into slices\n| Put these ingredients into a pie dish in layers, season well and pour in the [[stock]] to three-quarters fill the dish\n| Put on the cover (''[[pre-rolled puff pastry]]''), [[brush]] over with yolk of [[egg]], [[bake]] in a ''quick oven'' (see below) until the paste has risen and set, then cook at a ''lower temperature'' (again, see below) for about 1 hour\n| Have ready a few of the [[pigeon]]'s feet, scalded and the toes cut off, also the remainder of the [[stock]]\n| Before serving, pour in the [[stock]] through the centre of the pie and replace the pastry ornament with the feet, fixing them in a nearly upright position\n| The pie may be served either hot or cold; if the latter, the stock must form a jelly when cold\n}}\n===Chef's tip===\n\n'''Quick oven''' 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - Gas 6)\n\n'''Lower temperature''' 150\u00b0 C (300\u00b0 C - Gas 2)\n\nI would cover the pastry with [[tin-foil]] during the ''lower temperature'' stage to ensure it does not get over-cooked. \n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Pigeon]]\n[[Category:Egg recipes|Pigeon]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes|Pigeon]]\n[[Category:Main courses|Pigeon]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes|Pigeon]]\n[[Category:Poultry recipes|Pigeon]]\n[[Category:Game recipes|Pigeon]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#stock #egg #ham #pigeon #bacon #bake #rumpsteak #beef #brush #unusualrecipes #eggs </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Pimm's Pimpom",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",

title": "Pineapple salsa",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Spicy pineapple salsa recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#pineapplesalsa #pineapple #juice #sidedish #vegetarianrecipes #ginger #muscovadosugar #iceberglettuce #salsa #freshginger #chillies \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A sweet, spicy fragrant salsa that goes really well with roast duck\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 115\n|PortionCalories = 57\n|DatePublished=7th December 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  45 minutes\n|PrepTime =  45 minutes\n|CookTime = None\n|Image = [[Image:Pineapple salsa recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Fabulously fresh.</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Great with pulled pork</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry, aka Chef]])</span></span>\n}}\nI was looking for a little [[Side dish|side dish]] to go with a recent discovery: [[Gressingham Memphis Barbecue Pulled Duck]].  This was the result - it was so [[Goo|goo]] that next time we had it we added it directly to half a chopped up [[Iceberg lettuce|iceberg lettuce]]; but that's another story: [[Crunchy lettuce salad with pineapple salsa]].\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 small tin of [[Pineapple|pineapple]] rings (4 rings)\n| 1 small [[Red onion|red onion]], peeled and cut into thin rings\n| 2 small fresh [[Chillies|chillies]], deseeded and chopped into rings\n| 1 teaspoon [[Fresh ginger|fresh ginger]] - ([[Frozen ginger paste]] is the most economical way to use [[Ginger|ginger]] and still have the zing)\n| 1 level teaspoon [[Muscovado sugar|muscovado sugar]]\n| 20 ml [[Lime juice|lime juice]]\n| 20 ml [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| Pinch of [[Sea Salt|sea salt]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Drain the canned [[Pineapple|pineapple]] rings and cut into segments - reserve a little of the [[Juice|juice]]\n| Leave the [[Onions|onions]] to dress the [[Salsa|salsa]] at the end\n| Mix the remaining items together and the flavours to combine\n| Taste and add a little of the [[Pineapple|pineapple]] [[Juice|juice]] if needed\n| Add the [[Onion|onion]] rings and mix everything together\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nThis went really well with [[Roast|roast]] [[Ducks|ducks]] legs\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Chilli pepper recipes]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Uncooked]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#pineapplesalsa #pineapple #juice #sidedish #vegetarianrecipes #ginger #muscovadosugar #iceberglettuce #salsa #freshginger #chillies </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Pineapple upside down cake",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Pineapple upside down cake, a fruit recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#pineapple #butter #pineappleupsidedowncake #bakingpowder #flour #castersugar #jam #cherry #bakingtray #freerangeeggs #demerarasugar \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This colourful cake-come-pudding can be easily made from items found in a well kept kitchen cupboard\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1940\n|PortionCalories = 242\n|DatePublished=20th January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 8\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 1 hour, 5 minutes\n |PrepTime = 20 minutes\n |CookTime = 45 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Pineapple upside down cake recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"><span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Just like Mum used to make</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Tasting this again bought back memories from 50 odd years ago!</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\">[[User:Chef|Jerry]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis colourful cake-come-pudding can be easily made from items found in a well kept kitchen cupboard.\n\n\n'''topping'''\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 30 g [[Butter|butter]], softened\n| 30 g [[Muscovado|muscovado]] [[Sugar|sugar]] or  [[Demerara sugar|demerara sugar]] \n| 2 tablespoons of [[Apricot|apricot]] [[Jam|jam]]. Any jam or [[Marmalade|marmalade]] would be fine\n| 220 g whole [[Pineapple|pineapple]] rings in [[Juice|juice]]\n| 8 Glac\u00e9 [[Cherries|cherries]]\n}}\n'''cake mix'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 100 g [[Butter|butter]], softened\n| 100 g [[Caster sugar|caster sugar]]\n| 3 [[free range eggs]]\n| 100 g [[Self-raising flour|self-raising flour]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Baking powder|baking powder]]\n| 2 tablespoons [[Milk|milk]]\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4)\n===Method===\n\n\n'''topping'''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Beat the softened [[Butter|butter]], [[Sugar|sugar]] and [[Jam|jam]] and spread in the base of a non-stick cake tin\n| Arrange the [[pineapple]] rings in the base with a [[Cherry|cherry]] in each [[Pineapple|pineapple]] ring and others dotted about as you wish\n}}\n'''cake mix'''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| In a large bowl, mix the [[Butter|butter]] and [[Caster sugar|caster sugar]]\n| Beat in the [[Eggs|eggs]], one at a time, each with a 1 tablespoon of [[Flour|flour]]\n| Sift the remaining [[Flour|flour]] into the bowl together with the [[Baking powder|baking powder]]\n| Add the [[Milk|milk]] and mix really well\n| Spoon the mixture over the [[Pineapple|pineapple]] rings and smooth over with a spatula\n| [[Bake]] for 40 to 45 minutes until well risen and golden [[Brown|brown]]. To check if it is properly cooked, insert a skewer into the middle of the cake - it should come out clean if the cake is properly cooked\n| Leave in the tin to cool  for 5 minutes then loosen the edges with a spatula\n| Place a large serving plate over the [[baking tray]], turn everything over and tap the tray to release the cake.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Vanilla|vanilla]] [[Ice cream|ice cream]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#pineapple #butter #pineappleupsidedowncake #bakingpowder #flour #castersugar #jam #cherry #bakingtray #freerangeeggs #demerarasugar </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Piri piri hazelnuts",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Piri piri hazelnuts\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#oliveoil #garlic #hazelnuts #spray #nuts #butter #piripirihazelnuts #spices #ghee #wok #spice \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=peri peri or piri piri and garlic nuts. More experiment with the Taste Sensation taste sensation seasonings and spices.\n|og:image=https://www.cookipedia.co.uk/wiki/images/thumb/2/2e/Piri_piri_hazelnuts_recipe.jpg/450px-Piri_piri_hazelnuts_recipe.jpg\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=14th December 2019\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  14 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime =  4 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 1429\n|PortionCalories = 714\n|Image = [[Image:Piri piri hazelnuts recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Can't stop eating these!!!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I make these with a mind to store them to eat later, but grazed them all the same day! </span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nMore experiment with the [[Taste Sensation Seasonings|taste sensation seasonings]] and [[Spices|spices]].  This time I thought I would try jazzing up some supermarket packet [[Nuts|nuts]].  I love munching on the spices as much as the nuts themselves!\n\nI've used two tablespoons of [[Taste Sensation piri piri seasoning]].  You might try just one tablespoon to start with if you're not sure how hot you want them.  The [[Spice|spice]] mix is nice and subtle, not just heat.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 200 g pack of [[Hazelnuts|hazelnuts]]\n| 1 tablespoon of [[Butter|butter]] [[Ghee|ghee]] - normal butter or even [[Olive oil|olive oil]] would also be fine\n| 4 [[Cloves of Garlic, peeled and crushed|cloves of garlic, peeled and crushed]]\n| 1 tablespoon of [[Demerara sugar|demerara sugar]]\n| 2 tablespoons [[Taste Sensation piri piri seasoning]] Seasoning\n| &#189; teaspoon pink [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] - optional\n| A quick [[Spray|spray]] of [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Peri peri hazelnuts sauteeing.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Glazed with a spray of [[olive oil]]\nImage:Peri peri hazelnuts ingredients.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Peri Peri [[hazelnuts]], the basic ingredients\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Heat the [[Ghee|ghee]] or [[Butter|butter]] in a [[Wok|wok]] or pan being careful not to burn it\n| Have the [[Nut|nut]] ready to tip in to stop the [[Garlic|garlic]] cooking\n| Carefully sizzle the [[Crushed garlic|crushed garlic]] to remove as much of the water content. The moment the [[Garlic|garlic]] starts to colour, remove the pan and tip in the [[Hazelnuts|hazelnuts]] and stir well \n| Add the [[Sugar|sugar]], heat and stir until it melts, then sprinkle the remaining [[Spices|spices]], stir well and toss to mix everything together\n| You might want to add a quick [[Spray|spray]] of [[Olive oil|olive oil]] at the very end, just to gloss the [[Nuts|nuts]] so they look nice!\n}}\n\n===Chef's notes===\nAs raw products cooked with fresh [[Garlic|garlic]] don't keep too well and have the propensity to harbour nasty bacteria it's probably best to keep these in the [[Refrigerator|refrigerator]] and use them within a week or so.\n\nNot a problem for me as I don't suppose they'll survive the day!\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Portuguese recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Chilli pepper recipes]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Taste Sensation recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#oliveoil #garlic #hazelnuts #spray #nuts #butter #piripirihazelnuts #spices #ghee #wok #spice </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

15 minutes\n|PrepTime =  5 minutes\n|CookTime =  10 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 1942\n|PortionCalories = 485\n|Image = [[Image:Pitta bread pizzas recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span cheese.jpg|thumb|300px|right|[http://www.dragonwales.co.uk/products/cheddar/mild/ Dragon mild Welsh Cheddar cheese]]]\n\nA nice easy recipe that is great to get kids to help with.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 4 [[Wholemeal|wholemeal]] [[Pitta breads|pitta breads]] or 8 mini [[pitta breads]]\n| 4 teaspoons [[Tomato|tomato]] pur\u00e9e\n| 4 slices [[Ham|ham]], [[Shredded|shredded]]\n| 2 tablespoons cooked [[Sweetcorn|sweetcorn]]\n| 100g [[Dragon mild Welsh Cheddar cheese]], [[Grated|grated]]\n| 2 [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]] thinly sliced\n| Sprinkling of [[Dried|dried]] [[Basil|basil]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6), [fan oven 180\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Spread each [[Pitta|pitta]] with 1 teaspoon pur\u00e9e. Arrange [[Tomato|tomato]] slices, [[Ham|ham]] and [[Sweetcorn|sweetcorn]] on each pitta and sprinkle with [[Cheddar|cheddar]] and [[Basil|basil]] (try with other toppings such as [[Salami|salami]], [[Peppers|peppers]], [[Pineapple|pineapple]] or make a funny face with your ingredients for kids).\n| Place on the [[Baking sheet|baking sheet]] and [[Bake|bake]] for 10 minutes until the [[Pittas|pittas]] are golden [[Brown|brown]] and bubbling.\n}}\n{{Template:Dragon cheese attribution}}\n==See also==\n* [[South Caernarfon Creameries]]\n* [[Dragon mild Welsh cheddar cheese]]\n\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Pizza recipes]]\n[[Category:Dragon cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#basil #sweetcorn #pittabreadpizzas #southcaernarfoncreameries #pittabreads #ham #tomato #recipesfromothersites #peppers #miseenplace #wholemeal </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Plain oatcakes",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Plain oatcakes, Irish recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#cheesyoatcakes #plainoatcakes #lard #dough #boiling #oatmeal #miseenplace #bake #bakingtray #greaseproofpaper #fry \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Delicious with sweet or savoury items, these oatcakes are simple to make\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 393\n|PortionCalories = 196\n|DatePublished=20th September 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = These are the [[Cheesy oatcakes|cheesy version]]\n |Servings = Serves 2\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 25 minutes\n |PrepTime = 15 minutes\n |CookTime = 10 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Cheesey oatcakes recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"><span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">My favourite!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Great with a cup of tea</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\">[[User:Chef|Jerry]] </span></span>\n}}\nDelicious with sweet or [[Savory|savoury]] items, these [[Oatcakes|oatcakes]] are simple to make.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 60 g (2oz) medium [[Oatmeal|oatmeal]], plus extra for sprinkling\n| 60 g (2oz) [[Wholemeal flour|wholemeal flour]].\n| &frac12; teaspoon of [[Bicarbonate of soda|bicarbonate of soda]].\n| A pinch of [[Salt|salt]].\n| 5 tablespoons of [[Boiling|boiling]] water.\n| A tablespoon of [[Lard|lard]].\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the [[oven]] to  204\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - Gas 6)\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Grease a [[baking tray]] and line with [[Greaseproof paper|greaseproof paper]]\n| Melt a tablespoon of [[Lard|lard]] in a bowl and add the [[Fry|fry]] ingredients, mix well\n| Add 5 tablespoons of [[Boiling|boiling]] water and mix. Using a palette knife fold the mixture until a [[Dough|dough]] starts to form\n| Sprinkle a little [[Oatmeal|oatmeal]] on a board, cut the [[Dough|dough]] into two and roll each half out into rounds, about 5 cm (1/2\") thick\n| Score into [[Farls|farls]]\n| [[Bake]] in the oven for about 10 minutes or until golden [[Brown|brown]]\n| Cool on a rack before eating\n}}\n==See also==\n* [[Cheesy oatcakes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Oatcakes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments|Oatcakes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking|Oatcakes]]\n[[Category:British recipes|Oatcakes]]\n[[Category:Irish recipes|Oatcakes]]\n[[Category:Grain and bean recipes|Oatcakes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites|Oatcakes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#cheesyoatcakes #plainoatcakes #lard #dough #boiling #oatmeal #miseenplace #bake #bakingtray #greaseproofpaper #fry </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }

title": "Plain omelette",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Plain omelette, Egg recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#plainomelette #butter #eggs #garlic #parsley #chives #oliveoil #cream #blackpepper #panfried \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=As omelettes are so quick to make, it's just as easy to make one each as it is to make one huge omelette\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 272\n|PortionCalories = 272\n|DatePublished=12th April 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 1\n|Difficulty = 1\n|ImageComment = Plain omelette with cherry tomatoes\n|TotalTime = 10 minutes\n|PrepTime = 5 minutes\n|CookTime = 5 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:RecipePlain_omelette.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Simple and superb</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">One of the easiest meals to make and this is simplicity itself.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nAs omelettes are so quick to make, it's just as easy to make one each as it is to make one huge omelette.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 2 large free-range [[eggs]]\n| Salt and freshly ground [[black pepper]] to taste\n| Splash of [[cream]] or [[milk]] (optional)\n| 1 tablespoon [[butter]] or [[olive oil]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Break the [[eggs]] into a bowl with the [[salt]], pepper and [[milk]]\n| Mix roughly with a knife. Don't whisk - it's nice to get some white and yolk only areas in the omelette\n| Add the [[butter]] to a small frying pan\n| When the [[butter]] is foaming add the mixture to the pan\n| Fry for 2 minutes on this side, pulling the solid edges to the centre with a fork\n| Flip over and fry for 1 minute on the other side\n| Slide on to a warm serving plate, folding the omelette - this way, the last bit of cooking is done on the plate\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\n\nServe immediately\n\nAdd some tomatoes at the side and a leaf of coriander or mint so it looks different and tastier.\n\nAlso you can put a drop of mayonnaise on the top of the tomatoes and an olive.\n\n===Variations===\n\nExperiment using chopped herbs such as [[chives]] or [[parsley]].\n\nRub the pan with half a [[Garlic|garlic]] clove prior to frying (discard the garlic).\n\nAdd a handful of microwaved mixed vegetables just before folding over.\n\n{{OmeletteRecipes}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Omelette]]\n[[Category:Egg recipes|Omelette]]\n[[Category:Main courses|Omelette]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Student recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#plainomelette #butter #eggs #garlic #parsley #chives #oliveoil #cream #blackpepper #panfried </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Plaited bread",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Plaited bread, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#plaitedbread #egg #bread #dough #yeast #fridge #flour #oliveoil #thermomix #bake #miseenplace \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This plaited loaf is made with 6 braids, rather than the more usual 3 and needs to be started the evening before\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1781\n|PortionCalories = 178\n|DatePublished=27th October 2012\n|Author = JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = Servings: 10 - 1 large loaf\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 16 hours 20 minutes\n |PrepTime = 15 hours 30 minutes\n |CookTime = 50 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Plaited bread.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Needs quite a lot of time</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.6</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">But it looks brilliant - like a fabulous harvest festival centrepiece.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis plaited loaf is made with 6 braids, rather than the more usual 3 and needs to be started the evening before.\n[[Image:Plaited bread - the crumb.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Plaited [[Bread|bread]] - the crumb]]\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 330ml [[Milk|milk]]\n| 550g [[Strong white bread flour|strong white bread flour]]\n| 7g fast action [[Yeast|yeast]]\n| 50g [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| &frac34; teaspoon [[Salt|salt]]\n| 1 large [[Egg|egg]], beaten\n| [[Oil]] for greasing\n| 1 [[egg]], beaten, for [[Brushing|brushing]]\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* The evening before, mix all of the [[Milk|milk]], half (275g) of the [[Flour|flour]] and the [[Yeast|yeast]].\n* Cover with [[Clingfilm|clingfilm]] or a shower cap and leave overnight in the [[Fridge|fridge]].\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| The following morning, remove the bowl from the [[Fridge|fridge]] and allow to come up to room temperature.\n| Mix in the other 250g [[Flour|flour]] and the remaining ingredients.\n| [[Knead]], according to your chosen method.\n| Shape into a ball and place in an oiled bowl and leave, covered until almost double its size.\n| Deflate the [[Dough|dough]] and repeat the previous step.\n| Divide into 6 - use your scales - trying not to deflate the [[Dough|dough]] too much..\n| Roll each piece into '[[Sausages|sausages]]' about 20 cm in length. \n| Hold them upright in front of you and attach the ends to each other. \n| Take the first right-[[Hand|hand]] braid and pass over the following two (2-3) under 4 and over the last two (5-6).\n| At this stage, the first part finds itself at the end beyond braid 6 and braid 2 is found at the extreme right.\n| You continue as before, so take what is now braid 1, pass it over 2 and 3, under 4, and over 5 and 6.\n| Repeat these actions until the plait is complete and then seal the end.\n| Cover and allow to [[Proove|proove]].\n| [[Brush]] with the [[egg]] and [[Bake|bake]] in a preheated [[Oven|oven]] at 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4), [fan oven 160\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour], for 50 minutes.\n| You may wish to turn the [[Bread|bread]] round after 30 minutes, if your [[Oven|oven]] is like mine and cooks unevenly and I would recommend that you turn it upside down for the final 10 minutes of the cooking time.\n| When [[Baked|baked]], allow to cool on a wire rack.\n}}\n===Recipe source===\n* This is my own recipe, but the plaiting method is explained at '''[http://djouza.over-blog.com/article-pain-aux-oeufs-86664280.html Ma Cabane aux D\u00e9lices]'''.\n===Variations===\nAdd flavourings to taste, such as onion powder, tomato pur\u00e9e, seeds, grated cheese etc.\n===Chef's notes===\nThe plaiting was not that difficult, but you need to keep the braids quite tight.  When dividing your dough, use a metal dough cutter as this will give a cleaner cut.\n==See also==\n* [[Plaited bread (TM)|Here]] is a recipe for making the [[bread]] in a [[Thermomix]].\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]][[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#plaitedbread #egg #bread #dough #yeast #fridge #flour #oliveoil #thermomix #bake #miseenplace </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Plaited bread (TM)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Plaited bread - A Thermomix recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#egg #bread #flour #fridge #yeast #miseenplace #oliveoil #plaitedbread #brushing #brush #thermomixrecipes \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This Thermomix plaited loaf is made with 6 braids, rather than the more usual 3 and needs to be started the evening before\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1781\n|PortionCalories = 178\n|DatePublished=27th October 2012\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = Servings: 10 - 1 large loaf\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 15 hours 10 minutes\n |PrepTime = 14 hours 20 minutes\n |CookTime = 50 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Plaited bread.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Pretty bread</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Great for a festival</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Plaited bread - the crumb.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Plaited [[Bread|bread]] - the crumb]]\nThis plaited loaf is made with 6 braids, rather than the more usual 3 and needs to be started the evening before.  This is the version for making in a [[Thermomix]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredientsTM\n| 330ml [[Milk|milk]]\n| 550g [[Strong white bread flour|strong white bread flour]]\n| 7g fast action [[Yeast|yeast]]\n| 50g [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| &frac34; teaspoon [[Salt|salt]]\n| 1 large [[Egg|egg]], beaten\n| [[Oil]] for greasing\n| 1 [[egg]], beaten, for [[Brushing|brushing]]\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* The evening before, mix all of the [[Milk|milk]], half (275g) of the [[Flour|flour]] and the [[Yeast|yeast]] in a bowl (do not use the TM bowl).\n* Cover with [[Clingfilm|clingfilm]] or a shower cap and leave overnight in the [[Fridge|fridge]].\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| The following morning, remove the bowl from the [[Fridge|fridge]] and allow to come up to room temperature.\n| Tip the mixture into the TM bowl together with the other 275g [[Flour|flour]] and the remaining ingredients.\n| [[Knead]], for '''4 minutes / Knead'''.\n| Leave in the TM bowl until it is pushing up the MC.\n| Shape into a ball and place in an oiled bowl and leave, covered until almost double its size.\n| Divide into 6 - use your scales - trying not to deflate the [[Dough|dough]] too much..\n| Roll each piece into '[[Sausages|sausages]]' about 20 cm in length. \n| Hold them upright in front of you and attach the ends to each other. \n| Take the first right-[[Hand|hand]] braid and pass over the following two (2-3) under 4 and over the last two (5-6).\n| At this stage, the first part finds itself at the end beyond braid 6 and braid 2 is found at the extreme right.\n| You continue as before, so take what is now braid 1, pass it over 2 and 3, under 4, and over 5 and 6.\n| Repeat these actions until the plait is complete and then seal the end.\n| Cover and allow to [[Proove|proove]].\n| [[Brush]] with the [[egg]] and [[Bake|bake]] in a preheated [[Oven|oven]] at 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4), [fan oven 160\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour], for 50 minutes.\n| You may wish to turn the [[Bread|bread]] round after 30 minutes, if your [[Oven|oven]] is like mine and cooks unevenly and I would recommend that you turn it upside down for the final 10 minutes of the cooking time.\n| When [[Baked|baked]], allow to cool on a wire rack.\n}}\n===Recipe source===\n* This is my own recipe, but the plaiting method is explained at '''[http://djouza.over-blog.com/article-pain-aux-oeufs-86664280.html Ma Cabane aux D\u00e9lices]'''.\n===Variations===\nAdd flavourings to taste, such as onion powder, tomato pur\u00e9e, seeds, grated cheese etc.\n===Chef's notes===\nThe plaiting was not that difficult, but you need to keep the braids quite tight.  When dividing your dough, use a metal dough cutter as this will give a cleaner cut.\n==See also==\n* [[Plaited bread|Here]] is a recipe for making this [[bread]] conventionally.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n[[Category:Thermomix recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#egg #bread #flour #fridge #yeast #miseenplace #oliveoil #plaitedbread #brushing #brush #thermomixrecipes </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Ploughmans' deep pan pizza",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Ploughmans' deep pan pizza, British recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#dough #parmesancheese #fetacheese #ploughmansdeeppanpizza #tomatoes #ham #pizzadough #oregano #feta #branstonpickle #blackpepper \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Following the success of the Chicago deep pan pizza, I have made many versions of the deep-dish pizza\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1888\n|PortionCalories = 472\n|DatePublished=7th June 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment =\n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  2 hours, 25 minutes\n|PrepTime =  1 hours 40 minutes\n|CookTime =  45 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Creating Ploughmans' deep pan pizza.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Gorgeous!!!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">There is no better 'proper' pizza \ud83c\udf55\ud83c\udf55\ud83c\udf55</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]] </span></span>\n}}\nFollowing the success of the [[Chicago deep pan pizza|Chicago deep pan pizza]], I have made many versions of the deep-dish pizza.  This recipe is inspired by the Ploughmans' lunch: [[ham]], [[cheese]], [[Branston pickle]], [[tomatoes]] and variations thereof.  Following a true ploughmans', obviously [[Cheddar]] would be the [[cheese]] of choice, however, I spotted some lovely oak barrel aged [[feta]] so used that instead.\n\nThese deep-dish pizzas are excellent cooked the moment the dough has been made, but if time and conditions allow, they are even better if left in a warm place to rise first.  They then become light and airy with a sponge-like texture.  As this is a rare warm sunny day, I'm going to leave this one out to rise for a few hours before it's cooked.\n\n===How to ensure a crispy base===\nHaving made these deep pan pizzas many, many times, I've found that sometimes it's hard to get the base well cooked without burning the rest of the [[pizza dough]].  I've found the best way is to use a meta-based pan, similar to a baking tray.  The metal base gets hot enough to crisp the base properly.  I have a really heavy rectangular Le Creuset baking tray that is absolutely ideal.  It seems a shame as it will mean I'll never use my earthenware deep pan pizza dish again!\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 180 g good quality sliced [[ham]].\n| 1 portion of [[Pizza dough|pizza dough]]\n| [[Fine yellow cornmeal|fine yellow cornmeal]] for dusting\n| 150 g (5 oz) [[Feta cheese]], crumbled or sliced\n| 50 g (2 oz) freshly [[Grated|grated]] [[Parmesan cheese]]\n| 1 400 g can of chopped peeled [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]], left to drain over a coarse sieve for 15 minutes or more.\n| &#189; teaspoon of dried [[oregano]]\n| Freshly ground [[black pepper]]\n| 4 tablespoons [[Branston pickle]]\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 190\u00b0 C (375\u00b0 F - gas 5), [fan oven 170\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n* Make the [[Dough|dough]] as instructed\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Ploughmas deep pan pizza ready to rise.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Left to rise for an hour or so\nImage:Branston Pickle pizza.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Plenty of Branston pickle\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| [[Spray]] or lightly [[Oil|oil]] a deep 25cm (10\") pizza dish or pan\n| Roll out two thirds of the [[Dough|dough]] to about 3mm and line a pan so the [[Dough|dough]] just  overlaps the edges and trim any excess\n| Sprinkle the base with two thirds of the [[Feta cheese]]\n| Layer the ham over the cheese.\n| Spread the [[Branston]] in a thick layer, over the ham.\n| Sprinkle with one third of the [[Parmesan cheese]]\n| Roll out the remaining [[Dough|dough]] to make a lid\n| Pinch the lid so it joins the base and make a few slashed in the top for [[Steam|steam]] to escape\n| Mix another third of the [[Parmesan cheese]] with the [[oregano]] and [[black pepper]] and mix into the [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]]\n| Spread the tomato mixture over the top of the [[Dough|dough]]\n| Top with remaining crumbled [[feta cheese]] and the rest of the [[Parmesan cheese]]\n| [[Bake]] for 45 minutes, resting a sheet of [[Tin-foil|tin-foil]] on top of the [[Pizza|pizza]] for the final 10 minutes\n| Allow to cool for 5 minutes before slicing and serving\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with a [[Green salad|green salad]]\n\n===Chef's notes===\nA fantastic pizaa.   The oak barrel aged [[feta]] made a really nice change for a pizza.  Will have to use it again.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Pizza recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#dough #parmesancheese #fetacheese #ploughmansdeeppanpizza #tomatoes #ham #pizzadough #oregano #feta #branstonpickle #blackpepper </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

Great with crispy duck.</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.6</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Ginger gives this a terrific edge and counteracts the sweetness.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nA fabulously fruity sauce for [[duck]] and [[pork]]. Great if you have easy access to an orchard!\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 500g fresh [[plums]], de-stoned and cut into quarters\n| 2 tablespoons red wine or [[sherry vinegar]]\n| 3 heaped tablespoons (50g) [[demerara sugar]]\n| 2 tablespoons fresh [[Ginger|grated ginger]]\n| 125ml (4 fl oz) water\n| 1 tablespoon [[light soy sauce]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Put all ingredients in a small pan and bring to the boil\n| Reduce to a gentle heat and simmer for about 20 minutes or until the plums are soft\n| Stir well\n| Strain sauce and remove skins\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\n\nGood with duck and game\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Dips and sauces]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Cooking with wine]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#plumandgingersauce #duck #plums #lightsoysauce #sherryvinegar #pork #demerarasugar #ginger #boiledorsimmered </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Poached eggs, Indian-style",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Poached eggs, Indian-style, Egg recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#rice #poachedeggsindianstyle #poachedeggs #tomatoes #sauce #curry #currypowder #butter #onions #flour #plainflour \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A simple supper dish, poached eggs on rice and tomatoes with a mild curry sauce\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1182\n|PortionCalories = 295\n|DatePublished=24th January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  30 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime = 15 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Poached eggs, Indian-style recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Curried eggs!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">This could catch on!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Poached eggs, Indian-style avocado.jpg|thumb|300px|right|..and you could add avocado if you like..]]\nA simple supper dish, [[Poached eggs|poached eggs]] on [[Rice|rice]] and [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]] with a mild [[Curry|curry]] [[Sauce|sauce]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 110 g (4 oz) [[Basmati rice|basmati rice]]\n| 1 small [[Onion|onion]], peeled and finely chopped\n| 2 [[Cloves of Garlic, peeled and crushed|cloves of garlic, peeled and crushed]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Curry powder|curry powder]] - or to taste\n| 1 tablespoon [[Plain flour|plain flour]]\n| 284 ml (&frac12; pint) [[Vegetable Stock|vegetable stock]]\n| 150 ml pot [[Single cream|single cream]]\n| 25 g (1 oz) [[Butter|butter]]\n| 2 large [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]], sliced\n| 4 [[free range eggs]]\n| Seat and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Rinse the [[Rice|rice]] in a [[Sieve|sieve]] under cold water until it runs clear\n| Add the [[Rice|rice]] to a large pot of [[Boiling|boiling]] water and [[Boil|boil]] for about 12 minutes - drain and keep warm.\n| [[Poached eggs|Poach the eggs]].\n| In a small pan, gently saut\u00e9 the [[Onions|onions]] and [[Garlic|garlic]] in the [[Butter|butter]] for 5 minutes, don't allow it to colour.\n| Stir in the [[Curry powder|curry powder]].\n| Sprinkle the [[Flour|flour]] over the [[Onions|onions]], add the [[Milk|milk]] and stir until it thickens.\n| Season with [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]].\n| Place the sliced [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]] in the base of a serving dish, layer the [[Rice|rice]] next, top with the [[Poached eggs|poached eggs]] and then pour over the [[Curry|curry]] [[Sauce|sauce]].\n| Serve immediately from the dish.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with a [[Green salad|green salad]] or [[Vegetables|vegetables]] such as [[Broccoli|broccoli]] or [[Cauliflower|cauliflower]].\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Indian recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Egg recipes]]\n[[Category:Rice recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]][[Category:Poached]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#rice #poachedeggsindianstyle #poachedeggs #tomatoes #sauce #curry #currypowder #butter #onions #flour #plainflour </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Poached eggs",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=How to cook the perfect poached egg using only a saucepan recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#poachedeggs #fresheggs #salad #poached #saucepan \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Cooking the perfect poached egg is simple, just follow these very simple steps:\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 78\n|PortionCalories = 78\n|DatePublished=3rd November 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = 2 perfect poached eggs.  The ''huge'' one is a double-yolker from our [[Buying point of lay hens|girls]]\n|Servings = Serves 1\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime = 6 minutes\n|PrepTime = 3 minutes\n|CookTime = 3 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Poached egg in a saucepan double yolk.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"><span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Rustic looking!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.2</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Every one looks different!</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\">[[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nWhile you can make poached eggs using a purpose made egg poacher, it is just as easy to cook them using a normal [[saucepan]] or [[frying pan]].  The trick is to swirl the water vigorously first and then gently lower the egg into the centre of the pan using a ladle or a saucer.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1 Really fresh [[egg]], free-range if possible.\n| A pinch of [[sea salt]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| ''Don't attempt more than 2 eggs at a time in the same pan''\n| Fill a small frying pan about 4 cm (1.5\") with boiling water and lower heat to a simmer.\n| Add a pinch of [[sea salt]]\n| Break each egg into its own saucer\n| Slide each egg off the saucer into the water. Do both in a short space of time if you can\n| Wait 3 minutes...\n| Remove each egg with a slotted spoon\n| Allow each egg to drain properly, as soggy toast is horrible\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Poached egg in a saucepan gathering the white.jpg|The swirling water gathers up the white\nImage:Poached egg swirl the water.jpg|swirl the water with another spoon and then slip the egg into the middle of the pan\nImage:Perfect poached eggs recipe.jpg|Slide the egg off a saucer\n</gallery>\n===Chef's notes===\nDon't let the water boil, it will break up the egg white.\nDon't stir the water again.\nSkim the white residue if you wish.\n===Serving suggestions===\n* Serve with hot brown buttered toast, using only real butter.\n* Pat dry and refrigerate for later use in a [[salad]].\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Egg recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Student recipes]]\n[[Category:Poached]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#poachedeggs #fresheggs #salad #poached #saucepan </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Poached salmon with liquorice (TM)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Poached salmon with liquorice - A Thermomix recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#salmon #liquorice #mayonnaise #vanilla #cakes #asparagus #agar #blend #grapefruit #corianderseeds #oliveoil \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This has been adapted (and slightly simplified!) from a recipe by Heston Blumenthal and converted for making in a Thermomix\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}}\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 5834\n|PortionCalories = 1458\n|DatePublished=17th September 2014\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime = 2 hours 30 minutes\n|PrepTime = 2 hours\n|CookTime = 30 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Poached salmon with liquorice (TM).jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">No, no, no!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">1</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Sorry, not liquorice</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:NonLoggedInUser|NonLoggedInUser]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis has been adapted (and slightly simplified!) from a recipe by Heston Blumenthal and converted for making in a [[Thermomix]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredientsTM\n}}\n'''For the [[Liquorice|liquorice]] jelly'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 50g Haribo Pontefract [[Cakes]] (apparently, these work better)\n| 250g cold tap water\n| A further 50g cold tap water\n| 1 teaspoon [[Agar|agar]]-agar\n}}\n'''For the [[Vanilla|vanilla]] [[Mayonnaise|mayonnaise]]'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 1 large [[Egg yolk|egg yolk]]\n| 1 whole large [[Egg|egg]]\n| 15g [[Dijon Mustard|dijon mustard]]\n| 5g [[Salt|salt]]\n| 20g [[White wine vinegar|white wine vinegar]]\n| 3-4mls [[Vanilla extract|vanilla extract]]\n| 350g [[Groundnut|groundnut]] or any neutral [[Oil|oil]]\n}}\n'''For the [[Salmon|salmon]]'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 4 x 150g [[Salmon fillets|salmon fillets]], skin removed\n| [[Olive oil]]\n}}\n'''To serve'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 1 pink [[Grapefruit|grapefruit]], segmented\n| 12 [[Asparagus spears|asparagus spears]], cut into 3-4 pieces each\n| 20g [[Balsamic vinegar|balsamic vinegar]], reduced to 10g and cooled\n| A few [[Coriander seeds|coriander seeds]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Soak the Pontefract [[Cakes|cakes]] in the 250g cold tap water for a few hours until soft\n* Cook the [[Asparagus|asparagus]] in the internal [[Steaming|steaming]] basket with 500g water 10-12 minutes / Temp Varoma / Speed 1 and allow to cool\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n}}\n'''For the [[Liquorice|liquorice]] jelly'''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Put the Pontefract [[Cakes|cakes]] with the soaking water in the bowl and [[Blend|blend]] 10 seconds / Speed 8, then 3-4 minutes (until temperature is reached) / Speed 1 / 90\u00b0 C\n| Strain through a fine [[Sieve|sieve]] and reserve\n| Add the 50g cold tap water to the bowl and sprinkle the [[Agar|agar]]-agar over the top 3-4 minutes (until temperature is reached) / Speed 1 / 100\u00b0 C\n| Once it has got to 100\u00b0 C, wait until it has cooled to 90\u00b0 C, then 3 minutes / Speed 1 / 90\u00b0 C, by which time the [[Agar|agar]]-agar should have dissolve\n| Pour in the [[Liquorice|liquorice]] [[Stock|stock]] 3 minutes / Speed 1 / 90\u00b0 C\n| [[Blend]] 20 seconds / Speed 8 and remove bowl from the stand\n| Line a small [[Baking tray|baking tray]] with [[Cling-film|cling-film]] and pour the mixture into it\n| Leave in the [[Fridge|fridge]] to set\n}}\n'''For the [[Vanilla|vanilla]] [[Mayonnaise|mayonnaise]]'''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Put all the ingredients in the bowl, except the [[Oil|oil]], and mix 10 seconds / Speed 4.\n| With the MC on the lid, program Speed 4 and pour the [[Oil|oil]] onto the lid, little by little.\n| If the [[Mayonnaise|mayonnaise]] curdles, take it out of the bowl and without washing it add 50g hot water and at Speed 5, incorporate the [[Curdled|curdled]] mixture, little by little.\n}}\n'''For the [[Salmon|salmon]]'''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Add 1 litre water to the bowl\n| Place the [[Salmon|salmon]] in a dish in the bottom varoma basket and add enough [[Olive oil|olive oil]] just to cover the [[Fish|fish]] 20 minutes / 100\u00b0 C / Speed 3\n}}\n'''To serve'''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Mix the [[Asparagus|asparagus]] with the [[Grapefruit|grapefruit]] and dress with a little [[Oil|oil]] from the [[Salmon|salmon]]\n| Cut pieces of the [[Liquorice|liquorice]] jelly to fit the tops of the [[Salmon|salmon]] pieces.\n| Plate the [[Salmon|salmon]] with a piece of the [[Liquorice|liquorice]] jelly on top\n| Put 3 [[Coriander seeds|coriander seeds]] on top of the [[Liquorice|liquorice]]\n| Using a pipette, dot the plate with the reduced [[Balsamic vinegar|balsamic vinegar]]\n| Add spoonfuls of the [[Asparagus|asparagus]] mixture and serve with the [[Vanilla|vanilla]] [[Mayonnaise|mayonnaise]]\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Sea fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Thermomix recipes]]\n[[Category:Poached]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#salmon #liquorice #mayonnaise #vanilla #cakes #asparagus #agar #blend #grapefruit #corianderseeds #oliveoil </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Popcorn baked beans with sundried tomatoes",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Jamie Oliver's Popcorn baked beans with sun dried tomatoes recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#beans #sundriedtomatopaste #bakedbeans #tomatopuree #peppers #popcorn #popped #redpepper #unusualrecipes #frying #steam \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=These beans are not baked, they're popped like popcorn. Better than any tinned baked beans and only take 10 minutes from start to finish\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1557\n|PortionCalories = 778\n|DatePublished=9th November 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  10 minutes\n|PrepTime =  3 minutes\n|CookTime =  7 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Popcorn baked beans with sundried tomatoes recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Well I never!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.8</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">The oddest thing, but really good.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry]]</span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Morrisons mixed bean salad.jpg|300px|thumb|right|Morrisons' mixed bean salad]]\n\nWell these [[Beans|beans]] are not [[Baked|baked]], they're [[Popped|popped]], like [[Popcorn|popcorn]] but they taste better than any tinned [[Baked beans|baked beans]] and only take 10 minutes from start to finish.\n\nI got the idea of [[Frying|frying]] the [[Beans|beans]] from one of Jamie Oliver's 15 minute meal TV programs but instead of making a [[Salad|salad]] I wanted to make luxury [[Baked beans|baked beans]].\n\nThis is a brilliant recipe to mess about with and is ideal for using up odd leftovers.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 400g can of [[Mixed bean salad|mixed bean salad]]\n| 1 whole bottled [[Red pepper|red pepper]], chopped and 2 tablespoons of the [[Oil|oil]] from the jar\n| [[Freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Sundried tomato paste|sundried tomato paste]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Tomato puree|tomato puree]]\n| Pinch of [[Sea Salt|sea salt]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Drain the [[Beans|beans]] and rinse them a few times and allow them to drain well\n| Heat the [[Red pepper|red pepper]] [[Oil|oil]] in a large [[Frying pan|frying pan]] over a high heat\n| Add a pinch of [[Black pepper|black pepper]] to the [[Oil|oil]] and swill it around the pan\n| Get a cover for the pan as it will spit violently when you add the [[Beans|beans]]\n| Very carefully tip the [[Beans|beans]] into the [[Frying pan|frying pan]] and cover quickly\n| Jiggle the pan to keep the [[Beans|beans]] turning over, ideally while holding the cover an inch away from the pan so they don't start to [[Steam|steam]] yet\n| After a minute or so, the [[Beans|beans]] will pop like [[Popcorn|popcorn]], crisping the skins and revealing a fluffy core\n| Once most of the [[Beans|beans]] have [[Popped|popped]] and the pan has calmed down a little, stir in the  chopped [[Peppers|peppers]], [[Sundried tomato paste|sundried tomato paste]] and [[Tomato puree|tomato puree]]\n| Mix well, reduce the heat and cover and [[Simmer|simmer]] for 3 or 4 minutes\n| If they look too dry, add a splash of liquid.  You could use water, [[Stock|stock]] , [[Wine|wine]] or [[Beer|beer]].  I used a splash of Stella [[Lager|lager]] to loosen them\n| Serve immediately\n}}\n===Variations===\nUse any variety of canned [[Beans|beans]] and practically anything you can think of.  Bottled [[Peppers|peppers]] are good because they don't require any cooking, however you could add fresh peppers for a little crunch, finely [[Chopped spring onions|chopped spring onions]], chillies, oh the list is endless!\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:North American recipes]]\n[[Category:Tex-Mex recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Grain and bean recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#beans #sundriedtomatopaste #bakedbeans #tomatopuree #peppers #popcorn #popped #redpepper #unusualrecipes #frying #steam </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}
