I've used dried shiitake mushrooms as they are a great kitchen stand-by but fresh\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1869\n|PortionCalories = 934\n|DatePublished=2nd March 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Served with a few cream cheese stuffed peppers\n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  45 minutes\n|PrepTime =  35 minutes\n|CookTime =  10 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Pork, bean and pasta salad recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Yum!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Love those little stuffed peppers</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis healthy [[Salad|salad]] recipe is a great use for leftover [[Roast pork|roast pork]].\n\nI've used [[Dried|dried]] [[Shiitake mushrooms|shiitake mushrooms]] as they are a great kitchen stand-by but fresh [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]] of any type will do\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 150 g [[Dried pasta|dried pasta]] of your choice, I used [[Macaroni|macaroni]]\n| 200g cooked [[Roast pork|roast pork]], cubed\n| 1 cup of [[Dried|dried]] [[Shiitake mushrooms|shiitake mushrooms]]\n| 1 eating [[Apple|apple]], peeled, cored and chopped\n| A few [[Spring onions, chopped|spring onions, chopped]]\n| 1 tin of mixed [[Beans|beans]], thoroughly rinsed and drained\n}}\n'''dressing'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 2 tablespoons [[Cider vinegar|cider vinegar]]\n| 2 tablespoons of [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| A dash of [[Balsamic vinegar|balsamic vinegar]]\n| &#189; teaspoon [[Sugar|sugar]]\n| A pinch of [[Salt|salt]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* If using [[Dried mushrooms|dried mushrooms]], soak in [[Boiling|boiling]] water for 30 minutes, drain well then slice thinly\n\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Cook the pasta in salted boiling water as instructed on the packet. We have a comprehensive list of [[Pasta cooking times|pasta cooking times here]]\n| Drain well\n| Mix all of the ingredients together in a serving bowl\n| Whisk up the dressing ingredients and season to taste\n| Mix the dressing into the salad\n| Chill and serve\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pasta recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#porkbeanandpastasalad #shiitakemushrooms #dried #roastpork #balsamicvinegar #boiling #driedmushrooms #macaroni #miseenplace #favouriterecipes #oliveoil </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Porky-pig hot dogs",
                "revisions": [

title": "Pork and bean curry crumble",

                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Pork and bean curry crumble\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#suet #porkandbeancurrycrumble #pork #bakingpowder #beans #flour #currysauce #mashedpotatoes #dough #freeze #pie \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A very different, very good way to serve a curry!\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=1st June 2019\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  40 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime =  30 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 2488\n|PortionCalories = 1244\n|Image = [[Image:Pork and bean curry crumble recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">What !!!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Sounds mad, tasted fab!</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis is just an aide-memior for me so I can replicate this recipe easily.\n\nIt's 'constructed' from pre-made ingredients so the preparation times are a little inaccurate.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 portion of my [[Curry sauce|curry sauce]] for 2 people, about 500 grams\n| 2 small [[Pork|pork]] steaks, chopped - I've cooked them [[Sous-vide|sous-vide]] for 4 hours at 50\u00b0 C but they could probably go in raw if sliced thinly\n| 1 can of mixed [[Beans|beans]], rinsed and drained\n}}\n====crumble====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 105 g [[Suet|suet]]\n| 105 g [[Self-raising flour|self-raising flour]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Baking powder|baking powder]]\n| Pinch of [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]\n| 30g cold water\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your oven to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6), [fan oven 180\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Pork_and_bean_curry_crumble_covered.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Covered with suet crumble, ready to bake\nImage:Pork and bean curry crumble suet ready.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Crumble rolled out, make it no neater than this!\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Add the chopped [[Pork|pork]] to two [[Pie|pie]] dishes\n| Tip most of the mixed [[Beans|beans]] over the [[Pork|pork]].  I didn't use the full tin.  The remains [[Freeze|freeze]] well\n| Pour over enough [[Curry sauce|curry sauce]] to cover and mix well\n| Mix the [[Flour|flour]], [[Suet|suet]], [[Salt|salt]], [[Pepper|pepper]] and [[Baking powder|baking powder]]\n| Rub the [[Flour|flour]] and [[Suet|suet]] together until it starts to feel springy\n| Tip in the water (30g) and mix into a [[Dough|dough]]\n| Leave to [[Rest for|rest for]] 30 minutes then roll out to roughly cover the pic dishes\n| [[Bake]] for 30 minutes at 200\u00b0 C\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Green beans|green beans]] and [[Mashed potatoes|mashed potatoes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Irish recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Sous vide recipes]]\n[[Category:Sous vide cooking]]\n{{Template:Sous Vide, Smoking and Curing UK}}\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#suet #porkandbeancurrycrumble #pork #bakingpowder #beans #flour #currysauce #mashedpotatoes #dough #freeze #pie </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }

title": "Pork and beef sausage meat recipe",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Pork and beef sausage meat, a British recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#pork #meatmincer #burgers #sausages #freeze #beef #burger #porkshoulder #dried #egg #blackpepper \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This sausage meat recipe would be ideal for making your own sausages or burgers or for use in a stuffing recipe or force-meat recipe. It's fairly\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2625\n|PortionCalories = 328\n|DatePublished=25th September 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Mincing the meat\n |Servings = Serves 8 - Makes 750 g of [[pork]] and [[beef]] [[Sausage meat | sausage meat]]\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 15 minutes\n |PrepTime = 15 minutes\n |CookTime = None\n|Image = [[Image:Mincing the meat.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Simple and good</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.7</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Used to make this all the time, but now we live in a village with 3 artisan butchers, we have no need anymore!</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis [[Sausage meat | sausage meat]] recipe would be ideal for making your own [[Sausages|sausages]] or [[Burger|burgers]] or for use in a [[Stuffing|stuffing]] recipe or force-[[Meat|meat]] recipe.\n\nIt's fairly simple, and easy to adjust the quantities to suit your recipe.\n\nAlthough a [[meat mincer]] is the best tool for [[mincing]] the [[pork]], I find that a [[food processor]] with a sharp metal blade used in pulse-mode does the job equally well.  Just go easy or you can quickly turn the meat into paste!\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 250g [[beef stewing steak]], diced\n| 250g free-range or organic [[Pork shoulder|pork shoulder]]\n| 250g free-range or organic [[Pork belly|pork belly]]\n| 25g fine [[Dried|dried]] [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]] (optional)\n| &#189;  teaspoon [[Salt|salt]]\n| 16 [[Sage leaves|sage leaves]], finely chopped\n| [[Black pepper]]\n| &frac14; teaspoons of freshly [[Grated|grated]] [[Nutmeg|nutmeg]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Using a [[meat mincer]] or a food processor with a metal blade mince the stewing steak, pork shoulder and pork belly to your desired consistency.\n| Add all of the ingredients to a large bowl.\n| Using clean hands mix the ingredients really well.\n| Use to make [[Sausages|sausages]], [[Burgers|burgers]] or [[Freeze|freeze]] for later use.\n}}\n===Chef's notes===\nIf you are going to make [[Burgers|burgers]], add a beaten [[Egg|egg]] at the mixing stage to bind the [[Sausagemeat|sausagemeat]] together.\n{{Template:ThinkPig}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n\n[[Category:Uncooked]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#pork #meatmincer #burgers #sausages #freeze #beef #burger #porkshoulder #dried #egg #blackpepper </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }

title": "Pork and peas",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Pork and peas, a one pot recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#passThePeas #pork #ghee #parsley #porkshoulder #cider #chickenstock #chili #spicy #casserole #recipe\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=An easy winter pork shoulder casserole, with peas!\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=16th October 2021\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Slow cooked, with egg noodles\n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  1 hour, 15 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  1 hour\n|TotalCalories = 3286\n|PortionCalories = 821\n|Image = [[Image:Pork and peas recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">  <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Lovely flavours, too tough!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">2</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I would slow cook this next time.  It was lovely but very chewy.  3hours in the slow-cooker would be much better.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\">[[User:Chef|Jerry]] </span></span>\n}}\nA nice wintery [[Casserole dish|casserole dish]] that's really simple to make to your own personal taste.  Leave out what you don't like and add what you fancy.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 kg boneless [[Pork shoulder|pork shoulder]] cut into 1 cm (1/2\" cubes)\n| 275g / 10 oz [[Frozen peas|frozen peas]]\n| 15g / &#189; oz [[Lard|lard]], [[Ghee|ghee]] or [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| A good pinch of [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 1 large [[Onion|onion]], peeled and chopped\n| 3 [[Cloves of Garlic, peeled and crushed|cloves of garlic, peeled and crushed]]\n| 1 tablespoon of [[Smoked Paprika|smoked paprika]]\n| &#188; teaspoon [[Chilli powder|chilli powder]]\n| 125 ml / 4 fl oz [[Chicken stock|chicken stock]]\n| 75 ml [[Cider|cider]]\n| 2 tablespoons freshly chopped [[Parsley|parsley]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Heat the [[Lard|lard]], [[Oil|oil]] or [[Ghee|ghee]] in a large [[Frying pan|frying pan]] and add the [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n| [[Stir-fry]] the [[Pork|pork]] cubes for 5 minutes until lightly [[Browned|browned]], remove and keep to one side\n| Add the [[Onions|onions]] and [[Garlic|garlic]] and [[Stir-fry|stir-fry]] for another 5 minutes\n| Add the [[Pork|pork]] back to the pan and shake over the [[Dry|dry]] [[Spices|spices]] and toss the pork to coat evenly\n| Add the [[Chicken stock|chicken stock]] and [[Cider|cider]], cover and [[Simmer|simmer]] for 40 minutes, or until the [[Pork|pork]] is cooked\n| Add the frozen [[Peas|peas]] and chopped [[Parsley|parsley]] stir in and cook for the final 10 minutes, no need to defrost them\n| Taste for seasoning and serve\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:FryingOffPork.jpg|Frying off the pork shoulder cubes, (half recipe quantity)\nImage:Pork and peas, the ingredients.jpg|The ingredients, (half recipe quantity)\nImage:Spiced pork shoulder.jpg|Pork shoulder, tossed in the spices, (half recipe quantity)\n</gallery>\n===Chef's notes===\nThe pork shoulder was too tough cooked in this manner, far better to slow cook for two or 3 hours to break up the tough tissues.  Another solution would be to [[mince]] the [[pork shoulder]] first.\n===Variations ===\nI made this for two, using half the meat but the other ingredients were left mostly the same; more gravy, pass the peas!\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe over [[Egg noodles|egg noodles]] and [[Vegetables|vegetables]] of your choosing\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Cooking with beer]]\n[[Category:Chilli pepper recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#passThePeas #pork #ghee #parsley #porkshoulder #cider #chickenstock #chili #spicy #casserole #recipe</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }

title": "Pork and strawberry salad with grilled halloumi cheese",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Pork and strawberry salad with grilled halloumi cheese recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#strawberries #oliveoil #basil #halloumi #zest #porkandstrawberrysaladwithgrilledhalloumicheese #fry #salad #juice #lime #spanish \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=The idea for this recipe came from Jamie Olivers Jamie at Home. Ive often used fruit in savoury recipes but never with strawberries. They have a..\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=7th August 2016\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  55 minutes\n|PrepTime =  45 minutes\n|CookTime =  10 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 805\n|PortionCalories = 402\n|Image = [[Image:Pork and strawberry salad with grilled halloumi cheese.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Glorious</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I cannot wait for strawberry season to begin again</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n\nThe idea for this recipe came from Jamie Oliver's ''Jamie at Home''.  I've often used [[Fruit|fruit]] in  savoury recipes but never with [[Strawberries|strawberries]].  They have a fantastic flavour and just the right amount of tartness to cut a fatty meat such as [[pork]].\n\nAs it's August, Morrison's (and probably every other supermarket) has [[Strawberries|strawberries]] on special offer - 2 x 400g cartons of British strawberries for \u00a33.00 so what you don't use in this recipe you can enjoy with a dollop of [[Soured cream|soured cream]] as a sweet.\n\n''Most of the preparation time is spent in allowing the cooked ingredients to cool''.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 200g fresh [[strawberries]]\n| 2 tablespoons [[Balsamic vinegar|balsamic vinegar]] (or [[Balsamic|balsamic]] glaze)\n| [[Juice]] and [[Zest|zest]] of 1 [[Lime|lime]]\n| 1 small [[Basil|basil]] plant (supermarket-type)\n| 5 tablespoons of [[Extra virgin Olive oil|extra virgin olive oil]]\n| 200g [[Halloumi cheese|halloumi cheese]], sliced to 5mm\n| 10 fresh [[Mint leaves|mint leaves]], finely chopped\n| A small bag of tender [[Salad|salad]] leaves\n| 1 small red onion, peeled and very thinly sliced\n| 120g selection of continental [[Meats|meats]] (eg: Morrisons '[[Spanish]] Platter')\n| [[Salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:The easy way to remove the peduncle from a strawberry.jpg|300px|thumb|right|The easiest way I've found to remove the peduncle (''petiole'') from a strawberry is with a pair of long-nosed pliers\nImage:Morrison's Spanish Platter.jpg|300px|thumb|right|Morrison's Spanish platter (120g - \u00a32)\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Pick most of the [[Basil leaves|basil leaves]] and gently [[Fry|fry]] for 5 minutes in 5 tablespoons of [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| Allow to cool and drain the [[Oil|oil]] in a [[Sieve|sieve]] and discard the leaves\n| [[Fry]] the sliced [[Halloumi|halloumi]] in a [[Frying pan|frying pan]] or [[Griddle|griddle]] tray for 2 minutes a side, moistening the pan with a smear of [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| Remove the [[Cheese|cheese]] allow to cool, then chop into smaller slices\n| De-hull the [[Strawberries|strawberries]] (my long-nosed plier tip works brilliantly on strawberries that are not over-ripe).  Cut the strawberries into thin slices. \n| When the [[Basil|basil]] infused [[Oil|oil]] has cooled, mix it with the [[Juice|juice]] and [[Zest|zest]] of 1 [[Lime|lime]] and a pinch of [[Salt|salt]] and [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n| Add the [[Strawberries|strawberries]] and the [[Oil|oil]] to a bowl and leave them until you are ready to put the dish together.  Drain and reserve the [[Strawberry|strawberry]]/[[Basil|basil]] oil to use a a final dressing.\n| With the cold sliced [[Halloumi|halloumi]] as a base, build the [[Salad|salad]] in layers with the salad leaves, mint leaves, sliced onions, Spanish meats and the remaining fresh basil leaves. Finally drizzle with the flavoured [[Olive oil|olive oil]].\n| This dish was fantastic, I loved the idea so much that some more [[Strawberries|strawberries]] have already been bought to go with Sunday's [[Roast pork|roast pork]]!\n}}\n===Variations===\nThis would make a brilliant [[Starter|starter]] and an impressive anti-pasta dish.\n\nMake a spicy version; use [[Hugh's fried halloumi]].\n{{SeeAlso-HalloumiRecipes}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Spanish recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Salad recipes]]\n[[Category:Grilled, griddled or barbecued]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#strawberries #oliveoil #basil #halloumi #zest #porkandstrawberrysaladwithgrilledhalloumicheese #fry #salad #juice #lime #spanish </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Pork chops with a creamy Philadelphia mustard sauce",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Pork chops with a creamy Philadelphia mustard sauce recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#porkchopswithacreamyphiladelphiamustardsauce #greenbeans #mashedpotato #mustard #philadelphialight #margarine #dijonmustard #porkchops #potatoes #recipesfromothersites #pork \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Philadelphia Light is a great shortcut to a creamy low calorie sauce to accompany pork chops\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 3211\n|PortionCalories = 802\n|DatePublished=27th April 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  20 minutes\n|PrepTime =  5 minutes\n|CookTime =  15 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Pork chops with a creamy Philadelphia mustard sauce recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Even the oink is creamy</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.1</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Better than it sounds, lovely and creamy.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Philadelphia Light]] is a great shortcut to a creamy low calorie sauce to accompany pork chops.\n\n{{PhiladelphiaPermission}}\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 tablespoon [[Oil|oil]]\n| 4 [[Pork chops|pork chops]]\n| 120 g Philadelphia Light\n| 3 tablespoons [[Milk|milk]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Dijon Mustard|dijon mustard]]\n| 800 g [[Mash|mash]] [[Potatoes|potatoes]] with [[Margarine|margarine]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Heat the [[Oil|oil]] in a large [[Frying pan|frying pan]] and [[Fry|fry]] the chops on both sides for approx. 10 minutes until [[Browned|browned]] and juices run clear when tested with a sharp knife.\n| Reduce the heat, add the Philly, [[Milk|milk]] and [[Mustard|mustard]]. Stir well to combine.\n| Serve with [[Mashed potato|mashed potato]] and [[Green beans|green beans]].\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Mashed potato|mashed potato]] and [[Green beans|green beans]].\n===Recipe source===\n\n* [http://www.philadelphia.co.uk/philadelphia3/page?siteid=philadelphia3-prd&locale=uken1&PagecRef=609&rid=38663 The Philadelphia recipe website]\n\n===Chef's notes===\nFollow the [[RSPCA Think Pig Checklist]] to make sure that your [[Pork|pork]] has come from pigs that have been reared to higher welfare standards.\n\n* http://bit.ly/rspcathinkpig\n==See also==\n* [[Safe minimum cooking temperatures]]\n{{OtherRecipes Philadelphia Light}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Philadelphia recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n[[Category:Cookery cheats]]\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#porkchopswithacreamyphiladelphiamustardsauce #greenbeans #mashedpotato #mustard #philadelphialight #margarine #dijonmustard #porkchops #potatoes #recipesfromothersites #pork </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Pork fillet, apple and sweet potato bake",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Pork fillet, apple and sweet potato bake a fruit recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#porkfilletappleandsweetpotatobake #porkfillet #potatoes #cider #sweetpotato #fry #oliveoil #sweetpotatoes #mash #butter #miseenplace \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This is a small variation on pork sausage and apple pie\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1420\n|PortionCalories = 710\n|DatePublished=2nd August 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime = 1 hour 20 minutes\n|PrepTime = 20 minutes\n|CookTime = 1 hour\n|Image = [[Image:Pork fillet, apple and sweet potato bake.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Sorry</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">2</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I still prefer this with proper potatoes \ud83e\udd12</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The&nbsp;Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Pork fillet, apple and sweet potato bake out of the oven.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Fresh out of the oven]]\nThis is a small variation on [[Pork sausage and apple pie|pork sausage and apple pie]]. The only difference being that we used a small [[pork fillet]] and used half [[sweet potato]] and half normal potatoes for the mash. \n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| Dash of [[olive oil]]\n| 250g [[pork fillet]] [10 oz]\n| 1 [[leek]], halved along its length and cut into slices.\n| 2 cloves garlic, peeled and crushed.\n| 225g mashing [[potatoes]] such as Nadine, Saxon, Wilja, Desiree or King Edward, peeled and quartered\n| 225g [[sweet potato]], peeled and cut into slices\n| 25 g (1 oz) [[Butter]]\n| 200 ml (.42 pint) dry [[cider]] \n| 1 tablespoon [[plain flour]]\n| &#189; teaspoon [[mustard powder]] or 1 heaped teaspoon of [[taco-mix]]\n| 1 large cooking [[apple]], peeled, cored and cut into very thin rings\n| [[Sea salt]] and [[freshly ground black pepper]]\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the [[oven]] to  204\u00b0 C\t(400\u00b0 F - Gas 6)\n\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Cut the [[pork fillet]] into small slices\n| [[Fry]] the [[pork fillet]] slices in a little [[olive oil]] for 5 minutes\n| Add the leeks and [[Fry]] for another 4 minutes\n| Add the crushed garlic and stir fry for a minute of so\n| Add the mustard or your choice of spices to the flour and sprinkle over the pork and leeks.\n| Stir well to distribute the flour evenly\n| [[Deglaze]] the pan with the [[cider]]\n| Season with a pinch of salt and pepper.\n| Meanwhile, [[boil]] the [[potatoes]] and [[sweet potatoes]] in lightly [[salted]] water until they are soft and can be pierced easily with a fork\n| [[Mash]] the [[sweet potatoes]] and the [[potatoes]] together in the same bowl and add the [[butter]] and [[salt]] and [[pepper]] to taste\n| Layer half of the apple rings i=onto the base of an oven proof dish\n| Pour the pork mixture over the top\n| Layer the remaining apple on top of the pork mixture, top with [[mash]] [[potato]] and decorate with the tines of a fork\n| [[Bake]] in the oven for 1 hour minutes\n}}\n===Serving suggestion===\n\nServe hot with a green vegetable such as [[broccoli]] or [[peas]]..\n\n===Chef's notes===\n\nIf the [[leeks]] are large and a little 'tired', freshen them by [[blanching]] them in boiling water for 3 minutes-this stops them drying out whilst they are being saut\u00e9ed.\n\n{{Template:ThinkPig}}\n==See also==\n* [[Shepherds' pie recipes|other shepherds' pie recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes]]\n[[Category:Pies tarts and flans]]\n[[Category:British #porkfillet #potatoes #cider #sweetpotato #fry #oliveoil #sweetpotatoes #mash #butter #miseenplace </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }

title": "Pork honey and mustard sausages with jacket potatoes and baked beans",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Pork honey and mustard sausages with jacket potatoes and baked beans recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#sausages #bakedbeans #potatoes #bake #porkhoneyandmustardsausageswithjacketpotatoesandbakedbeans #onions #chilisauce #favouriterecipes #miseenplace #chillisauce #bakingtray \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=There are a couple of tricks to turn this from a standard meal, to a very special occasion\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 863\n|PortionCalories = 431\n|DatePublished=5th November 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Not a pretty photo - I was in too much of a hurry to eat this!\n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  5 hours, 35 minutes\n|PrepTime =  4 hours, 5 minutes\n|CookTime =  1 hour, 30 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Pork honey and mustard sausages with jacket potatoes and baked beans recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Simple is best...</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">...and it doesn't get better or simpler than this!</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nNot a very adventurous meal, but a damned good one, none the less.\n\nA couple of tricks to turn this from a 'standard meal', to a special occasion\n\n* Use high quality specialist [[Sausages|sausages]]\n\n* Prepare the [[Baked potatoes|baked potatoes]] so the skins are hard and crunchy\n\n* Add lots of [[Chili sauce|chili sauce]] to your [[Baked beans|baked beans]]!\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 pack of high quality specialist [[Sausages|sausages]] - see [[Chef's notes|chef's notes]] below\n| 1 [[Onion|onion]], peeled and roughly chopped\n| A [[Hand|hand]] full of [[Fresh herbs|fresh herbs]] - [[Sage|sage]] is ideal\n| [[Freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 2 large [[Baking|baking]] [[Potatoes|potatoes]]\n| 1 415g can of [[Baked beans|baked beans]]\n| [[Chilli sauce]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Prepare your [[Jacket potatoes|jacket potatoes]] by [[Salting|salting]] them for 4 hours - instructions are here.  This gives you a [[Rock|rock]] hard, crunchy skin as you can see from the photo.\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6), [fan oven 180\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| [[Bake]] the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] in the middle to the top of the [[Oven|oven]] for about 1 hour 15 minutes.\n| Add a tiny splash of [[Olive oil|olive oil]] to a small [[Baking tray|baking tray]]\n| Arrange the chopped [[Onions|onions]] in the base of the baking tray\n| Spread the [[Herbs|herbs]] out evenly and place the [[Sausages|sausages]] on the herby [[Onions|onions]] and sprinkle with [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| After the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] have been cooking for about 45 minutes, pop the [[Sausages|sausages]] in the in the middle of the [[Oven|oven]] and [[Bake|bake]] for 30 minutes, turning once.\n| [[Microwave]] the [[Baked beans|baked beans]] for 2 to 3 minutes, stir in your favourite [[Chili sauce|chili sauce]] and serve.\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Oven cooked sausages.jpg|thumb|300px|right|30 minutes: Done!\nImage:Cooking sausages in the oven.jpg|thumb|300px|right|200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6) - middle of the oven - turn once\n</gallery>\n===Chef's notes===\n* [[Gourmet sausage maker - Bexley]] - the sausages used were the pork honey and mustard - fabulous!\n* [[DebbieandAndrews.co.uk|Debbie & Andrew's sausages]]\n* [[Baked potatoes|How to make '''very''' special baked potatoes]]\n* [[Chili pepper sauce|A very good selection of chili sauce recipes]]\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Microwaved]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#sausages #bakedbeans #potatoes #bake #porkhoneyandmustardsausageswithjacketpotatoesandbakedbeans #onions #chilisauce #favouriterecipes #miseenplace #chillisauce #bakingtray </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Pork London broil with a creamy mushroom and cucumber sauce",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Pork London broil with a creamy mushroom and cucumber sauce recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#porklondonbroilwithacreamymushroomandcucumbersauce #butter #mushrooms #cucumber #blackpepper #rice #dried #dill #londonbroil #doublecream #peas \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=I've added this odd sounding recipe as an aide-memoir for myself, so it can be easily repeated.  It sounds very strange but the combination worked brilliantly\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2137\n|PortionCalories = 534\n|DatePublished=28th August 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  25 minutes\n|PrepTime =  5 minutes\n|CookTime =  20 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Pork London broil with a creamy mushroom and cucumber sauce recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">The Best Sauce!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Unusual, and unforgettable.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nI've added this odd sounding recipe as an aide-memoir for myself, so it can be easily repeated.  It sounds very strange but the combination worked brilliantly.  The sauce is based on [[Mushrooms in a cucumber sauce|mushrooms in a cucumber sauce]], with added [[double cream]].  The [[London broil]] marinade was just a rather successful experiment. Although [[London broil]] is usually associated with beef, this worked really well with a pork fillet - even better because it was barbecued, creating a smoky, crisp finish, but remaining tender inside.\n\n\n'''Mushroom and cucumber sauce'''\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| A good grind of [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n| 50g [2 oz] [[Butter|butter]]\n| 110 g [4 oz] of oyster [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]], wiped clean and chopped\n| 1 tablespoon [15 ml] [[Plain flour|plain flour]]\n| Half a [[Cucumber|cucumber]], de-seeded, peeled and cubed\n| 150 ml [1/4 pint] hot [[Vegetable Stock|vegetable stock]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Dried|dried]] [[Dill|dill]]\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] to taste\n| 150 ml [[double cream]]\n}}\n'''London broil pork fillet'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 300g [[Pork tenderloin fillet]], sliced into 2 pieces lengthways\n| 4 tablespoons of orange juice\n| 2 tablespoons of [[dark soy sauce]]\n| 2 tablespoons of [[light soy sauce]]\n| 2 tablespoons of [[Worcestershire sauce]]\n| 2 tablespoons of [[sherry vinegar]]\n| Pinch of [[black pepper]]\n| Pinch of [[chilli powder]]\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\nAdd the pork fillet and the marinade ingredients to a [[Lock and Lock]] box, close the lid and shake well to coat evenly. Refrigerate for up to 12 hours, turning and shaking now and then if you are able.\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Add a good grind of [[Black pepper|black pepper]] to a small saucepan and melt the [[Butter|butter]]\n| [[Saut\u00e9]] the [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]] in the [[Butter|butter]] for 4 minutes, turning often\n| Add the cubed [[Cucumber|cucumber]] cubes and cook until they visibly 'wilt', about 5 minutes, stirring now and then\n| Make a [[Roux|roux]] by sprinkling  the [[Flour|flour]] over the buttery [[Cucumber|cucumber]] and [[mushrooms]] and mix well so all the [[Fat|fat]] is absorbed\n| Add the [[Dried|dried]] [[Dill|dill]] and hot [[Stock|stock]] and [[Blend|blend]] into a [[Sauce|sauce]]\n| Bring to the [[Boil|boil]] and then reduce and [[Simmer|simmer]] for 10 minutes\n| Stir in the double cream and heat gently - don't allow it to boil or the cream will 'split'\n}}\n'''London broil pork fillet'''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Drain the pork fillets and discard the marinade\n| Barbecue or grill over a fairly high heat for about 5 minutes per side\n| Check the [[meat is properly cooked]]\n| Serve\n}}\n\n===Serving suggestion===\nWe had this with [[rice]], it might be nice to add a few [[peas]] or [[beans]] to the [[rice]], just for a little colour.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:North American recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Barbecue recipes]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n[[Category:Grilled, griddled or barbecued]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#porklondonbroilwithacreamymushroomandcucumbersauce #butter #mushrooms #cucumber #blackpepper #rice #dried #dill #londonbroil #doublecream #peas </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Pork sausage and apple pie",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<sub>Subscript text</sub><!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Pork sausage and apple pie, a fruit recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#porksausageandapplepie #leeks #cider #apple #potatoes #sausages #mash #oliveoil #butter #pork #fry \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This pork sausage and apple shepherds pie was created from what happened to be about on the day\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1449\n|PortionCalories = 724\n|DatePublished=20th January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime = 1 hour 20 minutes\n|PrepTime = 20 minutes\n|CookTime = 1 hour\n|Image = [[Image:Pork sausage and apple pie recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">What's not to like?</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Sheep's pie - gotta be the best ever.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis [[pork]] [[sausage]] and [[apple]] `shepherds pie' was created from what happened to be about on the day.  It was a brilliant success and will definitely be made again.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| Dash of [[olive oil]]\n| 4 large [[pork]] [[sausages]]\n| 1 [[leek]], halved along its length and then chopped into slices\n| 450 g (1 lb) good mashing [[potatoes]] such as Nadine, Saxon, Wilja, Desiree or King Edward, peeled and quartered\n| 25 g (1 oz) [[Butter]]\n| 200 ml (.42 pint) dry [[cider]] \n| 1 tablespoon [[plain flour]]\n| &#189; teaspoon [[mustard powder]]\n| 1 large cooking [[apple]], peeled, cored and cut into thin rings\n| [[Sea salt]] and [[freshly ground black pepper]]\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the [[oven]] to  204\u00b0 C\t(400\u00b0 F - Gas 6)\n\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| [[Fry]] the [[sausages]] in a little [[olive oil]] for 10 minutes, reserve and keep warm\n| [[Fry]] the [[leeks]] in the same pan until tender\n| [[Deglaze]] the pan with the [[cider]]\n| Add the [[mustard powder]] to the [[flour]] and whisk into the [[cider]] and [[leeks]], season with [[salt]] and [[pepper]]\n| Meanwhile, [[boil]] the [[potatoes]] in lightly [[salted]] water until they are soft and can be pierced easily with a fork\n| [[Mash]] the [[potatoes]] and add the [[butter]] and [[salt]] and [[pepper]] to taste\n| Pour the [[Cider]] and [[leeks]] into an oven proof dish\n| Lay the sausages on top of the [[leeks]]\n| Make a layer of [[apple]] rings on top of the sausages\n| Top with [[mash]] [[potato]] and decorate with the tines of a fork\n| [[Bake]] in the oven for 1 hour\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Pork sausage and apple pie layering apples.jpg|thumb|300px|right\nImage:Pork sausage and apple pie ingredients.jpg|thumb|300px|right\n</gallery>\n===Serving suggestion===\n\nServe hot with a green vegetable such as [[broccoli]].\n\n===Chef's notes===\n\nIf the [[leeks]] are large and a little 'tired', freshen them by [[blanching]] them in boiling water for 3 minutes-this stops them drying out whilst they are being saut\u00e9d.\n\n{{Template:ThinkPig}}\n==See also==\n* [[Shepherds' pie recipes|other shepherds' pie recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes]]\n[[Category:Pies tarts and flans]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#porksausageandapplepie #leeks #cider #apple #potatoes #sausages #mash #oliveoil #butter #pork #fry </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Pork sausage meat recipe",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Pork sausage meat, a British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#sausagemeat #sausages #burgers #meatmincer #pork #porkshoulder #dried #sageleaves #burger #nutmeg #breadcrumbs \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This recipe would be ideal for making your own sausages or burgers or for use in a stuffing recipe or force-meat recipe\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2673\n|PortionCalories = 334\n|DatePublished=25th September 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Mincing the meat\n |Servings = Serves 8 - Makes 750 g of [[Pork|pork]] [[Sausagemeat|sausagemeat]]\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 15 minutes\n |PrepTime = 15 minutes\n |CookTime = None\n|Image = [[Image:Mincing the meat.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Easy sausages</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.6</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">This method makes great sausage meat really quickly, just don't overdo it if you're using a food processor with a blade.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis [[Sausagemeat|sausagemeat]] recipe would be ideal for making your own [[Sausages|sausages]] or [[Burger|burgers]] or for use in a [[Stuffing|stuffing]] recipe or force-[[Meat|meat]] recipe.\n\nIt's fairly simple, and easy to adjust the quantities to suit your recipe.\n\nAlthough a [[meat mincer]] is the best tool for [[mincing]] the [[pork]], I find that a [[food processor]] with a sharp metal blade used in pulse-mode does the job equally well.  Just go easy or you can quickly turn the meat into paste!\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 500g free-range or organic [[Pork shoulder|pork shoulder]]\n| 250g free-range or organic [[Pork belly|pork belly]]\n| 25g fine [[Dried|dried]] [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]] (optional)\n| &#189;  teaspoon [[Salt|salt]]\n| 16 [[Sage leaves|sage leaves]], finely chopped\n| [[Black pepper]]\n| &frac14; teaspoons of freshly [[Grated|grated]] [[Nutmeg|nutmeg]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Using a [[meat mincer]] or a food processor with a metal blade mince the pork shoulder and pork belly to your desired consistency.\n| Add all of the ingredients to a large bowl.\n| Using clean hands mix the ingredients really well.\n| Use to make [[Sausages|sausages]], [[Burgers|burgers]] or [[Freeze|freeze]] for later use.\n}}\n===Chef's notes===\nIf you are going to make [[Burgers|burgers]], add a beaten [[Egg|egg]] at the mixing stage to bind the [[Sausagemeat|sausagemeat]] together.\n{{Template:ThinkPig}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n\n[[Category:Uncooked]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#sausagemeat #sausages #burgers #meatmincer #pork #porkshoulder #dried #sageleaves #burger #nutmeg #breadcrumbs </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Pork steaks with apples, sage and cider",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Pork steaks with apples, sage and cider a fruit recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#porksteakswithapplessageandcider #shallots #cider #sage #apples #apple #mashedpotatoes #miseenplace #greenvegetable #wok #sageleaves \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This autumnal recipe is pretty quick to prepare and cook and will be a pork lovers firm favourite and is a good way to use up those excess apples\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2209\n|PortionCalories = 552\n|DatePublished=31st October 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Pork steaks with apples, sage and cider served with squash, bubble and squeak\n |Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 1 hour\n |PrepTime = 15 minutes\n |CookTime = 45 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Pork steaks with apples, sage and cider recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">It's now Autumn - lets go!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I can see most of the ingredients growing from my office window today!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The&nbsp;Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis autumnal recipe is pretty quick to prepare and cook and will be a [[Pork|pork]] lovers firm favourite and is a good way to use up those excess [[Apples|apples]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1 tablespoon [[Olive oil]]\n| 4 boneless [[Pork loin|pork loin]] steaks\n| 250 g [[Shallots|shallots]], peeled but not chopped\n| 1 medium [[Cooking apple|cooking apple]]\n| 1 medium red-skinned eating [[Apple|apple]]\n| 300 ml good quality [[Cider|cider]]\n| 2 tablespoons of fresh [[Sage leaves|sage leaves]], chopped (''about 14 leaves'')\n| [[Sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Peel, core and cut each [[Apple|apple]] into 8 slices\n* Leave the \n[[shallots]] [[blanching]] in just boiled water for 3 minutes then  top, tail and peel them.\n\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Pork steaks with apples, sage and cider cooked.jpg|Cooking complete\nImage:Pork steaks browned, ready to stew.jpg|Browned steaks, ready to stew\nImage:Pork steaks, apples, sage and cider.jpg|Every ingredient a perfect match!\nImage:How to peel shallots.jpg|Blanche in boiling water for 3 minutes then top, tail and peel them\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Heat the [[Oil|oil]] in a [[Wok|wok]] or large [[Frying pan|frying pan]] and cook the steaks for 5 minutes per side.  They should be lightly [[Browned|browned]].\n| Add the [[Shallots|shallots]] and [[Stir-fry|stir-fry]] for another 6 minutes.\n| Drain any excess fat.\n| Add the [[Apples|apples]], [[Sage|sage]] and [[Cider|cider]], stir well and season to taste.\n| [[Simmer]] vigorously for 25 to 30 minutes or until the apples have broken down into the sauce.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Mashed potatoes|mashed potatoes]] or [[Squash mash|squash mash]] and a [[Green vegetable|green vegetable]].\n\nWe're going to try this with [[Squash, bubble and squeak]].\n===Chef's notes===\nAlthough 14 [[sage]] leaves sounds an awful lot, it probably could have had more as the flavour was not prevalent.\n{{Template:ThinkPig}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Cooking with beer]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n[[Category:Stir fried]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#porksteakswithapplessageandcider #shallots #cider #sage #apples #apple #mashedpotatoes #miseenplace #greenvegetable #wok #sageleaves </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Portobello mushroom burger",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Portobello mushroom burger, British recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#mushrooms #portobellomushroomburger #garlic #ciabatta #tomato #sauce #olive #lettuce #lightsoy #soy #grilled \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=An excellent vegetarian substitute for a standard meat-based burger. This recipe is simple and delicious\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 708\n|PortionCalories = 177\n|DatePublished=21st January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime = 30 minutes\n|PrepTime = 20 minutes\n|CookTime = 10 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Portobello mushroom burger recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Who would know?</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Looks like a normal burger and tasted fabulous.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nAn excellent vegetarian substitute for a standard [[Meat|meat]]-based burger.  This recipe is simple and delicious.\n[[Image:Portobello mushroom marinade.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Mushrooms marinading]]\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 4 large [[Portobello mushrooms]] or large field [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]]\n| 30m (l/2) tablespoon [[Olive|olive]] [[Oil|oil]]\n| 1 [[Clove|clove]] [[Garlic|garlic]], crushed\n| Splash of [[Light soy|light soy]] [[Sauce|sauce]]\n| Ground [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n| 4 crusty [[Ciabatta|ciabatta]] rolls\n| 4 Crisp [[Lettuce|lettuce]] leaves\n| 1 Large [[tomato]], sliced\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Place the [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]] in shallow dish, add the [[Olive|olive]] [[Oil|oil]], Crushed [[Garlic|garlic]], [[Soy|soy]] [[Sauce|sauce]] and seasoning and toss until the mushrooms are evenly coated. Leave to marinate for at least 15 minutes.\n| Cook the [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]] on a lightly oiled griddle pan for 8-10 minutes, turning once.\n| Test for tenderness with a skewer.\n| Rest the [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]] on a plate for 5 minutes, gill sides down.\n| Toast the [[Ciabatta|ciabatta]] rolls and fill with [[Lettuce|lettuce]], [[Tomato|tomato]] and top with the [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]].\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\n\nGo the whole way healthy and try this with a simple salad and [[beetroot rosti]].\n\n===Variations===\n\nPlace a thin slice of [[Cheese|cheese]] on the [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]] for the last minutes of cooking and let it melt whilst they are resting.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Mushroom]]\n[[Category:Main courses|Mushroom]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes|Mushroom]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes|Mushroom]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Student recipes]]\n[[Category:Grilled, griddled or barbecued]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#mushrooms #portobellomushroomburger #garlic #ciabatta #tomato #sauce #olive #lettuce #lightsoy #soy #grilled </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Potato, cheese and bacon pie a cheese recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#bacon #potatoes #potatocheeseandbaconpie #cheese #baking #butter #miseenplace #grated #bake #potato #gruyerecheese \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Potato, cheese and bacon pie British Cheese and potato recipes\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2371\n|PortionCalories = 592\n|DatePublished=20th January 2013\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 1 hour 10 minutes\n |PrepTime = 10 minutes\n |CookTime = 1 hour\n |Image = [[Image:Potato, cheese and bacon pie recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Tasty</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">This was nice cold, sliced thinly.</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]] </span></span>\n}}\n\n{{FindAlbertBartlett}}\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1kg of Bartlett Rooster potatoes peeled & thinly sliced \n| 15g Melted [[Butter|butter]] \n| 200g Thinly sliced streaky [[Bacon|bacon]] \n| 100g [[Grated]] [[Gruyere cheese]] \n| [[Salt]] & [[Pepper|pepper]] to taste\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* You will need a 9 inch ovenproof [[Baking|baking]] dish preferably non-stick. \n* Preheat [[Oven|oven]] to 425\u00b0F/220\u00b0C or Gas mark 7.\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| [[Butter]] the [[Baking|baking]] dish, arrange the [[Bacon|bacon]] onto the bottom and sides of the pan. \n| Allow the [[Bacon|bacon]] to slightly overhang the edge of the dish.\n| Wash the sliced [[Potatoes|potatoes]] and dry in a towel.\n| Arrange 1/3 of the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] onto the [[Bacon|bacon]] and sprinkle with 1/3 of the [[Cheese|cheese]]. \n| Repeat, creating two additional layers of [[Potato|potato]] and [[Cheese|cheese]]. \n| Fold the overhanging [[Bacon|bacon]] onto the [[Potatoes|potatoes]].\n| [[Bake]] uncovered for 50 minutes, test the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] are cooked by piercing them with a knife.\n}}\n\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Albert title": "Potato, cheese and garlic bake",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Potato, cheese and garlic bake a cheese recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#potatocheeseandgarlicbake #cheese #butter #potato #garlic #breadcrumbs #baking #cheeses #cornishquartzcheese #potatoes #ricer \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This recipe has been adapted from Mrs Maureen Kirkland's recipe for Cheese Pie which appears in The Hairy Bikers' book, Mum's Know Best\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2221\n|PortionCalories = 555\n|DatePublished=27th October 2012\n|Author = JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 2 hours 15 minutes (includes [[Roast garlic|roasting the garlic]])\n |PrepTime = 15 minutes\n |CookTime = 2 hours\n |Image = [[Image:Potato, cheese and garlic bake recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Gorgeous!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Thanks Julia - having this tomorrow night!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis recipe has been adapted from Mrs Maureen Kirkland's recipe for ''[[Cheese]] Pie'' which appears in The Hairy Bikers' book, '''Mum's Know Best''' (ISBN 0297860267).  My version is rather more powerful and rustic.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 4 bulbs [[Roasted garlic|roasted garlic]], squeezed\n| 500 g [[Potatoes|potatoes]], peeled\n| Large knob of [[Butter|butter]]\n| Splash of [[Milk|milk]]\n| [[White pepper]], freshly [[Ground|ground]]\n| 180 g [[Cornish Quartz cheese]]\n| 180 g [[Parmesan cheese]]\n| 70 g fresh [[Rye|rye]] [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]]\n| Fried, sliced [[Indian green chillies]], to taste (optional)\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Allow an hour beforehand to [[Roast|roast]] the [[Garlic|garlic]].  Grease a shallow [[Baking|baking]] dish with [[Butter|butter]].  \n* Keep the [[Oven|oven]] on at 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4)\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| [[Boil]] the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] until they are cooked.\n| Drain thoroughly and put through a [[Ricer|ricer]] with the [[Butter|butter]] and [[Milk|milk]].\n| Add the [[Pepper|pepper]], [[Garlic|garlic]] and [[Chillies|chillies]] (if using) and mix well.\n| Add 60 g each of the two [[Cheeses|cheeses]] and mix again.\n| Layer the bottom of the [[Baking|baking]] dish with half of the [[Potato|potato]] mixture.\n| Sprinkle a further 60 g each of the two [[Cheeses|cheeses]] over the top.\n| Season again and spread the rest of the [[Potato|potato]] mixture over the top.\n| Mix the remaining [[Cheese|cheese]] with the [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]] and sprinkle them onto the [[Potato|potato]] mixture.\n| [[Bake]] in the [[Oven|oven]] for about 25-30 minutes until the [[Cheese|cheese]] has crispened.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Vegetables|vegetables]] and any suitable [[Sauce|sauce]].  Also good with [[Salad|salad]].\n===Variations===\nUse any combination of strong [[Cheese|cheese]] you like.  I would normally include some [[Fried|fried]] [[Chilli|chilli]] slices, but as my daughter is eating this as well, I have had to omit them on this occasion.\n===Chef's notes===\n[[Cornish Quartz cheese]] is available from '''[http://www.waitrose.com Waitrose]'''\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Potato, cheese and garlic bake]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes|Potato, cheese and garlic bake]]\n[[Category:Chilli pepper recipes|Potato, cheese and garlic bake]]\n[[Category:British recipes|Potato, cheese and garlic bake]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes|Potato, cheese and garlic bake]]\n[[Category:Main courses|Potato, cheese and garlic bake]]\n[[Category:Pies tarts and flans|Potato, cheese and garlic bake]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes|Potato, cheese and garlic bake]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes|Potato, cheese and garlic bake]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes|Potato, cheese and garlic bake]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#potatocheeseandgarlicbake #cheese #butter #potato #garlic #breadcrumbs #baking #cheeses #cornishquartzcheese #potatoes #ricer </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

Stirring to avoid sticking.\n| Add the finely [[Shredded|shredded]] [[Cabbage|cabbage]].\n| Once soft add the [[Tomato paste|tomato paste]] diluted in the water and &frac14; of [[Lemon zest|lemon zest]].\n| Season and cover with a little [[Greaseproof paper|greaseproof paper]], [[Simmer|simmer]] for a further 15 minutes until everything is cooked.\n}}\n\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Albert Bartlett recipes]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes]]\n[[Category:Stews and casseroles]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Stewed, braised or pot roasted]]\n{{Template:Albert Bartlett attribution}}\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#potatosavoycabbageandmushroomcasserole #potatoes #cabbage #tomatopaste #simmer #stewedbraisedorpotroasted #shredded #onions #mushrooms #casseroledish #salted </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Potato, smoked haddock and leek soup",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Potato, smoked haddock and leek soup a British recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#potatosmokedhaddockandleeksoup #simmer #haddock #bouquetgarni #onion #fishstock #potatoes #bones #doublecream #butter #springonions \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Potato, smoked haddock and leek soup British potato recipes\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1885\n|PortionCalories = 471\n|DatePublished=17th January 2013\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 45 minutes\n |PrepTime = 10 minutes\n |CookTime = 35 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Potato, smoked haddock and leek soup recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Jock food?</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Sounds like fare from north of Kielder \ud83d\ude01</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> haddock|smoked haddock]] \n| 1 [[Onion]] finely chopped \n| 3 [[Leeks]] sliced \n| 750 ml Water \n| 75ml [[Double cream]] \n| 25g [[Butter]] \n| 4 [[Spring onions]] sliced \n| [[Bouquet garni|bouquet garni]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Put the [[Haddock|haddock]], chopped [[Onion|onion]] and [[Bouquet garni|bouquet garni]] into a saucepan, cover with water and bring to a [[Simmer|simmer]]. \n| Skim the surface of any froth, [[Simmer|simmer]] for 5 minutes.\n| Lift the [[Haddock|haddock]] from the pan, remove any skin and [[bones]], [[Flake|flake]] the haddock and return the skin and [[bones]] to the water and [[Simmer|simmer]] for 20 minutes.\n| Strain the [[Fish stock|fish stock]].\n| Melt the [[Butter|butter]] in a heavy saucepan, add the washed and sliced [[Leeks|leeks]], cook till just soft, add the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] and continue to cook for another 3 minutes.\n| Add the [[Fish stock|fish stock]] and [[Simmer|simmer]] gently till [[Potatoes|potatoes]] are tender.\n| Add the [[Double cream|double cream]] and bring to the [[Boil|boil]], add the [[Haddock|haddock]], check for seasoning.\n| Divide into bowls and sprinkle the [[Spring onions|spring onions]] on top.\n}}\n\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Albert Bartlett recipes]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n[[Category:British #bones #doublecream #butter #springonions </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Potato and celeriac mash",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Potato and celeriac mash, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#celeriac #potatoes #potatoandceleriacmash #freeze #singlecream #butter #boil #accompaniment #unusualrecipes #steam #salted \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This unusual recipe comes from Jamie Oliver's new book: \"Jamie's Great Britain\" and goes well with Guinness lamb shanks with dark\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 902\n|PortionCalories = 150\n|DatePublished=21st January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = 6 as an [[Accompaniment|accompaniment]]<br />Any leftovers [[Freeze|freeze]] well.\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 35 minutes\n |PrepTime = 10 minutes\n |CookTime = 25 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Potato and celeriac smash.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">I prefer plain mash</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Not bad for a change, but I don;t think you can beat good old mashed potato and butter.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis unusual recipe comes from Jamie Oliver's new book: \"Jamie's Great Britain\" ISBN 978-0718156817 and goes well with [[Guinness lamb shanks with dark sticky gravy]].\n\nIt is ever so simple to make and is probably a good way to introduce kids to odd vegetables - they don't come much stranger than this!\n\nIf you like the taste of celery, you'll love this; it's [[celery]] flavoured mashed potato.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1 whole [[Celeriac|celeriac]], about 1 kg\n| About 800g [[Potatoes|potatoes]] - see method\n| A splash of full cream [[Milk|milk]] or [[Single cream|single cream]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Butter|butter]]\n| [[Salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| 'Peel' the [[Celeriac|celeriac]] by roughly slicing off the skin - don't try to peel in conventionally.\n| Wash the 'peeled' [[Celeriac|celeriac]] - ''you will probably get about 800g of [[Celeriac|celeriac]] from a 1 kg celeriac''.\n| Weigh out an equivalent amount of peeled [[Potatoes|potatoes]], the amount does not have to be accurate - 50/50 ish.\n| Cut the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] into quarters and the [[Celeriac|celeriac]] into slightly smaller chunks into small chunks so they cook  quickly and evenly.\n| Add to a large pan of [[Boiling|boiling]] [[Salted|salted]] water, return to the [[boil]] and cook for 20 minutes.\n| Drain and  leave in the pan to [[Steam|steam]] for few minutes.\n| Mash with a [[potato ricer]] or a [[potato masher]].\n| Add a tablespoon of [[Butter|butter]], a splash of full cream [[milk]] or [[single cream]].\n| Season and serve.\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Potato and celeriac mash recipe.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Cut the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] into quarters and the [[Celeriac|celeriac]] into slighly smaller chunks\nImage:Potato and celeriac smash recipe.jpg|thumb|300px|right|[[Potatoes]] and [[Celeriac|celeriac]]\n</gallery>\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe immediately.\n\nLeft overs [[Freeze|freeze]] well and can be reheated in the [[Microwave|microwave]].\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#celeriac #potatoes #potatoandceleriacmash #freeze #singlecream #butter #boil #accompaniment #unusualrecipes #steam #salted </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Potato and celeriac mash (V)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Potato and celeriac mash a British vegetarian recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#celeriac #potatoes #freeze #accompaniment #salted #microwave #potatomasher #potatoricer #steam #boil #boiling \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This unusual recipe comes from Jamie Oliver's new book: \"Jamie's Great Britain\". It is ever so simple to make and is probably a\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 766\n|PortionCalories = 127\n|DatePublished=21st January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = 6 as an [[Accompaniment|accompaniment]]<br />Any leftovers [[Freeze|freeze]] well.\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 35 minutes\n |PrepTime = 10 minutes\n |CookTime = 25 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Potato and celeriac smash.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Not half bad</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I'm not a fan of celeriac, but this makes mash quite interesting</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis unusual recipe comes from Jamie Oliver's new book: \"Jamie's Great Britain\" ISBN 978-0718156817.\n\nIt is ever so simple to make and is probably a good way to introduce kids to odd vegetables - they don't come much stranger than this!\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1 whole [[Celeriac|celeriac]], about 1 kg\n| About 800g [[Potatoes|potatoes]] - see method\n| [[Salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| 'Peel' the [[Celeriac|celeriac]] by roughly slicing off the skin - don't try to peel in conventially.\n| Wash the 'peeled' [[Celeriac|celeriac]] - ''you will probably get about 800g of [[Celeriac|celeriac]] from a 1 kg celeriac''.\n| Weigh out an equivalent amount of peeled [[Potatoes|potatoes]], the amount does not have to be accurate - 50/50 ish.\n| Cut the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] into quarters and the [[Celeriac|celeriac]] into slighly smaller chunks into small chunks so they cook  quickly and evenly.\n| Add to a large pan of [[Boiling|boiling]] [[Salted|salted]] water, return to the [[boil]] and cook for 20 minutes.\n| Drain and  leave in the pan to [[Steam|steam]] for few minutes.\n| Mash with a [[potato ricer]] or a [[potato masher]].\n| Season and serve.\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Potato and celeriac mash recipe.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Cut the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] into quarters and the [[Celeriac|celeriac]] into slighly smaller chunks\nImage:Potato and celeriac smash recipe.jpg|thumb|300px|right|[[Potatoes]] and [[Celeriac|celeriac]]\n</gallery>\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe immediately.\n\nLeft overs [[Freeze|freeze]] well and can be reheated in the [[Microwave|microwave]].\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#celeriac #potatoes #freeze #accompaniment #salted #microwave #potatomasher #potatoricer #steam #boil #boiling </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }

title": "Potato cubes with bacon and herb crumbs",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Potato cubes with bacon and herb crumbs a British recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#potatoes #bacon #potatocubeswithbaconandherbcrumbs #herbs #fry #vegetableoil #panfried #breadcrumbs #tarragon #marjoram #colander \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Potato cubes with bacon and herb crumbs British potato recipes\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1801\n|PortionCalories = 450\n|DatePublished=19th January 2013\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 40 minutes\n |PrepTime = 5 minutes\n |CookTime = 35 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Potato cubes with bacon and herb crumbs recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Oooh, nice</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Love the idea of this</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:NonLoggedInUser|NonLoggedInUser]] </span></span>\n}}\n\n{{FindAlbertBartlett}}\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 750g Small Rooster [[Potatoes]] washed and cut into 1cm cubes. \n| 4tbs Chopped [[Herbs|herbs]], [[Parsley|parsley]], [[Chives|chives]], [[Tarragon|tarragon]] and [[Marjoram|marjoram]] \n| 100g Fresh White [[Breadcrumbs]] \n| 125g [[Smoked]] Streaky [[Bacon]] Cut into small pieces \n| 3tbs [[Vegetable oil]] \n| 1 [[Egg white|egg white]] lightly beaten\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Place [[Potatoes|potatoes]] into a saucepan, cover with cold water, add a little [[Salt|salt]] to season. \n| Bring to a [[Simmer|simmer]] and cook till [[Potatoes|potatoes]] are almost done. \n| Drain in a [[Colander|colander]] and leave to dry. \n| Mix together the [[Herbs|herbs]], whites, crumbs and season with [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]. \n| Coat the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] in the crumb mix. \n| Heat a dry non stick [[Frying pan|frying pan]] and [[Fry|fry]] the [[Bacon|bacon]] for 3 to 4 minutes until golden and crisp. \n| Remove the [[Bacon|bacon]] onto kitchen paper to drain. \n| Wipe the pan clean, put onto a high heat and add the [[Vegetable oil|vegetable oil]]. [[Fry]] the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] till golden all over, add the [[Bacon|bacon]], toss together and serve.\n}}\n\n===Chef's notes===\n{{Template:ThinkPig}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Albert Bartlett recipes]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n\n{{Template:Albert Bartlett attribution}}\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#potatoes #bacon #potatocubeswithbaconandherbcrumbs #herbs #fry #vegetableoil #panfried #breadcrumbs #tarragon #marjoram #colander </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Potato salad",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Potato salad, Barbecue recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#potatosalad #mustard #potatoes #onion #oliveoil #whitewinevinegar #gherkins #dill #parmaham #herbs #potato \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This is a much nicer dish than the manufactured potato salads available from the supermarkets\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 447\n|PortionCalories = 111\n|DatePublished=24th October 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime = 50 minutes, incl chill time\n|PrepTime = 30 minutes\n|CookTime = 20 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Potato salad recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Nice</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Love it with the skins on</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]] </span></span>\n}}\n\nThis is a much nicer dish than the manufactured potato salads available from the supermarkets.  Add whatever takes your fancy to make a really special dish.  Perfect for picnics or barbecues.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 500 g baby new [[potatoes]], scrubbed\n| 1 small red [[onion]], finely chopped\n| 4 tablespoons light [[olive oil]]\n| 1 tablespoons [[white wine vinegar]]\n| 1 teaspoon made [[mustard]] of choice\n| 1 teaspoon [[mustard]] seeds\n| 2 teaspoons pickled [[capers]], chopped\n| &#189; bunch chopped fresh [[dill]] or [[parsley]]\n| A [[roasted red peppers|roasted red pepper]] cut into thin strips (optional)\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Boil the [[potatoes]] for 15-20 minutes until tender\n| Allow to cool, then cut each [[potato]] into quarters\n| Mix the chopped [[onion]] with 4 tablespoons [[olive oil]], 1 tablespoon [[white wine vinegar]] and 1 teaspoon  made [[mustard]]\n| Season and taste\n| Lightly crush the [[potatoes]] with a fork and fold in the dressing along with 1 teaspoon [[mustard]] seeds, 2 diced [[gherkins]] and the [[herbs]]\n| Allow to cool before serving\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\n\nServe cold\n\n===Variations===\n\nAdd chopped [[smoked bacon]], [[salami]] or [[Parma ham]]\n==Which are the best potatoes for salads==\n* Charlotte\n* Maris Peer\n* Nicola\n* [[Potatoes#Pictures of varieties of potatoes|Pink Fir Apple]] \n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Barbecue recipes]]\n[[Category:Salad recipes]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#potatosalad #mustard #potatoes #onion #oliveoil #whitewinevinegar #gherkins #dill #parmaham #herbs #potato </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
