title": "Potato wedges recipe",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Potato wedges, a British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#baking #potato #potatowedgesrecipe #potatoes #peanutoil #bakedpotatoes #oliveoil #boiledorsimmered #sourcream #chips #salsa \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=The healthier alternative to chips. Kids love them and don't realise they're missing their chips\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 656\n|PortionCalories = 164\n|DatePublished=21st January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime = 35 minutes\n|PrepTime = 5 minutes\n|CookTime = 30 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Potato wedges recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Nicer than chips</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.6</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">..and much easier to make than chips.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\">[[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]] </span></span>\n}}\nThe healthier alternative to [[chips]].  Kids love them and don't realise they're missing their chips.  Served with a [[salsa]] or [[sour cream]] they also make a very good starter.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 2 large [[baking]] [[potatoes]], unpeeled\n| 2 tablespoons [[olive oil]]\n| 2 tablespoons [[peanut oil]] ([[groundnut oil]])\n| [[Sea salt]] and [[freshly ground black pepper]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Preheat the oven to  220\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - Gas 6)\n| Cut the [[potatoes]] into wedges 2.5 cm (1\") wide\n| Add the [[potato]] wedges and both oils to a bowl and with your hands, mix really well to coat the wedges\n| Place on the preheated [[baking]] tray and cook for  20 to 30  minutes or until golden - check them regularly\n| Drain on kitchen paper, sprinkle with seasoning\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe immediately\n\n===Variations===\nThe following are the best [[potato]] varieties to make great tasty [[baked potatoes]]:\n* Cara\n* Estima\n* King Edwards\n* Marfona\n* Maris Piper\n* Vivaldi\n===See also===\n{{SeeAlso-chips}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#baking #potato #potatowedgesrecipe #potatoes #peanutoil #bakedpotatoes #oliveoil #boiledorsimmered #sourcream #chips #salsa </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Potted hough",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Potted hough a beef recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#pottedhough #bones #beefrecipes #unusualrecipes #meatrecipes #recipes #historicrecipes #britishrecipes #maincourses #servings\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=Head cheese or Potted hough is not a cheese at all but a Scottish prepared meat dish and is a great recipe for shin of beef\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}}\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=31st January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Head cheese!\n |Servings = Serves 8\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 28 hours\n |PrepTime = 24 hours\n |CookTime = 4 hours\n|TotalCalories = 1650\n|PortionCalories = 206\n |Image = [[Image:Potted hough.jpg|300px|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n===Recipe review===\n</span>\n'''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Headcheese?</span>'''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">3.4</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Headcheese sounds too disgusting.  Lol! :D</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry, aka Chef]] ([[User talk:Chef|talk]])</span></span>\n}}\n'''Head cheese''', '''Potted hough''' or '''brawn''' is not a cheese at all but a Scottish prepared meat dish and is a great recipe for shin of beef. I have taken it verbatim from the wonderful, wonderful book; [[Cookbook: Food In England|Food in England - Dorothy Hartley]] which is now available again as it has been reprinted and re-issued. Recommended.\n\n===[[Servings]]===\n\nTwa-three slices o' potted hough per person!\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| [[Shin of beef]]\n| 3 [[black peppercorns]]\n|  A blade of [[mace]]\n}}\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Take the hough and bash it well with an axe.\n| No' just beark it, but have at it , 'till the pieces are no bigger than a wee hen's egg.\n| Pack it into an iron pot with the papery brown skins of onions, two or three peppercorns and a blade of mace. just cover with water, set on the lid lightly, and let it stew for four hours at least.\n| When the meat is away from the bone, tilt it all into a colander, strain the liquid back into the saucepan, and let it gallop while you are gathering up the meat from the broken [[bones]]. \n| Press the meat into a basin with straight sides, and when the meat is all in, fill up with the liquid and set aside 'til cold.\n| It should set stiff.  If it no' sets stiff, you must reduce again for it should be stiff as glue.\n}}\n===Scotch woman's tip===\n\nDo not add vegetables, or over-season with herbs, when cooking this dish, as\n\nit is not a 'made' dish, in the usual sense: it is most essentially a plain\n\ndish of solid meat.  It turns out a brawn, but the texture is much more firm.\n\nThe Scotch woman who gave me the recipe said \"All o' mie want no more than\n\ntwa-three slices o' potted hough, and a well of baked taties, and a fresh\n\nlettuce and mustard-maybe twa-three pickles would go wi' it well-and a tankard\n\nof ale-'twill fill them fine-'tis all guid meat\", and as she was a mother of\n\nfour champion blacksmiths she knew what she was strengthening.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n{{RecipeSkip}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Beef recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:historic recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Stewed, braised or pot roasted]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#pottedhough #bones #beefrecipes #unusualrecipes #meatrecipes #recipes #historicrecipes #britishrecipes #maincourses #servings </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Potted smoked mackerel with Capricorn goats' cheese and chives",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",

                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Potted smoked mackerel with Capricorn goats' cheese and chives recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#mackerel #lemon #pottedsmokedmackerelwithcapricorngoatscheeseandchives #chives #goatscheese #ciabatta #thelubborncreamery #dice #horseradishsauce #smoked #horseradish \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Get your hit of omega 3 oils with this fishy starter from The Lubborn Creamery\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2633\n|PortionCalories = 658\n|DatePublished=24th October 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 10 minutes\n |PrepTime = 10 minutes\n |CookTime = None\n |Image = [[Image:Potted smoked mackerel with Capricorn goats' cheese and chives recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Rich pate</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">You don;t need much of this</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Carla_Cancio-Bello,_J.D.,_on_behalf_of_Cuban_Cuisine_UK|Carla]] </span></span>\n}}\nGet your hit of omega 3 oils with this fishy [[Starter|starter]] from [[The Lubborn Creamery]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 2 x100g Capricorn\u00ae Somerset [[Goats cheese|goats cheese]]\n| 90g flaked [[Smoked|smoked]] [[Mackerel|mackerel]]\n| 1 [[Ciabatta|ciabatta]] loaf\n| A handful of chopped [[Chives|chives]]\n| &frac12; teaspoon of [[Horseradish sauce|horseradish sauce]]\n| &frac12; [[Lemon|lemon]]\n| [[Freshly ground black pepper]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Place the flaked [[Mackerel|mackerel]] into a bowl.\n| [[Dice]] and add the Capricorn\u00ae Somerset [[Goats cheese|goats cheese]], season well with [[Pepper|pepper]].\n| Add the [[Chives|chives]] and [[Horseradish|horseradish]].\n| Cut a wedge from the [[Lemon|lemon]] and set aside. [[Juice]] and [[Zest|zest]] the remaining lemon, add to the bowl and mix well. Divide into two ramakins.\n| Slice the [[Ciabatta|ciabatta]], cutting three small slices for each person, and lightly toast.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with the potted [[Mackerel|mackerel]] and [[Lemon|lemon]] wedge.\n\n===Chef's notes===\nDon't be tempted to add [[salt]] as processed [[mackerel]] can be quite salty already.\n{{Template:HorseradishSeeAlso}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Salad recipes]]\n[[Category:Sea fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Lubborn Creamery recipes]]\n[[Category:Uncooked]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#mackerel #lemon #pottedsmokedmackerelwithcapricorngoatscheeseandchives #chives #goatscheese #ciabatta #thelubborncreamery #dice #horseradishsauce #smoked #horseradish </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }

title": "Prawns, peas and pasta",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Prawns, peas and pasta recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#butter #garlic #lemonjuice #boiling #homemadepasta #prawns #tagliatelle #prawnspeasandpasta #oliveoil #frozenpeas #peas \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This recipe is surprisingly good\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2811\n|PortionCalories = 702\n|DatePublished=25th October 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 20 minutes\n |PrepTime = 5 minutes\n |CookTime = 15 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Brown shrimp, peas and pasta recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">The home-made pasta makes this</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">It tastes as good as it looks</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis recipe is surprisingly good.  The [[mint]] seems an odd herb to accompany [[seafood]] and [[Garlic|garlic]] but it worked really well.\n\nThis is a variation of [[Brown shrimp, peas and pasta]] that I made when I could not manage to buy [[brown shrimp]] in the UK.\n\n[[Home made pasta]] is the best to go with this dish. Do try it, you don't even need a [[Pasta machine|pasta machine]].  Just roll it our flat and cut into rough strips with a knife.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 2 portions of [[Home made pasta]], rolled flat and cut into rough rustic strips\n| '''''or''''' 300g [[Dried|dried]] [[Tagliatelle|tagliatelle]]\n| 300g fresh peeled prawns\n| 500 g [[Frozen peas|frozen peas]]\n| 4 cloves of [[Garlic]], peeled and crushed\n| 2 tablespoons finely chopped [[Mint leaves|mint leaves]]\n| [[Juice]] from 1 [[Lemon|lemon]]\n| 3 tablespoons of [[butter]] or a mixture of [[butter]] and [[olive oil]] for the more health conscious. \n| [[Salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Melt half of the [[Butter|butter]] in a pan, add the [[Garlic|garlic]] and gently saut\u00e9 until soft, don't allow it to burn or colour.\n| Add the [[prawns]], half of the [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]] and season with [[Salt|salt]], [[Pepper|pepper]]. Stir well to mix and then remove from the heat.\n| Meanwhile cook the [[Peas|peas]] until tender, either by microwaving or [[Boiling|boiling]] - about 4 minutes\n| Cook the [[Tagliatelle|tagliatelle]] in salted [[Boiling|boiling]] water until [[Al dente|al dente]]\n| Drain the [[Pasta|pasta]] and add to the [[prawns]], Stir in the remaining [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]], [[Butter|butter]] and peas. Mix well, season and serve.\n}}\n\n{{Template:YoutubePastaDough}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Pasta recipes]]\n[[Category:Shellfish recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#butter #garlic #lemonjuice #boiling #homemadepasta #prawns #tagliatelle #prawnspeasandpasta #oliveoil #frozenpeas #peas </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Prawn and crab lasagne bake",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Prawn and crab lasagne bake a British recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#prawnandcrablasagnebake #soup #lasagne #crab #pasta #boil #oliveoil #singlecream #lobsterbisquesoup #tabascosauce #drysherry \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This is another version of the old favourite: Salmon and prawn tagliatelle made into a lasagne and using crab-claw meat instead of salmon. This was\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1551\n|PortionCalories = 775\n|DatePublished=13th November 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  45 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime =  35 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Prawn and crab lasagne bake recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Nothing better!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">If you follow me you will know what a fan I am of Lobster Bisque - this is crazy-good with the additional crab!</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis is another version of the old favourite: [[Salmon and prawn tagliatelle]] made into a [[Lasagne|lasagne]] and using [[Crab|crab]]-claw [[Meat|meat]] instead of [[Salmon|salmon]].\n[[Image:Prawn and crab lasagne bake construction.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Ready to put together]]\n\nThis was extremely good, the crab flavour came through very well.  It is going on our [[:Category:Favourite recipes|favourites list]]!\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 130g fresh [[Lasagne|lasagne]]  (6 sheets) - the sheets were quite small - 1 single layer of [[Pasta|pasta]] required 2 sheets\n| 1 teaspoon [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| Pinch of [[Salt|salt]]\n| 1 400 ml can [[Lobster bisque soup|lobster bisque soup]]\n| 150 ml [[Single cream|single cream]]\n| 2 tablespoons of [[Dry sherry|dry sherry]]\n| Splash of [[Tabasco sauce]]\n| Bunch of fresh [[Chives|chives]], chopped finely\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] & [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 145g [[King prawns|king prawns]], chopped\n| 114g fresh [[Crab|crab]]-claw [[Meat|meat]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4), [fan [[Oven|oven]] 160\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Bring a pan of [[Salted|salted]] water to [[Boil|boil]] and drop the [[Lasagne|lasagne]] sheets in one by one.\n| Add a teaspoon of [[Olive oil|olive oil]] to prevent them sticking together.\n| Bring them back to the [[Boil|boil]], remove from the heat, cover and leave for 2 minutes. Drain and rinse with cold water.\n| Add the [[Lobster bisque|lobster bisque]], [[Single cream|single cream]], [[Sherry|sherry]], [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]] to a bowl and stir well.\n| Add a few tablespoons of the [[Soup|soup]] mixture into the bottom of an [[Oven|oven]]-proof dish.\n| Add 2 sheets of [[Pasta|pasta]], a little more [[Soup|soup]] and the chopped [[Prawns|prawns]]. Layer another 2 sheets, more [[Soup|soup]] and the [[Crab|crab]]-claw [[Meat|meat]].\n| Finish with a final layer of [[Lasagne|lasagne]] and the remaining [[Soup|soup]].\n| [[Bake|bake]] for 30 minutes at the top part of the [[Oven|oven]].\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with a [[salad]]\n===Recipe source===\nA variation of [[Salmon and prawn tagliatelle]].\n{{LasagneRecipes}}\n\n{{Template:YoutubePastaDough}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Pasta recipes]]\n[[Category:Sea fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n[[Category:Shellfish recipes]]\n[[Category:Cooking with wine]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#prawnandcrablasagnebake #soup #lasagne #crab #pasta #boil #oliveoil #singlecream #lobsterbisquesoup #tabascosauce #drysherry </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Prawn and onion mashed potato",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Prawn and onion mashed potatoes\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#prawnmash #fishmash #fishymashedpotatoes #seafoodmash #lobstermash #fakelobstermash #prawnpotatoes #prawnandonionmashedpotato #shrimp\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=A creamy seafood mashed potato with onions and herbs\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=15th August 2020\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  55 minutes\n|PrepTime =  25 minutes\n|CookTime =  30 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 1615\n|PortionCalories = 403\n|Image = [[Image:Prawn and onion mashed potato recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">A great side dish</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Almost a meal in itself</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nMy eco. version of [[Lobster]] [[Mash]] to go with [[Battered|battered]] [[Fish|fish]], [[Peas|peas]] and [[Sweetcorn|sweetcorn]].  This makes a superb [[Accompaniment|accompaniment]] to [[Seafood|seafood]].\n\nI've used coldwater [[Prawns|prawns]] ([[Shrimp|shrimp]]), but [[Lobster|lobster]], [[Crab|crab]] or any interesting [[Seafood|seafood]] would  work as well.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 5 medium [[Potatoes|potatoes]], peeled and cut into quarters\n| 1 medium [[Onion|onion]], peeled and finely chopped\n| 1 tablespoon [[Taste Sensation Well Matured Cheese Powder]] (3 tablespoons [[Grated|grated]] [[Cheese|cheese]] is as good)\n| 1 tablespoon [[Dried|dried]] [[Parsley|parsley]]\n| 2 tablespoons [[Creme fraiche|creme fraiche]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Butter|butter]]\n| Pinch of [[Sea Salt|sea salt]]\n| Pinch of [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 150 g coldwater [[Prawns|prawns]] ([[Shrimp|shrimp]]) - chopped if you like\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat the oven to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6), [fan oven 180\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour], see Chef's notes below.\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Prawn mash baked.jpg|right|Fake Lobster mash, baked\nImage:Prawn mash on greaseproof.jpg|On greaseproof paper\nImage:Prawn mash ready to bake.jpg|Ready to bake (or eat now!)\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| [[Boil]] the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] for about 14 minutes of until soft\n| Add the chopped [[Onions|onions]] for the last 4 minutes\n| Drain the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] and add all the remaining ingredients and mix really well.\n| Spoon onto a [[Roasting tray|roasting tray]] covered with [[greaseproof paper]] and lightly spray with olive oil\n| Cook for 30 minutes at 200\u00b0 C with your [[Fish|fish]].\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Battered|battered]] [[Cod|cod]], [[Peas|peas]] and [[Sweetcorn|sweetcorn]].\n===Recipe source===\n\nWe recently had [[Lobster|lobster]] [[Mash|mash]] from the nearby [https://www.thecrownlodgehotel.co.uk/ The Crown Lodge Hotel, Outwell] and it was rather good so I thought I would try my own version with slightly less-expensive ingredients,\n===Chef's notes===\nI'm serving mine with 'shop-bought' [[Battered|battered]] [[Cod|cod]] so I will [[Bake|bake]] mine with the [[Fish|fish]].  This can be served as is, without cooking the [[Prawns|prawns]] but if you were using [[Seafood|seafood]] that needs to be cooked, pan [[Fry|fry]] it before mixing in with the [[Mash|mash]].\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Freshwater fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#prawnmash #fakelobstermash #fishmash #fishymashedpotatoes #seafoodmash #lobstermash #prawnpotatoes #prawnandonionmashedpotato #shrimp</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Prawn cocktail (2)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Prawn cocktail (2), British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#cabbage #cucumber #tabasco #mayonnaise #lettuce #brandy #tomatoketchup #cayennepepper #butter #lemonslices #shredded \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=An old favourite from the days of the Hostess Trolley :-)\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1197\n|PortionCalories = 299\n|DatePublished=15th October 2012\n|Author = JuliaBalbilla\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  10 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime = None\n|Image = [[Image:Prawn cocktail (2) recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Abigail's Party, anyone?</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.6</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">This is a proper prawn cocktail - no messing about. Thanks Julia!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nAn old favourite from the days of the [[Hostess Trolley]] \ud83d\ude38\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 125g equal mixture of white [[Cabbage|cabbage]] and crisp [[Lettuce|lettuce]], [[Shredded|shredded]] - enough to line 4 individuals dishes or bowls\n| &frac12; [[Red onion|red onion]], finely sliced\n| &frac14; large [[Cucumber|cucumber]], peeled and [[Diced|diced]]\n| 130ml [[Mayonnaise|mayonnaise]], preferably home made\n| 2 tablespoons [[Tomato ketchup|tomato ketchup]]\n| [[Tabasco]], to taste\n| 1 tablespoon [[Brandy|brandy]]\n| 200g-250g shelled, cooked, [[King prawns|king prawns]]\n| [[Cayenne pepper]]\n| [[Lemon slices]], to garnish\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Line 4 bowls or dishes with the [[Cabbage|cabbage]] and [[Lettuce|lettuce]] mixture.\n| Sprinkle the [[Onion|onion]] and [[Cucumber|cucumber]] over the top.\n| Make the Marie Rose [[Sauce|sauce]] by thoroughly mixing the [[Mayonnaise|mayonnaise]], [[Tomato ketchup|tomato ketchup]], [[Tabasco]] and [[Brandy|brandy]].\n| Spoon over the [[Prawns|prawns]] and sprinkle the [[Cayenne pepper]] over the top,\n| Garnish with a [[Lemon slice|lemon slice]] and serve.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nThis is traditionally served with thin slices of [[Wholemeal|wholemeal]] [[Bread|bread]] and [[Butter|butter]].\n===Recipe source===\n* Adapted from a recipe in '''''The Prawn Cocktail Years''''' by Simon Hopkinson and Lindsey Bareham ISBN 0718149807\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Shellfish recipes]]\n[[Category:Cooking with wine]]\n\n[[Category:Uncooked]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#cabbage #cucumber #tabasco #mayonnaise #lettuce #brandy #tomatoketchup #cayennepepper #butter #lemonslices #shredded </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Prawn cocktail salad",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Prawn cocktail salad, Egg recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#prawncocktailsalad #salad #prawns #saladcream #lettuce #cucumber #watercress #prawncocktail #tomatoes #shredded #celerysalt \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Feeling in a bit of a retro mood, I thought I would go back to the 1960s/70s and recreate one of the periods' most popular first courses, but make a\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1083\n|PortionCalories = 541\n|DatePublished=22nd October 2012\n|Author = JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = Serves 2\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 15 minutes\n |PrepTime = 15 minutes\n |CookTime = None\n|Image = [[Image:Prawn cocktail salad recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"><span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Abigail's party anyone?</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.8</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">She must have served this? Or was it all drinkys \ud83d\ude04</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\">[[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]] </span></span>\n}}\nFeeling in a bit of a retro mood, I thought I would go back to the 1960s/70s and recreate one of the periods' most popular first courses, but make a whole [[Salad|salad]] out of it.\n\n'''For the [[Prawn cocktail|prawn cocktail]]:'''\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 3 tablespoons [[Mayonnaise|mayonnaise]]\n| 2 tablespoons [[Salad cream|salad cream]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Tomato|tomato]] pur\u00e9e\n| 20 ml [[Worcestershire sauce]]\n| 2 teaspoons [[Cider vinegar|cider vinegar]]\n| A pinch of sweet [[Smoked paprika|smoked paprika]]\n| A few drops of [[Tabasco sauce]]\n| Pinch of [[Celery salt|celery salt]]\n| 400g net of peeled, cooked [[Prawns|prawns]], drained and [[Dried|dried]] with kitchen paper\n}}\n'''For the [[Salad|salad]] (Use as much or as little as you like of each ingredient):'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 6 [[Lettuce]] leaves, chopped or [[Shredded|shredded]]\n| A handful of [[Watercress]]\n| 1 [[Red pepper]], sliced\n| 1/4 [[Cucumber]], sliced\n| A few [[Tomatoes]], sliced\n| 2 [[Eggs]], hard [[Boiled|boiled]], and quartered\n| A few Whole [[Black olives|black olives]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Mix all of the ingredients, except for the [[Prawns|prawns]].\n| When thoroughly mixed, stir in the [[Prawns|prawns]].\n| This can be prepared in advance.\n| Just before serving, layer a plate with a base of the [[Lettuce|lettuce]], [[Watercress|watercress]], [[Peppers|peppers]], [[Cucumber|cucumber]] and [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]].\n| Place the [[Prawn cocktail|prawn cocktail]] mixture in the centre of the plate.\n| Garnish with the [[Egg|egg]] quarters and [[Olives|olives]].\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Rustic style French loaf|Rustic French bread]]\n===Variations===\nJust add your favourite [[Salad|salad]] ingredients.  Suggestions are raw [[Avocado|avocado]], [[Cabbage|cabbage]], [[Shredded|shredded]] [[Carrot|carrot]], [[Radishes|radishes]] etc.  Anything raw and crunchy would work well.\n===Chef's notes===\nIf you wish to use homemade [[Salad cream|salad cream]], I suggest you taste it for sweetness before making the Marie-Rose [[Sauce|sauce]].  Use commercial [[Salad cream|salad cream]] if desired, but again, taste and add more [[Vinegar|vinegar]] or [[Sugar|sugar]] to your own taste.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Prawn cocktail salad]]\n[[Category:Egg recipes|Prawn cocktail salad]]\n[[Category:British recipes|Prawn cocktail salad]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes|Prawn cocktail salad]]\n[[Category:Main courses|Prawn cocktail salad]]\n[[Category:Sea fish recipes|Prawn cocktail salad]]\n[[Category:Shellfish recipes|Prawn cocktail salad]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites|Prawn cocktail salad]]\n[[Category:Starters|Prawn cocktail salad]]\n[[Category:Uncooked]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#prawncocktailsalad #salad #prawns #saladcream #lettuce #cucumber #watercress #prawncocktail #tomatoes #shredded #celerysalt </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }

title": "Prawn potato bake",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Prawn potato bake, Italian recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#potatoes #butter #sauce #prawns #prawnpotatobake #onions #blackpepper #cremefraiche #singlecream #greenvegetable #salted \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A complete meal that is a variation on Dauphinois potatoes, but with a creamy prawn sauce\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2470\n|PortionCalories = 617\n|DatePublished=1st January 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  50 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime =  40 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Prawn potato bake recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n}}\n\nA complete meal that is a variation on [[Dauphinois potatoes]], but with a creamy [[Prawn|prawn]] [[Sauce|sauce]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 6 [[Potatoes|potatoes]], sliced (leave the skins on if you prefer)\n| 1 small [[Onion|onion]], peeled and sliced\n| 225 g (8 oz) [[Peeled prawns|peeled prawns]] or [[Shrimp|shrimp]]\n| 2 [[Cloves of Garlic, peeled and crushed|cloves of garlic, peeled and crushed]]\n| 25g (1 oz) [[Butter|butter]]\n| 30 ml (2 tablespoons) [[Dry sherry|dry sherry]]\n| 250 ml (1 cup) [[Single cream|single cream]]\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]] to taste\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4), [fan [[Oven|oven]] 160\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| [[Boil]] the sliced [[Potatoes|potatoes]] in lightly [[Salted|salted]] water for 4 minutes (once the water is [[Boiling|boiling]]).\n| Drain and pat dry.\n| Heat the half of [[Butter|butter]] in a [[Frying pan|frying pan]] and add a grind of [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n| Saut\u00e9 the [[Onions|onions]] in the [[Butter|butter]] over a medium heat for 4 minutes\n| Add the [[Crushed garlic|crushed garlic]] and [[Prawns|prawns]] and [[Stir-fry|stir-fry]] for 2 minutes\n| Reduce the heat a little, pour in the [[Sherry|sherry]] and [[De-glaze|de-glaze]] the pan\n| Mix the [[Cream|cream]] in and stir well and cook for another minute\n| Strain the [[Sauce|sauce]] to separate the [[Prawns|prawns]] and [[Onions|onions]] \n| Pour the [[Prawns|prawns]] and [[Onions|onions]] in the base of an [[Oven|oven]]-proof dish\n| Layer the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] on top , dotting with the remaining [[Butter|butter]]\n| Season with [[Salt|salt]] and [[Black pepper|black pepper]] and pour the [[Sauce|sauce]] over the top of the [[Potatoes|potatoes]]\n| [[Bake]] for up to 35 minutes or until the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] are golden and cooked through. Check them after 25 minutes.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with a [[Green vegetable|green vegetable]] like [[Broccoli|broccoli]] or [[Peas|peas]]\n===Variations===\nUse [[Creme fraiche|creme fraiche]] instead of [[single Cream]] (it will be less likely to separate while cooking. Mix the [[Creme fraiche|creme fraiche]]  with  [[milk]] to make if pourable.\n\nUse large frozen prawns that have been defrosted, chopped into four pieces.\n\nSprinkle a few tablespoons of finely grated [[Parmesan cheese]] over the top before it is [[baked]].\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Good with crayfish too</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.8</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Recently tried this with crayfish and it was fab.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n\n\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Italian recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Sea fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Shellfish recipes]]\n[[Category:Cooking with wine]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#potatoes #butter #sauce #prawns #prawnpotatobake #onions #blackpepper #cremefraiche #singlecream #greenvegetable #salted </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Pulled beef brisket",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Slow cooker pulled beef brisket recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#pulledbeefbrisket #slowcooker #orange #garlic #guinness #gravy #slowroastbeefbrisketwithguinness #broccoli #slowcooked #mixedherbs #pork\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=Pulled beef brisket, slow cooked in Guinness with orange and garlic\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=3rd October 2020\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 6\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  8 hours, 15 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  8 hours\n|TotalCalories = 2787\n|PortionCalories = 464\n|Image = [[Image:Pulled beef brisket slow cooked.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">We'er having this again tonight</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">And tonight's version will be chilli cheese brisket</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]])</span></span>\n}}\nI thought I would try various way of making pulled [[Beef|beef]].  [[Pork]] works very well in the [[Slow Cooker|slow cooker]] so I'm trying a version of [[Slow roast beef brisket with Guinness]].\n\nThis version has far less ingredients than the original and is much simper as it is cooked in a [[Slow Cooker|slow cooker]].\n\nLovely meat from [https://www.facebook.com/pages/category/Butcher-Shop/Brian-Tweed-Son-Ltd-365996273756393/ Brian Tweed & Son]. Congratulations on the butchery; I asked for a kilo or thereabouts and he cut it by sight and when weighed, it came out at 1000.5 grams!\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Pulled beef brisket after six hours.jpg|After 6 hours in the [[slow cooker]]\nImage:Pulled beef brisket in Guinness orange slow cooker.jpg|Ready for the [[slow cooker]]\nImage:Pulled beef brisket in Guinness ingredients.jpg|Pulled beef in [[Guinness]] and [[orange]], the ingredients\n</gallery>\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 kg rolled [[Beef brisket|beef brisket]]\n| 5 [[Cloves of garlic|cloves of garlic]], smashed\n| 1 [[Orange|orange]], washed and halved\n| Pinch of [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]\n| 150 ml of [[Guinness]] original\n| 1 tsp [[jaggery]] or [[demerara sugar]]\n| Pinch of [[Dried mixed herbs|dried mixed herbs]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Place the smashed [[Garlic|garlic]] in the base of your [[Slow Cooker|slow cooker]].\n| Unroll the brisket and season with the [[Mixed herbs|mixed herbs]], [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]].\n| Lay the brisket over the [[Garlic|garlic]] and cover with the [[Orange|orange]] halves.\n| Pour the [[Guinness]] over the top and add the sugar.\n| Slow cook on high for 4 hours turning now and then if able.\n| After about 4 hours (the time is not critical), cut the joint into smaller chunks with [[Butchers|butchers]] shears and slow cook on low for a further 4 hours, or more.\n| Discard the [[Orange|orange]] pieces and thicken the cooking juices with [[Cornflour|cornflour]] to make [[Gravy|gravy]] if needed.\n| You may need to trim and discard any fat that has not rendered down, even after a prolonged cooking period.\n| Serve in one of the methods suggested below, or invent your own!\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\n* With [[crispy jacket potatoes]], [[broccoli]] and [[gravy]] made from thickening the cooking juices.\n* In [[taco shells with sour cream and cheese]]\n\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Pulled beef taco shells recipe.jpg|[[Pulled beef taco shells]]\nImage:FilledTacoShellPeppersTomaotesCheese.jpg|[[Pulled beef taco shells]] ready top cook\nImage:FilledTacoShellsAIrFryer.jpg|Filled taco shells stood in the [[air fryer]]\n</gallery>\n\n===Recipe source===\nA simpler version of [[Slow roast beef brisket with Guinness]].\n\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Beef recipes]]\n[[Category:Cooking with beer]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Slow cooker recipes]]\n[[Category:Slow cooked]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#pulledbeefbrisket #slowcooker #orange #garlic #guinness #gravy #slowroastbeefbrisketwithguinness #broccoli #slowcooked #mixedherbs #pork</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }

taco shells\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=5th October 2020\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  45 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  30 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 2038\n|PortionCalories = 1019\n|Image = [[Image:Pulled beef taco shells recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span lovely and will be a regular favourite.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 300g unseasoned [[Pulled beef brisket]]\n| 1 can El Paso [[Refried beans|refried beans]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Taste Sensation]] [[Tex mex seasoning|tex mex seasoning]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Taste Sensation]] [[Fajita]] mix\n| 50 g [[Grated|grated]] [[Cheddar cheese|cheddar cheese]]\n| 3 [[Spring onions|spring onions]], finely chopped\n| 3 small [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]], chopped\n| Half a [[Sweet red pepper|sweet red pepper]], deseeded and chopped\n| 6 [[Taco shells|taco shells]]\n| 150 ml [[Sour cream|sour cream]]\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\nPreheat your oven or air fryer to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4), [fan oven 160\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Mix the [[Beans|beans]] and [[Pulled beef brisket]] together with the [[Taste Sensation]] [[Tex mex seasoning|tex mex seasoning]] and Taste Sensation [[Fajita]] mix\n| Heat for 15 minutes in a small pan - we used the [[Slow Cooker|slow cooker]].\n| Line the [[Air Fryer|air fryer]] or [[Oven tray|oven tray]] with [[Greaseproof paper|greaseproof paper]].\n| Fill the [[Taco shells|taco shells]] with the [[Meat|meat]] and [[Bean|bean]] mix\n| Arrange the chopped [[Peppers|peppers]], [[Onions|onions]] and [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]] over the top.\n| Sprinkle with [[Grated|grated]] [[Cheddar cheese|cheddar cheese]]\n| Cook or [[Grill|grill]] for 10 minutes until the [[Cheese|cheese]] is melted and the [[Taco shells|taco shells]] are crisped.\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:FilledTacoShellPeppersTomaotesCheese.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Covered with tomatoes, peppers and cheese\nImage:FilledTacoShellsAIrFryer.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Filled taco shells stood in the [[air fryer]]\n</gallery>\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe drizzled with [[Sour cream|sour cream]].\n==See And a very good one at that!\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 665\n|PortionCalories = 332\n|DatePublished=7th August 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  18 minutes\n|PrepTime =  3 minutes\n|CookTime =  15 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Pulled pork burgers recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Wow! \ud83d\udc37\ud83d\udc37\ud83d\udc37</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">These were fab!</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nNot really a recipe, just an idea for re-use of leftover [[Pulled pork recipes|pulled pork]]. And a very good one at that!\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 450g prepared & cooked [[Pulled pork recipes|pulled pork]] or enough to make 4 [[Pork|pork]] patties.\n| 3 tablespoons of [[Fine yellow cornmeal|fine yellow cornmeal]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6), [fan [[Oven|oven]] 180\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Using your hands, [[Mould|mould]] the [[Pulled pork recipes|pulled pork]] into four patties.\n| Roll the patties in [[Yellow cornmeal|yellow cornmeal]] to completely cover.\n| Place on a [[Baking tray|baking tray]], lined with [[Bake-O-Glide]] or a similar non-stick liner.\n| [[Bake]] for 15 minutes at the bottom of the over, turning once.\n| We cooked these with [[Oven|oven]]-[[Chips|chips]], adding the [[Burgers|burgers]] after the [[Chips|chips]] had cooked for 5 minutes of so.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Chips|chips]] and [[Baked beans|baked beans]]!\n===Variations===\nYou could of course [[Fry|fry]] these, but [[Oven|oven]] [[Baking|baking]] is a healthier option.\n{{Template:See-also-pulled-pork}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:North American recipes]]\n[[Category:Tex-Mex recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#chips #pulledporkrecipes #pulledporkburgers #yellowcornmeal #bakedbeans #baking #burgers #fry #bakingtray #pork #bake </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Pulled Pork Enchiladas\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#pulledporkenchiladas #cheddarcheese #pulledpork #oliveoil #spray #sweetredpepper #recipes #branstonpickle #enchiladas #grated #sourcream\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=Pulled pork served in rolled tortillas, flavoured with spices and topped with grilled cheese\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=30th September 2020\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  45 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime = 15 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 2337\n|PortionCalories = 1168\n|Image = [[Image:Pulled Pork Enchiladas recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Looks amazing</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">My version didn't look as good ass this but it tasted fab. </span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nWe recently cooked a [[Shoulder of pork|shoulder of pork]] just with a little [[Wine|wine]] in the [[Slow Cooker|slow cooker]] for about 6 hours and the resulting [[Pulled pork|pulled pork]] provided lots of different meals.  This one, unlike the original slow cooked [[Pork shoulder|pork shoulder]] has a whole manner of different flavourings.\n\nWe both chose three of each for ourselves, marked them with [[Cocktail sticks|cocktail sticks]] so we knew which ones were ours.\n\nThe results were fabulous.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 400g unflavoured [[Pulled pork|pulled pork]], already cooked\n| 5 [[Spring onions|spring onions]], finely chopped\n| Half a [[Sweet red pepper|sweet red pepper]], finely chopped\n| 60g [[Cheddar cheese|cheddar cheese]]\n| 6 small white [[Flour tortillas|flour tortillas]]\n}}\n====flavours====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 1 tablespoon [[Branston pickle|branston pickle]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Curry powder|curry powder]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Taste Sensation Jalapeno and Lime Seasoning]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Taste Sensation Mexican seasoning]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Taste Sensation fajita seasoning]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Taste Sensation Tangy Chipotle Marinade]]\n| A quick [[Spray|spray]] of [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4), [fan oven 160\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Pulled pork tortillasBaked.jpg|Baked to perfection - crispy, yet moist inside.\nImage:Pulled pork tortillasReadyToBake.jpg|Rolled and ready to bake\nImage:Pulled pork enchiladas INGREDIENTS.jpg|The ingredients\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Mix the [[Chopped spring onions|chopped spring onions]] and [[Red peppers|red peppers]] together in a large bowl.\n| Divide the mixture into 6 and mix one of your chosen seasonings (or [[Pickles|pickles]]!) into each portion.\n| Fill each [[Flour tortilla|flour tortilla]] with the mixture, roll up and close with a [[Cocktail stick|cocktail stick]] if needed.\n| [[Spray]] a [[Baking tray|baking tray]] with [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and place the rolled [[Enchiladas|enchiladas]] in the tray.\n| Sprinkle with the [[Grated|grated]] [[Cheddar cheese|cheddar cheese]].\n| [[Bake]] for 30 minutes at 180\u00b0 C.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Sour cream|sour cream]], chopped [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]] and a little torn [[Basil|basil]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Chilean recipes]]\n[[Category:Latin American recipes]]\n[[Category:Mexican recipes]]\n[[Category:Peruvian recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Chilli pepper recipes]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#pulledporkenchiladas #cheddarcheese #pulledpork #oliveoil #spray #sweetredpepper #recipes #branstonpickle #enchiladas #grated #sourcream</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Pumpkin soup",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Pumpkin soup, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#pumpkinsoup #butter #pumpkin #onions #potatoes #nutmeg #squash #boil #lemonjuice #sherryvinegar #basilleaves \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Definitely one for the winter. Our big pumpkin has been sitting under the kitchen window for months, awaiting pumpkin soup day\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1364\n|PortionCalories = 227\n|DatePublished=17th January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 6\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 1 hour\n |PrepTime = 20 minutes\n |CookTime = 40 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Pumpkin soup recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Basic, but nice.</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.7</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">The vinegar seemed to make the difference in the flavour of this soup.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nDefinitely one for the winter.  Our big [[Pumpkin|pumpkin]] has been sitting under the kitchen window for months, awaiting pumpkin soup day.  When we checked it's weight it was almost a stone (6 kilos) and the recipe only calls for 675 g of pumpkin flesh!  So we'll be making this again in the week!\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1 tablespoon [[Garlic olive oil|garlic olive oil]] (normal [[Olive oil|olive oil]] will be fine)\n| 2 tablespoons [[Butter|butter]]\n| 1 large [[Onion|onion]], roughly sliced\n| 675 g (1.5 lb) [[Pumpkin|pumpkin]] cut into chunks (cook un peeled and scoop out the flesh rather than trying to peel it first) \n| 1 lb [[Potatoes|potatoes]], sliced and peeled\n| 600 ml (1 pint [[Vegetable stock|vegetable stock]] (make it with a veggy cube if you have to)\n| &#188; of a [[Nutmeg|nutmeg]], [[Grated|grated]]\n| 1 teaspoon fresh [[Tarragon|tarragon]] (of 1 teaspoon [[Dried|dried]] tarragon & a handful of freshly chopped [[Basil leaves|basil leaves]])\n| 600 ml (1 pint) [[Milk|milk]]\n| 2 teaspoons [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]]\n| 2 teaspoons of [[sherry vinegar]]\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Heat the [[Oil|oil]] and [[Butter|butter]] and saut\u00e9 the [[Onions|onions]] for 5 minutes, don't [[Brown|brown]]\n| In a separate pan, [[Boil|boil]] the [[Squash|squash]] pieces for 10 minutes, remove and scoop out the flesh\n| Add the [[Squash|squash]] flesh and the sliced [[Potatoes|potatoes]] to the [[Onions|onions]] and seat on a low heat for 10 minutes, stirring to prevent them sticking\n| If you have any other odd vegetables knocking about, chuck them in now.  We found a handful of soft tomatoes, so in they went!\n| Add the [[Nutmeg|nutmeg]], [[Herbs|herbs]], [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]], bring to the [[Boil|boil]] and [[Simmer|simmer]] for 10 minutes or until the [[Vegetables|vegetables]] are tender\n| Leave to cool a little and blend in a [[Food processor|food processor]], do this in batches if necessary\n| Pour back into a clean pan and add the [[Milk|milk]] and reheat when ready to serve.\n| Season to taste with [[salt]] and [[pepper]], [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]] and [[sherry vinegar]]. The lemon juice and sherry vinegar have been added to balance the sweetness of the squash, so add more or less or even omit completely, as taste requires.\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Pumpkin soup simmered.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Simmer until tender\nImage:The Pumpkin.jpg|thumb|300px|right|14 pounds of pumpkin\n</gallery>\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe hot with fresh crusty [[Bread|bread]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes]]\n[[Category:Soup and stock recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Squash recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#pumpkinsoup #butter #pumpkin #onions #potatoes #nutmeg #squash #boil #lemonjuice #sherryvinegar #basilleaves </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Quail and black pudding tower with Jazz apple",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Quail and black pudding tower with Jazz apple a fruit recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#blackpudding #quail #sauce #quailandblackpuddingtowerwithjazzapple #butter #apple #roasting #brush #lemonjuice #miseenplace #dip \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A good dinner party recipe using Jazz apples and black pudding\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 648\n|PortionCalories = 162\n|DatePublished=21st January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4 - Makes 1 cake\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 1 hour\n |PrepTime = 30 minutes\n |CookTime = 30 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Quail and black pudding tower with Jazz apple recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Looks nice</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">2</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">But still cannot eat black pudding!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry]] </span></span>\n}}\nA good dinner party recipe using Jazz apples and [[black pudding]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 2 [[Oven|oven]]-ready [[Quail|quail]]\n| A few sprigs of fresh [[Lemon thyme|lemon thyme]]\n| [[Juice]] of half a [[Lemon|lemon]]\n| About 30g (1oz) softened [[Butter|butter]]\n| [[Salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 1 [[Jazz apple]]\n| 2 thick slices [[Black pudding|black pudding]]\n}}\n'''For the [[Sauce|sauce]]''':\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| Splash of [[Dry sherry|dry sherry]] or [[White wine|white wine]], optional\n| 2 teaspoons cr\u00e8me fraiche\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Set the [[Oven|oven]] to 200\u00b0C/Gas 6\n* Put a [[Roasting|roasting]] tin in to heat up\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Put a sprig of [[Thyme|thyme]] in each [[Quail|quail]], [[Brush|brush]] the birds with [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]] then some [[Butter|butter]] and season well. \n|Heat a [[Frying pan|frying pan]] and [[Brown|brown]] the [[Quails|quails]] for about 5 minutes. \n|Put them in the roasting tin with the slices of [[Black pudding|black pudding]] and cook for 15 minutes then test to see if the quail is cooked by piercing the thigh with a skewer. If the juices run clear it is cooked, if not, cook another 5 minutes. \n|Leave quail (and black pudding) loosely covered in [[Foil|foil]], to rest for 5 minutes. \n|Meanwhile cut the top and bottom off the [[Apple|apple]] then cut it in half across the core to make 2 thick slices. \n|Remove the core. [[Dip]] the slices in [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]] then [[Brush|brush]] them with [[Butter|butter]]. \n|Pan-[[Fry|fry]] the apple slices to [[Brown|brown]] them well and soften a little.\n|Take the legs off the [[Quail|quail]], then the wings then ease off the breast [[Meat|meat]]. Reserve all the pan juices for making the [[Sauce|sauce]].\n|Cut the [[Black pudding|black pudding]] to the same size as the [[Apple|apple]] slices. Place the black pudding, with an apple slice on top, on two hot plates. Arrange the [[Quail|quail]] breasts and legs on top of that. \n|Heat the pan juices in the [[Roasting|roasting]] tin, adding a really good splash of [[Sherry|sherry]] or [[Wine|wine]] or water to [[Deglaze|deglaze]] it. Let it reduce a little then stir in cr\u00e8me fraiche, to taste, and fresh [[Thyme leaves|thyme leaves]]. Check the seasoning then spoon the [[Sauce|sauce]] onto the plate.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Game|game]] [[Chips|chips]] or [[Roast potatoes|roast potatoes]].\n===Variations===\n[[Partridge]], [[Pheasant|pheasant]] and [[Scallops|scallops]] work equally well.\n\nhttp://www.jazzapples.co.uk/\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Quail]]\n[[Category:British recipes|Quail]]\n[[Category:Game recipes|Quail]]\n[[Category:Main courses|Quail]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes|Quail]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#blackpudding #quail #sauce #quailandblackpuddingtowerwithjazzapple #butter #apple #roasting #brush #lemonjuice #miseenplace #dip </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Quattro formaggi (four cheese) pizza",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Quattro formaggi (four cheese) pizza a cheese recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#pizzadough #pizza #garlic #walnuts #cheeses #tomatoes #pizzastone #oliveoil #grill #cheese #chillies \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=My take on the four cheese pizza-dictated by cheeses available at the time. This was very nice indeed\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2638\n|PortionCalories = 1319\n|DatePublished=6th January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 2 with breakfast leftovers\n|ImageComment = Sitting on the pizza stone, ready to serve\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  1 hour, 14 minutes\n|PrepTime =  1 hour\n|CookTime =  14 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Quattro formaggi (four cheese) pizza recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">\ud83d\ude00 \ud83d\ude0b \ud83d\ude0d</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.7</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Love the tomato dividers!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nMy take on the four [[Cheese|cheese]] [[Pizza|pizza]]-dictated by [[Cheeses|cheeses]] available at the time.\n\nThis was very nice indeed.  I think next time I would reduce the [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]] and try and find pairings for all of the [[Cheeses|cheeses]]. I would keep sliced [[Chillies|chillies]] & [[Cheddar|cheddar]], crushed [[Walnuts|walnuts]] & [[St Agur]] ([[Soft Blue cheese|soft blue cheese]]) but need some for [[Somerset brie]] and [[Mozzarella|mozzarella]].  Suggestions are very welcome!\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1 portion of [[Pizza dough|pizza dough]] - Makes 2 pizzas\n| 6 tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 4 [[Cloves|cloves]] [[Garlic|garlic]], sliced\n| 10 halved baby [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]] (sungold if you can get them/grow them)\n| Copious torn [[Basil leaves|basil leaves]]\n| 125 g [[Mozzarella cheese]] ball, torn into pieces\n| 80 g strong [[Cheddar cheese|cheddar cheese]], thinly sliced\n| 100 g [[Saint Agur Blue cheese]], crumbled\n| 90 g [[Somerset brie]], thinly sliced\n| 2 [[Green Indian chillies|green indian chillies]], cut into rings\n| 4 tablespoons of crushed [[Walnuts|walnuts]]\n| [[Fine yellow cornmeal|fine yellow cornmeal]] for dusting\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Make the [[Pizza dough|pizza dough]] as instructed\n* If using a [[pizza stone]], preheat the [[pizza stone]] under a very hot [[grill]] for about 20 minutes.  Place it about 8cm (3\") from the heat source.\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Quattro formaggi (four cheese) oven ready.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Quattro formaggi-ready for the oven\nImage:Quattro formaggi (four cheese) pizza_ingredients.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Quattro formaggi (four cheese) pizza, the ingredients\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Make 1 pizza per person\n| Dust your work surface with [[Yellow cornmeal|yellow cornmeal]]\n| Divide the [[Pizza dough|pizza dough]] into two and roll out into two thin 25.5 cm (10 inch) [[Pizzas|pizzas]]\n| Prick the pizzas all over with a fork. This prevents it puffing up too much and burning while it is cooking\n| With a deft move, slide the [[Pizza dough|pizza dough]] from the [[Pizza peel|pizza peel]], on to the preheated [[Pizza stone|pizza stone]].\n| Cook on one side only for about 2 minutes or until lightly [[Browned|browned]].\n| remove from the oven, flip and add the topping.\n| Repeat for the second [[Pizza|pizza]] whilst you prepare the first.\n| Meanwhile heat the [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and saut\u00e9 the sliced [[Garlic|garlic]] until it just starts to colour, no more or it will be [[Bitter|bitter]] \n| Drizzle the [[Pizza|pizza]] with the half of the [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and [[Garlic|garlic]] slices.\n| Make a cross with the [[Basil leaves|basil leaves]] and top with the sliced [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]]\n| Arrange the [[Cheeses|cheeses]] in the four quadrants-adding your chosen accompaniments to each cheeses; [[Walnuts|walnuts]] and [[Blue cheese|blue cheese]], [[Chillies|chillies]] and [[Cheddar|cheddar]], etc.\n| [[Bake]] the [[Pizza|pizza]] until the [[Cheese|cheese]] starts to melt and bubble-this only takes a few minutes under a hot [[Grill|grill]].\n| Keep the first pizza warm at the bottom of the oven whilst you make the second.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with homemade [[Cole-slaw|cole-slaw]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Italian recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Chilli pepper recipes]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Pizza recipes]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#pizzadough #pizza #garlic #walnuts #cheeses #tomatoes #pizzastone #oliveoil #grill #cheese #chillies </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Quick fruit jam",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Quick fruit jam recipe - agar agar \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#agar #jam #fruit #quickfruitjam #frozen #fridge #sterilised #defrosted #boiledorsimmered #boil #preservingsugar \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This is a modernist jam which uses agar agar to set it. However, it does not have the keeping qualities of standard jam so it is best to make it in\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 445\n|PortionCalories = 14\n|DatePublished=19th August 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Servings: 30 - Makes about 1\u00bd standard pots\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  25 minutes (includes 15 minutes resting time)\n|PrepTime =  20 minutes (includes 15 minutes resting time)\n|CookTime =  5 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Quick fruit jam recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Easy jam</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.3</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">We use this recipe a lot now we have free access to so much fruit.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis is a modernist [[Jam|jam]] which uses [[Agar|agar agar]] to set it.  However, it does not have the keeping qualities of standard jam so it is best to make it in small quantities.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 x 500g bag of [[Frozen|frozen]] [[Fruit|fruit]] of your choice, [[Defrosted|defrosted]]\n| 150g [[Sugar|sugar]] (any sort is fine, but no need for special [[Preserving sugar|preserving sugar]])\n| 1.5g [[Agar|agar agar]] (generous 1\u00bd teaspoons in powder form)\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Mix the [[Fruit|fruit]] with the [[Sugar|sugar]] in a [[Saucepan|saucepan]] and leave for 15 minutes\n| Stir in the [[Agar|agar agar ]] \n| Bring to the [[Boil|boil]] and cook for a minute, then remove from the heat\n| Transfer to hot or warm, clean jars, before it has a chance to set in the pan\n| Once cooled, keep [[Refrigerated|refrigerated]] even if unopened\n}}\n\n===Recipe source===\nLightly adapted from a [http://www.molecule-r.com/en/content/45-quick-and-easy-jam Molecule-R] recipe\n===Chef's notes===\nKeep in the [[Fridge|fridge]] at all times and it should last a couple of weeks at least.  I [[Sterilised|sterilised]] my jars, but I am not sure that that is necessary as the [[Jam|jam]] should be used up quickly.\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:North American recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Breakfast recipes]]\n[[Category:Pickles and preserves]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Molecular gastronomy recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#agar #jam #fruit #quickfruitjam #frozen #fridge #sterilised #defrosted #boiledorsimmered #boil #preservingsugar </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }

title": "Quick prawn curry",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Quick prawn curry, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#quickprawncurry #currypaste #butter #onions #potatoes #onion #currypowder #prawns #mash #wok #fry \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Another recipe sent to me from north of the border by Alastair\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 902\n|PortionCalories = 451\n|DatePublished=21st January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Quick prawn curry on a ring of mash\n |Servings = Serves 2\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 40 minutes\n |PrepTime = 10 minutes\n |CookTime = 30 minutes \n |Image = [[Image:Quick prawn curry recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Easy-peasy, lemon-squeezy</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">A five year old could make this!  Lovely stuff, thanks Alistair.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nAnother recipe sent to me from north of the border by [[User:Alastair|Alastair]].\n[[Image:Quick prawn curry adding lager.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Want more sauce?]]\n\n'''Prawn curry'''\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 220g Peeled (defrosted) [[Prawns|prawns]] - about 400g when frozen\n| 1 medium [[Onion|onion]], peeled and sliced - normal white onions are best, the red onion I used gave it a strange blue hue!\n| [[Curry paste]] or [[Curry powder|curry powder]] to taste\n}}\n'''Mashed potato'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 2 large [[Potatoes|potatoes]], peeled and quartered\n| Good splash of [[Milk|milk]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Butter|butter]]\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| [[Extra virgin olive oil]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| [[Boil]] the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] for 20 to 25 minutes or until soft\n| [[Mash]] with the  [[Butter|butter]] and [[Milk|milk]] and season to taste\n| Heat the [[Oil|oil]] in a [[Frying pan|frying pan]] or [[Wok|wok]], add a good grind of [[Pepper|pepper]] but no [[Salt|salt]] to the oil and [[Fry|fry]] the sliced [[Onions|onions]]  until they begin to caramelise\n| Add the [[Curry powder|curry powder]] or [[Curry paste|curry paste]]. Any of the Patek-type curry pastes are good.  About 1 tablespoon should do but add a little at a time - you can't take it out once you've made it too hot!\n| Tip the [[Prawns|prawns]] in to the pan and stir meaningfully until they have changed to the colour of the curried [[Onions|onions]]\n| If you want more sauce, just add a little [[vegetable stock]], [[lager]] or even water.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nArrange the [[Mashed potatoes|mashed potatoes]] in a ring and pour the [[Prawn|prawn]]/[[Onion|onion]] mixture into the centre, crack open a bottle of [[Ale|ale]] and enjoy!\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Chilli pepper recipes]]\n[[Category:Fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Sea fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Shellfish recipes]]\n[[Category:Cookery cheats]]\n[[Category:Student recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#quickprawncurry #currypaste #butter #onions #potatoes #onion #currypowder #prawns #mash #wok #fry </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]

title": "Quick tartare sauce",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Quick tartare sauce, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#dill #quicktartaresauce #sauce #parsley #capers #garlicmayonnaiserecipes #refrigerated #gherkins #pickledgherkin #fridge #lemonjuice \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=I have been experimenting with the best 'quick' tartare sauce recipe\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 50\n|PortionCalories = 12\n|DatePublished=22nd October 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Fish dippin'\n |Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 5 minutes\n |PrepTime = 5 minutes\n |CookTime = None\n|Image = [[Image:Quick tartare sauce (cheat) recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Nice dip</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Nice picture too</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Sue_spins|Susie]] </span></span>\n}}\n\nI have been experimenting with the best 'quick' tartare [[Sauce|sauce]] recipe. (tartare sauce - US)\nThis is the best I have found using ingredients from the [[Fridge|fridge]].  I don't always have [[Gherkins|gherkins]] around but it was quite acceptable with [[Pickled onions|pickled onions]], especially if you have any fresh [[Dill|dill]] available.\n\nI find the fresh [[Dill|dill]] or [[Parsley|parsley]] makes the [[Sauce|sauce]] nicer, even if it may be less authentic\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 150 ml [[Mayonnaise|mayonnaise]] - try our cheats mayonnaise, it's quick and easy.\n| 2 tablespoons [[Capers|capers]], chopped\n| 1 small [[Pickled gherkin|pickled gherkin]], chopped\n| Squeeze of fresh [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]]\n| [[Salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 2 tablespoons finely chopped [[Parsley|parsley]] (optional)\n| 2 tablespoons finely chopped [[Dill|dill]] (optional)\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Mix all of the ingredients together in a small bowl and serve immediately.\n}}\n===Storage===\nIt will keep reasonably well if [[Refrigerated|refrigerated]]\n==See also==\n* [[Tartare sauce (Mrs Beeton's)]]\n* [[Tartare Sauce (TM)]]\n* A huge variety of [[Garlic mayonnaise recipes|different mayonnaise recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Cookery cheats]]\n[[Category:Dips and sauces]]\n[[Category:Fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Uncooked]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#dill #quicktartaresauce #sauce #parsley #capers #garlicmayonnaiserecipes #refrigerated #gherkins #pickledgherkin #fridge #lemonjuice </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Ragout of Hare",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Ragout of Hare, Game recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#ragoutofhare #hare #stock #diced #stew #simmer #onion #tomatoes #carrots #celery #bones \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This is the first time I have made anything with hare, but saw one in the butcher's and decided to give it a go\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 3246\n|PortionCalories = 1623\n|DatePublished=19th January 2013\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = Serves 2\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 1 hour 10 minutes\n |PrepTime = 20 minutes\n |CookTime = 50 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Ragout of Hare recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"><span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Looks fab</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Don't know which supermarket you get your hares from though.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\">[[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis is the first time I have made anything with [[Hare|hare]], but saw one in the butcher's and decided to give it a go.  It is basically a hare [[Stew|stew]] with [[Vegetables|vegetables]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| [[Olive oil]]\n| 500 g [[Hare|hare]] [[Meat|meat]], chopped into very small pieces\n| Seasoning to taste\n| 1 large [[Onion|onion]], [[Diced|diced]]\n| 2 sticks [[Celery|celery]], [[Diced|diced]]\n| 2 [[Carrots|carrots]], [[Julienned|julienned]]\n| 2 bulbs [[Garlic|garlic]] or more, finely [[Diced|diced]]\n| 1 tin of chopped [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]]\n| [[Oregano]]\n| 4 [[Bay leaves|bay leaves]]\n| 150 ml [[Dry sherry|dry sherry]]\n| 75 ml [[Stock]], or more, if needed\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Heat a little [[Oil|oil]] in a large saucepan over a medium heat until it is [[Smoking|smoking]].\n| [[Brown]] the [[Hare|hare]] in batches of three, seasoning each batch before removing from pan.\n| Heat some more [[Oil|oil]] and [[Stew|stew]] the [[Onion|onion]], [[Carrots|carrots]] and [[Celery|celery]] until soft - stir from time to time.\n| Add in the [[Garlic|garlic]] and [[Stew|stew]] until golden.\n| Stir in the [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]], [[Herbs|herbs]] and [[Sherry|sherry]].\n| [[Simmer]] for 10 minutes and return the [[Hare|hare]] to the pan.\n| Reduce the heat and [[Simmer|simmer]] until the [[Hare|hare]] is cooked.\n| The [[Sauce|sauce]] should be thick, but you may need to top it up with small amounts of [[Stock|stock]] to stop it from being too thick or sticking.\n| Adjust seasoning if necessary.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe on a plate of creamy [[Mashed potatoes|mashed potatoes]].\n===Variations===\nYou can use [[Rabbit|rabbit]] or [[Venison|venison]] instead of the [[Hare|hare]]. Add a square of bitter chocolate to the sauce if desired.\n===Chef's notes===\nHares are a lot larger than rabbits and as there is only one person in our household who will try it, the unused [[Meat|meat]] will form part of a mixed [[Game terrine|game terrine]].\n\nIf you are buying [[Hare|hare]] on the bone, once the [[Meat|meat]] has been removed, keep the [[bones]] in the [[Freezer|freezer]] to make [[Stock|stock]].  We have a 'bone bag' specifically for keeping [[bones]] and innards for [[stock]] making.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Ragout of hare]]\n[[Category:British recipes|Ragout of hare]]\n[[Category:Game recipes|Ragout of hare]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses|Ragout of hare]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes|Ragout of hare]]\n[[Category:Stews and casseroles|Ragout of hare]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes|Ragout of hare]]\n[[Category:Stewed, braised or pot roasted]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#ragoutofhare #hare #stock #diced #stew #simmer #onion #tomatoes #carrots #celery #bones </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Raspberry vinegar",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",

                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Raspberry vinegar, a fruit recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#raspberryvinegar #raspberries #litres #vinegar #boil #pickled #whitesugar oil.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\">[[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]] </span></span>\n}}\nAs well as being a fine [[Fruit vinegar|fruit vinegar]] for [[Sauces|sauces]] and [[Salad dressings|salad dressings]] it is also good for sore throats\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 2 [[Litres|litres]] [[Malt vinegar|malt vinegar]]\n| 1 kg [[White sugar|white sugar]]\n| 1.5 kg freshly picked [[raspberries]]\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Wash the [[raspberries]] by placing them in a [[Colander|colander]] and running cold water over them\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Put the [[raspberries]] in a large non-metallic bowl and cover with [[Vinegar|vinegar]]\n| Protect with a [[Tea-towel|tea-towel]] and leave for three days to infuse, stirring occasionally\n| Strain the liquid into a large pan, discarding the pulp (see Chef's notes below)\n| Add the [[Sugar|sugar]], bring to the [[Boil|boil]] and boil for 10 minutes\n| Bottle in [[Sterilised|sterilised]] bottles\n}}\n===Chef's notes===\nReserve the pulp for addition to [[Fruit|fruit]] [[Puddings|puddings]]. \n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Dips and sauces]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Marinades dressings and butters]]\n[[Category:Pickles and preserves]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Pickled]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#raspberryvinegar #raspberries #litres #vinegar #boil #pickled #whitesugar #saladdressings #fruit #colander #sterilised </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
