title": "Ratatouille tray bake",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Ratatouille tray bake, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#ratatouilletraybake #celerysalt #roast #cherrytomatoes #garlicpowder #lemon #oliveoil #parsnips #potatoes #leeks #carrots \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This dish is just about as easy as they come to make yet tastes absolutely divine\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 725\n|PortionCalories = 181\n|DatePublished=18th January 2013\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 45 minutes\n |PrepTime = 15 minutes\n |CookTime = 30 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Ratatouille tray bake recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Looks wierd</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Tastes nothing like beetroot!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The&nbsp;Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis dish is just about as easy as they come to make yet tastes absolutely divine. Purple Majesty potatoes are available from branches of '''[http://www.sainsburys.co.uk/sol/index.jsp Sainsbury's].'''\n\n{{FindAlbertBartlett}}\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| [[Zest]] and [[Juice|juice]] of a [[Lemon|lemon]]\n| Handful of fresh [[Rosemary|rosemary]]\n| Sprinkling of fresh [[Thyme|thyme]]\n| 2 [[Garlic cloves, peeled and crushed|garlic cloves, peeled and crushed]]\n| &frac12; Pack (about 600g) Purple Majesty [[Potatoes|potatoes]], washed and cut into quarters or [[Wedges|wedges]]. Leave the skins on.\n| 2 [[Red onions|red onions]], peeled and quartered\n| 4 [[Leeks|leeks]], rinsed and cut into four\n| 1 green, 1 red and 1 [[Yellow pepper|yellow pepper]], chopped into large pieces\n| 2 [[Parsnips|parsnips]], peeled and quartered lengthways\n| 2 [[Carrots|carrots]], peeled cut into chunks\n| 2-\u00963 tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Garlic powder|garlic powder]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Celery salt|celery salt]]\n| [[Freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 200g [[Cherry tomatoes|cherry tomatoes]]\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6)\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Mix the [[Olive oil|olive oil]], [[Lemon zest|lemon zest]], [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]], [[Garlic powder|garlic powder]] and [[Celery salt|celery salt]] with the [[Herbs|herbs]] and Crushed [[Garlic|garlic]] in a bowl and set aside. \n| Put the prepared Purple Majesty [[Potatoes|potatoes]], [[Onions|onions]], [[Leeks|leeks]], [[Peppers|peppers]], [[Parsnips|parsnips]] and [[Carrots|carrots]] in a large, deep [[roasting tin]]. \n| Now drizzle all over with the [[Lemon|lemon]] and [[Herb|herb]] [[Marinade|marinade]] and season with [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]. \n| [[Roast]] for 25 minutes, stir everything around, then add the [[Cherry tomatoes|cherry tomatoes]] and stir again so that everything browns evenly. \n| [[Roast]] for a further 25-30 minutes, or until cooked through and nicely [[Browned|browned]] on the edges.\n}}\n===Variations===\nFeel free to play with the quantities to add more of your favourite veggies.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Albert Bartlett recipes]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n{{Template:Albert Bartlett attribution}}\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#ratatouilletraybake #celerysalt #roast #cherrytomatoes #garlicpowder #lemon #oliveoil #parsnips #potatoes #leeks #carrots </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Raw grated horseradish for dipping",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Raw grated horseradish for dipping\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#horseradishroot #grated #dip #britishrecipes #rawhorseradish #chipdip #chicken #veganrecipes #spicyrecipes #jamieoliveracidetchedcoarsegrater #starters #vegetarianrecipes\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=I discovered this gem accidently, and being a lover of all things hot and spicy, this simple recipe has become my new hottest favourites! This simple dip.\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=28th October 2020\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 1\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  3 minutes\n|PrepTime =  3 minutes\n|CookTime = None\n|TotalCalories = 29\n|PortionCalories = 29\n|Image = [[Image:Grate the horseradish.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Nom, nom, nom!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.1</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">But it does make me sneeze!</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nI discovered this gem accidently, and being a lover of all things hot and spicy, this simple recipe has become my new hottest favourites!\n\nThis simple [[Dip|dip]] is great for dipping [[Chips|chips]], [[Chicken|chicken]] pieces, [[Sausages|sausages]], anything really.  Touch your food in the dip and little pieces of horseradish will stick to it giving you spicy little bursts of flavour.\n\nIt is so simple, nothing needed but raw [[Horseradish root|horseradish root]] and a tiny pinch of [[Salt|salt]], no [[Sauce|sauce]] at all.  Just [[Grated|grated]] [[Horseradish|horseradish]].\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Jamie Oliver acid etched coarse grater.jpg|Jamie Oliver Acid Etched Coarse Grater\nImage:One inch of horseradish root.jpg|One inch of horseradish root\nImage:Cleaned_and_dried_horseradish_root_pieces.jpg|Cleaned and trimmed horseradish root pieces from our dyke\n\n</gallery>\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 inch of cleaned [[Horseradish root|horseradish root]]\n| A pinch of [[Sea Salt|sea salt]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Using a '''coarse''' laser cut [[Grated|grated]] such as the [[Jamie Oliver acid etched coarse grater]] grate the [[Horseradish root|horseradish root]] into a serving bowl.\n| Add a pinch of [[Sea Salt|sea salt]].\n| Stir with a toothpick to distribute evenly.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nUse as a [[Side dish|side dish]] to [[Dip|dip]] your fries in!\n{{Template:HorseradishSeeAlso}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Dips and sauces]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n[[Category:Uncooked]]\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#horseradishroot #grated #dip #britishrecipes #chips #chicken #veganrecipes #spicyrecipes #jamieoliveracidetchedcoarsegrater #starters #vegetarianrecipes</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Ready steady pasta recipe",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Ready steady pasta, an Italian recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#chicken #readysteadypastarecipe #broccoli #pasta #sherry #chorizo #leeks #mushrooms #cream #zest #unusualrecipes \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This was one of those Ready Steady Cook moments and the result was rather good so I thought I would add it here so it can be reproduced easily\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 3306\n|PortionCalories = 826\n|DatePublished=2nd December 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime = 30 minutes\n|PrepTime = 15 minutes\n|CookTime = 15 minutes \n|Image = [[Image:Ready steady pasta recipe recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">A home-made ready meal</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.7</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">This was easy and delicious</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis was one of those Ready Steady Cook moments and the result was rather good so I thought I would add it here so it can be reproduced easily.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 2 tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| [[Freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 1 medium [[Leek|leek]]\n| 350 g box of field [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]]\n| 5cm (2\") [[Chorizo sausage|chorizo sausage]]\n| 1 medium [[Chicken breast|chicken breast]]\n| 3 [[Cloves of garlic|cloves of garlic]], peeled and sliced (or to taste)\n| 2 tablespoons of [[Cream|cream]] [[Sherry|sherry]]\n| 150 ml [[Single cream|single cream]]\n| [[Zest]] and [[Juice|juice]] of half a [[Lemon|lemon]]\n| 300 g [[Fresh pasta|fresh pasta]] of choice\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Slice the [[Chorizo|chorizo]] thinly\n* Cut the [[Chicken|chicken]] into thin bite-sized pieces - nice and thin means they will cook quickly\n* Cut each [[Mushroom|mushroom]] onto about 3 slices\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Heat the [[Oil|oil]] in a [[Wok|wok]] or a [[Frying pan|frying pan]], add a good grind of [[Pepper|pepper]] and tip in the [[Leeks|leeks]]\n| Gentry saut\u00e9 the [[Leeks|leeks]] for 3 minutes - don't let them take on any colour\n| Turn the heat up add add the [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]] and [[Stir-fry|stir-fry]] them until they start to release a little water\n| Add the [[Chorizo|chorizo]] and [[Stir-fry|stir-fry]] for for 2 minutes\n| Mix in the [[Chicken|chicken]] pieces and the sliced [[Garlic|garlic]] and cook until the chicken is done and not pink when cut.  \n| Now is a good time to start the [[Broccoli|broccoli]] and the [[Pasta|pasta]] - add the pasta to fast [[Boiling|boiling]] water and [[Boil|boil]] for about 4 minutes.  [[Dried pasta]] will take longer.  The [[Broccoli|broccoli]] should be [[Steamed|steamed]] for about the same time depending upon how well cooked you like it.\n| This should only take 3 or 4 minutes if the [[Chicken|chicken]] is cut thinly enough.\n| Add the [[Sherry|sherry]] the zest and juice from half a lemon and stir well to [[De-glaze|de-glaze]] the pan.\n| Remove from the heat and pour in the [[Cream|cream]] and mix really well to combine.\n| Pour over the cooked [[Pasta|pasta]].\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Ready steady cook pasta stir-fry.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Stir-fried, ready for the cream\nImage:Ready steady cook pasta recipe_ingredients.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Ready steady pasta recipe, the ingredients\n</gallery>\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Steamed broccoli|steamed broccoli]]\n==See also==\n\n* http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ready_Steady_Cook\n\n{{Template:YoutubePastaDough}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Italian recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Pasta recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Poultry recipes]]\n[[Category:Cooking with wine]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n[[Category:Stir fried]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#chicken #readysteadypastarecipe #broccoli #pasta #sherry #chorizo #leeks #mushrooms #cream #zest #unusualrecipes </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Redcurrant jelly",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Redcurrant jelly, a fruit recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#currants #redcurrantjelly #boiling #raspberries #fruit #redcurrants #boiledorsimmered #simmer #preserving #sterilisedjars \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Another favourite from Mrs Beeton's cookbook. Its one of those recipes that can't really be improved upon\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}}\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 5065\n|PortionCalories = 633\n|DatePublished=17th January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = 8 quarts of [[currants]] will make from 10 to 12 pots of jelly\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime = 3 hours\n|PrepTime = 2 hours 15 minutes\n|CookTime = 45 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Redcurrant jelly recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Good Old Beeton!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Almost unchanged since she first made it, and nice too.</span> \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\">[[User:Chef|Jerry]] </span></span>\n}}\nAnother favourite from Mrs Beeton's cookbook.\n\nIts one of those recipes that can't really be improved upon.  I love the idea of adding a few [[raspberries]].\n\nHave the [[fruit]] gathered in fine weather, July is ideal.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 9 litres [8 quarts] of [[redcurrants]]\n| To every 600ml (1 pint) of Juice allow:\n| 340g (12oz) [[Sugar]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Remove the stalks from the [[redcurrants]].\n| Put into a jar and place the jar in a saucepan of [[boiling]] water over the heat and let it [[simmer]] gently until the juice is well drawn from the [[currants]].\n| Strain them through a jelly bag or fine cloth. If a very clear jelly is wanted, do not squeeze them too much, as the skin and pulp from the [[fruit]] will be pressed through with the juice and so make the jelly muddy.\n| Measure the juice and to each 600ml (1 pint) allow 340g (12oz) of [[sugar]].\n| Put into a [[preserving]] pan, over the heat and keep stirring the jelly until it is done, carefully removing any scum as it rises, using a wooden or silver spoon for the purpose, as metal or iron ones would spoil the colour of the jelly.\n| When it has [[boiled]] for 20 to 30 minutes put a little of the jelly on a plate and if firm when cool, it is done.\n| Take it off the heat, pour it into small [[sterilised jars]], cover with airtight lids\n| Label the pots, adding the year when the jelly was made and store it away in a dry place.\n| A jam may be made with the [[currants]], if they are not squeezed too dry, by adding a few fresh [[raspberries]] and [[boiling]] all together, with enough [[sugar]] to sweeten it nicely.\n}}\n\nAs this preserve is not worth storing away, but is only for immediate eating, a smaller ratio of [[sugar]] than usual will be found enough: it answers very well for children\u2019s puddings or for a nursery preserve.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Dips and sauces]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Pickles and preserves]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#currants #redcurrantjelly #boiling #raspberries #fruit #redcurrants #boiledorsimmered #simmer #preserving #sterilisedjars </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Red cooked beef with ginger",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Red cooked beef with ginger\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#pressurecooker #chinesebeef #beef #simmering #ginger #rice #darksoysauce #boil #choppedonthediagonal #redcookedbeefwithginger #brownsugar #flanksteak\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=A classic Chinese recipe, cooked in a pressure cooker so the beef is really tender\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=27th March 2023\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  1 hour, 25 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime =  1 hour, 15 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 1235\n|PortionCalories = 617\n|Image = [[Image:Red cooked beef with ginger served with roasties and veg.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Not salty at all</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I expected this to be very salty - far from it; almost perfect. Will be made again!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis recipe is usually cooked by [[Simmering|simmering]] for an hour or so, but recently I've had such a success with [[Pressure cooking|pressure cooking]] [[Beef|beef]] [[Stews|stews]] I thought it worth a try with this as it has such strong flavours, which are unlikely to be reduced by the relative long cooking time.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 400 g lean [[Stewing|stewing]] [[Beef|beef]] ([[Flank|flank]] is ideal)\n| 2 thumb-sized pieces of [[Ginger|ginger]], thinly sliced.\n| ..don't worry about peeling the [[Ginger|ginger]], most of it can be picked out before serving, or eaten anyway.\n| Good pinch of freshly [[Ground|ground]] [[Szechuan peppercorns]]\n| 4 large bulb [[Spring onions|spring onions]], [[Chopped on the diagonal|chopped on the diagonal]]\n| 360 ml water\n| 50 ml [[Light soy sauce|light soy sauce]]\n| 50 ml [[Dark soy sauce|dark soy sauce]]\n| 50 ml [[Rice wine|rice wine]] or pale [[Cream Sherry|cream sherry]]\n| 1 tablespoon soft [[Brown sugar|brown sugar]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Place all of the ingredients in a bowl and mix well\n| Pop the bowl on a trivet in your [[Pressure cooker|pressure cooker]]\n| ..I have modified a small [[Saucepan|saucepan]] so it can be easily removed from the [[Pressure cooker|pressure cooker]], though a [[Pyrex bowl]] would be fine\n| Pressure cook on a high setting for one hour\n| Allow to depressurise naturally\n| Serve!\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Red cooked beef with ginger before any cooking.jpg|Prepared and ready for the pressure cooker\nImage:Out of the pressure cooker in my modified pressure cooker saucepan.jpg|Cooked, in my saucepan I modified to fit in a pressure cooker\n</gallery>\n===Serving suggestions===\nI would normally serve this with [[Rice|rice]] and [[Vegetables|vegetables]] but we fancied [[Air fried roast potatoes|air-fried]] roasties this time.\n===Chef's notes===\nThis could be cooked by bringing to the [[Boil|boil]] and [[Simmering|simmering]] for an hour or so, but it won't be as tender as the relative extended cooking time in a [[Pressure cooker|pressure cooker]].\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Chinese recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Beef recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n[[Category:Pressure cooked]]\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#pressurecooker #chinesebeef #beef #simmering #ginger #rice #darksoysauce #boil #choppedonthediagonal #redcookedbeefwithginger #brownsugar #flanksteak</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

|Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 35 minutes\n |PrepTime = 10 minutes\n |CookTime = 25 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Red onion soup with Capricorn croutons recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"><span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Meh!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">2.5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">It's ok.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\">[[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis delicious [[Soup|soup]] idea is reproduced with the kind permission of [[The Lubborn Creamery]].\n\n'''the [[Soup|soup]]'''\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1 tablespoon [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 25g [[Butter|butter]]\n| 3 [[Red onions|red onions]], peeled and thinly sliced\n| 2 teaspoons of [[Plain flour|plain flour]]\n| 2 teaspoons of[[Tomato pur\u00e9e|tomato pur\u00e9e]]\n| 3 tablespoons of [[Red wine|red wine]]\n| 800ml [[Beef Stock|beef stock]]\n| Seasoning\n}}\n'''for the [[Croutons|croutons]]:'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 4 diagonal slices [[French bread]]\n| 2 tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 100g [[Capricorn Somerset Goats' cheese]], sliced into 4\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Heat the [[Oil|oil]] and [[Butter|butter]] together in a large saucepan and [[Fry|fry]] the [[Onions|onions]] for 5-6 minutes until soft.\n| Stir in the [[Flour|flour]].\n| Gradually [[Blend|blend]] in the [[Tomato|tomato]] pur\u00e9e, [[Red wine|red wine]] and [[Beef Stock|beef stock]].\n| Bring to the [[Boil|boil]], stirring.\n| Cover and [[Simmer|simmer]] gently for 8-10 minutes\n| Preheat the [[Grill|grill]] to medium.\n| Drizzle the [[Bread|bread]] with the [[Oil|oil]] and place under the [[Grill|grill]], [[Brown|brown]] each side.\n| Top each cro\u00fbton with a slice of [[Capricorn Somerset Goats cheese]], [[Grill|grill]] until melted and golden [[Brown|brown]].\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe the [[Soup|soup]] with the [[Capricorn Somerset Goats' cheese]] [[Croutons|croutons]] on top.\n\n{{Template:Croutons recipes}}\n\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Soup and stock recipes]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Lubborn Creamery recipes]]\n[[Category:Grilled, griddled or barbecued]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#grill #soup #redonionsoupwithcapricorncroutons #croutons #beefstock #oliveoil #redwine #butter #redonions #simmer #onions </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Red pickled eggs",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Red pickled eggs, Egg recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#beetroot #eggs #juice #redpickledeggs #vinegar #pickledbeetroot #miseenplace #unusualrecipes #cocktailstick #pickling \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=These eggs are red due to the addition of beetroot juice\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 817\n|PortionCalories = 81\n|DatePublished=28th July 2013\n|Author = JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = Servings: 10 - To fill a 1 litre jar\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 25 minutes\n |PrepTime = 10 minutes\n |CookTime = 15 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Red pickled eggs recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"><span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">They look weird</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.36</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">..but they taste like normal pickled eggs, only they are red.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\">[[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]] </span></span>\n}}\n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}}\n\nThese [[Eggs|eggs]] are red due to the addition of [[Beetroot|beetroot]] [[Juice|juice]]\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 10 [[Eggs|eggs]], hard-[[Boiled|boiled]] and peeled\n| 200ml distilled, white [[Pickling|pickling]] [[Vinegar|vinegar]]\n| 200ml [[Beetroot|beetroot]] [[Juice|juice]] (see Chef's notes below)\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Sterilise your jar and lid, and allow to cool.\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Randomly prick the [[Eggs|eggs]] with a [[cocktail stick]] to allow for the better colouring and flavouring of the eggs (optional).\n| Fill your cold jar with them [[Eggs|eggs]].\n| Pour in the [[Beetroot|beetroot]] [[Juice|juice]] and top up with the distilled [[Vinegar|vinegar]].\n| Seal, and keep for 2 weeks before consumption.\n}}\n===Chef's notes===\nFor preference, use peeled, raw, fresh [[Beetroot|beetroot]] (about 500g) to obtain your [[Juice|juice]].  My next choice would be pre cooked, vacuum packed beetroot and in third place, you could use jarred [[Pickled beetroot|pickled beetroot]], drained from its [[Vinegar|vinegar]].\n\nFor this recipe, I have used the pre cooked vacuum packed [[Beetroot|beetroot]], as our nearest greengrocer is miles away.\n\n400g [[beetroot]] should yield about 200ml juice.  Do not overpack the jar with [[eggs]] otherwise parts of the [[eggs]] will not colour so well as others.  Therefore, use too few, rather than too many.\n\nIf you can get it, there is an excellent commercially produced '''[http://www.goodnessdirect.co.uk/cgi-local/frameset/detail/570112_Eden_Organic_Beetroot_Juice_750ml.html  organic beetroot juice]''' available.  It is so delicious, however, that you will probably want to drink it rather than use it for pickling!\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Pickled eggs red]]\n[[Category:British recipes|Pickled eggs red]]\n[[Category:Egg recipes|Pickled eggs red]]\n[[Category:Pickles and preserves|Pickled eggs red]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites|Pickled eggs red]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes|Pickled eggs red]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes|Pickled eggs red]]\n[[Category:Pickled]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#beetroot #eggs #juice #redpickledeggs #vinegar #pickledbeetroot #miseenplace #unusualrecipes #cocktailstick #pickling </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

Post war cookery advice from the UK Ministry of Food\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 471\n|PortionCalories = 117\n|DatePublished=20th January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Ministry of Food Cookery calendar - 1951\n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime = 40 minutes\n|PrepTime = 10 minutes\n|CookTime = 30 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Ministry of Food Cookery calendar - 1951.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Just as good now, as it was then!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.6</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">You can't improve on perfection!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Sue_spins|Susie]] </span></span>\n}}\n\"Housekeeping's most important secret nowadays is to know how to make best use of the foods available.  Here are some practical suggestions for improving your inside knowledge without undue expense.\"\n'''Ministry of food Cookery Calendar - April..May 1951'''\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| [[Flaky pastry]] using 6 oz [[flour]]\n| 1 lb [[rhubarb]] stems, cut into 1\" lengths\n| 3 oz [[dates]], chopped\n| 2 level teaspoons [[honey]]\n| 1 tablespoon water\n}}\n''Glaze:''\n* 1 level teaspoons [[honey]] dissolved in 1 teaspoon water\n\n\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Line a deep tart plate (7\" diameter) with two thirds of the pastry and fill the case with alternate layers of [[rhubarb]], [[dates]] and [[honey]]\n| Pour over the water\n| Roll out the remaining pastry and cut into thin strips\n| Place the strips across the fruit in a criss-cross design and [[brush]] with the glaze\n| [[Bake]] in a moderately hot (200\u00b0 C - 400\u00b0 F - Gas 6) oven for 25-30 minutes\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#honey #rhubarb #dates #flakypastry #flour #bake #brush </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

                "revisions": [

                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",

                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Rhubarb sauce, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#rhubarbsauce #rhubarb #sauce #zest #duck #boil #fish #sticksofrhubarb #brownsugar #frozen #simmer \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This quick and easy sauce goes really well with fatty meat for fish such as pork, duck and mackerel and is equally as good as a dessert with a few\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 158\n|PortionCalories = 39\n|DatePublished=17th January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Rhubarb sauce, at the start of the cooking process\n |Servings = Serves 4 as a [[Sauce|sauce]]\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 30 minutes\n |PrepTime = 5 minutes\n |CookTime = 25 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Rhubarb sauce recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Fine coloured sauce</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">It was very sharp, good with our bass.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis quick and easy [[Sauce|sauce]] goes really well with fatty [[Meat|meat]] for [[Fish|fish]] such as [[Pork|pork]], [[Duck|duck]] and [[Mackerel|mackerel]] and is equally as good as a [[Dessert|dessert]] with a few sweet biscuits or a little [[Custard|custard]].\n[[Image:Mackerel with rhubarb and ginger recipe.jpg|thumb|300px|right|[[Mackerel with rhubarb and ginger]], [[Tex-Mex potato wedges]] and tomatoes]]\n\n\nWhat you don't use now can be [[Frozen|frozen]] for later use.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 6 [[Sticks of rhubarb|sticks of rhubarb]], washed, topped and tailed\n| [[Grated]] [[Zest|zest]] and [[Juice|juice]] of one [[Orange|orange]]\n| 6 teaspoons of [[Brown sugar|brown sugar]] (or to taste)\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Chop the [[Rhubarb|rhubarb]] into 5 cm (1\") lengths\n| Heat a large [[Frying pan|frying pan]], add the [[Rhubarb|rhubarb]], [[Sugar|sugar]], [[Orange juice|orange juice]] and [[Zest|zest]] and almost cover with cold water.\n}}\n\n# Bring to the [[Boil|boil]] and [[Simmer|simmer]] for 15 to 20 minutes. At the last few minutes, the [[Rhubarb|rhubarb]] will break down and absorb all of the water.\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe hot or cold.\n===Chef's notes===\nYou may want more [[Sugar|sugar]] than this - I like the [[Sauce|sauce]] to be nice and sharp.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Dips and sauces]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#rhubarbsauce #rhubarb #sauce #zest #duck #boil #fish #sticksofrhubarb #brownsugar #frozen #simmer </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

Post war cookery advice from the UK Ministry of Food\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1212\n|PortionCalories = 303\n|DatePublished=24th October 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Ministry of Food Cookery calendar - 1951\n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime = 40 minutes\n|PrepTime = 10 minutes\n|CookTime = 30 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Ministry of Food Cookery calendar - 1951.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">My Mum's recipe card!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.8</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">From way back in 1950-something.</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry]] </span></span>\n}}\n\"Housekeeping's most important secret nowadays is to know how to make best use of the foods available.\n\nHere are some practical suggestions for improving your inside knowledge without undue expense.\"  '''Ministry of food Cookery Calendar - April..May 1951'''\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 113g [4 oz] [[rice]]\n| 28g [1 oz] [[margarine]]\n| 28g [1 oz] [[flour]]\n| 213 ml [3/8 pint] of [[milk]]\n| 85g [3 oz] [[Cheddar cheese]], [[grated]]\n| [[Salt]], [[pepper]] and [[cayenne pepper]]\n| White [[breadcrumbs]]\n| [[Fat]] for [[frying]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Wash the [[rice]] and cook in [[boiling]] [[salted]] water until tender; drain well\n| Make a thick [[sauce]] with the margarine, [[flour]] and [[milk]] and mix in the [[rice]] and [[cheese]]\n| Season well and turn the mixture onto a plate and leave until cold\n| Thin [[batter]] for coating (see note)\n| Divide into 8 portions, form into croquettes and coat with batter and [[breadcrumbs]]\n| [[Fry]] in hot [[fat]] until golden brown and serve hot with [[carrots]] and [[peas]], or cold with a green [[salad]]\n}}\n\n''Batter coating'' \n* 2 level tablespoons [[flour]] blended with 4 tablespoons [[milk]] or water\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Rice recipes]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]][[Category:Pan fried]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#rice #flour #breadcrumbs #fat #salad #frying #salted #peas #boiling #cheddarcheese #carrots </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Roasted butternut squash and Capricorn goats' cheese gnocchi",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Roasted butternut squash and Capricorn goats' cheese gnocchi recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#gnocchi #butter #roastedbutternutsquashandcapricorngoatscheesegnocchi #butternutsquash #goatscheese #sageleaves #bakingtray #thelubborncreamery #miseenplace #sage #fat \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Another interesting and economical way to utilise your annual squash-glut\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 998\n|PortionCalories = 499\n|DatePublished=25th October 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 2\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 40 minutes\n |PrepTime = 10 minutes\n |CookTime = 30 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Roasted butternut squash and Capricorn goats' cheese gnocchi recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Nice, and simple too.</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Dead easy!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Sue_spins|Susie]] </span></span>\n}}\nAnother interesting and economical way to utilise your annual [[Squash|squash]]-glut.  And if you've never tried [[Gnocchi|gnocchi]], here is your chance.\n\nMany thanks to those nice people at [[The Lubborn Creamery]] for giving us permission to reproduce this recipe.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1 x100g Capricorn [[Goats cheese|goats cheese]]\n| 250g fresh [[Gnocchi|gnocchi]]\n| 100g [[Diced|diced]] [[Butternut squash|butternut squash]]\n| A small handful of fresh [[Sage leaves|sage leaves]], chopped\n| 25g [[Butter|butter]]\n| [[Olive oil]]\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]]\n| [[Freshly ground black pepper]]\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4), [fan oven 160\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Place the [[Butternut squash|butternut squash]] on a [[Baking tray|baking tray]] in the middle of a hot [[Oven|oven]]. [[Roast]] at 180\u00b0C for 20 minutes.\n| Add the [[Gnocchi|gnocchi]] to a pan of [[Salted|salted]], [[Boiling|boiling]] water and cook for 3 minutes or according to packet instructions.\n| Melt the [[Butter|butter]] in a pan and add the [[Gnocchi|gnocchi]], Capricorn [[Goats cheese|goats cheese]], [[Butternut squash|butternut squash]] and [[Sage|sage]]. Season with [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]], then remove from heat.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nPlace into bowls and serve.\n===Chef's notes===\nFor a lighter alternative, use 15g of [[Butter|butter]] instead of 25g, or a low-[[Fat|fat]] spread.\n{{Gnocchi-See also}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Pasta recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Squash recipes]]\n[[Category:Lubborn Creamery recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]][[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#gnocchi #butter #roastedbutternutsquashandcapricorngoatscheesegnocchi #butternutsquash #goatscheese #sageleaves #bakingtray #thelubborncreamery #miseenplace #sage #fat </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Roasted garlic fish pie (TM)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Roasted garlic fish pie - A Thermomix recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#fish #potatoes #steaming #butter #potato #garlic #thermomix #cornflour #bake #cream #mashedpotato \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This Roasted garlic fish pie recipe for Thermomix is finished off in the oven\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2704\n|PortionCalories = 676\n|DatePublished=7th November 2012\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = Serves 4 to 6\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 1 hour 25 minutes\n |PrepTime = 15 minutes\n |CookTime = 1 hour 10 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Roasted garlic fish pie (TM).jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Garlic, fish, Thermy!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">What's not to like? \ud83e\udd17</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis recipe for [[Thermomix]] is finished off in the [[Oven|oven]].\n\n\n'''For the pie'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsTM\n| 340g [[Milk|milk]]\n| 160g water\n| 500g mixed [[Fish|fish]], cut into chunks - use firm fish such as [[Cod|cod]], [[Haddock|haddock]], [[Monkfish|monkfish]], [[Pollack|pollack]] or [[Salmon|salmon]]\n| 60g [[Butter|butter]] or [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 40g [[Cornflour|cornflour]]\n| 1&frac12; teaspoons [[Bron's Spanish vegetable stock concentrate (TM)|Thermomix vegetable stock concentrate]] \n| 3 bulbs [[garlic]], [[roasted]] and squeezed out from the skin - see [[Roasted garlic|here]] for the method.\n}}\n'''For the [[Mashed potato|mashed potato]]'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 750g floury [[Potatoes|potatoes]], peeled and cut into 2cm pieces\n| 500g water (use the [[Fish|fish]] liquid left over from above, and make up to 500g with water)\n| &frac12; teaspoon [[Salt|salt]]\n| 40g [[Butter|butter]]\n| 100g of the [[Steaming|steaming]] water\n| 100g [[Milk|milk]] or [[Cream|cream]]\n| &frac12; teaspoon [[Nutmeg|nutmeg]], [[Grated|grated]]\n| Seasoning, to taste\n| Breadcrumbs\n| A little extra [[Butter|butter]] for dotting\n}}\n===Method===\n\n\n'''For the pie'''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Put the [[Milk|milk]] and water into the TM bowl and insert the internal [[Steaming|steaming]] basket.\n| Add the [[Fish|fish]] to the basket.\n| Cook '''10 minutes / 100\u00b0 / Speed 4'''.\n| Tip out the [[Fish|fish]] liquid and reserve.\n| Place the [[Fish|fish]] in a pie dish or casserole.\n| Weigh 400g of the [[Fish|fish]] liquid back into the TM bowl, using extra [[Milk|milk]] if necessary to make it up to 400g.\n| Add the [[Butter|butter]] or [[Oil|oil]], [[Cornflour|cornflour]], [[Bron's Spanish vegetable stock concentrate (TM)|Thermomix vegetable stock concentrate]] and the [[Garlic|garlic]].\n| Cook '''4 minutes / 100\u00b0 / Speed 4'''.\n| Taste and season if necessary.\n| Pour the sauce over the [[fish]] and mix well.\n}}\n'''For the [[Mashed potato|mashed potato]]'''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Having washed the TM bowl (no need to wash the basket at this stage), weigh in the water, add the [[Salt|salt]] and insert the basket.\n| Weigh the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] into the basket.\n| Cook '''15 minutes / Temp. Varoma / Speed Spoon'''.\n| Check the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] have been properly cooked and is necessary, cook a few minutes more until tender.\n| Drain the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] and reserve the [[Steaming|steaming]] water.\n| Insert the '''Butterfly Whisk''' and add the butter, [[Steaming|steaming]] water, [[Milk|milk]] or [[Cream|cream]], [[Nutmeg|nutmeg]] and seasoning with the [[Potatoes|potatoes]].\n| Mix '''2-10 seconds / Speed 4''' depending on the desired consistency - I find that 4 seconds is about right.\n| Spread the [[Potato|potato]] over the [[Fish|fish]] mixture and sprinkle with breadcrumbs.\n| Dot some small pieces of [[Butter|butter]] over the [[Potato|potato]].\n| [[Bake]] at 220\u00b0 C (425\u00b0 F - gas 7), [fan [[Oven|oven]] 200\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour] for 30-40 minutes until golden [[Brown|brown]].\n| ('''AGA [[Ovens|ovens]]''':  [[Bake]] 30 minutes on rack set on lowest set of runners in the [[Roasting]] [[Oven]].)\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Steamed|steamed]] [[Peas|peas]] or [[Broccoli|broccoli]].\n===Recipe source===\n* Adapted from a recipe in '''Fast and Easy Cooking''', the [[Thermomix]] UK recipe book.\n===Variations===\nYou can also use [[Prawns|prawns]] or [[scallops]] in place of the some of the [[Fish|fish]].  You can cover with [[Puff pastry|puff pastry]] instead of [[Potato|potato]] if preferred.  Add some [[Garlic|garlic]] and/or [[onion]] - this will need be [[saut\u00e9ed]] in the TM bowl '''before''' [[steaming]] the [[fish]].\n===Chef's notes===\nUsually I find that the [[potatoes]] need cooking for 20 minutes.  If bubbling liquid starts to come through the lid, increase spees to 2.  It is best to allow the [[fish]] mixture to cool, before adding the [[potato]] or it will sink too much into the [[fish]] [[sauce]].\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes]]\n[[Category:Sea fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Thermomix recipes]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#fish #potatoes #steaming #butter #potato #garlic #thermomix #cornflour #bake #cream #mashedpotato </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Roasted sausage, parsnip and pear with maple syrup glaze",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Roasted sausage, parsnip and pear with maple syrup glaze recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#maplesyrup #pecans #sausages #pears #parsnips #sage #roastedsausageparsnipandpearwithmaplesyrupglaze #bake #roast #baking #pear \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A no-mess, moreish roast. This roasted sausage, parsnip and pear dish with a maple syrup glaze and crispy fried sage is an easy win with guests\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1977\n|PortionCalories = 494\n|DatePublished=22nd October 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  1 hour, 15 minutes\n|PrepTime =  35 minutes\n|CookTime =  40 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Roasted sausage, parsnip and pear with maple syrup glaze recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Not bad,</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Not sure about your parsnip idea, much nicer when I used carrots instead.</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Carla_Cancio-Bello,_J.D.,_on_behalf_of_Cuban_Cuisine_UK|Carla]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Harrogate-pork-sausages.png|300px|thumb|right|[[Debbie and Andrew's Harrogate 97% Pork Sausages|Debbie and Andrew's Harrogate 97% Gluten Free Pork Sausages]]]]\nA no-mess, moreish [[Roast|roast]]. This [[Roasted|roasted]] [[Sausage|sausage]], [[Parsnip|parsnip]] and [[Pear|pear]] dish with a [[Maple syrup|maple syrup]] glaze and crispy [[Fried|fried]] [[Sage|sage]] is an easy win with guests. The hearty sausage roast recipe is reproduced courtesy of [[Debbie&andrew's sausages|debbie&andrew's sausages]].\n\nThe prime cuts of [[Shoulder|shoulder]] and [[Belly pork|belly pork]] in the Harrogate 97% [[Sausages|sausages]] are juicy, with [[Maple syrup|maple syrup]] bringing out the sweetness of the [[Parsnips|parsnips]] and [[Pears|pears]]. A sprinkle of chopped [[Pecans|pecans]] adds crunch to this delicious [[Roast|roast]]  feast.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 6 debbie&andrew\u0092s [[Harrogate 97% Pork Sausages]]\n| 500g [[Parsnips|parsnips]] or [[Potatoes|potatoes]], peeled and cut into quarters\n| 2 [[Banana shallots|banana shallots]] or [[Onions|onions]], peeled and cut lengthways, keeping the root end on to hold together when [[Baking|baking]]\n| 1 large [[Pear|pear]] or [[Apple|apple]], cored and cut into eighths lengthways\n| 2 tablespoons of [[Maple syrup|maple syrup]] or [[Honey|honey]]\n| Handful of chopped [[Pecans|pecans]] or [[Walnuts|walnuts]]\n| 10-15 [[Sage leaves|sage leaves]]\n| 30g [[Butter|butter]]\n| [[Salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] top 190\u00b0 C (375\u00b0 F - gas 5), [fan oven 170\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| In a large shallow [[Casserole dish|casserole dish]] add a tablespoon of [[Oil|oil]] and cook the [[Sausages|sausages]] for around 2 minutes until they are coloured.\n| Add the [[Parsnips|parsnips]] and [[Shallot|shallot]], season with [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]] and stir.\n| [[Bake]] in the [[Oven|oven]] for 25 minutes, giving a shake once or twice.\n}}\n====whilst the sausages and parsnips are cooking in the oven:====\n{{RecipeMethod\n| In a [[Frying pan|frying pan]], heat the [[Butter|butter]] and once foaming add the [[Pears|pears]], [[Frying|frying]] off for 5 minutes until the flesh is [[Caramelised|caramelised]] and golden [[Brown|brown]]. Remove and [[Rest|rest]] on a plate until needed.\n| In a small [[Saucepan|saucepan]], [[Deep-fry|deep-fry]] the [[Sage|sage]] in [[Oil|oil]]. Remove with a [[Slotted spoon|slotted spoon]] and blot with [[Kitchen paper|kitchen paper]] to remove excess oil.\n| After 25 minutes of [[Baking|baking]], add the [[Pears|pears]] and [[Pecans|pecans]] to the [[Sausages|sausages]] and drizzle with the [[Maple syrup|maple syrup]]. [[Bake]] for a further 10 minutes.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nPlace in the middle of the table and scatter with the crispy [[Sage leaves|sage leaves]].\n===Variations===\nChunks of [[Blue cheese|blue cheese]] can be added at the end for a more indulgent dish.\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Stews and casseroles]]\n[[Category:Debbie&andrew's sausage recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n{{Template:DebbieAndAndrew attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#maplesyrup #pecans #sausages #pears #parsnips #sage #roastedsausageparsnipandpearwithmaplesyrupglaze #bake #roast #baking #pear </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }

                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Roasted sausages with apples and lots of garlic - easy recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#garlic #sausages #roast #wedges #apples #apple #oliveoil #onion #sageleaves #roastedsausageswithapplesandlotsofgarlic #maplesyrup \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=If you like easy recipes with lots of garlic, apples and sausages then this is definitely for you\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 403\n|PortionCalories = 100\n|DatePublished=23rd October 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  50 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime =  40 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Roasted sausages with apples and lots of garlic recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Looks lovely..</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.2</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">..but the garlic needs to be cooked a bit more\ud83d\ude11</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nIf you like easy recipes with lots of [[Garlic|garlic]], [[Apples|apples]] and [[Sausages|sausages]] then this is definitely for you.  Made in one pot in under an hour this recipe is brought to [[Cookipedia]] by [[Debbie&andrew's sausages|debbie&andrew's sausages]].\n[[Image:Perfect-cumberland-sausages.png|300px|thumb|right|[[Debbie and Andrew's Perfect Cumberland Pork Sausages]]]]\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 pack [[Debbie and Andrew's Perfect Cumberland Pork Sausages]]\n| 1 [[Onion|onion]], peeled and cut into [[Wedges|wedges]]\n| A drizzle of [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 1 bulb [[Garlic|garlic]], unpeeled and halved lengthways\n| 1 tablespoon [[Gluten free|gluten free]] [[Wholegrain mustard|wholegrain mustard]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Maple syrup|maple syrup]]\n| 2 [[Dessert|dessert]] [[Apples|apples]], sliced\n| 1 cooking [[Apple|apple]], sliced\n| 6 fresh [[Sage leaves|sage leaves]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6), [fan oven 180\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Place the [[Sausages|sausages]] in a [[Roasting tin|roasting tin]] along with the [[Onion|onion]] [[Wedges|wedges]] and [[Garlic|garlic]] bulb halves and drizzle with [[Olive oil|olive oil]]. [[Roast]] for 20 minutes and remove from the [[Oven|oven]].\n| Mix together the [[Mustard|mustard]] and [[Maple syrup|maple syrup]] and pour over the [[Sausage|sausage]] mix. Add the [[Apple|apple]] pieces and [[Sage leaves|sage leaves]] and return to the [[Oven|oven]].\n| [[Roast]] for a further 20 minutes then divide up the [[Roast garlic|roast garlic]] and serve the whole lot straight from the tin.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Mashed potatoes|mashed potatoes]] and buttered [[Cabbage|cabbage]].\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Gluten free recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Stews and casseroles]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n[[Category:Debbie&andrew's sausage recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n{{Template:DebbieAndAndrew attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#garlic #sausages #roast #wedges #apples #apple #oliveoil #onion #sageleaves #roastedsausageswithapplesandlotsofgarlic #maplesyrup </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Roasted tomato soup (TM)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Roasted tomato soup - A Thermomix recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#worcestershiresauce #roast #sherryvinegar #chillies #blend #garlic #parsley #oliveoil #onions #tomatoes #fruit \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This recipe has been adapted for the Thermomix from Channel 4's Come Dine with me\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 503\n|PortionCalories = 167\n|DatePublished=20th October 2012\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = Serves 3 to 4\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 55 minutes\n |PrepTime = 10 minutes\n |CookTime = 45 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Roasted tomato soup recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Tomato Glut?</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Look on - this is the cure!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis recipe has been adapted for the Thermomix from a '''[http://www.channel4.com/4food/recipes/popular-dishes/soup/roasted-tomato-soup-recipe Come Dine With Me]''' recipe.  The orginal is quite chunky but here I have made it into a smooth, thick soup.  I have also tweaked around a bit with the ingredients.\n\nSee '''Variations''' below for the conventional method of making this.\n\n{{RecipeIngredientsTM\n| 1kg ripe [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]], quartered\n| 360g [[Onions|onions]], cut into thick [[Wedges|wedges]]\n| [[Garlic]], to taste\n| 2 [[Red peppers|red peppers]], quartered and deseeded\n| 100ml [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| [[Salt]]\n| 4 [[Chillies|chillies]], [[Seeds|seeds]] left in (optional)\n| 300ml water\n| 4 teaspoons [[Vegetable|vegetable]] [[Bouillon|bouillon]] powder\n| 2 tablespoons [[Sherry vinegar|sherry vinegar]]\n| 4 dashes of [[Worcestershire sauce]]\n| Seasoning\n| Few sprigs fresh [[Parsley|parsley]]\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 220\u00b0C/fan 200\u00b0C/gas 7\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Put the [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]], [[Onions|onions]], [[Garlic|garlic]], and [[Peppers|peppers]] into a large [[Roasting tin|roasting tin]]. \n| Drizzle with [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and [[Roast|roast]] for 45 minutes until tender and beginning to char.\n| Put the [[Roasted vegetables|roasted vegetables]] in the TM with the [[Chillies|chillies]], [[Stock|stock]], [[Sherry vinegar|sherry vinegar]], and [[Worcestershire sauce]]. \n| [[Blend]] for '''40-50 seconds / Speed 10''', until smooth.\n| Reheat '''100\u00b0 / 4 minutes / Speed 2'''.\n| Check seasoning, serve, garnished with the [[Parsley|parsley]].\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe as a [[Light lunch|light lunch]] with [[Bread|bread]], [[Cheese|cheese]] and [[Fruit|fruit]]\n===Variations===\nTo make this conventionally [[Roast|roast]] the [[Vegetables|vegetables]] as instructed, [[Blend|blend]] in a [[Food processor|food processor]] or liquidiser with the remaining ingredients and reheat in a saucepan.\n===Chef's notes===\nThis recipe may not need additional seasoning, so taste before you add any [[Salt|salt]] or [[Pepper|pepper]] at the end.  This also make a good cold soup.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Soup and stock recipes]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Chilli pepper recipes]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Thermomix recipes]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#worcestershiresauce #roast #sherryvinegar #chillies #blend #garlic #parsley #oliveoil #onions #tomatoes #fruit </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }

title": "Roasting a chicken in a slow cooker",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Proper roast chicken, cooked only in a slow cooker / crockpot recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#chicken #aluminiumfoil #roastingachickeninaslowcooker #slowcooker #onion #oliveoil #freshherbs #tacoseasoning #heart #smokedpaprikapowder #liver \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=I didn't think that this would be possible until I read Julia's blog, she is always coming up with innovative ideas! What a great use for a slow cooker / crockpot\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1117\n|PortionCalories = 279\n|DatePublished=19th June 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = After 8 hours it looks and smells divine!\n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  8 hours, 10 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime =  8 hours\n|Image = [[Image:Roasting a chicken in a slow cooker recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Unbelievable</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Until I tried this, I did not believe it would be possible.   I wish I had been able to this when I had my first bed-sit!</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nI didn't think that this would be possible until I read [[:Category:I believe I can fry recipes|Julia's blog]], she is always coming up with innovative ideas!\n\nWhat a great use for a [[Slow cooker|slow cooker]], go out to work in the morning and come back to [[Roast|roast]] [[Chicken|chicken]]!\n\nI've used my own variation of Julia's [[Marinade|marinade]] rub.  You can invent your own, all you need is a little imagination.  At the very least, you should rub the skin with [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and a little [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 whole raw [[Chicken|chicken]] - if it has been [[Frozen|frozen]], ensure that it is completely [[Defrosted|defrosted]].\n| 1 [[Onion|onion]], un peeled, cut into quarters\n| A few sprigs of [[Fresh herbs|fresh herbs]] of choice (if available)\n| 2 tablespoons of [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n}}\n'''rub'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 1 teaspoon [[Garlic powder|garlic powder]]\n| 1 teaspoon fine [[Salt|salt]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Paprika powder|paprika powder]]\n| &#189; teaspoon [[chilli powder]] \n| &#189; teaspoon [[Smoked paprika powder|smoked paprika powder]] (optional)\n| 1 teaspoon [[Dried mixed herbs|dried mixed herbs]]\n| Plenty of [[aluminium foil]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Random recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Unbelievable</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Until I tried this, I did not believe it would be possible.   I wish I had been able to this when I had my first bed-sit!</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Roasting a chicken in a slow cooker - ready to cook.jpg|Ready to start cooking\nImage:Roasting a chicken in a slow cooker - tin foil, rub and stuffing.jpg|Slow cooker lined with aluminium foil, rub ingredients and onion and herbs\nImage:Roasting a chicken in a slow cooker - no tin foil.jpg|No aluminium foil? a lattice of spoons does just as well\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Scrunch up the [[aluminium foil]] into 8 loose balls, line the base of the [[Slow cooker|slow cooker]] with these.\n| These will keep the [[Chicken|chicken]] from sitting in the cooking juices, so we get a [[Dry roast|dry roast]].\n| Remove and discard the innards, if any ([[Heart|heart]], [[Liver|liver]], neck etc)\n| Remove the [[Parson's nose|parson's nose]].\n| Rinse inside and out with cold-running water and pat dry using [[Paper towels|paper towels]].\n| Drop the quartered [[Onion|onion]] into the cavity together with any [[Fresh herbs|fresh herbs]] you may have to [[Hand|hand]].\n| Mix the rub ingredients together in a small bowl.\n| Using you hands, massage the [[Oil|oil]] all over the [[Chicken|chicken]]'s skin.\n| Cover the [[Chicken|chicken]] with the rub so it is really well coated.\n| Sit the [[Chicken|chicken]] (breast upwards) gently on the [[aluminium foil]], taking care not to crush it.\n| Set the [[slow cooker]] to low and leave to cook for 8 hours.  It won't hurt if it's left for a little longer.\n| Check the chicken has reached a [[safe cooking temperature]] [74 \u00b0C (165 \u00b0F)]\n}}\n===Variations===\nUse a packet of [[Taco seasoning]] as a rub for the [[Chicken|chicken]] or make your own here: [[Tex-Mex seasoning]]\n===Chef's notes===\nI would start with a medium sized chicken unless you are sure that a large chicken will fit.  We have a large Morphy Richards 6.5 litre slow cooker and a small chicken fitted easily, but I'm not so sure that a large one would fit.\n\n'''A little more environmentally friendly:''' Revisiting this recipe, the reason for the [[aluminium foil]] is just to stop the [[chicken]] overcooking should it make contact with the [[crockpot]]. It seems rather wasteful to use so much [[aluminium foil]] and then chuck it away afterwards so I looked for an alternative.  An ovenproof plate would be good but it has to be surprisingly small to fit in a slow cooker.  After a few experiments, a lattice of spoons worked the best. I still use a ball of [[aluminium foil]] on each side to hold the legs away from the edge of a cooker.\n\nYou could also rest the chicken on some [[carrots]], [[parsnips]] and [[onions]] which would serve the same purpose.\n==See also==\n* www.ibelieveicanfry.com/2013/04/slow-cooker-rotisserie-chicken.html\n* http://www.paleocupboard.com/slow-cooker-rotisserie-chicken.html\n* [[Slow cooker chicken (slow cooker recipe)]]\n* [[Roasting a turkey in a slow cooker]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:North American recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Poultry recipes]]\n[[Category:Slow cooker recipes]]\n[[Category:I believe I can fry recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Slow cooked]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#chicken #aluminiumfoil #roastingachickeninaslowcooker #slowcooker #onion #oliveoil #freshherbs #tacoseasoning #heart #smokedpaprikapowder #liver </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Roasting a turkey in a slow cooker",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Roasting a turkey in a slow cooker recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#turkey #slowcooker #foil #onion #bacon #baking #freshherbs #roastingaturkeyinaslowcooker #stock #oliveoil #garlic \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=You wouldn't believe this recipe was possible until you try it.  A brilliant way to cook poultry, no one would know it wasn't oven cooked\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 4185\n|PortionCalories = 1046\n|DatePublished=24th November 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  10 hours, 15 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  10 hours\n|Image = [[Image:Roasting a turkey in a slow cooker recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Brilliant idea!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I didn't think this would work until I tried it.  It's great if you don't have access to an oven and it tasted as good as it looked.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nOk, I admit that it's not possible to [[Roast|roast]] a whole [[Turkey|turkey]] in a [[Slow cooker|slow cooker]] unless it is ''very small''.  However it is perfectly possible to slow cook a turkey crown, turkey breast or a turkey leg.\n\nIn the UK our local supermarket (Morrisons) sell a 1600g [3.5 lb] [[Turkey|turkey]] leg, separated into two pieces for just \u00a34.50, compared to \u00a324 for a turkey crown.  The leg is ideal for prolonged cooking and it '''''will''''' [[Roast|roast]] in the [[Slow cooker|slow cooker]].\n\nI've used a massive amount of [[Fresh herbs|fresh herbs]] from our garden to give this joint masses of flavour.\n\nThe [[Roasting|roasting]] occurs because the [[Turkey|turkey]] is kept out of the [[Stock|stock]] by sitting it on 5 or 6 balls of scrunched up [[Baking|baking]] [[Foil|foil]], a large [[Onion|onion]], halved and a bed of [[Herbs|herbs]].  I've used 500 ml of stock and 6 rashers of streaky [[Bacon|bacon]] to prevent the turkey from [[Drying|drying]] out. Plus some [[Garlic|garlic]] for extra flavour.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1.6kg [1lb 8oz] [[Turkey|turkey]] leg (separated)\n| 6 rashers of streaky [[Bacon|bacon]]\n| 1 large [[Onion|onion]], unpeeled and cut into two halves\n| 5 [[Cloves of garlic|cloves of garlic]], unpeeled and smashed under the flat of a knife\n| Large pinch of [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| Large bunch of [[Fresh herbs|fresh herbs]]. ([[Sage|sage]], [[Rosemary|rosemary]], [[Thyme|thyme]], etc). I also added the remains of a bunch of [[Dill|dill]]\n| [[Olive oil]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* [[Roasting a chicken in a slow cooker]] - [[Tin foil|tin foil]], rub and [[Stuffing|stuffing]].jpg\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Roast turkey and trimmings.jpg|Served with [[roast potatoes]] and [[roasted vegetables]] that were cooked in a conventional oven\nImage:Cooking turkey leg in a slow cooker prepped.jpg|Prepped and ready for 10 hours of slow cooking\nImage:Cooking turkey leg in a slow cooker ingredients.jpg|The basic ingredients - all that turkey for \u00a34.50!\nImage:Roasting a turkey leg in a slow cooker - tin foil balls.jpg|Scrunch up the baking foil into small balls to give the turkey some support and keep it dry so it can roast\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Loosely scrunch up 5 or 6 balls of [[Baking|baking]] [[Foil|foil]] and place in the base of the [[Slow cooker|slow cooker]]\n| Arrange the [[Onion|onion]] halves where they will provide the best support for the [[Turkey|turkey]] leg\n| Distribute the smashed [[Garlic|garlic]] in the base of the [[Cooker|cooker]] and make a bed with your [[Fresh herbs|fresh herbs]]\n| Make up 500 ml ( almost a pint) of [[Chicken stock|chicken stock]] and pour this into the base of the [[Cooker|cooker]]\n| Lay the [[Turkey|turkey]] leg on the bed of [[Herbs|herbs]] and drizzle with a little [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and sprinkle with the [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n| Lay the rashers of streaky [[Bacon|bacon]] over the leg\n| Loosely cover with a sheet of [[Baking|baking]] [[Foil|foil]]\n| Pop the lid on and slow cook on low for 10 hours\n| You could prepare this the night before and set the [[Slow cooker|slow cooker]] on a timer if you wanted to have this in the middle of the day\n| Discard the bacon rashers as they will now be tasteless, all their flavour has gone into the turkey and the stock.\n| Use the [[Stock|stock]] as [[Gravy|gravy]], thickening it with a tablespoon of [[gravy granules]] or few teaspoons of [[Cornflour|cornflour]] if needed\n| Carve and serve!\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Roast potatoes|roast potatoes]] and all the trimmings\n==See also==\n\n* [[Roasting a chicken in a slow cooker]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:North American recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Poultry recipes]]\n[[Category:Slow cooker recipes]]\n[[Category:Slow cooked]]\n[[Category:Cookery cheats]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#turkey #slowcooker #foil #onion #bacon #baking #freshherbs #roastingaturkeyinaslowcooker #stock #oliveoil #garlic </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Roast apricots goats cheese salad with pistachios",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Roast apricots goats cheese salad with pistachios\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#apricots #roastapricotsgoatscheesesaladwithpistachios #butter #honey #fruit #roast #pistachios #lemon #cheese #oliveoil #goat \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=I switched my broadsheet Telegraph for the tabloid Times. I spotted this recipe within.\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=17th June 2017\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  35 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  20 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 711\n|PortionCalories = 355\n|Image = [[Image:Roast apricots goats cheese salad with pistachios recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Glorious!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Orange is a fabulous accompaniment.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry]]</span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Roast apricots goats cheese salad with pistachios oven ready.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Ready to pop into the oven]]\n\n\nSwitching my broadsheet Telegraph for the 'tabloid' Times so I had a paper I could read on the beach, I spotted this recipe within.  This is my slightly modified version.  A nice meal for a hot summers evening that would also work as a starter or meze.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 5 large ripe [[Apricots|apricots]]\n| Zest and juice of half a [[lemon]]\n| 2 tablespoons of [[honey]] - '''Tip:''' Microwave ''set'' honey for 5 seconds to make it runny\n| 10g of [[butter]]\n| 20 pistachio nuts\n| 100g [[goats cheese|goat's cheese]]\n| 2 slices of orange\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* As most supermarkets seem to sell [[Fruit|fruit]] that is as hard as bullets, it might be an idea to buy your fruit ahead of time to allow them to ripen properly first.\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4), [fan oven 160\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Separate the [[Apricots|apricots]] by cutting round the middle and twisting the two halves apart. Pick out the stones and discard.  Remove any stubborn left-over bits with a sharp knife.\n| Wipe the base of a small [[Roasting tray|roasting tray]] with [[Butter|butter]] paper or [[Olive oil|olive oil]].\n| Sit the [[Apricots|apricots]] in the tray so they are an array of ''cups''.\n| fill each ''[[Cup|cup]]'' with a dot of [[Butter|butter]], half a teaspoon of [[Honey|honey]], a squeeze of [[Lemon|lemon]] and a pinch of [[Salt|salt]].\n| [[Roast]] for 15 minutes or until the [[Fruit|fruit]] is gooey and runny.\n| After 15 minutes, add a teaspoon of [[Goat|goat]]'s [[Cheese|cheese]] to each [[Apricot|apricot]] and [[Roast|roast]] for a further 5 minutes to soften the cheese.\n| Shell the [[Pistachios|pistachios]], pop them in a clean [[Tea-towel|tea-towel]] and smash them to crumbs with a [[Rolling pin|rolling pin]].\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe the warm [[Apricots|apricots]] on a bed of [[Rocket|rocket]], lightly dressed with [[Olive oil|olive oil]].\n\nSprinkle with crushed [[Pistachios|pistachios]] and dress with [[Orange|orange]] slices.\n===Recipe source===\n\n* Lindsey Bareham, The Times newspaper, Thursday 15th June 2017\n===Variations===\nTry this with other seasonal [[Fruits|fruits]] like [[Nectarines|nectarines]] or even a couple of [[Peaches|peaches]].\n\nA few freshly picked, torn [[basil]] leaves complemented this well.\n\nI wonder if a little [[Roquefort|roquefort]] blue in place of the [[Goat|goat]]'s [[Cheese|cheese]] might be nice too?\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:French recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Salad recipes]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#apricots #roastapricotsgoatscheesesaladwithpistachios #butter #honey #fruit #roast #pistachios #lemon #cheese #oliveoil #goat </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Roast beef",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Roast beef a beef recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#beef #roastpotatoes #roastbeef #flour #yorkshirepuddings #miseenplace #mustardpowder #broccoli #horseradish #creamedhorseradish #basteit \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=The Englishman's quintessential Sunday lunch, served with roast potatoes, peas, broccoli, Yorkshire puddings, traditional English mustard sauce and\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 7416\n|PortionCalories = 1236\n|DatePublished=21st January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Sunday lunch\n|Servings = Serves 6\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime = 1 hour 45 minutes\n|PrepTime = 10 minutes\n|CookTime = 1 hour 35 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Roast beef recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Sunday, Sunday!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">So good to me.  Especially when I've got a roast like this.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]]</span></span>\n}}\nThe Englishman's quintessential Sunday lunch, served with [[roast potatoes]], [[peas]], [[broccoli]], [[Yorkshire puddings]],  [[traditional English mustard sauce]] and [[creamed horseradish]].  Just follow these few simple steps to ensure a perfect roast.\n\nFor a really special meal, go for the more expensive sirloin joint on the bone including the fillet.\n\nFor a normal Sunday lunch, go for wing end of the sirloin.  If in doubt, ask your butcher. A joint size of around 2.25 to 2.75 kg (5-6 lb) will easily serve six people\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 2.25kg (5 lb) joint of [[beef]]; see above\n| 2 medium [[onions]], peeled and halved\n| [[Salt]] and [[freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[English mustard powder]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[plain flour]]\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the oven to 240\u00b0 C (475\u00b0 F - Gas 9)\n\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Mix the [[flour]] and [[mustard powder]] together and roll the [[beef]] joint in the [[flour]] mix to coat well\n| Season with [[salt]] and [[freshly ground black pepper]]\n| Place the four [[onion]] halves, flat-side down in a square pattern to make a `stand' for the [[beef]] joint.  This will keep the joint out of the [[fat]] and add extra flavour.\n| Put the tray in the top part of the oven and leave it to cook for 20 minutes\n| Turn the heat down to 190\u00b0 C (375\u00b0 F - Gas 5) and cook for 15 minutes for every 450 g (1 lb)\n| When that time has elapsed, it will be rare.  Add 15 minutes more for meduim-rare and 30 minutes more for well-done\n| Whilst it's cooking at the lower temperature, [[baste it]] with its own juices every 20 minutes to ensure succulent [[beef]]\n| When the total time has elapsed, remove it from the oven and leave it to rest for at least 45 minutes before carving it. This will dramatically improve the succulence. Keep it in a warm place on a wooden chopping board, covered with [[silver-foil]]\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\n\nServe with [[roast potatoes]], [[minty peas]], creamed [[horseradish]] and [[English mustard]]\n==See also==\n* [[Roast potatoes]]\n* [[Roast vegetables]]\n* [[Gravy recipes]]\n* [[Perfect Yorkshire puddings]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Beef]]\n[[Category:Beef recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses|Beef]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes|Beef]]\n[[Category:British recipes|Beef]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#beef #roastpotatoes #roastbeef #flour #yorkshirepuddings #miseenplace #mustardpowder #broccoli #horseradish #creamedhorseradish #basteit </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Roast beetroot and Stilton salad",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
