                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Roast beetroot and Stilton salad a cheese recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#oliveoil #beets #roastbeetrootandstiltonsalad #sourcream #beetroot #rocketleaves #horseradish #browned #simmer #roasting #lightlunch \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=An unusual recipe that would work as a starter or as a light lunch. A good way to enjoy your vegetables. Try it out with your homemade Stilton cheese\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 605\n|PortionCalories = 151\n|DatePublished=25th October 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 45 minutes\n |PrepTime = 10 minutes\n |CookTime = 35 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Stilton_Cheese_02-wiki.png|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Love Stilton</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">It pairs well with beetroot too. (Fenland Mates)</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n\nAn unusual recipe that would work as a [[Starter|starter]] or as a [[light lunch]]. A good way to enjoy your [[Vegetables|vegetables]].  Try it out with your [[Home-made Stilton cheese|homemade Stilton cheese]]!\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| About 450 g of small fresh [[Beetroot|beetroot]], trimmed, and scrubbed or skinned\n| 2 tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Sour cream|sour cream]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Horseradish sauce|horseradish sauce]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[White wine vinegar|white wine vinegar]]\n| 100g [[Rocket leaves|rocket leaves]]\n| 100 g [[Stilton cheese]], crumbled\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 220\u00b0 C (425\u00b0 F - gas 7)\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| In a medium sized pan, cover the [[Beetroot|beetroot]] with cold water, bring to the [[Boil|boil]] and [[Simmer|simmer]] for 15 minutes.\n| Remove & drain, toss in 1 tablespoon of the [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and season with salt and [[Pepper|pepper]]\n| Place the [[Beets|beets]] in a small [[Roasting|roasting]] tin and [[Roast|roast]] for 20 minutes until [[Browned|browned]], tossing a few times for an even finish\n}}\n'''Dressing'''\n# Whisk the remaining [[Olive oil|olive oil]], [[Sour cream|sour cream]], [[Horseradish|horseradish]], [[Vinegar|vinegar]].  Season with [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]\n# Reserve a few tablespoons of the dressing for the [[Beets|beets]]. Add the [[Salad|salad]] leaves and [[Stilton]] to a bowl and toss in the dressing\n# Slice the cooked [[Beets|beets]] into 4 and drizzle with the reserved dressing\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with crusty [[Bread|bread]]\n==See also==\n* [[Beetroot recipes|Our favourite beetroot recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Beetroot]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes|Beetroot]]\n[[Category:British recipes|Beetroot]]\n[[Category:Salad recipes|Beetroot]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites|Beetroot]]\n[[Category:Starters|Beetroot]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes|Beetroot]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes|Beetroot]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]][[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#oliveoil #beets #roastbeetrootandstiltonsalad #sourcream #beetroot #rocketleaves #horseradish #browned #simmer #roasting #lightlunch </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }

                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Roast butternut squash - an Air fryer recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#squash #airfryer #butternutsquash #spices #oliveoil #kitchengadget #blackpepper #roastbutternutsquashairfryerrecipe #cuminseeds #roasted #pumpkin \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=I so love my Air Fryer - the best Kitchen kitchen gadget I have ever purchased - It is used endlessly\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=14th January 2017\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  30 minutes\n|PrepTime =  5 minutes\n|CookTime =  25 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 90\n|PortionCalories = 45 \n|Image = [[Image:Roast butternut squash Air fryer recipe recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">So easy</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">So nice - this is the perfect recipe for any squash</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:NonLoggedInUser|NonLoggedInUser]] </span></span>\n}}\nI so love my [[Air Fryer]] - the best [[Kitchen gadget|kitchen gadget]] ever purchased - It is used endlessly!\n\nThis is not really a recipe, just proof that it can be done and how well it works.\n\nI added a teaspoon of [[Spices|spices]] to jazz it up a little - use your favorite spices or [[Herbs|herbs]].\n\nIf you need to add [[Salt|salt]] then do that after the [[Butternut squash|butternut squash]] has been [[Roasted|roasted]] as it will cause liquid to leech out of the [[Squash|squash]] if you add it beforehand.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 small [[Butternut squash|butternut squash]] peeled, deseeded and cut into thumb-sized pieces.\n| 2 teaspoons of [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 1 teaspoon of [[Cumin seeds|cumin seeds]] (optional)\n| A large pinch of [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Add the [[Olive oil|olive oil]] to the [[Air Fryer|air fryer]]\n| Tip the [[Squash|squash]] pieces and the [[Spices|spices]]\n| Jiggle the pan to coat the [[Squash|squash]] pieces evenly\n| [[Roast]] in the [[Air Fryer|air fryer]] for about 20 to 25 minutes, depending upon the size of the pieces.\n}}\n===Variations===\nAny type of [[Squash|squash]] or [[Pumpkin|pumpkin]] would work using this method.\n\nTry this with [[Chilli flakes|chilli flakes]]\n===Chef's notes===\nA small [[Butternut squash|butternut squash]] is perfect for 2 people and a large should be fine for four.\n\nThe optional accessory: [[Tefal Snacking Mesh Metal Tray / Grid / Basket]] is great for roasting the [[squash]] as it doesn't get broken up by the paddle action.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Air fried recipes]]\n[[Category:Cookery cheats]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#squash #airfryer #butternutsquash #spices #oliveoil #kitchengadget #blackpepper title": "Roast cabbage",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Roast cabbage and apples recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#cabbage #apples #savoycabbage #tastesensationitalianseasoning #chickenstock #currants #roastcabbage #spices #accompaniments #tastesensation #vegetablerecipes\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=Just playing around with some produce from Jess, our local smallholder and what we had that might go well with it\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=25th May 2020\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Not the greatest looking recipe, but lovely and tasty\n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  1 hour, 5 minutes\n|PrepTime =  5 minutes\n|CookTime =  1 hour\n|TotalCalories = 407\n|PortionCalories = 203\n|Image = [[Image:Roast cabbage recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Looks rubbish</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.4</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">But it does taste nice!</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry, aka Chef]])</span></span>\n}}\nJust playing around with some produce from Jess, our local smallholder and what we had that might go well with it.\n[[Image:Roast cabbage recipe ingredients.jpg|thumb|300px|right|My ingredients - Be original and try your own ideas.]]\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 small [[Savoy cabbage|savoy cabbage]]\n| 2 very small eating [[Apples|apples]]\n| A handful of [[Currants|currants]]\n| A teaspoon of [[Muscovado sugar|muscovado sugar]]\n| A teaspoon of [[Taste Sensation Italian seasoning]]\n| A teaspoon of [[Taste Sensation|taste sensation Lime Juice Powder]]\n| 200 ml [[Chicken stock|chicken stock]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 190\u00b0 C (375\u00b0 F - gas 5), [fan oven 170\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| I like to trim the stalks from [[Savoy cabbage|savoy cabbage]], but that's a personal preference.\n| Roll up the [[Cabbage|cabbage]] leaves in bundles and chop into thin slices\n| Quarter the [[Apples|apples]] and remove cores, leave the skins on.\n| Add the [[Cabbage|cabbage]], [[Apples|apples]] and [[Currants|currants]] to a [[Roasting pan|roasting pan]], sprinkle the [[Sugar|sugar]] and [[Spices|spices]] over everything.\n| Pour the [[Chicken stock|chicken stock]] over the [[Cabbage|cabbage]] and mix well.\n| Cover with [[Tin foil|tin foil]] and [[Roast|roast]] at 190\u00b0 C for about an hour - see notes.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nGoes rather well with [[Roast pork|roast pork]]!\n===Variations===\nI've used [[Taste Sensation]] lime juice powder because I have it and love it.  You can use about a tablespoon of [[lime juice]] instead.\n\nI've also used [[Taste Sensation]] Italian Seasoning, you can use [[ black pepper]] and a pinch of [[herbs]].\n===Chef's notes===\nThis will be cooked after an hour but could easily be cooked for twice that time and at almost any temperature.  Eg: just add it to whatever else you are cooking at the time.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#cabbage #apples #savoycabbage #tastesensationitalianseasoning #chickenstock #currants #roastcabbage #spices #accompaniments #tastesensation #vegetablerecipes</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Roast chestnuts",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Roast chestnuts, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#chestnuts #roastchestnuts #grill #airfryer #stuffing #chestnut #roasting #roast #snack #miseenplace \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=These make a delicious snack, hot or cold and especially at Christmas time. They are also a useful ingredient for stuffing recipes\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1310\n|PortionCalories = 65\n|DatePublished=27th October 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = [[Roasting]] [[Chestnuts|chestnuts]]\n |Servings = Servings: 20 - Makes 1 kg of roasted chestnuts\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 35 minutes\n |PrepTime = 20 minutes\n |CookTime = 15 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Roasting chestnuts recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Gloriously easy</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">So simple.  These taste and smell delicious.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nThese make a delicious hot or cold [[Snack|snack]], especially at Christmas. They are also a useful [[Ingredient|ingredient]] for [[Stuffing|stuffing]] recipes.\n[[Image:Roasted chestnuts recipe.jpg|thumb|300px|right|[[Chestnuts]], roasted and chopped]]\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1 kg (2&frac14;lb) of raw [[Chestnuts|chestnuts]]\n| Good shake of [[sea salt]]\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the [[Grill|grill]]\nor\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6), [fan oven 180\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Cut a slit in every [[Chestnut|chestnut]].  This prevents them exploding and making a mess of the [[Oven|oven]]\n| Either: [[Grill]] on a tray for about 10 to 15 minutes, turning now and then\n| Or [[Roast]] in the [[Oven|oven]] for 30 minutes\n| You can add a shake of [[sea salt]] before, or after roasting\n| Allow to cool so they can be handled\n| Peel both layers of skin off, taking care to remove all of the inner layer as it can be rather bitter\n| Eat as they are, with a little [[Salt|salt]] or use as directed in your recipe.\n}}\n\n===See also===\nChestnuts can also be roasted in an [[Air fryer]].  Our [[Air fried roasted chestnuts|suggested recipe is here]].\n\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#chestnuts #roastchestnuts #grill #airfryer #stuffing #chestnut #roasting #roast #snack #miseenplace </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Roast pheasant",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Roast pheasant, Game recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#pheasant #roasting #roastpheasant #breadcrumbs #marinade #sherry #rosemary #roast #cider #bayleaves #gravy \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=An easy recipe for pheasant which has been marinated in cider\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1733\n|PortionCalories = 433\n|DatePublished=21st January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty =  2\n |TotalTime = 13 hours, 15 minutes\n |PrepTime = 12 hours, 20 minutes\n |CookTime = 55 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Roast pheasant recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Great with Pintard too.</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Tried this same recipe with guinea fowl (pintard) and it was perfect.</span> \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\">[[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}}\n\nAn easy recipe for [[Pheasant|pheasant]] which has been [[Marinated|marinated]] in [[Cider|cider]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1 or 2 [[Pheasants|pheasants]] (depending on size)\n}}\n'''For the [[Marinade|marinade]]:'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 450ml [[Dry cider]] to cover\n| 50 ml [[Sunflower oil|sunflower oil]]\n| 2 [[Bay leaves|bay leaves]]\n| 2 sprigs [[rosemary]], cut into half\n| 1 bulb [[Garlic, crushed|garlic, crushed]]\n| [[Freshly ground black pepper]]\n}}\n'''For the stuffing'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| Seasoned [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]]\n| 80ml Fino [[Sherry|sherry]]\n}}\n'''For [[Roasting|roasting]]'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| [[Sunflower oil]]\n| Seasoning\n| [[Butter]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Place the [[Pheasant|pheasant]] in a bowl, cover it with the [[Cider|cider]], [[Oil|oil]], [[Bay leaves|bay leaves]], [[rosemary]], [[Garlic|garlic]] and [[Pepper|pepper]] and [[Marinate|marinate]] overnight or longer.\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Remove the [[Pheasant|pheasant]](s) from the [[Marinade|marinade]] and dry thoroughly.\n| Meanwhile, soak the [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]] in sufficient [[Sherry|sherry]] to cover for 20 minutes.\n| Place a [[Roasting|roasting]] tin, containing a little [[Oil|oil]] in the [[Oven|oven]] and preheat to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6).\n| Squeeze the [[Sherry|sherry]] from the [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]] and stuff the [[Pheasant|pheasant]](s) with them.\n| Season the [[Pheasant|pheasant]](s) and smear some [[Butter|butter]] all over them.\n| Place in the [[Roasting|roasting]] tin, breast side down and [[Roast|roast]] for 15 minutes.\n| Turn so that the breast is now facing upwards.\n| After a further 15 minutes you can insert a [[Roasting|roasting]] rack under the [[Pheasant|pheasant]](s), if desired, to drain off some of the [[Fat|fat]].\n| Continue [[Roasting|roasting]] until the [[Pheasant|pheasant]](s) is/are cooked, ie the juices run clear when prodded through to the bone with a skewer.\n| Rest in a warm place for 10 minutes before carving.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Roast|roast]] or [[Mashed potatoes|mashed potatoes]], [[Steamed|steamed]] [[Vegetables|vegetables]] and [[Gravy|gravy]] (see Chef's Notes below)\n===Chef's notes===\nIf you want something slightly different from your usual [[Gravy|gravy]], you can use the [[Strained|strained]] [[Juice|juice]] from the [[Marinade|marinade]] as all or part of the liquid.  However, you '''MUST''' bring this to the [[Boil|boil]] before using as it has been in contact with raw [[Meat|meat]].  \nComplete [[Roasting|roasting]] time is about 40 minutes, but will depend on the size of the [[Pheasants|pheasants]].\n==See also==\n* '''[[Meat cooking time calculator Metric|A comprehensive guide to roast meat cooking times]]''' - give the time you want to carve your roast and we'll give you a timed step by step roasting guide\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Pheasant (roast)]]\n[[Category:Cooking with beer|Pheasant (roast)]]\n[[Category:British recipes|Pheasant (roast)]]\n[[Category:Game recipes|Pheasant (roast)]]\n[[Category:Main courses|Pheasant (roast)]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes|Pheasant (roast)]]\n[[Category:Cooking with wine|Pheasant (roast)]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#pheasant #roasting #roastpheasant #breadcrumbs #marinade #sherry #rosemary #roast #cider #bayleaves #gravy </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Roast pig's head",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Roast pig's head, a classic historic recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#apples #onions #roastpigshead #pig #baking #flour #dripping #bake #sauce #unusualrecipes #boil \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A pig's head is a cheap meal (\u00a33.50 - 2009) though I think I'll be passing on this one\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 969\n|PortionCalories = 161\n|DatePublished=18th January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Modern practical cookery, circa 1900\n |Servings = Serves 6 (pigs?)\n |Difficulty = 3\n |TotalTime = 2 hours 45 minutes\n |PrepTime = 30 minutes\n |CookTime = 2 hours 15 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Modern practical cookery.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Not for me!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">2</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Though if someone like a pig's ear, it might suffice \ud83d\ude01</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Sue_spins|Susie]] </span></span>\n}}\nA [[Pig|pig]]'s head is a cheap meal (\u00a33.50 - 2009) though I think I'll be passing on this one.  If anyone makes it, please do let us have the photos.\n\nThis recipe was taken from an undated cookery book, 'Modern practical cookery', circa 1900 from the look of it.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| Half a [[Pig|pig]]'s head (fresh)\n| 2 lb large cooking [[Apples|apples]]\n| 1 lb [[Onions|onions]]\n| 1 pint of water\n}}\n'''For the gravy'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 1 oz [[Dripping|dripping]]\n| 1 oz [[Flour|flour]]\n| &#190; pint of water used for cooking the head\n| [[Salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Peel and slice the [[Onions|onions]] and place in a [[Baking|baking]] tin\n| Wash the head and score the skin with a sharp knife\n| Lay the head on the [[Onions|onions]], pour the water over them and [[Bake|bake]] them in a moderate oven for two hours, [[Basting|basting]] the head every 15 minutes\n| Wipe the [[Apples|apples]] and take out the cores with a small knife\n| Stand the [[Apples|apples]] round the [[Meat|meat]] for the last half hour it is [[Baking|baking]]\n| Place the head surrounded with [[Apples|apples]], in a hot dish and put this in the oven to keep hot\n| Pour off liquid\n| Melt the [[Dripping|dripping]], stir in the [[Flour|flour]], and [[Fry|fry]] until [[Brown|brown]], stirring all the time\n| Add &#190; of a pint of the cooking liquid and stir until it boils\n| [[Boil]] for 3 minutes and serve in a [[Sauce|sauce]]-boat\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Briefly.jpg|thumb|300px|[[How to cook a pig's head|Step-by-step pics here]]|alt=Electus\nImage:PigsHeads.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Pig heads at market, in Ecuador\n</gallery>\n==See also==\n* [[How to cook a pig's head]] - a pictorial exercise!\n* [[Pig's head, boiled (Mrs Beeton's)]] - Mrs Beeton's offering\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Offal recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#apples #onions #roastpigshead #pig #baking #flour #dripping #bake #sauce #unusualrecipes #boil </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }

title": "Roast pork fillet with mushrooms in filo pastry",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Roast pork fillet with mushrooms in filo pastry recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#filopastry #butter #roastporkfilletwithmushroomsinfilopastry #brush #zest #tangerine #oliveoil #shallots #breadcrumbs #bakingsheet #porktenderloinfillet \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=I suppose you could call this recipe Pork Wellington.  It is very similar in style to Beef Wellington, but a little less complicated\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1541\n|PortionCalories = 770\n|DatePublished=25th August 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  55 minutes\n|PrepTime =  20 minutes\n|CookTime =  35 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Roast pork fillet with mushrooms in filo pastry recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Fancy Pants</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">3.9</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Very nice but a little fancy for my taste</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nI suppose you could call this recipe Pork Wellington.  It is very similar in style to to [[Beef Wellington|beef wellington]], but a little less complicated.  \n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 300g [[Pork tenderloin fillet|pork tenderloin fillet]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 2 [[Shallots|shallots]], peeled and finely chopped\n| 2 [[Cloves of Garlic, peeled and crushed|cloves of garlic, peeled and crushed]]\n| 150 g of [[Oyster mushrooms|oyster mushrooms]], wiped clean and finely chopped\n| 1 tablespoon fresh [[Sage leaves|sage leaves]], or 1 teaspoon of [[Dried|dried]] [[Sage|sage]]\n| [[Grated]] [[Zest|zest]] from a [[Tangerine|tangerine]]\n| 25 g of [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]]\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 4 sheets of [[Filo pastry|filo pastry]]\n| 15 g [[Butter|butter]], melted\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6), [fan [[Oven|oven]] 180\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Trim and discard any [[Fat|fat]] or membranes from the [[Pork fillet|pork fillet]]\n| Add the [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and a grind of [[Black pepper|black pepper]] to a large non-stick [[Frying pan|frying pan]]\n| Over a high heat, seal the [[Pork tenderloin|pork tenderloin]] on all sides\n| Remove from the pan, set to one side and keep warm\n| Add the [[Shallots|shallots]], [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]] and [[Crushed garlic|crushed garlic]]  and saut\u00e9 gently for 5 minutes\n| Remove from the heat and add the [[Tangerine|tangerine]] [[Zest|zest]], [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]] and a pinch of [[Salt|salt]]\n| On a clean worktop, lay out one sheet of [[Filo pastry|filo pastry]] and [[Brush|brush]] with melted [[Butter|butter]]\n| Place another sheet directly over the top, [[Brush|brush]] with [[Butter|butter]] and repeat until you have a stack of 4 sheets\n| Spread your [[Mushroom|mushroom]] mixture over the centre of the [[Filo pastry|filo pastry]] \n| Pat the fillet dry with a [[Paper towel|paper towel]] and place in the centre of the [[Pastry|pastry]]\n| Wrap the [[Filo pastry|filo pastry]] around the [[Pork|pork]] and tuck the edges in so it is a neatly wrapped parcel\n| Place on a lightly greased [[Baking sheet|baking sheet]] and [[Roast|roast]] for 30 minutes\n| Allow it to [[Rest for|rest for]] 5 minutes before carving into thick slices and serving\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Boiled|boiled]] [[New Potatoes|new potatoes]] and a [[Green vegetable|green vegetable]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#filopastry #butter #roastporkfilletwithmushroomsinfilopastry #brush #zest #tangerine #oliveoil #shallots #breadcrumbs #bakingsheet #porktenderloinfillet </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }

title": "Roast pork pizza",

                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Roast pork pizza, Italian recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#roastporkpizza #roastpork #pizza #pizzastone #fineyellowcornmeal #grill #applesauce #oliveoil #pizzadough #mozzarellacheese #pizzapeel \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=We had a tiny amount of roast pork left over and fancied a pizza - this was the result. It was fabulous\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1714\n|PortionCalories = 857\n|DatePublished=7th November 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  20 hours, 10 minutes\n|PrepTime =  20 hours\n|CookTime =  10 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Roast pork pizza recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Unusually good</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">This was great.  I also made a similar version with thinly sliced roast beef.  Yum!</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nWe had a tiny amount of [[Roast pork|roast pork]] left over and fancied a [[Pizza|pizza]] - this was the result.  It was fabulous.\n[[Image:Roast pork pizza_ready to bake.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Roast pork pizza, ready to bake]]\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 portion of [[Pizza dough|pizza dough]] \n| 2 tablespoons of [[Tomato sauce for pizza|pizza sauce]]\n| 5 tablespoons of [[Shredded|shredded]], cooked [[Roast pork|roast pork]]\n| 2 tablespoons [[Apple sauce|apple sauce]]\n| 2 balls of [[mozzarella cheese]]\n| 1 small white [[Onion|onion]], very thinly sliced\n| [[Olive oil]]\n| A few small [[Red chillies|red chillies]], finely chopped - optional\n| [[Freshly ground black pepper]]\n| [[Fine yellow cornmeal]] for dusting\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Pre heat a [[Pizza stone|pizza stone]] under a very hot [[Grill|grill]] for about 20 minutes.  Place it about 8cm from the heat source.\n* This can be made in an [[Oven|oven]] but will take about 20 to cook.  If using the oven, preheat it to 220\u00b0 C (425\u00b0 F - gas 7)\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Dust the work surface with [[Fine yellow cornmeal]]\n| Roll or stretch the [[Pizza dough|pizza dough]] into dinner-plate sized circles.  Make one pizza per person.\n| Prick the pizza all over with a fork. This prevents it puffing up too much and burning while it is cooking.\n| Slide the empty [[Pizza|pizza]] onto the [[Pizza stone|pizza stone]] using a [[Pizza peel|pizza peel]].\n| [[Bake]] for about 3 minutes on one side only until it puffs up and is slightly [[Browned|browned]]\n| Remove from the [[Oven|oven]], flip over and add the topping\n| Spread a few tablespoons of [[Tomato sauce|tomato sauce]] over the uncooked side of the base.\n| Sprinkle with the cooked [[Roast pork|roast pork]] and dab [[Apple sauce|apple sauce]] here and there.\n| Layer a few rings of finely sliced [[Onions|onions]] over the [[Pork|pork]].\n| Tear the [[mozzarella]] ball in to pieces and add to the [[Pizza|pizza]].\n| Sprinkle with chopped [[Chillies|chillies]] if using.\n| Drizzle with [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and season with [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]].\n| Slide on to the [[Pizza stone|pizza stone]] and [[Grill|grill]] until the [[Cheese|cheese]] is [[Toasted|toasted]]. This should take about 4 minutes.  Keep this pizza warm at the bottom of the oven while you make the second pizza.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with a [[Green salad|green salad]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Italian recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Pizza recipes]][[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#roastporkpizza #roastpork #pizza #pizzastone #fineyellowcornmeal #grill #applesauce #oliveoil #pizzadough #mozzarellacheese #pizzapeel </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Roast pork with red apples",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Roast pork with red apples recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#pork #cinnamon #apples #roast #roastporkwithredapples #papertowel #brownsugar #tinfoil #drycider #vegetableoil #miseenplace \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Roast pork, cinnamon and apples.  The perfect combination for Sunday lunch\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 6688\n|PortionCalories = 1114\n|DatePublished=26th August 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 6\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  2 hours, 20 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  2 hours, 5 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Roast pork with red apples recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Remeber this for Stow's Apple Day!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.8</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Was lovely. Good to make when all the apples are free.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Roast pork]], [[Cinnamon|cinnamon]] and [[Apples|apples]].  The perfect combination for Sunday lunch.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 2 kg boneless leg of [[Pork|pork]]\n| Handful of fresh [[Sage leaves|sage leaves]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Vegetable oil|vegetable oil]]\n| &#188; teaspoon freshly grond [[Cinnamon|cinnamon]] powder.  A [[Coffee grinder|coffee grinder]] is good for this\n| 2 tablespoons of [[Demerara sugar]], [[Jaggery|jaggery]] or [[Brown sugar|brown sugar]]\n| 568 ml (1 pint) of [[Dry cider|dry cider]]\n| 3 red skinned eating [[Apples|apples]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6), [fan [[Oven|oven]] 180\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Check the weight of the [[Pork|pork]] for the [[Meat|meat]] [[Cooking times|cooking times]]\n| (25 minutes at 200\u00b0 C per 500g + 25 minutes at 180\u00b0 C)\n| That's 1 hour 40 minutes + 25 minutes for a 2 kg joint\n| Pat the skin dry with a [[Paper towel|paper towel]] and score with a very sharp knife such as a [[Utility knife]]\n| Make a paste with the [[Oil|oil]], [[Cinnamon|cinnamon]] and [[Sugar|sugar]] and spread all over the joint\n| Our the [[Cider|cider]] into the base of the [[Roasting tray|roasting tray]]\n| [[Roast]] for 1 hour 40 minutes, spooning the juices over the joint every 20 minutes\n| Core and quarter the [[Apples|apples]] and wedge under the [[Pork|pork]] joint\n| Spoon the juices over the [[Meat|meat]] for the final time, reduce the [[Oven|oven]] temperature to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4), [fan [[Oven|oven]] 160\u00b0 C] and [[Roast|roast]] for a further 25 minutes until the [[Pork|pork]] is properly cooked\n| remove from the [[Oven|oven]], cover with [[Tin foil|tin foil]] and allow to [[Rest for|rest for]] 10 minutes before carving and serving\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Roast potatoes|roast potatoes]], [[Boiled carrots|boiled carrots]] and a [[Gravy|gravy]] of your choice.\n==See also==\n* '''[[Meat cooking time calculator Metric|A comprehensive guide to roast meat cooking times]]''' - give the time you want to carve your roast and we'll give you a timed step by step roasting guide\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Cooking with beer]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#pork #cinnamon #apples #roast #roastporkwithredapples #papertowel #brownsugar #tinfoil #drycider #vegetableoil #miseenplace </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Roast potatoes",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Roast potatoes, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#potatoes #roastpotatoes #bayleaves #peppercorns #groundnutoil #fat #bay #goosefat #sunfloweroil #thyme #rosemary \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=The best potatoes for roasting are Maris Piper, Desiree, Romano, King Edward or Rooster\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 264\n|PortionCalories = 264\n|DatePublished=12th April 2013\n|Author = JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = 175g (6oz) [[Potatoes]] per person\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime = 1 hour 10 minutes\n|PrepTime = 10 minutes\n|CookTime = 1 hour\n|Image = [[Image:Roast potatoes recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Love the little monsters</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Lol!  Ears and eyes!</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nThe best [[potatoes]] for roasting are Desir\u00e9e, Romano, King Edward or Rooster\n[[Image:Bay-leaf roast potato people.jpg|thumb|300px|right|...with ears and eyes]]\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 175g (6oz) [[Potatoes]] per person\n| A few tablespoons of [[sunflower oil|sunflower oil]], [[groundnut oil]], [[duck fat]] or [[goose fat]].\n| [[Sea salt]]\n}}\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Preheat the oven to 220\u00b0 C (425\u00b0 F) (gas 7)\n| Wash and peel the [[potatoes]]\n| Place in a pan and cover with boiling water\n| Add a pinch of [[salt]] and boil for 10 minutes\n| Remove from the heat and drain in a colander\n| Place the [[potatoes]] back in the pan and replace the lid\n| Hold the pan in a cloth and shake the pan vigorously so that the [[potatoes]] become fluffy, the fluffy bits will become crunchy when roasted.  ''Thank you Delia Smith''!\n| Add the [[bay leaves]] and [[peppercorns]] at this stage if making potato people\n| Add the [[oil]] or [[fat]] to the roasting tin and heat on the hob until the oil is almost smoking\n| Using tongs, turn the [[potatoes]] so they are all evenly covered with the oil or fat\n| Place the roasting tin on the top shelf of the oven and roast for 45-50 minutes\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\n\nServe hot with a little [[sea salt]] sprinkled over them\n\n===Variations===\n* Sprinkle with a little chopped herbs such as [[rosemary]] or [[thyme]].\n* Make [[bay]] flavoured potato people by making eyes from [[peppercorns]] and ears from halved [[bay leaves]].  Make slices in the potatoes and slot the leaves in.  This is much easier to do if the bay leaves are sliced in half.\n\n==Which are the best potatoes for roasting==\n* Desiree\n* King Edward\n* Rooster\n* Cara\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Student recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#potatoes #roastpotatoes #bayleaves #peppercorns #groundnutoil #fat #bay #goosefat #sunfloweroil #thyme #rosemary </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Roast potatoes a British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#potatoes #bayleaves #peppercorns #groundnutoil #sunfloweroil #bay #rosemary #fat #thyme \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=The best potatoes for roasting are Desiree, Romano, King Edward or Rooster. This recipe makes the perfect roasties\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 154\n|PortionCalories = 154\n|DatePublished=12th April 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = 175g (6oz) [[Potatoes]] per person\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 1 hour 10 minutes\n |PrepTime = 10 minutes\n |CookTime = 1 hour\n |Image = [[Image:Roast potatoes recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Love the little monsters</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Lol!  Ears and eyes!</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Bay-leaf roast potato people.jpg|thumb|300px|right|...with ears and eyes]]\nThe best [[potatoes]] for roasting are Desir\u00e9e, Romano, King Edward or Rooster\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 175g (6oz) [[Potatoes]] per person\n| A few tablespoons of [[sunflower oil|sunflower oil]] or [[groundnut oil]].\n| [[Sea salt]]\n}}\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Preheat the oven to 220\u00b0 C (425\u00b0 F) (gas 7)\n| Wash and peel the [[potatoes]]\n| Place in a pan and cover with boiling water\n| Add a pinch of [[salt]] and boil for 10 minutes\n| Remove from the heat and drain in a colander\n| Place the [[potatoes]] back in the pan and replace the lid\n| Hold the pan in a cloth and shake the pan vigorously so that the [[potatoes]] become fluffy, the fluffy bits will become crunchy when roasted.  ''Thank you Delia Smith''!\n| Add the [[bay leaves]] and [[peppercorns]] at this stage if making potato people\n| Add the [[oil]] or [[fat]] to the roasting tin and heat on the hob until the oil is almost smoking\n| Using tongs, turn the [[potatoes]] so they are all evenly covered with the oil or fat\n| Place the roasting tin on the top shelf of the oven and roast for 45-50 minutes\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe hot with a little [[sea salt]] sprinkled over them\n===Variations===\n* Sprinkle with a little chopped herbs such as [[rosemary]] or [[thyme]].\n* Make [[bay]] flavoured potato people by making eyes from [[peppercorns]] and ears from halved [[bay leaves]].  Make slices in the potatoes and slot the leaves in.  This is much easier to do if the bay leaves are sliced in half.\n\n==Which are the best potatoes for roasting==\n* Maris Piper\n* Desiree\n* King Edward\n* Rooster\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#potatoes #bayleaves #peppercorns #groundnutoil #sunfloweroil #bay #rosemary #fat #thyme </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Roast potatoes (V) 2",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Roast potatoes (V) 2 recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#potatoes #boil #saucepan #roastpotatoes #olive #roastingtin #roastpotatoesv2 #colander #boiledorsimmeredpotatoesroast #roast #miseenplace \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This recipe for Roast roast potatoes is my personal favourite as I like them to be as crispy as possible\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=2nd December 2016\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  2 hours, 5 minutes\n|PrepTime =  25 minutes\n|CookTime =  1 hour, 40 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 1470\n|PortionCalories = 367\n|Image = [[Image:Roast potatoes V 2 recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Is there any other way to cook roasties?</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">They're not roasties if they're not crispy \ud83e\udd13</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis recipe for [[Roast potatoes|roast potatoes]] is my personal favourite as I like them to be as crispy as possible.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1kg King Edward or Maris Piper [[Potatoes|potatoes]], peeled and cut to an appropriate size,  Try to cut so that there are no rounded sides\n| [[Olive]] or [[Groundnut oil|groundnut oil]] or a mixture of both\n| [[Salt]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Either:  Soak the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] in a pan of cold water for 15 minutes, changing the water every 5 minute OR put the potatoes in a [[Saucepan|saucepan]] and run the cold tap over them for 5 minutes.\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| In a pan of fresh cold water, bring the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] to the [[Boil|boil]] and cook until they are fully cooked and just as they are about to fall apart.\n| Carefully transfer the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] (one by one) to a [[Colander|colander]].\n| Leave until any [[Steam|steam]] has disappeared.\n| Meanwhile, add the [[Oil|oil]] to a [[Roasting tin|roasting tin]], to a depth of about 5mm and sprinkle in some [[Salt|salt]].\n| Place the tin in the [[Oven|oven]] and preheat 250\u00b0 C (475\u00b0 F - gas 9), [fan oven 230\u00b0 C].\n| Once the [[Oven|oven]] has heated, quickly and gently transfer the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] to the pan and turn them over so that they are coated in [[Oil|oil]].\n| Return the tin to the [[Oven|oven]] and reduce the oven temperature to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4), [fan oven 160\u00b0 C].\n| [[Roast]] for about 1 hour - 1 hour 20 minutes, turning the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] every 20 minutes.  \n| The cooking times can vary, but the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] will be ready when they are crisp and golden all over.\n| Remove from the [[Oven|oven]] and serve.\n}}\n===Chef's notes===\nYou need to get to know your own [[Oven|oven]] as far as a cooking times are concerned.  I suggest you do a couple of trial runs to start with.\n==See also==\n\n* [[Roast potatoes 2]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Potatoes roast]]\n[[Category:British recipes|Potatoes roast]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments|Potatoes roast]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes|Potatoes roast]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes|Potatoes roast]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes|Potatoes roast]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes|Potatoes roast]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted|Potatoes roast]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered|Potatoes roast]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#potatoes #boil #saucepan #roastpotatoes #olive #roastingtin #roastpotatoesv2 #colander #boiledorsimmeredpotatoesroast #roast #miseenplace </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Roast potatoes 2",

                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Roast potatoes 2 recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#potatoes #dripping #roastingtin #roastpotatoes2 #saucepan #boiledorsimmeredpotatoesroast #roastpotatoes #beef #miseenplace #colander #boil \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This recipe for Roast roast potatoes is my personal favourite as I like them to be as crispy as possible.\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=2nd December 2016\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  2 hours, 5 minutes\n|PrepTime =  25 minutes\n|CookTime =  1 hour, 40 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 1470\n|PortionCalories = 367\n|Image = [[Image:Roast potatoes V 2 recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Our favourite vegetable</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">These are even better made in an air fryer</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis recipe for [[Roast potatoes|roast potatoes]] is my personal favourite as I like them to be as crispy as possible.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1kg [[Markies]], King Edward or Maris Piper [[Potatoes|potatoes]], peeled and cut to an appropriate size,  Try to cut so that there are no rounded sides\n| [[Beef]] [[dripping]] to a depth of 5 mm, see below\n| [[Salt]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Either:  Soak the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] in a pan of cold water for 15 minutes, changing the water every 5 minute OR put the potatoes in a [[Saucepan|saucepan]] and run the cold tap over them for 5 minutes.\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| In a pan of fresh cold water, bring the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] to the [[Boil|boil]] and cook until they are fully cooked and just as they are about to fall apart.\n| Carefully transfer the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] (one by one) to a [[Colander|colander]].\n| Leave until any [[Steam|steam]] has disappeared.\n| Meanwhile, add plenty of [[dripping]] to a [[Roasting tin|roasting tin]] - you want a depth of about 5mm when melted, and sprinkle in some [[Salt|salt]].\n| Place the tin in the [[Oven|oven]] and preheat 250\u00b0 C (475\u00b0 F - gas 9), [fan oven 230\u00b0 C].\n| Once the [[Oven|oven]] has heated, quickly and gently transfer the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] to the pan and turn them over so that they are coated in [[dripping]].\n| Return the tin to the [[Oven|oven]] and reduce the oven temperature to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4), [fan oven 160\u00b0 C].\n| [[Roast]] for about 1 hour - 1 hour 20 minutes, turning the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] every 20 minutes.  \n| The cooking times can vary, but the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] will be ready when they are crisp and golden all over.\n| Remove from the [[Oven|oven]] and serve.\n}}\n===Chef's notes===\nYou need to get to know your own [[Oven|oven]] as far as a cooking times are concerned.  I suggest you do a couple of trial runs to start with.\n==See also==\n\n* [[Roast potatoes (V) 2]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Potatoes roast]]\n[[Category:British recipes|Potatoes roast]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments|Potatoes roast]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes|Potatoes roast]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes|Potatoes roast]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted|Potatoes roast]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered|Potatoes roast]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#potatoes #dripping #roastingtin #roastpotatoes2 #saucepan #boiledorsimmeredpotatoesroast #roastpotatoes #beef #miseenplace #colander #boil </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Roast turkey with apricot chardonnay glaze",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Roast turkey with apricot chardonnay glaze recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#turkey #foil #apricot #baste #roastturkeywithapricotchardonnayglaze #garlic #sage #preserves #pastry #stuffing #unusualrecipes \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This seasonal roast turkey recipe comes from Woodbridge Chardonnay\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 10852\n|PortionCalories = 1085\n|DatePublished=14th November 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = 10 people\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime = 4 hours 10 minutes \n|PrepTime = 40 minutes \n|CookTime = 3 hours 30 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Turkey with Apricot Chardonnay recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Fancy-pants turkey!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Gravy is cheaper!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:NonLoggedInUser|NonLoggedInUser]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis seasonal roast turkey recipe comes from [https://www.facebook.com/WoodbridgeByRobertMondavi Woodbridge Chardonnay].  It uses Woodbrigde Chardonnay for the unique glaze.  It is ideal for Thanksgiving and Christmas.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 4kg [10 lb] Butterball [[Turkey|turkey]]\n}}\n''''External [[Turkey|turkey]] seasoning:''''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| &frac14; cup [[Canola|canola]]/[[Vegetable oil|vegetable oil]]\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] to season entire bird\n| 1 large piece [[Foil|foil]]\n}}\n'''Internal [[Turkey|turkey]] seasoning:'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 1 bunch fresh [[Sage|sage]]\n| 2 whole [[Garlic|garlic]] bulbs,\n| 1 large piece [[Foil|foil]]\n}}\n'''[[Apricot]] Chardonnay Glaze:'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 1&frac12; cups of Woodbridge Chardonnay\n| 1 cup [[Sugar|sugar]]\n| 2 tablespoons [[Apricot|apricot]] [[Preserves|preserves]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Lemon zest|lemon zest]] (optional)\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* 160\u00b0 C (325\u00b0 F - gas 3), [fan [[Oven|oven]] 140\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n* Wash hands\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n}}\n'''the [[Turkey|turkey]]'''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Thoroughly rinse [[Turkey|turkey]] with water.\n| Remove innards and neck; pat dry with clean paper towels.\n| Place [[Turkey|turkey]] breast up in a large, stable [[Roasting pan|roasting pan]].\n| Tuck wings back to prevent burning.\n| Neatly tie legs together with butcher\u0092s twine.\n| Massage [[Turkey|turkey]] with [[Oil|oil]], making sure to coat evenly.\n| Season entire bird, including internal cavity, with [[Sea Salt|sea salt]].\n| Place [[Sage|sage]] and [[Garlic|garlic]] bulbs inside (optional).\n| Loosely cover just the top of [[Turkey|turkey]] with [[Foil|foil]].\n| Place [[Turkey|turkey]] on bottom [[Oven|oven]] rack.\n| Set timer accordingly.\n| Remove [[Foil|foil]] and [[Baste|baste]] [[Turkey|turkey]] with pan juices approx. every 45 min.\n| When [[Turkey|turkey]] is &frac34; cooked, remove [[Foil|foil]] and [[Baste|baste]] with [[Apricot]] Chardonnay Glaze.\n| Place back inside [[Oven|oven]] and let crisp up during remaining time.\n| Safe internal temperature is 180\u00b0F (82\u00b0 C) deep in the thigh\u0097juices should run clear, not pink.\n| If stuffed, temperature should be 165\u00b0F (74\u00b0 C) in center of [[Stuffing|stuffing]].\n| When bird is done, allow it to stand for 15 min. to release juices before serving.\n}}\n'''the glaze'''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| In a medium saucepan over medium-low heat, add Chardonnay, [[Sugar|sugar]], and [[Apricot|apricot]] [[Preserves|preserves]].\n| Cook down, stirring occasionally until thick (approx. 30 min.).\n| When [[Turkey|turkey]] is &frac34; cooked, evenly [[Baste|baste]] with glaze using a [[Pastry|pastry]] [[Brush|brush]].\n| Remove [[Foil|foil]] from top of bird and finish cooking.\n}}\n===Recipe source===\n* Woodbridge chardonnay\n==See also==\n* [https://www.facebook.com/WoodbridgeByRobertMondavi Woodbridge chardonnay (Facebook page)]\n* [[Meat cooking time calculator Imperial]]\n* [[Meat cooking time calculator Metric]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Australian recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:North American recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Poultry recipes]]\n[[Category:Cooking with wine]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#turkey #foil #apricot #baste #roastturkeywithapricotchardonnayglaze #garlic #sage #preserves #pastry #stuffing #unusualrecipes </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Roast vegetables",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Roast vegetables, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#vegetables #roast #parsnips #oliveoil #carrots #roastpotatoes #roastvegetables #herbs #garlic #celeriac #deglaze \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=I think this was one of the first recipes I cooked from Jamie Oliver's \"Happy days with the Naked Chef\", when if first came out\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 586\n|PortionCalories = 146\n|DatePublished=27th October 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = One tray oven roasted vegetables\n |Servings = Serves 4 to 6\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 1 hour 10 minutes\n |PrepTime = 20 minutes\n |CookTime = 50 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:One tray oven roasted vegetables recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Nice change</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Not made this for ages, really glad I saw it.  Made a great side dish for our barbecue.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nI think this was one of the first recipes I cooked from Jamie Oliver's \"Happy days with the Naked Chef\", when if first came out.  Certainly been making it regularly since then. Rather oddly, I never did get around to adding the recipe here. Time to make amends.\n[[Image:One tray oven roasted vegetables.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Ready for the oven]]\n\nSimply put; select the [[Vegetables|vegetables]] from your favourites, cut into even sized chunks, [[Oil|oil]], season and [[Roast|roast]].\n\nYou can cook [[Roast potatoes|roast potatoes]] in with the [[Vegetables|vegetables]], but I feel that roast potatoes deserve [[Roast potatoes|separate treatment]] for superior results.\n\nAs for quantities, judge what your guests would eat from the raw, prepared quantities, remembering that they will shrink quite a lot after cooking.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 6 medium [[Carrots|carrots]]\n| 6 medium [[Parsnips|parsnips]]\n| 1 small [[Butternut squash|butternut squash]], peeled and cut into chunks\n|Cut the squash slightly larger than the [[Carrots|carrots]] and [[Parsnips|parsnips]]\n| 2 medium [[Onions|onions]], peeled, each roughly cut into 6 pieces\n| 6 to 8 Cloves of [[Garlic|garlic]]\n| Big bunch of [[Thyme|thyme]]\n| Big bunch of [[Rosemary|rosemary]]\n| Handful of fresh [[Bay leaves|bay leaves]]\n| 2 teaspoons whole [[Cumin seeds|cumin seeds]]\n| 1 teaspoon whole [[Fennel seeds|fennel seeds]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Chili flakes|chili flakes]]\n| [[Olive oil]]\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Pre heat the [[Oven|oven]] to 220\u00b0 C (425\u00b0 F - gas 7)\n* I've chosen this temperature as it matches the cooking time for [[Roast|roast]] potatoes. They will do just as well at 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4), though will take a little longer  \n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Peel and prepare all of the [[Vegetables|vegetables]] and cut into equal sized pieces, cut lengthways, not into discs.\n| [[Oil]] a large [[Oven|oven]] tray\n| Tip all the [[Vegetables|vegetables]] and whole bunches of [[Herbs|herbs]] into the tray, sprinkle with the seasonings, drizzle with a good few glugs of [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and mix well with your hands\n| Cover with [[Tin-foil|tin-foil]]\n| [[Roast]], covered, for 30 minutes, remove the [[Foil|foil]] and toss the [[Vegetables|vegetables]] in the [[Oil|oil]]\n| [[Roast]] for a further 10 to 20 minutes\n| Remove the woody [[Herbs|herbs]] and serve.\n}}\n===Variations===\nIf your guests  will enjoy the fun of squeezing out the pur\u00e9ed [[Garlic|garlic]] paste over their veg, leave the garlic un peeled, peel them for the more fastidious eaters.\n\n'''Other possibilities include:'''\n* [[Deglaze]] the tray with [[balsamic vinegar]] to release the caramelised sugars and make a drizzle for the vegetables.\n* [[Aubergine]]\n* [[Celeriac]]\n* [[Courgette]]\n* [[Leeks]]\n* [[Peppers]]\n* [[Potatoes]]\n* [[Salsify]]\n* [[Swede]]\n* [[Sweet potato]]\n* [[Tomatoes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#vegetables #roast #parsnips #oliveoil #carrots #roastpotatoes #roastvegetables #herbs #garlic #celeriac #deglaze </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Roast wild boar",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Roast wild boar, Game recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#roastwildboar #unusualrecipes #wildboar #herbs #vegetables #restfor #roasting #miseenplace #roastingtin #garlic #fat \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This is a basic recipe for roasting wild boar\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1520\n|PortionCalories = 380\n|DatePublished=13th November 2013\n|Author = JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  2 hours 45 minutes\n|PrepTime = 15 minutes \n|CookTime = 2 hours 30 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Roast wild boar recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">As good with normal porkers</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.6</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I cannot find wild boar easily so I used pork, just as good in my opinion.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis is a basic recipe for [[Roasting|roasting]] [[Wild boar|wild boar]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1 wild boar joint\n| A good pinch of [[salt]]\n| 6 cloves of [[garlic]],unpeeled\n| Big sprig of [[sage]] leaves\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6), [fan oven 180\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Score the rind/[[Fat|fat]] with a sharp knife and the rub with plenty of [[Sea Salt|sea salt]].\n| Place the [[Herbs|herbs]] and [[Garlic|garlic]] in the centre of a [[Roasting tin|roasting tin]] then place the joint on top of them.\n| [[Roast]] in the centre of the [[Oven|oven]] for 25 minutes then reduce the heat to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4), [fan oven 160\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n| Allow 40 minutes per kg plus 40 minutes - if it is a [[Shoulder|shoulder]] joint, cook for a little longer.\n| When the [[Meat|meat]] is cooked, allow to [[Rest for|rest for]] 10 minutes or so, wrapped in [[Foil|foil]].\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Vegetables|vegetables]] or cold in sandwiches etc.\n==See also==\n* '''[[Meat cooking time calculator Metric|A comprehensive guide to roast meat cooking times]]''' - give the time you want to carve your roast and we'll give you a timed step by step roasting guide\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Boar]]\n[[Category:British recipes|Boar]]\n[[Category:Main courses|Boar]]\n[[Category:Game recipes|Boar]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes|Boar]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes|Boar]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted|Boar]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#roastwildboar #unusualrecipes #wildboar #herbs #vegetables #restfor #roasting #miseenplace #roastingtin #garlic #fat </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Rocket, olive, tomato and Capricorn Goats' cheese pizza recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#pizza #rocketolivetomatoandcapricorngoatscheesepizza #rocket #tomato #passata #tomatoes #redonion #oliveoil #blackolives #dice #breadmaker \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A goats' cheese vegetarian pizza from those nice people at The Lubborn Creamery\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 951\n|PortionCalories = 475\n|DatePublished=1st November 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 2\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 20 minutes\n |PrepTime = 10 minutes\n |CookTime = 10 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Rocket, olive, tomato and Capricorn Goats' cheese pizza recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">I like the addition of rocket</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I wouldn't have thought of using it in a pizza</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:NonLoggedInUser|NonLoggedInUser]] </span></span>\n}}\nA [[Goats' cheese|goats' cheese]] [[Vegetarian|vegetarian]] [[Pizza|pizza]] from those nice people at [[The Lubborn Creamery]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1 x 100g [[Capricorn Somerset goats' cheese]]\n| 2 ready-made [[Pizza|pizza]] bases\n| 125g [[Tomato|tomato]] [[Passata|passata]]\n| &frac12;  [[Red onion|red onion]], sliced into rings\n| 80g sun-blushed [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]]\n| A  handful of [[Rocket|rocket]] leaves\n| A handful of pitted [[Black olives|black olives]]\n| [[Olive oil]]\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]]\n| [[Freshly ground black pepper]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Cover the [[Pizza|pizza]] bases with a layer of [[Tomato|tomato]] [[Passata|passata]] and add the [[Rocket|rocket]].\n| Add the sun-blushed [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]] and scatter the [[Red onion|red onion]] rings over the top.\n| [[Dice]] the [[Capricorn Somerset goats' cheese]] and sprinkle over, then finish off with a handful of [[Black olives|black olives]].\n| Season with [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]].\n| Place the [[Pizza|pizza]] in the middle of a preheated [[Oven|oven]] and cook at 180\u00b0C for 6-8 minutes.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with extra [[Rocket|rocket]] as desired and a drizzle of [[Olive oil|olive oil]].\n===Variations===\nMake your own [[Pizza dough|pizza base]] - it's so simple, especially if you own a [[bread maker]].\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Pizza recipes]]\n[[Category:Lubborn Creamery recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#pizza #rocketolivetomatoandcapricorngoatscheesepizza #rocket #tomato #passata #tomatoes #redonion #oliveoil #blackolives #dice #breadmaker </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Rolls for soup",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Rolls for soup recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#rollsforsoup #flour #butter #yeast #soup #egg #warmplace #knead #dough #rice #brush \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A basic recipe for rolls to accompany soup from the 1930s. Starting the baking in a cold oven saves fuel!\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1122\n|PortionCalories = 93\n|DatePublished=6th December 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Servings: 12 - Makes 12 rolls\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  2 hours, 10 minutes plus rising time\n|PrepTime =  1 hour, 45 minutes plus rising time\n|CookTime =  25 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Rolls for soup recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Incomplete recipe!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">2.5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">This needs further work</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n{{Template:WorkInProgress}}\nA basic recipe for rolls to accompany [[Soup|soup]] from the 1930s.  Starting the [[Baking|baking]] in a cold [[Oven|oven]] saves fuel!\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 225g [[Strong flour|strong flour]]\n| \u00bd teaspoon fine [[Salt|salt]]\n| 30g [[Butter|butter]]\n| 15g fresh [[Yeast|yeast]]\n| \u00bd teaspoon [[Sugar|sugar]]\n| 140ml tepid water\n| 1 [[egg]], beaten (optional)\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| [[Sieve]] the [[Flour|flour]] and [[Salt|salt]] into a warm bowl.\n| Rub in the [[Butter|butter]].\n| [[Cream]] the [[Yeast|yeast]] with the [[Sugar|sugar]].\n| Stir in the water and add to the [[Flour|flour]] mixture.\n| Mix it all together until you have a soft [[Dough|dough]].\n| [[Knead]] well, cover with a damp cloth and leave to [[Rice|rice]] in a [[Warm place|warm place]] for about an hour.\n| [[Knead]] well again and divide into 12 equal sized pieces.\n| Form into rolls and place on a greased and floured [[Baking tray|baking tray]].\n| Cover and leave to rise in a [[Warm place|warm place]] for about 15 minutes.\n| [[Brush]] with a little beaten [[Egg|egg]] if desired and place on a low-ish self of a cold [[Oven|oven]].\n| Turn on the heat to 230\u00b0 C (450\u00b0 F - gas 8), [fan [[Oven|oven]] 210\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour] and [[Bake|bake]] for about 30-35 minutes, turning the tray around for the final 10 minutes.\n| Allow to cool on a wire rack.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nIdeal for serving with [[Soup|soup]], but can also be used for [[Breakfast|breakfast]] and picnics if you make fewer, larger rolls.\n===Recipe source===\n\n* '''Main Cookery Book''' (1937)\n===Chef's notes===\nAdd more or less water as required.  The harder the [[Flour|flour]], the more water you may need.\n[[Category:Recipes|Rolls for soup]]\n[[Category:British recipes|Rolls for soup]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments|Rolls for soup]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking|Rolls for soup]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes|Rolls for soup]]\n[[Category:Soup and stock recipes|Rolls for soup]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes|Rolls for soup]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted|Rolls for soup]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#rollsforsoup #flour #butter #yeast #soup #egg #warmplace #knead #dough #rice #brush </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

Leave to cool then peel.\n| Cut into [[Dice|dice]] and fold in the thinly sliced [[Spring onion|spring onion]], [[Sour cream|sour cream]], seasoning and as much [[Grated|grated]] [[Horseradish|horseradish]] as you can take.\n| Lay the [[Fish|fish]] skin side up, [[Brush|brush]] with [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and season with [[Pepper|pepper]].\n| Place under a hot [[Grill|grill]] and cook for 6-8 minutes. The skin should be [[Browned|browned]] and crisp.\n| Finish with a little [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]] and lay the [[Fish|fish]] on top of the [[Potato salad|potato salad]].\n| Decorate with a little [[Spring onion|spring onion]].\n}}\n===Chef's notes===\nDon't be tempted to add [[salt]] as processed [[mackerel]] can be quite salty already.\n{{Template:HorseradishSeeAlso}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Albert Bartlett recipes]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes]]\n[[Category:Salad recipes]]\n[[Category:Sea fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]][[Category:Grilled, griddled or barbecued]]\n{{Template:Albert Bartlett attribution}}\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#roosterpotatosaladwithgrilledmackerelandhorseradish #lemonjuice #horseradish #fish #potatoes #oliveoil #sourcream #mackerel #springonion #dice #springonions </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Rose bundt cake",
                "revisions": [

                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",

                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Rose bundt cake recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#butter #yoghurt #rosebundtcake #cornflour #bake #eggs #flour #creamcheese #bakingpowder #cake #castersugar \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This recipe requires the use of a Nordic Ware Rose Bundt tin, but any tin with a volume of 2.3 litres or a little bigger will do fine.\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 6273\n|PortionCalories = 627\n|DatePublished=19th April 2016\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = 10\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  1 hour, 15 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime =  1 hour, 5 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Rose bundt cake recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Would be great if I could find a tin like yours!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I do keep looking. \ud83d\udc40</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis recipe requires the use of a [https://www.amazon.co.uk/Nordic-Aluminum-Platinum-Bundt-Black/dp/B00006JSVI/ref=sr_1_11?ie=UTF8&qid=1461097940&sr=8-11&keywords=nordic+ware+bundt+tins Nordic Ware Rose Bundt tin], but any tin with a volume of 2.3 litres or a little bigger will do fine.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 350g [[Caster Sugar|caster sugar]]\n| 115g [[Cream cheese|cream cheese]]\n| 230g softened [[Butter|butter]]\n| 3 large [[Eggs|eggs]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Vanilla extract|vanilla extract]]\n| 380g [[Plain flour|plain flour]], sieved\n| 65g [[Corn flour|corn flour]], sieved\n| 1 generous tablespoon [[Baking powder|baking powder]]\n| A large pinch [[Salt|salt]]\n| 150ml [[Milk|milk]] mixed with\n| 150ml [[Yoghurt|yoghurt]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Grease the tin using [[Cake|cake]] release - [[Butter|butter]] or [[Oil|oil]] will not be sufficient.  Use a [[Pastry|pastry]] [[Brush|brush]] to ensure that all the nooks and crannies are coated.\n* Pre-heat the [[Oven|oven]] to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4) - do not use the fan.  If you cannot switch off the fan, heat to 160\u00b0 C, cover the tin with foil before putting in the oven, in which case it may need a longer cooking time. \n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| [[Cream]] the [[Sugar|sugar]], [[Butter|butter]] and [[Cream cheese|cream cheese]] in a bowl.\n| Add the [[Eggs|eggs]], one at at time, beating well between each one.\n| Add the [[Vanilla|vanilla]].\n| Mix the [[Flour|flour]], [[Cornflour|cornflour]], [[Baking powder|baking powder]] and [[Salt|salt]] together.\n| Add to the [[Sugar|sugar]] and [[Butter|butter]] mixture, one-third at a time, alternating with the [[Milk|milk]] and [[Yoghurt|yoghurt]], ending with the [[Flour|flour]].\n| Tip it into the bundt tin  and bash it gently on the work surface to remove any air.\n| [[Bake]] for one hour or longer until cooked.\n| Cool in the tin for 10 minutes, then turn out onto a [[Cooling rack|cooling rack]].\n| Allow to cool completely.\n| Decorate as desired.\n}}\n===Recipe source===\n\n* Adapted from the recipe that came with the tin\n===Chef's notes===\nThis mixture may be a little too much, so make sure sure that you fill the tin no more than three-quarters.  [[Bake]] any remaining mixture in a small tin or paper cases.\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:North American recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#butter #yoghurt #rosebundtcake #cornflour #bake #eggs #flour #creamcheese #bakingpowder #cake #castersugar </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
