title": "Russell's of Upwell Meatloaf",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Russell's of Upwell Meatloaf\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#meatloaf #tomatoes #russellsofupwellmeatloaf #greaseproofpaper #recipes #meatrecipes #cherrytomatoes #blender #britishrecipes #maincourses #porkrecipes\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=A lovely meatloaf made from ingredients from our Local local butcher, Russells Butchers of Upwell, Norfolk and other ingredients found to hand. This is..\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=8th August 2023\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  1 hour, 20 minutes\n|PrepTime =  20 minutes\n|CookTime =  1 hour\n|TotalCalories = 2720\n|PortionCalories = 680\n|Image = [[Image:Russell's of Upwell Meatloaf recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Meaty meatloaf</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">The sun-dried tomatoes are the best!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jeremy]] </span></span>\n}}\nA lovely [[Meatloaf|meatloaf]] made from ingredients from our [[Local butcher|local butcher]], [[Russell's Butchers of Upwell, Norfolk]] and other ingredients found to hand.\n\nThis is the second time we've made it and it was lovely.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 2 [[Russell's steak burgers]]\n| 2 slices of [[Treacle Cured Bacon from Russell's of Upwell]]\n| Trimmed [[Fat|fat]] from streaky [[Bacon|bacon]]\n| Big pinch of [[Salt|salt]] and [[Freshly ground pepper|freshly ground pepper]]\n| &#189; teaspoon [[Taste Sensation Italian seasoning]]\n| 10 [[Cherry tomatoes|cherry tomatoes]], half chopped for the meatloaf mix, half to garnish\n| 2 tablespoons [[Taste Sensation Sun-dried Tomatoes Diced]]\n| 2 medium [[Onions|onions]], finely chopped\n| Large bunch of fresh [[Basil|basil]], chopped\n| Large bunch of fresh [[Sage|sage]], chopped\n| 2 cups of home-made [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Chop the [[Meat|meat]] into small pieces as the [[Blender|blender]] won't reduce them much more\n| Save a few halved [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]] to garnish the top, add the [[Rest|rest]], chopped, to the mixture\n| Add all of the ingredients to a [[Food processor|food processor]] with a plastic blade\n| Mix well until combined well - you may want to give them an extra [[Knead|knead]] by [[Hand|hand]] to be sure\n| Line a [[Baking tin|baking tin]] with [[Greaseproof paper|greaseproof paper]]\n| Pack the tin with the [[Meatloaf|meatloaf]] mix\n| Top with halved [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]]\n| Cover with a layer of [[tin foil]]\n| Cook in an [[Air-fryer|air-fryer]] for 1 hour at 180\u00b0C\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Russells of Upwell Butchers Shop.jpg|Served with mushroom spaghetti\nImage:Russells Butcher Shop Upwell Meatloaf.jpg|Meatloaf chopped\nImage:Russells of Upwell Meatloaf95.jpg|Ready to cook in the [[Air fryer]]\nImage:Russells of Upwell Meatloaf94.jpg|Mixed and ready to fill\nImage:Russells of Upwell Meatloaf93.jpg|The basic ingredients - we actually used about 3 times this amount of breadcrumbs\n</gallery>\n===Serving suggestions===\nWe, oddly, served this with [[Spaghetti|spaghetti]] mixed into a can of [[Mushroom soup|mushroom soup]]!\n===Chef's notes===\nThis will stretch to four people, or two [[Pigs|pigs]], with a little left over for [[Breakfast|breakfast]]!\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Beef recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Air fried recipes]]\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#meatloaf #tomatoes #russellsofupwellmeatloaf #greaseproofpaper #recipes #meatrecipes #cherrytomatoes #blender #britishrecipes #maincourses #porkrecipes</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Russells of Upwell Duck, Sausage and Bacon cassoulet",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Russells of Upwell Duck, Sausage and Bacon cassoulet\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#onions #slowcooker #fat #russellsofupwellducksausageandbaconcassoulet #duck #duckfat #bacon #sausages #sherryvinegar #chickenstock #fry\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=My Norfolk-based version of this French classic using produce from Russell's' Butchers of Upwell.\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=21st December 2022\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  5 hours, 15 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  5 hours\n|TotalCalories = 1964\n|PortionCalories = 982\n|Image = [[Image:Russells of Upwell Duck, Sausage and Bacon cassoulet recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Cracking recipe</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">A winter warmer!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry]] </span></span>\n\n}}\n[[Image:Russells of Upwell Duck, Sausage and Bacon cassoulet slow cooked.jpg|thumb|right|After 3 hours in the slow cooker - \ud83d\ude0b]]\n\nI've made plenty of variations of the classic [[Cassoulet|French duck cassoulet recipes]], especially as we spent 15 years of summer holidays surfing in the Basque region; where the original version of this recipe can be commonly found.\n\nThis is my own recipe based on [[Treacle Cured Bacon from Russell's of Upwell's]], bacon I can buy from the [[Butchers|butchers]] I can see across the fields from my office and spare 'left-over' items.\n\nThis recipe is cooked in the [[Slow-cooker|slow-cooker]]; just starting off in a cast [[Iron|iron]] [[Frying pan|frying pan]] to [[Brown|brown]] the [[Duck|duck]], [[Sausages|sausages]] and [[Onions|onions]].\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 large [[Duck|duck]] leg, skin on, from Russell's of Upwell if you're lucky enough to live in Norfolk!\n| 3 [[Pork sausages|pork sausages]] from Russell's of Upwell\n| 3 rashers of [[Treacle Cured Bacon from Russell's of Upwell's]] - (fatty back bacon [[Cured|cured]] in [[Black treacle|black treacle]])\n| 1 large [[Onion|onion]], peeled and chopped\n| 3 [[Fat|fat]] [[Cloves of Garlic, peeled and crushed|cloves of garlic, peeled and crushed]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Sherry vinegar|sherry vinegar]]\n| 2 [[Thin Indian green chillies|thin indian green chillies]], left whole\n| 1 large [[Portobello mushroom|portobello mushroom]], chopped\n| 1 400g can of chopped [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]]\n| 1 400g can of [[Butter beans|butter beans]]\n| 300 ml [[Chicken stock|chicken stock]]\n| Big pinch of [[Taste Sensation Italian seasoning]]\n| Pinch of [[Sea Salt|sea salt]]\n| &#189; teaspoon of [[Mixed herbs|mixed herbs]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Using no [[Fat|fat]] at all, [[Fry|fry]] the [[Duck|duck]] leg for 10 minutes in a heavy based pan to [[Brown|brown]] and release the [[Duck fat|duck fat]] from the skin\n| Chop the [[Bacon|bacon]] rashers into bite-sized pieces and [[Fry|fry]] them together with the [[Sausages|sausages]] for 3 or 4 minutes to colour them\n| Leaving the [[Fat|fat]] in the pan, remove all the [[Meat|meat]] and place in the [[Slow Cooker|slow cooker]] while you cook the [[Onions|onions]]\n| [[Sautee]] the [[Onions|onions]] for 5 minutes until until well [[Browned|browned]]\n| Add the [[Garlic|garlic]] and [[Stir-fry|stir-fry]] for a minute or so\n| Tip the contents of the pan into the [[Slow Cooker|slow cooker]] and [[Deglaze|deglaze]] the pan with the [[Sherry vinegar|sherry vinegar]]\n| Mix all of the [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]], drained [[Beans|beans]], [[Chillies|chillies]], [[Herbs|herbs]] and seasoning together and stir well to combine\n| Add all of this to the [[Slow Cooker|slow cooker]] together with the [[Chicken stock|chicken stock]] and slow cook on high for 2 hours\n| After 2 hours, stir well, remove and discard the whole [[Chillies|chillies]], turn the [[Slow-cooker|slow-cooker]] down to low and cook for the remaining two hours.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with hot crusty [[Bread|bread]]\n===Recipe source===\n\n* Based on an idea bought to me by produce sold by the [[Butchers|butchers]] I can see from here!\n===Chef's notes===\nAlmost anything you love can be added to this, the [[Duck fat|duck fat]] and the [[Beans|beans]] are the mainstay of this recipe to my mind, but anything you have top [[Hand|hand]] will be fabulous in this hearty [[Soup|soup]]-cum-[[Stew|stew]] recipe\n==See also==\n* [https://www.facebook.com/people/Russells-Family-Butchers/100063462076744/?paipv=0&eav=AfY1bdaLsrKyd7lZwxlS3oVF2YMWaPhrzCHWXKcQ3R8QqU018A93uyL5jG6NTEpPsC8&_rdr Russell's of Upwell (Facebook page)]\n* [[Russell's Butchers of Upwell, Norfolk]]\n* [[Treacle Cured Bacon from Russell's of Upwell's]]\n* [[Cassoulet|Other good cassoulet recipes]]\n\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:French recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Soup and stock recipes]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Chilli pepper recipes]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Slow cooker recipes]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n[[Category:Slow cooked]]\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#onions #slowcooker #fat #russellsofupwellducksausageandbaconcassoulet #duck #duckfat #bacon #sausages #sherryvinegar #chickenstock #fry</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

teaspoon [[Dried]] [[Sage]]\n| 70ml [[Milk]]\n| [[Salt]] & [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Peel and quarter the [[Onions|onions]] and cook in [[Boiling|boiling]] water until tender.\n| Drain and finely chop.\n| Mix with [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]], [[Sage|sage]] and seasoning.\n| Bind loosely with melted [[Butter|butter]] and [[Milk|milk]].\n| Use to stuff [[Chicken|chicken]], [[Pork|pork]] or [[Lamb|lamb]], or place in a [[Baking|baking]] tin dot with [[Butter|butter]] and [[Bake|bake]] for 15 minutes.\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:British Onions recipes]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n{{Template:British Onions attribution}}\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#sageandonionstuffing #butter #sage #breadcrumbs #onions #dried #lamb #blackpepper #stuffingrecipe #pork #chicken </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Sage and onion stuffing (Mrs Beeton's)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Sage and onion stuffing (Mrs Beeton's) an egg recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#butter #onions #egg #sage #simmer #sageleaves #liver #yolk #bread #breadcrumbs #boiledorsimmered \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This is from Mrs Beeton's Cookery Book. This copy was a present for my partner's mother, dated 1954\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 693\n|PortionCalories = 115\n|DatePublished=21st January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Other publications - circa 1945\n |Servings = Serves 6 plus\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 10 minutes\n |PrepTime = 5 minutes\n |CookTime = 5 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:BeetonsAd.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">This makes a LOT of stuffing!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">If it's good enough for Mrs Beeton, it's good enough for me.</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Carla_Cancio-Bello,_J.D.,_on_behalf_of_Cuban_Cuisine_UK|Carla]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis is from Mrs Beeton's Cookery Book. This copy was a present for my partner's mother, dated 1954\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 4 large [[Onions|onions]]\n| 10 [[Sage leaves|sage leaves]]\n| 125g (/&frac14;lb) [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]]\n| 40g (1&frac12;oz) [[Butter|butter]]\n| [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]] to taste\n| 1 [[Egg|egg]], beaten\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Peel the [[Onions|onions]], put them into [[Boiling|boiling]] water, let them [[Simmer|simmer]] for 5 minutes or rather longer, and just before they are taken out, put in the [[Sage|sage]]-leaves for a minute or two to take off their rawness.\n| Chop both these very fine, add the [[Bread|bread]], seasoning and [[Butter|butter]], and work the whole lot together with the [[Yolk|yolk]] of an [[Egg|egg]], when the stuffing will be ready for use.\n| It should be rather highly seasoned, and the [[Sage|sage]]-leaves should be very finely chopped.\n| Many cooks do not [[Parboil|parboil]] the [[Onions|onions]] in the manner just stated, but merely use them raw. The stuffing then, however is not nearly so mild, and to many tastes, its strong flavour would be very objectionable.\n| When made for [[Goose|goose]], a portion of the [[Liver|liver]] of the bird, [[Simmered|simmered]] for a few minutes and very finely [[Minced|minced]], is frequently added to this stuffing; and where economy is studied, the [[Egg|egg]] and [[Butter|butter]] may be dispensed with.\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Egg recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Poultry recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#butter #onions #egg #sage #simmer #sageleaves #liver #yolk #bread #breadcrumbs #boiledorsimmered </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Sage and walnut mustard",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Sage and walnut mustard, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#walnuts #sage #mustard #wine #mustardseeds #sageandwalnutmustard #foodprocessor #whitewine #sterilisedjar #hand #walnut \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Making you own condiments is so easy and always better then commercial offerings. Modify vigorously to suit your personal tastes\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 966\n|PortionCalories = 27\n|DatePublished=27th October 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = thumb|right|Variegated sage\n |Servings = Servings: 35 - Makes 500 ml of homemade [[Walnut|walnut]] and [[Sage|sage]] [[Mustard|mustard]]\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 1 day, 10 minutes\n |PrepTime = 1 day, 10 minutes\n |CookTime = None\n|Image = [[Image:Sage.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Strange, very strange</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">But quite nice actually</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nMaking you own [[Condiments|condiments]] is so easy and always better then commercial offerings.  Modify vigorously to suit your personal taste.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 100g [[Mustard seeds|mustard seeds]].\n| 250 ml [[White wine|white wine]].\n| 100 ml [[Sherry vinegar|sherry vinegar]].\n| 1 teaspoon [[Sea Salt|sea salt]]\n| 75g [[Walnuts|walnuts]], crushed with the palm of your [[Hand|hand]].\n| 4 sprigs of fresh [[Sage|sage]], about 35 [[Sage leaves|sage leaves]], stems removed.\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Pour the [[Wine|wine]] and [[Vinegar|vinegar]] into a bowl and add the [[Mustard seeds|mustard seeds]], leave for 24 hours.\n| Place the [[Mustard|mustard]] and [[Wine|wine]] in a [[Food processor|food processor]] with a metal blade and add the [[Sage|sage]], [[Salt|salt]] and [[Walnuts|walnuts]] , reserving a few walnuts for the end.\n| Process to a paste, the finer the blend the hotter it will be.\n| Add the remaining [[Walnuts|walnuts]] and pulse a few times leaving some roughly chopped [[Nuts|nuts]] in the [[Mustard|mustard]].\n| Store in a [[Sterilised jar|sterilised jar]].\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Dips and sauces]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Cooking with wine]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n\n[[Category:Uncooked]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#walnuts #sage #mustard #wine #mustardseeds #sageandwalnutmustard #foodprocessor #whitewine #sterilisedjar #hand #walnut </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }

Traditionally made with parsley\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 416\n|PortionCalories = 104\n|DatePublished=22nd October 2015\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  5 minutes\n|PrepTime =  5 minutes\n|CookTime = None\n|Image = [[Image:Sage chimichurri recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Dipping sauce</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Lovely to dip Knights malt crunch bread in.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nIn [[Argentina]], [[Chimichurri|chimichurri]] is as common as [[Ketchup|ketchup]] is in the UK. Traditionally made with [[Parsley|parsley]], this classic [[Sauce|sauce]] is served up at family BBQs, perfect with the [[Sage|sage]] in [[Perfect Pork sausages|perfect pork sausages]]!\n\nThis recipe is reproduced courtesy of [[Debbie&andrew's sausages|debbie&andrew's sausages]].\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| &#188; [[Cup|cup]] [[Sage leaves|sage leaves]] and stems\n| &#188; teaspoon [[Red pepper|red pepper]] flakes\n| &#189; teaspoon [[Salt|salt]]\n| 1 [[Clove|clove]] [[Garlic, peeled and crushed|garlic, peeled and crushed]] or [[Minced|minced]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Red wine vinegar|red wine vinegar]]\n| 1 tablespoon water\n| 3 tablespoons [[Oil|oil]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Chop the [[Sage leaves|sage leaves]] as finely as you can\n| Add all the ingredients in a bowl and mix well\n| Use as an accompaniment to your recipe\n}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Latin American recipes]]\n[[Category:Dips and sauces]]\n[[Category:Marinades dressings and butters]]\n[[Category:Chilli pepper recipes]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Gluten free recipes]]\n[[Category:Debbie&andrew's sausage recipes]]\n[[Category:Uncooked]]\n{{Template:DebbieAndAndrew attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#sageleaves #sagechimichurri #redwinevinegar #perfectporksausages #cup #ketchup #sage #argentina #sauce #recipesfromothersites #parsley </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Salad cream",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Salad cream, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#saladcream #whitepepper #evaporatedmilk #horseradish #mustard #sunfloweroil #blender #sauces #herbs #salads #fridge \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This recipe has been heavily adapted from Mrs Beeton. It tastes nothing like commercial salad cream and is much thicker!\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 169\n|PortionCalories = 169\n|DatePublished=20th October 2012\n|Author = JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = 1\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 15 minutes\n |PrepTime = 15 minutes\n |CookTime = None\n|Image = [[Image:Salad cream recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"><span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Nicer than the bottled stuff</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">And this is not chemical tasting, like the Heinz stuff.</span> \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\">[[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis recipe has been heavily adapted from Mrs Beeton.  It tastes nothing like commercial salad cream and is much thicker!\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1 teaspoon [[Mustard powder|mustard powder]]\n| &frac12;  teaspoon [[Caster sugar|caster sugar]]\n| 50 ml  [[Cider vinegar|cider vinegar]]\n| A large pinch each of [[White pepper|white pepper]] and [[Cayenne pepper|cayenne pepper]]\n| &frac12; teaspoon [[Salt|salt]]\n| 150 ml [[Evaporated milk|evaporated milk]]\n| 150 ml [[Sunflower oil|sunflower oil]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Mix the [[Mustard|mustard]], [[Sugar|sugar]], [[Vinegar|vinegar]], [[White pepper|white pepper]], [[Cayenne|cayenne]] and the [[Salt|salt]]. \n| Using a [[Blender|blender]], add the [[Evaporated milk|evaporated milk]], until the mixture is smooth.\n| Add the [[Oil|oil]], little by little, until you have a creamy consistency.\n| Adjust seasoning to taste.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nWith [[Salads|salads]] of course, but can be used as the basis for other [[Sauces|sauces]].\n===Variations===\nAdd chopped, [[Herbs|herbs]], [[Garlic|garlic]], [[Horseradish|horseradish]], or whatever you like.\n===Chef's notes===\nThis will keep for a few days in the [[Fridge|fridge]].\n===Servings===\nServings: 18 - Makes about 350 ml\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Salad cream]]\n[[Category:British recipes|Salad cream]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes|Salad cream]]\n[[Category:Marinades dressings and butters|Salad cream]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes|Salad cream]]\n[[Category:Uncooked]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#saladcream #whitepepper #evaporatedmilk #horseradish #mustard #sunfloweroil #blender #sauces #herbs #salads #fridge </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Salami Cheese Pasta Bake using Long Life Ingredients",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Salami Cheese Pasta Bake using Long Life Ingredients\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#pasta #cheesepowder #oliveoil #roux #plainflour #salamicheesepastabakeusinglonglifeingredients #milkpowder #whisk #sauce #salami #maincourses\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=In the advent of the Coronavirus event and being mindful of cooking with long life ingredients, I thought I would do some experiments with pasta.\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=19th March 2020\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = 2\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  55 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  40 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 1040\n|PortionCalories = 520\n|Image = [[Image:Salami Cheese Pasta Bake using Long Life Ingredients recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Tasty!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I could eat this all day long. \ud83c\udf5d</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry, aka Chef]])</span></span>\n}}\nIn the advent of the Coronavirus event and being mindful of cooking with long life ingredients,  I thought I would do some experiments with [[Pasta|pasta]].  This is the successful result of a few experiments.\n\nAll of the ingredients are long life and make a pretty reasonable meal even after they have been stored for many months.\n\nThe only item that might be more difficult to source is the [[Cheese powder|cheese powder]],  although [[Cheese|cheese]] can be successfully [[Frozen|frozen]], so you could use that.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 400 ml water\n| 50 g of [[Milk powder|milk powder]]\n| or 400 ml of [[Milk]]\n| 40g of [[Taste Sensation]] [[Cheese powder|cheese powder]]\n| 40g [[Olive oil]]\n| 30g [[Plain flour|plain flour]]\n| 60 g of [[Salami|salami]] or [[pepperoni]], sliced.\n| 150 g of [[Pasta|pasta]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4), [fan oven 160\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| [[Boil]] the [[Pasta|pasta]] in plenty of water, to which a good pinch of [[Salt|salt]] has been added.\n| Drain and reserve\n| Make up the [[Milk|milk]] from the [[Milk powder|milk powder]] by whisking the powder into the milk until combined.\n| [[Whisk]] in the [[Cheese powder|cheese powder]] to the [[Milk|milk]].\n| Add the [[Olive oil|olive oil]] to a [[Saucepan|saucepan]] and heat gently.\n| Stir in the [[Plain flour|plain flour]] until combined into a [[Roux|roux]] (a floury paste).\n| Pour the [[Milk|milk]] into the pan and [[Whisk|whisk]] to combine the [[Roux|roux]] into the cheesey milk.\n| Bring to a rolling [[Simmer|simmer]] while stirring as the [[Sauce|sauce]] thickens.\n| Mix the drained [[Pasta|pasta]] into the [[Sauce|sauce]] and pour into the sauce.\n| Pour the [[Pasta sauce|pasta sauce]] into an [[Oven|oven]] dish and dot with the [[Salami|salami]] slices.\n| Allow your cat to examine the results!\n| [[Bake]] in the middle of the [[Oven|oven]] at 180\u00b0 C for about 30 minutes.\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:baked long life cheese pasta.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Long-life salami pasta, baked\nImage:Cat examined pasta.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Allow your cat to investigate the pasta before baking!\n</gallery>\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with a [[Green vegetable|green vegetable]] if you have any.\n===Variations===\nOptionally add a chopped [[Onion|onion]] and 3 [[Cloves of garlic, crushed|cloves of garlic, crushed]] to the [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and [[Fry|fry]] off before making the [[Roux|roux]].\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Italian recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pasta recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Taste Sensation recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#pasta #cheesepowder #oliveoil #roux #plainflour #salamicheesepastabakeusinglonglifeingredients #milkpowder #whisk #sauce #salami #maincourses</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Salmon kedgeree",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Salmon kedgeree, Egg recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#salmonkedgeree #fishstock #fish #rice #salmon #chilli #garlic #oliveoil #stock #simmer #butter \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This breakfast dish was traditionally made with smoked haddock and, in spite of what other recipes say, without spices\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2814\n|PortionCalories = 1407\n|DatePublished=3rd November 2012\n|Author = JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = 2 as a main course. 4 as a breakfast\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 1 hour\n |PrepTime = 15 minutes\n |CookTime =  45 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Salmon kedgeree recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Look good Julia</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.3</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">It also looks like there's lots of it too.</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Sue_spins|Susie]] </span></span>\n}}\n\nThis breakfast dish was traditionally made with [[Smoked haddock|smoked haddock]] and, in spite of what other recipes say, without [[Spices|spices]].  This version uses [[Salmon|salmon]] as an alternative and to satisfy my husband's constant need for [[Garlic|garlic]] and [[chilli]], they have been included.  You may, of course, leave them out.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1 litre light [[Fish stock|fish stock]] or [[Court bouillon|court bouillon]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Chilli powder|chilli powder]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Garlic powder|garlic powder]]\n| 500 g [[Salmon|salmon]]\n| 15-20 ml [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 400 g [[Basmati rice|basmati rice]]\n| 5 tablespoons [[Butter|butter]]\n| 3 [[Hard boiled eggs|hard boiled eggs]], chopped\n| 2 tablespoons flat-leaved [[Parsley|parsley]], chopped\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Bring the [[Fish stock|fish stock]] to a gentle [[Simmer|simmer]] in a pan.\n| Meanwhile, mix the [[Chilli|chilli]] and [[Garlic|garlic]] powders together.\n| Mix with a little of the [[Fish stock|fish stock]] and add to the pan.\n| Gently [[Poach|poach]] the [[Salmon|salmon]] in the [[Stock|stock]] for about 5 minutes.\n| Remove from pan, and pour [[Stock|stock]] into a jug.\n| Using the same pan, heat the [[Olive oil|olive oil]].\n| Add the [[Rice|rice]] and stir for a minute or two.\n| Remove from heat and add 800 ml of the [[Fish stock|fish stock]].  If you have less than that, make up with water.\n| Cover and [[Simmer|simmer]] until the [[Rice|rice]] has absorbed the liquid (about 15 minutes).\n| Meanwhile, preheat [[Oven|oven]] to 160\u00b0 C (325\u00b0 F - gas 3).\n| [[Flake]] and bone the [[Fish|fish]].  Skin if desired.\n| When the [[Rice|rice]] is cooked, stir in the [[Fish|fish]] and the [[Butter|butter]].\n| Transfer to a [[Baking|baking]] dish and cover with [[Tin foil|tin foil]].  Prick a a few holes in the [[Tin foil|foil]]\n| [[Bake]] for 15-20 minutes and remove from [[Oven|oven]].\n| Garnish with the chopped [[Egg|egg]] and [[Parsley|parsley]].\n}}\n===Variations===\nTry with any [[Fish|fish]] that flakes easily.  Choose [[Spices|spices]] according to taste.  If you like a smoked flavour and use non-smoked salmon. add 1 teaspoon [[Paprika#Piment\u00f3n de La Vera|Piment\u00f3n de La Vera dulce]] to the [[chilli]] and [[garlic powder]].  Use fresh, crushed [[Garlic|garlic]] instead of the powder.\n==See also==\n[[Buttery kedgeree]], a version based on Delia's book recipe and [['Greasy spoon' kedgeree]] which speaks for itself.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Salmon kedgeree]]\n[[Category:Egg recipes|Salmon kedgeree]]\n[[Category:Chilli pepper recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes|Salmon kedgeree]]\n[[Category:Fish recipes|Salmon kedgeree]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses|Salmon kedgeree]]\n[[Category:Sea fish recipes|Salmon kedgeree]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes|Salmon kedgeree]]\n[[Category:Breakfast recipes|Salmon k]]\n[[Category:Poached]][[Category:Baked or roasted]][[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#salmonkedgeree #fishstock #fish #rice #salmon #chilli #garlic #oliveoil #stock #simmer #butter </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Salmon pesto parcels",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Salmon pesto parcel recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#filopastry #pesto #butter #salmon #pastry #breadcrumbs #lemon #brush #zest #filo #bakeoglide \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=I've based this on a recipe spotted on a Morrisons recipe card. It looks interesting and useful as we have salmon about once every two weeks\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1894\n|PortionCalories = 947\n|DatePublished=9th March 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  35 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime =  25 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Salmon pesto parcels recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Thanks Morrisons</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">A great recipe idea, and easy to make too.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nI've based this on a recipe spotted on a Morrison's recipe card.  It looks interesting and as we have [[Salmon|salmon]] about once every two weeks it is definitely worth a try.   I recall there might even be some [[Filo pastry|filo pastry]] in the [[Freezer|freezer]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 100g [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Pesto|pesto]]\n| [[Zest]] of a [[Lemon|lemon]]\n| [[Juice]] from half a [[Lemon|lemon]]\n| 30 g [[Butter|butter]]\n| 6 sheets of [[Filo pastry|filo pastry]]\n| 2 x 170g [[Salmon fillets|salmon fillets]], skin removed and checked for pin [[bones]]\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6), [fan oven 180\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Mix the [[Pesto|pesto]], [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]] and [[Zest|zest]], [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]] together and season to taste\n| Melt the [[Butter|butter]] in a small pan and lay a sheet of [[Filo pastry|filo pastry]] onto a dry cutting board. [[Brush]] with melted butter, add another sheet and rush with butter.  repeat until you have two stacks of 3 sheets of [[Pastry|pastry]]\n| Place a [[Salmon|salmon]] fillet in the centre of each [[Filo|filo]] stack and top with the [[Pesto|pesto]] mix\n| Gather the top of the [[Pastry|pastry]] to seal the parcel and [[Brush|brush]] with the remaining [[Butter|butter]]\n| [[Bake]] on a non-stick [[Baking sheet|baking sheet]] or [[Bake O Glide|bake o glide]] for 25 minutes\n| Serve immediately\n}}\n===Recipe source===\n\n* Based on a Morrisons recipe card.\n* http://your.morrisons.com/Recipes-and-Ranges/recipes/index/S/Salmon-pesto-parcels/\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Freshwater fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Sea fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Pies tarts and flans]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#filopastry #pesto #butter #salmon #pastry #breadcrumbs #lemon #brush #zest #filo #bakeoglide </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]

title": "Salted chocolate and nut brittle",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Salted chocolate and nut brittle recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#chocolate #parchment #saltedchocolateandnutbrittle #bakingtray #paletteknife #nuts #castersugar #thermometer #boiledorsimmered #dip #simmering \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Whilst peanuts are usually used, you can make this with any nut you like, in particular almonds, hazelnuts and pistachios\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=27th January 2017\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 10\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  40 minutes plus cooling time\n|PrepTime =  25 minutes plus cooling time\n|CookTime =  15 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 3360\n|PortionCalories = 336\n|Image = [[Image:Salted chocolate and nut brittle recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Lovely, thanks Julia</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Nice with chopped brazil nust</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry, aka Chef]])</span></span>\n}}\n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}}\nWhilst [[Peanuts|peanuts]] are usually used, you can make this with any [[Nut|nut]] you like, in particular [[Almonds|almonds]], [[Hazelnuts|hazelnuts]] and [[Pistachios|pistachios]] or a mixture\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 250g [[Caster Sugar|caster sugar]]\n| 100ml water\n| 250g [[Nuts|nuts]] of your choice very roughly chopped and lightly [[Toasted|toasted]]\n| 100g plain or [[Milk|milk]] [[Chocolate|chocolate]] broken into pieces\n| [[Sea salt]] or [[Salt#Himalayan_Pink_Rock_Salt|Himalayan rock salt]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Lightly grease a shallow [[Baking tray|baking tray]] and line with [[Parchment|parchment]] or [[Bake-O-Glide]]. \n| Place the [[Sugar|sugar]] in a small, heavy-based [[Saucepan|saucepan]] with the water and heat gently until the sugar has dissolved, gently stirring occasionally from time to time. \n| Bring to the [[Boil|boil]], then boil for about 10 minutes until the syrup has reached the 'hard crack' stage - it should form threads that are stiff (brittle) and break easily.  Don't let it get too dark or the flavour will be [[Bitter|bitter]].  If you have a [[Thermometer|thermometer]] you are looking for a temperature of 146-155 C (295-310 F).\n| Remove from the heat, [[Dip|dip]] the base of the pan briefly in cold water to prevent further cooking and stir in the [[Nuts|nuts]] straight away.  You may find it easier to add the nuts slightly earlier before the mixture becomes too stiff.\n| Tip the mixture out onto the line [[Baking tray|baking tray]]. \n| Spread a thin layer with the back of a spoon or [[Palette knife|palette knife]] and leave to harden.\n| Melt the [[Chocolate|chocolate]], either in a heatproof bowl over a pan of gently [[Simmering|simmering]] water, or in short bursts in the [[Microwave|microwave]]. \n| Invert the brittle on a clean sheet of [[Baking|baking]] [[Parchment|parchment]] so the flat side is uppermost and spread with the [[Chocolate|chocolate]] using a [[Palette knife|palette knife]]. \n| Sprinkle with a little [[Salt|salt]].\n| Leave to set before breaking into chunky pieces.\n}}\n===Recipe source===\n\n* Lightly adapted from a '''[https://www.waitrose.com/content/waitrose/en/home/recipes/recipe_directory/h/peanut_brittle_withseasaltchocolate.A4.html Waitrose recipe]'''\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#chocolate #parchment #saltedchocolateandnutbrittle #bakingtray #paletteknife #nuts #castersugar #thermometer #boiledorsimmered #dip #simmering </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }

title": "Sardine curry puffs",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Sardine curry puffs, Indian recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#currypaste #sardinecurrypuffs #sauce #lemon #egg #puffpastry #coriander #fry #bay #brush #sardines \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A far more interesting version of the curry pasties sometimes found in our fish and chip shops\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 6829\n|PortionCalories = 1138\n|DatePublished=3rd November 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 6 to 8 people\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime = 1 hour\n|PrepTime = 15 minutes\n|CookTime = 45 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Sardine curry puffs recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Fishy puffs</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Dinky mini fish pasties</span> \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\">[[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nA far more interesting version of the curry pasties sometimes found in our fish and chip shops.\n\n'''For the [[Curry paste|curry paste]]'''\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1 fresh [[Bay|bay]] leaf\n| 2 whole [[Clove|clove]] buds\n| &#189; teaspoon cardomom seeds (green or black), removed from pods\n| 1 tablespoon [[Coriander|coriander]] seed\n| 2 teaspoons white [[Cumin|cumin]] seeds\n| 1 teaspoon ground [[Turmeric|turmeric]]\n| 4 small hot [[Dried|dried]] [[Chillies|chillies]]\n| 2 [[Cloves|cloves]] of [[Garlic|garlic]], peeled and crushed\n| 2 tablespoons [[Malt|malt]] [[Vinegar|vinegar]]\n}}\n'''For the curry puffs'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 3 tablespoons [[Vegetable|vegetable]] [[Oil|oil]]\n| 1 small [[Onion|onion]], peeled and chopped\n| 1 can [[Sardines|sardines]] in [[Oil|oil]], drained\n| Juice of 1 [[Lemon|lemon]]\n| 1 teaspoon sea [[Salt|salt]]\n|* 1 500g (1 lb 2 oz) packet of [[Puff pastry|puff pastry]]\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the oven to 190\u00b0 C (375\u00b0 F - Gas 5)\n\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| In a small pan, dry roast the [[Bay|bay]] leaf, [[Cloves|cloves]], cardomom seeds, [[Coriander|coriander]] seeds until the [[Bay leaf|bay leaf]] starts to [[Brown|brown]], allow them to cool a little.\n| Add all of the [[Curry paste|curry paste]] ingredients to the [[Grinding|grinding]] attachment of a [[Food processor|food processor]] and blend to a paste.\n| [[Fry]] the [[Onions|onions]] in the [[Oil|oil]] until softened, about 4 minutes.\n| Add the [[Curry paste|curry paste]] and sizzle [[Fry|fry]] it for at least 3 minutes, stirring all the while.\n| Add 6 fl oz of [[Boiling|boiling]] water and cook until the [[Sauce|sauce]] thickens, about 10 minutes.\n| Add the [[Sardines|sardines]] and fold them into the [[Sauce|sauce]] to ensure they are coated, but don't let them break up.\n| Drizzle with the [[Lemon|lemon]] juice, sprinkle with [[Salt|salt]], stir gently to mix and leave for 1 hour to marinade.\n| Roll the [[Puff pastry|puff pastry]] out to 2.5 mm (1/8\") thick and cut into 13 cm (5\") rounds.\n| Preheat the oven to 190\u00b0 C (375\u00b0 F - Gas 5)  \n| Distribute the curried [[Fish|fish]] evenly between the rounds, [[Brush|brush]] the edges with the beaten [[Egg|egg]] and crimp to seal.\n| [[Brush]] the puffs with the remaining beaten [[Egg|egg]].\n| [[Bake]] for 25 minutes so the pastry is risen and [[Brown|brown]].\n}}\n===Chef's tip===\n\nIf the pastry browns before it has properly risen, lay a piece of [[tin-foil]] loosely over the puffs.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Indian recipes]]\n[[Category:Sea fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#currypaste #sardinecurrypuffs #sauce #lemon #egg #puffpastry #coriander #fry #bay #brush #sardines </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Sausage, bacon, red cabbage and apple bake (GF)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Sausage, bacon, red cabbage and apple bake recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#glutenfree #butter #raisins #cabbage #bacon #apples #sausages #shredded #sunfloweroil #cidervinegar #recipesfromothersites \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A warming gluten free pan roast full of Autumn fruit and vegetables. This recipe is courtesy of Debbie&Andrews sausages\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 790\n|PortionCalories = 197\n|DatePublished=23rd October 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  55 minutes\n|PrepTime =  20 minutes\n|CookTime =  35 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Sausage, bacon, red cabbage and apple bake GF recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Fast and healthy</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">A tasty, healthy meal in less than one hour, start to finish.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nA warming [[Gluten free|gluten free]] pan [[Roast|roast]] full of Autumn [[Fruit|fruit]] and [[Vegetables|vegetables]].  This recipe is courtesy of [[debbie&andrew's sausages]].\n[[Image:Harrogate-pork-sausages.png|300px|thumb|right|[[Debbie and Andrew's Harrogate 97% Gluten Free Pork Sausages]]]]\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 pack [[Debbie and Andrew's Harrogate 97% Gluten Free Pork Sausages]]\n| 1tsp [[Sunflower oil|sunflower oil]]\n| 8 rashers [[Smoked bacon|smoked bacon]], chopped\n| 600g [[Red cabbage|red cabbage]], [[Shredded|shredded]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Butter|butter]]\n| 2 Cox's [[Apples|apples]], peeled, cored and cut into [[Wedges|wedges]]\n| A pinch of [[Caster Sugar|caster sugar]]\n| A handful of [[Raisins|raisins]]\n}}\n====for the dressing:====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 1 tablespoon [[Honey|honey]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Gluten free|gluten free]] [[Wholegrain mustard|wholegrain mustard]]\n| 3 tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Cider vinegar|cider vinegar]]\n| [[Salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Part-[[Bake|bake]] your [[Sausages|sausages]] in a lightly oiled [[Baking tray|baking tray]] in the preheated [[Oven|oven]] for 5 minutes,  shaking the pan once or twice during that time. Remove and put to one side. When cool enough to  handle, cut into bite size chunks.\n| To make the dressing, simply whisk all the ingredients in a bowl, then put to one side.\n| Heat the [[Oil|oil]] a large [[Frying pan|frying pan]] and cook the [[Bacon|bacon]] until crispy and golden. Add the [[Cabbage|cabbage]] to  the pan and [[Stir-fry|stir-fry]] for 5 minutes. Tip into a bowl and toss with half the dressing.\n| Heat a knob of [[Butter|butter]] in the same [[Frying pan|frying pan]] and cook the part-cooked [[Sausages|sausages]] in the [[Oil|oil]] and  [[Bacon|bacon]] juices. Remove and put to one side.\n| Turn up the heat and [[Fry|fry]] the [[Dessert|dessert]] [[Apples|apples]] in a knob of [[Butter|butter]] in the same pan. Add the [[Raisins|raisins]], sprinkle with the [[Sugar|sugar]] and cook until [[Caramelised|caramelised]].\n| Now add the [[Cabbage|cabbage]] mix and the [[Sausage|sausage]] pieces back to the pan and warm everything through together. Add more dressing to taste and toss in the pan.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nSeason and serve with [[Gluten free|gluten free]] [[Bread|bread]].\n\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Gluten free recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Debbie&andrew's sausage recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n[[Category:Stewed, braised or pot roasted]]\n{{Template:DebbieAndAndrew attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#glutenfree #butter #raisins #cabbage #bacon #apples #sausages #shredded #sunfloweroil #cidervinegar #recipesfromothersites </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Sausage, bean and radicchio hash",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Sausage, bean and radicchio hash an Italian recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#sausagebeanandradicchiohash #tomatopuree #radicchio #tomatoes #sausage #chickenstock #fry #chilliflakes #oliveoil #redwine #beans \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=In our attempt to reach our 5 a day target, we're getting a weekly vegetable box from Abel &amp; Cole, which is making us\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2381\n|PortionCalories = 396\n|DatePublished=14th April 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 6\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  1 hour 40 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime =  1 hour 30 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Sausage, bean and radicchio hash recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Spicy soup</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Great for a fireside snack</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Carla_Cancio-Bello,_J.D.,_on_behalf_of_Cuban_Cuisine_UK|Carla]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Sausage, bean and radicchio hash on the hob.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Simmering on the hob]]\nIn our attempt to to reach our [[5 a day]] target, we're getting a weekly vegetable box from [[Abel & Cole]], which is making us use vegetables that we might not normally use.  The [[radicchio]] is a good example of this.  The spicy pork sausages and beans should go well with the bitter leaved radicchio.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 3 [[Cloves of Garlic, peeled and crushed|cloves of garlic, peeled and crushed]]\n| 2 [[Red onions|red onions]], peeled and sliced\n| 2 tablespoons of [[Olive oil]]\n| Splash of [[red wine]] (optional)\n| 1 x 200g Mattessons [[Smoked pork|smoked pork]] horseshoe [[Sausage|sausage]], [[Sliced on the diagonal|sliced on the diagonal]]\n| 1 x 225g (8 oz) hot [[Chorizo sausage|chorizo sausage]], sliced\n| 1 x 400g can of [[Cannellini beans|cannellini beans]], rinsed well and drained\n| 1 x 400g can of [[Flageolet beans|flageolet beans]], rinsed well and drained\n| 2 x 400g tinned [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Tomato puree|tomato puree]]\n| 300 ml (1/2 pint) [[Chicken stock|chicken stock]]\n| pinch of [[Chilli flakes|chilli flakes]]\n| pinch of mixed [[herbs]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Tomato puree|tomato puree]]\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 1 450 g (1 lb) [[Radicchio|radicchio]], cored and [[Shredded|shredded]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Heat the [[Olive oil|olive oil]] in a heavy based pan and add a good pinch of [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n| Gently [[Saute|saute]] the [[Onions|onions]] for 5 minutes, add the [[Garlic|garlic]] for the last 2 minutes.  Don't let the [[Garlic|garlic]] burn\n| Deglaze the pan with the [[red wine]], if using.\n| Add the [[Chorizo sausage|chorizo sausage]] and [[Fry|fry]] for 3 minutes, turning often\n| Add the horseshoe [[Sausage|sausage]] and [[Fry|fry]] until [[Browned|browned]].\n| Tip in the [[Beans|beans]], tinned [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]], [[Tomato puree|tomato puree]], [[Chicken stock|chicken stock]] and the [[Chilli flakes|chilli flakes]], mixed herbs and stir well, bring to the [[Boil|boil]], reduce the heat and [[Simmer|simmer]] for 45 minutes\n| After 45 minutes, add the sliced [[radicchio]], cover and simmer for a further 30 minutes.\n| Check for seasoning and serve.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with crusty [[bread]] or a [[bread roll]] to dip into the sauce.\n\n[[Pasta]], [[rice]] or [[boiled potatoes]] would be nice, but remember that this is very filling and a little goes a long way.\n===Variations===\nUse any variety of [[Cabbage|cabbage]]and any variety of canned [[beans]]. Reconstituted [[dried beans]] would be great providing you leave time to rehydrate them.\n\nI added a sliced up [[courgette]] 30 minutes before the end, as we had one spare. \n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Italian recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Grain and bean recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n[[Category:Abel and Cole veg box recipes]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#sausagebeanandradicchiohash #tomatopuree #radicchio #tomatoes #sausage #chickenstock #fry #chilliflakes #oliveoil #redwine #beans </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Sausage, bean and radicchio hash (slow cooker recipe)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",

                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Sausage, bean and radicchio hash slow cooker, Italian recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#tomatopuree #garlic #cabbage #redwine #onions #chilliflakes #oliveoil #sausage #chickenstock #tomatoes #fry \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This is a very hearty and filling cassoulet and perfectly suited to slow cooking\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2634\n|PortionCalories = 439\n|DatePublished=17th April 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Served with [[homemade pasta]] and [[broccoli]]\n|Servings = Serves 6\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  4 hours, 10 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime =  4 hours\n|Image = [[Image:Sausage, bean and radicchio hash pasta recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Winter Warmer</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">In Autumn!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis is a very hearty and filling [[cassoulet]] and perfectly suited to slow cooking.\n\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 3 [[Cloves of Garlic, peeled and crushed|cloves of garlic, peeled and crushed]]\n| 2 [[Red onions|red onions]], peeled and sliced\n| 2 tablespoons of [[Olive oil]]\n| Splash of [[red wine]] (optional)\n| 1 Mattessons [[Smoked pork|smoked pork]] horseshoe [[Sausage|sausage]], [[Sliced on the diagonal|sliced on the diagonal]]\n| 1 225g (8 oz) hot [[Chorizo sausage|chorizo sausage]], sliced\n| 1 400g can of [[Cannellini beans|cannellini beans]], rinsed well and drained\n| 1 400g can of [[Flageolet beans|flageolet beans]], rinsed well and drained\n| 2 400g tinned [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Tomato puree|tomato puree]]\n| 300 ml (1/2 pint) [[Chicken stock|chicken stock]]\n| Pinch of [[Chilli flakes|chilli flakes]]\n| Pinch of mixed [[herbs]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Tomato puree|tomato puree]]\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 450 g (1 lb) [[Radicchio|radicchio]], cored and [[Shredded|shredded]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Heat the [[Olive oil|olive oil]] in a heavy based pan and add a good pinch of [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n| Gently [[Saute|saute]] the [[Onions|onions]] for 5 minutes, add the [[Garlic|garlic]] for the last 2 minutes.  Don't let the [[Garlic|garlic]] burn\n| Deglaze the pan with the [[red wine]], if using.\n| Reserve the [[onions]] and [[garlic]] to the [[slow cooker]] and add the [[Chorizo sausage|chorizo sausage]] and [[Fry|fry]] for 3 minutes, turning often\n| Add the horseshoe [[Sausage|sausage]] and [[Fry|fry]] until [[Browned|browned]].\n| Add the cooked [[sausages]] to the [[slow cooker]]\n| Tip in the [[Beans|beans]], tinned [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]], [[Tomato puree|tomato puree]], [[Chicken stock|chicken stock]] and the [[Chilli flakes|chilli flakes]], mixed herbs and stir well.\n| Add the sliced [[radicchio]], cover and cook on low for 4 hours\n| Check for seasoning and serve.\n}}\n===Variations===\nUse any variety of [[Cabbage|cabbage]]and any variety of canned [[beans]]. Reconstituted [[dried beans]] would be great providing you leave time to rehydrate them.\n\nI added a sliced up [[courgette]] 30 minutes before the end, as we had one spare.\n===Chef's notes===\nIf you like your [[cabbage]] with a little bite, and time allows, add the cabbage during the last 30 minutes of cooking. \n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Italian recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Grain and bean recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Slow cooker recipes]]\n[[Category:Slow cooked]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#tomatopuree #garlic #cabbage #redwine #onions #chilliflakes #oliveoil #sausage #chickenstock #tomatoes #fry </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }

title": "Sausage, fennel and chilli courgetti",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Sausage, fennel and chilli courgetti recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#courgettes #sauce #parmesancheese #blackpepper #rocket #courgette #sausages #julienned #peeler #spiralizer #julienne \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Courgetti is courgettes cut into spaghetti style ribbons with a spiralizer or julienne peeler, gluten free and low carbohydrate\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 767\n|PortionCalories = 383\n|DatePublished=22nd October 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  20 minutes\n|PrepTime =  5 minutes\n|CookTime =  15 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Sausage, fennel and chilli courgetti recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Top marks, Good Grips</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">One of the best julienne peelers around</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Carla_Cancio-Bello,_J.D.,_on_behalf_of_Cuban_Cuisine_UK|Carla]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Harrogate-pork-sausages.png|300px|thumb|right|[[Debbie and Andrew's Harrogate 97% Gluten Free Pork Sausages]]]]\n[[Image:Oxo Good Grips Julienne peeler.jpg|300px|thumb|right|oxo Good Grips now make an the perfect tool for making corgetti]]\nCourgetti is [[Courgettes|courgettes]] cut into [[Spaghetti|spaghetti]] style ribbons with a [[Spiralizer|spiralizer]] or [[Julienne|julienne]] [[Peeler|peeler]], perfect as a [[Gluten free|gluten free]] and low [[Carbohydrate|carbohydrate]] alternative to [[Wheat|wheat]] spaghetti. This recipe is allergy free.\n\nRecipe created by Natural Chef, Ceri Jones and reproduced on [[Cookipedia]] by courtesy of [[Debbie&andrew's sausages|debbie&andrew's sausages]].\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 2 teaspoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 2 [[Cloves garlic, minced|cloves garlic, minced]] \n| 1 teaspoon [[Fennel seeds|fennel seeds]]\n| \u00bd teaspoon [[Dried|dried]] [[Chilli flakes|chilli flakes]] \n| 4 debbie&andrew\u0092s [[Harrogate 97% Pork Sausages]], chopped \n| 10 [[Cherry tomatoes|cherry tomatoes]], quartered \n| 2 large [[Courgettes|courgettes]], [[Julienned|julienned]] (reserve the cores, [[Dice|dice]] them and add to the [[Sauce|sauce]])\n| 25g fresh [[Rocket|rocket]], [[Black pepper|black pepper]] and [[Parmesan cheese]] to serve\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Heat the [[Olive oil|olive oil]] in a large [[Frying pan|frying pan]]. Add the [[Garlic|garlic]], [[Chilli flakes|chilli flakes]], and [[Fennel seeds|fennel seeds]] and [[Fry|fry]] for 30 seconds before adding the raw chopped [[Sausage|sausage]].\n| Cook till the mixture starts to [[Brown|brown]].\n| Next add the [[Diced|diced]] [[Courgette|courgette]] cores along with the [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]] and cook over a medium heat until the [[Sausages|sausages]] are cooked through, approximately a further 7-8 minutes\n| When the [[Sausages|sausages]] are cooked add the [[Julienned|julienned]] [[Courgette|courgette]] and stir through the [[Sauce|sauce]]. Let the [[Courgettes|courgettes]] warm in the sauce for 2-3 minutes until softened.\n| Plate up and dress with fresh [[Rocket|rocket]], a good dose of [[Black pepper|black pepper]] and a shaving of [[Parmesan cheese]].\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nPlate up and dress with fresh [[Rocket|rocket]], a good dose of [[Black pepper|black pepper]] and a shaving of [[Parmesan cheese]].\n===Chef's notes===\nYou can use a [[Julienne|julienne]] [[Peeler|peeler]] or [[Spiralizer|spiralizer]] to create your [[Courgette spaghetti|courgette spaghetti]]. If you have neither, use a standard peeler to create wider ribbons of [[Courgette|courgette]] instead. Depending on your method there may or may not be any courgette cores for the [[Sauce|sauce]].\n===See also ===\n* [[Oxo Good Grips Julienne peeler]]\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Italian recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Gluten free recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Debbie&andrew's sausage recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n{{Template:DebbieAndAndrew attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#courgettes #sauce #parmesancheese #blackpepper #rocket #courgette #sausages #julienned #peeler #spiralizer #julienne </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Sausage, Kale and Bean Stew",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Paelo Sausage, Kale and Bean Stew recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#srirachasauce #beans #chickenstock #oregano #stew #kale #sausagekaleandbeanstew #butternutsquash #sausage #punch #oliveoil \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=The hearty sausage stew recipe is reproduced courtesy of Debbie&andrews debbie&andrews sausages. With super healthy ingredients and a chilli kick\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1769\n|PortionCalories = 442\n|DatePublished=22nd October 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  1 hour, 5 minutes\n|PrepTime =  25 minutes\n|CookTime =  40 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Sausage, Kale and Bean Stew recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Tastes nicer than it looks</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">And the chilli helped!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The&nbsp;Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Harrogate-pork-sausages.png|300px|thumb|right|[[Debbie and Andrew's Harrogate 97% Pork Sausages|Debbie and Andrew's Harrogate 97% Gluten Free Pork Sausages]]]]\nThe hearty [[Paelo]] friendly [[Sausage|sausage]] [[Stew|stew]] recipe is reproduced courtesy of [[Debbie&andrew's sausages|debbie&andrew's sausages]].\n\nWith super healthy ingredients and a [[Chilli|chilli]] kick, pack a nutritional [[Punch|punch]] and make life a bit easier! This hearty [[Gluten free|gluten free]] winter [[Stew|stew]] can be made a day or two in advance if you've a busy week ahead and only gets better with time.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 6 debbie&andrew's [[Harrogate 97% Pork Sausages]], cut into 2-3cm chunks\n| 1 small [[Butternut squash|butternut squash]] or [[Carrots|carrots]], peeled and cut into 2-3cm chunks\n| 2 tins cooked [[Flageolet beans|flageolet beans]], drained and washed (any [[Beans|beans]] will work)\n| 3 [[Cloves garlic, crushed|cloves garlic, crushed]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Oregano|oregano]]\n| 1 medium [[Onion|onion]], cut into chunks\n| 900ml [[Chicken stock|chicken stock]]\n| 275g [[Kale|kale]], stalks removed\n| 2 tablespoons of [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| [[Salt]] & [[Pepper|pepper]]\n| [[Sriracha sauce]] to garnish (or [[Chilli flakes|chilli flakes]] if you prefer)\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| In a large [[Casserole|casserole]] pan, heat the [[Oil|oil]], add the [[Sausages|sausages]] and cook for 3-4 minutes until golden.\n| Turn the heat down to medium and add the [[Onions|onions]], [[Garlic|garlic]], [[Butternut squash|butternut squash]] and [[Oregano|oregano]].\n| Cook for 10 minutes or until softened, stirring occasionally.\n| Add the [[Beans|beans]] and [[Chicken stock|chicken stock]], place the lid on and cook for 20 minutes on a gentle heat.\n| Add the [[Kale|kale]], season and cook for a further 3-4 minutes with the lid on.\n| To serve, place dish in the middle of the table and drizzle over [[Sriracha sauce|sriracha sauce]].\n| Top tip: Add a touch of [[Cream|cream]] for extra richness if you\u0092re feeling decadent.\n| Going Paleo? Don't include the [[Beans|beans]] and make your own [[Sriracha sauce|sriracha sauce]] using [http://nomnompaleo.com/post/36060636540/paleo-sriracha-homemade-20-minute-sriracha this recipe]!\n}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Soup and stock recipes]]\n[[Category:Chilli pepper recipes]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Grain and bean recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Stews and casseroles]]\n[[Category:Debbie&andrew's sausage recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n[[Category:Stewed, braised or pot roasted]]\n{{Template:DebbieAndAndrew attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#srirachasauce #beans #chickenstock #oregano #stew #kale #sausagekaleandbeanstew #butternutsquash #sausage #punch #oliveoil </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Sausage, mushroom, lemon and thyme pot roast (GF)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Sausage, mushroom, lemon and thyme pot roast (Gluten free) recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#lemon #mushrooms #thyme #glutenfree #butter #whitewine #sausages #sausagemushroomlemonandthymepotroastgf #chestnut #bread #fry \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=An very quick and easy pot roast with mushrooms, debbie and andrews Gluten gluten free sausages, lemon and thyme\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1287\n|PortionCalories = 643\n|DatePublished=23rd October 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  25 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime =  15 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Sausage, mushroom, lemon and thyme pot roast GF recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Yummy with crusty bread</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">and mushrooms!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Sue_spins|Susie]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Harrogate-pork-sausages.png|300px|thumb|right|[[Debbie and Andrew's Harrogate 97% Gluten Free Pork Sausages]]]]\nAn very quick and easy [[Pot roast|pot roast]] with [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]], debbie and andrew's [[Gluten free|gluten free]] [[Sausages|sausages]], [[Lemon|lemon]] and [[Thyme|thyme]].\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 pack |[[Debbie and Andrew's Harrogate 97% Gluten Free Pork Sausages]]\n| 2 handfuls of [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]] (field, [[Chestnut|chestnut]], button etc), sliced to around the same size\n| Bunch of [[Thyme|thyme]]\n| Knob of [[Butter|butter]]\n| &#189; [[Lemon|lemon]]\n| &#188; bottle [[White wine|white wine]]\n| 1 crusty loaf (or [[Gluten free|gluten free]] alternative)\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| In a large fry pan over a medium high/heat, melt a knob of [[Butter|butter]] until sizzling. [[Fry]] off your [[Sausages|sausages]] and [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]] until lovely and golden, about 12 minutes.\n| Add [[White wine|white wine]] and reduce completely.\n| Squeeze [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]] all over dish, throw in the [[Lemon|lemon]] once squeezed. Season with [[Salt|salt]], [[Pepper|pepper]] and garnish with chopped [[Thyme|thyme]].\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with hot crusty [[Bread|bread]].\n===See also===\n* [[Udi's Gluten Free Products|Udi's Gluten Free Products for gluten free bread]]\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Gluten free recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Cooking with wine]]\n[[Category:Stews and casseroles]]\n[[Category:Debbie&andrew's sausage recipes]]\n[[Category:Stewed, braised or pot roasted]]\n{{Template:DebbieAndAndrew attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#lemon #mushrooms #thyme #glutenfree #butter #whitewine #sausages #sausagemushroomlemonandthymepotroastgf #chestnut #bread #fry </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Sausage, Onion, Fig and Feta Salad (GF)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Sausage, Onion, Fig and Feta Salad Gluten free recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#oliveoil #sausages #figs #salad #balsamic #lambslettuce #pea #feta #redonions #bake #goatscheese \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This salad features juicy figs combined with a leafy salad (try lambs lettuce and pea shoots) along side dollops of rich Goats cheese\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2407\n|PortionCalories = 601\n|DatePublished=15th October 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  40 minutes\n|PrepTime =  20 minutes\n|CookTime =  20 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Mediterranean sausage salad recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Down among the glutens</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Sounds like a tv show \ud83d\ude04</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:DebbieandAndrews-logo.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Recognise the sausages by the wellies on the packet, find them at your local supermarket]]\nThis [[Salad|salad]] features juicy [[Figs|figs]] combined with a leafy salad (try [[Lambs lettuce|lambs lettuce]] and [[Pea|pea]] shoots) along side dollops of rich [[Goats cheese|goats cheese]] that give a creamy but robust [[Accompaniment|accompaniment]] to the properly peppery Perfect Cumberland [[Sausages|sausages]]. For a really rustic look, cut the sausages into bite-sized chunks and then drizzle the whole thing with [[Balsamic vinegar|balsamic vinegar]] and a good quality [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 pack of [[Debbie and Andrew's Perfect Cumberland Pork Sausages]]\n| 8 [[Figs|figs]], quartered\n| 2 [[Red onions|red onions]], peeled and quartered\n| 200g [[Feta|feta]] cheese\n| 20ml [[Balsamic]] glaze\n| [[Olive oil]]\n| 200g bag mixed leaf [[Salad|salad]] or fresh selected [[Pea|pea]] shoots and [[Lambs lettuce|lambs lettuce]].\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4), [fan oven 160\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Place [[Onions|onions]] in a [[Roasting dish|roasting dish]] and lather in [[Salt|salt]], [[Pepper|pepper]] and [[Olive oil|olive oil]].\n| [[Bake]] for 20 minutes until soft and golden.\n| Chop the [[Debbie and Andrew's Perfect Cumberland Pork Sausages]] into thick slices [[On the diagonal|on the diagonal]].\n| In a non-stick large [[Fry|fry]] pan, fry off over a medium/high heat until lovely and golden. Set aside to cool.\n| Assemble your [[Salad|salad]] by layering salad leaves, [[Red onion|red onion]], debbie&andrew\u0092s [[Sausages|sausages]] and [[Figs|figs]].\n| Season with [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]].\n| Finish with a generous drizzle of [[Olive oil|olive oil]], [[Balsamic|balsamic]] glaze and crumbled [[Feta|feta]].\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Greek recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Gluten free recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Debbie&andrew's sausage recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n{{Template:DebbieAndAndrew attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#oliveoil #sausages #figs #salad #balsamic #lambslettuce #pea #feta #redonions #bake #goatscheese </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Sausage, red pepper and butternut squash roast (GF)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Sausage, red pepper and butternut squash roast recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#oliveoil #roast #honey #redonions #sprigsrosemary #greens #vegetable #sausage #roastingtin #redpeppers #glutenfree \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This one dish sausage and vegetable roast recipe is really easy to make and can be ready in under one hour, Gluten free too!\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 471\n|PortionCalories = 94\n|DatePublished=24th October 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 5\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  50 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime =  40 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Sausage, red papper and butternut squash roast GF recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">A lovely way with sausages</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">And it's gluten free</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Perfect-pork.png|300px|thumb|right|[[Debbie and Andrew's Perfect Pork sausages]]]]\nThis one dish [[Sausage|sausage]] and [[Vegetable|vegetable]] [[Roast|roast]] recipe is really easy to make and can be ready in under one hour, it's also [[Gluten free|gluten free]].  It comes to Cookipedia courtesy of [[debbieandandrew's sausages]]\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 pack [[Debbie and Andrew's Perfect Pork sausages]]\n| 2 [[Red peppers|red peppers]], deseeded and cut into chunks\n| 2 [[Red onions|red onions]], peeled and quartered\n| 1kg [[Butternut squash|butternut squash]], such as butternut, deseeded and cut into [[Wedges|wedges]]\n| 3 [[Sprigs rosemary|sprigs rosemary]], leaves only\n| 3 tablespoons of [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 1 tablespoon of [[Honey|honey]]\n| [[Salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6), [fan oven 180\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Put the [[Sausages|sausages]], [[Peppers|peppers]], [[Red onions|red onions]] and [[Squash|squash]] in a large [[Roasting tin|roasting tin]] and scatter over the [[Rosemary leaves|rosemary leaves]], along with a generous pinch of [[Salt|salt]].\n| Drizzle with the [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and [[Honey|honey]] and season generously.\n| Mix everything together with your hands until well coated and [[Roast|roast]] in the preheated [[Oven|oven]] for 40 minutes.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with fresh seasonal [[Greens|greens]].\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Gluten free recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Stews and casseroles]]\n[[Category:Debbie&andrew's sausage recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n{{Template:DebbieAndAndrew attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#oliveoil #roast #honey #redonions #sprigsrosemary #greens #vegetable #sausage #roastingtin #redpeppers #glutenfree </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
