title": "Sausage, Spinach and Egg Bake",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Sausage, Spinach and Egg Bake recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#mushrooms #butter #spinach #sausages #dairy #cheese #cheesesauce #fry #sausagespinachandeggbake #grill #rest \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Perfect Cumberland Sausages and mushrooms with spinach and baked eggs, covered in cheese sauce\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2808\n|PortionCalories = 702\n|DatePublished=22nd October 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  40 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  25 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Sausage, Spinach and Egg Bake recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Sausage traybake</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Nice \ud83d\ude0b</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Perfect-cumberland-sausages.png|300px|thumb|right|[[Debbie and Andrew's Perfect Cumberland Pork Sausages]]]]\nThe hearty sausage roast is reproduced courtesy of [[debbie&andrew's sausages]].\n\nPerfect Cumberland [[Sausages]] and [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]] with [[Spinach|spinach]] and [[Baked eggs|baked eggs]], covered in [[Cheese sauce|cheese sauce]] and [[Baked|baked]] until golden. A quick, delicious weekend brunch, this is one-pan cooking at its best, just serve at the table and let everyone tuck in.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 4 x [[Debbie and Andrew's Butcher's Classic Cumberland Sausages]], cooked and sliced \n| 100g [[Spinach|spinach]], cooked\n}}\n====for the bake====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 100g [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]], [[Fried|fried]] and sliced (I used re-hydrated [[Wild mushrooms|wild mushrooms]])\n| 4 [[free range eggs]]\n| [[Oil]] for cooking\n| [[Butter]] for cooking (use a [[Dairy]] Free alternative if preferred)\n}}\n====for the cheese sauce:====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 30g [[Butter|butter]]\n| 25g [[Plain flour|plain flour]] (use [[Gluten free|gluten free]] if preferred)\n| 350ml [[Milk|milk]] (use a [[Dairy]] Free alternative if preferred)\n| 130g [[Grated|grated]] [[Cheese|cheese]] (use a [[Dairy]] Free alternative if preferred)\n| [[Salt]] & [[Pepper|pepper]]\n| [[Nutmeg]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Grill|grill]]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n}}\n====cheese sauce:====\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Melt the [[Butter|butter]] in a [[Saucepan|saucepan]], add the [[Flour|flour]] to make a [[Roux|roux]] and cook off for 3 minutes.\n| Slowly pour in the [[Milk|milk]], stirring to create a b\u00e9chamel. Cook for 5-6 minutes, mixing so the bottom does not catch.\n| Add the [[Cheese|cheese]], season, take off the heat and cover with [[Greaseproof paper|greaseproof paper]] so a skin does not form.\n}}\n====the bake:====\n{{RecipeMethod\n| [[Fry]] off the [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]] in a knob of [[Butter|butter]], season and [[Rest|rest]] on a plate.\n| [[Fry]] the [[Sausage|sausage]] slices in the same pan with some [[Oil|oil]] for 3-4 minutes until they start to caramelise. Transfer to the same plate as the [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]].\n| Add a little more [[Oil|oil]] to the pan, then break in the [[Eggs|eggs]]. As soon as they start to go white, scatter the [[Sausages|sausages]], [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]] and [[Spinach|spinach]] over them.\n| Next and as quickly as possible pour the [[Cheese sauce|cheese sauce]] over the top, sprinkle with the remaining [[Cheese|cheese]] and place under the hot [[Grill|grill]] until golden and bubbling.\n| Serve in the pan immediately.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe directly from the pan, immediately.\n===Variations===\nServe with [[Potatoes|potatoes]] for a hearty supper\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Breakfast recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Egg recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Debbie&andrew's sausage recipes]]\n[[Category:Grilled, griddled or barbecued]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n{{Template:DebbieAndAndrew attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#mushrooms #butter #spinach #sausages #dairy #cheese #cheesesauce #fry #sausagespinachandeggbake #grill #rest </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Sausage, tomato and pepper bake with balsamic vinegar",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Sausage, tomato and pepper bake with balsamic vinegar recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#gravy #oliveoil #sausagetomatoandpepperbakewithbalsamicvinegar #tomatoes #balsamicvinegar #onions #roastingtray #bake #sausages #newpotatoes #vegetables \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Another sticky gravy tray bake, this time using Debbie and Andrews sausages as they seem to be the best quality sausages\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=2nd August 2016\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  1 hour, 10 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime =  1 hour\n|TotalCalories = 166\n|PortionCalories = 83\n|Image = [[Image:Sausage, tomato and pepper bake with balsamic vinegar.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">cOLOURFUL!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">And really tasty.</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Sue_spins|Susie]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Sausage, tomato and pepper bake with balsamic vinegar recipe.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Ready to bake]]\nAnother sticky [[Gravy|gravy]] tray [[Bake|bake]], this time using [[:Category:Debbie&andrew's sausage recipes|Debbie & Andrew's sausages]], as they seem to be the best quality sausages available from the supermarkets at a reasonable price.\n\nAdd any of your favourite [[Vegetables|vegetables]] to this dish to liven it up. Even small [[New Potatoes|new potatoes]] would work well, although they might need to be [[Par-boiled|par-boiled]] for 15 minutes first just to ensure they soften up.  They would be great to soak up the dark sticky [[Gravy|gravy]].\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 medium [[Onion|onion]], peeled and sliced\n| 4 [[Debbie and Andrew's Harrogate 97% Pork Sausages]]\n| 3 [[Cloves of Garlic, peeled and crushed|cloves of garlic, peeled and crushed]]\n| 1 [[Yellow pepper|yellow pepper]], [[Seeds|seeds]] removed and sliced\n| 1 teaspoon [[Dried oregano|dried oregano]]\n| 350g [[Cherry tomatoes|cherry tomatoes]], left uncut\n| 1 [[Sprig of rosemary|sprig of rosemary]]\n| 1 sprig of [[Thyme|thyme]]\n| 2 [[Bay leaves|bay leaves]]\n| 3 tablespoons [[balsamic vinegar]]\n| 3 tablespoons of [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 190\u00b0 C (375\u00b0 F - gas 5), [fan oven 170\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Chose a fairly small [[Baking tray|baking tray]] and add 2 tablespoons of [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and a good grind of [[Black pepper|black pepper]].\n| Pop the [[Oven|oven]] try on the [[Hob|hob]] and put it on a high heat.\n| Add the [[Sausages|sausages]], sliced [[sweet pepper]] and the sliced [[Onions|onions]] and [[Brown|brown]] them.  You'll need to keep moving them about because they won't heat as evenly as they would in a [[Frying pan|frying pan]].\n| Once everything has taken a tiny bit of colour, add the [[Garlic|garlic]] and [[Stir-fry|stir-fry]] for a minute or so, then remove the tray from the heat.\n| Add the halved [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]], [[Herbs|herbs]] and [[Balsamic vinegar|balsamic vinegar]] to the sausages and stir well.\n| Season with a pinch of [[Salt|salt]] and pour over the remaining [[Olive oil|olive oil]].\n| [[Bake]] in the top half of the [[Oven|oven]] for 30 minutes, then mix everything up again and cook for a further 30 minutes.\n| If the gravy looks to be too liquid, place the baking tray on the hob on a high heat for 5 minutes, stirring now and then.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe from the [[Oven|oven]] dish with slices of stoneground [[Bread|bread]] to soak up the delicious [[Gravy|gravy]].\n===Chef's notes===\nAlthough this [[Debbie and Andrew's]] recipe suggests heating the [[sausages]], [[peppers]], [[onions]] et al, in a [[roasting tray]], I found it more convenient to do the [[browning]] in a large [[wok]] or [[frying pan]] and then transfer the part-cooked items to a preheated [[roasting tray]] and finish in the [[oven]].\n\nThe original recipe suggested halving the [[tomatoes]] but after making this dish many times I think it's nicer to leave them whole.  There's less liquid produces and you get the exquisite flavour bombs everytime you bite into one.\n===Variations===\nAdd a chopped deseeded dried [[Chile de Arbole]] for a livelier version!\n\nSliced [[mushrooms]] added a nice meaty bite to this dish.\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Debbie&andrew's sausage recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#gravy #oliveoil #sausagetomatoandpepperbakewithbalsamicvinegar #tomatoes #balsamicvinegar #onions #roastingtray #bake #sausages #newpotatoes #vegetables </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Sausages with garlic, chive and cauliflower mash (Paleo)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Sausages with garlic, chive and cauliflower mash, Paleo, gluten free recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#cauliflower #mash #chives #garlic #gravy #oliveoil #balsamicvinegar #fry #diced #beefstockcube #sausages \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Everyone loves bangers & mash! This is a British favourite with a paleo twist. Gluten free obviously\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 67\n|PortionCalories = 11\n|DatePublished=23rd October 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 6\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  1 hour\n|PrepTime =  30 minutes\n|CookTime =  30 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Sausages with garlic, chive and cauliflower mash Paleo recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Pile 'O sausages</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">The only thing missing is mustard mash!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Harrogate-pork-sausages.png|300px|thumb|right|[[Debbie and Andrew's Harrogate 97% Gluten Free Pork Sausages]]]]\nEveryone loves [[Bangers|bangers]] & [[Mash|mash]]! This is a British favourite with a paleo twist. Rustled up in just under half an hour, this warming winter classic is perfect for those busy days when you fancy a hearty meal. Recipe by [http://paleopolly.com/about/ Paleo Polly]. courtesy of [[Debbieandandrew's sausages|debbieandandrew's sausages]], the ones with the green Hunter wellies on the packet!\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 8-12 [[Debbie and Andrew's Harrogate 97% Gluten Free Pork Sausages]]\n| 1 medium [[Cauliflower|cauliflower]]\n| 2 [[Cloves of garlic|cloves of garlic]] (crushed)\n| 1 handful of fresh [[Chives|chives]] ([[Diced|diced]])\n| 1 organic [[Beef stock cube|beef stock cube]]\n| [[Balsamic vinegar]]\n| [[Olive oil]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| In a pan, [[Fry|fry]] your [[Sausages|sausages]] on a medium heat, turning regularly for around 20-25 minutes until cooked thoroughly.\n| Meanwhile, take your [[Diced|diced]] [[Cauliflower|cauliflower]] and [[Boil|boil]] in a pan for 15-20 minutes until soft.\n| In a pan, [[Fry|fry]] the [[Garlic|garlic]] in a splash of [[Olive oil|olive oil]] then set aside.\n| Drain the [[Cauliflower|cauliflower]] of the water, save the water in a medium pan (to use for the [[Gravy|gravy]].)\n| Add the [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and [[Garlic|garlic]] to the [[Cauliflower|cauliflower]] pan and [[Mash|mash]] together, until smooth. Season with [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]], and add the chopped [[Chives|chives]], leaving a small amount to garnish.\n| Cover and set aside the [[Mash|mash]] pan.\n| In a separate pan, take your organic [[Beef stock cube|beef stock cube]], add 250 ml of the [[Cauliflower|cauliflower]] water, stir and then reduce, until the [[Stock|stock]] thickens. Add a splash of [[Balsamic vinegar|balsamic vinegar]]. Reduce further until a thick [[Gravy|gravy]].\n| Pour the [[Gravy|gravy]] into the base of a serving plate.\n| Now add the [[Garlic|garlic]] and [[Chive|chive]] [[Mash|mash]].\n| Assemble [[Sausages|sausages]] on top and garnish with fresh [[Chives|chives]].\n}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Breakfast recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Debbie&andrew's sausage recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n[[Category:Paleolithic diet recipes]]\n{{Template:DebbieAndAndrew attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#cauliflower #mash #chives #garlic #gravy #oliveoil #balsamicvinegar #fry #diced #beefstockcube #sausages </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Sausage and apple pie with pumpkin-seed scattered pastry",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Sausage and apple pie with pumpkin-seed scattered pastry recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#apples #doublecream #cider #pastry #pumpkinseeds #egg #butter #leeks #oliveoil #recipesfromothersites #wholegrainmustard \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This recipe was specially put together for this years Kent County Show by Debbie&andrews sausages\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 6847\n|PortionCalories = 1141\n|DatePublished=16th October 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 6\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  1 hour, 45 minutes\n|PrepTime =  45 minutes\n|CookTime =  1 hour\n|Image = [[Image:Sausage and apple pie with pumpkin scattered pastry recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Posh Pies \ud83d\ude1d</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Love the idea of crunchy pumpkin seeds on a pie.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis recipe was specially put together for this year's Kent County Show by [[Debbie&andrew's sausages|debbie&andrew's sausages]].\n[[Image:Perfect-pork.png|300px|thumb|right|[[Debbie and Andrew's Perfect Pork sausages]]]]\n\nQuality [[Pork sausages|pork sausages]], [[Apples|apples]] and [[Cider|cider]] - a perfect combination.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 2 packs debbie&andrew's [[Perfect Pork sausages|perfect pork sausages]], chopped into chunks\n| 1 tablespoon [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Butter|butter]]\n| 2 [[Leeks|leeks]], washed and sliced\n| 2 green [[Apples|apples]] (Granny Smith or Bramley), cored and [[Diced|diced]] 250ml [[Apple cider|apple cider]]\n| 2 tablespoons [[Plain flour|plain flour]]\n| 250ml [[Chicken stock|chicken stock]]\n| 100ml [[Double Cream|double cream]]\n| 2 tablespoons [[Wholegrain mustard|wholegrain mustard]]\n| 1 [[Egg|egg]] - beaten\n| 2 sheets of [[Puff pastry|puff pastry]]\n| 2 tablespoons [[Pumpkin seeds|pumpkin seeds]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6), [fan oven 180\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| In a large heavy based [[Saucepan|saucepan]] over a medium-high heat, [[Fry|fry]] off the [[Leeks|leeks]], [[Sausages|sausages]] and [[Apples|apples]] in the [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and [[Butter|butter]] for about 10 minutes until golden [[Brown|brown]]. Stir in the [[Flour|flour]] and cook out for a further 2 minutes.\n| Add the [[Cider|cider]] and reduce down to half. Add the [[Stock|stock]], [[Mustard|mustard]] and [[Double Cream|double cream]] and reduce until lovely and thick. Cool.\n| Divide your filling between 6 small pie dishes\n| On a floured bench top, cut out 6 pieces of [[Pastry|pastry]] just larger than the small pie dishes/cups. Lay over the top of the pie dishes, using a fork tightly press the edges.\n| [[Brush]] the [[Pastry|pastry]] with the beaten [[Egg|egg]] and sprinkle with [[Pumpkin seeds|pumpkin seeds]].\n| [[Bake]] for 20-25 minutes until lovely and golden.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe hot!\n===See also===\n* [[Debbie and Andrew's Perfect Pork sausages|Debbie and Andrew's Perfect Pork sausages: ''more info'']]\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Cooking with beer]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Pies tarts and flans]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n[[Category:Debbie&andrew's sausage recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n{{Template:DebbieAndAndrew attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#apples #doublecream #cider #pastry #pumpkinseeds #egg #butter #leeks #oliveoil #recipesfromothersites #wholegrainmustard </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Sausage and Apple Slaw Muffin",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Celiac friendly sausage and apple slaw muffin recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#muffins #glutenfree #mangochutney #dairy #muffin #sausageandappleslawmuffin #currypowder #frying #mayonnaise #cabbage #sausage \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A gluten free street food inspired burger with a difference, the crunchy apple in the slaw is brilliant\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 910\n|PortionCalories = 227\n|DatePublished=22nd October 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  40 minutes\n|PrepTime =  25 minutes\n|CookTime =  15 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Sausage and Apple Slaw Muffin recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Mac Muffin with a difference</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.6</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">A nice fresh difference, and unlike MacDonald's; no litter \ud83d\ude1c.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis [[Sausage|sausage]] [[Sandwich|sandwich]] recipe is reproduced courtesy of [[Debbie&andrew's sausages|debbie&andrew's sausages]].\n[[Image:Perfect-pork.png|300px|thumb|right|[[Debbie and Andrew's Perfect Pork sausages]]]]\n\nWorking and living in East London inspires Andy Bates to create a new recipe: Sausage Muffin with Mango Chutney and Curried Apple Slaw. A street food inspired burger with a difference, the crunchy apple in the slaw is brilliant with the flavour of Perfect Pork Sausages. This recipe can be made [[Gluten free]] by using [[Udi's Gluten Free Products|Udi's GF White Rolls]].\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 6 debbie&andrew's [[Perfect Pork sausages|perfect pork sausages]] \n| 4 large [[English muffins]] (use [[Gluten free|gluten free]] option if preferred, [[Udi's Gluten Free Products|Udi's GF White Rolls]])\n| 4 tablespoons [[Mango chutney|mango chutney]]\n| For the slaw:\n| &#188; head of white [[Cabbage|cabbage]], sliced super thin\n| 1 granny smith [[Apple|apple]], cored and [[Julienned|julienned]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Cider vinegar|cider vinegar]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Mayonnaise|mayonnaise]] (use [[Dairy]] Free option if preferred)\n| 2 tablespoons [[Soured cream|soured cream]] (use [[Dairy]] Free option if preferred)\n| &#189; teaspoon [[Curry powder|curry powder]]\n| [[Salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]\n| [[Oil]] for [[Frying|frying]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Remove [[Sausage meat|sausage meat]] from skins.\n| Shape into 4 flat equal [[Burger|burger]] patties, cover with [[Cling Film|cling film]] and chill until needed.\n| Mix the slaw ingredients. Cover until needed.\n| Heat a [[Frying pan|frying pan]] with a dash of [[Oil|oil]] and add the patties, cooking for two to three minutes each side, and cook through in a hot [[Oven|oven]] for 5 minutes. [[Rest]] on a plate for 5 minutes.\n| Pull apart the [[Muffins|muffins]] with a fork instead of cutting with a knife and toast to your liking.\n| To assemble, on one half of a [[Muffin|muffin]], spoon on a tablespoon of [[Mango chutney|mango chutney]], add a patty, then a heaped tablespoon of the slaw and top with the remaining muffin half. Repeat with remaining [[Muffins|muffins]].\n}}\n===Chef's notes===\nSeparating the [[Muffins|muffins]]: Use a fork instead of a knife (this keeps the inside fluffy) to separate the [[Muffin|muffin]]. No muffins? A bun would work as well.\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:North American recipes]]\n[[Category:Breakfast recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Gluten free recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Salad recipes]]\n[[Category:Debbie&andrew's sausage recipes]]\n[[Category:Grilled, griddled or barbecued]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n{{Template:DebbieAndAndrew attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#muffins #glutenfree #mangochutney #dairy #muffin #sausageandappleslawmuffin #currypowder #frying #mayonnaise #cabbage #sausage </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }

title": "Sausage and Leek Potato Pie",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Sausage and Leek Potato Pie; a  recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#tomatoes #boil #cremefraiche #leeks #diced #sausageandleekpotatopie #simmer #butter #potatoes #sweetpotatoes #onion \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This recipe comes courtesy of Debbie&andrews sausages and has been replicated in Rugby World magazine\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2396\n|PortionCalories = 399\n|DatePublished=22nd October 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 6\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  1 hour, 20 minutes\n|PrepTime =  20 minutes\n|CookTime =  1 hour\n|Image = [[Image:Sausage and Leek Potato Pie recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">No - not for me.</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">2</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">That looks radioactive!</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis recipe comes courtesy of [[Debbie&andrews sausages|debbie&andrew's sausages]] and has been replicated in Rugby World magazine. \n[[Image:Harrogate-pork-sausages.png|300px|thumb|right|[[Debbie and Andrew's Harrogate 97% Pork Sausages|Debbie and Andrew's Harrogate 97% Gluten Free Pork Sausages]]]]\n\nAfter a [[Game|game]] of rugby, the main goal for most players is to tuck into a hearty meal. However, with the increase in food sensitivities, the challenge for many organisers is to make sure everyone on the team can eat the meal!\n\nDebbie& andrews [[Harrogate 97% Pork Sausages]] are [[Wheat|wheat]], [[Gluten|gluten]] and [[Dairy|dairy]] free, a perfect option for people with the common food intolerances.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 tablespoon [[Sunflower oil|sunflower oil]]\n| 1 pack of [[debbie&andrew's Harrogate 97% Pork Sausages]]\n| 2 [[Leeks|leeks]], peeled and chopped\n| 2 sticks [[Celery|celery]], chopped\n| 1 [[Onion|onion]], chopped\n| 2 [[Cloves garlic, crushed|cloves garlic, crushed]]\n| 2 [[Courgettes|courgettes]], chopped\n| 1 x 400g tin chopped [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]]\n| 1 [[Chicken stock|chicken stock]] cube\n| 200ml [[White wine|white wine]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Dried mixed herbs|dried mixed herbs]]\n| [[Salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]\n| 4 [[Potatoes|potatoes]], peeled and [[Diced|diced]]\n| 2 [[Sweet potatoes|sweet potatoes]], peeled and [[Diced|diced]]\n| 2 tablespoons [[Milk|milk]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Butter|butter]]\n| 3 tablespoons [[Creme fraiche|creme fraiche]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 190\u00b0 C (375\u00b0 F - gas 5), [fan oven 170\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Heat the [[Oil|oil]] in a large [[Frying pan|frying pan]]. Add the [[Sausages|sausages]] to the pan and [[Fry|fry]] over a gentle heat for 10 minutes until [[Browned|browned]].\n| Now add the [[Leeks|leeks]], [[Celery|celery]], [[Onion|onion]], [[Garlic|garlic]] and [[Courgettes|courgettes]] to the pan and cook for 5 minutes more.\n| Add the chopped [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]], [[Crumble|crumble]] in the [[Stock cube|stock cube]], then add the [[Wine|wine]] and [[Herbs|herbs]] and season well with [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]. Bring to the [[Boil|boil]], then reduce the heat and [[Simmer|simmer]] for 20 minutes.\n| Meanwhile, place the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] and [[Sweet potatoes|sweet potatoes]] in a pan of cold [[Salted|salted]] water and bring to the boil over a high heat. [[Boil]] for 15 minutes, then drain, and add the [[Milk|milk]] and [[Butter|butter]].\n| Add the [[Creme fraiche|creme fraiche]] to the [[Frying pan|frying pan]] and stir in gently. [[Simmer]] for 5 minutes then transfer to a [[Casserole|casserole]] or [[Pie dish|pie dish]].\n| Top with the [[Mashed potato|mashed potato]] mixture and level evenly. Cook in the preheated [[Oven|oven]] for half an hour and serve with [[Baked beans|baked beans]] - delicious\n}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Australian recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Gluten free recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Debbie&andrew's sausage recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n{{Template:DebbieAndAndrew attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#tomatoes #boil #cremefraiche #leeks #diced #sausageandleekpotatopie #simmer #butter #potatoes #sweetpotatoes #onion </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Sausage and Onion Gluten Free Baguette",
                "revisions": [
                    {

                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Sausage and Onion Gluten Free Baguette recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#butter #glutenfree #onions #sausages #ketchup #mustard #bread #sausageandonionglutenfreebaguette #onion #recipesfromothersites #baguette \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A nice and simple barbecue Hot-hot-dog recipe made with gluten free sausages from debbie&andrews sausages\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 188\n|PortionCalories = 31\n|DatePublished=25th October 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 6\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  25 minutes\n|PrepTime =  5 minutes\n|CookTime =  20 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Sausage and Onion Gluten Free Baguette check the packaging.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nA nice and simple [[Barbecue|barbecue]] [[Hot-dog|hot-dog]] recipe made with [[Gluten free|gluten free]] [[Sausages|sausages]] from [[Debbie&andrews sausages|debbie&andrews sausages]] so is also suitable for coeliacs.\n[[Image:Harrogate-pork-sausages.png|300px|thumb|right|[[Debbie and Andrew's Harrogate 97% Gluten Free Pork Sausages]]]]\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 thin [[French baguette|french baguette]], cut into 6 pieces, or [[Gluten free|gluten free]] rolls of your choice such as Udi's GF White Rolls\n| 2 [[Onions|onions]], peeled and sliced\n| 1 tablespoon [[Butter|butter]], plus more to spread\n| 1 pack [[Debbie and Andrew's Harrogate 97% Gluten Free Pork Sausages]]\n| [[Ketchup]] and [[Mustard|mustard]] to serve\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Melt the [[Butter|butter]] in a small [[Frying pan|frying pan]] and cook the [[Onion|onion]] until beyond golden and almost [[Brown|brown]].\n| Remove from the pan and put to one side.\n| On a pre-heated [[BBQ]], cook [[Sausages|sausages]], turning regularly for 10-12 minutes until cooked through and [[Browned|browned]] evenly.\n| Meanwhile, slice each piece of [[Baguette|baguette]] in half (but not all the way through) and [[Butter|butter]] generously, or butter your [[Gluten free|gluten free]] [[Bread|bread]] choice.\n| Fill each piece of [[Bread|bread]] with a [[Sausage|sausage]] and a few buttery [[Onions|onions]].\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Ketchup|ketchup]] and [[Mustard|mustard]].\n===See also===\n[[Udi's Gluten Free Products]]\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:North American recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Gluten free recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Barbecue recipes]]\n[[Category:Debbie&andrew's sausage recipes]]\n[[Category:Grilled, griddled or barbecued]]\n{{Template:DebbieAndAndrew attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer title": "Sausage and Potato Gratin (GF)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Sausage and Potato Gratin (Gluten free)  recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#doublecream #potatoes #sausages #roastingdish #sausageandpotatogratingf #bake #onion #fry #sausage #miseenplace #recipesfromothersites \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A quick and easy sausage supper that is also gluten free.\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2526\n|PortionCalories = 421\n|DatePublished=23rd October 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 6\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  1 hour\n|PrepTime =  20 minutes\n|CookTime =  40 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Sausage and Potato Gratin GF recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Simple recipe</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Just as it should be</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:NonLoggedInUser|NonLoggedInUser]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Perfect-pork.png|300px|thumb|right|[[Debbie and Andrew's Perfect Pork sausages]]]]\nA quick and easy [[Sausage|sausage]] supper that is also [[Gluten free|gluten free]].\n\nThis recipe comes to Cookipedia courtesy of [[debbie&andrew's sausages]].\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 pack of [[Debbie and Andrew's Perfect Pork sausages]], thinly sliced if you wish\n| 6 large [[Potatoes|potatoes]] very thinly sliced\n| 1 [[Onion|onion]] thinly sliced \n| 200ml [[Double Cream|double cream]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4), [fan oven 160\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| In a large non stick [[Fry|fry]] pan over a high heat, fry off the [[Sausages|sausages]] until golden [[Brown|brown]]\n| In a small deep [[Roasting dish|roasting dish]], layer the [[Potatoes|potatoes]], [[Onions|onions]], [[Sausages|sausages]] and [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]], layer by layer.\n| Evenly pour over the [[Double Cream|double cream]] and [[Bake|bake]] for 40 minutes until golden and crispy.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nCut into slices and serve hot.\n===Chef's notes===\nTop tip: For extra flavour, try rubbing the [[Roasting dish|roasting dish]] with broken down [[Garlic|garlic]] [[Cloves|cloves]]!\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:French recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Gluten free recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Debbie&andrew's sausage recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n{{Template:DebbieAndAndrew attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#doublecream #potatoes #sausages #roastingdish #sausageandpotatogratingf #bake #onion #fry #sausage #miseenplace #recipesfromothersites </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }

title": "Sausage and potato skillet",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Sausage and potato skillet recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#potatoes #sausages #sausageandpotatoskillet #oliveoil #springonions #leeks #parboiled #redpepper #grill #fry #cheese \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This warming winter sausage recipe can be cooked indoors or outdoor on the barbecue - a great meal for bonfire night\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2455\n|PortionCalories = 613\n|DatePublished=14th October 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  35 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime =  25 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Sausage and potato skillet recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Nice and easy</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Want an easy meal?<br />This be it!</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis warming winter recipe comes courtesy of [[debbieandandrew's sausages]].  It can be cooked indoors or outdoors on the [[Barbecue|barbecue]] - a great meal for bonfire night.\n\nIt's an ideal Autumn recipe as it uses seasonal [[Vegetables|vegetables]] that are easily available from supermarkets or your garden if you are lucky enough to be growing them.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 pack [[debbie&andrew's sausages]]\n| 6 cooked [[Potatoes|potatoes]], chunked and [[Par boiled|par boiled]]\n| &#188; [[Butternut squash|butternut squash]], cubed and [[Par boiled|par boiled]]\n| 2 [[Leeks|leeks]], washed and thinly sliced\n| &#189; [[Red pepper|red pepper]]\n| 100g [[Cheddar cheese]], [[Grated|grated]] \n| 2 [[Spring onions|spring onions]], chopped\n| [[Olive oil]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| If cooking indoors turn on [[Grill|grill]] to full, if outdoors bring coals to white hot heat then:\n| Heat [[Olive oil|olive oil]] in a large heavy based [[Saucepan|saucepan]] \n| [[Fry]] debbie&andrew\u0092s [[Sausages|sausages]] until golden [[Brown|brown]], at least 20 minutes then remove from pan\n| [[Fry]] off [[Leeks|leeks]], [[Potatoes|potatoes]], butternut, [[Red pepper|red pepper]] till soft and golden\n| Add [[Sausages|sausages]] back to mix\n| Sprinkle top with [[Cheese|cheese]] and [[Spring onions|spring onions]]\n| If cooking indoors, complete by placing the whole pan under [[Grill|grill]] until [[Cheese|cheese]] is melted and golden, about 5 minutes. \n| Serve hot.\n}}\n{{Template:DebbieAndAndrewsSeeAlso}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Squash recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Barbecue recipes]]\n[[Category:Grilled, griddled or barbecued]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n[[Category:Debbie&andrew's sausage recipes]]\n{{DebbieAndAndrew attribution}}\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#potatoes #sausages #sausageandpotatoskillet #oliveoil #springonions #leeks #parboiled #redpepper #grill #fry #cheese </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Sausage and potato skillet (GF)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Sausage and potato skillet - Gluten Free recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#sausages #cheese #oliveoil #potatoes #parboiled #springonions #leeks #redpepper #fry #grill #saucepan \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This warming winter gluten free sausage recipe can be cooked indoors or outdoor on the barbecue - a great meal for bonfire night\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2455\n|PortionCalories = 613\n|DatePublished=14th October 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  35 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime =  25 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Sausage and potato skillet gluten free recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">No glutens</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Always good to know</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Sue_spins|Susie]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis warming winter [[gluten free]] recipe comes courtesy of debbieandandrew's [[Sausages|sausages]].  It can be cooked indoors or outdoors on the [[Barbecue|barbecue]] - a great meal for bonfire night.\n\nIt's an ideal Autumn recipe as it uses seasonal [[Vegetables|vegetables]] that are easily available from supermarkets or your garden if you are lucky enough to be growing them.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 pack [[debbie&andrew's sausages|debbie&andrew's gluten free sausages]]\n| 6 cooked [[Potatoes|potatoes]], chunked and [[Par boiled|par boiled]]\n| &#188; [[Butternut squash|butternut squash]], cubed and [[Par boiled|par boiled]]\n| 2 [[Leeks|leeks]], washed and thinly sliced\n| &#189; [[Red pepper|red pepper]]\n| 100g lactose free [[cheese]], [[Grated|grated]] \n| 2 [[Spring onions|spring onions]], chopped\n| [[Olive oil]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| If cooking indoors turn on [[Grill|grill]] to full, if outdoors bring coals to white hot heat then:\n| Heat [[Olive oil|olive oil]] in a large heavy based [[Saucepan|saucepan]] \n| [[Fry]] debbie&andrew's [[Sausages|sausages]] until golden [[Brown|brown]], at least 20 minutes then remove from pan\n| [[Fry]] off [[Leeks|leeks]], [[Potatoes|potatoes]], butternut, [[Red pepper|red pepper]] till soft and golden\n| Add [[Sausages|sausages]] back to mix\n| Sprinkle top with [[Cheese|cheese]] and [[Spring onions|spring onions]]\n| If cooking indoors, complete by placing the whole pan under [[Grill|grill]] until [[Cheese|cheese]] is melted and golden, about 5 minutes. \n| Serve hot.\n}}\n{{Template:DebbieAndAndrewsSeeAlsoGF}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Gluten free recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Squash recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Barbecue recipes]]\n[[Category:Grilled, griddled or barbecued]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n[[Category:Debbie&andrew's sausage recipes]]\n{{DebbieAndAndrew attribution}}\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#sausages #cheese #oliveoil #potatoes #parboiled #springonions #leeks #redpepper #fry #grill #saucepan </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Sausage Boulangere (GF)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Sausage Boulangere (Gluten Free)  recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#garlic #butter #onions #potatoes #bake #sausages #chickenstock #glutenfree #oliveoil #miseenplace #stock \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A great one pot meal with sausages, thinly sliced potatoes, onions and garlic. This recipe uses gluten free products\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2021\n|PortionCalories = 336\n|DatePublished=25th October 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 6\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  1 hour, 45 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  1 hour, 30 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Sausage Boulangere GF recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Nice one pot meal!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Might have this tonight?</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Harrogate-pork-sausages.png|300px|thumb|right|[[Debbie and Andrew's Harrogate 97% Gluten Free Pork Sausages]]]]\nA great one pot meal with [[Sausages|sausages]], thinly sliced [[Potatoes|potatoes]], [[Onions|onions]] and [[Garlic|garlic]].\n\nAs this recipe uses [[Gluten free|gluten free]] products it is suitable for coeliacs.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 pack [[Debbie and Andrew's Harrogate 97% Gluten Free Pork Sausages]]\n| A large knob of [[Butter|butter]]\n| A drizzle of [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 2 [[Onions|onions]], peeled and thinly sliced\n| 2 [[Cloves|cloves]] [[Garlic|garlic]], thinly sliced\n| 1.5kg [[Potatoes|potatoes]], peeled\n| 1 [[Litres|litre]] of hot [[Chicken stock|chicken stock]] ([[Gluten free|gluten free]])\n| [[Salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4), [fan oven 160\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Slice the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] as thinly as you can with a [[Mandolin|mandolin]], if you have one.\n| Grease a shallow [[Baking|baking]] dish with a little of the [[Butter|butter]].\n| Part-[[Bake|bake]] your [[Sausages|sausages]] in a lightly oiled [[Baking tray|baking tray]] in the preheated [[Oven|oven]] for 15 minutes, shaking the pan once or twice during that time.\n| Remove and put to one side.\n| When cool enough to handle, slice the sausages in half lengthways.\n| Melt the remaining [[Butter|butter]] along with a little [[Olive oil|olive oil]] in a [[Frying pan|frying pan]].\n| Add the [[Onions|onions]] and [[Garlic|garlic]] and [[Sweat|sweat]] gently for 10 minutes.\n| Now layer the [[Potato|potato]] slices, [[Sausage|sausage]] pieces and the [[Onion|onion]] mix in the greased dish, seasoning as you go.\n| Pour the [[Chicken stock|chicken stock]] over the whole dish so that the contents are only just covered. Don't use all the [[Stock|stock]] if you don't need to.\n| Now cover the dish with [[Foil|foil]] and [[Bake|bake]] in the preheated [[Oven|oven]] for 30 minutes.\n| Remove the foil and cook for another 30 minutes.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe this one pot meal immediately.\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:French recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Gluten free recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Stews and casseroles]]\n[[Category:Debbie&andrew's sausage recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Stewed, braised or pot roasted]]\n{{Template:DebbieAndAndrew attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#garlic #butter #onions #potatoes #bake #sausages #chickenstock #glutenfree #oliveoil #miseenplace #stock </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Sausage Bruschetta with Sweetcorn Salad",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Sausage Bruschetta with a sweetcorn salad recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#diced #oliveoil #sweetcorn #coriander #sausage #glutenfree #cheddar #baguette #cumin #grill #honey \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This posh Gluten free sausage sandwich recipe is reproduced courtesy of Debbie&andrews debbie&andrews sausages\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2377\n|PortionCalories = 594\n|DatePublished=22nd October 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  30 minutes\n|PrepTime =  20 minutes\n|CookTime =  10 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Sausage Bruschetta with Sweetcorn Salad recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">What a picture!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">3.9</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Someone's taken a lot of trouble for a recipe picture!!!</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis posh [[Gluten free]] [[Sausage|sausage]] [[Sandwich|sandwich]] recipe is reproduced courtesy of [[Debbie&andrew's sausages|debbie&andrew's sausages]].\n[[Image:Harrogate-pork-sausages.png|300px|thumb|right|[[Debbie and Andrew's Harrogate 97% Gluten Free Pork Sausages]]]]\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 pack of debbie&andrew\u0092s [[Harrogate 97% Pork Sausages]]\n| 1 [[Baguette|baguette]] sliced thickly (or a [[Gluten free|gluten free]] option)\n| 200g [[Cheddar|cheddar]] [[Grated|grated]] \n| 1 red mild [[Chilli|chilli]], [[Diced|diced]]\n| 1 can of [[Black beans|black beans]], drained and rinsed\n| 1 can of [[Sweetcorn|sweetcorn]], drained and rinsed\n| 1 [[Tomato|tomato]] deseeded and [[Diced|diced]]\n| 1 [[Yellow bell pepper|yellow bell pepper]], [[Diced|diced]] \n| A bunch of chopped [[Coriander|coriander]] \n| 1 jalape\u00f1o, seeded and [[Minced|minced]] \n| [[Olive oil]] \n| 1 [[Lime|lime]], [[Juice|juice]] and [[Zest|zest]] \n| Drizzle [[Honey|honey]] \n| &#189; teaspoon [[Cumin|cumin]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Turn on [[Grill|grill]] to high and line a flat [[Baking tray|baking tray]] with [[Foil|foil]].\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| In a medium bowl combine [[Beans|beans]], [[Sweetcorn|sweetcorn]], [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]], [[Bell Pepper|bell pepper]] and [[Onion|onion]].\n| In another bowl, whisk together [[Olive oil|olive oil]], [[Lime zest|lime zest]] and [[Juice|juice]], [[Honey|honey]], [[Cumin|cumin]] and jalape\u00f1o.\n| Mix the dressing into the [[Sweetcorn|sweetcorn]] mixture and set aside to [[Marinate|marinate]].\n| Slice the debbie&andrew's [[Harrogate 97% Pork Sausages]] into thick chunks and [[Fry|fry]] in a non stick fry pan in a little [[Olive oil|olive oil]] over a high heat until cooked.\n| Place your [[Baguette|baguette]] slices cut side down and sprinkle tops with [[Cheddar|cheddar]] and [[Chilli|chilli]].\n| [[Grill]] until lovely and golden. Once out of the [[Oven|oven]], top with [[Sausage meat|sausage meat]] and [[Coriander|coriander]].\n| Garnish [[Salad|salad]] with [[Coriander|coriander]] and serve alongside [[Sausage|sausage]] [[Bruschetta|bruschetta]].\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Italian recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Chilli pepper recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Debbie&andrew's sausage recipes]]\n[[Category:Grilled, griddled or barbecued]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n{{Template:DebbieAndAndrew attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#diced #oliveoil #sweetcorn #coriander #sausage #glutenfree #cheddar #baguette #cumin #grill #honey </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Sausage meatball pizza",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Sausage meatball pizza recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#pizza #meatballs #oliveoil #sausages #pizzadough #pizzastone #pizzas #cheese #mozzarellacheese #sausagemeatballpizza #panfried \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Pizza topped with Italian meatballs. Just 3 sausages make 18 meatballs - more than enough for two pizzas! \n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=11th February 2017\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  1 hour, 42 minutes\n|PrepTime =  1 hour, 30 minutes\n|CookTime =  12 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 2380\n|PortionCalories = 1190\n|Image = [[Image:Sausage meatball pizza recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Glorious!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Looks and tastes divine. Fabulous pizza topping.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nYet another [[Pizza|pizza]] recipe!\n[[Image:Meatballs from sausages recipe.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Cooking the meatballs]]\n\nWe got some lovely [[Italian]]-style [[Sausages|sausages]] from [[Gourmet sausage maker - Bexley]] ([[Hall Place Farmers' Market, Bexley, Kent]]), but this time, instead of using them as sausages we would extract the [[Sausagemeat|sausagemeat]] from the sausages and make [[Meatballs|meatballs]] from them to top the [[Pizza|pizza]].\n\nWe managed to get 35 [[Meatballs|meatballs]] from 6 [[Sausages|sausages]]! The 'recipe' is here: [[Meatballs from sausages]]\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| Pinch of [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n| 2 tablespoons of [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 1 small [[Onion|onion]], very finely chopped\n| Cooked [[Meatballs|meatballs]] from 3 meaty [[Sausages|sausages]]\n| 1 portion of [[Pizza dough]] (makes 2 [[Pizzas|pizzas]])\n| About 6 tablespoons of [[Tomato sauce for pizza]] or [[Passata|passata]]\n| 2 balls [[Mozzarella cheese|mozzarella cheese]] torn into small pieces(about 250g in total)\n| Fresh [[Basil leaves|basil leaves]], chopped finely\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| Half of a Polish pickled red pepper, chopped, ''optional''\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Dust your work surface with [[Fine yellow cornmeal|fine yellow cornmeal]]\n| Divide the [[Pizza dough|pizza dough]] into two and roll out into two thin 25.5 cm (10 inch) [[Pizzas|pizzas]]\n| You can leave them in a [[Warm place|warm place]] for an hour or so to rise. I quite like them cooked immediately they are rolled out for a more crispy finish.\n| Prick the [[Pizza|pizza]] all over with a fork. This prevents it puffing up too much and burning while it is cooking\n| With a deft move, slide the [[Pizza|pizza]] from the [[Pizza peel|pizza peel]], on to the preheated [[Pizza stone|pizza stone]].\n| Cook on one side only for about 2 minutes or until lightly [[Browned|browned]].\n| Remove from the [[Oven|oven]] and distribute a ball of torn [[Mozzarella cheese|mozzarella cheese]] over the  [[Pizza|pizza]].\n| Spread the [[Tomato sauce|tomato sauce]] over the top of the [[Cheese|cheese]] -  this helps to keep the [[Pizza|pizza]] base dry and crispy.\n| Crumble the [[Meatballs|meatballs]] and arrange over the topping and drizzle with [[Olive oil|olive oil]] - preferably the [[Oil|oil]] the meatballs were cooked in.\n| Return to the [[Oven|oven]] and [[Bake|bake]] until the [[Cheese|cheese]] is nicely melted. This should take about 4 minutes under a [[Grill|grill]] on a [[Pizza stone|pizza stone]], if oven [[Baking|baking]], about 15 minutes in the middle of the oven.\n| Repeat for the second [[Pizza|pizza]].\n| Keep the first [[Pizza|pizza]] warm at the bottom of the [[Oven|oven]] whilst you make the second.\n}}\n===Chef's notes===\nUse a little extra [[Olive oil|olive oil]] when cooking the [[Sausage|sausage]] [[Meatballs|meatballs]] and use this flavored [[Oil|oil]] to top the [[Pizza|pizza]] before it is [[Baked|baked]].\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Italian recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Pizza recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#pizza #meatballs #oliveoil #sausages #pizzadough #pizzastone #pizzas #cheese #mozzarellacheese #sausagemeatballpizza #panfried </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Sausage pot (slow cooker recipe)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Sausage pot, a British slow cooker recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#leeks #carrots #sausages #blackpepper #bread #onion #beefstock #wok #stock #slowcooked #boil \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A simple easy to cook sausage stew that goes well with crusty bread. Specially adapted for use in a slow-cooker (crockpot)\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1684\n|PortionCalories = 421\n|DatePublished=8th July 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment =\n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  6 hours, 15 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  6 hours\n|Image = [[Image:Sausage pot slow cooker recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Tasty</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Love the taste of the Branston in this</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:NonLoggedInUser|NonLoggedInUser]] </span></span>\n}}\nA simple easy to cook [[Sausage|sausage]] [[Stew|stew]] that goes well with crusty [[Bread|bread]] which means that no more cooking is needed. It's ready to eat the moment you get home.\n\nThis freezes well for [[Microwave|microwave]] reheating.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 400 g (1 pack) of your favourite [[Sausages|sausages]]\n| Good grind of fresh [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n| 2 tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 1 large [[Onion|onion]], peeled and sliced\n| 2 [[Cloves of Garlic, peeled and crushed|cloves of garlic, peeled and crushed]] (or to taste)\n| 2 medium [[Carrots|carrots]], peeled and thinly sliced into 'coins'\n| 1 large [[Leeks|leek]], washed and sliced into 'coins'\n| 2 tablespoons [[Plain flour|plain flour]]\n| 400 ml [[Beef Stock|beef stock]] made with 1 [[Beef|beef]] [[Oxo cube]]\n| 3 tablespoons [[Branston pickle|Branston pickle]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Worcestershire sauce]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Heat the [[Oil|oil]] in a [[Frying pan|frying pan]] or a [[Wok|wok]] and add the [[Black pepper|black pepper]].  Once it is sizzling, carefully add the [[Sausages|sausages]] and [[Brown|brown]] for a few minutes until nicely coloured.\n| Add the [[Onions|onions]], [[Carrots|carrots]] and [[Leeks|leeks]] and saut\u00e9 for 5 minutes until softened but not coloured.\n| Shake the [[Flour|flour]] into the pan and mix until the [[Oil|oil]] is absorbed.\n| Mix in the [[Stock|stock]], bring to the [[Boil|boil]], stirring all the while.\n| once it has thickened, remove from the heat, stir in the remaining items and taste and adjust seasoning if needed.\n| Carefully pour the mixture into the slow-[[Cooker|cooker]] [[Crock pot|crock pot]] and cook for 5 to 8 hours.  Medium setting should be fine for most [[Slow cookers|slow cookers]].\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with crusty [[Bread|bread]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Slow cooker recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n[[Category:Slow cooked]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#leeks #carrots #sausages #blackpepper #bread #onion #beefstock #wok #stock #slowcooked #boil </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Sausage Sandwich Melt",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Sausage Sandwich Melt with pea pesto - Club sandwich recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#cheese #dairy #avocado #pesto #sandwich #pea #bread #caramelised #sausages #mayonnaise #sausagesandwichmelt \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=The special sausage sandwich recipe is reproduced courtesy of Debbie&andrews sausages\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2136\n|PortionCalories = 534\n|DatePublished=22nd October 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  55 minutes\n|PrepTime =  30 minutes\n|CookTime =  25 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Sausage Sandwich Melt recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Use a Breville!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Mine was Top Job, but I did it in a Breville Sandwich Maker.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nThe special [[Sausage|sausage]] [[Sandwich|sandwich]] recipe is reproduced courtesy of [[Debbie&andrew's sausages|debbie&andrew's sausages]].\n[[Image:Caramelised-red-onion-sausages.png|300px|thumb|right|[[Debbie & Andrew's Caramelised Red Onion Pork Sausages]]]]\nGolden and crisp on the outside, with chunky [[Pea|pea]] [[Pesto|pesto]], creamy [[Avocado|avocado]] and sweet [[Caramelised]] [[Red onion|red onion]] [[Pork sausages|pork sausages]] which are simply mouth watering with the melted [[Cheese|cheese]]. We can't think of a better hangover alternative to the [[Bacon|bacon]] butty, and yes, the Club Sandwich is rewritten!\n\n====for the sandwiches====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 4 [[Debbie & Andrew's Caramelised Red Onion Pork Sausages]]\n| 1 [[Avocado|avocado]]\n| 4 x 25g slices of [[Gouda cheese]] (any mild [[Cheese|cheese]] will work) (use a [[Dairy]] Free alternative if preferred)\n| 2 tablespoons [[Mayonnaise|mayonnaise]] (use a [[Dairy]] Free alternative if preferred)\n| 4 slices of [[Sourdough bread|sourdough bread]] (use [[Gluten free|gluten free]] if preferred)\n| 50g [[Butter|butter]] (use a [[Dairy]] Free alternative if preferred)\n}}\n====for the pea pesto:====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 100g fresh [[Frozen peas|frozen peas]], [[Boiled|boiled]] or [[Steamed|steamed]]\n| 1 [[Garlic clove, crushed|garlic clove, crushed]]\n| 30g [[Pine Nuts|pine nuts]], [[Toasted|toasted]]\n| 30g fresh [[Parmesan cheese|parmesan cheese]], chopped into small chunks (use a [[Dairy]] Free alternative if preferred)\n| Handful fresh [[Mint|mint]] & [[Basil leaves|basil leaves]] - around 10g of each\n| 3 tablespoons extra-virgin [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| [[Bake]] the [[Sausages|sausages]] for 10 minutes or until done to your liking. [[Rest for]] 10 minutes then slice in half lengthways.\n| Add [[Pesto|pesto]] ingredients to a [[Food processor|food processor]] and combine. Season to taste. Any left over pesto can be covered tightly and [[Frozen|frozen]].\n| Slice the [[Avocado|avocado]] in half, remove the [[Seed|seed]], [[Scoop|scoop]] out the flesh and slice into thin strips.\n| Take a slice of [[Bread|bread]], spread with a heaped tablespoon of [[Pea|pea]] [[Pesto|pesto]], add 4 [[Sausage|sausage]] halves, then one half of the [[Avocado|avocado]] slices and 2 slices of [[Cheese|cheese]] and season with [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]. Spread a tablespoon of [[Mayonnaise|mayonnaise]] over the remaining slice of bread and place the mayonnaise side down on top of the cheese. Push together slightly to form the [[Sandwich|sandwich]].\n| [[Butter]] the [[Sandwich|sandwich]] on the outside and toast in a [[Frying pan|frying pan]] for 3-4 minutes on both sides.\n| Place the pan into an [[Oven|oven]] for 5 minutes to melt the [[Cheese|cheese]].\n| Place on [[Kitchen paper|kitchen paper]] to absorb any [[Oil|oil]], slice in half and serve.\n}}\n===Chef's notes===\n[[Pea]] [[Pesto|pesto]] works amazingly well with [[Sausages|sausages]], and could even be stirred through [[Mashed potato|mashed potato]] to liven up [[Bangers and mash|bangers and mash]]. Buttering the outside of the [[Bread|bread]] helps create a golden crust. If you don't have [[Gouda|gouda]] - any mild [[Cheese|cheese]] will work!\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Breakfast recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Gluten free recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Debbie&andrew's sausage recipes]]\n{{Template:DebbieAndAndrew attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#cheese #dairy #avocado #pesto #sandwich #pea #bread #caramelised #sausages #mayonnaise #sausagesandwichmelt </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Sausage Stuffed Aubergines (GF)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Sausage Stuffed Aubergines (Gluten free)  recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#aubergine #oliveoil #parmesancheese #glutenfree #sausagemeat #parsley #garlic #breadcrumbs #scoop #salad #brush \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A great way of using aubergines when they are in season. This recipe fills the aubergines with a sausage meat stuffing\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 996\n|PortionCalories = 249\n|DatePublished=25th October 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  1 hour, 10 minutes\n|PrepTime =  30 minutes\n|CookTime =  40 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Sausage Stuffed Aubergines GF recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Not for me</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">2</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Even with a sausage in them, aubergines are fisgusting!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:NonLoggedInUser|NonLoggedInUser]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Harrogate-pork-sausages.png|300px|thumb|right|[[Debbie and Andrew's Harrogate 97% Gluten Free Pork Sausages]]]]\nA great way of using [[Aubergines|aubergines]] when they are in season.  This recipe fills the aubergines with a [[Sausagemeat|sausagemeat]] [[Stuffing|stuffing]].\n\nIt is also suitable for coeliacs as it uses [[Gluten free|gluten free]] ingredients.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 [[Aubergine|aubergine]], halved lengthways\n| [[Salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]\n| 125ml [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 1 pack [[Debbie and Andrew's Harrogate 97% Gluten Free Pork Sausages]]\n| 2 cloves of [[garlic]], peeled and crushed\n| 2 tablespoons of chopped fresh [[Parsley|parsley]]\n| 125ml [[White wine|white wine]]\n| 240g fresh [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]] (make with [[Gluten free|gluten free]] [[Bread|bread]], if required)\n| 50g [[Grated|grated]] [[Parmesan cheese|parmesan cheese]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4), [fan oven 160\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Remove all the [[Sausages|sausages]] from their skins. Put to one side in a large bowl.\n| [[Scoop]] out the flesh of the [[Aubergine|aubergine]], then chop it and place it in a [[Sieve|sieve]] over the sink. Sprinkle with a little [[Salt|salt]] and leave to drain.\n| Season the [[Aubergine|aubergine]] skins with [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]] and [[Brush|brush]] with a little [[Olive oil|olive oil]]. Set to one side.\n| Now heat 4 tablespoons of [[Olive oil|olive oil]] in a large [[Frying pan|frying pan]]. Cook the [[Sausage meat|sausage meat]] with the [[Garlic|garlic]] until [[Browned|browned]]. Break up the [[Meat|meat]] as much as you can as you cook.\n| Squeeze as much moisture as you can from the [[Aubergine|aubergine]] and add to the pan.\n| Add the [[Parsley|parsley]] and plenty of seasoning.\n| Pour in the [[Wine|wine]] and cook for 5 minutes.\n| Now remove from the heat and add the [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]] and half the [[Parmesan cheese|parmesan cheese]].\n| Stuff this mixture into the [[Aubergine|aubergine]] skins and sprinkle the tops with the remaining [[Parmesan cheese|parmesan cheese]].\n| [[Bake]] in the preheated [[Oven|oven]] for 30 minutes until tender and golden.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe immediately with a spicy [[Rocket|rocket]] or [[Watercress|watercress]] [[Salad|salad]].\n==See also==\n\n* [[Udi\u0092s Gluten Free Products]]\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:French recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Gluten free recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Cooking with wine]]\n[[Category:Debbie&andrew's sausage recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n{{Template:DebbieAndAndrew attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#aubergine #oliveoil #parmesancheese #glutenfree #sausagemeat #parsley #garlic #breadcrumbs #scoop #salad #brush </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Savoy cabbage pasta bake",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Savoy cabbage pretend pasta bake\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#cabbage #oliveoil #salami #pasta #panko #mozzarella #parsley #savoycabbage #bake #breadcrumbs #blackcurrantjam \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=For a change, I thought I would make our regular pasta bake, using salami and mozzarella, but use Savoy savoy cabbage instead of actual pasta.\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=17th October 2019\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Served with scrumptious roasties.\n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  55 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  40 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 1740\n|PortionCalories = 870\n|Image = [[Image:Savoy cabbage pasta bake recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Delish!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">What a grand idea!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nFor a change, I thought I would make our regular [[Pasta|pasta]] [[Bake|bake]], using [[Salami|salami]] and [[Mozzarella|mozzarella]], but use [[Savoy cabbage|savoy cabbage]] instead of actual [[pasta]].\nTo balance the saltiness of the salami I added a good few tablespoons of [[blackcurrant jam]].  It might seem unusual, but it worked really well and shall be made again. \n\n\nWe served it with air-[[Fried|fried]] [[Roast potatoes|roast potatoes]] to make up for the missing carbs!\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| Two thirds of a small [[Savoy cabbage|savoy cabbage]], tender leaves, finely chopped.\n| A [[Chicken stock|chicken stock]] cube\n| 6 scant teaspoons of [[blackcurrant jam]]\n| 2 125g balls of [[Mozzarella cheese|mozzarella cheese]]\n| 150g [[Salami|salami]], sliced fairly thinly and then chopped\n| A handful of [[Panko]] [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]]\n| Fresh [[Parsley|parsley]], chopped\n| [[Olive oil]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6), [fan oven 180\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| [[Blanch]] the chopped [[Cabbage|cabbage]] for 4 minutes in [[Boiling|boiling]] water to which the [[Stock cube|stock cube]] has been added.\n| While the [[Cabbage|cabbage]] is cooking, drain the mozarella, tear it into small pieces and allow it to drain over a [[Sieve|sieve]] to remove excess water.\n| Drain the [[Cabbage|cabbage]]\n| Oli the [[Baking tray|baking tray]] / dish with [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| Spread the chopped [[Cabbage|cabbage]] into the dish and sprinkle with chopped [[Parsley|parsley]] and [[Black pepper|black pepper]].\n| Layer the [[Mozzarella|mozzarella]] and [[Salami|salami]], leaving a layer of salami on the top. We like crispy salami!\n| Top with [[Panko]] [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]] and a quick [[Spray|spray]] of [[Olive oil|olive oil]].\n| [[Bake]] for about 40 minutes, checking after 25.\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:SavoyCabbagePastaBaked.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Baked and crispy\nImage:SavoyCabbagePastaReadyToBake.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Raedy for the oven\n</gallery>\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Air fried roast potatoes|air fried roast potatoes]]\n===Recipe source===\n\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Italian recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pasta recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#cabbage #oliveoil #salami #pasta #panko #mozzarella #parsley #savoycabbage #bake #breadcrumbs #blackcurrantjam </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }

title": "Scotch eggs",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Scotch eggs\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#scotcheggs #eggs #sausagemeat #sausages #scotch #sesameseeds #poppyseeds #bake #bakingtray #panko #boil \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Scotch eggs are so easy to make at home and can easily be tinkered with to add your favourite flavouring or coating\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=1st March 2018\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 8\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  1 hour\n|PrepTime =  20 minutes\n|CookTime =  40 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 3400\n|PortionCalories = 425\n|Image = [[Image:Sesame seed Scotch eggs recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">I could not stop eating these.</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">They were so good, and so much nicer than shop-bought Scotch eggs.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\n\n\n[[Scotch]] [[Eggs|eggs]] are easy to make at home and you can tinker with them to add your favourite flavouring or coating.\n\n16 [[Sausages|sausages]], 2 packs, make 8 meaty [[Scotch]] [[Eggs|eggs]].\n\nThey don't actually need to be coated with anything providing you cook them on a non-stick surface. [[Panko]] breadcrumbs work well. For this batch I used a mixture of black & white [[Poppy seeds|poppy seeds]]. [[Sesame seeds|sesame seeds]] are very good too.\n\nAfter trying many varieties of [[Sausages|sausages]] I have found the nicest tasting were Morrisons own brand sausages.  They are also economical [from 97p to \u00a31.65 for 454 grams - March 2018] Another advantage of these is that the [[Sausagemeat|sausagemeat]] is really easy to extract from the sausages because the skins are so loose on the [[Uncooked|uncooked]] sausages.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 2 packs of Morrisons own brand [[Sausages|sausages]] [454 g per pack]\n| 8 medium [[Free range eggs|free range eggs]] - ensure the [[Eggs|eggs]] are at least 4 days old or you will be unable to peel them easily.\n| Optional flavourings and coatings\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Add the [[Eggs|eggs]] to a pan of warm water and bring to the [[Boil|boil]] and boil for 5 minutes.  Remove the pan from the heat and allow to cool.\n* Peel the [[Hard-boiled eggs|hard-boiled eggs]] using a teaspoon.  Doing this under a trickle of water sometimes makes the task a little easier.\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4), [fan oven 160\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Sesame poppy seed Scotch eggs recipe.jpg|Sesame seed and poppy seed Scotch eggs, cooked\nImage:Poppy seeds and Sesame seed Scotch eggs - ready to cook.jpg|Sesame seed and poppy seed Scotch eggs, ready to cook\nImage:Morrisons own brand sausages.jpg|Morrisons ''own brand'' sausages - my favourite!\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Squeeze the [[Sausagemeat|sausagemeat]] from 16 raw [[Sausages|sausages]] into a bowl.\n| If you are going to add any flavourings to the [[Sausage meat|sausage meat]], do this now.\n| Using your hands - latex gloves make this easier - squidge the [[Sausage meat|sausage meat]] together so it's mixed well.  Especially if your using a mixture of [[Sausages|sausages]].\n| Weigh out about 110g of [[Sausage meat|sausage meat]] and make a round pattie - about 13 cm [5 inches] in diameter.\n| Place a [[Hard-boiled egg|hard-boiled egg]] in the centre of the pattie and work it into a ball, ensuring there is no ''seam''.\n| If you are going to coat them, sprinkle your coating onto a large plate and roll the [[Scotch|scotch]] [[Eggs|eggs]] around in the mixture until they are completely covered.\n| Place the [[Eggs|eggs]] on o non-stick [[Baking tray|baking tray]] or a [[Baking|baking]] tray covered with [[Grease-proof paper|grease-proof paper]].\n| [[Bake]] in the [[Oven|oven]] for 40 minutes, turning once.\n| Allow to cool and serve.\n}}\n===Variations===\nTry coating with [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]], [[Poppy seeds|poppy seeds]] or [[Sesame seeds|sesame seeds]].\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Beef recipes]]\n[[Category:Egg recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#scotcheggs #eggs #sausagemeat #sausages #scotch #sesameseeds #poppyseeds #bake #bakingtray #panko #boil </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}
