title": "Scotch pies",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Scotch pies a beef recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#scotchpies #pies #beef #pastry #scotch #egg #mutton #fridge #miseenplace #kneadingbread #mince \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Scotch pies are small raised pies, filled with either beef or mutton and sealed with a lid that sits s little inside the shell. These pies are filled\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}}\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 8208\n|PortionCalories = 513\n|DatePublished=8th March 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Servings: 16 - Makes 16 [[Scotch]] [[Pies|pies]]\n |Difficulty = 3\n |TotalTime = 13 hours\n |PrepTime = 30 minutes\n |CookTime = 12 hours 30 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Scotch pies recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Fiddly to make</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Right old fiddle to make.  I can never get them perfect like the butchers do.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Scotch]] [[Pies|pies]] are small raised pies, filled with either [[Beef|beef]] or [[Mutton|mutton]] and sealed with a lid that sits s little inside the shell.\n\nThese [[Pies|pies]] are filled with [[Beef|beef]]\n\n'''for the pie filling'''\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 700g (1.5 lb) lean [[Minced beef|minced beef]]\n| 300g (10.5 oz) white rusks, crushed with a rolling pin (use baby rusks)\n| 25 g (1 oz) seasoning 3:1 ([[Salt|salt]] to [[White pepper|white pepper]])\n| A beaten [[Egg|egg]] to glaze\n}}\n'''for the [[Pastry|pastry]]'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 300 ml (10 fl oz) water\n| 225 g (8 oz) [[Dripping|dripping]] or [[Lard|lard]]\n| 700 g (1.5 lb) [[Self raising flour|self raising flour]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Sea Salt|sea salt]]\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Prepare the pie casings the day before so you can leave them overnight to harden\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Add the [[Fat|fat]] and water to a pan and [[Boil|boil]] it until the fat has melted.\n| Warm a large bowl and sift the [[Flour|flour]] and [[Salt|salt]] into it\n| Pour in the liquid and mix with a wooden spoon\n| Once cool enough to handle, [[Kneading bread|knead]] until it is smooth and elastic.\n| Cover with a damp cloth and leave in a [[warm place]] for an hour.\n| Roll the [[Pastry|pastry]] out so you enough cases to fill 15 to 20 pie moulds, bun or [[Muffin|muffin]] tins with enough pastry left over to make lids.\n| Leave the shells and lids in a cool place overnight to harden off. A [[Fridge|fridge]] is good for this.\n| The next day, preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 190\u00b0 C (375\u00b0 F - gas 5)\n| Mix the [[Mince|mince]] and rusks and seasoning together with a little ice-cold water so it has a stiff consistency\n| Fill the shells, no more than &#190; full, press on the lids, cut a slit or a hole in each lid and then glaze with the beaten [[Egg|egg]].\n| [[Bake]] for 25 minutes or until golden brown.\n| Serve hot.\n}}\n===Chef's note===\nIf you don't wish to make as many as 15 or 20 in one go, freeze a batch, un-cooked for baking at a later date.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Beef recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pies tarts and flans]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#scotchpies #pies #beef #pastry #scotch #egg #mutton #fridge #miseenplace #kneadingbread #mince </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Scottish porridge",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Scottish porridge, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#scottishporridge #simmer #oatmeal #porridge #boiledorsimmered #boil \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This is the proper stuff as it should be made!\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 23\n|PortionCalories = 23\n|DatePublished=21st January 2013\n|Author = JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = Serves 1\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 30 minutes\n |PrepTime = 5 minutes\n |CookTime = 25 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Scottish porridge.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">It might be wrong</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">..but I prefer sugar or syrup with mine</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Sue_spins|Susie]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis is the proper stuff as it should be made!\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 250ml water\n| 35g medium [[Oatmeal|oatmeal]]\n| [[Salt]] to taste - you only need a little\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Bring the water to the [[Boil|boil]] in a non-stick saucepan.\n| Add the [[Porridge|porridge]] in a steady trickle whilst stirring vigorously - there should be no lumps.\n| Reduce the heat, cover and gently [[Simmer|simmer]] for about 15 minutes.\n| Stir in the [[Salt|salt]], cover and [[Simmer|simmer]] for a further 5 minutes or so.\n| You will know when it is done as the [[Oatmeal|oatmeal]] will have absorbed the water to such an extent that it has a crater appearance when [[Simmer|simmer]].\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nI love this with a generous pouring of cold [[Milk|milk]].\n===Variations===\nAdd a little [[Sugar|sugar]] if you wish, but do not omit the [[Salt|salt]].\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Porridge]]\n[[Category:British recipes|Porridge]]\n[[Category:Breakfast recipes|Porridge]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes|Porridge]]\n[[Category:Grain and bean recipes|Porridge]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#scottishporridge #simmer #oatmeal #porridge #boiledorsimmered #boil </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Scottish sausage stovies (GF)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Scottish sausage stovies a gluten free  recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#potatoes #onions #sausages #recipesfromothersites #glutenfree #scottishsausagestoviesgf #carrots #cornedbeef #mincedbeef #boil #simmer \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=One of the many variations of stovies, this one uses sausages and potatoes. It's also gluten free so is suitable for coeliacs.\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1251\n|PortionCalories = 312\n|DatePublished=25th October 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  1 hour, 40 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime =  1 hour, 30 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Scottish sausage stovies GF recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Simple dinner</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Easy peasey</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:NonLoggedInUser|NonLoggedInUser]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Perfect-pork.png|300px|thumb|right|[[Debbie and Andrew's Perfect Pork sausages]]]]\nOne of the many variations of stovies, this one uses [[Sausages|sausages]] and [[Potatoes|potatoes]].  It's also [[Gluten free|gluten free]] so is suitable for coeliacs.\n\nIn case you were wondering what is the origin of 'stovies', to enlighten you further, here is a short extract from Wikipedia describing them:\n\nStovies is a Scottish dish based on [[Potatoes|potatoes]]. Recipes and ingredients vary widely, but the dish always contains potatoes with, variously, [[Onions|onions]], [[Carrots|carrots]], other [[Vegetables|vegetables]], [[Roast beef|roast beef]], [[Corned beef|corned beef]], [[Minced beef|minced beef]] or other [[Meat|meat]]. Stovies is thus a dish intended to use left-over food.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 2 [[Onions|onions]], peeled and chopped\n| 1 pack [[Debbie and Andrew's Perfect Pork sausages]]\n| 1.5kg [[Potatoes|potatoes]], peeled and chopped in half\n| 1 [[Beef stock cube|beef stock cube]]\n| [[Salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Simply put the [[Onions|onions]], [[Sausages|sausages]], [[Potatoes|potatoes]] and [[Stock cube|stock cube]] into a large pan.\n| Just cover with cold water and bring to the [[Boil|boil]].\n| Lower the heat and [[Simmer|simmer]] for 1 to 1 &#189; hours. Keep an eye on it and top up with water if the mixture starts to look dry.\n| Season well with [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]] and spoon into bowls for a hearty supper.\n}}\n==See also==\n\n* [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stovies Wikipedia article: Stovies]\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Gluten free recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Stews and casseroles]]\n[[Category:Debbie&andrew's sausage recipes]]\n[[Category:Stewed, braised or pot roasted]]\n{{Template:DebbieAndAndrew attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#potatoes #onions #sausages #recipesfromothersites #glutenfree #scottishsausagestoviesgf #carrots #cornedbeef #mincedbeef #boil #simmer </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Scrambled eggs",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Scrambled eggs, Egg recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#scrambledeggs #butter #eggs #asparagus #egg #spinach #foiegras #parmesancheese #parsley #grilled #tomato \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=The ultimate simple breakfast. Use two eggs and 10 g (1/2 oz) butter per person, multiply for more people, cook all in the same pan, though the cooking\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 307\n|PortionCalories = 307\n|DatePublished=21st January 2013\n|Author = JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = Serves 1\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime = 10 minutes\n|PrepTime = 5 minutes\n|CookTime = 5 minutes \n|Image = [[Image:Scrambled eggs recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Simple is best</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.7</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Home-made bread, newly laid eggs and butter.  Nothing better for breakfast.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n\n}}\nThe ultimate simple breakfast.\n\nUse two [[eggs]] and 10 g (1/2 oz) [[butter]]  per person, multiply for more people, cook all in the same pan, though the cooking time will increase.\n\nUnlike [[boiled]] [[eggs]], the eggs can be as fresh as you can get them.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 2 Fresh [[free range eggs]]\n| 10 g (1/2 oz) [[butter]]\n| [[Salt]] and [[freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 1 slice of hot buttered toast (optional)\n| Freshly chopped [[parsley]] (optional)\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Break the [[eggs]] into a bowl and whisk them together\n| Season well with [[salt]] and [[pepper]]\n| Mix in &#190; of the chopped [[herbs]] if using\n| Add half of the [[butter]] to a pan and heat (medium) until the [[butter]] starts to froth\n| Swill the pan around to ensure the base and 'corners' are well oiled\n| Pour in the [[egg]] mixture and stir firmly with a wooden spatula ensuring the [[egg]] does not stick to the base or 'corners' of the pan\n| Leave the heat at medium and stir until at least &#190; of the mixture has solidified and the remainder is still runny\n| Remove the pan from the heat, add the remaining [[butter]] and continue stirring so the remaining [[egg]] mixture solidifies\n| Once there is no runny [[egg]] left, serve immediately, sprinkled with the remaining chopped [[parsley]] if using\n}}\n===Chef's tip===\nUse 2 eggs per person.\n\nDon't overcook scrambled [[eggs]] or you'll get the yellow leather they usually serve in hotel buffets!\n\n===Variations===\n* scrambled eggs \u00e0 l'arl\u00e9sienne - add the [[diced]], cooked pulp of [[courgettes]] (zucchini) along with a concentrated [[Garlic|garlic]]-flavoured [[tomato]] fondue (1 tablespoon per 2 eggs). The cooked [[eggs]] are then placed into the hollowed, cooked [[courgette]] shells, placed on an oiled gratin dish sprinkled with Parmesan cheese and browned in a 475 degree oven.\n* scrambled eggs \u00e0 l'am\u00e9ricaine - Add cubes of [[smoked bacon]] [[fried]] in [[butter]] to [[eggs]]. When cooked, mound on plate garnished with slices of fried or [[grilled]] [[bacon]] and small [[grilled]] [[tomato]] halves.\n* scrambled eggs argenteuil - Scramble the eggs, garnish with [[asparagus]] tips which have been [[parboiled]] in salted water and them slowly cooked in [[butter]]. Serve with triangle shaped cro\u00fbtons and [[cream]] sauce.\n* scrambled egg and asparagus barquettes- Cook the [[eggs]] and prepare [[asparagus]] tips by parboiling and slowly cooking in [[butter]]. Fill barquettes with scrambled eggs and garnish with [[asparagus]] tips. Top with melted [[butter]] and warm in oven.\n* scrambled eggs \u00e0 la Bercy - [[Grill]] some chipolata sausages. Arrange scrambled eggs in a pie dish. Garnish with cooked sausage and a \"ribbon\" of tomato sauce.\n* scrambled eggs Massenet - Parboil some [[asparagus]] tips and cook them slowly in [[butter]]. [[Boil]] or [[steam]] some [[artichoke hearts]], [[dice]] and [[saut\u00e9]] them in [[butter]]. While preparing scrambled eggs, add [[artichoke]] hearts. Plate in a mound and garnish with [[asparagus]].\n* scrambled eggs princesse - Prepare scramble eggs and pour into a bowl. Garnish with [[asparagus]] tips stewed in [[butter]], [[julienne]] of white [[chicken]] meat bound with supr\u00eame sauce and some truffle slivers heated in [[butter]].\n* scrambled eggs \u00e0 la reine - Make a very thick puree with cooked [[chicken breast]] and some supr\u00eame sauce. Bake a large vol-au-vent case and keep it warm. Cook the scrambled eggs until just creamy. Layer the scrambled eggs and [[chicken puree]] in alternating layers inside the vol-au-vent case. Serve hot with supr\u00eame sauce on the side in a sauce boat.\n* scrambled eggs \u00e0 la romaine - Cook 800g (1.75 lb) [[spinach]] in butter. Scramble 8 [[eggs]] with 50g (2 oz.) grated [[Parmesan cheese]]. Cut 8 oil-packed [[anchovies]] into small pieces, add to the [[spinach]] and spread the mixture over the base of a buttered gratin dish. Arrange [[eggs]] on top of [[spinach]] mixture and sprinkle with 25-40g (1-1.5 oz.) grated [[Parmesan cheese]] along with some melted [[butter]]. Brown under a grill.\n* scrambled eggs Rossini - Cook some scrambled eggs. Saut\u00e9 some thin slices of [[foie gras]] in [[butter]]. Cook some [[sliced truffle]] in [[butter]]. Plate the scrambled eggs on a serving dish, garnish with [[foie gras]] and [[truffles]], then coat with a very reduced Madeira-flavoured demi-glace sauce.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Egg recipes]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Breakfast recipes]]\n[[Category:Student recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#scrambledeggs #butter #eggs #asparagus #egg #spinach #foiegras #parmesancheese #parsley #grilled #tomato </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Seeded wholemeal bread",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Seeded wholemeal bread, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#seeds #seededwholemealbread #nut #bread #wholemealflour #granulatedsugar #flour #chilli #wholemeal #strongwholemealflour #sesameseeds \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This bread is delicious! I was feeling lazy today and made this in my breadmaker. The recipe is designed to be made with a Panasonic breadmaker\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2351\n|PortionCalories = 235\n|DatePublished=13th June 2012\n|Author = JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = Servings: 10 - Makes 1 large loaf\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 5 hours 10 minutes\n |PrepTime = 10 minutes\n |CookTime = 5 hours\n |Image = [[Image:Seeded wholemeal bread recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Makes great toast</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.7</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Especially nice with poppy seeds - they have a special scent!</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis [[Bread|bread]] is delicious!  I was feeling lazy today and made this in my [[Breadmaker|breadmaker]].  The recipe is designed to be made with a Panasonic breadmaker.  Depending on your model, add the [[Seeds|seeds]] to the [[Nut|nut]] dispenser or into the pan when your machine bleeps.  For other [[Breadmakers|breadmakers]], follow your manufacturer's instructions regarding the order in which you add your ingredients.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1&frac14; teaspoons fast action [[Dried yeast|dried yeast]]\n| 550g [[Strong wholemeal flour|strong wholemeal flour]] (I like to use Waitrose Very Strong Canadian [[Wholemeal flour|wholemeal flour]])\n| 1&frac12; teaspoons [[Granulated sugar|granulated sugar]]\n| 25g [[Butter|butter]]\n| 1&frac12; teaspoons [[Salt|salt]]\n| 360ml sparkling water\n| 2 tablespoons each of [[Linseeds|linseeds]], [[Sesame seeds|sesame seeds]], [[Pumpkin seeds|pumpkin seeds]], black [[Mustard seeds|mustard seeds]] and [[Sunflower seeds|sunflower seeds]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Add the ingredients (except the [[Seeds|seeds]]) in to your machine in the order given - non-Panasonic owners should refer to their manufacturer's instructions as to the order you should add them.\n| If you have a [[Nut|nut]] dispenser, place the [[Seeds|seeds]] into it.\n| Set to Whole [[Wheat]] - [[Bake]] [[Raisin]] and the [[Bread|bread]] will be [[Baked|baked]] in 5 hours.\n| For Panasonic machines without a dispenser, add the [[Seeds|seeds]] when you hear the beep.\n| For other machines, select a [[Wholemeal|wholemeal]] programme which kneads for roughly 15-10 minutes, rises for at least 2 hours 20 minutes and bakes for around 50 minutes.\n| When the [[Baking|baking]] time has ended, remove from the pan and allow to cool for at least 20 minutes before slicing.\n| Again, other makes of machine may recommend that the loaf should be left in the pan before the final cooling.\n}}\n===Variations===\nVary the [[Seeds|seeds]] if desired, but ensure that you restrict your large seeds to two and use three smaller seeds.  A suggestion for large ones is [[Melon|melon]] seeds.  Smaller seeds could include [[Poppy|poppy]], [[Celery|celery]], yellow [[Mustard|mustard]], [[Nigella|nigella]], [[Chilli|chilli]] etc\n===Chef's notes===\nRemember that the addition of ingredients such as [[Seeds|seeds]] will give a heavier [[Dough|dough]], which is why I recommend using Canadian [[Wheat flour|wheat flour]] which is very strong.  If your usual [[Wholemeal flour|wholemeal flour]] makes a denser loaf, you could add a crushed [[Vitamin C tablet|vitamin C tablet]] to the [[Flour|flour]].  It is to your personal taste.\n==See also==\n{{Wholemeal bread recipes-See also}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Breadmaker recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#seeds #seededwholemealbread #nut #bread #wholemealflour #granulatedsugar #flour #chilli #wholemeal #strongwholemealflour #sesameseeds </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Semolina milk pudding",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Semolina milk pudding, Indian recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#semolina #semolinamilkpudding #toasted #grated #saffronstrands #rava #blacktreacle #almonds #fry #custard #boil \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This pudding is great with golden syrup, black treacle or a good quality jam and is simple to make. Adjust the sugar levels according to your taste\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1302\n|PortionCalories = 325\n|DatePublished=13th November 2013\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|ImageComment = Semolina\n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime = 20 minutes\n|PrepTime = 5 minutes\n|CookTime = 15 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Semolina.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"><span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Nah!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">2</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Not for me - ever!</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\">[[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis pudding is great with [[golden syrup]], [[black treacle]] or a good quality jam and is simple to make. Adjust the [[sugar]] levels according to your taste.  It will be much better than you remember from school dinners.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1 litre (35 fl oz)  [[milk]]\n| &#190; cup [[semolina]] sooji or [[rava]]\n| &#189; cup [[sugar]], according to your taste\n| 1 [[stick of cinnamon]]\n\n| A little [[grated]] [[nutmeg]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n| In a large heavy based pan, dry-[[fry]] the [[semolina]] until you get a [[toasted]] aroma.  Don't burn it though.\n| Tip the [[roasted]] [[semolina]] into a bowl and add enough cold [[milk]] from the 1 litre to coat the semolina.  This can stop it lumping at the later stage.\n| [[Boil]] the remaining [[milk]] in the large pan\n| Add the [[semolina]] a little at a time , stirring constantly until you get a thick [[custard]]-like consistency\n| Add [[sugar]] to taste\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\n\nServe hot or chilled\n\n===Variations===\n\nSprinkle with [[toasted]] [[almonds]], [[pistachio nuts]] and [[sultanas]] just before serving.\n\nFor a more luxurious [[semolina]], mix a pinch of [[saffron strands]] with a little warm [[milk]] and leave for 15 minute4s, then stir into the milk as it boils.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Grain and bean recipes]]\n[[Category:Indian recipes]]\n[[Category:North African recipes]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#semolina #semolinamilkpudding #toasted #grated #saffronstrands #rava #blacktreacle #almonds #fry #custard #boil </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Sesame crusted Capricorn on warm Puy lentils and roasted peppers",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Sesame crusted Capricorn on warm Puy lentils and roasted peppers recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#parsley #sesamecrustedcapricornonwarmpuylentilsandroastedpeppers #oliveoil #sesameseeds #wedges #peppers #garlic #chilliflakes #redonion #balsamicvinegar #thelubborncreamery \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=As a vegetarian recipe, this is yet another contender for our Gent night. Everything in this recipe appeals and it looks visually stunning\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 450\n|PortionCalories = 112\n|DatePublished=25th October 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 35 minutes\n |PrepTime = 10 minutes\n |CookTime = 25 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Sesame crusted Capricorn on warm Puy lentils and roasted peppers recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Neat idea</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I did this with Camembert</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Sue_spins|Susie]] </span></span>\n}}\n\nAs a [[Vegetarian|vegetarian]] recipe, this is yet another contender for our [[Gent night]].  Everything in this recipe appeals and it looks visually stunning.  Give it a try!\n\nMany thanks to those nice people at [[The Lubborn Creamery]] who gave us permission to reproduce this recipe.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1 red and 1 [[Yellow pepper|yellow pepper]]\n| 1 [[Red onion|red onion]], cut into [[Wedges|wedges]]\n| 2 Cloves [[Garlic|garlic]], peeled and sliced\n| Pinch of [[chilli flakes]]\n| 4 tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 150g [[Puy lentils]], rinsed\n| 2 tablespoons [[Balsamic vinegar|balsamic vinegar]]\n| 2 tablespoons roughly chopped flat leaf [[Parsley|parsley]]\n| 2 x 100g [[Capricorn Somerset Goats' cheese]], halved\n| 2 tablespoons of [[Sesame seeds|sesame seeds]]\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6), [fan oven 180\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Halve and deseed the [[Peppers|peppers]] then cut into [[Wedges|wedges]].\n| Toss the [[Peppers|peppers]], [[Red onion|red onion]] and [[Garlic|garlic]] together in a [[Baking tray|baking tray]] with 1 tablespoon [[Olive oil|olive oil]], [[chilli flakes]] and seasoning. [[Roast]] for 20-25 mins until beginning to caramelise.\n| Meanwhile, cook the [[Lentils|lentils]] in [[Boiling|boiling]] water for 15-20 mins until tender - keep an eye on them, it is easy to boil them dry!\n| Drain and mix with 2 tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]], the [[Balsamic vinegar|balsamic vinegar]], [[Parsley|parsley]] and seasoning\n| Stir in the [[Roasted vegetables|roasted vegetables]].\n| Press the cut sides of the [[Capricorn Somerset Goats' cheese]] in the [[Sesame seeds|sesame seeds]].\n| Heat 1 tablespoon [[Oil|oil]] in a non-stick [[Frying pan|frying pan]], add the [[Capricorn Somerset Goats' cheese]], [[Seed|seed]]-side down, and cook for 2-3 mins until golden, over a medium heat.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nSprinkle with [[parsley]] and serve on top of the warm [[Lentil|lentil]] [[Salad|salad]].\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Grain and bean recipes]]\n[[Category:Salad recipes]]\n[[Category:Lubborn Creamery recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]][[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#parsley #sesamecrustedcapricornonwarmpuylentilsandroastedpeppers #oliveoil #sesameseeds #wedges #peppers #garlic #chilliflakes #redonion #balsamicvinegar #thelubborncreamery </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Sesame fried cod roe",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Home-cooked sesame fried cod roe recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#sesameoil #sesamefriedcodroe #mayonnaise #salad #codroe #tomatoes #oliveoil #deepfrying #kitchenpaper #sesameseed #frying \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Cod roe makes a brilliant lunch time snack for me and this is a healthier way to fry it\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 282\n|PortionCalories = 282\n|DatePublished=15th October 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment =\n|Servings = Serves 1\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime = 7 minutes\n|PrepTime = 2 minutes\n|CookTime = 5 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Sesame fried cod roe recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Pretty!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">...and healthy too.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n\n}}\n[[Image:Sesame fried cod roe in Tefal mini pan.jpg|300px|thumb|right|Frying in the neat Tefal mini pan]]\n\n[[Cod roe]] makes a brilliant [[Lunch|lunch]] time [[Snack|snack]] for me but the conventional way of [[Deep frying|deep frying]] it is far from healthy so I looked for better ways to cook it.\n\nShallow [[Frying|frying]] it in delicious [[Sesame seed|sesame seed]] [[Oil|oil]] works really well and only takes about 5 minutes to cook.  Using the [[Tefal one egg wonder 12 cm mini frying pan]] means you only need to use a minimal amount of [[Sesame oil|sesame oil]].\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 100g slice of [[Canned pressed cod roe]], about 2.5 mm [1 \"] thick\n| 2 tablespoons of [[Sesame oil|sesame oil]]\n| 2 [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]]\n| A handful of [[Salad]] leaves\n| 15ml [[Mayonnaise]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Gently heat the [[Sesame oil|sesame oil]] over a low flame\n| Don't let the [[Oil|oil]] get too hot or the moisture in the [[Roe|roe]] will make the oil spit dangerously\n| Carefully slide the [[Cod roe|cod roe]] slice into the pan\n| Pan [[Fry|fry]] for about 2.5 minutes a side, turning once\n| Drain on [[Kitchen paper|kitchen paper]]\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]], [[Salad|salad]] leaves and [[Mayonnaise|mayonnaise]].\n===Variations===\nThis recipe works just as well with [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Sea fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#sesameoil #sesamefriedcodroe #mayonnaise #salad #codroe #tomatoes #oliveoil #deepfrying #kitchenpaper #sesameseed #frying </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }

title": "Shepherd's pie (cheat)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Shepherd's pie (cheat), British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#garlic #onions #cream #worcestershiresauce #bakedbeans #gravygranules #butter #potatoes #blackpepper #miseenplace #stockcube \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Anne makes this when we are short of time and long on hunger. It's really quick and easy and lasts us for 2 days\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 3199\n|PortionCalories = 799\n|DatePublished=20th January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 55 minutes\n |PrepTime = 15 minutes\n |CookTime = 40 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Cheat's shepherds pie.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Lovely!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Reviewing this reminds me that we've not had this in a while!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry]] </span></span>\n}}\nAnne makes this when we are short of time and long on hunger.  It's really quick and easy and lasts us for 2 days.  A good strong cheese makes all the difference to this simple recipe.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| A few tablespoons of [[olive oil]] for frying the [[onions]] and [[Garlic|garlic]]\n| 1 medium [[Onion|onion]], chopped\n| 2 cloves of [[Garlic]], crushed (or to taste)\n| 450g [[Minced|minced]] [[Lamb|lamb]] or [[Mutton|mutton]]\n| &#189; teaspoon [[dried mixed herbs]]\n| 1 450g can [[baked beans]]\n| 1 450g can [[plum tomatoes]], chopped\n| 2 tablespoons of [[gravy granules]] or a crumbled [[beef stock cube]]\n| A dash of [[Worcestershire sauce]]\n}}\n'''Topping'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 4 medium / large [[potatoes]], peeled and quartered\n| 1 tablespoon of [[butter]]\n| A dash of [[milk]] or [[cream]]\n| [[Salt]] and freshly ground [[black pepper]]\n| 4 tablespoons of strong [[Cheddar cheese]], grated\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4)\n===Method===\n\n\nI know Delia Smith would have us use frozen mash potatoes for a [[Cheat's Recipe]], but I really can't bring myself to buy frozen mash, so...\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Boil the [[potatoes]] for about 20 minutes, mash with the [[butter]], seasoning and a dash of [[milk]] or [[cream]].\n| Meanwhile, fry the [[onions]] and [[Garlic|garlic]] until softened, about 5 minutes.\n| Add the mince and fry for a 3 or 4 minutes.\n| Add the [[onions]] and mince to a large oven proof [[casserole dish]].  You can of course do the [[frying]] in that too if it is suitable.\n| Add the chopped [[tomatoes]], [[baked beans]], [[mixed herbs]] and stir well.  Sprinkle the [[gravy granules]] or [[stock cube]] over the mixture, add a dash of [[Worcestershire sauce]] and give it one final mix.\n| Carefully layer the [[mashed potato]] on the top and using a fork, create plenty of peaks so they brown and crisp during the baking.\n| Top with [[grated]] [[cheese]] and [[bake]] for 20 minutes until the top is golden-brown.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with peas.\n==See also==\n* [[Shepherds' pie recipes|other shepherds' pie recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Shepherd's pie]]\n[[Category:British recipes|Shepherd's pie]]\n[[Category:Cookery cheats|Shepherd's pie]]\n[[Category:Lamb recipes|Shepherd's pie]]\n[[Category:Main courses|Shepherd's pie]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes|Shepherd's pie]]\n[[Category:Mutton recipes|Shepherd's pie]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes|Shepherd's pie]]\n[[Category:Student recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#garlic #onions #cream #worcestershiresauce #bakedbeans #gravygranules #butter #potatoes #blackpepper #miseenplace #stockcube </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Shepherds' pie",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Shepherds' pie a beef recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#shepherdspie #potatoes #sweetpotatoes #mangochutney #onion #browned #diced #boil #tomatoes #vegetablestock #worcestershiresauce \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Tuck in for the ultimate in comfort food\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2421\n|PortionCalories = 484\n|DatePublished=21st January 2013\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = 5-6\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 1 hour 40 minutes\n |PrepTime = 20 minutes\n |CookTime = 1 hour 20 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Shepherds' pie recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Lovely with Cara spuds</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">or Golden Markees</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]] </span></span>\n}}\nTuck in for the ultimate in comfort food.\n\nAlbert Bartlett products are available from most supermarkets.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 600g white, floury [[Potatoes|potatoes]], peeled and [[Diced|diced]]\n| 600g [[Sweet potatoes|sweet potatoes]], peeled and [[Diced|diced]]\n| [[Freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 3 tablespoons semi-skimmed [[Milk|milk]]\n| 400g extra lean [[Lamb|lamb]] [[Mince|mince]], [[Beef mince|beef mince]] or [[Turkey|turkey]] mince\n| 1 medium [[Onion|onion]], peeled and chopped\n| 1 [[Celery|celery]] stick, chopped\n| 2 [[Garlic cloves, peeled and crushed|garlic cloves, peeled and crushed]] or chopped\n| 2 teaspoons of [[Tomato pur\u00e9e|tomato pur\u00e9e]]\n| 450g canned chopped [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]]\n| 300ml [[Vegetable Stock|vegetable stock]]\n| 1 slug of [[Worcestershire sauce]]\n| 2 [[Bay leaves|bay leaves]]\n| 3 [[Rosemary#Sprigs_of_rosemary|sprigs fresh rosemary]], leaves picked and chopped\n| 2 teaspoons of [[Dried oregano|dried oregano]], \n| 1 tablespoon [[Mango chutney|mango chutney]] (optional)\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| [[Boil]] the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] and [[Sweet potatoes|sweet potatoes]] for 15-20 minutes, or until tender. \n| Drain the [[Potatoes|potatoes]], then [[Mash|mash]] with the [[Milk|milk]] using an electric whisk until smooth. \n| Season with [[Pepper|pepper]]. \n| In a large pan over a medium heat, [[Dry fry|dry fry]] the [[Minced meat|minced meat]] until [[Browned|browned]]. \n| Drain off any excess [[Fat|fat]], then add the [[Onion|onion]], [[Celery|celery]] and [[Garlic|garlic]] and [[Fry|fry]] for a further 3-4 minutes, stirring occasionally. \n| Add the canned [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]], [[Vegetable Stock|vegetable stock]], [[Worcestershire sauce]], [[Herbs|herbs]] and [[Mango chutney|mango chutney]] (optional). \n| Bring to the [[Boil|boil]], stirring until thickened. \n| Reduce the heat, then cover and [[Simmer|simmer]] for 20 minutes, stirring occasionally. \n| Place the [[Meat|meat]] in an ovenproof dish. \n| Spoon the [[Mashed potato|mashed potato]] mixture over the top and texture the top with a fork. \n| Either [[Grill|grill]] (broil) until lightly [[Browned|browned]], or pop into a preheated [[Oven|oven]] at 200c / 400F / gas mark 6 for 20 minutes.\n}}\n(Recipe by '''[http://www.albert-bartlett.co.uk/recipes/ Sally Bee]''')\n==See also==\n* [[Shepherds' pie recipes|Other shepherds' pie recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Albert Bartlett recipes]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n[[Category:Beef recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Lamb recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pies tarts and flans]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n[[Category:Grilled, griddled or barbecued]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n{{Template:Albert Bartlett attribution}}\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#shepherdspie #potatoes #sweetpotatoes #mangochutney #onion #browned #diced #boil #tomatoes #vegetablestock #worcestershiresauce </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Shepherds pie",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Shepherds pie, Irish recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#shepherdspie #grated #potatoes #oliveoil #onion #redwine #butter #chickenstock #parmesancheese #eggyolks #worcestershiresauce \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=We guarantee that this classic shepherds pie recipe won't leave you feeling sheepish! If you prefer a more spicy version, try our shepherd's pie with\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 3539\n|PortionCalories = 884\n|DatePublished=22nd January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime = 1 hour\n|PrepTime = 10 minutes\n|CookTime = 50 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Classic shepherds pie recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Such a classic dish</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.7</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Just as Mum made, every week when I was a kid.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nWe guarantee that this classic [[shepherds pie]] recipe won't leave you feeling sheepish!\n[[Image:Classic shepherds pie ingredients.jpg|thumb|300px|right|The ingredients (less mash)]]\n\nIf you prefer a more spicy version, try our [[Shepherd's pie with spicy lamb and pine nuts|shepherd's pie with spicy lamb and pine nuts]] instead.\n\n'''Filling'''\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 2 tablespoons [[olive oil]]\n| 500 g (1.10 lb) lean minced [[lamb]]\n| 2 cloves [[Garlic|garlic]], minced\n| 1 large [[onion]], [[grated]]\n| 1 large [[carrot]], [[grated]]\n| 250 ml (0.43 pint - 8.45 fl oz) [[red wine]]\n| 300 ml (0.52 pint - 10.10 fl oz) good [[chicken stock]]\n| 2 teaspoons [[cornflour]] (optional)\n| Handful of [[French green beans]], roughly chopped (optional)\n| 1 small [[yellow bell pepper]], de-seeded and sliced (optional)\n| 1 small [[green bell pepper]], de-seeded and sliced (optional) \n| 1 teaspoon fresh [[thyme leaves]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[rosemary]] leave, chopped finely\n| 1 tablespoon [[tomato puree]]\n| 2 tablespoons [[Worcestershire sauce]]\n| Sea salt and [[freshly ground black pepper]]\n}}\n'''Topping'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 1 kg Desiree [[potatoes]], peeled and cubed\n| 50 g (2 oz) [[butter]]\n| 2 [[egg yolks]]\n| 15g Freshly grated [[Parmesan cheese]]\n| Handful of freshly chopped [[parsley]]\n| [[Sea salt]] and [[freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 15g Freshly grated cheddar cheese (optional)\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the  [[oven]] to 175\u00b0C (350\u00b0F - gas 4)\n\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Heat 2 tablespoons [[olive oil]] in a large pan, season the mince and brown on a high heat for 3 minutes - I find a large wok good for this as it seems to be easier to get very hot for reducing liquids\n| Add the grated [[onion]], [[grated]] [[carrot]] and the [[Garlic|garlic]] and fry for a few more minutes\n| Add the herbs, [[Worcestershire sauce]], [[tomato puree]] and mix well\n| Turn the heat up and add the [[red wine]], stirring well until the wine reduces\n| Add the [[chicken stock]] reduce the heat and simmer for 10 minutes\n| If you prefer a thick gravy, mix two teaspoons of cornflour and a little cold water and stir this into the mix now\n| If using other vegetables that don't need to much cooking, like the peppers and beans add then now\n| Boil the [[potatoes]] until cooked (about 17 minutes)\n| Drain well and return to the hot pan for a few minutes to dry out\n| Mash, using a [[potato ricer]] if you like your mash really smooth\n| Whisk the [[egg yolks]] with 2 tablespoons of freshly [[grated]] [[Parmesan cheese]] and mix into the mash with half of the butter, season to taste\n| Pour the mince into a large ovenproof dish\n| Add the [[mash]] topping a spoonful at a time\n| Fluff the mash with a fork and grate a little more [[Parmesan]] and maybe some Cheddar over the top.  \n| Dot the remaining [[butter]] evenly over the top. \n| [[Bake]] for 20 minutes\n| If you like the top really crispy, finish by browning under a grill\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\n\nSprinkle with chopped [[parsley]] and serve with [[minty peas]].\n\n==See also==\n* [[Shepherds' pie recipes|other shepherds' pie recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Shepherds]]\n[[Category:Lamb recipes|Shepherds]]\n[[Category:Main courses|Shepherds]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes|Shepherds]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes]]\n[[Category:Pies tarts and flans]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Irish recipes]]\n[[Category:Cooking with wine]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#shepherdspie #grated #potatoes #oliveoil #onion #redwine #butter #chickenstock #parmesancheese #eggyolks #worcestershiresauce </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }

title": "Shooter's sandwich",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Shooter's sandwich a beef recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#shooterssandwich #duxelles #mushrooms #butter #shallots #thyme #garlic #steak #bread #beef #lemonjuice \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=I first saw this recipe on series 1 of \"Two Fat Ladies\", way back in 1996 and again recently\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 3906\n|PortionCalories = 1953\n|DatePublished=28th July 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 2 to 4\n |Difficulty = 3\n |TotalTime = 1 day, 1 hour, 30 minutes\n |PrepTime = 1 day, 40 minutes \n |CookTime = 50 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Shooter's sandwich recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">A lot of work for a simple sandwich</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.6</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">May6be I'll press it in a vice next time \ud83d\ude02\ud83d\ude02\ud83d\ude02</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Shooter's sandwich - Pressed under a heavy weight.jpg|thumb|300px|right|A pressing job in the garage]]\nI first saw this recipe on series 1 of \"Two Fat Ladies\", way back in 1996 and again recently in a [http://www.guardian.co.uk/lifeandstyle/gallery/2010/apr/07/how-to-make-shooters-sandwich Grauniad article].  If it tastes anything like as good as [[Beef Wellington]], the recipe on which it is based, it should be fantastic.\n\nThe origin of the recipe is purported to satisfy the requirement of a very rich and fulfilling meal that could be easily transported when hunting and shooting.  Sounds feasible!\n\nIt's pretty simple really; A loaf of [[Bread|bread]], hollowed out and filled with a sandwich of [[Beef|beef]] steaks that are stuffed with a layer of [[Duxelles|duxelles]] ([[Shallots|shallots]], [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]], [[Garlic|garlic]], [[Butter|butter]], [[Thyme|thyme]] and seasoning).  The loaf is then pressed under a heavy weight to flatten it - making it easier to carry I imagine\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 300g good quality [[Beef|beef]] steaks not too thick\n| 250 g [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]]\n| 4 [[Shallots|shallots]], peeled and finely chopped\n| 2 Cloves of [[Garlic|garlic]], peeled and crushed - or to taste\n| 4 tablespoons of [[Butter|butter]] (or butter / [[Oil|oil]] mixture)\n| 50 ml [[Dry sherry|dry sherry]]\n| Splash of [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]]\n| Sprig of [[Thyme|thyme]]\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| A splash of interesting [[Sauce|sauce]] to liven it up a little - [[Worcestershire sauce]], [[Chilli sauce|chilli sauce]] etc.\n| 1 suitably shaped loaf of [[Bread|bread]] that is to your taste.  Most recipes seem to use white bread but I prefer wholemeal. \n}}\n===Method===\n\n\n''' [[Duxelles]]:'''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Gently saut\u00e9 [[Garlic|garlic]] and [[Shallots|shallots]] in the  the finely chopped [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]] in the [[Butter|butter]] for about 6 minutes until soft.\n| Add the chopped [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]] and the whole sprig of [[Thyme|thyme]] and gently cook for 10 minutes so most of the [[Mushroom|mushroom]] [[Liquor|liquor]] is cooked off.\n| remove the sprig of [[thyme]]\n| Add the [[Wine|wine]], a splash of [[lemon juice]] and season to taste.\n| Cook gently until all of the liquid has gone.\n| The [[Duxelles|duxelles]] should stick together easily.\n| Remove from the heat and allow to cool.\n}}\n'''[[Steak]]'''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Hammer the steak really well with a [[steak mallet]] so it is quite thin and almost doubled in size.  Cut into two pieces.\n| [[Fry]] the steaks to your liking in a little [[Butter|butter]] or [[Olive|olive]] - drain any excess [[Fat|fat]] after [[Frying|frying]]\n}}\n'''[[Bread]]'''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Slice a 'lid' off the loaf, leaving enough room in the remaining loaf to stuff with the steaks and [[Duxelles|duxelles]]\n| Hollow out the lid and loaf and discard or whizz up in a [[Food-processor|food-processor]] to make [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]] for another time\n| Lay the first [[Steak|steak]] in the base of the loaf - trim and arrange to fit, see photos\n| Add the [[Duxelles|duxelles]] mixture\n| At this point you could add spread with some [[English mustard]] or [[Horseradish sauce|horseradish sauce]].  I [[Fried|fried]] the steaks in [[Chilli oil|chilli oil]] so have omitted this step\n| Cover with the remaining [[Steak|steak]]\n| Replace the 'lid'\n| Wrap in [[Greaseproof paper|greaseproof paper]] and tie with [[kitchen string]].\n| Wrap in a [[Tea-towel|tea-towel]] and press under a heavy weight for 24 hours.\n| The garage seemed the safest place to leave this, judging by the attention the cats were giving it!\n| I pressed the loaf between a plate and a cutting board, under a very heavy car tool-kit.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe in slices\n===Variations===\nI'm thinking....\n===Chef's notes===\nA few comments after making this.  I have now halved the amount of meat originally used - go for quality, not quantity.  The taste was fantastic but there was too much meat and it was quite chewy unless sliced very thinly.\n\n[[Hammer the meat flat]] to reduce the thickness and also to tenderise it.\n\nUse the best quality steak you can afford.\n\nDon't worry about over-pressing it!  My pressing method was the tool-box pictured, almost full of car tools, spanners, hammers etc.  So heavy that it was almost not possible to lift it onto the workbench.  I checked it first thing in the morning, panicking and thinking it would like as flat as a tortilla.  It was not - it could easily have been left for another day.\n\n==Step by step photographs==\n===Making Duxelles===\n<gallery widths=270px heights=270px perrow=5>\nImage:Duxelles ingredients.jpg|The basic ingredients for [[duxelles]]\nImage:Shallots and garlic suateed in butter.jpg|[[Shallots]] and [[Garlic|garlic]] [[saut\u00e9ed]] in [[butter]]\nImage:Mushrooms chopped.jpg|Mushrooms chopped in the [[food processor]]\nImage:Mushrooms go in dry.jpg|The [[mushrooms]] look very dry when they are first added\nImage:White wine added.jpg|Wet again once the [[white wine]]/[[sherry]] is added\nImage:Duxelles reduced, ready to cool.jpg|[[Duxelles]] completed, ready to cool\n</gallery>\n===Assembling a Shooter's Sandwich===\n<gallery widths=270px heights=270px perrow=5>\nImage:Shooter's sandwich - Duxelles prepared and ready.jpg|Duxelles prepared and ready\nImage:Shooter's sandwich - Loaf separated and hollowed out.jpg|Loaf separated and hollowed out\nImage:Shooter's sandwich - First steak added.jpg|First steak added\nImage:Shooter's sandwich - Topped with duxelles.jpg|Topped with duxelles\nImage:Shooter's sandwich - Covered with the final steak.jpg|Covered with the final steak\nImage:Shooter's sandwich - Wrapped in grease-proof paper.jpg|Wrapped in grease-proof paper, tied with string\nImage:Shooter's sandwich - Pressed under a heavy weight.jpg|In the garage, away from the cats for 24 hours\nImage:Shooter's sandwich recipe.jpg|A Shooter's sandwich\n</gallery>\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Beef recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Cooking with wine]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#shooterssandwich #duxelles #mushrooms #butter #shallots #thyme #garlic #steak #bread #beef #lemonjuice </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Shortbread",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Shortbread, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#shortbread #butter #castersugar #whiteflour #bake #plainflour #miseenplace #baking #oatmeal #whitesugar #flour \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Shortbread, a biscuit traditionally made from one part white sugar, two parts butter, and three parts oatmeal (although plain white flour is more\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1600\n|PortionCalories = 160\n|DatePublished=10th June 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Servings: 10 - Makes 10 to 12 shortbreads\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime = 40 minutes\n|PrepTime = 20 minutes\n|CookTime = 20 minutes \n|Image = [[Image:Shortbread recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Anne loves these</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.6</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">..so do I!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry]] </span></span>\n}}\n\nShortbread, a biscuit traditionally made from one part [[White sugar|white sugar]], two parts [[Butter|butter]], and three parts [[Oatmeal|oatmeal]] (although plain [[White flour|white flour]] is more common today)\n\nQuick and easy to make, don't eat too many of them!\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 125 g (4 oz) [[Butter|butter]] at room temperature\n| 55 g (2 oz) [[Caster sugar|caster sugar]]\n| 180 g (6 oz)  [[Plain flour|plain flour]], sifted\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the oven to 190\u00b0 C (375\u00b0 F - Gas 5)\n\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Beat the [[Butter|butter]] and the [[Sugar|sugar]] together\n| Mix in the [[Flour|flour]] to get a smooth paste\n| Turn out to a work surface and gently roll out until the paste is 1 cm (&frac12; in) thick.\n| Cut into rounds or fingers and sprinkle with a little extra [[Caster sugar|caster sugar]], prick with a fork to make a pattern on the top\n| Place on a [[Baking|baking]] sheet and chill for 20 minutes\n| [[Bake]] for 15-20 minutes until pale golden\n| Cool on a wire grid\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#shortbread #butter #castersugar #whiteflour #bake #plainflour #miseenplace #baking #oatmeal #whitesugar #flour </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

                ]
            }

title": "Shortcake sponge baskets with diplomat cream and fruit",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Shortcake sponge baskets with diplomat cream and fruit recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#butter #fridge #gelatine #icingsugar #boil #airtightcontainer #foil #cherries #castersugar #saucepan #cream \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=I would advise making these over two days. Each component will keep well in the fridge for 3 days at least. You will need a special tin to make the..\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 3554\n|PortionCalories = 592\n|DatePublished=19th April 2016\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 6\n|Difficulty = 3\n|TotalTime = 1 hour\n|PrepTime = 40 minutes \n|CookTime = 20 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Shortcake baskets with diplomat cream and fruit recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Nice creamy filling</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Never knew this was called 'Diplomat cream'!</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}}\n\nI would advise making these over two days. Each component will keep well in the [[Fridge|fridge]] for 3 days at least.\n\nYou will need a special tin to make the baskets. I used Nordic Ware's Shortcake Basket Tin and not sure if anyone else makes them. They can be got from [https://www.amazon.co.uk/Nordic-Ware-Platinum-Shortcake-Basket/dp/B000Q7QI3U?ie=UTF8&psc=1&redirect=true&ref_=oh_aui_detailpage_o03_s00 Amazon]\n{{RecipeIngredients\n}}\n====For the Shortcake Sponge:====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 150g [[Plain flour|plain flour]], sieved with\n| 1.5 teaspoons [[Baking powder|baking powder]]\n| 1/4 teaspoons [[Salt|salt]]\n| 140g [[Caster Sugar|caster sugar]]\n| 1 [[free range egg]]\n| 1/2 a teaspoon of [[Vanilla|vanilla]] or other extract of your choice\n| 150g softened [[Butter|butter]]\n}}\n====For the Cr\u00e8me P\u00e2tissi\u00e8re ====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 4g leaf [[Gelatine|gelatine]] (optional) \u2013 the 'set' version only\n| 50g [[Egg yolks|egg yolks]]\n| 60g [[Caster Sugar|caster sugar]]\n| 25g [[Cornflour|cornflour]]\n| 250g [[Milk|milk]]\n| 25g [[Butter|butter]]\n}}\n====For the Cr\u00e8me Chantilly====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 200g [[Double Cream|double cream]] (chilled)\n| 40g [[Icing Sugar|icing sugar]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Vanilla extract|vanilla extract]]\n}}\n====To finish====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 36 [[Cherries]] or other small [[Fruit|fruit]] as desired\n| 15g [[Icing Sugar|icing sugar]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n}}\n====For the Shortcake Sponge:====\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Pre-heat the [[Oven|oven]] to 180C / 350F / Gas 4 (see [[Chef's notes|chef's notes]] below for fan oven instructions)\n| Mix all of the ingredients together.\n| Beat for 2 minutes using a medium speed\n| Taste and add more [[Vanilla|vanilla]] etc extract if necessary\n| Grease the tin with melted [[Butter|butter]] and lightly dust with [[Flour|flour]]. If using the Nordic Ware tin, I suggest you paint the butter on with a [[Pastry|pastry]] [[Brush|brush]] to make sure you get into all the crevices.\n| Divide the mixture into the 6 moulds. If you fill to the last basket market, that should be about right.\n| [[Bake]] for about 20 minutes.\n| Leave in the tin for 10 minutes, then turn out onto a [[Cooling rack|cooling rack]] and allow to go completely cold.\n| The sponges should have an interior texture of a cross between normal sponge [[Cake|cake]] and a nicely [[Baked|baked]] scone. Do not expect them to be like a Victoria [[Sandwich]] as that type of sponge won\u00c2\u2019t be strong enough to hold the filling.\n| When cold, reserve the sponges until ready for use. They can go into an [[Airtight container|airtight container]] in the [[Fridge|fridge]] if necessary.\n}}\n====For the Cr\u00e8me  Diplomate (This will probably make more than you need)====\n{{RecipeMethod\n| This is made in two parts \u2013 the Cr\u00e8me P\u00e2tissi\u00e8re and the Cr\u00e8me Chantilly \u2013 which are then mixed together. You can either make it a 'set' version or an 'unset' one. The 'set' one requires the use of [[Gelatine|gelatine]] to set the Cr\u00e8me P\u00e2tissi\u00e8re, but I chose to do the 'unset' one, being a [[Vegetarian|vegetarian]]. It may be possible to use [[Agar|agar]]-agar as a setting agent, but this will need some experimentation because agar behaves differently to gelatine. I would make the Cr\u00e8me P\u00e2tissi\u00e8re first as that need to cool.\n}}\n====For the Cr\u00e8me P\u00e2tissi\u00e8re ====\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Hydrate the [[Gelatine|gelatine]] (if using).\n| Beat the [[Egg yolks|egg yolks]] with the [[Sugar|sugar]].\n| Whisk in the [[Cornflour|cornflour]].\n| Bring the [[Milk|milk]] to the [[Boil|boil]] in a [[Saucepan|saucepan]], the pour half of the milk over the [[Egg|egg]] mixture.\n| Whisk, return to the [[Saucepan|saucepan]] and heat, whisking thoroughly.\n| As the mixture thickens, carry on whisking.\n| When it returns to the [[Boil|boil]], cook for 45 seconds and remove from the heat.\n| Whisk in the [[Gelatine|gelatine]] (if using) and the [[Butter|butter]].\n| Cover and leave to cool.\n}}\n====For the Cr\u00e8me Chantilly====\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Whisk all of the ingredients in a chilled bowl until it has thickened.\n| Do not over-whisk or you will end up with sweet [[Butter|butter]].\n| Cover the bowl and keep in the [[Fridge|fridge]] until needed.\n}}\n====To mix the two====\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Whisk the cold Cr\u00e8me P\u00e2tissi\u00e8re.\n| Whisk in one-third of the Cr\u00e8me Chantilly, until smooth.\n| Fold in the remaining [[Cream|cream]] with a [[Spatula|spatula]].\n| Store in an [[Airtight container|airtight container]] the [[Fridge|fridge]] until needed, although it is easier to work with if used immediately\n}}\n====Assembly====\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Fill the sponge cases with the Diplomat Cream \u2013 if you have made the unset version, just [[Pile|pile]] it in. For set version, you can use a [[Piping bag|piping bag]].\n| Arrange [[Cherries|cherries]] or [[Fruit|fruit]] of your choice on the [[Cream|cream]].\n| Sprinkle with a little [[Icing Sugar|icing sugar]].\n}}\n===Chef's notes===\nIt is likely that you will have some of the Diplomat Cream left over.  This can be [[Frozen|frozen]] and used in other recipes.\n\nIf using a fan [[Oven|oven]] which does not allow the fan to be switched off, do the following:\n\nOnce you have put the mixture into the moulds, wrap some [[Tin foil|tin foil]] around the [[Baking|baking]] in. The sponges need to be protected from the fan, but you don\u00c2\u2019t want the [[Foil|foil]] to touch them. I made a sort of tent over the top, which helped to keep it free of the mixture and if possible, enclose the whole [[Baking tin|baking tin]] with foil, so that the fan doesn\u00c2\u2019t dry up the sponges.\n\nPlace in a COLD [[Oven|oven]], below the middle, but not at the bottom.\n\nSwitch the [[Oven|oven]] on to 160C and [[Bake|bake]] for about 35 minutes (!).\n\nRemove the [[Foil|foil]] and check that they are cooked. If not they can go back in without the foil covering.\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:North American recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#butter #fridge #gelatine #icingsugar #boil #airtightcontainer #foil #cherries #castersugar #saucepan #cream </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Sicilian sausage soup",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Sicilian sausage soup recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#basilleaves #celery #parmesan #parsley #oliveoil #fennelseeds #onion #chickenstock #tomatoes #siciliansausagesoup #carrots \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Enjoy the flavour of the Mediterranean with this continental-style soup recipe from Debbie&andrews debbie&andrews sausages\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 552\n|PortionCalories = 92\n|DatePublished=23rd October 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 6\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  1 hour\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  45 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Sicilian sausage soup recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Nice</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">A neat idea.  Very sausagey!</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nEnjoy the flavour of the Mediterranean with this continental-style [[Soup|soup]] recipe from [[Debbie&andrew's sausages|debbie&andrew's sausages]].\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1tsp [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 1 pack [[Debbie and Andrew's Harrogate 97% Gluten Free Pork Sausages]]\n| 1 [[Onion|onion]], [[Diced|diced]]\n| 1 [[Clove garlic, crushed|clove garlic, crushed]]\n| A pinch of [[Fennel seeds|fennel seeds]]\n| 3 [[Carrots|carrots]], peeled and sliced\n| 2 sticks [[Celery|celery]], sliced\n| 1 x 400g chopped [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]]\n| 300ml [[Chicken stock|chicken stock]]\n| A handful fresh flatleaf [[Parsley|parsley]]\n| 1tsp [[Dried oregano|dried oregano]]\n| 100g cooked farfalle [[Pasta|pasta]]\n| [[Salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]\n| Freshly [[Grated|grated]] [[Parmesan|parmesan]] and fresh [[Basil leaves|basil leaves]] to serve\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Heat the [[Olive oil|olive oil]] in a large non stick [[Saucepan|saucepan]]. Add the [[Onion|onion]], [[Garlic|garlic]] and [[Fennel seeds|fennel seeds]] and cook for 5 minutes until soft.\n| Then add the [[Sausages|sausages]] and [[Brown|brown]] evenly for 8 minutes or so.\n| Stir in the [[Carrots|carrots]] and [[Celery|celery]] and cook for another 5 minutes until the [[Vegetables|vegetables]] start to colour and soften.\n| Stir in the [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]], [[Parsley|parsley]], [[Oregano|oregano]] and [[Chicken stock|chicken stock]]. Bring to the [[Boil|boil]], then reduce the heat and [[Simmer|simmer]] for 20 minutes.\n| Stir in the cooked [[Pasta|pasta]], season well, then serve in bowls scattered with torn [[Basil leaves|basil leaves]] and sprinkled with [[Parmesan cheese|parmesan cheese]].\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nGarnish with freshly [[Grated|grated]] [[Parmesan|parmesan]] and fresh [[Basil leaves|basil leaves]].\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Italian recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Soup and stock recipes]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pasta recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Debbie&andrew's sausage recipes]]\n[[Category:Stewed, braised or pot roasted]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n{{Template:DebbieAndAndrew attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#basilleaves #celery #parmesan #parsley #oliveoil #fennelseeds #onion #chickenstock #tomatoes #siciliansausagesoup #carrots </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Silverside of beef in a pressure cooker (PC)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Silverside of beef in a pressure cooker a beef recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#pressurecooker #worcestershiresauce #jacketpotatoes #garlic #shiitakemushrooms #beefstock #beef #redwine #slowcooker #carrots #roasting \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Silverside of beef is an inexpensive cut of meat and despite what supermarkets tell you to do with it, it is not suitable for traditional roasting\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 8352\n|PortionCalories = 1044\n|DatePublished=21st January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Silverside of beef served with [[jacket potatoes]] and [[broccoli]]\n |Servings = Serves 8 to 12\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 3 hours, 45 minutes\n |PrepTime = 35 minutes\n |CookTime = 3 hours, 10 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Silverside of beef in a pressure cooker.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">I keep forgetting how good pressure cooked beef is!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Sounds like boiled beef; it's way better than that!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry]] </span></span>\n}}\nSilverside of [[Beef|beef]] is an inexpensive cut of [[Meat|meat]] and despite what supermarkets tell you to do with it, it is not suitable for traditional [[Roasting|roasting]].  It needs to be cooked very slowly in some sort of liquid, otherwise it will become tough and dry. \n\nThis is a version of [[Slow cooked silverside of beef]] adapted for a [[pressure cooker]].\n\nWe would not normally buy a joint of this size for just two of us, but it seemed good value and will last for at least 3 days.\n\nThis was fabulous - thank you [[Julia]] for the inspiration!\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 2 kg (4 lb) joint of [[Beef|beef]] silverside\n| 2 tablespoons [[Oil|oil]]\n| Freshly [[ground black pepper]]\n| 4 medium [[Carrots|carrots]], peeled and sliced\n| 3 sticks of [[Celery|celery]], coarsely chopped\n| 10 [[Dried|dried]] [[shiitake mushrooms]]\n| 500ml hot [[Beef Stock|beef stock]]\n| 1 bottle of robust [[Red wine|red wine]]\n| 6 large cloves of [[Garlic|garlic]], peeled\n| 1 large [[Onion|onion]], sliced\n| 2 tablespoons [[Tomato|tomato]] puree\n| A squeeze of lemon juice\n| 3 tablespoons [[Worcestershire sauce]]\n| 1 [[Bouquet garni]] - made up from what was in the garden at the time: [[sage]], [[rosemary]], [[parsley]], [[cutting celery]], [[bay leaves]].\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the [[Slow cooker|slow cooker]] for a few minutes.\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Silverside of beef carved.jpg|Silverside of beef carved\nImage:Silverside of beef in a pressure cooker ready.jpg|Ready for 3 hours of cooking\nImage:Silverside of beef in a pressure cooker ingredients.jpg|The ingredients\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Pat the joint dry and cover with a good grind of [[black pepper]]\n| Leaving the ''netting'' on the joint, heat the [[Oil|oil]] in a [[Frying pan|frying pan]] and [[Sear|sear]] the [[Meat|meat]] for about 3 minutes on each side.\n| Chop the dried mushrooms into quarters\n| Add the [[carrots]], [[onions]], [[garlic]], [[shiitake mushrooms|mushrooms]] to the [[pressure cooker]] and sit the seared meat on top, jiggle it around a little if you need more room.\n| Deglaze the meat pan with a little red wine and add that to the mix.\n| Pour over the remaining [[red wine]], [[beef stock]], [[Worcestershire sauce]] and [[tomato pur\u00e9e]] and mix well.\n| Fit the lid, bring up to pressure and cook on [[pressure cooker#Internal temperature related to pressure|high pressure]] for 3 hours.\n| [[De-pressurising a pressure cooker#Natural release|Depressurise naturally]]\n| Remove the silverside from the [[pressure cooker]] and allow to rest, under tented [[Foil|foil]] for 15 minutes.\n| Using a slotted spoon, ladle just more than half of the vegetables and a little stock into a [[food processor]] and blend to make a gravy.\n| Add the gravy back to the pan with the remaining vegetables, add a few tablespoons of [[yellow cornmeal]] if it needs thickening.  Bring back to the boil, uncovered, for a short while to thicken when ready to serve.\n| Slice the silverside, reheat the [[Gravy|gravy]] and serve.\n}}\n===Chef's notes===\nI don't profess to be a pressure cooker expert, so 3 hours may be rather a long time to cook this joint-however, it was melt-in-the-mouth tender and almost all of the gelatinous tissues had melted away.  The meat still had plenty of flavour.\n\nThis fabulous recipe has lasted us for 5 days!  We have had it with [[jacket potatoes]] & vegetables, filled [[Yorkshire puddings]] and [[vegetables]], with [[homemade pasta]], with [[couscous]] and tonight, turned into [[Mexican meatballs]] in a [[Bolognaise Sauce (PC)|bolognaise sauce]] with [[spaghetti]].\n\nThe trick was to separate the gravy and the cooked meat as soon as the meat was cooked.  Because they were separately stored and refrigerated in [[Lock and Lock]]-style boxes, the meat could be carved and server with or without the gravy.\n==See also==\n* [[Slow cooked silverside of beef]] - A [[slow cooker]] version of this recipe.\n* [[Talk:Slow cooked silverside of beef|Notes made after cooking this recipe in a slow cooker]]\n* [[Slow roast recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Beef silverside]]\n[[Category:British recipes|Beef silverside]]\n[[Category:Main courses|Beef silverside]]\n[[Category:Beef recipes|Beef silverside]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes|Beef silverside]]\n[[Category:Cooking with wine|Beef silverside]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes|Beef silverside]]\n[[Category:Pressure cooker recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#pressurecooker #worcestershiresauce #jacketpotatoes #garlic #shiitakemushrooms #beefstock #beef #redwine #slowcooker #carrots #roasting </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=The Simplest, Healthiest, Tangerine ice lolly\n|titlemode=replace\n|description=I love ice lollies, ice poles, frozen orange orange juice, etc. so this is such a genius idea!\n|keywords=#frozenfreshfruitlolly #frozentangerineicelolly #freezetangerinepieces #oranges #fruitrecipes #freezer #frozenorangesegments #sweetsanddesserts #healthylolly #healthyice\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=26th November 2020\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 6\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  4 hours 5 minutes\n|PrepTime = 5 minutes \n|CookTime = None\n|TotalCalories = 282\n|PortionCalories = 47\n|Image = [[Image:Simplest, healthiest, tangerine ice lolly recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Neat idea</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Take one, or ten, whenever you fancy a nibble.</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:NonLoggedInUser|NonLoggedInUser]] </span></span>\n}}\nI love ice lollies, ice poles, [[Frozen|frozen]] [[Orange juice|orange juice]], etc. so it is a little odd that it's taken me so long to think of this idea - and it's genius!\n\nTake a handful of [[Tangerines|tangerines]], peel them, break them into segments, [[Freeze|freeze]] them for 4 hours, then eat them!\n\n''Do try this out Tiff, I'm sure the little one will love them, just not too cold. x'' \n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 6 [[Tangerines|tangerines]]\n| or 6 easy to peel small [[Oranges|oranges]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Peel the [[Oranges|oranges]]\n| Separate into individual segments\n| Scatter in a freezer-proof container and [[Freeze]] for at least 4 hours.\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nfrozen tangerines segments, ready to eat.jpg|Frozen tangerine segments, ready to eat\n6 tangerines, peeled and segmented.jpg| 5 tangerines, peeled and segmented\n6 small tangerines.jpg|6 small tangerines\n</gallery>\n===Serving suggestions===\nEat them whole, like mini ice-lollies.\n===Chef's notes===\nI eat them directly from the [[Freezer|freezer]], but for small children and more sensitive souls, I would leave them out of the freezer for 15 to 30 minutes before consuming.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Gluten free recipes]]\n[[Category:Ice-cream recipes]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n[[Category:Frozen]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#frozenfreshfruitlolly #frozentangerineicelolly #freezetangerinepieces #oranges #fruitrecipes #freezer #frozenorangesegments #sweetsanddesserts #healthylolly #healthyice</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
