title": "Simple fish pie",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Simple fish pie, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#simplefishpie #fish #sauce #butter #flour #fishpie #haddock #turmeric #miseenplace #plainflour #poached \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This recipe was one of a few sent to us by Alastair Meikle. No specific quantities were given so I have calculated them for two people\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1292\n|PortionCalories = 646\n|DatePublished=20th January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 2\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 1 hour\n |PrepTime = 10 minutes\n |CookTime = 50 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Simple fish pie recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Simple is best</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.8</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Why make this complicated?</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis recipe was one of a few sent to us by [[User:Alastair|Alastair Meikle]].  No specific quantities were given so I have calculated them for two people.\n \nThis quick and simple recipe is also a candidate for the [[:Category:Cookery cheats|Cheat category]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 2 [[Haddock|haddock]] fillets - you can leave the skin on\n| 150ml [[Milk|milk]]; enough to just cover the [[Fish|fish]] fillets in a saucepan or small [[Frying pan|frying pan]]\n| 350 g (12 oz) [[Potatoes|potatoes]] - cooked and mashed: [[Mashed potato recipe|see here]] if you need a recipe.\n| 2 [[free range eggs]]\n| 1 tablespoon of [[Butter|butter]]\n| 1.5 tablespoons of [[Plain flour|plain flour]]\n| Big pinch of [[Turmeric|turmeric]]\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]] to taste\n| 75 g (3 oz) cheddar cheese, grated\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 190\u00b0 C (375\u00b0 F - gas 5)\n\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Simple fish pie cooked.jpg|Simple [[Fish pie|fish pie]] cooked\nImage:Simple fish pie oven ready.jpg|Simple [[Fish pie|fish pie]], ready for the oven\nImage:Simple fish pie sauce.jpg|The fish and the sauce\nImage:Simple fish pie poaching.jpg|Poaching the fish, you may need to turn it once if not completely covered.\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Add the [[Haddock|haddock]] fillets to a small [[Frying pan|frying pan]] and just cover with [[Milk|milk]]\n| Bring the [[Milk|milk]] to a [[Simmer|simmer]] and cook for about to 10 minutes.\n| Meanwhile [[Boil|boil]] the [[Eggs|eggs]].\n| Once the [[Fish|fish]] starts to beak up, remove from the heat, strain and reserve the [[Milk|milk]] for the [[Sauce|sauce]].\n| Melt the [[Butter|butter]] in a separate saucepan. Stir in the [[Flour|flour]] to make a [[Roux|roux]]; season to taste with [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] (or Proven\u00e7al [[Herb|herb]] [[Salt|salt]]), [[Pepper|pepper]] and [[Turmeric|turmeric]].\n| Slowly add the [[Milk|milk]] in which the [[Fish|fish]] had been [[Poached|poached]], to make a reasonably thick [[Sauce|sauce]]. Heat gently, and keep stirring, until the [[Flour|flour]] 'explodes'.\n| Add the [[Fish|fish]] to the [[Sauce|sauce]], and fold it into an [[Oven|oven]]-proof dish. Peel the [[Hard-boiled eggs|hard-boiled eggs]] and slice, place slices evenly over the fish and sauce. [[Mash]] the [[Potato|potato]] after seasoning to taste, use a little extra [[Butter|butter]] and a splash of [[Milk|milk]].\n| Cover the [[Fish|fish]] in the dish with the [[Mashed potato|mashed potato]], spread the [[Grated|grated]] [[Cheese|cheese]] evenly overall.\n| Place the dish in the [[Oven|oven]] and [[Bake|bake]] for 30 minutes.\n}}\n===Variations===\nFor variety, a dash of [[garam masala]] in the mashed potato is a pleasant contrasting taste.\n\nAdd a chopped leek to the potatoes for the final 10 minutes of boiling for a little more flavour and texture.\n\nAdd a sprinkle of whole [[fennel seeds]] to the milk whilst the fish is cooking.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes]]\n[[Category:Sea fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Cookery cheats]]\n[[Category:Student recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#simplefishpie #fish #sauce #butter #flour #fishpie #haddock #turmeric #miseenplace #plainflour #poached </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Simple shepherd's pie",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Simple shepherd's pie, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#butter #garlic #potatoes #lamb #meatstock #simpleshepherdspie #flour #bayleaf #onion #nutmeg #stew \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This is a nice easy shepherds pie recipe - see below for more complex versions\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 3356\n|PortionCalories = 839\n|DatePublished=20th January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 1 hour 25 minutes\n |PrepTime = 10 minutes\n |CookTime = 1 hour 15 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Classic shepherds pie recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Really simple</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">How easy is this?</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Sue_spins|Susie]] </span></span>\n}}\n\nThis is a nice easy shepherds pie recipe - see below for more complex versions.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 50g [[Butter|butter]]\n| 1 medium [[Onion|onion]], finely [[Diced|diced]]\n| [[Garlic]] to taste, crushed (I used 1 bulb)\n| A twist or two of freshly [[Ground|ground]] [[Nutmeg|nutmeg]]\n| 1 large [[Bay leaf|bay leaf]]\n| 450g [[Minced|minced]] [[Lamb|lamb]] or [[Mutton|mutton]]\n| 20 g [[Flour|flour]]\n| 280 ml hot [[Meat stock|meat stock]]\n| 140 ml [[Milk|milk]]\n| Seasoning\n| 3/4 cup of [[garden peas]]\n| 2 [[Carrots|carrots]], peeled and sliced\n| 1.5 kg [[Potatoes|potatoes]], peeled\n| [[Butter]], to taste\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Melt the [[Butter|butter]] over a medium heat and add the [[Onion|onion]].\n| Allow to [[Stew|stew]] until soft (about 10 minutes).\n| Reduce heat to low and add the [[Garlic|garlic]] .\n| [[Fry]] for a further 5 minutes, or until the [[Garlic|garlic]] is slightly golden.  Stir from time to time.\n| Remove from heat and increase the heat level to medium-high.\n| Stir in the [[Nutmeg|nutmeg]] and [[Bay leaf|bay leaf]].\n| Return to the heat and add the [[Lamb|lamb]].\n| Allow to [[Stew|stew]] for a maximum of 10 minutes.\n| Slowly stir in the [[Flour|flour]], and add the [[Meat stock|meat stock]] and the [[Milk|milk]].\n| Season to taste and add the [[Peas|peas]] and [[Carrots|carrots]].\n| [[Simmer]] for a further 10 minutes and pour into a greased [[Baking|baking]] dish.\n| Allow to go cold.\n| In the meantime, [[Boil|boil]] the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] for about 20 minutes.\n| Drain and [[Mash|mash]] with [[Butter|butter]] and seasoning.\n| [[Potato ricer|Rice]], if desired.\n| Once the [[Lamb|lamb]] is cool, preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4).\n| Spread the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] over the top and add a few knobs of [[Butter|butter]] if you like.\n| [[Bake]] for 20 minutes until the top is golden-[[Brown|brown]].\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Gravy|gravy]].\n===Variations===\nAdd some strong [[Grated|grated]] [[Cheese|cheese]] to the top of the [[Potato|potato]].\n==See also==\n* [[Shepherds' pie recipes|Other shepherds' pie recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Shepherd's pie]]\n[[Category:British recipes|Shepherd's pie]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes|Shepherd's pie]]\n[[Category:Lamb recipes|Shepherd's pie]]\n[[Category:Main courses|Shepherd's pie]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes|Shepherd's pie]]\n[[Category:Mutton recipes|Shepherd's pie]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes|Shepherd's pie]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#butter #garlic #potatoes #lamb #meatstock #simpleshepherdspie #flour #bayleaf #onion #nutmeg #stew </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Simple slow cooker fruity pork curry",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Simple slow cooker fruity pork curry\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#slowcooker #simpleslowcookerfruityporkcurry #porkfillet #ghee #fry #curry #leeks #rice #juice #leek #naanbreads #slowcooker\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=I thought I would make a nice simple fruity pork curry and cook it in the Slow Cooker\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=30th December 2022\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  2 hours, 15 minutes\n|PrepTime =  5 minutes\n|CookTime =  2 hours, 10 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 1015\n|PortionCalories = 507\n|Image = [[Image:Simple slow cooker fruity pork curry recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Nice way of using leeks</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.2</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Also made a decent curry - thanks!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nI thought I would make a nice simple fruity [[Curry|curry]] and cook it in the [[Slow Cooker|slow cooker]]; feeling lazy!\n\nOur [[Slow Cooker|slow cooker]] is neat as it also has the ability to [[Fry|fry]] so the [[Pork|pork]] and [[Leeks|leeks]] can be [[Fried|fried]] off in the [[Slow cooker|slow cooker]] first.  If your slow [[Cooker|cooker]] cannot fry then either start the [[Frying|frying]] in a [[Frying pan|frying pan]], of just  ignore the frying, it won't make a massive difference.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| A pinch of [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 1 large [[Leek|leek]], cleaned, cut in half lengthwise and then chopped into 'rings'.\n| 1 [[Pork fillet|pork fillet]]\n| 4 [[Cloves of garlic|cloves of garlic]], peeled and chopped\n| 1 tablespoon [[Ghee|ghee]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| \u00bd teaspoon [[Mixed herbs|mixed herbs]]\n| 300ml [[Orange]] and [[Mango]] [[Juice|juice]]\n| 1 heaped tablespoon of [[Curry powder|curry powder]]\n| 3 tablespoons of [[Sultanas|sultanas]]\n| 6 soft [[Apricots|apricots]], cut into quarters\n| 1 stick of [[Rhubarb|rhubarb]], chopped - I've used some that was [[Frozen|frozen]] from the summer\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Add the [[Black pepper|black pepper]], [[Oil|oil]] and [[Ghee|ghee]] to your [[Slow Cooker|slow cooker]], set to [[Hob|hob]]-mode (or [[Frying pan|frying pan]])\n| [[Fry]] the [[Pork fillet|pork fillet]] for 5 minutes, turning now and then\n| Add the [[Leeks|leeks]] and [[Fry|fry]] for another 5 minutes, adding the chopped [[Garlic|garlic]] for the last minute or so\n| Set the [[Slow Cooker|slow cooker]] to high slow-cook\n| Add the remaining ingredients, mix very well and and cook for 2 hours, stirring now and then if you are able\n| Slice the [[Pork fillet|pork fillet]] and serve with [[Side dishes|side dishes]] of your chosing\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Simple slow cooker fruity pork curry.jpg|Simple slow cooker fruity pork curry; the basic ingredients\nImage:Simple slow cooker fruity pork curry after one hour.jpg|Pork curry after one hour in the slow cooker\nImage:Slow cooked pork fillet carved for curry.jpg|Slow cooked pork fillet carved and ready for the curry sauce\n</gallery>\n===Serving suggestions===\nWe've chosen a [[Vegetable|vegetable]] [[Rice|rice]] and [[Naan breads|naan breads]], sprinkled with [[Coconut Merchant Toasted Coconut Chips]].\n===Chef's notes===\nIf you don't have [[Ghee|ghee]], just double the amount of [[Oil|oil]]. Normal [[Orange juice|orange juice]] will be fine too.\n===Variations===\nMaking a slightly different version of this tonight so making notes in case it's a keeper.\n\nLargely similar, the main differences being:\n* Smaller [[pork fillet]]\n* One large [[onion]] and one [[leek]]\n* A few trimmed chunks off-cuts from [[Treacle Cured Bacon from Russell's of Upwell's]]\n* Two large [[portobello mushrooms]]\n* 400 ml [[grape juice]] instead of 300ml [[Orange]] and [[Mango]] [[Juice|juice]]\n* More of both curry powders and a teaspoon of hot chilli powder\n* A teaspoon of mixed [[cardamom pods]]\n* Half a [[coconut block]] - '''only need a quarter in future'''\n\nThis was nice but it was much too hot for Anne, sorry.  Only use 1 tbs of curry powder and very little chilli powder in future. \ud83d\ude13\n===Chef's noters===\nI've mixed my [[Curry|curry]] powder [[Blend|blend]] and [[Taste Sensation Kashmiri Curry Powder]], together with \u00bd teaspoon of [[Turmeric|turmeric]] and a pinch of [[Fenugreek|fenugreek]]; I like to fiddle with my [[Spices|spices]]!\n\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Indian recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Slow cooker recipes]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n[[Category:Taste Sensation recipes]]\n[[Category:Slow cooked]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#slowcooker #simpleslowcookerfruityporkcurry #porkfillet #ghee #fry #curry #leeks #rice #juice #leek #naanbreads</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Sirloin steak with buttery potatoes (SV)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Sirloin steak with buttery potatoes a sous vide recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#butter #steak #potatoes #onion #potato #unsaltedbutter #garlicpowder #moleculargastronomyrecipes #oliveoil #sirloinsteakwithbutterypotatoessv #filetmignon \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Cooking the perfect steak is dead easy using the sous vide method\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 3655\n|PortionCalories = 913\n|DatePublished=13th November 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  2 hours, 15 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  2 hours\n|Image = [[Image:Sirloin steak with buttery potatoes SV recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Love th4e steak like this</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I wasn't so keen on the potatoes</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Vacuum packed steak and potatoes.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Vacuum packed steak and potatoes]]\nCooking the perfect [[Steak|steak]] is dead easy using the sous vide method.  You only need to cook it at the right temperature to get it to the required doneness and it will never be overdone.  Another advantage to this method is that the [[Meat|meat]] will be cooked evenly throughout.\n\nOne of the points of this recipe is to demonstrate that you can cook food at different temperatures without using two or three separate water baths.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 2 large [[Baking|baking]] [[Potatoes|potatoes]], peeled and sliced (up to 50mm thick)\n| [[Salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]\n| 2 tablespoons [[Unsalted butter|unsalted butter]], softened\n| 4 [[sirloin steaks]]\n| 1/2 a teaspoon of [[Garlic powder]]\n| 1/2 a teaspoon of [[Onion]] powder\n| A further 60g [[Unsalted butter|unsalted butter]]\n| [[Olive oil]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your water bath to 84\u00b0C.\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Pat the [[Potato|potato]] slices dry and season them lightly with [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]].\n| Place them in a large pouch - they can overlap - and rub them with the [[Butter|butter]].\n| If you get any [[Butter|butter]] near the top of the pouch, wipe thoroughly, or it will not seal properly.\n| Place in the water bath and cook for 1 hour.\n| At the end of this time, reduce the water temperature to 56.5\u00b0C (''133.7\u00b0F'') for a medium-rare [[Steak|steak]] - see 'Variations' below for rare, well done etc.\n| The quickest way to reduce the temperature is to add cold water, removing some of the hot water with the aid of a jug if necessary.\n| In the meantime, sprinkle the steaks with [[Pepper|pepper]], [[Garlic powder|garlic powder]] and [[Onion|onion]] powder - the two latter ingredients are often slightly [[Salt|salt]]y, so additional [[Salt|salt]] may not be necessary.\n| Place in separate vacuum bags, and smear 15g [[Butter|butter]] over each [[Steak|steak]], again wiping the top of the pouch if it comes in contact with the [[Butter|butter]].\n| Keeping the [[Potato|potato]] slices in the water bath, add the sealed pouches once the correct temperature has been reached - the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] will not cook any more but will just be kept warm.\n| Cook the steaks for 1-4 hours for steaks of 25 mm thickness or 2-4 hours for 50mm steaks.\n| Cut open the pouches containing the steaks and [[Sear|sear]] for 1 minute each side in a very hot [[Frying pan|frying pan]] with a little [[Oil|oil]]. \n| Allow the steaks to [[Rest for|rest for]] a few minutes before serving with the [[Potatoes|potatoes]].\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Salad|salad]] or leafy [[Vegetables|vegetables]].\n===Variations===\nYou can use [[rib-eye steak]]s or [[Filet mignon|filet mignon]] if desired.  If you like your [[Steak|steak]] rare, the water bath should be heated to 49\u00b0C (''120.2\u00b0F''), medium 60\u00b0C (''140\u00b0F''), medium-well 65.5\u00b0C (''149.9\u00b0F'') or well done 71\u00b0C (''159.8\u00b0F'').\n{{SousVideSeeAlso}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Beef recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes]]\n[[Category:Sous vide recipes]]\n[[Category:Sous vide cooking]]\n[[Category:Molecular gastronomy recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#butter #steak #potatoes #onion #potato #unsaltedbutter #garlicpowder #moleculargastronomyrecipes #oliveoil #sirloinsteakwithbutterypotatoessv #filetmignon </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Skate wings in peppery black butter with fennel seeds",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Skate wings in peppery black butter with fennel seeds recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#skatewings #skatewingsinpepperyblackbutterwithfennelseeds #fish #fennelseeds #oliveoil #butter #flour #bones #panfried #steam #newpotatoes \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=In all the years Cookipedia has been running, I've not put this recipe up. Skates, rays, all the same family\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1330\n|PortionCalories = 2661\n|DatePublished=27th January 2016\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  15 minutes\n|PrepTime =  5 minutes\n|CookTime = 10 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Skate wings in peppery black butter with fennel seeds recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Tasty stuff</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">3.8</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">The downside is that there never seems to be very much 'meat' n skate, after picking through all the bones.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nIn all the years [[Cookipedia]] has been running, I've not put this recipe up.  Time to rectify that!\n[[Image:Skate wings two pans.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Use two frying pans if you can]]\nSkates, rays and sharks are all part of the Chondrichthyes family which have [[bones]] made from cartilage, almost soft and bendy, so no nasty 'stick in your throat' [[bones]].\n\nAs with most [[Fish|fish]] they don't need much cooking and because the [[Skate wings|skate wings]] are of a fairly thin and of an even thickness, they cook quickly - about 4 minutes a side.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 2 [[Skate]] wings\n| 2 teaspoons [[Fennel seeds|fennel seeds]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Black peppercorns|black peppercorns]]\n| 3 tablespoons of [[Plain flour|plain flour]]\n| 2 teaspoons of [[Butter|butter]]\n| 2 teaspoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 10 [[New Potatoes|new potatoes]]\n| 1 cup of [[Frozen peas|frozen peas]]\n| 1 fresh [[Lemon|lemon]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Pop the [[Fennel seeds|fennel seeds]] and the [[Peppercorns|peppercorns]] in a [[Pestle and mortar|pestle and mortar]] and smash them up.  Don't worry if you can't get the [[Fennel|fennel]] [[Seeds|seeds]] to a powder, the flaky bits are fine.\n| Shake the smashed [[Spices|spices]] onto a plate and coat either side of the [[Skate wings|skate wings]]\n| Repeat the same process with the [[Flour|flour]] so the wings are well covered.\n| Using two pans if you can, heat the pans to medium, when hot add a teaspoon of [[Butter|butter]] to each pan, the moment it starts to sizzle and colour, ad a splash of [[Olive oil|olive oil]] to each pan, mix well and slide the [[Skate wings|skate wings]] into the pan.\n| Cook for 4 minutes on each side.\n| Meanwhile [[Steam|steam]] the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] and [[Microwave|microwave]] the [[Peas|peas]].\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Wedges of lemon|wedges of lemon]] and [[Mayonnaise|mayonnaise]] - Yum!\n===Recipe source===\n\n* I got the inspiration to try this recipe from reading Jamie Oliver's 'Great Britain Recipe Book' one rainy Sunday afternoon.\n===Variations===\nI love the flavour of [[Masa Harina|masa harina]] so use whenever I can.  Even in this dish it imparts its character.  Us it if you can, or even [[Yellow cornmeal|yellow cornmeal]].\n===Chef's notes===\nYou could use an [[Egg wash|egg wash]] to assist the [[Flour|flour]] in sticking to the [[Fish|fish]].  Our [[Chickens|chickens]] are not laying at the moment so thankfully this recipe seems to work just as well without.\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Sea fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#skatewings #skatewingsinpepperyblackbutterwithfennelseeds #fish #fennelseeds #oliveoil #butter #flour #bones #panfried #steam #newpotatoes </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Skewiff beetroot and halloumi",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Skewiff beetroot and halloumi a cheese recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#halloumi #beetroot #mint #skewiffbeetrootandhalloumi #honey #oliveoil #blender #fry #foodprocessor #lemon #orangejuice \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=The sugary beetroot and the salty halloumi are an incredible flavour match\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1273\n|PortionCalories = 318\n|DatePublished=17th May 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  50 minutes\n|PrepTime =  20 minutes\n|CookTime =  30 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Skewiff beetroot and halloumi recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Vegalicious heaven</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">What a fabulous idea!</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry, aka Chef]])</span></span>\n}}\nThe sugary [[Beetroot|beetroot]] and the salty [[Halloumi|halloumi]] are an incredible flavour match.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 8 small or 4 large [[Beetroot|beetroot]]\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground pepper|freshly ground pepper]]\n| 3 tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]], plus a few extra glugs\n| 3 sprigs of [[Mint|mint]], leaves finely chopped\n| 3 tablespoons [[Lemon|lemon]] or [[Orange juice|orange juice]]\n| \u00bd teaspoons [[Honey|honey]]\n| 2 x 150g blocks of [[Halloumi|halloumi]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 200\u00b0C/Gas 6. Place a large [[Roasting dish|roasting dish]] in the [[Oven|oven]] to heat up.\n| Peel the [[Beetroot|beetroot]] and cut into 4cm cubes. Toss into a bowl with a pinch of [[Salt|salt]], [[Pepper|pepper]] and a gloss of [[Oil|oil]]. Tumble onto your warmed dish. [[Roast]] for 25 mins or till tender.\n| Whizz the chopped [[Mint|mint]], [[Olive oil|olive oil]], [[Juice|juice]] and [[Honey|honey]] in a [[Food processor|food processor]] or [[Blender|blender]] for an extra creamy dressing or shake everything up in a [[Jam|jam]] jar till well mixed. Cut each block of [[Halloumi|halloumi]] into 12 cubes (so 24 in total). Get a large [[Frying pan|frying pan]] hot. Add a gloss of [[Oil|oil]]. Lower heat. [[Fry]] your [[Halloumi|halloumi]] in batches (if needed) till golden on top and bottom.\n| Skewer your [[Beetroot|beetroot]] and [[Halloumi|halloumi]]. You should get 8 generously filled [[Skewers|skewers]] or 12 smaller ones.\n| Drizzle with the [[Mint|mint]] dressing and serve any remaining on the side.\n}}\n{{SeeAlso-HalloumiRecipes}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Abel and Cole veg box recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n{{Template:Abel and Cole veg box recipes attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#halloumi #beetroot #mint #skewiffbeetrootandhalloumi #honey #oliveoil #blender #fry #foodprocessor #lemon #orangejuice </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }

title": "Slow cooked chicken (slow cooker recipe)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Slow cooker chicken slow cooker, British crockpot recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#chicken #slowcooker #vegetables #cider #fry #carrots #gravy #stock #kale #onion #garlic \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=You will need quite a large (6.5 litre) slow cooker for this recipe. It will take about 5 hours to cook in total. Crockpot recipe\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 4135\n|PortionCalories = 1033\n|DatePublished=19th June 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = 4-5\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 5 hours 15 minutes\n |PrepTime = 15 minutes\n |CookTime = 5 hours\n |Image = [[Image:Slow cooker chicken recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Tender and tasty</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Worth the long wait - even better using the timer on the slow cooker</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The&nbsp;Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nYou will need quite a large (6.5 litre) [[Slow cooker|slow cooker]] for this recipe.  It will take about 5 hours to cook in total.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1.5kg whole [[Chicken|chicken]]\n| 30ml [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 1 large [[Onion|onion]], cut into 6\n| 2 or more bulbs [[Garlic|garlic]], peeled\n| 500ml very strong [[Dry cider|dry cider]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Dijon Mustard|dijon mustard]]\n| 2 teaspoons [[Caster sugar|caster sugar]]\n| Seasoning\n| 900ml hot [[Chicken stock (2)|chicken stock]]\n| 3 [[Carrots|carrots]], peeled and cut into chunks\n| 3 sticks [[Celery|celery]], cut into chunks\n| 2 teaspoons of [[Dried oregano|dried oregano]]\n| 10 leaves [[Kale|cavolo nero]], chopped\n| 50ml [[Sour cream|sour cream]]\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the [[Slow cooker|slow cooker]] per the manufacturer's instructions.\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| [[Parson's nose|Remove the parson's nose]] from the chicken.\n| Wash the [[Chicken|chicken]] inside and out and dry thoroughly with [[Kitchen towel|kitchen towel]].\n| Heat the [[Oil|oil]] in a [[Frying pan|frying pan]] and add the [[Chicken|chicken]], breast side down.\n| [[Fry]] for 10 minutes, turning the [[Chicken|chicken]] so that it is [[Browned|browned]] all over.\n| Place the [[Chicken|chicken]], breast side down in the [[Slow cooker|slow cooker]].\n| [[Fry]] the [[Onion|onion]] and [[Garlic|garlic]] in the remaining [[Oil|oil]] until they are golden [[Brown|brown]] - if there is a lot of [[fat]] in the pan after browning the [[chicken]], drain some it off.\n| Add the [[Cider|cider]], [[Mustard|mustard]], [[Sugar|sugar]] and seasoning and bring to the [[Boil|boil]].\n| Pour over the [[Chicken|chicken]].\n| Add the hot [[Chicken stock (2)|stock]], [[Carrots|carrots]], [[Celery|celery]] and [[Oregano|oregano]], ensuring that the [[Chicken|chicken]] and [[Vegetables|vegetables]] are covered.\n| Cook, covered, on high for 4 hours, turning the [[Chicken|chicken]] after 3.\n| Add the [[Kale|kale]] at this stage.\n| When cooked, remove the [[Chicken|chicken]] from the pot and allow to rest, wrapped in [[Foil|foil]] for 20 minutes.\n| Carve the [[Chicken|chicken]] and remove the [[Vegetables|vegetables]] from the [[Slow cooker|slow cooker]] with a [[Slotted spoon|slotted spoon]].\n| Put 600ml of the cooking [[Stock|stock]] in a jug and mix with the [[Sour cream|sour cream]], to make a [[Gravy|gravy]].\n| Serve the [[Chicken|chicken]] pieces/slices with the [[Vegetables|vegetables]] and [[Gravy|gravy]].\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Champ|champ]] or plain [[Mashed potatoes|mashed potatoes]].\n===Variations===\nWould also work well with [[Pheasant|pheasant]], although you may need to reduce the cooking time.\n===Chef's notes===\nDo use the strongest [[Cider|cider]] you can find.  In general, the lower the strength of the cider, sweeter it is.  My [[chicken]] was larger than 1.5kg so I had to add quite a bit extra [[cider]]. \n \nYou must make sure that there is sufficient liquid to cover the [[chicken]] and the [[vegetables]].\n\nDo not throw away the left over liquid.  Keep it and use to make [[stock]].\n==See also==\n* {{See also - Jointing a chicken}}\n* [[Roasting a chicken in a slow cooker|Roast a whole chicken in a slow cooker]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Chicken]]\n[[Category:British recipes|Chicken]]\n[[Category:Main courses|Chicken]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes|Chicken]]\n[[Category:Poultry recipes|Chicken]]\n[[Category:Slow cooker recipes|Chicken]]\n[[Category:Cooking with wine|Chicken]]\n[[Category:Slow cooked|Chicken]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#chicken #slowcooker #vegetables #cider #fry #carrots #gravy #stock #kale #onion #garlic </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Slow cooked silverside of beef",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Slow cooked silverside of beef Beef crockpot recipes\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#stock #slowcooker #slowcookedsilversideofbeef #gravy #carrots #tomato #oregano #onion #beef #pressurecooker #garlic \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Silverside of beef is an inexpensive cut of meat and despite what supermarkets tell you to do with it, it is not suitable for traditional roasting. Crockpot recipe\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 3633\n|PortionCalories = 908\n|DatePublished=8th July 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 7 hours 45 minutes\n |PrepTime = 15 minutes\n |CookTime = 7 hours 30 minutes \n |Image = [[Image:Silverside of beef carved.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Soft texture and tasty</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.8</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">This takes a long time to cook, but as it's in the slow cooker you could even cook it on the timer while you're out.  I love the way the meat fibres break up after this long cook.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Slow cooked siverside of beef.jpg|thumb|300px|right|[[Slow-cooker]] loaded and ready to go!]]\nSilverside of [[Beef|beef]] is an inexpensive cut of [[Meat|meat]] and despite what supermarkets tell you to do with it, it is not suitable for traditional [[Roasting|roasting]].  It needs to be cooked very slowly in some sort of liquid, other wise it will become tough and dry.\n\nThis recipe is cooked in a [[Slow cooker|slow cooker]], but can just as easily be adapted for cooking on the hob or in a low oven or even a [[pressure cooker]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 800g joint of [[Beef|beef]] silverside\n| 2 tablespoons [[Oil|oil]]\n| 3 medium [[Carrots|carrots]], peeled and sliced\n| 2 sticks of [[Celery|celery]], coarsely chopped\n| A handful of [[Dried|dried]] [[shiitake mushrooms]]\n| 500ml hot [[Beef Stock|beef stock]]\n| 300ml robust [[Red wine|red wine]]\n| 2 bulbs [[Garlic|garlic]], peeled\n| 1 large [[Onion|onion]], sliced\n| 2 tablespoons [[Tomato|tomato]] puree\n| 3 tablespoons [[Worcestershire sauce]]\n| 2 teaspoons dried [[oregano]]\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the [[Slow cooker|slow cooker]] for a few minutes.\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Heat the [[Oil|oil]] in a [[Frying pan|frying pan]] and [[Sear|sear]] the [[Meat|meat]] for about 3 minutes on each side.\n| Meanwhile, make a bed with the [[Carrots|carrots]] and [[Celery|celery]] on the bottom of the [[Slow cooker|slow cooker]].\n| Place the [[Seared|seared]] [[Meat|meat]] on top of the [[Vegetables|vegetables]] and add the [[shiitake mushrooms]].\n| Pour the [[Stock|stock]] and [[Wine|wine]] over the [[Meat|meat]], cover and set to 'low'.\n| After 2 hours, add the [[Garlic|garlic]], [[Onion|onion]], [[Tomato|tomato]] pur\u00e9e, [[oregano]] and [[Worcestershire sauce]].\n| Continue cooking for 5 hours.\n| Remove the silverside from the [[Slow cooker|slow cooker]] and allow to rest, under tented [[Foil|foil]] for 15 minutes.\n| Meanwhile, blend the [[Stock|stock]] and [[Vegetables|vegetables]] until smooth, to make a [[Gravy|gravy]].  You may need to thicken the gravy with a little [[cornflour]] or [[arrowroot]].\n| Slice the silverside, reheat the [[Gravy|gravy]] and serve.\n}}\n==See also==\n\n===Chef's notes===\nLast time we made this, there was lots of leftover gravy. So we froze the surplus [[stock]] in 150ml plastic coffee cups and then vacuum packed them as little [[stock]] lollies.  These have proved to be a highly useful and delicious [[stock]] base.  ''When finding them in the [[freezer]]I wondered what recipe they came from until re-making this recipe again today!'' \n* [[Slow cooked silverside of beef (PC)]] - A [[pressure cooker]] version of this recipe.\n* [[Talk:Slow cooked silverside of beef|Notes made after cooking this recipe]]\n* [[Slow roast recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Beef silverside]]\n[[Category:British recipes|Beef silverside]]\n[[Category:Main courses|Beef silverside]]\n[[Category:Beef recipes|Beef silverside]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes|Beef silverside]]\n[[Category:Slow cooker recipes|Beef silverside]]\n[[Category:Cooking with wine|Beef silverside]]\n[[Category:Slow cooked|Beef]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#stock #slowcooker #slowcookedsilversideofbeef #gravy #carrots #tomato #oregano #onion #beef #pressurecooker #garlic </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Slow cooked Spanish pork recipe",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Slow cooked Spanish pork recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#pork #ghee #greenpeppers #lard #reddpaprika #tomatoes #casseroledish #mushrooms #spanish #mediterranean #slowcooker\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=Red paprika pork casserole with green peppers and mushrooms in tomato sauce\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=16th October 2021\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  1 hour, 15 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  1 hour\n|TotalCalories = 3060\n|PortionCalories = 765 \n|Image = [[Image:Spanish pork casserole recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Looks like baby food \ud83d\ude01</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.7</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">But I assure you, it tasted fabulous!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nA nice easy one pot [[Casserole|casserole]] recipe using [[Shoulder of pork|shoulder of pork]], always good for an economic dish.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 kg boneless [[Pork shoulder|pork shoulder]], minced\n| 15g / \u00bd oz [[Lard|lard]], [[Ghee|ghee]] or [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| A \u00bd teaspoon of [[Taste Sensation Italian seasoning]]\n| A good pinch of [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 1 large [[Onion|onion]], peeled and chopped\n| 3 [[Cloves of Garlic, peeled and crushed|cloves of garlic, peeled and crushed]]\n| 1 tablespoon sweet [[Paprika powder|paprika powder]]\n| A good pinch of dried [[Mixed herbs|mixed herbs]]\n| 1 [[Bay leaf|bay leaf]]\n| 3 tablespoons of [[Taste Sensation Mixed Sweet Red and Green Bell Pepper Granules]]\n| 1 can of chopped [[Plum tomatoes|plum tomatoes]]\n| 100g / 4 oz [[Button mushrooms|button mushrooms]], sliced\n| 2 teaspoons [[Cornflour|cornflour]]\n}}\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Fry the onions for 5 minutes in the oil\n| Add the garlic and fry for a further 3 minutes, don't let it burn\n| Mix the remaining ingredients together and stir well\n| Slow cook for 1 hour on high\n| Serve\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Spanish recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Slow cooked]]\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#pork #ghee #greenpeppers #lard #reddpaprika #tomatoes #casseroledish #mushrooms #spanish #mediterranean #slowcooker</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Slow roasted pork belly with kohlrabi coleslaw, pickled apple and fennel",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Slow roasted pork belly with kohlrabi coleslaw, pickled apple and fennel recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#dill #fennel #pork #apple #kohlrabi #crackling #potatoes #coleslaw #shredded #slowroastedporkbellywithkohlrabicoleslawpickledappleandfennel #roastingtin \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=The sweet, lush, grassy flavour of the raw kohlrabi works incredibly well in the coleslaw, the sharp appley flavour of the pickle compliments the pork \n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}}\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=26th September 2016\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 3\n|TotalTime = 1 day, 3 hours, 40 minutes\n|PrepTime = 1 day, 40 minutes\n|CookTime =  3 hours\n|TotalCalories = 9823\n|PortionCalories = 2455\n|Image = [[Image:Slow roasted pork belly with kohlrabi coleslaw, pickled apple and fennel recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Vary Germanic, I think</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.7</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Lots of strange flavours and textures, but nice, all the same</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis interesting recipe comes courtesy of [[Nik & Edwina's cookbook|nik & edwina's cookbook]].\n\nThis recipe didn\u2019t exactly come about by accident, but there was a series of coincidences and expediencies that ended up with a superb dish - we\u2019d already made the [[Pickle|pickle]] and were wondering what to have it with, and, while we\u2019d forgotten to buy [[Carrots|carrots]] for the [[Coleslaw|coleslaw]], we did have half a head of [[Kohlrabi|kohlrabi]] in the [[Fridge|fridge]], not to mention a head of [[Fennel|fennel]] that needed to be used up\n\nThe sweet, lush, grassy flavour of the raw [[Kohlrabi|kohlrabi]] works incredibly well in the [[Coleslaw|coleslaw]], the sharp [[Apple|apple]]y flavour of the [[Pickle|pickle]] compliments the [[Pork|pork]] very nicely indeed, and the [[Fennel|fennel]] on the side adds a nicely aromatic flavour and crunch. The [[Potatoes|potatoes]] are in fact optional, they\u2019re there more as a garnish than an [[Accompaniment|accompaniment]]. Any left over coleslaw and apple pickle will go very well in a [[Cheese|cheese]] sarnie\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n}}\n====roast pork====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 1 kg [[Pork belly|pork belly]] \u2013 a good lean cut, but with skin on \n| 2 medium [[Onions|onions]] cut into thick slices \n| 16 or so small [[New Potatoes|new potatoes]], halved\n}}\n====pickled apples====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 2 sweet crisp [[Apples|apples]], peeled, cored and cut into 1cm chunks \n| 250ml [[Cider vinegar|cider vinegar]] or a mix of 125ml [[Cider|cider]] [[Vinegar|vinegar]] and 125ml [[Apple|apple]] vinegar if you can get it \n| 250ml water \n| 60g soft [[Brown sugar|brown sugar]] \n| 1 [[Star anise|star anise]] \n| 1 tablespoon chopped [[Dill|dill]] stalks \n| 1 tablespoon finely chopped [[Dill|dill]] leaves \n| \u00bd teaspoons [[Salt|salt]] \n| \u00bd teaspoon [[Ground ginger|ground ginger]]\n}}\n====kohlrabi coleslaw====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| Half a head of [[Chinese cabbage]], cut into 4 segments and cored, then [[Shredded|shredded]] as finely as you can \n| Half a [[Kohlrabi|kohlrabi]], coarsely [[Grated|grated]] \n| 1 pack [[Dill|dill]], chopped finely, including all but the coarsest stalks (they can be used in the [[Pickling|pickling]] [[Liquor|liquor]] above)\n| 4 tablespoons of homemade [[Mayonnaise|mayonnaise]]\n| [[Salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]] to taste \n| Half a head of [[Fennel|fennel]], cored and very finely sliced. Hang on to the feathery leaves for a garnish \n| [[Ground nut]] [[Oil|oil]]\n| [[Salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* 250\u00b0 C (475\u00b0 F - gas 9), [fan [[Oven|oven]] 230\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Pack the [[Onion|onion]] and [[Potatoes|potatoes]] onto the bottom of your [[Roasting tin|roasting tin]] to create a platform for the [[Meat|meat]]. Score the skin of the [[Pork belly|pork belly]] to create a 1cm grid all over, about 5 mm deep. Rub with [[Groundnut oil|groundnut oil]] and [[Salt|salt]], and place it on top of the veggies, skin side up. Turn your [[Oven|oven]] on to 240C, then put the [[Roasting|roasting]] tin in and cook for 20-25 minutes or so until the skin is [[Browned|browned]] all over. Turn the oven down to 160\u00b0 C (325\u00b0 F - gas 3), [fan oven 140\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour] and add a little [[Boiling|boiling]] water to the roasting tin to stop the veggies from burning. Continue cooking for a further 2 hours adding a little boiling water every half hour or so if necessary \n| Once cooked, remove the [[Pork|pork]] from the [[Roasting tin|roasting tin]] and allow it to [[Rest|rest]]. Using a [[Slotted spoon|slotted spoon]], remove the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] and [[Onions|onions]] and keep warm. Separate the [[Meat|meat]] from the [[Crackling|crackling]]; if you have a cook\u2019s [[Blow torch|blow torch]] this is a good time to give the [[Pork crackling|pork crackling]] a quick blast of heat to ensure that it is really crisp. \n}}\n====Meanwhile, prepare the Pickle Apples:- ====\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Fill a 1 litre jar with [[Apple|apple]] chunks and chopped [[Dill|dill]] leaves \n| Combine [[Vinegar|vinegar]] with water, chopped [[Dill|dill]] stalks, [[Sugar|sugar]], [[Salt|salt]] and [[Ginger|ginger]] in a medium [[Saucepan|saucepan]], and bring to a [[Boil|boil]]. [[Simmer]] for 5 minutes, stirring, making sure all the sugar dissolves. [[Sieve]] the hot mixture over the [[Apple|apple]] chunks, close the lid and [[Refrigerate|refrigerate]], preferably overnight. It will keep for up to two weeks \n}}\n====The Coleslaw:- ====\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Put the [[Cabbage|cabbage]], [[Kohlrabi|kohlrabi]] and [[Dill|dill]] leaves into a large bowl. Gently stir in 2 tablespoons of [[Mayonnaise|mayonnaise]]. If it needs some more, add one more. Season, put in a lunchbox, keep in the [[Fridge|fridge]]. It\u2019ll last about 4 days \n| With half an hour to go, put the [[Fennel|fennel]] slices into a bowl, and cover with water. Set your timer for 30 mins \n| Once the [[Pork|pork]] is done, take it out of the [[Oven|oven]]. Take it off the veggies, and set them aside on [[Kitchen paper|kitchen paper]]. Carefully take the [[Crackling|crackling]] off the pork, and cut it into four quarters. Shred the [[Rest|rest]] of the pork. Drain the [[Fennel|fennel]]\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nPlace a neat heap of [[Coleslaw|coleslaw]] in the centre of each plate. Scatter some [[Fennel|fennel]] slices around it, and arrange some [[Potato|potato]] halves too, if you fancy using them. Put a neat heap of [[Shredded|shredded]] [[Pork|pork]] on top of the coleslaw. Place a piece of [[Crackling|crackling]] on top, put a couple of little heaps of [[Pickled|pickled]] [[Apples|apples]] around too, garnish with fennel leaves and serve\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Pickles and preserves]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n[[Category:Nik and Edwina's Cookbook recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#dill #fennel #pork #apple #kohlrabi #crackling #potatoes #coleslaw #shredded #slowroastedporkbellywithkohlrabicoleslawpickledappleandfennel #roastingtin </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Slow roast beef brisket with Guinness",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Slow roast beef brisket with Guinness Beef crockpot recipes\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#beef #gravy #onions #garlic #carrots #herbs #guinness #mushrooms #cornflour #slowroastbeefbrisketwithguinness #casseroledish \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=I thought that it would be nice to do some experimenting with brisket as it is so good for slow-roasting because of its high collagen content. Crockpot recipes\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 960\n|PortionCalories = 240\n|DatePublished=28th July 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 5 hours 20 minutes\n |PrepTime = 20 minutes\n |CookTime = 5 hours\n |Image = [[Image:Pot roast beef brisket with Guinness recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Melts in your mouth</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">The most tender beef is when it's slow cooked, wither in beer or wine.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nEating with friends recently, we all had a marvellous meal of [[beef brisket]]. I thought that it would be nice to do some experimenting with this cut of meat as it is so good for [[slow-roasting]] because of its high collagen content.  Initially I was going to use [[Red wine|red wine]] until I spotted a can of [[Guinness]] in the cupboard!\n\nSilverside of [[Beef|beef]] would be an equally good cut to use for this recipe.\n\nOnce the [[Onions|onions]], [[Garlic|garlic]] and [[Beef|beef]] have been [[Browned|browned]], this recipe could be made in a [[Slow cooker|slow cooker]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1 kg brisket of [[Beef|beef]], rolled and tied with [[butchers' string]]\n| 440 ml can of [[Guinness]] original\n| A few tablespoons of [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 8 small [[Onions|onions]] or [[Shallots|shallots]], peeled and halved\n| 3 Cloves of [[Garlic|garlic]] or to taste, peeled and chopped\n| [[Freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 2 [[Carrots|carrots]], peeled and sliced\n| A handful of [[Dried|dried]] [[Porcini mushrooms|porcini mushrooms]], or any strongly flavoured [[Dried mushrooms|dried mushrooms]]. Even fresh [[Button mushrooms|button mushrooms]] would do at a push\n| 2 tablespoons [[Balsamic vinegar|balsamic vinegar]]\n| 2 tablespoons of your favourite acidic [[Vinegar|vinegar]].  [[Sherry vinegar]] would be my choice here\n| A stick of [[Celery|celery]] with leaves if possible.  I used some [[Cutting celery|cutting celery]] that was just about to go to [[Seed|seed]]\n| A small sprig of fresh [[Thyme|thyme]]\n| 2 small fresh [[Bay leaves|bay leaves]]\n| A sprig of [[Parsley|parsley]]\n| A small cube of [[Jaggery|jaggery]], scraped to powder or a level tablespoon of [[Brown sugar|brown sugar]]\n| 1 pint of hot [[Beef Stock|beef stock]]\n| [[Cornflour]] to thicken if required\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 150\u00b0 C (300\u00b0 F - gas 2)\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Locro simmering.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Seal the casserole lid with scrunched up [[tin foil]]\nImage:Pot roast beef brisket with Guinness ingredients.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Pot roast brisket with [[Guinness]], the ingredients\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| I'm never keen on [[Vegetables|vegetables]] that have been slow cooked, so apart from the [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]] and the [[Beef|beef]], everything else will be discarded or used to make the [[Gravy|gravy]] once the cooking has been finished.  I leave the [[Herbs|herbs]] whole for easy removal.\n| Heat the [[Olive oil|olive oil]] in a large [[Casserole dish|casserole dish]], grind lots of fresh [[Peppercorns|pepper]] into the hot [[Oil|oil]] and then [[Brown|brown]] the [[Beef|beef]] on both sides.\n| Add the [[Onions|onions]] and [[Garlic|garlic]] and saut\u00e9 for 4 minutes.\n| Add the remaining ingredients and mix well.\n| Seal the [[Casserole dish|casserole dish]] with scrunched up [[Silver foil|silver foil]] and [[Pot roast|pot roast]] in the [[Oven|oven]] for about 5 hours.\n| Discard the [[Carrots|carrots]] and [[Herbs|herbs]].\n| Drain as much of the [[Stock|stock]] as you need to make the [[Gravy|gravy]], together with some of the [[Onions|onions]] and [[Garlic|garlic]].  Reduce a little if you wish and then thicken by stirring in a few teaspoons of [[Cornflour|cornflour]] or [[arrowroot]] that has been mixed with a little cold water, bring to a bubble and whisk until it is at your desired consistency.\n| You could liquidise some of the [[Carrots|carrots]] and [[Herbs|herbs]] too and add to the [[Gravy|gravy]] if you wish.\n| Slice very thickly and serve with the [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]] and [[Gravy|gravy]].\n}}\n===Variations===\nYou could omit the herbs and vegetables and just use a very strong [[vegetable stock]].\n===Serving suggestions===\n[[Peas]] or [[Broccoli|broccoli]] and [[Crispy jacket potatoes|crispy jacket potatoes]] would be my choice. \n{{RecipeLine}}\n* [[Slow roast recipes]]\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Irish recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Beef recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Slow cooker recipes]]\n[[Category:Stews and casseroles]]\n[[Category:Cooking with beer]]\n[[Category:Stewed, braised or pot roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#beef #gravy #onions #garlic #carrots #herbs #guinness #mushrooms #cornflour #slowroastbeefbrisketwithguinness #casseroledish </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Smoked butter",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Smoked butter, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#butter #clingfilm #smokedbutter #chips #sherryvinegar #smoking #vinegar #herbs #diced #butters #smokedbuttersmoked \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A very easy beginners' recipe for a handheld smoking gun and makes 2 types of butter\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1803\n|PortionCalories = 150\n|DatePublished=2nd April 2014\n|Author = JuliaBalbilla\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Servings: 12 - Makes 250g\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  12 minutes plus resting time between smokings\n|PrepTime =  12 minutes plus resting time between smokings\n|CookTime = None\n|Image = [[Image:Smoked butter recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Lovely with malt-crunch bread</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Lovely recipe Rosemary.  How I miss my smoker now!</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nA very easy beginners' recipe for a handheld [[Smoking|smoking]] gun and makes 2 types of [[Butter|butter]].  Decide for yourself which one you would like to use as your standard [[Smoked|smoked]] [[Butter|butter]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 250g [[Unsalted butter|unsalted butter]], divided into two 125g pieces, and roughly [[Diced|diced]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Sherry vinegar|sherry vinegar]]\n| [[Apple]] or oak [[Smoking|smoking]] [[Chips|chips]], briefly soaked in water\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Place the [[Butter|butter]] in separate bowls.\n| Add the [[Sherry vinegar|sherry vinegar]] to one of the bowls.\n| Beat the [[Butter|butter]] which is in the bowl without the [[Vinegar|vinegar]], until soft.\n| Repeat the operation for the [[Butter|butter]] containing the [[Vinegar|vinegar]].\n| Cover both bowls with [[Cling film|cling film]] or an airtight lid.\n}}\n'''For each bowl'''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Prepare the [[Smoking|smoking]] gun with the desired wood [[Chips|chips]].\n| Loosen up a little of the [[Cling film|cling film]], so that you have just enough room to insert the gun (you can use the tube if you like).\n| Light the wood [[Chips|chips]] with a lighter or match (do NOT use a blow torch or gas lighter).\n| Smoke for 15-20 seconds until the bowl is full of smoke.\n| Remove the gun and seal the gap with the [[Cling film|cling film]].\n| Leave for 10 minutes.\n| Repeat the previous three steps several times (up to 8) until you have the desired smokiness.\n| If not using immediately, remove the [[Butters|butters]] from the bowls, shape and wrap in [[Cling film|cling film]], or place in containers and keep [[Refrigerated|refrigerated]].\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nMelt on [[Meat|meat]] or [[Vegetables|vegetables]].  Also excellent with anything cooked on a [[barbecue]].\n===Variations===\nPlay about with different flavours of wood chips.  You can also add things to the [[Butter|butter]], such as [[Herbs|herbs]], [[Spices|spices]] or [[Citrus|citrus]] rind.\n===Chef's notes===\nDelicious, with or without the [[sherry vinegar]]!\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Butter smoked]]\n[[Category:British recipes|Butter smoked]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments|Butter smoked]]\n[[Category:Marinades dressings and butters|Butter smoked]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes|Butter smoked]]\n[[Category:Smoker recipes|Butter smoked]]\n[[Category:Smoked|Butter smoked]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#butter #clingfilm #smokedbutter #chips #sherryvinegar #smoking #vinegar #herbs #diced #butters #smokedbuttersmoked </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Smoked haddock pilaf",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Smoked haddock pilaf, Indian recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#bayleaf #rice #smokedhaddockpilaf #fish #garlic #pakistanibasar #chilli #coriander #grated #freshginger #salad \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This dish is very similar to kedgeree\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1055\n|PortionCalories = 527\n|DatePublished=13th April 2013\n|Author = JuliaBalbilla\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2-4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  50 minutes\n|PrepTime =  20 minutes\n|CookTime =  30 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Smoked haddock pilaf recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"><span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Nicer than kedgeree</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Fabulous recipe Rosemary - having this again next week - thanks! x</span> \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\">[[User:Chef|Jerry]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis dish is very similar to [[Kedgeree|kedgeree]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 40g [[Groundnut oil|groundnut oil]]\n| 1 [[Scotch bonnet|scotch bonnet]] [[Chilli|chilli]], chopped\n| [[Garlic]], to taste, chopped\n| 1 small piece [[Fresh ginger|fresh ginger]], peeled and finely chopped\n| 2 teaspoons [[Pakistani basar]]\n| 250g [[Basmati rice|basmati rice]]\n| 1 [[Bay leaf|bay leaf]]\n| [[Salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 375ml [[Fish stock|fish stock]]\n| 400g un-dyed [[Smoked haddock|smoked haddock]] fillet, boned, skin on, cut into 4 equal portions\n| 2 free-range [[Eggs, hard-boiled|eggs, hard-boiled]], peeled, [[Grated|grated]]\n| 2 [[Spring onions|spring onions]], trimmed, finely sliced\n| Fresh [[Coriander|coriander]], to taste, chopped\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6), [fan [[Oven|oven]] 180\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Heat the [[Oil|oil]] in a large, heavy-based saucepan.\n| Add the [[Chilli|chilli]], [[Garlic|garlic]] and [[Ginger|ginger]] and saut\u00e9 for a minute or two. \n| Add the [[Pakistani basar]] and cook for a further few seconds, stirring constantly.\n| Add the [[Rice|rice]] and stir until it is well coated with the [[Oil|oil]].\n| Add the [[Bay leaf|bay leaf]], and the seasoning. \n| Pour over the [[Stock|stock]], bring to a [[Simmer|simmer]], and remove from the heat.\n| Tip the [[Rice|rice]] mixture into a [[Casserole dish|casserole dish]].\n| Arrange the [[Fish|fish]] on the top, pushing it slightly under the surface.\n| Cover and cook for 20-25 minutes.\n| Remove from the [[Oven|oven]], then leave to stand for 5-7 minutes without removing the lid.\n| Take off the lid, remove the skin from the [[Fish|fish]] and immediately add the [[Grated|grated]] [[Egg|egg]], spring  [[Onions|onions]] and [[Coriander|coriander]].\n| Using two forks, gently mix the [[Rice|rice]], while also breaking the [[Fish|fish]] into flakes and mixing everything else in as you go. \n| Remove the [[Bay leaf|bay leaf]] and cover with a [[Tea towel|tea towel]], and the lid. \n| Leave for a further 5 minutes to remove any excess [[Steam|steam]]. \n| Mix again lightly and serve directly from the dish onto hot plates.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Salad|salad]] or [[Vegetables|vegetables]].\n===Recipe source===\n\n* Adapted from a recipe by '''[http://www.bbc.co.uk/food/recipes/smoked_haddock_pilaf_84768 Simon Hopkinson]'''\n\n{{Template:PeelingGinger}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Haddock pilaf]]\n[[Category:British recipes|Haddock pilaf]]\n[[Category:Indian recipes|Haddock pilaf]]\n[[Category:Breakfast recipes|Haddock pilaf]]\n[[Category:Main courses|Haddock pilaf]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes|Haddock pilaf]]\n[[Category:Chilli pepper recipes|Haddock pilaf]]\n[[Category:Fish recipes|Haddock pilaf]]\n[[Category:Rice recipes|Haddock pilaf]]\n[[Category:Sea fish recipes|Haddock pilaf]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted|Haddock pilaf]]\n[[Category:Pan title": "Smoked mackerel salad with grapefruit and potato salad",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Smoked mackerel potato salad with grapefruit recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#grapefruit #mackerel #whitewinevinegar #pasta #ceviche #unusualrecipes #herb #springonions #darksoysauce #oliveoil #honey \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This mackerel salad recipe is very similar to a basic South American ceviche. Serve with potato salad\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1694\n|PortionCalories = 847\n|DatePublished=7th March 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 2 as a main meal\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 40 minutes (incl chilling time)\n |PrepTime = 40 minutes\n |CookTime = None\n |Image = [[Image:Smoked mackerel salad with grapefruit and new poratoes.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Looks healthy</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Rocket goes well with mackerel</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Sue_spins|Susie]] </span></span>\n}}\n\nAs [[Smoked mackerel salad with grapefruit with pasta]] is Anne's favourite recipe of all time, I thought it would try a variation using new potatoes instead of [[pasta]].  It was an absolute success, the [[grapefruit]] pairs so well with the [[mackerel]], cutting through what can a rather oily fish.\n\nThis recipe is very similar to a basic South American [[ceviche]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 320 g (11 oz) peppered or plain, ready-to-eat smoked [[Mackerel|mackerel]] fillets, skinned and flaked\n| 380 g 85 g (13.5 oz) cooked new potatoes, skin on, chopped into bite-sized pieces\n| 1 small [[Grapefruit|grapefruit]]\n| 1 100 g (3 &frac12; oz) pack prepared [[Salad|salad]] leaves\n}}\n'''For the [[Herb|herb]] dressing'''\n* 2 tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n* 1 tablespoon clear [[Honey|honey]]\n* 1 tablespoon [[White wine vinegar|white wine vinegar]]\n* 1 tablespoon [[dark soy sauce]]\n* A handful of [[Spring onions|spring onions]], finely [[Chopped on the diagonal|chopped on the diagonal]] or 1 small [[onion|red or white onion]], peeled and finely chopped \n* [[Sea Salt|sea salt]]\n\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Add the dressing ingredients to a large serving bowl\n| Cut the skin from the grapefruit and discard\n| Halve the  skinned grapefruit over the serving bowl and using your fingers, try to scoop the flesh from the grapefruit, leaving the membranes behind. Let all of the juice and separated flesh go into the bowl\n| [[Hand whisks|Whisk]] the ingredients well and check for seasoning\n| Add the potatoes and flaked mackerel to the dressing ingredients and mix well\n| Refrigerate for 30 minutes or more to allow the flavours to mingle\n| Serve on a bed of salad leaves\n}}\n==See also==\n* Similar [[Ceviche-style recipes|ceviche-style recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes]]\n[[Category:Salad recipes]]\n[[Category:Sea fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n[[Category:Uncooked]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#grapefruit #mackerel #whitewinevinegar #pasta #ceviche #unusualrecipes #herb #springonions #darksoysauce #oliveoil #honey </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Smoked mackerel salad with grapefruit with pasta",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Smoked mackerel pasta salad with grapefruit recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#salad #mackerel #grapefruit #pasta #springonions #honey #refrigerate #unusualrecipes #fish #herb #chives \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This mackerel salad recipe is very similar to a basic South American ceviche\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1166\n|PortionCalories = 583\n|DatePublished=2nd April 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 2 as a main meal\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 40 minutes (incl chilling time)\n |PrepTime = 40 minutes\n |CookTime = None\n |Image = [[Image:Smoked mackerel salad with grapefruit recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Such a nice contrast</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">The sharp of the grapefruit tempers the richness of the fish - fabulous.</span> \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\">[[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nAfter a night of gluttony and another one planned tomorrow, I thought some healthy restraint was in order. This tasty, simple to prepare [[Salad|salad]] fits the bill perfectly.\n\nThis recipe is very similar to a basic South American [[ceviche]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 200 g (7 oz) peppered or plain, ready-to-eat smoked [[Mackerel|mackerel]] fillets, skinned and chopped roughly\n| 100 g (3.5 oz) cooked peeled prawns\n| 85 g (3&frac12; oz) dried [[Pasta|pasta]] of choice, cooked, drained and cooled\n| 1 small pink [[Grapefruit|grapefruit]], peeled and segmented\n| 1 100 g (3 &frac12; oz) pack prepared [[Salad|salad]] leaves\n}}\n'''For the [[Herb|herb]] dressing'''\n* 2 tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n* 1 tablespoon clear [[Honey|honey]]\n* 1 tablespoon [[Cider vinegar|cider vinegar]]\n* 2 [[Spring onions|spring onions]], finely [[Chopped on the diagonal|chopped on the diagonal]]\n* 2 tablespoons fresh [[Chives|chives]], chopped\n\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Place the dressing ingredients into a screw-topped jar and shake well.\n| In a large bowl add the [[Fish|fish]], [[Pasta|pasta]], [[Grapefruit|grapefruit]]. Pour over the dressing and mix well.\n| Transfer to a serving dish and [[Refrigerate|refrigerate]] for 30 minutes.\n| Mix in the [[Salad|salad]] leaves and serve.\n}}\n===Chef's notes===\nDon't be tempted to add [[salt]] as processed [[mackerel]] can be quite salty already.\n\n==See also==\n* Similar [[Ceviche-style recipes|ceviche-style recipes]]\n\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Pasta recipes]]\n[[Category:Salad recipes]]\n[[Category:Sea fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n[[Category:Uncooked]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#salad #mackerel #grapefruit #pasta #springonions #honey #refrigerate #unusualrecipes #fish #herb #chives </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Smoked salmon pancake stack",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Smoked salmon pancake stack recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#smokedsalmonpancakestack #dill #pancakes #butter #batter #salmon #lemonjuice #tomatoes #pancake #starter #freerangeeggs \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This simple meal served with New York slaw and tomatoes made un unusual and refreshing change. Cut into small slices, this would also make a good\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1401\n|PortionCalories = 700\n|DatePublished=22nd October 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  15 minutes\n|PrepTime =  5 minutes\n|CookTime =  10 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Smoked salmon pancake stack recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Doesn't get better than this.</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">A super-stack of savoury pancakes \ud83e\udd5e</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Building the smoked salmon pancake stack.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Building the smoked salmon pancake stack]]\nThis simple meal served with [[New York slaw]] and [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]] made an unusual and refreshing change.  Cut into small slices, this would also make a good [[Starter|starter]]. I Will definitely make this again.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n}}\n====pancake mixture====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 200 ml (7fl oz) [[Milk|milk]] mixed with 75 ml (3fl oz) cold water\n| 2 [[Free range eggs|free range eggs]]\n| 110 g (4 oz) [[Plain flour|plain flour]], sifted\n| 50 g (2 oz) [[Butter|butter]]\n| pinch of [[Table salt|table salt]]\n| [[Butter]] for [[Frying|frying]]\n}}\n====filling====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 180 g thinly sliced [[Smoked salmon|smoked salmon]]\n| Fresh [[Dill|dill]], finely chopped\n| [[Lemon juice]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Chop the [[Dill|dill]] and separate the [[Salmon|salmon]] into smaller pieces before you star in order to build the layers quickly.\n* Warm a plate on which to build the stack of [[Pancakes|pancakes]]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Add the [[Milk|milk]], water, [[Eggs|eggs]], [[Flour|flour]] and [[Salt|salt]] to a [[Blender|blender]] and mix until smooth.\n| Remove any stalks from the [[Dill|dill]] and finely chop the leaves\n| Separate the [[Salmon|salmon]] into much smaller pieces\n| Using 2 [[Frying pans|frying pans]] ensures you can build the stack quickly, but one will do.\n| Heat &#188; tablespoons of [[Butter|butter]] in a hot [[Frying pan|frying pan]], pour a few tablespoons of [[Batter|batter]] into the middle of the pan and quickly swirl the pan to distribute evenly.\n| [[Fry]] for about 30 seconds or until the underside is [[Browned|browned]].\n| Flip and cook the other side.\n| Pop the [[Pancake|pancake]] on a warm plate, top with sliced [[Salmon|salmon]], chopped [[Dill|dill]] and a sprinkle of [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]].\n| Keep adding [[Pancakes|pancakes]] in this manner until the [[Batter|batter]] mix is used up.\n| This amount of [[Batter|batter]] makes from 6 to 8 [[Pancakes|pancakes]].\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nChop the stack of [[Pancakes|pancakes]] in half, or smaller and serve with a [[Cole slaw|cole slaw]] and fresh [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]].\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Egg recipes]]\n[[Category:Fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Freshwater fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Sea fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#smokedsalmonpancakestack #dill #pancakes #butter #batter #salmon #lemonjuice #tomatoes #pancake #starter #freerangeeggs </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }

serve\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Cook the [[Pasta|pasta]] in fast [[Boiling|boiling]] [[Salted|salted]] water [4 to 5 minutes for fresh], 6 to 7 for [[Dried pasta|dried pasta]])\n| If [[cr\u00e8me fra\u00eeche]] to a large bowl , season with [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]] and mix very well\n| Drain the [[Pasta|pasta]] well and mix into the [[cr\u00e8me fra\u00eeche]]\n| Spoon the mixture into serving bowl add a final flourish of [[Dill|dill]] and a squeeze of [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]] to finish\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe immediately with [[Lemon wedges|lemon wedges]]\n\n{{Template:YoutubePastaDough}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Freshwater fish title": "Smoked salmon quiche",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",

                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Smoked salmon quiche; a  recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#smokedsalmonquiche #salmon #parsley #basicflancase #freerangeeggs #blindbake #tomato #greaseproofpaper #miseenplace #eggs #tomatoes \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This is the kind of recipe that you get cravings for, which is fine because it's not difficult to make.\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1454\n|PortionCalories = 727\n|DatePublished=17th January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime = 50 minutes\n|PrepTime = 10 minutes\n|CookTime = 40 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Smoked salmon quiche.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Simple and tasty</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.8</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">This was easier than I thought it would be and really rather good. A small packet of flaked smoked salmon is still relatively inexpensive.\n[[Image:Remember the greaseproof.jpg|thumb|right|300px|Twice now, I've forgotten to put [[greaseproof paper]] under the baking beans.  Perhaps this picture will remind me next time!]]\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1 [[Basic flan case]]\n| 135 g (4&frac12; oz) flaked smoked [[salmon]]\n| 2 [[Free range eggs|free range eggs]]\n| 250 ml (0.43 pint) of full cream milk\n| [[Salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 2 tablespoons of freshly chopped [[parsley]]\n| 1 fresh [[Tomato|tomato]], sliced for garnish\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat the oven to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - Gas 6)\n\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Follow the recipe for the [[Basic flan case]] or use a ready-made flan case\n| Add the [[Eggs|eggs]], [[Milk|milk]], [[parsley]] and seasoning to a bowl\n| With an electric whisk, combine the ingredients so they are well mixed.\n| [[Blind bake]] the case @ 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - Gas 6) for 10 minutes.\n| Arrange the smoked [[salmon]] in the base of the flan case\n| Pour over the [[Egg|egg]] mixture\n| Arrange the sliced [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]] on the top and [[Bake|bake]] for a further 30 minutes.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\n\nServe warm or cold\n\n{{Quiche - See also}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Egg recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Pies tarts and flans]]\n[[Category:Freshwater fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Sea fish recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#smokedsalmonquiche #salmon #parsley #basicflancase #freerangeeggs #blindbake #tomato #greaseproofpaper #miseenplace #eggs #tomatoes </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
