title": "Smokey Tomato Bread",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Smokey Tomato Bread; a  recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#dough #onion #yeast #smokeytomatobread #clingfilm #smokedpaprika #flour #oliveoil #knockback #tomatojuice #driedoregano \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This is a white loaf made with tomato juice and hot smoked paprika. \n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1435\n|PortionCalories = 143\n|DatePublished=20th October 2012\n|Author = JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = Servings: 10 - 1 large loaf \n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 2 hours 45 minutes\n |PrepTime = 2 hours 10 minutes\n |CookTime = 35 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Smokey Tomato Bread recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Now that's different!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.7</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Would be nice with soup</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:NonLoggedInUser|NonLoggedInUser]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis is a white loaf made with [[Tomato juice|tomato juice]] and hot [[Smoked paprika|smoked paprika]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 425g ripe [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]], [[Pureed|pureed]] and sieved- this should yield about 290g of [[Juice|juice]]\n| 15g fresh [[Yeast|yeast]]\n| 500g [[Strong white bread flour|strong white bread flour]], sifted\n| &frac34; teaspoon [[Salt|salt]]\n| 30g [[Piment\u00f3n de la Vera]] (picante)\n| 1 tablespoon [[Dried oregano|dried oregano]]\n| &frac12; tablespoons [[Dried mixed herbs|dried mixed herbs]]\n| 40g [[Onion|onion]] powder\n| Pinch of [[Sugar|sugar]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Tomato|tomato]] pur\u00e9e\n| 15g [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Dissolve the [[Yeast|yeast]] in the [[Tomato juice|tomato juice]].\n| Meanwhile, mix the dry ingredients.\n| When the [[Yeast|yeast]] has dissolved mix it in with the [[Flour|flour]] and add the tomatoe pur\u00e9e and the [[Olive oil|olive oil]]. \n| Leave to rest for 10 minutes.\n| Lightly [[Flour|flour]] a work surface and your hands and [[Knead|knead]] the [[Dough|dough]] for about 10 minutes until smooth and elastic. Don't worry about the dough sticking to your hands as it will become less moist as you work it.\n| Shape into a ball, place in an oiled bowl and cover with [[Clingfilm|clingfilm]].\n| Leave until the [[Dough|dough]] has almost doubled in size (about an hour).\n| Gently [[Knock back|knock back]] with your finger tips and repeat steps 6 and 7, but the [[Proving|proving]] should only take about 45 minutes.\n| Gently [[Knock back|knock back]] again, face downards into a rectangle, one side being the same length as the tin.\n| Roll the [[Dough|dough]] towards you as tightly as you can.\n| Flatten and stretch the ends and tuck them underneath so that they meet up in the middle.\n| Place into a 900g / 2lb loaf tin, cover with [[Clingfilm|clingfilm]] and prove until the [[Dough|dough]] reaches the top of the tin.\n| Make some diagonal slashes across the top or one long one across the lenghth and [[Bake|bake]] at 220\u00b0 C (425\u00b0 F - gas 7), [fan [[Oven|oven]] 200\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour] for 30-35 minutes until [[Baked|baked]].\n| Cool completely on a wire rack.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nGood with [[Cheese|cheese]].\n===Variations===\nVary the [[Herbs|herbs]] or you could use a sweet [[Smoked paprika|smoked paprika]] - [[Piment\u00f3n de la Vera]] (dulce).\n===Chef's notes===\nThe loaf looks burnt but isn't.  It is just where the [[onion]] powder has caramelised.  The same would also happen if you used [[Garlic|garlic]] powder.  I have a friend who goes to Barbados regularly who brings back [[onion]] powder for me as I have never seen it in our part of the UK.  I would suggest you try a good Asian or Caribbean grocer's shop.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]][[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#dough #onion #yeast #smokeytomatobread #clingfilm #smokedpaprika #flour #oliveoil #knockback #tomatojuice #driedoregano </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Smokin' neeps and tatties hash",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Smokin' neeps and tatties hash a gluten free recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#smokinneepsandtattieshash #butter #diced #garlic #haddock #whisky #smokedhaddock #leek #roots #oliveoil #fish \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Also known as Scottish Roots (smoked haddock Optional), this rustic hash is a brilliant way to use up your winter roots\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1595\n|PortionCalories = 398\n|DatePublished=18th May 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  45 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  30 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Smokin' neeps and tatties hash recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">No Bud - not for me</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">2</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">..not ever - animal food this!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:NonLoggedInUser|NonLoggedInUser]] </span></span>\n}}\nAlso known as Scottish [[Roots]] ([[Smoked haddock|smoked haddock]] Optional), this rustic hash is a brilliant way to use up your winter [[Roots|roots]]. With an optional slosh of [[Whisky|whisky]] and some smoky [[Haddock|haddock]], it\u0092s the perfect one-pan supper to warm you on a chilly January night.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 4 handfuls of peeled/[[Diced|diced]] [[Potato|potato]]\n| 2 handful of peeled/[[Diced|diced]] [[Swede|swede]] (or any root: [[Turnip|turnip]], [[Parsnip|parsnip]], [[Celeriac|celeriac]]\u0085)\n| A few glugs of [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]]\n| [[Freshly ground pepper]]\n| 2 [[Smoked haddock|smoked haddock]] fillets (optional)\n| 2 [[Garlic|garlic]] [[Cloves|cloves]], finely chopped\n| 1 [[Leek|leek]], cleaned and sliced\n| 1 tablespoon [[Thyme leaves|thyme leaves]]\n| 15ml of [[Whiskey|whiskey]] (optional)\n| A nugget of [[Butter|butter]]\n| 1 [[Lemon|lemon]], [[Juice|juice]] and [[Zest|zest]]\n| A handful of [[Parsley|parsley]] or [[Chervil|chervil]]\n| 30ml Cr\u00e8me fresh, to serve\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| In a bowl, toss [[Diced|diced]] veg with a little [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and seasoning. \n| Tumble veg into a hot [[Frying pan|frying pan]] with a little [[Oil|oil]]. Arrange in a single layer. Sizzle for a mo.\n| Prep [[Haddock|haddock]], if using. Soak in warm water for 5-10mins. Drain. Fleck the [[Fish|fish]] from the skin.\n| Turn your veg in the pan. Cover for a few mins, until softened.\n| Uncover. Add a slosh of [[Whisky|whisky]] (if using) and a lump of [[Butter|butter]]. Fold in the [[Garlic|garlic]], [[Leek|leek]] and [[Thyme|thyme]]. Turn to coat. Cook till nicely coloured up. Stir often.\n| Fold in [[Fish|fish]]. Add [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]]. Taste. Adjust seasoning. Finish with [[Lemon zest|lemon zest]] and [[Herbs|herbs]].\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nDelicious hot with a dollop of cr\u00e8me fraiche, a loaf of warm [[Bread|bread]], cold [[Butter|butter]] and a bottle of real [[Ale|ale]].\n==See also==\n* [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=M-oSFpW7538 'How to' video for this recipe]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Breakfast recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Gluten free recipes]]\n[[Category:Sea fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Abel and Cole veg box recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n{{Template:Abel and Cole veg box recipes attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#smokinneepsandtattieshash #butter #diced #garlic #haddock #whisky #smokedhaddock #leek #roots #oliveoil #fish </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Soft chocolate cake",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Soft chocolate cake, Gluten free recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#cherries #cocoa #chocolate #softchocolatecake #butter #gluten #eggs #kirsch #flour #egg #mash \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Might take a little longer than normal to make the cake...but it\u2019s worth it. Be patient!\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2798\n|PortionCalories = 279\n|DatePublished=27th October 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Servings: 10 - Makes one cake\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  1 hour\n|PrepTime =  20 minutes\n|CookTime =  40 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Soft chocolate cake.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Soft and squidgy</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Nice if you like very sweet cakes</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:NonLoggedInUser|NonLoggedInUser]] </span></span>\n}}\nMight take a little longer than normal to make the [[Cake|cake]]\u2026but it\u2019s worth it. Be patient!\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 140 g Fresh, dark [[Cherries|cherries]], pitted. (or use a tin or [[Frozen|frozen]])\n| 4 tablespoons [[Kirsch|kirsch]] de cuisine\n| 100g [[Butter|butter]], plus extra for the tin\n| 2 tablespoons [[Cocoa|cocoa]] (drinking [[Chocolate|chocolate]] won\u2019t do.)\n| 140 gm dark [[Chocolate|chocolate]] (70%) chopped\n| 100 gm [[Caster sugar|caster sugar]] (prefer golden myself..but it doesn\u2019t have to be)\n| 50g light [[Muscovado sugar]]\n| 4 large [[Eggs|eggs]], 2 separated\n| 1 teaspoon [[Vanilla extract|vanilla extract]]\n| 100 gm [[Ground almonds|ground almonds]] \n| 1 tablespoon [[Plain flour|plain flour]] ([[Gluten]] free works well)\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Gently heat the [[Cherries|cherries]] and [[Kirsch|kirsch]] in a small pan over a low heat until hot. Turn off the heat; cover the pan with lid or a saucer. Allow to cool. The [[Cherries|cherries]] will absorb the liquid. Stir occasionally. [[Mash]] a little or whiz with [[Stick blender|stick blender]], you don't want it to be too smooth.\n| [[Butter]] and base line only a 20cm springform tin. Dust with [[Cocoa|cocoa]], tip out any excess and reserve. Melt the [[Butter|butter]] and [[Chocolate|chocolate]] in a heatproof bowl set over a pan of barely [[Simmering|simmering]] water. Don't let the water touch the bottom of the bowl. When fully melted and smooth..allow to cool a little\u2026then stir in the [[Cherries|cherries]].\n| Whisk the [[Sugars|sugars]] and 2 whole [[Eggs|eggs]] and 2 [[Yolks|yolks]] until pale, thick and double in volume. Stick blenders are so good. Fold the [[Chocolate|chocolate]] mixture and the [[Vanilla|vanilla]] into the [[Egg|egg]]. Sift over the [[Almonds|almonds]], [[Flour|flour]] and any remaining [[Cocoa|cocoa]]\u2026fold well. \n| In a clean bowl, whisk the [[Egg whites|egg whites]] until stiff. Spoon 2 tablespoons of [[Egg white|egg white]]s into the main bowl to loosen. Then the remaining [[Egg|egg]] white. Work quickly and well until everything is well combined.\n| Spoon into the prepared tin and [[Bake|bake]] for 20-25 minutes or until a light crust has formed. \n| Allow to cool in the tin. It will sink and crack as it cools. Remove from the tin and dust with a little [[Cocoa|cocoa]] before serving.\n}}\n===Recipe source===\n* Recipe adapted from BBC Good Food. My adaptations in methods and use of [[Gluten|gluten]] free [[Flour|flour]]. Don\u2019t think it will [[Freeze|freeze]]. J Woodward\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:Gluten free recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#cherries #cocoa #chocolate #softchocolatecake #butter #gluten #eggs #kirsch #flour #egg #mash </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Crisp Parmesan cheese lattice nests recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#cheese #solidcrispycheesewafers #rollingpin #parmesan #spain #wafers #pancake #grated #tacos #cookipedia #recipesfromothersites \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=The recipe was created for D\u017eiugas cheeses by the famous food virtuoso from Spain, Mark Audibert\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 646\n|PortionCalories = 323\n|DatePublished=6th November 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  20 minutes\n|PrepTime =  5 minutes\n|CookTime =  15 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Solid crispy cheese wafers recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Not so good looking</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">They didn't look like this when I made them the second time, but they tasted fab.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n\n}}\n\nThe recipe was created for [[D\u017eiugas cheeses]] by the famous food virtuoso from [[Spain]], Mark Audibert.  [[D\u017eiugas cheeses]] have kindly given [[Cookipedia]] permission to use this recipe.\n\nAs well as looking stunning, these solid [[Cheese|cheese]] crips also taste fantastic. They look like solid cheese [[Tacos|tacos]] - mmm, now there's an idea!\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 150 g [[D\u017eiugas cheese]], finely [[Grated|grated]]\n| Spray of [[olive oil]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Finely grate the [[D\u017eiugas cheese]]\n| Heat a small non-stick [[Frying pan|frying pan]], ''the same size that you want the [[Wafers|wafers]] to be''.\n| Add a small spray of [[olive oil]]\n| Once the pan is hot enough to melt the [[Cheese|cheese]], sprinkle the cheese evenly over the surface of the pan in a thin layer.\n| Once the [[Cheese|cheese]] has crisped up, invert the pan over a [[Rolling pin|rolling pin]] and tap the cheese ''[[Pancake|pancake]] out on to the roller and allow it to cool and harden.\n}}\n===Variations===\nIf you cannot obtain [[D\u017eiugas cheese]], a good quality [[Parmesan]] will work equally well.\n===Chef's notes===\nThe [[Tefal one egg wonder 12 cm mini frying pan]] is absolutely the perfect size for this recipe.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Italian recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n[[Category:D\u017eiugas cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#cheese #solidcrispycheesewafers #rollingpin #parmesan #spain #wafers #pancake #grated #tacos #cookipedia #recipesfromothersites </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Sourdough bread pizza recipe",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=No dough Sourdough bread pizza recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#sourdoughbreadpizzarecipe #pizza #salami #redpepper #cheese #lemon #sourdoughbread #oliveoil #bread #sourdough #bake \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Not a true pizza, but this simple idea made a brilliant meal. I used sliced sourdough bread instead of pizza dough.\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=12th March 2017\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  45 minutes\n|PrepTime =  30 minutes\n|CookTime =  15 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 1606\n|PortionCalories = 803\n|Image = [[Image:Sourdough bread pizza recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">It's a cheat!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">But a great cheat \ud83e\udd21\ud83e\udd21\ud83e\udd21!</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry, aka Chef]])</span></span>\n}}\nA no-dough [[pizza]] using sliced sourdough bread and goodies from the fridge.  This made a brilliant meal.\n\nI thought I would make a [[Pizza|pizza]] using a [[Sourdough|sourdough]] loaf instead of [[dough]].  This was fantastic and will be made again and again.\n\nEach [[Pizza|pizza]] was made in a non-stick 20cm x 5cm flan flan tin which is deep enough to hold all that lovely runny [[Cheese|cheese]].\n\nDon't completely fill the base with bread or it will remain quite wet - you need to leave some space around so it can get crispy.\n\nUse whatever ingredients you fancy - [[Salami|salami]] worked well as the flavours run into the [[Bread|bread]].  Though it sounds odd, the slices of [[Lemon|lemon]] tempered the fatty [[Meat|meat]] and the [[Cheese|cheese]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 6 thick slices of white [[Sourdough bread|sourdough bread]] - crusts left on\n| 2 balls of [[Mozzarella cheese|mozzarella cheese]], drained and torn into pieces\n| 150g sliced [[Meat|meat]] such as [[Salami|salami]]\n| 4 very thick slices of [[Lemon|lemon]], skin on but pips removed\n| 1 [[Red pepper|red pepper]] from a bottle of jarred [[Roasted red peppers|roasted red peppers]], chopped into small pieces\n| Lots of freshly torn [[Basil leaves|basil leaves]] - almost &#190; of the plant pictures went into the 2 [[Pizzas|pizzas]]\n| [[Freshly ground black pepper]]\n| Lots of [[Extra virgin Olive oil|extra virgin olive oil]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6), [fan oven 180\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Sourdough bread pizza ready to bake.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Assembled, ready to bake\nImage:Sourdough bread pizza recipe ingredients.jpg|thumb|300px|right|The ingredients, the nectarine was unused in the end.\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Lightly [[Oil|oil]] the base of the [[Pie|pie]] / flan dishes\n| Place 3 slices of [[Sourdough bread|sourdough bread]] in each tin\n| Drizzle with [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and sprinkle with [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n| Layer the sliced [[Meat|meat]], chopped [[Red pepper|red pepper]] and torn [[Mozzarella|mozzarella]] to fill the tin, finding places to bury the [[Lemon slices|lemon slices]]\n| Drizzle with [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| [[Bake]] for 15 minutes in the middle of the [[Oven|oven]] set to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6)\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with a [[Green salad|green salad]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Italian recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Cookery cheats]]\n[[Category:Pizza recipes]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#sourdoughbreadpizzarecipe #pizza #salami #redpepper #cheese #lemon #sourdoughbread #oliveoil #bread #sourdough #bake </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

I used it in a much larger quantity that I would with a normal salad\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 211\n|PortionCalories = 52\n|DatePublished=2nd October 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  3 minutes\n|PrepTime =  3 minutes\n|CookTime = None\n|Image = [[Image:Yogurt salad dressing recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Superb</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I need say no more. \ud83d\ude0b\ud83d\ude0b\ud83d\ude0b</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nI made this with some leftover [[Sour cream|sour cream]] and it was delicious. title": "Sous-vide chili cheese turkey crown",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Sous-vide chili cheese turkey crown\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#turkey #onion #dry #herbs #spices #frozen #roast #defrost #parsonsnose #cheeserecipes #sageleaves\n|description=Sounds weird, but I assure you, its fabulous. If the flavours disturb you, leave the spices out and make it sage and onion\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=23rd January 2021\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 7\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  10 hours, 15 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  10 hours\n|TotalCalories = 1897\n|PortionCalories = 271\n|Image = [[Image:Sous vide turkey crown with roasties.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Fabulous</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Last week we did beef in this marinade and it was better than the turkey.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nSounds weird, but I assure you, it's fabulous.\n\nIf the flavours disturb you, then just leave the [[Spices|spices]] out and make it with just [[Sage|sage]] and [[Onion|onion]].\n\nI've found that it's cooked perfectly well after 5 hours, but I like to leave it for about ten hours so the flavours penetrate properly.  It won't dry out during the extended cooking time if it's cooked [[Sous-vide|sous-vide]]. This is probably the most succulent way we've found to cook turkey.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 medium [[Frozen|frozen]] [[Turkey]] Crown \n| 1 [[Onion|onion]]\n| Bunch of [[Sage leaves|sage leaves]]\n| A sprig of fresh [[Thyme leaves|thyme leaves]]\n| 2 tablespoons of [[Taste Sensation Chili Cheese marinade]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Thoroughly [[Defrost|defrost]] the [[Turkey|turkey]] crown in a cool place.\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Peel and chop the [[Onion|onion]]\n| Wash and [[Dry|dry]] the [[Fresh herbs|fresh herbs]]\n| Add the chopped [[Onion|onion]], [[Herbs|herbs]] and [[Taste Sensation Chili Cheese Marinade Powder]] to the [[Sous-vide|sous-vide]] bag\n| Carefully rinse the [[Turkey|turkey]] crown in warm water and pat [[Dry|dry]] with [[Paper towels|paper towels]]\n| Using [[Poultry shears|poultry shears]] or good scissors, remove and discard the flap of fatty skin at the rear of the bird, where the [[Parson's nose]] was.\n| Add the [[Turkey|turkey]] crown to the [[Sous-vide|sous-vide]] bag and shake well to allow the [[Spices|spices]] and [[Herbs|herbs]] to be evenly distributed throughout.\n| [[Vacuum seal]] and cook in the [[Sous-vide bath|sous-vide bath]] for 10 hours at 67\u00b0 C\n| Serve immediately, no need to [[Rest|rest]] the bird when it's cooked this way.\n| The juices make a nice spicy [[Gravy|gravy]] when added 50/50 to chicken [[gravy granules]] &#128520;.\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Sous vide turkey crown, carved.jpg|Carved!\nImage:Sous-vide turkey crown after ten hours.jpg|After ten hours in the bath\nImage:Nacho cheese sous-vide turkey crown.jpg| Coated with herbs and spices and ready for 10 hours in the bath\nImage:Aldi medium turkey crown.jpg | Medium turkey crown from Aldi\n</gallery>\n\n===Serving suggestions===\nOn the day of cooking, we like to serve the [[Turkey|turkey]] as a [[Roast|roast]] with all the trimmings.  The second and third days, it's lovely with a [[Salad|salad]] or in [[Pittas|pittas]].\n===Variations===\nSlice up a whole leak and add it to the [[Sous-vide|sous-vide]] bag with lots of [[Herbs|herbs]] so the flavours permeate the [[Turkey|turkey]].\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Tex-Mex recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Chilli pepper recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Sous vide recipes]]\n[[Category:Sous vide cooking]]\n[[Category:Taste Sensation recipes]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n{{Template:Sous Vide, Smoking and Curing UK}}\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#turkey #onion #dry #herbs #spices #frozen #roast #defrost #parsonsnose #cheeserecipes #sageleaves</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Sous-vide duck breast with treacly bacon and orange",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Sous-vide duck breast with treacly bacon and orange\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#duck #bacon #staranise #orange #sousvideduckbreastwithtreaclybaconandorange #treacle #recipes #blacktreacle #peppercorns #sousviderecipes #vacuumbag\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=Our local butchers, Russells of Upwell, make their own lovely treacly bacon, nice, thick fatty back bacon with a huge hit of treacle and molasses. They..\n}}\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=28th November 2022\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  10 hours, 10 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime =  10 hours\n|TotalCalories = 420\n|PortionCalories = 210\n|Image = [[Image:Sousvide duck breast with treacly bacon and orange recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">So tender</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Almost like soft liver, Yum!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Sue_spins|Susie]] </span></span>\n}}\nOur local [[Butchers|butchers]], [[Russell's Butchers of Upwell, Norfolk]], make their own [[Treacle Cured Bacon from Russell's of Upwell's|Treacle Cured Back Bacon]], nice, thick fatty back bacon with a huge hit of [[Treacle|treacle]] and [[Molasses|molasses]].  They also produce fabulous [[Duck|duck]] breasts.  I thought a combination of the two, with the addition of a few extra flavours might be nice.\n\nThe results were fantastic, despite the long cooking time and the relatively high cooking temperature the duck was soft and tender and full of flavour.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 large [[Duck|duck]] breast, skin on\n| 1 thick slice of [[Treacle Cured Bacon from Russell's of Upwell's|Treacle Cured Back Bacon]]\n| 4 whole [[Star anise|star anise]]\n| 5 [[Szechuan peppercorns|szechuan peppercorns]], crushed\n| 5 [[Black peppercorns|black peppercorns]], crushed\n| &#189; a large [[Orange|orange]], cut into thick slicers, skin left on\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Roll the [[Duck|duck]] breast in the mixture of [[Ground|ground]] [[Peppercorns|peppercorns]]\n| Place the [[Bacon|bacon]] on the fleshy side of the [[Duck|duck]] breast\n| Cover the [[Bacon|bacon]] with the [[Orange|orange]] slices\n| Place in a sous-vice [[Vacuum bag|vacuum bag]]\n| Scatter the [[Star anise|star anise]] over the [[Oranges|oranges]]\n| Vacuum seal and cook in a [[Sous-vide bath|sous-vide bath]] for 10 hours at 82\u00b0C (179.6\u00b0F)\n| Drain the fat and discard the star-anise\n| If you wish you can crisp up the skin (and the bacon) by searing in a hot pan, skin-side down in a hot pan for 4 minutes\n| Slice thinly before serving\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage: Sous-vide duck breast shredded and chopped.jpg|Duck breast chopped and shredded ready to serve\nImage:Sous-vide duck breast pan seared with treacly bacon and orange.jpg|Bacon and duck seared in the pan to crisp the skin\nImage:Treacly bacon and orange duck breast searing in the pan.jpg|Make sure the bacon is crispy too\nImage:Vacuum sealed duck breast with treacly bacon orange and star-anise.jpg|Vacuum sealed ready for bath-time!\nImage:Russell's Treacly Bacon Slices.jpg|[[Treacle Cured Bacon from Russell's of Upwell's]]\n</gallery>\n===Serving suggestion===\nServe with [[curly fries]] and a selection of vegetables\n===Variations===\nIf you can't get hold of [[treacly bacon]], use thick fatty back bacon and a teaspoon of [[Black treacle|black treacle]]\n===Chef's notes===\nI would normally advise cooking a [[Sous-vide|sous-vide]] [[Duck|duck]] breast for only 4 hours at a much lower temperature so the result is medium-rare, however to distribute the [[Duck fat|duck fat]] within th emeat and to spread the flavours, my experiments have show a higher temperature for longer, produces much nicer results.\n===See also===\n* [[Russell's Butchers of Upwell, Norfolk]]\n* [[Treacle Cured Bacon from Russell's of Upwell's]]\n\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Game recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Poultry recipes]]\n[[Category:Sous vide recipes]]\n[[Category:Sous vide cooking]]\n{{Template:Sous Vide, Smoking and Curing UK}}\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#duck #bacon #staranise #orange #sousvideduckbreastwithtreaclybaconandorange #treacle #recipes #blacktreacle #peppercorns #sousviderecipes #vacuumbag</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }

title": "Sous-vide fillet steak with Cambozola and mushrooms",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Sous-vide fillet steak with Cambozola and mushrooms\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#steak #tastesensation #cheese #filletsteak #mushrooms #vacuumseal #portobellomushrooms #cambozolacheese #vacuumbag #mexicanrecipes #spicyrecipes\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=This is a fabulous way to cook Fillet fillet steak Sous-sous-vide. The mushrooms keep the meat moist and the cheese add a lovely subtle flavour.\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=24th April 2022\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  4 hours, 5 minutes\n|PrepTime =  5 minutes\n|CookTime =  4 hours\n|TotalCalories = 436\n|PortionCalories = 218 \n|Image = [[Image:Sousvide fillet steak with Cambozola and mushrooms recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Wow, just WOW!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">This is DIVINE!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Sue_spins|Susie]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis is a fabulous way to cook [[Fillet steak|fillet steak]] [[Sous-vide|sous-vide]].  The [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]] keep the [[Meat|meat]] moist and the [[Cheese|cheese]] add a lovely subtle flavour.\n\nI've added a little extra flavours with the [[Taste Sensation]] [[Tex-Mex seasoning|tex-mex seasoning]].\n\nUnfortunately this looked so good when we served it that I forgot to take a picture!\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 200g best [[Fillet steak|fillet steak]]\n| 2 large [[Portobello mushrooms|portobello mushrooms]], thickly sliced\n| 50g [[Cambozola cheese]] cut into two slices\n| 1 tablespoon [[Taste Sensation]] [[Tex-Mex seasoning|tex-mex seasoning]]\n| Good pinch of [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Wrap the [[Steak|steak]] in [[Cling-film|cling-film]] and bash the steak flat using a [[Rolling pin|rolling pin]].\n| I've found that the shrink wrapped steaks can be bashed in their packaging.\n| Roll the flattened [[Steak|steak]] in the [[Black pepper|black pepper]] and [[Tex-Mex seasoning]]\n| Place the seasoned [[Steak|steak]] in the [[Vacuum bag|vacuum bag]] with the sliced [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]] and and place the two slices of [[Cheese|cheese]] on top\n| [[Vacuum seal]] and cook for 4 hours at 65\u00b0 C\n| This time and temperature gives a medium well cooked [[Steak|steak]] that if as juicy as a raw steak. Lovely!\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\n</gallery>\n\n===Serving suggestions===\nOne smallish fillet steak cooked in this manner was perfectly sufficient for two people especially iuf served with lots of vegetables.\n\nServe with [[Potatoes|potatoes]] and [[Vegetables|vegetables]] of your choosing\n===Chef's notes===\nAlthough the quantity of the [[Tex-Mex seasoning]] seems a lot, it makes for a nicely seasoned [[Steak|steak]], not hot at all.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Mexican recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Beef recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Chilli pepper recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Sous vide recipes]]\n[[Category:Sous vide cooking]]\n{{Template:Sous Vide, Smoking and Curing UK}}\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#steak #tastesensation #cheese #filletsteak #mushrooms #vacuumseal #portobellomushrooms #cambozolacheese #vacuumbag #mexicanrecipes #spicyrecipes</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Sous-vide Phillycheese rib-eye steaks",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Sous-vide Phillycheese rib-eye steaks\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#tastesensation #spicyrecipes #phillycheesesteak #tastesensationltd #tastesensationphillycheesesteakseasoning #spices #sousvidecooking #tastesensationrecipes #meatrecipes #sousvide\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=The classic American 'steak dog' flavoured with Taste Sensation's own seasoning mix.\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=13th December 2020\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  4 hours, 10 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime =  4 hours\n|TotalCalories = 1098\n|PortionCalories = 549\n|Image = [[Image:Sousvide Phillycheese ribeye steaks recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Sous-vide forever</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Without doubt, the best way to cook beef</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]])</span></span>\n}}\nNick Lumby, founder and proprietor of [[Taste Sensation Ltd]] (my chosen [[Supplier|supplier]] for [[Herbs|herbs]], [[Spices|spices]] and rubs), sometimes sends me taster samples of his upcoming products when I place an order with him. As the [[Taste Sensation Philly cheesesteak seasoning]] is not currently on [https://tastesensationltd.com/shop the Taste Sensation website] or on [https://www.amazon.co.uk/s?i=merchant-items&me=A3AGJ26L1FKXJR the list of his products available from Amazon UK], I have to assume it's a new product line.\n\nI've decided to use this [[Spice|spice]] mix by cooking the [[rib-eye steak]][[Sous-vide|sous-vide]], as apart from [[Barbecuing|barbecuing]], I think it is the best way to bring out the flavours of the [[Meat|meat]]. It also keeps it nice and moist.\n\nIf you are '''not''' going to cook the [[Meat|meat]] [[Sous-vide|sous-vide]], leave the steaks covered in the rub for at least a few hours at room temperature before cooking.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 2 x 225g Aldi 21 day matured [[Rib-eye steaks]] from Ashfield Farms\n| 2 tablespoons [[Taste Sensation]] Philly Cheesesteak seasoning\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Shake about 3 tablespoons of the [[Taste Sensation]] Philly Cheesesteak seasoning evenly on to a dinner plate\n| Press the steaks onto the rub and ensure they are evenly and well coated\n| Add both of the [[Rib|rib]]-eye steaks to one [[Sous-vide|sous-vide]] [[Vacuum bag|vacuum bag]]\n| [[Vacuum seal]] and cook in the [[Sous-vide bath|sous-vide bath]] at 68\u00b0C for 4 hours\n| Remove the bag and serve immediately\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Vacuum sealed Philly rib-eye Cheesesteak.jpg\nImage:Taste Sensation Philly Cheesesteak being seasoned.jpg\nImage:Taste Sensation Philly Cheesesteak seasoning plated.jpg\nImage:Taste Sensation Philly Cheesesteak seasoning bag details.jpg\n</gallery>\n\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Chips|chips]], and [[Vegetables|vegetables]] of your choice.\n\n===Chef's notes===\nI originally cooked the steaks at 64\u00b0C for 3 hours; they were very nice but not done well enough for the interconnecting tissues to break down so I have increased the temperature and cooking time slightly.\nNice seasoning mix. \n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:North American recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Sous vide recipes]]\n[[Category:Taste Sensation recipes]]\n[[Category:Sous vide cooking]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n{{Template:Sous Vide, Smoking and Curing UK}}\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#tastesensation #spicyrecipes #phillycheesesteak #tastesensationltd #tastesensationphillycheesesteakseasoning #spices #sousvidecooking #tastesensationrecipes #meatrecipes #sousvide</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Sous-vide pork fillet",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Sous-vide pork fillet\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#porkfillet #frozen #pork #lager #applesauce #marinade #apple #tastesensationlimejuicepowder #wine #tenderloin #cooker\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=A little Sous-sous-vide experiment using some very reasonable Aldi frozen Scottish Pork pork fillet tenderloin (\u00a36.69 per kg) and some odds that were..\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=11th December 2020\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Served with [[squash mash]], [[Sous-vide garlicy Brie mushrooms]] and pan-fried courgettes\n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  12 hours\n|PrepTime =  9 hours\n|CookTime =  3 hours\n|TotalCalories = 1446\n|PortionCalories = 361\n|Image = [[Image:Sousvide pork fillet recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Still fairly tough \ud83e\udd2b</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">3</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Pork fillet is normally so tender and I've had a few failures with the Aldi pork fillet - must try this again with meat farmed from out local butchers.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry, aka Chef]])</span></span>\n}}\nA little [[Sous-vide|sous-vide]] experiment using some very reasonable Aldi [[Frozen|frozen]] Scottish [[Pork fillet|pork fillet]] [[Tenderloin|tenderloin]] (\u00a36.69 per kg) and some odds that were laying about in the [[Freezer|freezer]].\n\nI will only cook the [[Tenderloin|tenderloin]] [[Sous-vide|sous-vide]] for a maximum of 3 hours, but I am going to [[Vacuum seal|vacuum seal]] the fillet and [[Marinade|marinade]] for about 6 hours.\n\nI've [[Vacuum sealed|vacuum sealed]] the [[Frozen|frozen]] [[Pork|pork]] 1 heaped teaspoon of [[Taste Sensation Lime Juice Powder]] together with 170 ml of frozen home-made [[Apple sauce|apple sauce]] and a splash of frozen Stella [[Lager|lager]]. (A good cook never throws any food away!)\n\nFor the '[[Marinade|marinade]]' I put the [[Frozen|frozen]] vac-sealed [[Apple|apple]]-[[Pork|pork]] filet in the [[Sous-vide|sous-vide]] [[Cooker|cooker]] at it's lowest setting [45\u00b0C - 113\u00b0F] for about 6 hours.  Jiggle it now and then.  That should allow the acid in the [[Fruit|fruit]] to penetrate the [[Meat|meat]].\n\nFor the final cook, remove the [[Pork fillet|pork fillet]] from the vac-bag , wipe the [[Pork|pork]] fillet with a [[Paper towel|paper towel]] and roll it in the powdered [[Herbs|herbs]] - reseal and cook [[Sous-vide|sous-vide]] for 3 hours at 58\u00b0C - 136\u00b0F\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 500g [[Pork tenderloin fillet|pork tenderloin fillet]]\n| 170 ml home-made [[Apple sauce|apple sauce]]\n| 2 teaspoons [[Taste Sensation Lime Juice Powder]]\n| A splash of [[Wine|wine]] or [[Lager|lager]]\n}}\n====powdered herb mixture====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 1 tablespoon [[Paprika|paprika]]\n| 1 heaped teaspoon of [[Taste Sensation Tomato powder]] \n| 1 heaped teaspoon [[Jaggery|jaggery]] or [[Demerara sugar|demerara sugar]]\n| &#189; teaspoon [[Sea Salt|sea salt]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Caraway seeds|caraway seeds]]\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Spiced pork fillet cooked.jpg|Sliced; nice and tasty but still a little tough \ud83d\ude10\nImage:Spiced pork fillet ready for the final cook.jpeg|The spice rubbed, marinated pork fillet ready for the final 3 hours at 58\u00b0C\nImage:Pork fillet marinated in apple sauce.jpg|Pork fillet after marinating in apple sauce for 6 hours in the sous-vide bath\nImage:Powdered marinade mixture.jpg|The ground mixed herb rub, ready for the pork\nImage:Marinade mixture.jpg|The herb rub before grinding\nImage:Pork fillet marinade vac-sealed.jpg|Pork fillet vacuum sealed and ready to marinade for 6 hours in the sous-vide bath. \nImage:Sous-vide tenderloin fillet marinade frozen ingredients.jpg|Pork tenderloin fillet, ready to vacuum seal and marinade.\nImage:Sous-vide tenderloin fillet marinade basic ingredients.jpg|Basic ingredients for the maridade process.\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| [[Marinade]] the [[Pork fillet|pork fillet]] for as long as you can in the [[Apple sauce|apple sauce]], [[Lime juice|lime juice]] powder and a little [[Lager|lager]], [[Wine|wine]] or even [[Sherry|sherry]].  I've used my [[Sous-vide|sous-vide]] [[Cooker|cooker]] on ait's lowest setting to do this.\n| When you are ready to cook, discard the [[Apple|apple]] mixture, [[Dry|dry]] the [[Pork fillet|pork fillet]] and roll in the [[Herb|herb]] mixture.  [[Vacuum seal]] again and cook in the [[Sous-vide bath|sous-vide bath]] for 3 hours at  58\u00b0C - 136\u00b0F\n}}\n\n===Serving suggestions===\nWe're serving this with [[Courgettes|courgettes]], [[Squash mash|squash mash]] and [[Sous-vide|sous-vide]] [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]] cooked in [[Brie|brie]] and [[Garlic|garlic]].\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:German recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Taste Sensation recipes]]\n[[Category:Sous vide recipes]]\n[[Category:Sous vide cooking]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n{{Template:Sous Vide, Smoking and Curing UK}}\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#porkfillet #frozen #pork #lager #applesauce #marinade #apple #tastesensationlimejuicepowder #wine #tenderloin #cooker</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }

title": "Sous-vide rib-eye steak curry",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Sous-vide rib-eye steak curry\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#currysauce #rib #frozen #vacuumseal #spicyrecipes #britishrecipes #sousviderecipes #meatrecipes #sousvideribeyesteakcurry #curry #beefrecipes\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=Using pre-frozen portions of my famous Curry curry sauce and a couple of small rib-eye steaks, I thought I would try an attempt at a Sous-sous-vide..\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=14th August 2020\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  4 hours 5 minutes\n|PrepTime =  5 minutes\n|CookTime = 4 hours\n|TotalCalories = 2576\n|PortionCalories = 1288 \n|Image = [[Image:Sousvide ribeye steak curry recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Superb \ud83c\udf5b\ud83c\udf5a\ud83e\udd69 </span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Tender and tasty!</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nUsing pre-[[Frozen|frozen]] portions of my famous [[Curry sauce|curry sauce]] and a couple of small [[Rib|rib]]-eye steaks, I thought I would try an attempt at a  [[Sous-vide|sous-vide]] [[Curry|curry]].\n[[Image:Sous vide ribeye steak curry ready to cook.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Prepared, ready to cook tomorrow]]\n\nBeing pre-[[Frozen|frozen]] makes it easy to [[Vacuum seal|vacuum seal]] as there is relatively little liquid, which is normally a problem if you are vacuum sealing.\n\nThe process is very simple and you could always use a commercial [[Curry sauce|curry sauce]] rather than make your own.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 2 portion of [[Frozen|frozen]] [[Curry sauce|curry sauce]] - about 150 to 200 ml\n| 2 x 200 g [[Rib|rib]]-eye steaks\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Individually [[Vacuum seal|vacuum seal]] the [[Rib|rib]]-eye steaks and [[Curry sauce|curry sauce]]\n| Cook [[Sous-vide|sous-vide]] for 4 hours at 65\u00b0 C\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Plain boiled rice|plain boiled rice]] and [[Toasted|toasted]] [[Naan breads|naan breads]]\n\n===Chef's notes===\nI vacuum sealed the steaks the night before and allowed the curry sauce to defrost in the fridge overnight.  You could cook from frozen; just add an extra 30 minutes cooking time for the defrosting to occur in the sous-vide cooker.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Indian recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Beef recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Sous vide recipes]]\n[[Category:Sous vide cooking]]\n{{Template:Sous Vide, Smoking and Curing UK}}\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#currysauce #rib #frozen #vacuumseal #spicyrecipes #britishrecipes #sousviderecipes #meatrecipes #sousvideribeyesteakcurry #curry #beefrecipes</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }

title": "Sous-vide rib-eye steak with red pepper onions and sage",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Sous-vide rib-eye steak with red pepper onions and sage\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#onion #redpepper #blackpepper #sageleaves #steak #chips #sousvideribeyesteakwithredpepperonionsandsage #sousvidecooking #salad #sear #cutofbeef \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A little experiment with our favourite Cut of cut of beef and a few simple flavourings. Ive used one large Rib-eye rib-eye steak (370 g) which will be..\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=19th September 2017\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  10 hours, 25 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  10 hours, 10 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 1244\n|PortionCalories = 622\n|Image = [[Image:Sousvide ribeye steak with red pepper onions and sage recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Those chips look great</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">..and the steak is not bad either! \ud83d\udc96</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nA little experiment with our favourite [[Cut of beef|cut of beef]] and a few simple flavourings.\n\nI've used one large [[Rib-eye Steak|rib-eye steak]] (370 g) which will be plenty for 2 people.\n\nThis piece of [[Steak|steak]] has been flavoured with 4 slices of [[Onion|onion]], 4 small slices of [[Red pepper|red pepper]] and 4 large [[Sage leaves|sage leaves]]. The only other flavouring is a good pinch of [[Black pepper|black pepper]].  Don't add any [[Salt|salt]] as this would just dehydrate the steak as it cooks.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 370 g [[Rib-eye Steak|rib-eye steak]]\n| 4 slices of [[Onion|onion]]\n| 4 small slices of [[Red pepper|red pepper]]\n| 4 large [[Bay leaves|bay leaves]]\n| A good pinch of [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Sous vide at 62\u00b0 C for 10 hours.jpg|Cook sous vide at 62\u00b0 C for 10 hours\nImage:Rib-eye steak onion sage and red pepper sealed.jpg|Rib-eye steak onion sage and red pepper sealed\nImage:Rib-eye steak onion sage and red pepper ready.jpg|Rib-eye steak onion sage and red pepper\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Sprinkle the steaks with a good pinch of [[Black pepper|black pepper]] - no [[Salt|salt]]!\n| Layer the [[Onion|onion]] slices, [[Red pepper|red pepper]] and [[Sage leaves|sage leaves]] over either side of the steaks.\n| [[Vacuum seal]] the [[Steak|steak]] in a [[Sous-vide|sous-vide]] bag\n| Cook [[Sous-vide|sous-vide]] for 10 hours at 62\u00b0 C [143\u00b0 F]\n| Remove the [[Steak|steak]] from the bag\n| Reserve the juices if you want to make [[Gravy|gravy]] from them\n| Discard the [[Onion|onion]], [[Pepper|pepper]] and [[Sage leaves|sage leaves]]\n| Quickly [[Sear|sear]] the steaks for a minute on each side in a hot, lightly oiled [[Frying pan|frying pan]] or with a [[Blowtorch|blowtorch]]\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Chips|chips]], [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]] and a little [[Salad|salad]].\n===Chef's notes===\nBy all means cook 2 separate steaks, in 2 sous-vide bags.\n\n[[Air fried]] [[Chips|chips]] are best with this!\n\nThis was very nice, looked well-done but tasted rare.  Would like to try the same recipe but with a teaspoon of butter added to the sous-vide bag.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Beef recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Sous vide recipes]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n[[Category:Sous vide cooking]]\n{{Template:Sous Vide, Smoking and Curing UK}}\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#onion #redpepper #blackpepper #sageleaves #steak #chips #sousvideribeyesteakwithredpepperonionsandsage #sousvidecooking #salad #sear #cutofbeef </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Sous-vid gammon steaks with plum and apple sauce\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#gammonsteaks #applesauce #roastpotatoes #sousvidecooking #maincourses #chinese #plumsauce #fruitrecipes #sousviderecipes #vegetables #meatrecipes\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=Gammon gammon steaks cooked with a British and Chinese flavours\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=7th February 2021\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  6 hours, 5 minutes\n|PrepTime =  5 minutes\n|CookTime =  6 hours\n|TotalCalories = 682\n|PortionCalories = 341 \n|Image = [[Image:Sousvid gammon steaks with plum and apple sauce recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Fabulous use of apple sauce</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">This tasted even better than it looks!</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry, aka Chef]]</span></span>\n}}\n[[Bramblebee Farms]] do the most fantastic [[Gammon steaks|gammon steaks]] which in all honesty, don't need to be cooked with any flavourings, unlike some of the saltier supermarket cuts, but I do like experimenting with my cooking!\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 2 x medium sized [[Gammon steaks|gammon steaks]]\n| 200 ml home-made [[Apple sauce|apple sauce]]\n| 3 tablespoons [[Plum sauce|plum sauce]] - [[Chinese]] supermarkets have the best range of these\n| 2 tablespoons [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Add all of the ingredients to a [[Sous-vide|sous-vide]] [[Vacuum bag|vacuum bag]] and seal\n| Cook in a [[Sous-vide bath|sous-vide bath]] for 65\u00b0C for 6 hours\n| Reserve the cooking juices and use to make up a gravy\n| A few tablespoons of gravy granules and a minute or so in the moicrowave made a fabulous gravy\n| Heat a [[griddleplate]] or [[grill pan]] on very high and [[caramelise]] the steaks for a minute or so\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Gammon finishing on the griddle plate.jpg|Finishing off on the griddle plate\nImage:Gammon with plum and apple sauce ready to cook.jpg|Ready to cook sous-vide with an example of the sauces in the background\n</gallery>\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Roast potatoes|roast potatoes]], [[Vegetables|vegetables]] of your choice and use the cooking juices as a rich [[Gravy|gravy]].\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Sous vide recipes]]\n[[Category:Sous vide cooking]]\n{{Template:Sous Vide, Smoking and Curing UK}}\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#gammonsteaks #applesauce #roastpotatoes #sousvidecooking #maincourses #chinese #plumsauce #fruitrecipes #sousviderecipes #vegetables #meatrecipes</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

Mum had circled this recipe\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2421\n|PortionCalories = 605\n|DatePublished=20th January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = All about Herrings - 1948\n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime = 1 hour 30 minutes\n|PrepTime = 15 minutes\n|CookTime = 1 hour 15 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:All_about_Herrings.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">A bit lie rollmops</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">(I think)</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n\nFrom the Ministry of Food leaflet \"All about Herrings\" - reprinted in 1948!\n\nMum had circled this recipe.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 8 [[herrings]], cleaned and boned\n| 4oz [[onion]], sliced\n| 1 level tablespoon of [[mixed pickling spice]]\n| 1 [[bay leaf]]\n| 1 level teaspoon [[salt]]\n| &#189; pint [[vinegar]]\n| &#189; pint water\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Roll up the fish with a slice of [[onion]] inside each one\n| Place in a baking dish\n| Scatter the [[pickling spices]] between the rolls and put in the [[bay leaf]], then add the remaining [[onion]]\n| Sprinkle the [[salt]] over all the fish and pour in the [[vinegar]] and water which have been mixed together. Bake in a slow oven (150\u00b0 C / 300\u00b0 F / Gas 2) for  1 &frac14; hours\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\n\nServe hot or cold\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Herrings]]\n[[Category:Fish recipes|Herrings]]\n[[Category:Sea fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses|Herrings]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes|Herring]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#onion #bayleaf #vinegar #herrings #picklingspices #mixedpicklingspice </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Sous vide bacon wrapped chicken filled with garlic and cheese",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Sous vide bacon wrapped chicken filled with garlic and cheese recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#bacon #chicken #chickenbreasts #smoked #cheese #chickenbreast #butter #sousvidebaconwrappedchickenfilledwithgarlicandcheese #favouriterecipes #sousvidebath #sousvide \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Anne made Cheese stuffed pancetta chicken breasts for me last year and I tried a sous vide version , Sous vide prosciutto wrapped chicken\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1059\n|PortionCalories = 529\n|DatePublished=7th March 2016\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  2 hours, 25 minutes\n|PrepTime =  20 minutes\n|CookTime =  2 hours, 5 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Sous vide bacon wrapped chicken filled with garlic and cheese recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Gloriously garlicy</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">The flavours in this are immense, especially if you love garlic; and who doesn't? :-)</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nAnne made [[Cheese stuffed pancetta chicken breasts]] for me last year and I tried a sous vide version , [[Sous vide prosciutto wrapped chicken stuffed with garlicky parsley butter]] which was a bit of a failure.\n\nThis is a [[Bacon|bacon]] version and was a fabulous success.\n\nOnce the [[Chicken|chicken]] has been cooked surrounded by the [[Bacon|bacon]], the bacon clings tightly to the chicken allowing it to be finished by pan [[Frying|frying]].\n\nTake care to choose 2 equal sized [[Chicken breasts|chicken breasts]] if you are buying them pre-packaged.  Mine were obscured by the label, resulting in one huge piece and one rather small.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 2 [[Chicken breasts|chicken breasts]] of equal size\n| 8 rashers of [[Smoked|smoked]] streaky [[Bacon|bacon]] - fatty bacon is the trick to keeping the [[Chicken|chicken]] moist.\n| 5 [[Cloves of Garlic, peeled and crushed|cloves of garlic, peeled and crushed]]\n| 1 tablespoon of [[Butter|butter]]\n| 2 slices of your favourite [[Cheese|cheese]]. I used a [[Smoked|smoked]] cheese which went rather well\n| A pinch of [[Mixed herbs|mixed herbs]]\n| Pinch of [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Carefully cut a pocket into each [[Chicken breast|chicken breast]]\n| Mix the [[Butter|butter]], [[Crushed garlic|crushed garlic]], [[Herbs|herbs]], [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]] into a paste, divide it in two and fill the pockets with the mixture\n| Add the [[Cheese|cheese]] slices\n| Roll the [[Chicken|chicken]] up in the [[Bacon|bacon]]\n| Pop each [[Chicken breast|chicken breast]] into its own [[Sous Vide|sous vide]] bag and [[Vacuum seal|vacuum seal]]\n| Cook in a [[Sous vide bath|sous vide bath]] heated to 64\u00b0 C (147\u00b0 F) for 2 hours\n| Remove from the bag, reserving any [[Juice|juice]] to make gravy.\n| Pan [[Fry|fry]] in a hot pan for 3 or 4 minutes until golden [[Brown|brown]],\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Pan frying to crisp the bacon.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Pan frying to crisp the bacon\nImage:Chicken wrapped in bacon and vacuum sealed.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Wrapped in bacon and vacuum sealed\n</gallery>\n===Serving suggestions===\nWe had these with [[Air fried roast potatoes]] and steamed broccoli and a little [[gravy]]\n===Recipe source===\nThis much improved recipe is a version of my failed [[Sous vide prosciutto wrapped chicken stuffed with garlicky parsley butter]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Poultry recipes]]\n[[Category:Sous vide recipes]]\n[[Category:Sous vide cooking]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n{{Template:Sous Vide, Smoking and Curing UK}}\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#bacon #chicken #chickenbreasts #smoked #cheese #chickenbreast #butter #sousvidebaconwrappedchickenfilledwithgarlicandcheese #favouriterecipes #sousvidebath #sousvide </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }

title": "Sous vide beef prime topside joint",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",

                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Beef prime topside sous vide cooked to medium rare recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#sousvide #englishmustard #springonions #sousvidecooking #meattenderiser #bayleaves #fat #herbs #sage #blowtorch #vacuumseal \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=The sous vide recipe cooks prime topside for 10 hours at 57\u00b0 C for a medium rare finish.  It's cooked with garden herbs and English mustard\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1700\n|PortionCalories = 425\n|DatePublished=3rd March 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Cooked at 57\u00b0 (''134.6\u00b0F'') for 10 hours, tender and juicy but not bloody.\n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  10 hours, 5 minutes\n|PrepTime =  5 minutes\n|CookTime =  10 hours\n|Image = [[Image:Sous vide prime topside beef joint recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">A special treat</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">This tastes as good as it looks.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nAn experiment at [[sous vide]] cooking a beef roasting joint to rare/medium rare. This is being cooked for a friend for looking after our boys - Meow!\n\nCook [[Sous vide|sous vide]] for 10 hours at 57\u00b0C (''134.6\u00b0F'')\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 625 g prime topside - The underside had a layer of [[Fat|fat]] which I left intact after much work with the tenderiser.\n| 4 [[Spring onions|spring onions]]\n| Bunch of [[Sage|sage]]\n| 2 [[Bay leaves|bay leaves]]\n| Bunch of [[Thyme|thyme]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[English mustard]]\n| Pinch of [[Salt|salt]] and [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:TalkSous vide salmon cut silverside beef joint recipe.jpg|Apparently it was delicious!\nImage:Beef prime topside sous vide medium rare sealed.jpg|Bagged and sealed\nImage:Beef prime topside sous vide medium rare.jpg|The basics\nImage:Tom and Jerry say thanks Micky.jpg|Tom and Jerry say thank you Micky\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Stamp the join all over with a [[Meat tenderiser|meat tenderiser]]\n| Seal one end of a vacuum bag\n| Add a pinch of [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]\n| Paint the joint with 1 tablespoon of [[English mustard]]\n| Add the joint to the bag, hold it closed and shake it to distribute the [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]\n| Arrange the [[Spring onions|spring onions]] and [[Herbs|herbs]] equally around the joint\n| [[Vacuum seal]]\n| Cook [[Sous vide|sous vide]] for 10 hours at 57\u00b0C (''134.6\u00b0F'')\n| After 10 hours, open the bag and discard everything but the beef, you might have to pick some of the twiggy bits out as they can get 'buried'\n| Seal the joint for 2 minutes in a very hot pan that is lightly oiled, [[blowtorch]] can also be used\n| Serve immediately, or refrigerate and store for cold sliced beef\n}}\n{{SousVideSeeAlso}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Beef recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Sous vide recipes]]\n[[Category:Sous vide cooking]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#sousvide #englishmustard #springonions #sousvidecooking #meattenderiser #bayleaves #fat #herbs #sage #blowtorch #vacuumseal </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Sous vide chicken liver pate",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Sous vide chicken liver pate recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#pate #butter #sousvide #springonions #chickenliver #chickenlivers #refrigerator #vacuumpack #ramekindish #lardons #sousvidecooking \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This was a sous vide experiment to see if I could make chicken liver pate with the absolute minimum of effort. This was really easy\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1572\n|PortionCalories = 157\n|DatePublished=20th February 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Fillet steaks stuffed with chicken liver pate\n|Servings = Serves 10\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  10 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime = None\n|Image = [[Image:Sous vide fillet steak with chicken liver pate recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Such a valuable accessory</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">This is fabulous and I could not live with out my Sous Vide cooker now.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}}\n\nThis was a [[Sous vide|sous vide]] experiment to see if I could make [[Chicken liver|chicken liver]] [[Pate|pate]] with the absolute minimum of effort.  This was really easy to make and was a great success, so much so I used it as [[Stuffing|stuffing]] for [[Sous vide fillet steak with chicken liver pate]].\n[[Image:Pate filled fillet steaks.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Filling with pate]]\nThis is a great 'template' for many versions of [[Pate|pate]]. The temperature and cooking times are work well enough to cook all of the ingredients to the desired consistency, just and mess about with ingredients of your choice.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 300g [[Chicken livers|chicken livers]]\n| 100g [[Lardons|lardons]]\n| 3 [[Spring onions|spring onions]], finely chopped\n| 4 [[Cloves of Garlic, peeled and crushed|cloves of garlic, peeled and crushed]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Brandy|brandy]]\n| 2 tablespoons [[Port|port]]\n| Good pinch of [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]\n| 3 tablespoons of [[Butter|butter]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Remove the white centres of the livers and any connective tissues and roughly chop them.\n| Mix all of the ingredients together.\n| Seal one end of a [[Vacuum pack|vacuum pack]] bag and add the [[Pate|pate]] mix.\n| [[Vacuum seal]] the bag\n| Cook in a [[Sous vide|sous vide]] bath for 8 hours at 70\u00b0C (''158\u00b0F'')\n| As soon as the [[Pate|pate]] is cooked, melt the [[Butter|butter]] over a gentle heat.\n| Pack the [[Pate|pate]] into a [[Ramekin dish|ramekin dish]] and pour the melted  [[Butter|butter]] over the top.\n| Store in the [[Refrigerator|refrigerator]].\n}}\n{{SousVideSeeAlso}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Poultry recipes]]\n[[Category:Cookery cheats]]\n[[Category:Sous vide recipes]]\n[[Category:Sous vide cooking]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#pate #butter #sousvide #springonions #chickenliver #chickenlivers #refrigerator #vacuumpack #ramekindish #lardons #sousvidecooking </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Sous vide Cumberland sausages in onion soup with red lentils",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Sous vide Cumberland sausages in onion soup with red lentils recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#onion #lentils #soup #sausages #slowcooker #sousvidebath #sousvide #sousvidecumberlandsausagesinonionsoupwithredlentils #boil #clovesofgarlic #redlentils \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This recipe would probably work just as well in a slow cooker, but as I've cracked my crockpot, sous vide it is. I browned the sausages first\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 391\n|PortionCalories = 195\n|DatePublished=21st February 2016\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  8 hours, 15 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  8 hours\n|Image = [[Image:Sous vide Cumberland sausages in onion soup with red lentils recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Probably overkill!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.7</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Works fine, but probably easier done in a pan.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis recipe would probably work just as well in a [[Slow cooker|slow cooker]], but as I've cracked my [[Crockpot|crockpot]], [[Sous Vide|sous vide]] it is.\n\nI [[Browned|browned]] the [[Sausages|sausages]] first just so they have a little colour.  Cooked at 71\u00b0C (''159.8\u00b0F''), the [[Lentils|lentils]] would still not be properly cooked so I [[Boiled|boiled]] them for 10 minutes first.  Different lentils may need longer cooking.\n\nI've used Debbie & Andrew's Cumberland [[Sausages|sausages]], but any good quality would do.\n\nI found the Heinz [[Onion|onion]] [[Soup|soup]] to be too sweet for my test so I would try an alternative next time.  A total success nonetheless.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 pack (6) [[Debbie and Andrew's Butcher's Classic Cumberland Sausages]]\n| 140 g [[Dried|dried]] [[Red lentils|red lentils]]\n| 1 small [[Red onion|red onion]], peeled and finely chopped\n| 4 [[Cloves of garlic|cloves of garlic]], peeled, smashed and chopped\n| Pinch of [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 1 can [[French]] [[Onion]] [[Soup|soup]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Pop the [[Sous vide bath|sous vide bath]] on to preheat to 71\u00b0C (''159.8\u00b0F'')\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Rinse the [[Lentils|lentils]] in cold running water then [[Boil|boil]] for 10 minutes, skim and discard any scum. , test them before bagging up as they won't get much softer being cooked [[Sous-vide|sous-vide]].\n| Drain them in a [[Sieve|sieve]].\n| Toss the [[Sausages|sausages]], [[Onion|onion]] and [[Garlic|garlic]] in a hot pan just enough to colour the sausages. Don't let them begin to cook through. \n| Sprinkle with [[Black pepper|black pepper]] and add to a [[Sous Vide|sous vide]] bag\n| Add the [[Onion|onion]] [[Soup|soup]] and [[Lentils|lentils]] to the bag and vacuum seal. If using the [[Andrew James Professional Quality Vacuum Food Sealer Machine]]: [[Vacuum seal]], then cancel, then manually seal, allows you to vacuum seal a liquid without drawing it all into the vacuum chamber.\n| Cook in a [[Sous vide bath|sous vide bath]] for 8 hours at 71\u00b0C (''159.8\u00b0F'')\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Sous vide sausages lentils onion soup ingredients.jpg|300px|thumb|right|Simple ingredients\nImage:Sous vide sausages lentils onion soup bagged up.jpg|300px|thumb|right|Vacuum sealed, ready for the bath\n</gallery>\n===Serving suggestions===\nThis went nicely with crusty [[Bread|bread]] to [[Dip|dip]] with.\n===Variations===\nYou could cook this in a [[Slow cooker|slow cooker]] on low for about 4 hours.\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Soup and stock recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Slow cooker recipes]]\n[[Category:Sous vide recipes]]\n[[Category:Debbie&andrew's sausage recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n[[Category:Sous vide cooking]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n{{Template:Sous Vide, Smoking and Curing UK}}\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#onion #lentils #soup #sausages #slowcooker #sousvidebath #sousvide #sousvidecumberlandsausagesinonionsoupwithredlentils #boil #clovesofgarlic #redlentils </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
