title": "Sous vide duck pizza",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Sous vide duck pizza recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#pizza #sousvideduckpizza #duck #hoisinsauce #pizzas #pizzadough #sauce #sousvide #mozzarella #cheese #oliveoil \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Any excuse to use my homemade sous-vide cooker because it makes meat so tender. duck is a great candidate for this method of cooking\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 5358\n|PortionCalories = 1339\n|DatePublished=8th April 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Just enough for one, leaving the last quarter for tomorrow's snack.\n|Servings = Serves 4 - Makes 2 pizzas\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  3 hours, 30 minutes\n|PrepTime =  20 minutes\n|CookTime =  3 hours, 10 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Sous vide duck pizza recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Wow!!!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">That looks SO good!</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nAny excuse to use my homemade [[Homemade sous-vide slow cooker conversion kit|homemade sous vide sous vide cooker]] because it makes [[Meat|meat]] so tender.  [[Duck|duck]] is a great candidate for this as I find sometimes if it's cooked rare, it can be a bit chewy.  This has been [[Sous vide|sous vide]]  cooked for 3 hours at 56.5\u00b0C (''133.7\u00b0F'').  [[Seared]], skin side only to release excess [[Fat|fat]] and then allowed to cool and then sliced thinly and added to the [[Pizza|pizza]]. It was a lot of work but it was delicious. \n\nOne 170g [[Duck|duck]] breast was enough for two [[Pizzas|pizzas]], I [[Sous vide|sous vide]] cooked two and froze the unused one for next weeks duck [[Pizza|pizza]].\n\nI added a teaspoon of [[Hoisin sauce|hoisin sauce]] to the vacuum bag as I think it goes so well with [[Duck|duck]].  That's a personal taste so I guess it is optional.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 170g [[Duck|duck]] breast, skin on.\n| 1 teaspoon [[Hoisin sauce|hoisin sauce]]\n| 1 portion [[Pizza dough|pizza dough]]\n| 4 tablespoons of [[Tomato sauce for pizza|tomato sauce for pizzas]]\n| 250g [[Mozzarella cheese|mozzarella cheese]]\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| A pinch of [[Dried oregano|dried oregano]]\n| A drizzle of [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\nIf using a pizza stone, preheat the pizza stone under a very hot grill for about 20 minutes. Place it about 8cm (3\") from the heat source.\n\nIf using the oven, preheat it to 220\u00b0 C (425\u00b0 F - gas 7)\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Sous vide duck pizza.jpg|Fresh out of the oven\nImage:Sous vide duck pizza tomato topping.jpg|Spreading out the topping\nImage:Sous vide duck pizza ready for the oven.jpg|Ready for the oven\nImage:Sous vide duck pizza one breast.jpg|One breast, two pizzas\nImage:Sous vide duck pizza seared.jpg|Duck breast seared\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| [[Vacuum seal]] the [[Duck|duck]] breast together with 1 teaspoon of [[Hoisin sauce|hoisin sauce]]\n| Cook in a [[Sous vide bath|sous vide bath]] for 3 hours at 56.5\u00b0C\n| Remove from the vacuum bag, discarding the [[Sauce|sauce]], it will have done its job and flavoured the [[Meat|meat]].\n| Allow to [[Rest for|rest for]] 10 minutes.\n| Heat a [[Frying pan|frying pan]] over a medium high flame\n| Wipe any [[Sauce|sauce]] from the skin side of the [[Duck|duck]] breast and [[Sear|sear]] (skin side only) in the hot pan for 3 minutes without adding any extra [[Oil|oil]].\n| Allow to cool and slice thinly.  This can all be done way ahead of cooking the [[Pizza|pizza]].\n| Dust your work surface with [[Fine yellow cornmeal|fine yellow cornmeal]]\n| Divide the [[Pizza dough|pizza dough]] into two and roll out into two thin 25.5 cm (10 inch) [[Pizzas|pizzas]]\n| You can leave them in a [[Warm place|warm place]] for an hour or so to rise. I quite like them cooked immediately they are rolled out for a more crispy finish.\n| Prick the [[Pizza|pizza]] all over with a fork. This prevents it puffing up too much and burning while it is cooking\n| With a deft move, slide the [[Pizza|pizza]] from the [[Pizza peel|pizza peel]], on to the preheated [[Pizza stone|pizza stone]].\n| Cook on one side only for about 2 minutes or until lightly [[Browned|browned]].\n| Repeat for the other side.\n| Remove from the [[Oven|oven]] and spread the pizza with 2 tablespoons of [[Tomato sauce for pizza|tomato sauce for pizza]].\n| Crumble a ball of [[mozzarella]] cheese over the pizza and top with the sliced duck.\n| Season with salt, pepper a drizzle of olive oil and a pinch of oregano.\n| Return to the [[Oven|oven]] and bake until the [[Cheese|cheese]] is nicely melted. This should take about 4 minutes under a grill on a pizza stone, if oven baking, about 15 minutes in the middle of the oven.\n| Repeat for the second [[Pizza|pizza]].\n| Keep the first [[Pizza|pizza]] warm at the bottom of the [[Oven|oven]] whilst you make the second.\n}}\n===See also===\n* [[Sous vide hoisin duck pizza]]\n* [[Crispy duck and hoisin pizza]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Italian recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Poultry recipes]]\n[[Category:Pizza recipes]]\n[[Category:Sous vide recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Sous vide cooking]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#pizza #sousvideduckpizza #duck #hoisinsauce #pizzas #pizzadough #sauce #sousvide #mozzarella #cheese #oliveoil </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Sous vide fillet steak with chicken liver pate",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Sous vide fillet steaks filled with chicken liver pate recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#steak #sousvide #pate #butter #meattenderiser #specialfriedrice #miseenplace #vacuumpack #sousvidefilletsteakwithchickenliverpate #filletsteaks #vacuumseal \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Having made some coarse sous vide chicken liver pate, I thought I would use it as a filling for my sous vide fillet steaks\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1502\n|PortionCalories = 751\n|DatePublished=20th February 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  15 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime = None\n|Image = [[Image:Sous vide fillet steak with chicken liver pate recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Easily worth the effort</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Delicious and not as hard to make as I thought it would be.  Always glad of ideas to use my sous-vide cooker.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nHaving made some coarse [[sous vide chicken liver pate]], I thought I would use it as a filling for my [[sous vide]] fillet steaks.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 2 [[Fillet steaks|fillet steaks]], about 200g [7 oz ] each\n| 3 tablespoons [[Chicken liver|chicken liver]] [[Pate|pate]]\n| 2 teaspoons [[Butter|butter]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat the [[Sous vide|sous vide]] bath to cook the steaks to your liking:\n{| class=\"wikitable\" class=\"sortable wikitable\"\n|-\n!width=\"280pt\"|'''Cooked'''\n!width=\"60pt\"|'''Thick'''\n!width=\"80pt\" colspan=\"2\"|'''Cooking temp.'''\n!width=\"120pt\"|'''Time (min)'''\n!width=\"120pt\"|'''Time (max)'''\n|-\n|Rare|\n|25mm ||49\u00b0C||''120.2\u00b0F''||1 hour||4 hours\n|-\n|Rare||50mm ||49\u00b0C||''120.2\u00b0F''||2 hours||4 hours\n|-\n|Medium rare||25mm ||56.5\u00b0C||''133.7\u00b0F''||1 hour||4 hours\n|-\n|Medium rare||50mm ||56.5\u00b0C||''133.7\u00b0F''||2 hours||4 hours\n|-\n|Medium||25mm ||60\u00b0C||''140\u00b0F''||1 hour||4 hours\n|-\n|Medium||50mm ||60\u00b0C||''140\u00b0F''||2 hours||4 hours\n|-\n|Medium well||25mm ||65.5\u00b0C||''149.9\u00b0F''||1 hour||4 hours\n|-\n|Medium well||50mm ||65.5\u00b0C||''149.9\u00b0F''||2 hours||4 hours\n|-\n|Well done||25mm ||71\u00b0C||''159.8\u00b0F''||1 hour||4 hours\n|-\n|Well done||50mm ||71\u00b0C||''159.8\u00b0F''||2 hours||4 hours\n|}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Vacuum packed fillets with butter.jpg|Vacuum packed fillet steaks, topped with a knob of butter\nImage:Pate filled fillet steaks.jpg|Fillet steaks filled with chicken liver pate\nImage:Tenderised fillet steaks.jpg|Fillet steaks treated with a [[meat tenderiser]]\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| With a sharp knife, carefully make a pocket in each of the fillets buy cutting into the side of the steaks.\n| Stamp each [[Steak|steak]] with a [[Meat tenderiser|meat tenderiser]] to ensure a really tender steak.  Pay special attention to areas where there are membranes.\n| Pop a tablespoon and a half of [[Pate|pate]] into each [[Steak|steak]].\n| Close the pockets and press the steaks flat.\n| Add a teaspoons of [[Butter|butter]] on the top of each [[Steak|steak]].\n| Put each [[Steak|steak]] into its own [[Vacuum pack|vacuum pack]] bag and [[Vacuum seal|vacuum seal]].\n| Cook the steaks in the [[Sous vide|sous vide]] bath set to a temperature to match your preferred doneness. ''see [[Chef's notes]]''\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nThese go well with anything but as a nod the The [[Chinese]] New Year I'm serving these with [[Special fried rice|special fried rice]]\n===Chef's notes===\nObviously two steaks cannot easily be cooked to different levels of doneness as this is determined by the temperature of the [[Sous vide|sous vide]] bath, not by the cooking time, although I've found that an extended cooking time tenderises the [[Meat|meat]] more.\n\nI've also found that a well done [[Steak|steak]] cooked [[Sous vide|sous vide]] has the same juiciness and mouth feel of a normally cooked rare steak.  If you require rare and well done steaks, I would cook them both to medium [60\u00b0C for 2 hours].  You won't get any complaints!\n{{SousVideSeeAlso}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Beef recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Sous vide recipes]]\n[[Category:Sous vide cooking]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#steak #sousvide #pate #butter #meattenderiser #specialfriedrice #miseenplace #vacuumpack #sousvidefilletsteakwithchickenliverpate #filletsteaks #vacuumseal </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }

title": "Sous vide hoisin duck pizza",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Sous vide duck pizza hosin sauce mozzarella cheese recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#hoisinsauce #pizza #pizzadough #pizzas #chillioil #cherrytomatoes #sousvidecooking #mozzarellacheese #sousvide #sauce #warmplace \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Sous vide duck is cooked to medium then crisped on a pizza base under the grill.\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2843\n|PortionCalories = 710\n|DatePublished=23rd march 2016\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment =\n|Servings = Serves 4 - Makes 2 pizzas\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  3 hours, 30 minutes\n|PrepTime =  20 minutes\n|CookTime =  3 hours, 10 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Sous vide duck pizza alt recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Perfect!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">If you like pizza and you like Chinese, you'll just love this!</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry, aka Chef]])</span></span>\n}}\nWe've made [[sous vide]] duck [[pizzas]] before but the difference to this one was using [[hoisin sauce]] in place of the tomato topping. Very ''[[Chinese]]''!\n[[Image:Sous vide duck pizza alt.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Sous vide hoisin duck pizza, ready to bake]]\n\nWe used the [[Gressingham duck breast portions]] which are quite small at 125g each and also end up quite wet.  Fresh duck breast is quite dry and firm.  Still an exceptionally good pizza. \n\n'''for the sous vide duck breasts'''\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1 pack [[Gressingham duck breast portions]] (2 x 125g duck breasts)\n| 1 tablespoon hoisin sauce \n}}\n\n'''for the pizza'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 1 portion [[pizza dough]]\n| 30 ml [[Hoisin sauce|hoisin sauce]]\n| 1 portion [[Pizza dough|pizza dough]]\n| 2 sliced sous vide duck breasts\n| 8 [[cherry tomatoes]]\n| 2 balls of [[Mozzarella cheese|mozzarella cheese]]\n| [[Sea salt]]\n| Freshly ground [[black pepper]]\n| 2 teaspoons [[Chilli oil]]\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\nIf using a pizza stone, preheat the pizza stone under a very hot grill for about 20 minutes. Place it about 8cm (3\") from the heat source.\n\nIf using the oven, preheat it to 220\u00b0 C (425\u00b0 F - gas 7)\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| [[Vacuum seal]] the [[Duck|duck]] breasts together with 1 tablespoon easpoon of [[Hoisin sauce|hoisin sauce]]\n| Cook in a [[Sous vide bath|sous vide bath]] for 3 hours at 61\u00b0C [141\u00b0F]\n| Remove from the vacuum bag, discarding the [[Sauce|sauce]], it will have done its job and flavoured the [[Meat|meat]].\n| Slice the duck breast and lay on a paper towel to remove any excess water - these packaged duck breasts seem to be pumped full of water\n| Dust your work surface with [[Fine yellow cornmeal|fine yellow cornmeal]]\n| Divide the [[Pizza dough|pizza dough]] into two and roll out into two thin 25.5 cm (10 inch) [[Pizzas|pizzas]]\n| You can leave them in a [[Warm place|warm place]] for an hour or so to rise. I quite like them cooked immediately they are rolled out for a more crispy finish.\n| Prick the [[Pizza|pizza]] all over with a fork. This prevents it puffing up too much and burning while it is cooking\n| With a deft move, slide the [[Pizza|pizza]] from the [[Pizza peel|pizza peel]], on to the preheated [[Pizza stone|pizza stone]].\n| Cook on one side only for about 2 minutes or until lightly [[Browned|browned]].\n| Repeat for the other side.\n| Remove from the [[Oven|oven]] and cover the pizza base with a good drizzle of [[hoisin sauce]]\n| Crumble a ball of [[mozzarella]] cheese over the pizza\n| Top with the sliced duck and 4 halved [[cherry tomatoes]]\n| Season with salt, pepper a drizzle of [[chilli oil]]olive\n| Return to the [[Oven|oven]] and bake until the [[Cheese|cheese]] is nicely melted. This should take about 4 minutes under a grill on a pizza stone, if oven baking, about 15 minutes in the middle of the oven.\n| Repeat for the second [[Pizza|pizza]].\n| Keep the first [[Pizza|pizza]] warm at the bottom of the [[Oven|oven]] whilst you make the second.\n}}\nOnce the pizzas had been cooked a lot of water was released from the duck.  I just mopped this up with a [[paper towel]] and the pizza was still fabulous.  Fresh duck breasts would not do this.\n===See also===\n*[[Sous vide duck pizza]]\n* [[Crispy duck and hoisin pizza]], similar but with tomato topping\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Italian recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Poultry recipes]]\n[[Category:Pizza recipes]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n[[Category:Sous vide recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Sous vide cooking]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#hoisinsauce #pizza #pizzadough #pizzas #chillioil #cherrytomatoes #sousvidecooking #mozzarellacheese #sousvide #sauce #warmplace </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Sous vide medallions of venison",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Sous vide recipe: medallions of venison \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#butter #sousvide #meattenderiser #sousvidecooking #bayleaf #venison #sousvidebath #sousvidemedallionsofvenison #vacuumsealed #vacuumseal #restingmeat \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=We got these venison medallions from V. J. Game - Sussex Smokers on their first visit to Hall Place Farmers Market cooked them sous vide in butter and herbs\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 636\n|PortionCalories = 318\n|DatePublished=5th May 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  8 hours, 15 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  8 hours\n|Image = [[Image:Sous vide medallions of venison recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">A good looking meal!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.6</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">That tastes fantastic.  Really creamy.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nWe got these [[Venison|venison]] medallions from [[V. J. Game - Sussex Smokers]] on their first visit to [[Hall Place Farmers' Market, Bexley, Kent]].\n\nI thought they might be nice, simply cooked [[Sous vide|sous vide]] in just [[Salt|salt]], [[Pepper|pepper]], [[Butter|butter]] and a [[Bay leaf|bay leaf]].\n\nFrom the experiments I have done when [[Sous vide cooking|sous vide cooking]], I've found if the temperature is kept relatively low the cooking period does not seem to be so important.  In fact, I would say that the longer it is cooked, the more tender the [[Meat|meat]].  Rather like [[Slow cooking|slow cooking]], the extended cooking time helps to break down the collagens into a nice [[Sauce|sauce]].\n\nBecause the [[Meat|meat]] is [[Vacuum sealed|vacuum sealed]], the meat is never dry, even after 3 hours of cooking.\n\nCompared to normal [[Meat|meat]] cooking when a rare [[Steak|steak]] can be bloody and not tender, even meat cooked [[Sous vide|sous vide]] to medium well done still has the moisture and mouthfeel of a rare steak, but without the blood. I'm going for 58.5\u00b0C for 3 hours.\n===Ingredients===\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 2 [[Venison|venison]] ([[Deer|deer]]) medallions - about 140 g each\n| 2 [[Bay leaves|bay leaves]]\n| 2 tablespoons of [[Butter|butter]]\n| [[Salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Stamp the medallions with a [[Meat tenderiser|meat tenderiser]] if you have one.\n| Pat the medallions dry, dress with a pinch of [[Salt|salt]] and freshly [[Ground|ground]] black  [[Pepper|pepper]], add a knob of [[Butter|butter]] and a [[Bay leaf|bay leaf]] and then [[Vacuum seal|vacuum seal]].\n| Cook in a [[Sous vide bath|sous vide bath]] at 56.5\u00b0C (''133.7\u00b0F'') for 3 hours\n| Remove from the vacuum pouch, reserving the juices to add to the gravy.  I used them to make a mushroom sauce.\n| [[Sear]] in a hot pan to finish, ideally with a [[Blowtorch|blowtorch]].\n| Serve immediately.  (Unlike conventionally cooked [[Meat|meat]], I've never found a benefit to [[Resting meat|resting meat]] cooked [[Sous vide|sous vide]])\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Venison Deer medallion vacuum sealed.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Vacuum sealed\nImage:Venison Deer medallions meat tendersier.jpg|thumb|300px|right|[[Meat tenderiser]] with the ingredients\n</gallery>\n===Chef's note===\nThe medallions were moist and had a really tender mouthfeel, taste and texture almost like liver.  Very nice.\n\nI'm sure some cuts of venison may take a lot longer to cook, but these were selected cuts and very tender to start with.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Game recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Sous vide recipes]]\n[[Category:Sous vide cooking]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#butter #sousvide #meattenderiser #sousvidecooking #bayleaf #venison #sousvidebath #sousvidemedallionsofvenison #vacuumsealed #vacuumseal #restingmeat </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Sous vide pork tenderloin with garlic and apple",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Sous vide pork tenderloin with garlic and apple recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#gravy #broccoli #sousvideporktenderloinwithgarlicandapple #sageleaves #porktenderloin #pork #vacuumseal #cheat #porktenderloinfillet #tomatoes #springonions \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This is an aide-memoir for me so I can repeat this delicious sous vide dish. I bought the pork tenderloin to make this dish\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 634\n|PortionCalories = 317\n|DatePublished=14th December 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  6 hours, 10 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime =  6 hours\n|Image = [[Image:Sous vide pork tenderloin with garlic apple recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Super lazy way to cook pork</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">And dead easy too, you just need the bath to cook it in.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis is an aide-memoir for me so I can repeat this delicious dish.\n[[Image:Sous vide pork tenderloin with garlic and apple recipe.jpg|thumb|right|300px|Vacuum sealed, ready for the sous-vide bath]]\n\nI bought the [[Pork tenderloin|pork tenderloin]] to make this dish, but then used a mixture of odds and ends to add as flavouring while the [[Pork|pork]] cooked.  Once cooked, the cooking juices were reserved for adding to [[Gravy|gravy]], all of the additional items were discarded.\n\nIf you have a [[Sous-vide|sous-vide]] bath then use it as a guide and add ingredients of your choosing.  Great for using up odd left-overs.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 Whole [[Pork tenderloin fillet|pork tenderloin fillet]] (about 400 g)\n}}\n==== additional items added for flavouring====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 4 [[Cloves of Garlic, peeled and crushed|cloves of garlic, peeled and crushed]]\n| 2 tablespoons home-made [[Apple sauce|apple sauce]]\n| 10 fresh [[Sage leaves|sage leaves]]\n| 3 whole [[Spring onions|spring onions]]\n| 2 medium [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]], chopped\n| Pinch of [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Calvados|calvados]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Add all of the ingredients to a vacuum bag and squish them up so they mix well.\n| [[Vacuum seal]] the bag\n| Cook in a [[Sous-vide|sous-vide]] bath for 6 hours at 65\u00b0 C\n| Cut the corner off the bag and drain juices to make [[Gravy|gravy]]\n| Open the bag and remove the [[Tenderloin|tenderloin]].  Ensure you remove any odd [[Sage leaves|sage leaves]] etc.\n| Cut into medallions.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Gravy|gravy]] made from the juices, [[Roast potatoes|roast potatoes]] and [[Broccoli|broccoli]].\n===Variations===\n[[Cheat]] with the [[Gravy|gravy]]:  Use [[Gravy granules|gravy granules]] and use the [[Broccoli|broccoli]] water mixed with the cooking juices as the liquid.  Mix well and [[Microwave|microwave]] for a few minutes to heat up.\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Sous vide recipes]]\n[[Category:Sous vide cooking]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#gravy #broccoli #sousvideporktenderloinwithgarlicandapple #sageleaves #porktenderloin #pork #vacuumseal #cheat #porktenderloinfillet #tomatoes #springonions </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Sous vide prosciutto wrapped chicken stuffed with garlicky parsley butter",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Sous vide prosciutto wrapped chicken stuffed with garlicky parsley butter recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#parsley #chickenbreasts #prosciutto #sousvideprosciuttowrappedchickenstuffedwithgarlickyparsleybutter #butter #blowtorch #clovesofgarlic #chickenbreast #seared #peas #vacuumseal \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This recipe should be perfectly suited to Sous-sous-vide cooking, however, in the end it was rather disappointing, however, I wont give up\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 778\n|PortionCalories = 389\n|DatePublished=6th February 2016\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  1 hour 20 minutes\n|PrepTime =  20 minutes\n|CookTime =  1 hour\n|Image = [[Image:Sous vide prosciutto wrapped chicken stuffed with garlicky parsley butter recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Don't bother!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">3</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Lots of work for what were rather poor results.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n{{Template:WorkInProgress}}\nThis recipe unfortunately was a huge failure.  I tried again, this time with bacon and the result was marvellous: see [[Sous vide bacon wrapped chicken filled with garlic and cheese]]\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 2 large [[Chicken breast|chicken breast]] fillets\n| 1 packet of [[Prosciutto|prosciutto]] [[Ham|ham]] (10 very thin slices)\n| Big handful of fresh [[Parsley|parsley]] including stems, finely chopped\n| 1 tablespoon [[Butter|butter]]\n| 4 [[Cloves of garlic|cloves of garlic]], peeled and roughly chopped (or to taste)\n| Pinch  of [[Sea Salt|sea salt]]\n| Good pinch of [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Garlic chicken ready to sous vide.jpg|Wrapped, vacuum sealed and ready to sous-vide\nImage:Stuffing the chicken breasts.jpg|Stuffing the chicken breasts with garlic herb butter\nImage:Making the garlic herb butter.jpg|Making the garlic herb butter\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Add the [[Garlic|garlic]], [[Parsley|parsley]], [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]] to a [[Mortar and pestle|mortar and pestle]] and smash to a pulp\n| Add the [[Butter|butter]], smash it to combine with the [[Herbs|herbs]]\n| Cut a couple of pockets into the [[Chicken breasts|chicken breasts]] and stuff with the [[Garlic butter|garlic butter]]\n| Lay out the [[Prosciutto|prosciutto]] slices and roll up the [[Chicken breasts|chicken breasts]]\n| Pop into plastic bags and [[Vacuum seal|vacuum seal]]\n| Cook in a preheated [[Sous-vide|sous-vide]] bath at 64\u00b0C (''147.2\u00b0F'') for 1 hour\n| When cooked the proscuitto packets can be [[Seared|seared]] in a hot pan or by a [[Blowtorch|blowtorch]]. \n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Boiled potatoes|boiled potatoes]], [[Peas|peas]] and [[Sweetcorn|sweetcorn]] kernels.\n===Chef's notes===\nThis was rather disappointing in the end and also rather dry in comparison with meat usually cooked sous vide. The chicken breasts I used had been previously frozen, I wonder if that might have made a subtle difference.\n\nI will persist with this and make some changes, a little [[sherry]] might make a difference.\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:French recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Poultry recipes]]\n[[Category:Sous vide recipes]]\n[[Category:Sous vide cooking]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#parsley #chickenbreasts #prosciutto #sousvideprosciuttowrappedchickenstuffedwithgarlickyparsleybutter #butter #blowtorch #clovesofgarlic #chickenbreast #seared #peas #vacuumseal </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Sous vide salmon cut silverside beef joint",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Sous vide salmon cut silverside beef joint recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#beef #butter #salmon #englishmustard #sousvide #sousvidecooking #sousvidesalmoncutsilversidebeefjoint #roastpotatoes #rest #blowtorching #blowtorch \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Today I'm sous vide cooking a 750g joint of salmon cut silverside beef, a common roasting beef joint that is idea for cooking this way\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}}\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1606\n|PortionCalories = 401\n|DatePublished=25th February 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Served with Roasties, Yorkies, peas and onion gravy.\n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  10 hours, 15 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  10 hours\n|Image = [[Image:Sous vide salmon cut silverside beef joint recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Melts in your mouth</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I found this one of the best ways to cook cheap cuts of beef.  They are so soft and still juicy.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis time I [[Sous vide cooking|sous vide cooked]] a 750g joint of [[Salmon|salmon]] cut silverside [[Beef|beef]], a common [[Roasting|roasting]] joint.  It was simply seasoned, just coated it with [[English mustard|english mustard]] and [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]].\n\nIt was cooked at 60\u00b0C (''140\u00b0F'') for 10 hours and finished by sauteing in a little [[Butter|butter]] while [[blowtorching]] it.\n\nIt was delicious and tender though I think next time I'll go a little rarer.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 750 g [[Salmon|salmon]] cut silverside [[Beef|beef]] joint\n| 1 tablespoon ready made [[English mustard]]\n| &#189; teaspoon [[Sea Salt|sea salt]]\n| &#189; teaspoon [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Butter|butter]]\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Sous vide salmon cut silverside carved.jpg|Carved, rather poorly!\nImage:Sous vide salmon cut silverside.jpg|Vacuum sealed and ready for the bath\nImage:Sous vide silverside mustard coated.jpg|Coated with English mustard , salt and pepper\nImage:Sous vide silverside Mark Thompson.jpg|Cooked as described in Mark Thompson's comments\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Sprinkle the [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]] onto a plate and roll the [[Beef|beef]] joint in the mixture to coat evenly.\n| Paint the [[Mustard|mustard]] all over the outside of the joint.\n| [[Vacuum seal]] the [[Beef|beef]] joint.\n| Cook in a [[Sous vide|sous vide]] bath for 10 hours at 60\u00b0C (''140\u00b0F'') for medium done. ''58\u00b0 for medium-rare; see notes below''.\n| When ready to serve, heat a [[Frying pan|frying pan]] with 1 teaspoon of [[Butter|butter]] and roll the joint around the hot pan for a minute or so to [[Brown|brown]].  I'm also using my wonderful mapp [[Blowtorch|blowtorch]] at the same time, just for the fun of it.\n| I don't bother to [[Rest|rest]] [[Sous vide|sous vide]] cooked [[Meat|meat]], it seem fine directly from the bath.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Roast potatoes|roast potatoes]], [[Peas|peas]], [[Yorkshire puddings|yorkshire puddings]] and [[Onion gravy|onion gravy]].\n===Reader's comments===\n''Thanks for the post. Much appreciated as a relative newcomer to the whole sous vide experience.''\n\n''I love experimenting and found your article extremely helpful.''\n\n''I went one better, I hope, at least, in some respect.  Keeping it simple I bought a 2.5 kg  Silverside beef joint from tesco in St Helens whilst at half price.  I followed the basic tenet that it's not weight but thickness that counts.  My silverside salmon cut(ish) joint was probably 4 inches thick at its widest and not much wider than the joint in the recipe at leat I am basing this roughly on the pics provided.  Rather than vacuum seal it I cooked it in a ziploc bag overnight. When i got up it had been cooking for 8 hours and had reached an internal temp of 58C.  I resealed the bag and cooked it for the extra 2 hours as advised. I got home a bit late, approx 30 mins. Temp at this point was still 58 degrees, but not as tough, I assumed, allowing for cooling, when the thermometer probe was pushed into the meat. Chilled in fridge over next 6 hours, no rapid  chilling  !!''\n\n''Meat on slicing was cooked to medium doneness and stock made a lovely gravy with mushrooms and onion.''\n\n''In reality I also prefer a medium rare cut but the wife is not a big beef lover, hence my attempt to please.  As it happens, she didn't appreciate it and left the meat, but she tried to please.''\n\n''So, as the original author suggested, a lower temp may well be required and adviseable for a medium rare doneness.''\n\n'''Mark Thompson - March 2018'''\n{{SousVideSeeAlso}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Beef recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Sous vide recipes]]\n[[Category:Sous vide cooking]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#beef #butter #salmon #englishmustard #sousvide #sousvidecooking #sousvidesalmoncutsilversidebeefjoint #roastpotatoes #rest #blowtorching #blowtorch </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Sous vide Tex-Mex pork tenderloin fillet",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Sous vide Tex-Mex pork tenderloin fillet recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#herbs #onion #spice #porktenderloin #sousvide #porkfillet #porktenderloinfillet #blowtorch #tacoseasoning #sousvidetexmexporktenderloinfillet #blend \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Pork tenderloin cooked sous-vide is glorious. Tender and juicy with a hint of spice and herbs. I actually cooked this for another recipe, Cheatin' pork enchiladas as I needed pre cooked tenderloin\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 465\n|PortionCalories = 232\n|DatePublished=1st March 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  9 hours, 15 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  9 hours\n|Image = [[Image:Sous vide TexMex pork tenderloin fillet recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Sort and spicy</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">This is exsquisite. The only downside is that you do need a sous vide cooker.  If you've got one, then start cooking!</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Pork tenderloin]] cooked [[Sous-vide|sous-vide]] is glorious.  Tender and juicy with a hint of [[Spice|spice]] and [[Herbs|herbs]].  I actually cooked this for another recipe, [[Cheatin' pork enchiladas]] as I needed pre cooked [[Tenderloin|tenderloin]].  This would be fabulous cooked as it is but if you are going to use it in another recipe, try to avoid overcooking the pork in the second recipe or you will lose the benefit of cooking [[Sous vide|sous vide]].\n[[Image:Sous vide TexMex pork tenderloin fillet vac sealed.jpg|300px|thumb|right|Vacuum sealed, ready to cook for 9 hours]]\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 [[Pork tenderloin fillet|pork tenderloin fillet]] (about 700g)\n| 2 bunches of [[Sage leaves|sage leaves]]\n| &#189; small [[Onion|onion]], peeled and sliced\n| 1 stick of celery, cut into moons\n| 1 tablespoon of [[Old India Taco Seasoning]] or a similar [[Spice|spice]] [[Blend|blend]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n| If you have a [[Swiss steak|meat tenderiser]] with metal blades, stamp the tenderloin all over, on both sides.\n| Cut the [[Pork fillet|pork fillet]] into 2 pieces so it will fit into a large vacuum bag together with the [[Onion|onion]] a [[Herbs|herbs]].\n| Seal the bag at one end and add the [[Pork tenderloin|pork tenderloin]], [[Onion|onion]], [[Herbs|herbs]] and [[Spices|spices]].\n| Hold the bag closed and shake well to mix.\n| Wipe the edge to be sealed with a [[Paper towel|paper towel]] to ensure it seals properly.\n| [[Vacuum seal]] the bag.  I like to seal twice at both ends, but that's just the pessimist in me!\n| Cook [[Sous vide|sous vide]] at 59\u00b0C (''138.2\u00b0F'') for up to 9 hours or at least a minimum of 3 hours.\n| Once cooked, discard the [[Onions|onions]] and [[Herbs|herbs]] and any juices.\n| If you want to [[Brown|brown]] the outside, cook in a hot pan with a little [[Butter|butter]] for a few minutes, adding an extra blast of a [[Blowtorch|blowtorch]] if you have one.\n| Slice and serve!\n}}\n===Chef's notes===\nIf you are using [[Old India Taco Seasoning]], don't add any [[Salt|salt]] or [[Pepper|pepper]] as this mix is pretty salts already.  However, without Old [[India]] [[Taco seasoning|taco seasoning]], this would be delicious with just a grind of pepper and a pinch of salt added before sealing the bag.\n{{SousVideSeeAlso}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Mexican recipes]]\n[[Category:Tex-Mex recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Sous vide recipes]]\n[[Category:Sous vide cooking]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#herbs #onion #spice #porktenderloin #sousvide #porkfillet #porktenderloinfillet #blowtorch #tacoseasoning #sousvidetexmexporktenderloinfillet #blend </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Sous vide Tex-Mex turkey breast",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Sous vide Tex-Mex turkey breast; a  recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#turkey #sousvidetexmexturkeybreast #sousvide #vacuumseal #tenderise #blackpepper #tacoseasoning #roast #sousvidecooking #blowtorch #butter \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=sous vide is a great way to cook this amazingly economical turkey joint I've used Old India Taco Seasoning for..\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1680\n|PortionCalories = 280\n|DatePublished=3rd March 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 6\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  10 hours, 5 minutes\n|PrepTime =  5 minutes\n|CookTime =  10 hours\n|Image = [[Image:Sous vide TexMex turkey crown recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">T'was as good as it looks!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">So moist, so tasty. Mmmm!</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Sous vide]] is a great way to cook this amazingly economical [[Turkey|turkey]] joint (1.2 kg for \u00a35.24 - Morrisons, March 2014)\n\nI've used [[Old India Taco Seasoning]] for all of the seasoning.  Any similar [[Spice|spice]] mix would do, don't add any extra [[Salt|salt]] if you do use Old [[India]] [[Taco seasoning|taco seasoning]] as it's very salty already.  This would be equally good with just salt and [[Black pepper|black pepper]].  The temperature of 67\u00b0C (''152.6\u00b0F'') been chosen for a moist joint and a cooking time of 10 hours seems to [[Tenderise|tenderise]] the [[Meat|meat]] really nicely and is also a convenient period of time for anyone out at work all day.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1.2 kg boneless [[Turkey|turkey]] breast joint\n| 2 tablespoons [[Old India Taco Seasoning]]\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Sous vide Tex-Mex turkey breast sealed.jpg|Vacuum sealed and ready for the sous vide bath\nImage:Sous vide Tex-Mex turkey breast taco mix.jpg|Turkey breast rolled in the taco mix\nImage:Sous vide Tex-Mex turkey breast ingredients.jpg|The basic ingredients\nImage:Nacho cheese sous-vide turkey crown.jpg|Aldi 'medium' turkey crown - Nacho cheese powder, sage and onion\n</gallery>\n===[[Mise en place]]===\nPreheat your [[sous-vide bath]] to 67\u00b0C.\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Remove all the packaging from the [[Turkey|turkey]] breast, including the net bag as the vacuum packing will hold the joint together while it cooks.\n| Add 2 tablespoons of [[Old India Taco Seasoning]] to a plate and roll the breast around in it to coat evenly.\n| Measure out a vacuum bag bigger than you probably need, it makes for much easier sealing I find.\n| Seal one end, twice for good measure!\n| Pop the [[Turkey|turkey]] breast in the bag and [[Vacuum seal|vacuum seal]].\n| Cook in a [[Sous vide|sous vide]] bath for 10 hours at 67\u00b0C.\n| If you wish you can finish the joint by [[Browning|browning]] in a hot pan with a little [[Butter|butter]] or [[Olive oil|olive oil]], if you have a [[Blowtorch|blowtorch]] you can use that while sealing in the pan.  It saves setting fire to the worktop!\n| Carve and serve immediately.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nWe'll have the hot slices with all of the [[Roast|roast]] trimmings, the rest will go well in [[Salads|salads]] for the next few days.\n{{SousVideSeeAlso}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Poultry recipes]]\n[[Category:Sous vide recipes]]\n[[Category:Sous vide cooking]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#turkey #sousvidetexmexturkeybreast #sousvide #vacuumseal #tenderise #blackpepper #tacoseasoning #roast #sousvidecooking #blowtorch #butter </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Spaghetti Bolognese (Nik and Edwina)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Spaghetti Bolognese (Nik and Edwina) a beef recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#parsley #butter #beefstock #mushrooms #garlic #fry #pork #buttonmushrooms #mincedbeef #wine #dried \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=The variation comes courtesy of Nik & Edwina's cookbook in Sydenham.\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 3408\n|PortionCalories = 568\n|DatePublished=25th October 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 6\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 1 hour 45 minutes\n |PrepTime = 15 minutes\n |CookTime = 1 hour 30 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Spaghetti Bolognese (Nik and Edwina) recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Ten years on, Nick!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I wonder how you're doing now?</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Spaghetti Bolognese simmering.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Simmer for 1 hour]]\nThe variation comes courtesy of [[Nik & Edwina's cookbook|nik & edwina's cookbook]].\n\nTo quote Nik, ''I think'' - \"After years of experimentation, Nik arrived at this, his favourite way of making spag bol. It's quite a soupy version, with a rich winey flavour\"\nThis [[Freeze|freeze]]s really well, so make the lot and freeze what you don't eat.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1 kg good quality very lean [[Minced beef|minced beef]], or 500g very lean [[Minced|minced]] [[Beef|beef]] and 500g very lean minced [[Pork|pork]]\n| 1 tablespoon of [[butter]]\n| 1 tablespoon of [[olive oil]]\n| 1 large [[Onion|onion]]\n| 1 [[Clove|clove]] [[Garlic|garlic]] or to taste.\n| 250g chopped [[Button mushrooms|button mushrooms]], or 6 finely chopped [[Dried|dried]] [[Porcini|porcini]] [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]] or [[shiitake mushrooms]] soaked in [[Milk|milk]] for 20 minutes\n| 2.5 tablespoons of [[Plain flour|plain flour]]\n| 1 &#189; tins of [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]]\n| 300mls good [[Red wine|red wine]]\n| 200mls [[Beef Stock|beef stock]]\n| 2 tablespoons [[tomato pur\u00e9e]]\n| 2 tablespoons chopped curly leaf [[Parsley|parsley]] (other [[Herbs|herbs]] can be added)\n| [[Sea salt]] and freshly ground [[black pepper]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Gently [[Fry|fry]] [[Onions|onions]] and [[Garlic|garlic]] in [[Oil|oil]] and [[Butter|butter]] for 10 minutes until melting\n| Add [[Mince|mince]] slowly, turning and stirring gently until cooked thoroughly, keeping the mixture dry\n| Add [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]] and cook till soft\n| Mix in [[Flour|flour]] and cook through for a minute or so\n| Add tomatoes, salt and pepper, &#190; of the [[Parsley|parsley]] and the [[tomato pur\u00e9e]] , and stir well. Cook for 3 - 4 minutes. Add [[Wine|wine]] and [[Beef Stock|beef stock]], cover wth a lid and [[Simmer|simmer]] very gently for 60 minutes, checking every now and then to make sure it's not catching. The [[Sauce|sauce]] should still be fairly liquid at the end of cooking\n| Serve with [[Spaghetti|spaghetti]], more chopped [[Parsley|parsley]], and [[Parmesan]]\n}}\n===Chef's notes===\nThe only change I would make to this recipe is to add a [[Bay leaf|bay leaf]] while [[Simmering|simmering]] and to garnish with plenty of chopped fresh [[Basil|basil]].\n===Chef's notes===\n{{Template:ThinkPig}}\n\n{{Template:YoutubePastaDough}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Italian recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Beef recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pasta recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Cooking with wine]]\n[[Category:Nik and Edwina's Cookbook recipes]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]][[Category:Pan fried]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#parsley #butter #beefstock #mushrooms #garlic #fry #pork #buttonmushrooms #mincedbeef #wine #dried </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }

            }

title": "Spaghetti with garlic, courgettes, Parmesan and lemon",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Spaghetti with garlic, courgettes, Parmesan and lemon recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#courgettes #grated #spaghettiwithgarliccourgettesparmesanandlemon #pasta #zest #spaghetti #oliveoil #parsley #parmesancheese #fry #wok \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Some friends cooked this unusual vegetarian recipe for us recently and it was so good that I scribbled the recipe ideas down and have attempted to\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1182\n|PortionCalories = 295\n|DatePublished=20th January 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  20 minutes\n|PrepTime =  5 minutes\n|CookTime =  15 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Spaghetti with garlic, courgettes, Parmesan and lemon recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Nice \ud83d\ude0b</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Couldn't really taste the courgettes either</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Tripolini with garlic, courgettes, Parmesan and lemon recipe.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Made with [[Pasta cooking times#Tripoline|tripoline]] instead of [[spaghetti]]]]\nSome friends cooked this unusual [[Vegetarian|vegetarian]] recipe for us recently and it was so good that I scribbled the recipe ideas down and have attempted to reproduce it here.\n\nIt's a quick and easy recipe that makes interesting use of [[Courgettes|courgettes]], it's especially good for those who don't really like [[Courgettes|courgettes]] very much.\n\nThis will be another contender for our regular [[Ghent night]]!\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 200 g [[Dried spaghetti|dried spaghetti]]\n| [[Zest]] from 1 [[Grapefruit|grapefruit]] or 2 [[Lemons|lemons]]\n| 3 [[Courgettes|courgettes]], [[Grated|grated]]\n| Bunch of fresh [[Parsley|parsley]], chopped\n| 70g [[Parmesan cheese]], finely [[Grated|grated]]\n| 4 tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| [[Freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 4 big [[Cloves of Garlic, peeled and crushed|cloves of garlic, peeled and crushed]]\n| 2 fresh [[Green Indian chillies|green indian chillies]], finely chopped (de-seeded if you dont want this too hot)\n}}\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Cook the [[Spaghetti|spaghetti]] in lightly [[Salted|salted]] [[Boiling|boiling]] water until [[Al-dente|al-dente]] (about 7 to 10 minutes)\n| While the [[Pasta|pasta]] is cooking, heat the [[Olive oil|olive oil]] in a [[Frying pan|frying pan]] or a [[Wok|wok]] and add a good grind of [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n| [[Fry]] the [[Garlic|garlic]] for 3 minutes, don't let it [[Brown|brown]]\n| Add the [[Lemon zest|lemon zest]] and [[Grated|grated]] [[Courgettes|courgettes]] and cook until softened or done to your liking.\n| Cooking the [[courgettes]] produces a lot of liquid.  Ideally try reduce this a little over a high heat.  If there is too much then drain some of it, but not all as it makes a very good sauce.  \n| Add the chopped [[Chillies|chillies]] and [[Stir fry|stir fry]] for a few seconds, then add the drained [[Pasta|pasta]].\n| Add the chopped [[Parsley|parsley]], mix well and serve\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Grated|grated]] [[Parmesan cheese]]\n===Recipe source===\n* Jack and Maureen\n===Chef's notes===\nFollowing comments made by [[Julia]] that there were not enough [[courgettes]], I've amended the recipe for 2 people, by reducing the pasta quantity and slightly reducing the amount of courgettes, but keeping the remaining ingredients the same. I thought this made a good balanced meal.  It will be made again. \nIf you don't cut the [[Citrus fruit|citrus fruit]] once you have removed the [[Zest|zest]], they will be good for juicing for a few days, so they won't be wasted.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Italian recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Chilli pepper recipes]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n[[Category:Stir fried]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#courgettes #grated #spaghettiwithgarliccourgettesparmesanandlemon #pasta #zest #spaghetti #oliveoil #parsley #parmesancheese #fry #wok </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }

title": "Spam fritters",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Spam fritters, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#spamfritters #guinness #bitter #branstonpickle #chips #spam #batter #bakedbeans #fritter #frying #fry \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=I know I shouldn't, but I just love Spam, especially in the form of a fritter, served with baked beans, chips and Branston pickle - it's junk food at\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1547\n|PortionCalories = 386\n|DatePublished=23rd October 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|ImageComment = Spam fritters, [[home made Branston pickle]]<br />and strong coffee, the perfect breakfast!\n|TotalTime = 40 minutes\n|PrepTime = 25 minutes\n|CookTime = 15 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Spam fritters recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Naughty, but nice!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Delicious and dead easy to make. Fried in olive oil they are almost healthy! </span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Spam fritters frying.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Spam fritters, fried]]\nI know I shouldn't, but I just love [[Spam]], especially in the form of a [[fritter]], served with [[Baked beans|baked beans]], [[Chips|chips]] and [[Branston pickle]] - it's junk food at its worst and its best.  Go on, indulge!\n\nIf you like these, give our [[Spam pizza]] a try as well!\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1 tin [[Spam]], cut into 10 mm (1/2\" slices)\n| [[Olive oil]] for [[Frying|frying]]\n}}\n\n'''[[Batter]] mix'''\n* 60 g [[Self-raising flour|self-raising flour]]\n* 1 [[Egg|egg]], beaten\n* Splash of [[Guinness]], [[Bitter|bitter]] or if you must, [[Milk|milk]] and water mixed (about 35 to 40 ml of liquid is required)\n* Splash of [[Louisiana hot pepper sauce]] or [[Tabasco sauce]] (to taste)\n* Pinch of [[Salt|salt]]\n* A little plain flour\n\n\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Add all of the dry [[batter]] ingredients to a bowl, then whisking well, add just enough fluid ([[Guinness]], [[Bitter|bitter]], or the [[Milk|milk]]/water mix) to make a thick batter. Add the egg and mix it in extremely well.\n| Rest the batter in the [[refrigerator]] for 20 minutes if you can\n| Dip each piece of spam in a saucer of plain flour and knock off any excess (this helps the batter mix to stick)\n| Dip each piece of spam in the batter \n| Heat a shallow [[Frying pan|frying pan]] with a little [[Oil|oil]]. When it has just started to smoke, reduce the heat a little and [[Fry|fry]] the fritters a few at a time for 3 minutes a side\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\n\nServe hot with [[Baked beans|baked beans]], [[Chips|chips]] and [[Branston pickle]] or [[OK Sauce]]\n=== Tip ===\n\nTo make it easier to dip the pieces of spam in the batter, use a fork and spear the slice about 1cm from its end. Have the bowl of batter as close to the frying pan as possible, then dip the Spam and transfer into the hot oil immediately. Slide the fritter off the fork with a knife or other metal implement. '''Do not use your fingers at any point - severe burns can occur!!'''\n\nAlternatively, if you're handy with a pair of chopsticks, you can grip the end of the Spam with them and do the dipping and transferring that way. For me, the only disadvantage of this method is that there is always a 'naked' uncovered bit on the fritter. Forking it is the only way!!!\n==See also==\n{{FritterRecipes}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Cooking with beer]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:North American recipes]]\n[[Category:Student recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#spamfritters #guinness #bitter #branstonpickle #chips #spam #batter #bakedbeans #fritter #frying #fry </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Spanish pork casserole",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Slow cooked Spanish pork recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#pork #ghee #lard #tomatoes #casserole #mushrooms #spanish #mediterranean #slowcooker\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=Minced pork shoulder in tomato and mushroom sauce\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=16th October 2021\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  1 hour, 15 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  1 hour\n|TotalCalories = 3060\n|PortionCalories = 765 \n|Image = [[Image:Spanish pork casserole recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Lovely</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Anything made with pork shoulder is good in my books.</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry]] </span></span>\n}}\nA nice quick one pot [[Casserole|casserole]] recipe using [[Shoulder of pork|shoulder of pork]], always good for an economic dish.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 kg boneless [[Pork shoulder|pork shoulder]], minced\n| 15g / \u00bd oz [[Lard|lard]], [[Ghee|ghee]] or [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| A \u00bd teaspoon of [[Taste Sensation Italian seasoning]]\n| A good pinch of [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 1 large [[Onion|onion]], peeled and chopped\n| 3 [[Cloves of Garlic, peeled and crushed|cloves of garlic, peeled and crushed]]\n| 1 glass of [[red wine]]\n| 1 [[chicken stock cube]] stirred into 200 ml boiling water\n| 1 tablespoon sweet [[Paprika powder|paprika powder]]\n| A good pinch of dried [[Mixed herbs|mixed herbs]]\n| 1 [[Bay leaf|bay leaf]]\n| 3 tablespoons of [[Taste Sensation Mixed Sweet Red and Green Bell Pepper Granules]]\n| 1 can of chopped [[Plum tomatoes|plum tomatoes]]\n| 100g / 4 oz [[Button mushrooms|button mushrooms]], sliced\n| 2 teaspoons [[Cornflour|cornflour]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Heat the [[Lard|lard]], [[Oil|oil]] or [[Ghee|ghee]] in a large [[Frying pan|frying pan]] and add the [[Black pepper|black pepper]] and [[Taste Sensation Italian seasoning]]\n| [[Stir-fry]] the onions and garlic for 5 minutes\n| Add the onions, garlic and ghee with all of the remaining ingredients to the [[slow cooker]]\n| Slow cook on on medium for about 3 hours\n| Taste for seasoning and serve\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Spanish recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Slow cooked]]\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#pork #ghee #greenpeppers #lard #reddpaprika #tomatoes #casseroledish #mushrooms #spanish #mediterranean</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Spatchcocked chicken with fennel and onions",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Spatchcocked chicken with fennel and onions a French recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#spatchcockedchickenwithfennelandonions #fennel #chicken #lemon #roast #onions #oliveoil #baste #blackpepper #gravy #roastingtray \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Spatchcocking is a different way to prepare a bird and is very easy with a pair of poultry shears\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 223\n|PortionCalories = 55\n|DatePublished=21st January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  1 hour, 30 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  1 hour, 15 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Spatchcocked chicken with fennel and onions recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Much easier than it looks</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.8</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I thought this would be difficult but it's actually rather easy to do.  The results look and taste impressive./</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Spatchcocking]] is a different way to prepare a bird and is very easy with a pair of [[poultry shears]].  In this recipe it results in a crispy flavourful bird.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1 medium-sized [[Chicken|chicken]], [[Parson's nose|parson's nose removed]]\n| 1 [[Lemon|lemon]], bruised and halved\n| 8 [[Cloves of garlic|cloves of garlic]], 4 peeled and crushed, 4 peeled, bashed and left whole\n| 1 large [[onion|onion]]\n| [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and freshly [[Ground|ground]] back [[Pepper|pepper]]\n| 2 tablespoons of [[plain flour]]\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 220\u00b0 C (425\u00b0 F - gas 7), [fan oven 200\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Spatchcocked chicken, oven ready.jpg|Spatchcock chicken, ready for the oven\nImage:Spatchcocked chicken garlic rub.jpg|Rub the garlic/lemon oil over the bird\nImage:Spatchcock chicken fennel and onion bed.jpg|A bed of fennel, onions, garlic and lemon\nImage:Spatchcocked chicken with fennel and onions_ingredients.jpg|Spatchcocked chicken with fennel and onions, the ingredients\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| [[Spatchcock]] the [[Chicken|chicken]] - [[Spatchcock|see here for details]]\n| Find a [[Roasting tray|roasting tray]] that is large enough to take the bird laid out flat\n| Peel and slice the [[Onions|onions]]\n| Slice the [[Fennel|fennel]] and roughly chop any green leaves\n| [[Oil]] the tray and layer the base with the [[Onions|onions]] and [[Fennel|fennel]]\n| Add the juice of the [[Lemon|lemon]] to the [[Crushed garlic|crushed garlic]], a glug of olive oil and a generous seasoning of [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]] and rub this all over the bird\n| Lay the bird, skin-side-up in the tray and tuck the whole [[Garlic|garlic]] [[Cloves|cloves]] and [[Fennel|fennel]] leaves anywhere you can\n| Drizzle a little more [[olive oil]] over the bird, garnish with a final grind of [[black pepper]], cover with [[Tin-foil|tin-foil]], seal and [[Roast|roast]] for 30 minutes\n| Remove the [[Foil|foil]], [[Baste|baste]] the [[Chicken|chicken]] and [[Roast|roast]] uncovered for a further 30 to 45 minutes.\n| Remove the chicken to a warm plate and cover with foil\n| Heat the roasting tray on the hob, sprinkle 2 tablespoons of flour into the cooking juices and mix well to make delicious [[gravy]].  Heat until it thickens then serve.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nAlmost anything would go with this.  [[Tex-Mex potato wedges]] and [[broccoli]] worked for us!\n===Chef's notes===\nIf you are not eating this in one sitting, store the remaining meat in a large [[Lock and Lock]] style box and refrigerate one cooled. This way you will have moist chicken the next day, not dried-out meat.\n==See also==\n* [[Spatchcock|How to spatchcock a chicken, step-by-step pictures]]\n* http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spatchcock\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:French recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Poultry recipes]]\n[[Category:Stewed, braised or pot roasted]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#spatchcockedchickenwithfennelandonions #fennel #chicken #lemon #roast #onions #oliveoil #baste #blackpepper #gravy #roastingtray </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Spiced-up scramble and toms",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",

                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Spiced-up scramble and toms; a  recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#cuminseeds #butter #tomatoes #chilli #spicedupscrambleandtoms #eggs #zest #lemon #juice #images #freshlygroundpepper \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Get a kick start in the morning with this spicy scrambled egg breakfast recipe from Abel & Cole: Spiced-up scramble and toms \n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 639\n|PortionCalories = 159\n|DatePublished=17th May 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  15 minutes\n|PrepTime =  5 minutes\n|CookTime =  10 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Spiced up scramble and toms recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Tasty scrambled eggs</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">\ud83c\udf36\ud83c\udf36\ud83c\udf36</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry, aka Chef]])</span></span>\n}}\n<!--any extra [[Images|images]] MUST be place between this comment and the /div tag below or the layout will be very broken-->\n</div>\n\nGet a kick start in the morning with this spicy scrambled [[Egg|egg]] [[Breakfast|breakfast]] recipe from [[Abel & Cole]]: Spiced-up scramble and toms\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 teaspoon of [[Oil|oil]] or [[Butter|butter]] to gloss the pan\n| 1 fresh [[Chilli|chilli]], thinly sliced\n| 6 large [[Eggs|eggs]]\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground pepper|freshly ground pepper]]\n| A pinch of [[Turmeric powder|turmeric powder]] (optional)\n| 1 [[Lemon|lemon]], [[Juice|juice]] and [[Zest|zest]]\n| 6 large [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]], halved or a punnet of [[Cherry|cherry]] toms\n| 2 teaspoons of [[Cumin seeds|cumin seeds]]\n| A large handful fresh [[Coriander|coriander]], [[Parsley|parsley]] or [[Chervil|chervil]], chopped\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Get a smallish pan hot. Add your [[Cumin seeds|cumin seeds]]. Toast till fragrant. Pour into a little dish.\n| Add a gloss of [[Oil|oil]] or [[Butter|butter]] to the pan. Spoon your [[Chilli|chilli]] slices through the [[Oil|oil]] or [[Butter|butter]], just to soften. [[Scoop]] out. Add the [[Cumin seeds|cumin seeds]].\n| Turn the heat under the pan to low. Whisk your [[Eggs|eggs]] with a pinch of [[Salt|salt]], a good hit of [[Pepper|pepper]], a pinch of [[Turmeric|turmeric]] and the [[Zest|zest]] of your [[Lemon|lemon]] and a squeeze of [[Juice|juice]].\n| Add to the pan. Cook over low heat. As it starts to set on the bottom, gently fold that bit through the [[Uncooked|uncooked]] bit on the top, helping it slowly but evenly cook. The slower you cook your [[Eggs|eggs]], the creamier they wi\u0092ll be.\n| While they'\u0092re cooking get another [[Frying pan|frying pan]] on the [[Hob|hob]]. Add a gloss of [[Oil|oil]] or [[Butter|butter]]. Place your [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]] in the pan (cut side down if using large [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]]). Season with a little [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]. Cook till just tender. 6. [[Pile]] your tomatoes on your plates. [[Perch]] the warm tomatoes alongside. Finish with [[Fresh herbs|fresh herbs]], the [[Toasted|toasted]] [[Cumin seeds|cumin seeds]] and [[Chilli|chilli]] slices.\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Breakfast recipes]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Chilli pepper recipes]]\n[[Category:Egg recipes]]\n[[Category:Gluten free recipes]]\n[[Category:Abel and Cole veg box recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n{{Template:Abel and Cole veg box recipes attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#cuminseeds #butter #tomatoes #chilli #spicedupscrambleandtoms #eggs #zest #lemon #juice #images #freshlygroundpepper </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }

title": "Spiced onion jam",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Spiced onion jam, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#spicedonionjam #onions #thyme #redwine #port #jam #castersugar #chilli #chilliflakes #unusualrecipes #simmer \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A savoury chutney, courtesy of British Onions\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1404\n|PortionCalories = 35\n|DatePublished=24th December 2012\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = Servings: 40 - Makes 4-6 jars\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 2 hours (incl. cooling time)\n |PrepTime = 1 hour\n |CookTime = 1 hour\n |Image = [[Image:Spiced onion jam recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Rich tasting</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">And it seems to improve with age.</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The&nbsp;Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\n\nA savoury chutney, courtesy of British Onions.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1.5kg [[Red onions|red onions]], thinly sliced\n| 2 tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 100g golden [[Caster sugar|caster sugar]]\n| &frac12; teaspoon [[Chilli flakes|chilli flakes]], a few sprigs of [[Thyme|thyme]]\n| 300ml [[Red wine vinegar|red wine vinegar]]\n| 1 glass [[Red wine|red wine]]\n| &frac12; glass [[Port|port]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Heat the [[Oil|oil]] in a large heavy based pan. \n| Cook the [[Onions|onions]] really slowly over a low heat for 30 minutes or until they have softened so much that they have become caramelized. \n| Add the [[Sugar|sugar]], [[Chilli|chilli]] and [[Thyme|thyme]] and cook for a further 10 minutes.\n| Pour over the [[Wine vinegar|wine vinegar]], [[Red wine|red wine]] and [[Port|port]] and [[Simmer|simmer]], uncovered for 20 minutes, stirring every so often. \n| You want the [[Onions|onions]] to become a deep red colour and there to only be a small pool of liquid floating around the bottom of the pan and when you draw a wooden spoon through the [[Jam|jam]] a path clears before filling again with syrupy juices.\n| Cool the [[Onions|onions]] in the pan then fill [[Sterilized|sterilised]] [[Jam|jam]] jars with the mixture. \n| It can be eaten straight away but tastes really great when it has had a couple of weeks to mature.\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Pickles and preserves]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Cooking with wine]]\n[[Category:British Onions recipes]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Pickled]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n{{Template:British Onions attribution}}\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#spicedonionjam #onions #thyme #redwine #port #jam #castersugar #chilli #chilliflakes #unusualrecipes #simmer </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Spiced rooster potato cakes",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Spiced rooster potato cakes, a fruit recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#potatoes #spicedroosterpotatocakes #butter #currypowder #toasted #cuminseeds #raisins #flour #egg #degrees #bakingtray \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Spiced rooster potato cakes recipe Fruit recipes from The cook's Wiki\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 3492\n|PortionCalories = 873\n|DatePublished=27th October 2012\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 45 minutes\n |PrepTime = 15 minutes\n |CookTime = 30 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Spiced rooster potato cakes recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Strange</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">An unusual idea, but they use potato flour sometimes, don't they?</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]] </span></span>\n}}\nSpicy potato cakes.\n\n{{FindAlbertBartlett}}\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1kg Rooster [[Potatoes]], peeled and quartered\n| 2tbs [[Curry powder|curry powder]]\n| 200g [[Butter|butter]]\n| 200g [[Plain flour|plain flour]]\n| 150g soaked [[Raisins|raisins]]\n| 1 [[Egg]], beaten\n| 1 tablespoon [[Toasted]] [[Cumin seeds|cumin seeds]]\n| [[Salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]] for seasoning\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Put [[Potatoes|potatoes]] into a saucepan, cover with cold water, add the 2tbs of [[Curry powder|curry powder]] and [[Salt|salt]] to season. \n| [[Simmer]] gently until the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] are tender (about 15 minutes).\n| Preheat [[Oven|oven]] to 180 [[Degrees|degrees]] C, Gas mark 6. \n| When the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] are cooked, drain and [[Mash|mash]] in the saucepan with 150g of [[Butter|butter]] and adding the [[Flour|flour]] gradually. \n| Finally add the drained [[Raisins|raisins]], season with [[Salt|salt]], [[Pepper|pepper]] and a little [[Curry powder|curry powder]].\n| Turn out the [[Potato|potato]] mix onto a floured work surface and with a [[Rolling pin|rolling pin]] roll out to 2cm thickness.\n| Cut out round the diameter of a glass. With the remaining [[Butter|butter]], lightly grease and [[Flour|flour]] a [[Baking tray|baking tray]].\n| Place the [[Potato cakes|potato cakes]] onto the tray and [[Brush|brush]] lightly with beaten [[Egg|egg]]. \n| Sprinkle a few [[Toasted|toasted]] [[Cumin seeds|cumin seeds]] onto each cake and place into an [[Oven|oven]] for 10 minutes.\n| Turn during cooking to [[Brown|brown]] both sides.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe as a garnish with [[Roasted|roasted]] [[Meats|meats]] or as a light supper dish with a tossed [[Salad|salad]].\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Albert Bartlett recipes]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n{{Template:Albert Bartlett attribution}}\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#potatoes #spicedroosterpotatocakes #butter #currypowder #toasted #cuminseeds #raisins #flour #egg #degrees #bakingtray </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
