title": "Spiced salt",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Spiced salt recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#dried #celery #spicedsalt #blender #vegetables #thermomix #chives #spice #dehydrator #coffee #grinding \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This recipe is to make a basic spiced salt.\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=9th June 2017\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 8 - Makes about 750g\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  5 minutes (plus dehydrating time)\n|PrepTime =  5 minutes (plus dehydrating time)\n|CookTime = None\n|TotalCalories = 25\n|PortionCalories = 25 \n|Image = [[Image:Spiced salt recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Keeps for ages</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.3</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Easy to make and it keeps for ages as long as you keep it dry</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis recipe is to make a basic [[Spice|spice]]d [[Salt|salt]].  You can play around with your own combination of ingredients - just make sure that they are absolutely [[Dried|dried]] out before use, or they could go mouldy.  This can be made in a [[Thermomix]], a good [[Blender|blender]] or a [[Coffee|coffee]]/[[spice]] grinder.\n{{RecipeIngredientsTM\n| 65g [[Dried|dried]] [[Vegetables|vegetables]] and [[Herbs|herbs]] (see [[Chef's notes|chef's notes]] below)\n| 6 large [[Bay leaves|bay leaves]]\n| 50g [[Dried|dried]] [[Bird's Eye chillies|bird's eye chillies]] (or others of your choice)\n| 40g [[Black peppercorns|black peppercorns]]\n| 20g [https://www.amazon.co.uk/Engevita-Savoury-Yeast-Condiment-Pack/dp/B00A4C48LQ/ref=pd_lpo_vtph_543_bs_tr_t_2?_encoding=UTF8&psc=1&refRID=7T45S5NDXR6ZXEHKTMM6 Engevita Yeast Flakes]\n| 600g [[Salt|salt]] of your choice - I used [[Salt#Himalayan Pink Rock Salt|Pink Himalayan Rock Salt]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| If using a [[Thermomix]], place all of the ingredients into the bowl and grind '''30 secs/ Speed 6-8-10'''.\n| If using a normal [[Blender|blender]] or [[Coffee grinder|coffee grinder]], I would suggest [[Grinding|grinding]] it in smaller batches and the mixing together at the end.\n| Whichever method you use, just grind until you are happy with the texture - I like mine to be a little coarse\n| Transfer to clean [[Glass|glass]] jars or [[Lock&Lock boxes]] and if kept dry, it will keep for at least 18 months.\n}}\n===Recipe source===\n\n* Adapted from a recipe in '''Fast and Easy Indian Cooking''' (Thermomix UK)\n===Chef's notes===\nFor the [[Dehydrated|dehydrated]] [[Vegetables|vegetables]], I used the following ingredients:\n\n*750g [[Celery|celery]]\n\n*2 medium [[Red onions|red onions]]\n\n*Several [[Clove|clove]] of [[Garlic|garlic]]\n\n*A few [[Chives|chives]]\n\nand [[Dried|dried]] them in a [[Dehydrator|dehydrator]].\n\nIf you don't have a [[Dehydrator|dehydrator]], you can buy [[Dried|dried]] [[Onions|onions]], [[Garlic granules|garlic granules]] and [[Chives|chives]], but you will need to dry the [[Celery|celery]] in the [[Oven|oven]].  To do this, slice the [[celery]] as thinly as you can and spread out on [[Baking trays|baking trays]] - the [[celery]] pieces can be close, but shouldn't be touching.  Put your [[oven]] on to its lowest setting and place the trays inside. Leave until totally shrivelled and dried.  This could take several hours, so do it on a day when you won't want the oven for anything else.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Salt spiced]]\n[[Category:British recipes|Salt spiced]]\n[[Category:Indian recipes|Salt spiced]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes|Salt spiced]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes|Salt spiced]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes|Salt spiced]]\n[[Category:Chilli pepper recipes|Salt spiced]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes|Salt spiced]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes|Salt spiced]]\n[[Category:Thermomix recipes|Salt spiced]]\n[[Category:Dehydrated|Salt spiced]]\n[[Category:Uncooked|Salt spiced]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#dried #celery #spicedsalt #blender #vegetables #thermomix #chives #spice #dehydrator #coffee #grinding </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Spicy barbecued courgettes",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Spicy barbecued courgettes recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#courgettes #barbecue #spicybarbecuedcourgettes #miseenplace #griddle #marinade #grilled #griddled #barbecued #spices #oliveoil \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A lovely way to barbecue courgettes (zucchini), even those who wouldn't eat them normally might be tempted to change their minds with this recipe\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 66\n|PortionCalories = 33\n|DatePublished=11th September 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  36 minutes\n|PrepTime =  30 minutes\n|CookTime =  6 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Spicy barbecued courgettes recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">A different way of cooking zucchini!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">\ud83e\udd52\ud83e\udd52\ud83e\udd52</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nA lovely way to [[Barbecue|barbecue]] [[Courgettes|courgettes]], even those who wouldn't eat them might be tempted to change their minds.\n[[Image:Courgettes marinading.jpg|300px|thumb|right|After 30 minutes]]\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 2 [[Courgettes|courgettes]], sliced, not too thinly\n| 1 tablespoon [[Old India Taco Seasoning]] or [[Tex-Mex seasoning]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Add all of the ingredients to a [[Lock & Lock box]]\n* Close the lid and shake well to coat the [[Courgettes|courgettes]]\n* Leave to [[Marinade|marinade]] while the [[Barbecue|barbecue]] warms up\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Drain the courgettes - the salt in the seasoning will cause the courgettes to leech some water.\n| [[Griddle]] on the [[Barbecue|barbecue]] for about 3 minutes a side, turning once.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe hot!\n===Variations===\nUse any combination of [[Spices|spices]] - crushed [[Garlic|garlic]] would be a nice addition.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Tex-Mex recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Chilli pepper recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Barbecue recipes]]\n[[Category:Grilled, griddled or barbecued]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#courgettes #barbecue #spicybarbecuedcourgettes #miseenplace #griddle #marinade #grilled #griddled #barbecued #spices #oliveoil </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Spicy beef pudding (MoF)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Spicy beef pudding (MoF) a beef recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#dried #onion #beef #peas #onions #thyme #blackpepper #sage #spices #fry #steamed \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A recipe for Spicy beef pudding. Post war cookery advice from the UK Ministry of Food\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2271\n|PortionCalories = 567\n|DatePublished=21st January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Ministry of Food Cookery calendar - 1951\n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime = 2 hours 15 minutes\n|PrepTime = 15 minutes\n|CookTime = 2 hours\n|Image = [[Image:Ministry of Food Cookery calendar - 1951.jpg|200px|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">I can hear someone reading this...</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">On The Home Service \ud83d\ude01</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]] </span></span>\n}}\n\"Housekeeping's most important secret nowadays is to know how to make best use of the foods available.  Here are some practical suggestions for improving your inside knowledge without undue expense.\"  '''Ministry of food Cookery Calendar - April..May 1951'''\n\n'''Filling:'''\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1 oz dripping\n| 2 level teaspoons [[sugar]]\n| 10 oz [[stewing]] [[beef]], cut in 1\" pieces\n| 8 oz [[onion]], sliced\n| 1/8 level teaspoons [[black pepper]]\n| 2 level teaspoons [[salt]]\n| &#189; level teaspoons ground [[ginger]]\n| 1 [[clove]]\n| 1 pint water\n| 2 oz [[dried]] [[peas]], soaked and cooked\n}}\n'''Savoury [[suet]] pastry:'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 6 oz [[plain flour]]\n| 1/8 level teaspoons [[dried]] [[sage]]\n| 1/8 levels teaspoons [[dried]] [[thyme]]\n| 1 level teaspoons [[salt]]\n| 1 small [[onion]], finely [[grated]]\n| 3 oz [[shredded suet]]\n| Approx. &#188; pint water to mix\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Heat the dripping in a heavy saucepan, add the [[sugar]] and stir over a moderate heat until the [[sugar]] caramelises\n| Add the [[meat]] and [[fry]] until it is a good brown colour, then add the [[onions]] and cook for 5 minutes\n| Add the seasoning, [[spices]] and water and cook gently until the [[meat]] is tender\n| Line a greased basin (1.5 pint size) with thirds of pastry and put alternate layers of spicy [[beef]] and [[peas]] into this, keeping back sufficient gravy for serving \n| Cover with remaining pastry, cover the basin with greased paper and steam for 1 &#188; - 1 &#189; hours\n| Serve hot\n}}\n===Shelf life===\n\nI have found that packet suet has a limited shelf life once opened. I thought I was unable to make decent dumplings until I threw out what turned out to be rancid suet and made them with a fresh packet!\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Beef]]\n[[Category:Beef recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes|Beef]]\n[[Category:Main courses|Beef]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes|Beef]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes|Beef]]\n[[Category:British recipes|Beef]]\n[[Category:Steamed]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#dried #onion #beef #peas #onions #thyme #blackpepper #sage #spices #fry #steamed </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Spicy brisket (SV)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Spicy brisket, a British sous vide recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#spices #brine #litres #blackpeppercorns #salads #groundcloves #onionpowder #allspice #ground #garlicpowder #chilliflakes \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Whilst this is often eaten at Christmas, it can (and should) be made all year round as it is excellent when cold and sliced for sandwiches or salads\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 4365\n|PortionCalories = 727\n|DatePublished=13th November 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Medium rare\n|Servings = Serves 6\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime = 1 day, 3 hours, 15 minutes\n|PrepTime =  3 hours, 15 minutes (includes brining time)\n|CookTime = 1 day\n|Image = [[Image:Perfectly medium-rare.jpg|300px| alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Looks nasty</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.34</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Tastes fantastic</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:NonLoggedInUser|NonLoggedInUser]] </span></span>\n}}\nWhilst this is often eaten at Christmas, it can (and should) be made all year round as it is excellent when cold and sliced for sandwiches or [[Salads|salads]].  It is also a cheap cut of [[Beef|beef]] which is improved by long cooking at a low temperature.  This recipe produces a medium-rare [[Meat|meat]].\n===Ingredients===\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n}}\n'''For the [[Brine|brine]]'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 2.5 [[Litres|litres]] cold water\n| 1 litre [[Dry cider|dry cider]]\n| 50g [[Sugar|sugar]]\n| 130g sea or pink Himalayan [[Salt|salt]]\n}}\n'''For the brisket'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 1kg brisket (unrolled)\n| 50g soft [[Brown sugar|brown sugar]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Black peppercorns|black peppercorns]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Grated|grated]] [[Nutmeg|nutmeg]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Ground cloves|ground cloves]]\n| \u00bd teaspoon [[Ground mace|ground mace]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Ground ginger|ground ginger]]\n| 2-3 teaspoons [[Chilli flakes|chilli flakes]]\n| \u00bd teaspoon ground [[Allspice|allspice]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[garlic powder]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[onion powder]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Put the [[Brine|brine]] ingredients into a bowl with the brisket making sure that the [[Meat|meat]] is submerged into the liquid.  Cover and leave for 3 hours in a cool place or [[Refrigerator|refrigerator]].\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Brisket medium.jpg|Cooked medium\nImage:Using the blowtorch.jpg|Using the blowtorch\nImage:Ready to come out.jpg|Ready to come out\nImage:Vacuum packed.jpg|Vacuum packed\nImage:Brining the brisket.jpg|Brining the brisket\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Preheat the water bath to 56.5\u00b0C (''133.7\u00b0F'').\n| Meanwhile remove the brisket from the [[Brine|brine]] and pat dry with kitchen paper.\n| Rub the [[Sugar|sugar]] and the [[Ground|ground]] [[Spices|spices]] all over the [[Meat|meat]].\n| Place in a vacuum pouch and evenly distribute the whole [[Spices|spices]] over the [[Meat|meat]].\n| Seal the pouch and cook in the water bath for 24-30 hours.\n| Remove from the pouch and [[Brush|brush]] off the [[Spices|spices]] and [[Sugar|sugar]].\n| Pat dry.\n| [[Sear]] the [[Meat|meat]] in a smoking [[Frying pan|frying pan]] for 1-2 minutes on each side or a [[blowtorch]] to [[Brown|brown]] both side.\n| Allow to cool before slicing.\n}}\n===Variations===\nCook at 49\u00b0C (''120.2\u00b0F'') for rare [[Meat|meat]], 60\u00b0C (''140\u00b0F'') for medium, 65.5\u00b0C (''149.9\u00b0F'') for medium well or 71\u00b0C (''159.8\u00b0F'') for well done.\n\nThis can, of course, be served as a joint as part of a hot meal.\n===Chef's notes===\nYou can use your own favourite [[spice]] mix, but if using whole spices, ensure they are not hard and jagged or you might pierce the vacuum pouch.\n{{SousVideSeeAlso}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Brisket spiced]]\n[[Category:British recipes|Brisket spiced]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes|Brisket spiced]]\n[[Category:Beef recipes|Brisket spiced]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes|Brisket spiced]]\n[[Category:Cooking with wine|Brisket spiced]]\n[[Category:Sous vide recipes|Brisket spiced]]\n[[Category:Sous vide cooking|Brisket spiced]]\n[[Category:Molecular gastronomy recipes]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#spices #brine #litres #blackpeppercorns #salads #groundcloves #onionpowder #allspice #ground #garlicpowder #chilliflakes </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Spicy chicken breasts (SV)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",

                        "*": "<!-- seo -->{{#seo:\n|title=Spicy chicken breasts, a British sous vide recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#chickenbreasts #salad #groundblackpepper #herbs #rice #paprika #dried #maincourse #miseenplace #vegetables #images \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A very easy sous vide recipe\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 677\n|PortionCalories = 169\n|DatePublished=23rd March 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  1 hour, 5 minutes - 4 hours, 5 minutes\n|PrepTime = teaspoon [[Dried|dried]] [[Marjoram|marjoram]]\n| 2\u00bd teaspoons sweet [[Paprika|paprika]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Chilli powder|chilli powder]]\n| 2 teaspoons [[Ground black pepper|ground black pepper]]\n| 2 teaspoons [[Garlic powder|garlic powder]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Onion powder|onion powder]]\n| Up to 1 teaspoon [[Salt|salt]]\n| 4 boneless [[Chicken breasts|chicken breasts]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat the water bath to 63.5\u00b0C (''147\u00b0F'')\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Mix the [[Herbs|herbs]] and [[Spices|spices]] together\n| Rub into the [[chicken breasts]]\n| [[Vacuum seal]] in suitable pouches\n| Place in the water bath and cook for at least 1 hour or for a maximum of 4 hours\n| Remove from the pouches and pat dry with kitchen paper\n| [[Sear]] on both sides, over a high heat, until golden\n| Alternatively, use a blowtorch\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe as a first course or [[Snack|snack]] on a bed of [[Salad|salad]] leaves, or as a [[Main course|main course]] with [[Potatoes|potatoes]] or [[Rice|rice]] and [[Vegetables|vegetables]] or [[Salad|salad]].\n{{SousVideSeeAlso}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Spicy title": "Spicy curry puffs",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Spicy curry puffs recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#puffpastry #curry #spicycurrypuffs #bake #pizzastone #sauce #slowcooker #servings #mincedbeef #ghee #potatoes \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=These delicious curry puffs or pasties make a great meal or snack and the filling is ideal for freezing so you can make them fresh every time\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 4942\n|PortionCalories = 617\n|DatePublished=2nd April 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Now that's a massive curry puff!\n|Servings = Serves 8\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  7 hours, 40 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  7 hours, 25 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Spicy curry puffs recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">I remember this.</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I remember making this, and I remember eating it too. Yum!</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis recipe makes enough filling for 8 huge [[Curry|curry]] puffs.  I've divided up the cooked filling, [[vacuum sealed]] in '2 puff' portions and [[Frozen|frozen]] them.  I slow cooked the filling but it would be nearly as good if it was just [[Simmered|simmered]] for an hour.\n[[Image:Spicy curry puffs on the pizza stone.jpg|thumb|300px|right|baked on the [[pizza stone]]]]\n\nYou could probably use less [[Puff pastry|puff pastry]], but as it's so nice why not use more of it!\n\nYou could use a few [[Chillies|chillies]] or your favourite [[Curry|curry]] [[Sauce|sauce]] or paste as an alternative to my choice of [[Cock Brand curry paste]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 500 g [[Minced beef|minced beef]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Ghee|ghee]] or [[Vegetable oil|vegetable oil]]\n| 3 [[Cloves garlic, peeled and crushed|cloves garlic, peeled and crushed]]\n| Good pinch of [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 1 [[Onion|onion]], peeled and finely chopped\n| 1 [[Leek|leek]], sliced\n| 1 tablespoon [[Cock Brand curry paste]]\n| 1 large [[Carrot|carrot]], peeled, quartered lengthwise and sliced\n| 1 mug of [[Frozen peas|frozen peas]]\n| 1 [[Oxo cube]], crumbled\n| A little water\n}}\n'''for the puffs'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 1 pack of [[Pre-rolled puff pastry|pre-rolled puff pastry]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Add all of the ingredients to the [[Slow cooker|slow cooker]] and stir well.\n| Add a little water to loosen the mixture. Not too much as you don't want it to be too wet inside the [[Puff pastry|puff pastry]].  Start off with about 50 ml and check after an hour.\n| Slow cook on low for up to 7 hours.\n| You could use this immediately.  I batched mine up into 300g [[Servings|servings]] (enough for 2 large puffs), vacuum sealed and froze them.\n| When you are ready to [[Bake|bake]] the puffs, remove the [[Puff pastry|puff pastry]] from the [[Fridge|fridge]] for 1 hour before you need to use it and preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 220\u00b0 C (425\u00b0 F - gas 7), [fan oven 200\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n| One standard pack of [[Puff pastry|puff pastry]] makes 2 large puffs as shown in the photos.\n| Add the filling to the middle of the bottom half of the [[Puff pastry|puff pastry]] and fold the top over to seal. I found that folding the edge over before crimping with the tines of a fork prevented the filling from leaking out, a potentially disastrous event!\n| [[Bake]] for 25 minutes in the middle of the [[Oven|oven]], but check after 20 minutes as they burn easily at this temperature.\n| I [[Baked|baked]] mine on a preheated [[Pizza stone|pizza stone]] so the base was as crunchy as the top.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Potatoes|potatoes]] and [[Vegetables|vegetables]] and a little gravy.\n===Variations===\nYou could of course make much smaller [[Curry|curry]] puffs than are shown here.  They would make great [[Tapa|tapa]].\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Beef recipes]]\n[[Category:Chilli pepper recipes]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Slow cooked]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#puffpastry #curry #spicycurrypuffs #bake #pizzastone #sauce #slowcooker #servings #mincedbeef #ghee #potatoes </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Spicy fried chicken pieces",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Spicy fried chicken pieces, British recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#chicken #oliveoil #spicyfriedchickenpieces #egg #marinade #wok #limejuice #plainflour #fry #cornmeal #spices \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=I made this as a little experiment and it went down so well with everyone that I've decided to add it as a recipe. This recipe is fairly healthy as it\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 804\n|PortionCalories = 402\n|DatePublished=31st July 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  4 hours, 12 minutes\n|PrepTime =  4 hours\n|CookTime =  12 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Spicy fried chicken pieces recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Wow!  Delicious</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Nice and healthy with olive oil too.  Well done you.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nI made this as a little experiment and it went down so well with everyone that I've decided to add it as a recipe.\n\nThis recipe is fairly healthy as it does not need to be [[Deep-fried|deep-fried]].  I've used [[Olive oil|olive oil]] but you could use any [[Vegetable oil|vegetable oil]].  If you do use [[Olive oil|olive oil]], as its smoke point is much lower that most [[Frying|frying]] [[Oils|oils]], so keep the temperature lower than you normally would, or put the smoke alarm in the garden!\n\nAlthough the preparation time is shown as 4 hours, you could sacrifice the [[Marination|marination]] period if you were short on time.\n\nI've used [[Tex-Mex mix]] for the seasoning, but in place of that you could just add a pinch of [[Chilli powder|chilli powder]] and any powdered [[Spices|spices]] that you fancy.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 2 large [[Chicken breasts|chicken breasts]], chopped into thumb-sized pieces\n| 1 tablespoon [[Lime juice|lime juice]]\n| &#188; teaspoon [[Salt|salt]] for the [[Marinade|marinade]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Taco-mix|taco-mix]] for the [[Marinade|marinade]]\n| 1 large [[Clove|clove]] of [[Garlic, peeled and crushed|garlic, peeled and crushed]]\n| 1 [[Egg|egg]], beaten\n| 2 tablespoons fine [[Cornmeal|cornmeal]]\n| 5 tablespoons [[Plain flour|plain flour]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Taco-mix|taco-mix]] for the 'batter'\n| Enough [[Olive oil|olive oil]] to fill the base of a [[Wok|wok]] by 1.3cm (1/2\")\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Add the [[Chicken|chicken]] pieces, [[Salt|salt]], [[Taco-mix|taco-mix]], [[Lime juice|lime juice]] and [[Crushed garlic|crushed garlic]] to a [[Lock and Lock box]], replace the lid, shake very well and leave in the [[Fridge|fridge]] for 3 or four hours to [[Marinade|marinade]], shaking now and then if you can.\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Chicken pieces frying in the wok.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Chicken pieces frying in the wok\nImage:Chicken pieces coated with flour, ready to fry.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Chicken pieces coated with flour, ready to fry\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Heat the [[Olive oil|olive oil]] in a [[Wok|wok]] or [[Frying pan|frying pan]].  Not too hot that it smokes.\n| Add the [[Taco-mix|taco-mix]] (or your desired [[Spices|spices]]) to a bowl containing the [[Plain flour|plain flour]] and mix well.\n| When you are ready to [[Fry|fry]] the [[Chicken|chicken]], add two tablespoons of [[Cornmeal|cornmeal]] to the [[Chicken|chicken]] pieces and shake really well to coat the chicken evenly.\n| Beat the [[Egg|egg]] and add to a bowl.\n| [[Dip]] each pice of [[Chicken|chicken]] in the beaten [[Egg|egg]], then coat coat with the spicy [[Flour|flour]] mix, then carefully add to the hot [[Oil|oil]].  Do this in two batches so you don't overwhelm the [[Oil|oil]] and kill the temperature.\n| [[Fry]] for about 2 to 3 minutes, turning often.\n| Remove the cooked [[Chicken|chicken]] with a [[Slotted spoon|slotted spoon]] and allow to drain on kitchen paper.\n| Check the [[Chicken|chicken]] is properly cooked, though it should be fine as the pieces are very small and turning them ensures an even heat.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with a mixed [[Salad|salad]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:North American recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Poultry recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#chicken #oliveoil #spicyfriedchickenpieces #egg #marinade #wok #limejuice #plainflour #fry #cornmeal #spices </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Spicy Jazz Apple Crisps",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Spicy Jazz Apple Crisps; a  recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#jazzapplegranita #jazzapple #juice #ginger #mandolin #spice #5spice #coolingrack #groundcinnamon #ground #frozen \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Crunchy fruit crisps made with Jazz apples, an ideal accompaniment for jazz apple granita. \n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 129\n|PortionCalories = 16\n|DatePublished=2nd January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 8\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 2 hors 30 minutes\n |PrepTime = 30 minutes\n |CookTime = 2 hours\n |Image = [[Image:Jazz apple granita recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Debbie makes this in her Aga</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.76</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">It's a no-brainer as the oven is always on anyway</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry]] </span></span>\n}}\nCrunchy fruit crisps made with Jazz apples, an ideal accompaniment for [[Jazz apple granita]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 2 Jazz [[Jazz apple|apples]]\n| [[Juice]] of half a [[Lemon|lemon]]\n| 4 teaspoons [[Caster sugar|caster sugar]]\n| 1 level teaspoon Chinese [[5 spice]] (or a little [[Ground|ground]] [[Ginger|ginger]] or [[Ground cinnamon|ground cinnamon]])\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Set the [[Oven|oven]] to Gas Mark &frac14;-1/2 or 110\u00b0C. Slice the whole [[Jazz apple|apples]] across into very thin slices using a sharp knife or a [[Mandolin|mandolin]] slicer. [[Brush]] the slices quickly on both sides with a little [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]] then spread them out on a [[Baking|baking]] sheet and sprinkle them all over with [[Sugar|sugar]] and a little [[Spice|spice]]. Use a template, like a star cutter, and sprinkle the spice round it, if you like.\n| [[Bake]] for 1 &frac12; - 2 hours until the slices are just crisp. Transfer to a [[Cooling rack|cooling rack]] to crisp and dry.\n| Serve on their own or with drinks or [[Desserts|desserts]].\n| Stored in an airtight container, the crisps should keep for a few days.\n| ''Makes approx 24-32 crisps''\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nAn ideal accompaniment for [[Jazz apple granita]]\n===Recipe source===\n\n* http://www.jazzapples.co.uk/\n\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Ice-cream recipes]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Cooking with wine]]\n[[Category:Frozen]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#jazzapplegranita #jazzapple #juice #ginger #mandolin #spice #5spice #coolingrack #groundcinnamon #ground #frozen </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Spicy meatballs",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Spicy meatballs a beef recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#bread #olive #garlic #mint #dried #egg #sauces #flour #onion #spicymeatballs #oregano \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=These are easy to make and can be utilised with many different flavoured sauces and work well on a pizza\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1985\n|PortionCalories = 496\n|DatePublished=21st January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Meatballs\n |Servings = Serves 4 to 6 people\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 30 minutes\n |PrepTime = 15 minutes\n |CookTime = 15 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Meatballs recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Ok, but needs more garlic</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">At least a total of 4 cloves</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:NonLoggedInUser|NonLoggedInUser]] </span></span>\n}}\n\nThese are easy to make and can be utilised with many different flavoured [[Sauces|sauces]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 450 g (1 lb) lean [[Minced|minced]] [[Beef|beef]]\n| &#189; cup [[Grated|grated]] [[Onion|onion]]\n| 2 [[Cloves|cloves]] of [[Garlic|garlic]], peeled and crushed\n| &#188; teaspoon [[Dried|dried]] [[Oregano|oregano]]\n| 1/8 of a  teaspoon of [[Dried|dried]] [[Mint|mint]]\n| 1/2 a teaspoon of [[chilli flakes]]\n| 2 slices white [[Bread|bread]], crusts removed - this can be stale bread\n| &#189; cup [[White wine|white wine]] or water\n| 1 [[Egg|egg]], beaten\n| Sea [[Salt|salt]] and freshly ground [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n| [[Flour]] for rolling\n| [[Olive]] [[Oil|oil]] for [[Frying|frying]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| With clean hands, mix the [[Mince|mince]], [[Onion|onion]], [[Garlic|garlic]], [[Salt|salt]], [[Pepper|pepper]], [[Oregano|oregano]], [[chili flakes]] and [[Mint|mint]].\n| Moisten the [[Bread|bread]] in the [[Wine|wine]] or water.\n| Add [[Bread|bread]] and [[Egg|egg]] to [[Meat|meat]]. Knead well.\n| Shape into 2.5 cm (1\") balls, dust with [[Flour|flour]], and [[Saute|saute]] in hot [[Olive|olive]] [[Oil|oil]] until [[Browned|browned]] and cooked to your liking.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nUse them to make [[New York-style stone baked pizza]], [[Meatball pizza]] or serve them with [[spaghetti]] and one of the following [[sauces]].\n* [[Balsamic vinegar gravy]]\n* [[Sofrito (Spanish tomato sauce)]]\n* [[Spicy tomato salsa]]\n* [[Tomato sauce for pizza]]\n* [[Roast garlic and sherry vinegar sauce]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Beef recipes]]\n[[Category:Chilli pepper recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:North American recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#bread #olive #garlic #mint #dried #egg #sauces #flour #onion #spicymeatballs #oregano </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Spicy pickled cabbage",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Spicy pickled cabbage, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#vinegar #cabbage #spicypickledcabbage #spices #rocksalt #pickling #boil #juniperberries #cookingsalt #foodprocessor #shredded \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This is my spicy version of Mrs Beeton's pickled red cabbage recipe. Adjust the spices to suit your personal taste. I like to strain the vinegar so it's\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}} \n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 182\n|PortionCalories = 2\n|DatePublished=28th February 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = 100\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 1 day, 50 minutes\n |PrepTime = 1 day, 30 minutes\n |CookTime = 20 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Spicy pickled red cabbage.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Colourful and tasty</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">The addition of jaggery softens the vinegary sharpness and makes this a warm tasting pickle.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis is my spicy version of '''Mrs Beeton's  [[Pickled red cabbage (Mrs Beeton's)|pickled red cabbage recipe]]'''.\n\nAdjust the [[Spices|spices]] to suit your personal taste.\n\nI like to strain the [[Vinegar|vinegar]] so it's clear, but if you omit the [[Ginger powder|ginger powder]], you probably won't need to.\n\nI've made this recipe 4 or 5 times now and it's a real winner!\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 650g [[Red cabbage|red cabbage]] (''1 large red cabbage'')\n| About &#189; cup of [[cooking salt]] or [[table salt]]. It needs to be fine so [[rock salt]] won't do.\n| 1 litre of [[Pickling|pickling]] [[Vinegar|vinegar]]\n| 1 tablespoon whole [[Coriander seeds|coriander seeds]]\n| 1 tablespoon whole [[Peppercorns|peppercorns]] \n| 1 tablespoon [[Chili flakes|chili flakes]]\n| 1 heaped tablespoon [[Ground ginger powder|ground ginger powder]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Juniper berries|juniper berries]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Rinse and dry the outside of the cabbage \n| Peel and discard any floppy or damaged leaves\n| Cut into quarters, cut out the core and then cut into eight pieces.\n| Shred the [[Cabbage|cabbage]], preferably with a [[Food processor|food processor]] fitted with a slicing attachment\n| Pick through the shredded cabbage, remove and chop any large pieces by hand.\n| Split the [[Shredded|shredded]] [[Cabbage|cabbage]] between a couple of colanders and build up in layers; a layer of cabbage, a layer of [[Salt|salt]], a layer of cabbage, etc.\n| Place the colanders over plates and leave in a cool place for 24 hours\n| Meanwhile we'll [[Spice|spice]] up the [[Vinegar|vinegar]].\n| In a well ventilated kitchen, add the [[Vinegar|vinegar]] and the [[Spices|spices]] to a large pan and bring to the [[Boil|boil]]. [[Simmer]] gently for 10 minutes, then remove from the heat and allow to cool completely\n| When cold, pour into a jar and cover until the [[Cabbage|cabbage]] is ready\n| After 24 hours, rinse the [[Cabbage|cabbage]] under a cold tap to remove the [[Salt|salt]] and then squeeze out as much excess water as you can.  A [[salad-spinner]] would be good for this.\n| Leave to drain in the colanders whilst you strain the [[Vinegar|vinegar]] through a clean [[muslin]] cloth or a [[Tea|tea]]-towel.\n| Pack the [[Cabbage|cabbage]] into clean sterilised jars and cover with the [[vinegar]]\n| Seal and store in a cool dark place for up to 10 weeks.\n| It will be ready to eat after 1 week.\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Spicy pickled red cabbage salting.jpg|thumb|300px|right|1 of 2 colanders of the salting cabbage after just 15 minutes\nImage:Spicy pickled red cabbage ingredients.jpg|thumb|300px|right|The ingredients\n</gallery>\n===Chef's notes===\nIf you notice a musty smell from the cabbage before you cut it open, yet it appears perfect on the outside, cut it in half and check the core.  More than once I've had a little mould on the inside leaves around the core.  Discard them and wash the cabbage once it's been sliced if you are really paranoid. Do pat it dry on a tea-towel before salting.\n\n''This recipe makes exactly enough pickled cabbage to fill a two litre preserving jar''\n{{Template:PeelingGinger}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Pickled cabbage]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments|Pickled cabbage]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes|Pickled cabbage]]\n[[Category:Pickles and preserves|Pickled cabbage]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes|Pickled cabbage]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes|Pickled cabbage]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Pickled]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#vinegar #cabbage #spicypickledcabbage #spices #rocksalt #pickling #boil #juniperberries #cookingsalt #foodprocessor #shredded </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Spicy three cheese flan with sesame seeds",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Spicy three cheese flan with sesame seeds recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#pastry #sesameseeds #bluecheese #cheese #oliveoil #cheddarcheese #currypowder #eggwhites #chives #creamcheese #butter \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A superb quiche using stilton, cheddar and cream cheese with curry and sesame seeds\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 6494\n|PortionCalories = 1082\n|DatePublished=25th April 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 6\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  1 hour 20 minutes\n|PrepTime =  40 minutes\n|CookTime =  40 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Spicy three cheese flan with sesame recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Nice and cheesy</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">That's for sure!</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nA deliciously spicy quiche made with three [[Cheeses|cheeses]], the pastry is flavoured with curry powder and the quiche is topped with [[Sesame seeds|sesame seeds]].  This makes a great [[Accompaniment|accompaniment]] to a [[Salad|salad]], any time of year.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 60 ml [[Olive oil|olive oil]] (about 4 tablespoons)\n| 1 large [[Onion|onion]], peeled and chopped\n| 2 [[Cloves of Garlic, peeled and crushed|cloves of garlic, peeled and crushed]]\n| 50 g [[Blue cheese|blue cheese]]\n| 225 g [[Cream cheese|cream cheese]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Plain flour|plain flour]]\n| 3 [[Eggs|eggs]], whites and [[Yolks|yolks]] separated\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 3 tablespoons [[Chives|chives]], finely chopped\n| 225 g pre rolled [[Shortcrust pastry|shortcrust pastry]]\n| 50 g [[Cheddar cheese]]\n| 4 pinches of [[Curry powder|curry powder]]\n| Pinch of fine [[Salt|salt]]\n| Pinch of [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 2 tablespoons of [[Sesame seeds|sesame seeds]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* If the pre rolled pastry has been refrigerated, remove from the fridge 30 minutes before you want to work with it.\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6), [fan oven 180\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Spicy three cheese flan with sesame ready for the oven.jpg|Ready for the oven\nImage:Spicy three cheese flan with sesame curry pastry.jpg|Cheddar cheese and curry powder rolled on to the pastry\nImage:Spicy three cheese flan with sesame the filling.jpg|Filling mixed and ready\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Heat the [[Oil|oil]] in a [[Frying pan|frying pan]] or [[Wok|wok]] and add a good pinch of [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n| [[Saute]] the [[Oil|oil]] over a low heat until soft and transparent. Do not allow it to [[Brown|brown]]\n| Add the [[Crushed garlic|crushed garlic]] and [[Stir-fry|stir-fry]] for the last few minutes\n| Remove from the heat and set aside and allow to cool\n| Crumble the [[Blue cheese|blue cheese]] into a bowl and mix in the [[Cream cheese|cream cheese]]\n| Stir in the [[Flour|flour]], [[Egg yolks|egg yolks]], cooled cooked [[Onions|onions]] and [[Garlic|garlic]], chopped [[Chives|chives]] and season with a pinch of [[Salt|salt]], not too much as the [[Blue cheese|blue cheese]] is quite salty\n| Using a 20 cm (8 inch) push out flan tin,  mark a circle that will fit snugly in the bottom\n| Grease the inside of the flan case with a little [[Olive oil|olive oil]] or [[Butter|butter]]\n| Sprinkle the [[Grated|grated]] [[Cheddar cheese]] over the prepared [[Pastry|pastry]] and dust with the [[Curry powder|curry powder]]\n| Use a [[Rolling pin|rolling pin]] to press this into the [[Pastry|pastry]]\n| Line the base of the tin with the disc of [[Pastry|pastry]], [[Cheese|cheese]] side up. Rolling this up first is the easiest way to transfer it to the fan tin. \n| To make the edge strip you will need to re roll the remaining pastry.  Using your hands, roll into a long sausage, about 60 cm long (2 feet) long, and then roll that out to match the height of your tin.\n| Use this strip to line the edge of the tin, [[Cheese|cheese]] side up.\n| Crimp the two pieces of [[Pastry|pastry]] together with your fingers so they make a good seal\n| In another bowl, whisk the [[Egg whites|egg whites]] until they create still peaks and sprinkle with a little [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]\n| Gently fold the [[Egg whites|egg whites]] into the [[Cheese|cheese]] mixture and spread evenly to fill the flan case\n| Sprinkle with [[Sesame seeds|sesame seeds]]\n| '''[[Bake]] in the middle of the [[Oven|oven]] for 30 minutes at 200\u00b0 C'''. Check it after 20 minutes and lower the heat to 180\u00b0 if it looks too browned.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]] and a [[Green salad|green salad]]\n{{Quiche - See also}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Egg recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#pastry #sesameseeds #bluecheese #cheese #oliveoil #cheddarcheese #currypowder #eggwhites #chives #creamcheese #butter </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Squash, bubble and squeak",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Squash, bubble and squeak, British recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#squashbubbleandsqueak #squash #potatoes #cabbage #diced #springonions #fry #oliveoil #mash #squashes #panfried \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=It's Autumn, so it's time to dig out more squash recipes. This would probably be better made with a butternut squash than my Harlequin F1 squashes\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 646\n|PortionCalories = 161\n|DatePublished=21st January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 1 hour 10 minutes\n |PrepTime = 20 minutes\n |CookTime = 50 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Pork steaks with apples, sage and cider recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Crazy!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">(that it's Autumn AGAIN!)</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry]] </span></span>\n\n}}\nIt's Autumn, so it's time to dig out more [[Squash|squash]] recipes.\n\nThis would probably be better made with a [[Butternut squash|butternut squash]] than my Harlequin F1 [[Squashes|squashes]] which make are ''wetter'' when cooked than the butternut squash.  Anyway, I have about 25 of these, so Harlequin it is!\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1 Harlequin [[Squash|squash]] (or any small squash or [[Pumpkin|pumpkin]] weighing between 500 g and 700 g).\n| Peel and dice the squash and discard the seeds\n| 450 g [[Potatoes|potatoes]], peeled and  [[Diced|diced]].\n| 200 g [[Cabbage|cabbage]], shredded (woody parts removed) - Savoy is best, but any will do.\n| 5 [[Spring onions|spring onions]], trimmed and thinly chopped\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 2 tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Squash, bubble and squeak both sides cooked.jpg|Both sides cooked\nImage:Squash, bubble and squeak one side cooked.jpg|One side cooked\nImage:Squash, bubble and squeak ready to fry.jpg|You could freeze in batches at this stage and then fry as needed later\nImage:Squash, bubble and squeak ingredients chopped.jpg|The food processor is your friend\nImage:Squash, bubble and squeak ingredients.jpg|Nice healthy ingredients\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Add the [[Squash|squash]] pieces to a pan of lightly [[Salted|salted]] [[Boiling|boiling]] water and cook for 15 minutes.\n| In another pan, [[Boil|boil]] the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] for 10 minutes, then add the [[Cabbage|cabbage]] and cook for a further 10 minutes or until the potatoes are just soft enough to mash.\n| Drain the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] and [[Cabbage|cabbage]] really well.\n| Drain the [[Squash|squash]], if it is very watery, place in a [[Sieve|sieve]] and press some of the water out with the back of a large spoon.\n| Add the [[Potatoes|potatoes]], [[Squash|squash]] to a large bowl, season with [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]] and [[Mash|mash]] together really well. Finally, mix in the [[Spring onions|spring onions]].\n| Heat 1 tablespoon of the [[Oil|oil]] in a large [[Frying pan|frying pan]], add the mixture and pat down so it fills the pan. Cook for 10 minutes on a medium heat.\n| Slide the bubble and squeak out onto a large plate, heat the remaining [[Oil|oil]], return the bubble and squeak to the pan and [[Fry|fry]] the un-cooked side for another 10 minutes.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nCut into [[Wedges|wedges]] and serve.\n===Chef's notes===\nFor 2 people, freeze half and make a thinner tortilla.\n==See also==\n[[Bubble and carrot squeak]]\n[[Bubble and squeak|Bubble and squeak recipe]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Squash recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#squashbubbleandsqueak #squash #potatoes #cabbage #diced #springonions #fry #oliveoil #mash #squashes #panfried </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Squash and pear soup",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Squash and pear soup, Gluten free recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#walnuts #cream #squash #squashandpearsoup #pumpkin #freshginger #garlic #thyme #rosemary #mascarpone #scoop \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=With this flexible friend you can swap the ginger and walnuts for Parmesan and sage\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1392\n|PortionCalories = 348\n|DatePublished=18th May 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  1 hour, 20 minutes\n|PrepTime =  20 minutes\n|CookTime =  1 hour\n|Image = [[Image:Squash and pear soup recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Just the Best Bowl!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Great way to serve many dishes, not just soup.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry, aka Chef]])</span></span>\n}}\n\nWith this flexible friend you can swap the [[Ginger|ginger]] and [[Walnuts|walnuts]] for [[Parmesan]] and [[Sage|sage]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 medium-sized [[Squash|squash]] or [[Pumpkin|pumpkin]]\n| 3 [[Pears|pears]], peeled and [[Diced|diced]]\n| 1 whole [[Garlic|garlic]] bulb, 1 cm of top cut off to reveal the [[Cloves|cloves]]\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| A few [[Rosemary|rosemary]] or [[Thyme|thyme]] sprigs (optional)\n| A gloss of [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 500ml veg or [[Chicken stock|chicken stock]], warmed\n| A dash of [[Cream|cream]], [[Mascarpone|mascarpone]] or cr\u00e8me fra\u00eeche (optional)\n| A small thumb of [[Fresh ginger|fresh ginger]]\n| A handful of [[Walnuts|walnuts]], [[Toasted|toasted]] and chopped\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Heat your [[Oven|oven]] to 220\u00b0 C (425\u00b0 F - gas 7), [fan [[Oven|oven]] 200\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Carve the top off the [[Squash|squash]]/ [[Pumpkin|pumpkin]]. [[Scoop]] out the [[Seeds|seeds]]. Carve out the flesh inside. [[Scoop]] it out with a spoon.\n|Roughly chop the flesh. Mix with the [[Pear|pear]]. Season. Toss on a [[Baking tray|baking tray]], with the [[Pumpkin|pumpkin]]/[[Squash|squash]] and [[Garlic|garlic]]. Gloss with [[Olive oil|olive oil]]. Tuck in some [[Rosemary|rosemary]]/[[Thyme|thyme]] sprigs. [[Roast]] for 1hr or till the pumpkin is golden and tender, check throughout cooking.\n|Once tender, whizz the flesh with the [[Stock|stock]], slowly trickling it in till it\u0092s as you like. Finish with a little [[Cream|cream]], [[Mascarpone|mascarpone]] or cr\u00e8me fra\u00eeche, if you like. Grate in some [[Fresh ginger|fresh ginger]], to taste. Adjust [[Salt|salt]]/[[Pepper|pepper]] levels, if needed.\n}}\n\n===Serving suggestion===\n* Serve with a little extra [[Cream|cream]] and the [[Walnuts|walnuts]].\n\n{{Template:PeelingGinger}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Soup and stock recipes]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Gluten free recipes]]\n[[Category:Squash recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n{{Template:Abel and Cole veg box recipes attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n[[Category:Abel and Cole veg box recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#walnuts #cream #squash #squashandpearsoup #pumpkin #freshginger #garlic #thyme #rosemary #mascarpone #scoop </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }

title": "Squeezy cheese cookies",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Squeezy cheese cookies recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#butter #cheese #plainflour #bakeoglide #squeezycheesecookies #miseenplace #smokedpaprikapowder #bake #foodprocessor #restfor #cheddarcheese \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Having just bought myself another toy; an Oxo Good Grips Cookie Press, I thought I should find a suitable recipe to use it with\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1882\n|PortionCalories = 188\n|DatePublished=14th October 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Wrapped in cling-film - far too hard to extrude.\n|Servings = Servings: 10\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  59 minutes\n|PrepTime =  45 minutes\n|CookTime =  14 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Squeezy cheese cookie dough - wrapped in cling-film.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Press did not work for me either \ud83e\udd2d</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">3.9</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">But this still made great savoury cookies.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry, aka Chef]]</span></span>\n}}\n\n\nHaving just bought myself another toy; an [[Oxo Good Grips Cookie Press]], I thought I should find a suitable recipe to use it with.  I can't abide sweet biscuits so it has to be something savoury.  This is it.\n\n'''Don't bother trying to use the cookie press with this recipe.''' I can't get this (or any other) recipe to work well in the [[Oxo Good Grips Cookie Press]].  The dough is either too hard to extrude properly or too liquid so ends up as a splodge on the baking tray.\n\nThis recipe works perfectly as cheese cookie recipe, but you'll need to hand cut the cookies manually.  I've made this recipe 4 times now and to my mind, the best cookies are very thin ones, 2 to 3 mm when cooked.  These have a nice crisp crunch.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 150 g [5 oz - 1.5 cups] [[Plain flour|plain flour]]\n| &#188; teaspoon [[Chili powder|chili powder]]\n| &#188; teaspoon [[Smoked paprika powder|smoked paprika powder]]\n| &#189; teaspoon [[Sea Salt|sea salt]]\n| 60 g [2.5 oz] [[Butter|butter]] cut into small cubes\n| 225 g [1.5 lb] strong [[Cheddar cheese]], roughly [[Grated|grated]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 190\u00b0 C (375\u00b0 F - gas 5), [fan oven 170\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n* Ensure the [[Cheese|cheese]] and [[Butter|butter]] are at room temperature\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Add the dry ingredients to a [[Food processor|food processor]] with a metal blade and pulse until combined.\n| Add the [[Butter|butter]] and [[Cheese|cheese]] and mix until it separates into small balls.  Don't over mix.\n| Tip into a bowl and knead with your hands to combine into a pliable dough.\n| Shape the dough into a sausage shape, wrap in [[Cling-film|cling-film]] and allow to [[Rest for|rest for]] 30 minutes at room temperature.\n| You can refrigerate at this stage and bake the cheese cookies later.  If you do this, allow the dough to get back to room temperature.\n| Cut the dough into thin slices, 2 mm to 3 mm thick, the thinner the better. Spread out on a baking tray lined with greaseproof paper or [[Bake O Glide]].\n| [[Bake]] in the middle of the [[Oven|oven]] for 8 minutes or until the edges begin to [[Brown|brown]]\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Squeezy cheese cookie dough - kneaded.jpg|300px|thumb|right|Kneaded into a dough\nImage:Squeezy cheese cookie dough - small balls.jpg|300px|thumb|right|Blended into small balls\n</gallery>\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Chilli pepper recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#butter #cheese #plainflour #bakeoglide #squeezycheesecookies #miseenplace #smokedpaprikapowder #bake #foodprocessor #restfor #cheddarcheese </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Steak, Guinness and Cheddar puff pastry pie",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Steak, Guinness and Cheddar puff pastry pie a cheese recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#guinness #oliveoil #onions #garlic #wok #steakguinnessandcheddarpuffpastrypie #miseenplace #flour #brandy #carrots #butter \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This is going to be our New Years Eve dinner - hopefully. Fine food for this cold miserable weather we are having\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 6812\n|PortionCalories = 1703\n|DatePublished=14th December 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 3 hours 10 minutes\n |PrepTime = 25 minutes\n |CookTime = 2 hours 45 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Steak, Guinness and Cheddar puff pastry pie recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">The cheddar rocks this recipe</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Just makes such a difference</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis is going to be our New Years Eve dinner - hopefully.  Fine food for this cold miserable weather we are having.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| [[Olive oil]] - I prefer [[Garlic olive oil|garlic olive oil]] for this - but that' me 'n' me [[Garlic|garlic]]!\n| 30 g [[Butter|butter]]\n| 3 Cloves of [[Garlic|garlic]], peeled and crushed\n| 3 medium [[Onions|onions]], peeled and chopped\n| 2 small [[Carrots|carrots]], peeled and sliced\n| 2 [[Celery|celery]] sticks, 'strings' removed with a [[Peeler|peeler]] and cut into moons\n| 1 [[Portobello mushroom]], cut into thin strips\n| 1kg [[Stewing|stewing]] [[Beef|beef]], cut into 2 cm cubes\n| 1 tablespoon freshly picked [[Rosemary leaves|rosemary leaves]], chopped finely\n| 2 tablespoons [[Parsley|parsley]], stems removed and finely chopped\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| Big pinch of [[mustard powder]] (to taste)\n| 1 x 440 ml can of [[Guinness]]\n| Splash of [[brandy]]\n| 3 heaped tablespoons [[Wholemeal flour|wholemeal flour]]\n| 200 g [[Cheddar cheese]], [[Grated|grated]]\n| 500g block of [[Puff pastry|puff pastry]] or 1 x 375g pack of ready rolled puff pastry\n| 1 [[Free range egg|free range egg]], beaten for glazing\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the oven to 190\u00b0 C (375\u00b0 F - gas 5)\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Steak and kidney covered.jpg|Once the pastry has risen, loosely cover with tin foil\nImage:Steak, Guinness and Cheddar puff egg wash.jpg|Brushed with beaten egg\nImage:Jamie Oliver's Steak, Guinness and Mushroom.jpg|Ready for the oven\nImage:Steak, Guinness and Cheese pie.jpg|Ingredients, [[mise en place]]\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n'''The filling'''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| The filling can be made in advance. Why not make double the amount and freeze half for another pie at a later date?\n| Add the [[Flour|flour]] to a bowl and season with [[Salt|salt]] and '''lots''' of [[Black pepper|black pepper]] and [[mustard powder]].\n| Roll the [[Meat|meat]] in the [[Flour|flour]] to coat well\n| You can do the [[Frying|frying]] stage in an oven proof pan, a [[Le Creuset]] type dish or a [[Wok|wok]].\n| Add a glug of [[Olive oil|olive oil]] to the [[Wok|wok]] and saut\u00e9 the [[Onions|onions]] and [[Garlic|garlic]] over a low heat until translucent, about 7 minutes, remove and reserve\n| Turn up the heat and add a little more [[Olive oil|olive oil]] if necessary, [[Brown|brown]] the [[Beef|beef]] cubes for 3 or 4 minutes then add the [[Onions|onions]] back and tip in the [[Butter|butter]], [[Carrots|carrots]], [[Celery|celery]], [[parsley]], [[Rosemary|rosemary]] and [[mushrooms]] and [[Fry|fry]] off for a few more minutes \n| [[Deglaze]] the pan with a splash of [[brandy]] if you have some laying around.\n| Tip everything into an oven proof dish if you are using your [[Wok|wok]] and pour in the [[Guinness]] and enough water so the contents are just covered, stir, cover and cook in the oven for about 2.5 hours.  Give it a stir halfway through.\n| If after this cooking it's still very runny, reduce it further by heating on the hob.\n| Mix in half of the [[Cheese|cheese]], taste and adjust the seasoning if required.\n}}\n'''Baking the pie'''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Grease a [[Pie dish|pie dish]] with [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and tip in the filling\n| Sprinkle over the with the remaining [[Cheddar cheese]]\n| With a sharp knife, have some fun scoring a pattern in the top, and then [[Brush|brush]] with the beaten [[Egg|egg]]\n| Lay the crust over the dish, allowing plenty of it to hang over the side as it will shrink.  Notice the difference in the photos\n| If the filling is hot then the pie will only need baking to rise the crust, whereas if it is cold, it will need longer to heat the filling\n| I would bake for 20 to 30 minutes to rise the crust alone, but check it's progress regularly\n| If you need to heat the contents as well bake for 30 to 40 minutes, but I would cover the pastry with [[tin-foil]] once it is golden-brown or it will burn.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe hot with [[Garden peas|garden peas]], [[Boiled potatoes|boiled potatoes]] and a pint of [[Guinness]]!\n===Variations===\nMake smaller, individual pies.\n\nTo make a conventional [[steak and ale pie]], substitute [[bitter]] for the [[Guinness]].\n===Chef's tip===\nI have just lidded the pie with puff pastry but you can line the pie with [[Puff pastry|puff pastry]] as well, however, I find it just goes soggy.  You will probably need a 500g block if you are doing this. 2/3rds for the lining and 1/3 for the lid\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Cooking with beer]]\n[[Category:Beef recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pies tarts and flans]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Irish recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#guinness #oliveoil #onions #garlic #wok #steakguinnessandcheddarpuffpastrypie #miseenplace #flour #brandy #carrots #butter </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Steak and Dragon Welsh cheddar cheese pies",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Steak and Dragon Welsh cheddar cheese pies recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#sauce #casserole #pies #cheese #carrots #fry #beef #puffpastry #egg #steakanddragonwelshcheddarcheesepies #steak \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Steak pies with a cheesy finish, this is a little fiddly but definitely worth the effort.\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=24th September 2016\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 6\n|Difficulty = 3\n|TotalTime =  2 hours, 50 minutes\n|PrepTime =  30 minutes\n|CookTime =  2 hours, 20 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 7263\n|PortionCalories = 1210\n|Image = [[Image:Steak and Dragon Welsh cheddar cheese pies recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Nearly as good as steak and ale</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Good old Dragon cheese.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Steak]] [[Pies|pies]] with a cheesy finish, this is a little fiddly but definitely worth the effort.\n\nThis recipe  from [[South Caernarfon Creameries]] makes one very large pie or 4 individual [[Pies|pies]].\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 kg [[Beef|beef]] [[Steak|steak]], [[Diced|diced]]\n| 2 [[Red onions|red onions]], peeled and chopped\n| 2 [[Carrots|carrots]], peeled and thinly sliced\n| 2 [[Cloves garlic, crushed|cloves garlic, crushed]]\n| 150g [[Chestnut mushrooms]], washed and quartered\n| 3 tablespoons [[Sunflower oil|sunflower oil]]\n| 3 sprigs [[Fresh thyme|fresh thyme]], leaves removed and washed\n| 250ml [[Red wine|red wine]]\n| 200ml [[Beef Stock|beef stock]]\n| [[Salt]] & [[Pepper|pepper]] to taste\n| 1/2 a teaspoon of Worcester [[Sauce|sauce]] (optional)\n| 2 tablespoons [[Plain flour|plain flour]]\n| 180g [[Grated|grated]] [[Dragon mature Welsh cheddar cheese]]\n| 500g pack [[Puff pastry|puff pastry]]\n| 1 [[Egg|egg]] beaten with pinch [[Salt|salt]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6), [fan oven 180\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| In a large [[Frying pan|frying pan]] heat 2 tablespoons on a medium to high heat. [[Fry]] off the [[Beef|beef]] in small batches and place in a large ovenproof [[Casserole dish|casserole dish]]\n| Add the [[Onions|onions]] to the [[Frying pan|frying pan]] and [[Fry|fry]] gently until lightly [[Browned|browned]], add [[Garlic|garlic]] and [[Carrots|carrots]] and extra [[Oil|oil]] if needed. Sprinkle with [[Flour|flour]] and mix through, add [[Wine|wine]] and [[Stock|stock]] and stir thoroughly whilst bringing [[Sauce|sauce]] to [[Boil|boil]]\n| Season with [[Salt|salt]], [[Pepper|pepper]] and add Worcester [[Sauce|sauce]] (optional). Pour over [[Meat|meat]] and cover the [[Casserole|casserole]]. Cook for 1\u00bd hours in moderate [[Oven|oven]]\n| Saut\u00e9 [[Mushrooms|mushrooms]] in some [[Oil|oil]] and add to [[Casserole|casserole]], cook for a further 30 minutes until [[Meat|meat]] is tender\n| Check [[Sauce|sauce]] is thick enough as pie filling needs to be thick, if too thin place sauce in pan and reduce down over a high heat. Return to [[Casserole|casserole]] and add 100g [[Cheese|cheese]]\n| Place filling in a deep [[Pie dish|pie dish]]\n| Roll out [[Puff pastry|puff pastry]] and make a lid for pie, make sure there is some overhang as [[Pastry|pastry]] will shrink on cooking. Crimp the edges and [[Brush|brush]] top with beaten [[Egg|egg]]. Sprinkle over remaining [[Cheese|cheese]] and [[Bake|bake]] for 20 mins in a very hot [[Oven|oven]] until pastry is risen and golden\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Dragon mature Welsh cheddar cheese.jpg|thumb|300px|right|[http://www.dragonwales.co.uk/products/cheddar/mature/ Dragon mature Welsh cheddar cheese]\nImage:Dragon vintage Welsh cheddar cheese.jpg|thumb|300px|right|[http://www.dragonwales.co.uk/products/cheddar/clasurol/ Dragon vintage Welsh cheddar cheese]\n</gallery>\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Green vegetables|green vegetables]] and [[Steamed|steamed]] [[Potatoes|potatoes]]\n===Variations===\nFor an extra special occasion, use [[Dragon vintage Welsh cheddar cheese]]!\n{{Template:Dragon cheese attribution}}\n==See also==\n* [[South Caernarfon Creameries]]\n* [[Dragon mature Welsh cheddar cheese]]\n* [[Dragon vintage Welsh cheddar cheese]]\n\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Beef recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pies tarts and flans]]\n[[Category:Dragon cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#sauce #casserole #pies #cheese #carrots #fry #beef #puffpastry #egg #steakanddragonwelshcheddarcheesepies #steak </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }

title": "Steak and kidney pie",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Steak and kidney pie a beef recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#steakandkidneypie #pastry #puffpastry #parsley #brush #mustard #onion #flour #gravy #steam #mushroomketchup \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Classic pub lunch this one. Crispy top with loads of tasty gravy. Making it with ready-rolled puff pastry saves loads of your time\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 3539\n|PortionCalories = 884\n|DatePublished=12th November 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime = 2 hours 30 minutes\n|PrepTime = 30 minutes\n|CookTime = 2 hours\n|Image = [[Image:Steak and kidney pie.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Better than anything you can buy</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">One of my favourite meals ever.  Perfection.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nClassic pub lunch this one.  Crispy top with loads of tasty [[gravy]]. Making it with with ready-rolled [[puff pastry]] saves loads of your time.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 600 g (1lb 5 oz) diced [[stewing]] steak, diced\n| 280 g (10 oz) [[beef kidney]], trimmed and finely sliced\n| 2 tablespoons [[plain flour]]\n| 150ml/5fl oz [[beef stock]] mixed with a dash of [[red wine]]. Half an Oxo cube would do at a push\n| Salt and [[freshly ground black pepper]] to taste\n| Pinch of [[mustard]]\n| 1 large [[onion]], peeled and chopped\n| 2 tablespoons freshly chopped [[parsley]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[tomato pur\u00e9e]]\n| 225g/8oz ready rolled [[puff pastry]]\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the oven to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - Gas 6 - Moderately hot)\n** If your electric oven has the options of upper, lower, both elements, use the lower element.\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Trim any excess fat from the steak and the kidneys\n| Season the [[flour]] and add the steak and kidney and coat well\n| shake off any excess flour\n| Layer the [[onion]], meat and [[parsley]] into a buttered pie dish\n| Mix the [[tomato pur\u00e9e]], beef stock and [[mustard]]\n| Pour the stock mixture into the dish so that the meat is just over half covered.  Add extra water if required\n| Roll out the [[pastry]] to 2mm (1/8\") thick and cut a long strip to fit around the edge of the pie dish\n| [[Brush]] the edge of the dish with water and press the strip on to it.\n| [[Brush]] the top of the strip with more water and lay the [[pastry]] on the top to make a lid\n| Trim away any excess and crimp the edge. Cut a 1cm (&frac12;\")  hole in the top to allow [[steam]] to escape or fit a [[pie funnel]].\n| Refrigerate the pie for 15 minutes\n| [[Bake]] in the oven for 30 minutes in the middle of the oven until the [[pastry]] has risen and is golden brown\n| Once the pastry has risen, lay a sheet of [[tin foil]] very loosely over the top of the pastry to prevent it overcooking\n| Lower the heat to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - Gas 4 - moderate) and cook for a further 90 minutes\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Steak and kidney covered.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Once the pastry has risen, loosely cover with tin foil\nImage:Steak and kidney pie pre-lid.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Ready for the lid\n</gallery>\n===Serving suggestions===\n\nServe with [[minty peas]] and [[boiled potatoes]]\n===Variations===\n\nYield to the Delia (Smith) Effect: Add a few tablespoons of [[mushroom ketchup]] to the stock mixture.\n==See also==\n* [[Steak and kidney pudding]]\n* A recipe for [[Steak and kidney pudding (PC)|steak and kidney pudding]], cooked in a pressure cooker\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Beef recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Offal recipes]]\n[[Category:Pies tarts and flans]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Cooking with wine]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#steakandkidneypie #pastry #puffpastry #parsley #brush #mustard #onion #flour #gravy #steam #mushroomketchup </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}
