title": "Steak and kidney pudding",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Steak and kidney pudding (boiled version) recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#steakandkidneypudding #flour #suet #worcestershiresauce #boiling #plainflour #kidney #dough #kidneys #peas #mustard \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Home-made Steak and kidney pudding recipe. This one is boiled\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 4252\n|PortionCalories = 708\n|DatePublished=26th September 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 6\n |Difficulty = 2\n |ImageComment = Steak and kidney pudding, peas and mash\n |TotalTime = 5 hours 20 minutes\n |PrepTime = 20 minutes\n |CookTime = 5 hours\n |Image = [[Image:Steak and kidney pudding recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">I love steak and kidney pud</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">A real heartwarming meal.  This is a bit fiddly, but is worth the effort. Yum!</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n'''Home-made Steak and kidney pudding recipe'''. Although this recipe takes 5 hours to cook, or burn, if you are forgetful, most of the time is in the [[Boiling|boiling]], the preparation is minimal, plus you have the benefit of the wonderful smell whilst it's cooking.\n\nThe pudding is known colloquially as \"Babby's Yead\" (Baby's Head) in certain areas of North West England.\n\n'''[[Steak and kidney pudding (PC)|The pressure cooker version of this recipe can be found here.]]'''\n\n''' Suet crust'''\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 350 g( 12 oz) [[Self-raising flour|self-raising flour]]\n| 175 g (6 oz) [[Shredded|shredded]] [[beef suet]] ([[Atora]])\n| Pinch of [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n}}\n'''Filling'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 560 g (1&frac14; lb) [[chuck steak]] / [[braising steak]]\n| 275 g (10 oz) ox [[Kidney|kidney]] - trimmed to 225 g (8 oz), ''some supermarkets sell the above, ready trimmed, in one packet''\n| 2 tablespoons [[Plain flour|plain flour]]\n| Big pinch of [[Mustard powder|mustard powder]]\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]] \n| Handful of fresh [[Parsley|parsley]], chopped\n| 1 teaspoon [[Worcestershire sauce]]\n| 1 Oxo cube, crumbled\n| 1 medium [[Onion|onion]], peeled and sliced\n| ''You shouldn't need to add any water though you may want to make some gravy separately to serve with the pudding''. \n}}\n===Method===\n\n'''Pastry'''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| You can do this in a [[Food processor|food processor]], but don't over-mix it\n| Sift the [[Flour|flour]], [[Salt|salt]] into a large mixing bowl\n| Season with [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n| Add the [[Suet|suet]], a few drops of water and combine with the [[Flour|flour]], using a palette knife\n| Continue stirring, adding a few drops of water at a time until it starts to become a little clay-like\n| Stop adding water now and mix with your hands\n| Keep mixing until you have a smooth elastic [[Dough|dough]].  You can always make small adjustments by adding a little more [[Flour|flour]] or water as needed\n| Divide the [[Dough|dough]] into &frac14; for the lid and &frac34; t line the bowl\n| Roll out a circle, quite thick, about a foot in diameter and press into your pie-bowl\n| Roll the remainder out as a lid so that it sits over the edges of the lined bowl\n}}\n'''Filling'''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Trim the [[Meat|meat]] and [[Kidneys|kidneys]] of excess [[Fat|fat]] etc. so you have the correct weight. Feed your cats or dogs with the remainder!\n| Season the [[Flour|flour]] with [[Salt|salt]], [[Pepper|pepper]] and [[Mustard|mustard]]\n| Dredge the [[Meat|meat]] and [[Kidney|kidney]] in the seasoned [[Flour|flour]]\n| Add all of the filling ingredients to a separate bowl.  Crumble in the [[Oxo cube]].  Mix well with your hands.\n| Fill the suet-lined bowl with the filling ingredients.\n| Shake any remaining [[Flour|flour]] over the top and ''just'' cover the [[Meat|meat]] with cold water\n| Add a few shakes of [[Worcestershire sauce]]\n| Season with [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Steak and kidney pudding cooked.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Cooked & serving\nImage:Steak and kidney pudding prepared.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Ready for the lid\n</gallery>\n'''Wrapping and cooking'''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Cover with a double layer of [[tin-foil]], leaving a pleat for expansion\n| Tie with [[kitchen string]] and make a handle affair if you are able.  It assists with removal later\n| Fill a lidded pan &frac34; full with [[Boiling|boiling]] water and lower the bowl into it, cover and [[Boil|boil]] for 5 hours. Yes that's five hours!\n| '''Set a timer for every hour''' so you can check that it's not boiled dry and top up if needed\n| If using a [[pressure cooker]], reduce the cooking time to about 2 hours, see full details in a [[Steak and kidney pudding (PC)|separate recipe, here]].\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[mashed potatoes]] and [[peas]] and [[gravy]].\n\nDon't try and invert a pudding of this size onto a plate. You are inviting disaster, and for no sensible reason. Trust me. Serve it directly out of the bowl!\n\n===Chef's notes===\n* Don't sit the bowl on a saucer in the pan.  It will probably be broken after 5 hours\n* Next time, using this quantity, I would make 2 separate puddings\n* Check the ''use-by'' [[Date|date]] of the [[Suet|suet]], I had a batch of suet-pudding failures, which I eventually traced to years out-of-date packet [[suet]]. It does go off.\n* Suet can be frozen and keeps for ever this way.  Defrost naturally. \n\n===Variations===\nI often make 2 separate puddings using this recipe. I make the first using half the cooked meat and freeze the remainder for the other pudding.\nAlways make the suet mix on the day you plan to cook the pudding. I use 200 g of [[plain flour]] and 100 g of [[suet]] for each of the smaller puddings.\n\nOther variations can be found on the [[Talk:Steak and kidney pudding|comments]] page.\n====The best knot to tie kitchen twine single-handedly====\nAfter much experimenting, I have discovered the best knot to tie kitchen twine on your own is the ''[[Surgeons' knot]]''.\n==See also==\n* [[Steak and kidney pudding (PC)|A steak and kidney pudding recipe especially for a pressure cooker]]\n* [[Slow roast recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Beef recipes]]\n[[Category:Offal recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Steamed]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#steakandkidneypudding #flour #suet #worcestershiresauce #boiling #plainflour #kidney #dough #kidneys #peas #mustard </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Steak and kidney pudding (PC)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Steak and kidney pudding, a pressure cooker recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#flour #suet #kidney #dough #pressurecooker #pressurecookerrecipes #blackpepper #plainflour #mashedpotatoes #chucksteak #mushroomketchup \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Cooking steak and kidney pudding in a pressure cooker reduces the cooking time by more than half compared to the conventional method\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 4273\n|PortionCalories = 712\n|DatePublished=26th September 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 6\n |Difficulty = 2\n |ImageComment = Steak and kidney pudding, peas and mash\n |TotalTime = 2 hours 20 minutes\n |PrepTime = 20 minutes\n |CookTime = 2 hours\n |Image = [[Image:Steak kidney pudding pressure cooker recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Pressure cooked pud. is THE BEST</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">And it's the most economical way to cook this recipew.</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nCooking steak and kidney pudding in a [[pressure cooker]] reduces the cooking time by more than half compared to the [[Steak and kidney pudding|conventional method]].\n\nThe pudding is known colloquially as \"Babby's Yead\" (Baby's Head) in certain areas of North West England.\n\n\n''' Suet crust'''\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 350 g( 12 oz) [[Self-raising flour|self-raising flour]]\n| 175 g (6 oz) [[Shredded|shredded]] [[beef suet]] ([[Atora]])\n| Pinch of [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n}}\n'''Filling'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 560 g (1&frac14; lb) [[chuck steak]] / [[ steak]]\n| 275 g (10 oz) ox [[Kidney|kidney]] - trimmed to 225 g (8 oz), ''some supermarkets sell the above, ready trimmed, in one packet''\n| 2 tablespoons [[Plain flour|plain flour]]\n| Big pinch of [[Mustard powder|mustard powder]]\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]] \n| Handful of fresh [[Parsley|parsley]], chopped\n| 2 cloves of garlic, peeled and crushed\n| 1 tablespoon of [[mushroom ketchup]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Worcestershire sauce]]\n| 1 Oxo cube, crumbled\n| 1 medium [[Onion|onion]], peeled and sliced\n| [[Sea salt]] and freshly ground [[black pepper]]\n| ''You shouldn't need to add any water though you may want to make some gravy separately to serve with the pudding''. \n}}\n===Method===\n\n'''Pastry'''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Sift the [[Flour|flour]] and the [[Salt|salt]] into a large mixing bowl\n| Season with [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n| Add the [[Suet|suet]], a few drops of water and combine with the [[Flour|flour]], using a palette knife\n| Continue stirring, adding a few drops of water at a time until it starts to become a little clay-like\n| Stop adding water now and mix with your hands\n| Keep mixing until you have a smooth elastic [[Dough|dough]].  You can always make small adjustments by adding a little more [[Flour|flour]] or water as needed\n| Divide the [[Dough|dough]] into &frac14; for the lid and &frac34; t line the bowl\n| Roll out a circle, quite thick, about a foot in diameter and press into your pie-bowl\n| Roll the remainder out as a lid so that it sits over the edges of the lined bowl\n}}\n'''Filling'''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Trim the [[Meat|meat]] and [[Kidneys|kidneys]] of excess [[Fat|fat]] etc. so you have the correct weight. Feed your cats or dogs with the remainder!\n| Season the [[Flour|flour]] with [[Salt|salt]], [[Pepper|pepper]] and [[Mustard|mustard]]\n| Dredge the [[Meat|meat]] and [[Kidney|kidney]] in the seasoned [[Flour|flour]]\n| Add all of the filling ingredients to a separate bowl.  Crumble in the [[Oxo cube]].  Mix well with your hands.\n| Fill the suet-lined bowl with the filling ingredients.\n| Shake any remaining [[Flour|flour]] over the top and ''just'' cover the [[Meat|meat]] with cold water\n}}\n'''Wrapping and cooking'''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Cover with a double layer of [[tin-foil]], leaving a pleat for expansion\n| Tie with [[kitchen string]].\n| Quarter fill the [[pressure cooker]] with boiling water.\n| Place the bowl in the shallow trivet.\n| Cook on high pressure for 2 hours.\n| Allow the pressure to come down naturally.\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Steak and kidney pudding cooked.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Cooked and ready to serve\nImage:Steak and kidney pudding prepared.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Ready for the lid\n</gallery>\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[mashed potatoes]] and [[peas]] and [[gravy]].\n\nDon't try and invert a pudding of this size onto a plate. You are inviting disaster, and for no sensible reason. Trust me. Serve it directly out of the bowl!\n\n===Chef's notes===\n* Don't sit the bowl on a saucer in the pan.  It will probably be broken after 5 hours\n* Next time, using this quantity, I would make 2 separate puddings\n* Check the ''use-by'' [[Date|date]] of the [[Suet|suet]], I had a batch of suet-pudding failures, which I eventually traced to years out-of-date packet [[suet]]. It does go off. \n* Suet can be frozen and keeps for ever this way.  Defrost naturally.\n\n===Variations===\nI often make 2 separate puddings using this recipe. I make the first using half the cooked meat and freeze the remainder for the other pudding.\nAlways make the suet mix on the day you plan to cook the pudding. I use 200 g of [[plain flour]] and 100 g of [[suet]] for each of the smaller puddings.\n\nOther variations can be found on the [[Talk:Steak and kidney pudding|comments]] page.\n\nThis recipe was tested in a WMF 6.5 litre pressure cooker.   On this model high pressure is represented by two red rings showing (117&deg;C)\n====The best knot to tie kitchen twine single-handedly====\nAfter much experimenting, I have discovered the best knot to tie kitchen twine on your own is the ''[[Surgeons' knot]]''.\n==See also==\n* [[Pressure cooker recipes]]\n* [[Steak and kidney pudding]] - recipe and timings for the non-pressure cooker version.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Beef recipes]]\n[[Category:Offal recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Pressure cooker recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#flour #suet #kidney #dough #pressurecooker #pressurecookerrecipes #blackpepper #plainflour #mashedpotatoes #chucksteak #mushroomketchup </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }

title": "Steak Diane",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Steak Diane a beef recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#steakdiane #butter #parsley #brandy #worcestershiresauce #boil #fry #stock #onion #diced #carrot \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Steak Diane was the height of fashion in grand dining rooms across America\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 3816\n|PortionCalories = 954\n|DatePublished=21st January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 3\n|TotalTime = 45 minutes\n|PrepTime = 15 minutes\n|CookTime = 30 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Steak Diane recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Yum!!!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Bring back the eighties.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nSteak Diane was the height of fashion in grand dining rooms across America. The highpoint of the meal came when a waiter in jacket and bow-tie flamed a diner's [[sirloin]] table-side before his very eyes! There are a number of variations on Steak Diane, but most call for [[butter]], [[shallots]], [[mustard]], [[cream]], [[Worcestershire sauce]], [[brandy]], and a match.\n\nThe dish is said to be named for Diane, the Roman Goddess of hunting; many game dishes also use her name.\n\nThis classic 70's dinner party dish is definitely still worth making because it has the very best ingredients.  Probably needs a bottle of Blue Nun and a [[prawn cocktail]] too!\n\n\n'''Sauce'''\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1 large [[onion]], peeled and [[diced]] finely\n| 1 large [[carrot]], peeled and [[diced]] finely\n| 50 g (2 oz) [[butter]]\n| 15 g (1/2 oz) [[plain flour]]\n| &#190; pint of [[beef]] [[stock]] - (Mine was 2/3rds good beef stock & 1/3 red wine)\n| 1 [[bay leaf]]\n| Big handful of [[parsley]], stalks 'n all\n| Sprig of [[thyme]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[tomato puree]]\n| &#189; teaspoon [[mustard powder]]\n| &#189; teaspoon [[salt]] (omit if you are being lazy and using [[stock]] from a cube!)\n| [[Freshly ground black pepper]]\n}}\n'''Steaks'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 25 g (1 oz) [[butter]]\n| 4 fillet steaks\n| 2 tablespoons [[brandy]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[dry sherry]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Worcestershire sauce]]\n| Chopped [[parsley]] to garnish\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Flaming Steak Diane.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Flaming Steak Diane\nImage:Steak Diane ingredients.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Steak Diane - the ingredients\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n\n'''Sauce'''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| In a saucepan, [[fry]] the [[onion]] and [[carrot]] in [[butter]] until golden\n| Add the [[flour]] and stir to absorb any remaining [[butter]]\n| Add the remaining [[sauce]] ingredients, bring to the [[boil]] and then [[simmer]] gently for 30 minutes, aiming to reduce by about half\n| Strain the liquid through a colander so you keep some of the ''bits''\n| Cover and set-aside for later\n}}\n'''Steaks'''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Heat the [[butter]] and [[fry]] the steaks until [[browned]] all over\n| Pour the [[sherry]] and [[brandy]] over the steaks and light the vapours.  You could do this stage at the table if you wish.\n| Cover, turn off the heat and let the steaks rest for 10 minutes\n| Add the reserved [[sauce]] and [[Worcestershire sauce]] to the [[frying]] pan, bring to the [[boil]], sprinkle with chopped \n[[parsley]] and serve\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Beef recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Cooking with wine]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#steakdiane #butter #parsley #brandy #worcestershiresauce #boil #fry #stock #onion #diced #carrot </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Steak wraps with sour cream and salad",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Steak wraps with sour cream and salad\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#steak #tomatoes #greensalad #lemonjuice #minitortillawraps #paprika #steakwrapswithsourcreamandsalad #oliveoil #sourcream #driedoregano #fry \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Cubed rib eye steak with a paprika rub served in salad wraps\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=14th May 2017\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  30 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  15 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 1915\n|PortionCalories = 957 \n|Image = [[Image:Steak wraps with sour cream and salad recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Neat cheat!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.7</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">\ud83d\udc8b Beautiful \ud83d\udc8b</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry, aka Chef]])</span></span>\n}}\nA luxurious Saturday night special [[Salad|salad]] which is delicious, yet fairly economical at about \u00a35 each for two people.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 tablespoon unsmoked [[Paprika powder|paprika powder]]\n| Good pinch of [[Salt|salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| &#188; teaspoon of [[Dried oregano|dried oregano]]\n| Pinch of [[Hot chilli powder|hot chilli powder]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]]\n| 395g [[rib eye steak]] (1 large steak)\n| 2 tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n}}\n==== to serve====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 4 [[mini tortilla wraps]] each\n| [[Green salad]]\n| [[Sour cream]] with [[Chives|chives]]\n| Fresh [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]], chopped\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Add the [[Paprika|paprika]], [[Salt|salt]], [[Pepper|pepper]] and [[Dried oregano|dried oregano]] to a [[Pestle and mortar|pestle and mortar]] and mix well\n| Chop the [[Steak|steak]] into bite-sized cubes\n| Add the cubed [[Steak|steak]] to a [[Lock and Lock box]] and add a tablespoon of [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]], close the box and shake well\n| Add the powdered [[Spices|spices]] to the [[Steak|steak]], close  the box and shake like mad for 10 seconds to coat the [[Meat|meat]] evenly.\n| If you have time, leave for 15 minutes to '[[Marinade|marinade]]'.\n| Heat the [[Olive oil|olive oil]] over a high heat and as soon as it's hot, tip in the [[Steak|steak]].\n| Pan [[Fry|fry]] for about 4 minutes, turning very often.\n| Remove from the heat and allow to [[Rest for|rest for]] 5 minutes.\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Steak, salad, wraps and sour cream.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Laid out, ready to go!\nImage:Steak cubes coated with paprika rub.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Cubed steak coated with the [[paprika]] rub\n</gallery>\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[mini tortilla wraps]], a [[Green salad|green salad]], fresh [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]] and a [[Sour cream|sour cream]] or [[Yogurt|yogurt]] dir\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Beef recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Salad recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#steak #tomatoes #greensalad #lemonjuice #minitortillawraps #paprika #steakwrapswithsourcreamandsalad #oliveoil #sourcream #driedoregano #fry </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Steamed broccoli",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Steamed broccoli, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#steamedbroccoli #broccoli #butter #steam #boiling #steamed #blackpepper #colander #carrots #steaming #vegetable \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This is probably our favourite vegetable and steaming it is such an easy way to cook it\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 51\n|PortionCalories = 25\n|DatePublished=21st January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 2\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 12 minutes\n |PrepTime = 5 minutes \n |CookTime = 7 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Steamed broccoli recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">How Green?</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">If you like your broccoli green, then this is for you!</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis is probably our favourite [[Vegetable|vegetable]] and [[Steaming|steaming]] it is such an easy way to cook it. Allow  3 to 4 minutes for crunchy, about 5 minutes to leave it slightly tender but still with a little bite.\n[[Image:Steamed broccoli cooking evenly.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Cut a cross in the stems to ensure everything cooks evenly]]\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1 small head of [[Broccoli|broccoli]]\n| Ensure the broccoli is cut into evenly sized florets\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Ensure the florets are all the same size.  \n| Make a small cross cut down the base of any thick stems to ensure that they cook evenly.\n| Place the [[Broccoli|broccoli]] in a [[Steamer|steamer]] or a [[Colander|colander]] set over a pan of [[Boiling|boiling]] water, cover and [[Steam|steam]] for 7 minutes.\n| Serve immediately.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\n[[Broccoli]] is nice served with a dab of [[Butter|butter]] and some [[Black pepper|black pepper]].\n===Variations===\nMix 50/50 with [[Cauliflower|cauliflower]] or [[Carrots|carrots]] - cut into similar-sized pieces to ensure they are evenly.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Student recipes]]\n[[Category:Steamed]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#steamedbroccoli #broccoli #butter #steam #boiling #steamed #blackpepper #colander #carrots #steaming #vegetable </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Steamed monkfish tail",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=How to cook frozen monkfish tails recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#monkfish #dill #frozen #steamer #steamedmonkfishtail #steaming #prawns #whitefish #herbs #steamed #boiling \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Steaming the frozen monkfish tail with a bunch of dill added a lovely herb flavour\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 66\n|PortionCalories = 33\n|DatePublished=30th December 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  20 minutes\n|PrepTime =  5 minutes\n|CookTime =  15 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Steamed monkfish tail recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Dill the dog. I'm a dog called Dill</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.2</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Anne always sings that when I made this meal!</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Monkfish|monkfish]] is a superb firm [[White fish|white fish]], with a taste similar to [[King prawns|king prawns]].  It is now widely available at a reasonable price.  If it has been filleted and deboned it can be used exactly like [[Prawns|prawns]], however it is often sold  sold on the bone as [[monkfish]] tail.  Removing the [[Meat|meat]] from the bone while the fish is raw can be tricky and wasteful. However, once cooked the meat just falls off.\n\nThe method below worked very well with a [[Frozen|frozen]] [[Monkfish|monkfish]] tail, the [[Dill|dill]] gave it a really nice [[Herbs|herbs]] flavour.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 [[Monkfish|monkfish]] tail - [[Frozen|frozen]] is fine\n| 1 bunch of [[Dill|dill]]\n| Pinch of [[Sea Salt|sea salt]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Make a bed of the [[Dill|dill]] in the [[Steamer|steamer]] basket\n| Sit the [[Monkfish|monkfish]] tail on the [[Dill|dill]], sprinkle with [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and drop a few sprigs of dill over the top\n| Add [[Boiling|boiling]] water to the [[Steamer|steamer]] and [[Steam|steam]], covered for 15 minutes\n| I cooked mine from [[Frozen|frozen]] so after 15 minutes of [[Steaming|steaming]] I took the pan off the heat and let it sit for 10 minutes.\n| Once cooled a little the flesh just falls off the gelatinous bone.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nI used the monkfish meat in [[Cheesy monkfish jacket potatoes]] - plenty for two people.\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Sea fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Steamed]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#monkfish #dill #frozen #steamer #steamedmonkfishtail #steaming #prawns #whitefish #herbs #steamed #boiling </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Steven's beef stew with suet dumplings",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Steven's beef stew with suet dumplings a beef recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#stevensbeefstewwithsuetdumplings #beefstock #potatoes #onions #stew #beef #cabbage #carrots #lard #steak #spices \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This stew is based upon Bogracsgulyas (Goulash), but without the spices\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 5499\n|PortionCalories = 1374\n|DatePublished=19th January 2013\n|Author = JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 2 hours 10 minutes\n |PrepTime = 10 minutes\n |CookTime = 2 hours\n |Image = [[Image:Steven's beef stew with suet dumplings recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Good on you Steve</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Nothing wrong with plain food.</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The&nbsp;Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis [[Stew|stew]] is based upon [[Bogr\u00e1csguly\u00e1s (Goulash)]], but without the [[Spices|spices]].  This was requested by Steven, who is the boyfriend of my daughter and who likes plain food.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 2 medium [[Onions|onions]], roughly chopped\n| 2 tablespoons [[Lard|lard]] or [[Sunflower oil|sunflower oil]]\n| 1.1 kg [[Stewing|stewing]] [[Steak|steak]], cut into large cubes\n| 2.8 [[Litres|litres]] warm [[Beef stock|beef stock]] \n| 750 g [[Carrots|carrots]], cut into large chunks\n| 1 kg [[Potatoes|potatoes]], peeled and quartered\n| 1 small Savoy [[Cabbage|cabbage]], coarsely [[Shredded|shredded]]\n| 1&frac12; quantity of [[User:Chef|Chef]]'s [[Suet dumplings|suet dumplings]] recipe\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Preheat the [[Lard|lard]] to a medium temperature in large pan.\n| Add the [[Onions|onions]], and [[Stew|stew]] until glossy, but not [[Brown|brown]].\n| Add the [[Beef|beef]] cubes and cook for about 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.\n| Remove from the heat, and add the warm [[Beef stock|beef stock]].\n| Cook, covered, over a medium heat for one hour.\n| Increase the heat, remove the lid and add the [[Carrots|carrots]].\n| [[Simmer]] for 20 minutes.\n| Place the [[Dumplings|dumplings]] in the pan.\n| Add the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] and bring to a gentle [[Boil|boil]] for 10 minutes.\n| Add the [[Cabbage|cabbage]] and cook for a further 10 minutes.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nSteve wanted this served with [[Pan con s\u00e9mola de trigo duro]], which is an excellent [[Bread|bread]].\n===Chef's notes===\nI made the [[Stock|stock]] using Kallo Organic [[Beef|beef]] cubes, but any decent [[Beef stock|beef stock]] would be fine.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Steven's beef stew with suet dumplings]]\n[[Category:Beef recipes|Steven's beef stew with suet dumplings]]\n[[Category:British recipes|Steven's beef stew with suet dumplings]]\n[[Category:Main courses|Steven's beef stew with suet dumplings]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes|Steven's beef stew with suet dumplings]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes|Steven's beef stew with suet dumplings]]\n[[Category:Stews and casseroles|Steven's beef stew with suet dumplings]]\n[[Category:Stewed, braised or pot roasted]]\n\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#stevensbeefstewwithsuetdumplings #beefstock #potatoes #onions #stew #beef #cabbage #carrots #lard #steak #spices </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }

title": "Stir-fried beef fillet strips with peanut and chilli sauce",
                "revisions": [

                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",

                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Stir-fried beef fillet strips with peanut and chilli sauce\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#sesameoil #marinade #lime #beef #chillies #peanutbutter #ginger #filletofbeef #stirfriedbeeffilletstripswithpeanutandchillisauce #demerarasugar #meatrecipes\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=My version of this classic Asian dish, though you would probably have a search to find one made with best Fillet of fillet of beef.\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=5th April 2022\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  1 hour, 33 minutes\n|PrepTime =  1 hour, 15 minutes\n|CookTime =  18 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 1735\n|PortionCalories = 433\n|Image = [[Image:Stirfried beef fillet strips with peanut and chilli sauce recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Happy Boy!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I'm very pleased with this; just about the right mix of flavours, not too hot and very tasty.</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry]] </span></span>\n}}\nMy version of this classic Asian dish, though you would probably have a search to find one made with best [[Fillet of beef|fillet of beef]].\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n}}\n====stir-fried beef====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 450g [[Fillet of beef|fillet of beef]], beaten flat and cut into thin strips\n| 15 ml [[Sesame oil|sesame oil]]\n| 4 large [[Garlic cloves, peeled and crushed|garlic cloves, peeled and crushed]]\n| 1\" piece of [[Ginger|ginger]], chopped into thin discs\n| 3 [[Green Indian chillies|green Indian chillies]], deseeded and finely chopped\n| 1 tablespoon whole [[Coriander seeds|coriander seeds]], left whole\n| 1 tablespoon smooth [[Peanut butter|peanut butter]]\n| 3 tablespoons of hot water\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 1 [[Lime|lime]] cut into slices\n}}\n====marinade====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 1 tablespoon [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Light soy sauce|light soy sauce]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Dark soy sauce|dark soy sauce]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Worcestershire sauce]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Demerara sugar|demerara sugar]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Mix the [[Marinade|marinade]] ingredients together.  Toss the [[Beef|beef]] strips in the marinade and leave for at least an hour.\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Heat the [[Sesame oil|sesame oil]] in a [[Wok|wok]] and [[Stir fry|stir fry]] the [[Coriander|coriander]], [[Ginger|ginger]], [[Garlic|garlic]] and [[Chillies|chillies]] until coloured and fragrant.\n| Add the [[Sugar|sugar]] and [[Beef|beef]] strips together with the [[Marinade|marinade]] and strip [[Fry|fry]] to [[Sear|sear]] the beef.\n| Add the [[Peanut butter|peanut butter]] and enough hot [[Stock|stock]] to thin it down.\n| Season with [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]] and serve.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Plain boiled rice|plain boiled rice]] and garnish with [[Lime|lime]] slices and more sliced [[Chillies|chillies]], if liked.\n===Variations===\nThis would work equally well with [[Chicken breasts|chicken breasts]] or [[Pork fillet|pork fillet]].\n===Chef's notes===\nI've chosen to serve this with [[Stir-fried|stir-fried]] [[Bean sprouts|bean sprouts]], [[Noodles|noodles]].\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Chinese recipes]]\n[[Category:Korean recipes]]\n[[Category:Oriental cuisine]]\n[[Category:Thai recipes]]\n[[Category:Vietnamese recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Beef recipes]]\n[[Category:Chilli pepper recipes]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Marinaded]]\n[[Category:Stir fried]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#sesameoil #marinade #lime #beef #chillies #peanutbutter #ginger #filletofbeef #stirfriedbeeffilletstripswithpeanutandchillisauce #demerarasugar #meatrecipes</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Stir fried giant asparagus with garlic and soy sauce",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Stir fried giant asparagus with garlic and soy sauce recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#asparagus #oliveoil #blackpepper #stirfriedgiantasparaguswithgarlicandsoysauce #steaming #crushedgarlic #wok #gravlaxspaghetticream #seared #darksoysauce #stirfried \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=We've grown giant asparagus at home for many years.  This recipe is ideally suited to the home gardener who probably only has a few stems available at a time\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 119\n|PortionCalories = 59\n|DatePublished=4th May 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Served with [[Gravlax spaghetti cream]]\n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  15 minutes\n|PrepTime =  5 minutes\n|CookTime =  10 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Stir fried giant asparagus with garlic and soy sauce recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Yum!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Nice with gravlax.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nWe've grown giant [[Asparagus|asparagus]] at home for many years.  This recipe is ideally suited to the home gardener who probably only has a few stems to deal with at a time, often not enough to use as a serving of [[Vegetables|vegetables]].  This also works with slightly woody stems too. \n\nAs the flavours are immense you only need a sprinkling of them to really lift a meal.\n\nSlice them according to tenderness, the foot quite thin and the 'flower head' leave completely intact.\n===Ingredients===\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 4 giant [[Asparagus|asparagus]] stems\n| 3 [[Cloves of Garlic, peeled and crushed|cloves of garlic, peeled and crushed]]\n| A pinch of [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n| A few tablespoons of [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 5ml [[Dark soy sauce|dark soy sauce]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Remove and discard the really woody part of the stems\n| Slice the remaining [[On the diagonal|on the diagonal]], leaving the very tender heads in one piece\n| Heat a [[Frying pan|frying pan]] or a [[Wok|wok]] and add about 4 tablespoons of water and the sliced stems and allow to cook in the [[Steaming|steaming]], bubbling water until it completely dries up\n| Shimmy the pan to allow the [[Asparagus|asparagus]] to get a little [[Seared|seared]]\n| To be on the safe side, you may need to let the pan cool a little before the next stage.\n| With the [[Asparagus|asparagus]] still in the pan, add a few tablespoons of [[Olive oil|olive oil]], a shake of [[Black pepper|black pepper]] and the [[Crushed garlic|crushed garlic]] and cook quite gently for 3 to 5 minutes to allow the flavours to mingle.  Don't let the [[Garlic|garlic]] [[Brown|brown]].\n| Mix well and serve.\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Stir fried giant asparagus with garlic and soy - steamed.jpg|Slightly coloured after the water has evaporated\nImage:Stir fried giant asparagus with garlic and soy - diagonal.jpg|Chopped on the diagonal according to tenderness\nImage:Stir fried giant asparagus with garlic and soy - size.jpg|Size comparison against a large egg\n</gallery>\n===Variations===\nUse 1 tablespoon [[Sesame oil|sesame oil]] instead of the [[Olive oil]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n[[Category:Stir fried]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#asparagus #oliveoil #blackpepper #stirfriedgiantasparaguswithgarlicandsoysauce #steaming #crushedgarlic #wok #gravlaxspaghetticream #seared #darksoysauce #stirfried </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Stir fried roots with potatoes",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Stir fried roots with potatoes a British recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#bacon #potatoes #stirfriedrootswithpotatoes #wok #parsnip #parsley #sesameoil #onion #blackpepper #fennelbulb #grilled \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This is a simple mix of vegetables that is very adaptable\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 267\n|PortionCalories = 66\n|DatePublished=31st October 2012\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 45 minutes\n |PrepTime = 15 minutes\n |CookTime = 30 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Stir fried roots with potatoes recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Healthy</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I like baby sweetcorn in this.</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Sue_spins|Susie]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis is a simple mix of vegetables that is very adaptable.  Purple Majesty potatoes are available from branches of '''[http://www.sainsburys.co.uk/sol/index.jsp Sainsbury's].'''\n\n{{FindAlbertBartlett}}\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| &frac12; pack (about 600g) Purple Majesty [[Potatoes|potatoes]]\n| 1 large [[Carrot|carrot]], peeled and cut into quarters lengthways\n| 1 [[Parsnip|parsnip]], peeled and cut into quarters lengthways\n| 1 whole [[Fennel bulb]], thinly sliced\n| 1 large [[Onion|onion]], peeled and thinly sliced\n| 2 tablespoons [[Sesame oil|sesame oil]]\n| Handful of flat leaf [[Parsley|parsley]], chopped to garnish\n| [[Freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 50g [[Smoked|smoked]] lean [[Bacon|bacon]] cut into small pieces (See '''Variations''' below)\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Peel and cut [[Potatoes|potatoes]] in half. \n| Place in a large, lidded pan and cover with cold water. \n| Bring to the [[Boil|boil]] then reduce the heat to medium and [[Simmer|simmer]] for 15 minutes until tender but still holding shape. \n| Meanwhile, in a wide non-stick [[Wok|wok]]/[[Frying pan|frying pan]], over a medium heat, [[Fry|fry]] the [[Bacon|bacon]] pieces until starting to [[Brown|brown]], then remove from the heat and set aside. \n| Next, add 2 tablespoons of [[Sesame oil|sesame oil]] to the [[Wok|wok]]/[[Frying pan|frying pan]] and add the [[Carrots|carrots]] and [[Parsnip|parsnip]] slices and saut\u00e9 over a high heat, stirring continuously for 5 mins.\n| Now, add the sliced [[Fennel|fennel]], [[Onion|onion]], a couple of tablespoons of water and season with [[Black pepper|black pepper]], cover and cook over a medium heat for a further 15 minutes until the [[Root vegetables|root vegetables]] are tender and the onion is transparent. \n| Finally, strain the cooked Purple Majesty [[Potatoes|potatoes]] and add those and the cooked [[Bacon|bacon]] back into the [[Vegetable|vegetable]] mix. \n| Mix together and serve immediately with a sprinkling of fresh [[Parsley|parsley]] on top.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nGood with [[Chicken|chicken]] or [[Grilled|grilled]] [[Fish|fish]].\n\n===Chef's notes===\n{{Template:ThinkPig}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Albert Bartlett recipes]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n{{Template:Albert Bartlett attribution}}\n[[Category:Stir fried]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#bacon #potatoes #stirfriedrootswithpotatoes #wok #parsnip #parsley #sesameoil #onion #blackpepper #fennelbulb #grilled </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

pepper]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Peel and cut [[Potatoes|potatoes]] in half. \n| Place in a large, lidded pan and cover with cold water. \n| Bring to the [[Boil|boil]] then reduce the heat to medium and [[Simmer|simmer]] for 15 minutes until tender but still holding shape. \n| Next, add 2 tablespoons of [[Sesame oil|sesame oil]] to the [[Wok|wok]]/[[Frying pan|frying pan]] and add the [[Carrots|carrots]] and [[Parsnip|parsnip]] slices and saut\u00e9 over a high heat, stirring continuously for 5 mins.\n| Now, add the sliced [[Fennel|fennel]], [[Onion|onion]], a couple of tablespoons of water and season with [[Black pepper|black pepper]], cover and cook over a medium heat for a further 15 minutes until the [[Root vegetables|root vegetables]] are tender and the onion is transparent. \n| Finally, strain the cooked Purple Majesty [[Potatoes|potatoes]] and serve immediately with a sprinkling of fresh [[Parsley|parsley]] on top.\n}}\n===Chef's title": "Strawberry ice-cream",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Strawberry ice-cream; a  recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#strawberries #icecream #frozen #lemonjuice #icecreammaker #goldensyrup #sorbet #honey #greekyogurt #cuisinart #lockandlock \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=I've been experimenting with many Ice-ice-cream recipes for a forthcoming dinner party and I'm convinced this one is the winner\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1700\n|PortionCalories = 94\n|DatePublished=5th October 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Servings: 18 - Makes more than 1.5 litres of ice cream\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  1 hour, 15 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  1 hour\n|Image = [[Image:Wed recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Love the lumps.</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">The whole bits of strawberry make this SO special.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nI've been experimenting with many [[Ice-cream|ice-cream]] recipes for a forthcoming dinner party and I'm convinced this one is the winner.\n\nI'm not a great fan of sickly sweet [[Ice-cream|ice-cream]], this recipe is more like a creamy [[Sorbet|sorbet]].  I think this is a nicer way to make an [[Ice cream|ice cream]] to suit everyones tastes.  Squeezy [[Chocolate sauce|chocolate sauce]], [[Honey|honey]] or [[Golden syrup|golden syrup]] can be drizzled over the ice-cream for those sweeter of tooth.\n\nThe maximum volume of my [[Ice-cream maker|ice-cream maker]] ''[[Cuisinart]] Professional [[Ice cream maker|ice cream maker]]'' is 1.5 [[Litres|litres]], which seems to fairly common.  This recipe makes more than this, but any leftover [[Ice cream|ice cream]] can be [[Popped|popped]] into a [[Lock and Lock box]] and [[Frozen|frozen]] immediately.  Just remove it from the [[Freezer|freezer]] an hour before you want to serve it.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 460 g fresh [[Strawberries|strawberries]]\n| 600 ml [[Single Cream|single cream]]\n| 500 ml [[Greek yogurt]]\n| 40 ml freshly squeezed [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]]\n| 100 g [[Caster Sugar|caster sugar]]\n| [[Scant]] &#189; teaspoon of [[Vanilla extract|vanilla extract]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Remove the stems (''peduncle'') from the [[Strawberries|strawberries]] and trim and discard any white unripe parts.\n| Add the [[Strawberries|strawberries]] and the remaining ingredients to a [[Food processor|food processor]] with a metal blade and [[Blend|blend]] to your desired consistency.\n| Pour unto your [[Ice-cream maker|ice-cream maker]] and follow your manufacturer's instructions. For mine it's just needs to run for one hour.\n| Pour any leftover mixture into a [[Lock and Lock]] style box and [[Freeze|freeze]].\n}}\n===Chef's notes===\nTo my palate, this tastes like a creamy sorbet as it has a fresh lemony tang.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Ice-cream recipes]]\n[[Category:Frozen]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#strawberries #icecream #frozen #lemonjuice #icecreammaker #goldensyrup #sorbet #honey #greekyogurt #cuisinart #lockandlock </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Strawberry ice-cream (alt)",

                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Strawberry ice-cream recipe (variation) \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#strawberries #cream #freezer #lemonjuice #blend #vanillaextract #stickblender #doublecream #frozen #castersugar #fridge \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A recipe for Ice-cream made with fresh strawberries\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 3413\n|PortionCalories = 189\n|DatePublished=15th December 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Servings: 18 - Makes about 1.5 litres\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  4 hours including chilling and churning time\n|PrepTime =  4 hours including chilling and churning time\n|CookTime = None\n|Image = [[Image:Strawberry icecream recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Ice cream made with fresh strawberries</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">No review needed here!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Ice-cream]] made with fresh [[Strawberries|strawberries]].  If your [[Ice-cream maker|ice-cream maker]] has no built-in [[Freezer|freezer]], place your bowl in the freezer for a minimum of 12 hours before using.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 600g fresh [[Strawberries|strawberries]], hulled and cut in half (cut into quarters if particularly large)\n| 60ml freshly squeezed [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]]\n| 330g [[Caster Sugar|caster sugar]]\n| 330ml full [[Fat|fat]] [[Milk|milk]]\n| 600ml [[Double Cream|double cream]]\n| 1\u00bd teaspoons [[Vanilla extract|vanilla extract]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Place the [[Strawberries|strawberries]] in a bowl and mix with the [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]] and 110g of the [[Sugar|sugar]] and leave for 2 hours to allow the sugar to dissolve\n| Pour into a tall jug and add the remaining ingredients except for the [[Cream|cream]]\n| [[Blend]] until the mixture is smooth using a [[Stick blender|stick blender]]\n| Add the [[Cream|cream]] and [[Blend|blend]] briefly\n| Allow to chill in the [[Fridge|fridge]] for at least 1 hour\n| Pour into your [[Ice-cream maker|ice-cream maker]] and churn according to the manufacturer's instructions\n| Transfer into a container and keep in the [[Freezer|freezer]]\n}}\n\n{{Soft ice cream}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Ice-cream recipes]]\n[[Category:Frozen]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#strawberries #cream #freezer #lemonjuice #blend #vanillaextract #stickblender #doublecream #frozen #castersugar #fridge </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

Varoma / Speed 2 / MC Off (but place internal [[Steaming|steaming]] basket on the lid to prevent splashing)\n| Test for setting ability by putting a teaspoon of [[Jam|jam]] on a saucer and [[Freezing|freezing]] for about 2 minutes.\n| The mixture is set if the [[Jam|jam]] wrinkles when removing from [[Freezer|freezer]]\n| Pour into dry, sterlised jars, place a waxed disk on the [[Jam|jam]] and seal\n| It will keep for up to one year\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe on toast or use as a filling for [[Cakes|cakes]], [[Tarts|tarts]] etc.\n===Variations===\nOther soft [[Fruit|fruit]] such as [[Raspberries|raspberries]], [[Blackberries|blackberries]] etc can be used instead\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Pickles and preserves]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Thermomix recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#jam #strawberries #cakes #thermomix #miseenplace #strawberryjamtm #images #sterilise #raspberries #juice #butter </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Stuffed baked potatoes",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Stuffed baked potatoes a cheese recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#potatoes #springonions #stuffedbakedpotatoes #grated #vegetableoil #parmesan #butter #grill #onions #salad #potato \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Rooster potatoes stuffed with spring onions and Parmesan cheese\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2631\n|PortionCalories = 657\n|DatePublished=21st January 2013\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 1 hour 20 minutes\n |PrepTime = 10 minutes\n |CookTime = 1 hour 10 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Stuffed baked potatoes recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">A weekly staple</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Great with baked beans</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Sue_spins|Susie]] </span></span>\n}}\n\nRooster [[Potatoes|potatoes]] stuffed with [[Spring onions|spring onions]] and [[Parmesan cheese]].  \n\n{{FindAlbertBartlett}}\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 4 Medium Sized Rooster [[Potatoes]] \n| 2 tablespoons [[Vegetable oil|vegetable oil]] \n| 8 [[Spring onions|spring onions]] \n| 50ml [[Milk]] \n| 125g [[Unsalted butter|unsalted butter]] \n| 50g Freshly [[Grated]] [[Parmesan]] \n| [[Salt]] & [[Freshly ground pepper|freshly ground pepper]]\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Pre-Heat [[Oven]] to 475\u00b0F/250\u00b0C or Gas mark 9\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Wash & Dry the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] and rub with [[Vegetable oil|vegetable oil]].\n| Arrange the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] on a [[roasting tray]] and place in the heated [[Oven|oven]] for 1 hour approx. (Test with a thin knife and remove when soft.)\n| Wash and slice the [[Spring onions|spring onions]].\n| Melt 25g [[Butter|butter]] in a saucepan; add the [[Onions|onions]] and sprinkle with a little [[Salt|salt]]. \n| Cook gently until the onions are soft, and then remove from the heat.\n| Halve the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] lengthways, and remove the flesh with a spoon, being careful not to break the skin.\n| Crush the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] with a fork, add the remaining [[Butter|butter]], [[Milk|milk]], [[Salt|salt]], [[Pepper|pepper]] and [[Spring onions|spring onions]].\n| Spoon the [[Potato|potato]] mixture back into the potato skins, sprinkle with [[Grated|grated]] [[Parmesan|parmesan]] and place onto a [[Baking tray|baking tray]], then [[Brown|brown]] under a hot [[Grill|grill]].\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with a nice, crisp [[Salad|salad]].\n{{Template:Albert Bartlett attribution}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Albert Bartlett recipes]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#potatoes #springonions #stuffedbakedpotatoes #grated #vegetableoil #parmesan #butter #grill #onions #salad #potato </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }

title": "Stuffed Roast Peppers and Coriander Salsa",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Stuffed Roast Peppers and Coriander Salsa recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#coriander #peppers #oliveoil #pinenuts #stuffedroastpeppersandcoriandersalsa #courgettes #courgette #sausage #grated #roast #salsa \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Sweet roasted peppers provide the perfect home for a filling of rich caramelised onion sausages\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 290\n|PortionCalories = 145\n|DatePublished=22nd October 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  50 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime =  40 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Stuffed Roast Peppers and Coriander Salsa recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">A funny looking dish</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">This was really filling!</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nSweet [[Roasted peppers|roasted peppers]] provide the perfect home for a filling of rich [[Caramelised|caramelised]] [[Onion|onion]] [[Sausages|sausages]], suitably paired with a dressing of fresh [[Coriander|coriander]] and toasty [[Pine Nuts|pine nuts]]. \n[[Image:Caramelised-red-onion-sausages.png|300px|thumb|right|[[Debbie & Andrew's Caramelised Red Onion Pork Sausages]]]]\n\nThis [[Gluten free|gluten free]], [[Wheat|wheat]] free, [[Dairy|dairy]] free, allergy free recipe created by Natural Chef, Ceri Jones.\n\nThis recipe is reproduced courtesy of [[Debbie&andrew's sausages|debbie&andrew's sausages]].\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 2 [[Red bell peppers|red bell peppers]]\n| [[Olive oil]] \n| 4 [[Debbie and Andrew's Caramelised Red Onion Pork Sausages]], removed from their casings\n| 1 medium [[Courgette|courgette]], [[Grated|grated]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Sultanas|sultanas]] [optional]\n| [[Zest]] of half a [[Lemon|lemon]]\n| 1 tablespoon finely sliced [[Coriander|coriander]] leaf\n| 1 tablespoon [[Pine Nuts|pine nuts]], [[Toasted|toasted]]\n}}\n====dressing====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 25g [[Coriander|coriander]] leaf \n| 1 [[Clove|clove]] of [[Garlic|garlic]], [[Minced|minced]] \n| 3 tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]]\n| 1 tablespoon water\n| \u00bd teaspoon [[Salt|salt]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n*  Pre-heat [[Oven|oven]] to 180\u00b0C (fan-setting).\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| [[Split]] the [[Peppers|peppers]] in half down the middle (through the stalk), remove all of the [[Seeds|seeds]] and fibrous flesh and lay cut side up over a teaspoon of [[Olive oil|olive oil]] in an [[Oven|oven]] dish, [[Roast|roast]] for 15 minutes.\n| In a [[Frying pan|frying pan]], [[Fry|fry]] the [[Sausage meat|sausage meat]] in a teaspoon of [[Olive oil|olive oil]]. After three minutes, add the [[Grated|grated]] [[Courgette|courgette]] to the pan, stir and continue to cook until the [[Sausage|sausage]] [[Meat|meat]] is fully [[Browned|browned]] - 6-7 minutes in total.\n| Remove the filling from the pan, and drain in a [[Sieve|sieve]]. Use a spoon to push out any excess liquid (a mix of [[Sausage|sausage]] [[Fat|fat]] and water from the [[Courgettes|courgettes]]). Add the [[Sultanas|sultanas]] if using, plus the [[Lemon zest|lemon zest]] and [[Coriander|coriander]]. Stir well.\n| Remove the [[Peppers|peppers]] from the [[Oven|oven]]. Stuff with all of the filling and [[Roast|roast]] in the oven for a final 25 minutes.\n| Meanwhile make the [[Salsa|salsa]]. In a small [[Food processor|food processor]], [[Blend|blend]] the [[Coriander|coriander]] with the [[Rest|rest]] of the ingredients, till a chunky paste forms.\n| When the [[Peppers|peppers]] are ready, remove from the [[Oven|oven]] and drizzle with [[Salsa|salsa]] and [[Toasted|toasted]] [[Pine Nuts|pine nuts]]. Serve with [[Green salad|green salad]].\n}}\n===Chef's notes===\nInstead of [[Peppers|peppers]] you could stuff [[Aubergines|aubergines]] or [[Courgettes|courgettes]].\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Gluten free recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Debbie&andrew's sausage recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n{{Template:DebbieAndAndrew attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#coriander #peppers #oliveoil #pinenuts #stuffedroastpeppersandcoriandersalsa #courgettes #courgette #sausage #grated #roast #salsa </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=St David's Day cheesy biscuits recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#southcaernarfoncreameries #dough #butter #cheese #bakingtray #flour #biscuit #grated #stdavidsdaycheesybiscuits #dragoncheeserecipes #salted \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A traditional St Davids Day biscuit recipe from South Caernarfon Creameries, the award winning Welsh cheesemakers.\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=16th September 2016\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = 16 biscuits\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  43 minutes\n|PrepTime =  35 minutes\n|CookTime =  8 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 1324\n|PortionCalories = 83\n|Image = [[Image:St Davids Day cheesy biscuits recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Welsh biscuits?</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.6</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Shurely?</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The&nbsp;Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nA traditional St David's Day [[Biscuit|biscuit]] recipe from [[South Caernarfon Creameries]], the award winning Welsh cheesemakers.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 100g [[Plain flour|plain flour]]\n| 100g Cold, [[Unsalted butter|unsalted butter]]\n| 60g Mature Dragon [[Cheese|cheese]], [[Grated|grated]]\n| [[Sea Salt]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6), [fan oven 180\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Cut the [[Butter|butter]] into small pieces and rub into the [[Flour|flour]] to form crumbs\n| Add the [[Cheese|cheese]] and bring the mixture together to form a ball\n| Wrap the [[Dough|dough]] in [[Cling Film|cling film]] and chill in the [[Fridge|fridge]] for around 30 minutes\n| Heat the [[Oven|oven]] to 200C/Fan 180C/Gas 6 and line a [[Baking tray|baking tray]] with [[Greaseproof paper|greaseproof paper]]\n| Sprinkle a little [[Flour|flour]] on the surface and roll out the [[Dough|dough]] until it\u0092s around 3mm in thickness.\n| Cut the biscuits in any shape desired (makes approx. 16 circular biscuits)\n| Place on a [[Baking tray|baking tray]] and sprinkle with [[Sea Salt|sea salt]]\n| Cook for 8 minutes and leave to cool before eating\n| You could also use dragon [[Salted|salted]] [[Butter|butter]]; if doing so you won't need the [[Sea Salt|sea salt]].\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Dragon mature Welsh cheddar cheese.jpg|thumb|300px|right|[http://www.dragonwales.co.uk/products/cheddar/mature/ Dragon mature Welsh cheddar cheese]\nImage:Dragon reduced fat mature Welsh cheddar cheese.jpg|thumb|300px|right|[http://www.dragonwales.co.uk/products/cheddar/mature-reduced-fat/ Dragon reduced fat mature Welsh cheddar cheese]\n</gallery>\n===Variations===\nFor a low-[[Fat|fat]] version use [[Dragon reduced fat mature Welsh cheddar cheese]].\n\n{{Template:Dragon cheese attribution}}\n\n==See also==\n* [[Dragon mature Welsh cheddar cheese]]\n* [[Dragon reduced fat mature Welsh cheddar cheese]]\n* [[South Caernarfon Creameries]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks title": "Succotash (British ingredients)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Succotash British ingredients recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#couscous #sweetcorn #stock #butter #chilliflakes #pulses #borlottibeans #boil #springonions #boiledorsimmered #vegetablestock \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=The version of succotash is based on Lyn Hall's 'My succotash' Lyn Hall's Cookery Course\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1641\n|PortionCalories = 410\n|DatePublished=6th November 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Suffrin' Succotash!\n |Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 30 minutes\n |PrepTime = 15 minutes\n |CookTime = 15 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Succotash couscous recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Lovely side dish</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Fairly healthy too</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The&nbsp;Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\n==Succotash using British ingredients==\nThe version of [[Succotash|succotash]] is based on Lyn Hall's 'My succotash' [Lyn Hall's Cookery Course ISBN 1840913487] which uses ingredients that would be available in the UK.  I am making it to go with [[Tex-Mex beer can chicken]] as I feel they would work well together.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 450 g canned [[Sweetcorn|sweetcorn]]\n| 300 ml [[Vegetable Stock|vegetable stock]]\n| 60 g [[Dried|dried]] [[Couscous|couscous]]\n| 50 g [[Butter|butter]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Chilli flakes|chilli flakes]]\n| 100g [[Spring onions|spring onions]], [[Sliced on the diagonal|sliced on the diagonal]]\n| 3 [[Sweet peppers|sweet peppers]], [[Roasted|roasted]], de-seeded and sliced.  A mix of colours is good.\n| 400g [[Borlotti beans|borlotti beans]]\n| 1 cup [[defrosted]] [[garden peas]]\n| [[Salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]] to taste\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Place the [[Couscous|couscous]] in a small bowl, [[Boil|boil]] the [[Stock|stock]] and pour about &frac34; of it over the couscous. Leave for 15 minutes then fluff with a fork.\n| Rinse the [[Sweetcorn|sweetcorn]] and [[Beans|beans]] under running cold water.\n| Heat the [[Butter|butter]] in a large [[Frying pan|frying pan]] or [[Wok|wok]], add the [[Chilli flakes|chilli flakes]], a grind of [[Pepper|pepper]] and the [[Chopped spring onions|chopped spring onions]] and [[peppers]] and [[Stir-fry|stir-fry]] for a 20 seconds and then add the [[Sweetcorn|sweetcorn]], [[Pulses|pulses]] and the remaining [[Stock|stock]]\n| Bring to the [[Boil|boil]], reduce and [[Simmer|simmer]] until the [[stock]] has almost disappeared and the [[Vegetables|vegetables]] are heated, about 10 minutes.\n| Add the [[Couscous|couscous]], mix well and serve hot.\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Succotash (British ingredients) recipe.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Before the couscous\nImage:Succotash ingredients) recipe.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Succotash (British ingredients)\n</gallery>\n===Variations===\nI've used [[Borlotti beans|borlotti beans]] so there is a good colour mix, however almost any canned [[Pulses|pulses]] would be fine.  I often open various cans of pulses, rinse them, mix them all up in a huge bowl and [[Freeze|freeze]] in small batches.  A mix such as this would be ideal in this dish.\n==See also==\n* [[Succotash (Native American)]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Grain and bean recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#couscous #sweetcorn #stock #butter #chilliflakes #pulses #borlottibeans #boil #springonions #boiledorsimmered #vegetablestock </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Succotash (British ingredients) (V)",

                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Succotash (British ingredients) a British vegetarian recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#sweetcorn #couscous #stock #borlottibeans #boil #chilliflakes #pulses #oliveoil #succotash #simmer #gardenpeas \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=The version of succotash is based on Lyn Hall's 'My succotash' Lyn Hall's Cookery Course which uses ingredients that would be\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1282\n|PortionCalories = 320\n|DatePublished=6th November 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Suffrin' Succotash!\n |Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 30 minutes\n |PrepTime = 15 minutes\n |CookTime = 15 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Succotash couscous recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Looks fab</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.7</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">A great veggie dish</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Sue_spins|Susie]] </span></span>\n}}\n==Succotash using British ingredients==\nThe version of [[Succotash|succotash]] is based on Lyn Hall's 'My succotash' [Lyn Hall's Cookery Course ISBN 1840913487] which uses ingredients that would be available in the UK.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 450 g canned [[Sweetcorn|sweetcorn]]\n| 300 ml [[Vegetable Stock|vegetable stock]]\n| 60 g [[Dried|dried]] [[Couscous|couscous]]\n| 50 g [[Olive oil]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Chilli flakes|chilli flakes]]\n| 100g [[Spring onions|spring onions]], [[Sliced on the diagonal|sliced on the diagonal]]\n| 3 [[Sweet peppers|sweet peppers]], [[Roasted|roasted]], de-seeded and sliced.  A mix of colours is good.\n| 400g [[Borlotti beans|borlotti beans]]\n| 1 cup [[garden peas]]\n| [[Salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]] to taste\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Place the [[Couscous|couscous]] in a small bowl, [[Boil|boil]] the [[Stock|stock]] and pour about &frac34; of it over the couscous. Leave for 15 minutes then fluff with a fork.\n| Rinse the [[Sweetcorn|sweetcorn]] and [[Beans|beans]] under running cold water.\n| Heat the [[olive oil]] in a large [[Frying pan|frying pan]] or [[Wok|wok]], add the [[Chilli flakes|chilli flakes]], a grind of [[Pepper|pepper]] and the [[Chopped spring onions|chopped spring onions]] and [[peppers]] and [[Stir-fry|stir-fry]] for a 20 seconds and then add the [[Sweetcorn|sweetcorn]], [[Pulses|pulses]] and the remaining [[Stock|stock]]\n| Bring to the [[Boil|boil]], reduce and [[Simmer|simmer]] until the [[stock]] has almost disappeared and the [[Vegetables|vegetables]] are heated, about 10 minutes.\n| Add the [[Couscous|couscous]], mix well and serve hot.\n}}\n===Variations===\nI've used [[Borlotti beans|borlotti beans]] so there is a good colour mix, however almost any canned [[Pulses|pulses]] would be fine.  I often open various cans of pulses, rinse them, mix them all up in a huge bowl and [[Freeze|freeze]] in small batches.  A mix such as this would be ideal in this dish.\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Succotash (British ingredients) recipe.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Before the couscous\nImage:Succotash ingredients) recipe.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Succotash (British ingredients)\n</gallery>\n==See also==\n* [[Succotash (Native American)]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Grain and bean recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#sweetcorn #couscous #stock #borlottibeans #boil #chilliflakes #pulses #oliveoil #succotash #simmer #gardenpeas </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

level teaspoons [[pepper]]\n| Pinch of ground [[cloves]]\n| 2 level tablespoons [[breadcrumbs]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Rub the [[herring]] fillets well with the [[salt]] and place the fillets overlapping slightly, in a flat dish\n| Mix the [[vinegar]], water, [[sugar]], [[peppers]] and [[cloves]] together and pour over the [[herrings]]\n| Sprinkle on the crumbs and bake in a moderate oven (180\u00b0 C / 350\u00b0F / Gas 4) for 20-25 minutes\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\n\nServe with [[boiled potatoes]] and [[watercress]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Herrings]]\n[[Category:Fish recipes|Herrings]]\n[[Category:Sea fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses|Herrings]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes|Herring]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Swedish recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#vinegar #herrings #breadcrumbs #watercress #herring #peppers #boiledpotatoes </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Sweetcorn and cheddar scones",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Sweetcorn and cheddar scones a cheese recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#butter #grated #scones #sweetcornandcheddarscones #cheddar #chilli #soup #bakingpowder #dough #corn #brush \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=These savoury scones are packed full of summer sunshine. They go down with little ones, as well as adults\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2551\n|PortionCalories = 255\n|DatePublished=17th May 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 10\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  27 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  12 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Sweetcorn and cheddar scones recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">\ud83e\uddc0 + \ud83c\udf3d = \ud83d\udc96\ud83d\udc98\ud83d\udc9d</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Two of my favourite foods in a scone - wow!</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry, aka Chef]])</span></span>\n}}\nThese savoury [[Scones|scones]] are packed full of summer sunshine. They go down with little ones, as well as adults. Serve as an alternative afternoon [[Tea|tea]], in lunchboxes or alongside [[Soup|soup]] - perhaps, a rich, [[Roasted red pepper|roasted red pepper]] [[Soup|soup]]. Mmm...\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 2 [[Sweetcorn|sweetcorn]] cobs\n| 350g [[Self-raising flour|self-raising flour]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Baking powder|baking powder]]\n| a pinch of finely chopped [[Chilli|chilli]] (or [[Chilli powder|chilli powder]])\n| 1tsp [[Salt|salt]]\n| 50g cold [[Butter|butter]], cut into cubes\n| 150g [[Grated|grated]] [[Cheddar|cheddar]], plus extra for tops\n| 175ml [[Milk|milk]], plus extra for [[Brushing|brushing]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\nHeat the oven to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6), [fan oven 180\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Cut the kernels off the cobs, place in a pan, add enough water to just cover. [[Simmer]] 5 minutes. Drain well.\n| Heat [[Oven|oven]] to 200\u00b0C/400\u00b0F/gas 6. Mix [[Flour|flour]], [[Baking powder|baking powder]], [[Chilli|chilli]] and [[Salt|salt]]. Rub [[Butter|butter]] cube into the mix until it looks like fine crumbs. Add [[Grated|grated]] [[Cheddar|cheddar]] and the [[Corn|corn]]. Drizzle in the [[Milk|milk]]. Fold in to make a slightly sticky [[Dough|dough]]. Don't over-work.\n|Gently [[Knead|knead]] on a floured surface until smooth. Divide into 10 balls. Shape each roughly with floured hands. Put onto an oiled [[Baking sheet|baking sheet]]. [[Brush]] [[Scones|scones]] with a little [[Milk|milk]]. Scatter [[Grated|grated]] [[Cheese|cheese]] over the top. [[Bake]] for 10-12 mins or until the [[Scones|scones]] are risen, golden and sound hollow when tapped on the bottom. \n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nDelicious with [[Butter|butter]].\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Abel and Cole veg box recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n{{Template:Abel and Cole veg box recipes attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#butter #grated #scones #sweetcornandcheddarscones #cheddar #chilli #soup #bakingpowder #dough #corn #brush </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
