title": "Sweetcorn and chilli soup (TM)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Sweetcorn and chilli soup - A Thermomix recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#parsley #sweetcorn #bouillon #onion #cream #chillies #vegetable #blender #singlecream #oliveoil #soup \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=I just threw this together. I used 2 long chillies of the variety sold in Indian grocery chops and it was fairly hot\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 958\n|PortionCalories = 239\n|DatePublished=8th September 2012\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 30 minutes\n |PrepTime = 5 minutes\n |CookTime = 25 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Sweetcorn and chilli soup recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Nice invention Julia!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">A great mixture!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Carla_Cancio-Bello,_J.D.,_on_behalf_of_Cuban_Cuisine_UK|Carla]] </span></span>\n}}\nI just threw this together.  I used 2 long [[Chillies|chillies]] of the variety sold in [[Indian]] grocery chops and it was fairly hot.  This recipe is for making in a [[Thermomix]] but can easily be adapted for making in a saucepan and finishing off in a [[Blender|blender]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredientsTM\n| 1 [[Onion|onion]], peeled and thickly sliced\n| [[Chillies]], to taste\n| 30g [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| Pinch of [[Sugar|sugar]]\n| 500g [[Frozen|frozen]] [[Sweetcorn|sweetcorn]]\n| 300g water\n| 250g [[Single cream|single cream]]\n| 2 teaspoons of [[Vegetable|vegetable]] [[Bouillon|bouillon]] powder\n| Seasoning (if needed)\n| [[Parsley]], to garnish\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Put the [[Oil|oil]] into the TM bowl 8 minutes / Temp. Varoma / Reverse Blade / Speed 1\n| Add the [[Onion|onion]] slices and the [[sugar]] 15 minutes / Temp. Varoma / Reverse Blade / Speed Spoon / MC OFF\n| Add the [[Sweetcorn|sweetcorn]], water, [[Cream|cream]] and [[Vegetable|vegetable]] [[Bouillon|bouillon]] powder and cook '''15 minutes / 100\u00b0C / Speed 1 / MC On'''.\n| [[Blend]] the [[Soup|soup]] '''1 minute / increasing from Speed Spoon to Speed 9'''.\n| Serve garnished with some chopped [[Parsley|parsley]].\n}}\n===Variations===\nYou can use [[Yoghurt|yogurt]] instead of [[Cream|cream]].\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Soup and stock recipes]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Chilli pepper recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Student recipes]]\n[[Category:Thermomix recipes]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#parsley #sweetcorn #bouillon #onion #cream #chillies #vegetable #blender #singlecream #oliveoil #soup </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }

            }

title": "Sweet and sour radish salad",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Sweet and sour radish salad a British recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#radishes #sweetandsourradishsalad #muscovadosugar #salads #lightsoysauce #salad #marinate #cidervinegar #papertowels #sesameoil #tablesalt \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=An interesting addition to your salad repertoire which gives a nice spicy bite with an oriental flavour\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 99\n|PortionCalories = 24\n|DatePublished=23rd June 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  2 hours, 25 minutes\n|PrepTime =  2 hours, 25 minutes\n|CookTime = None\n|Image = [[Image:Radishes (4701358924).jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Nice and peppery</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.6</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">This works well with roast beef</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]]</span></span>\n}}\nAn interesting addition to your [[Salad|salad]] repertoire which gives a nice spicy bite with an oriental flavour.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 8 small red [[Radishes|radishes]]\n| 2 teaspoons [[Table salt|table salt]] (10 ml)\n| 2 tablespoons [[Muscovado sugar]]\n| 2 tablespoons [[Cider vinegar]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Sesame oil]]\n| 2 teaspoons of [[Light soy sauce]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Wash, top and tail the [[Radishes|radishes]]\n| Using the tines of a fork, scratch the surface of the [[Radishes|radishes]].\n| Arrange on a large plate and sprinkle with half of the [[Salt|salt]], leave for 10 minutes\n| Turn the [[Radishes|radishes]] over and repeat the process\n| Wash the [[Radishes|radishes]] and discard the [[Salt|salt]]\n| Dry with [[Paper towels|paper towels]]\n| Mix the remaining ingredients and whisk\n| Pour over the [[Radishes|radishes]] and all to [[Marinate|marinate]] for two hours or more\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe as part of a selection of [[Salads|salads]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Pickles and preserves]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Salad recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Uncooked]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#radishes #sweetandsourradishsalad #muscovadosugar #salads #lightsoysauce #salad #marinate #cidervinegar #papertowels #sesameoil #tablesalt </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Sweet pepper dip (WS)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Sweet pepper dip whipping syphon recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#peppers #cream #garlic #creamcheese #chives #lemonjuice #whippingsyphons #vegetable #blender #sweetpepperdipws #paprika \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This deliciously light dip is made with the help of a whipping syphon\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 10508\n|PortionCalories = 656\n|DatePublished=3rd August 2014\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Servings: 16 - Makes about 600ml\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  15 minutes, plus 2 hours chilling time\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes, plus 2 hours chilling time\n|CookTime = None\n|Image = [[Image:Sweet pepper dip WS recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Woosh!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">That's what it sounded like to make!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis deliciously light dip is made with the help of a [[Whipping syphons|whipping syphon]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 200g preserved sweet peppers, such as [[Pimientos del Piquillo de Lodosa]], drained\n| [[Garlic]] to taste, crushed\n| 500g full [[Fat|fat]] [[Cream cheese|cream cheese]]\n| A couple of dashes of [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]]\n| 100ml [[Double Cream|double cream]]\n| Seasoning\n| [[Smoked paprika]] or snipped [[Chives|chives]] to garnish\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| [[Blend]] the [[Peppers|peppers]], [[Garlic|garlic]], [[Cream cheese|cream cheese]], [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]] and [[Cream|cream]] using a stick (immersion [[Blender|blender]]) or [[Liquidiser|liquidiser]] until you have a very smooth mixture\n| Mix in the [[Cream|cream]] by hand\n| Strain through a fine [[Sieve|sieve]] and season to taste\n| With the aid of a funnel, spoon the mixture into a [[Whipping syphons|whipping syphon]]\n| Choose a suitable nozzle and attach to the lid of the syphon\n| Screw on the lid - do not over-tighten\n| Place an N<sub>2</sub>O cartridge into the holder and attach to the lid\n| Once the gas has been released into syphon, charge with another cartridge if using a 1 litre syphon.  You only need one for the 500ml and 250ml ones\n| Shake thoroughly between chargings\n| Allow to chill in the [[Fridge|fridge]] for at least 2 hours\n| With the lever, squirt out the mixture into a large bowl or several individual ones\n| Garnish with the [[Paprika|paprika]] or [[Chives|chives]]\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Vegetable|vegetable]] sticks, [[Potato|potato]] or [[Vegetable|vegetable]] crisps and savoury biscuits\n===Variations===\nUse any colour [[Peppers|peppers]] you like.  You can also include [[Chillies|chillies]] for a bit of kick.  \n\nIf you cannot get [[Preserved|preserved]] [[Peppers|peppers]], fresh ones are fine, but you will need to skin and saut\u00e9 them first in a little [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n===Chef's notes===\nRemember to halve the ingredients if using a 500 ml whipper and to quarter them if using a 250 ml one\n\n'''Do not use reduced fat [[cheese]] or [[cream]] as it won't whip properly'''\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Pepper dip]]\n[[Category:British recipes|Pepper dip]]\n[[Category:Dips and sauces|Pepper dip]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites|Pepper dip]]\n[[Category:Starters|Pepper dip]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes|Pepper dip]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes|Pepper dip]]\n[[Category:Uncooked|Pepper dip]]\n[[Category:Whipping syphon recipes|Pepper dip]]\n[[Category:Whipped|Pepper dip]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#peppers #cream #garlic #creamcheese #chives #lemonjuice #whippingsyphons #vegetable #blender #sweetpepperdipws #paprika </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Swiss dark flour and rye loaf",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Swiss dark flour and rye loaf a British recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#swissdarkflourandryeloaf #ryeflour #dough #yeast #flour #swiss #fridge #honey #knead #bake #rest \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This is made with an unusual flour from Switzerland and in the UK it can be bought online from Shipton Mill\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1827\n|PortionCalories = 182\n|DatePublished=23rd February 2013\n|Author = JuliaBalbilla\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Servings: 10 - 1 large loaf\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime = 1 hour 10 minutes + resting time  \n|PrepTime = 30 minutes + resting time \n|CookTime = 40 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Swiss dark flour and rye loaf recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">pretty nice</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Quite heavy though, don't need lots of this.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]])</span></span>\n}}\n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}}\n\nThis is made with an unusual [[Flour|flour]] from [[Switzerland]] and in the UK it can be bought online from [[Shipton Mill]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 170g [[Rye flour|rye flour]]\n| 330g [[Swiss]] dark [[Flour|flour]]\n| 10g fresh [[Yeast|yeast]]\n| 335ml sparkling mineral water \n| \u00bd teaspoons [[Sugar|sugar]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Salt|salt]]\n| 2 teaspoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Mix the [[Yeast|yeast]] in with 100g of the [[Rye flour|rye flour]] and 135ml water and the [[Sugar|sugar]] or [[Honey|honey]] to form a [[Batter|batter]]. \n| Leave to rise overnight in the [[Fridge|fridge]].\n| The following morning, remove from the [[Fridge|fridge]] and bring up to room temperature.\n| Add the remaining 70g [[Rye flour|rye flour]], all of the [[Swiss]] dark, the remaining 200ml water, [[Salt|salt]] and [[Oil|oil]].\n| [[Knead]] according to your chosen method.\n| Shape into a ball and allow to [[Rest|rest]], covered, until doubled in size.\n| Gently deflate the [[Dough|dough]] and repeat the previous step.\n| Shape the [[Dough|dough]] as desired or place in a loaf tin.\n| Cover and prove until it has increased by about two thirds.\n| Place the loaf in the [[Oven|oven]] and then turn on the [[Oven|oven]] to 220\u00b0 C (425\u00b0 F - gas 7), [fan oven 200\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n| [[Bake]] until the loaf is golden [[Brown|brown]] (about 40 minutes, but check after 30) and allow to cool on a rack.\n}}\n\n===Recipe source===\n* Adapted from a recipe by '''[http://www.shipton-mill.com/the-bakery/recipes/article-237/ Leslie Wilson]'''\n\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Swiss recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#swissdarkflourandryeloaf #ryeflour #dough #yeast #flour #swiss #fridge #honey #knead #bake #rest </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Swiss fingers (MoF)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Swiss fingers (MoF), British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#warmplace #egg #flour #margarine #dough #icingsugar #fat #baking #almonds #cookingfat #blanched \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A recipe for  Swiss fingers. Post war cookery advice from the UK Ministry of Food\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1696\n|PortionCalories = 424\n|DatePublished=16th March 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Ministry of Food Cookery calendar - 1951\n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime = 1 hour 40 minutes\n|PrepTime = 1 hour 30 minutes\n|CookTime = 10 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Ministry of Food Cookery calendar - 1951.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Simple food!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Not the least bit complicated - but I suppose that's the point.</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]] </span></span>\n}}\n\"Housekeeping's most important secret nowadays is to know how to make best use of the foods available.  Here are some practical suggestions for improving your inside knowledge without undue expense.\"  '''Ministry of food Cookery Calendar - April..May 1951'''\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 12 oz [[plain flour]]\n| &#188; level teaspoon [[salt]]\n| 1.5 oz [[margarine]] or [[cooking fat]]\n| 1 oz [[sugar]]\n| &#189; oz yeast\n| &#188; pint warm [[milk]]\n| 1 [[egg]], well beaten\n}}\n\n''For decoration:''\n* 4 oz [[icing sugar]]\n* &#189; oz [[blanched]] and browned [[almonds]]\n\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Sift the [[flour]] and [[salt]] into a warm bowl, and run in the [[fat]]; mix in the [[sugar]] and make a well in the centre\n| Blend the yeast with a little of the [[milk]] and pour into the well in the [[flour]]. Leave to ''sponge'' for 5 minutes\n| Mix to a slack [[dough]] with the restof the [[milk]] and the [[egg]], and beat well\n| Set to rise in a [[warm place]] for 1 hour , or until double the size\n| Turn on to a floured board, divide into 14 pieces and make each peice a roll 5\" long\n| Place on a floured [[baking]] sheet 1/4\" apart and prove for 15 minutes in a [[warm place]]\n| [[Bake]] in a very hot oven (240\u00b0  C - 475\u00b0 F - Gas 9) for 7-8 minutes\n| When cold coat with water icing and sprinkle [[nuts]] on top immediately\n| Break into fingers\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#warmplace #egg #flour #margarine #dough #icingsugar #fat #baking #almonds #cookingfat #blanched </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }

Watching Jamie Oliver's 'Comfort Food' recently, I thought the [[Salad dressing|salad dressing]] for his 'Insanity [[Burger]]' looked interesting so I thought I would try it as a [[Taco shell|taco shell]] filling.  It was fabulous. We're having it again tonight!\n[[Image:Taco shells with Jamie Oliver Insanity burger dressing.jpg|thumb|300px|right|A colourful DIY meal]]\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 140g cooked [[Chicken|chicken]] pieces\n| 10 [[Taco shells|taco shells]]\n| Half a [[Sweet Pepper|sweet pepper]] (pick your favourite colour)\n| Half a small white [[Onion|onion]], finely chopped (or a few [[Spring onions|spring onions]])\n| 1 [[Carrot|carrot]], peeled and [[Julienned|julienned]] with an [[Oxo Good Grips Julienne peeler]]\n| 3 small [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]], quartered\n}}\n==== for the creamy salad dressing====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 3 tablespoons [[Mayonnaise|mayonnaise]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Tomato ketchup|tomato ketchup]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Worcestershire sauce]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Tabasco sauce]] or my favourite, [[Louisiana Hot Pepper Sauce]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Brandy|brandy]]\n| 1/3 of an [[Iceberg lettuce]], finely chopped\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Add the [[Mayonnaise|mayonnaise]], [[Tomato ketchup|tomato ketchup]], [[Tabasco|tabasco]], [[Worcestershire sauce]] and [[Brandy|brandy]] to a serving bowl and mix well.\n| Finely chop the [[Iceberg lettuce]] and mix into the [[Salad dressing|salad dressing]].\n| Prepare all the remaining items and place on small serving dishes.\n| [[Microwave]] the [[Taco shells|taco shells]] for 30 seconds or place in a warm [[Oven|oven]] for 5 minutes.\n| Lay everything out on the table and [[Help|help]] yourself!\n}}\n===Variations===\n[[Turkey]] left-overs would work well in this\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Tex-Mex recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Poultry recipes]]\n[[Category:Uncooked]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n\n<!-- title": "Tantan soup with ramen, pak choi and mad eggs",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Tantan soup with ramen, pak choi and mad eggs recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#noodles #pakchoi #tantansoupwithramenpakchoiandmadeggs #soy #boil #ginger #tahini #corianderleaves #dashi #truffleoil #blender \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This recipe comes to Cookipedia courtesy Nik and Edwina's Cookbook. Inspired by a lovely soup they had in a Japanese restaurant in Kensington\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}}\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=29th September 2016\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = 2\n|Difficulty = 3\n|TotalTime = 1 day, 1 hour\n|PrepTime = 1 day, 15 minutes\n|CookTime =  45 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 3581\n|PortionCalories = 1790\n|Image = [[Image:Tantan soup with ramen, pak choi and mad eggs recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Wicked!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.9</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Love your mad eggs!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The&nbsp;Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis recipe comes to [[Cookipedia]] by courtesy of [[Nik and Edwina's Cookbook]].\n\n\"Inspired by a lovely [[Soup|soup]] we had in a Japanese restaurant in Kensington, this is a deliciously comforting, nutty flavoured soup, with the [[Noodles|noodles]] and [[Pak choi|pak choi]] and particularly the [[Eggs|eggs]] providing a rich and tasty counterpoint. If you [[Freeze|freeze]] the soup it can separate a bit, so give it a quick whizz in a [[Blender|blender]] when you [[Defrost|defrost]] it\"\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n}}\n====The Mad Eggs:- ====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 200ml regular [[Soy sauce|soy sauce]]&#8232; \n| 200ml water&#8232; \n| 20g [[Sugar|sugar]] \n| \u00bd teaspoons [[Truffle oil|truffle oil]]\n| 4 whole [[Soft-boiled eggs|soft-boiled eggs]], carefully peeled \n}}\n====The Tantan Soup:- ====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 750ml [[Chicken stock|chicken stock]] \n| 375ml [[Nage]]\n| 250ml [[Dashi]]\n| 100g white [[Sesame seeds|sesame seeds]] &#8232; \n| 150g [[Tahini|tahini]] \n| 100mls regular [[Soy sauce|soy sauce]]&#8232; \n| 25g [[Sugar|sugar]]&#8232; \n| 1 hot [[Chilli|chilli]], deseeded and finely chopped \n| 20g [[Ginger|ginger]], peeled and finely chopped&#8232; \n| 15g [[Spring onion|spring onion]], finely chopped&#8232; \n}}\n====To Serve:- ====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 350g fresh ramen [[Noodles|noodles]] (or use another [[Noodle|noodle]])&#8232; \n| 4 medium sized heads of [[Pak choi|pak choi]], quartered\n| 1 tablespoon finely chopped [[Coriander leaves|coriander leaves]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Mix together the [[Soy|soy]], water, [[Sugar|sugar]], and [[Truffle oil|truffle oil]], then [[Marinate|marinate]] the [[Eggs|eggs]] in this overnight if possible, but for at least four hours \n| Heat a [[Frying pan|frying pan]], and add the [[Sesame seeds|sesame seeds]], [[Toasting|toasting]] them till a good third of them are [[Browning|browning]] and [[Oil|oil]] is starting to leak from them. Whizz them in a [[Blender|blender]]\n| Put the [[Stocks|stocks]] in a good sized heavy bottomed pan, bring them to a [[Boil|boil]]. Whisk in the [[Sesame|sesame]] mix,  then add the [[Soy|soy]], the [[Sugar|sugar]], the [[Chilli|chilli]], the [[Ginger|ginger]], the [[Spring onions|spring onions]] and the [[Tahini|tahini]].\n| Bring back to a [[Boil|boil]] and [[Simmer|simmer]] gently for 15 mins. Whisk the [[Dashi|dashi]] in, bring back to the boil again, then take off the heat.\n| Meanwhile, [[Steam|steam]] the [[Pak choy|pak choy]] till it\u0092s only just done, and set aside, then cook your [[Noodles|noodles]].\n| Place a quarter of the [[Noodles|noodles]] in each of four deep [[Soup|soup]] bowls, and ladle a portion of soup into each. [[Pile]] some [[Pak choi|pak choi]] on top.\n| Place a [[Soft boiled egg|soft boiled egg]] on top of the [[Pak choi|pak choi]], sprinkle with the chopped [[Coriander leaves|coriander leaves]] and serve\n}}\n===Recipe source===\n\n* https://sites.google.com/site/nikandedwinascookbook/Home/soups/tantan-soup-with-ramen-pak-choi-and-mad-eggs\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Oriental cuisine]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Soup and stock recipes]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Chilli pepper recipes]]\n[[Category:Egg recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Nik and Edwina's Cookbook recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#noodles #pakchoi #tantansoupwithramenpakchoiandmadeggs #soy #boil #ginger #tahini #corianderleaves #dashi #truffleoil #blender </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Tartare Sauce (TM)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Tartare Sauce - A Thermomix recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#gherkins #vinegar #capers #sauce #egg #mayonnaise #quicktartaresauce #thermomix #fridge #chives #onion \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This Tartare Sauce recipe is a translation of a recipe in Salsas y Alinos con Thermomix (Susaeta Ediciones)\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 235\n|PortionCalories = 19\n|DatePublished=31st August 2012\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|ImageComment = The new [[Thermomix]] TM5 (2014)\n |Servings = Servings: 12 - Makes 300 ml\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 2 hours, 10 minutes \n |PrepTime = 2 hours, 10 minutes\n |CookTime = None\n|Image = [[Image:The new (2014) Thermomix TM5.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Thanks Julia</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Nice to make this in my Thermy, and it went well with roast vegetables as you suggested.</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:NonLoggedInUser|NonLoggedInUser]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis is a translation of a recipe in '''Salsas y Ali\u00f1os con Thermomix (Susaeta Ediciones)'''\n\n{{RecipeIngredientsTM\n| 250g [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 1 large [[Egg|egg]]\n| 4 [[Pickled|pickled]] [[Gherkins|gherkins]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Mustard|mustard]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Capers|capers]]\n| 1 tablespoon chopped [[Parsley|parsley]]\n| 1 tablespoon chopped [[Chives|chives]]\n| 1 tablespoon chopped [[Onion|onion]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Vinegar|vinegar]]\n| [[Salt]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Drain the [[Capers|capers]] and [[Gherkins|gherkins]] and cut the latter into several pieces.\n| Place all of the ingredients apart from the [[Oil|oil]] and [[Vinegar|vinegar]] in the TM.\n| Run the machine at '''Speed 4'''.\n| With the MC in place, add the [[Oil|oil]], little by little to the lid and carry on mixing until you have a similar texture to [[Mayonnaise|mayonnaise]].\n| Add the [[Vinegar|vinegar]] and mix for '''3 seconds / Speed 4''' and then halt the machine.\n| Leave to rest 2 hours in the [[Fridge|fridge]] before consumption.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nThis [[Sauce|sauce]] is especially good for [[Meat|meat]] and [[Fish|fish]], dressing [[Salads|salads]], or it can give a quirky taste to [[Roast vegetables|roast vegetables]].  \n===Variations===\nIf you want a different texture, cut the [[Gherkins|gherkins]] into smaller pieces and mix them after the [[Sauce|sauce]] has been made.\n==See also==\n* [[Tartare sauce 2 (TM)]]\n* [[Quick tartare sauce]]\n* [[Tartare sauce (Mrs Beeton's)]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Spanish recipes]]\n[[Category:Dips and sauces]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Egg recipes]]\n[[Category:Thermomix recipes]]\n\n[[Category:Uncooked]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#gherkins #vinegar #capers #sauce #egg #mayonnaise #quicktartaresauce #thermomix #fridge #chives #onion </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Taste Sensation Blue Cheese Pasta bake",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Taste Sensation Blue Cheese Pasta bake; a recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#pasta #dried #flour #parsley #maasdamcheese #tastesensationbluecheesepastabake #boiling #chorizo #butter #onions #rest \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Experimenting with my sample of Taste Sensation Matured Blue Cheese powder. It's not a ready-made cheese sauce, just a high quality Danish spray dried blue cheese\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=2nd February 2020\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  40 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  25 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 1730\n|PortionCalories = 865 \n|Image = [[Image:Taste Sensation Blue Cheese Pasta bake recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Powdered cheese is great.</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Not that nasty packet stuff, this is Danish Mature Cheddar and it makes a great Covid Lockdown meal.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nExperimenting with my sample of [[Taste Sensation Matured Blue Cheese powder]].  It's not a [[Cheese sauce|cheese sauce]], just a high quality Danish [[Spray|spray]] [[Dried|dried]] [[Blue cheese|blue cheese]], in a powdered form. \n[[Image:Taste Sensation Blue bake.jpg|thumb|300px|right|After 30 minutes in the oven]]\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 2 tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Taste Sensation Italian seasoning|taste sensation Italian seasoning]]\n| 1 large red onion, peeled and sliced\n| 2 [[Cloves of Garlic, peeled and crushed|cloves of garlic, peeled and crushed]]\n| 120g [[Chorizo|chorizo]] slices, chopped\n| 190g of [[Pasta|pasta]] tubes\n| 40g [[Taste Sensation Matured Blue Cheese powder]]\n| 40g [[Butter|butter]]\n| 30 g plan [[Flour|flour]]\n| 400 ml [[Semi-skimmed milk|semi-skimmed milk]]\n| 1 heaped teaspoon [[Dried|dried]] [[Parsley|parsley]]\n| 2 slices of [[Maasdam cheese]], torn\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 190\u00b0 C (375\u00b0 F - gas 5), [fan oven 170\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Add the [[Taste Sensation Matured Blue Cheese powder]] to a mixing bowl and gradually whisk in the [[Milk|milk]], leave to [[Rest|rest]] while you prepare the [[Onions|onions]]\n| Cook the [[Pasta|pasta]] shells in plenty of [[Boiling|boiling]] water for about 12 minuets, or until done to your liking\n| Meanwhile add the olive oil to your [[Frying pan|frying pan]] and saute the chopped [[Onions|onions]] for 5 minutes\n| Add the [[Crushed garlic|crushed garlic]] and saute for a few minutes\n| Add the chopped [[chorizo]]\n| Stir in the [[Taste Sensation Italian seasoning|taste sensation Italian seasoning]]\n| Drain the [[Pasta|pasta]] and stir it onto the [[Onion|onion]] mix to prevent it sticking together\n| For the [[blue cheese sauce]], melt the [[Butter|butter]] in a saucepan and stir in the [[Flour|flour]] to make a [[Roux|roux]]\n| Gradually whisk in about a third of the [[Milk|milk]]/[[Cheese powder|cheese powder]] and add the [[Dried|dried]] [[Parsley|parsley]] to the mixture and bring to a [[Boil|boil]].  The moment it is [[Boiling|boiling]], stir in the [[Rest|rest]] and return to the boil.\n| Tip the [[Onion|onion]]/[[Pasta|pasta]] mix into a [[Baking tray|baking tray]] and spread it evenly\n| Pour the [[Sauce|sauce]] over the [[Pasta|pasta]] and mix well\n| Scatter the torn [[Maasdam cheese]] over the top and [[Bake|bake]] for 25 to 30 minutes.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with fresh [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]]\n===Chef's notes===\nYou can use [[Ground black pepper|ground black pepper]], [[Salt|salt]] and [[Herbs|herbs]] of your choice as a substitute for the [[Taste Sensation Italian spice]] mix.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Danish recipes]]\n[[Category:Dutch recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Taste Sensation recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#pasta #dried #flour #parsley #maasdamcheese #tastesensationbluecheesepastabake #boiling #chorizo #butter #onions #rest </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }

title": "Taste Sensation Cheese Dumplings",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Taste Sensation Cheese Dumplings\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#tastesensationcheesedumplings #shreddedsuet #flour #parsley #recipesfromothersites #snacksandlightbites #recipes #vegetarianrecipes #warmplace #stew #danishrecipes\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=Normal dumpling made cheesy by adding a few tablespoons of Taste Sensations lovely Mature Strong Cheese powder.\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=14th June 2020\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  40 minutes\n|PrepTime =  5 minutes\n|CookTime =  35 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 1235\n|PortionCalories = 617 \n|Image = [[Image:Taste Sensation Cheese Dumplings recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Light and cheesy</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">These are lighter that they would have been with real cheese as that adds more fat.  Very tasty and you can see how fluffy they were in the stew.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nNormal [[Dumpling|dumpling]] made cheesy by adding a few tablespoons of [[Taste Sensation]]'s lovely [[Mature Strong Cheese powder]].\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 80 g [[Shredded suet]] at room temperature\n| 160 g [[Self raising flour|self raising flour]]\n| A pinch of [[Ascorbic Acid|ascorbic acid]] (if available)\n| 1 teaspoon [[Dried|dried]] [[Parsley|parsley]]\n| A few tablespoon water at room temperature\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 190\u00b0 C (375\u00b0 F - gas 5), [fan oven 170\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Add the [[Parsley|parsley]], [[Taste Sensation Well Matured Cheese Powder]], [[Shredded suet|shredded suet]] and self raining [[Flour|flour]] to a bowl\n| Gently mix with a spoon to combine\n| Using your fingers rub the [[Flour|flour]] into the [[Suet|suet]] until the flour is no longer 'floury'\n| Add a little water at a time until you are able to form the mixture into balls, slightly smaller than ping-[[Pong|pong]] balls\n| Leave to [[Rest|rest]] in a [[Warm place|warm place]] until you're ready to [[Bake|bake]] them\n| Add them to the top of a [[Stew|stew]] during the final 30 to 40 minutes of cooking at between 180 \u00b0 C to 200 \u00b0 C\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Taste Sensation Cheese Dumplings recipe in the stew baked.jpg|In the stew, baked\nImage:Taste Sensation Cheese Dumplings recipe in the stew.jpg|In the stew, dumplings ready to bake\nImage:Taste Sensation Cheese Dumplings recipe prepared.jpg|Ready for the stew\n</gallery>\n===Chef's notes===\nAlways use [[Shredded suet|shredded suet]] at room temperature.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Danish recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Grain and bean recipes]]\n[[Category:Taste Sensation recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#tastesensationcheesedumplings #shreddedsuet #flour #parsley #recipesfromothersites #snacksandlightbites #recipes #vegetarianrecipes #warmplace #stew #danishrecipes</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

It was very  tasty and easy to prepare and cook.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 [[Pork fillet|pork fillet]]\n| 1 heaped  tablespoon [[Taste Sensation]] Hot Louisiana [[Barbecue]] [[Marinade]] powder\n| 1 teaspoon [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Chop the [[Pork fillet|pork fillet]] into medallions.\n| Place in a [[Lock & Lock box]] with one tablespoons of [[Taste Sensation]] Hot Louisiana [[Barbecue]] [[Marinade]] powder and shake vigorously for a minute.\n| [[Vacuum seal]] in a [[Sous-vide|sous-vide]] bag.\n| Cook in your water bath at 61\u00b0 C for about 6 hours.\n| Drain the liquid from the [[Vacuum bag|vacuum bag]] and pat the medallions [[Dry|dry]] on a [[Paper towel|paper towel]].\n| Pan [[Fry|fry]] in 1 teaspoon of [olive oil]] for a few minutes to [[Brown|brown]] the outside of the [[Meat|meat]].\n| Serve.\n}}\n\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\n</gallery>\n\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Chips|chips]] and [[Vegetables|vegetables]] of your chosing\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Sous vide recipes]]\n[[Category:Taste Sensation recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n[[Category:Sous vide cooking]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n{{Template:Sous Vide, Smoking and Curing UK}}\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#tastesensation #marinade #porkfillet #barbecue #tastesensationhotlouisianabarbecueporkfillet #vacuumseal #porkrecipes #recipesfromothersites #meatrecipes #vacuumbag #chips</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Taste Sensation Tangy Chipotle Chicken Nuggets",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Taste Sensation Tangy Chipotle Chicken Nuggets recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#tastesensationtangychipotlemarinade #masaharina #chicken #tastesensationtangychipotlechickennuggets #recipesfromothersites #lockandlock #maincourses #lemonjuice #recipes #meatrecipes #hotairfryer\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=Air fried spicy chicken nuggets using Taste Sensations wonderful powdered chipotle marinade\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=15th March 2020\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Served with a stir-fry and sesame noodles\n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  17 minutes\n|PrepTime =  5 minutes\n|CookTime =  12 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 277\n|PortionCalories = 138\n|Image = [[Image:Taste Sensation Tangy Chipotle Chicken Nuggets recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Air fryed to perfection.</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Almost no oil and tons of flavour!</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nAnother experiment with a [[Taste Sensation]] [[Marinade|marinade]] sample I have been sent.\n\nThis time using [[Taste Sensation Tangy Chipotle Marinade]].  We're trying to eat less protein and more vegetables.  This should be healthier for us and might help us make food last longer should this Coronavirus force us to self-isolate for a prolonged period of time.\n\nWe've only used one large chicken breast for two people.  We shall cook this in our new [[Pro Breeze XL 5.5L Air Fryer]]\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 large [[Chicken breast|chicken breast]], cut into bit-sized pieces\n| 1 tablespoon of [[Taste Sensation Tangy Chipotle Marinade]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 2 tablespoons [[Masa Harina|masa harina]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Add all of the ingredients to a [[Lock and Lock]] style box, close the lid and shake like mad for a few minutes until the [[Chicken|chicken]] pieces are well covered.\n| Leave in a cool place for a few hours if you have the time.  It helps to make the flavours more intense.  Fine if you have to cook straight away though.\n| Preheat the [[Air Fryer|air fryer]] for 5 minutes at 180\u00b0\n| Place the [[Chicken|chicken]] nuggets in the [[Hot air fryer|hot air fryer]] basket and cook for 10 to 12 minutes.\n| Serve immediately.\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:TS Chicken air fried nuggets.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Air fried for 10 minutes\nImage:TS Chicken nuggets marinading.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Leave to marinade for a few hours if you can\nImage:Taste Sensation Tangy Chipotle Marinade.jpeg|thumb|300px|right|[[Taste Sensation Tangy Chipotle Marinade]]\n</gallery>\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with a [[Stir-fry|stir-fry]] and [[Egg noodles|egg noodles]]\n===Variations===\nPlain old [[Yellow cornmeal|yellow cornmeal]] will make a perfect substitute for [[Masa Harina|masa harina]].\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:North American recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Chilli pepper recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Poultry recipes]]\n[[Category:Air fried recipes]]\n[[Category:Taste Sensation recipes]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#tastesensationtangychipotlemarinade #masaharina #chicken #tastesensationtangychipotlechickennuggets #recipesfromothersites #lockandlock #maincourses #lemonjuice #recipes #meatrecipes #hotairfryer</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Taste Sensation Well Matured Cheese Sauce",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Taste Sensation Well Matured Cheese Sauce recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#butter #simmer #blend #tastesensationwellmaturedcheesesauce #salted #plainflour #sauce #cheese #spray #saucepan #tastesensations \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Ive been trying out a range of Taste Sensations products, mostly spices, which I have to say, are excellent. Ive now got some samples of their spray..\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=21st January 2020\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  5 minutes\n|PrepTime =  2 minutes\n|CookTime =  3 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 728\n|PortionCalories = 364\n|Image = [[Image:Gluten free cheese sauce.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Now my Go-To-Sauce</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Began using this at the start of Covid lockdown. I now prefer this to `normal` cheese sauce! \ud83e\uddc0\ud83e\uddc0\ud83e\uddc0</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nI've been trying out a range of [[Taste Sensations]] products, mostly [[Spices|spices]], which I have to say, are excellent. I've now got some samples of their [[Spray|spray]] [[Dried|dried]] [[Cheese|cheese]] powders.  Apart from the obvious uses (to me anyway) for a [[Taste Sensation Well Matured Cheese Powder]], another one was to make a [[Cheese sauce|cheese sauce]].  As a committed cheese lover, we ''always'' have cheese in the [[Fridge|fridge]]; however, if this works well and tastes good, then it's another way to use cheese, even if it is in a powdered form!\n[[Image:MySampleCheesePowder.jpg|thumb|300px|right|My sample of the Well Matured cheese powder]]\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| [[Milk]] (Semi Skimmed) 400ml\n| [[Taste Sensation Well Matured Cheese Powder]] 40g\n| [[Plain flour]] 30g\n| [[Salted]] [[Butter]] 40g\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Gradually add the [[Milk|milk]] to the [[Taste Sensation Well Matured Cheese Powder]], stirring until all the milk has absorbed the cheese powder.\n| Melt the [[Butter|butter]] in a [[Saucepan|saucepan]].\n| Stir in the [[Flour|flour]] and cook for 1-2 minutes.\n| Take the pan off the heat and gradually stir in one- third of the [[Milk|milk]] and [[cheese powder]] blend.\n| Return to the heat and [[Simmer|simmer]], stirring, until the [[Milk|milk]] [[Blend|blend]] is absorbed.Repeat this process, stirring all the time, allowing the [[Sauce|sauce]] to become thick and shiny before adding more of the milk blend.\n| When the entire [[Milk|milk]] [[Blend|blend]] is added bring to the [[Boil|boil]]. [[Simmer]] gently for 2-3 minutes and season with [[Salt|salt]] and [[White pepper|white pepper]].\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Danish recipes]]\n[[Category:Dips and sauces]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Cookery cheats]]\n[[Category:Student recipes]]\n[[Category:Taste Sensation recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#butter #simmer #blend #tastesensationwellmaturedcheesesauce #salted #plainflour #sauce #cheese #spray #saucepan #tastesensations </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Teviot pie recipe",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Teviot pie recipe Beef, from Cookipedia.Co.Uk\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#suet #bakingpowder #parsley #flour #onion #beefstock #mustard #teviotpierecipe #worcestershiresauce #potatoes #potatodumpling \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=We recently discovered, and now often enjoy a Morrisons Teviot pie so thought it was about time to attempt a homemade version\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 3530\n|PortionCalories = 882\n|DatePublished=9th February 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Black garlic\n |Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 3 hours 15 minutes\n |PrepTime = 15 minutes\n |CookTime = 3 hours\n |Image = [[Image:Teviot pie with buttered broccoli.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Warms your heart</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Winter warming fare this.  Needs a leather armchair afterwards!</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Teviot pie - baked.jpg|thumb|right|Teviot pie - baked to perfection]]\nWe recently discovered, and now often enjoy a Morrisons Teviot pie so thought it was about time to attempt a homemade version.  Although the classic Teviot pie has a suet pastry crust, I prefer the more subtle texture and flavour of a suet crust made with a [[potato dumpling]] mix.\n\nGive it a try and see if you agree.\nIf you want to make this pie using the traditional method, '''''after''''' you have tried this recipe, you can always make it with a [[Steak and kidney pudding|pure suet crust]]. :-)\n\n'''pie filling'''\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 600g (1lb 5 oz) diced [[stewing]] steak, diced\n| A few tablespoons of [[plain flour]]\n| 284ml/ 1/2 pint of stock in total made with [[beef stock]] and including a dash of [[red wine]]\n| Splash of [[Worcestershire sauce]]\n| Salt and [[freshly ground black pepper]] to taste\n| Pinch of [[mustard]]\n| 1 large [[onion]], peeled and chopped\n| 2 tablespoons freshly chopped [[parsley]]\n| 2 tablespoons [[tomato pur\u00e9e]]\n}}\n'''suet crust'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 450g (1 lb) floury potatoes (Desiree, King Edward), peeled, boiled and mashed.  About two medium baking potatoes.\n| 110g (4 oz) suet\n| 110g (4 to 4&frac12; oz) self-raising flour\n| 1 heaped teaspoon of [[baking powder]]\n| Salt and pepper to taste\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\nPreheat [[Oven|oven]] to 140\u00b0 C (275\u00b0 F - gas 1)\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Trim any excess [[fat]] from the [[steak]] and cut into bite-sized pieces\n| Season the [[flour]] with [[salt]] and pepper, place in a [[Lock and Lock]] style box together with the steak pieces, seal the lid and shake well to coat.\n| Layer the [[onion]], [[meat]] and [[parsley]] into a buttered pie dish\n| Mix the [[tomato pur\u00e9e]], [[beef stock]] and [[mustard]]\n| Pour the stock mixture into the dish so that the meat is about half covered.\n| Cover the pie dish with [[tin-foil]] so it is completely sealed and bake for about 3 hours.\n}}\n'''suet crust'''\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Mash the cooled [[potatoes]] into a large bowl and with you hands, rub in the [[suet]], [[flour]], seasoning and [[baking powder]].  If the resulting mixture is too wet, add a little more flour.\n| Store in a sealed container so it does not dry out and refrigerate whilst the pie filling slowly cooks.\n| After the filling has cooked for 3 hours, increase the oven temperature to 200\u00b0C (400\u00b0F - Gas\t6)\n| Check the suet mixture has not become too wet and correct using extra flour - the potatoes seem to release more moisture over time.\n| To prevent it sticking to the work surface, use [[yellow cornmeal]] if you have it, plain flour if not and roll out the [[suet]]. Carefully remove the tin-foil from the pie dish and and lay the crust on the pie filling.\n| [[Bake]] in the oven for 20 to 30 minutes until the [[suet]] crust has risen and is golden brown.\n}}\n===Chef's notes===\nIf you are pushed for time, you can cook this for less time at a higher temperature, however, the steak won't be as succulent and flavoursome.\n\nThe quick version: 220\u00b0 C (425\u00b0 F - Gas 7 - Hot) and follow the cooking instructions for [[Steak and kidney pie]] including the tin-foil tip.\n\nDon't be tempted to make the suet crust with a food processor, you will probably get a crust that does not rise.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Beef recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#suet #bakingpowder #parsley #flour #onion #beefstock #mustard #teviotpierecipe #worcestershiresauce #potatoes #potatodumpling </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Tex-Mex breaded pork chops",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",

                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Tex-Mex breaded pork chops, British recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#porkchops #texmexbreadedporkchops #cornmeal #breadcrumbs #egg #barbecued #grill #breadcrumb #pork #fry #ground \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A really simple recipe that livens up pork chops. I make my own Tex-Mex mix / Taco mix but you can buy it in packet form in most supermarkets\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1280\n|PortionCalories = 640\n|DatePublished=30th June 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Accompanied by [[Spicy honey glazed butternut squash]] and [[broccoli]]\n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  30 minutes\n|PrepTime =  5 minutes\n|CookTime =  25 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Spicy honeyglazed butternut squash recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">The spice makes the difference.</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.6</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">The livens-up an average pork chop, and makes an exceptional one brilliant.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nA really simple recipe that livens up [[Pork chops|pork chops]].\n[[Image:Old El Paso Taco Mix.jpg|thumb|200px|right|Old El Paso Taco Mix, the BIG container!]]\n\nI make my own [[Taco mix|Tex-Mex mix / Taco mix]] but you can buy it in packet form in most supermarkets.  I notice in the US (Walmart), you can even buy a 200g container of it!  Be a while before that's available over here I guess.  Anyway, I do prefer my own!\n\nAfter I made these I went on a search for a commercial blend 'tex-mex taco mix' that was available in large quantities.  I found [[Old India Taco Seasoning]] and was very pleased with the results.\n\nI cooked these in the [[Oven|oven]] as it was already on for the [[Spicy honey-glazed butternut squash]].  It also uses less [[Fat|fat]] this way.  You could just as easily [[Grill|grill]] or [[Fry|fry]] these.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 2 [[Pork chops|pork chops]]\n| 4 tablespoons [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]]\n| 2 tablespoons [[Ground|ground]] [[Cornmeal|cornmeal]]\n| 1 beaten [[Egg|egg]]\n| 2 tablespoons [[Tex-Mex mix|Taco mix]], or to taste\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4), [fan [[Oven|oven]] 160\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Mix the [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]], [[Cornmeal|cornmeal]] and [[Tex-Mex]] mix together and spread out on a plate\n| [[Dip]] the [[Pork chops|pork chops]] in the beaten [[Egg|egg]], then coat the [[Pork chops|pork chops]] with the spicy [[Breadcrumb|breadcrumb]] mix\n| Place on a [[Baking tray|baking tray]] with a wire grid and [[Bake|bake]] for 25 minutes.\n| Check that the [[Pork|pork]] is properly cooked, allow to [[Rest for|rest for]] 5 minutes, then serve.\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Tex-Mex recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Grilled, griddled or barbecued]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#porkchops #texmexbreadedporkchops #cornmeal #breadcrumbs #egg #barbecued #grill #breadcrumb #pork #fry #ground </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Thermomix butter (TM)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Thermomix butter - A Thermomix recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#butter #cream #doublecream #frozen #greaseproofpaper #lemonzest #herbs #garlic #ramekindishes #steaming #refrigerator \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This is an ideal way of using up any excess double cream and the butter can be frozen\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1145\n|PortionCalories = 115\n|DatePublished=20th October 2012\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = 10\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 10 minutes\n |PrepTime = 10 minutes\n |CookTime = None\n|Image = [[Image:Thermomix butter recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">1 kg of double cream?</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">3</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Wow!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Carla_Cancio-Bello,_J.D.,_on_behalf_of_Cuban_Cuisine_UK|Carla]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis is an ideal way of using up any excess [[Double cream|double cream]] and the [[Butter|butter]] can be [[Frozen|frozen]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredientsTM\n| 250g-1kg [[Double cream|double cream]], at room temperature\n| [[Salt]] (optional)\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Pour the [[Cream|cream]] into the TM bowl.\n| Whip for '''3 minutes / Speed 8''' until the [[Buttermilk|buttermilk]] is separated.\n| Every so often, check what stage it is at and scrape down the sides of the bowl - if you over whip it, it will revert to [[Cream|cream]] again.\n| Strain through the internal [[Steaming|steaming]] basket .\n| Return the [[Butter|butter]] to the TM bowl together with 500g cold water.\n| Mix '''10 seconds / Speed 4''' to wash the [[Butter|butter]].\n| Strain and repeat the process with a further 500g cold water.\n| Strain, and squeeze out any excess water.\n| Weigh the [[Butter|butter]] and add [[Salt|salt]], if desired, at 1.2% for slightly [[Salted|salted]] and 1.7%-2.0% for fully salted.\n| You can do this with your hands, or return the [[Butter|butter]], with the [[Salt|salt]] to the TM and mix for a few seconds.\n| Shape as desired, wrap in [[Greaseproof paper|greaseproof paper]] or fill [[Ramekin dishes|ramekin dishes]] and place in the [[Refrigerator|refrigerator]].\n}}\n===Servings===\n700 ml double cream makes 230 ml buttermilk / 225 g butter\n===Variations===\nYou can add [[Herbs|herbs]], [[Garlic|garlic]], [[Lemon zest|lemon zest]] or anything you like.\n===Chef's notes===\nTry to work quickly when squeezing out the excess water and shaping, especially if your kitchen is warm, otherwise it will become too soft and therefore difficult to handle.\n==See also==\n* [[Home-made butter and buttermilk recipe]]\n* [[Thermomix butter - Spanish recipe (TM)]]\n* [http://www.channel4.com/4food/recipes/tv-show-recipes/the-fabulous-baker-brothers-recipes/homemade-butter-recipe The fabulous Baker brothers butter recipe]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Butter thermomix]]\n[[Category:British recipes|Butter thermomix]]\n[[Category:Dips and sauces|Butter thermomix]]\n[[Category:Marinades dressings and butters|Butter thermomix]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes|Butter thermomix]]\n[[Category:Thermomix recipes|Butter thermomix]]\n[[Category:Uncooked]]\n\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#butter #cream #doublecream #frozen #greaseproofpaper #lemonzest #herbs #garlic #ramekindishes #steaming #refrigerator </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Thermomix kedgeree (TM)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Thermomix kedgeree - A Thermomix recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#rice #eggs #fish #thermomix #butter #yoghurt #kedgeree #chillipowder #salmonkedgeree #thermomixrecipeskedgereethermomix #saffronstrands \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This is an excellent recipe as the fish, rice and eggs can all be left in the Thermomix to cook at the same time\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1402\n|PortionCalories = 350\n|DatePublished=14th October 2012\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime = 1 hour 45 minutes \n|PrepTime =  1 hour 15 minutes\n|CookTime =  30 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Thermomix kedgeree (TM) recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Thermy Kedgeree</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Wow - two of my most favourite things!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis is an excellent recipe as the [[Fish|fish]], [[Rice|rice]] and [[Eggs|eggs]] can all be left in the [[Thermomix]] to cook at the same time.  No need to stand over three rings on the [[Hob|hob]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredientsTM\n| 200g [[Basmati rice]], washed and soaked for 1 hour\n| Pinch of [[Saffron strands|saffron strands]]\n| 3 [[Eggs|eggs]], thoroughly washed\n| 400g [[Smoked haddock|smoked haddock]] or [[Cod|cod]]\n| 200ml [[Milk]]\n| 50g [[Butter|butter]], chopped into small pieces\n| 150g [[Yoghurt|yogurt]]\n| [[Chilli powder]]. to taste\n| [[Salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]], to taste\n| 30g [[Heston's spiced butter]]\n| [[Fresh herbs]] to garnish, finely chopped\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Add 1kg water to the bowl and place the [[Rice|rice]], mixed with the [[Saffron|saffron]] in the internal [[Steaming|steaming]] basket.\n| Put the [[Eggs|eggs]] on top of the [[Rice|rice]].\n| Put the [[Haddock|haddock]] in a container  that fits easily into the Varoma bowl. \n| Pour enough [[Milk|milk]] over the [[Fish|fish]] to just cover. \n| Place the container in the Varoma and position it over the [[Thermomix]] bowl.\n| Cook for 14 minutes / Temp. Varoma / Speed 4. \n| After 10 minutes it may [[Help|help]] to open lid of the [[Thermomix]] and fluff the [[Rice|rice]] around the [[Eggs|eggs]].\n| Remove the [[Fish|fish]] from the Varoma, drain and leave to cool.\n| Remove the [[Eggs|eggs]], cool and shell before setting aside. \n| Place [[Rice|rice]] in a bowl and mix with the 50g of [[Butter|butter]].\n| Remove skin and [[bones]] from the [[Fish|fish]] and [[Flake|flake]].\n| Mix in with the [[Rice|rice]], together with the [[Yoghurt|yogurt]], seasoning and [[Chilli powder|chilli powder]].\n| Chop 2 of the [[Eggs|eggs]] and add to the [[Rice|rice]] mixture.\n| Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4), [fan oven 160\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour].\n| Grease an ovenproof dish and gently transfer the [[Kedgeree|kedgeree]] mixture to it.\n| Dot with [[Heston's spiced butter]] and [[Bake|bake]] for about 15 minutes.\n| Cut the remaining [[Egg|egg]] lengthwise into quarters to garnish the [[Kedgeree|kedgeree]] and sprinkle the [[herbs]] over the top.\n}}\n===Recipe source===\n* Lightly adapted from a recipe by '''[http://www.forumthermomix.com/index.php?topic=94.0 Thermomixer]'''\n===Variations===\nYou can also use [[Smoked salmon|smoked salmon]] or a mixture of [[Fish|fish]].\n==See also==\n*[[Salmon kedgeree]]\n*[[Buttery kedgeree]]\n*[[Red lentil kedgeree with avocado & tomato]]\n*[['Greasy spoon' kedgeree]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Kedgeree thermomix]]\n[[Category:British recipes|Kedgeree thermomix]]\n[[Category:Indian recipes|Kedgeree thermomix]]\n[[Category:Breakfast recipes|Kedgeree thermomix]]\n[[Category:Main courses|Kedgeree thermomix]]\n[[Category:Egg recipes|Kedgeree thermomix]]\n[[Category:Rice recipes|Kedgeree thermomix]]\n[[Category:Sea fish recipes|Kedgeree thermomix]]\n[[Category:Thermomix recipes|Kedgeree thermomix]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#rice #eggs #fish #thermomix #butter #yoghurt #kedgeree #chillipowder #salmonkedgeree #thermomixrecipeskedgereethermomix #saffronstrands </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

#sparklingmineralwater \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Proper homemade lemonade taken from Fast and Easy Cooking from Thermomix\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 94\n|PortionCalories = 15\n|DatePublished=12th April 2013\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = Servings: 6 - Makes about 1 litre\n class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Tastes authentic</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.3</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">has that lovely lemony smell</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Sue_spins|Susie]] </span></span>\n}}\nProper homemade [[Lemonade|lemonade]] taken from '''Fast and Easy Cooking''' from [[Thermomix]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredientsTM\n| 70g [[Granulated sugar|granulated sugar]]\n| 2 unwaxed [[Lemons|lemons]], washed\n| 8-10 ice cubes\n| Water\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Weigh the [[Sugar|sugar]] into the TM bowl and grind '''5 seconds / Speed 10'''.\n| Whilst the [[Sugar|sugar]] is settling, cut the [[Lemons|lemons]] into quarters and remove any superficial pips.\n| Place into the TM bowl, with the ice cubes.\n| Pulse '''Turbo / 3-4 seconds'''.\n| Add water to the 1.25 litre mark.\n| Stir '''5 seconds / Speed 4'''.\n| Place the internal [[Steaming|steaming]] basket in the TM bowl, pushing it down carefully.\n| Strain the [[Lemonade|lemonade]] into a jug or individual [[Glasses|glasses]] while holding the basket in place.\n}}\n===Variations===\nYou can use [[Sparkling mineral water|sparkling mineral water]] instead of still.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Lemonade]]\n[[Category:British recipes|Lemonade]]\n[[Category:Drink and beverage recipes|Lemonade]]\n[[Category:Vegan title": "The best sausage rolls in the world",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=The best sausage rolls in the world a beef recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#thebestsausagerollsintheworld #sausages #pastry #bakingtray #miseenplace #sausage #delia #newpotatoes #bakedbeans #grill \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Dreaming up recipes to add to our cheat section was made really easy by a recent purchase of extremely high quality sausages from a local butcher\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 3228\n|PortionCalories = 538\n|DatePublished=4th October 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = The best sausage rolls in the world (are huge)\n |Servings = 6 huge [[Sausage|sausage]] rolls\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 1 hour\n |PrepTime = 30 minutes\n |CookTime = 30 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:The best sausage rolls in the world recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Wow!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">You're not wrong. These are fab.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nDreaming up recipes to add to our cheat section was made really easy by a recent purchase of extremely high quality [[Sausages|sausages]] from a local butcher. What a superb success - how these are not in [[Delia]]'s cheat book I'll never know!\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 6 high quality [[Sausages|sausages]], preferably from your local butchers or farmers market\n| 1 375g [[Pre-rolled puff pastry|pre-rolled puff pastry]]\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6)\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Allow the [[Sausages|sausages]] and the [[Pastry|pastry]] about 30 minutes to get to room temperature\n| Unroll the [[Pastry|pastry]] and cut into lengths large enough to cover the [[Sausages|sausages]]\n| Roll [[Pastry|pastry]] around the [[Sausages|sausages]] - don't overlap too much\n| Cut a few slashes in the top\n| Place on a lightly greased [[baking tray]]\n| Bake until golden [[Brown|brown]] for about 30 minutes\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:The best sausage rolls in the world ready for baking.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Ready for baking\nImage:The best sausage rolls in the world simple ingredients.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Simple ingredients\n</gallery>\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe two of these with [[New Potatoes|new potatoes]] and [[Baked beans|baked beans]] for a superb meal.\n===Variations===\nIf you're not so keen on lots of [[Pastry|pastry]], cut it narrow and allow the [[Sausages|sausages]] to poke out of each end\n===Chef's notes===\nI thought that a [[Grill|grill]] mesh would be a good idea as it would allow air under the rolls.  It was not, the [[Pastry|pastry]] covers the grid and expands, making it impossible to remove them cleanly.  Use a greased [[baking tray]]!\n===Chef's notes===\n{{Template:ThinkPig}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Sausage rolls]]\n[[Category:Beef recipes|Sausage rolls]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking|Sausage rolls]]\n[[Category:Cookery cheats|Sausage rolls]]\n[[Category:British recipes|Sausage rolls]]\n[[Category:Main courses|Sausage rolls]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes|Sausage rolls]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes|Sausage rolls]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites|Sausage rolls]]\n[[Category:Student recipes|Sausage rolls]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#thebestsausagerollsintheworld #sausages #pastry #bakingtray #miseenplace #sausage #delia #newpotatoes #bakedbeans #grill </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Thomas the Tank Engine Pasta in tomato sauce",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Thomas the Tank Engine Pasta in tomato sauce an Italian recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#pasta #diced #thomasthetankenginepastaintomatosauce #tomatoes #carrots #grated #simmer #butter #onions #wine #garlic \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This recipe is just a bit of fun to encourage young children to eat 'proper' pasta as opposed to the tinned varieties\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1972\n|PortionCalories = 986\n|DatePublished=25th October 2012\n|Author = JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = 2-3 or more if serving to children\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 2 hours 20 minutes\n |PrepTime = 25 minutes<br />incl [[Roast peppers|roasting peppers]]\n |CookTime = 1 hour 55 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Thomas the Tank Engine Pasta in tomato sauce recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Choo, choo!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.6</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Great for the kids - get them to help make this.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis recipe is just a bit of fun to encourage young children to eat 'proper' pasta as opposed to the tinned varieties.  The Thomas the Tank Engine [[Pasta]] shapes are organic and obtainable from some of the main supermarkets.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 50ml [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 2 medium [[Carrots|carrots]], scraped and finely [[Diced|diced]]\n| 2 [[Celery|celery]] sticks, finely [[Diced|diced]] (include the leaves is you have them)\n| 2 medium [[Red onions|red onions]], peeled and coarsely [[Diced|diced]]\n| 4 cloves of [[Garlic]], peeled and finely [[Diced|diced]], or to taste.\n| 150ml [[Red wine|red wine]] or [[Vegetable Stock|vegetable stock]]\n| 1 tbsp [[tomato pur\u00e9e]]\n| 40 g [[Butter|butter]]\n| 3 [[Roast peppers|red peppers, roasted]], peeled and roughly chopped\n| 2 x 400 g tins chopped [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]]\n| seasoning\n| 1 teaspoon [[Sugar|sugar]]\n| 250g Thomas the Tank Engine [[Pasta|pasta]] shapes\n| 30g [[Parmesan cheese]], freshly [[Grated|grated]] (optional)\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Heat the [[Oil|oil]] in a deep saut\u00e9 or [[Frying pan|frying pan]] on a high heat.\n| When hot, but not [[Smoking|smoking]], add the [[Carrots|carrots]], [[Celery|celery]], [[Onions|onions]] and [[Garlic|garlic]]. \n| Reduce the heat to medium and cook until the [[Onions|onions]] are soft.\n| Stir in the [[wine]] and [[tomato pur\u00e9e]] and allow to cook for 5 minutes, uncovered.\n| Add the [[Butter|butter]], [[Peppers|peppers]] and the [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]].\n| Cover and [[Simmer|simmer]] slowly for 1 hour.\n| Add the [[Sugar|sugar]] and [[Simmer|simmer]] gently for a further 30 minutes.\n| Meanwhile, [[Boil|boil]] up two kettles-full of water and pour into a large saucepan.\n| Once the water is [[Boiling|boiling]], add the [[Pasta|pasta]] shapes and cook for 7-8 minutes. \n| When the [[Pasta|pasta]] is cooked, drain and  plate immediately.\n| Cover with the [[Sauce|sauce]] and serve, sprinkled with [[Grated|grated]] [[Parmesan]] if desired.\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Thomas the Tank Engine Pasta individual shapes.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Thomas the Tank Engine [[Pasta]] individual shapes\nImage:Thomas the Tank Engine Pasta.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Thomas the Tank Engine [[Pasta]]\n</gallery>\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Italian]] [[Bread|bread]] and side [[Salad|salad]].\n===Variations===\nIf you are are cooking for young children, use [[Vegetable Stock|vegetable stock]] instead of [[Wine|wine]] and a mild [[Cheese|cheese]] instead of the [[Parmesan]].  Adults, add some [[chillies]] or [[chilli powder]] to give the sauce a kick!\n===Chef's notes===\nFor a change, I am blending the sauce until smooth - a good way of disguising [[vegetables]] for reluctant children.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Pasta]]\n[[Category:British recipes|Pasta]]\n[[Category:Italian recipes|Pasta]]\n[[Category:Main courses|Pasta]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes|Pasta]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes|Pasta]]\n[[Category:Pasta recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes|Pasta]]\n[[Category:Cooking with wine|Pasta]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]][[Category:Pan fried]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#pasta #diced #thomasthetankenginepastaintomatosauce #tomatoes #carrots #grated #simmer #butter #onions #wine #garlic </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Thomas the Tank Engine Pasta in tomato sauce V) Italian recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#pasta #diced #tomatoes #grated #carrots #simmer #oliveoil #onions #garlic #wine #celery \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This  vegetarian recipe is just a bit of fun to encourage young children to eat 'proper' pasta as opposed to the tinned varieties\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1620\n|PortionCalories = 810\n|DatePublished=25th October 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = 2-3 or more if serving to children\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 2 hours 20 minutes\n |PrepTime = 25 minutes<br />incl [[Roast peppers|roasting peppers]]\n |CookTime = 1 hour 55 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Thomas the Tank Engine Pasta in tomato sauce recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Thanks Julia</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">You can't beat proper pasta!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry]] </span></span>\n}} \nThis recipe is just a bit of fun to encourage young children to eat 'proper' pasta as opposed to the tinned varieties.  The Thomas the Tank Engine [[Pasta]] shapes are organic and obtainable from some of the main supermarkets.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 50 ml [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 2 medium [[Carrots|carrots]], scraped and finely [[Diced|diced]]\n| 2 [[Celery|celery]] sticks, finely [[Diced|diced]] (include the leaves is you have them)\n| 2 medium [[Red onions|red onions]], peeled and coarsely [[Diced|diced]]\n| 4 cloves of [[Garlic]], peeled and finely [[Diced|diced]], or to taste\n| 150ml [[Red wine|red wine]] or [[Vegetable Stock|vegetable stock]]\n| 1 tbsp [[tomato pur\u00e9e]]\n| 40 g [[Olive oil]]\n| 2 [[Red peppers|red peppers]], [[Roasted|roasted]], peeled and roughly chopped\n| 2 x 400 g tins chopped [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]]\n| seasoning\n| 1 teaspoon [[Sugar|sugar]]\n| 250g Thomas the Tank Engine [[Pasta|pasta]] shapes\n| 25g [[Parmesan cheese]], freshly [[Grated|grated]] (optional)\n}}\n===Method===\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Thomas the Tank Engine Pasta individual shapes.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Thomas the Tank Engine [[Pasta]] individual shapes\nImage:Thomas the Tank Engine Pasta.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Thomas the Tank Engine [[Pasta]]\n</gallery>\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Heat the [[Oil|oil]] in a deep saut\u00e9 or [[Frying pan|frying pan]] on a high heat.\n| When hot, but not [[Smoking|smoking]], add the [[Carrots|carrots]], [[Celery|celery]], [[Onions|onions]] and [[Garlic|garlic]]. \n| Reduce the heat to medium and cook until the [[Onions|onions]] are soft.\n| Stir in the [[wine]] and [[tomato pur\u00e9e]] and allow to cook for 5 minutes, uncovered.\n| Add the [[oil]], [[Peppers|peppers]] and the [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]].\n| Cover and [[Simmer|simmer]] slowly for 1 hour.\n| Add the [[Sugar|sugar]] and [[Simmer|simmer]] gently for a further 30 minutes.\n| Meanwhile, [[Boil|boil]] up two kettles-full of water and pour into a large saucepan.\n| Once the water is [[Boiling|boiling]], add the [[Pasta|pasta]] shapes and cook for 7-8 minutes. \n| When the [[Pasta|pasta]] is cooked, drain and  plate immediately.\n| Cover with the [[Sauce|sauce]] and serve, sprinkled with [[Grated|grated]] [[Parmesan]] if desired.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Italian]] [[Bread|bread]] and side [[Salad|salad]].\n===Variations===\nIf you are are cooking for young children, use [[Vegetable Stock|vegetable stock]] instead of [[Wine|wine]] and a mild [[Cheese|cheese]] instead of the [[Parmesan]].  Adults, add some [[chillies]] or [[chilli powder]] to give the sauce a kick!\n===Chef's notes===\nFor a change, I am blending the sauce until smooth - a good way of disguising [[vegetables]] for reluctant children.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Pasta]]\n[[Category:British recipes|Pasta]]\n[[Category:Italian recipes|Pasta]]\n[[Category:Main courses|Pasta]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes|Pasta]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes|Pasta]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes|Pasta]]\n[[Category:Pasta recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes|Pasta]]\n[[Category:Cooking with wine|Pasta]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]][[Category:Pan fried]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#pasta #diced #tomatoes #grated #carrots #simmer #oliveoil #onions #garlic #wine #celery </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

                "revisions": [
