                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Three cheese quiche a cheese recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#threecheesequiche #bake #cheese #grated #cheddar #bluecheese #cheddarcheese #cheeses #eggyolk #pastry #eggs \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This is my interpretation of the multi-cheese quiches that have been popular over the years\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1974\n|PortionCalories = 493\n|DatePublished=17th January 2013\n|Author = JuliaBalbilla\n|ImageComment = Three cheese quiche with salad and vegetable spaghetti\n|Servings = 4-6\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  1 hour, 40 minutes\n|PrepTime =  45 minutes (including resting time), plus cooling time\n|CookTime =  55 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Three cheese quiche recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"><span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">A quiche is good with one cheese</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">With 3 cheeses, it's the dogs!</span> \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\">[[User:Chef|Jerry]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis is my interpretation of the multi-[[Cheese|cheese]] quiches that have been popular over the years.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| Enough [[Shortcrust pastry|shortcrust pastry]] to line a 23cm (9 inch) flan tin (see Chef's notes below)\n| 1 [[Egg yolk|egg yolk]], beaten\n| 160g [[Cheddar cheese]], cut into small cubes \n| 110g any semi-hard [[Blue cheese|blue cheese]], [[Grated|grated]] or crumbled\n| 4 very large [[Eggs|eggs]], beaten\n| 200ml [[Milk|milk]]\n| Seasoning\n| 110g any hard [[Cheese|cheese]], [[Grated|grated]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Line the flan tin with the [[Pastry|pastry]].\n| Prick holes with a fork all over the bottom and [[Refrigerate|refrigerate]] for 30 minutes.\n| Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6), [fan oven 180\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour].\n| [[Bake]] blind for 20 minutes.\n| [[Brush]] the beaten [[Egg yolk|egg yolk]] over the base so that the fork holes are covered.\n| Return to the [[Oven|oven]], and [[Bake|bake]] for a further 7 minutes.\n| Remove from the [[Oven|oven]] and leave to cool.\n| Once cool, scatter the cubed [[Cheddar]] over the base.\n| Mix the [[Blue cheese|blue cheese]] with the [[Egg|egg]], [[Milk|milk]] and seasoning and pour over the [[Cheddar cheese]].\n| [[Bake]] at 190\u00b0 C (375\u00b0 F - gas 5), [fan [[Oven|oven]] 170\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour] for 40 minutes.\n| At this stage the mixture may still be unset, but that is fine.\n| Sprinkle the [[Grated|grated]] hard [[Cheese|cheese]] evenly over the top and [[Bake|bake]] for a further 10-20 minutes until the [[Cheese|cheese]] starts to [[Brown|brown]].\n| During this period, it may rise like a souffl\u00e9, but it will soon revert to normal during cooling.\n| Allow to cool to room temperature before serving.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Salad|salad]] and [[Bread|bread]].\n===Variations===\nFor this recipe I used Pembrokeshire [[Cheddar]], Bleu de Beaude and Cerne Abbas [[Cheeses|cheeses]], but you can use any of your choice.  I would avoid choosing 3 very salty [[Cheeses|cheeses]] as that would make it over-seasoned, so try to get a nice balance.\n===Chef's notes===\nFor the pastry I used [[Shortcrust pastry (TM)|this recipe]] and made the full quantity.  There was enough left over to make a couple of pasties or a small quiche.  It is very difficult to specify how much pastry to make as it depends on the height of your tin and how thick you like your pastry.  I like mine fairly thin.\n{{Quiche - See also}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Egg recipes]]\n[[Category:Pies tarts and flans]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#threecheesequiche #bake #cheese #grated #cheddar #bluecheese #cheddarcheese #cheeses #eggyolk #pastry #eggs </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Three ingredient pineapple cake",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Three ingredient pineapple cake\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#pineapple #threeingredientpineapplecake #cake #greaseproofpaper #castersugar #veganrecipes #bake #breadandbaking #flour #unusualrecipes #coolingrack\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=I found this recipe in a copy of The Times in its Food and Drink section. It looked quite fun and was easy to make.\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=8th May 2022\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 10\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  1 hour, 30 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  1 hour, 15 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 1310\n|PortionCalories = 131\n|Image = [[Image:Three ingredient pineapple cake recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Not bad, nice with ice cream</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Anne made this as an experiment, the result was pleasant, but quite stodgy. But I expect a sweet like this always will be 'heavy'. </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry]] </span></span>\n}}\nI found this recipe in a copy of The Times in its Food and Drink section.\n\nIt looked quite fun and was easy to make.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 250 g [[Self-raising flour|self-raising flour]]\n| 200g [[Caster Sugar|caster sugar]]\n| 450 g can of [[Pineapple|pineapple]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4), [fan oven 160\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| [[Spray]] a springform [[Cake|cake]]-tin with [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and lien the base with a circle of [[Greaseproof paper|greaseproof paper]]\n| Add the [[Pineapple|pineapple]] chunks to an [[Electric mixer|electric mixer]] with a metal blade and [[Blend|blend]] to a pulp\n| If you do not have access to a [[Food mixer|food mixer]] you can buy ready crushed [[Pineapple|pineapple]] in cans from some supermarkets\n| Mix  the crushed [[Pineapple|pineapple]], [[Flour|flour]] and [[Sugar|sugar]] to a bowl and mix until well combines\n| Pour the mixture into your [[Cake|cake]] tine and [[Bake|bake]] in the middle of the [[Oven|oven]] for 60 minutes or until golden [[Brown|brown]]\n| Remove from the [[Oven|oven]] and leave to cool in the tin for 15 minutes then transfer to a [[Cooling rack|cooling rack]] until cooled\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Ice-cream|ice-cream]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#pineapple #threeingredientpineapplecake #cake #greaseproofpaper #castersugar #veganrecipes #bake #breadandbaking #flour #unusualrecipes #coolingrack</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Thrice cooked chipped potatoes",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Thrice cooked chipped potatoes a British recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#chips #roasting #thricecookedchippedpotatoes #freezer #boil #kitchentowel #cakerack #emmental #starch #greaseproofpaper #boiledorsimmered \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=These chips (Heston Blumenthal's Triple Cooked Chips), are time-consuming, so start well in advance, or even the previous day\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 847\n|PortionCalories = 211\n|DatePublished=12th April 2013\n|Author = JuliaBalbilla\n|ImageComment = Heston Blumenthal's Triple Cooked Chips\n |Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 2 hours 25 minutes\n |PrepTime = 2 hours, 5 minutes\n |CookTime = 20 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Thrice cooked chipped potatoes recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Heston's Chips!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.8</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Lots of work involved in this but the results are worthwhile.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:3 sorts of chips.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Three different varieties - Purple Majesty, King Edward & Lady Balfour]]\nThese [[Chips|chips]] (Heston Blumenthal's Triple Cooked Chips), are time-consuming, so start well in advance, or even the previous day.  They are thick and therefore absorb less [[Oil|oil]] than thin ones.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1.1 kg large [[Potatoes|potatoes]] - approx. (eg. King Edward, Maris Piper, Rooster or Sante) peeled and cut into thick [[Chips|chips]]\n| [[Salt]]\n| [[Sunflower]] or [[Peanut oil|peanut oil]] - follow your fryer's manufacturer's instructions as to quantity.\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Soak the [[Chips|chips]] in a pan of cold water for 45 minutes to remove excess [[Starch|starch]].\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Drain the soaked [[Chips|chips]] and bring to the [[Boil|boil]], with the [[Salt|salt]], in a pan of fresh cold water and cook for about 5-6 minutes.\n| Immediately, remove from heat, drain, return to the pan and rinse off in cold water.  This may need to be done more than once.\n| Drain again and dry the [[Chips|chips]] individually with [[Kitchen towel|kitchen towel]].\n| In a [[Roasting|roasting]] tin lined with [[Bake-O-Glide|bake-o-glide]] or [[Greaseproof paper|greaseproof paper]], position the [[Chips|chips]] so that they are in rows and not touching each other.  You will probably need to use more than one tin, or use the tin's [[Roasting|roasting]] rack upon which you can make a second layer.\n| Put in the [[Freezer|freezer]] for at least 30 minutes.\n| Meanwhile, heat the [[Oil|oil]] to 130 C and remove the [[Chips|chips]] from the [[Freezer|freezer]].\n| Pat them dry again and [[Deep-fry|deep-fry]] in small batches until they look as if they are starting to change colour.  This could take 4 minutes or more.\n| Drain on [[Kitchen towel|kitchen towel]] and when they are all cooked, return the to the [[Roasting|roasting]] tin and [[Freeze|freeze]] again for a further 30 minutes, or overnight if desired.\n| About 20 minutes before you are ready to serve, reheat the [[Oil|oil]] to 190 C and cook the [[Chips|chips]] in batches again until golden (about 2 minutes or more).\n| Drain and serve.\n}}\n===Alternative method stages 1-3===\n# Drain the soaked [[Chips|chips]] and bring a pan of cold, unsalted water to the [[Boil|boil]], then add the [[chips]].\n# Reduce the heat and allow to simmer until almost cooked.\n# Immediately, remove from heat, drain, and place them on a [[cake rack]] to cool, then follow from stage 4 above.\n#Instead of boiling the [[Chips|chips]], you can place them in a microwave in a covered container with 110ml water and cook for 6 minutes.  This is for large [[Chips|chips]] using a 900 watt microwave.\n===Serving suggestions===\nWell, [[Chips|chips]] can go with most dishes, but can also be served with [[Garlic mayonnaise|garlic mayonnaise]], dips or [[Sauces|sauces]] as a snack.  You could sprinkle some [[Grated|grated]] melty [[Cheese|cheese]] over them, such as [[Emmental]], [[Queso Tetilla|Tetilla]], [[Mozzarella]] or [[Cheddar]].\n===Variations===\nThey can be made as thick or thin as you wish, but you will have to adjust the [[Cooking times|cooking times]] accordingly.\n===Chef's notes===\nIf you do not have a deep-[[Fat|fat]] fryer, then a large saucepan will be fine, but DO be careful not to fill it more than a third full with the [[Oil|oil]].  You will also need a [[thermometer]] to check the temperatures.\n===See also===\n{{SeeAlso-chips}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Chipped potatoes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments|Chipped potatoes]]\n[[Category:British recipes|Chipped potatoes]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes|Chipped potatoes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites|Chipped potatoes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes|Chipped potatoes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes|Chipped potatoes]]\n[[Category:Deep fried]][[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#chips #roasting #thricecookedchippedpotatoes #freezer #boil #kitchentowel #cakerack #emmental #starch #greaseproofpaper #boiledorsimmered </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Thyme and sour cream dressing",
                "revisions": [

                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Thyme and sour cream dressing a British recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#thymeandsourcreamdressing #garlic #lemonjuice #sourcream #oliveoil #thymeleaves #saladdressing #bean #vegetables #salads \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=An unusual dressing that is great with bean salads, leafy salads and most vegetables\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 197\n|PortionCalories = 32\n|DatePublished=25th December 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 6 - Makes 100 ml of [[Salad dressing|salad dressing]]\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 3 minutes\n |PrepTime = 3 minutes\n |CookTime = None\n |Image = [[Image:Thyme and sour cream dressing recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">A very odd pairing</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">But it works very well</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:NonLoggedInUser|NonLoggedInUser]] </span></span>\n}}\nAn unusual dressing that is great with [[Bean|bean]] [[Salads|salads]], leafy salads and most [[Vegetables|vegetables]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 100 ml (4 fl oz) [[Sour cream|sour cream]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Olive oil|olive oil]] \n| 2 tablespoons fresh [[Thyme leaves|thyme leaves]], finely chopped\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]]\n| &#189; Clove of [[Garlic|garlic]], peeled and crushed\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Add the [[Thyme leaves|thyme leaves]], [[Olive oil|olive oil]], [[Garlic|garlic]] and [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]], tighten the lid and shake vigorously until well mixed.\n| Add the [[Sour cream|sour cream]] to a bowl and fold this mixture into it\\Season to taste with [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]].\n}}\n{{Salad dressing-See also}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Dips and sauces]]\n[[Category:Marinades dressings and butters]]\n[[Category:Salad recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Uncooked]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#thymeandsourcreamdressing #garlic #lemonjuice #sourcream #oliveoil #thymeleaves #saladdressing #bean #vegetables #salads </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Toad in the hole",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Toad in the hole a beef recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#toadinthehole #sausages #bakedbeans #batter #freerangeegg #pork #bangers #onion #tabascosauce #brownsauce #batterpudding \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=No toads in this recipe. Just good bangers and batter pud\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 423\n|PortionCalories = 105\n|DatePublished=20th January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Toad in the hole served with [[baked beans]]\n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime = 40 minutes\n|PrepTime = 5 minutes\n|CookTime = 35 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Toad in the hole and baked beans.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">My favourite!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Just the best meal. Even better with lashings of OK sauce!</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nNo toads in this recipe.  Just good [[bangers]] and [[batter pudding]].  It's all about personal taste, whilst the original was probably made with [[Pork|pork]] [[Sausages|sausages]], if you prefer smoked alligator sausages, make it with them instead!\n\nThis recipe is based on the batter recipe from Delia Smith's famous cookbook so has been proven time and again.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 2 tablespoons of olive oil\n| 1 medium [[onion]], peeled and sliced\n| 8 quality [[Sausages|sausages]] such as [[Debbie and Andrew's Perfect Cumberland Pork Sausages]]\n| 75 g (3 oz) [[Plain flour|plain flour]], sifted\n| 1 large [[Free range egg|free range egg]]\n| 75 ml (3 fl oz) cold [[Milk|milk]]\n| 55 ml (2 fl oz) water\n| ''130 ml - 5 fl oz in total''\n| [[Salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]] to taste\n| Splash of [[Louisiana hot pepper sauce]] or [[Tabasco sauce]] (optional)\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Place a [[roasting tin]] in the oven and preheat 220\u00b0 C (425\u00b0 F - gas 7)\n| Fry the onion in 1 tablespoon of olive oil, in a frying pan for 4 minutes until the onions are soft.\n| Partially cook the sausages by frying in the same pan together with the onions for another 4 minutes.\n| Meanwhile add the remaining ingredients to a [[Food processor|food processor]] and blitz until you have a smooth batter\n| There should be enough fat from the sausages for the [[batter]], if not, add a tablespoon of oil.\n| Arrange the sausages and onions evenly in the tray and carefully heat the pan on the top of the oven for a 30 seconds so the oil bubbles  then pour the [[batter]] mix over the [[Sausages|sausages]]\n| [[Bake]] for 30 minutes at 220\u00b0 C (425\u00b0 F - gas 7) on the highest shelf in the oven until risen\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Toad in the hole.jpg|Toad in the hole, ready\nImage:Toad in the hole batter pud.jpg|batter poured into the hot pan\nImage:Toad in the hole sausages and onions.jpg|Sausages and onions lightly browned\n</gallery>\n===Serving suggestions===\n\nServe hot with [[Mashed potatoes|mashed potatoes]], [[Baked beans|baked beans]] and [[Brown sauce|brown sauce]].\n\n===Chef's notes===\n\nI'm always trying to improve recipes, this one included.  Originally I used the smaller Le Creuset cast iron rectangular dish but have had better luck using a large roasting tray.  I guess more room makes for a thinner batter which gets hotter and rises better.  The original results can be seen on the comments page.\n\n{{Template:ThinkPig}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Beef recipes]]\n[[Category:Egg recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#toadinthehole #sausages #bakedbeans #batter #freerangeegg #pork #bangers #onion #tabascosauce #brownsauce #batterpudding </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Toad in the hole with apple and horseradish relish",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Toad in the hole with apple and horseradish relish recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#batter #browned #glutenfree #sausages #oliveoil #grated #baking #blackpepper #toadintheholewithappleandhorseradishrelish #steamed #dill \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A classic dish reinvented with a mostly whole-grain gluten free batter. Serve with gravy\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2118\n|PortionCalories = 1059\n|DatePublished=22nd October 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  1 hour, 10 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  55 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Toad in the hole with apple and horseradish relish recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Apple and horseradish - forest flavours.</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Always nice to have an interesting sauce to add.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nA classic dish reinvented with a mostly whole-[[Grain|grain]] [[Gluten free|gluten free]] [[Batter|batter]]. Serve with [[Gravy|gravy]] for ultimate comfort, and a dollop of a creamy sweet kicking relish for something different. \n[[Image:Caramelised-red-onion-sausages.png|300px|thumb|right|[[Debbie & Andrew's Caramelised Red Onion Pork Sausages]]]]\n\nRecipe created by Natural Chef, Ceri Jones and reproduced on [[Cookipedia]] by courtesy of [[Debbie&andrew's sausages|debbie&andrew's sausages]].  it is [[Gluten free|gluten free]], [[Dairy|dairy]] free, [[Wheat|wheat]] free - an allergy free recipe!\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 4 [[Debbie & Andrew's Caramelised Red Onion Pork Sausages]]\n| 100g [[Gluten free|gluten free]] [[Flour|flour]] (either from a packet or your own [[Blend|blend]] of 40g [[Tapioca starch|tapioca starch]], 30g [[Brown rice|brown rice]] flour, 30g [[Buckwheat flour|buckwheat flour]])\n| 1 teaspoon [[Dried mixed herbs|dried mixed herbs]] \n| \u00bd teaspoon [[Salt|salt]] \n| \u00bd teaspoon [[Baking powder|baking powder]] \n| Pinch [[Black pepper|black pepper]] \n| 2 medium free-range [[Eggs|eggs]]\n| 250mls [[Almond|almond]] [[Milk|milk]]\n| [[Olive oil]]\n}}\n====relish====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 1 small red [[Apple|apple]], [[Grated|grated]]\n| 1.5 tablespoons fresh [[Grated|grated]] [[Horseradish|horseradish]]\n| 3 tablespoons half-[[Fat|fat]] cr\u00e8me fraiche\n| 1 teaspoon fresh [[Dill|dill]], finely chopped\n| 1 tablespoon [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]] \n| \u00bd teaspoon [[Salt|salt]]\n| Pinch [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 180\u00b0C (fan setting)\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Drizzle a teaspoon of [[Oil|oil]] in a 18cm x 24cm [[Baking|baking]] dish, add the [[Sausages|sausages]] and [[Roast|roast]] for 20 minutes until lightly [[Browned|browned]].\n| Meanwhile, place the [[Rest|rest]] of your [[Batter|batter]] ingredients into a bowl and whisk thoroughly to whip air into the batter, preferably with an electric whisk. Set aside.\n| Remove the [[Browned|browned]] [[Sausages|sausages]] from the [[Baking|baking]] dish, and wipe out any sticky residue from the [[Caramelised|caramelised]] [[Onions|onions]] that may have escaped from the sausages. Add a tablespoon of fresh [[Olive oil|olive oil]] into the dish, increase the [[Oven|oven]] heat to 220\u00b0C and heat the dish with [[Oil|oil]] for 5 minutes till really hot.\n| After 5 minutes put the [[Browned|browned]] [[Sausages|sausages]] back in the pan and pour the [[Batter|batter]] over them.\n| Cook for a further 30-35 minutes, until the [[Batter|batter]] is [[Puffed|puffed]] up, set and golden [[Brown|brown]] on top.\n}}\n====relish====\n{{RecipeMethod\n| To make the relish, combine all the ingredients in a small bowl and transfer to a serving dish. [[Refrigerate]] until ready to eat.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe [[Toad in the hole|toad in the hole]] with [[Steamed|steamed]] green veg, red [[Onion gravy|onion gravy]] and a dollop of relish.\n===Chef's notes===\nTop tip: Serve up the [[Toad in the hole|toad in the hole]] as soon as it is ready, to avoid it settling and sticking to its cooking dish\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{Template:HorseradishSeeAlso}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Egg recipes]]\n[[Category:Gluten free recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Debbie&andrew's sausage recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n{{Template:DebbieAndAndrew attribution}}\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#batter #browned #glutenfree #sausages #oliveoil #grated #baking #blackpepper #toadintheholewithappleandhorseradishrelish #steamed #dill </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

sides.\n| Cut into quarters and serve immediately.\n}}\n===Variations===\nAlternative fillings are seedless [[Grapes|grapes]] or [[Ham|ham]] and [[Tomato|tomato]].  \n===Chef's notes===\nFollow the title": "Tomato, chicken and mozzarella traybake",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Tomato, chicken and mozzarella traybake\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#sageleaves #oliveoil #tomatochickenandmozzarellatraybake #pickled #chickenthighs #mozzarellacheese #garlic #jalapenochillipeppers #britishrecipes #garlicrecipes #italianseasoning\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=My variation on a recipe seen in The Times Saturday magazine, 21st may 2022. A special looking meal that is simple to prepare.\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=25th May 2022\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  50 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime =  40 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 2478\n|PortionCalories = 619\n|Image = [[Image:Tomato, chicken and mozzarella garlic traybake recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">A good mixture</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Thank you - The Times</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:NonLoggedInUser|NonLoggedInUser]] </span></span>\n}}\nMy variation on a recipe seen in The Times Saturday magazine, 21st may 2022.\n\nA special looking meal that is simple to prepare.\n\nKeep the basic ingredients like the [[Chicken|chicken]], [[Garlic|garlic]] and [[Mozzarella cheese|mozzarella cheese]], and add other ingredients of your choosing, just don't go easy on the garlic &#128518;\n\n[[Image:Tomato, chicken and mozzarella traybake roasted.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Roasted to perfection!]]\n[[Image:Tomato, chicken and mozzarella traybake recipe.jpg|thumb|300px|right|The basic ingredients, plus an olive branch or two!]]\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| Up to 8 [[Chicken thighs|chicken thighs]], depending upon size\n| 2 125g balls of [[Mozzarella cheese|mozzarella cheese]], drained and roughly torn\n| 400g [[Cherry tomatoes|cherry tomatoes]]\n| 2 teaspoons [[Taste Sensation Mexican seasoning]]\n| 2 tablespoons sliced green [[Jalapeno chilli peppers|jalapeno chilli peppers]], the [[Pickled|pickled]] type\n| 4 tablespoons [[Pickled|pickled]] [[Green olives|green olives]]\n| 2 small bulbs of [[Garlic|garlic]], [[Cloves|cloves]] peeled and smashed\n| 2 tablespoon [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 1 [[Glass|glass]] of [[Red wine|red wine]] or [[sherry]]\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| A pinch of [[Italian seasoning]], or all purpose seasoning\n| 2 tbs [[Taste Sensation Mixed Sweet Red and Green Bell Pepper Granules]] \n| A handful of fresh [[Sage leaves|sage leaves]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat your [[Oven|oven]] to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6), [fan oven 180\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Add the [[chicken thighs]] to a large bowl and toss them in [[olive oil]]\n| Mix the remaining ingredients together\n| Mix all of the ingredients together and tip everything into the tray, arranging the [[Chicken thighs|chicken thighs]] so the skin can get crispy\n| Pour the [[red wine]] into the base of the tray\n| Scatter with [[Sage leaves|sage leaves]] and [[Roast|roast]] in the [[Oven|oven]] for 40 minutes, discard any burnt leaves\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\n</gallery>\n\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[New Potatoes|new potatoes]] and a [[Green vegetable|green vegetable]].\n\n===Chef's notes===\nThis is a great recipe for using up 'volunteers' from the fridge.  I would normally have used bottled [[sweet peppers]] but had run out,. so doubled-up on [[tomatoes]] instead.  Use sherry, red wine or even half a left-over can of lager just to moisten the dish.  A chopped up [[fennel]] bulb would be good too.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Chilli pepper recipes]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Poultry recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#sageleaves #oliveoil #tomatochickenandmozzarellatraybake #pickled #chickenthighs #mozzarellacheese #garlic #jalapenochillipeppers #britishrecipes #garlicrecipes #italianseasoning</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",

                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Tomato and Capricorn tarts a cheese recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#tomatoandcapricorntarts #chives #pesto #cherrytomatoes #tarts #diced #baking #bake #miseenplace #pastry #puffpastry \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Impress your guests with this simple yet sophisticated recipe from The Lubborn Creamery\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1812\n|PortionCalories = 453\n|DatePublished=4th October 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 35 minutes\n |PrepTime = 15 minutes\n |CookTime = 20 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Tomato and Capricorn tarts recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Simple and tasty</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.6</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Sort of puff-pastry pizza</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The&nbsp;Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nImpress your guests with this simple yet sophisticated recipe from [[The Lubborn Creamery]]\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 250g [[Frozen|frozen]] [[Puff pastry|puff pastry]], thawed\n| 2 tablespoons red [[Pesto|pesto]]\n| 2 rounds of [[Capricorn Somerset Goats cheese]] (100g each), [[Diced|diced]]\n| 1 tablespoon fresh [[Chives|chives]], snipped\n| 300g [[Cherry tomatoes|cherry tomatoes]], halved\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6), [fan oven 180\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Allow the pastry 30 minutes to get to room temperature for ease of handling\n| Roll out the [[Pastry|pastry]] and cut into four x 15cm rounds, using a saucer as a guide.\n| Place on a large greased [[Baking|baking]] sheet.\n| Using a sharp knife, score around each disc, 1cm from the edge.\n| Spread each tart with the [[Pesto|pesto]] to the score line\n| Mix together the [[Capricorn Somerset Goats cheese]] and [[Chives|chives]], season and sprinkle over the [[Tarts|tarts]]\n| Place the [[Cherry tomatoes|cherry tomatoes]] on top.\n| [[Bake]] in the [[Oven|oven]] for 15 to\u0096 18 minutes.\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Pies tarts and flans]]\n[[Category:Lubborn Creamery recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#tomatoandcapricorntarts #chives #pesto #cherrytomatoes #tarts #diced #baking #bake #miseenplace #pastry #puffpastry </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Tomato and cheese macaroni tray bake",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Tomato and cheese macaroni tray bake recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#tomatoes #dried #oliveoil #mozzarellacheese #pancetta #dill #tomatoandcheesemacaronitraybake #basilleaves #macaroni #onion #chillioil \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This is very loosely based on one of the tomato recipes in Jamie Olivers Jamies Kitchen. Its a great idea for a starting point for many..\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=2nd August 2016\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 3\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime = 45 minutes\n|PrepTime = 15 minutes\n|CookTime = 30 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 1832\n|PortionCalories = 610\n|Image = [[Image:Tomato and cheese macaroni tray bake recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">That's colourful!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Looked so good, I didn't want to spoil it by eating it!</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis is very loosely based on one of the tomato recipes in Jamie Oliver's ''Jamie's Kitchen'', (I think).\n[[Image:MacaroniBake ready for the oven.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Ready to bake for 30 minutes]]\n\nIt's a great idea for a starting point for many recipes and a very good way to use up your glut of home-grown [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]].\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 135g [[Dried|dried]] [[Macaroni|macaroni]], cooked [[Al-dente|al-dente]]\n| 2 tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| A pinch of [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n| 1 [[Onion|onion]] chopped finely\n| 100g cooking [[Pancetta|pancetta]], cube\n| 3 [[Cloves of Garlic, peeled and crushed|cloves of garlic, peeled and crushed]]\n| 6 large [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]]\n| 12 small [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]]\n| &#189; a teaspoon of [[Dried|dried]] [[Dill|dill]]\n| 10 fresh [[Basil leaves|basil leaves]]\n| 1 ball [[Mozzarella cheese|mozzarella cheese]]\n| 2 teaspoons of [[Chilli oil|chilli oil]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Cook the [[Pasta|pasta]] for 7-9 minutes in fast [[Boiling|boiling]] [[Salted|salted]] water.  Drain well.\n* Pre-heat your [[Oven|oven]] to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4), [fan oven 160\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| [[Saute]] the chopped [[Onion|onion]] in a tablespoon of [[Olive oil|olive oil]] for 3 minutes.\n| Stir in the cubed [[Pancetta|pancetta]] and [[Stir-fry|stir-fry]] so it takes a tiny bit of colour.\n| Add the [[Crushed garlic|crushed garlic]] and cook for a minute, stirring while it cooks.\n| Pour this mixture into a smallish [[Baking tray|baking tray]] and move it around so it coats the base with the [[Oil|oil]].\n| Halve the small [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]] and quarter the large tomatoes and add them to the tray with the [[Macaroni|macaroni]] and [[Dried|dried]] [[Dill|dill]].\n| Chop the [[Basil leaves|basil leaves]], reserve half for garnish and add the [[Rest|rest]] to the mixture.  Stir well to combine.\n| [[Crumble]] the ball of [[Mozzarella|mozzarella]] over the top and drizzle with the remaining [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and [[Chilli oil|chilli oil]].\n| [[Bake]] at the top of a  180\u00b0 C [[Oven|oven]] for 30 minutes or until the [[Mozzarella cheese|mozzarella cheese]] starts to crust.\n| Garnish with the remaining chopped basil.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nThis is nice served with crusty [[Bread|bread]] and would probably stretch to four people if served this way.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Italian recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pasta recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#tomatoes #dried #oliveoil #mozzarellacheese #pancetta #dill #tomatoandcheesemacaronitraybake #basilleaves #macaroni #onion #chillioil </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }

title": "Tomato chutney",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Tomato Pickle recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#tomatoes #apples #onions #sultanas #muslin #pickle #simmer #tomatochutney #maltvinegar #historicrecipes #vegetarianrecipes\n|hashtagrev=12032020\n|description=Janet Potton's gorgeous tomato pickle, one year on.\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=16th June 2020\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Lovely tomato chutney, one year on!\n|Servings = 10\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  2 hours, 15 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  2 hours\n|TotalCalories = 1133\n|PortionCalories = 113\n|Image = [[Image:Tomato chutney recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">best after a year</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">..but it's worth the wait. \ud83d\ude0b</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry, aka Chef]]</span></span>\n}}\n[https://www.facebook.com/janet.potten Janet Potton], our local horticultural expert, plant stall holder [''Potton's Pots and Pickles to me''], dog-walker and close neighbour, also has [[Pickles|pickles]] and [[preserves]] for sale from time to time.\n[[Image:Janet Pottons original recipe.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Janet's recipe from years gone by.]]\n\nI tried her [[Tomato|tomato]] [[Pickle|pickle]] last year and found it to be excellent so I asked her for the recipe.  She kindly obliged; so here it is!\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 teaspoon [[Pickling spice|pickling spice]]\n| 8 oz finely chopped white [[Onions|onions]]\n| &#189; pint [[Malt vinegar|malt vinegar]]\n| 8 oz [[Apples|apples]], peeled and cored and roughly chopped\n| 2 lb [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]], green or red, skinned. See notes\n| 1 rounded teaspoon [[Mustard powder|mustard powder]]\n| &#189; teaspoon [[Ginger powder|ginger powder]] or 1 teaspoon [[Fresh ginger|fresh ginger]]\n| &#189; teaspoon [[Salt|salt]]\n| &#189; teaspoon [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 8 oz [[Sultanas|sultanas]]\n| 8 oz [[Sugar|sugar]] - [[Muscovado sugar]] or [[Jaggery|jaggery]] can also add a little uniqueness here\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Put the [[Pickling spices|pickling spices]] in a piece of [[Muslin|muslin]]\n| Put the sliced [[Onions|onions]] in a pan with 2 or 3 tablespoons of the [[Malt vinegar|malt vinegar]] and [[Simmer|simmer]] until nearly soft\n| Add the peeled chopped [[Apples|apples]], skinned sliced [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]], [[Spices|spices]], [[Salt|salt]], and [[Sultanas|sultanas]]. [[Simmer]] until the mixture is quite soft, stirring from time-to-time.\n| Once soft, add the [[Sugar|sugar]] and remaining [[Vinegar|vinegar]], increase the heat to dissolve the sugar and [[Boil|boil]] until the mixture has a jammy consistency.\n| Remove the [[Muslin|muslin]] bag, pour into warm [[Sterilised|sterilised]] pots and seal immediately.\n| '''Store for one year before using'''.\n}}\n\n===Recipe source===\n\n* From a recipe book of bygone days - thank you [https://www.facebook.com/janet.potten Janet Potton].\n===Variations===\nGreen [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]] can be used instead of ripe tomatoes, they will just take longer to soften.\n===Chef's notes===\nI made this [[Pickle|pickle]] a year ago and tried it immediately.  Big mistake. I thought it was unpleasant so did not add the recipe to [[Cookipedia]].  I kept the jars of pickle and when I tasted it after it had matured for a year, it was delicious.\n\n[[Popping]] the [[Kilner jars]] into a [[Dishwasher|dishwasher]] cleans and sterilises them, and if your timing is good, they will be warm and ready for the [[Pickling|pickling]] process.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Dips and sauces]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Pickles and preserves]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Pickled]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:12032020'>#tomatoes #apples #onions #sultanas #muslin #pickle #simmer #tomatochutney #maltvinegar #historicrecipes #vegetarianrecipes</code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }

title": "Tomato sauce (PC)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Tomato sauce, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#sauce #parsley #tomatoes #garlic #onion #pressurecooker #boil #vegetablestock #frozen #chillies #boiledorsimmered \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A new pressure cooker arrived yesterday, so this easy sauce is ideal for giving it a trial run\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 538\n|PortionCalories = 13\n|DatePublished=11th June 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Servings: 40 - Makes 1 litre of tomato sauce\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime = 25 minutes \n|PrepTime = 10 minutes \n|CookTime = 15 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Tomato sauce for pizza recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Great for making pizza</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Tomoato glut - gone!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]] </span></span>\n}}\nA new [[Pressure cooker|pressure cooker]] arrived yesterday, so this easy [[Sauce|sauce]] is ideal for giving it a trial run.  I also have a nice large box of English [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]] at my disposal.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 30ml [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 1 large [[Onion|onion]], chopped\n| [[Garlic]] to taste, [[Diced|diced]]\n| [[Red chillies]], to taste, chopped (optional)\n| 2 tablespoons [[Balsamic vinegar|balsamic vinegar]] \n| 1.5kg peeled [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]] (net weight)\n| 4 tablespoons [[Tomato|tomato]] pur\u00e9e\n| 6 tablespoons chopped [[Parsley|parsley]]\n| 500ml [[Vegetable Stock|vegetable stock]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Heat the [[Oil|oil]] in a 5 litre or larger [[Pressure cooker|pressure cooker]]. \n| Add the [[Onion|onion]], [[Garlic|garlic]] and [[Chillies|chillies]] (if using) and saut\u00e9 until softened. Add all the remaining ingredients except [[Parsley|parsley]]. \n| Bring to the [[Boil|boil]], stirring constantly. \n| Close the lid and bring the pressure up to medium - about 10psi.\n| Keep at this pressure for 7 minutes. \n| Allow the pressure to reduce naturally. \n| Remove the lid and if desired, [[Boil|boil]] until the [[Sauce|sauce]] begins to thicken, stirring constantly. \n| Stir in the [[Parsley|parsley]].\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nUse on [[Pizzas|pizzas]], in [[Pasta dishes|pasta dishes]] or as a general [[Sauce|sauce]] for [[Meat|meat]] or [[Fish|fish]]\n===Variations===\nVary the [[Herbs|herbs]], [[Spices|spices]] or other additions to suit the purpose of the [[Sauce|sauce]].  You can use the equivalent weight in tinned [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]] when fresh, ripe ones are out of season.\n===Chef's notes===\nThe [[Sauce|sauce]] can be [[Frozen|frozen]] or kept in [[Sterilised|sterilised]], sealed jars or bottles.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Dips and sauces]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Chilli pepper recipes]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Pressure cooker recipes]]\n[[Category:Student recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#sauce #parsley #tomatoes #garlic #onion #pressurecooker #boil #vegetablestock #frozen #chillies #boiledorsimmered </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Tortilla baskets",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Edible tortilla baskets recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#tortilla #tortillabaskets #spray #flourtortilla #wheat #brush #oliveoil #flour #yellowcornmeal #taco #miseenplace \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=These edible tortilla pots or baskets are easy to make and create fantastic edible bowls which enhances the appearance (and taste) of any meal\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 237\n|PortionCalories = 29\n|DatePublished=16th December 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Servings: 8 - 1 pack of soft tortillas makes 8 edible bowls\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  31 minutes\n|PrepTime =  25 minutes\n|CookTime =  6 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Tortilla baskets recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Genius!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Such a neat idea.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n\n}}\n\nThese [[Tortilla pots|tortilla pots]], [[Tortilla|tortilla]] baskets are easy to prepare and make fantastic edible bowls which enhances the appearance (and taste) of any meal.\n\nThis cooking process works just as well with soft [[Flour|flour]] [[Wheat|wheat]] [[Flour tortilla|flour tortilla]] wraps as it does with soft [[Yellow cornmeal|yellow cornmeal]] [[Tortilla|tortilla]] wraps.\n\nThe idea is really simple, [[Spray|spray]] or [[Brush|brush]] the [[Tortilla|tortilla]], shape it into a greased bowl and back it in the [[Oven|oven]].  This hardens it  an turns it into a large crispy edible [[Taco|taco]]!\n\nYou must use an [[Oven|oven]]-proof bowl and you may have to experiment to find the bowl that produces the best shape.  I've found that  a small and a medium [[Glass|glass]] pyrex bowl work really well.\n\nFill them with the food of your choice, you'll find them to be much stronger than you might imagine.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 pack of soft [[Wheat|wheat]] [[Flour tortilla|flour tortilla]] wraps or soft [[Cornmeal|cornmeal]] [[Tortilla|tortilla]] wraps.\n| [[Olive oil]] for spraying for [[Brushing|brushing]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6), [fan oven 180\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Lightly [[Spray|spray]] or [[Brush|brush]] your [[Oven|oven]]-proof bowls so the [[Tortilla|tortilla]] wrap doesn't stick once it has been [[Baked|baked]].\n| Lightly [[Spray|spray]] the top surface of the [[Tortilla|tortilla]] with a little [[Olive oil|olive oil]], not too much.\n| Push the [[Tortilla|tortilla]] into your bowl so it makes a 'useful' shape.\n| [[Bake]] the [[Tortillas|tortillas]], in the bowls for 6 minutes or until they start to colour.\n| Watch them closely as the time between [[Browning|browning]] and burning is really short!\n| Carefully remove the bowls from the [[Oven|oven]] and invert them over [[Paper towels|paper towels]] and knock the shaped [[Tortilla|tortilla]] out onto the paper towels.\n| They remain soft and pliable while they are still hot so leave them upside down for 15 minutes or so to cool and harden, ready for use.\n| If like me, you don't have enough bowls, you can make these in batches, they keep pretty well for a day or so.\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\n[[Image:Edible tortilla bowl.jpg.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Lightly greased and ready to bake]]\n</gallery>\n\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Mexican recipes]]\n[[Category:North American recipes]]\n[[Category:Tex-Mex recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Salad recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#tortilla #tortillabaskets #spray #flourtortilla #wheat #brush #oliveoil #flour #yellowcornmeal #taco #miseenplace </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Toulouse sausage pittas",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Toulouse sausage pita pockets recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#oliveoil #sausages #toulousesausages #salad #pittas #fat #homemadepittabreads #barbecued #grilled #blackpepper #iceberglettuce \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Sausage pitas made with Toulouse sausages from The Gourmet Sausage Maker, Bexley, Kent\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 3658\n|PortionCalories = 914\n|DatePublished=13th May 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Even better with [[homemade pitta breads]] \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  35 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  20 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Toulouse sausage pittas recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Simply Sausages</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">That's what makes this so special - Nice Sausages!</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry, aka Chef]])</span></span>}}\nWe had some lovely [[Toulouse sausages|toulouse sausages]] from [[Gourmet sausage maker - Bexley]] that we had [[Frozen|frozen]].  As we had lots of [[Salad|salad]] ingredients and some [[Greek yogurt]], I thought this would be a good way of combining them.\n[[Image:Pitta pockets salad and sausages.jpg|300px|thumb|right|Salad, sausages and pitta breads and a lurking Siamese cat.]]\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n}}\n====pittas====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 4 [[Pitta breads|pitta breads]]\n| 6 [[Fat|fat]] [[Toulouse sausages]]\n}}\n==== salad====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| A quarter of a small [[Iceberg lettuce|iceberg lettuce]]\n| 1 small [[Red onion|red onion]], peeled and thinly sliced\n| 1 [[Bell Pepper|bell pepper]], any colour, deseeded and chopped\n| A few [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]], roughly chopped\n| [[Olive oil]]\n}}\n==== dressing====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 1 small pot of [[Yogurt|yogurt]]\n| 2 [[Cloves of Garlic, peeled and crushed|cloves of garlic, peeled and crushed]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| [[Salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n}}\n====sausages====\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Pop the [[Sausages|sausages]] on a [[Grill tray|grill tray]] under a medium heat  and [[Grill|grill]] gently for about 20 minutes, turning now and then.\n}}\n====dressing====\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Add the [[Olive oil|olive oil]] to a small [[Frying pan|frying pan]] with a pinch of [[Black pepper|black pepper]] and stir in the chopped [[Garlic|garlic]]. Once it starts to take any color remove it from the heat, stir well and allow to cool.\n| Once cooled stir into the yogurt and season with salt if needed.\n}}\n====salad====\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Add the [[Salad|salad]] ingredients to a large bowl, drizzle with [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and [[Refrigerate|refrigerate]] while the [[Sausages|sausages]] are cooking\n}}\n\nOnce the [[Sausages|sausages]] are cooked, keep them warm while you warm the [[Pittas|pittas]] for a minute each side\n\nHalve the sausages, pop a few into an opened pitta bread, add some salad and a tablespoon of garlic yogurt\n\n===Chef's notes===\nMake your own [[Pitta bread]]s, it's so easy and so much nicer than the dried up things you can buy.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:French recipes]]\n[[Category:Greek recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Garlic recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pork recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Grilled, griddled or barbecued]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#oliveoil #sausages #toulousesausages #salad #pittas #fat #homemadepittabreads #barbecued #grilled #blackpepper #iceberglettuce </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Traditional roast turkey",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Traditional roast turkey, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#turkey #fahrenheit #degrees #stuffing #stock #roastingpan #traditionalroastturkey #meatthermometer #butter #baste #roast \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Roast turkey usually forms the centrepiece of Thanksgiving in the United States. There are many recipes and methods for cooking whole turkeys\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 20778\n|PortionCalories = 1731\n|DatePublished=4th January 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 12\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  5 hours, 30 minutes\n|PrepTime =  1 hour, 30 minutes\n|CookTime =  4 hours\n|Image = [[Image:RoastTurkey_CP.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Perfect!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Roast turkey doesn't get any better than this!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The&nbsp;Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Roast turkey]] usually forms the centrepiece of Thanksgiving in the United States. There are many recipes and methods for cooking whole [[Turkeys|turkeys]]. Below is one of the simplest and therefore one of the most traditional.\n\nCooking [[Turkey|turkey]] and [[Stuffing|stuffing]] involves the risk of salmonella poisoning. To prevent this, cook the [[Turkey|turkey]] to 185 [[Degrees|degrees]] [[Fahrenheit]] and the [[Stuffing|stuffing]] to 165 [[Degrees|degrees]] [[Fahrenheit]]. Also, avoid cross contamination by keeping raw turkey away from all foods and wash your hands thoroughly after handling it.\n\nThe most effective way to measure food temperatures is with a digital [[Meat thermometer|meat thermometer]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 8kg (18 pound) whole [[Turkey|turkey]]\n| &#189; cup [[Butter|butter]], softened\n| 1.5 quarts homemade [[Turkey|turkey]] [[Stock|stock]] or canned [[Chicken stock|chicken stock]]\n| [[Salt|salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]] to taste\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 160\u00b0 C (325\u00b0 F - gas 3), [fan [[Oven|oven]] 140\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Preheat [[Oven|oven]] to 325 [[Degrees|degrees]] [[Fahrenheit]]. Place the rack in the lowest position of the [[Oven|oven]].\n| Remove the neck and giblets.\n| Rinse the [[Turkey|turkey]] and pat it dry with [[Paper towels|paper towels]].\n| Place the [[Turkey|turkey]], breast side up, on a rack in the [[Roasting pan|roasting pan]]. Rub the skin with softened [[Butter|butter]], and season with [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]].\n| Fill the body cavity with [[Stuffing|stuffing]].\n| Place a [[Meat thermometer|meat thermometer]] in the thickest part of one [[Thigh|thigh]].\n| Position an [[Aluminium foil| aluminium foil]] tent over the [[Turkey|turkey]].\n| Place the [[Turkey|turkey]] in the [[Oven|oven]], and pour two cups of [[Stock|stock]] into the bottom of the [[Roasting pan|roasting pan]].\n| [[Baste]] the entire [[Turkey|turkey]] every 30 minutes with the juices on the bottom of the pan.\n| Add [[Stock|stock]] to the drippings as they become dry, about one to two cups at a time.\n| Remove [[Aluminium foil| aluminium foil]] tent after two and a half hours.\n| [[Roast]] until the [[Meat|meat]] reaches 185 [[Degrees|degrees]] [[Fahrenheit]] and the [[Stuffing|stuffing]] reaches 165 [[Degrees|degrees]] [[Fahrenheit]]. This should take about 4 hours.\n| Serve immediately.\n}}\n==See also==\n* '''[[Meat cooking time calculator Metric|A comprehensive guide to roast meat cooking times]]''' - give the time you want to carve your roast and we'll give you a timed step by step roasting guide\n*[[Stuffing recipes|A large selection of stuffing recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:North American recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Poultry recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#turkey #fahrenheit #degrees #stuffing #stock #roastingpan #traditionalroastturkey #meatthermometer #butter #baste #roast </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Tuna and bulgar wheat pilau",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Tuna and bulgar wheat pilau a British recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#tunaandbulgarwheatpilau #garlic #tuna #oliveoil #zest #bulgarwheat #vegetablestock #peeledprawns #defrosted #crayfishtails #brine \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This quick and healthy meal would probably be as good cold as it was when we had it hot recently\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 850\n|PortionCalories = 425\n|DatePublished=25th October 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 2\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 35 minutes\n |PrepTime = 10 minutes\n |CookTime = 25 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Tuna and bulgar wheat pilau recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n======Best recipe review======\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">A bit starchy</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">3</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Tasted better and I prefer rice</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> - [[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]])</span></span>\n}}\nThis quick and healthy meal would probably be as good cold as it was when we had it hot recently.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1 tablespoon [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 1 [[Onion|onion]] peeled and chopped\n| 3 Cloves of [[Garlic|garlic]], peeled and crushed (optional)\n| 110g [[Bulgar wheat|bulgar wheat]] (dry weight)\n| 200g can [[Tuna|tuna]] in [[Brine|brine]], drained\n| 200ml [[Vegetable Stock|vegetable stock]]\n| 120g [[Frozen peas|frozen peas]], [[defrosted]]\n| [[Zest|zest]] and [[Juice|juice]] from half a [[Lemon|lemon]]\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] and [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Heat the [[Olive oil|olive oil]] in a pan and add a grind of [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n| Gently saut\u00e9 the [[Onions|onions]] for about 5 minutes, adding the [[Garlic|garlic]] for the last few.\n| Add the [[Bulgar wheat|bulgar wheat]] and stir well so it is coated with the oil\n| Add the [[Stock|stock]], bring to the [[Boil|boil]] and [[Simmer|simmer]] for 15 minutes or until all of the liquid is absorbed\n| Add the flaked [[Tuna|tuna]] and the [[Peas|peas]], stir and allow to heat through.\n| Add the [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]] and [[Zest|zest]], season to taste and serve.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Rocket leaves]] and sliced [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]]\n===Variations===\nThis could just as easily be made with tinned [[Salmon|salmon]], [[crayfish tails]] or [[Peeled prawns|peeled prawns]].\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Grain and bean recipes]]\n[[Category:Salad recipes]]\n[[Category:Sea fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Shellfish recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#tunaandbulgarwheatpilau #garlic #tuna #oliveoil #zest #bulgarwheat #vegetablestock #peeledprawns #defrosted #crayfishtails #brine </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Tuna noodle casserole with mushrooms",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Tuna noodle casserole with mushrooms recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#tuna #darksoysauce #grated #sweetcorn #mushrooms #breadcrumbs #frozenpeas #butter #tunanoodlecasserole #pasta #rest \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This is my variation on Julia's Classic American recipe: Tuna noodle casserole \n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1574\n|PortionCalories = 393\n|DatePublished=3rd November 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  50 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime =  40 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:JPs Tuna Noodle Casserole recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Nicer with normal pasta \ud83e\udd24</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I would chose macaroni instead, next time.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry, aka Chef]])</span></span>\n}}\nThis is my variation on [[:Category:I believe I can fry recipes|Julia's]] [[Tuna Noodle Casserole|Tuna noodle casserole recipe]].  It is essentially the same but I'm adding it as a unique recipe so I can reproduce it again easily. From the gusto with which our Siamese cats consumed the remains in the preparation bowl, I think it's going to be tasty!\n\nThe changes I've made are to use [[Celebrity_Chefs_on_Desert_Island_Discs#Antonio_Carluccio_-_broadcast_6th_July_2008|Antonio Carluccio's]] '[[Gallery_of_pasta_types|Pappardelle al Funghi Porcini]]' (Durum wheat pasta with porcini mushrooms), more [[tuna]] than [[Tuna Noodle Casserole|Julia's recipe]], sliced [[mushrooms]], [[dark soy sauce]] and [[Mah\u00f3n-Menorca cheese]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 175 g (6oz) [[Celebrity_Chefs_on_Desert_Island_Discs#Antonio_Carluccio_-_broadcast_6th_July_2008|Antonio Carluccio's]] '[[Gallery_of_pasta_types|Pappardelle al Funghi Porcini]]' (Durum wheat pasta with porcini mushrooms)\n| 1 400g can [[Tuna|tuna]] packed in water, drained and flaked with a fork - 280g drained weight\n| 1 small can condensed [[Cream of mushroom soup|cream of mushroom soup]]\n| 300 ml [[milk]] (fill the condensed mushroom can with [[milk]] and rinse out the can)\n| 6 large [[button mushrooms]], sliced\n| 1 cup mixed [[Frozen peas|frozen peas]] and frozen [[sweetcorn]], cooked\n| &#189; cup grated [[Mah\u00f3n-Menorca cheese]]\n| 2 tablespoons of [[Dark soy sauce]]\n| [[Salt]] and [[freshly ground black pepper]]\n| &#189; cup [[Dried|dried]] [[Bread crumbs|bread crumbs]]\n| 1 tablespoon melted [[Butter|butter]]\n| &#188; cup [[Grated|grated]] mature [[Mah\u00f3n-Menorca cheese]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4), [fan oven 160\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Tuna mushroom pasta casserole.jpg|thumb|240px|right|Ready for the breadcrumbs\nImage:Pappardelle al Funghi Porcini, Durum wheat pasta with porcini mushrooms.jpg|thumb|240px|right|Antonio Carluccio's Pappardelle al Funghi Porcini (Durum wheat pasta with porcini mushrooms)\n</gallery>\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Cook the [[pasta]] for 5 to 6 minutes in salted boiling water.  He say's 3 to 4 minutes but I found the cooking times on all of the pasta in this Carluccio 'gift pack' to be rather too short for my taste.\n| Cook the [[Frozen peas|frozen peas]]: simply [[Microwave|microwave]] them in a bowl with a few tablespoons of water for 2-3 minutes, covered with [[Cling-film|cling-film]].\n| Add the [[Peas|peas]], [[sweetcorn]], [[Tuna|tuna]], sliced [[mushrooms]], [[Cream of mushroom soup|cream of mushroom soup]], [[Milk|milk]], & [[grated]] [[Cheese|cheese]]. Add a few tablespoons of [[dark soy sauce]] a pinch of [[salt]] and a generous pinch of [[black pepper]]. Stir until well combined.\n| Transfer to a greased 9x9\" [[Baking|baking]] dish. Toss the [[Bread crumbs|bread crumbs]] with the melted [[Butter|butter]]. Sprinkle evenly atop the [[Casserole|casserole]]. Top with [[Grated|grated]] [[Mah\u00f3n-Menorca cheese]].\n| [[Bake]] in the top half of a 350-degree [[Oven|oven]] for 40 minutes, covered for the first 30 minutes, remove the lid for the final 10 minutes. Let it [[Rest|rest]] about 5 minutes before serving.\n}}\n===See also===\n* [[Tuna Noodle Casserole]]\n===Chef's notes===\nAs I had a little spare time I made this a good few hours ahead.  If you do this, refrigerate it, covered, and leave the breadcrumb stage until you're ready to bake it.\n\n{{Template:YoutubePastaDough}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:North American recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Pasta recipes]]\n[[Category:Sea fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Stews and casseroles]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#tuna #darksoysauce #grated #sweetcorn #mushrooms #breadcrumbs #frozenpeas #butter #tunanoodlecasserole #pasta #rest </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Turkey and onion burger with cranberry relish",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Turkey and onion burger with cranberry relish a Barbecue recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#turkeyandonionburgerwithcranberryrelish #onion #ciabatta #breadcrumbs #parsley #burgers #turkey #egg #rocket #oliveoil #grilled \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Another great burger recipe from British Onions\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1733\n|PortionCalories = 433\n|DatePublished=21st January 2013\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 20 minutes\n |PrepTime = 5 minutes\n |CookTime = 15 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Turkey and onion burger with cranberry relish recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">British onions are the best</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Buying them helps our farmers \ud83d\ude9c\ud83d\ude9c\ud83d\ude9c</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]] </span></span>\n}}\n\nAnother recipe from [[British Onions]]\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 450g (1lb) [[Turkey]] [[Mince]]\n| 25g [[Onion]], finely chopped\n| 1 [[Clove garlic, crushed|clove garlic, crushed]]\n| 10g/&frac14;oz [[Breadcrumbs]]\n| 1 Handful [[Parsley]]\n| 1 [[Egg]], beaten\n| [[Salt]] & [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 2 tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 4 [[Ciabatta]] Rolls\n| 2 tablespoons [[Cranberry relish]]\n| Handful [[Rocket leaves|rocket leaves]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Mix the [[Turkey|turkey]], [[Onion|onion]] [[Garlic|garlic]], [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]], [[Parsley|parsley]] [[Egg|egg]], [[Salt|salt]] & [[Pepper|pepper]] together in a bowl. \n| Shape into 4 [[Burgers|burgers]].\n| Heat the [[Oil|oil]] in a [[Frying pan|frying pan]] & [[Fry|fry]] the [[Burgers|burgers]] on both sides until [[Browned|browned]] & cooked through.\n| Cut the [[Ciabatta|ciabatta]] rolls in half & toast. \n| Divide the [[Rocket|rocket]] between the rolls, then top with a bun & finally spoon on the [[Cranberry and red onion relish|cranberry relish]].\n}}\n===Variations===\nThese could also be [[grilled]] or [[barbecued]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Poultry recipes]]\n[[Category:British Onions recipes]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Barbecue recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n[[Category:Grilled, griddled or barbecued]]\n{{Template:British Onions attribution}}\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#turkeyandonionburgerwithcranberryrelish #onion #ciabatta #breadcrumbs #parsley #burgers #turkey #egg #rocket #oliveoil #grilled </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Turkey meatballs with creamy lemon pasta",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Turkey meatballs with creamy lemon pasta a British recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#turkeymeatballswithcreamylemonpasta #turkey #freshpasta #lemon #oliveoil #mince #pasta #veal #foodprocessor #lemonzest #chicken \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=These meatballs are healthy, tasty and easy to make\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2370\n|PortionCalories = 592\n|DatePublished=25th October 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  25 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime = 15 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Turkey meatballs with creamy lemon pasta recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Never thought of these before</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">These are delightful and well worth the effort</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]] </span></span>\n}}\n\nThese [[Meatballs|meatballs]] are healthy, tasty and easy to make.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1 tablespoon [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]]\n| [[Freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 500g [[Turkey|turkey]] breast [[Mince|mince]]\n| [[Zest]] from 1 [[Lemon|lemon]]\n| [[Juice]] from &#189; a [[Lemon|lemon]]\n| 350 g [[Fresh pasta|fresh pasta]] (pappardelle, linguine, [[Spaghetti|spaghetti]] etc)\n| 6 tablespoon cr\u00e8me fra\u00eeche\n| 50 g [[Wild rocket|wild rocket]]\n}}\n'''to serve'''\n* [[Green salad]] leaves\n\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Add the [[Lemon zest|lemon zest]], [[Turkey|turkey]] [[Mince|mince]], [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]] to a bolw and mix well with clean hands.\n| Form into 20 balls, (''slightly smaller than a ping-[[Pong|pong]] ball'')\n| [[Fry]] in [[Olive oil|olive oil]] for 12 to 15 minutes, turning regularly.\n| Meanwhile cook the [[Pasta|pasta]] as instructed on the pack - [[Fresh pasta|fresh pasta]] normally only needs 3 or 4 minutes - it changes visually once it is cooked.\n| Dress the [[Pasta|pasta]] with [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]] and cr\u00e8me fra\u00eeche and seasoning\n| Stir in 50g of the [[Rocket leaves|rocket leaves]] and allow it to wilt.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with fresh [[Salad|salad]] leaves\n===Recipe source===\n* Inspiration from a Waitrose recipe card\n===Variations===\n* If you have a [[food processor]], make your own mince; just whizz a [[turkey]] breast for a few seconds with a metal blade.\n* Try this with [[chicken]] or [[veal]]\n\n{{Template:YoutubePastaDough}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Pasta recipes]]\n[[Category:Poultry recipes]]\n[[Category:Student recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]][[Category:Pan fried]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#turkeymeatballswithcreamylemonpasta #turkey #freshpasta #lemon #oliveoil #mince #pasta #veal #foodprocessor #lemonzest #chicken </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
