title": "Turkey pizza",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Turkey pizza, Italian recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#turkeypizza #pizzastone #chicken #turkey #oliveoil #pizza #pizzadough #grill #mozzarella #bake #onion \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Another idea to use up the leftover Christmas turkey. Chicken would work just as well. Do ensure that the meat is properly cooked\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1920\n|PortionCalories = 480\n|DatePublished=7th November 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4 - Makes 2 pizzas (serves 2+)\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  1 hour 25 minutes<br />Includes making the dough\n|PrepTime = 1 hour 15 minutes  \n|CookTime =  10 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Turkey pizza recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Fab for Leftovers</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">When cold turkey gives you cold turkey, try this!</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nAnother idea to use up the leftover Christmas [[Turkey|turkey]].  [[Chicken]] would work just as well.  Do ensure that the meat is properly cooked.  If you want to use uncooked [[chicken]] or [[turkey]], use [[Steamed chicken|this recipe]] to prepare it first.\n[[Image:Turkey pizza.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Turkey pizza ready to slide on to the [[pizza stone]]]]\n\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1 portion of [[Pizza dough]] - Makes 2 pizzas\n| 2 balls of [[mozzarella cheese]]\n| 200g cooked [[Chicken|chicken]] or [[Turkey|turkey]]\n| &#189; bottle of [[Dolmio tomato and garlic pasta sauce]], or make your own [[Tomato sauce for pizza|pizza sauce]]\n| A few slices of raw [[Onion|onion]]\n| Slices of fresh [[green chillies]] (optional)\n| 30g grated [[cheddar cheese]] (optional)\n| 15ml olive oil\n| [[Fine yellow cornmeal]] for dusting\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Make the [[Pizza dough|pizza dough]] as instructed\n* If using a [[pizza stone]], preheat the [[pizza stone]] under a very hot [[grill]] for about 20 minutes.  Place it about 8cm (3\") from the heat source.\n\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Make 1 pizza per person\n| Sprinkle the worksurface with [[Cornmeal|cornmeal]]\n| Stretch or roll the [[Dough|dough]] into two thin rounds\n| Prick the pizzas all over with a fork. This prevents it puffing up too much and burning while it is cooking\n| Lightly [[Oil|oil]] one side of the [[Pizza|pizza]] and [[Grill|grill]], oiled side down for about 3 minutes or until it starts to brown and puff up.\n| Remove from the oven, flip over and add the topping.\n| Drizzle the [[Pizza|pizza]] with [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and spread the pizza with &frac12; of the [[Tomato sauce|tomato sauce]]\n| Lay a few slices of the raw onion on the tomato topping.\n| Add the chopped turkey \n| Top with torn [[Mozzarella|mozzarella]] and a drizzle of [[olive oil]].\n| [[Bake]] for 3 or 4  minutes or until the [[Cheese|cheese]] browns a little - watch it carefully as it can burn easily.\n| Keep the fist pizza warm at the bottom of the oven whilst you make the second.\n| Serve hot\n}}\n===Chef's notes===\nPasta sauce such as the 350 g Dolmio range makes a perfect pizza topping.  The unused half can be put straight in the freezer ready for the next two pizzas!\n\nIf you don't have a [[pizza stone]] you can lay the pizza on a [[grill tray]] instead, it just won't be quite as good.\n\n''I trust [[User:PaoloCastagna|Paolo]] won't be too upset that I have included this in the [[Italian recipes]] section.''\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Italian recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Poultry recipes]]\n[[Category:Pizza recipes]][[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#turkeypizza #pizzastone #chicken #turkey #oliveoil #pizza #pizzadough #grill #mozzarella #bake #onion </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }

title": "Turmeric crusted turbot with goan curry sauce",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Turmeric crusted turbot with goan curry sauce recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#sauce #fish #seeds #fry #curryleaves #onion #nage #dessert #shallots #tomatoes #turmeric \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Robust, creamy fish with a spicy coating and a sharp fiery goan curry sauce.\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=29th September 2016\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 3\n|TotalTime =  30 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime =  20 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 1610\n|PortionCalories = 530\n|Image = [[Image:Turmeric crusted turbot with goan curry sauce recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Very authentic</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">But then it should be.  I've never met two more passionate foodies, than Nik & Edwina.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis recipe is reproduced with the kind permission of [[Nik and Edwina's Cookbook]].\nRobust, creamy fish with a spicy coating and a sharp fiery goan curry sauce\nTo quote: \"This is a divine dish; the smooth, robust, creamy [[Fish|fish]] goes incredibly well with its spicy crusting, and with the sharp, fiery, sweet/sour [[Sauce|sauce]].\"\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n}}\n====The fish:- ====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 2 x 150g fillets of [[Turbot|turbot]], skin on \n| 15 fresh [[Curry leaves|curry leaves]], finely chopped \n| \u00bd teaspoons black [[Onion|onion]] [[Seeds|seeds]] \n| 1 teaspoon [[Ground|ground]] [[Turmeric|turmeric]] \n| 1 teaspoon [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] \n}}\n====The Goan spice mix:- ====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 10 [[Cloves|cloves]] \n| 1 tablespoon [[Ground coriander|ground coriander]] \n| 1\u00bd teaspoons [[Black peppercorns|black peppercorns]] \n| 2 black [[Cardamoms|cardamoms]], [[Seeds|seeds]] taken out, pods discarded. If you can\u2019t get black, green will do nicely \n| 2 [[Star anise|star anise]] \n| 3 [[Dried|dried]] hot [[Red chillies|red chillies]] \n| 2 tablespoons [[White wine vinegar|white wine vinegar]] \n| 1 tablespoon [[Caster Sugar|caster sugar]] \n| 1 teaspoon [[Salt|salt]] \n}}\n====The sauce:- ====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 4 small [[Shallots|shallots]], finely chopped \n| \u00bd teaspoon mild red [[Chilli powder|chilli powder]] \n| 2 large [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]], chopped \n| 125mls [[Nage]]\n| 125mls thin [[Coconut milk|coconut milk]] \n}}\n====To serve:- ====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| [[Steamed]] [[Basmati rice|basmati rice]] for 2\n| [[Steamed]] [[Spinach|spinach]] for 2\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| To make the [[Spice|spice]] mix, [[Dry roast|dry roast]] the dry spice mix [[Spices|spices]] in a pan until they start to smell lovely. Blitz them in a liquidizer with the [[Rest|rest]] of the spice mix ingredients. Set aside.\n| To make the [[Sauce|sauce]], heat a [[Dessert|dessert]] spoon of [[Coconut|coconut]] or [[Ground nut|ground nut]] [[Oil|oil]] in a heavy bottomed [[Saucepan|saucepan]] and [[Fry|fry]] the chopped [[Shallots|shallots]] over a medium heat till they\u2019re soft, and are starting to go golden.\n| Add the [[Chilli powder|chilli powder]] and stir for a minute, then add the [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]] and stir till they\u2019ve disintegrated, and are starting to go quite dry.\n| Turn the heat down low, and add the [[Spice|spice]] mix you\u2019ve set aside, and cook slowly, stirring, till the [[Oil|oil]] is starting to separate from the mix.\n| Add the [[Nage|nage]] and [[Simmer|simmer]] for a few minutes, then bring the heat back up and add the [[Coconut milk|coconut milk]] and simmer gently for five minutes.\n| Season, and check the flavour; it should be quite fiery, with a sharp sweet/sour flavour.\n| [[Sieve]] the [[Sauce|sauce]] into a bowl, clean the pan, discarding the remaining contents, and return the sauce to the pan. Keep warm.\n| To cook the [[Fish|fish]], rub it with the [[Curry leaves|curry leaves]], [[Onion|onion]] [[Seeds|seeds]], [[Turmeric|turmeric]] and [[Salt|salt]] and leave for 10 minutes. Then heat a [[Dessert|dessert]] spoon of [[Coconut oil|coconut oil]] in a [[Frying pan|frying pan]] and add the fish, skin side down.\n| [[Fry]] for about 2 minutes, so the skin is nice and crisp, then turn it over, take the heat down a bit, and cook for another 3 minutes.\n| Meanwhile, put neat [[Pile|pile]]s of [[Rice|rice]] on two plates (we use those steel tower thingies, they\u2019re open ended metal rings 7cm in diameter and 6cm tall), then place a piece of [[Fish|fish]] on each plate, add a neat pile of [[Spinach|spinach]], then pour a generous dollop of [[Sauce|sauce]] neatly around, and serve.\n}}\n===Recipe source===\n\n* https://sites.google.com/site/nikandedwinascookbook/Home/fish/turmeric-crusted-turbot-with-goan-curry-sauce\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Indian recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Chilli pepper recipes]]\n[[Category:Fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Sea fish recipes]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n[[Category:Nik and Edwina's Cookbook recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#sauce #fish #seeds #fry #curryleaves #onion #nage #dessert #shallots #tomatoes #turmeric </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Using a marrow as an edible bowl",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Using a marrow as an edible bowl recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#marrow #chilli #usingamarrowasanediblebowl #bake #miseenplace #gulyas #marrows #freezer #chilliconcarne #baking #sauce \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A scooped out marrow makes a really good edible plate or bowl\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 669\n|PortionCalories = 334\n|DatePublished=15th October 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  1 hour, 25 minutes\n|PrepTime =  25 minutes\n|CookTime =  1 hour\n|Image = [[Image:Using a marrow as an edible bowl recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Neat idea</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">And no washing up!</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:NonLoggedInUser|NonLoggedInUser]] </span></span>\n}}\n\nA really simple way to conjure up a tasty meal from [[Freezer|freezer]] leftovers and a [[Marrow|marrow]] from the garden. A scooped out [[marrow]] makes a really good edible plate or bowl.  In the time it takes to cook the marrow, the contents will be lovely and hot.  You could cook the contents from scratch but this was really an excuse to clear out the freezer.\n\nIn this instance , our filling was 1 portion of [[gulyas]] and 1 portion of a home-cooked [[chilli con carne]] that need a little more spice so both frozen meals were defrosted and mixed together with 3 finely chopped green indian chillies.\n\nThe blandness of the [[Marrow|marrow]] nicely offsets the spiciness of the [[Chilli|chilli]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 1 medium sized [[Marrow|marrow]]\n| 2 portions of [[Chilli|chilli]]-con-carne or a similar meal that has plenty of [[Sauce|sauce]] and a chilli kick to it\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6), [fan oven 180\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour] - I've allowed for the oven preheat time in the preparation time, but you could add the [[Marrow|marrow]] when the oven is first turned on and increase the overall cooking time a little - the contents are cooked anyway so as soon as the marrow is softened, the meal is ready\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| [[Scoop]] out and discard the [[Marrow|marrow]] [[Seeds|seeds]] and enough of the flesh to leave room for your filling, being careful to leave enough flesh to contain the filling as the marrow will 'collapse' as it cooks\n| Place the two halves in an [[Oven|oven]]-proof dish that will prevent the [[Marrows|marrows]] from falling over during cooking. I wedged a roll of silicone [[Baking|baking]] mat between the two halves in order hold them up during cooking\n| [[Bake]] for 1 hour or until the [[Marrow|marrow]] is softened\n}}\n\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe with [[Pitta bread|pitta bread]].\n\n===Chef's notes===\nBe careful when eating this served straight from the [[Oven|oven]] as the [[Marrow|marrow]] can be very hot!\n\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Chilli pepper recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Squash recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#marrow #chilli #usingamarrowasanediblebowl #bake #miseenplace #gulyas #marrows #freezer #chilliconcarne #baking #sauce </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Vanilla slice recipe",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Vanilla slice recipe Egg, from Cookipedia.Co.Uk\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#butter #custard #vanillaslicerecipe #icingsugar #puffpastry #cornflour #eggyolks #bakingtray #lemonjuice #lemon #grated \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This recipe came as a visitor request and after a little research it seems for some reason this dessert is peculiar to Australia and New Zealand\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 6050\n|PortionCalories = 605\n|DatePublished=21st January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Servings: 10 - (slices)\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 50 minutes\n |PrepTime = 30 minutes<br />Incl. resting pastry / oven warming\n |CookTime = 20 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Vanilla slice recipe recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n}}\n\nThis recipe came as a visitor request and after a little research it seems for some reason this [[Dessert|dessert]] is peculiar to Australia and New Zealand.  I have tried this out and it's quite good, though fairly filling.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 1 500g pack of ready made [[Puff pastry|puff pastry]]\n| 1 cup [[Granulated sugar|granulated sugar]]\n| &frac14; cup [[Cornflour|cornflour]]\n| 50 g [[Butter|butter]]\n| 2 large [[Egg yolks|egg yolks]]\n| 2 teaspoons [[vanilla essence]]\n| &frac12; cup [[Custard|custard]] powder\n| 4 cups full [[Cream|cream]] [[Milk|milk]]\n}}\n'''Lemon icing'''\n* 1 cup [[Icing sugar|icing sugar]]\n* 1 teaspoon [[Butter|butter]]\n* 2 teaspoons [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]]\n* [[Grated]] zest of &frac14; [[Lemon|lemon]]\n* &frac12; teaspoon water\n\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the [[oven]] to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6), [fan oven 180\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Leave the pastry at room temperature for a little while before rolling\n| Cut the contents of packet in half and roll out each piece into 30 cm squares\n| Place each square on an un-greased [[baking tray]] and stab all over with the tines/prongs of a fork to lessen the chance of it rising too much\n| [[Bake]] for about 10 minutes or until [[Browned|browned]]\n| Carefully trim each sheet to about 23 cm square and pat any risen areas back down with your hands\n| Line a 23 cm square [[baking tray]] with [[tin-foil]] and allow plenty of overlap for easy removal\n| Place one sheet of the pastry in the [[foil]]\n| Add the [[Sugar|sugar]], [[Cornflour|cornflour]] and [[Custard|custard]] powder to a cold saucepan, add a little [[Milk|milk]] and combine to a paste\n| Whisk in the remaining [[Milk|milk]] and mix well\n| Add the [[Butter|butter]], heat the pan and gently bring to the [[Boil|boil]], stirring often\n| Reduce the heat, stir in the [[Vanilla|vanilla]] essence and [[Simmer|simmer]] for 3 minutes to thicken\n| Whisk the [[Egg yolks|egg yolks]] in a separate bowl and then whisk into the pan\n| Pour the hot [[Custard|custard]] over the first piece of [[Puff pastry|puff pastry]], cover with the second sheet and pat down so it comes into contact with the custard everywhere\n}}\n'''Lemon icing'''\n# Beat the [[Lemon juice|lemon juice]] and [[Zest|zest]] in with the [[Butter|butter]]. It may [[Help|help]] to [[Microwave|microwave]] the butter for a few seconds to soften first\n# Beat in the [[Icing sugar|icing sugar]] and add a little water if needed\n# Allow the sandwich to cool then spread the icing evenly over the top\n# Chill in the [[Refrigerator|refrigerator]]\n===Serving suggestions===\n\nCut into slices and dust with a little [[Icing sugar|icing sugar]]<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Fill you up, cheer you up.</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Nice with a cup of tea with no sugar!</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Egg recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Pies tarts and flans]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Australian recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#butter #custard #vanillaslicerecipe #icingsugar #puffpastry #cornflour #eggyolks #bakingtray #lemonjuice #lemon #grated </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Vegan no-egg fruit cake",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Vegan no-egg fruit cake, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#cake #fruit #darkrum #vegannoeggfruitcake #cookery #cherries #vegan #molasses #almonds #currants #mixedspice \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Another of Mum's recipes from her sheaf of cookery notes. This vegan fruit cake does not keep as well as a traditional fruit cakes so needs to be used\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 3923\n|PortionCalories = 392\n|DatePublished=28th June 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Servings: 10 - Makes one vegan fruit cake\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  2 hours, 45 minutes\n|PrepTime =  45 minutes\n|CookTime =  2 hours\n|Image = [[Image:Vegan noegg fruit cake recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Not sure about this</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">3</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Don't much like cakes anyway</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]] </span></span>\n}}\n\nAnother of Mum's recipes from her sheaf of [[Cookery|cookery]] notes.\n\nThis [[Vegan|vegan]] [[Fruit|fruit]] [[Cake|cake]] does not keep as well as a traditional [[Fruit|fruit]] [[Cakes|cakes]] so needs to be used fairly quickly.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 150 ml [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 450 ml cold water\n\n| 675 g (1.5 lb) mixed [[Dried fruit|dried fruit]] ([[Raisins|raisins]], [[Cherries|cherries]], [[Currants|currants]], [[Sultanas|sultanas]] & chopped [[Apricots|apricots]])\n| 50 g (2 oz) chopped whole [[Almonds|almonds]]\n| 2 teaspoons [[Ground|ground]] [[Mixed spice|mixed spice]]\n| 1 tablespoon of [[Black treacle]] or [[Molasses|molasses]]\n| [[Grated|grated]] rind of 1 waxless [[Lemon|lemon]]\n| 75g (3 oz) [[Muscovado sugar|muscovado sugar]] or [[Jaggery|jaggery]]\n| 350g (12 oz) [[Wholemeal|wholemeal]] [[Self-raising flour|self-raising flour]]\n}}\n'''after the [[Baking|baking]]'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 45 ml (3 tablespoons) [[Dark rum|dark rum]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 150\u00b0 C (300\u00b0 F - gas 2), [fan [[Oven|oven]] 130\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Line and [[Oil|oil]] a 19 cm (7.5\") round [[Cake|cake]] tin.\n| Add all of the [[Cake|cake]] ingredients to a large bowl and beat well unit smooth and evenly mixed.\n| Pour the mixture into the greased [[Cake|cake]] tin and [[Bake|bake]] in the middle of the [[Oven|oven]] for 2 hours.\n| The [[Cake|cake]] should feel firm to the touch and sound hollow when tapped if done.\n| Allow to cool for 15 minutes then drizzle the [[Rum|rum]] evenly over the top of the [[Cake|cake]].\n| Leave until perfectly cool until slicing and serving.\n}}\n===Recipe source===\n\n* Mum's [[Cookery|cookery]] notes.\n===Variations===\nUse [[Sherry|sherry]] instead of [[Dark rum|dark rum]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#cake #fruit #darkrum #vegannoeggfruitcake #cookery #cherries #vegan #molasses #almonds #currants #mixedspice </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Vegetarian New York truck tortillas",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Vegetarian New York truck tortillas recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#coriander #liquor #springonions #celery #corianderleaves #beans #saucepan #bayleaves #tortillas #onions #guacamole \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A trip to New York introduced us to their posh food trucks, they were an eye opener about how delicious itinerant food can be\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=27th September 2016\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Unusual food truck - [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maximus/Minimus Maximus Minimus], not from New York though!\n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 3\n|TotalTime =  2 hours, 15 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  2 hours\n|TotalCalories = 3694\n|PortionCalories = 923\n|Image = [[Image:Maximus_Minimus_food_truck_Seattle.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">I just love the food truck</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">A superb vegetarian recipe from two lovely people, Nik & Edwina.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis recipe is reproduced on [[Cookipedia]] courtesy of [[Nik and Edwina's Cookbook]].\n\nA trip to New York in early 2013 introduced us to their posh food trucks and stalls \u2013 they were an eye opener about how delicious itinerant food can be, especially the one we ate from on the corner of Wooster and Prince, between Chelsea and the Lower East Side. Also, hats off to all the food truck guys for feeding blacked-out areas of New York at cost price during Hurricane Sandy in October 2012 \n\nThe [[Bean|bean]] mix here is gorgeous; creamy and filling without being stodgy and bloaty, with a lovely clean beany flavour, and the various trimmings go incredibly well with it. Unlike some UK interpretations of [[Tortillas|tortillas]], these are free from the ersatz flavours of [[Refried beans|refried beans]], [[Cumin|cumin]] and [[Garlic|garlic]]. What follows are broad guidelines \u2013 this is mainly about the [[Black bean|black bean]] recipe.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 8 [[Soft corn tortillas|soft corn tortillas]] \n}}\n====the beans ====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 200g [[Black beans|black beans]], soaked for 2 hours and drained \n| 2 medium [[Carrots|carrots]], peeled and quartered \n| 3 sticks of [[Celery|celery]] sliced lengthways and cut in two \n| 2 [[Onions|onions]], halved \n| large bunch of [[Coriander|coriander]] stalks, tied together with string \n| 2 [[Bay leaves|bay leaves]] \n| 4 small [[Spring onions|spring onions]], finely chopped \n| 1 tablespoon powdered [[Coriander|coriander]] \n| [[Salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]] \n| 2 tablespoons chopped [[Coriander leaves|coriander leaves]]\n}}\n====the [[Guacamole|guacamole]]==== \n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 2 ripe [[Avocados|avocados]], [[Mashed|mashed]] \n| 1 teaspoon [[Cayenne|cayenne]] \n| [[Juice|juice]] of a [[Lime|lime]] \n| [[Sea Salt|sea salt]] \n}}\n====to serve====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 80g [[Cheddar cheese|cheddar cheese]], [[grated]] \n| 140ml [[Sour cream]] \n| 100g [[Iceberg lettuce|iceberg lettuce]], roughly sliced  \n| Chopped mild [[Red chillies|red chillies]], deseeded,  or pickled [[Chillies|chillies]] (San Marcos [[Pickled]] [[Chipotle]] is especially good)\n| 2 halved [[Limes|limes]]\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Put the soaked and drained [[Beans|beans]], [[Carrot|carrot]], [[Celery|celery]], [[Onions|onions]], [[Bay leaves|bay leaves]] and [[Coriander|coriander]] stalks into a large lidded [[Saucepan|saucepan]], and top up with just enough water to cover everything.\n| Place on a low heat and bring to the [[Boil|boil]].\n| Cook gently for 90 -120 minutes until the beans are tender.\n| Drain and reserve the cooking [[Liquor|liquor]]. Pick out and discard the carrot, celery, onions, [[Bay|bay]] leaves and coriander stalks. \n| Return the drained [[Beans|beans]] to the large [[Saucepan|saucepan]], add 3 tablespoons of the cooking [[Liquor|liquor]], the [[Spring onions|spring onions]], the [[Coriander powder|coriander powder]], and season well. Cook gently for 8 minutes.\n| Check seasoning again, and add a little more liquor if it looks too dry \u2013 the mixture should be very slightly runny.\n| Resist any temptation to [[Mash|mash]], these beans are meant to be kept whole.\n| Stir in the [[Coriander leaves|coriander leaves]].\n| Set aside and keep warm.\n| Warm through the [[Tortillas|tortillas]], then bring everything to the table and let everyone assemble their own wraps and enjoy.\n| Y'all have a nice day now!\n}}\n===Variations===\nFor a [[Vegan|vegan]] version, just omit the [[Cheese|cheese]] and the [[Cream|cream]] use for the topping.\n==See also==\n\n* Another of [[Nik and Edwina's Cookbook]], based largely upon this recipe: [[Deconstructed tortilla salad]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:North American recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Grain and bean recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Nik and Edwina's Cookbook recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#coriander #liquor #springonions #celery #corianderleaves #beans #saucepan #bayleaves #tortillas #onions #guacamole </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Vegetarian Scotch eggs",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Vegetarian Scotch eggs, Egg recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#eggs #plainflour #breadcrumbs #vegetarianscotcheggs #chickpeas #egg #chilliflakes #oliveoil #miseenplace #potatomasher #bellpepper \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Thanks to Colin Griffiths for this recipe and accompanying photograph\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2253\n|PortionCalories = 375\n|DatePublished=31st July 2014\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = 6 eggs\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  1 hour, 10 minutes\n|PrepTime =  20 minutes\n|CookTime =  50 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Vegetarian Scotch eggs recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Looks fab Colin!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Wouldn't normally make something lie this, but these look fab.</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nThanks to Colin Griffiths for this recipe and accompanying photograph.  Colin and [[Cookipedia]] seem to have an affinity with [[Eggs|eggs]] for it is his pictures that grace our [[Ostrich]] section!\n\nFrom the picture, this looks fantastic.\n\nOur [[How to boil an egg|how to boil an egg]] section has useful cooking time information so you can get the yolk set to your preference.\n\nDo not use very fresh eggs or you won't be able to peel them - see [[eggs]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 2 tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 6 [[Free range eggs|free range eggs]]\n| 2 tablespoons [[Plain flour|plain flour]]\n| 6 tablespoons [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Chilli flakes|chilli flakes]] or [[Taco-mix|taco-mix]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Smoked paprika powder|smoked paprika powder]]\n| 2 [[Cloves of Garlic, peeled and crushed|cloves of garlic, peeled and crushed]]\n| 1 [[Sweet Pepper|sweet pepper]], deseeded and finely chopped\n| 1 [[Red onion|red onion]], peeled and finely chopped\n| 1 400g can of [[Chickpeas|chickpeas]], drained and well rinsed\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4), [fan [[Oven|oven]] 160\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Break one of the [[Eggs|eggs]] into a bowl and beat well.\n| Put the [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]] and [[Plain flour|plain flour]] into separate bowls.\n| Place the eggs into a pan of boiling water and boil for 4 minutes.  This should result in a runny yolk. See [[How to boil an egg|how to boil an egg]] for different yolk preferences.\n| Leave the [[Eggs|eggs]] to cool then remove the shell.\n| Heat the [[Olive oil|olive oil]] in a [[Wok|wok]] or [[Frying pan|frying pan]] and gently saut\u00e9 the [[Bell Pepper|bell pepper]] and [[Onions|onions]] for 8 minutes.\n| Add the [[Crushed garlic|crushed garlic]] and saut\u00e9 for another few minutes.\n| Stir in the [[Chickpeas|chickpeas]], [[Paprika powder|paprika powder]] and [[Chilli flakes|chilli flakes]] and then [[Mash|mash]] the [[Chickpeas|chickpeas]] with a [[Potato masher|potato masher]].\n| Mix well and allow to cool so the mixture can be handled.\n| Roll the peeled [[Eggs|eggs]] in the [[Plain flour|plain flour]] to coat and then take a fifth of the [[Veggie|veggie]] mix and [[Mould|mould]] it around the [[Egg|egg]].\n| [[Dip]] in the beaten [[Egg|egg]] and roll in the [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]].\n| Pop the [[Eggs|eggs]] on a lightly oiled [[Baking tray|baking tray]] or one lined with [[Bake-O-Glide|bake-o-glide]].\n| Cook for 35 minutes, turning once.\n}}\n===Recipe source===\n\n* Colin Griffiths\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Spicy recipes]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Chilli pepper recipes]]\n[[Category:Egg recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#eggs #plainflour #breadcrumbs #vegetarianscotcheggs #chickpeas #egg #chilliflakes #oliveoil #miseenplace #potatomasher #bellpepper </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Vegetarian shepherd's pie",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Vegetarian shepherd's pie\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#dried #cheese #freshherbs #vegetarian #grated #butter #potatoes #onions #mashedpotatoes #oliveoil #crushedgarlic \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This recipe is based on an idea by a good friend of ours. Thank you Francis (and Martin for the vegetarian slant). filling topping \n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=20th January 2018\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  35 minutes\n|PrepTime =  10 minutes\n|CookTime =  25 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 3055\n|PortionCalories = 763\n|Image = [[Image:Classic shepherds pie recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Thanks Guys!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Lovely veggie meal.</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:NonLoggedInUser|NonLoggedInUser]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis recipe is based on an idea by a good friend of ours.  Thank you Francis (and Martin for the [[Vegetarian|vegetarian]] ''slant'').\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n}}\n====filling====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 400g tinned [[Green lentils|green lentils]], or cooked and drained green [[Lentils|lentils]]\n| &#189; of a teaspoon of [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 2 large white [[Onions|onions]], peeled and finely chopped\n| &#189; teaspoon [[Dried oregano|dried oregano]]\n| 1/2 a teaspoon of [[Dried|dried]] [[Sage|sage]]\n| 4 [[Fat|fat]] [[Cloves of garlic|cloves of garlic]], peeled and crushed\n| 1 small [[Red chili pepper|red chili pepper]],deseeded and finely chopped\n| 1 teaspoon [[Sea Salt|sea salt]]\n}}\n====topping====\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 2 kg [[Potatoes|potatoes]]; peeled & [[Boiled|boiled]] or [[Steamed|steamed]]\n| 300 ml hot [[Milk|milk]]\n| [[Butter]] to taste\n| 200 g [[Vegetarian|vegetarian]] [[Cheese|cheese]]; [[Grated|grated]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Pre-heat your [[Oven|oven]] to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6), [fan oven 180\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Add the [[Black pepper|black pepper]] to the [[Olive oil|olive oil]] and gently [[Saute|saute]] the [[Onions|onions]] for 5 minutes in a large [[Frying pan|frying pan]] or [[Wok|wok]]\n| Add the [[Crushed garlic|crushed garlic]] and [[Fry|fry]] for 30 seconds, then tip in the lentis and cook for a further 5 minutes\n| Add the remaining filling ingredients, mix well and set to one side while you prepare the topping\n| [[Mash]] the [[Potatoes|potatoes]] with the hot [[Milk|milk]] and [[Butter|butter]]\n| Lightly [[Oil|oil]] a suitably sized [[Oven|oven]]-proof dish and fill with the [[Lentil|lentil]] mixture\n| Cover with with [[Mashed potatoes|mashed potatoes]] and top with the [[Grated|grated]] [[Cheese|cheese]]\n| [[Bake]] for 25 minutes\n| Serve with seasonal [[Vegetables|vegetables]]\n}}\n===Variations===\nTry other forms of canned [[Beans|beans]] or [[Pulses|pulses]]. If the beans are large or have fairly tough skins, like [[Kidney beans|kidney beans]], crush them slightly first.\n===Chef's notes===\nYou can use freshly chopped [[Herbs|herbs]] instead of [[Dried|dried]] herbs; or a combination of both.  Use at least double the amount of [[Fresh herbs|fresh herbs]].\n\nAdd a good pinch of [[Dried|dried]] or [[Fresh herbs|fresh herbs]] to the [[Mashed potatoes|mashed potatoes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Grain and bean recipes]]\n[[Category:Potato recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#dried #cheese #freshherbs #vegetarian #grated #butter #potatoes #onions #mashedpotatoes #oliveoil #crushedgarlic </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }

title": "Victoria surprise cake (TM)",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Victoria surprise cake - A Thermomix recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#butter #chocolate #cream #victoriasurprisecaketm #fridge #eggs #flour #greaseproofpaper #doublecream #raspberries #fruit \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A different take on the traditional Victoria sandwich, adapted for making with a Thermomix\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2301\n|PortionCalories = 230\n|DatePublished=26th January 2014\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Servings: 10 - 1x18cm cake\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  40 minutes\n|PrepTime =  15 minutes\n|CookTime =  25 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Victoria surprise cake TM recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Cake in my Thermy</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Great idea, great cake</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Sue_spins|Susie]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Image:Victoria surprise tins.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Victoria surprise tins]]\nA different take on the traditional Victoria sandwich, adapted for making with a Thermomix.  A special tin set is required, which is produced by Alan Silverwood.  You can obtain one online from [[Head Cook and Bottlewasher]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredientsTM\n\n}}\n''' For the sponge'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 2 large [[Eggs|eggs]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[Baking powder|baking powder]]\n| 4 drops [[Vanilla|vanilla]] essence\n| 110g [[Butter|butter]]\n| 110g [[Caster Sugar|caster sugar]]\n| 110g [[Self-raising flour|self-raising flour]]\n}}\n''' For the filling'''\n{{RecipeIngredientsNB\n| 150 ml Extra thick [[Double Cream|double cream]]\n| 180 g [[Fresh fruit]], eg [[strawberries]], [[Raspberries|raspberries]], [[Blackberries|blackberries]], [[Kiwi fruit|kiwi fruit]], [[Blueberries|blueberries]] etc\n}}\n''' For the top '''\n\n* 50 g [[Chocolate]], at least 70% [[cocoa]] solids\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4), [fan [[Oven|oven]] 160\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Place all of the sponge ingredients into the bowl  '''20 seconds / Speed 5'''.\n| Scrape down the bowl and mix for a few more seconds at the same speed.\n| Line the centres of the raised bases with 14cm circles of buttered [[Greaseproof paper|greaseproof paper]].\n| [[Butter]] and [[Flour|flour]] the tins.\n| Pour the mixture in equal quantities into the tins and place on a [[Baking tray|baking tray]].\n| [[Bake]] for 20-25 minutes.\n| Leave to cool in the tins and turn out onto the work surface.\n| To fill, spread the [[Cream|cream]] into the holes in both sponges.\n| Overfill one half with [[Fruit|fruit]] and gently, but firmly, press both halves together.\n| Break off chunks of chocolate into a clean bowl, and grate '''6 seconds / Speed 6'''.\n| Melt 37\u00b0 C / Speed 2 until you have the desired melting consistency, scraping down inside of the bowl if necessary.\n| Coat the top of the sponge with melted [[Chocolate|chocolate]] and leave to chill in the [[Fridge|fridge]].\n}}\n===Recipe source===\n\n* Adapted for [[Thermomix]] from the recipe supplied with the tins.\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Thermomix recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#butter #chocolate #cream #victoriasurprisecaketm #fridge #eggs #flour #greaseproofpaper #doublecream #raspberries #fruit </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Violet ice cream",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Violet ice cream (ice cream maker recipe)\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#violeticecream #freezer #cream #blend #doublecream #stickblender #lakeland #castersugar #fat #frozen #fridge \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=An unusual violet flavoured ice cream for an ice cream maker\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 3201\n|PortionCalories = 177\n|DatePublished=18th March 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Servings: 18 - Makes about 1.5 litres\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  4 hours including chilling and churning time\n|PrepTime =  4 hours including chilling and churning time\n|CookTime = None\n|Image = [[Image:Violet ice cream recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Hopeless ice cream maker</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">The recipe is fine, this ice cream maker is expensive and noisy. Avoid Cuisinart like the plague.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n[[Ice-cream]] made with violet extract.  If your [[Ice-cream maker|ice-cream maker]] has no built-in [[Freezer|freezer]], place your bowl in the freezer for a minimum of 12 hours before using.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 330g [[Caster Sugar|caster sugar]]\n| 330ml full [[Fat|fat]] [[Milk|milk]]\n| 600ml [[Double Cream|double cream]]\n| \u00bc teaspoon violet extract (or to taste) - I used extract from [[Lakeland]] but different makes will vary in strength.\n| Natural violet food colouring (optional)\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Put all of the ingredients except for the [[Cream|cream]] into a bowl or tall jug\n| [[Blend]] until the mixture is smooth using a [[Stick blender|stick blender]]\n| Add the [[Cream|cream]] and [[Blend|blend]] briefly\n| Allow to chill in the [[Fridge|fridge]] for at least 1 hour\n| Pour into your [[Ice-cream maker|ice-cream maker]] and churn according to the manufacturer's instructions\n| Transfer into a container and keep in the [[Freezer|freezer]]\n}}\n\n{{Soft ice cream}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Ice-cream recipes]]\n[[Category:Frozen]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#violeticecream #freezer #cream #blend #doublecream #stickblender #lakeland #castersugar #fat #frozen #fridge </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Warming vegetable broth",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Warming vegetable broth a cheese recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#soup #bread #warmingvegetablebroth #cheese #cabbage #vegetables #carrots #onions #dice #grated #grilled \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A hot herby broth made with onions, root vegetables and leaves, ladled over grilled bread and finished with cheese\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2131\n|PortionCalories = 532\n|DatePublished=21st January 2013\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 40 minutes\n |PrepTime = 15 minutes\n |CookTime = 25 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Warming vegetable broth recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">That's a lot of broth</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">(for home use?)</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:NonLoggedInUser|NonLoggedInUser]] </span></span>\n}}\n\nA hot herby [[Broth|broth]] made with [[Onions|onions]], [[Root vegetables|root vegetables]] and leaves, ladled over [[Grilled|grilled]] [[Bread|bread]] and finished with [[Cheese|cheese]]. A [[Soup|soup]] similar to [[Italian]] ribollito, but made only with British ingredients and a great way to use up leftovers\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 4 tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 3 medium sized white or [[Red onions|red onions]], peeled and chopped into small [[Dice|dice]]\n| 2 Cloves of [[Garlic|garlic]], peeled and chopped\n| 1 [[Carrots|carrots]], cut into small [[Dice|dice]]\n| 1 [[Celery|celery]] stick and leaves, chopped finely\n| About 4 tablespoons chopped [[Vegetables|vegetables]], either [[Turnip|turnip]], [[Squash|squash]], [[Celeriac|celeriac]], [[Swede|swede]] or [[Parsnip|parsnip]]\n| 2 large [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]], de-seeded and chopped, or 12 [[Cherry tomatoes|cherry tomatoes]], quartered;\n| 1.2 [[Litres|litres]]/2 [[Pints|pints]] [[Chicken stock|chicken stock]]\n| 1 can 225g haricot, [[Borlotti|borlotti]] or [[Cannellini beans|cannellini beans]], drained\n| 2 green savoy [[Cabbage|cabbage]] leaves, or cavolo nero ([[Italian]] black cabbage), [[Shredded|shredded]]\n| [[Salt]] and [[Black pepper|black pepper]]\n}}\n'''To serve:'''\n* 4 thick slices of day old [[Ciabatta|ciabatta]] or [[Sourdough bread|sourdough bread]]\n* [[Extra virgin olive oil]]\n* 4 tablespoons of chopped [[Parsley|parsley]] or [[Basil|basil]]\n* 4 tablespoons of [[Grated|grated]] [[Cheese|cheese]], either mature [[Cheddar|cheddar]], [[Caerphilly]], [[Cheshire]] or [[Lancashire]] - or try [[Lord of the Hundreds cheese|Lord of the Hundreds]] or [[Berkswell cheese|Berkswell]], both hard [[Pecorino|pecorino]]-style sheeps\u0092 [[Milk|milk]] [[Cheeses|cheeses]], made in the UK\n\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| To make the [[Soup|soup]] first [[Grill|grill]] the [[Bread|bread]], [[Brushing|brushing]] with a little [[Oil|oil]] then [[Grilling|grilling]] in a dry pan or ridged [[Grill pan|grill pan]] over a medium heat until crisped. \n| Put a slice of [[Bread|bread]] into each warmed [[Soup|soup]] bowl.\n| Heat the [[Oil|oil]] in a large pan and add the [[Onion|onion]] and [[Garlic|garlic]]. \n| Cook over a low heat for 10 minutes; do not let them take on any colour or it will spoil the flavour of the [[Soup|soup]].\n| Add the [[Carrots|carrots]], [[Celery|celery]] and chopped [[Vegetables|vegetables]] and cook, stirring occasionally over a medium-low heat for another 3 minutes. \n| Add the [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]], cook for another 3 minutes then add the [[Stock|stock]], [[Beans|beans]] and [[Cabbage|cabbage]] leaves and bring to the [[Boil|boil]].\n| [[Simmer]] until the [[Cabbage|cabbage]] leaves are tender, taste and add [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]] - you will need only the smallest amount.\n| Serve the [[Soup|soup]] ladled over the [[Grilled|grilled]] [[Bread|bread]]; sprinkle a few drops of [[Extra virgin olive oil|extra virgin olive oil]] on top then scatter over the [[Herbs|herbs]] and some [[Grated|grated]] [[Cheese|cheese]].\n}}\n===Variations===\nThis is a very flexible recipe, designed to use up what you have in store - chop and change the [[Vegetables|vegetables]] as you wish, but always use [[Onions|onions]].\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Soup and stock recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Grain and bean recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:British Onions recipes]]\n[[Category:Recipes from other sites]]\n{{Template:British Onions attribution}}\n\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#soup #bread #warmingvegetablebroth #cheese #cabbage #vegetables #carrots #onions #dice #grated #grilled </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Welsh cakes",
                "revisions": [

                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",

                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Welsh cakes, a fruit recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#welshcakes #griddle #butter #egg #castersugar #dough #tava #driedfruit #browned #flour #sultanas \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=\"Chroesawa pawb\" (Welcome all)Welsh cakes (Welsh: picau ar y maen, pice bach, cacen gri or teisen radell) are traditional Welsh snacks. These griddle-\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1814\n|PortionCalories = 302\n|DatePublished=27th October 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Servings: 6 - Makes 6 cakes\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 35 minutes\n |PrepTime = 20 minutes\n |CookTime = 15 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:Welsh cakes recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Welcome Cakes</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Nicer than I thought they would be.</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n}}\n\n\"'''Chroesawa pawb'''\" (Welcome all)\n'''Welsh cakes''' (Welsh: picau ar y maen, pice bach, cacen gri or teisen radell) are traditional Welsh snacks.\n\nThese [[Griddle|griddle]]-cakes are also known as \"bakestones\" as they were originally cooked on a hot stone or cat-iron [[griddle]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 8oz (225 g) [[Self-raising flour|self-raising flour]], sieved to aerate\n| 4oz (110 g) [[Butter|butter]]\n| 1 free-range [[Egg|egg]], beaten\n| A handful of [[Sultanas|sultanas]]\n| A little [[Milk|milk]]\n| 3 oz (85 g) [[Caster sugar|caster sugar]]\n| [[Butter|butter]] for greasing\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Rub the [[Fat|fat]] into the sieved [[Flour|flour]] to until it resembles [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]].\n| Add to a bowl with the [[Sugar|sugar]], [[Dried fruit|dried fruit]] and mix well.\n| Add the beaten [[Egg|egg]]\n| Combine using your hands and form a ball of [[Dough|dough]].\n| If you need to loosen the [[Dough|dough]] a little, use a splash of [[Milk|milk]].\n| Roll out the [[Pastry|pastry]] to a &frac14;\" (5 mm) thick and cut into rounds with a 3-4i\" (7.5-10 cm) pastry cutter.\n| Grease a heavy [[Griddle|griddle]] or [[Tava|tava]] with with [[Butter|butter]]\n| Place on direct heat until it is quite hot\n| Cook the Welsh cakes on the [[Griddle|griddle]], turning once, about 2 to 3 minutes on each side.\n| Each side needs to be [[Browned|browned]] before it's turned over.\n| Remove and dust with [[Caster sugar|caster sugar]] while still warm.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nSplit in half and serve while still warm with [[Butter|butter]] and [[Jam|jam]].\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Pies tarts and flans]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]][[Category:Grilled, griddled or barbecued]]\n[[Category:Unusual recipes]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#welshcakes #griddle #butter #egg #castersugar #dough #tava #driedfruit #browned #flour #sultanas </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=White chocolate, cranberry and pistachio fudge recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#pistachionuts #whitechocolatecranberryandpistachiofudge #chocolate #cranberries #glucose #condensedmilk #fridge #bakingtin #airtightcontainer #clingfilm #boiledorsimmered \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This is a delicious fudge, the recipe for which I adapted from one for Thermomix.\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:AdvancePreparationIcon}}\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|DatePublished=4th December 2016\n|Author=JuliaBalbilla\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 8\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  1 hour, 20 minutes\n|PrepTime =  1 hour, 10 minutes\n|CookTime =  10 minutes\n|TotalCalories = 2957\n|PortionCalories = 369\n|Image = [[Image:White chocolate, cranberry and pistachio fudge recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Fudgealicious</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">(if that's a word?)</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Klapaucius|Klapaucius]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis is a delicious [[Fudge|fudge]], the recipe for which I adapted from one for [[Thermomix]].  Unfortunately, I can no longer find the original recipe.\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 200g white [[Chocolate|chocolate]],chopped small or [[Grated|grated]]\n| 400g can [[Condensed milk|condensed milk]] (or make your own)\n| 125g [[Unsalted butter|unsalted butter]]\n| 80g [[Sugar|sugar]] of any sort\n| 1 tablespoon liquid [[Glucose|glucose]]\n| A handful of [[Pistachio nuts|pistachio nuts]]\n| A handful of [[Dried cranberries|dried cranberries]] (Craisins), plus some extra\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Put the [[Chocolate|chocolate]], [[Condensed milk|condensed milk]], [[Butter|butter]], [[Sugar|sugar]] and [[Glucose|glucose]] in a non-stick [[Saucepan|saucepan]].\n| Dissolve over a medium low heat until smooth, stirring from time to time.\n| Stir in the [[Pistachio nuts|pistachio nuts]] and [[Cranberries|cranberries]].\n| Pour into a small [[Baking tin|baking tin]], lined with [[Clingfilm|clingfilm]] or [[Bake-O-Glide]] and sprinkle the extra [[Cranberries|cranberries]] over the top.\n| Chill for at least an hour in the [[Fridge|fridge]] until firm.\n| Cut into squares and keep in the [[Fridge|fridge]] in an [[Airtight container|airtight container]].\n}}\n===Variations===\nYou can use any [[Dried fruit|dried fruit]] and [[Nuts|nuts]] you like, but chop them a bit if largish\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Fruit recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#pistachionuts #whitechocolatecranberryandpistachiofudge #chocolate #cranberries #glucose #condensedmilk #fridge #bakingtin #airtightcontainer #clingfilm #boiledorsimmered </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "White dinner rolls",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=White dinner rolls, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#dough #flour #yeast #whitedinnerrolls #butter #egg #brushing #breadmaking #bread #clingfilm #pastrymat \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=These rolls are based on a recipe I made at the Miele Experience Centre when I went there for a breadmaking course\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1445\n|PortionCalories = 180\n|DatePublished=8th March 2013\n|Author = JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = Servings: 8 - Makes 8 large rolls\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime =  2 hours 15 minutes\n |PrepTime = 2 hours\n |CookTime = 15 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:White dinner rolls recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">They look posh</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.6</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Good for a dinner party</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Sue_spins|Susie]] </span></span>\n}}\nThese rolls are based on a recipe I made at the '''[http://www.miele.co.uk/showrooms/abingdon/Default.aspx M\u00edele Experience Centre]''' when I went there for a [[Breadmaking|breadmaking]] course.  See Variations below for instructions for partially making in a breadmaker.  Making them all by hand though is much more fun!\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 225ml lukewarm [[Milk|milk]] (approx)\n| 15g fresh [[Yeast|yeast]]\n| 375g [[Strong white bread flour|strong white bread flour]] (I used Waitrose Very Strong Canadian [[Bread]] [[Flour]])\n| &frac12; teaspoons [[Salt|salt]]\n| 30g [[Butter|butter]]\n| &frac12; [[Egg|egg]], beaten\n| A little [[Oil|oil]]\n| 1 tablespoon of [[poppy seeds]], or seeds of your choice (optional)\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Dissolve the [[Yeast|yeast]] in half of the [[Milk|milk]].\n| Meanwhile [[Sieve|sieve]] the [[Flour|flour]] and [[Salt|salt]] into a bowl and rub in the [[Butter|butter]].\n| Make a well in the centre of the [[Flour|flour]] and add the dissolved [[Yeast|yeast]].\n| Stir in with the [[Flour|flour]] and add the [[Egg|egg]] and almost all of the other half of the [[Milk|milk]].\n| Mix to a soft, but not sticky [[Dough|dough]] and add the remaining [[Milk|milk]] if necessary.\n| Lightly [[Flour|flour]] a board or [[Pastry mat|pastry mat]] and [[Kneading bread|knead]] the [[Dough|dough]] for about 10 minutes until smooth and elastic - you can tell when it has been kneaded sufficiently if the dough spring back when you poke it.\n| Place the [[Dough|dough]] in a lightly oiled bowl and cover with [[Cling film|cling film]].\n| Allow to rise in a warm area until it has doubled in size.\n| [[Knock back]] the [[Dough|dough]] and return it to the bowl for a second rising.\n| When it has risen to double its size again, knock the [[Dough|dough]] back and divide into 8 pieces.\n| Shape as desired and sprinkle [[Seeds|seeds]] over them, if using, first [[Brushing|brushing]] them with water.\n| Leave on the [[Baking tray|baking tray]] in a [[warm place]] until doubled in size again.\n| [[Bake]] at 220\u00b0 C (425\u00b0 F - gas 7) for 15 minutes or until golden. \n| Cool on a wire rack.\n}}\n===Variations===\nIf you wish to use your [[Bread maker|bread maker]] to do the kneading, use a 7g sachet of fast action [[Yeast|yeast]] and set it to the longest [[Dough|dough]] programme.  For the [[Panasonic 253 breadmaker]], this is French dough, for the [[Panasonic SD-ZB2502 automatic breadmaker]]. use menu option 21, French dough rise. (3 hr, 35 minutes).\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Breadmaker recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#dough #flour #yeast #whitedinnerrolls #butter #egg #brushing #breadmaking #bread #clingfilm #pastrymat </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "White wine and onion gravy",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=White wine and onion gravy, British recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#bayleaves #whitewineandoniongravy #onions #flour #vegetarian #whitewine #panfried #gravyrecipes #gravy #garlic #drywhitewine \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A vegetarian onion gravy that uses white wine\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 594\n|PortionCalories = 148\n|DatePublished=17th January 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 25 minutes\n |PrepTime = 5 minutes\n |CookTime = 20 minutes\n |Image = [[Image:White wine and onion gravy recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n}}\n\nA [[Vegetarian|vegetarian]] [[Onion gravy|onion gravy]] that uses [[White wine|white wine]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 2 tablespoons [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 2 [[Onions|onions]], peeled and finely sliced\n| 2 [[Cloves garlic, peeled and crushed|cloves garlic, peeled and crushed]]\n| 8g [[Sugar|sugar]]\n| 1.5 tablespoons [[Plain flour|plain flour]]\n| 250 ml [[Dry white wine|dry white wine]]\n| 500 ml [[Vegetable Stock|vegetable stock]]\n| 2 [[Bay leaves|bay leaves]]\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Heat the [[Oil|oil]] in a medium pan, add the [[Onions|onions]] and saut\u00e9 over a medium heat for 7 minutes or until softened.\n| Add the [[Garlic|garlic]] and [[Sugar|sugar]] and heat for a further few minutes.\n| Stir in the [[Flour|flour]] and cook for a minute or two until combined.\n| Turn up the heat, add the [[Wine|wine]] and stir constantly for a few minutes with a whisk.\n| Add the [[Bay leaves|bay leaves]] and the [[Stock|stock]] and heat for a further 5 minutes or until it reached your desired consistency.\n| Remove the [[Bay leaves|bay leaves]] and serve in a [[Gravy|gravy]] boat.\n}}\n==See also==\n* Many other [[gravy recipes]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Stacy will love this</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.5</span>/5 </span></span>\n\n\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments]]\n[[Category:Dips and sauces]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n[[Category:Pan fried]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#bayleaves #whitewineandoniongravy #onions #flour #vegetarian #whitewine title": "Wholemeal cheese scones",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Wholemeal cheese scones a cheese recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#wholemealcheesescones #dough #cheese #wholemealflour #chillipowder #bakingpowder #butter #pastry #yellowcornmeal #cookery #breadcrumbs \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Another savoury winner from Mum's scribbled cookery notes. This version uses wholemeal flour, see here for a version using white Self-raising flour\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 3647\n|PortionCalories = 227\n|DatePublished=21st July 2013\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Servings: 16 - Makes about 16 scones\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  50 minutes\n|PrepTime =  30 minutes\n|CookTime =  20 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Wholemeal cheese scones recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">I always pig out on these</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.6</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">I can never eat just one, especially when they are warm.</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The&nbsp;Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nAnother savoury winner from Mum's scribbled [[Cookery|cookery]] notes.\n\nThis version uses [[Wholemeal flour|wholemeal flour]], [[Cheese scones|see here for a version using white Self-raising flour]].\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 450 g (1 lb) 100% [[Wholemeal flour|wholemeal flour]]\n| Big pinch of [[Salt|salt]]\n| 2 teaspoons of [[Baking powder|baking powder]]\n| Big pinch of [[Chilli powder|chilli powder]]\n| 50 g (2 oz) softened [[Butter|butter]]\n| 300 g (10 oz) mature [[Cheddar cheese|cheddar cheese]]\n| &#189; pint (284 ml) [[Milk|milk]]\n| [[Yellow cornmeal]] for rolling out.\n\n}}\n\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6), [fan [[Oven|oven]] 180\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Put the [[Flour|flour]], [[Baking powder|baking powder]], [[Chilli powder|chilli powder]] and [[Salt|salt]] in a large bowl and mix together.\n| Rub the [[Butter|butter]] into the mixture with your fingers until it resembles fine [[Breadcrumbs|breadcrumbs]].\n| Mix in 225 g (8 oz) of the the [[Grated|grated]] [[Cheese|cheese]].\n| Add enough of the [[Milk|milk]] as needed to produce a nice soft [[Dough|dough]] when mixed well.\n| [[Knead]] this [[Dough|dough]] for a few minutes.\n| Dust a work-surface with [[Cornmeal|cornmeal]] and roll the [[Dough|dough]] out until it is about 2.5 cm (1\") thick\n| Stamp out about 16 7.5 cm (3\") rounds with a fluted [[Pastry|pastry]] cutter.\n| [[Brush]] the tops with a little [[Milk|milk]] and sprinkle with the remaining [[Cheese|cheese]].\n| [[Bake]] for 20 minutes until golden.\n| Cool on a metal rack.\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nThese don't store too well so eat them within a day or so.\n==See also==\n\n* [[Cheese scones]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Tapas, mezze and antipasti]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Cheese recipes]]\n[[Category:Chilli pepper recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#wholemealcheesescones #dough #cheese #wholemealflour #chillipowder #bakingpowder #butter #pastry #yellowcornmeal #cookery #breadcrumbs </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}

title": "Wig's cake",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Wig's cake, British recipe \n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#chocolate #walnuts #wigscake #cake #orange #icingsugar #hand #castersugar #cocoa #hazelnuts #vanillaextract \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This moist all-in-one cake is flavoured with chocolate, orange and walnuts and takes its name from the fact that it is my husband's recipe\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 2744\n|PortionCalories = 274\n|DatePublished=4th October 2012\n|Author = JuliaBalbilla\n|Servings = Servings: 10 - 1 x 20cm [[Cake|cake]]\n |Difficulty = 1\n |TotalTime = 1 hour 15 minutes\n |PrepTime = 15 minutes\n |CookTime = 1 hour \n |Image = [[Image:Wig's cake recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">I remember you making this for him</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">RIP, Mike.</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:Chef|Jerry]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis moist all-in-one [[Cake|cake]] is flavoured with [[Chocolate|chocolate]], [[Orange|orange]] and [[Walnuts|walnuts]] and takes its name from the fact that it is my husband's recipe.  Wig is my daughter's nickname for him.\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 175g [[Plain flour|plain flour]], sieved with\n| 2 teaspoons [[Baking powder|baking powder]]\n| 3 large [[Eggs|eggs]], beaten\n| 175g soft [[Butter|butter]]\n| 175g [[Caster sugar|caster sugar]]\n| The [[Grated|grated]] rind of 1 [[Orange|orange]]\n| &frac12; teaspoon [[Vanilla extract|vanilla extract]]\n| 70g [[Walnuts|walnuts]], slightly bashed in a plastic bag\n| 50g Green and Black's Organic Dark [[Chocolate]] with Madagascan [[Vanilla]] (85% [[Cocoa|cocoa]]), coarsely bashed in a plastic bag\n| 10g [[Icing sugar]], for dusting\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 170\u00b0 C (325\u00b0 F - gas 3), [fan oven 140\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour].  \n* Place the [[Chocolate|chocolate]] in the [[Fridge|fridge]] whilst you are preparing the other ingredients.\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Place all of the ingredients (except for the [[Walnuts|walnuts]] and [[Chocolate|chocolate]]) into a mixing bowl.\n| Mix thoroughly using a [[Hand|hand]] or stand [[Mixer|mixer]] - if using a Kenwood Chef / Major, use the Flexi-Beater.\n| When the mixture is of an even consistency, add the [[Walnuts|walnuts]] and mix using the slowest setting.\n| Grease and line a 20cm (8 inch) loose bottomed deepish [[Cake|cake]] tin.  There is no need to line if you are using a Silverwood tin.\n| When the [[Oven|oven]] has reached the required temperature, gently mix in the [[Chocolate|chocolate]] using the slowest setting.\n| Pour the mixture into the tin, smooth it out and [[Bake|bake]] so that the top of the tin is about halfway down the [[Oven|oven]] for about 50-60 minutes.\n| Remove from the [[Oven|oven]] and allow to cool in the tin.\n| To touch, it may not seem cooked, but it is and if you over cook it, you will loose too much moisture.\n| Dust with [[Icing sugar|icing sugar]].\n}}\n===Variations===\nUse [[Hazelnuts|hazelnuts]] instead of [[Walnuts|walnuts]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Bread and baking]]\n[[Category:Sweets and desserts]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#chocolate #walnuts #wigscake #cake #orange #icingsugar #hand #castersugar #cocoa #hazelnuts #vanillaextract </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Wimpy-style bender grill",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Wimpy-style bender grill using proper sausages recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#tomatoes #chives #oliveoil #eggs #sausages #bake #grilltray #mashedpotato #balsamicvinegar #eggrings #grilled \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=This is a tongue-in-cheek nod to the Wimpy bender grill with the sausages bent around a circle with slashes in the side\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1543\n|PortionCalories = 385\n|DatePublished=3rd May 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = \n|Servings = Serves 4\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime =  50 minutes\n|PrepTime =  20 minutes\n|CookTime =  30 minutes\n|Image = [[Image:Wimpystyle bender grill recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">1970, here we come.</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">You are as old, or older than me if you remember these!</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nThis is a tongue-in-cheek nod to the Wimpy bender grill with the sausages bent around a circle with slashes in the side, in the original I believe a [[Frankfurter|frankfurter]] was used - this much improved version uses [[chipolata sausages]] from [[Bexley's Gourmet sausage maker]], bought from [[Hall Place Farmer's market]], where we will be visiting again today as it is the first Sunday of the month.\n\nWith a few [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]], [[Eggs|eggs]] from our [[Chickens|chickens]] and a buttery [[Mash|mash]] speckled with home grown [[Chives|chives]] this is a massive improvement on the sad old Wimpy offering.\n===Ingredients===\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 9 thin chipolata [[Sausages|sausages]] - ( [[Gourmet sausage maker - Bexley]] )\n| 5 medium [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]], halved\n| 6 [[Free range eggs|free range eggs]]\n| 1 portion of [[Mashed potato]] recipe\n| Bunch of freshly chopped [[Chives|chives]]\n| [[Balsamic vinegar]]\n| [[Olive oil]]\n| [[Salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]]\n}}\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4), [fan oven 160\u00b0 C & reduce cooking time by 10 mins per hour]\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Wimpy benders - grilled around tomatoes.jpg|thumb|300px|right|'Benders' grilled\nImage:Wimpy benders, prepared.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Wimpy style 'benders', prepared for grilling\n</gallery>\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| prepare a [[Grill tray|grill tray]] with a layer of [[Tin foil|tin foil]] or [[Bake]] 'O Glide\n| Halve the [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]]\n| With a sharp knife, cut a slash in one side of the chipolata every 2 cm\n| Wrap the chipolatas around the [[Tomatoes|tomatoes]], nicks to the outside\n| Place them on the [[Grill tray|grill tray]]\n| Add a few drops of [[Balsamic vinegar|balsamic vinegar]] and a few drops of [[Olive oil|olive oil]] to each [[Tomato|tomato]]\n| Add a sprinkle of [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]] from a height\n| [[Bake]] at 180\u00b0 C (350\u00b0 F - gas 4) for 25 minutes at the top of the [[Oven|oven]].  Finish for the final 5 minutes under the [[Grill|grill]] to [[Brown|brown]] the [[Sausages|sausages]] nicely\n| [[Fry]] the [[Eggs|eggs]] in [[Olive oil|olive oil]] using [[Egg rings|egg rings]]\n| Stir the finely chopped [[Chives|chives]] into the [[Mashed potato|mashed potato]] and serve\n}}\n==See also==\n\n* [http://amuchmoreexotic.dreamwidth.org/278922.html What today's Wimpy is like - humerous blog!]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Breakfast recipes]]\n[[Category:Historic recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Egg recipes]]\n[[Category:Meat recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n[[Category:Grilled, griddled or barbecued]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#tomatoes #chives #oliveoil #eggs #sausages #bake #grilltray #mashedpotato #balsamicvinegar #eggrings #grilled </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
