title": "Winter squash and walnut salad",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Winter squash and walnut salad a British recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#squash #wintersquashandwalnutsalad #garlic #oliveoil #sageleaves #parmesancheese #walnuts #rocketleaves #squashes #miseenplace #bass \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=Another recipe to help you use up your squashes and pumpkins\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 993\n|PortionCalories = 248\n|DatePublished=25th October 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment = Plated up!\n |Servings = Serves 4\n |Difficulty = 2\n |TotalTime = 1 hour 15 minutes\n |PrepTime = 15 minutes\n |CookTime = 1 hour\n |Image = [[Image:Winter squash and walnut salad, plated.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Fresh \ud83e\udd57\ud83e\udd57\ud83e\udd57</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Clean tasting and healthy.</span> \n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:PSmith|Paul&nbsp;R&nbsp;Smith]] </span></span>\n\n}}\nAnother recipe to help you use up your [[Squashes|squashes]] and [[Pumpkins|pumpkins]].  Will serve 4 as a [[Starter|starter]] or bulked out with a little [[Pan-fried|pan fried]] [[Fish|fish]] such as [[Basa|basa]] or [[Bass|bass]], it would make an excellent [[Main course|main course]]\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| 800g [[Squash|squash]] - any type will do\n| 100g [[Walnut|walnut]] pieces (half the price of walnut halves!)\n| Small bag of [[Rocket leaves|rocket leaves]] or spicy [[Green salad|green salad]] leaves\n| 1 large [[Garlic|garlic]] bulb\n| 12 fresh [[sage]] leaves\n| [[Olive oil]]\n| 20g shavings of [[parmesan cheese]] to serve\n\n}}\n\n===[[Mise en place]]===\n* Break the bulb of [[Garlic|garlic]] into [[Cloves|cloves]]. Leave them un peeled\n* Peel and de-[[Seed|seed]] the [[Squash|squash]], cut into bite-sized chunks\n* Preheat the [[Oven|oven]] to 200\u00b0 C (400\u00b0 F - gas 6)\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Lightly [[Oil|oil]] a large [[Oven|oven]]-proof [[baking tray]]\n| Distribute the [[Squash|squash]] pieces, [[Garlic|garlic]] cloves, and [[Sage leaves|sage leaves]] evenly. Season well with [[Salt|salt]] and [[Pepper|pepper]] and drizzle with plenty of [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| [[Roast]] uncovered for about an hour.  The [[Squash|squash]] should just be [[Browning|browning]] at the edges\n| Add the [[Walnuts|walnuts]] in a separate dish to toast for the last 5 minutes\n| Toss the [[Squash|squash]] once more before serving\n| Dress 4 plates with the [[Salad|salad]] leaves and scatter over with the [[Squash|squash]], [[Garlic|garlic]], [[Walnuts|walnuts]] and [[Sage leaves|sage leaves]]\n}}\n<gallery widths=300px heights=300px perrow=5>\nImage:Winter squash and walnut salad oven ready.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Ready for the oven\nImage:Winter squash and walnut salad ingredients.jpg|thumb|300px|right|Simple ingredients - this squash could make this recipe 5 times over!\n</gallery>\n\n===Variations===\nThrow in any spare vegetables that you have knocking around at the time.\n\nAdd a splash of [[balsamic vinegar]] with the [[olive oil]].\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe warm or cold.\n\nServe with shaves of [[Parmesan cheese]].\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Main courses]]\n[[Category:Salad recipes]]\n[[Category:Snacks and light bites]]\n[[Category:Starters]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Squash recipes]]\n[[Category:Baked or roasted]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#squash #wintersquashandwalnutsalad #garlic #oliveoil #sageleaves #parmesancheese #walnuts #rocketleaves #squashes #miseenplace #bass </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"

title": "Winter squash soup",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->{{#seo:\n|title=Winter squash soup, British vegetable recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#rosemaryleaves #chickenstock #sageleaves #wintersquashsoup #carrots #redonions #garlic #chili #celery #butternutsquash #foodprocessor \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=If you grow butternut squashes, this recipe is a great way to use them up. A warming winter soup that is well worth making\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 1272\n|PortionCalories = 159\n|DatePublished=31st October 2012\n|Author=Chef\n|Servings = Serves 8\n|Difficulty = 2\n|TotalTime = 1 hour\n|PrepTime = 15 minutes\n|CookTime = 45 minutes \n|Image = [[Image:Squash soup.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\"> <span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Nice with pumpkins too</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">4.5</span>/5</span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Here in Norfolk, we have lots of pumpkins; this was nice using those instead. </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:NonLoggedInUser|NonLoggedInUser]] </span></span>\n}}\nIf you grow butternut [[squashes]], this recipe is a great way to use them up. A warming winter soup that is well worth making\n\n{{RecipeIngredients\n| [[Extra virgin olive oil]]\n| 16 freshly picked [[sage leaves]] with stems\n| 2 [[carrots]], peeled and chopped\n| 2 [[red onions]], peeled and sliced\n| 2 [[celery]] sticks, washed and chopped, leaves trimmed\n| 4 cloves [[Garlic]]\n| A handful of [[rosemary leaves]], chopped\n| 1 dried hot [[chili]], ground to powder\n| [[Sea salt]] and [[freshly ground black pepper]]\n| 1 large [[butternut squash]], peeled, de-seeded, halved and cut into 1\" thick slices\n| 2 litres good quality chicken or vegetable stock.  For the cheaters amongst us; use 1 tin of good quality clear chicken soup, plus a  Knorr [[chicken stock]] cube in enough boiling water to make up the 2 litres.\n}}\n===Method===\n\n{{RecipeMethod\n| Add a three good glugs of olive oil to a big saucepan, when '''nearly''' smoking, add the [[sage leaves]] and fry until crisp and dark.  About 30 seconds.\n| Remove and drain on kitchen paper and reserve.\n| In the same pan and oil, add the onion, celery, carrots, [[rosemary leaves]], ground chili and the salt and pepper and stir-fry for 15 minutes until the softened\n| Add the squash and [[chicken stock]], return to the boil and simmer for 30 minutes\n| Test the squash, it should be soft like a cooked [[potato]]\n| Remove from the heat and whizz up in a [[food processor]] until you have your desired consistency\n}}\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:Recipes|Squash]]\n[[Category:Accompaniments|Squash]]\n[[Category:Main courses|Squash]]\n[[Category:Soup and stock recipes|Squash]]\n[[Category:Vegetable recipes|Squash]]\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Squash recipes]]\n[[Category:Favourite recipes]]\n[[Category:Boiled or simmered]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#rosemaryleaves #chickenstock #sageleaves #wintersquashsoup #carrots #redonions #garlic #chili #celery #butternutsquash #foodprocessor </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }

title": "Yogurt salad dressing",
                "revisions": [
                    {
                        "contentformat": "text/x-wiki",
                        "contentmodel": "wikitext",
                        "*": "<!-- seo -->\n{{#seo:\n|title=Yogurt salad dressing recipe\n|titlemode=replace\n|keywords=#chives #yogurtsaladdressing #crunchysalad #greekyoghurt #oliveoil #yogurt #dressings #mayonaise #yoghurt #lemonjuice \n|hashtagrev=032020\n|description=A very simple dressing that is ideal for large crunchy salad leaves. It can be used in larger quantities than conventional oil based\n}}\n<!-- /seo -->\n{{Template:CookTools}}\n{{recipesummary\n|TotalCalories = 60\n|PortionCalories = 30\n|DatePublished=6th October 2015\n|Author=Chef\n|ImageComment =\n|Servings = Serves 2\n|Difficulty = 1\n|TotalTime =  4 minutes\n|PrepTime =  4 minutes\n|CookTime = None\n|Image = [[Image:Yogurt salad dressing recipe.jpg|alt=Electus]]\n<span class=\"review\">\n<span class=\"reviewHeader\">\n====Best recipe review====\n</span>\n''<span class=\"reviewTitle\">Lovely on chopped savoy cabbage!</span>''\n\n<span style=\"line-height:180%\"><span style=\"font-size:180%;\"><span class=\"reviewScore\">5</span>/5 </span>\n\n<span class=\"reviewDesc\">Wierd, I know, but I love raw cabbage and this dip/dressing is The Dogs! \ud83d\udc96\ud83d\udc96\ud83d\udc96</span>\n \n<span class=\"reviewAuthor\"> [[User:TheJudge|The Judge]] </span></span>\n}}\nA very simple dressing that is ideal for large [[Crunchy salad|crunchy salad]] leaves.  It can be used in larger quantities than conventional [[Oil|oil]] based [[Dressings|dressings]].  It's almost like a thin [[Mayonaise|mayonaise]].\n{{RecipeIngredients\n\n| 6 tablespoons plain [[Yogurt|yogurt]]\n| 1 tablespoon [[Olive oil|olive oil]]\n| 1 teaspoon [[lemon juice]]\n| A pinch of fine [[Sea Salt|sea salt]]\n| A pinch of [[Freshly ground black pepper|freshly ground black pepper]]\n| A pinch of [[Sugar|sugar]]\n| Up to 3 tablespoons of cold water (''see method'')\n| Chopped [[Chives|chives]] (optional)\n}}\n\n===Method===\n{{RecipeMethod\n\n| Add the ingredients to a bowl and whisk until well combined.\n| I used [[Greek yoghurt]] which is fairly thick so it needed to be thinned with 3 tablespoons of cold water. Natural [[Yoghurt|yoghurt]] may not require as much thinning.\n| Mix in the finely chopped [[Chives|chives]]\n}}\n===Serving suggestions===\nServe in a jug so it can be poured over each serving plate.\n[[Category:Recipes]]\n{{RecipeLine}}\n[[Category:British recipes]]\n[[Category:Dips and sauces]]\n[[Category:Marinades dressings and butters]]\n[[Category:Vegan recipes]]\n[[Category:Vegetarian recipes]]\n[[Category:Salad recipes]]\n[[Category:Uncooked]]\n\n<!-- footer hashtags --><code 'hashtagrev:032020'>#chives #yogurtsaladdressing #crunchysalad #greekyoghurt #oliveoil #yogurt #dressings #mayonaise #yoghurt #lemonjuice </code><!-- /footer_hashtags -->"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }
}
